12.description: Me being Irish and all,I love it.The prices are cheap.I just felt like I was sitting in someones basement getting drunk.Theres nothing wrong with that anyways.*******UPDATE**********************************Since my last review they have remodeled,It is a very nice place and they even have bean bag tornaments.

7.description: Loved all the dart boards along the wall. (Except, it doesn't work very well if you want to play bags indoors since you have to play both in the same area) They have plenty of tables in the front and off to the side and decent drink specials. There was a DJ when we went and other than the music being a little too loud---The night was filled with numerous drinks and dart games! A-Ok in my book =]

3.description: Well I've known Erin C for 16 years now and the reason she really hates this bar is because her brother and I used to patron it multiple times during the week. The bar sponsors 2 men's and one women's softball teams and the young Irish gents and ladies from neighborhood like to come and get nice and drunk without intolerance. Multiple tv's. great to come watch all the games possible on a Saturday and drunk for cheap. Don't mind the old guys in the corner. They don't bother anyone and even if you tried to talk to them you wouldn't understand what they're saying anyways. The bar tenders are granddaughters and grandsons of the owners or a wonderful lady who lived down the street from me and they aim to please. It's a safe place to be seeing that some of the cities public safety workers patron there. if you're looking for more than a shot and and beer then you're in the wrong place. But if you're down with a real corner Irish hole in the wall with a neighborhood feel, then you're in the right place. Oh, and there's no food so eat something at home and save room for andll the cheap beer you'll be drinking..

1.description: Cash only bar.  The prices aren't bad but the crowd really kills this place.I've seen three dudes crammed into a bathroom stall "not doing drugs" as well as fights over the pool table and old drunks passed out on tables and at the bar.  It amazes me that an old school dive bar like this can still survive today.

2.description: They are cash only which is annoying - they have an ATM though. Their beer lines I don't think have EVER been cleaned... They are so corroded you can taste the mildew in your beer - so gross stay away! They don't serve food and the place smells awful. Side note:  The owner is a lunatic - if you have the unlucky pleasure of being there when he storms in - its best to stay out of his way. All in all there are much better establishments to go to.

9.description: I've got a soft spot for bars that are equal parts blue-collar Chicago and Ireland. Six Penny Bit pulls this off with ease. Attentive and playfully surly young women deliver a proper pint and a generous shot of Jameson or Bushmill's. The mark of a great neighborhood bar is an age distribution from 21 to retirement age and there may very well have been 20-somethings sharing a pint with their grandparents in here. Irish offerings like several varieties of 'Tayto' crisps and advertisements for weekend sports on Setanta inspire me to return and spend a good chunk of the day when the place is quieter and less crowded. A bona fide diamond in the rough.

10.description: I went into this bar because my Mexican friend brought me there.  I am Irish citizen of foreign birth.  The bar is fine, but I had an experience that I can only describe as being disgustingly racist and repugnantly pathetic.  There was an Irish man in his waning years, old enough to understand  that Ireland is occupied by the British Military, and England has done centuries of harm to the Irish people.   He told me he was from Meath, just outside Du_lin (Sorry the correct letter is malfunctioning).  I asked him what he thought a_out the Queen visiting the Garden of Remem_erances and Croke Park.  He said "I think it is a good thing.  It is time to bury the ax., but that fucking nigger..."  And he almost had a heat stroke.   I said to him, "Oh, it is OK for the Queen of England, who occupies Irish soil at the point of 20,000 bayonets to visit, but because our president is Black, you get indignant and angry?"   My friend dragged me out before things got out of control.This fool is not unusual in the Irish.  They suck up to their oppressor, but find a person who has never done the Irish harm to curse.  I do not know who this guy is but he is a disgrace to the Irish.

13.description: Been going here for years.  Great place, cheap drinks, and a change from Lincoln Park and Wrigleyville.  The other reviews are pretty dead on and while I've seen fights happen in the past I can't remember when the last one was in years.

16.description: so far as i know, this is the irish-est bar in the city, horse racing on monitors, darts, appropriate beers on tap, and genuine people who were born on the emerald isle and don't drink green beer......ever.  others in yelp and friends of mine have told me they have witnessed fights here, but isn't that part of what makes it real???

17.description: The Six Penny Bit isn't the kind of Irish bar where you'll find polish Cubs fans drinking car bombs. If you don't speak with a bit of a brogue you might be in the minority, but that being said, the staff, and for that matter, the regulars, are all extremely friendly people. The tavern is decorated with all sorts of knick knacks form Ireland, and the TVs always have a rugby match on. They have a pool table and a couple dart boards (be sure to bring your own metal tipped darts) and live music in the weekend. The music is usually a one man band who preforms a mix of pop classics (the Beatles, Elvis, Johnny Cash, etc) and traditional Irish folk songs. The drinks are cheap, especially on Sunday and Monday when they offer draft specials, and Thursday nights are Ladies Nights, where the strawberry daiquiri's are flowing at a price that won't cut into your Friday night budget (but might cut into your Friday morning productivity).

15.description: I agree w. John, it's a REAL Irish pub. They remodeled it a bit and it's lovely. The only downside is that they don't take credit cards so make sure you have cash or your atm card handy. The staff is great and the beer is cold. What more could you ask for?

0.description: I've been sporadically coming to the Six Penny for about four years now due to a good friend being a regular there and just love the whole atmosphere there. I have a soft spot for local camaraderie type bars and the Six Penny definitely fits into that type. It is a smaller and authentic irish neighborhood bar with the sweetest owners and bartenders. They don't serve any food there but are more than willing to hand you over some menus for delivery from local restaurants. Plus, I have eaten a delicious, homemade sandwich on more than one occasion that was given to me by the bartender because someone in the family likes to make a whole platter of them for the patrons. There is also a pool table, bags set, and a darts board if you're interested in throwing in some games into your night too. Also, I would advise against the "house shot" - I've never tried it but heard its pretty intense!

5.description: Great place to stop in for a pint during the day.  Gets busy in the evening on weekends if you like that.

11.description: If you aren't an Irish brick layer you probably don't know about this bar.  No, it's not the cheesy Irish bar you see in Wrigleyville with Miller Lite Shamrock neons and drunken frat boys wearing backwards Notre Dame hats, this is the place you go if your visa has expired and you spent all day laying a mile of concrete. Let's put it this way, above the bar there is a picture of the bar tender shaking hands with Gerry Adams, the leader of Sein Fein.  They pour the Guinness like they do back in the old country and since he obviously knows the leader of the IRA, I wouldn't bug him about speeding it up.Walking into this bar feels like what it must felt like for the first black guys who tried to sit at the counter at Woolworths back in the 1950s. You definitely get a sense that you don't belong and may end up with a car bomb under your hood if you piss off the wrong guy.That being said, I usually go right to the back to play darts. If you like Irish music, the juke box won't disappoint and neither will the Guinness.

8.description: The Six Penny Bit is a clogged artery in an otherwise healthy area of the shitty heart that is the Northwest side of Chicago. They have something here called the "house shot", this the the epitome of gut wrenching alcoholic speed. They take all the bottoms of the liquor bottles and dump them into one special bottle. You ask for it. You take the shot. You IMMEDIATELY regret doing so because you will be drunk much quicker than you have ever anticipated. This is a good thing. The atmosphere is the avoidable section of this here bar. I vehemently hate country music. I have no comparable source of disdain. Country is the fucking kicker. Whatever. If you want to get completely slam drunk and probably get into a fight about nothing, come here. Cheap beer on Thursday, High Life is the right choice. Unfortunately there is not coat check, darn.

4.description: I lived in this neighborhood about 15 years ago. Now every time i fly into Chicago for business i make it my business  to stop in for a pint of Guinness then a bottle of Old Style (chi-town seems be the only place in the USA I can find Old Style) Anyhooo! I love Chicago and I'm a native New Yaaaka. I get a kick from the Irish crowd who mistake my NYC accent for a British one. The dirty looks i've gotten make my day.

14.description: Decent prices, fun atmosphere.

6.description: Just a plain bar that's out in the middle of nowhere. The place might as well be Middle Earth to me. The bar is pretty simple, nothing fancy, a back room with  additional tables. A couple of beers on tap, plenty more in botttles and packaged chips and stuff you'd find in any dive.I have no idea why I came here-oh wait, that's right it's because my cop buddy knew about this place. I don't think I would come again, not without my cop buddy(s) but I paid for 4 beers and the tab came up to be 9 bucks. Twelve when you count the 3 dollar lukewarm Gatorade that I got before heading out.

3.description: You need a barber on sunday this is the go to spot ask for mario for 10 bucks kids 15 adults with shave cant beat it clean

1.description: I'm re writing a SECOND review. Turns out, Th place was convenient, however, after returning to see if anything has changed. They literally kept talkin Arabic while he took 3 min for my cut then began to become irate over my review. After looking in the mirror I noticed that he F'd up my cut on purpose after I tried to give them a second chance. BEWAAAAARE DO NOT GO HERE, HE WIL TAKE IT OUT ON U IF U HAVE SOME COLOR ON UR SKIN. RACIST!!!  Then n made racial slurs about Hispanics. I should smacked em but thought this will hurt more. Thnks fade by whoever, notice EVERYONE IS ARABIC !!!!

2.description: I have been coming here for over 4 years actually. Now that I am yelping more I feel like I should give some credit where its deserved.

5.description: Been going to these guys since they left fade inn. There's really only 1 guy that can't fade but the rest I've let cut my hair and haven't been disappointed. Recommend to anyone that needs a fade

6.description: The atmosphere is always of foreign( Arabic) decent. The radio the tv is all in middle eastern language. Everyone who works there is of middle eastern decent. I am of PR heritage and used to work here for all of 3 days. The discrimination was OBVIOUS and the barber in the second chair was the one who stood up for me against the other owner who was an obvious racist and discriminatory in race and religion. They will never turn down ur money though. And I still get a haircut from th barber in th second chair or the last chair on the far end. If u hav no problems monetarily supporting individuals who are blatant racist , this is the place for u. If u want a fast good haircut go to guy in sdcond chair.

7.description: I've been going here since they left the fade inn.  Go to Mario.  Second chair from the front.

0.description: Been coming here for about 4 years and love it! The whole staff is friendly, and have a great sense of humor. Ahmed is my main man there! Excellent work! Love it!

4.description: I loved this place and now vow to never go back. They use to be amazing...when more people then Mario just worked there. He literally is the only person cutting hair now and although he's good he only knows how to do a fade half way decent and a taper only if he's doing a fade. Sorry for the bad review but they did at one point have amazing barbers and for cheap but its lost its touch and lost their final customer

29.description: So I live in the neighborhood and based on what I've read I thought I should stop in and try this place.  Dive bar....NO!! There are other dive bars in this area.Beer Garden, cork dart board, juke box, and good times here.  Tried the cheeseburger and fries to see if the kitchen could handle "The Basics." It was somewhat under-cooked, but did have good flavor. They have a daily $2 pint special for domestic drafts. While you will find an occasional "local" who will talk your ear off, there is good atmosphere here.Friendly place, and I'll try it again. :)

42.description: I love this place, it is the Mercedes-Benz of bar food. The bartender Janetta (I think that's how it's spelled) always takes care of us and is remarkably nice. It's a brisk walk from my house and it's a nice place to unwind on a friday/saturday night. The music is pretty varied (where as most bars just have Lady Gaga on repeat....yuck...). The only thing that ruins it is that sometimes the place is overrun with dumb 20-something jocks who get drunk and yell so loud you can't hear the person next to you. It's not a usual occurance though, it's usually just neighborhood folks. All together a nice place to relax after a long week

23.description: Awesome local watering hole! Great location! Very clean! Service and staff are awesome! Food surprisingly is excellent! If I ever owned a bar it would be similar to this one!

47.description: A better neighborhood alternative to Hops & Barley due to cheaper prices, better food and a real beer garden. Lots of neighborhood regulars who won't give you the stink eye.

8.description: Great neighborhood bar. Decent drinks and good food. When my late boyfriend lived in the neighborhood they let us take his dog into the patio area. Place gets busy/crowded during key sports games like the Blackhawks and Bulls.

31.description: Love this place!!!! Biggest beer garden in the neighborhood, cheap drinks, good food, great service.  The clientele/atmosphere is rather....ehem....ecletic but everyone seems happy to be there and is friendly to everyone else.

34.description: Darts.Beer Garden.Bags.Food!!!Need I say more?

16.description: Fun outdoor seating, indoor with open air in good weather and bags in the back.  Attentive bartenders, fun atmosphere.  Good food.

13.description: Great ambience, friendly locals and super service. Good selection of craft ales and the Reuben sandwich was excellent. We'll be going back!

11.description: Me and my wife were in the neighborhood with our daughter and dropped in as she is a fan of this place.  Looks like a kind of dive, Irish pub so we lowered our expectations.  We were wrong.  Great service and truly great but simple food.  Looks like our daughter has good taste after all.  Nice job here.  No bells or whistles...just quality.  This place will be around for awhile.

39.description: The Windsor is a nice enough bar, but I've never had a nice enough time there.   It's full of low-key folks from the neighborhood who seem to collectively turn their heads as you walk through the door to see if they know you.  The food is good and Bud and Miller drafts are $2 every day.  It's a shame then that the barkeeps are awful enough to make you think twice about spending a night boozin' here.  If the place is empty, they disappear for large amounts of time doing god knows what.  (Napping?  Snorting coke?  Smoking?)  When the bar is full, there's zero sense of urgency and it takes too long to get a drink.  There are plenty of TVs, but none of the viewing angles from the tables are remarkable.  And either my eyesight is worsening with old age or this place isn't even outfitted with HD.  Come on, guys!The Windsor is like the All-American everyman in a movie.  You can relate to him, but he's boring and forgettable.

37.description: An Irish bar with marylin Monroe pictures on the wall. How original. There is nothing original about this bar and I guess the people go there just because it is near by. There is nothing special about the decor or the mood at this bar. I gues if you are stuck in Portage Park and have nothing better to do with your timethen this is the place to go and be seen. I give it a high ranking just for being an Irish bar in a Polish neighborhood. Ilove to see that.

0.description: My favorite neighborhood bar within walking distance.  Friendly proprietor and bartenders make any visit to the Windsor a pleasant one.  The bar has a large outdoor covered patio which is great for summer and shoulder seasons.  The inside is cozy and mid-sized with beautiful woodwork throughout.  Nice neighborhood establishment, definitely not a divey bar.  Major thumbs up to them for their bar menu.  Best burgers in Jefferson Park IMO.  If you try one, you'll get hooked and come back.  Yes they're that good.  Great place to come in to watch sporting events.  Better people, better food and better beer!

38.description: Great neighborhood bar for those who live in Portage and Jeff Park. Nice surprise to find Negra Modelo, one of my fave beers, on tap. Become a regular and the service gets better. Hehe

27.description: The food, atmosphere and drinks here are top notch. It's an enjoyable neighborhood spot which is off the beaten path. I'd recommend this place to anyone to check out in the area!

32.description: Great neighborhood place.  I would probably go more often if I lived closer.

44.description: If you haven't been here in a while, you have to go back!  The owner recently remodeled the basement and added more tables, flat screen TVs and a small bar.  Great space for a privat party.There is a beer garden (open in the summer) that is a decent size and even has bags on certain nights.They have pretty decent bar food too! Friendly bar tenders will take your food order and bring your drinks to the table! There are dart boards in the bar area next to the men's and women's bathrooms.It's nice to pay a domestic price for a domestic beer $2.50 miller lites!!! If you are a fan! :)Got to do something about the root beer - get that on the drink menu! :)

24.description: Charming and friendly stop to grab a drink. Prices were reasonable too.  Love bars that are relaxed and warm feeling, and this fits the bill nicely.  Hope to go back on my return trip.

7.description: Really good tacos! Chips and salsa, yummy. Service was friendly and attentive! Fun to sit on patio to watch the Blackhawks.

40.description: Windsor Tavern is one of those places where they look at you a little funny when you come in the door if you aren't a regular.  That being said, service was friendly and prompt, even on a busy night.  Prices are fair, even though we were charged 3 different prices for the same drinks through 3 rounds, but the "average" was still good.Food = excellent, great bar grub.  They actually have Shrimp DeJonge on the menu, tho I haven't ventured there yet.  The one thing that knocks this place down is the occasional drunken moron factor.  These guys were bugging my super cute friend, but they were just icky and drunk, so we bugged out.

30.description: This place is my favorite neighborhood hang out. Great food,( i love the fish tacos), great beer garden, awesome atmosphere, wide variety of beers. If you are in the vicinity of Milwaukee and Montrose i highly recommend the Windsor Tavern, whether you want to catch a good game, have a party with your friends, or hang in the beer garden they have it all!!

46.description: Hmm well I have mixed feelings about this bar. Being that its only about a mile from me, I still do find myself coming here from time to time. If i were to rate it just on food and prices alone, it's a 4-5. It seems as though every time or almost every time I come in hear crappy bon jovi marathons blasting. And sometimes I feel overwhelmed by all the frat boys.  Ive also noticed that their isnt much interaction with people outside of their company that they come with. But yeah check out the food, its pretty great and cheap.

1.description: Really like this place. Dawn was behind the bar. She was nice and made great recommendations about beer and food. Ordered the stuffed mushrooms- so good. Tasty and I would highly recommend. Pizza is so good. Crust was perfect, almost cracker-like and tasty. Toppings were great. We met Ivan the cook. Very nice and great at what he does. I will be back again, and again and...  Will recommend to others for sure!

9.description: Great neighborhood place to grab a beer/cocktail and sit out on a small patio. The menu is a little small, however what they do have is totally worth it. They even play soccer games (for those feeling lost in a world of American sports)

26.description: Love this place! Great beer garden!!!

25.description: Good little joint in Jeff park. If you haven't been here in a while, come back. Great craft beer selection and food that is really good. Try the $5.50 burger special on Thur nights that is esp good and juicy. Also have the hot wings that are as good as any place around.  Add rehabbed outdoor space in back or patio on the side and its awesome.

12.description: I liked the place, although it's kinda small... it's got a lot of character!!  Service is great and they have great specials daily.  I really liked the pizza and would def go back in a heartbeat! Saturday Funday Destination..gdd

21.description: This is a really cool, small space.  Great neighborhood style bar.  I have not tried the food yet and will update the review once I do.I am not a regular here, so the locals here don't really interact with me, but they do with each other.  The bartenders are very friendly and make you feel welcome.  Drink prices are very good too.If you are looking for a night club, this isn't it, but if you are looking for a cool neighborhood bar with a lot of character, this is your place.

17.description: 1.  Good food2.  Great drink specials (especially those individual mini-pitchers of beers)3.  Great attitude from staff4.  Sidewalk/outdoor patio to enjoy in the summer5.  Rentable party space in the backMy friends and I came here to unwind after a long day of strenuous yard work in the heat.  We were pleasantly surprised to find that this place had super cheap beer in large quantities. Exactly what we were looking for.On top of that, their sandwiches and burgers were superb.The inside of the bar is cozy and small.  The lighting and decor give the place a friendly and approachable feel.  There is also outdoor sidewalk seating, perfect when you want to enjoy the cool summer breeze.Lastly, they have a big room in the back that can be rented out for parties and special events. One note on the bartender (forgot her name).  When we came in, we waited a while to get attended to and when she finally showed up she was deeply apologetic and sweet and explained that she was the only one working until the next person showed up.Luckily reinforcements walked in a few minutes later and service was cool after that.  I just have to give kudos to that bartender lady for keeping her cool and still managing to serve drinks at the bar, hand out menus, take orders, put in orders, and everything else in between when it was getting busy and still being able to be so polite and respectful.

10.description: Great neighborhood place,  Bartenders are the best. The food is always good and fresh. Good craft beer changes with the season.

5.description: I'm jealous of anyone who lives  within walking distance of the Windsor. This is the kind of cozy, friendly Chicago neighborhood bar I would go to all the time. Great patio and covered outdoor space, warm, wood-filled bar (and a second level for parties). These bartenders are the best, too.

3.description: Awesome place. Great atmosphere. Service was excellent. Food was top notch for a corner bar

35.description: Italian Beef Crawl Stop #9: Windsor (6:57PM)We took the bus back after Mr. Beef & Pizza and the night was winding down, seven hours of beef later we had completed our pilgrimage through the northwest side. At Windsor, we had a few more drinks and there was one dartboard to play on. I was introduced to their massive garden patio in the back and people took out the bags and started throwing them. Most everyone was on beef overdose and there was much satisfaction from a fine afternoon of beefin' and beerin' it. The bar was great and the back patio proved to be the key to this bar since everyone else was inside watching college football. It was a great night and a great place to be with darts!  Italian Beef Crawl 2010 was a great success, with the 2011 plan to feature the winners of years past.  Windsor did the trick and I can't wait to go back!

19.description: Good little joint in Jeff park. If you haven't been here in a while, come back. Great craft beer selection and food that is really good. Try the $5.50 burger special on Thur nights that is esp good and juicy. Also have the hot wings that are as good as any place around.  Add rehabbed outdoor space in back or patio on the side and its awesome.

28.description: This place gets two stars for the huge beer garden, otherwise I would give it one star.Beer prices are ok, I think I paid $2.50 for an Old Style.The problem with the place is the douchebag quotient was extremely high.Possibly Hops & Barley has now been eclipsed by The Windsor as the douchebag capitol of Portage Park.

45.description: Still haven't returned, but I need to thank the drunken patrons who helped catch the dude who hit my parked car and drove away.  You guys rock!  That's that salt of the earth that make Jeff Park a nice place to live...

33.description: Good, cheap pub grub. Great beer garden. $2 domestics on Saturday night.The cheese steak is amazing. Try the cheddar sauce on your fries and attempt to not have a heart attack, I dare you. Friendly, neighborhood pub that is a tad less sketch than the package store up on Lawrence and a tad more comfortable than Hops and Barley (or Hops and Blackout, as we like to call it). Stop in.

43.description: Cute place for a neighborhood bar... Good prices, food looks good (never had it yet), and they have a back patio with bags in the summer. Was at a birthday party and was in the basement, cute space!

2.description: Windsor Tavern is an interesting restaurant bar.Located on Milwaukee Avenue in what may be considered the north part of Portage Park, Windsor Tavern looks very much like an Irish pub from the outside.  When walking in the outdoor theme in confirmed with all wood furnishings and bar.  They have a couple TVs and the typical bar set up.  They also have outdoor picnic table like seating.  These tables have umbrellas.The menu is very interesting.  Like I said above it has the feel of an Irish pub but the menu is much more representative of a mix of many local flavors.   They have salads,  steak and fish, burgers and sandwiches, soup, pizza, tacos, and all kinds of appetizers.  The menu is not that large but they do have a little bit of everything.  I had the dos tacos and they were pretty good.They had some drink specials written on a chalkboard that was placed outside.  $5 Jager bombs if I recall correctly.  I imagine they have all kinds of specials throughout the week.  I look forward to coming by and trying a few other things out at Windsor Tavern.

18.description: Awesome local watering hole! Great location! Very clean! Service and staff are awesome! Food surprisingly is excellent! If I ever owned a bar it would be similar to this one!

41.description: Went here with a girlfriend while the hockey playoffs were going on.  Well, we got there well before the game started so the bar was empty.  We sat in the beer garden, and it stayed pretty empty while the bar filled up with Hawks fans.Service was really friendly, food was good.  Nice that it's in my 'hood.

4.description: Very cute bar, has booths as in, along the wall. It got busy at moments but then kind of not. They don't have menus but they have some listed on a chalkboard on the wall. I enjoyed it. We had a beer and an order of chips and salsa, that at first i looked at and i said "really, why does the salsa come in a plastic container like that?" The salsa was spicy and good, but if it was more presentable then i would've enjoyed it even more, yes presentation is a big deal to me. The bartenders seemed to be on the "alternative side" so music was a little interesting, they played from pop to rock, which was fine. Id return if I'm back in the neighborhood

6.description: After a very long bike ride from our house through half of the North Branch Trail and back, we passed the Windsor Tavern and decided to park it for a beer and some early dinner. The Stanley Cup playoffs were playing inside and the place was packed to the gills, so we sat outside on their patio. Even though it's on the corner of Milwaukee Ave., it's pretty far north and it didn't feel like we were sitting on a very busy, car-exhaust-filled street. The beer selection was adequate and the menu leaned very heavily on bar food standards. Never one to shy away from hot cheese, I ordered the quesadillas and hubs got a sandwich of some sort. The quesadillas were a masterpiece of ooey-gooey, 4-cheese, artery-clogging goodness. That and the beer made for a very pleasant, filling, post-3 hour bike ride re-fueling session. I really liked the atmosphere outside and would likely return to sit on the patio on another long bike ride through that area.

22.description: 1.  Good food2.  Great drink specials (especially those individual mini-pitchers of beers)3.  Great attitude from staff4.  Sidewalk/outdoor patio to enjoy in the summer5.  Rentable party space in the backMy friends and I came here to unwind after a long day of strenuous yard work in the heat.  We were pleasantly surprised to find that this place had super cheap beer in large quantities. Exactly what we were looking for.On top of that, their sandwiches and burgers were superb.The inside of the bar is cozy and small.  The lighting and decor give the place a friendly and approachable feel.  There is also outdoor sidewalk seating, perfect when you want to enjoy the cool summer breeze.Lastly, they have a big room in the back that can be rented out for parties and special events. One note on the bartender (forgot her name).  When we came in, we waited a while to get attended to and when she finally showed up she was deeply apologetic and sweet and explained that she was the only one working until the next person showed up.Luckily reinforcements walked in a few minutes later and service was cool after that.  I just have to give kudos to that bartender lady for keeping her cool and still managing to serve drinks at the bar, hand out menus, take orders, put in orders, and everything else in between when it was getting busy and still being able to be so polite and respectful.

15.description: Was actually headed to another bar, but took a wrong turn and stopped in. Ended up staying 3 hours, my friend & I had such a good time. It was a very nice experience all around. They had a great outdoor section, but the inside was the best. You could sit right next to the front where they had the bar opened up, so you can have fresh air and a decent view. The decor was pleasant & the staff were awesome. The staff was attentive and friendly. Will definitely be going back.

20.description: Great bar. Great service. Great prices. Great food.  It's also where I met my husband.  Whenever we go out, this is where we go.

36.description: Well I've only gone to Windsor 5 times and so far it's been much ado about nothing.  Walk in and you get a look  from everyone in the bar.  (this ain't CHEERS).  The most recent visit was just two days ago and it was definitely a 'boys club'.   My friend joked that it might be a gay bar as the bartender/waitress was VERY good looking and none of the men at the bar or tables (about 20) seemed to take notice.  Maybe as regulars they are just used to her but for me she would always be worth checking out.  Eventually a few couples came in.  We spent about four hours there and we got two free drinks.  The beautiful bartender (Nicole) even joined us for a drink which was a nice touch.  I did not eat anything this trip but have in the past.  People rave about the food.  It didn't do a thing for me. I would go back for the bartender but she said she no longer worked there and was just filling in.

14.description: Really nice neighborhood bar/pub!  I've driven by so many times and have wanted to try it, so glad I finally did!  Sat outside Friday night, busy inside, but waitress was still very attentive.  Good selection, great prices!  I will definitely be back!

1.description: I went here for a fade. I was desperate because my usual barber was on vacation, and wasn't coming back for awhile. I went here purely on a gut feeling, since there are like 4 places within this vicinity that offered to do fades.  I walked in and a chair was open, so I plopped on down and the barber asked me how I want it cut. He said, "fade up all the way up to here, and a razor part?" I didn't even need to say a word, because that is exactly what I wanted. He lined it up pretty good, and gave me a good razor part. The fade was done nicely, and I walked out a happy man.I will be coming back to this place, it is much closer and a lot cheaper than the place I go to. Good job Master Hair. Good job indeed!

2.description: Have been coming here for 3 months for me and my 11 year old son. In the course of those 3 months I've gotten haircuts from 3 of the barbers. All of them were great and consistent. My son also likes his haircuts. Also they are cheaper than other barbers who do fades in the area. The place isn't necessarily fancy but clean. No parking lot but street parking isn't an issue.

0.description: Some of the best barbers in Chicago. These barbers are famous for their fades.  Always packed on weekends so get there early.

58.description: Hit or miss, local diner. The Irish breakfast selections are fantastic and my kids love the waffles. The soups are great too. They are quick on the coffee refills!

56.description: Lucky Grill, always hit it miss.  Tried the meatloaf, with potatoes.  Just bland except for the pepper taste a bit much.  On the positive, quick service and the waitresses are always friendly and helpful.

29.description: If your going to run a restaurant, the seaters need to be able to understand English. We we waiting to be seated and asked for a table as opposed to a booth and your seater didn't comprende and seated the 2 that came 10 minutes after us at the open table.

42.description: Great food, good service and decent prices. Parking, too! Open til 9 pm, a good diner!!

23.description: I love this place. It's a great diner!! You walk in you see ppl sitting sipping coffee  in a l- shaped counter watching the cooks flip pancakes and mini wadfles. Which u can get with any order.     They also have plenty of tables. The waitress had purple hair and looked like a pin up girl. Real cool looking, it fit the personality. Food is very good lots of it and the pork sausage links answer mini waffles is a must with you order. Speedy service and reasonable prices. A must try kinda diner!

47.description: i've been going to lucky since it debut in the 90's. love the place and the people who work there especially the watiresses are always friendly and they do a great job. however, the food lately has been sub par.  the hash browns tasted old. like it's been frozen forever and i can taste the freezer burn. i ordered grits one time and it was poorly made. don't offer grits if you can't make it right.  it should be creamy and fresh tasting, not lumpy and old.  i am now shopping for a new favorite breakfast place. a's on irving and narragensett is on the top of my list right now. lucky's will have to improve their food quality before i come back.

8.description: This place is excellent.  Ordered delivery and was told it'd be about an hour.  Got it in 25 minutes.  Can never complain about that.Then got to the food.  I was hankering for a reuben sandwich, and the reuben deluxe with soup of the day and onion rings meal called to me.  Reuben was tasty, not over salted and had the right amount of sauerkraut and swiss.  It wasn't overpowering and didn't leave me with over-salted dry mouth the way some meals can.Soup of the day was minestrone, and it was also delicious.  Also not over salted.Definitely ordering again from this place.  Great bang for the buck.

31.description: I've been here 4 times in the past two months as I come to Chicago for work. Our server, Demi, was awesome and the food was great!

34.description: I'm hooked. Food is outstanding. Lucky Skillet is the food of the Gods. Orange juice is truly freshly squeezed (best I've had). Delivery is ALWAYS well short of the ETA given. I find myself ordering any lazy morning I have.

16.description: Great food. Delivery is so slow. Will be back. They have a great variety of different food always hot when delivered.

13.description: I would have liked to try them, but they said they would not take my order for pick up or delivery. Would appreciate them to notate what hours they will accept orders on their website as they say "breakfast anytime" and their online ordering service allows you to place an order.

11.description: Ordered breakfast from here again. Ordered chef's omelette w swiss cheese instead of cheddar (um, YUM!!!!), side of wheat toast and fresh fruit. I also got a banana shake (they make it from real bananas ya'll!) and a side of avocados. Hubby got biscuits and gravy w sunny side up eggs w hash browns and a side of toast. All of the above enjoyed in the comfort of my home for $28.11! Will most def order from here again and again and again...

39.description: I've only ever ordered from Lucky from work for breakfast delivery. I have never tried any other items other than breakfast and I have never been inside the restaurant, so this review is based on breakfast delivery only. The skirt steak and eggs always comes perfectly cooked and the price is great! I always order the steak medium-rare with over easy eggs with whole wheat toast. I add feta cheese and onions in my hash browns and a cup of fresh squeezed orange juice.  My total bill comes to $20 plus tip for delivery. I have never had a bad experience with Lucky Grill and will continue to ordering from.

37.description: Eggs poached, egg runny, Florentine bountiful spinach sautéed with hollandaise sauce, side of seared plump sausage links and fluffy pancaces. syrup butter and great waitresses

0.description: This is my breakfast "go to" place in the neighborhood.  The breakfast selections that I've had have always been freshly prepared and very tasty.  For lunch the club sandwiches are huge and one of the hidden treasures on their menu.  My dinner faves during the cold of winter have always been their "hot" sandwiches served open faced with mashed and gravy.  Hearty fare and reasonably priced.  Their delivery is always fast and typically ahead of schedule.  Good variety of foods, though not gourmet dining.  My experiences both for dining in and delivery have always been good.  Keep in mind that they are phenomenally busy on Sunday mornings if dining in or calling for delivery.

38.description: I visted luck Grill almost every Sunday for the Cream of Chicken rice soup.  It is almost a cult following for many.   Although there food is top notch.   They have changed the Cream of Chicken rice recipe. I am used to it being not to thick, not to thin, lots of Chicken and Chicken flavor, with a hint of lemon.But latley it hasent been.  I thought on my last 3 Sunday visits, maybe the cheif had a bad day our, was on vacation.   Well, I asked.  and that wasnt the case.Be warned!   Lucky Grill's cream of chicken soup is now:Thick like wall paper paste, tastes like flour not chicken.  Also, now there must tie a string on the chicken, and pull it out before serving.Thick, nasty no chicken.Well, I guess all good things do not last forever. Did they really thing nobody would notice?????

51.description: Maybe its just me, but their food and service is getting consistently worse. I have been eating here since I was born. Never really had a complaint. But lately, they are going down hill immensely. First I called in to order. They would not take my credit card over the phone. Had me go to their website to order. Ordered on their website for delivery, I will edit and add pictures of the pathetic sandwich I got. A small chicken breast that did not cover even half on the huge bun it was on. Never was like this before. On top of it I asked for bread for the soup that came with each sandwich. I added a note to each sandwich individually, for them to not forget bread. "Please do not forget bread and butter" x3 ....... Guess what? No bread. Now I have a three year old who specifically asked for it crying his eyes out. Thanks Lucky Grill. Hmm maybe if you had taken my order over the phone like a real restaurant... we wouldn't have this issue. And to add on, it took 1 hour and 20 minutes for delivery, A little long seeing i'm less that a mile away and its a Monday night. Oh and the owner delivered it. So the owner is there... yet this kind of thing is happening.....This is just tonight. last time my food arrived ice cold. So cold I had them bring a different order. The time before that they forgot half of what we ordered and had to run it out. Um... get it together Lucky Grill before you start losing 20+ year customers.The only reason you have 2 stars is out of loyalty.

27.description: This place is great. They have the kind of food I like, and most important - they bring it to me. I normally order lunch in (when I do) since I work in a virtual food desert. They are always accommodating, on time, and their food hits the spot just when I need it. The food tastes great, their creamy chicken and noodle soup (in it's various styles/concoctions) is always good, and the delivery dudes are cool.

32.description: Ordered breakfast from here again. Ordered chef's omelette w swiss cheese instead of cheddar (um, YUM!!!!), side of wheat toast and fresh fruit. I also got a banana shake (they make it from real bananas ya'll!) and a side of avocados. Hubby got biscuits and gravy w sunny side up eggs w hash browns and a side of toast. All of the above enjoyed in the comfort of my home for $28.11! Will most def order from here again and again and again...

54.description: We live in neighborhood and drive by this place a number of times but never stopped.  Today we wanted to have breakfast someplace close so we searched Yelp and the reviews for this place were pretty good so we went.  I have to say were both were not impressed.  My bacon was dry and hard...looks like it was sitting for a while.  My husband who ordered a skillet was surprised that the cheese was a slice of processed cheese at the bottom.  The bowl of creamer had empty containers from prev guests probably and the butter containers were sticky with syrup, just felt unclean.  Lots of people behind the counter standing around where they could be making sure the tables were cleaned and restocked before the next guest.  Will not revisit.

48.description: I really like this diner. Waitresses are all really polite and attentive. Its in a strip mall and parking is usually not too bad. Tried a few things. Greek omelette was good. Burgers are typical diner style which isnt a bad thing.  Patty melt was excellent. If your in the mood for a good breakfast, this really isnt a bad choice.

44.description: Blue collar paradise boys and girls! This place beats the snot out of a Denny"s or the nearby IHOP. I like the fact that the omelets are made with real eggs and not a "mixture". I appreciate that the majority of the food tastes made from scratch and will on occasion not taste the same each time. Anyways,Good eats here my friends! Mazeltov! (did I spell that right!)

24.description: I've ordered breakfast for delivery a few times from this place. Food is usually on point and delivered breakfast is the best.

7.description: I've been here four times. First three times, I was unimpressed with the waiters and how they treated me. They were, at best, seemingly disappointed at having to do a job.Then yesterday happened. I wanted to take my boyfriend out for his birthday lunch and chose this place out of convenience. We sat down, and the bus seemed irritated at the thought of getting us water. No eye contact. No smile. Just toss us our waters. A few minutes later, the waitress comes. No eye contact. No smile. "You guys ready." She stated as she looked outside into the world she so wished she could be in instead of serving us two @$$holes.Alright. Well, that seals it. We took our leave and will never return. I have never been treated with such disregard and disrespect in any food establishment. I don't know if they don't like Hispanics, if they don't like black clothes, if they don't couples, Saturdays, being servers, being alive, whatever. Fourth time is obviously not the charm. Being made felt like I am a burden because I'm a customer? Nice. Great way to run a place.

49.description: Was really hoping this would be my new go to spot. Portions were generous and prices weren't too bad. I had it delivered and they did a great job with separating and packaging everything which was a big plus. One of the items I had ordered was a julienne salad, unfortunately they forgot the dressing. Bummer. The food was extremely bland. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good.  BLT barely had any mayo. Fries= no bueno. Not only were the fries bland...but so were the hash browns, eggs, pancakes, and soup. Get the point? Disappointed.

40.description: Decent food. A little high priced for a little restaurant.   The women always answers the phone with such additude and Don't ask for extra napkins or plates you won't get them!!! Over all ....decent..that's is it.

53.description: I've only been here twice, both times for breakfast, and both times I've gotten the Irish breakfast. Two big rashers of bacon, two pieces of toast, two eggs, two Irish sausages, two pieces each of black and white pudding both on top of a mound of hash browns.Man, is it a breakfast! The bacon is delicious, thick cut, not crispy but not a floppy mess either. Great white pudding, black pudding isn't really my thing, next time I'll try subbing it for extra white. Eggs were eggs, hash browns were hash browns. I'm not exactly sure what the difference between an Irish sausage and a regular breakfast link is. Seemed a little longer. Slightly different casing, a little softer maybe? Regardless, they're good. Everything needed a little salt, pepper, hot sauce, or chef sauce, but it was all provided so no biggy!Last time we were there my girlfriend got the French toast, which they ask if you want thick or thin. She got the thick toast, said it was good.Service was exceptionally quick the more recent time we went. The time we went prior it was packed, so it being slow then I can let slide. Coffee cup doesn't stay empty for long, and the food comes surprisingly quick.Since I'm only a little over a mile from this place, I'm sure I'll be back. (Also there's another location that I know nothing about)

30.description: I love their skillets!  I just had their crepes and that is the second best thing Ive had from here.  The delivery is on time, and accurate.  I've been in their once and I love the chill diner atmosphere.   I wish it was closer so I could walk to it.

46.description: ordered the irish skillet for delivery. YYUUMMMM! food came hot and delivery didn't take long. everything was delish! scrambled eggs with toast on the side. perfection.

1.description: Went there for the first time with my bride and daughter.  It was fantastic, much better than it looked from the outside.  We went in the late afternoon and had dinner.  A large menu, each of us ordered something different and each item was good.  The soup was especially good and the break and butter was hot.Not close enough for me for breakfast but I've heard some very good reviews for this.  Also, they could use a bicycle rack nearby for parking.

55.description: Love their breakfast menu, and a decent lunch and dinner menu. I have a bit if a none to puck with them though as last time I came in they took like 4 families in before me while my wife & I sat patiently and got no service at all. It really upset her and we left. Hopefully they'll see us if we come back, if they were a little mire organized their eating would be higher. Hopefully since its so close they won't dissapoint again!

9.description: Any place that delivers breakfast is amazing in my book. Also, they're within walking distance!Good variety of breakfast items; their other food looks great too, but I'm definitely big on the breakfast.First place that actually followed through when I asked for my hash browns extra crispy. Eggs are always cooked perfectly and service is good.They have a very relaxed environment, which I definitely enjoy because I never feel rushed to leave like other breakfast places that get crowded. Please stick around Lucky Grill!

26.description: Ordered steak and eggs. Got barely any eggs. An entire tray of hash browns. Pancakes sucked. Steak was ok, have def had better. I will not order from here again. I did receive the order less than an hr later however, so there's ONE positive.

25.description: Not sure I have ever been to a 5 star greasy spoon, but I know most fail to live up to the Lucky.If your asking me...I say go and you will certainly enjoy!

12.description: I can not ask for more from a neighborhood diner.  The check for a lunch for a family of four included drinks, a tuna melt, chicken melt, and dogs and fries for the kids for $33.  Along with Shilah's this is my go-to breakfast joint and I particularly appreciate the continuity in waitstaff the past 5 years. Plus every time I ask for extra burnt crispy hash browns they oblige.  I am routinely surprised how often this gets overlooked at other joints.

59.description: I was there over the weekend with my family and the place was pretty empty. The food took a little long, but it was ok. This is one of the only breakfast place in Jefferson Park, so can't complain too much. Average breakfast, average price.

21.description: We just moved to Chicago. Thought we would try a new restaurant for home delivery. Ordered rib eye steaks that were burnt and were more like a skirt steak order baked potatoes got mashed the rolls were like hockey pucks

17.description: The 2 stars are for their delivery service. This is my go-to diner in the neighborhood and I tried delivery for the first time this morning. The soup of the day was not listed on line (I remember seeing signs in the restaurant saying look up our daily soups online) so I had to call and decided to just place the order over the phone. But after placing my order, I was told they don't take credit cards over the phone so I had to cancel and order online. The delivery was fairly quick but they forgot the soup. The soup was finally delivered an hour and a half later. So my delivery experience was not up to snuff. Go to the diner instead.

10.description: My favorite local breakfast place. Walking distance from my house. They also deliver. Fast, good, and inexpensive.

5.description: Lucky Grill is a diamond in the ruff breakfast establishment serving all kinds of goodies. I 've been coming here for years solely for their amazing breakfast items and let me tell you they never fail. The interior design is very cozy,clean. Great service,superb food come on out and give them a try you'll fall in love. Thank me later  Happy eating

3.description: Still coming here after all this time. Great staff, INCREDIBLE Irish Breakfast - I make time at least once a month just for that. Great small neighborhood diner that packs a punch!

35.description: I've been here about 10 times tried something different every time. Almost everything I had was very good above average for a diner. From the gyro plate to French toast they didn't disappoint. Only complaint is server needs to stop by more but I do usually go on Sunday when it's busy. I recommend this place !

19.description: This place is great. They have the kind of food I like, and most important - they bring it to me. I normally order lunch in (when I do) since I work in a virtual food desert. They are always accommodating, on time, and their food hits the spot just when I need it. The food tastes great, their creamy chicken and noodle soup (in it's various styles/concoctions) is always good, and the delivery dudes are cool.

28.description: This place is ok. The food is pretty average. Delivery was quick and the guy was nice. I don't know that I'd order from here again though. Food isn't ry anything special.

45.description: I work nearby and we have ordered from here through grub hub three or four times within the last 3 weeks. The first time we ordered here we were more than satisfied. The portions were generous and they got our order down to a tee, even threw in a bottle of tobasco. The last time we ordered they messed up our order. When we got there they not only  not know where our order was and had to re make it and we had to wait, but they also messed it up. I called them and they told me the menu isn't correct online. I don't understand why they wouldn't correct it then? They said it's just too much information. Not happy about this.

33.description: Giving this place 2 stars is being VERY generous, especially after my experience tonight. I've been coming to Lucky Grill since 2008 & it has completely changed over the years. For example, today I walked in at 6:00pm. I was not greeted until 6:15pm when I placed my order. The waitress was not apologetic at all. Not only that, but she was attending to other people who sat down after me. Really?! I received my food at 6:42pm. It should not take 27 minutes to make pancakes. The service over the years has really gone down. I know about 2-3 waitresses that are decent or above average & the rest I don't care for. Not only has service gone down, but the quality of food has as well, especially with little things. Their ranch dressing is watered down & has a sweet taste to it. There are some dishes that ranch would go great with, but I don't order it because Lucky Grill's ranch dressing sucks. The syrup is another thing that has been watered down. Syrup should not pour out of the container. The one thing that probably bothers me the most out of everything is their bread! Bread should not feel as hard as a rock! Stop microwaving it, or whatever it is that you're doing to heat it up, over & over again! I swear someone could chip a tooth on it. Plus, it tastes like crap. I don't mind paying more for my food, as long as it tastes good. When you go cutting corners & then charging people more, we have a problem.

43.description: Came to this place after a wild night out. I was pretty much starving from all the liquor I had the night before. When we got here we got seated right away. Their orange juice was amazing but their food was just okay. I ordered fried eggs (over hard), french toast and hash browns. I wasn't too impressed with the quality of the food but the servers were pretty hot! I guess that kinda made up for the so so food. If you want to grab a quick breakfast this place is ideal. Their meal time prepartion is very very fast and they get you in and out!

2.description: I love me a diner just about as much as a tablecloth restaurant  , and today I was sure hoping that Lucky Grill was going to be a hot ticket.  It wasn't . I ordered the Chefs Omelette with well done/ crispy ( as in brown ) hash browns . Omelette was OD'd (dry). Hash browns were cold. Server took the potatoes and asked kitchen to serve me some crispy/hot ones. What came back (see attached pic) was at least hot ,  (a hot mess ) but  there was nothing "brown" about them . More like mashed potatoes .   Albany Park has much better options .

18.description: So I have been here a few times and have ordered delivery as well, usually good service and pretty fast but after today I will not be returning as a customer.  Maybe it's a chick thing (it seems the guys mind their business unless dragged into it) the blond at the register and her semi red headed friend immediately began making fun of me (absolutely clueless as to why) and thought I couldn't see them (though they had the just caught look when I made eye contact with them). I have no idea why and frankly I don't care. It was extremely unprofessional, disrespectful, and uncalled for because I never live my life like that and have been nothing but polite and friendly to every staff member I run into. Food was quick though and that's why I'll give 2 stars. If you're good at ignoring disrespectful staff whom you help to pay the wages of then go ahead and dine here.  *I ended up speaking to the manager over the phone after finding out that after I pulled out of parking lot, an employee approached my friends claiming they didn't pay a dollar that they owed. He mentioned the lack of tip to them as well. How did they not pay that dollar if they paid their bill at the register??? He basically tried to make them feel bad about not tipping a large amount even though the service there was horrible. When I found out what happened to them I was beyond livid! Never EVER again!!!

41.description: Decent food and prices. The only thing I want to know is since when is wearing yoga pants a suitable work outfit?

52.description: My husband is from Liverpool, England and one of the things he misses most is their authentic full english breakfast ( or brekky). Lucky grill totally delivers in their irish breakfast and irish breakfast sandwich totally authentic ingredients and completely yummy. Well better than the one we just had in the Manchester airport! We are so happy to have made this find... and they deliver!

50.description: I always order out since it is always pack on weekends. But food is defiantly better then ihop! French toast is great and skillets are pretty big! Staff is always friendly!

4.description: The lucky grill is a modern American brunch spot.  There are 12 booths, 8 tables and a long breakfast counter.  The style is late 70s dinner and could be legit.  There were two TVs showing soccer on them which could be nice for a football brunch as well.  The coffee I got was a bit weak, which is a shame.  They do have the full sized sugar container on each table, which I like.  The creams are the standard crappy deans prepackaged stuff.  My second cup was much better than the first so I may have just got unlucky at first.  So overall average coffee experience  The style is seat yourself, I came in at 12:30 on a Saturday.  They seemed well staffed with a couple of bussers augmenting the 4 waitresses.   The staff was attractive and semi attentive.  I would not say I felt like they never checked on you but my waitress pulled the wait to check on you when you have food in your mouth move.  So professional waitress.  I also noticed that this was done to at least the table directly next to me.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy.  It comes with 2 eggs and hash browns.  I added on my typical side of sausage Patti.  The biscuits were pre made.  They were ok, but nothing special.  The gravy was light but flavorless.  There was plenty of it but even with pepper and salt it just tasted bland.  The side of sausage was also a pass.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, and the hash browns were pretty good.  It was interesting to see this come out on a different plate that the BnG came out on.  Overall this place seemed average and may be a decent stop if you are in the hood.  I would not say that it was a great experience and I would not go out of my way to go again.

6.description: I love this place. It's a great diner!! You walk in you see ppl sitting sipping coffee  in a l- shaped counter watching the cooks flip pancakes and mini wadfles. Which u can get with any order.     They also have plenty of tables. The waitress had purple hair and looked like a pin up girl. Real cool looking, it fit the personality. Food is very good lots of it and the pork sausage links answer mini waffles is a must with you order. Speedy service and reasonable prices. A must try kinda diner!

22.description: Great neighborhood diner!  Food is good and the waitresses are always a pleasure to deal with. Whether you are sitting down, grabbing to go or ordering for delivery, you will not be disappointed.

15.description: I asked my partner if he wanted to order in for breakfast and he couldn't stop laughing. He'd never heard of breakfast delivery. Well take that! Lucky grill provided our breakfast and it was swell. He got an omelette with feta cheese and gyro meat. I tried some and it was excellent. I got scrambled eggs with bacon, hashbrowns with pancakes on the side. I LOVED the pancakes, but I wasn't a big fan of the bacon or the hashbrowns. I felt like the hashbrowns were a bit mushy and the bacon a bit overcooked. But the delivery was fast and it was a pretty hearty breakfast. If you want something simple and decent go here. It was good, not great for me. But I'd probably order again, if I'm feeling lazy.

57.description: The first time I went there the servings were large, the service was friendly and the price was fair.  Recently, we sat outdoors for a 10 am breakfast on Saturday.  Servings were still large and pretty good.   It took an half hour to be offered coffee, and 1.5 from when we sat down for breakfast until we received our bill.  We had to go inside to request our order be taken, we had to go inside to request our bill.  My friends say one star, but due to the first time visit being a 3, I am calling it a two.

20.description: I asked my partner if he wanted to order in for breakfast and he couldn't stop laughing. He'd never heard of breakfast delivery. Well take that! Lucky grill provided our breakfast and it was swell. He got an omelette with feta cheese and gyro meat. I tried some and it was excellent. I got scrambled eggs with bacon, hashbrowns with pancakes on the side. I LOVED the pancakes, but I wasn't a big fan of the bacon or the hashbrowns. I felt like the hashbrowns were a bit mushy and the bacon a bit overcooked. But the delivery was fast and it was a pretty hearty breakfast. If you want something simple and decent go here. It was good, not great for me. But I'd probably order again, if I'm feeling lazy.

36.description: In the last year I purchased a set of three Groupons for Lucky Grill when I moved into the neighborhood. I really wanted to like this place. I was excited to have a diner nearby and was hoping it could become a regular place for me. The menu was very large and had a good amount of choices to choose from. The reviews on Yelp also sounded good. It seemed so promising. Each time I came here the food was disappointing. Cheap iceberg lettuce for the entirety of a salad, vegetable sides that were obviously from a bag of frozen vegetables, flavorless skillets, overcooked and dried out meat, overcooked poached eggs, watered down split pea soup. Eventually I gave up on this place. I'm not real picky when it comes to restaurants, but it's disappointing when I feel like I could do a much better job. The service was pretty all right but couldn't make up for the food. Sorry Lucky Grill, I really wanted to like you but the poor quality food isn't worth close to the price you want for it. I'm honestly confused as to why this place is still around.

14.description: Not sure I have ever been to a 5 star greasy spoon, but I know most fail to live up to the Lucky.If your asking me...I say go and you will certainly enjoy!

1.description: This dive is now called Love Nails. I can't say enough bad things about this place. I only tried it because my aunt always goes here. They cut up all my fingers. I will have to go get a blood test now because this place doesn't look sanitary. Its so old inside and the nail techs are so rude. They will do the opposite of everything you say. My first time, I asked for flowers painted and they just put 4 dots and charged me $10. I only returned a second time because they were so apologetic. My second time here, the girl wanted to tell me it was $10 extra to get French on my ring fingers and thumbs. She considered that a design. Yet, to do French on all ten fingers she wanted to charge me only $5. I ended up paying $45 for a fill in. I didn't get a pedicure because I was so mad. To top it off, if you complain about the prices, their rude loyal clientele will attack you. Lots of trailer trash and Humboldt Park trash that have moved on up to Jefferson Park go inside this salon. The nail techs laughed when one of their trashy clients attacked me instead of defending me because I was spending a lot more than this lady was spending with her normal manicure.

0.description: This place deserves 0 stars. I came in and sat in the pedicure chair for over an hour. Then they brought in people that were walk ins and started working on them before me. If you want crappy service and a terrible, eye-gauging atmosphere, this is the place for you.

1.description: This place has horrible service the woman in the front was very rude . I wanted to order something from the menu they had on the window and she did not know what the menu said and was confuse. I told her to repeat me what she was putting in the order and she rudely said what I order ? I just wanted to make clear if she put my order right .She had a horrible attitude. I left and she gave me a rude attitude and said whatever and even called me dumb. Was not going to argue over something like that. Over all horrible experience. Never go there

9.description: Cheap prices=cheap quality of food. I've been coming here every since they've opened and I feel the quality has gone down. If I'm every craving a slice of pizza this is the place to go. Just make sure to get a fresh slice not one that has been sitting out for a while. I've tried the broasted chicken meal, cheese fries, and grilled chicken salad. The broasted chicken was very dry and the potatoes were flavorless. I do not recommend this at all. The fries are standard frozen fries and the cheese is watered down. If you want good cheese fries walk down a block to Bob O Rinos. The grilled chicken salad is just some iceberg lettuce (I HATE iceberg) with veggies and flavorless grilled chicken. I say just come here for a cheap slice of pizza and thats about it.

23.description: I have been here many times since my original review and still think it is a very good choice for lunch or dinner.

5.description: Horrible gyro's. The fat was not dripping; it was actually running out of the "meat." That's fine, this is a pizza parlor. Not at all! The worst pizza I've ever had. I thought little clown in Avondale had the worst pizza in the US, but after trying cochiaro's, I know where the worst pizza in the world comes from. I also doubt anyone in that restaurant has at least a food handlers certificate, Dirty, groce, filthy place.

25.description: Cochiaro's is fast, friendly, and inexpensive.  They've been here a few years and've become popular, but you shouldn't have to wait very long at all.  Order from a long menu, have a seat and they'll call your order out when ready.I like their stuffed pizza myself, and believe me I know pizza in Chicago!Would've given them a full 5-star, but remember a price disagreement some time back.  I'm the type that notices and quibbles about almost everything though, so the blame may be half mine own.Plan to return to Cochiaro's myself in a couple days I think, so maybe see you there.  Enjoy!

12.description: My family and I have been ordering from Cochiaro's for several years now and so far we have been pretty happy with the food and service. Not the greatest pizza, but will definately worth the price.

21.description: I stopped in because I needed a little something in my stomach before dinner a few hours later.  I opted for the Polish sausage with fries after looking at the pizza slices which looked like they had been sitting in the warmer for too long.  The polish sausage was pretty dried out and did not taste all that great, I will give them credit for snappy natural casings.  The place smelled like over used frying oil, I think I smelled like grease when I left, pretty gross.  The fries were standard medium thickness frozen...  They tasted of oil past it's prime.  I don't think I'll bother with Cochiaro's again.  I do like Broasted Chicken, but If I need to get a fix I'll go to Broasted Chicken Royal instead.

16.description: This is the second time I have had a problem it took almost two hours to get my pizza delivered an on top of that my food was.cold when I called to complain nothing was done never going to order again

17.description: I have been here many times since my original review and still think it is a very good choice for lunch or dinner.

10.description: I love this place. It's our go to pizza and wings late night food. Best wings in Chicago. Consistently awesome, fast delivery too

11.description: Holy crap.  This place is disgusting.  This IS NOT broasted chicken.  They have NO IDEA how to make a pizza.  Nasty shit.  DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE!!!

26.description: Cheapest pizza slices around, very cheap and filling.  Something like $1.25+ for thin crust, $2.25+ for pan or stuffed.If you are lactose intolerant, I advise to stay away from the pan pizza and stuffed.  More cheesy and a different cheese than the thin.  I felt terrible afterwards.  Like a faucet, if you get my meaning.Brownie's are freshly made.  They are gross.  I could pick up a box of brownie mix and do a better job at home. I wondered, if they couldn't get the brownie right, how well could any meal that needs baking be?The brownie was clumpy, hard in some spots, soft in others, and the glaze was burnt.  One bite was too much.Prices aren't expensive.  I saw an advertisement for rib tips w/salad and french bread for $3.50.  That's a steal.  I might return to try the tips or a panini.  Never any pizza slices, again.

22.description: The Friday Night Girls' Club decided on a whim to order broasted chicken from Cochiario's, mostly because none of us had had any in years.  And I have to say I wasn't disappointed.  It was good broasted chicken.  The garlic  bread sucked, and the broasted potatoes were sort of meh.  Coleslaw was good, if pretty standard.  Food arrived hot, cans of pop cold, and all in good time at a reasonable price.  Given all that I know we'll try it again, perhaps for Italian beef or pizza puffs (The work of the devil, but SO good.)  just because you really need a reliable place for cheap food that contains only a modicum of nourishment.

0.description: Prices listed for the menu on Yelp are not the prices when you go into the restaurant... Not a good look. When I called and informed them of this, got str8 attitude... Not a good look. Pizza is good besides the price difference its a good place to eat. The stars are for the food not the service

20.description: I've been a most satisfied customer of Cochiaro's Pizza for over 12 years now.  Like any small business, there's peak hours, slow hours and "off days," but the service is always focused and sincere, and the food is made exclusively for comfort, convenience and a limited budget....It's not "fine dining," but you aren't being asked to pay for that either..  Just great, friendly, clean surroundings and food that hits that special need....

19.description: I stopped in because I needed a little something in my stomach before dinner a few hours later.  I opted for the Polish sausage with fries after looking at the pizza slices which looked like they had been sitting in the warmer for too long.  The polish sausage was pretty dried out and did not taste all that great, I will give them credit for snappy natural casings.  The place smelled like over used frying oil, I think I smelled like grease when I left, pretty gross.  The fries were standard medium thickness frozen...  They tasted of oil past it's prime.  I don't think I'll bother with Cochiaro's again.  I do like Broasted Chicken, but If I need to get a fix I'll go to Broasted Chicken Royal instead.

2.description: Haven't been to the restaurant, so I can't comment on that.  The delivery is great, I prefer thin crust, and have only ordered the different thin crust football pizzas for parties I've had and everyone always asks where the pizza is from because it's good.  I've tried all the pizza's in the area and Cochiaro's is my favorite pizza in the area, great sauce, good thin crust and the football size pizza is a good deal and hard to find.

18.description: Good pizza and awesome cheeze fries! Also Great on the wallet.

13.description: For the price of the food it isn't bad! I actually kind of like there burgers. The staff at times has screwed up my orders however. I think the staff can be a little friendlier and professional.

4.description: Been ordering and coming here for YEARS. The lady who takes our order on the phone knows us. I wouldn't recommend anything other than pizza and wings, though. I do like the pizza, even stuffed. Not saying it's the best, but worth the money. However throughout the years I think the cook has been replaced by a newer one. The cheese has changed and the pizza overall has gone down in taste. We do still order here for a cheap pizza, but we now mainly go to Porettas. Go here for cheap, good pizza, or a quick bite to eat.

24.description: Someone I know is in Resurrection Hospital across the street from here. I opted to visit here one evening.I had its italian beef sandwich ($4.60). Hot or sweet peppers are an extra 30¢. I thought I requested the hot peppers. I did not get them. I was not charged for them either. So I wound up with a wet italian beef. I think it is mostly ok. It's a thicker cut than other italian beef stands. The sandwich is cut in half and separately wrapped. I (and You) will have problems with beef falling out of the sandwich. Without peppers, there is only a faint flavor of italian seasoning (oregano?), and it is neither fiery nor 'hot'.French fries are included with the sandwich; and it is just as well. They are dreadful. They had the constituency of institutional frozen fries. They disintegrated when chomped. Many varieties of Pringles® have more potato flavor than these.I'm giving here a three-star rating because I suspect that the sandwich, dinners, and pasta side of the menu (although Tom Z. liked the panini) is "second fiddle" to the pizzas.Transit options: The #152 Addison bus ceases running westbound at 9:45, 7:10, & 7:20 pm on weekdays, Saturday, & Sunday, respectively. But the last buses will run to Central. (That is their way to | from the Forest Glen Garage.) When the north side b**eball team has a home game that day, there will be extra service supplied by the North Park Garage, consisting of the _long_, articulated buses. [The #152, and the #85, are on the CTA BustRacker system.] [The articulated buses will have numbers in the 7571-7640 range.] Eastbound buses cease at 10:40, 8:20, & 8:10 pm.The #85 Central runs southbound from here until 1:15 am; northbound until 2:00 am.

6.description: Jan 1 2015,  I was undecided about what to order, but I definitely had a taste for a Gyro. It was about 8 in the evening and I was starving. I never ate a Gyro there and I thought the worse that could happen is they would skimp out on the meat. The meat...... Dear god I don't know what that was, but it should not be put on the menu as a Gyro....that's an insult to people who eat Gyro's in Chicago! The fries were burnt and disgusting! I ordered it takeout so when I called to complain about it, they were closed. Did I mention the grease that dripped out! I made a call the next day to the manager, no dice on a refund! DO NOT GO THERE!

15.description: Very good pizza... Great prize.. Can't beat it... Awesome football pizza..

7.description: I order from here many times before and the food is ok .. today I order a pizza I understand there is a snow storm so food was going to take longer then expected but 4 hrs and 15 min is just ridiculous !!  The food was cold and i mean cold like they took it out of the refrigerator , we didn't receive any kind of discount or even a freaking coupon . Now what kind of business is this !! Very desapointed . I'm never going to order from here again.

8.description: Never going here again after I got sick from the cheese fries. The food quality is obviously very cheap and they don't seem to care much. I doubt there are many sanitation rules in place..

3.description: We never really had anything other than pizza and rib tips. Pizza is good and that's what we always order. Rib tips are very light on meat and very fatty.

14.description: Cheapest pizza slices around, very cheap and filling.  Something like $1.25+ for thin crust, $2.25+ for pan or stuffed.If you are lactose intolerant, I advise to stay away from the pan pizza and stuffed.  More cheesy and a different cheese than the thin.  I felt terrible afterwards.  Like a faucet, if you get my meaning.Brownie's are freshly made.  They are gross.  I could pick up a box of brownie mix and do a better job at home. I wondered, if they couldn't get the brownie right, how well could any meal that needs baking be?The brownie was clumpy, hard in some spots, soft in others, and the glaze was burnt.  One bite was too much.Prices aren't expensive.  I saw an advertisement for rib tips w/salad and french bread for $3.50.  That's a steal.  I might return to try the tips or a panini.  Never any pizza slices, again.

3.description: It has been a long time since I have been here (and I live one block away).  I am generously giving it 3 stars simply for it's relaxed atmosphere.  The food is easily forgotten, the service only decent and the decor is, well, non-existent.  But it was comfortable and relaxed inside.  No one was in a rush, or rude.  They didn't mind my husband and I just sitting and talking for an extra hour.  So, for that it was nice.  Perhaps the dish I ordered wasn't one of their best, or the drink I tasted was mixed incorrectly....  Anyhow, it seems to be a popular spot for law enforcement folks, so it must be very safe inside. :)
