1.description: Went here for breakfast with my family.  There was not a children's menu with breakfast options which made the tab a bit on the pricey side.  There was a children's menu for lunch and dinner but maybe we were just not given one for breakfast.  The orange juice was fresh squeezed and I think the whip cream is homemade and not from a can.  Pancakes were good and the omelet was excellent.  I might go back there to try their lunch and dinner options.

2.description: The food could be better. Expensive for what you get. Unfortunate because its so close to where we live!

0.description: My gf and I went in today and it's a great place. It has an old school breakfast place feel to it. Great service by the staff they always kept checking up on us and the rest of the customers. Huge shoutout to Karie our waitress, she was great. * our second time there and many more to come.

4.description: I love this place...staff is friendly and helpful..funky atmosphere...the food is always very good...it's a diner ...not greasy at all...cold beer and a full bar...cheap..what more do ya want!

56.description: My cousin told me about this salon, so I thought I would try it and I'm so glad I did.  Mirsa does my cut and color and she is amazing!  Very caring and considerate and extremely knowledgable.  The salon has a great location and very nice and comfortable environment.  Def worth trying out.  Also, your 7th haircut is free.  (I get my brows done here too!!) - Michelle

29.description: I've been coming to InStyle for a little under a year & have had some of the best highlights & haircuts of my life. My hair looks incredible every time I leave & remains looking that way for the remainder of time, until I return. I also appreciate that they are wheelchair accessible, even though the rinse sinks aren't, because the chairs are attached to them & can't be undone. But, because my chair has a tilt function, if I go to the sink on the end, we can make it work for the rinse out. The stylists are very sweet  & respectful of their clients. Anytime I visit, almost all of the clients are holding conversations with each other & the stylists. It's a fun atmosphere to be in. I highly recommend this salon if you value looking beautiful, just from a great haircut. I gain confidence rolling out of this place everytime. And I also love that my hair doesn't smell like chemicals, when I leave. The place I used to go to, used product with chemicals I would still smell for a week after.

42.description: i Love this place and the reason i love this place is because one of the ladies who's really awesome and actually knows what she is doing and does a fantastic job is mirsa...... shes amazing and her hands are like magic :) the other ladies are great as well but i only go there for mirsa ............so if your looking for a new salon. try this you will love it and make sure you book with MIRSA

23.description: The stylists here are great - you can tell that they all get along (for the most part - LOL). But there's just a really good vibe to the place that I always enjoy. Lots of natural light. They offered me coffee - seriously! Julie cut my hair and she was just delightful - truly a magician with the scissors. Plenty of on-street parking, too. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.

47.description: Wow! First time at In Style Hair Studio & Day Spa and my wife loved it. I also liked the fact that they take there time and just a heads up" I recommend four anybody to get there early. and as for price well my wife got a hair cut plus high lights = $110 with tip but, over all it was worth it, will go there again. And if they had a suggestion box I would of suggest to them that a liquor license would of been great. :)

8.description: First time here, great experience and very nice associates. So happy with my hair. Thank you Yessinia!

31.description: LOVE THIS PLACE!I have never had a consistent hair stylist. I could never find one that could cut AND style my curly thinning hair.  My hair is not kinky just very curly and long. So needless to say, I only get my haircut about every 6 months because it is a painful processSo I have tried many salons on the NW side and throughout the city and south suburbs. I found In Style on Yelp. Boy am I glad...There were all types of clientele in the salon including a male. My stylist was Layla (hope that's spelled right). She was super friendly and made me feel welcome and comfortable. We discussed what I wanted and she made sure several times that what she was doing to my hair was agreeable with meSo let me preface this next part by saying I am 38 and so have had many haircuts....For $25 I got the best cut and style I have ever had. My hair is not easy to cut. I actually left the salon smiling :)My stylist was not pushy and gave me some suggestions for the next haircutThere are plenty of chairs and all the stylists seem very friendlyIf you are looking for a new salon or maybe 1 that is cheaper, check this one out. On second thought, don't. Then it will get too crowded because you will love it

34.description: After receiving bad service from my salon after going there for 3 years, I decided to try this place.  Glad I did.  Service was excellent, the price was right and I can walk there.   I received many compliments on the cut.

16.description: i love my hair in the process will take forever but my stylist did a good job of doing it faster. color is so pretty it gets me so excited. and the owner is nice too. found a place to stick with now.

13.description: I came in for a haircut in high hopes. I've read the reviews and thought I should try it. Plus my brother got a haircut earlier in the week and his hair looked great. I'm a simple girl who just wanted a trim. One length haircut. Easiest style of haircuts. My stylist must have really f***** up because after blowing my hair she decided to cut my ends all crazy and randomly. Every girls hair is precious and I cannot begin to describe how upset I feel. It took me forever to grow my hair long and for someone to fuck it up and be charged $35. If I wanted a bad haircut I would of gone to a $5 haircut salon. Do not! I repeat do not get your haircut here.

11.description: Had the pleasure of having Yesenia work on my hair last week.Went in for just a trim and walked out with a fabulous hair color too. Have received so many compliments since last week from others that I felt the need to compliment her on Yelp.Thanks again Yesenia and hope to be seeing you again.Ms. B

39.description: Made my first visit to InStyle on a recommendation of a friend. I was delightfly surprised. Everyone was professional and enthusiastic, willing to help with spot-on styling suggestions.  While washing my hair, Robert gave a scalp massage that was the best I ever had!  Christina did my manicure and Mirsa did eyebrow rethreading. I highly recommend them all.  Here the prices are reasonable, a real selling point. The salon itself is very pleasant, but could use a little more style-- some artwork on the walls, better music or speakers, and some sound absorbing panels to muffle noise and voices.   A few scarves or hair ornaments for sale might be a nice touch.  These changes need not be expensive, just creative. This would give the salon real class.I hope the community becomes aware of this little gem.  i am definitely switching from my old salon and coming here.

37.description: i came here a few months ago and was fairly happy with the service. my cut was nice and the stylist even dried and straightened my hair (which is huge because my hair is long and thick!). the only reason i gave it 3 stars is because the stylist saw 2 gray hairs and kept telling me i needed to color my hair!! she also waxed my eyebrows and not only took 30 minutes to do that but they were uneven and i had wax all over my face. but at the end of it all the experience wasn't THAT bad.i figured if my experience at this location was good then hopefully my experience at the Elston location (which is walking distance from my house) would be great. i went there last week and i am sad to say that i have NOTHING good to say about my experience there (if you want to know all the details just hop on the Elston page!!). its a same because it is so close and i wanted to like this place so badly!! i guess i will just go back to traveling to the suburbs to get my hair and eyebrows done.

0.description: Tried it today for the first time. Understand, I've been going to a salon in Michigan for about 5 years because they wonderful, but it's a 5 hour drive . I read the reviews, desperately needing a cut and color, I decided to give them a try. I was surprising pleased with the end result. Mayra was my stylist. Awesome!  I have very curly hair and I like it straight. I like my color a certain way!  She was able do both. Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. I've been to many salons here in Chicago and hadn't found a "home" for my hair, until today.

38.description: Made my first visit to InStyle a few weeks ago with my friend Maria we both had a cut and color Robert was a great I loved the hair cut and color. My friend Maria loved her cut and color too, he was nice and very funny. the only draw back of this place is their very pricey but in all honesty I really did like the place and the service.. Thanks Rob :)

51.description: Two months ago I served as maid of honor for my best friend's wedding.  I've never needed to get my hair done for an event before so I had no idea where to go.  This salon was recommended to us by a friend.  I was a little skeptical at first.  I thought, "Really?  Portage Park?  There's nothing in Portage Park."  (Unfortunately I am all too familiar with the Northwest Side.)  Man alive was I shocked by this place!  I found it was really clean and modern looking.  The employees were really friendly.  Most importantly they did a KICK ASS job on my hair and makeup.  I was truly impressed.  The ladies that did our hair and makeup spent so much time on us and they were so meticulous.  We looked perfect.  Seriously, my best friend looked like a Greek goddess and I looked smokin (usually I'm pleased if I at least look mildly spicy but smokin...whoa!  Whole 'nother level.)  I received so many compliments at the wedding!   I wish I could remember the ladies names but I do remember they were both European.  If I wasn't so devoted to my current stylist I would totally come here for a hair cut.  They seemed to have a pretty devoted clientèle.

27.description: Thanks to all the good reviews on this place, I am happy to say that I went to see if they could fix a disasterous haircut I received a few weeks prior.  Leyla was a miracle worker.  I couldn't  be more pleased  that she was able to not only fix it, but she really gave me an awesome cut and listened to what it was I wanted.  This is now my go-to place in the future.  And the prices are very good.  The salon is very pretty and clean as well.  Thank you all for your good reviews.

32.description: I'm really glad I discovered this place. I had been looking for a new hairstylist/salon for a while now, but I was hesitant to try a new place. After reading the reviews on here, and seeing that this salon is located in the Portage Park neighborhood (which is where I live), I decided to give this place a try. I'm glad I did!The salon was very clean and modern. The people were friendly and always doing something to help out, whether cleaning, laundry, answering phones, etc.I called on a Friday evening and was able to make an appointment for Saturday, the next day (during a holiday weekend might I add). I made an appointment with Lela based on the reviews, but I would feel just as comfortable having anyone else in the salon work on my hair. Lela was nice, personable, and took me on time. She listened to what I wanted done and the results were perfect. (I was just getting a cut/trim). She didn't rush to finish me. She took her time and really focused on me, which was nice and a good change from what I was used to. I will definitely be going back!If anyone else, especially in the Portage Park neighborhood, is looking for a new place, look no more! Give this place a try! You will NOT be disappointed!

54.description: What a difference a great haircut makes! And what a difference it makes to have an actual professional do it (as opposed to a hack, like the ones at cheaper salons)! I discovered In Style a year or so ago when my girlfriend's friend and former boss gushed to us about it. She was so right! Everyone here is so friendly and the woman who always cuts my hair, Leila (I believe I am spelling it right) is so great at what she does - I would have to call her an artist! She's there taking chunks of my hair, clip-clip-clip...and somehow, like magic, it looks straight and not choppy (what a concept!).  She's also never been afraid to tell me when she's not sure a certain style will work on me or tell me what having my hair cut the way I am thinking might entail. She's got an amazing eye for shape and I think that makes all the difference. I would have to recommend this place to anyone looking for an inexpensive (but not so inexpensive  that it means your stylist is inexperienced and has no idea what they're doing) haircut - or hair color, make-up, etc. I've had my hair highlighted here before, too, and it turned out just as fantastic.

48.description: I have lived in Chicago for a year now and had a hard time finding a salon. I came across In Style because I finally figured I might as try to find a place nearby. I have been to the Irving Park location once and now have returned to their new locations on Elston several times. The owner, Leila, makes you feel so comfortable and is so friendly. I plan on sticking with this salon for a while and that's such a relief!

44.description: I just discovered this place thanks to all you smart yelpers who gave this salon such great reviews! I had Mirsa as a stylist. Not only is she a true professional, she is super  sweet. I highly recommend her as a stylist. I went in with dark hair wanting to lighten it up. Now I did go in with an open mind. I was thinking all-over color at first. The  first thing Mirsa did was discuss my desires and realistically what she could do to my hair. I really appreciated  that she was straight up with me. She gave me a couple options. It was decided full highlights would be the best option. This gave me the lighter look I wanted without damaging my hair. Mirsa also gave me a great haircut. I am so happy with the results! I also want to let you guys know I met Layla the owner, she is very nice and she thanked me for giving her salon a try. Great customer service. btw my husband loved my hair too!  Also, we went to get a bite to eat at a local place we frequent ,the waitress we've had several times noticed my hair right away. She complimented me , said it looked great! I had just left there twenty minutes ago and I already received 2 compliments! I just found my new salon! One more thing, this salon gets a lot of people needing corrective color from Gallery of Hair! (read reviews of GOH) So do yourself a favor skip GOH and head east on Irving to this gem of a salon! I swear you will not be disappointed.

24.description: My experience:After trying many different salon's & hair stylist. I must say this salon deserves an A+.Great customer service, attention to detail, clean environment, and most of all the final outcome of work. My stylist, Ms. Dora was absolutely outstanding,Great work!Also, my compliments to the other girls.Great job InStyle !

7.description: In search of a balayage, I tried this place and had Yesenia attend me.  My dark dark brown hair is very stubborn with hair dye and I've had trouble finding a good colorist to give me results without the brassy red/orange undertone.   She did a great job with the balayage blending, color tone, and also a hair cut.  I was very clear when explaining what I wanted and she not only met, but exceeded my expectations.   Thank you Yesenia,  I'll definitely be back.

49.description: I just moved to this area last year and was searching for a new hair stylist. I'm so happy I found this place and Mirsa. She took the time to meet with me and go through some hair style books before even sitting down in the chair. She wanted to make sure she got a good idea of what I wanted before she started cutting. She is also very friendly and will make suggestions on what she thinks will help a person achieve their hair style goals. This salon is nicely done and clean. The only annoyance (and it is a small one) is that tips have to be paid in cash. You cannot include your tip on your credit or debit card. Overall,  I'm very happy with the service. My hair looks great and the price (with tip) was just under $35.

40.description: I, too, am very pleased with In Style and have had three cuts  and colors - going for a 4th - in the past year with Dora.  Never disappointed.  Prices and cut and color.  What more can you ask for?  I hesitated on writing a review because once the news is out, I may never get in!  :-(  I am happy I have somewhere to go in Portage Park!

53.description: I had my haircut here for the first time by Mirsa. She's awesome! I went from long hair to a cute bob. I had a great time chatting with her while she worked on my hair and the atmosphere was very relaxed and comfortable. Also, the prices are very reasonable. I expected the cut to cost much more. I'm definitely looking forward to becoming a regular client here.

30.description: Love the place, love the spirit, love the girls. In my lifetime I have visited more than enough hair salons but this one beats them all. It's always clean, it's always organized, the atmosphere is friendly. DORA is my girl, she does everything I want her to do, and I can always trust her on her HONEST ideas. This place deserves A***, Thanks Bulgarian ladies

46.description: I'm so happy I checked this salon out! It's in my neighborhood, has very reasonable prices, friendly stylists, and clean. I've been three times and have had three different stylists. I know, I know I cheat. It's not really intentional, either. I am a little lazy when it comes to getting haircuts so when I call to make the appointment it's usually same day and whoever is first available. The first, Destiny, is no longer at this location (I believe she transferred when the owner opened another salon location). The second, Mirsa, is the most friendly stylist there I think! She'll talk to you about anything and everything and is as sweet as can be. Quite funny too, and of course gives solid hair cuts. My last haircut was done by Dora, and though she's more quiet, she's very thorough and gave me an exceptional cut. I LOVE it. She framed my hair nicely around my face and gave me exactly the layers I asked for. I've been charged between $23-27 for the shampoo, cut and style which I think is very affordable. They accept credit cards but gratuities are cash only. Parking can be found on Irving Park Rd. or on a side street just around the corner from the salon - never a problem.Highly recommend this salon, and love that it is located in Portage Park!

1.description: My cousin and I decided to impulsively get our hair done and In Style couldn't be more accomodating! Of course we wanted everything so we spent a good amount of time in the salon but it was well worth it. We both got cuts and full head highlights that look amazing! My niece was with us just to get a cut and they deep conditioned her hair just because they knew she needed it. We were so comfortable that all 3 of us went far more adventurous than we've ever gone (I've been thinking of bangs for a decade and never had the courage until now). I found my new salon!

55.description: I love this place. It is a warm, friendly environment. I used to go to Gallery of Hair until this place opened up. They do everything here, and you don't feel awkward.I went on vacation to Mexico a year ago and my firends kept telling me to get a brazillian wax , so I didn't have to waste my time shaving. I have never had waxing done in my life and I was really freaked out to get it done. When I went in to get myhair done I asked about waxing and the owner Layla, said yes she did it.  I made the appointment and was glad I did.Layla did a wonderful job, she was so relaxing to be around. Having waxing done in private places can give you a very uncomfortable and uneasy feeling, but Layla made it seem like it was no big deal. She kept asking if I was ok, if I needed a break, etc. She was gentle and knew what she was doing.  Waxing is no 5 minute affair, I think I was there for 3 hours, but it was well worth it. Being in Mexico and not having to worry about stubble or stray hairs was great. I never go anywhere else to get pampered now.  InStyle is my choice of pampering.

9.description: Ive been holding off writing a review for selfish reasons but I've had a change of heart. In Style is a hidden gem. These European ladies are highly skilled hair stylist. My girl is Dora is great but the owner is awesome too. Take it from me a girl living in Portage Park, who felt she had to drive to the more trendy places to get a great hair cut. No longer! I always bring a picture of a hair style I want and I am never disappointed. Another plus, their prices. Where in this expensive city can you get a beautiful hair cut for under $40.00?! I don't know maybe Europeans are more reasonable about hair cuts prices? I'm not complaining.  But at these prices I can tip very generously. Please stay this way. Thank you In Style.

26.description: Writing this review a week late and I'm still seething.This was my second visit to InStyle. My first experience wasn't fabulous, but I decided to give them a second try.I got to the salon at my appointment time and met Nicole there. Everything was going great until I sat down in her chair. There was another 'stylist' curled up in the chair next to me. It became abundantly clear very early that I was going to have to listen to the asinine conversation of these two for my entire haircut. I'm not the kind of person that needs someone to talk to me the whole time, but I do want to be able to sit in peace. They were talking and swearing around me the whole time about having babies, missing periods, etc. Worse yet, they were talking bad about the salon, the manager and other stylists the rest of the time and that made me really uncomfortable. Evidentially, the manager had asked my stylist if she could take two appointments (beginning 45 minutes after the start of my appointment), and when my stylist told the other, she was pissed off because initially they were her appointments, so she complained and pouted the whole time I was there. The other stylist sat in the chair picking at her hair and complaining about how much it sucked working there until the manager came over and asked her if she wanted to take one of the appointments (thankfully, I couldn't hear the manager. I just gathered all this info from the asinine conversation). She said no and proceeded to complain about the salon and manager.So let's get back to the actual haircut. It sucks. Not really a haircut actually. The texture of my hair shouldn't feel like I need a haircut again one week after. I have long layers and she only cut the bottom layer. This presents multiple problems in that I got my hair cut so the dead ends would be gone and it could grow healthily, so now that's not going to happen correctly. Also since the layers are more or less the same length, it's not laying right and the bottom just poofs out. When she agreed to take these other appointments, I knew she was going to have to rush through my haircut and I was right. Nothing is even. She didn't check to see if the length matched by comparing the sides in the front, so it doesn't! The layers aren't even on same side. When comparing the length in the back, she took all the hair in the back, held it up, and cut straight across, so the middle of the back is shorter than the sides in the back. It's really the most haphazard haircut I've ever gotten. The bangs were one thing I was not going to be rushed through. She cut my bangs at a very dramatic angle, and I clearly have a more subtle angle as I wear them side-swept. I said something to that effect and she tried to assure me that it would look better when it dried, and I know that's not the truth. After she sort of fixed it, but clearly not to my liking, there was a chunk of bangs that was at least half an inch longer than the rest and didn't blend. It was so obviously wrong that I was mortified when I had to pull out the piece and demand that she cut it. It's still too long! She assured me that it would look better when I flat ironed it at home. All I could do was sit there fuming while she burnt my head with the hair dryer and scraped my scalp raw with the hair clips so I didn't scream or cry. Here's a free hint: If your client is wincing every time you clip the hair up, you're doing it wrong. Here's another one: If you don't notice your client is wincing, you should stop talking to the 'stylist' who is curled up in a ball in her chair.My worst haircut experience as an adult by far.The other time I visited, I saw Dora. She's very sweet. The reason I won't review higher is because it took really long, especially on my bangs, and I still wasn't very happy with them.The one star is for how nice Dora is, how affordable it is ($35 for a haircut) and how easy it is to get an appointment the same day.

25.description: Ever since I started coming here I have never had a bad experience. I just got highlights on my hair. Nicole did my highlights. I was nervous to get a lighter color since I am a brunette. My hair is normally really dark. She gave me great advice on which color would match my skin tone. We choose a warm blonde color. It looks good.

12.description: Absolutely loving this salon!! I decided to get a last minute trim, and brow for my birthday so I looked up the nearest salon. Very happy to have found this salon! Layla does an excellent job on hair, and eyebrows. She gave me a very clean shape for brows, and was considerate on how I wanted my hair. Unlike other stylists who ask you what you want, and do whatever THEY want. This woman works with grace, I highly recommend her. Plan to come back very often :) !!

21.description: I have been coming here for YEARS, actually I think since it first opened! The owner, Leyla, is a lovely lady. She is fun and really works with you. Mirza is the BEST gal that place has. She is just so amazing. She is engaging, works with you, remembers you and the stories told, she's fun and really has great ideas if you walk in clueless to what you want. If you live in Portage Park I highly recommend her or Leyla. I've only had those two work on me and I think they are great. The others in the store though from what I have seen are also very friendly and engaging.

17.description: Older crowd. Waited over 35 minutes to get my bangs trimmed, which takes 5 min. The older hair stylists ignored me when I approached her to ask her how much longer while she was sitting at the front desk typing away. Not sure I'll be coming back. They seemed friendly to their regulars....

10.description: I have to give credit where it is due and Yesenia, one of the hair stylists at In Style, deserves it and more. I've been looking for a hair salon that doesn't break the bank just for a haircut (ahem, Mario Tricocci) and came across In Style on Yelp (where else?). I was glad I made an appointment because I can tell they can get busy when I got there. Yesenia greeted me warmly and she listened to what I wanted and did a great job with my haircut. I'm the type of girl that wouldn't comb my hair if I can get away with it and so I'm not a fan of spending time blow drying or straightening my hair. Yesenia cut my hair so well that my hair falls just exactly the way I want it without applying much to it (basically just comb it). Oh yeah, she also waxed my eye brows and they looked great.  I'm definitely going back and Yesenia will be my go-to girl. One thing to be reminded though,  this place is cash only but there's an ATM in the salon in case you forget to bring cash.

5.description: If you want an amazing style, I recommend this place 100%. Excellent service with personalized treatment. Easy parking!!!! I did my ombré 4 months ago with the owner, and It was incredible. Everybody have been asking  me about it. It was really good. I came to retouch it today, I can't wait to see the results, but I'm confident it will make me happy.

3.description: Awesome stylist the Dominican lady Mayra best around! Great salon. Walk in or make appointment

35.description: I'm really glad my friend introduced me to this place a few years ago.  First, it's in walking distance for me, which is great, and second, I've been able to get an appointment almost anytime I've called for the same day, even though I try and schedule my appointments out a few weeks.For one, this place is very reasonably priced for the quality products they use and the service you receive.  I was going to Christina for the majority of the time, and when she left I was very sad, but I have now been going to Leyla and have been very pleased with the service she provides.  She is always very friendly and does a great job. I went to get a manicure and had Kimberly do my nails.  She does a fantastic job and she has the coolest hair!  Seriously-check it out!I typically get my hair colored/re-colored, highlights/lowlights, haircut, and eyebrows done.What I like about the place is that it doesn't make you feel uncomfortable, which I think a lot of places do, and that's why I had such a hard time finding a place to get my hair done for so many years.  The place is also very clean, which is extremely important to me, and there is plenty of parking close-by.

19.description: I've been coming to InStyle for a little under a year & have had some of the best highlights & haircuts of my life. My hair looks incredible every time I leave & remains looking that way for the remainder of time, until I return. I also appreciate that they are wheelchair accessible, even though the rinse sinks aren't, because the chairs are attached to them & can't be undone. But, because my chair has a tilt function, if I go to the sink on the end, we can make it work for the rinse out. The stylists are very sweet  & respectful of their clients. Anytime I visit, almost all of the clients are holding conversations with each other & the stylists. It's a fun atmosphere to be in. I highly recommend this salon if you value looking beautiful, just from a great haircut. I gain confidence rolling out of this place everytime. And I also love that my hair doesn't smell like chemicals, when I leave. The place I used to go to, used product with chemicals I would still smell for a week after.

28.description: First time checking out this salon, and I was not dissapointed! Very classy and elegant appearing salon, well decorated but with a very laid back mood; perfect combo! They were in full swing when I walked in, but Drea quickly took me in. She was very knowledgeable and very comfortable to chat with! Love my hair, love my brows! Very reasonably priced. I found my salon home!

45.description: I actually visited their newer location on Elston - same family ownership, so this review is for that location but the service/stylists are the same. :o)  I showed up Sunday early evening after biking for half an hour, sweaty as all get out and sunburned to death from a whole afternoon at the pride parade with no sunscreen.  I was a hot mess - ESPECIALLY the RIDICULOUS haircut I had gotten from another 'salon' the day before.Remember 'No Country for Old Men'?  Remember the do' that Javier Bardem was rockin' in that flick?  Yeah, it was like that haircut mated with a 17th century page boy to produce the worst haircut in the history of the world.  I literally had the same cut when I was 6 years old.  It was awful then, and it was awful Saturday when I got it.So when I showed up at Instyle Sunday, sweaty and desperate for a fix to for my head monster before the work week began again, the lovely and kind Lela (sp? pronounced Layla) didn't even bat an eye. :o)  She took me the moment I walked in, let me show her photos on my laptop of the hairstyle I had actually wanted, and talked me through what would work and what wouldn't, since my hair had gotten sheared so short the day prior.  She made a couple recommendations and we got down to business.What I got was the cutest haircut I've probably ever had.  An adorable layered bob with side swept bangs - bouncy and sassy, perfect for the summer and for bike commuting.  Since I shower everyday at my work locker room, I can't bother with carrying a bunch of styling tools and products - not that I'd know how to use them anyway, because I'm basically inept at that sort of thing.  The cut she gave me looks AWESOME with literally no effort.  I've gotten a ton of compliments on it in the past couple days since I got it Lela was really easy to talk to - very friendly with a great sense of humor.  I haven't had a regular stylist since I moved to Chicago 5 years ago, because I tend to have bad experiences (like the one Saturday before I went to InStyle), but I think I have found my place!  I am definitely already planning on going back to have highlights put in.  The salon itself (again, this is the one on Elston) was very nice.  Chic, modern, clean.  The bathroom was stylish and modern looking.  A great overall experience.  Recommended!

33.description: I was tired of the production line nail salons.  I came here and Kimberly gave me a great pedicure.  She took her time and she's very personable.   The pedi was $30, slightly more than other places, but WELL WORTH it.  My feet feel so good.  I'm thinking of going back for a haircut.  Oh, and the salon is clean and modern.

43.description: Robert is the bomb diggity! Definitely going back.woot woot!

2.description: Worse no-chip manicure experience ever & the pedicure experience was not all that either smh.....she didn't use all the necessary polish to do the no chip I realized that after I went to another salon to do my no-chip she tried to claim there was something wrong with the polish so unprofessional & mediocre the no chip kept shrinking so she had to remove it all she's lucky I left her a tip for the pedi....

18.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place.  I have been looking for a new salon after The Gallery of Hair totally destroyed my hair and I happened upon this place.  Honestly, I couldn't be happier.  I was seen the same day I called. I was placed with Ada who listened to what I wanted and asked questions BEFORE she started.  I had a lot done; color, highlights and a cut.  I am so unbelievably happy with the results.  The color turned out exactly the way I wanted it and the cut is so cute and stylish.  I will continue to go here!  Wonderful place.  People were very nice and friendly.  Yeah!

41.description: I went to In Style on the recommendation of a friend, and I'm so glad I did!  Robert was awesome, he gave me the best haircut I've had in a while!  I went in without any clear cut style in mind, but somehow he gave me exactly what I wanted.  I will definitely be going back for another visit!

52.description: This place deserves more than 5 stars but unfortunately, we're only able to give 5! Let me just start off by saying that everyone here (employees and other clients) are so nice and personable. This is similar Cheers, you get the feeling it's a place where everyone knows your name and your always welcomed! I called on a Wednesday to make a hair and make-up appointment for my wedding reception on Saturday (2 days later) and they were able to squeeze me in! They were so friendly on the phone and in making the appointment! Kristina did my hair and make-up. I kind of told her what I was looking for and she showed me a few pictures of different styles just to get a clearer picture. While getting my hair done, I was talking with other clients and employers and it was such a friendly atmosphere. My hair came out beautiful....Kristina did a wonderful job! My make-up was beautiful...exactly what I wanted!!! I would definitely go back to this place! They have a great atmosphere, great parking, great service! The best thing is they can accomodate for any last minute appointments! I do have to say, the night of my reception, my hair was still perfect (lasting all through the night, as did my make-up) and EVERYONE complimented by hair and make-up! Thank you so much Kristina!!!! If you need any hair/make-up....GO HERE!!!

50.description: I love this place!!! I went to many high end and expensive salons in Chicago.  In style does a much better job at a much more reasonable price.Layla the owner does a outstanding job running a great salon and spa making my hair and self feel and look great! And she does threading like a artist.Glad I found this hidden gem  - very impressed.

4.description: I live in the old irving park area and i wanted to chop my hair on a whim .l. i looked up some local places on yelp. I called ahead and they said I could come in Saturday afternoon! The salon is very nice on the inside and very clean. The hair stylist talked with me quite a bit about what i wanted and then she did a great job. I cut off almost 5 inches and i love it!I would definitely go back!

6.description: Layla and Dora are the real MVPs! I came to her a few months ago with a terrible haircut and very low hopes of anyone being able to fix it (Really! My hair was a hot mess!) Anyway, Dora did an outstanding job and worked her magic, I left a very happy costumer. I recommended this place to my mom as she was looking for a new hairstylist (she's a very hard person to please when it comes to her hair) Dora gave her a wonderful haircut, my mom left feeling a million bucks! Thank you Dora for giving my mom a huge boost of confidence!I went in again yesterday for a haircut and ombre. I loved it!! From the cut to the color! Thank you so much Layla for taking the time to make me pretty! These ladies really do take their time, I have never felt rushed, even when they're super busy. I would give a 6 star!

22.description: Never have I EVER gone to a stylist more than once..Dora is my first!! I've gone to her maybe about five or 6 times, I have  very short hair,  and  I'm very picky with who touches my hair, but she hasn't let me down at all!  I've referred people to her and even got my mom to go to her and we absolutely LOVE her! I've also seen how other clients have walked out and their hair looked great so I'm positive that the other girls are great. Thank you Dora for the amazing service and haircuts!

15.description: My experience:After trying many different salon's & hair stylist. I must say this salon deserves an A+.Great customer service, attention to detail, clean environment, and most of all the final outcome of work. My stylist, Ms. Dora was absolutely outstanding,Great work!Also, my compliments to the other girls.Great job InStyle !

20.description: Older crowd. Waited over 35 minutes to get my bangs trimmed, which takes 5 min. The older hair stylists ignored me when I approached her to ask her how much longer while she was sitting at the front desk typing away. Not sure I'll be coming back. They seemed friendly to their regulars....

36.description: This is my fourth time getting my hair cut at In Style Hair Studio & Day Spa.  I have been very satisfied every time and received great cuts.  Today, Kimberly cut my hair and did a perfect job!  She is a very talented stylist and completely understood my needs and was able to cut and style my hair in a style that suited me very well. She took the time to be sure she understood what I wanted. Kimberly was personable and I was instantly comfortable and at ease for her.  This salon is a great asset to this community.  The salon, itself, is spacious, clean and modern. I highly recommend!

14.description: So it was a last minute decision to take my niece for a hair cut. I Google hair salons near the area I was in at the time and came up with this place. I walked in with  no appointment and I was seen right away. So great with walk ins. My niece liked her hair cut and she got bangs too, which looked great. The stylist did a great job. I didn't get her name. Only downfall was that it was pricey. I paid about 40 bucks tip included. My niece just got a wash, trim, bangs and blow dry.  Yes I understand you get what you paid for and what not but I usually pay 25 tip included and I have way longer hair than my niece.  Overall I like that I was help right away, place is nice and clean.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

28.description: I'm only reviewing their maternity selection.  The prices for used maternity clothing are the same as sale racks for brand new clothes at Pea in the Pod and Belly Dance, so I'd pass if I were you.  Selection for XS and S is very limited.

1.description: Im not a fan of this place. It felt super overwhelming with the racks super packed. Most of the stuff was rather expensive. For example, the gap items were cheaper on sale at gap.com. I don't see the point in buying secondhand of its more expensive than the new item. Other stuff can be bought cheaper at Marshalls and TJ Maxx. There were some nice sweaters, but I wouldn't pay $50 for a sweater a newborn would wear just a few times.

9.description: Really love this place, I left today with over 60 dollars of clothes, and halloween costumes for my two little ones...First time there n def will be coming back more n more!!! This is def an "upscale" second hand store compared to once upon a child, and the lady was very helpful there with finding my kids costumes!!!! The prices our fair, and the clothes were all neatly placed and not thrown around and torn up...The only thing I didn't agree with was the ugg baby boots that were kind of dirtier than expected were 20 bux.....That too me is a little high for baby second worn boots....but other than that i really love this place n i didn't catch the employees name but thank you so much for helping me find the costumes for my kids and saved a lot!!!! Will be coming in constantly for my kids clothes!

29.description: I've been a dedicated consignment store shopper for decades, so when I finally had a baby daughter, one of my first questions was, "Are there any hip consignment shops for kids?"  Thank God, the answer is yes.  My daughter is two now, and I've dressed her almost exclusively from Second Child.  But you would never know I wasn't dropping beaucoup bucks at super expensive boutiques across the city.  Everywhere we go, her outfits turn heads, and I didn't have to raid her college fund.

23.description: I have been in this store several times and each time I have a negative experience due to the unhelpful sales staff.  I just called today looking for any items made by Community Playthings, a maker of wooden blocks, and large items such as mini kitchenettes, tables chairs etc.  I asked the sales person who said they have such items but don't know who the makers are. She also mentioned she didn't know any brand names in particular that they carry in the store.  I found that hard to believe that being that second hand stores generally know if they are carrying a name brand stroller like Bugaboo, or the Bob jogger stroller or other high end items.

5.description: I loved this place.  I will be a new "Glamma" in April and wanted to pick up a few things.  It ended up being their end of the season closeout and I was able to purchase a huge bag of clothes, which included several dresses and four or five Baby Gap sweaters, all nicely worn.  I also found a cradle swing which was on my daughter's registry for almost $200.00...I paid $11.00.  I spent $40.00 and got the swing, the dresses, (all name brand), several pairs of adorable leggings, sweaters and a Baby Gap "shearling" coat for next winter that looked absolutely brand new.  I was thrilled and my daughter was thrilled.  I presented the items to my daughter at her baby shower and no one knew they were pre-worn.  I will be going back for spring things. P.S.  The owners helped me dismantle the cradle swing as I had no clue.

31.description: I don't even have a first child yet along a second one, but if I was a mom I'd shop here...especially after noticing lately how expensive kids clothing can be. Seriously- $50 for a sweater that a toddler can wear 2 times before growing out of?  The Second Child understands that, which is why the owners decided to open this store 20 years ago upon having her second child.I was shopping with fellow yelper Tristin M, who being the fabulous mom that she is noticed this store.  I did some browsing of my own and noticed that they have some really cute clothes at amazing prices...I wish some of this stuff came in my own size! I'll be back someday (although not for many many years) to shop for my own children so hopefully this store will stay open for another 20 years!

25.description: Love, love, love this place. I'm expecting my daughter July 7th, 2010. The owner is extremely helpful and all of the items are in fantastic condition. I've always managed to find something on each of my adventures here. Most of my daughter's wardrobe has been purchased from The Second Child. The location off the brown line at Armitage is great. I found a beautiful baptismal gown and bonnet which had never been worn. It had just been brought in an hour earlier. Everytime I've been to the Second Child there seems to be a sale of some sort. Great selection, great prices and awesome customer service.

12.description: How anyone could give this place four stars I have no idea. I can't believe I even wasted the parking $ to come here. The maternity clothes are hideous, on a rack like a cheap garage sale, and I could buy new pants or dresses for significantly less!  A baby shirt that is used and on which the fabric is worn costs like $15 and they want $35 for used baby shoes?? Nuts. Maybe dumb Lincoln Park yuppies are willing to pay these prices but I will go get some new stuff at Marshall's or TJ Maxx.

21.description: Amy's Second Child is as good as it gets.  High end merchandise in excellent condition for moderate prices.  You'll also find many unique pieces here.  I have been a regular at Second Child for 3.5 years and don't know what I'd do without this gem.  I've introduced so many friends who also adore it.  The only drawback:  it's sooooooooooooooo addictive - hard to stay away!  :-)   Once a year - in December - they also have a terrific toys sale.Thank you, Amy!

16.description: Where else can you find your kid Italian leather loafers that were worn maybe twice, and a functionally brand new Brooks Brothers shirt? IN LINCOLN PARK, OF COURSEI love this place.

17.description: Just So SO....This place is very inconvenient to enter when you have a stroller (which most people looking for baby clothes have) You have to leave your stroller outside because there are stairs to get in it. The selection tends to get pretty stale- same stuff there for a long time. Also, although the brands are good/botique type stuff at times it is used and overpriced for being used. I still go in from time to time to see what they have but usually leave wthout buying anything and am overall not a huge fan of the place.

10.description: The staff was so helpful - so nice - I'm a fan! I plan to hit this place up every month to see what they have!

11.description: Been here a couple times and each time have found a variety of things.  I initially came here to try and find some consignment maternity dresses for evening wear and was pleasantly surprised to find maternity as well as everything baby.  They have infant to toddler sizes for both genders that are gently used. There is a small maternity selection and accessories like strollers and cribs but there is TONS of clothes.  Not the best maternity but I will be back for some clothes and to try and sell clothes that I can't use.Note-the store is very small so taking the stroller into this store makes it hard on the mom as well as the others shopping.

26.description: A well curated collection of used kids clothing - the kinds of brands that, for the most part, will cost more money than I could even imagine spending on baby stuff - pants that would be $42 new (!!!) might be in excellent used condition here for about $10 - you can dress your child in Bloomingdales clothes for Target prices. Or, in grown up bougshie lady shopping speak - you can get Louboutins at Payless prices. But usually not like actual baby high heels or anything, but if Suri Cruise starts rocking that shit a bit more, look the hell out bit.ly/df64wa And if that does become the trend, trust that a couple of months later they will probably have the fanciest of those wee little bitty hoochie shoes here, for like $12. Some of my recent acquisitions for my sweet cherubic baby boo boo: Baby James Perse, a sweet Adidas sweat suit, all kinds of Mini Boden and Tea Collection and some Keen sandals. Seriously, google some of those original prices - see? AAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!! Nuh uh. But look out for Gap trying to be masqueraded here as being on the same level as Mini Boden, Hanna Andersson, et al - um...no... A very quiet, almost adult atmosphere - tight space. Often a lot better than Once Upon a Child and the few other indie places at doing a similar thing. They have a not quite as good and small collection of books and dvds that are worth a look because you might get lucky. It's also upstairs and a bit of a pain in the ass to access it, especially if you have a stroller or more than one child with you. A major positive - it's directly across the street from Vosges. You can buy fancy designer junk for your baby on the used tip and then spend all of that extra savings directly on some good ass fancy chocolate instead - mmm Mama likes. What's the 5 stars, as good as it gets equivalent - finding those same expensive brands at the Salvation Army for .90 cents instead of $9 OR $90 - holla!

27.description: Where else can you find your kid Italian leather loafers that were worn maybe twice, and a functionally brand new Brooks Brothers shirt? IN LINCOLN PARK, OF COURSEI love this place.

0.description: Cheaper than brand new.Needs bigger space and sound dampening walls.Walked in, they've got some clean clothes at almost thrift store prices.  The staff is friendly, the location is probably great, toys are clean and in good condition.  More infant & toddler clothes, not so much maternity.Place is just somewhat small for the amount of foot traffic they get on weekends.

20.description: Just finished shopping here with my pregnant sister.  We found great cheap maternity clothes!  The maternity section is tiny (two racks) compared to what they have in kids' clothes (an entire store), but we majorly scored.  She got about 8 pieces for $70.  All were quality, adorable, belly-licious gems that you couldn't even tell were used.  Many of the fancier items were under $10!  Apparently their huge Winter sale is next weekend where everything will be 50-75% off.  Then, on Feb. 1st, they are hanging all of the Spring stuff.  I'm happy to have found this place, thanks to Yelp, to look forward to my impending Aunt-hood.

19.description: I like this place a lot. They are quite picky about what they consign from sellers; this makes it so easy for the shopper! I've picked up some super cute maternity clothes for a fraction of the price. They carry only the better brands of maternity clothes and everything is in good condition. Like any consignment shop, it is hit or miss, you might hit the jackpot and find tons of stuff you love in your size, or you might not, that's the thrill of the hunt for consignment shopping. The kid's clothes are very nice, once again, they are picky about what they take. I was in there recently looking for summer newborn clothes, it seemed that someone else had the same idea and cleared everything out! So it's the kind of place you need to stop in frequently and see what's new. It's right by the Armitage Brownline station so very easy to get to; don't bother with driving.  I didn't know they had an upstairs! It isn't very obvious, I'll have to check it out sometime. It is a rather cozy store, so for the love of God, please leave your zamboni-sized double strollers outside!

2.description: Granted, I am not an consignment queen by any means. Nevertheless, the thought of saving money on high quality clothes for my little one (clothes that she will eventually either ruin or outgrow) appealed to me. The establishment was a big cluttered but the brands are high-end so I didn't have to weed through a bunch of crap to get to what I wanted. Additionally, the prices are a bit steeper than what I've seen at other shops.

32.description: I was so glad to run into this place by accident on the way to my car! It's a cute little Children's clothing store right next door to Argo... Been there for 20 years doing clothes through consignment... I could see how I had missed it before cause it's up a few steps onto a stoop... small sign... nothing fancy schmansy... It's cute!... And then you get to the door and buzz to get in...  This place has Children's clothes galore! Kiddie stuff can get just as expensive as adult clothing and we all know how fast the little guys can grow out of EVERYTHING in a matter of months so this place is perfect because everything is really reasonably priced, in good shape and... they had stuff for all ages! 5 stars because I think I just made a new destination point for myself when it comes to shopping for the kid!P.S. they're jam packed with winter stuff right now so if you have a niece or nephew or kid of your own.... go check it out!!Made me a happy momma today!!!

18.description: I don't even have a first child yet along a second one, but if I was a mom I'd shop here...especially after noticing lately how expensive kids clothing can be. Seriously- $50 for a sweater that a toddler can wear 2 times before growing out of?  The Second Child understands that, which is why the owners decided to open this store 20 years ago upon having her second child.I was shopping with fellow yelper Tristin M, who being the fabulous mom that she is noticed this store.  I did some browsing of my own and noticed that they have some really cute clothes at amazing prices...I wish some of this stuff came in my own size! I'll be back someday (although not for many many years) to shop for my own children so hopefully this store will stay open for another 20 years!

13.description: When you're used to Once Upon a Child's selection and prices, Second Child is sort of just ho-hum.  I guess it's problem is two-fold: it's really small, and it's so focused on brands/"nice" stuff that it lacks the basics I'm really needing.I dropped by on a Saturday afternoon in February and couldn't find  a single, simple sleeper for my 6 month old! But I did find plenty of pricey name brand polo shirts and hoity-toity plaid shorts in his size... totally stuff that is super adult looking but will end up riding up to look like hotpants and a bare middriff if I dare dress a little one in it.Feeling the eyes of the woman at the counter pressuring me to buy something, I picked up a cute pair of Robeez for $8.  They did have a LOT of shoes, that's for sure.  And if you're in the market for a Svan Highchair, they had three of them at fairly reasonable prices in the $150 range.

4.description: Painful to have to write this review as this is (or was) one of my favorite consignment stores in Chicago.  Walked in today to browse for fall clothing for my two year old, admittedly for the first time without her, and was immediately asked to surrender my laptop bag (due to policy).  I have been here at least twenty times before, and even spoke to the owner on multiple occasions in the past (who was present today), but this is the first time I felt unwelcome and downright criminal. If bag checks are your policy, today was the first time you attempted to enforce it, and lost a loyal, repeat customer in the process.  When I mentioned what happened to my wife, she told me that she was there on Saturday with three enormous bags filled with clothes (from different stores) and nobody asked her to check those bags.  This is consistent with all our previous experiences.

24.description: I like this place a lot. They are quite picky about what they consign from sellers; this makes it so easy for the shopper! I've picked up some super cute maternity clothes for a fraction of the price. They carry only the better brands of maternity clothes and everything is in good condition. Like any consignment shop, it is hit or miss, you might hit the jackpot and find tons of stuff you love in your size, or you might not, that's the thrill of the hunt for consignment shopping. The kid's clothes are very nice, once again, they are picky about what they take. I was in there recently looking for summer newborn clothes, it seemed that someone else had the same idea and cleared everything out! So it's the kind of place you need to stop in frequently and see what's new. It's right by the Armitage Brownline station so very easy to get to; don't bother with driving.  I didn't know they had an upstairs! It isn't very obvious, I'll have to check it out sometime. It is a rather cozy store, so for the love of God, please leave your zamboni-sized double strollers outside!

6.description: I went to The Second Child for the first time today and had the first pleasant experience so far in my quest for stylish maternity clothes on a budget. I haven't done a ton of maternity clothes shopping, but of the places I've been, I've found a lot of maternity clothing runs large (I'm a smaller short person) and there seems to be a surplus of twee out there (i.e. bows, flowers, and t-shirts with little sayings on them).The selection at The Second Child is not large, but it is well curated. No overwhelming amount of cutesy here. The staff was very friendly, and I'm very excited to wear my new-to-me clothes! Bonus-- they were also having a sale, so two of the items I bought were 30% off!

22.description: I found some cute stuff there, but overall it is difficult to look through the clothes (very packed) and some stuff seems too expensive (a used Gymboree outfit for $28?).  However, we did get some good deals, like Ugg boots for $25.  Overall, it is ok if you have the time to look through stuff.

15.description: It's hard for me to decide how to rate this store.  There are pros and cons.Pros:  The store is PACKED with children's clothes.  Tons of stuff and the prices seemed pretty good from what I could see.  They also have socks, shoes, and other assorted baby items like bouncers or walkers.  I didn't look at the prices on the baby items.Cons:  The maternity section.  I know it's probably not their main draw but there are only two racks and they didn't have very much selection.  A lot of black pants, a few pairs of jeans and some skirts for the bottoms.  The tops and dresses had a wider range of stuff but it covered all seasons from what I could tell.  They had the boutique brands like Japanese Weekend, Olian and Michael Stars but also the cheaper brands like H&M, Old Navy and Gap.  The prices were a bit more than what I was willing to pay (no used Old Navy Item should ever cost more than $5 the way that store puts things on sale).  I'll be back for the kids clothes for sure but I'll stick to the sale racks for mat wear since the stuff is at the same price.

7.description: Just went here today to get some snow suit/pram/bunting for my upcoming baby. The place is pretty small but there's plenty of items for infants, toddlers, and kids. Yes their maternity section is just 2 racks but this place is called 2nd CHILD not 2nd pregnancy so for those that gave it a low rating base on their maternity selection then you really are being unfair.I ended up buying 2 snow suits/pram for $44. One was by Baby Gap and the other was Ralph Lauren. Their items are in good condition and I think their price is reasonable for the designer brands they carry. If you care more about prices and practicality then this place is not for you. You should go to Once Upon A Child. Don't expect cheap when you're shopping in Lincoln Park. I will definitely go back and bring some friends :)

8.description: As with other city shops, this is little cramped. They have fair selection of used baby/infant clothes and some gear. Although they don't have space for more gears. I could also find gd quality maternity clothes here. Wish I had visited it earlier in my pregnancy while I was desperately looking for petite maternity pants. Owner was friendly and informed us about upcoming sales. This might b gd option for city dwellers but suburbs have greater variety of used baby stuff..

30.description: It's hard for me to decide how to rate this store.  There are pros and cons.Pros:  The store is PACKED with children's clothes.  Tons of stuff and the prices seemed pretty good from what I could see.  They also have socks, shoes, and other assorted baby items like bouncers or walkers.  I didn't look at the prices on the baby items.Cons:  The maternity section.  I know it's probably not their main draw but there are only two racks and they didn't have very much selection.  A lot of black pants, a few pairs of jeans and some skirts for the bottoms.  The tops and dresses had a wider range of stuff but it covered all seasons from what I could tell.  They had the boutique brands like Japanese Weekend, Olian and Michael Stars but also the cheaper brands like H&M, Old Navy and Gap.  The prices were a bit more than what I was willing to pay (no used Old Navy Item should ever cost more than $5 the way that store puts things on sale).  I'll be back for the kids clothes for sure but I'll stick to the sale racks for mat wear since the stuff is at the same price.

3.description: Definitely a hit or miss. But none the less absolutely amazing. Quality items for your littles. Be it a stroller, toy or even educational and fun books. You can tell their selection is very selective. Right off of the brown line and free street parking nearby. Always try to stop here if you're in the area and love to thrift more so for children but hey if you can fit children's clothes that works too ;)

14.description: A well curated collection of used kids clothing - the kinds of brands that, for the most part, will cost more money than I could even imagine spending on baby stuff - pants that would be $42 new (!!!) might be in excellent used condition here for about $10 - you can dress your child in Bloomingdales clothes for Target prices. Or, in grown up bougshie lady shopping speak - you can get Louboutins at Payless prices. But usually not like actual baby high heels or anything, but if Suri Cruise starts rocking that shit a bit more, look the hell out bit.ly/df64wa And if that does become the trend, trust that a couple of months later they will probably have the fanciest of those wee little bitty hoochie shoes here, for like $12. Some of my recent acquisitions for my sweet cherubic baby boo boo: Baby James Perse, a sweet Adidas sweat suit, all kinds of Mini Boden and Tea Collection and some Keen sandals. Seriously, google some of those original prices - see? AAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!! Nuh uh. But look out for Gap trying to be masqueraded here as being on the same level as Mini Boden, Hanna Andersson, et al - um...no... A very quiet, almost adult atmosphere - tight space. Often a lot better than Once Upon a Child and the few other indie places at doing a similar thing. They have a not quite as good and small collection of books and dvds that are worth a look because you might get lucky. It's also upstairs and a bit of a pain in the ass to access it, especially if you have a stroller or more than one child with you. A major positive - it's directly across the street from Vosges. You can buy fancy designer junk for your baby on the used tip and then spend all of that extra savings directly on some good ass fancy chocolate instead - mmm Mama likes. What's the 5 stars, as good as it gets equivalent - finding those same expensive brands at the Salvation Army for .90 cents instead of $9 OR $90 - holla!

12.description: Missing a piece of your awesome Halloween costume? CCW! Seriously, this place is awesome. It's an actual warehouse, and they have pretty much everything. And if they don't have it, the employees will (shh..on the DL) tell you where you might be able to find it.It's filled to the rim with costumes for couples, men, women, and kids, as well as a TON of costume accessories. Medusa headpiece? They got it. Bedazzled brassieres? Yep. Fake muscles for your DJ Pauly D outfit? Checkity check check check. They have a pretty good variety of fake mustaches, which I know because I bought one for my costume last year but my boyfriend wouldn't let me wear it because it creeped him out. Saddings.They have costumes for rent too. I've never rented from them, but it looks like they have a good variety of shtuff in that section as well. Go there! You might be overwhelmed by all the pieces they have but there's also the chance you might get inspired too.

3.description: The Chicago Costume Company has two locations (one on Fullerton), which are both opened year-round.  The place can get pretty overwhelming with the amount of masks, make-up, costumes, wigs/facial hair, and accessories that they have.  My friend and I stopped by to get a masquerade mask for a party, and the variety was just too crazy!  If you cannot find anything that catches your fancy, you can also have things custom-made for you!  The store also ships items across state lines, so it's super convenient.  One does not need to wait for Halloween in order to find some costumes/accessories.  Check this place out!+costume shop+open year-round

1.description: Large selection of domino/lace/feather/bedazzled masks (well, it's near Mardi Gras).  Small but mighty stage makeup section; includes Graftobian as well as Mehron/Ben Nye and has a clearance section of discontinued colors (this never happens). Up front is a "make your own flapper headband" station; I didn't, but what a cool idea.  The costumes are about 90% costumes-in-a-bag, but they include some higher-end ones (which yes, means paying real prices), including some licensed Disney costumes and high-quality knockoffs.  Carries at least some plus sizes.  Mixed in with the costumes-in-a-bag are a few higher quality items, such as mail shirts. Stocking selection and some medium-sized feather carnival / showgirl masks (sequin/coque/ostrich); excellent selection of burlesque mini-tophats (gold sequin!) and a small crown section.  They don't have beaded bras but do have a few not-terribly sparkly bellydancer beaded caps and some of the faceted-metallic plastic bead shimmy belts, and let's face it, most costume stores don't even HAVE an Egyptian section.  Didn't spend much time with the wigs, but they had a good selection.  Helpful staff and parking's not too bad (prowl the side streets).

2.description: to the window to the wall costumes on costumes ! they have every imaginable costume ! the staff is awesome , they will help make sure your costumes have the correct accessories  and that it's exactly what you are looking for ! And they have Ben nye banana powder ! Lol

9.description: Today was my first visit to Chicago Costume Warehouse, and itwill definitely be my last.,Reasons being..Whenever I hear the word Warehouse I get this visual of a dark,gloomy type of place, and that's exactly what I found here today.Now, in all fairness, I realize this is a Costume /Halloween Store andit is bound to look cluttered and disorganized but, to me this placelooked so old and run down.And, when I entered this warehouse today I walked up to the counterand asked for some help in finding a great costume, and honestly theircustomer service totally sucked because the associate just pointed a fingerin the direction of the back of the store and told me to go look there..Now, wait a minute.. you seriously expect me to send some money yourway when you wouldn't e,ven help me find a costume?Me thinks not!But, for the record, I did find my way to the back of this store andlooked over their costumes, and some of their prices were like close toa hundred bucks for a costume, some were higher, some less.And, personally, I saw nothing that captured my attention, the best Isaw was a Snow White Costume, now, saw lots of witchy costumes too.But, I thought I would give this place a try..I did, it's over.. offer expired!Never to Return..Much better places in the city for costumes..On Milwaukee Avenue for example..That's where I'm headed...

10.description: I love this place. There is a great selection of costumes and the staff is friendly. I like this place because unlike fantasy you can look at your costume immediately. You don't need to wait for some employee to rush you as you browse. That part always annoyed me about fantasy. The prices here are reasonable and the staff is friendly.

4.description: If you get scared off by the rental prices(or hey, the crowds) of Fantasy Costumes, this is a good backup option to look for a costume, or bits and pieces for one if you go the route of hitting a couple different stores like I did. They didn't have as many options as Fantasy(very obviously), but their selection was still pretty darn good. I ended up going the route of going to a few different stores(thrift and costume ones), to find the pieces I needed to do a Simpsons costume last year. Of course this store isn't 24/7 on the week before Halloween(and up to) a la Fantasy, but they do extend their daily hours somewhat during the month of October. This is also one of their 2 year round stores, with the other one on Fullerton across from DePaul's campus.Don't forget to go upstairs to look at the additional suits, dresses, and etc. there, if you don't find at first what you're looking for on the first floor. Glad an employee told me they had more stuff, up there. Very accessible from both the Kennedy Expwy., Metra(Mayfair on the Fox Lake/Milwaukee District North Line), Montrose Blue Line, and 3 CTA bus routes(78, 54, and 54A during weekday rush hours). Parking is very easy too if you drive. Either on Montrose(limited, and I sometimes see spaces on that street fill up), but if not, you'll absolutely for sure find a free space along Knox Ave south of Montrose(aka the north/south street inbetween both Metra tracks). When you see the length(!) of that street surrounded by industrial buildings going all down that street, you'll see what I mean when you park on Knox.

6.description: For my job I need to regularly  purchase things like wigs,costumes, makeup etc.  Lastnight I went into the Fullerton store and Chris was very helpful in looking for a wig for me.  They didnt have it at that location so he called the other location for me.   Next I went to the Montrose location to get what I needed. I called ahead and talked to Nicole. I told her I was in traffic and was worried the store would be closed by the time I got there. She ensured me she would stay open for me and worked diligently to get me what I needed.  She was helpful, professional, and friendly through the entire process.  Not once did I feel like I was being rushed since it was past store hours.  The only disappointing part was the store was out of stock in a few things I needed. Im sure recovering from the Halloween rush. I will be back though as I appreciate the excellent customer service.

15.description: I will never ever ever purchase or rent a costume or prop from anyone else again - Chicago Costume is the BEST!!! I have purchased both Halloween and party costumes, but have also used them for many shows that my non-profit organizations have had. The owners and staff are wonderful, extremely helpful, their prices are much better than anywhere else - they have also bent over backwards to find things that I needed last minute and quickly shipped items when my shows were out of town. Love them!!!

0.description: Great selection, super customer service and cheaper costumes than Fantasy Costume. Last weekend my friend and I came here to try on costumes because we planned on sharing a costume. She's 6ft and I'm 5ft. Candace greeted us and, helped us find a costume that fit and looked great on both of us. Candace was very attentive and provided us with many ideas and was all around very helpful and knowledgeable. Candace also allowed me to try on some blue make-up samples and showed me how to apply and layer the FX makeup and Mehron. This is a good location because it has fitting rooms, plenty of costumes and wide aisles with workers who are very willing to help. I'm definitely switching from Fantasy Costumes to Chicago Costume because of the overall customer service.

5.description: So this place is great! Me and 3 of my friends just went spur of the morning on Halloween, not knowing what we were going to be.  We ended up seeing a bunch of good options on the first floor, but on the second floor they even had rentals of awesome costumes. We found our mariachi costumes, and with the help of the staff, we were fully set-up in hardly no time. Everything is reasonably prices too. I expect to be going back here every single Halloween going forward!!

13.description: Found exactly what I wanted at this well-stocked costume store.  The customer service was amazing.  My daughter wasn't sure who she wanted to be and staff offered ideas and sought out options for her.  Never going anywhere else for my costumes.

11.description: After a horrible experience at Party City, Chicago Costume was a godsend.  You would not know that this is a costume store from its outside appearance.  When you go inside, it is a verifiable wonderland of costume.  Yes, Halloween costumes are pricey, but you do receive service here.  They also have items that you may not see anywhere else.  The staff worked with me to find an awesome Jessica Rabbit costume and even gave me a discounted price!There is a rental division.  I have not personally used it but have known people who have.  They have told me that they are completely satisfied.

8.description: Holy moly millions of costumes and accessories. They have a ton of really cool costumes in here and I absolutely know where to go if I ever need something for a themed party. The only downside is the prices. Some of the super cute costumes were $120, Yikes! I don't ball like that! However, they did have some costumes & accessories marked down throughout the store ranging from 30-70% off. I didn't see any of the actual character or name-brand costumes marked down though. They really truly have so much to see here & it's a fun trip to browse through all their offerings.

14.description: I'm a non-traditional student who likes to write period films.  My outfits must be true to the period of the storyline. A segment of my film dealt with ancient horseman, swords, capes, chain-maile, helmets... This place (fullerton store) has the best assortment of intricate swords.  I needed a sword to look special not typical.  I am pleased.  I also needed a few garments that were not as pristine but could look like a period of famine (I didn't have time to distress garments) so I went to their MONTROSE location, and the help went through the racks and found fabulous layers  to piece together an 1800's outfit (oh yeahhh-rockin) (very nice people at montrose). the inventory is endless, and you get a garment bag to carry your items. Hey, the prices BEAT the crap out of all the other stores I've scouted.

7.description: Let me just say that I am a big kid at heart. Halloween will always be my number 1 holiday. I love to dress up and party! Chicago costume warehouse has the coolest costumes and accessories to make your party  night a success. This place trumps going to like a chain costume store like spirit, party city etc. The people that work here are nice as well. It can get a little pricey depending on what you are looking for, but again I'm willing to spend a little more to have a better quality costume then a cheap one cuz that's how I roll. #IfYouAintGotNoMoneyTakeYourBrokeAssHome  I've gotten accessories here for the last few years and I will continue to do so for years to come! Chicago costume warehouse I love you!! Xooxoxo

28.description: I can dig it!!!  Good quality stuff!!

1.description: Love the ready made food here! There is a good variety of hot meals available for a few bucks. There are always good pastries available for a snack. definitely try the deli meats on the fresh buns which they make there.

39.description: Name sounds generic, but the clientele and much of the food is thoruighly Polish.  Great Polish ham and sausage, nice salads and pierogi, and very good reasonable meet.  Aisles have lots of Polish and European pantry items and there is also a small but decent produce section.  Prices are extremely reasonable.One draaback is that they are so successful they need to expand -- tiny aisles are claustrophobic when it's busy.

9.description: Great grocery store in the neighborhood. They have fresh food cooked daily. You cannot get a better, healthier option for the price anywhere. The meals are loaded, something different on special each day. The soups are awesome.

29.description: Sadly, this deli is now very much out of my way since I moved to Franklin Park. It is very crowded and tiny, but packed with goodies. The deli meats are always fresh and the cheeses incredible. The homemade salmon spread is absolutely awesome.

23.description: the best deli ever - mostly polish product, but not only,fresh fruit and vegetables, fresh meat, fishes,  a lot of products, very profesional, nice and helpfull people, a lot of parking + additional parking

5.description: Chicago, IllinoisMy Ukie friend and I went to visit the Montrose Deli today for the first time. As I am not Polish nor Ukranian and my friend is 50/50 Polish and Ukrainian (Ulock) I took him along to show me the ropes. The Deli is definitely a place that stocks all things Polish/Ukrainian. If you are from Poland or the Ukraine, this is the place for you. The aisles are somewhat narrow so you have to be good at walking a tight rope. They have hand baskets to carry your purchases with you as you navigate down the aisles, no room for carts. They have a deli section for fresh meats and sausages ( of all varieties ) and a deli section for fresh prepared foods like breaded pork cutlets, varieties of chicken , stuffed cabbage, fresh mashed potatoes, ribs etc. They have a fresh produce section with fruits and vegetables etc. They carry specialty items that are familiar to Eastern European clientele. They even have cute little glass jars of jam with handles to be used as glasses for serving beverages after all the jam is gone. There is adequate parking adjacent to the west side of the store with an even larger parking lot directly across the street. Oh, and they have a bakery section with fresh breads and pastries and my favorite almond crescent rolls. They also have an extensive array of home soups including borscht. Everything is reasonably priced. If Polish/Ukranian food is your cup of tea, this is the place for you.
