31.description: My BF and I try to make it here every weekend to pick up fresh deli foods for the week.  They go through their deli meats so fast, so you know it's pretty fresh.  I love their assortment of sausages that hang from the back wall of their deli area.  If you have great timing, they have fresh bread right from the oven that smells spectacular.  You don't have to speak Polish, but it helps to have someone with you that can if you don't.  Their Hunter Stew is great too and cheap!

25.description: I'm used to Western markets, even small ones. This one is tightly packed into its spacing. It's usually very busy- people everywhere around you and no personal space at all. Has a huge fresh meat case at the back. Go later in the evening unless you want to fight the crowds. I LOVE their to-go area. As a Masters student with almost zero time to cook (although I CAN cook, quite well) their to go area is amazing and cheaper than dirt. A pint of mushroom soup or lazanki (cabbage with pasta and bacon and heaven?) are each less than $2 (as of 9/8/2011.) They have an astounding array of butters and a really awesome cake/torte area. The clerks and most people in the store only speak Polish unless they hear you speak English and then they flip to English for you. I don't speak Polish, but that store is open till 10, and so I can go when I direly need study fuel.

12.description: Medium size polish grocery store, variety of goods is medium. They mostly speak their language there. Out of their delis I got 'Kielbasa Poledwicowa z Indyka' - $5.29/lb, 'Kapusta  kiszona, domowei roboty', 'Old world twarog' - the farmers cheese and pickles and everything was to my taste

37.description: This place is small and  the aisles are tight but the prices are good and the produce is in good shape too!If you grab your cart and just zig zag your way through to the other end of the store to the register, you'll be fine and won't have to play bumper carts with everyone else.

21.description: Great Deli, VERY fresh meats and vegetables and fruits!  They have a ton of pre-packaged polish foods including fresh vegetable salad and pierogi.  This deli is ALWAYS busy so grab a number and go get the rest of the things you need from the rest of the store till they call your number over the PA system in the store.  Also, DELICIOUS bakery items, fresh whenever I go in!

16.description: Great place to go for all things sausage.  When my brother comes into town he buys here to take back to Boston. They will shrink wrap for travel like that so very nice.

17.description: Update for the new year! The rickety chain link fence that looked like it was going to topple over if a couple more people bumped into it has been replaced with a nice solid black metal fence. Makes it look a lot nicer.That aside, over the past 8 months I've stopped in here quite a bit more, typically during emergencies for mayo and stuff like that, but I've also purchased some sausages, and they were all good. If you don't speak Polish it's sorta hard to order anything though.People still bumping into each other and getting into arguments in the parking lot while their lot across the street stays at a constant 1/4-1/2 full.

10.description: Authentically Polish - no cilantro - they speak English, and the employees are eager to provide recommendations and translations to we the Americans.  Prepared meals are a bargain and are delicious just like what my old neighbor "babcia" used to make.

11.description: This is a great deli I give them 5 stars I've been going there for years.. Some of this stuff they buy from other butcher shops but overall they are top 5 delis in Chicago

26.description: You cannot beat the prices here--especially not on the deli meats and cheeses. There's typically a long line at the counter but the number tag system works well and the the microphones are linked throughout the store so you can finish your shopping while you wait for your number to be called. There's also many people manning the counter and so it goes really fast. The veggies and fruit selection are good and you can't beat the desserts and fresh breads. I'd also recommend the soups at lunchtime--and they're homemade. Whenever I come to visit my mom, this is my go-to place for most of my groceries. You won't be disappointed, and, you'll save a lot of money too!

27.description: Whether you are Polish or not you will find lots to love here. Yes I am Polish American 3rd generation. There are so many things to eat here just take your time and enjoy

35.description: The northwest side has a ton of options in small, independent Polish grocery stores.  Most tend to emphasize one part of the grocery experience more than the others (at Gorsky's or Ideal it's the bakery, at Gene's it's all about the deli counter, etc).  Montrose is the best, all-around, balanced, all-purpose neighborhood grocer of them all.  So with a nice selection of just about everything, a person who lived near by could do all of their food shopping here and not miss out on much of anything, and never need to take a separate trip for their fruit juice or whatever.  That's saying a lot for such a small store.  As others have said, the place is always busy, and they have a parking lot across the street.  I really do love the place, but they get knocked off one star for the snotty communist way they treated me when I wanted to order a couple of trays of kanapki for a party and they were too busy to do it because of Easter.  I get it that everyone there speaks Polish as a first language, and I probably should have known that Easter's a big deal for Poles, but that's no reason to treat me like some kind of troublemaker for asking in English.  Oh well, I still shop here sometimes on my way home... it's a good place.

8.description: My toddler son calls Montrose Deli the "cookie store". I can't blame him. Because shopping for staples like milk and bread is so boring. But picking up a container of fresh kolacky, well, that's got to be something kids of all ages would love. Montrose Deli is a great neighborhood store. It's now my go-to for the usuals,like bread, milk, fruits/veggies and prepared foods that come in handy for quick meals with no fuss. Everything is fresh and the price is right.Most recently I purchased some tomato soup, mushroom soup and potato/cheese pierogi from their prepared foods section and it was all quite good and again, the price was good too. Their deli counter is always busy--I have yet to check it out. Although their packaged Kabanosi (smoked Polish sausage, thinner than Kielbasa) was really tasty. MD has two parking lots, one adjacent and one across the street. I've visited on different weekdays, morning vs afternoon and the store is always busy. I don't want to try to visit on the weekends because if weekdays are any indication, then weekends must be crazeee!  The store isn't that big and they use every inch of space so those narrow aisles might mean nightmares for the claustrophobic.Service is always pleasant. I like hearing the young cashiers speaking in Polish to the older customers. Easily a favorite place.

0.description: There wasn't a thing here that we tried and didn't like. From the assortment of Polish and Eastern European pastries to their meats and cheeses, everything was delicious. Better yet, their prices beat out most big box, chain supermarkets. For instance, muenster cheese was 54% less here than at my local Walmart. The pastries were fresh and the dough flaky. The pierogies and kielbasa were excellent. I would highly recommend giving this place a try if you are looking for any type of authentic European eats.

38.description: English is optional here. Few of the labels and none of the conversation is in English. Even when they call out the numbers @ the deli counter, you don't hear any English.  The parking lot is always packed, and frequently clogs traffic on Montrose. Not being terribly grocery store literate, I guess the prices & value & freshness are ok. This place is a fine example of how someone can survive perfectly well in America without being able to speak English. I think that's a good thing, although my French ancestors may not agree.

20.description: Update for the new year! The rickety chain link fence that looked like it was going to topple over if a couple more people bumped into it has been replaced with a nice solid black metal fence. Makes it look a lot nicer.That aside, over the past 8 months I've stopped in here quite a bit more, typically during emergencies for mayo and stuff like that, but I've also purchased some sausages, and they were all good. If you don't speak Polish it's sorta hard to order anything though.People still bumping into each other and getting into arguments in the parking lot while their lot across the street stays at a constant 1/4-1/2 full.

19.description: Been coming to the Montrose location for about 5 years & this place has always been excellent. I once even gave it a 5 star review on yelp. Earlier tonight one of the female clerks at the deli decided to laugh at & talk about us in Polish to other workers while pointing at us & laughing. I'm all about supporting smaller businesses & this place is great. I go here at least Once a week & never had any problem with a worker or service. My father is Polish & my mother is Filipino. I don't speak any Polish. My mix makes me look Hispanic. Guess she was like what the hell is a Mexican & an Asian doing shopping here? Guessing she hasn't been in America/Chicago too long & isn't used to diversity. She's a damn peasant who's too coward to say what she said about us in English. Best off, not 1 person involved apologized to me & my mom but instead we were laughed at & not taken seriously. If that girl is not fired they've defianately lost mine & the business of my large family who lives in the Chicago area.

33.description: I'm a little mixed about this place.  I was a little put off by the SECURITY standing in front of the registers when you walk in.  The purpose of my visit today was Oranges.  I walk straight to their mini produce section.  I was immediately turned off by the lighting.   I felt like a blind person picking oranges.  The price was great, but I couldn't SEE what I was getting.  AnyHOW, I  walked by the CROWDED deli counter and heard all the comotion (in Polish) so, I didn't bother really checking it out.  I waited in a long line (I had 3 items and the person in front of me had a shopping-cart full)  so I expected a little courtesy, "go ahead" NOT.  I figured waiting wouldn't kill me ... here comes a girl and announces something in POLISH ... I step over (relief) and pay for my 3 items.  I'd give this place another chance, as the person in front of me and the people in line around me had great items ... anyhow, if you don't speak Polish your in a disadvantage... if you have the patience, check it out.I'd go back.

2.description: A great grocery store for cheaper and decent quality produce which doubles as a quick place to grab a bite to eat when on a budget. Their lunch specials are a staple item when I feel lazy to make my own food or go out somewhere further. I generally come here for the lunch special which includes sides and a main entree. The menu changes daily so you really do not know what is in store but the times that i went i got some friend chicken meatball thingy stuffed with cheese and spinach. Their mashed potatoes as a side is amazing! If ever in the area, do give it a try. Some good quality cheap authentic Polish food. What do I know about authentic polish though?

34.description: Small but solid grocery with an outstanding deli section.  Brush up on your Polish, as the numbers for the deli counter are called out in Polish.  Great meat selection.

32.description: This is a good Polish shop.  You wouldn't know it by the sign though.  The produce is stunning and really clean.  The store is neat.  NO ONE speaks any English, which is ok, but they don't even know the English names of their own products, so be prepared for a lot of pointing.The only draw back is that I didn't like their periogis- potato and cheese or mushroom and cabbage.  Which was really disappointing, and I couldn't really tell you why, the dough is a bit mushy and the fillings are lack luster.  Also the "smoked Polish sausage" was a bit dry.  But I'm really a critic having grown up with home made peirogis and great sausages for the holidays.

18.description: I just moved to Portage Park a few months ago and I am happy to adopt Montrose Deli as my neighborhood store. The selection isn't huge, but it almost always meets my needs for the usual staple fruits and vegetables, milk, canned goods and the guilty pleasures like ice cream and polish pastries that regular people jones for on some random night. The prices are excellent. Case in point, I remember making tiramisu one night and I was short on marscapone. A half pound tub at Montrose Deli was $3. At a large chain grocery store the same brand would have cost me $5. Another great thing about this place is it's open at 7:00 AM. Forget an ingredient for breakfast? No problem! Need some milk at 9pm? No problem! They close at 10PM. This isn't a place you would drive five miles to visit, but if you live in the Portage Park area, give Montrose Deli a whirl.

41.description: This is a quality produce market/deli that also has a decent amount of general grocery items. They are Polish owned and operated and have alot of Polish products as well as American products. It can get crowded at times. I don't speak Polish, but for those that do it would helpful.

13.description: They are selling dinners for $3:99 ar the Chef's Corner! Awsome!!!

4.description: A Polish grocery store resides on Montrose Avenue. Instead of shelves stocked with the usual American brands, you'll find items imported from Poland with the original labels intact. Neat stuff you want to try, with a tremendous assortment of breads and pastries, fresh produce, dairy, canned goods and tinned fish. There's a long deli case filled with meats, poultry and cheese, and a prepared food counter with Polish specialties for take-away. I tried the clear beet borscht, which was rich tasting and well seasoned, and pickle soup, which tastes just like it sounds, a treat if you love pickles, and who doesn't? Sunflower rye bread went well with the soups. There are 3-4 varieties of poppy seed cake, and the cheese blintzes are out of this world. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the herring from a barrel, which was too briny for my taste.This is a pretty well run place, even though it can get crowded and the aisles are narrow. Numbers are called, people line up to check out, and some English is spoken, especially by the younger staff. So next time you get tired of  the same old, same old at Jewel or Mariano's, you might want to head over here for something different.

24.description: I just moved to Portage Park a few months ago and I am happy to adopt Montrose Deli as my neighborhood store. The selection isn't huge, but it almost always meets my needs for the usual staple fruits and vegetables, milk, canned goods and the guilty pleasures like ice cream and polish pastries that regular people jones for on some random night. The prices are excellent. Case in point, I remember making tiramisu one night and I was short on marscapone. A half pound tub at Montrose Deli was $3. At a large chain grocery store the same brand would have cost me $5. Another great thing about this place is it's open at 7:00 AM. Forget an ingredient for breakfast? No problem! Need some milk at 9pm? No problem! They close at 10PM. This isn't a place you would drive five miles to visit, but if you live in the Portage Park area, give Montrose Deli a whirl.

6.description: I don't normally cook at home due to my inconsistent work schedule, so this little gem has become my "go-to" spot for all things grocery shopping!  I love this place not only it's Polish (my favorite), but also it has a large selection of soup, hot Polish delicacies and pastries.  By the way, the prices are fantastic.  I can get all my lunch and dinner essentials here for under $20 and the amount of food can last me for at least six (6) meals!  There are plenty of parking spots considering that this is still located in the city.  Anyways, you guys should definitely pay a visit to this lovely place.

22.description: This place been usually ok, (now employes speak to you in english and polish) but today I purchased 2 kremowki and what a disappointment ,one of them was old. Really ,tasted like a sour cream .  Do they mix new products with old ones just to make a buck and get rid off the stinky foods ? I mean ,what about sausage ? Ham ? How old is it ? What a waste of money ! I know this was my last time here

15.description: this is a fairly small place but a huge variety including ketchup from polandthey prepare a number of different things in house and sell behind the counter and they sell homemade frozen peirogi and everything is very cheap vs other delis i have been into. (less than $2 for a container of soup whereas other places are $3.5 or more)

40.description: This place is amazing, becuase the business is so great (a strong polish community) the meat is always fresh and the place is always buzzing (especially around the time of big polish/catholic holidays). Even stopping in here for some great pastries (their sweet poppy seed buns are great) and fresh bread with real butter (not the tub o' margerine stuff) will leave you pleased.

7.description: I like Montrose Deli! Truly I do!The moment I walked in I was hit by wonderful aromas ofsmoked sausages, baked goods and prepared foods.And these smells touched my senses in the best of ways unlikethe aroma I had to inhale in the yellow cab yesterday..:(Anyway, this store is not very big, but, man, is it busy in there, justa constant stream of people through this store.And.. I have no complaints other than the fact that everyone in herespeaks Polish and I don't.. and granted, this is on me because I am Polishon my Mom's side of the family and when I was about 7 years old my Momsat me down and tried to teach me the polish lingo with a Polish Bookfor beginners but, I wasn't having it so I told my Mom "No Mowimy Po Polsku"please.. which meant Hell No I don't want to learn this language!So, that was the end of that and for the record, I am Scottish on my Dad's sideand I always tell people I am Scottish if they ask me what ethnicity I am..Okay.. getting back to Montrose Deli, this place has great sales, especiallybehind the Deli Counter where 1 pound of Smoked Turkey Breast is goingfor $2.98 per pound this week.And.. smoked polish sausage is $1.59 per pound!They have a prepared food station where you can pick up pierogies, blintzes,chicken, fish, potatoes, standard polish fare type food.They have a really nice bakery case where you can get Napoleons and otherassorted sweets.. I liked this too!They also have some nice looking fresh produce and actually everythingin this Deli/Store looked really good and fresh!So, even though I can't talk the lingo I tried to fake it as much as I couldand the women behind the deli counter were really nice to me anyway!Had a nice Cashier too!So, Montrose Deli.. I most definitely am a fan for your prices can'tbe beat and you are a very nice store!But.. I am going to be 52.. Don't think I'll be wanting to learnPolish anytime soon..

36.description: Authentic polish deli and grocery store!I love this place the deli counter is amazing if you can get past all the old polish women without getting pushed, shoved or slapped! Just Kidding!The prices are amazing, the produce fresh. The fresh baked rolls are delicious. I love the variety of polish sausages and deli meats.

30.description: The quantity and variety of smoked sausages, hams, and pork is incredible and very fresh due to a robust Polish customer base that's make this place it's daily shopping destination.  That's not to say that the turkey isn't great too (many types to choose from) or other deli meats/cheeses.  This is a meat/poultry shop with about 10 deli ladies actively slicing, packaging the customer requests.  The deli counter is swamped (some jostling to see the selections) but take a number and you will receive SERVICE.  What a concept.  It's worth some patience.  FYI, just order some cheese slices and be amazed at how it is packaged with care as it should be to retain freshness.  OH, did I mention prices....CHEAP!  I will never by deli at Jewel/Dominicks ever again.Here's some of my other favorites:Breads of all grain types and even some baked on siteHomemade soups...so good and in containers for home reheatingPolish pastries...fresh dailyProduce is beautiful if not "shiny".  Last bit of advice.  Don't over buy and you will be tempted to given the price and selection.  Just come back week to week.  Enjoy Yelpers!

3.description: Avoid going here on Wednesdays and close to hoildays! This place gets pretty packed!

14.description: Small deli with a lots of customers, which can pretty much guarantee that the deli remains fresh. The baked good are fresh as well. Drawback is that it is packed! The parking and moving through the space is tough, but I kind of like the small corner store charm it has.

58.description: Went there last night for a friends birthday. The food was o.k....once it arrived. our waitress was unfriendly , when she was to be found. Thats saying a lot because the restaurant, though nice, is small. There were only maybe three other tables with two or three people and yet it took over 30 minutes for our appetizers and even more time to get our order in because the waitress was never around. The food was o.k but not worth the service.

56.description: I would live to give you 5 stars for your food!!! I absolutely love the sushi option a. And I think it's a great price for what you get. Also all the other food that I haved ordered here was excellent. However I don't like the waitress, not sure why she works as a waitress. She is super unfriendly and seems always pissed off. Sorry I'm just a customer, if you don't like your job, find something else to do that gives you more joy! I hope the owner reads this review, because I was reading some of the other reviews and it's seems like I'm not the only one who feels this way! Today I ordered take -out and I gave her 0.00$ tip, yes that's right, $0.00 tip. I always like to tip generously as I used to be a waitress myself onetime. But this is seriously one "shitty service" ! Please put a smile on your face!

29.description: This place is in our general neighborhood and is a great option for Japanese and Thai food. I've been to the restaurant and it's a small cozy restaurant. Had lunch there during the week and it was pretty good. I love the Portage Park roll. Squashes my craving for sushi every time. I've also ordered delivery from here. The food is always pretty good. My husband got the pineapple friend rice and added some chicken and that was pretty darn tasty too. Sushi is pretty good. There is a spot that is closer to me, but this Ruk is way tastier!

42.description: This review is based entirely on delivery service, which is the kind of delivery service you might have expected if you were John Adams in Paris in the 18th century ordering delivery from Philadelphia. Unfortunately, for Ruk Sushi and Thai, this is the 21st century and the restaurant is a mile away from our house. The first time it took them two hours to deliver to our house we chalked it up to bad luck, PLUS they gave us a refund plus an additional credit, so we thought we'd give them another chance. And, in fact, for some months they delivered within an hour. Until the disaster of a couple of weeks ago, in which the woman answering the phone said the order was late because of bad traffic. The next couple of times I called she said they were late with orders because they were busy.This was the second time this happened to us, and we're sad to say unless Ruk actually has the capacity to deliver food, they should not offer delivery. I wish this wasn't the case.  I see other recent reviews lamenting their deteriorating service, so I'm not alone. It's a shame. Their food, while unspectacular, has been pretty reliable for the most part.  We won't be ordering from them again.

23.description: A nicer restaurant in the Portage Park area, Ruk Sushi literally delivers great sushi and a simple Thai menu. Their sushi is refreshing, not a big helping, nor are they small pieces. My favorite rolls by far is The Portage Park as well as the SOS roll. Also, order the miso soup with your meal, light and tasty.

47.description: I've lived in the Jeff Park neighborhood for three years and when I first moved in, Ruk was my go-to sushi place. They delivered for quite some time, if I ordered on Grub Hub, but now they won't even deliver, although I'm less than one mile away. The food is inconsistent, rarely hot (when it's supposed to be) whether pick-up or delivery, and this last time was the very last I'll order from them. They have great rolls, the Godzilla is amazing, but when you order something and it's excellent, the next time it's ho-hum, and the third time it's a roll of mush, you start looking for other places to order from. If you are eating in, I'd give Ruk another star and a half, but that's only on a good day.

8.description: Delicious!!! Hands down the best sushi I have gotten in Chicago thus far (been a resident 3 years now). I love the atmosphere to go with friends or on a date. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the food is delicious (sushi and noodle dishes). The prices are very reasonable for the quality you're getting. It's BYOB too which I enjoy. I would definitely recommend Ruk!

31.description: Just ordered from here, took 2 hours for delivery to get here, when I called they could not tell me where the driver was, and never called back to let me know. Was never offered compensation for anything. Sometimes you get fortune cookies, sometimes not. Inconsistent and poor customer service.

34.description: Meh.  BYOB which is a plus.  The Crab Rangoon had barely any crab in it.  The fried calamari looked like fried onion rings.  I never had calamari like that.  Didn't taste all that great either.  We had 5 sushi rolls.  Spicy Tuna Roll- the tuna was mushy....kind of odd.  I was worried that it was bad fish.  The Portage-good.  Shrimp Tempura-good.  Firework-ok.  Philly Roll-ok.

16.description: We order from Ruk often for lunch. They have lunch specials that include eggrolls (and soup if you're eating in). My favorite from here is the chicken pad see ew, which is the bomb diggity. I have also had their sushi while dining in. Not bad. They're always nice, prices are decent, place is clean, and food is good. Thumbs up!

13.description: This place is in our general neighborhood and is a great option for Japanese and Thai food. I've been to the restaurant and it's a small cozy restaurant. Had lunch there during the week and it was pretty good. I love the Portage Park roll. Squashes my craving for sushi every time. I've also ordered delivery from here. The food is always pretty good. My husband got the pineapple friend rice and added some chicken and that was pretty darn tasty too. Sushi is pretty good. There is a spot that is closer to me, but this Ruk is way tastier!

11.description: I have mixed feelings about this place.  I've only dined in twice, and it was more than a year ago, so this review is primarily for take out.Pros:-Pretty good food, sometimes even really great food.-Super nice people, have had great interactions with staff.-Once, I accidentally ordered pickup from the wrong Ruk location and they made the whole order again rather than making me drive to Albany Park.  I thought that was really nice.-Cute place.  I like the setup and decor.-Free Edamame, California Roll, or Egg Roll if your delivery is over a certain amount ($25?).  This is a fun perk.-The flavor of the Panang Curry is amazing. It's my go-to Thai order and I love it here.Cons:-Food quality is inconsistent.  ESPECIALLY THE SPICE!!  There has been more than one time where medium spicy has been so hot I've had to just toss it.  But sometimes it's perfect.  I hate that I now order mild and have to eat blander food just in case their cook is feeling a bit wild that night.  Sometimes I'll order the same dish and it will look totally different the next time, different peppers, etc.  It's so weird.-Their delivery takes a long time.  Do not order from here if you are in any kind of a rush.I love that there is a good Thai/Sushi place in Jeff Park.  And it's really close to being a great place.  I hope they make the small changes necessary to get there.

39.description: The owner reached out to me and gave me enough reason to give them one more shot. It's a shame to say that they blew it. My order was late on an extremely slow night. I will not be going back.

37.description: The food here is decent but the service is the absolute worst.  Plan for a LOT of time for a simple meal.

0.description: Very pleasantly surprised by this place! I've been pretty busy lately and have ordered a lot of delivery in the past few weeks. Almost everything has been crap and not worth the money. I didn't have high hopes for Ruk and I'm really happy to be proven wrong.I had the tamago and smoked salmon nigiri, a California roll, and the Godzilla roll. All very fresh and delicious. A friend got the chicken pad thai and it was also pretty good (she had it without the cabbage, though). Prices are reasonable, except for the nigiri. To top it off, delivery time said 70-80 minutes on grubhub and they were here in 35! Until further notice, this is my go-to for sushi and Thai.

38.description: I will continue to use Ruk for delivery but after my last experience will not return to the restaurant. Was going on a Friday-made a reservation. When I arrived, my friend had beat me there and had been seated. I made sure to let the person up at the sushi bar know that I no longer needed the table I had reserved. We waited more than 10 minutes for anyone to come to the table. Good service was extremely slow for edamame and worse for our entrees. I was amazed though, at how fast the check was delivered to the table after our entrees were delivered, and then within 5 minutes, we were asked to finish up as they had other people waiting for tables!  I wasn't even done eating yet! The food has always been good, I was thrilled to find this place in my neighborhood, but you don't ask customers to leave while they're still eating the food!!

51.description: Visited Chicago and was staying at my cousin's place and I was craving some sushi!  This was the nearest place that had decent ratings on Yelp so we decided to give it a try.  The place was pretty empty around 7:00pm.  As we walked in, we were seated.  Hmm there is 4 of us and only one napkin setting with utensils.  We looked at other tables and there were also missing napkins and utensils.  Aren't place settings suppose to be set already?  Anyways, I ordered the spicy salmon crunch ($6.95) and it was okay.  There was way to much rice in it.  We also ordered the Pad See Ew ($7.50)  My sister really liked it and it was her first time eating it. I've had quite a few Pad See Ew dishes here and there and this has got to be the worst one that I've eaten...ever!!  You know how people describe what food tastes in ways of how it smells?  Well this tasted like I was eating a wet dog!!  It smelled like what a dog smells like after it is wet.  It smelled like dog food and anything related to a dog.  I totally lost my appetite after i had a bite of it.  We also ordered banana rolls ($3.95) and this comes with 5.  This was okay too.  Sweet, crunchy, and definitely tastes like banana!  Dip it in their sauce it it is pretty good.  Overall, okay place.  Service was lacking quite a bit and had to wait roughly 30 minutes which is crazy because there was no one in the restaurant.

27.description: Poor service Pricey and not worth it... Wont go again

32.description: This is one of our favorite go to places for carry out. I usually get the red curry, chicken basal noodle, or pad thai. The only thing is they usually put you on hold when you call to place an order. Sometimes you need to call back a couple times. For us, the quality has been consistent each time. :)

54.description: I had ordered form Ruk a few weeks back, it took them literally 1 hour and 45 minutes to deliver my food. I had to call 3 times and finally after the third time the manager called me back apologizing for the long delay due to their out sourced delivery service driver getting lost, i live less than a mile away. when the delivery man finally came to my door, my kids were crying because they were so hungry, I told him to get the hell of my porch and slammed the door in his face. never again, Ruk you people are useless!

48.description: Reaked of rotten fish when we entered they actually lit incense as we ate - can't decide which is worse. Food was sub par and despite searching for bento box and them coming up in search they DON'T have them. Annoyed.

44.description: The food was awesome. Ordered to go the beef basil fried rice, California roll, Portage Park making (which by the way was amazing) and the Thai iced tea. Definitely going back again. Stopped in and it was not a long wait at all, service was good. Highly recommend.

24.description: This place was really a big disappointment the service sucked, the food was mediocre and they obviously didn't have any busboy cause we where surrounded by tables with dirty dishes piled high smfh will never go back 45 dollar lesson learned. Zero stars

7.description: Solid Thai and veg sushi. It's a good neighborhood place. Might not be a destination like some other places in the city but their prices have stayed reasonable, they've gotten to be consistent, not super oily like some Thai food can get. It's one of the few places we can walk to where we'll take family and friends from out of town.

49.description: The sushi here was decent but the wonton soup and the pad thai noodles were extremely bland! I only recommend this spot for the sushi!

40.description: Overall we enjoyed the food. The Godzilla roll was delicious as well as the Pad See Ew and Panag Curry. Serves was a little slow based on only having 3 tables occupied. I can tell they were busy with deliveries but they need to find a better balance of serving customer in the restaurant verses deliveries.

53.description: Crab Rangoon was pretty solid. Service a bit slow.The Sushi was mediocre at best.  Got a Philly roll, summer roll and snow leopard maki.  Meh...about as good as the stuff you can get at the grocery store.  Don't think the fish is as fresh as other sushi restaurants/seaweed a bit chewy.  The Basil noodle were pretty solid although my fiancée wasn't a fan.  Overall pretty average to below average food. Don't think we will be back

30.description: This place is great also the prices are great as well. Sushi is awesome. The pad Thai is great but sometimes it taste a little different. I would give it a five star but two times I went there and they only gave me five pieces of sushi instead of six which it usually comes with. But overall it's a great and affordable place

46.description: My go to place for Sushi and Thai delivery at work once a week. Never disappoints. Great mini egg rolls, soups, and great lunch specials. Always washed down with a Thai Iced Coffee...or two. Unlike some other reviewers, I find (just my humble opinion, in my case) delivery to be prompt (usually no more than 30 minutes) & calculate accordingly. This has, however, been a recent improvement & wasn't always the case. Why 4 and not 5 stars? Your parking lot. Mother of God. Potholes? No. Craters, as can be found on the Moon. Please fix your parking lot!

1.description: I've been here four times in the past week. Really quite an amazing and little known gem. Equally suited for business meetings as it is for a date with your significant other. The food is the best in the area and their hand rolls, in particular, are outstanding. Great selection of tea and great service. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it's not upscale enough for my taste.

55.description: My friends love the won-ton soup here. Their rice and noodles (especially wide rice noodles) are really good. They also have great pricing on their lunch specials. Although, I'm not a huge fan of their sushi. I was disappointed in their Godzilla maki.

9.description: This place had really good sushi. Nice waitstaff. I had the plum wine and it was to die for.

26.description: I have mixed feelings about this place.  I've only dined in twice, and it was more than a year ago, so this review is primarily for take out.Pros:-Pretty good food, sometimes even really great food.-Super nice people, have had great interactions with staff.-Once, I accidentally ordered pickup from the wrong Ruk location and they made the whole order again rather than making me drive to Albany Park.  I thought that was really nice.-Cute place.  I like the setup and decor.-Free Edamame, California Roll, or Egg Roll if your delivery is over a certain amount ($25?).  This is a fun perk.-The flavor of the Panang Curry is amazing. It's my go-to Thai order and I love it here.Cons:-Food quality is inconsistent.  ESPECIALLY THE SPICE!!  There has been more than one time where medium spicy has been so hot I've had to just toss it.  But sometimes it's perfect.  I hate that I now order mild and have to eat blander food just in case their cook is feeling a bit wild that night.  Sometimes I'll order the same dish and it will look totally different the next time, different peppers, etc.  It's so weird.-Their delivery takes a long time.  Do not order from here if you are in any kind of a rush.I love that there is a good Thai/Sushi place in Jeff Park.  And it's really close to being a great place.  I hope they make the small changes necessary to get there.

25.description: I moved to this area about 2 years ago. At first I used to go here on a somewhat regular basis. I really wanted it to be my go-to since it's within walking distance. The ambiance is great and the food is all very delicious. Service is okay; not phenomenal, maybe a bit slow, but nothing terrible to complain about. My problem is that the prices are higher than I would normally pay for Thai food especially since the portions are so small. I'm surprised they don't even fill up the plate with extra broccoli to hide the size. Broccoli is cheap! I've since found many other Thai restaurants to go to and have retired Ruk from the list. The rare occasion I come here is when the weather is terrible and I haven't gone grocery shopping, but even then I tend to go elsewhere.Sorry Ruk! If you adjusted your pricing I would come back.

12.description: Sushi its the best what can happened with me. I can eat sushi every day, every hour. I stoped at this restaurant for a new experiences. Its not the best sushi I've ever tried, but it worst to try it. I like their classic rolls.

59.description: Place is small and quaint. But if it's cold and you sit by the door watch out! It's drafty!  Service was decent. Nothing special in the food department,  but good. I would go here again, but only if the mood strikes and I'm in the neighborhood.  I wouldn't go back just for the food though.

21.description: This review is well overdue.  I've lived in Jeff Park for 2 yrs now (after leaving a long stint on the northside). The sushi options are limited out here but Ruk is by far the best!   The food is always so good and consistent.  They can get busy on weekends with delivery but good to see they are expanding (to Albany park).  I highly recommend if you live on northwest side, it's the best around.  I usually get sushi platter b and veggie steamed pot stickers- yum!  But their Thai noodle dishes are really good too.  Pad Thai is awesome!  Definitely recommend.  I usually deliver but have eaten at the restaurant a few times.   It's Byob so thats a plus!  :). Friends have had their food and agree with me on quality and constancy.

17.description: LOVE THIS PLACE! We live in the neighborhood and are soooo happy to have a good Thai and sushi place nearby.  Especially because every other business and restaurant that's occupied that space in the past has failed, but this place has got staying power!First, I adore the fact that it's BYOB.  Second, the sushi dishes are of great quality and they are always changing up the menu to include unique and different dishes (sushi pinwheel rolls wrapped in cucumber - um, delicious and fun!!).  Service is friendly and prompt. If you're planning on going on a Friday or Saturday night, I'd recommend making a reservation, as it can sometimes get busy.  This place is also my go-to for sushi takeout in my neighborhood, so if you're not in the mood to eat in the establishment, pick up your phone and place the order, it'll be ready to go and you can be back at home in no time enjoying your food whilst wearing your PJs :)

10.description: Have lived in Jefferson Park for almost 3 years and was leery of trying because it was Thai and Sushi. So glad we gave in we had an asian culture combination, Pad Thai, Pad See Eiw, Fried Rice, Crab Rangoon and free Egg Rolls. Everything was delicious, great quality, will be our regular spot for Thai and other Asian treats.

5.description: great sushi and the spicy basil noodles no meat was delicious ordered many times from here fast delivery

3.description: I don't mind to experiment and try new things at this place. Anything I tried here was delicious. The size of the food is just right. I love the affordable lunch deals during the week days. The place is around the corner for me so I don't have to drive there. But there is free street parking on Milwaukee right the next block heading north (across the street). I also like the look of this place, the huge windows. It's also a great place for a conversation, no laud music.

35.description: This review is really different; I was expecting a long wait and a delicious meal. Maybe this is as good as it gets for asian takeout in Chicago. If so, we need to recruit some real talent from San Francisco and New York to come show Chicagoan's what they are missing. The double 00 chicken seemed popular so we tried it. Bummer. This was a weak version of General Tso's without broccoli or freshness. Bleh.Bamee Noodles were interesting; I wouldn't try it again but it wasn't a major disappointment. Sakura maki looked good but didn't taste fresh. At all. Tekka Maki was standard and okay; nothing to brag about and a little steep at $6.Wish it was better-Sadly missing the coasts and real asian takeout

19.description: This review is based entirely on delivery service, which is the kind of delivery service you might have expected if you were John Adams in Paris in the 18th century ordering delivery from Philadelphia. Unfortunately, for Ruk Sushi and Thai, this is the 21st century and the restaurant is a mile away from our house. The first time it took them two hours to deliver to our house we chalked it up to bad luck, PLUS they gave us a refund plus an additional credit, so we thought we'd give them another chance. And, in fact, for some months they delivered within an hour. Until the disaster of a couple of weeks ago, in which the woman answering the phone said the order was late because of bad traffic. The next couple of times I called she said they were late with orders because they were busy.This was the second time this happened to us, and we're sad to say unless Ruk actually has the capacity to deliver food, they should not offer delivery. I wish this wasn't the case.  I see other recent reviews lamenting their deteriorating service, so I'm not alone. It's a shame. Their food, while unspectacular, has been pretty reliable for the most part.  We won't be ordering from them again.

28.description: Food is a bit above average. While dining in, the wait for the food took long taking almost an hour.  Also as the food came out, they were taken out half an hour apart.  Half of the party were eating as they finished the other half got their meal.  Service needs upgrade.

45.description: It's the best sushi and Thai place near Jefferson Park. The customer service is great. I'm always greeted with a smile despite showing up hungover & hungry. My experiences here have only been carryout but the inside of the restaurant looks nice and clean. Almost out of place for the neighborhood. (I love Jeff Pk). The food is great. The sushi taste fresh & the noodles are always perfectly cooked. The only thing I would change is the prices. It's seems to be a bit pricey but you do get what you pay for.

33.description: We order from Ruk often for lunch. They have lunch specials that include eggrolls (and soup if you're eating in). My favorite from here is the chicken pad see ew, which is the bomb diggity. I have also had their sushi while dining in. Not bad. They're always nice, prices are decent, place is clean, and food is good. Thumbs up!

43.description: 00 Chicken is awesome.  Sushi is all very good.  I like that it is a little off the beaten path.  In my opinion, it is arguably the best sushi in the whole city.

2.description: This review is for their customer service when answering the phone. If your restaurant is not busy, and I call twice to see if my order is ready for pick up, then answer your damn phone. How do I know theyre not busy? Im parked in front and I can see through the window! Lets see if the $50 I spent here was worth it. Going in now....

18.description: Visited Chicago and was staying at my cousin's place and I was craving some sushi!  This was the nearest place that had decent ratings on Yelp so we decided to give it a try.  The place was pretty empty around 7:00pm.  As we walked in, we were seated.  Hmm there is 4 of us and only one napkin setting with utensils.  We looked at other tables and there were also missing napkins and utensils.  Aren't place settings suppose to be set already?  Anyways, I ordered the spicy salmon crunch ($6.95) and it was okay.  There was way to much rice in it.  We also ordered the Pad See Ew ($7.50)  My sister really liked it and it was her first time eating it. I've had quite a few Pad See Ew dishes here and there and this has got to be the worst one that I've eaten...ever!!  You know how people describe what food tastes in ways of how it smells?  Well this tasted like I was eating a wet dog!!  It smelled like what a dog smells like after it is wet.  It smelled like dog food and anything related to a dog.  I totally lost my appetite after i had a bite of it.  We also ordered banana rolls ($3.95) and this comes with 5.  This was okay too.  Sweet, crunchy, and definitely tastes like banana!  Dip it in their sauce it it is pretty good.  Overall, okay place.  Service was lacking quite a bit and had to wait roughly 30 minutes which is crazy because there was no one in the restaurant.

41.description: I ordered medium spicy and its crazy hot. Its mean of you to make it this spicy. Just un called for. I have been to Bangcok, Chang Mai and Krabbi and nothing I ate was even close to this spicy. You guys are mean.

52.description: My husband and I ordered Ruk fried calamari...honestly the appetizer we had was okay. We ordered beef pad see iew and chicken pad Thai which was pretty good. For dessert we had banana roll with a sweet dipping sauce.  Now, that was really good!It's great that we finally found a Thai place around this neighborhood.  Yay! Overall,  we'll come again.

50.description: Average at best but convenient location.  A little pricey I'd say for average food.  The soup is awful and the servers not very knowledgeable about the menu.  Once in a  while place.

4.description: Such great food! This place is amazing!!!! Pad Thai, sushi, and BYOB. It comes first in my mind when I think of Thai or Sushi. There is an expansive list and everything I order is heavenly. My favorites are the SOS roll, Sakura, and the Bangkok. The interior is very nice but looks like it can use a touch up.

6.description: Ruk Sushi and Thai is located just north of Montrose off of Milwaukee avenue.  You really can't go wrong with a location on Milwaukee avenue.  This restaurant is an open seating set up as you can just come in a pick a place to sit.  The west side of the restaurant faces Milwaukee avenue with large windows so you can people watch if you'd like.  The wooden tables and chairs are decent and you won't miss all the maneki nekos.  Ruk Sushi and Thai serves sushi, rice bowl dishes, appetizers, noodles, you name it they have some of it.  The menu items are decently priced and won't break the bank.  I had the egg rolls which were good.  The wonton soup (woop!) which was hot in temperature for the entire time I was eating it.  This is key to any good soup.  Finally, I had the spicy seafood curry as my entree.  For many entree menu items they give you the choice of three spiciness levels.  I went for the third which was the hottest level and I was not disappointed.  I was a little afraid but better too hot than not hot enough.  Ruk Sushi and Thai definitely knows how to spice things up and the service is good.  I look forward to coming back here to try some sushi and perhaps a few other menu items.

22.description: The food is always inconsistent which is unfortunate because when the right chef is working the food is amazing!!!! The inconsistencies are as follows:1) Dont ask for any of your food mild or spicy! They put sooooo much red pepper in the dish that I have actually had to throw it away. 2)I love the Thom Kha soup however some days its really salty with no lime flavor and other days its pure white as if they just heated up coconut milk.3)Pad thai. Sometimes its perfect. Other times its soooo fishy its inedible. Its so important to cook all of the sauce out of the pad thai as its made with fish sauce. If you don't cook the pad thai long enough the fish taste will linger. When I opened the container it was a light gray color. UGHI can't gamble on my food, its too expensive to do so. I will not be back which is really unfortunate. Maybe the owner should keep an eye on the food that is going out so he can check for quality and consistency. Another thing that kinda bothers me is that I see someone from the restaurant bringing in produce and other ingredients from places other than accredited distributors. I live next door and see this happening almost on a daily basis. That is very concerning to me as ingredients from distributors have passed safety and quality control issues.

15.description: Recently moved to portage park and so happy this place is right around the corner! Panang curry is amazing. Spicy basil noodles and pad Thai are also spot on. Sushi is always great too!

57.description: I really like Ruk Sushi! Seafood is fresh! Everyone is very nice, especially the owner! He does the deliveries sometimes! I love that it is BYOB ! Perfect compliment to all there selections because the menu is huge!! Try the curries!

20.description: I was a bit hesitant to order delivery because of a couple negative reviews regarding the delivery but the other sushi /thai place in the area has even worse reviews so I went for it.   Delivery came ahead of schedule and the food was good.   10%overpriced though.   Will order again

36.description: Delicious for what it's worth and quite a selection to choose from ! I can't wait to go here again.

14.description: Poor service Pricey and not worth it... Wont go again

58.description: I love this place.  Small, quick service, and delicious eats.  Sushi is fresh and delicious and the bento box gives a lot of food for a small price.

56.description: I placed lunch order on the phone for the first time. Although GrubHub said they wouldn't deliver to my location, they were flexiable enough to arrange for a delivery when I called.  Their delivery was super fast & Katsu Bento Box looked delicious!!! The portion was good for lunch too (including Miso Soup & Salad).  Unfortunately, the lunch was not for me this time, but hopefully I can get to try their food to comment on taste! :)

29.description: This spot has a bento box that's great value for money and I love the vegetarian/vegan options on the menu. I also had a piece of Saba (my favorite fish) and it wasn't bad at all. This is a good sushi spot for the neighborhood!

42.description: It's a hole in the wall, but the people are super friendly and sushi I had was delish! :-) The Bomb roll is my favorite!!!

23.description: This place is great! Their sushi is always super fresh. Always get the tuna avocado and spicy crab maki. Both are so good. Their hibachi chicken is amazing. Only complaint is a couple times we have gotten their fried ice cream which is advertised as vanilla and it's been green tea flavored. That would be fine if it was advertised that way.

47.description: I would seek alternative sushi options. Rolls had a gross amount of spicy mayo, miso soup had a stale taste, yellowtail had a funky taste and red snapper was over the top chewy. I gave it two stars because if you would eliminate the spicy mayo then the rolls weren't too bad, especially for the price.

8.description: The Jalapeño Popper was delish! Fast delivery, good prices! Will definitely have again!

31.description: First time I've been here and have to admit it was better than expected. When we walked in we were immediately greeted and brought to a table. Service was quick and friendly.

34.description: My boyfriend and I love the Ewok! Order the Jalapeno poppers. Jalapenos cut length-wise, stuffed with cream cheese, tuna, covered in panko and fried, topped with spicy mayo, unagi sauce, masago and green onions. They're divine and extremely unique! Any of the specialty rolls are excellent. Some of our favorites include: Geisha roll, Da Bomb, and Double Pleasure. 8090 is a very popular one as well. You can't go wrong with sushi at this place.

16.description: I usually order out from this place. If you decide to dine it's pretty quiet and casual. I have ordered crab rangoon, Long River Roll, Shrimp Tempura Roll, and Shrimp Fried Rice everything is good. If your in the area good place to order out or dine in.

13.description: Halfway nice looking place with Chinese and sushi. The main issue I had with the place is the two entrees I ordered basically had almost no meat on them at all...charge me more if you have to but don't skimp on the meat.

11.description: I love this place! Great vegetarian options! The Agadashi tofu is delicious. The main entree are so filling. The staff are always so kind!

39.description: Oh HECK NO!Ordered the Mongolian beef and the 2 rolls for $8.00 lunch special.The taste is good, no issue there, But the last time I heard, the Mongolian Beef  has to have beef in it... It was a mass of white onions (which true mongolian does not have) and a few green onions and six strings of green peppers... There was ONE small piece of meat the size of a quarter... And it was full of black pepper. So much so that it burned my esophagus on the first bite!The rolls were half the size of the original rolls. The menu said 2 rolls for 8.00, but what I got was only 12 very small pieces. At .66 each, I'd rather have the Jewel's rolls!And the fried rice had crunchy kernels... A sign of rice being re-used. Don't even want to think whose leftovers I ate!If these people think that "special" means give them left overs or less of the main ingredient, they are sorely mistaken. I give these people less than a year. There are better places to spend $40.00 for lunch!

37.description: Yub nub!

0.description: I picked this place because I was in the mood for sushi and this was midway between a friend and me. We actually ate there. This place is really meant for carry out. We were the only people there. The server was the cashier so I don't recommend for a dining experience.The sushi however is very good. We split up three different roles and the crab Rangoon.  The Rangoon was excellent. Normally you can't taste crab or they use the fake crab stuff but this was the real thing and the crab was good.The sushi rolls were very good. I'm not a huge sushi fan and I only go for it once or twice a year. However I would definately go back here. The food was great. Just do it as carry out.

38.description: Good hidden neighborhood spot. The inside is nicer than you'd think from the windows. Good lunch specials. Affordable and tasty sushi options. I haven't tried the cooked items. Pleasant server.

51.description: Ok.  I am hesitant to even give out 1 star but there isn't a no-star option so.....  This is the most disgusting food I have ever received via delivery.  I found this place via Grub Hub.  Ick.  Ick.  Ick!   I read another review or two that said the meat was "funky" from this place but the rest of the reviews seemed good so I thought I'd give it a try.  I should have known from the second the delivery driver called me saying "can you come outside" that this was going to be weird.  And no, as a matter of fact I can not come outside.  Why don't you walk up my three front stairs and ring my doorbell like I would expect from a delivery service?  Is that too much to ask?  I don't need you to call me to tell me my food is out front.  You aren't leaving it in the yard...you are delivering it...to my door.  Please do so!  Alas...onto the next issue.... FUNKY MEAT is an UNDERSTATEMENT.  I specifically ordered chicken hibachi to make my order as simple as possible given the above review on weird meat.  I also ordered crab rangoon and a fried banana (which I know doesn't make a lot of sense for delivery but I had a sweet tooth and figured they had to have a way to transport it).  First of all, I believe I actually received an Ewok Hibachi as my mystery meat...not chicken at all.  I bit into a piece of what I thought was chicken, tasted like bad scallop and had the consistency of jellied meat (like SPAM from a jar).  EEK!  I picked all of the mystery meat out and the remaining rice, broccoli and mushrooms were so doused in sauce that it was basically inedible and carried that fishy scent.  Onto the crab rangoon.  GONG.  Fishy, fishy, fishy.  I couldn't get past the first taste.  And of course, the fried banana was smothered in some sort of berry sauce (instead of putting it on the side) so was basically a sloppy, pasty mess of mush by the time it arrived. Mystery fruit?  I guess.  Seriously, I have never ever had such an inedible meal and really want my money back.  The mystery meat is seriously worrying me after I had one bite and I think I am working myself up over the texture and causing myself a sour stomach now -- either that or I will be hugging the toilet in about an hour from whatever it was that I ate.  I can only say that I am SO glad I didn't attempt sushi from this place -- how much worse could it get?

27.description: Nice to know this place is in my 'hood for when I have a sushi fix. My sister and I were the only ones in the restaurant on a Saturday afternoon. The sushi was pretty good and they are very fast. The prices were pretty reasonable as well.  Space is a little small, but it wasn't about being flashy so I can see why people can overlook coming here. The windows are covered in pictures of sushi which can be unappealing to someone that doesn't really like it. It's more like those window decals that doubles to keep out glare and cuts down on sunlight from the inside. Although the outside doesn't have visual appeal; the inside is all right, seats and a sushi bar. Pan Asian cuisine as well so I can probably talk my husband to coming back with me since he doesn't do sushi.

32.description: Hmmm... I've been to a lot of sushi in Chicago.  This place is reasonably priced. They have great lunch specials. I don't think their soups are any good. The miso is fine but if you can mess up miso then foget about it.Their sushi isn't bad. Try the Mexican roll and the tuna and avocado.This place is mediocre. It's great for pick up... It's the only place in my proximitys which makes it a little more necasarry. The people are nice that run it. Service is fine. It just is what it is.I've yet to find something to rave about...

54.description: I really like this place because it has a bunch of vegan and vegetarian options. The sweet potato tempura is divine. The people who work here are friendly and everything is suprisingly inexpensive. I bought two roll sets, a soda, and egg rolls (also good) for about $15 (including tip). And I live down the street. If you're in the area, it's definitely a nice place to eat at.

48.description: I don't think a good Chinese Restaurant that delivers in my area is to much to ask for which means my still continues.I got the sesame chicken and crab rangoon.  The sesame chicken had a good amount coating and a nice crunch but it was missing one simple thing - Flavor!! The crab Rangoon had a thin wrapper and had the potential to be good but the dipping sauce. Agh! Almost had it! The sweet and sour sauce was a thin sauce that wasn't sweet at all. With that said, the search continues...

44.description: I recently became somewhat obsessed with Sushi, in the last two years. I guess I felt I had some catching up to do since I am 30 and really always refused to eat Sushi, guess I was missing out. I live in Portage Park and always try to use small businesses near me so it is safe to say that I have eaten at every sushi place within a 5 mile radius of Ewok cafe and this place is BY FAR the best one around. In fact, I think it is even better than some of the trendy places downtown and in the Lincoln Park area etc.One thing I have noticed is that some Sushi places have dry almost sour tasting rice. I used to eat at Ruk on Milwaukee before I discovered Ewok. They had that relatively dry rice, and on a couple occasions, it even tasted outright bad.But never has Ewok disappointed. I have eaten there at least 15 times just this year alone and the consistency of quality is top notch. I always order the Double Pleasure specialty roll, and I also really enjoy the Mexican roll (without cilantra, yuk!).Not only is the rice extra moist and delicious, the fish is always fresh, never fishy smelling or tasting. And I have eaten there very close to closing time as well (some places will dump there old stuff on you at the end of the night.)Prices are reasonable as well, with good size basic Sushi rolls selling for around $6 and specialty rolls selling around $11 to $13 average range.If you want some well priced, fresh moist rice, Sushi rolls, with excellent friendly service, look no further than Ewok Cafe!Happy eating!

24.description: Loved this place. Ordered out for a Saturday night sushi dinner and loved everything. They gave us some free appetizers to try that were delicious. Also had the jalapeno chicken dish which was great. Totally be back

7.description: Great sushi for the money and just right down the street.  They are always fast and professional and there is always room to eat in the dining room.

49.description: So many great vegetarian options! When I do occasionally go for meat, the fish has always been very fresh. Everything is always seasoned really well (and can be really spicy) and I love how they cook their tofu. Entrees are large and everything is very affordable.Wait staff is really attentive and, occasionally, we get free appetizers. One of my favorite restaurants in the area!

40.description: Great sushi place if you're in the area for a few drinks or doing anything near Six Corners. Plenty of options available, and the rolls are delicious and good quality with inexpensive prices. You get full fast! The past couple of times I dined there, there were either no other people eating there, or just a group of a few, so I'm guessing it's more of a carry-out place.

53.description: I feel like I've become a regular there! I'm here at least every couple months and the food is superb and the waitress is always super attentive.  Sometimes we get free appetizers from the chef, and get to try new specials.  The price is right compared to a lot of other sushi places and the service is ALWAYS great. They're fast, clean, relaxing, and minus the sake, everything a sushi place should.

30.description: The sushi was good here. I'll go back again. Couple of things on the menu that I like to try

46.description: Great service. Food was delicious, my parents suggested this place and my wife and we tried it out on a whim. What a great idea! Delicious food, and awesome sushi! We will definitely come back and tell others!

1.description: This is the first time I ordered from here. My husband and I thought this place is fantastic. We really enjoyed the coconut shrimp with the dipping sauce, the shrimps were large, crispy, and not greasy. We're on the fence about the crab Rangoon, they were not bad bad, but not great either, I think we'll skip the crab Rangoon next time. We both enjoyed the General Tso's chicken very much, as well as the pad Thai. This place is a keeper as a go to delivery! Fast, good food, and reasonable prices!

55.description: Small place, very clean and relaxing atmosphere. The Sushi taste fresh and tasty. Prices are reasonable and lunch special is until 2:00pm.

9.description: Been coming here for a little over a year. I love their AAC and da bomb rolls, my boyfriend And friends really love the bento boxes. Calamari and crab Rangoon is also good

26.description: The Teppanyaki dishes are pretty good, but I've had "meh" experiences with the seafood and sushi.

25.description: This place is amazing. It's in a different neighborhood than downtown which is nice. Don't have to compute far to have good sushi. It's fast and very clean. The food was great. I had crunchy spicy tuna and it was delicious.The only down side is that they don't have any music playing. I don't know if it was only like that when I was there or if it was something that's always like that. Otherwise, it was perfect and if you eve have a craving for sushi hopefully not as bad as me.... Go here.

12.description: I was not impressed. We came in close to closing time, but that should be no excuse for less than great service. We were the only ones there. We didn't get water, we had to ask for it. The girl seemed to be annoyed while taking our order. We ordered a simple chicken dish and a bento box. It was just ok. Maybe it's the lighting in the place, but it seemed so sad-the ambiance and the food. Might try it again, but weary.

59.description: Pretty good Pan Asian food for Portage Park. If you live close to the restaurant the food will probably come in less then 45 minutes.

21.description: It's good but not the best sushi in Chicago. It also happens to be right across the street from my apartment so I generally order from here. I would say best Sushi in Portage Park for sure. Favorite dishes:Geisha Roll Crunchy Spicy Tuna (And I'm super picky about my crunchy spicy tuna because most places seem to either be crunchy or spicy but almost never both and this place gets it right every time) Sweet Potato tempuraTheir deliveries almost always take exactly 40 minutes so take that into consideration when ordering.

17.description: This place is so good and delivery is so fast!  Usually always order on Grubhub and have never been disappointed.

10.description: It's good but not the best sushi in Chicago. It also happens to be right across the street from my apartment so I generally order from here. I would say best Sushi in Portage Park for sure. Favorite dishes:Geisha Roll Crunchy Spicy Tuna (And I'm super picky about my crunchy spicy tuna because most places seem to either be crunchy or spicy but almost never both and this place gets it right every time) Sweet Potato tempuraTheir deliveries almost always take exactly 40 minutes so take that into consideration when ordering.

5.description: This place is amazing. It's in a different neighborhood than downtown which is nice. Don't have to compute far to have good sushi. It's fast and very clean. The food was great. I had crunchy spicy tuna and it was delicious.The only down side is that they don't have any music playing. I don't know if it was only like that when I was there or if it was something that's always like that. Otherwise, it was perfect and if you eve have a craving for sushi hopefully not as bad as me.... Go here.

3.description: Great food, fast pickup. This is my new favorite place Chinese/Sushi in Portage Park!

35.description: ordered from 24 EAT app and delivery came in 35min, sushi tasted great with nice clean presentation... spicy crunchy tuna roll $5.75 tasted great and avocado tuna roll $4.75 was delicious.. comes in 8 pieces

19.description: I enjoyed this place every time I came here, delicious fresh and yammy, good prices !

28.description: Love this place!  Best Thai and vegetarian sushi in the neighborhood, in my humble opinion.  We've only done take out from E Wok but it always arrives hot and delicious.  Or cold and delicious, if it's my sushi.  Yum yum!

45.description: We've only ordered take-out, no delivery, but the food has always been made correctly & is pretty good. Very friendly & efficient service as well. Nice addition to the area. They offer vegan mock-meats, other than tofu, too.

33.description: It's a shame because we really liked this place.  I have ordered 4 times from this place, delivery, 2 of 4 times they got lost (and I live 5 blocks away) and this last time, they didn't order everything I asked for, leaving my sons meal off (who can't eat dairy)...sad, but that's the last time.  Good food, but any restaurant needs to get. Their deliveries straight.

43.description: Oh gosh... It was really terrible.I got the hibachi filet mignon with fried rice. The fried rice was hard and tasteless. The sauce on the meat and veggies was good, but overall it was a flavorless dish. The meat did not taste like it was seasoned at all and it left a bad aftertaste in my mouth. I ordered a crunchy spicy tuna roll to make up for the bad dish. The rolls were small, but come with 8 pieces as opposed to the usual 6. Unfortunately it tasted terrible. The "spicy mayo" drizzled on top made the rolls taste disgustingly sour and the filling for the roll was anything but spicy. It didn't taste very fresh and was also bland.I'm very disappointed. I had eaten here once before and remember thinking it blasphemous that they would charge $2.00 for ONE piece of Super white tuna. The nigiri sushi is not even full sized. They're cut in half length wise. It's ridiculous to charge me $2.00 for sub quality fish that isn't even the full size.**Especially, when you can get super white tuna from the Lawrence Fish Market on Lawrence and Pulaski for $1.00 a piece!I kept wondering why I had an aversion to this place. I'd often see it listed in GrubHub and not consider it with a second glance without really knowing why. I decided to give it a shot after having bad hair styling done at InStyle up the street. Well, now I know why I've been avoiding it and I should have listened to my instincts.I won't be going back. Very unpleasant experience.The only things I really liked about the place is that the waitress (note: it's a small place so there is only one waitress and she doubles up as the person answering the phone and processing take-out orders) was very nice. She filled up my water cup very frequently and the water was very cold and tasty. Though, she wouldn't have had to come over to refill my water 8 times if the cup was decently sized but that is an example of the restaurants shortcomings in design and has nothing to do with her.

2.description: Came here for lunch. They really have decent lunch special prices. I ordered the Mongolian beef w/ miso soup. The food was ok, but didn't wow me. That's the reason for the 3 stars.

18.description: I love Ewok. Being a vegetarian, my favorite thing on the menu is the tempura sweet potato roll. Their entrees are really good as well. My husband is a big fan of the Bento boxes, where you get a little of everything. Great service. My favorite thai/sushi place in the Portage Park area.

41.description: I live close by to this place and eat there often. The food is much lighter and well prepared than the typical American-Chinese type. The sushi is very good and the entrée portions are huge! The chef must take a lot of pride in his work. The ambiance is nothing to write home about; the building used to be a gyros joint that has been remodeled to expose the now immaculate kitchen to public view. Everything is now much cleaner there than it was 5 years ago. As for taste and price goes, this is a really good place.

52.description: The best Hibachi Grill, Sushi food around Portage Park, Old Irving.Everything I've tried has been delicious. Fast, friendly, clean, great prices.Definitely worth a trip.

50.description: Visited this restaurant for the first time yesterday and had an alright experience.  The service was great (plus), the menu was extensive (plus), and it is BYOB (plus).  We started off with a spicy crab soup, which was pretty flavorful, and the server gave us a free appetizer, very nice.  Next, we ordered an assortment of signature and top signature sushi rolls along with two unagi nigiri (eel).  Some of the signature rolls were average, not offering too much unique flavor which was a bummer because I thought the flavor combinations listed in the menu would yield something a little better.  Then came the unagi nigiri...my piece of eel was horribly fatty and almost inedible (I know eel is a fatty fish, but my particular piece was so chewy and fatty that I literally could not eat part of it), yuck!!  My boyfriend's piece of unagi nigiri was fine, but my experience left an icky taste in my mouth :(  We moved onto the top signature rolls, most of which were very flavorful and inventive (especially the Geeko Maki with thinly sliced kiwi laid on top of the roll, very yummy!).  We finished our dining experience with a free scoop of green tea ice cream with sliced bananas, so I'd say the service here is pretty darn good.  Overall, I'd give this place another shot.  Perhaps the "eel incident" was a one-time thing.  I'm also happy to have a sushi restaurant in the Portage Park neighborhood, so I don't want to write them off just yet.

4.description: Writing this review makes me sad, as I genuinely enjoyed the food the times I've ordered from E Wok. However, our order tonight included almonds in the dessert, and no allergens were mentioned on the menu. My wife is allergic to almonds, and we were fortunate enough to get Benadryl into her before we'd have needed to call an ambulance. Food allergies are no joke. They can kill. The item's description has been updated online, so the next person will be warned.  They refunded the price of the dessert, but such carelessness with something so serious means I cannot recommend E Wok.

6.description: This spot has a bento box that's great value for money and I love the vegetarian/vegan options on the menu. I also had a piece of Saba (my favorite fish) and it wasn't bad at all. This is a good sushi spot for the neighborhood!

22.description: We ordered for delivery. Hawaiian roll was my favorite thing. Spicy tuna roll was chewy, so my cat enjoyed it. And my friend said the chicken bento box was ok, but not great. The sashimi was fresh though. Not bad for portage park.

15.description: Legitimately the best sushi I have found in Chicago. Sure there are pricier places with a more "upscale" dining area, but who wants to trade quality of delicious rolls?!? We tried 4 different rolls and were more than satisfied with each one. Amazing flavor and everything came out super fast.

57.description: I tried E Wok Cafe last night, what a nice addition to the Vegetarian/vegan community! The fact that you can get what you like at the hibachi grill, plus vegan protein-rich soy meat makes this one of the best choices for me. They offer a number of good vegetarian entrees and some delicious vegetarian sushi rolls. Overall, food is amazing and the service is great. Definitely will come back.

20.description: I've had delivery from E Wok, and it was fast and everything was delicious. Big plus for getting my General Tso's chicken to me while it was still crispy with a perfect sauce to chicken ratio. I went later with my daughter for a quick sushi date. The place was completely empty, despite a nice atmosphere. We had the shrimp tempura roll and the California roll (my baby is a sushi newbie) as well as the crab rangoon. The sushi was perfect, and I'm a big fan of the shrimp tempura roll. I loved the crab rangoon because it had a lot of flavorful filling, and the wrapper was the thin kind (not what I'm used to, but I liked it). They are right by my house, so I will be back.

36.description: Don't get yaki soba. 6 year old Daughter hated it and when they saw that she didn't touch it, they didn't nothing about it. Rolls were ok. Salt and pepper shrimp was only decent thing. Hibachi scallop - underwhelming and tasted like frozen scallops. Won't be coming back.

14.description: This is one of those stick with what you like kind of restaurants. My favorites are the bento boxes, yakiniku entree, and steak and shrimp. Also, their crab ragoon is better (because they have more crab in them) than other places but they're also incredibly small. Not bad, but not awesome.

12.description: I purchased a Groupon for this place and when I called to get an appointment, the were not able to get me in for several weeks.  I think that is pretty ridiculous.  I read some other reviews about how they are accommodating.  But they were not in the slightest bit accommodating to me.  I was also put on hold 4 times during the conversation.  Decided to cancel Groupon.

3.description: I bought a deal through Amazon local One session Microdermabrasion 29.00 $The sassion went greatMy face is very smooth no pain no long time The ladys there are very nice helpful especially the one that did the session .. To went there again or often mmm not sure it's kinda pricey (,:

1.description: I have been coming here on and off for about 2 years now.  I absolutely love their microdermabrasion. I suffer from acne prone skin but with just one microderm session I always see an immediate change in the texture and overall look of my skin. They also have the best prices on Groupon!

2.description: I bought a microdermabrasion package off of Groupon, after comparing several med spas. I live in Wicker Park but chose Luxe Blue because I did not want to battle with street parking in busier areas of the city (an extra 10 minute drive for cheap parking directly outside their door is well worth it...especially when leaving with a reddened, make-up free face). They also had the best bang-for-your-buck options. I had never had a microdermabrasion before, and was a bit nervous going in because I have always been self-conscious about my skin. However, Selena was more than welcoming and laid back, and did a great job. She was easy to talk to and the whole session was much more relaxing than I had anticipated. Additionally, they text you reminders for your appointments that can be easily added to iCal. I just purchased another package!
