9.description: Massage was not great at all.  Felt more like a skin rub down than a massage, I've never been rocked back and forth so much during a massage.  The whole hour it was just moving me rather than massaging the muscles.  The location itself is very nice, ambience is perfect for relaxation.  All they need is a good masseur.

10.description: One star because there's option for no stars! I was a walk-in trying to get a polish change or manicure. They said the mani was $20, which I wouldn't pay for a mani unless I really knew they would do a good job. I was just walking in so I opted for the quick polish change. The girl painting my nails couldn't even be 16, let alone have any professional experience with nails! She went straight for the polish without even filing my nails, which is standard for a polish change! I quickly took note and said I'd go for the manicure instead. Big mistake! She didn't even soak my nails! She put cuticle oil on and that was it! The worst part of it all was that I waited at least 15 min in the salon for my nails to dry. They were closing and I felt rushed so I left doubtful that my nails were completely dry. They got so smudged and ruined I had to take the polish off and redo my whole mani again. I can't believe I tipped her! I wish I would've spoken up at the time. What a waste of money !

4.description: I had a great experience with Alicja, she did the best eyebrow waxing I've ever had. She outlined the shape with a white pencil to show me what the ideal shape is for my face. She's like an eyebrow architect! For $15, it was worth every penny. I'll definitely be going back.

6.description: Set up appt for massage because I had Amazon Local deal. When I went in, they told me my appointment was for the next day. Now I do mess up from time to time, but I know i had the correct day. Massage therapist was 'on call' so they said she'd be in for me a couple hours later. I was very nice about it & said that would be fine. I got a call 45 minutes before my 2nd appt saying massage therapist would not be able to make it in that day.No apology, no offer to extend my coupon since they screwed up. I have no desire to even try this place. That person missed out on a good tip. I thought the idea of offering a deal like that was to get some return business, not to treat people with a coupon like garbage.

0.description: Overall, I had a great experience. I bought the Groupon for 1 microdermabrasion for 29.00. STEAL! I wanted to start off with 1 just in case I didn't have a good experience and didn't want to return. Not the case and will be back for sure buying the package. The ambiance is really cute and quaint. The receptionist was really nice when I called. She was also pretty nice when I got there. I wasn't offered water or tea which I am normally asked at most spas but it wasn't a huge deal to me so it's whatever. I got there a half hour early and was seen 10 min past my appointment. I didn't expect to be seen early and as long as I'm not waiting past 15 min of my assigned appointment, I really can't complain. The esthetician Selene/Selena(can't remember which) was great. She's a really sweet girl who will make conversation with you if you're in the mood to chat. She's currently the only esthetician there which she likes but also feels overwhelmed at times. We just chit chatted throughout the entire session about life and she's such a cool relatable gal. She wasn't judgey about my skin which I am always faced with whenever I get a micro. She offered tips and products WHEN I ASKED which I loved. My face felt super refreshed, clean and I could feel the radiance and fresh glow. Parking is pay to park but there's usually plenty of it down Milwaukee. Good customer service and great pricing that you really can't beat.

5.description: They never answer the phone and when they finally call back it's a day later. The service was OK (microderm)

13.description: I give them 5 stars I found the spa via group on and they had a great deal. I was there today for my first microdermabrasion treatment ever.  I was quite nervous and had lots of questions and concerns.  I spoke to over the phone Claudia the day before my treatment and she  was VERY pleasant and informative. She answered all my questions and assured me I was in good hands, that she had been performing various procedures for over 6 years. The day of I arrived at the spa much more at ease. It was a calming and soothing atmosphere inside. I went with my roommate, we filled out some paper work and was offered coffee or tea. I was 5 degrees outside, ouch! I volunteered my roommate to go first, she had had various procedures done in the past. About 20 mins later it was my turn. Again Claudia explained everything to me before she started, the she began! At first my face was massaged and cleansed, then she tested a small section of the mircoderm on the side of my cheek close to my ear. As I'd been told, it was not unpleasant at all. She increased the strength of the suction, still not unpleasant I dear even say it was rather relaxing, then she proceeded with the treatment. About mid way  she stopped so I could see and feel the different in my skin. Believe me when I say I have never felt my skin feel so silky smooth, it was amazing.  She completed the procedure the applied a warm towel to reintroduce some moisture back into my skin. This was followed by another cleanse and message. All done.My skin felt absolutely amazing and I was already hooked! My skin felt naturally bright and rejuvenated. I have a lot of hyperpigmentation for old and not so old acne scars. I know I will need multiple treatments to see a significant difference in their appearance so I really do want to return to achieve this goal.Claudia is very pleasant and skilled. I would recommend this place to anyone.

11.description: I purchased a 4 for $99 Microdermabrasion Groupon and have had 2 treatments so far. I've had to cancel an appt or 2 due to work but they are accommodating which is something other spas are not. Nice little gem in the center of city chaos. Thankfully there is parking on the street in front, although it's paid, but reasonable at $2 an hour, I usually pay $3 for hour and a half in case time runs over. There's also a Dollar Tree walking distance so it makes my trip to Luxe a 2-fer :) The staff is helpful, knowledgeable, pleasant and personable. I never give 5 stars because I feel any business has room to improve but I will definitely keep going here after my Groupon is complete.

8.description: So I bought a groupon for microdermabrasion, 4 for $99. It was my first time having a microdermabrasion, and it was a very relaxing experience. I had Rosa, she explained everything she was going to do before hand. I loved that she washed her hands IN FRONT OF ME, prior to the procedure! A++ for hygiene! She talked to me, but not like a chatter box, which i appreciated very much, because I really needed a relaxing environmnent even if it was just for a short period of time. She didn't try to sell me anything, but I did ask about what services they offer and she told me about the most popular and gave me a pamphlet with some prices at the end. My face looks slightly brighter, just slightly though. I'm hoping for more noticeable improvement after I use all 4. Face is super smooth/soft and my husband said the black heads on my nose are less noticeable. Already scheduled my next appt!

14.description: I purchased an online deal for a microdermabrasion treatment since it was uber close to my local neighborhood (I'd never heard/seen this place before) and scheduled an appointment online to come in. First off, let me just say, the scheduling was hilarious since I have a very hectic life and as such, the salon was very accomodating and persistent in keeping in touch until we could finally arrange a good day/time. Was very impressed they wanted my business and were willing to work for it, as it were. Having said that, I scheduled an appointment (this was this last Friday) and came in anticipating what I've become accustomed to at other facilities - that being an interrogation over what products I use and why they're horrible and why it's my fault my skin is so awful, etc, etc, etc. I was also not in the greatest of moods the day of my appointment - having had a pretty horrendous day at work so quite honestly, I wasn't sure I could deal with any further mental anguish about my personal appearance. In any case, I was most pleasantly surprised and grateful to find everyone at the spa to be friendly, down-to-earth and 'soothing.' I know that sounds ilke a strange word to use but it couldn't be more accurate. I was immediately and consistently relaxed throughout my appointment during which time, product suggestions weren't forced upon me (I actually had to inquire on my own which was very refreshing) and I wasn't scolded for skin care regime (or lack thereof). I was most satisfied with the results of my visit and have just purchased another deal. I look forward to returning and suggest you guys give this place a go as they have such a meek sincerity about them I find quite rare in this industry.

7.description: So my roommate bought me a deal from livingsocial for the microdermabrasion & a full body swedish massage with the thai bodywrap for my birthday week. I love getting massages so I was pretty excited for that, never had a thai bodywrap or the microdermabrasion so I was overall excited for the whole experience actually,  but I know that sometimes when buying these deals online the places can either be a hit or miss. I read some of the other reviews on Luxe Blue before my appointment but they were not really helpful so I walked in optimistic.First. The receptionist was friendly and attentive but I did find it very classless to have their customers pay before the appointment but no big deal whatever. I started off with the microdermabraion with this extremely sweet and obviously well experienced polish women whom I wish I could remember her name. But she did a great job and started my appointment off nicely ( which is why I did give some stars)Next was time for my massage. ( again wishing I could remember names ) Took my clothes off , laid on the table, Ive had my share of massages so I knew the drill. I really hate to be the person to complain but so many things just started going wrong from that point. It was completely silent in the room which I didnt mind but most spas have relaxation music playing ( which was actually playing in the microdermabrasion room ) but for some reason wasnt in the next room I was in and the only reason it was brought to my attention was because all of the sudden I started only hearing every conversation everyone else in the place was having. The lady had began her massage where I felt uncomfortable for the sole fact that I could feel how uncomfortable she even was for some reason. It was almost like she was nervous to touch me. Number one way to spot a unexperienced masseuse is when they constantly ask you questions. PLEASE do not ask me one more time if i am okay ? or what would i like ? You as a masseuse should know the body I have never had to talk so much on the table. Meanwhile the music was actually broken so people were coming in and out of my room as I was laying on the table still naked under the blanket having people trying to figure out the music situation. Their solution at that point was to just put a speaker in my room where terrible and loud music then began to play right in my ear. After that I just didnt even want to continue laying down. My back way itching me from how light she was touching me, she kept doing the samethings over and over again because everytime something distracted her she would restart, the music was giving me a headache , I could still hear people talking around me. It was my birthday, I did not wanna stick around. Didnt even get to experience whatever the thai bodywrap wouldve consisted of but I was not worried about it. Awkward moment was walking out , everyone apologizing to me a million times , trying to figure out how to refund me now since I of course already paid upfront...... 6 business days later my refund was complete and the receptionist did follow up which I did appreciate. If youre gonna do the microderambraion session I would totally say go for it. As far as a massage goes. Book it somewhere else baby.

3.description: The owner is a very nice guy and knows his stuff. He has a passion for comics and games for sure.  The shop is about a block from my house so I stop by often and we shoot the shit.  He carries all the books I read from Marvel and Image along with DC.  He has a nice selection of games and toys.  I've bought many a birthday gift there.  The shop also has good hours noon til 8pm. Because who is really comic shopping before noon?  I usually stop in with my dog and he's cool with it so that's a major plus.  It's local and the owner is right there. Support Portage Park and buy your comics here!

1.description: Sure, Maximum Distractions is a cozy little hideaway with boxes of back issues and fresh issues on the wall.  Yes, Grant is probably the coolest guy to sit behind a counter in the last dozen years.  My love for the place has to do with its commitment to allowing customers to use the limited space for gaming (be it Magic: The Gathering, Hero Clicks, or D&D).  Great experience.

2.description: LOVE Maximum Distractions.  Need a graphic novel but don't know which to pick up?  The owner, Grant, will give you great suggestions.  Super friendly, lots of comics and board games to choose from, overall great shop to get gifts.  So happy to have them in the neighborhood!

0.description: Great vibes!  Plenty of comics and good tunes!  I'm trying to help the owner get some casual Magic play going on Friday nights.  If that happens this place will be boss!  The chillness would be great for some cards! The owner is super nice!Recommended!

1.description: I go here at least 5 times a month and there is ALWAYS a line. And on many occasions the cashier is chatting away with another employee...usually bad mouthing coworkers and cussing. Just trashy.

2.description: Walgreen prescriptions are 2 1/2 times what Cosco charges and doubles what Target Charges- They do not inform uninsured patients of options.I am not insured for meds and found this out by mistake. What about the elderly person who stops taking medicine because she cannot afford the prices at her neighborhood Walgreens but does not have the ability to shop around. This is so wrong on so many levels. Neighborhood Convenience costs something but should it cost $50.00 more? I don't care what Walgreen charges there customers but shouldn't they at least inform their uninsured customers of lower pricing. We are not talking about Kleenex. I bet Walgreens advise their own families and neighbors to shop somewhere else. Regional Managers are not calling back--"they are visting stores."  Store manager did call me back but bottom line he does not control pricing AND feels no responsibility to inform customers of high prescription prices. The pharmacist at this store feels the same way and has "no idea" what Cosco or Target charges for prescriptions.

0.description: Staff was as courteous as they were knowledgable. I was greeted at the door and throughout the store as I passed by other staff members. The staff that helped me knew where everything was immediately and didn't have to look around for it. I was in and out quickly, everything was great. I wish more businesses ran like this.

1.description: Lisa did my makeup for a wedding I attended back in May. It was my first time being a bridesmaid and I wanted to look awesome. I am someone that wears makeup every single day so I am very picky when it comes to anyone else dolling me up. Lisa did not disappoint. She did a great job listening to what I wanted and making it happen! The airbrush she did felt so light on my face, PERFECT for a summer wedding. My eye makeup was bold and done perfectly. Her lash application was flawless. My makeup held perfectly through the entire night and I felt beautiful. She was so sweet and helpful and I had a truly awesome experience. I have a wedding coming up in August and I hope to have Lisa work her magic once again. Also, she works out of Portage Park which is super convenient for me! I highly recommend the Beauty Squad!!!!

0.description: As a bride-to-be, trying to find a make up artist for my wedding proved to be more challenging than  I thought it would be. After searching through tons of listings, I was so happy I found Beauty Squad Chicago! When it comes to make-up, it simply doesn't get any better! Lisa did my make-up for my wedding - as well as the make-up for two of my bridesmaids - and we all looked absolutely beautiful! Lisa is a total pro and takes the time to really evaluate your skin and ask you questions about your event and what you like before diving in. Her attention to detail really shows. When I've been in other weddings and had my make-up done, I often feel the end result isn't "me." That's not the case with Lisa. You look like yourself - only 100x's better! I especially loved the look of the false lashes and airbrushing - which artfully camouflaged my years of sun abuse. :) In terms of price, you really won't find a better value out there! I searched and searched and called a ton of different make-up artists and companies and Beauty Squad Chicago was the only one who quoted me an affordable price - which included a trial!!! Most places make you pay extra for the trial. Also, if you have three or more people in your party, Beauty Squad will travel to your location for free! We had so much fun drinking mimosas and getting ready in the comfort of my condo the morning of the wedding and I was glad we didn't have to travel to a salon.After following-up with Lisa regarding some products after my wedding, I found out that Beauty Squad also offers make-up tutorials and facials - which I will definitely be taking advantage of as well! If you're looking for someone to do your make-up for a wedding or other special event, definitely give Beauty Squad Chicago a call - I promise you won't be disappointed!!!

58.description: WASSSSUP MY YELPERS!!! Alright lets get right to it. Pizza again people sorry bout that I'm going to to have to branch out and eat different food eventually, but give me a break I lived in Las Vegas the last few years( not exactly a mecca for pizza).Once again suparossa was good ate there many years ago was good then and its good now. Had there french fries they were cooked to perfection(well down and crispy) There sandwiches however are just average nothing special. The prices at suparossa are fairly priced. Its funny because my sister live 30 or 40 steps away but we still have it delivered, sometimes the guy walk over how funny is that. Now I have never ate in there so your on oyur own with that sorry.

56.description: Excellent pizza with amazing spices in the sauce.

29.description: I order from here pretty regularly, always delivery.  So far, the food has been damn good (hence my repeat visits), but there is one issue I've noticed.This only happens when more than one of the same item is ordered (example below)1 stuffed burger with bacon & cheese, med. rare1 stuffed burger with cheese, medium.You get: 1 stuffed burger with bacon & cheese, med. rare1 stuffed burger with bacon, cheese & mushrooms, med. rareNormally, I wouldn't care too much, but when you're allergic to mushrooms, it can get nasty.  Since it only happens when you get two of the same, I'm not exceptionally concerned, I just dodge getting the same thing as anyone else.  But as is, the food is usually good when I order, must be getting lucky judging from the other reviews.

42.description: Well, for years the stuffed and thin pizzas were phenomenal! However, after my last 2 orders I am thinking maybe it's time to say bye-bye to this place. They sent me an antipasto salad instead of an antipasto tray Sunday past. Then on Thursday I ordered this super deal buy 2 sandwiches get 1 free only they sent me the wrong sandwich. At first I didn't mind the antipasto sald but when they sent me the entirely wrong sandwich and it was 2 wrong orders in 1 week I called. I didn't ask for a credit, I simply called to voice my concern. I was treated rudely, called a liar, etc etc not even offered a credit and I felt un-appreciated as a customer. Maybe it's time to call the credit card company and ask for a dispute. I made 2 orders in the same week and I placed previous orders (the man on the phone looked at my history), the least they could have done was treat me politely and just for the inconvenience offer a coupon or something. He didn't even bother, rather insinuated that I was lying. OK, I'll go take my liars $$ somewhere else!! BYE BYE Suparossa!

23.description: Nice ambiance since remodel and outdoor seating option. Ordered a ceasar salad on last visit. They've tried to get fancy with presentation and in my opinion, it hasn't helped the food. The salad was soggy with too much dressing. It consisted of about 6 whole romaine leaves stacked with a parmesan crisp on top. There was a sardine split  in half and laid out on the side as garnish. It was not worth the $8 pricetag and I would not recommend.

47.description: Been ordering from this place since I was a kid in the eighties and everything is good here. Whether its stuffed or pan, thin it don't matter it's all good. I've also tried some of there specialty pizzas like the wise guy yeah!!! There pastas and Italian dishes are great as well, a neighborhood staple

8.description: This review is based on the lack of customer service skills provided by Claudia who took my phone order in addition to a poor attempt at an italian beef sandwich.Claudia had poor skills in taking my order, she should have politely asked me to call back if she couldn't hear me. She repeated everything I said, wrong and then insisted she had repeated it correctly when I proceeded to repeat my order. I got so frustrated I passed the phone on so someone else could finish the ordering. And even he had to let her know he was loud with her because she had things wrong.Italian beef sandwich seriously couldn't even eat it, the meat was just badly seasoned with all the meat piled on half of the bun, fries nothing more than your frozen buy and their coleslaw swimming in mayo...more like a colesauce.Horrible service horrible food, don't intend to ever order from their again! To top it off on the delivery ticket my info was WRONG!! I'm shocked we even got dinner.

31.description: This place was good before the rehab of the restaurant and menu.  Now it is fantastic!  The ambiance is modern with lots of wood with glass accents.  The bar looks comfortable and inviting.  The classic rock music is nice.  Service is good.  The food is absolutely delicious!  Kids menus are available too.  The spare rib is my favorite so far.  The pizza is delicious as is everything else I've tried on the menu.  A must try!

34.description: Do not ever order delivery from here.  Ever.  Unless you are a masochist who enjoys the pain of having to deal with the staff here.  As with other reviewers I have had issues with delivery.  Delivery coming late, delivery missing items, delivery without utensils (apparently this is restaurant policy - how am I supposed to eat my pasta at the office?  Using 2 pens as chopsticks?).  Isn't this what I am PAYING for when you charge for delivery?Food is okay,  portions are big, but honestly it is not worth the hassle.  Get your food from somewhere you won't have to worry about issues with delivery and where you get utensils to eat your food with.

16.description: This is one of the places and I'll definitely not order or even try to!!! Well I honestly don't know if I should blame Grubhub or the place itself. According to my knowledge GRUBHUB is supposed to have recorded or somehow know the restaurants operational hours. Well my family get hungry and decided to try a new place from where we usually order from. It is 1:30am and I decided to place my order at this place which it didn't even had operational hours or a closed. So if you see that it doesn't say anything and it is a new place where you have never order from and don't know their open and close times you assume that it is OPEN! So I placed my almost $70 and waited about 30 minutes until I received about 20-25 mins a notification on my email that my order was received. Right after I received my confirmation I received a call from GRUBHUB at 1:57a.m. saying that they are calling for the order I recently placed and just to say that the delivery guy had left for the night and they didn't have a driver. OK obviously I got upset and told the lady how come they were calling me that late to tell me such thing and that I had to go pick up my food which it was no  biggy after I told her about picking up my food she told me that she was really sorry but the kitchen was closed and they weren't cooking anymore like WT heck!!! First she tells me there is no driver and then she tells me there is no cook!!?!!!! I waited ridiculously 30 mins for someone to call be back and let me know this nonsense! So after all that time WASTED I had to call somewhere else to place an order for my guests! Not even the restaurant called me to apologize for such mistake. It is now 8:50 a.m and they haven't even reimburse my money into my card!!!!! Not cool!!

13.description: SO we order from here kind of often:1) I love the stuffed pizza & quick service! However our last few orders haven't been up to par :( the cost of the meal seems to be different each order- same order each time! The last two stuffed pizzas were soggy and just doughy! The thin crust was ordered "well done/crispy thin crust" - it was a sloppy soggy mess. Seems the quality of the food has changed since the remodel of the restaurant! We dined in a few months ago and as the atmosphere is swanky cool, the food was banquet blah! You're rolling the dice with this place. Feeling disappointed & let down by our neighborhood stand by pizza joint!

11.description: Not the pizza I grew up with. New corporate owners and old recipes are gone. I have given them multiple times in the last year to get their stuffed pizzas right and they have been consistently bad. Too bad. 28 years of excellent stuffed pizza is now gone. The search for a new place begins.

39.description: BEST PIZZA EVER!!!!!!! not only in Chicago, but this is definitely the best pizza in the world. I would consider myself a pizza connoisseur, having traveled and tried the best pizzas in Italy, New York, California, and across the world. I have been a part of a pizza club, pizza tours, and let's just say I LOVE PIZZA! And, this place is the absolute best you can get- the best combination of a great, flavorful sauce, cheesy mozzarella, and a perfect thick crust. THE BEST! I am quite confused by the mixed reviews to be honest, but you can trust me- if you want the best deep-dish Chicago pizza, you can't get a better than this. When I have family come in town, they consistently eat at Biagio's Suparossa Pizza before they come to see me and the rest of the family. The only reason a person would have a negative critique of the pizza would be if they don't like good deep-dish. Otherwise, enjoy and you're welcome for the review. Happy eating! :)

37.description: Disappointed that every year our school has their 8th grade banquet here, but they never give back to our school. The food is average, but I'm just really disappointed that they haven't given back to the community like other establishments have.

0.description: I've been coming to this location for a long time, they deliver to O'Hare so coworkers and I would put in on a pizza from time to time, always arrived hot and delicious.. I live in the Portage Park area now so I've ordered from here more often now and can't really recall a time I wasn't satisfied. There are coupons on their website and on their take out menu so helps to save some money..

38.description: Another good neighborhood spot that I love the food from! Much like another local spot near by that I has to give a poor review this place would get 5 stars if the accuracy of their delivery matched how great the food is! I've dined in several times and never disappoints.  I like the dim atmosphere and the food is top notch. Their thin crust pizza is very under rated in the city but their pastas and traditional Italian dinners are all great.Delivery is a different story, although the last 2-3 times have gotten much better I did have at least half a dozen issues in the past year with accuracy of my orders.  I shouldn't have to drive back to the restaurant to get my full order and then I didn't even get my delivery fee or anything refunded.  Again great food but sometimes their delivery accuracy sucks

51.description: The pizza is gross here. There is another Suparossa a few miles away with PHENOMENAL pizza - I don't understand why THIS Suparossa's pizza is so terrible. it made me sick! The garlic and the sauce on the pizza were so bitter! The Chicken Parm is ok and they have ok salads.

27.description: Delivery order was perfect. They were here quick & the pizza was nice and hot! And delicious! Will definitely be ordering delivery from here again soon!

32.description: Awesome restaurant ! Food was really awesome and the service was very good.

54.description: Just ok, hadn't been here for years, We had gotten carry out menu in our mailbox and decide to call for carry out. the meatballs were not good at all not like i remember having from Suparossa as a kid these tasted like they were frozen then thawed & microwaved. wish when i ate spaghetti & meatballs i would have felt them fond memories from years ago.One good thing was death by chocolate cake wish order 2 of them it so was so good. We might give them one more time to try the pizza but since the pasta was such disappoiment I'm thinking after all these years they let all the food slide.

48.description: We have been happy every time we have ordered from here!  Large portions of pasta at reasonable prices.  Tonight we ordered at 5:00 (on a Saturday night) and had our food by 5:35!  Can't say enough good things.

44.description: Ordered delivery from here one night with and I must say I am surprised I haven't tried this pizza place earlier.  The crust was just perfect to my liking nice and crispy but NOT BURNT!! lol. I ordered it with Ground beef and the ground beef had really good flavor. Overall I am happy with this experience, I even went it to sit down and eat one night, not the most lively place, the music and the decor can use some revamping and the place will be a lot more lively in my opinion. can't wait to try them again soon!

24.description: SO we order from here kind of often:1) I love the stuffed pizza & quick service! However our last few orders haven't been up to par :( the cost of the meal seems to be different each order- same order each time! The last two stuffed pizzas were soggy and just doughy! The thin crust was ordered "well done/crispy thin crust" - it was a sloppy soggy mess. Seems the quality of the food has changed since the remodel of the restaurant! We dined in a few months ago and as the atmosphere is swanky cool, the food was banquet blah! You're rolling the dice with this place. Feeling disappointed & let down by our neighborhood stand by pizza joint!

7.description: They used to have the best wings in the neighborhood, but they recently changed their dressing and it doesn't even taste like bleu cheese anymore.  It tastes like buttermilk dressing and has a nasty aftertaste.  Yuk.  Pinching pennies and losing dollars.  I'll be getting my wing fix elsewhere.

49.description: I have eaten stuffed pizza here a few times and I noticed an irregularity. Not a bad thing. Just...The first time here we got the small stuffed pizza (with garlic) and found surprisingly good since I am picky about my stuffed pizza. However, the second time, we got the large stuffed (also with garlic).... WOW! I have to say it was one of the most, if not the most, delicious stuffed pizzas I have ever had. The sauce, the cheese, and the crust were all superb. So I thought maybe size does matter ;-) So a few weeks later we got the exact same pizza... but it was off. It just didn't taste the same. The crust and the sauce were somehow off. I guess it's not a size issue.That being said... I will definitely eat pizza here again. I just hope it isn't a case of constant inconsistency. But if their worst pizza is still above average; count me in.I almost forgot. We had the "Flaming Hot Boneless Yummies" (not that there's anything wrong with that) and they were great. Actually not that hot but very delicious.As for their other food.... I'll just have to keep on truckin'

40.description: Have been here a few times and I must say nothing about this place wow's me at all.  It's very dull... boring.. the food is honestly not anything to rave about.  It almost feels like a fast food place decorated like an italian restaurant.  the servers are decent, but they look like they really don't want to be there.  I'll eat there if need be.. but I'm not rushing back for any reason.  Plenty of other places to go to.

53.description: really,really great pizza.

30.description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!! Not many have heard of it because its not really in the heart of Chicago, more like the outskirts. But boy this pizza is amazing. Pan or deep dish, their sauce is just amazing. And if you are looking for somewhere romantic to take your spouse, its very lovely inside with free parking across the street!

46.description: Very good and giant takeout dinners.Now that I live in rural America, access to good Italian food is a real treat- even if associated with a small chain of restaurants. On this visit home we hankered for some Italian (oddly it's not easy finding gnocchi around Portage Park). Ordered a number of takeout dinners, they were tremendous! The fridge was full of takeout containers by even the most dedicated eaters among us. The Gnocchi was very nice, good stuffed pizza as well. Looking forward to dining here again.

1.description: I honestly could have had a better (and cheaper) pizza from the frozen section of the grocery store.  It was one of the WORST delivery pizzas I've ever had.  What's more, the "mixed green" salad was 99.9% iceberg with (count 'em!) 2 quarter-sized shreds of radicchio.  Oh, but they threw in 1 campari tomato sliced in half... and maybe 3 cucumber slices.  That salad (most of which I threw away) cost me $6.25.  Also... the money got funny.  I was quoted under $21 on the phone for my un-delicious meal.  When the guy showed up, there was a non-itemized receipt for OVER $23.  When I called to ask about it, they hung up on me.  Hmmm.I still tipped my delivery guy, but I will NEVER, EVER patronize this business again.

55.description: I'm going to start this review by stating that I live four blocks from Suparossa. FOUR BLOCKS.Also want to state that I may be partially biased, because I love me some extra greasy pizza. I've ordered pizza for delivery from Suparossa twice now. The first time I got a large with onions, green peppers, and sausage. Everything was fine. Told delivery would be an hour, delivery was an hour and ten minutes. Let me repeat, FOUR BLOCKS. Pizza was pretty good considering it wasn't as greasy as I typically like. Sausage was tasty, veggies were fresh as pizza veggies can be.The second time I ordered myself a small pizza with black olives, bacon, and ground beef (my favorite.) I'm used to getting ground beef as.... yuno... ground beef. Suparossa has some big 'ol nuggets of ground beef. Ranging in size from large marble, to larger than golf ball but smaller than tennis ball. Kindouv ridiculous. This second time I was also quoted an hour delivery, this time it showed up in 25 minutes. Awesome, now that makes sense since I'm FOUR BLOCKS away. Figured, hell, pizza in 25 minutes? That deserves a hearty tip. Tipped, walk back to feast, opened the box, all of the toppings were smashed to one side. What the hell was he doing, riding a bike with the pizza in his backpack? Who knows. Either way, I spread the toppings out as much as I could, and somehow, only about 60% of the pizza was covered. Got hungry, had to take the pizza out of his backpack and stop to eat some enormous ground beef nuggets to get the energy for the bike ride? Who knows.Too expensive to deal with a fast but jacked up pizza with all the toppings all over the place, and way too close to deal with delivery taking over an hour. Overall, the pizza was pretty good, but too many negatives. Only way I'm eating Suparossa's pizza again is if somebody else is paying.

9.description: Well made a reservation when we got there we didn't see the person who was in charge of sitting us so we sat ourselves,alone with that I had to go outside to get a menu someone left outside on the table. Then we had to wait for another menu.  As soon as we got the menu then here comes are waiter. (Man can we even look at the menu) The drinks were tasty but didn't taste any alcohol. But my pizza was on point. The way of the layout of this restaurant doesn't make sense to me.  Don't know about returning.

26.description: I started ordering from this restaurant about a month ago, most orders were delivery, but one was for pick-up. The delivery is amazingly fast. The food is good some days, not so good other days. I have learned to NEVER order any pizza on weekends. On weekdays the pizza is about a 7-8, on weekends it is a solid 4. The pizza had no flavor whatsoever on a Saturday or Sunday. None. The crust was dry and in desperate need of salt.  Pizza on a Monday or Tuesday is much better, but could still use some salt. I have never in life had to sprinkle salt on my pizza, but it can taste like eating the box it comes in, if you don't. Next time, I would like actual sauce on my pizza, and not little red specks. Thanks!The gnocchi is very good. The portion serves about five people. They will make it without the spinach, or even the tomatoes.The Vesuvio chicken sandwich was excellent the first time. Toe licking good, to be honest, but the second one was prepared totally different, and was not the same sandwich at all.

25.description: I originally posted this months ago but apparently an email from Yelp got past me explaining my last review of this horribly managed establishment was removed because I suggested a competitor. I have removed the competitors information and revised my review as follows: I would give zero stars if it was an option. If you don't mind getting your order screwed up about 40% of the time go ahead and order here. If you like being charged for delivery order here. If you like buy one get one free pizza offers well they told me none are available at the time. Why this negative review. The last time they screwed up my salad dressing it was completely oil, as in 99.99 % oil you could not even smell any vinegar in it. I called in and spoke to the Manager, in typical italian fashing he told me he would send new dressing. I said no thanks because i am tired and this one is already covered in oil. He said next time I order just ask for him and he will take care of it. I agreed and was not worried about him making it up on my next order. When I called on another occasion,  and mentioned the above the girl on the phone said, all I get is $5.00 off. This is less than the cost of the salad that was ruined with oil. This is not the first time, this place has screwed up our order. Another time we ordered the linguine with with clam sauce to find out the plastic lid shattered in small pieces and ended up in the dish its self. Discovered a clear piece in my mouth. This review will stand until I am contacted by someone who has more business ethics. "Take care of the customer and the business will take care of itself" The opposite can also be said. I shared this review on Facebook. Please share it on your Facebook. This place has come to far on its name. Save money and get a better product at any other pizza establishment.

12.description: This review is for delivery only.1) the food was arrived much less than what grub hub estimated.  The entire delivery time frame was approximately 35 minutes, from the time that I ordered to the time that was arrived at the door.2) the food is as good as it gets for somewhere that delivers at 11pm.  Options are dwindling as you know.  If you are super hungry after retail exhaustion (I'm not talking about shopping; I'm referring to dealing with customers for 8 hours), you need to make a choice of selecting the "best" out of all the secondary candidates.  3) the portions are good.  Hubby and I both ordered pasta entrees that come with salad or other choices of yours.  For $28 after tax, delivery fee, tip, and online coupon, you know it's pricy, yet I was able to save a portion of it for dinner tonight.  4) Once again, for a foodie like myself, ordering delivery is the last resort to ease my hunger before my life is over (sorry for the exaggeration).  I only do it every once in awhile, even during winter time.  I would rather walk to get something better than this.Overall, it wasn't a bad experience.  I will keep this place in mind if I ever use delivery again in the near future.

59.description: What a surprise to have been taken to this wonderful, friendly restaurant.  The waitress was a big hit...promptly telling me when I was undecided " What do you have a taste for - we will make it for you! "...The food was incredible and the spicey sauce for pasta was out of this world good.  The whole meal with two appetizers, wine and dessert was under 80 bucks and the service and food was way better than average.  Can't wait to go again.

21.description: Food was okay but ordered through GrubHub and it took an hour and a half at 10 p.m. at night on a Tuesday when the restaurant is less than 15 minutes away. Also, they completely misread my order and put items on it that I specifically asked to be withheld due to allergies. Never ordering from them again!!!

17.description: Stuffed Cheese and Sausage Pizza.  The good news: It's in my top 5 for all of Chicago finest pies.  The Bad news: I cannot stop eating it and I'm going to have to loosen my belt buckle one more notch.

10.description: Do not ever order delivery from here.  Ever.  Unless you are a masochist who enjoys the pain of having to deal with the staff here.  As with other reviewers I have had issues with delivery.  Delivery coming late, delivery missing items, delivery without utensils (apparently this is restaurant policy - how am I supposed to eat my pasta at the office?  Using 2 pens as chopsticks?).  Isn't this what I am PAYING for when you charge for delivery?Food is okay,  portions are big, but honestly it is not worth the hassle.  Get your food from somewhere you won't have to worry about issues with delivery and where you get utensils to eat your food with.

5.description: Delivery guy was nice. But the females on the phone was extremely rude.They've sent wrong order to delivery but ..  Hopelessly, they don't seemed to know how to apologize and tries to solve problem with a manner..instead yells at customer.After dealing w the ladies on the phone, lost a petite of touching the food... postponing it to be tasted until a petite returns.. maybe the next day?  ^^'Oh, and says grub-hub's complete pricing at the end of exit isn't correct pricing that they'll be asking you at the door...so be careful!Two stars are for the delivery guy who looked & sounded like he felt bad..  poor guy.Taste of food... ordered couple items, one was cheese fries - cheese seemed to be old?..some white crumbs almost looked feta cheese.. so we tossed it in garbage after trying to pick good parts. Rest of the  food is in refrigerator until... later.  T.T

3.description: one star only because no stars isn't an option. Ordered 2/3/16 and got three pizzas, they tasted okay, nothing special but around 1-2 am everyone became nauseas and had diarrhea.The woman taking the orders was pretty rude to my wife. I will never ever eat at this place again after being sick for hours that night.

35.description: Celebrated my Birthday there tonight and there deep dish was so good i told the owner SAM it was better then any deep dish in the City he was so pleased he gave me free tiramisu for my birthday he is a very stand up guy i would recommend this place over Giordano's or Lou malnati's any day.

19.description: I used to love this place and it's consistently tasty and generously served dinners. The appetizers were also pretty good especially the rolled eggplant with ricotta. It always came with hearty marinara and with plenty of gooey quality cheese. After not having gone there for several months, I was hanckering for a Chicken Vesuvio and my wife wanted the rollled eggplant. So I went there to place my order since I was in the neighborhood. They told me that it would take 25 mins which I honestly didn't mind since I knew it would be worth it. I sat down and waited patiently for the order. I heard heavy laughter coming from the kitchen with guys joking around causing a ruckus. When I got home, the order was incomplete and the dinners were over cooked. The chicken was tough to chew and the cheese was totally burnt  with barely any marinara sauce for the rolled eggplant. I honestly find it hard to leave a negative review for this place since I truly enjoyed their previous meals, but this time it was  absolutely terrible. I hope this serves as a wake up call and they can get their act together. Instead of playing around in the kitchen they should pay more attention and care to  their orders.

28.description: Well made a reservation when we got there we didn't see the person who was in charge of sitting us so we sat ourselves,alone with that I had to go outside to get a menu someone left outside on the table. Then we had to wait for another menu.  As soon as we got the menu then here comes are waiter. (Man can we even look at the menu) The drinks were tasty but didn't taste any alcohol. But my pizza was on point. The way of the layout of this restaurant doesn't make sense to me.  Don't know about returning.

45.description: Great calamari and martinis.  Pizza A-Ok.  Would recommend to anyone.

33.description: I have been coming here for years my family loved the food and the service i made reservation for Valentine's day for 8 pm I was very surprised to walk in to a new place was a little hurt cuz i use to come to this place for the memory of my dad but I won't say its wasn't beautiful but boy was I unhappy with the food and service. Got there at 8 didn't get my food untill 10 had to ask for my bread 6 times and then I get burnt bread and we all got all our food a different time and my boyfriend and to send his chicken parmesan back cuz it was cold and and the chicken was hard and chuy so we had to share mine cuz by the time the waitress came back we where all done eating and what I think made me more upset is that I never got inconvenience taken off my bill .it would have been nice when I made reservations that I would have gotten a heads up of all the changes especially of the menu .WILL NEVER GO BACK and I will let all my family know to .very very sad

43.description: This location is totally different from the location on Lawrence ave. The pizza quality is totally different. I would suggest you order from the one located on Lawrence Ave. I ordered from here on my way into town expecting the same quality(ingredients, service, etc.) NOT!! It was horrible. The girl on the phone was rude and the pizza tasted like some regular old dive pizza joint. I dont choose Suparossa for mediocre pizza. I challenge you to try the Harwood Heights/Norridge location. It's not much further and it will be worth it Trust me!!

2.description: I ordered delivery through GrubHub. It took about 1.5 hours to come, much later than anticipated. (I live about 3 miles away). I ordered the Tuesday special, Chicken Parmesan. It tasted okay, but there was so much cheese and grease on it, I immediately felt sick after I ate only a little bit of it. Basically, their food is greasy and of terrible quality. Waste of money.

18.description: This is my first review Ever on here. That just shows how bad the food is there.The food taste really old fashion and out dated.I just order a pizza and it really lacks flavor I've tried to get them a chance a few times but this was it.. The sauce sucks not sure how this place is still in business. Won't be going there anymore.

41.description: Bad management.Very rude!Food has gone down fast.Will not order,or go in again.

52.description: I attended a bridal shower here a few months back. Great service. Great space. Easy lot parking. Delicious food! Great banquet area. Family friendly. Would love to come back and try this place out for a regular dinner/lunch.

50.description: The Gorgonzola Chicken Salad is one of the best salads I've ever had. mmmmmm

4.description: I used to like this place a lot.  When I first moved to Portage Park we dined in or ordered from here a lot.  But honestly, since they opened Legno, the quality of their delivery food has just tanked.  And for what you get, the prices are way too high.

6.description: Food was okay but ordered through GrubHub and it took an hour and a half at 10 p.m. at night on a Tuesday when the restaurant is less than 15 minutes away. Also, they completely misread my order and put items on it that I specifically asked to be withheld due to allergies. Never ordering from them again!!!

22.description: This review is for delivery only.1) the food was arrived much less than what grub hub estimated.  The entire delivery time frame was approximately 35 minutes, from the time that I ordered to the time that was arrived at the door.2) the food is as good as it gets for somewhere that delivers at 11pm.  Options are dwindling as you know.  If you are super hungry after retail exhaustion (I'm not talking about shopping; I'm referring to dealing with customers for 8 hours), you need to make a choice of selecting the "best" out of all the secondary candidates.  3) the portions are good.  Hubby and I both ordered pasta entrees that come with salad or other choices of yours.  For $28 after tax, delivery fee, tip, and online coupon, you know it's pricy, yet I was able to save a portion of it for dinner tonight.  4) Once again, for a foodie like myself, ordering delivery is the last resort to ease my hunger before my life is over (sorry for the exaggeration).  I only do it every once in awhile, even during winter time.  I would rather walk to get something better than this.Overall, it wasn't a bad experience.  I will keep this place in mind if I ever use delivery again in the near future.

15.description: Have been here a few times and I must say nothing about this place wow's me at all.  It's very dull... boring.. the food is honestly not anything to rave about.  It almost feels like a fast food place decorated like an italian restaurant.  the servers are decent, but they look like they really don't want to be there.  I'll eat there if need be.. but I'm not rushing back for any reason.  Plenty of other places to go to.

57.description: What happened to the Suparossa I remember as a kid?The only thing worth getting here is pizza. It is ok and eatable although nothing to write home about.The boneless chicken "yummies" are ok as well, but they seem to slather them in cheap high fructose corn syrup laden ridden garbage crap. The dipping sauce is of inferior quality as well.The Italian Beef came dry and tough. The only creature that might eat it and appreciate the Italian Beef is your dog.

20.description: I have been ordering for Suparossa for MANY years, however the food has not been up to par the last few times we have ordered.  Hit or miss on the calamari. I don't know if someone eats 1/2 of the calamari before we get it but it looks like we have only been getting 1/2 of the order as opposed to the full order as in the past.  We usually order quite a bit of food so I am sorry to say that we will be going down the street to Poretta'sfor the next few orders.

36.description: we had a birthdy party for my mother in law and had a  great time and  the staff and food was great. really had a great time would like to thank everyone for making it so special . i would highly recommend this restaurant  will be going back thanks to the staff and owner for being great. nancy

14.description: I started ordering from this restaurant about a month ago, most orders were delivery, but one was for pick-up. The delivery is amazingly fast. The food is good some days, not so good other days. I have learned to NEVER order any pizza on weekends. On weekdays the pizza is about a 7-8, on weekends it is a solid 4. The pizza had no flavor whatsoever on a Saturday or Sunday. None. The crust was dry and in desperate need of salt.  Pizza on a Monday or Tuesday is much better, but could still use some salt. I have never in life had to sprinkle salt on my pizza, but it can taste like eating the box it comes in, if you don't. Next time, I would like actual sauce on my pizza, and not little red specks. Thanks!The gnocchi is very good. The portion serves about five people. They will make it without the spinach, or even the tomatoes.The Vesuvio chicken sandwich was excellent the first time. Toe licking good, to be honest, but the second one was prepared totally different, and was not the same sandwich at all.

1.description: I love combing through resale shops and RPN has a lot of stuff  - furniture, housewares, bedding, books, trinkets and "dustables." Theres a mixture of new and used items and a very helpful and enthusiastic staff.  They hold auctions the first Wednesday of the month.Hours:Monday - Friday   10AM - 8PMSaturday               10AM - 6PMsunday                  11AM - 4PM

2.description: YIKES.... outrageous expensive for furniture. Yes I'll admit some of the furniture pieces are nice. Hutch, Armoire, desk and so on. But no way should a used armoire with chips in it be $400. I did ask what kind of store it is and they said new and used furniture.. It is very clean and organized, easy to walk around.  But if your looking to spend prices equal to new furniture prices... then i say GO TO A store with only new furniture... I mean c'mon seriously.. $900 for a dresser w/mirror ????

0.description: The show room has a nice cross section of used furniture. The prices are fair, but what is great is the Wednesday night auction!The first Wednesday of every month there is an auction, you can get there earlier an see what will be up for bidding. If no else wants what you want you will get it for a steal. Every auction is different but with low buyer fees and free cookies and coffee you should check it out.I have seen everything from vintage toys and comic books to brand new furniture.  Towards the end of the night they have boxed lots that sell for really cheap and are a good shot at getting a bargain.  This is also a great experience if you were ever wondering "where do all these guys at Maxwell street get their stuff?"

3.description: Crazy delicious fresh homemade food in a super comfy DIY atmosphere, all made by people that love what they do.  AND the Mac n cheese is insanely yummy.

1.description: Live a couple blocks from this place and decided to try it for Saturday breakfast. I got one of the breakfast sandwiches and my husband got a breakfast special; we both ordered the bottomless coffee. I thought the food was very good, the service was excellent, and the atmosphere is great. I loved the mismatched furniture; I felt like I was at someone's house and it was very inviting and cozy. We were told to take our time with the check, and I didn't feel rushed at all. After breakfast, I looked through the boutique area and then we went to the other side to order lattes and a package of cookies to go. The lattes were excellent and we both enjoyed the cookies as well. For a business that just opened, I think that Fannie's is wise to have a smaller menu and shortened dining hours as they get their name out in the community. We will definitely return.

2.description: Fannie's is two storefronts, one side being a counter for a small bakery plus coffee, the other side being a cafe with a small area with bags and other craft items for sale.The bakery side makes the same stuff that people have gotten at the smaller location (in the library in Harwood Heights) and at local farmers markets and that is on the whole quite good.The cafe is surprisingly large, the walls kind of a pastel orange, the tables mismatched, not a very typical Chicago place. It felt like something out of a small town. They only have one high chair right now, which was kind of a problem as there were at least five kids there who could have been in one.As for the food... meh. We had a sandwich, eggs with potato pancake, coffee. For some reason they try to have a noon cutoff, breakfast only before noon, lunch only after noon, but with so few items on the menu and a place that leads as a cafe specializing in pastries, that just doesn't make a lot of sense.It's in a good location with no other coffee shop too close, but if you're driving, there are places which focus on coffee or on breakfast in relatively close proximity.We'll still get the cinnamon buns at the farmers markets and if nearby might walk in for coffee but overall given the build up we were disappointed.

9.description: I love this place. I have been here a handful of times now, which I believe a new business should be visited a few times before reviewing. The food is good, baked goods are tasty....but most of all I love the atmosphere. It's so cozy and welcoming and I have brought many a friend here on these cold winter days to have lunch and lounge. I love that they always have events going on as well. We have been to a few. Awesome little neighborhood "spot"!

10.description: This place is fantastic! Strolled in this morning to purchase some cookie trays for Christmas. They were so helpful and the variety to choose from is awesome. Everything tastes scrumptious (especially the potato chip cookies) and the prices are so reasonable for what you get. Besides cookies and scones, they have sandwiches and soup, I can't wait to go back and try these as well. You should definitely check Fannie's out....you won't be disappointed!

4.description: Went on  a slow Saturday afternoon. There were no other patrons but me. While service was friendly it was also SUPER SLOW. I wish I could provide review on the food....I ordered the Zesty turkey sandwich to go. It took at least 15 minutes to put a simple sandwich together. I got home ready to enjoy my "zesty turkey sandwich", took out my sandwich only to find that there was NO TURKEY in my sandwich!!! I almost went back to return it, but it took soooo long to get any service the first time around, I decided it was worth the aggravation!

6.description: I wasn't going to write a review, but after the owner rudely commented on my mother's google review, I feel the need to say something and give my own review. First, I really wanted to like this place. Its in the neighborhood and they have tried to really create a cozy ambiance with a sort of artsy/retro vibe. However, there is much to be desired. I ordered the zesty turkey and a side of mac and cheese. The sandwich is over $6 (if I recall correctly) and only the sandwich comes. No pickle, no side of fruit, nothing. I only ate it and didn't say nothing because it took forever to come in the first place and I was super hungry. The waitress was very nice, but she seemed super shy and unattentive. I didn't want to keep bothering her because she acted like she was scared of people. My bread was super hard and tasted stale. The turkey also tasted old. There were no tomatoes on this sandwich, just a piece of bread. It was basically like the type of sandwich I could have made at home with few days old cold cuts. As for the mac and cheese, the owner claims it is made from high quality cheeses. In my opinion, it tastes like either Velveeta or powered cheese mixed with milk or cream. The mac and cheese was cold and very liquidy. 100 percent, it doesn't taste like it was made with real cheese. I have made home made mac and cheese before. I have also been to restaurants that made very good home made mac and cheese like Priscilla's Ultimate Soul Food cafeteria in Hillside. Yes, they did take the mac and cheese off the bill, but its not right to throw it up to the face's of the customers. Ultimately, I would have been better off going to a diner if I wanted a sandwich. My suggestion to Fannie's is to perhaps invest in a panini maker and/or do something to spice up their sandwiches like maybe use avocado or something. Before I left, I also felt terrible for complaining and I thought that maybe their strength is their baked goods so perhaps, I should try a cupcake. I also needed something sweet as a sort of palate cleanser after eating the stale sandwich until I could get home and brush my teeth. The chocolate cupcake was super dry. Not what I had in mind.

12.description: The food is great. All fresh homemade food and pastries. Great homey atmosphere. Check them out

5.description: The food is great. The coffee is delicious, and it's less expensive than Starbucks. The atmosphere is a lot of fun, too.

11.description: Their backed goods are not that good! I've tried everything . Scones are dry and taste artificial. Muffins taste exactly like scones. Bread was not fresh at all. Chocolate cakecup was dry and icing didn't taste home made. And I was so looking forward to this place.....

8.description: I was pleasantly surprised what this new cafe has to offer. The interior still resembles the pizzeria it used to be in the past, but it got an update within the possibilities of an independent small coffee shop. I loved the flavoured coffee specialties such as the white chocolate raspberry cappuccino and other coffee drinks. They have some pastries on the menu too.Welcome to the neighborhood!

0.description: Rosa J. celebrated the Valentine's/President's Day with a strong commitment to supporting local businesses, just as you were to do so with your spouse or the significant other.  She noticed that a relatively new coffee shop, Fannie's, opened in the northeast end of Portage Park several months ago.I dragged hubby along to check out this spot.  Fannie's is technically a "coffee shop, a "pastry/breakfast joint, and a "boutique" featuring arts and crafts made by local artists and products from local businesses.  I saw the soaps from "Distinct Bath and Body" on W. Irving Park Rd. sold in here.  The entire venue is very homey, which reflects the demographics of the neighborhood, more family-oriented.  Many patrons arrived at Fannie's early for the Sunday AYCE brunch ($15/adult).  Although I didn't have the luxury this morning to stay longer for this feast, I would definitely come back when I have a Sunday off.  Everyone was nice and inviting.  The prices for the coffee, beverages, and pastries are quite reasonable ($2.85/scone; $2.47/12oz. latte, as of 02/14/2016).  The coffee was adequately strong, and the blueberry scone was delicious.  The owner (assuming he was) commented on my Union Jack handbag.  I know it may be a subjective comment, but I think those who are fond of the Union Jack pattern can't be bad people because this pattern is merely awesome!  It's on my route to work (20-minute walk northbound to Jefferson Park Blue Line).  Fannie's is located near the corner of Milwaukee and Montrose, adjacent to the bartending school.

7.description: I am thrilled that Fannies opened up my neighborhood. The owners and staff are fantastic and so friendly and welcoming. I have been a few times now for lunch, as well as to purchase delicious scones, cookies and cinnamon rolls from the bakery. It is homely and quaint and a great addition to the neighborhood. The marble cookies, raspberry and white chocolate scones, and cinnamon roll are the best I have ever had!

3.description: I had high hopes for this place as it is located close to my house and Portage Park needs more restaurants! Walking in I was kindly greeted by a young man working there who took my order. I went in on a Tuesday and wanted to try their meats so I ordered al pastor, pollo and carne asada.  The wait wasn't long and I was entertained by the small chit chat providing by the young man. The meats were all pretty bad which is which I am giving this place two stars.  The carne asada was grey in color and lacked any flavor a steak should have. The al pastor was of the same consistency of ground beef which i've never seen with pork.   Accompanied with the meats were onions and cilantro (some of which were yellow and old) made all the tacos unappealing. The quality of the food could have been because it was dollar taco days (Which is Tuesday and Thursday) but I don't think it was acceptable.  I might try them one more time and order an actually meal, but some advice to the owner - try using better quality meats and fresher ingredients.  This place gets two stars because the young man was so nice and friendly.

1.description: Gave this place two tries, both during dinner. The first time, the waiter sucked. Took too long to see to our table. And we were only the third table there. Tacos are okay. The waiter got my Jarrito flavor wrong. Lime vs. pineapple. The second time around, we had tacos again on taco night. Again, mediocre tacos. But the point of no return was when they served me my beverage. Never get the horchata here. It is absolutely horrible. It's sugar water mixed with instant horchata if there is such a thing. If you don't have real horchata, don't serve it!Thought this might have been a decent addition to the neighborhood, but it is not. Zero stars.

0.description: I went here for dinner. I decided to go for carryout.I had the Burrito Dinner. I chose ground beef.The burrito: The beef had good flavor. The burrito had a bit too much cheese in it. Overall I found it to be good, they may have to tune the balance of ingredients a little.The Rice: It was dry and salty. Maybe it was because it was the evening and had been sitting a while. Please check the rice before serving it. Make sure it's still moist.The Beans: I really liked the beans. The texture was perfect and the flavor was good.The Salad: None, I did not receive any salad ingredients in my carton. Not what the menu says.As for the interior. It was nice. It seemed a little dark in the evening.The people were very nice. I was greeted right when I walked in the door.Bicycle Lanes or Parking:  There are no bicycle lanes on this part of Milwaukee or Montrose. I did not see a nearby bicycle rack, but there were a couple of sign posts you could use. Do NOT use the CTA posts, it is illegal.I will return again to give them another chance.

2.description: The hubby and I decided to check out this new addition to the neighborhood tonight. We were there around 8:00 p.m. and there were 2 other couples eating in. We were greeted at the door and told to sit wherever we liked. There was plenty of seating, so we grabbed one of the 4 tops.The menu was very simple. It's just a paper menu (not sure if this will change in the future) and had the basics covered - tacos, tortas, quesadillas, burritos, carne asada, enchiladas, and a few other items.The waiter, George, introduced himself and brought us some chips with red and green salsas. They were both terrific. In fact, I could have eaten the green salsa with a spoon. Fresh, obviously homemade, not overly spicy, but just perfect.I had the carne asada dinner and the hubby had the 2 taco dinner. Each came with rice and beans, and each was $4.99 (what a steal!).It only took about 10 minutes for our order to come out, and everything was piping hot. My carne asada was super tender, and cooked to perfection. Mexican places sometimes have a habit of overcooking, but not tonight! I tried both of the tacos the hubs had. One was steak, and it was terrific, but I was more surprised by the chorizo taco he had. I don't usually like chorizo because it's so greasy, but this one wasn't at all. It was actually really delicious.The rice and beans were great, and we both (surprisingly) polished off our plates. At the end of the meal, our total with a Coke and 2 full dinners plus tax came to just over $12. WHAT?! I've spent more than that at a fast food place!To sum it up, I'll be back. I'll probably be back a lot. George was very nice, and asked us to please spread the word. I was 100% satisfied (which, if you know me, you know isn't easy to accomplish). On a side note- I checked out the ladies room, and it was VERY clean. It needs some aesthetic work, but it's clean.

5.description: Went in on a Friday night with the wifey, no one greeted us as we figured out that we should seat ourselves. The place was empty. Finally someone came out and yelled across the room that someone will be right with us. A young waitress came over with two cups of water and asked if we'd like something else to drink. We ordered 2 cokes, she comes back with 2 cans and 2 straws. I like drinking from a cup when I sit down to eat so we asked for cups with ice.      She disappeared and returned with 2 cups that were wet with crushed ice. She then gave us 1 menu for us both?? I reached over the next table and grabbed one that was sitting on it. This menu was very sticky! A second waitress came and asked if we were ready to order. I ordered the 2 taco dinner and my wife ordered the flautas dinner. Food came pretty  quick. I received mine first, 2 minutes later my wife gets hers. The waitress then asked if we need anything else. Um, maybe a fork or two??     I picked a piece of steak from my taco and you can tell right away the quality of meat is really cheap. My wife's chicken was very salty (that's coming from a person that cooks salty food herself). The rice we got was obviously  scrapped from the bottom of the pot and the bean, well, were not good. I had to smash them myself! The fork was even bending as I attempted to make my "frijoles".      We left very dissatisfied and with upset stomachs. Never going back. I agree with the other Yelper, this place won't last. Bad food, inexperienced service. A place can not have both bad food and service, Sorry.

6.description: We had dinner here on Friday. The place is nicely appointed with bright tablecloths and very clean. Menu is small, but very reasonably priced. Between myself, my husband and 2 kids we had - a large order of guacamole, enchiladas in red sauce, a torta, a 2 taco dinner and a 3 taco dinner. And soft drinks for the kids. The bill: $39.98! The torta was perfectly griddled and dressed. We loved the chorizo, steak, and chicken tacos. The pork ones were tasty, but not off the trompo. The enchiladas in red sauce were spicy and well seasoned, but not covered in sauce. Guacamole and the table salsa were all excellent. This is tacqueria food with sit down service and at some of the best prices in the neighborhood. Service was efficient and polite. BYO for now, they have applied for a license though.

7.description: This place is so horrible I actually had to create a yelp account just to post this. I was really hoping for a nice Mexican place to open up around this area. Considering La Palaptia is the closet thing to me. But that place is a guaranteed trip to the washroom. (But at least it's tasty)....Anyway... Ordered 2 tacos and a torta from here. First off I've been here 4 times each time to try and get horchata and guess what their favorite saying is "WE DONT HAVE THAT TODAY" and this has been said with salsa too and lime... Really? It's Spanish food for heavens sake .... Second off the girl that works their has no idea what the menu is ... Running around to find a menu to input the prices ? Really? Then lastly my food was horrible ... Most tasteless garbage ever... Barley any meat ... Barley any lettuce .... But beans galore guys !! Smh ... Also I asked for GUACAMOLE ... I get home and what's on my torta a lame slice of avacado... I even asked if it was one or the other ... And my meat was filled with those little hard bits of like cartilage? (you guys know what I'm talking about ) but from this you can basically assume they use the cheapest meat they can find. Waste of money. Waste of time. This placed should of stayed what it was ...I give this place less then a year till those doors are shut..

8.description: This restaurant has amazing food! The guacamole is homemade by grandma and delicious! Some of the best that I have had :) I ordered enchiladas and they were melt in my mouth good. My fiancé ordered steak tacos, they were also very good. I will definitely be back and recommend this place for eat in or take out.

9.description: They need to get there act together, and it would help if the person at the desk had a clue about the menu.  Live within walking distance so decided to pick up dinner.  Very small menu, Ordered the Chili Rellenos and was told they were only available on Tuesday or Wednesday, though it was not noted on the menu.  This was Saturday evening.  Went to my second choice, which was the Chicken Flauta Dinner.  I was overcharged for that and a small order of Guacamole, but that eventually got resolved.  Got home to find instead of the Chicken Flauta's I got an order of really salty, not at all crispy Chicken Fajitas in a watery mix of onion and a few peppers.  The Guacamole was OK, as were the chips.   What is more disappointing then getting the wrong carry out order???

10.description: Went there for lunch today with my son from college. We walked- which was nice to find a place not too far from home. Impressed with the colorful tablecloths and cleanliness. Greeted at the door, and had great service. Food was prepared and served by "Mama". That clinched it for me- delicious! I had the taco special dinner ($4.99!) and my son had the steak burrito (HUGE!) for $7.99. Tell your friends, this one's a keeper.

4.description: The food is great... When they're open.  Every "taco Tuesday" or basically WHENEVER my boyfriend and I try to eat there, they're never open.  Regardless of their posted hours.

3.description: I was a little afraid, but curious before I did this, but there was nothing to be afraid of - it was fabulous!  I'm really glad I did this and will highly recommend it!  They have a variety of costumes and props to choose from and with the make-up and hair styling, I looked and felt like a whole new me!  Thank you to Corinne and Holly for making me feel glamorous and beautiful.  I enjoyed the pampering and the casual comfortable atmosphere - an afternoon well spent.  Thank You Ladies of Your Inner Pinup!

1.description: Pregnancy is an exciting time and finding out I was having Twins I definitely wanted to document this special time. As you can Imagine your body goes through some "massive" changes with twins on board. Corrine and her staff were professional and made me feel comfortable and at ease and most if all Beautiful throughout the shoot. I am so satisfied that I am returning one year later to do my "sexy" I have my body back shoot!

2.description: This was a fantastic experience and I'll have amazing photos to remember this day forever. Corinne coached me on posing and made me feel completely comfortable in front of the camera. Every woman should do this!

0.description: I had so much fun getting my sassy/flirty pinup photos done by Your Inner Pinup Photography! The photographer/makeup artist/hair stylist Corrine was great to work with. She made me feel at ease and confident about myself. Corrine did an excellent job of guiding me through fun poses throughout the shoot.I decided to treat myself and purchase the full package which included a facial micro dermabrasion (an instrument is used to gently sand the skin, removing dead skin), hand paraffin dip (made my skin smooth and to gave it a more radiant look), hairstyling, professional makeup (fake eyelashes included), pose coaching and four retouched digital photos in two outfits!My favorite part about the whole experience was receiving a disc at the end of the session with all of my photos. I then was able to go home and select the photos I wanted retouched. All the photos turned out great and boosted my self-esteem!I enjoyed the experience very much! Overall, you certainly get the whole pin-up feel/look/experience out of your shoot.My recommendation to prepare for your session would be to bring some music that makes you feel good and smile, as well as some cute flirty heels. Also, send Corrine hair ideas you have in mind prior to the session. If you don't have any ideas, no worries. Corrine will help you select a fun pinup hair style! I'll post pictures soon!

3.description: I came to get a hair cut because I desperately needed one. After seeing stellar reviews on Yelp, I called ahead to see what a cost of a haircut/blowdry would be... $35. (I think this is very reasonable.) I was also able to get an appointment the next day. There is also parking behind the building, off the streetMy haircut is terrific, just what I wanted. :o)Very happy, Certainly plan on coming back again.

1.description: Great place to go on saturdays when you can get a pedicure and manicure,all of them speak polish and engllish except for one but its great place! Parking in back and you can park in front but feed the meter, or you get ticket. Make appiontment for saturdays, closed monday and sunday, their prices are good but it might be worth it for you.

0.description: Woke up this morning and decided I needed a cut. Pulled up the Yelp app, and made my call. They took me right away, and I walked over. I was impressed with cleanliness, speed and skill. Price was great. I'll be back.

2.description: I chose to go to House of Hair because of the reviews on Yelp and the location.Super friendly staff, affordable, nice and cozy salon. I just picked out a hairstyle from one of their magazines and the stylist got it right on! I think that's the first time its worked for me. :)I plan to be a regular here. Hooray!

5.description: This place does both women's and men's hair. They accept walk-ins. They have off street parking in the rear off the alley and back door for convenience. The place is always clean and people always super accommodating. Extremely nice and polite  people and they speak Polish and English. Never had a bad haircut here. They do a wonderful job.

6.description: House of Hair is amazing!!I came here based on a friend's recommendation and I am so glad!I had my wedding updo done here in July 2012 and it was just perfect.  It was exactly what I wanted and it looked good all day.  I couldn't have been happier with how the updo turned out and to make matters even better the price was so reasonable.  Three of my bridesmaids also had their updos done here and everyone's hair style turned out fantastic!  I should also mention that my husband (!) came here a week before the wedding to fix a bad hair cut he got at a different salon.  Kinga fixed the haircut and it turned out to be one of the best hair cuts he's ever gotten. Really this is just a great salon where the stylists know their stuff and are still affordable!

7.description: Love this place.  I moved to the neighborhood recently and needed a new place for my hair.  They take walk-ins or appointment.  prices a fair and the work quality is top notch!
