8.description: A friend recommended I go to House of Hair. I am glad I did. The owner is wonderful. The salon is warm and cozy and I felt at home. I wasn't sure what I wanted but Ursula put my comments together and I came out with a great haircut and color. I also had my eyebrowns done. I never had them tinted before and they really came out nice. The pricing is right in line and the quality is excellent. I highly recommend House of Hair. Give them a try. You will be happy you did.

9.description: Absolutely the best haircuts by Ula. She really takes her time to make sure you are happy.

10.description: I have been going to House of Hair for years, there is a reason for it...the place is warm and inviting with great customer service, reasonable prices and a staff that love what they do. I don't always know what to do with my hair, but each and every time Ula does a consultation with me, shows me the options, and talks not only about what will look good but  also about what is good and healthy for my hair. I highly recommend this place, just give it a try once, you will be coming back for years.

4.description: This place is great. I've been three times now. Ursula gives great cuts, and she matched my color perfectly. And today I even got my nails done while I waited for the color to process. Great job on the nails too! I'm perfectly pampered without breaking my budget.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: The writing has quite literally been on the wall. Marty and I have been in and out of salvation shows up and down the delta for the better part of a week. We think our perp is tied to the church - problem is, the chief is so far up Tuttle's hind parts, he's quenching his thirst. In some of Dora's earlier journal entries, she hints at the existence of a "Yellow King". I thought I would dig deeper into this lead - which is how I found myself at the Burger King. Unfortunately the lead went nowhere, but BK's flame broiled cheeseburgers proved to be quite a worthy condolence prize. I was lucky enough to get an order of fries hot out of the fryer - I ate so many I was tempted to put in a missing persons report for my appetite. Unbeknownst to me - there are BK's all over the country. I'll be back for the fish sandwich

1.description: Extremely unhappy for a bk. Wish I could rate nothing. They didn't know how to use coupons ordered 2 small breakfast items . have been waiting in the parking lot for 20 mins. I'm late for work now. Will never come back.

2.description: Burger King is awesome!  Why anyone would choose macdonalds is beyond me. This Burger King was clean, the customer service was very good, food was quick to arrive, and as always, ten times better than Mickey d's. This was my first time to this location! Great job peeps!!!!!

9.description: Clean your washrooms! get my order right. You guys aren't that busy!

10.description: It's Burger King....I mean my standards for fast food are not too high. Just get my order right, be polite, and be quick.Well I have to say that this Burger King does all those things consistently well. They have a strange drive-thru and aren't 24 hours, but if I'm going to eat fast food-this is where I'm likely to go.

4.description: Horrible service. The girl at drive thru rude and nasty. French fries ice cold and dry. I hate being treated so badly. Will reconsider another visit if service is improved. That girl was so nasty i think she hates her job. (Large size with a smart mouth)

6.description: It's a fast food joint.  All I expect is friendly service, warm food and for it to come out at a reasonable time.  I got all that (2min wait - normal).  Good enough for 4 stars.

12.description: One of the best Bk's in Chicago. One of the few I've gone too that doesn't screw your order up or make you wait 10 minutes for your order. Also not a dumb staff like some I've gone to.

5.description: My kids and I stopped in here a couple months ago to grab a bite to eat mind you that I am aware I am eating at a fast good place not a 5 star restaurant but this place is so filthy we ordered our food and went to sit down I went to grab a highchair for my son and was in shock on how dirty it was it looked like it just came out a garbage can! The seats tables and some rails were just gross we left and ate in our car. I also noticed one of the workers had there kid sitting at a table by himself while she was working. All around poor management Anyhow my family and I have not ate Burger  King since and probably never will!

13.description: I had the worst experience that I have had to date at a fast food restaurant at this location.  DO NOT EAT AT THIS BURGER KING! I REPEAT, AVOID THIS ESTABLISHMENT AT ALL COSTS!  Christmas Eve all I wanted was a whopper, so I decided to walk to the Burger King 4 blocks from my house.  The dining room was closed, and I tried to walk through the drive-through, because I had got there and been craving a whopper all day. After the woman would not talk to me at the microphone, I walked up to the window, and she said I needed a car.  I walked back and got my car.  After getting there, there was suddenly a line, and I was about five deep.  Finally they get to me, at 2:20 p.m.   the woman looked out the window saw it was me , and told me that they were closed, moments after they had taken the last order.  Looking in the window, I saw three workers laughing.  Looking, out and laughing at me.  I walked up to the window, and asked to speak with the management.  To my surprise, one of the young men sitting laughing turned out to be the manager, who may have been at most 21 years old.  I pleaded to get a whopper on Christmas Eve, to do a favor in the spirit of the season, and I was met with mockery and insults.  I then said that I didn't know why he was being such a jerk on Christmas Eve.  My comment was taken as offensive, as the manager looked visibly angry, and called some of his friends from the back to come up and threaten me.  They then proceded to curse me out, and someone from a nearby car even approached me outside, one of their friends, and asked if I had a problem.  He said that he didnt "get down like these motherf*****s", and that he had something in his trunk for me, if I continued to cause trouble for his friend.  I have lived in this neighborhood for 18 years, and am truly saddened to see "my" Burger King go down the drain to low-lifes.  Clearly Burger King is having trouble hiring good, well mannered workers.  I guess the fact that I stood my ground was the problem.  I truly hope that this Burger King is closed, I will never go there again, and I would suspect the food that came out of that kitchen any day of the week.

11.description: What is 3 stars anyways? Average? Isn't that what Mc. Donald's and Burger King are anyways.... I've been to this one.. only through drive through and they've suited me well. :) No complaints.*side random note: one time we were going through the drive through and a bunny rabbit was hiding in the tree next to the drive through window... cute little fucker. :)

8.description: Worst Burger King I've been to!  It's Burger King, isn't it all supposed to be pretty easy and "same".  The wait for food for about 10 minutes here, the fries were disgusting (which is the only reason I'd ever go to Burger King) and the guy taking our order was incredibly confused.  I will be staying away.

0.description: this burger king was really good friendly and food was really good.me and wife eat there.

7.description: I'm so glad they recently remodeled this place. It was a minor pain in the ass to even walk in. Twice I've tried to enter by pushing on the pull-only exit door (yes, I'm a complete idiot). Well, those days are gone with the remodel. (About time!)This BK location comes in handy when I am craving a flame broiled whopper that must be satisfied immediately. Its service and dining area is like your typical neighborhood BK which is OK. It is a quick walk from me. Bonus! It's nice to know it's right there when I need it. Now if it was only open 24 hours...

58.description: Love this place, became an instant fan. For fast food, it's really good, and best of all, it's super affordable. With everything getting so pricey these days, you can still walk in here and get a meal for like $5. I love the crowd who comes here, it feels so Chicago, everyone talks and acts all funny,  I would recommend anyone coming into Chicago, if you got time make the trip! Highlights are gyros and hot dogs that come with sauerkraut.

56.description: Just what you would hope for.  Great prices too.

29.description: Been going to Jeff's for decades! The hot dogs are the best (I like 'em with mustard, relish, tomato and kraut!). The gyros plate is very good as well....not to mention the Pita Taco, cheese fries, etc. Service is fast .... friendly....and the cost won't break the bank. Go to Six Corners for the entertainment/culture (Filament Theatre, Portage Theater, Inside Out Art Studio, National Veterans Art Museum) and then go to Jeff's for great hot dogs!!!

42.description: Super fast, friendly and cheap. I got two italian beef combos, hot peppers and two cups of cheese for under $15. But the beef was super nasty. Thick, fatty, and the taste wasn't good at all. Gross! I didn't eat the rest of the day. Maybe just a bad experience but I know where not to go for italian beef.

23.description: This is my favorite place on the NW side for a Franceezie as well as their Gyro combo. I've been coming here for 20 years.Everything is good.Enjoy

47.description: Ummm delicious double cheese burger! And they have the best vanilla melts I've ever had.

8.description: I love everything on the menu, which I think I've had. Lol Fresh food and great service!!

31.description: I love this place, and have since I was a kid!! Nothing has changed, thankfully, and it's always on my 'must eat' list when I come home on visits.

34.description: I just moved in to a building directly behind this place.  The fries are thin and perfectly cooked the cheese sauce is delicious ( not too salty).  The burgers are so juicy it's almost obscene ( my fiancé loves to drench his fries in the drippins).  I usually get the grilled cheese, but the menu us HUGE!  The Gyros are pretty much the best I've ever had.  The staff is pretty cool, too and you can tell they really enjoy what they do.  Bottom line:  I will be gaining 10 pounds very soon.

16.description: Stumbled in here for a Chicago style dog after an interview.  I had a craving.   It's hot dogs.  Burgers, gyros, the usual.  But these guys are quality people with friendly attitudes.  Cheap prices, fast, hospitable service, what more can you ask for?!

13.description: Had the polish, nothing special that every other hot dog joint doesn't by from the same supplier. The bread i had with the polish didn't seem that fresh so over all would i go back, probably not wasn't that impressed and the parking is horrible.

11.description: This is, by far, the best hot dog place on the northwest side of the city (& probably in the city too). I've been coming to Jeff's Red Hots since I was a kid. My mother has been coming to Jeff's Red Hots since she was a kid & this is my daughter's absolute favorite place for hot dogs. Some of my favorite items include: Hot dogs, Chili dogs, Polish, Gyros, Burgers & Grilled chicken on a pita, Tamale boat, etc. I've never had anything bad from here or something that I didn't like. The employees are all extremely friendly & welcoming. If you go around lunch time, the place is always packed. This is just a really great neighborhood place.

39.description: I love this place..... probably a little too much :)They do everything well at Jeff's; Gyros, Dogs, Burgers, Italian Beef- it's all delicious!The prices here a pretty darn good for what you get (including the enormous pile of fries they give you) and the staff is always friendly.

37.description: I probably eat here once a week, great local hot dog stand with all the standards. Just Remember it is cash only.

0.description: Best cheesy beef in the city. Get the sweet and hot peppers combo and have that bad boy dipped.

38.description: Honestly, I haven't eaten here in the past 15 years easy... And I'll be damned. I walked in last week and theres Jeff himself still running sh%$ behind the counter. I don't think he remembered me though because as I stated I haven't been there in forever. But they were just as busy as I remember and the food was great! Thanks Jeff!

51.description: Very friendly staff. Very speedy service. Very low prices. The fries are so good, and they don't skimp on the order size.

27.description: Delicious, cheap, and fufilling. Chicago dog with kraut and some fries ALL FOR $2.90? SOLD. Food was quick to be made and very affordable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Bring cash for it is cash only, unless you wanna pay that ATM fee to use the one in store. Hot dog was astounding, really loved the addition of kraut to mine. I know that it may vary from the norm but hey, tasted delicious and thats all that matters. The french fries that came with them I would describe as shoestringish? Thin and crispy. Lacked salt but you could add that yourself. Have yet to try the Italian beef and gyros but does seem very promising and will be returning to give them a try.

32.description: Burger/fries were ok, Chicago dog was ok+. Overall, decent food at a fair price if you're craving a quick burger or dog.

54.description: Food is awesome. Staff is friendly. Love their customized shakes.

48.description: Childhood memories here have me coming back all the time, Same faces here so.ce I was a kid. Super nice! Great hot dogs, great gyros and very fast and cheap. Also the breakfast is very good!  It's a big winner! Only down side is that its closed on Sundays.

44.description: Great childhood memories!! Amazing food! They should really franchise this restaurant. Amazing and ORIGINAL Chicago Style Cheeseburgers and Hotdogs!! Oh my god the cheeseburgers with everything on them are to diiie for! You have to try them.Jeanette

24.description: Very good spot in the Old Irving neighborhood, been around since 1978. Good food for good price, two people eat double cheeseburger with fries and drink, and Gyro with fries and drink... $14.54!!!??? Hard to beat these days. Good job to everyone at Jeff's.

7.description: This is my favorite place on the NW side for a Franceezie as well as their Gyro combo. I've been coming here for 20 years.Everything is good.Enjoy

49.description: I've been eating at Jeff's since i was a kid.  This place is amazing.  Best greasy spoon on the north side.  Prices are great and food is amazing.  The fries taste like McDonalds fries.  Philly steak is awesome and Italian beef and Gyros are great.  Vienna beef hot dogs are good as well.

40.description: the food is great!! customer service is on point everytime wanna know there secret recipe?! they dont wear sanitized gloves/hair nets when preparing food, and they only accept cash lol

53.description: Beef sandwich still good after all these years. Love this place!

30.description: Really nice guys working there, and the food is awesome! One of my best places to get some food

46.description: Great Chicago hotdog place. The guys are so nice, and the food--great! They have a train that runs around near the ceiling. It's not always on--but whenever my kids go there with me the guys fire it up. The kids love it!The staff knows their customers by name and warmly welcomes newcomers. Great neighborhood place. Bring cash and a big appetite!

1.description: Jeff's Red Hots is a Portage Park represent.  It's located on Cicero, near the Six Corner.  Based on their stellar Yelp rating, I know many see Jeff's as an old friend, part of the family, and their childhood memory.  This evening was my first time visiting Jeff's Red Hots.  Although Jeff's didn't stimulate nostalgia, it could be on my "dog-joint" rotation when I'm on the go in the city.  Having a great credit history doesn't get you a hot dog meal here at Jeff's, so bring some cash or use their ATM onsite if you're willing to pay for the transaction surcharge.  Hubby and I had the two (2) dog combo (fries were included) and one (1) fountain drink, for $11.  I had to say that they weren't the best I've ever had, yet they were a solid B plus in my book.  For something that tasted better than my college Genetics exam, it certainly has made a passing grade.I browsed through Jeff's menu as I was finishing up my food; it appeared to be quite extensive.  Other than the standard Chicago street fare, I saw spinach puffs, spaghetti with meatballs, and breakfast items as well.  I can see myself come back here, try other items, and hope at least one (1) thing can impress me and turn myself into a regular since I will soon be residing in Portage Park.

55.description: The service is great. The food is great. You will not be disappointed in whatever you order. My favorites are Italian Beef and Chicago Dog.

9.description: Great burgers, better gyros, BEST fries!

26.description: Great neighborhood hot dog joint. I have tried various foods besides their dog and have not been disappointed. Prices are good too.

25.description: I have only had the shot Dogs but a great deal for $3. You get a ton of fries always quick !

12.description: Fresh food great service , always have had a great experience with owner , workers. Food always fresh great Gyros ! Best hot dogs , fries ! Great burgers too . Never disappointed

59.description: I just moved into to the neighborhood, and was surprise when i hit upon this hot dog  place. were else can you get a Double cheeseburger, fries and a coke for 5.99, Gyro,or Italianbeef, and get this for 45.cent more you can up grade your pop to a milk shake. I also love that you can have all the vegies you want" on your food and they will grill your onion for you Wow

21.description: My favorite after 8 pm spot. Love this place, been going for years. Staff is awesome cocky, arrogant all in fun. One of the few fast food spots in the neighborhood my kids will eat at without a complaint. Forever a customer..................

17.description: Don't really get what's the hype. I'm guessing because it's been around for a while?? Chicken sandwich was ok, just a frozen patty warmed up lol cheese fries were ok. I love cheese fries so I ate them but I had better. My sister said her hotdog was alright. I mean, this place is OK for a quick bite. If you want a good chicken sandwich visit outdoor grill (Milwaukee and Pulaski), they have fresh chicken.

10.description: Good burger and dog. Love that they garnish the way I do at home; Chicago style with sauerkraut. FYI: cash only but there's an ATM inside so never an inconvenience. Reasonable prices for good local eats.

5.description: We love the polish and the tamales Man what a great meal I sure wish they had something like this in Florida oh well I guess Chicago is still number one

3.description: Delicious, cheap, and fufilling. Chicago dog with kraut and some fries ALL FOR $2.90? SOLD. Food was quick to be made and very affordable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Bring cash for it is cash only, unless you wanna pay that ATM fee to use the one in store. Hot dog was astounding, really loved the addition of kraut to mine. I know that it may vary from the norm but hey, tasted delicious and thats all that matters. The french fries that came with them I would describe as shoestringish? Thin and crispy. Lacked salt but you could add that yourself. Have yet to try the Italian beef and gyros but does seem very promising and will be returning to give them a try.

35.description: I've been in Chicago for over two years and only just tried an Italian beef ( I know, I know). Unfortunately, my first amazing experience with that sandwich was not here. When I went to Jeff's Red Hots to recreate the experience ( because this is much more convenient to my place), I was disappointed to find a dingy space filled with grumpy employees.I ordered an Italian beef ( which was ok, but not as good as the one I tried at Outdoor Grill on Milwaukee) and two tamales. For almost 2 bucks a pop for the tamales, I was expecting something at least palatable. Instead I got a teeny, tiny prepackaged , misshapen atrocity. It was so mushy it was pretty much inedible and despite having a "beef" filling, the only flavor was the overwhelming taste of mushed cornmeal.Perhaps their other items made in-house are better, but I doubt I will be back to try it.

19.description: Great neighborhood hot dog joint. I have tried various foods besides their dog and have not been disappointed. Prices are good too.

28.description: Love this place! Eat there near weekly! Have had almost every variety of food available there and nothing has turned me away yet. Steve the owner is Awesome and so is his team. When you arrive they remember you from prior visits, joke around with you and make the whole visit a great experience. They were recently listed in Chicago Mag for their Hot Dogs and have the best price around on them. If you have not visited this spot yet, your missing out on great food and a great time.

45.description: Good Place! Staff is very nice and the hot dogs are great.. Nice twist with sauerkraut! Prices fair and parking lot.. Would definitely stop again! gdd

33.description: Excellent choice for your favourite Chicago treats!  Burgers, dogs, polish, gyros, you name it!  It's good here!  To top it off they have excellent thin fries.  Burgers are char grilled, gyros meat is toasted on the grill, love these touches!  It's what makes the place special!

43.description: Jeff's Red Hot's has amazing hamburgers, hotdogs and gyros. They are freshly cooked and prepared in front of you when you order. Make sure to put everything on the burger. They also make true authentic Chicago Style hotdogs. Delicious. One down side is this place only takes CASH! So make sure to have some cash before going. If you forget, you will be charged a ATM fee since there is an ATM in the restaurant. Best hidden secret in Chicago. Everyone should try this place.

2.description: It doesn't matter how many times I eat here I never get tired of their Vienna beef hot dog w/sauerkraut.  The Vienna beef hot dog cooked in hot water with the perfect snap of the hot dog casing as you bite into it coupled w/sauerkraut delicious.  Jeff's Red Hots also has the perfect fries cut thin, salted and fried to perfection every time.  There's nothing fancy just perfect F-in fries every time.  No matter how many places I have eaten at I always find my way back here for the fries & hot dogs

18.description: Wonderful place. Been coming here for over 10 years and it never seems to disappoint with very cheap prices. I absolutely love their double cheese burgers and hot dogs. Great service and very friendly .

41.description: Very hard to beat. Chicago food at its Finest. Everything here tastes Good. Period. Gyros, Burgers, Beef. Really great spot that has been here forever. Always good service and good eating. Very reasonable prices. Cash only.

52.description: Heaven includes their Polish with cheese and fries with cheese. Heart attack waiting to happen, and completely worth it. There's a reason they give you the fries with a plastic fork stuck into the top. You need it to eat it, and it's just.... divinity on a bun/in a paperboard basket. Was there late at night, craving a hot dog and wanting to see what they had. WOW. GOOD. And they have parking, which is not often available in that area. Nice people running the place, and wow, what a mouth trip. No wonder they've been around for more than 40 years. Prices are good.

50.description: A HotDog, Fries, Drink, and a Patty Melt including tax for $6.50 !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Did I just go back in time cuz I don't recall owning a Delorean, holy shi...  I'll be back for sure.

4.description: Came here after shopping in the area, and so glad we did! Hot dog with a plentiful amount of fries for $2.90?? Can't beat it!! They have an extensive menu that looks awesome as well. Food is fresh and tasty. I love hole in the wall places and this one is worth the stop! I will be back. Cash only but they do have an ATM inside!

6.description: Ok why 4 stars for an average fast food restaurant? Simple. . They do things right. Hamburger well done? You got it. Extra relish on that hotdog? ? No problem. It's nice to get what you ask for and be served with a smile. I especially like the gyros ... they slice the meat thin and layer on the pita it's juicy,  flavorful and topped with a good serving of the cucumber sauce (l'm getting hungry just writing this review). I've eaten there several times over the years and I have never been disappointed. I would recommend this restaurant.

22.description: Stumbled in here for a Chicago style dog after an interview.  I had a craving.   It's hot dogs.  Burgers, gyros, the usual.  But these guys are quality people with friendly attitudes.  Cheap prices, fast, hospitable service, what more can you ask for?!

15.description: I've been in Chicago for over two years and only just tried an Italian beef ( I know, I know). Unfortunately, my first amazing experience with that sandwich was not here. When I went to Jeff's Red Hots to recreate the experience ( because this is much more convenient to my place), I was disappointed to find a dingy space filled with grumpy employees.I ordered an Italian beef ( which was ok, but not as good as the one I tried at Outdoor Grill on Milwaukee) and two tamales. For almost 2 bucks a pop for the tamales, I was expecting something at least palatable. Instead I got a teeny, tiny prepackaged , misshapen atrocity. It was so mushy it was pretty much inedible and despite having a "beef" filling, the only flavor was the overwhelming taste of mushed cornmeal.Perhaps their other items made in-house are better, but I doubt I will be back to try it.

57.description: I can only review their Polish Sausage. My wife and I go here about once a month and the only thing we ever get is the Polish with the great 'thin' crispy fries. Fantastic!!! If the other items are as good as the Polish.....well.......then this has to be one of the best places in the city!! Two Polish with fries and two drinks is about 11 bucks. Excellent choice!

20.description: I've been going here for 10 years and the food is still amazing. It's low priced and filling. The owner is very friendly and the service is quick. Don't go during busy times because the line will be out the door lol

36.description: The food is satisfying.  Big proportions.  Quick and filling.  Everything you want is there.

14.description: That place has the best italian beef in the city. I work few blocks down and at least once a week my whole company orders from them. Higly recommended

12.description: One night I had taste for Chinese food and since this was so close to home and also cheap!  I had to try it and see what this little spot was about. The good, ordered a sesame chicken which was delicious, the mongolian beef delicious, the amazingly delicious crab rangoon, and a mediocre egg rolls and a smoothie that too was mediocre no tapioca that they don't have very disappointing cause I was looking forward to it! Charging for the hot sauce past e was a little to much excessive. But I will be back for more good tasting food that is very close to home.

7.description: Rudest phone service from ANY place I've ever called to order for pickup/delivery. Had to call 3 times just to finalize an order. Before I even get to finish the order- all I get is "Ok" and click- I was hung up on. I guess we will find out if the food is worth the rude service over the phone. From what I can gather, they will never get my business again.

20.description: The best chinese take -out in the city !!Portions are huge and you can order lunch specials  all day from the lunch menu for around $4 ..which include entree ,egg roll and rice .Try the beef fried rice ,Huge chunks of juicy beef and rice is always cooked perfectly .

19.description: If they would like to give me more packettes of sweet and sour sauce and soy sauce ( NOT TWO OF EACH FOR TWO PEOPLE) I would return.... The location at Milwaukee/Central is 100 times better.... I've been here a handful of times and due to the stinginess and retardation on the staff's behalf, I either make the trip to the Central location or order from China Chef on Belmont by the Tony's....

1.description: Mixed feelings about this place, sometimes its good and others its not. They are really really rude and to add to comment below there was a hair in the bag where my food was at I told the man and he just took it out. He didn't apologize or make an effort to apologize or correct it. I am trying to find another place for chinese take out but none seem to be close enough. I wouldn't bother going out of my way for this spot.

2.description: I live 2 min from here but I will never return. After not one but two horrible experiences with a very rude and hard to deal with man. Both on the phone and in person he is very rude. The food is just mediocre so trust me and go to one of the thousands of other Chinese places in the city.

9.description: Alright... I'm doing it, writing "one of those reviews." I was unhappy, I ordered Beef Lo Mein, because I love the stuff... They didn't use Lo Mein noodles... thin tough noodles are NOT LO MEIN. Naturally I called and complained (normally, I wouldn't but, I REALLY wanted Lo Mein) and it went absolutely nowhere, which is where I expected it to go... Normally their stuff is okay, but not when I want something really simple. Don't ever order Lo Mein from these guys if you really want Lo Mein... because you won't get it, you'll end up with crappy noodles and delicious "other stuff.".... thank god for SRIRACHA! NAPALM THE JUNGLE!

6.description: Well me an my family had a taste for Chinese food and this is close to home it pretty good for Chinese food and they give a lot of food for the price and the convince of ordering online and just go an pick up is also a plus or you can have it delivered but I have to say it taste good it not greasy or oily  at all

18.description: The best chinese take -out in the city !!Portions are huge and you can order lunch specials  all day from the lunch menu for around $4 ..which include entree ,egg roll and rice .Try the beef fried rice ,Huge chunks of juicy beef and rice is always cooked perfectly .

10.description: I do not understand why this place is being touted as the best chinese takeout in the city.  Not. Even. Close.The food was sub par, even for a cheap, greasy, chinese takeout place.  Based on the reviews, we ordered the crab rangoon, mongolian beef, egg rolls and general tso's chicken.The crab rangoon was flavorless, although there was a lot of filling.  It also tasted like it was overly fried...more so than usual.  The eggrolls had a funky aftertaste, which even the duck sauce could not fully drown out.  The mongolian beef tasted really processed and far oversauced.  I guess the general tso's was the best out of all the others.Totally mediocre, if not worse.Also, the delivery took over an hour.  Considering we live a mile and a half, that's kind of ridiculous.I'll be trying another place next time.

13.description: Okay I just found this place and I love it. I would only buy chinese food from the south side of town or in Palatine, IL when I'm out visiting friends. But this place is here right under my nose, and I've missed it for ten years. But no more I just order two time this week, because the food is so good. The Mongolian Beef is OFF THE CHAIN!! Oh and the price is right. The amount of food they give you is is enough for me to have lunch for the next day.

16.description: Pretty standard, good. Get's the job done if you're in the mood for typical, inexpensive quick-service American-Chinese food, a la lunch special. No digestion difficulties afterward. Nothing worth complaining about, or really praising for that matter.

17.description: julie is right.best chinese takeout/delivery i've had in chicago. my family orders here so much they have 3 credit cards on file LOL. i usually get one of their lunch specials (i.e. general tso chicken, sesame chicken, orbeef chow fun) and an appetizer (chicken wings, crab rangoon, or pot stickers). they give you huge portions for the money you pay them. the food is tasty and not too greasy.the delivery is stifling fast, hence the food is always hot and ready to eat. haha the old man that delivers is really cool, because he talks about random things (i.e. the weather). this is as good as takeout will ever get.

15.description: The food is so-so and the guy at the counter is rude. I go there a lot when time is tight since it is just around the corner, but it isn't very good. Everything tastes the same. The guy behind the counter doesn't like to give extra hot mustard for their bland egg rolls.

0.description: It was okay. I walked over here from my house after I found out another neighborhood place was closed today. I got some crab rangoon and a small orange chicken and white rice. The orange chicken was good, though not very citrusy. I do admit that for 5.55 I got an incredibly large portion.I was a little disappointed that the rice container wasn't filled to the top like at other places, but the rice was an admittedly better texture. Most places I can almost tell the rice is getting hard as I'm eating it and this wasn't the case here.I would have given this place more stars if the crab rangoon tasted better. I felt like it could have used more cream cheese but that's just a personal preference.Otherwise the place was very clean (I sat in), the food came out incredibly quickly and was very very hot. Good experience.

5.description: For the super cheap lunch special price you get a lot of food which usually is enough for good 2 people. Of course the food is little greasy and not the best Chinese food but for the price of fast food it is really good. It takes them like 15 mins for carry out.

11.description: finally a Chinese place that doesn't use salt as a cover up for their dishes. The place is relatively small but huge on flavor. I;ts s convenient place to stop by for lunch during work and theres always parking.

8.description: Of all the Chinese takeout places I've experienced, Chinese Kitchen is one of the good ones...so far.  I would've given this place 3.5 Stars, but since we can't, I'll just round up because of the good food I've had here.  Recently, we've tried their Mongolian Beef, Shrimp Fried Rice, and Beef Chow Fun.  All dished were good, not the best, but good.  What I like particularly of this establishment is that their various Combo Meals for lunch are also available for dinner, at the same price.  That makes my tummy and wallet very happy!Overall, good food, okay service, good prices.

3.description: I have mixed emotions about this place, I live right by there and get the food often and it's pretty decent, but they are just so unbelievably rude every time I go that I swear I'll never go back. The guy at the counter, who I am assuming is the owner because he's always there, literally makes you feel like he hates you for buying food from him. On second thought, my emotions aren't mixed, this place sucks.

14.description: My family and I order from here a couple times per month. We enjoy the beef on a stick, chicken on a stick, pot stickers, and crab rangoon. The entrees are good as well. I wouldn't call it the best in the city, like some others (just my opinion), but it's good, inexpensive, and fast delivery.

4.description: Please be careful when you eat at this restaurant.  I was there August 28, 2014 and as I was waiting for my food I seen a ROACH. I told the owner and he grabbed it with the rag that was used to clean there tables.  I asked for a refund and he started telling in his language.  He was extremely upset because I asked for a refund.  Please eat at your discretion.

0.description: An open love letter to AJ Wright: Oh, AJ Wright, you had me at Heeeeeeey (not hello, as that would be too formal for a deliciously ghetto fabulous store like you.) However, it seems our relationship is coming to an end. Why, oh why, did your owner TJ Maxx open this brand new store, only to announce they will be shutting down the Chicagoland locations in February? I will miss you. I will miss the fabulous, ridiculous and over-the-top shoes I bought from you and the "one of" bargain bin finds like mugs, picture frames and housewares. I will not miss your messy racks, crowded aisles and screaming children, but hey -sometimes personal sacrifices need to be made in the name of high fashion. Even though it hurts me so, I may see you a few more times before our final goodbye. After all, everything is now 25% off. -A grand farewell gesture to all of your fans and loved ones. I love you, A.J. Wright...I hope someday, we will meet again in the afterlife -if you need to find me through the mist and clouds, look for the 5'9 girl teetering on 4 inch studded Gaga-esque heels. With Love, Jennifer Q.

56.description: I noticed this place a couple of months ago, while driving by. I always had it in the back of my head to try it.I decided to go for lunch. I had the two hot dogs with fries deal.The hot dog was cooked just right. It was fresh, sometimes hot dog stands let the dogs sit in the water too long and they get mushy. This wasn't the case here. The fries are really good. They are the fresh cut type, but with a little more flavor than most fresh cut fries. It was a generous amount of fries, which is very good.The meal was a very good value.The place was very clean and the people were friendly.I will be returning to try some of the other food!

29.description: Portillos has nothing on their hot dogs.

42.description: Well, I'm not sure whether or not their chickens come from the center of the Earth, but they are JYNORMOUS!  Everything from the chicken sandwich (bun looks like a top hat) to the tenders (stacked like a 2 story log cabin) and the chicken topped Greek salad,(with a lid that needs to get sat on to fully close) are seasoned just right and moist like...well moist.  The bag of fries which comes with every meal are hand cut and weigh nearly a pound.  And you can splurge for that cup of creamy heart stopping cheese cause everything is fairly priced.  No, call it cheap.  A double cheeseburger weighing in at just under a ton. with fries and a savory cup of cheese...7 bucks out the door.  For real!  Split it into quarters and feed a family of 4. How do they do?  Everything I've had there has been great.  No truffle oil or creme fraiche, just a top notch Chicago grill.

23.description: I won't be coming back here - not sure how it has so many stars.  1.  The wait for presumably fast food (one hot dog, one gyro, one shake and fries) was well over 25 minutes with only two or three orders in ahead of ours...and three people working.  2.  No outdoor seating as advertised on yelp  3.  Brought food to the park to eat and then found out they don't give you any plastic wear so the gyro was pretty tough to eat since my husband didn't have a fork - he said it tasted good though.  4.  My dog bun was so soaking wet it was like raw dough so the entire dog was terrible tasting.  I knew as soon as I got it out since the paper was dripping wet all around that I was in for some nasty food.  This gets two stars because you can't screw up a milkshake, the gyro tasted good and we had a massive laugh over what a waste of time it was and how I basically just didn't get to eat since my dog was disgusting.  They should change the name to Gyro Express and give up on the hot dog endeavor.

47.description: Not bad...not bad at all.  I ordered a gyros plate which came with lots of gyros meat, pita, sauce, and a mound of fries.  Was so much food, and all tasty as well!  Haven't tried anything else, but if in the mood for gyros, give Hot Dog Express a try.In summary, good food, good service, fair prices.

8.description: This place is great. Food is fresh and delicious. Greek salad with grilled chicken is on point! Grilled chicken on pita bread is delicious. They marinade their chicken which is a plus!

31.description: Okay, so we've been back a couple times since, and the place is not bad.  Pretty standard hot dog/gyro/polish type of place, and all in all, pretty good.  really like the fries, and their Greek salad with chicken is pretty damn good.  So I take it back guys, they don't suck.  They just close really early sometimes....

34.description: This place is really close to my house, and I was craving a chili cheese dog. Hot Dog Express is really small, but it was well lit, clean, and the service was fast and friendly. We got two chili cheese dogs and some fries. Prices were pretty reasonable. Food selection and quality was typical/average. They have odd/short hours though.

16.description: Great value food. Prices are reasonable. Fries are fresh cut which i love. Ive had the beefs and hot dogs. Just under $6 for 2 dogs, fries and a drink. Not much as far as seating. You have window booths which should be fine for most people. Surprisingly parking isnt too bad. No meters on either side of the street if i remember right. Great service btw and you get your order quick.

13.description: They no longer have funnel cakes, but they still have great food. A hole in the wall type of place but do not underestimate their food and friendly service.

11.description: The fries are delicious! I like their gyros too but the fries are the best, in my opinion. I ordered a hot dog combo on my way to school and they had my food ready before the bus got there, so about six minutes according to the bus tracker. I thought that was amazing. I go here often and will to do so.

39.description: I am new to hotdogs express. The gyro was good.  My pita was a little on the chewy/doughy side. Tomato was nice and onions were raw and red not white which made for a sweet crunch to the gyro. The gyro sauce was tasty. The meat was tender and get grilled nicely. The fries were cut from real potatoes a plus but the oil wasn't hot enough I can tell from how the fries soaked up a lot of grease. Asked for more mild sauce but what I was given tasted more like sweet baby ray.  No biggie customers I wasn't charged xtra for two sauces.  Friendly staff and seemed nice and clean. I'll try them again and see what the dogs and burgers are about.  Just hope the fries are better

37.description: OK. So last week me and my Bro stopped there to get some food and I put their italian beef to the test.( Sorry Mr.Beef but you have been out done).  The entire meal including the french fries was the BOMB! My brother had the cheeseburger  he craved for cook to perfection and John and the crew are just plain awesome. I just to wife there for lunch and her Maxwell style polish was the best she had for a very long time! Quality food, outdoor seating, reasonable prices and the service of a friendly staff... what more can you ask for...did somebody say beer????Oh well

0.description: My go to spot for gyros Greek salad. Everything is always fresh! I've tried other places and have yet to find anywhere better. I really should try a hot dog one day!

38.description: Great dogs, great fries. Grabbed lunch here a few times and have never been disappointed. Small, compact place with a counter to eat at and jerry springer playing on the tv, usually. Also have tables outside to enjoy the nice summer weather.Street parking isnt hard to find.Cant ever go wrong with the hot dogs here.

51.description: Friend took me here to eat. Gotta say it's a nice place. Food was awesome and people were friendly. They have a nice amount of stools inside and have tables outside. Prices are nice as well. Definitely a place to check out and come back to. Love their shakes as well as their fries.

27.description: This place has one of the best fries and they are fresh!  I usually order a gyro plate and hot dogs.  They have one of the best hot dogs I've ate and gyros is good also.  The workers are friendly and they don't mind having a conversation.

32.description: This is one of my favorite go to place for hot dogs. We call the place "Hot Dog Palace" (or HDP) because we can never remember the real name, and because it seems more fitting to how awesome it is. A few important things to note:1. They have fresh cut fries. This is a huge deal. It is the true measure of a good hot dog joint and it shows they care about creating the right hot dog.2. They make me a root beer shake without batting an eye. (they also have chocolate peanut butter...but that is on the menu)3. The staff is always really nice.

54.description: how does this place only have three reviews??i wouldn't typically order gyros from an establishment that has the words, 'hot dog' in its name, but this is a notable exception.  sister, brother-in-law, and even mom endorsed hot dog express's gyros, so i had to give it a try.this is quite possibly the biggest serving of a gyro plate that i'll ever expect to encounter in my entire, fatty-food life.  it was quite intimidating.  the quality of the gyros is pretty good too.  i assumed that i'd receive copious amounts of leftover, hard meat from a fast food place, but i was pleasantly surprised to discover the opposite.they also give you a very generous amount of fries, though, they did lack salt.though i've never picked up an order in person, brother-in-law and mom tell me that the employees are very friendly.go hungry.  leave w/leftovers.

48.description: Two blocks from my house.  People there are nice. Their fries are fresh. And plentiful, in fact I'm going to come here more often for their burgers instead of going to Bacci's down the street. The guys there also do not seem perverted but I guess its cause of the tall counter they have, they cant see anything.

44.description: I'm from the south suburbs but work all over the chicagoland area doing remodeling.  I've been working for a client two blocks from this place and today I grabbed their 1/3 lb burger and fries and it was the best damn burger I've had in a long long time.  I have a couple of favorite places near me in the south burbs but this place put them to shame.

24.description: Really good fresh cut fries, and large sandwiches. The gyro and the beefs are tasty and have a ton of meat, and the prices are decent. The fries are always crispy and not greasy, and you get a ton. They don't do anything special or unique, but they do the classic fast food fare very well. Great neighborhood spot. Just wish they had better indoor seating; we always get it to go.

7.description: I recommend the gyro!! So good and the portions are insane (in a good way). My husband and I can easily share an order of fries with some left over! This is a great neighborhood spot. I had the beef with peppers on my last visit and was not impressed - I'll stick to the gyro and fries!

49.description: I had the 2 Hot Dogs and Fries meal for $4.99. Quick, efficient, courteous service. Food came quick, hot, and fresh. Hot dogs were both done perfectly and fries were hot, crisp. Definitely recommended.

40.description: If you think that the best beef sammich in Chicago can be had at Portillo's --- you're way off.  Johnny's? Eh, no... Jay's (on Narragansett)? Pretty damn close...Hot Dog Express is absolutely the best beef I've had in the city or the 'burbs. You just have to try it, trust me.  If you don't wanna go for the old reliable offering, the gyros are top notch, as is the Philly chicken sandwich.  No matter what, you won't end up hungry after paying a visit to Hot Dog Express.  I guess that, if I had a complaint, it would be that they close too early (a minor complaint, at that), but the food and service has always been great, and the prices are very reasonable - highly recommended!

53.description: This place serves the biggest gyros sandwich I have ever seen. It wasn't only huge, but it was perfectly cooked and the fresh cut fries are the perfect compliment to this huge sandwich.  The only thing that sucks is the parking (street parking only).

30.description: This place is awesome!! I used to think that Wilbur's had the best gyros, but Hot Dog Express blows them out of the water!!! Tons of crispy gyro meat, pita perfectly crisp, try it with grilled onions...YUMMMM!!!

46.description: This place continues to impress.  Other than lacking a char-broiler for char dogs, this place has it all: a nice owner, nice employees, good food, clean premises, decent prices, etc.  Recommended.

1.description: Rosa J. loves neighborhood joints.  Often time those places may not have "the best" food in the entire world, but they are solid, affordable, and convenient.  The Hot a Dog Express is located off Cullom on Milwaukee Ave. in Portage Park.  The CTA 56 southbound bus dropped us right in front of it.  The entire venue is tiny, but there are several high stools along the walls facing the street for dine-in patrons.  They welcome your credit cards and phone orders, if you don't feel like waiting onsite.  However, the waiting wasn't long at all for us; it was approximately five (5) minutes and all food items came at once.  We ordered the Italian beef combo, shrimp basket combo, and breaded mushrooms.  Each combo came with a small drink and a plenty of fries.  As many of you know, I'm a huge fan of Italian beef sandwiches.  In average in consumed two (2) to three (3) Italian beef sandwiches in a week.  Although I wasn't extremely impressed the flavor of their Italian beef, it was tender and smooth.  If using sing styles as the metaphor to describe how I thought about the Italian beef here, it was a classical singer who has good techniques, but he or she doesn't possess a signature "trademark" to be remembered.  In other words, it was rather forgettable.  The sweet peppers that I asked for had a slightly bitter taste.  The saturation of "dipping" was adequate.  Overall, they earned a passing grade.  The breaded mushrooms were quite delicious.  The portions were large as well.  In addition, the sour cream dipping sauce accompanied the breaded mushrooms fairly well.  Hence, I would ordered this item again.  Hubby's shrimp basket combo comes from one of the Lent specials.  For $4.99, the Lent combo special is very reasonably-priced.  They didn't skimp on the size and portions of the shrimp basket.  We would definitely give this dish a go next time when we come back.  This place is certainly a neighborhood staple, and I bet the locals can't live without it!  I don't live in Portage Park, yet I never know where I will end up with when it comes to food!  I was glad that my stomach was satiated after a slow day of work.

55.description: Fresh cut fries = yummy!!Stopped in last week to give this place a try.  The guys behind the counter were really friendly and nice.  We ordered a gyros sandwich, cheeseburger and a hot dog.  All came with a huge order of fries each!  I was contemplating on ordering the gyros b/c i really wanted to try a hot dog but the guy behind the counter piped up and told me that they make their own tzatziki sauce - i was sold! we were going to eat in but with just counter seating and a small congregation of hungry customers waiting for their orders, we decided to feast at home.they gyros was HUGE! i ate about a quarter of it, then we both ate it again for lunch the next day along with the tons of leftover fries we had.  my bf thought the cheeseburger was delicious and he said the hot dog was good too!We'll definitely be frequenting this spot more often - i just wish they stayed open a little later, they close at 8pm.if anything, come here for the fries! : )

9.description: 845 pm attempted to go into this place which closes at 9 pm. Doors shut tight. Im  guessing they don't need my business. Changed hands im  sure. Never again.

26.description: I LOVE this place! You sometimes think all hot dog joints are the same, but not this one. They have delicious fresh cut french fries and everything on the menu I've tried is awesome. Hot dogs are amazing, the polish is delicious, and their burger are comparable to portillos if not better. The place is pretty small so I usually just do carry in orders. If you are craving burgers, hot dogs, polish, salads, and freshly made milkshakes with real fruit, etc...do yourself a favor and get over to this place. The staff is also extremely friendly!

25.description: This is the place to get a gyro - I absolutely LOVE their gyros and fries! I have been chasing great gyros since my first over 20 years ago and HDE has them perfected. They sell enough of them that the meat is in great shape always, good balance of tomatoes and onions and their sauce is just right. You have to try one with the excellent fries.

12.description: I had not been here in a couple of months. I went recently and things were not the same. The Gyros was so tasteless I had to pour garlic salt all over it. Ownership change?

21.description: Good food, prompt service. I had the gyro plate. Get there early at lunch to grab a seat. Limited seating.

17.description: Went their for dinner.. And they were closed. It's only 5.. What happened to being open until 9

10.description: I live down the street from this spot. Potato skin on fries my favorite. My kids love going for the Ice cream shakes. Staff is Ok. Food is Good, out door seating is a plus. Good neighborhood place.

5.description: Tried my first Chicago style dog and wasn't disappointed. Crisp pickle and green chiles and fresh tomatoes.

3.description: They make the thickest Chicago dogs in the portage park area. The ingredients just taste so fresh. The salads are surprisingly good too. However the staff is not very neighborly. But the Chi dogs are so good you look past it.

35.description: Been going here since they opened and have never been disappointed. The gyros are huge and if you ask for crispy fries they will make them for you. Excellent place in the neighborhood if you live here and better yet if you work out of the house like me. Also of note are the crispy chicken sandwiches and hot dogs.

19.description: This is one of my favorite go to place for hot dogs. We call the place "Hot Dog Palace" (or HDP) because we can never remember the real name, and because it seems more fitting to how awesome it is. A few important things to note:1. They have fresh cut fries. This is a huge deal. It is the true measure of a good hot dog joint and it shows they care about creating the right hot dog.2. They make me a root beer shake without batting an eye. (they also have chocolate peanut butter...but that is on the menu)3. The staff is always really nice.

28.description: I have to say this place gives Jeffs red hots a run for their money in this area. Their beefs are huge and their fries are spectacular. Good prices too.

45.description: Best in the neighborhood or any I've lived in hands down!!  Fast, prompt service and good portions!!

33.description: My family loves this place! The portions are Andre-The-Giant-Sized. A Gyro platter feeds two - and it's quality goodness. All the sandwiches and dogs come with a shovelful of fries. Literally. I'm pretty sure they use a shovel. Oh, and the cheeseburgers are the best in Six-Corners. Yeah, I said it.There's plenty of on-street parking on Milwaukee, but don't you dare park in the bus stop. Seriously, it makes for an expensive lunch and an otherwise affordable joint. If you're picking up, there's a loading zone spot at the end of Cullom. (For free!)Kudos, Hot Dog Express - you're small, but you pack a big punch. You've KO'd my appetite and won my heart.

43.description: Right on the end of my block, takes about 30 seconds to walk to. They have a huge menu, and friendly service. I've had a cheeseburger and a hot dog from here with cheese fries, all great. I think their fries are fresh cut because they are delicious! I plan to try all their food because I can't imagine it would be anything but tasty. I can't wait until it gets warmer, I will be here getting ice cream cones and hot dogs all summer!

2.description: I love this place. Great food. Gyros, Hot Dogs and Burgers are great. Not to mention affordable and always greeted with a smile.

18.description: I won't be coming back here - not sure how it has so many stars.  1.  The wait for presumably fast food (one hot dog, one gyro, one shake and fries) was well over 25 minutes with only two or three orders in ahead of ours...and three people working.  2.  No outdoor seating as advertised on yelp  3.  Brought food to the park to eat and then found out they don't give you any plastic wear so the gyro was pretty tough to eat since my husband didn't have a fork - he said it tasted good though.  4.  My dog bun was so soaking wet it was like raw dough so the entire dog was terrible tasting.  I knew as soon as I got it out since the paper was dripping wet all around that I was in for some nasty food.  This gets two stars because you can't screw up a milkshake, the gyro tasted good and we had a massive laugh over what a waste of time it was and how I basically just didn't get to eat since my dog was disgusting.  They should change the name to Gyro Express and give up on the hot dog endeavor.

41.description: Probably the best fast food in Portage Park. Better burgers, hot dogs, and gyros than Scoops, if you ask me.

52.description: What can I say, this place is cozy inviting and better yet its rite down the street. I take my family here once in a while since they opened. The hot dogs are good. Ps try the fries

50.description: Fair pricing... down to earth staff... good food... and surely left overs for later... ya definitely get the most bang for your Buck here!

4.description: Overall, I would come back. Hot dog was good but my fries were undercooked. Everything here is fresh and I would return to try other items on the menu!

6.description: I go there for one thing only, the gyros! Hot dogs and all the rest are ok but this is by far the best item on the menu, and will feed you for days.

22.description: This place has good gyros for lunch and at a good price. Me and ex co workers go have lunch there

15.description: I've been going to HDE now for a few years.  The guys working the counter/grill are nice and have quick turnaround from when you order to the food getting to you.  It's my go to joint for a hot dog and their prices are great.My wife gets the hamburger and every once in awhile I'll get the Italian Beef.  Both are good quality, the beef is flavorful and I like their hot peppers.The best part about HDE is probably the fresh cut fries.  It's hard to beat fresh cut fries and they always give you enough so you're full with a sandwich and fry meal.Just to note, I'm giving HDE a 5 star rating not that it is on the level of a fancy restaurant, but rating it in the grouping of fast food/hot dog joint.

57.description: OMG. This place is awesome for a million and five reasons. Let's keep it brief, though, yes?5. This place is on the corner by my house. I can walk in, order up a cheese burger, pick up some Garcia Vega's from Friendly Liquors, go home and roll one, and then walk back to pick up my bacon burger of delicious-ness in 10 minutes or less!4. The employee's are sweet and nice and not creepy. When you are a girl, the not creepy part matters a lot. They are friendly but never TOO friendly. And since everyone there is a bit older (not teenagers) I'm assuming one of them is the owner. 3. Prices: They are cheap!! And you get free soda refills!! Yeah!! 2. EVERYTHING (pretty much) comes with fries. And GOOD fries. This is a must. I don't understand people charging $5 for a cheeseburger and not giving you anything to line your gut with before all that cheese and beef hits it. 1. The food is GOOD and PLENTIFUL. My bacon cheese berger wasn't a burger with 2 or 3 strips of gross bacon. It was smothered in bacon. Smothered. It has so much on there, I had to take some off to even be able to eat the burger. All around, Hot Dog Express rules. They are yummy, nice, and even clean. What kinda grease pit is clean?!?! This one.

20.description: Grest prices. Great gyro. I'm sold!

36.description: This place is not too far for me and it would be worth traveling further for.  The gyros are very good and soooo large(meat wise).  It is just a little place with the usual list of food, but it is done simply and well.  Fries are good(hand cut).  Prices are good as well.

14.description: I usually order a burger + fresh cut fries and I'm satisfied 100%. I get full just eating that. Plus the shakes here...I love!! And it doesn't hurt that this location isn't too far from my house.

58.description: Some costumes seem a bit pricey here, even the one I bought was priced higher then what I found it for online but considering the time left before Halloween, fantasy was the only place that I found a variety of options. Plus they carry very specific costumes that other places don't. I went to 5 other costume places and pop up shops to find the costume cheaper but none carried it except fantasy. Definitely worth it and will be back! I recommend it!

56.description: We go a tad bit overboard at our house for Halloween, and every year things get just a bit more over the top.  Not only do they have everything you might need for a great costume, they also have a huge variety of supplies, decorations, machines and everything else you need to put together some really scary stuff.I really like the ability to examine the products and get feedback from the staff. The advice and attention you'll get here beats any fly by night store or any on-line experience.

29.description: Saved the day! Had amazing time on the hunt for my costume. This was a one stop shop with expert opinions. Many of the people there work in theater and are willing to give the best advice. I went in a few times in October and had awesome customer service and items.

42.description: All I can say is wow.....This place is amazing and huge. I recently return to gather a few costume items for my daughters school function. Customer service was great,i was immediately greeted and asked if I needed help, from the moment in the door I was made to feel like royalty. This is by far the best place to shop for any costumes needs. Huge selection, great service and  the staff goes above and beyond.

23.description: I love fantasy costumes and will miss it terribly now that I'm in LA. They really do have everything you could ever possibly need for Halloween! Always super friendly and helpful staff and great prices. Pro tip: Make sure to google 'Fantasy costumes coupon code' - there is a printable 20 or 25 percent off coupon tyhat's good pretty much year round!

47.description: It doesn't matter what you are searching for, you will find it here! Fantasy has a great selection from costumes, to make up, wigs, masks, accessories, etc. This store is so fun and full of great merchandise. If you have never been here, stop by to see what they have! I bet it will give you a few ideas and make you excited for next Halloween or your next themed party! Everyone is so nice and helpful in there that it is worth a trip!

8.description: I've been going here since I moved to Chicago in 1998 and the place always meets my expectations year round despite what I'm in the market for. The staff are true pros especially the make-up people, they really know their product. I don't think I've ever not been able to find what I'm looking for at Fantasy Costumes. Once in mid winter I just wanted to buy a bulk of fake roaches and they had plenty. Just a word of warning, if you're a last minute shopper for Halloween and go in October be prepared to stand in long lines and share the large store with a mass of people. I don't know how the staff can do it. Kudos to them.

31.description: I want to preface this review by stating that today is 10/30/14.Yes, I am aware that I am going to a costume store the day before Halloween.  I could tell it was very busy at 11AM before even entering the store.  I understand that the people who work here are probably a little tired, now that the store is open 24 hrs a day.  Yeah, I get it...  I went in for makeup, to match two costumes, which I had in a bag with me.  Here is what I needed: a bald cap, makeup in green and gray, and liquid latex.  All of these things were behind one counter with one employee, and a long line.  When it was my turn I got all the easy items, leaving the green and gray makeup for the end.  Not only was she less than polite, but she was rude enough to tell me that it was the day before Halloween and that they are out of a lot of things!"I have lived in Chicago for 10 years, I am also a Professional Theatrical Makeup Artist and this is the only store that has received my business for all the productions I have worked on as well as 10 Halloweens.  That is a lot of money, and a lot of time at this store for several years!  Today was less than satisfying - I dropped $50 on makeup and was completely disappointed by the employees that worked there.  I also noticed a man, who smelled like a moldy towel being terrible to other customers.  Next time I will buy items online, or at the rival Chicago Costumes because today's visit was horrible!

34.description: LOVE this place! I've been coming to this place since my first Halloween. They literally have everything and anything you are looking for any costume. From babies to adults. The workers there are really nice and help you out as if they're picking out their own costume. It's insane how much stuff they have. They even help with make up. Everyone in the city knows about this place and I recommend this place to anyone for not just Halloween costumes, but also for decorations an wigs and stuff. AWESOME!

16.description: I felt the need to update my previous review.I would like to Thank everyone at Fantasy Costumes forhelping me find the perfect costume.And, this is no easy feat/task because I am 52 and as much as Iwant to dress up as Batgirl or Elvira I needed something that wasage appropriate and fit my style!Now, honestly, I was majorly checking out the Smurfette Costume todaybut, it was all furry and I thought it would be pretty hot inside that suit soI met with Kathy up front and she directed me to Desiree' who was sopatient and helped me find the best/costume choice for me.Now, this place was packed today, and every member of their staffwere on the sales floor, helping their customers.And, this is why this place has maintained/stayed in business for so longbecause they know how to treat their customers!And, here at Fantasy, the majority of their costumes are behind theircounters and these associates take the time to help you find what youare looking for, talk about a great hands on approach!So, closing out, I found a great costume with the help of the FantasyCostume Staff, and I got 10% off for checking in on Yelp!Thanks again Mr. Garcia and Staff, once again you have left quitea great impression on me, and it takes a lot to do that.So, Yelpers, Big Halloween Party Wednesday Night, don't waste yourtime anywhere else, go visit Fantasy Costumes,They'll take great care of you..That's a given..:)

13.description: I have been looking for the perfect hat for my costume and this place had exactly what I was looking for!  And I found a few other items that I know I wouldn't be able to find anywhere else. With the great selection and customer service, this store is by far the best Halloween store other there!

11.description: Saved the day! Had amazing time on the hunt for my costume. This was a one stop shop with expert opinions. Many of the people there work in theater and are willing to give the best advice. I went in a few times in October and had awesome customer service and items.

39.description: Jason was very helpful with our search for Halloween costume, he was very patient with us. We were so indecisive, but Jason stuck with us and showed us all the costumes we asked for. He over exceeded all our expectations of great costumer service. Thank you so much Jason for being so sweet and patient, King Tut & Cleopatra.

37.description: It's that time of the year to see all the great items that fantasy costume has for this year's Halloween party

0.description: If this place does not have it, it does not exist. When I say everything? It has EV-E-RY-THING and then some! I needed an item for a parade costume and thought it was worth a try to see if they carried the item. ... Well, they did and it was a great price even without the 15% off check in offer. Glanced at a few other items but after a much needed internal tug of war, I convinced myself impulsive side to only buy what I initially sought and "needed". When I stopped in near Halloween, same thing. Had a specific item in mind and they had it too. The staff is super helpful. Always willing to help you locate and item or field over the phone questions. If you need it, Fantasy has it all!

38.description: Why did I ever shop at any other costume shop?? Besides the outrageous selection and great website, The service was totally, unexpectedly gracious and accommodating. Every single employee was patient and went out of their way to make sure you were helped and did not brush you off. I highly recommend this place and I had stopped in before to look but this time was very impressed.

51.description: my experience was excellent. The employees were extremely helpful. Never felt rushed. I asked a bunch of questions and they walked around with me until I found the outfit I needed. Everyone in the place smiled and said hello when they walked past me  I felt welcome. I will make this my destination if ever I need a costume. I highly recommend it!

27.description: I was happy with this place, lots of options, helpful staff and they're hours are great too. The staff was very patient and helpful with any questions, no matter how busy this place was there's hardly ever a long wait for anything. Easy to try on their costumes they weren't strict lie a lot of other places we went to, they never had an attitude with trying on as many costumes as you needed. It's a little pricey not as cheap as many people made it seem but it wasn't outrageous either. They have some really cool high quality costumes also. Cool spot to check out if you already haven't.

32.description: Fantasy costume has the best selection in all of Chicago. The staff is very helpful. They helped us find exactly what we wanted at an affordable price. Everyone should come here. Best halloween store in Chicagoland

54.description: Just was there again yesterday.  This is definitely a one stop shopping place.  You won't waste your time running around.  In addition, they actually have many people there to guide you to what you want.  They will even let you in on discounts without you asking.

48.description: This place has the most costumes and accessories I've seen!  The people are friendly and helpful, which is especially important because there is so much around every corner. I regret not coming here sooner because it would have saved me a lot of trips searching from store to store with more limited selections. We also received a couple of free FC hats!

44.description: Fantasy Costume is the best costume place EVER!  Unbelievable variety and selection.  The kids room is packed with options and sizes.  They have wig stylists and makeup artists on-site and can help you with any costume you have in mind.  It's a one-stop shop for all your costume needs!!  You won't leave disappointed!

24.description: WOW! What a great experience I had here with an OUTSTANDING employee, RAY!  I needed to find some magic tricks to perform for my niece. I know absolutely NOTHING about magic.  Ray took the time to patiently explain the various tricks available and guided me to three that would not only impress my niece, but would be easy enough for a novice such as me to execute.Not only am I sure to return here for all of my costume and magic needs, but I'll definitely recommend this place to all of my friends and family.Thanks RAY!

7.description: Couldn't ask for a better selection of costumes. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Highly recommended!

49.description: I have been going to Fantasy for many years,  and each time I'm there I leave happy. You have to dedicate at least an hour to the store to get a chance to experience it. If you have a costume in mind they have it, and if they don't they have something close to it. Staff helps you with all questions and even gives you ideas.. its a must go to store.

40.description: The inventory at Fantasy Costume is enormous!! Definitely something for everyone! The staff is so helpful and always kind. One-stop-shop for ALL your costume needs! I will definitely be back!!

53.description: This place isn't anything special. Some quirky , some plain rude, and some nice staff. The quantity of costumes is there, not so much the quality. A side note the "fitting rooms" if you can call them that, are super creepy, dingy, and has a shamble of a curtain giving you "privacy". I also had the nagging feeling of a hidden Camera somewhere. And yes I checked! Anyway, not the greatest place, not even the okay place, more like the get in and get out as quick as you can all while holding your breath because of the mothball/ dust mite smell. Good luck finding your costumes, and good luck getting help with be attitude. Also I forgot to mention mascot rentals are pretty pricey $95 and up.

30.description: Really Good selection, very good customer service. I went in there on Halloween last minute and of course there was a ton of people but the lady was awesome n helped me as if she wasn't busy. On the other hand the return or exchange policy is non existent and the prices are a little high.

46.description: Stopped in to see about costumes for a historical themed party coming up soon.  They had everything we needed and the staff was great helping us out.  We found right look for our event which is a turn of the century farmhouse dinner.  Not just for Halloween, a great source for any party that needs a look.

1.description: I love that Fantasy Costumes is open year round. And I love that they are open 24 hours a day in the days leading up to Halloween (check website or call) so be warned if you plan to do any driving in the area because last year the whole block was backed up with traffic from people trying to park and people trying to cross the street.FC is huge.  HUGE! I counted 4 or 5? rooms full of costumes and costume accessories. From the big details (full costume) to the little details (think eyelashes and makeup)  And then there are the costumes for rent (huge chicken anyone?).  The possibilities are endless. For Halloween they also have an array of decor--lights, skulls, and pumpkin carving kits. Then  there's the display of horrors--large ghoulish display like the Exorcist girl, electric chair guy and other vivid displays of horror for sale for your ghoulish delight. Service is friendly for the most part.  One lady really kept hounding us and following us around--it was a bit unnerving.  But everyone else was nice.  Some of the items are pricey but if you need a costume ASAP or want a one-stop-shop without having to visit several stores, FC is your place.

55.description: Do you need to dress up for anything? Come here, they have EVERYTHING your costume wearing heart desires. They obviously get  really crowded around the big costumey holidays. Helpful staff.

9.description: I grew up going here. I've never had the pleasure of meeting the owner until today. What a great guy. Very friendly and welcoming. It seems the staff is treated like family which I like. The store is enormous. Full of fun crazy things for the whole family even your pets.  You gotta come check it out. You'll find what ya need plus..

26.description: I have been going to Fantasy for as long as I can remember. I still remember going as a kid and the haunted house set up they had with the guy in the electric chair!!! He would jump up, start shaking, and make me jump every time lol great place!! Great staff!!! Always helpful, always a great time, and worth the drive from no matter how far you live in the Chicago land area.

25.description: This place doesn't do returns. I should have known when I said that if what I was buying didn't work I could always return it and the three people there got really quiet. If you don't allow returns, be up front about it. Don't make it this dirty little secret that is only going to upset customers. I will never shop here again.

12.description: Great place love it, they have everything i need , 1 stop shop for all my clown needs. I recommend all professional clowns to come in and get there make up.

59.description: Fantasy costume has a great costume selection. I bought a flapper dress that turned out to be to big they let me exchanged it. They where very nice about it. I definitely will shop every year for all costumes there.

21.description: I think 4 stars still stands, a little over 6 years later. The employees are decent and very helpful here, and while I passed on getting a red jacket and some of the other things I needed for a custom Lyle Langley(of Simpsons monorail episode fame) costume at other stores instead, the selection is still amazing. When you're quoted $45 for the jacket and a $150 security deposit(and some of the other costumes, had a higher deposit!), I don't think it was bad I passed on coming here, and got my costume items at various thrift stores instead, plus one item at Chicago Costume.It's too bad about the security deposits on a lot of the costumes they have here that made me go the thrift store route largely, since I've often seen costumes I was eyeing that looked pretty good. They really do have some darn helpful employees, and don't even mind if you want to try on some of the masks and put them over your head. Maybe one of these days if I do have a better paying job and/or financial situation improves, and I learn about other stores, I'll realize the security deposits are the norm for such stores?

17.description: Fantasy Costumes is great for all of your party needs.  No matter what themed party is coming up, this place has the most inventory and the largest variety of costumes I have ever seen.  Last year I searched everywhere for a specific costume and couldn't find it anywhere.  I finally found what I wanted the day before Halloween.  The owner George has been a part of Chicago  culturefor years, cares about all of his customers and it really shows.  Whether its for a play, a holiday or Halloween Fantasy is the best in service, variety and customer service.

10.description: I think 4 stars still stands, a little over 6 years later. The employees are decent and very helpful here, and while I passed on getting a red jacket and some of the other things I needed for a custom Lyle Langley(of Simpsons monorail episode fame) costume at other stores instead, the selection is still amazing. When you're quoted $45 for the jacket and a $150 security deposit(and some of the other costumes, had a higher deposit!), I don't think it was bad I passed on coming here, and got my costume items at various thrift stores instead, plus one item at Chicago Costume.It's too bad about the security deposits on a lot of the costumes they have here that made me go the thrift store route largely, since I've often seen costumes I was eyeing that looked pretty good. They really do have some darn helpful employees, and don't even mind if you want to try on some of the masks and put them over your head.
