Maybe one of these days if I do have a better paying job and/or financial situation improves, and I learn about other stores, I'll realize the security deposits are the norm for such stores?

5.description: Fantasy Costumes is your one stop shop for Halloween costumes and theme parties   I have used them for both and have never left not 100% happy. The staff is friendly and helpful. They know what they have in stock and even when I've visited during Halloween were on top of the ball.

3.description: The greatest place in the world. One stop shop!!! They have everything you need at a great price. The customer service is awesome. I bring my kids there for school project supplies and everything else they need. You can always park in the Burger King lot if the parking space is full. Which I recently just learn. Thank you George for that one! But I come every year for my hellOwen customs it's a tradition now in my family.

35.description: My first time there, I was overwhelmed of all the stuff they had.  I bought two costumes, although I had my heart set on one they didn't have.  The employees were a big help.  They staff was friendly and very helpful.  This is my new spot for costumes!  I love that they are also open year round.

19.description: I want to preface this review by stating that today is 10/30/14.Yes, I am aware that I am going to a costume store the day before Halloween.  I could tell it was very busy at 11AM before even entering the store.  I understand that the people who work here are probably a little tired, now that the store is open 24 hrs a day.  Yeah, I get it...  I went in for makeup, to match two costumes, which I had in a bag with me.  Here is what I needed: a bald cap, makeup in green and gray, and liquid latex.  All of these things were behind one counter with one employee, and a long line.  When it was my turn I got all the easy items, leaving the green and gray makeup for the end.  Not only was she less than polite, but she was rude enough to tell me that it was the day before Halloween and that they are out of a lot of things!"I have lived in Chicago for 10 years, I am also a Professional Theatrical Makeup Artist and this is the only store that has received my business for all the productions I have worked on as well as 10 Halloweens.  That is a lot of money, and a lot of time at this store for several years!  Today was less than satisfying - I dropped $50 on makeup and was completely disappointed by the employees that worked there.  I also noticed a man, who smelled like a moldy towel being terrible to other customers.  Next time I will buy items online, or at the rival Chicago Costumes because today's visit was horrible!

28.description: We've been frequenting Fantasy Costumes for several years and consider it the most  fabulous find. They're likely to have whatever costumes, accessories, wigs and makeup you'll ever need (and more), and if they don't no one will!  The last time I was there (two weeks prior to Halloween), I needed a wig and was feeling miserable about my appearance in a black Cleopatra style. Kathy, a manager, sat me down on a chair in front of a mirror, brought me several wigs, made me feel beautious(!), and then walked  me over to makeup where I was awed by the makeup artist working on somone at the moment.  I doubt there's a costume store anywhere that could duplicate this impressive place. Accolades to them!

45.description: Great selection of costumes and all sorts of interesting trinkets!! I went in to try on a couple of wigs, and the woman assisting me was very knowledgeable about the product and was very insightful. A cool place to go if you're looking for awesome accessories for costumes or just anything in general.

33.description: I love Halloween and this is the best they have so much to offer i love it it was like walking into a candy store the people were so nice the only thing is it was a bit pricey and parking is horrible but the store its self is amazing

43.description: OMG!!!The most AMAZING store in the country!!!  They have everything and the prices are not bad either.

2.description: Why would you go to any other costume shop in the city? This place is open year around, has all types of props and outfits and is open 24 hours in October. It puts Party City to shame...Excellent adult costumes and I was excited to see PLUS SIZES. I'm 6'2 and nearly 300 pounds and I could be Sponge Bob if I wanted. lolOverall this place is awesome and the quality if far better then other places that have the same costumes. I posted a pic of my son's minion outfit which was only $30 and very high quality.

18.description: I love fantasy costumes and will miss it terribly now that I'm in LA. They really do have everything you could ever possibly need for Halloween! Always super friendly and helpful staff and great prices. Pro tip: Make sure to google 'Fantasy costumes coupon code' - there is a printable 20 or 25 percent off coupon tyhat's good pretty much year round!

41.description: My favorite costume store! Open year round!  I've been going here since I was a kid and every year it never fails to impress  me. The best selection around, almost any costume you could imagine!  I prefer shopping here to buying online, since you can actually see what you are getting. The  prices are reasonable. They also have a high quality selection of wigs. Family owned and operated-was even helped by the owner himself. Every employee I encountered was personable and assertive. I will be returning to Fantasy for all my costume needs!

52.description: i was recently at Fantasy Costumes with my son and he was so amazed and it made me realize how much a variety of stuff they have. Service is very helpful and they had supplies for every holiday. I also loved the wig department the owner was so knowledgeable and nice he made me feel very comfortable about trying some on before I made my purchase. I would recommend checking this store out.

50.description: Fantasy Costumes never disappoints.  I have been coming here for years, and returned yesterday looking for an "Interplanet Janet" costume for my daughter's "School House Rock" performance.  Sure enough, they hooked me up with a perfect, silver, futuristic outfit!  Thanks guys.

4.description: One star too many. This place sold me an un wearable costume with a huge hole in the middle of it. No rerurns. No exchanges.No store creditBut I do get to keep my costume which can never be worn. "Were not saying we sold you a bad product" says the man on the phone.... what does that even mean? You did though. It's blatantly irrefutably a bad product sold by your store. I should have known better though with several members of the staff talking unabashed and disrespectfully of the people in the store and how the entire season is such a nightmare. Take responsibility for your faulty products, your filthy store, and your wildly unprofessional staff. This place is a joke

6.description: I love this place. They have everything. My whole family shops here. Best costume store in chicago. If your ever in the neighborhood stop in. They are open year round .

22.description: I went to fantasy costume this past Halloween season. It was so packed and raining outside, I rushed and grabbed a costume that I didn't even really want. I went home tried it on and it was the wrong size. I went back and picked out the size that I wanted, I didn't want a refund or money back. Nothing like that. They wouldn't do it for me, they said all sales are final. It was an even exchange, and I wanted to buy tights for it too so really I would've ended spending more money. It was terrible. They have a big selection but they are way over priced and their policy sucks. Never going back!

15.description: This costume shop is extremely impressive in size and variety. It is a whole city block long and has over 1 million costumes in stock! Love the variety they offer and that they have makeup and wig professionals onsite to help tie your look together. I would recommend coming early in the season since they get slammed the week of Halloween. They are open 24 hours that week which is what makes this place awesome! Fantasy Costumes has a great selection, service and really scary "graveyard" display!!

57.description: These people were helpful and have a huge selection of stuff to choose from. Came through on what I needed in a pinch.

20.description: best costume place around ,has every and any thing you need .and great service

36.description: I've never been impressed with fantasy costumes. Costume warehouse is better. The staff here is ridiculously rushed even when they aren't busy. The stuff on their website is cheaper then in the store. I wish they would get more deluxe costumes in

14.description: This place is my THE GO-TO Halloween supplies! Also they have great makeup supplies for my photography shoots. Worker there is very friendly and knows everything to ask for.

58.description: Awesome food, had the Black Betty, super delicious the buns are awesome and they have Fist City on tap, the garlic Parm fries are flame also. Would highly recommend this place!

56.description: Quality burgers, both modern and classic toppings. Reasonably priced craft beer to boot. The Old Time Religion burger is phenomenal. Fries are good. Expect long lines and waiting outdoors if you go during normal eating hours. Limited seating. Definitely a must if you call yourself a connoisseur.

29.description: The best burger patties. The pork belly really makes them. I personally always get the Old Time Religion burger, as it's amazing. Arugula, roasted tomato, and goat cheese. The best. I'm also very thankful for their gluten free burger buns. And they're good too! Not spongey at all; I don't feel shafted. Lately I noticed they started toasting them, which is genius and wonderful as they keep from getting soggy. More gluten free beer options would be amazing but if not I'll still keep coming for a burger. I'm glad they've gotten so popular. Keep it up guys!

42.description: Pretty good! A bit pricey in my opinion, but the food was great. I don't remember the exact names, but my burger had bernaise sauce with mushrooms and onions, my boyfriend had the one with goat cheese, and his sister had one with Bloody Mary sauce. While we all liked our food, I think the Bloody Mary sauce burger was the table favorite. Also, we got The Whip spiked milkshakes and they were spectacular. I would go back just for those!!!!

23.description: just moved to the area and brgrbelly was my first local spot to check out based on yelp reviews. it did not disappoint. the staff was friendly, the food was fantastic, and the beer list was awesome. this will for sure be a regular in my rotation

47.description: Blah blah, standard Celiac thing. But what I miss most about burgers are how they are wrapped neatly into a tasty bun. Leadbelly makes a great burger, AND they have GF buns!

8.description: So today the wife and I decided to pick up some burgers.  I called to order ahead for a pickup, and was promptly told about their new policy.  They would need a credit card number before they would take my order.  What?  I have to admit that I've never needed a credit card number before I ordered from any pizza place, Chinese restaurant, taco place, or burger joint when I'm paying cash.  Once I recovered from the shock, I found it a little insulting, and felt like they wanted to do a credit check on me for the privilege of ordering one of their good but overpriced burgers.  Additionally, I didn't want my credit card number written on a scrap of paper that anyone could get access to.  Go ahead and give them your credit card number if you like.  We ordered pizza instead, and I didn't need a credit card number either.

31.description: MMMMMThe burgers are made with both ground beef and pork, and the corn buns are baked day of.  If they run out, no more buns.You pick your crazily-named burger.  It's similar to Kuma's, in that it is music themed and a burger joint.  But it's much calmer than Kuma's.  They show music videos and concerts in the place.  The fries are outstanding, lots of choices.  We usually get the pork belly fries.  The house made BBQ sauce is tangy and lightly spiced.  At the end, they give you a fresh baked cookie. Love this place!

34.description: We really enjoyed this place. Loved the option of getting a portabella mushroom or chicken breast in place of any burger. They have a variety of mustards but the seasoning was so good we didn't use any condiments. The buns are amazing. They don't fall apart which is why places like Kumas use a pretzel bun. We liked the fries and how they were served in mini deep fry baskets, theres enough for 2 people. Who doesn't like a complimentary homemade cookie? Thumbs up.

16.description: A nice stop while in Portage Park. We hit up Leadbelly on a nice warm Saturday night, and the patio and the place was hopping. I liked the rock 'n' roll portraits and live concert playing on the big screens. Someone has a big jones for Kurt Cobain here, and that's alright. I guess he's associated with Leadbelly the blues artist by way of MTV Unplugged, ding ding, Final Jeopardy!I ordered the Leadbelly original burger, and the house fries with sea salt and pepper. The burger was okay, NOT WOW, the Best, Jerry! Definitely just okay. The house fries were almost devoid of sea salt, and I would like to see a sweet potato fries option. The beer selection here is pretty amazing, and the service is really nice. They do have a small patio, and I did like that I saw people of all ages and all races enjoying this place. A unique burger place in a unique place, Portage Park.

13.description: I saw Leadbelly on some list of best burgers, but I had never had it. We ordered here for lunch today and low and behold, I've discovered yet another quality burger joint!!I had the "Old Time Religion" which is a delicious, high quality beef patty (I could taste it) on what was a soft, fresh, homemade bakery bun, with arugula, roasted tomatoes, goat cheese and truffle aoli. Wow. Talk about great ingredients and flavor combinations! The burger was so good -  the truffle aoili and goat cheese gave such a savory tone to it, while the peppery arugula and roasted tomatoes blended nicely and complimented these flavors! The bun was huge and I had some left, but again, I appreciated the fact that it was not your usual hamburger bun. I would like to eventually try other burgers on their menu, and even go in to experience the restaurant. For now, though, I am definitely a fan!!

11.description: Great quality burger & ingredients. Staff was extremely friendly & helpful with the menu items. Burgers were juicy,  but I felt slightly small compared to the bun,  way too much bread.  The cookie was a prefect finish and soo tasty.

39.description: I am so glad my husband and I found this place on Yelp!! I ordered the easy rider and it was delicious. We also got a side of fries and a chocolate shake. The shake was good - nothing to rave about but was a nice sweet treat after that meal. They don't have fountain drinks, they sell cans of soda. My husband liked that when he ordered a coke, he was able to go back and get another without additional cost. I'm expecting so we didn't try any beer but can't wait to go back when we can! We also loved the outdoor seating area. It's perfect for a nice summer evening. Can't wait to bring our friends & family here!!

37.description: Awesome burger I must say, I got the Garlic Parmesan fries with Black Bettysmoked bacon, bleu cheese, homemade fried onion straws, buffalo bleu sauce. I must say I'm impressed minus the fact that they won't give you a table unless you order. But overall I recommend this place

0.description: OMG! I could not wait to try this place for the longest time. I purchased the Groupon which overall saved me like 5.00 for the Portage Park location. Be careful that you're paying close attention to which location you're buying it from. There is also another one in Jefferson Park and they will not accept your Groupon for the other location. Once we got there, I super enjoyed the ambiance and overall vibe. They were playing music videos from 90s to 70s genre. LOVED it. They have a huge huge selection of beers I mean hugeeee. You go up to order and you take a seat while they give you a number and bring you your food.So I ordered the Black Betty medium which had bacon, bleu cheese, onion rings. It was cooked perfectly! The first couple bites were literally heaven! The combination of the cheese with the onion ring crunch was superb. However, when I got towards the end of the burger the bleu cheese just became overwhelming I mean there was just SO much of it. I would suggest to ask for it easy or on the side if they can. That's really my only complaint it got kind of soggy and just weird so I didn't finish the entire thing. The Parmesan garlic fries are a MUST! Perfectly crunchy full of flavor and everyone in the restaurant was also raving about the same fries. The customer service is amazing. Two women helped us throughout our whole dinner and they were super sweethearts and so so friendly. Because of this I'm really going for the 5 rather than a 4 just because of the ending experience with the burger this made up for it. Parking can be a bit of a pain since it's down Irving but you can find some around the corner down the side streets/not permit parking.

38.description: It breaks my heart to give this place 3 stars instead of 4 or even 5. I had high expectations for Leadbelly and I'm sorry to say but I was quite disappointed. I was looking forward to adding it to my "Best Burgers in Chicago" list, but it didn't make the cut. Darn. I ordered the 'Amazing Grace' burger which was topped with smoked pork belly, crispy onion straws, homemade spicy sriracha pickles, and mustard BBQ. My friend ordered the, 'The Gallows Pole' which was topped with swiss, onions and mushrooms. We also split the garlic and parmesan fries. One order of fries was enough for the both of us. It's a place where you order at the counter, you get a number, you seat yourself, and then they bring the food out to you. We found a nice spot out on their front patio. When the burger was brought out it LOOKED spectacular. However, the first bite was not magical like I had hoped...not at all whatsoever. The pork belly was too chewy and unfortunately I had to take it off because I couldn't bite through it while it was in the burger. I wish I had ordered a bacon burger instead. The burger meat was...different? First off it was not juicy at all, very dry, maybe it was more lean, but I know what lean ground beef tastes like that, and that is not it either. It tasted overcooked even though I saw it was pink bc I ordered it medium well so I'm not sure what was going on there, but I didn't like it. The bun was just okay, I think it was a brioche type of bun, which my friend enjoyed more than I did. The HIGHLIGHT of the meal was the fries. I thought they were fantastic and I would come back just for the fries.

51.description: We were advised before going to come eat, it has not disappointed. These best burger I've ever eat in my life. Especially the burger that has the same name as the restaurant " Leadbelly" burger with superb meat (not frozen meat) with a little big longer a Munster cheese ball with fried mushrooms ... A treat ... and simple burgers and cheeseburgers are excellent too. Not very expensive also for 2 Coca Cola wide and 2 burger shack shake: $ 25 with taxes ... Super simple to find it is the only restaurant in the Madison Square Park ... I highly recommend ...

27.description: Great place to hang out, drink beer, eat awesome burgers and delicious fries combinations. I constantly brag about it to friends, everybody loves the place.

32.description: I love this place. Last time it was slow and unprofessional, but the food is delicious as always and ill be back

54.description: I am kind of a hamburger snob.  I don't like pre-formed gray hamburgers.  I go for a hand formed thicker burger that can be medium rare on the inside and thoroughly  cooked on the outside.  This is exactly what I got at Leadbelly.  I ordered the "Good Night Irene" with the crab cake on top.  I ate the crab cake by itself.  It was delicious.  The hamburger was cooked just like I like it.  The toasted buttered bun was a perfect compliment to the meat.  They have several fancy fry choices.  We shared an order of pork belly fries with onion rings on top.  Yummy.  My only complaint, (and I know I am showing my age here) but the music was too loud.  When I couldn't hear my dinner partner not more than 2 feet away from me that's too loud.  Other than that it was a great experience.  I'll definitely be back.

48.description: Great and friendly service, the garlic parmesan fries are amazing!!! Oh and the butter cookies are the best cookies I've ever had! Yum!!!

44.description: VERY DISAPPOINTED, expected more from all the hype.The burger I had was so greasy - the fat/meat ratio was more fat than usual...so much that it should been called LARD ON A BUN.The Bread it was in was so airy and light it tasted like the cheapest bread at Aldi's.The fries are so soggy and oily - they taste like mashed baby food in fry form.The only positive thing is their large beer selection.

24.description: Sunday & I couldn't decide between breakfast or a burger I'm so glad I found this place first time I've been here ordered house of the Rising Sun which has a fried egg on it oh my god with that bun that burger this was definitely one of the best burger I've ever had and I got my mixture of breakfast and lunch .Andrew our server was fantastic  he suggested an October beer that went perfect with the burger ! The service,  atmosphere was excellent love the place ..live in the neighborhood will definitely be back .

7.description: I found this deal on Groupon. The Burgers and Garlic Parm Fries are the bomb.com.  Myah are waitress was extremely nice and helpful with choosing are selections.Then to top things off one of the owners Mr. Steve O'Brien came out personally to greet each customer. That was a Big Plus in my book. Awesome place to enjoy nice music great burgers and fries. P.S A nice sweet surprise in a small bag. A Butter Cookie

49.description: A nice stop while in Portage Park. We hit up Leadbelly on a nice warm Saturday night, and the patio and the place was hopping. I liked the rock 'n' roll portraits and live concert playing on the big screens. Someone has a big jones for Kurt Cobain here, and that's alright. I guess he's associated with Leadbelly the blues artist by way of MTV Unplugged, ding ding, Final Jeopardy!I ordered the Leadbelly original burger, and the house fries with sea salt and pepper. The burger was okay, NOT WOW, the Best, Jerry! Definitely just okay. The house fries were almost devoid of sea salt, and I would like to see a sweet potato fries option. The beer selection here is pretty amazing, and the service is really nice. They do have a small patio, and I did like that I saw people of all ages and all races enjoying this place. A unique burger place in a unique place, Portage Park.

40.description: Had a great time there on Friday last. Friends had recommended the place. We were very impressed. Great food in a great atmosphere.

53.description: Visiting from Colorado, and stopped in on way back to hotel b/c of the Yelp reveiws. Have to admit, great burger(Gallows Pole), cookie & service! Owner stopped by to see how everything was... found that nice!

30.description: Interesting place... The menu looked good.I can't really give a rating on the food as I didn't have any due to being ignored in lieu of the family that entered the restaurant after me. I stood waiting as the counter attendant walked past me, went behind the counter and then proceeded to greet and assist the family behind me. Naturally I left to seek a business that wants my money.

46.description: Leadbelly's is our family favorite... meat lovers get delicious hamburgers, vegetarians get amazing portabella burgers. Seriously, they're take it to the next level. Delicious, unique, and the atmosphere is fun. No soggy fries - and rather the fries are decadent. No crappy beer - a fantastic selection. And boozy milkshakes? Hello!! Finally, the burgers come with a cookie! And if you have kids, they happily will make grilled cheese (which i don't think is on the menu). So happy to have them in the neighborhood - so happy they've been so successful. The reviews, recognition, and write ups are true - they are awesome.

1.description: Great burger. One of the better choices that one will find for what is out there these days... The meat is well chosen (fat to meat ratio) and ground nicely. The patty is fair in size, nicely seasoned or salted,  and properly cooked (all the important elements of a good burger patty are done right here). The options of pre-set burger condiments and cheese choices are great. Also, the bread was very good, very fresh, and was made in house.The fries were fresh cut and were made excellent (twice cooked? = This is a good thing). The topping options for the fries were also nice choices. Although, the pork belly option didn't really have much pork belly with it but it was still very tasty. It's a well working business operation/concept. Simple  menu, and ones choice of beer. Followed by good customer service.The meal comes with a cookie that was very tasty,  resembles school cookies from back in the day (the sugar butter cookie kind).The only major disappointment, besides the tacky music idol theme (which is more of a turn off - good thing it's not named LEADBELLY anymore), is that of it not being BYOB! The business seems to be working with the selling of the beers that they offer so it doesn't seem likely that it will ever be BYOB but it definitely would be a better burger joint if it was. It would also be nice if the burger came with a side of fresh cut potato chips for like a dollar more and give the customer the option to upgrade the chips for a slight charge more. A plus+ on the hot sauce selections. They def know how to get people to easily run up the tab with the menu setup and beers but all and all there are so many overrated horrible burger restaurants and this IS NOT one of them. Again,  great burger! This is definitely going in the right direction if your looking for a good quality burger and excellent fries.

55.description: I went here on a fri night at 9:45pm and was informed that I would have to take my order to go as they were about to close at 10pm. I watched them turn away 3 parties totaling 10 people in the 10 min it took to make my food, this ain't Mayberry its Chicago why are you closing so early? I would give this place a lower star rating but they earned some redemption with food quality. Not the best I have ever had but none the less pretty good. Would have been better at a table with some craft beer though.....hint hint. Burger run you about $10 which is the standard for a place like this. May or may not return...

9.description: Meh, I was unimpressed.Extremely small space.  Far drive for us.  Parking is street.  Staff was nice.Food was really mediocre and tasteless.  The best part about the burgers were the buns...which is kind of sad.  There wasnt much flavor.  We had the midnight special...and it was plain, boring.  The black betty was delicious but I think it was because of the pungent blue cheese helped out the very bland burg.  Fries were good, but not worth coming all the way out here.It just didnt do anything for us.  Bums

26.description: Today was my second time visiting this joint, let me tell you I don't think I've ever been so fully satisfied from a burger in my life. Excellent atmosphere, great presentation & great grub. Can't wait for my next visit! Btw, the complimentary cookie was Fire

25.description: This might be my favorite burger place in Chicago. The food is delicious. I'm in between here and another. I've been to all the "big name" ones, which are supposedly the best in the country but this place needs to be in that list. I've never had a bad burger here. I've tried almost all of them. Try it out. You won't be disappointed.

12.description: Them buns though!!! I bookmarked Leadbelly Burgers long ago when I read a list somewhere of Chicago's Best Burgers. So this year one of my resolutions is to go to all my bookmarked places. My friend wanted to go to Kuma's but we decided to come here since neither of us have been before. Leadbelly's is a top contender for top burger. I can't say it's the best because I haven't tried them all yet!!! We got the Black Betty and the Easy Rider and both were delicious. We also ordered the Parmesan Garlic fries. Those could've been a bit more crisp but we did come on a very busy Saturday night so I won't dock a star. Although they were packed, the service was still good and we didn't feel rushed to leave. The bun really stood out to me. So buttery and slightly crispy. It made the burger even better. I loved the flavor profiles each burger had to offer. I am not at all a blue cheese fan but I do like it with beef. And the Black Betty was perfect. Not overwhelming but you could still taste it. On the Easy Rider I loved the homemade sriracha pickles, they should fry those up and make them a side! My friend loved the beer variety they had to offer and she was super excited to see one her favorites from Three Floyd's in the cooler. I loved the butter cookie as a little sweet treat after dinner. Even though we were stuffed we couldn't resist those cookies. I will definitely be back soon to try another burger. But I will probably come on a weekday to avoid a long wait for a table and my food. And I will also get some cookies to go!

59.description: I just swallowed one of the best burger I have had in a while...they claim that they blend and make their own meat, sauce, bread - and i believe them...the asymmetrical bread with all of its imperfection in visual design - is complimented with the savory taste of the buttery blend...my heart was pounding with each bite (not sure because it's so good and juicy or that my arteries are working extra hard - probably combinations of both)...the price is not bad either....will cost you about $7 for a burger...but don't eat too much otherwise a bi-pass heart surgery will cost you about $350,000...now where did i put my blood pressure meds...

21.description: I took my family to this place after seeing a review on TV.  It's a small place and it was full, so we had to order to go.  We waited and waited and waited.... for a long time to get the food.  The hamburgers were good but not good enough for us to go back and wait for that long again.  So if you are planning on going, make sure you are not too hungry by the time you get there.  Be prepared to wait for a seat. The service was just fine.

17.description: Wow. ...I just had the best burger around! Juicy burgers and homemade parmesano garlic fries!  Yummy! The easy rider burger had amazing barbecue sauce and crispy bacon. ....delicious! The place is small but cozy. It was cold in there. ....the music videos were entertaining. ....on a cold day like today make sure you bring an extra layer of clothes.

10.description: I have a thousand good things to say about this place. The burgers are GOOD and the fries are GREAT. Plus they give you this little cookie with your meal that is a very nice touch. They have lots of fun beers and nonalcoholic beverages to chose from. Aside from the food I love the inspirational quotes in the bathroom and the owner is very nice too. He came around to say enjoy our meal which I thought was a pleasant thing to do. The decor is hardcore music but I would still consider it a kid friendly place. Cons: The place is small so it can get crowded and the food takes a while since they make it all fresh. If it's winter don't sit by the door because it gets SO cold when people open it.

5.description: Post baby date night: I have been wanting to come gere for a long time. I enjoy the occasional burger. When we ate there, the name was still Leadbelly but due to licensing issues it turned into BrgrBelly. Hey a rose by any other name, right?The House of the rising sun with garlic parm fries. Yes. Amazing. I loved the metal atmosphere but not too much where you are scared to eat that burger like nobodys business. The prices were not too shabby with the amount they give you, very reasonable. Ps. I saw this little wrapped thing and blew it off as extra wax paper, nope, its a cookie. A COOKIE!!! Heck yes!

3.description: I've finally made it here, even though this place is less than ten (10) minute-walk from my house.I may be a very healthy eater.  I consume at least two (2) large apples a day for lunch so the doctor is definitely out my eyesight!  However, one of my guilty pleasures is to eat a burger, a very well-crafted burger, with some gourmet fries on the side.  By the way, can I get a bottle of "Green River" as well?  Thank you very much.  Did that sound familiar to the pictures below?  It should because I ordered exactly that.  First of all, speak up to the gentleman behind the register on your "pick of the day."  If your appetite allows, add that oily-yummy garlic Parmesan fry to complete the feast for the night.  I chose "House of the Rising Sun" because there's a fried egg in it.  By the way, their patty is made out of beef and pork.  I know hubby's stomach doesn't befriend with Ms. Piggy, but he had no complaint with his "Good Night Irene," with crab meat on top of the beefy-porky patty to create an extra crunch.  The burgers appeared greasy at first sight.  I didn't think they were.  The meat was actually very moist.  I could tell that burgers offered at brgrbelly have a creative approach.  For adventurous eaters like yourself, or in this case, Rosa J., you're in luck.   In terms of value vs. quality, most burger entrees are within $11-$12.  Hubby and I spent $33 and some change for two (2) burgers, one (1) order of garlic Parmesan fry, and two (2) bottles of soda.  Thus, don't equate burgers you have at Brgrbelly to whatever that yellow giant "M" fast food restaurant assembles across the street.  Cut those cheapo, synthetic-tasting burgers from these fast food restaurant chains five (5) days a month.  The money you've saved from that junk will pay for a satisfying Brgrbelly burger.  Their unlimited music videos on their dining room TVs were incredibly cool and amazing!  EMF's "unbelievable" was on.  And yes, this song is also on my Pandora playlist.Since the dine-in spaces are limited, carry-out seems to be a popular option.  I personally will stick around for their music videos and bang my head with them like a rock star!

35.description: One of the best burgers I've ever eaten.  I like the rock and roll theme, it works here.  If I lived in Chicago I would come here every weekend.

19.description: Love the taste of their meat! :) and the garlic parm fries are too legit to quit.

28.description: Wow what a burger the bun is awesome and the rest what can I say I have found my new burger spot had the easy rider and enjoyed it too much also the Parmesan garlic fries ok now had a craving went back with some buddies had the gallows pole very good burger tried the belly fires oh so good ,also had the spiked shake wow it was spot on with just the right amount of vodka. I don't think there is a bad thing at this place we'll be back here for my future burger cravings

45.description: I so wanted to like this place. I have been meaning to try it out forever. I finally made it there and was a bit disappointed.I ordered a Leadbelly with jalepeno jack cheese and garlic parmesan fries. My friend ordered the chipotle fries and we shared both.The burger was huge, but it wasn't awesome. The meat tasted overcooked and wasn't very juicy. The bun had a garlic-y smear on it, which I didn't care for too much. The sriracha pickles were great though. As for the fries, they had almost too much garlic on them. I liked the chipotle fries best, but it would be difficult to eat a whole basket of them. They were rich.I bought the burger, fries, and a beer and the total came in just over $18. Not what I expected from what I thought was a burger joint.As for atmosphere, I loved the posters and rocker vibe. There were quite a few tables inside, and there is a patio area. It looked like it was going to rain, or else we would have sat outside. It was rather loud inside though. They were playing what seemed to be a Dave Matthews Band live concert DVD. I thought maybe the volume level only bothered me, but I saw someone ask the cashier to turn the volume down, so I guess it wasn't. The cashier turned it down 2 levels. Still too loud.I think I would try this place one more time, but if I didn't like the food again, I wouldn't be back for a third time.

33.description: I had their Midnight Burger at a pop up location at my work & it rocked my world. So tasty. The toppings are perfect tasting & perfectly proportional.  The meat was juicy & the bun was so fresh. I will need to visit their locations. My mouth is happy.

43.description: Delicious & Unpretentious. Creative gourmet burgers with a cool atmosphere...they were playing the David Bowie Live DVD while we were there. Outdoor seating and easy parking at this Portage Park spot! I am sick of overhyped burger joints. This one is the real deal. Homemade buns, burgers, fries, and gourmet sodas. My new go-to!

2.description: I had found out about this restaurant through groupon and wanted to try, with high expectations as I live nearby and have heard good things. So I went on a Saturday night with the groupon, and also my girlfriend. It was bad. I felt like they were punishing me for using a groupon and not paying full price. It took almost 45 minutes to get served a burger and fries. What got me mad though was that my girlfriend got served first, along with most of the tables in the restaurant, despite that I had ordered before any of them. They brought out my girlfriends burger (she ordered right after me) and I was waiting for mine. I saw them handing out food to people who had just sat down. So I went to the cashier and asked her to check on mine. Some woman taking a phone call heard me complaining and she told me to sit down and wait, that the restaurant is busy and I will get to eat whenever they get to my order. I thought this woman was extremely rude both with what she said and how she said it. She didn't even put down the phone to tell me this. Luckily a few minutes later a man came to my table and explained that he heard me talking with this lady. He had me give him my order and I could tell he went into the kitchen and had them make my order right away. This man, probably the owner or manager, was the ONLY one working who had any interest in solving my problem. I was about to leave and demand a refund when he talked to me, so kudos for fixing the problem before it became worse. Besides him being helpful, I had a terrible time. I think they rushed cooking my burger, because even though I ordered it cooked medium, it made me sick the next day. The reason I didn't send it back was because I was afraid it would take another 45 min to re cook. I saw the other employees rushing guests for sitting "too long" at the tables eating. This is extremely unprofessional and just wrong. They charge $9-11 for a burger, to make you wait almost an hour. For a burger that isn't all the way cooked. To be rushed out by the staff if you want to enjoy and take your time with the burger. All these negatives aside, the food does taste good. Everything from the bun and sauce and meat and bacon and even fries. I have to say if you do want to try brgrbelly there a few tips to enjoy it even more. 1) call first! The menu is online, so call ahead and avoid a terrible wait. 2) if possible, take the order to go. The sitting area is extremely small and overcrowded. When it is busy, the dining room borders on being a fire hazard. This is a complicated review, because the food was really good. I think I would give it a 5/5 just for the food.BUT between all the problems with the wait, service, and value ($15 almost for burger and fries). I feel like these guys ruined a successful formula of great food, good theme, and in good neighborhood. Their service problems force a low score 1/5

18.description: Great burgers they make their own burger buns which makes a huge difference the meet is fresh and a frys out of this world.I was looking for a good burger joint near my house and I found one on yelp and no disappointment there

41.description: I really don't know how people like this place??? The place is tiny and no room for people to sit. The food was HORRIBLE!!! The fries were tasteless and soggy!!! The Burger was even worse. And don't get me started on the service. Who hires these people and how did they even be consider to work in the restaurant business. What a joke!!! I will never be back and I will make sure to tell people that this place SUCKS!!!! If you want a good burger go to LockDown's or Kuma's!!! They know what a burger is suppose to be. Yelp really needs to allow us to give "0 stars"

52.description: We were recommended by a friend, and was worth it. It took some glue, 30 minutes or so. They were very tasty and for me were the best burgers in town. Situated in a park below the Flatiron building. Very reecomendable

50.description: They have amazing burgers and a great beer selection and that's all any real burger loving  human needs to know,extremely happy I live close to this place, don't question it just go.

4.description: 2 for 2.  Consistent quality both times I have been here.  The Old Time Religion burger is perfect on so many levels.  The bun melts in your mouth and the combination of arugula, roasted tomatoes, and goat cheese bring out an amazing flavor.  In two trips here I have sampled all of the fries and you can't go wrong with any of them. I need to branch out and try more of the burgers, but can't seem to pass up the Old Time Religion.  The butter cookie included is a nice little surprise to top of a great meal.

6.description: Amazing burgers!! I've been to Kumas and a few other good burger joints and I have to say, Brgrbelly is VERY good competition.. Buns are always fresh every day and the meat is pretty damn flavorful.. Since I work and live nearby I've been a regular here for a while now and every time I have a burger it's delicious!! Fries are pretty tasty as well!! The Belly Fry on its own is like a meal!!

22.description: This place is amazing! Burgers aren't my favorite but at Brbr belly they are seriously amazing. Their parm fries are to die for!

15.description: It breaks my heart to give this place 3 stars instead of 4 or even 5. I had high expectations for Leadbelly and I'm sorry to say but I was quite disappointed. I was looking forward to adding it to my "Best Burgers in Chicago" list, but it didn't make the cut. Darn. I ordered the 'Amazing Grace' burger which was topped with smoked pork belly, crispy onion straws, homemade spicy sriracha pickles, and mustard BBQ. My friend ordered the, 'The Gallows Pole' which was topped with swiss, onions and mushrooms. We also split the garlic and parmesan fries. One order of fries was enough for the both of us. It's a place where you order at the counter, you get a number, you seat yourself, and then they bring the food out to you. We found a nice spot out on their front patio. When the burger was brought out it LOOKED spectacular. However, the first bite was not magical like I had hoped...not at all whatsoever. The pork belly was too chewy and unfortunately I had to take it off because I couldn't bite through it while it was in the burger. I wish I had ordered a bacon burger instead. The burger meat was...different? First off it was not juicy at all, very dry, maybe it was more lean, but I know what lean ground beef tastes like that, and that is not it either. It tasted overcooked even though I saw it was pink bc I ordered it medium well so I'm not sure what was going on there, but I didn't like it. The bun was just okay, I think it was a brioche type of bun, which my friend enjoyed more than I did. The HIGHLIGHT of the meal was the fries. I thought they were fantastic and I would come back just for the fries.

57.description: The chicken sandwich  is not so great, the place is very small,  TVs are very loud BUT the hamburguers are delicious and juicy ,  the fries are made it with fresh oil, good quality meat.

20.description: Amazing burgers! Can't go wrong with this place. Just wish there was more room to sit. Prices aren't that bad. It has some good selection of beer.

36.description: Always in search of a good burger,  tried Sutherland, was o.k., desided to give them a second chance and they failed the burgers where dried and salty,not going back.  Didn't know about this place, glad we found it, don't want to mention the other burger joint that everyone compares to,  this could give them a run for there money and beat them.

14.description: MMMMMThe burgers are made with both ground beef and pork, and the corn buns are baked day of.  If they run out, no more buns.You pick your crazily-named burger.  It's similar to Kuma's, in that it is music themed and a burger joint.  But it's much calmer than Kuma's.  They show music videos and concerts in the place.  The fries are outstanding, lots of choices.  We usually get the pork belly fries.  The house made BBQ sauce is tangy and lightly spiced.  At the end, they give you a fresh baked cookie. Love this place!

3.description: Sadly very underwhelming. The one and coolest exhibit they have pics of with the dog tags wasn't up and the exhibits they did have were average at best. I expected a lot more for the "National" Veterans Art Museum. I literally could have finished walking through the place in 15 min tops. Anyways, I'm a Veteran and this is just one guys take on the place.

1.description: I went on a Saturday afternoon and only staff was there, which I think was disappointing.  I remember when this museum used to be on Indiana Avenue, in south loop and it was difficult to get to by public transportation.  It is small and on the second floor, but there is easy public transportation and street parking if you drive.There dog tag exhibit is not up in the current location, but is expected to be on in the Harold Washington library, downtown Chicago, starting about February 20, 2016.  I'm looking forward to seeing that again!!The museum is free admission, you can make a donation for admission if you wish!  I didn't like paintings in current exhibit, but did like the sculptures.  They have another exhibit which has several photos and 'stuff' a vet would have while at war.  I liked that exhibit!!

0.description: Folks, this museum is first class in gallery space, artistic expression from artist veterans and supporters. We were planning on spending about 45 minutes or so. We left two hours later, became members and befriended Destiny and George ; both wonderful staffers who gave us a lot of insights to current and future exhibitions. This is not the AIC or MOMA. It's better as the art is bonded in helping veterans and non veterans talk about a difficult topic through visualization of canvases, sculptures, ceramics and so many other mixed art media forms. You will leave the museum with your hearts touch by the stories of those that served our country.

2.description: Beautiful, moving, inspiring. It's a shame it's so far northwest and more difficult to get to than other museums. Nevertheless, it is absolutely worth going to. The art holds the history and emotion of our veterans. As a donation only museum with free entrance, everyone should find a time to go.The museum is small with only two exhibits currently: The 100 Faces of War and The Things They Carried. There is technically a permanent exhibit as well, which includes a few photos and art created by veterans.Far from the el, the museum is around a mile from the nearest blue line. Several buses head that way that you can utilize as well, depending on your location.

5.description: Winter can take its toll on anybody, especially the holiday season.  The dark days, the cold temperatures, the stress of searching for that right gift in crowded stores.  Things can get sort of out of whack for even the most well-adjusted.Just steps off of Michigan Avenue (and therefore the 1 or 3 buses), about two miles south of the shopping chaos, however, is a place that puts it all in perspective no matter what time of year it is.Started in 1981 by a group of veterans who wanted to give artistic release to their fellow Vietnam soldiers with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, the collection has morphed into an impressive reminder of the cruel realities of war and its after-effects.  And with the new batch of veterans returning from the two current wars, the museum has been updated to include awe inspiring works by Iraq and Afghanistan veterans - including a current no-holds-barred photography exhibition on Fallujah.  According to the docent on-duty when a group of us went down there, it's actually soon to be rebranded the "National Veterans Art Museum."Some of the works are very graphic - there are many pieces of art depicting violence and dismembered bodies - and show the place of confusion and pain that many of the artists were at (especially the room devoted entirely to PTSD).  But at the same time, other pieces display a dark sense of humor about what they've been through.  But all tell the story of experience in ways that words sometimes can't convey (and a way the can be overwhelming to those, like me, who have thankfully never experience conflict first hand) through a variety of medium including painting, sculpture, and even cartoon.It's not a solemn place, though.  It's very alive, in fact.  And it doesn't try to force an agenda.  There are as many pieces depicting heroism as horror.  It's not Oliver Stone and it's not Rambo.  It's reality.One thing though.  I felt a little more discombobulated than I probably should have.  There is no signage on how to get to the museum floor once you're inside the building's lobby.  They're currently doing renovations and to get to the elevators involves going through a maze of plastic and plaster.  I half expected someone to jump out in fatigues and scream at me waving a rifle like a war-themed haunted house.  It's not really that kind of place, but a bit more guidance might result in a few more visitors.  I can imagine people just walking out the way they came in assuming the museum was closed.It's not, thankfully.  But they do need donations (and visitors - it was deserted except for our group when we visited on a Saturday in November).  And it's well worth anyone's time to take a break from the "first world civilian problems" further north and pay them a visit on the near south side.

6.description: On a recent visit it is clear they are downsizing. Now they only encompass the 3rd floor of this building. They are in need of support for their efforts so I suggest you go and check out what the recent vets are doing and how they are expressing themselves through their art. Keep in mind to look up at the ceiling upon entering. That sea of metal are individual dog tags. They are representative of the lives lost in Vietnam. They have a staff of veterans that are eager to show you around and explain their moving pieces. Definitiely recommend.

7.description: My favorite museum in Chicago. I am always so impressed with the forthcomingness of the vets in the art. Very close to the heart.

8.description: A mean grilled veggie burger and some Vietnamese beer. A smiling late Bill Davis, and a whole lot of friends. That's what the Vietnam Veterans Art Museum means to me- Vietnam Veterans Against the War barbecues and Iraq Veterans Against the War art exhibits. And even just for the art, one of my favorite art museums in the city. VVAM has an impressive collection of great art that it rotates on its top floor, with tremendous works on its first and second floors, filled with vivid depictions of war on paper and in sculpture. And among the temporary exhibits, IVAW vet Aaron Hughes's great works on what he experienced in Iraq, which I have seen now twice, is closing in a little over a week. Definitely worth checking out.Also, this museum is always in dire need of donations. If you live in Chicago, this is another museum you owe it to yourself to visit, especially if it goes under and you miss your chance. And those who can, give generously.

9.description: Beautifully kept, solemn journey.  I thought about the therapeutic benefits of art to the artist, and hoped that this place was some small help to veterans.  More photography than I expected.  Please support it.  Oh, and the Mexican food in the cafe' was outrageously good.  Pleasant seating and priced right.

10.description: I recently read an article in the Chicago Reader about how badly this place is doing financially and I was extremely upset.  I went to the NVVAM in 2001 to write a paper about it for an undergrad class that I was in and it changed my life.  It's hard to put a finger on exactly how this happened or what the effects were exactly that make me say this, but the NVVAM was (and I imagine still is) a remarkable place.  If we lose it, our city will have lost something very, very important. What it is: it is a museum with artwork done by people who were involved in the Vietnam War.  This means people from BOTH sides and it includes nurses, etc., not just soldiers.  It is NOT a place where patriotism is the only way of thinking.  I am most definitely not a flag-waving, right-wing supporting person.  I am about as left as it gets, in fact.  But, I do think this place has an incredible amount of history to teach -- about war and its possible effects on the people involved.  One of the most interesting things about writing this paper was that I talked to most of the guys that were involved in the museum at that time and they were an extremely diverse set of people.  They represented the anti-military perspective all the way to the I-Wish-I-Had-Been-to-'Nam perspective.  This is why it is hard to state specifically what the museum stands for.  I think the museum stands for whatever you bring to it -- your own perspective will indubitably color your take on this place.I'd like to say that it's an anti-war museum -- that is the effect it had on me (even more than I already felt anti-war).  When you walk in, by the front desk, there is a quote on the wall (there was 6 years ago, anyway) by a Buddhist guy that seemed pretty overtly anti-war, but if I recall, it says something like: war isn't child's play, it's serious business, and if you're going to do it, you damn well better understand what you are taking on.  And, while I know that some of the guys there would disagree with me, if ever there was a place that spoke about post traumatic stress disorder, this is the place.  I can see (from their website) that it's a different set of people running the museum now, so I don't know if it's the same.  I know for a fact that my view on the content was heavily influenced by my discussions with Ned (the main guy at the time, whose last name I am forgetting) and so it may have changed.  His artwork was up there and it spoke to the incredible emotional toll that the war had; there was a lot of artwork there that was angry/painful/sad.  I don't know anyone that I took there who left without shedding at least one tear.Uff.  I have gone on and on.  All I really want to say, I guess, is: go.  Go see what it's about.  Support it if you think it's good enough.  If it's still as good as it was a few years ago, it is something that this city can't afford to lose -- it's something this country can't afford to lose.  It is critically important to be considering the effects of war particularly at this time.  No matter how you feel about war, it is a fact that we are going to have to deal with the consequences as the soldiers keep coming back from Iraq -- the effects run deep.

4.description: This museum and it's work is nothing short of amazing. If you are ever in the area, a visit here will not disappoint. I am currently in graduate school working on my Ph.D. in Art Therapy. I also lost my dad, a special forces soldier of 20 years, in 2004. Unbeknownst to us he was suffering from PTSD and commited suicide less than two months after returing from a combat mission. Art has helped me come to terms and cope with his death. Over the past ten years we, as a society, and as family members of the military, have certainly become more aware of PTSD and the struggle to provide judgement-free mental health care to our service members, and it is because of places like the National Veterans Art Museum. My father served in a unit of the Army that was highly selective. They recruited individuals and screened specifically for an signs of mental illness. So it is no wonder that if a service member at some point felt they needed the help of a psychologist, they might be reluctant to seek it, seeing as how it would potentially disqualify them from a particular position.  But when you think about it, shouldn't it be the individuals who can go to war, watch their friends die, take another person's life, and then come back to their families and not be uterly impacted, the ones we should be worried about? If you ask me, PTSD is the "normal" side effect. Not having PTSD sould be the disorder. Places like the NVAM are essential. They not only provide a crutial outlet for these service members, but they educate the public. They also let other service members know that they are not alone in their experiences. Places like this should be expanding, not downsizing.

0.description: They also sell lotto and cigarettes. Let me add, that the guy who runs it is terrific : )

1.description: This deli is around the corner from my house and I love the experience when I go in here! I'm not Polish so I'm not familiar with a lot of the foods but I always ask questions and am willing to try new things and the ladies in here are always friendly. This is the real deal, it's like having your own European grandmother cooking you up food and feeding you sausage, cheese and bread. Everything I have tried from the warm meals is great and I love to go here for deli meat because personally it has better flavors then going to a supermarket chain. Nothing questionable in these sausages and deli selection. I always leave with some of their homemade chicken noodle soup. It's so special and nice to have in the fridge to put in a pan and warm up. This deli is small so some selections are sparse, not tons of fresh fruits and veggies but they keep fruits that are in season which is nice because they always have sweet flavors. I love coming here and learning about the culture. I've lived in Jefferson Park for 15 years, it's nice to experience what your neighborhood has to offer even if you are not familiar with the food.

2.description: One of the nicest  "neighborhood" Eastern European delis in Chicago .  While  it may not have the square footage of some of the larger places in town, it has a wide selection of  prepared hot. food and house made salads.  I have personally sampled hot entrée items ranging from potato pancakes to roast chicken & pork stew. Everything has been exceptionally tasty and fairly priced. J & J European Deli's homemade sausages are some of the best I have ever tasted. There is also a nice selection of baked goods as well as homemade frozen dumplings and pierogi. All the staff speaks English , and the store is spotless . I really enjoy perusing the grocery items for all kinds of things I didn't know I needed to buy .

0.description: Definitely one of the best Polish delis in town. Prepared foods and cured meats are their specialties, along with plenty of specialty imported goods. Fresh breads and pastries as well.Sausage selection is very extensive, and free samples are usually available. Excellent bigos and flaczki, and a good selection of prepared salads, frozen pierogi, etc. The only place I can find podpiwek in the city.The staff are friendly and helpful all around, they speak Polish and English fluently and appreciate if you try speaking limited Polish phrases (they didn't laugh at least). There's a parking lot in the back, but there's usually street parking out front. The intersection can be a little hairy, so be careful if you're a pedestrian. Nice 1-2 stop with Sandy's down the street.

28.description: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Especially Eric Murillo. I walked in here on Monday during the day and didn't see one customer. After speaking with Eric, he assured me that he could have what I wanted drawn up and ready for a 7pm appointment on the following Thursday. When I arrived, Eric was standing out front and informed me that he was going to email me later about another artist who was "Better with black and shading". Upon being introduced to this new artist, he didn't know a thing about an appointment or what I wanted for a tattoo..What gets me the most is that I gave him the picture to draw and told him about another artist at another shop who did the exact same thing to me! If anyone knows where Steins from Jade Dragon or Matt from Family Tatto have gone, please inform me! Both of these guys have done work on me and are fantastic!!!!!I HATE BEING LIED TO! Thats exactly what these guys did to me and I hope people see this post and steer clear of this place!

1.description: A year ago I had gotten a tattoo done here that the artist (Frank) completely messed up. The lettering wasn't evenly spaced & it was almost impossible to read, so of course I was pissed & went back in to get it fixed. I spoke to the manager who was extremely apologetic and offered to have it covered up for free with whatever I wanted. Matt Ward ended up doing the cover up & he did an amazing job! You can't even tell that it's a cover up & I ended up liking it even more than what I originally wanted.

9.description: I love this place.! I was a walk in and ended up getting a tattoo by Chops. HE spent almost 5 hours with me. By the end i felt like he was part of the family. He was very attentive to my pain level and was very eagered to tattoo. He was even helpful in ways of explaining to my mom how and why i got another tattoo. Hes just a very awesome person all around.  I cannot wait to get more. Im in the process of healing now but I cannot wait til this summer to show off my beautiful thigh piece!!P.S. The portfolio that Chops has in the shop does not do him any type of justice.

29.description: By far one of the fastest up and coming spots for tattoos..... It seems like all the great artists I have heard of are flocking to this shop. I personally have been tattooed by "pinga" and "cadilliac bob" on multiple occasions and have always been thrilled with their work and plan to check out other artists I have heard of doing great work from friends. I have even had shotty work from early in my year fixed at this shop. It has a super comfortable vibe and is EXTREMELY CLEAN which is EXTREMELY IMPORTANT to little ol me. Their prices are some of the most reasonable in Chicago for the quality of work you recieve. Don't waste your time or money anywhere else..... lets remember people this is on your body forever. Take it from me, I have many a tattoo from the old "lame "dragon that bit the big one and I hate not to mention one or two from the gag factory back in the day before I was legal to get a tattoo. This is a good old fashion family style shop with a modern twist, theres  lots to look at like a little art muesum. Check it out!!

23.description: I really need to get back here soon for some new ink...i have gotten my last 5 tattoos here, I've been tattooed by a few of the guys in here, but i definitely found my new tattoo artist, Pinga. The three he has done so far for me are perfect so I'm not sure I would trust anyone more at this point for an awesome tat! Prices are always super reasonable here too as well, and the staff has always seemed really nice! Pinga.... if you read this, you'll be hearing from me soon!

5.description: Just got another amazing and perfect tattoo from a awsome artist   named KEVIN he does the most unique and beutiful   1 of a kind tattoos  this place is super clean and very professional  and personal and attentive i only come here for my tats i highly recommend this place lots of good energy and amazing artists female or male and a veriety of styles too somthing for everyone great prices and great environment  only place i will let my daughter get tattooed...and pierced  cause i know it will be done correctly.....

25.description: I stopped into Stained in Pain to get my third tattoo after a 17 year hiatus.  I brought in artwork ahead of time and Friski drew up the perfect reflection of my inspiration piece.  My tattoo took a couple of hours, but Friski did an excellent job of making sure I was as comfortable as possible.  My finished tattoo turned out better than I could have imagined.  The lines are perfectly straight and there are so many details that give the piece depth.  A couple days later, it is healing beautifully and I can really start to see all of the stunning nuances of the tattoo.  Friski is a true talent.  I wouldn't hesitate to get another tattoo from him.  I'll be back soon.

12.description: Albert is fantastic.  He does great, clean work.  He works with you to make sure you are happy with your ink and that everything flows.  True artist at heart and very creative.  I'm def going back to get my chest piece done and couldn't be more excited!  So major kudos to Albert!

21.description: I came in late night and there was hardly any wait. I worked with Rich. He's definitely a good guy to work with to get pierced. He's very knowledgeable and know ' s what he's doing. We took the time to figure out correct spacing and sizes and he was very sanitary throughout the entire process. Not only that but you just can't beat the deal. I got a snake bite and two sets of jewelry for an amazing price. I will go back to get my jewelry re set and follow up with Rich. Go here and get pierced by this guy.

16.description: Albert smart is the best!!!! So professional and such a nice guy. I can't wait to get more done by him :)

17.description: My husband went and got his first tattoo here. He worked with Kevin on his tattoo and couldn't be happier.  Very friendly and reasonably priced.  Thank you!!

10.description: Fantastic experience. Made a call got a quick appointment. Fair price and attention to detail. I've got about 15 other tats this is my 1st in an actual shop so it was cool. I'm already thinking of the next project. Erie is the man. Be back soon.

11.description: My tattoo artist has done three of my tattoos he is very professional and listens to my needs. I would strongly recommend him. He is great in restoring and cover ups.

26.description: 5 Star's all the way. A friend of mine referred me to Eric Murillo. EricWas totally professional and his work was impeccable. I will be back.

27.description: I came here for my second tattoo after I saw my sons tattoo. It turned out that my sons friend Kevin is a tattoo artist. The place is pretty cool inside. It is an old Chicago style building and they set it up like you would expect a tattoo shop to be set up. I was able to email Kevin a drawing of what I wanted. What he drew up was a little of from what I wanted so he was able to take a couple of minutes to modify the drawing to what I wanted. He started and before you knew it he was done. He even invited me back if I wanted or needed touch ups.I'll be back

0.description: Almost 3 yrs ago my niece passed away and the entire family was looking to do a tattoo tribute to her. My brother's friend is a tattoo artist here so we came here. Eerie our tattooist did an amazing job. Captured every detail I wanted to incorporate into my tribute.  I've gotten a lot of compliments on it. Recently, I went back to add some flowers and detail to that tattoo and again EERIE did not disappoint. Absolutely amazing. I'll definitely be back.The shop is clean and Eerie opens all new needles, etc right in front of you.

20.description: This place is amazing !!! I just got a septum piercing done and I couldn't be happier with the service !!! Richie made me feel right at home even though I was a nervous wreck !!!! I promise you these guys give top notch service !!!!

19.description: Waited for about an hour for Richie....my appointment was at 5 and he didn't get there until about after 6....He was really nice though. I got a naval piercing and it didn't hurt all that much. He was also very helpful! Even though I waited a long time for him to get there it was still worth it. I would definitely come back.

2.description: I'm lasering off two tattoos done by JULZ which let me say is an extremely painful and expensive but will be worth it in the end.  She completely messed up my arm tattoo and made it look like shit, she usually posts all her tattoos on IG but never did with mine, she didn't take ANYTHING I said into consideration and made the three roses on my arm the size that could probably fit my dads shoulder smh with horrible DARK masculine And ROUGH colors. I model so what I wanted was a beautiful feminine pallet of small roses the colors of pastel pink, blue and purple. I guess I did kind of let her manipulate me due to her extremely demanding personality and how "she's the artist" and knows what looks better" but actually no she's not a true artist at all, clearly and since I didn't like what she did with my arm or how she treated me I want the other tattoo she did for my removed too.  I'm extremely sad/ sick about this situation especially because people at work will always comment on how bad the tattoo is so I always wear sleeves no matter what..But you live and you learn right ?!

18.description: Had an amazing experience with Friski over the weekend.  A friend and I were getting matching tattoos to honor a friend who had passed away.  My friend had never had a tattoo as was extremely nervous - but was put right at ease.  Work looks great!  Thanks!

13.description: AwesoMe clean and professional! I love Julia A newer artest there. After every tattoo she always blows me away with perfection!

4.description: Richie is the best!I highly recommend him!4 months ago I got my first piercing with Richie, it was a breeze. He was professional, quick, and actually cared. He explained the healing process and gave me a piece of paper afterwards, which explained how to clean it. He gave me instructions on how to clean the piercing and what metals I should use, when I decide to change the ring, as well as how long to wait before I can change it. My first piercing with Richie was my belly button. Now, I have gotten my nipples, ears, and septum pierced by him. Each time he explained the healing and cleaning process. He was very clean and professional.He even helped me pick out earrings when I didn't want just plain chrome stainless steel for my ears and septum. He was able to find me a titanium gold septum ring.Every time I have gotten pierced by Richie it's over so fast I hardly feel anything but a quick poke. I honestly feel more discomfort when I first clean it than when he puts the needle through. I used to be so afraid of needles and getting pierced but his technique has totally changed that.The last piercing I got from him was my septum and naturally, I was nervous because it's my face! But it was over before I knew it and he even showed my how to flip it upwards so I can hide it while at work. He once again explained the healing/cleaning processes to me. I asked which gauge I should get for clickers that I wanted to buy and he let me know the gauge and when I could change it.All of my piercings have healed just fine with his help, his instructions are clear and he is always up for explaining things in more detail should you need further explanations. I have even recommended a friend for a "hood" vagina piercing and was there during the process, she was afraid and he made her feel comfortable and she said it was so quick and it didn't even hurt.

24.description: The love for this place grows a little more ever since I went for the first time when it was under different ownership. Love, please do not mistake for like. I would love to know why anyone would shit-talk this place because the people are awesome here. Totally professional and friendly. The first time I went I had my entire back done by a guy who is no longer there, but for a year I strayed around to different places until a friend recommended me to Brett, who is now my go-to tattoo guy. He's amazing with shading and great with proportions. It's a trek from where I live but I'll travel far and wide to come back! :)

6.description: This isn't your typical tattoo shop where you walk in and there are rows after rows of artwork to pick from and more than likely there are 20 or 30 or even more others out there with the same tattoo on their body.  This place has a few books to choose from as they are known for custom work...the way tattoos should be anyway, in my opinion.  If you're a walk in, they do have a few books to get an idea of the artist's work.My artist is Pinga, he was referred to me from a friend and I had him fix up a few tattoos that didn't heal too well when he was at a shop previously that closed down.  He is an awesome artist, very professional and as others have mentioned, reasonable in price.  I highly recommend this artist and this tattoo shop.  I will be there soon for my 6th tattoo!

22.description: Waited for about an hour for Richie....my appointment was at 5 and he didn't get there until about after 6....He was really nice though. I got a naval piercing and it didn't hurt all that much. He was also very helpful! Even though I waited a long time for him to get there it was still worth it. I would definitely come back.

15.description: I came here for my second tattoo after I saw my sons tattoo. It turned out that my sons friend Kevin is a tattoo artist. The place is pretty cool inside. It is an old Chicago style building and they set it up like you would expect a tattoo shop to be set up. I was able to email Kevin a drawing of what I wanted. What he drew up was a little of from what I wanted so he was able to take a couple of minutes to modify the drawing to what I wanted. He started and before you knew it he was done. He even invited me back if I wanted or needed touch ups.I'll be back

7.description: I highly recommend this shop. I have gotten a couple of pieces by Julz and she is the best! Her artwork is amazing and she does great work. Her suggestions are always on point and her calming energy makes the painful process much easier. The shop is clean and has free street parking right in front. Can't wait for my next piece!

8.description: Stained in Pain is easily one of my favorite tattoo shops in this city. It's large, bright, and clean, with friendly, knowledgable, talented staff. I have gotten 16 tattoos from Julz alone and I currently have no plans to see anyone else for my tattoos. Her apprenticeship ended less than a year ago but she's one of the most talented artists I've had work done by. She improves with every tattoo she does and I have brought multiple friends in to see her as well as given out her business cards to anyone who asks me about where I got all my beautiful tattoos done. 11/10 would recommend.

3.description: Just had another AMAZING session with Albert Smart!! We spent about two hours working on traditional roses on my back tattoo piece and cover-up. It felt like it went by in 15 minutes. Besides being incredibly talented, Albert is so friendly, funny and personable! His detail and shading looks spot on and has great depth. Plus the color is even and bright. Albert has all the talent of the great Chicago tattoo artists... With ZERO of the Chicago tattoo artist diva arrogant attitude.  It's going to be the best experience you can ask for all around.

14.description: I got 4 ear piercings done by Richie within a period of 2 weeks and they all became infected even though I washed them with antibacterial soap and cotton swabs 3 times a day as he told me to and took very good care of them. Not only were my ears swollen, but one piercings wouldn't stop bleeding for 3 days straight until I finally had them taken out at another tattoo shop because the pain was so bad I couldn't tolerate it anymore. I have sensitive skin and Richie uses the cheapest, shittiest metal that he probably bought somewhere on eBay for a few cents but charges $30 per piercing which is a rip off! I later found out that a piercer should use acrylic jewelry for sensitive skin, but Richie never offered me that option. I used to have my eyebrow, nose, tongue, belly button and lip pierced by other people in the past and nothing got infected, which leads me to believe that Richie is just a shitty piercer. I will definitely NEVER be going back and I would NOT recommend him to anyone!! Save your money and go somewhere else!!

3.description: I went there with my friends last night and was pleasantly surprised ! The costumer service was really great and I'll be definitely going back there again.

1.description: Always great experience here , delicious polish food, fest service. Definitely we will be back again .

2.description: Let's Euro tonight! White Party time.  Came here for a Euro white party last summer.  Danced Salsa, had strong drinks.  Pretty typical place for the area.  I used to frequent the area as a 20 year old little Polak in a short skirt to hit the couple clubs there.  Those days are gone so it was fun to be there again.  The party was just okay so we left earlier and ventured out to check out something else.  The Polish bartenders tend to make a strong drink for little money, love it!

5.description: I've recently attended a christianing dinner at the cafe and I have to admit it was a pleasant surprise. The cafe is nice and cozy with interesting and warm interior and really nice staff. The food was good and it tasted like homemade. I recommend the restaurant for either a dinner or a nice cup of coffee!

6.description: From its name, you'd never know that Retro Cafe is actually a cute little Polish cafe.  But, once you're inside, you're practically transported to Eastern Europe.  I think we may have been the only non-Polish speakers in the place, but thankfully, the menu is in Polish and English.  We tried the pierogies and potato pancakes as appetizers.  The pierogies were good-- we tried the meat, cheese, and sauerkraut varieties.  All tasty.  The potato pancakes were perfect-- crispy and not too heavy.  Also, I liked that neither appetizer was too greasy.We shared the stuffed cabbage rolls for our entree.  While traditionally they are served with a tomato sauce, these had a mushroom cream sauce.  Very rich and delicious.  But, the sides had to be my favorite part of the meal-- oven potatoes (perfectly seasoned, perfectly crispy on the outside and soft in the middle-- there's plenty of brunch places that mess this up, so I was really happy) and a beet "salad", which was pretty much minced beets and horseradish (sweet and spicy!  Delicious!)
