7.description: Everytime on the way to visit Alexandra's (the retail place that sells the most delicious potato pierogis ever!), I walk past this little place called Retro Cafe so I thought I should stop in and try it.  The lighting is very cool and the seating is nice.  It's a small place and seems like the kind of place where business gets taken care of in the back, which is actually kind of cool.  I was a bit disappointed they didn't have tea lattes, but the one waitress they had there was very accommodating, and she found me a chai tea.  The best part was the old, drunk guy blowing kisses at me.  Girls, be forewarned, there are a lot of guys that seem to frequent the place, but they are a bit on the drunk side, but they didn't bother me.  The potato pierogis were very tasty and they seemed to have quite a selection of Polish dishes and pizzas so I think it's worth a stop back in there sometime.

8.description: The fact that the food is good, is made inconsiderable by their trickery. 2 major issues:- I went in on a day when draft beer is on special $2. I asked which bears were on special and they told me "everything on tap". I said OK, give me a Zywjec. I had a few, and they appeared as $3&something/each on my bill. I asked why this was, and I got an answer - The small drafts are on special, not ones you had. (btw the ones I had were the ones that are considered small in your avg bar)- The second time I went, my wife and I decided to drink Coke. The glasses were basically dollhouse glasses, less than 6oz. Upon drinking our Cokes, we were asked "You want more?". Now, when you are asked if you want MORE, it usually means that it's a refill. If they asked whether I wanted ANOTHER one, it would have meant that they would charge for it. (I know, I've been a part of the industry). So, we had 2 each and ended up getting charged $10+tax for 4 Cokes. To add insult to the injury, they were disgusting, barely drinkable, one or the worst fountain sodas I've ever had.The waitress was in fact very polite during the course of the service and we considered leaving a big tip prior to getting our bill. Don't get fooled by their "specials"!!! It is the kind of place that struggles and doesn't get too many customers, so they have to gyp the few that go in.

0.description: This place has great polish dishes. If you are able to catch a peek into the kitchen youll see a grandma cooking up a storm. BOYYY she can throw down. The beers here are plentiful and the bar scene is pretty chill. You can smoke in the back outdoor/covered patio. Everyone there seems like locals and are friendly. I would definitely go back for a beer.

4.description: We went to retro this past weekend  while it wasn't my first time it was the first time that I actually had something to eat. Before ordering I presented a coupon that I purchased a few months ago from my companies discount website ,the waitress had to call her "boss" and then informed us "they don't deal with that company Anymore " and that she won't accept the coupon !! Even though it said in big letters the coupon does not expire !  . After all of that we decided to stay and just try to enjoy the food.  We ordered the salmon with fries and the sample platter . After waiting 45 minutes for the food it was definitely not worth the wait.  Starting from the salmon to vegetables and to the fries tasted like it was dipped in pounds of salt.    The service was poor and at times with attitude. The food sucked   ..also why advertise if you won't honor something that was bought at that time.. Won't see me here again.

1.description: We stopped here after our Lake Effect Brewing Tour for the $6 tasting flights. We sampled 3 beers each. Our favorite hands down was the Mini Porter. With its notes of coffee and chocolate, it was just perfect.The bar itself is kind of small, but it was not full on a Saturday in the early evening. In fact, as we entered, the last tour of the brewery was just finishing up their tasting flights and were heading out.The bartender was very nice and definitely knowledgeable, especially about the Lake Effect beers. He was also helpful when we tried to figure out where to head to dinner nearby. His recommendations: Leadbelly or Las Tablas.The tab ended up being about $30 and included 4 tasting flights (at $6 each) and 2 glasses of Mini Porter. So, the Mini Porter must have been $3 a glass? Very reasonable.I'm not sure I'd make this a destination bar, but if you're in the area, stop in. And if you're iffy on doing the flight after the brewery tour - don't be, Well worth it.

0.description: Cool little joint with lake effect beer on tap. I'll take it. And at $3 for these and most beers, I could hang out here. Plus bring your own food.

1.description: Well, they no longer have the old flavors for the wings but they still have wings so I'm happy. The flavors now on GrubHub says BBQ, Hot, or Buffalo. When we walked in there, the lady was also willing to make the Krispy Krunchy still.I used to order these from Krispy Krunchy's GrubHub but now it's only on Bub's GrubHub. Annoying that I need to go to both to order from the same place but whatever.

9.description: The food was so-so. The hot dogs and fries were great but the chocolate milkshake I ordered tasted dirty, if that makes sense. I ended up throwing it away. The cheese sticks had an odd taste to them also.

23.description: This place re-opened under new management. I decided to give it a try and i was very disappointed. It started as soon as i walked in the door. I order a chicken and pita sandwich (sandwich only) and they try to charge me $7.50! On the menu it printed the price as $5.85, the meal was $8.10 and it included salad, fries and a drink. Anyways, the guy behind the counter pointed at the menu which read " prices can change without notice". This was their new, current menu.  I told them to cancel my order. They then said they would take $1 off which i then agreed,  I asked them if the sauce had any dairy such I have an allergy and one guy told me that can't give out their recipe. Are you kidding? Then they asked the chief and he didnt even know what dairy is!!! After explaining what dairy is, he finally said it had a little sour cream.  I decided to write this because the food was TERRIBLE!!!! The chicken they used was highly processed!!!!  It did not taste like real chicken. I took a bite and threw it in the garbage! Beware of this place!!! What a rip off! I'm still hungry.

12.description: For some reason I thought this was owned by Greeks....maybe I thought of hubs cause of the signage.  However...the polish owner was very friendly and had the tired look of someone who worked hard....I saw th is because my dad had the same look those years he owned his own place.  I did like the proud flags og polans flying outside...people should be proud of their roots. Sigh...again I digress.His staff was energetic...telling me about some of the foods they had and how they made th eir own BBQ sauce.  Food was good and quick and filling, parkin space was ample and it had that pleasant smell of a small busniess ma and pa place that I miss so much nowadays....When in the area....I want to come back and try the Paceswzeski or whatever it was....sorry to butcher then name...I do not poemi po polsku. :(

21.description: Food is great! .Has alot more choices of polish food on the menu which is a great.the staff is always so friendly. Check it out for yourself.Dont pay any attention to Mike P.Hes the past owner who got shut down by the city.

16.description: This place has been in the neighborhood for 20+ years...constantly changing owners closing and reopening, I was down the block at my Barber and I decided to check it out as it just recently reopened.The owners/workers were friendly and helpful.  The drinks have free refills.  I had the Gyros plate as that's what I had a taste for and the verdict...not bad lots of meat plenty of flavor..Will return due to the nice people and it being so close by...

17.description: I wish i could give this place no stars.  Absolutely horrible.  By far the worst food we've ever ordered from anywhere.  Lets break this down...-  Ice cold food upon delivery, also showed up late.  When the delivery guy gave me the food he was on his phone and just shoved the food in my hands and walked away.-  All of the food looks like its all pre frozen garbage.  Not fresh, nothing actually made in house.  Just horrible, asked for well done sausage and it was barely cooked.  The bread was moosh and disgusting.  We honestly didnt even eat the food, we took one bite and threw it all away.-  To top off the delivery driver giving us cold food, he also forgot half of our order and i had to call him back to bring it to us.  Then once we opened the rest of our order we were amazed to find that even more food was missing.  We called the restaurant and told them about our missing items and without even knowing our order the person on the phone simply yelled, " well its not on the order, if it was on the order it would've been there!" and hung up.TL;DR save your money.  $45 dollars down the drain.  I wish i could've just picked up wendys or some other chain.  At Least the food would've been semi edible.

10.description: Not what it us to be, I ordered a gyro it can out dry and hard seemed like it was old , I asked to return it, showed it to them, they did not offer another nor did they give me a refund...never again will I go there

5.description: I live two blocks away, so this is very convenient. I used to eat here when it was just Bub's, and was under different management. I started going here again this month because I saw that it was now a Krispy Krunchy Chicken as well. I had never heard of KKC, but it sort of sounded like Popeyes.I have had the Cajun 3pc fish combo twice. They said it was catfish, and I guess I will have to take their word for it, the menu I have does not say the fish type. The first time it was really good. The female cook gave me about 7 pieces of smaller sized fish, and I liked that. The biscuit was good and so sweet. The fries were crispy. The soda fresh. They asked me what kind of sauce I wanted.The second time I had the same meal, it was 3 long pieces of fish prepared by a male cook. I liked how the lady served it better. Everything was good, but I was not offered sauce, and had to ask.Stay away from the Jambalaya. Salty. Gummy. Nasty. Unidentifiable meat.On the Bub's side of things, I had two Italian beef meals on different days. Once again, the beefs are not consistent at another establishment. Day 1 the beef was killer good, Italian herbs all over the place. Day 2, what a letdown. The beef had not an herb to be found. Nothing! It was basically boiled gray meat. I could not believe it. Warning! Do you like living? If so, do NOT order the supposedly Vienna beef polish. Nasty is thy name. I'm not even joking, that thing was not meat, well, I guess someone's head could qualify as meat in some circles. I don't hang out with cannibals, though. I'm not sure even THEY would eat the polish sausage Bub's serves. Please remove it from the menu.

11.description: My boyfriend and I really like this place. There's a lot of parking for a small place and the food is reasonably priced and they have a big variety. They have a lot of seating inside too and its always really clean. We've had gyros, wings, burgers, cheese fries and its all been really good. Definitely recommend this place!

22.description: For some reason I thought this was owned by Greeks....maybe I thought of hubs cause of the signage.  However...the polish owner was very friendly and had the tired look of someone who worked hard....I saw th is because my dad had the same look those years he owned his own place.  I did like the proud flags og polans flying outside...people should be proud of their roots. Sigh...again I digress.His staff was energetic...telling me about some of the foods they had and how they made th eir own BBQ sauce.  Food was good and quick and filling, parkin space was ample and it had that pleasant smell of a small busniess ma and pa place that I miss so much nowadays....When in the area....I want to come back and try the Paceswzeski or whatever it was....sorry to butcher then name...I do not poemi po polsku. :(

0.description: First time ordering here and my order isn't here which makes it 20 min late if I order anywhere I expect to get my food the time that it shows.30 minutes late now still haven't got my food on a Sunday when there is no traffic.I want to say this is the bubs fault it's eat 24 fault because they need really consider who they give a job to because I never got my food and I called bubs and politely told them I didn't want my food.

20.description: Great fast food place with some Polish options.  This place has new owners & much needed improvements.  It is clean, has an updated menu, delivers & has a great staff.  Ordered for the family a week ago - rib tips were extremely meaty, chicken sandwich was fresh (not frozen) Greek salad was large & very fresh, kids loved the chicken fingers...and the prices were extremely reasonable.  I highly suggest giving this place another shot if you have not been since it has changed hands.  It's the best fast food option around.

19.description: Food is great! .Has alot more choices of polish food on the menu which is a great.the staff is always so friendly. Check it out for yourself.Dont pay any attention to Mike P.Hes the past owner who got shut down by the city.

2.description: We have ordered from this place a few time but this last time just ended our business with this restaurant. Yes our order arrived on time but the quality of the food was awful. We got an order of the 4 piece fried chicken dinner and the only good item were the fries. Chicken tasted like it was old tough and dry, cold slaw was way too cream. And the Greek salad with grilled chicken way to many olives ... it didn't have black olives instead it had green olives and the entire salad tasted like them even after I took them out. Not sure if this place is under new management or what but it is not worth ordering from here.

18.description: Great fast food place with some Polish options.  This place has new owners & much needed improvements.  It is clean, has an updated menu, delivers & has a great staff.  Ordered for the family a week ago - rib tips were extremely meaty, chicken sandwich was fresh (not frozen) Greek salad was large & very fresh, kids loved the chicken fingers...and the prices were extremely reasonable.  I highly suggest giving this place another shot if you have not been since it has changed hands.  It's the best fast food option around.

13.description: I proudly admit that I eat at least one hot dog a week. And I'm glad Bubs is around to service this addiction. They use Vienna beef dogs and their dogs are very well constructed. The pickle is subtlety placed and the ingredients fresh. They are my go to hot dog spot for the neighborhood. They also have Chicago staples of gyros and tamales which need to go into my stomach soon.

4.description: Been here twice. Had chicken both times. Best chicken I have ever had! Takes a little while to cook but with it if you have the time. Try one of the honey biscuits. My kids and I destroyed 4. Very tasty.

6.description: The food is horrible. The lady that works there is nice though. I've been here a few times and every time I do I regret  it. For the quality of food they have the prices are too high. The food is definitely one star. I have two because at least the employees are nice.

15.description: Eh... maybe we got the wrong items or something. Gyro meat was dry and chewy, hamburger was gray, flavorless, and lifeless. French fries were OK, nothing special. Krispy Krunchy-brand chicken sandwich was pretty decent. So in summary, the primary redeeming feature of this place is that they serve someone else's chicken.

7.description: The BEST corn dogs in town! Bubs has been around for a while, so it's understandable that they switch things up. However, adding a Krispy Krunchy Chicken, wasn't the best move. Still the milkshakes and the overall food and service will keep me coming back.

8.description: I ordered today from Krispy Krunchy Chicken via GrubHub. I placed my order at 8:37p and received my food at 8:47p. I don't care what you say, a 10 minute delivery time is phenomenal! I've ordered from places closer than this that deliver much more slowly. That being said, my biscuits and chicken were lukewarm when they arrived. The heat of the chicken didn't really bother me because I have a natural aversion to piping hot foods, but it does let me know that this is not made fresh to order. I'm fine with this since it is remarkably cheap, but for all of the people with high expectations for preparation this might not be for you. (Just think of this as another fast food chicken chain).Flavor wise the chicken was decent. I ordered two fried breasts. I enjoyed the seasoning, however it was not juicy and there seemed to be a little bit more bone and breading than meat. The frying wasn't done the way I personally prefer it, but I can understand the appeal. Some people prefer more of a dry, crispy fry. If that's what you like this would be excellent! A couple sections of meat on my chicken were way too tough for my liking though.In it's entirety I'd say the chicken is just okay, but for the pricing and the delivery time I'd say you should give this place a shot (if you're ordering delivery or pickup).The biscuits should GUARANTEE your visit. If you come for nothing else come for the biscuits. They're a bit small but pack a great flavor. It's like they gave a pancake a biscuit texture. It's all kinds of right.

3.description: I miss when it was just Bub's. It's Krispy Krunchy Chicken now. The chicken was really good though. And their fries are amazing too. The gentlemen who took our order was very friendly and helpful. The only thing that I have to say, turn up your heat please!! I was freezing and had to eat with my jacket on. Other than that, good place to eat.

14.description: Nom Nom gimme some of this. Ordered everything from Italian beef to the dogs and beyond. Nothing has disappointed and I cant wait to keep exploring the menu. Looking forward to the pirogi, I have heard good things.

0.description: The best service company in Chicago prepared my espresso machine when I was told by another company that it could not be fixed the price for the repair was less then what the other company charged for checking my machine out and trying to sell me a new one completely honest Roger the past I would recommend this company to do your service at your restaurant he also does home machines give him a call

28.description: Dairy queen what can i say... it was truely amazing the people seem to love their job there and even your local milk man goes there....it was so amazing..... i def going to bring my family there

1.description: DO NOT ORDER FOOD FROM THIS RESTAURANT. Yuck. Ordered a burger, tasted sour and freezer burnt - I spit it out after first bite.  They don't wear gloves preparing their food! The Heinz ketchup packets were black. The manager of this establishment is unsympathetic to the negative feedback about the food she is serving and simply said to me "I'm sorry that's how you feel...."  Trust me on this one- zero stars for this place.  Unclean.  Dept of Heath needed here. Badly.  No joke.

9.description: Usually pretty decent but have really been screwing up my order lately

29.description: I second what Mark S. said.  The kids who work here just cannot get it together.  About 90% of the time, my order is wrong, or they just cannot hear me through that ridiculously dilapidated microphone/speaker thing in the drive-through.  I almost always come very close to running over some small children with my car when leaving, since the entry/exit to the building is RIGHT in front of where you leave the drive through, and the people who "hang around" at this DQ do NOT have an eye on their children.  However, Mark S. was also right in saying that they will not give you a hard time about your order.  Want 5 ingredients in your Blizzard?  You bet.  Want nothing but caramel, and lots of it, on your banana split?  No problem.My biggest complaint?  THEY DON'T TAKE CREDIT CARDS!It's 2007.  Come ON now.  I think it's safe to say that I would go there at LEAST twice as often as I already do if they accepted credit cards.  Sometimes I want a quick ice cream treat, but I don't have cash.  They need to get with the times, in more ways than one.

23.description: I usually love Dairy Queen. But everytime I want to grab a bite to eat there that is not icecream I always get denied because its an HOUR before they close and they "turned off the grills". Lazy, and pathetic. That doesn't mean Dairy Queen isn't a great place all around to get icecream... just don't expect to get some real food when you really want it.That's okay though, if you're craving burgers and whatnot - Mc. Donald's is right next door. :)

5.description: We go here all the time for our ice cream and blizzards. The staff messed up our order on our last visit. I told them what they messed up on and she looked and talked to me like I did something wrong. I'm not a fan of being charged for whip cream and nuts that they automatically put on and don't tell you about the extra charge (I noticed bc I looked at my receipt & compared prices).

31.description: Five stars for the summer ice cream memories. We always use the drive through right before closing and get us some hot fuge sundaes. Tasty! McDonalds is next door and cheaper, but I like DQ better.

25.description: The service here always kind of sucks. For some reason they get my order wrong about 75% of the time, though they always grudgingly correct it. The food comes up a little slow, and everyone behind the counter looks like their mother just died. Of course, past all that, the ice cream creations here are top notch. Never had a bad blizzard. I always get cravings for this place over the summer. Looking forward to that.My other minor complaints about this place, they don't play any music. I would take muzak over the silence. Also, the door leading into the drive-thru, brilliant. I'd like to do a study about how many kids get hit over the summer.

12.description: Went here on a super hot, super busy night. The line for the drive-thru and the inside were ridiculously long, but hey, it was a good night for ice cream. The staff was super nice and friendly, even though they were out of a lot. The grill was supposed to close at 9:30 PM, but stayed open for anyone (like me) that desired a cheeseburger. Food and ice cream came out as soon as possible, and they apologized for the wait. All around good visit, even if it was busy! I've been to this Dairy Queen before, and I would have to say my only complaint is the tiny parking lot.

21.description: Recently went through the drive through to get a blizzard, dipped cone and a caramel shake. Pretty fast considering the line, and the workers that evening, were nice and efficient.  Still a good place...just hit or miss on the workers I guess.

16.description: I love their food, really.  This is the only Dairy Queen 'Brazier' (don't think they use the term any more, but it means they have regular food, not just ice cream) within reasonable driving distance.  I don't use the drive-thru, cuz what I eat is WAAYYY too messy to eat in the car: chili cheeseburgers, yum.  They looked at me a lil crazy the first time I ordered one, but quickly relented.  It's a cheeseburger, plain, except with chili on it.  Simple.Yes, the counter-chicks here are a little....dull?  No big deal to me, it's not like they aren't everywhere else.  As long as they aren't outwardly rude or spit in my food, I don't care.  On the inside, I've never had a problem with the service, except maybe that they're a little slow, but not so bad.I will agree with Curt S. about the grill closing early.....I got here at 9:30 one night (I think they close at 11) and it was already operating in ice cream-only mode, in the middle of winter, it's not like they were busy.  And I had taken the bus specifically to get my burger and fries.  Very irritating, minus one star for that, but lesson learned.

17.description: The service here always kind of sucks. For some reason they get my order wrong about 75% of the time, though they always grudgingly correct it. The food comes up a little slow, and everyone behind the counter looks like their mother just died. Of course, past all that, the ice cream creations here are top notch. Never had a bad blizzard. I always get cravings for this place over the summer. Looking forward to that.My other minor complaints about this place, they don't play any music. I would take muzak over the silence. Also, the door leading into the drive-thru, brilliant. I'd like to do a study about how many kids get hit over the summer.

10.description: This was an awesome experience. I was excited to locate the dairy queen. Icecream was really good. The meals were great. Its children friendly and the staff were decent. I find it comical that the food was more expensive than the icecream creations, but hey, everything tasted great.

11.description: This location is pretty good,I can't really complain because during the summer it was obviously very busy..I do hate the way their parking lot is set up..it is so dumb and incredibly easy to have an accident. They can get really busy,and the drive thru line might even go out as far as on Irving park which can be a pretty busy street. Other than that,the service is pretty good and I loooove their double fudge chocolate chip cookie dough blizzard :))

26.description: Service is slow here, but it's the heart of the workers that counts! My family likes to get our fastfood cravings taken care of here. It's definitely the pinacle of fastfood!

27.description: I've always loved Dairy Queen's ice cream creations, but an extra "bonus" was the BBQ Beef  Sandwich which was served at the now-defunct Howard/Ridge location. (I'm not sure if they have it at Southport.) Junk food heaven!  The meat and sauce soak beautifully into the soft white bun and who cares about the calories? If the Southport store has it I may raise the rating to 5 stars!

0.description: This institutional neighborhood dairy delight has been here for decades serving portage park residents and the surrounding community great food,outstanding desert items for a long time. Good parking,nice indoor and outdoor seating. Consistency at every level. Come try them out they have a drive thru  as well. Enjoy

20.description: Don't know much about the owner.   But the service is good and it is always packed- line out the door.  I think over all great dairy queen product and very well trained great staff!  Kudos!

19.description: It's Diary Queen. I mean my standards aren't that high to begin with.....but the teenagers that work there (I swear none are even 21) are apathetic at best. They are usually slow, and often get the order wrong. That being said...I love their buffalo chicken strips (nice and spicy) and of course their ice cream treats are great. Just watch it since last time we ordered the chicken strips and two cheeseburgers and ended up with just the strips until we *inquired* about the burgers, and then ended up with two DOUBLE cheeseburgers.I'm glad we live within walking distance because in the summer the lines at the drive-thru are LONG as hell. And watch out if you use the drive-thru that you don't hit the people coming in and out of the restaurant. One of the worst parking lot/drive thru layouts ever!

33.description: i love dairy queen. it's totally the shit. i eat the garbage out of everything they serve there.there's just one thing. they aren't called Mr. Misty's anymore.thanks a lot dairy queen for ruining my life.

2.description: This used to be THE place to be when I was younger. I used to order an m&m blizzard. However, this place has gone to hell. The staff there keeps the place dirty. There are practically no clean tables, and the floor is sticky. We have never returned since the employees had a terrible work ethic, and kept the kitchen area dirty. We have found other ice cream places that serve creamier ice cream with a much better sense of hygiene and customer service. However, despite the complaints, it is a popular spot during the summer to get a dipped ice cream cone since it is near Portage Park, and by a bus stop. I am giving it one star simply because it honestly is not a hygienic place, and because the employees are too busy being slow with orders, or are distracted. I know there are other places to get ice cream in the area that would taste better and that would be much cleaner. As for the savory food, I have always been too scared to try it there, so I have no idea.

34.description: Oh, Dairy Queen - how all the fond memories of my childhood come up when I go here...they've definately grown up with the times - they still serve my Mr.Misty but the Blizzard has grown to all these different tastes such as Oreo and Heath Cheesecake and Strawberry Cheesecake!

32.description: This is my Dairy Queen.  I live within walking distance, and end up here more than I should.  As far as Dairy Queens in general, I like them- I'm a peanut buster.  Here's what's special about this DQ:1. The high school kids who work here.  They absolutely have no system in terms of taking orders, making ice cream treats, putting the $ in the cash register.  Do not come here expecting a well oiled machine.  Expect it to be crowded, and despite all the practice the kids get running the place, they'll still struggle to get your order together.  I REALLY have to fight to control the grumpy old German man in me and remember that they're a bunch of kids with a crappy job- give 'em a break.2.  Extra fudge.  Unlike at most DQs, when I order "extra hot fudge" on my order here I get zero attitude or hassle.  The girl just drops the extra fudge charge onto my bill and there's no issue.  It's incredible how often I've dealt with some prick DQ worker at other DQs who can't seem to handle pushing the extra fudge button on the cash register- never a problem here.3.  I once rode my bike here and when I came out to eat my ice cream, a praying fucking mantis was sitting on my bike seat!  I stared at that thing for like 5 minutes- all the while it kept its two giant eyes on me.  Finally it flew out into the middle of Irving Pk Rd & landed right on the line that divides east/west like it knew how to cross the street!  That was cool.

18.description: This Dairy Queen (forced here because of the demise of Toots) on Irving Park Road is simply D list.  If you want to manuver through the most atrociously designed parking lot, then get inside to stand in line for 20 minutes for a dip cone, then be my guest.  The three times I've been in there they've a) run out of vanilla (isn't that supposed to be your core product), b) had the most apathetic employees I've ever seen, and c) neglected to clean the place in ages.That's D list - and not delicious.

13.description: Extremely irritated. We usually just put up with the sucky service, since the next nearest DQ near us is in Park Ridge.  However today was the straw that broke the camels back.  Got charged $70 instead of $7 and all I got in return was an apology, a delay in refund, and melty ice cream.  We won't be returning to this DQ.

4.description: Childhood favorite, brings back the best memories from baseball games in the summer. I still can't believe I could woof down a Peanut Buster Parfait in its entirety. Service great, packed with families and kids making new memories. The employees looked as if they were having a blast, laughing, joking. Not the cleanest facility but it matters not.

24.description: It's Diary Queen. I mean my standards aren't that high to begin with.....but the teenagers that work there (I swear none are even 21) are apathetic at best. They are usually slow, and often get the order wrong. That being said...I love their buffalo chicken strips (nice and spicy) and of course their ice cream treats are great. Just watch it since last time we ordered the chicken strips and two cheeseburgers and ended up with just the strips until we *inquired* about the burgers, and then ended up with two DOUBLE cheeseburgers.I'm glad we live within walking distance because in the summer the lines at the drive-thru are LONG as hell. And watch out if you use the drive-thru that you don't hit the people coming in and out of the restaurant. One of the worst parking lot/drive thru layouts ever!

6.description: This place sucks! The service is rude and there is a vaguely unhygienic feel to the entire place. Would not recommend to anyone!

22.description: This Dairy Queen (forced here because of the demise of Toots) on Irving Park Road is simply D list.  If you want to manuver through the most atrociously designed parking lot, then get inside to stand in line for 20 minutes for a dip cone, then be my guest.  The three times I've been in there they've a) run out of vanilla (isn't that supposed to be your core product), b) had the most apathetic employees I've ever seen, and c) neglected to clean the place in ages.That's D list - and not delicious.

15.description: Who doesn't love a blizzard (or some other DQ concoction) on a summer night??  The staff here tries to move as quickly as possible to keep the line moving and get you served.  However, you can expect an insanely long drive-thru line of cars on a nice warm summer evening.  I've waited close to an hour in that line of cars (from the time I first enter the line to the moment I'm pulling out with my ice cream).  It's crazy!  I think you're beter off going inside sometimes.  Of course, then you come across the problem of having to find parking.  Not easy... walk if you can.

7.description: The worst. Not sure if the first posted but I have yet to return after my experience!  Drive thru , sloooow , ok your busy. Girl takes order . Have to repeat at window . 4 girls bunch up in the small space . Chunky hispanic girl hands us ice cream . I get my ice cream see that it looked like the machine just threw it up. So, requested for a re-do! The chunky hispanic by the way was the same girl who took our order , rolled her eyes to the back of her head looked likee she was convulsing!  Mean while, the caucasian girl is complainkng cursing because shet had to make a new cone with MF this B that. Mind you , customers are in the establishment.  Like, really! Anyways, they just laughed as we pulled off . Horrible horrible horrible customer service. If you can' t get it right at a part time small job I feel sorry for you when you work full time and have a career! Forever YOGURT, is our new family icet cream spot .

8.description: You can't really go wrong with a drive thru ice cream parlor. For the most part they get your order right. They have a wide selections of ice cream. This probably the best place to go to for ice cream in Portage Park.

30.description: I love this Dairy Queen. A major reason why my marriage may not work is because my fiance does not understand why this Dairy Queen is awesome. I want a Georgia Mud Fudge blizzard. They retired it, but will still make it for you if you ask. That's superior customer service.

3.description: This is the worst ice cream shop. If it wasn't for my daughter having a coupon I wouldn't have came here. Where do I start. So as we approach the counter no one was their so I said hellooo then look around I seen two girl standing in the drive thru looking at me like I was crazy. So the young lady came from the back somewhere took my order. So as we wait for the ice cream they young lady in the drive thru has her head phones and her cell phone in her hands.(so unprofessional) then one of the young ladies that was standing by the drive thru earlier decided that she better do some work and came in the lobby to empty the trash cans. I know this is a ice cream shop and mostly young people work here but where do you start learning how to be professional at a work place. It doesn't matter if it's an ice cream place or president of an bank you should always be professional.

14.description: The blizzards are great. I loved the fact they came up with the mini blizzards. You can try the different flavors.

3.description: BEST NAIL SALON EVER...... Anna and Knock are wonderful!!!!! I will never go anywhere else to get my no-chip mani or pedi ever, unless Anna decides to retire but we still many years to go!!! Wonderful place a  MUST go!

1.description: Where to start - the positive? 2 stars for....1) Owners and employees who are very nice and personable 2) Price is fair 3) Close to homeOh, the negatives! 1) Old decor makes the place look and feel dirty. 2) The fumes are overwhelming. 3) They reuse all their tools and do not sterilize. The biggest NO NO! I am honestly worried about whether or not I contracted something. Never again.

2.description: I got a gift certificate for Christmas from a family member that had heard good things about this place. Since I am new to the area I have tried out 2 places I found on yelp that I loved esp "hot nails" so when I was told by a local that this place was a good place plus they gave me a gift certificate I was very excited to go here. I took my 7 year old daughter to get manicures and pedicures to say I was very unsatisfied before I even gotten the nail polish remover for my toes. Yes I will be the first to say that I'm very very picky, but the decore means nothing to me as long as you do a great job. The guy that works there seems like he does not want a lot of business. I know they were short handed that week because I made it a point to ask so I could have a better understanding of why they operate so poorly but I watched him discourage people that came in the door as walk ins about how long the wait would be when realistically it wasn't that long. The girl that works there is very friendly and she did an amazing job removing the calluses on my feet but I was not impressed what the polish on my toes. They don't even put lotion on your feet unless you pay an extra $10 for a deluxe pedicure. It also looks as if only one of the pedicure chairs function properly because the chair that was right next to me or my daughter was sitting waiting for her turn had residual water coming up from the drain when the water was left out of my tub. Along with the dirt under my fingernails that was left I feel like my toes were quickly passed over and not properly cleaned.  I don't normally get a like almost clear polish on my nails but I didn't want to hate the situation anymore than I did already. I would never recommend this place to anyone

5.description: Been coming here for YEARS!!  Ana is super friendly and outgoing.  I love their service.  The actual mani/pedi is outstanding.  They leave my hands and feet baby soft!  I only wish their product would stay on longer.  They def need better quality polishes.  I now bring in my own polish so that my mani's last a bit longer.

6.description: Location is great, serivce: communication (guy) okay, (lady Ana) great she is friendly and moves quickly. Product can be better. The man can be rough, the lady does a good job, but for some reason within less than 2 weeks you notice that your hair is getting stuck to your nails ! I've been to other places and that is not the case ( diffrentl city) so if they can figure out how to make sure their product stays on for 2 weeks or more that will be great,

0.description: I get a great manicure here at this nail salon.  They are very good.  The decor isn't anything fabulous, but the prices are great. 30 for a mani pedi.

4.description: Ana is a doll. She is so nice and makes small talk and is funny. She did a great job on my nails. I got a pedicure and she was very fast and efficient. She massaged my feet and legs with some exfoliator. Then, I got a hand polish change. Lime green for the summer! Wonderful place and service!

29.description: This place offers good food for a decent price.  the atmosphere could be a little better - but for a quick cheap eat it does the trick.

42.description: just got into yelp this week, but glad to see the reviewers agree with me on this one.....i think its the best mexican joint in Portage Park....the family that runs the joint has always been very friendly and the food is consistent and tasty...particularly the chile rellenos, which i almost never order in most places because they're soggy, tasteless, smelly....here they are great!

23.description: I got a steak burrito and the guacamole for delivery. Both were underseasoned and just unextraordinary. I won't be ordering from here again.

8.description: Food lacks flavor, how does a mexican place screw up beans to begin with? Pass on this place

31.description: My favorite place on the NW side for authentic steak tacos! Perfect with a lime wedge. LOVE LOVE LOVE these tacos; it's only thing I get here, but my husband has tried other items (torta, tamale) and says they are equally as good. Take-out is the way to go.

34.description: Very good hole in the wall Mexican. Service was friendly.. Enchiladas were good and the Tostada was outstanding. 6 tables that seat 4 people each. We will return and they also deliver.

16.description: Pico de gallo is spicy fresh salsa, they apparently think its just vegetables w/o jalapeno......its not pico de gallo then.   steak  dinner was really bad steak, no flavor.  Burrito was meh, wasnt even wrapped up completely the insides were flowing.   No interest in going back.

13.description: Ehhhh, just alright. I ordered a pork torta, a steak taco, and a barbacoa taco. I ordered the tacos with onion, cilantro, and avocado and one of the tacos I got had lettuce and tomato on it. Now the place was dead when I walked in so there's no excuse for my order being wrong. Talking to the register lady, she didn't sound confident as to how good the food was. Apparently she's worked at several Mexican restaurants.

11.description: Got delivery 2 times and each time it was cold and long delivery to just Laramie and Irving and its over priced

39.description: Did anybody here mention yet that Mucho Gusto delivers? Well they do, and they are polite on the phone, no drama in the order taking process (always a plus!) and fast, hot delivery.The food is amazingly fresh - and once you see the place in person, it becomes clear why everything seems so fresh, in a small kitchen like this,  food is indeed cooked fresh, to order, not sitting around in a steam kettle. I'd think that if it gets really busy, service could get backed up - but we've never had that happen - they just seem to bang out these delicious meals,  no matter how busy it gets. And the food - it is amazing, seriously this is what Rick Bayless aspires to. Along with a menu full of traditional treats & dishes - the Mucho Gusto platter is definitely a 'must try', a generous heap of deliciousness with  black beans, chipotle peppers and perfectly seasoned grilled steak, the smoky chipotle flavor puts this one head and shoulders above typical taqueria fare. It's the kind of thing you find yourself craving.. (like I am right now, as I type :). Orchata and liquadas are also always freshly made and cold and delicious - even when delivered. Another reviewer noted that they gave 4 out of 5 stars because of the rundown kitchen et al - I'm doing the same. A first visit to the actual restaurant after many happy delivered meals was a bit of a shock, and as inner city refugees we're not fussy, trust me. It's just that they really  could do with some attention to clean-up/fix up -- tho the food prep area and people are clean and tidy - the overall defunct appearance of everything else casts a shadow over an otherwise amazing food experience. Still - don't be put off, and do try, Mucho Gusto!

37.description: Okay...so we go in there to order some take out. I have NEVER had a problem in this restaurant. I didn't bat an eyelash when my "good deal" place, who used to have cheese and sour cream come as part of the taco without charging more....started charging per taco like other places. Yeah, I know the economy. So I let it go. We go in there the other day and started ordering tacos. Adding cheese to the many we were ordering for the family. On the menu it says 35 cents extra per taco (which is a little on the high side already, for a sprinkle of cheese). The gentleman, which BTW I've never really cared for much when I've come across him working (I think it's the husband of the lady who is always in there...they own it). He starts ringing up each taco with an extra 45 cents each per taco. My husband mentions to him. "It says 35 cents, not 45 cents". His response was in an extremely crabby and pissed off attitude...."Prices are subject to change"! Hmmm... okay....so is it just because he feels like it today he is going to charge an extra 10 cents PER TACO over the 35 cents?? So our response was..."yeah, well my order is subject to change too, and I don't want it"...so we left and tried the place across the street. I'm not sure if I want to go back??? I think I'm going to have to really watch my bill, because who knows what he "feels" like charging at any given moment. There is nothing they give you like a receipt or anything itemizing anything, so you never know!!UGH, I'm so mad, that one of my favorite places is getting a "tude"!

0.description: Let me begin by saying, I have been ordering from this place for many years now and loved this place better than Amigo Chino steak meat-wise. I hate to down this place but I hope the new owners read this because this is a mild suggestion. Ever since new owners or management has taken over, the meat portions on a taco, torta, enchilada, etc. has turn into the size of GROUND BEEF or pellet size crumbs I can feed to my fish!The taste as well has changed, I get it, char-grilled but does it really have to taste like you scraped it literally "off the grill"? The previous owners had bigger sized steak meat as well. I almost thought they had my order wrong when I ordered an enchilada plate with steak not ground beef. The portions here have always been small visually unlike Amigo Chino with their extraordinary size torta that 4 people can eat but I have always loved the meat from Mucho Gusto. But now the taste has become a disaster,I understand increase the heat equals faster service but don't sacrifice flavor. I rather wait for good cooked meal than to have fast food garbage. Either scrape off all the excess charred burnt tasting meat off the grill before cooking or lower the fire, cause everyone knows how a burnt tasting piece of meat taste like on a grill and this is not even a t-bone steak, its little pellets of meat that pigeons can begin to eat now.A fancy little tablet looking register, a pretty face to go behind it slash waitress, and customer service has improved but all that can only go so far. If you don't have good tasting food, I don't know what will happen to you guys. Now every time I order I hope that the meat just didn't burn in flames. Good luck to you guys, When Amigo Chino opens back up, you will need some serious thinking to do, and I don't even like Amigo Chino, their meat is even worst, just to be honest!

38.description: It was another evening when I visited someone hospitalized at Resurrection Hospital at Addison & Central. I did not want to try Cochiaro's Pizza [c.v.] so soon again. I walked the four blocks north to Irving Park. I rejected the chain restaurants there (although I did look at the menu board at the Dairy Queen), and opted for Mucho Gusto. (There is Taqueria Amigo Chino [yelp.com/biz/taqueria-am…, _another_ Mexican restaurant, across the street from it.)I was convinced to try it because it has a $3.99 ground beef burrito special (currently). The venue is small. That is why I voted "no" on "Good for Groups". There are six tables. I sat at one of them.Even with this $3.99 special, if you eat in, you get the basket of tortilla chips and two salsas, red and green. The green salsa is more fiery. I preferred the red salsa. But both of them were made on the premises [i.e.: Not poured out of a one-gallon tin can]. The burrito arrived in five minutes. The ground beef was good. I did not specify 'no tomatoes' in my burrito (which I usually do, but I forgot this time), but the amount of tomatoes therein [diced] was not so overwhelming that I was scooping it out. The onions and lettuce were in equal proportion to the tomatoes.I change off from steak burritos [carne asada] to ground beef burritos [picadillo] occasionally. This was one of the better ground beef burritos I have had.I'm giving it a four-star rating. It is in the center of four stars. The slightly dishevelled appearance of the venue is due to that this is the family's restaurant. There is probably not a salaried person working here. That itself wouldn't prevent me from giving it five stars; but there is also the fine edge that I think you will go over ten bucks a person when you eat here. That holds it down a  1/2-star. If you consume pork [I try to avoid this.], you can request a pork taco for one dollar.Transit options: This is easy. Central is the road to | from the Forest Glen Garage for many of the east-west bus routes including the #80 Irving Park & the #X80 Irving Park Express. You will be able to catch the #80 back east from here nearly every hour it is open. The #85 Central bus will get you out of here in either direction all the time.

27.description: This place should be on "Diners, Drive-In's, and Dives".. The Mojarra is amazing!!!

32.description: The biggest freakin burritos I've ever seen, served on a long slab of wood.  Seriously, this is one tough burrito to finish, but it's tasty enough to try.

44.description: Nachos! Quesadillas are good too. I've had other stuff... don't remember exactly what, since I usually just get an order of nachos and quesadillas, but it's always all good.

24.description: Nasty, nasty, nasty. Food was gross. Tasted overly greasy and not fresh. Guacamole was not fresh or seasoned ... I mean really? Not edible. I'm starving and I still threw the food away.

7.description: The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that it's not closer to my house haha.  I tried this spot with my girl last night for the first time and it was excellent. We had a takeout order and all the things we asked for as far as customizing our orders was on point. I had a steak taco dinner and the meat was awesome. Char-grilled, real carne asada (not to be mistaken with bistek). My girl had the chicken flauta dinner and that was excellent. Definitely a new go-to spot for tacos in my book. I have some of thee best tacos joint in my neighborhood so I definitely know good tacos when I taste them!

40.description: After living in Portage Park for nearly six years I was a little wary of this place.  It looked like a craphole wedged between Little Caesar's and 7-11.  But after reading other yelpers give it good reviews I finally tried it out.  Freakin' great Mexican food!  I will absolutely continue to give this place my business.  The only downside is I don't think it's really geared for a sit down meal.  The atmosphere is nonexistent and it does get pretty warm inside on summer days.  Much better for take-out orders.

30.description: Loved this place under the previous owners, and am sad they are no longer there. Been going there since I moved to Portage Park in 2001. Food is always high quality. Atmosphere.... not so much, but the quality of the food always drew us back.Have eaten there several times since the new owners took over and am pleased to say that the quality has not suffered a bit.

46.description: From the outside, in a strip mall next to a 7-11, Taqueria Mucho Gusto doesn't look like much. Leave your assumptions at the door!Outstanding Chile Rellenos - crisp fried to order in the tangy, but not too spicy ranchero. Porky, crispy tacos al pastor and fresh squeezed orange juice for a mere $2 a glass. It is not a place to go for the ambiance, but your eyes will be closed due to the porky taco bliss, so who cares!

1.description: I'm scratching my head because its difficult for me to bash a small business owner but I believe  it's my duty to report the truth. I've been in the restaurant business for years and still till today I carry my city&state managers sanitation license & Bassett servers license  even though I no longer own . I know that  most restaurant owners work very hard to produce great food,outstanding service,and a great atmosphere for customers but when you have slackers who cut corners either in front or back of house it can kill your reputation and ruin your business. Today I entered into this establishment hoping that I found a new spot that can produce a simple great steak taco close to my families home but boy was I wrong. The place is nice and clean ,the young lady at the front is a diamond in the ruff with her superb customer service skills. But the cook in the back needs to go to sanitation class because he doesn't know anything about temperature control and time management in knowing when you need to get rid of meat that's not fresh and juicy what a shame. You only get one shot to wow me or any new customer for that sake with something so simple as a taco. The meat was small nasty over cooked pieces that was tasteless & dry. The tortillas were stale. How can you call yourself a cook if you serve that kind of crap. You must taste your food before you send it out. I love supporting all local businesses but unfortunately I will never be returning. Sorry they need to go back to the drawing board.

9.description: Awful.  Just awful.

26.description: Mucho Gusto is absolutely delicious.  We are from Los Angeles where it's common to find a taco truck or stand on most corners and we miss that.  Well, we found this place and we feel good again!  We enjoyed pastor tacos and carne asada burrito.  Both had a ton of flavor.  Chips and salsa are free and they have red and green sauce.  Very spicy and very good! The staff was attentive and the price was great.

25.description: Had lunch here today.  I was at nearby Portage Park and was looking to get lunch. I decided to check Yelp on my phone and located De Mucho Gusto.I thought the Chips and Salsa was OK. The chips were good, but not the best I've had. The salsa both red and green had a kick to them.For lunch I decided to try the tacos. I had a steak and a ground beef taco.The steak was tender and full of flavor. The toppings were fresh and complimented the steak very well. The ground beef had a lot of flavor and very juicy.It's very simple inside, but clean. The people were very friendly.I will be returning...

12.description: Bad service.  Waited 1 hour and 45 mins for food until I had to call and cancel.  The guy who I spoke to with no remorse said "ok bye, Don't order from this place." Rude!!!!!

21.description: This place used to be great but now not so much. They changed owners and went down the crapper. The steak is not filled with so much gristle it makes it almost impossible to eat. The only thing that is still good is the salsa verde. Other then that two thumbs down. It's a shame to because they are one of the few places that deliver.

17.description: When I moved into the Portage Park neighborhood 3 years ago, this restaurant was under different management. The food was greasy and more than once, I regretted eating there.BUT THEN...something delightful happened. The new owners moved and turned the place around. The ambiance is like being in a busy latin kitchen, the telenovelas are on every tv, the owner's family members are eating at the tables and there is laughter everywhere.Whenever, I'm home for lunch, I will always bypass the Mexican giant on the corner and go to Mucho Gusto for my taco fix. They already know me there and are ready to serve me up whatever deliciousness my heart desires.One the occasion that I actually go for a sit down dinner there, the service  is impeccable. The young waitress with the heart of gold is always ready with water or the drink of your choice, she is attentive and delightful. The food is home cooked to perfection.I always say that if you aren't from Portage Park, you'll probably end up at Amigo Chino where I find the service atrocious and the food over priced. But if you are from the neighborhood, you will always choose Mucho Gusto.  This is a business that my stomach is happy to support.

10.description: Very disappointed. I've ordered from this place multiple times in the past, but today was awful. Ordered cheese only enchiladas and received chicken enchiladas. Asked for no onions on anything. Received onions on multiple items. The quesadilla was so greasy it wasn't even being held together by the melted cheese and just tore into shreds when moved. Sorry, De Mucho Gusto, everyone has a bad night, but three mistakes is too many for one meal.

5.description: Quick and Easy,Walked in with a group of friends.Very casual but the food was pretty good.I ordered a Torta with all the trimmings. Sou rcream, cheese, beans, LTO, super good. If in the neighborhood I'd definitely go back.Beware of the green salsa....sooo spicey.

3.description: Been coming here on and off since its inception along with several management changes ....not sure about the ownership. The food has always been very good here ..however on this  visit, service just stunk... The very uninterested waitress and gave us chips and salsa..... no napkins no plates..... Took our order and never came back ...gave us our food never checked back again.. Someone should train that waitress a little bit better

35.description: I agree with Frank  stay away from Amigo Chino .  Mucho Gusto has good quaility food and the prices are ok.  Steak burrito dinner with rice & beans  is my favorite.

19.description: Mucho TERRIBLE!  One star is too many.  Thought I'd try again since they changed ownership. Food is really bad since the new owners took over. Ordered a torta - mostly all lettuce, not much else. Very little egg and chorizo and not even any beans or cheese.  Everything was dried out and burned.  I called ahead so it would be ready when I got there. Took 3 times as long as they promised me to make one sandwich.Won't go back again. Don't waste your time or money either.

28.description: When I moved into the Portage Park neighborhood 3 years ago, this restaurant was under different management. The food was greasy and more than once, I regretted eating there.BUT THEN...something delightful happened. The new owners moved and turned the place around. The ambiance is like being in a busy latin kitchen, the telenovelas are on every tv, the owner's family members are eating at the tables and there is laughter everywhere.Whenever, I'm home for lunch, I will always bypass the Mexican giant on the corner and go to Mucho Gusto for my taco fix. They already know me there and are ready to serve me up whatever deliciousness my heart desires.One the occasion that I actually go for a sit down dinner there, the service  is impeccable. The young waitress with the heart of gold is always ready with water or the drink of your choice, she is attentive and delightful. The food is home cooked to perfection.I always say that if you aren't from Portage Park, you'll probably end up at Amigo Chino where I find the service atrocious and the food over priced. But if you are from the neighborhood, you will always choose Mucho Gusto.  This is a business that my stomach is happy to support.

45.description: Best Tripas in Chicago.  I've been searching for food this good ever since I moved to town.  I only wish Mucho Gusto was closer to the loop.  I'd seriously pay a $20 delivery surcharge to get them to deliver downtown.

33.description: I've grabbed take-out from this place a few times, and it's pretty good. But my most recent experience there was a disappointment. I ordered a burrito al pastor and guac & chips to go. When they handed me the bag, I thought they must have mistakenly given me someone else's order - it was extremely HEAVY and I assumed there was much more than one burrito and guac in there. Well, it was my order, it's just that the burrito was HUGE. While I appreciated its generous size, it was the worst al pastor I've ever had. The meat was chock full of inedible fat and grissel. Everything else about it was fine, but the meat was inedible, so after trying to pick out the bad parts, I ended up throwing the rest of it away. The guacamole was excellent, and I will probably give this place another try. But I will definitely avoid the al pastor, and possibly their meat altogether.

43.description: This place has been down the street from me for the whole 2 years I've lived here and I've never stopped in......probably because taqueria's like this are not only a dime a dozen, but it's hit or miss on whether or not I'll get food poisoning or there will be someone there who can take my order in English (my Spanish is rudimentary at best). Well we finally stopped in last night, and I WILL BE BACK. The food was great! I had a carne asada burrito and an order of nachos. It was tasty, quick, and fresh! If you dine in they even give you a complimentary basket of amazing tortilla chips. The reason that this place is 4 stars and not 5 is that it feels much more like you are in someone's kitchen that in a restaurant. That isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it seems like the combination of the lack of decoration/disrepair and slightly unprofessional staff knocks it down one star.

2.description: Friendly staff but the chicken burrito was honestly disgusting. It was watery and had an unnecessary brown sauce on it. Should of been chopped and not shredded in my opinion

18.description: Loved this place under the previous owners, and am sad they are no longer there. Been going there since I moved to Portage Park in 2001. Food is always high quality. Atmosphere.... not so much, but the quality of the food always drew us back.Have eaten there several times since the new owners took over and am pleased to say that the quality has not suffered a bit.

41.description: I am STUNNED that people like this place.  Yes, the food IS good.  But the atmosphere and "hidden" prices are just too much.We have been here a few times, and this last time was the LAST for us.  The food is not the problem, it's them.  The place is ridiculously hot.  All they have is one small fan, and there is an air conditioner, but it's never on!  The place is not very clean looking either which I guess is the reason why the lady decided to drag out the bucket and mop while people were eating, washing the floors around us and under us, filling the room with huge amounts of bleach and cleaning fluid.  It was disgusting.Also, our $7.50 meal ended up costing $11.  Why?  The "hidden" shit - she actually had the nerve to charge us an extra 40 cents PER ITEM AND PER TACO!!!  That was ridiculous.  A 3 taco meal had an extra $2.40 added on for a  few sprinkles of cheese and 2 slices of avocado.  When confronted, she was indifferent and refused to budge.  We will never be back here again.

4.description: Terrible customer service.  Delivery took over 2 1/2 hours with no communication from the restaurant.  After waiting all that time they forgot one of the main items on the order.  Then they were refusing to refund the cost of the item they forgot on my order and wanted to give me a credit.First and last time I'll order from there.  Really crappy and rude people that have no concept of customer service.

6.description: This place it my default neighborhood Mexican joint, and my family and I order dinner from here at least once every 4-6 weeks.  I can't comment on the atmosphere or the service, as we always order for pickup, but I could not be more pleased with the food.  I'm a big fan of the pastor tacos and nachos with avacado, while my boyfriend always orders and sings the praises of their steak burrito.

22.description: This place is pretty good. Their carne asada is very good. The salsa is decent.  I went to the Mexican restaurant across the street from them once which seems to get more business and I think this spot is 10x better. Prices are a little more then other places which I think is stupid but overall it's a good restaurant.

15.description: Had lunch here today.  I was at nearby Portage Park and was looking to get lunch. I decided to check Yelp on my phone and located De Mucho Gusto.I thought the Chips and Salsa was OK. The chips were good, but not the best I've had. The salsa both red and green had a kick to them.For lunch I decided to try the tacos. I had a steak and a ground beef taco.The steak was tender and full of flavor. The toppings were fresh and complimented the steak very well. The ground beef had a lot of flavor and very juicy.It's very simple inside, but clean. The people were very friendly.I will be returning...

20.description: the food here is always good , the steak is of good quality and cooked well !!  the only thing i didnt like was that they charge for there chips and salsa when u dine in! where all mexican restaurants that is complimentary, not here !!! cause of that i didnt give it 5 stars , i suggest dont dine in it will cost u for ur appetizer thats suppose to be free !!

36.description: I love this place!  It is about 2 minutes from my house, and always SO DELICIOUS!!!  Enchilada dinner with double side rice.... spicy sauce.... yummy!  If I had it my way, I'd eat there all the time.  Seriously.  This is not an exaggeration.

14.description: I really love the cheese enchiladas & the chilaquiles and order from them all the time, but they are never there in the mornings. For example, it is 10:23AM and the phone rings and rings. This is not the first time, it's actually more like the 5th time. I don't know why they say that they open at 9:00AM. Please update your hours of operation.

58.description: Yesterday was my first time helping myself to "Be Well" both literally and as the name so simply tells you to.  I have neglected myself, my pain issues and my overall health for quite sometime now, and I truly needed to make time for myself to finally *be well.*  Boy, am I glad I did.I let my back pain move deeper (a.k.a. letting it get worse by not addressing it) and it didn't help to have 2 months of high stress from full-time work and school.  I told the massage therapist (Marc) that my main issue was the stress, tension and pain deeply embedded in my neck & shoulders that also carried straight into my left shoulder blade.  Since I have had this pain for a good 10 + years, I got the 100 minute Be Well Signature massage. I needed that extra time and then some! (It goes by so fast).It was worth every penny.Marc's hands are *made* for healing.  I personally like a lot of pressure because my shoulders & neck are so tense and tight with plenty of crunchy knots.  I didn't have to request this, he made sure to ask what kind of pressure I prefer and what I have found relieves my discomfort.  After my session I felt like a cooked spaghetti noodle.  But feeling like that post-massage is nothing new to me; massage therapists I have had in the past usually always get me to the cooked spaghetti noodle state too. What makes this experience different and more extraordinary is that he really did tailor the treatment to exactly what was going on with my body.  He took the time to ask me very specific questions.  When I asked questions, I was very impressed not only by his wealth of knowledge on the human body, but how "in tuned" he was with the human condition of pain as a whole. The massage I got from him was definitely not a one size fits all.  And because he paid special attention to my problem areas, my neck has never felt this kind of "release" I am experiencing today. I can't remember the last time it has felt actually "relaxed" like this. He has an uncanny knack for really finding the source of your pain.  I will quote Diane S. "he always manages to find *just* the spot it's radiating from in the most unexpected places." I couldn't have put it better, Diane. Marc definitely has a gift.FYI, the actual environment is quite warm and cozy.  Others gave the smaller space a thumbs down. But I thought the small space made it that much more personal, cozy and an overall perfect mood-setting for an Eastern spa-like healing environment. In this setting, less is more. The sauna and rain shower are definite must try perks too!  I thank my lucky stars I found you, Marc. Thank you, THANK YOU.

56.description: Had a Relaxation Massage yesterday.............fabulous!! I'm thinking this is an easy holiday gift to give- and who wouldn't want it??!!

29.description: I thought the couples massage was up to standards.  When my husband and I arrived we were offered really good green tea.  Then we had about 10 minutes in the hot sauna and I wondered if it counted for the 60 minute massage... but we still had a full 60 minute massage.  I wish it could have been more "couple-y".  We were in the same room during our massage but separated by a partition... so we couldn't see each other and we weren't really "together".  But the massage felt great.  The steam shower after the massage was wonderful too.  Overall it seemed like a steep price for $200 but we enjoyed it and it felt like a fun special occasion as a couple.

42.description: We are so lucky to have this wonderful spa right around the corner!  I am sorry I have not written this for you sooner Julie and Rico!I have had many massages at other places- but this is the best yet!  Julie worked so well for me to get a therapist/time that worked in my crazy schedule.  I am so glad I found them.The spa is clean and beautiful.  The massages FANTASTIC and afterwards you can relax because you did not have to spend an arm and a leg to get such great service.Thanks so much for your super services!

23.description: Owner was super helpful and friendly, and the massage therapist (Marcus?) was knowledgable and did a great job loosening me up during marathon training.

47.description: I was able to book appointments for myself, my mom and my cousin with pretty short notice, and Be Well was able to accommodate all three of us at the same time!  The service was wonderful--my mom, who is a massage therapist, mentioned that this was one of the better massage experiences she's ever had.  We all left feeling really wonderful!

8.description: I surprised my husband with a Valentine's Day gift certificate for a couples massage. Julie responded to my E-mails very quickly and was extremely helpful in scheduling our appointment. I have had massages before, but never anything quite like this. After we changed into our robes, we were shown into a sauna for about 10 minutes. That was nice. Both our massages were excellent. Corey was my massage therapist, and I would definitely book with him. I don't recall the name of my husband's massage therapist, but he said she was wonderful, too, and worked on all his problem areas. Finally, we each finished up with a nice steam shower with beautifully scented hair and body products. It was a great experience overall. Really my only complaint (and it is such a minor one!) is that we were asked to remove our shoes when we entered the business. I'm not sure if it was because people were tracking snow and salt in, or if this is a year-round practice, but I was a but uneasy walking around the lobby in flip-flops. In the grand scheme of things, though, it was so minor as almost not to warrant mentioning. The environment was clean and comfortable (a major complaint with some of my past attempts at massages!), and the music was extremely relaxing. It might be a bit too expensive for us to become regular customers, but I think we'll be back for an occasional treat.

31.description: Great couples massage with my husband at Be Well. We called in the morning without much hope, and Rico was able to get us in that afternoon! Loved the sauna before and the steam shower after. Wish there was a little more room in the steam shower, but overall, a great experience. I will be back!

34.description: Chisato did one of the best jobs at a massage I've almost ever had.  I saw one review where someone gave a negative review because they didn't do a full medical intake (maybe you should see a doctor then) and complain about the sound of running water (which most people find relaxing.  Don't know what her problem was, but I don't trust her review at all).  Before the massage I had a really large knot in my left shoulder, probably about the size of a golf ball from what it seemed.  It was very painful, if I tried to lift my laptop with one hand from at my side to extended straight out I couldn't get very far due to the debilitating pain. After the massage, I was able to do the same task without incident.  I had a 90 minute massage and was completely relaxed the entire time.  At one point I was so relaxed, despite the fact the massage was pretty deep and intense, my mind pretty much wandered off.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone I knew and will probably not go anywhere else for a massage, so long as Chisato is still employed here.

16.description: Okay place.  The owner, Rico, was very welcoming and my massage therapist, Eva, was good.  Based on the 4 and 5 star reviews on Yelp - I thought the place would be much nicer, so I was willing to pay $98 for a 60 minute massage.  Actually I used the Yelp deal - so the massage was $88.  While it is not a calming beautiful environment,  it is nice and clean.  It'd expect to pay $50 for a massage like this.  And they are plenty of places in Chicago to do so.   I guess for $98 and the reviews I thought I'd be stepping into an environment like Nordstroms Spa- where a 60 minute massage is $100 - but the amenities are amazing.  While the massage table was warm the air in the room was cold and so were Eva's hand - even after she rubbed them together to try to warm them.  That was not great.  Maybe this location is convenient for a lot of people.  Rico hugged me on the way out - which was unnecessary.  I wish them luck - they seem to be doing well.  I wouldn't go back.  It was just okay, and for me not worth the price.

13.description: So good. I was so happy with my appointment and will be going back at least once a month.

11.description: My experience here was amazing on every level. Initially I booked a couples' massage for my husband and me, but he had to go out of town unexpectedly and Julie was so friendly changing the appointment from a couples' to a single massage with very short notice. Coming in, it was a welcoming environment and I was quickly taken to my massage therapist, Marek. He asked what my problem areas were and more than delivered on that. Being on my feet 6 days a week my legs and feet needed a little more TLC than is usually given in a regular massage, but he worked out the soreness in no time without neglecting the knots in my shoulders and rest of my body. His technique is impeccable and I can tell he is a true professional from only my first time here. It's a little pricey for me to go back on a very regular basis - although worth every single penny - but will most definitely be returning occasionally.

39.description: Be Well was incredible! My boyfriend and I were flying into Chicago for a wedding so I decided to Yelp couples' massages in the city that we could partake in as part of our vacation weekend. They were incredibly helpful - really pleasant to speak with on the phone and just overall great to work with. The massage itself was amazing. We had literally just gotten off the plane so all those little airplane kinks and soreness was just melted away. I can't say enough good things about the massage. The steam shower afterward, too, was just an awesome way to finish up the whole experience. I told them before we left that next time I'm in Chicago, I am DEFINITELY making a point of coming back.Incredible experience!

37.description: This is my new go-to for massages. The service is super friendly and the place is private, so when you book your appointment you're the only one there, which is really nice. The optional sauna time before the massage was wonderful- sometimes you just need to sweat it out. The massage was great. Chisato has more strength than anyone that tiny should have, but she worked out my knot-filled upper back and gave me some stretches to do to help loosen me up a bit. It felt longer than an hour. Afterwards I had a nice little steam to finish it all off. The whole place is so clean and lovely and quiet. I've been to a lot of spas, and Be Well is definitely doing it right.

0.description: You come here for a massage and you will definitely be happy! Since it's the holiday season my gf purchased us a couples massage and I've been on three or so massages before but this was definitely the best. First, they had us store our clothing in lockers and provided us with robes. We were able to meet our masseuses who greeted us kindly. Following that, they have a private sauna room where you can be with your partner and get relaxed for like 15 minutes. This was novel and I've never heard of/ seen a private sauna room like it--pretty cool! Afterwards we each got to choose our masseuses and tell them individually what we wanted. I  asked my therapist, Cory, to focus on my shoulders and needed some help with my stomach too. He did everything with great pressure and spent a good amount of time on the target areas I asked for work on. It's awesome being accommodated!After the massage, they follow it up with a nice steam shower with Japanese shampoo and body wash. Again, it was unexpected to have a shower like that and it was so relaxing. Be Well really does a fantastic job making you feel pampered and it would be hard to top the kind of experience you get here.

38.description: Really great, nice people who take therapeutic massage seriously.  It's small, clean, relaxing but not amateur hour in terms of knowing if you have an issue that needs attention.  I'm having some crazy stress-related muscle spasms that have left me with arm and hand issues.  Chisato knows what she is doing and really worked hard to improve my pain situation.  Like others said:  Easy area on Irving Park with accessible street parking and everything was hassle free.

51.description: Went to Be Well for a massage and needed someone to unwind the mess I call muscles. I had Chisato for my therapist who was fantastic and like Rachel R. below, felt the management was warm and welcoming. Here's the breakdown-Why you should go here:Super clean - They didn't offer waterproof sandals for the shower which normally grosses me out, but this place seemed so clean it didn't bother me as muchSuper quiet - I guess I can say this as I was the only one there.Flexible Scheduling - They really try to work with youSauna and Steam Shower - Detoxifiying and fantasticSnack and Tea while you wait - Come one, that's always an added bonusThe management - Friendly and really seem to believe in what they deliver.Therapist - Chisato was fantastic. Very communicative about where to get at and what pressure I liked. But not overly chatty so I could relax.Respectful - I don't like people touching my face, so when the therapist actually ASKED if I wanted a face massage, I was so happy!
