Instead I had a great head massage which was very relaxing.Massage table and linens - Felt very luxurious and cozy.Some high maintenance details that would have made this experience better:Sauna - They put me in the sauna before my massage and offered tea and a snack. The thing is, when its 92 degrees in a box, you really want cold water, not hot water. Some ice water would have been fantastic and would have made the sauna heat a bit more bearable (or if you really want to be fancy, a washcloth on ice/cucumbers is always a nice touch to keep cool). Also, I wasn't sure how long I was supposed to sit in there so I was just sitting there kind of waiting for someone to show up. Plus, all the magazines were a year old which didn't help the time pass.Oil used for the massage - Honestly, it was straight oil. I really didn't think people used that anymore (my chiro uses Biotone or some other kind of lotion). But this is my own personal paranoia as I break out easily, definitely not a deal breaker for me.Sanitized Comb/Brush after steam shower - Would have been nice to have one, but now I know just to bring my own next time (there was a brush, just wasn't clean).Sandals - I know I said this above, but clean shower sandals would have been great.The pros most definitely outweigh the cons. I will be back!!!!

27.description: First time to Be Well and it was wonderful. Greeted warmly and escorted to the massage room to meet Eva. We discussed my issue which is an ongoing "lean over and something pops in my back". Eva located the area and worked hard to loosen the muscles from my hamstrings up to my middle back. Following the session we discussed stretching exercises and the need to practice them frequently. This was a wonderful first experience, I will be back...

32.description: Has a lovely massage and overall relaxing and restoring experience. Went for the sauna before and after... amazing.

54.description: After a really stressful few months, I decided to treat myself to a massage but, since I'm a fairly recent transplant to Chicago, I had no clue where to go. I was wary of jumping on a GroupOn  deal because what if I get there and it's dingy or creepy? Ewww...So, instead I chose Be Well based on their great Yelp reviews. I couldn't have been happier with my experience! I made a Saturday appointment for a 70 minute signature massage but did not ask for access to the sauna before. When I got there, the man behind the desk (from other reviews, the owner?) was extremely friendly and immediately offered me tea and made me comfortable. Since I was there early, he asked me again if I wanted to use the sauna and he prepared it quickly...I was very impressed he was willing to accommodate me like that even though I didn't give him advanced warning. It was very relaxing to sit in there with my tea for a few minutes before my massage.My masseuse was Chisato who took some time to ask me exactly what I wanted - how much pressure, focus spots, any injuries to be careful of. She listened to what I said and gave me exactly the massage I wanted and needed! She made sure to check in a couple times to see if I was happy. Oh, did I mention heated towels? HEATED TOWELS!! There is nothing worse than dropping $100+ and getting a disappointing massage...there is also nothing more amazing than getting a wonderful massage! I would go back anytime to Chisato and definitely recommend her to everyone.

48.description: My mom was a massage therapist, so I'm pretty picky about massages.  That said, I'm not really used to luxury/spa style treatments- I'm more used to clinic-style massages.  I was unfamiliar with the spa-style amenities and felt like I kept making wrong turns, but the owner and therapist were very friendly and helpful.  I didn't book for a day of pampering- I booked an appointment because I had severe shoulder/back pain.  They were able to book me the same afternoon that I called for an appointment.  The massage was incredible- by far the best I've ever had.  I had a signature massage and felt I got best of both worlds- treatment focused on my aching muscles and a super relaxing full-body massage.  Margaret, my therapist, was terrific. You know it's a great massage when you practically stumble out of the door at the end, and I did.  It is not the cheapest massage option out there, but I was so impressed with the treatment I will definitely return.

44.description: Friendly staff and a good massage, can't really ask for much more

24.description: I took my husband for his birthday here.  He loved everything about it.  The massage was perfect for both my husband and me.  What a delight Rico was as well.  Nothing pretentious but clean and clean and clean.  Very nicely designed.  I especially loved the hot sauna prior to the massage and the hot steam shower afterwards.  It was great.

7.description: Excellent experience. My husband and I made an appt for the couples' massage. My masseuse, Zoe, was fantastic, as was his (whose name escapes him). They were both tentative to the areas we requested, without forgetting about the rest of the body. After, they lead you to your separate shower rooms, where you can sit in the steam and soak it all in, followed by a rain shower. The rooms have all your showerly-needs: body wash, shampoo, conditioner, as well as a hair brush, hair dryer, lotion, q-tips, etc, for after. A refreshing end to an excellent massage.Also- make sure to show up early if getting a couples' massage, to ensure time for a steam before your massage. We got there right on the dot, so missed out on this part. No fault to Be Well though, I'm a procrastinator. *Side Note- try to avoid booking your appointment through Whittl, and just go straight to the source. Whittl is a second-party company they use to book online appointments, and the text messaging/emails are out of control! 2 text reminders and an email yesterday, 1 this morning before the appointment, 1 DURING the appointment which asked, "Enjoying your Whittl appointment?", and a follow-up email from them thereafter. My goodness, Whittl, SETTLE DOWN! If I were you, Be Well, I'd drop the second-party feature. Although your intent is convenience on the part of the customer, it's just straight-up annoying.In sum, Be Well is awesome! Will definitely book my appt (directly next time) soon!

49.description: I had a random day off and my usual massage place was closed so I found this place on yelp. I paid $15 for a $25 certificate and they were able to get me in the same day. I opted for the sauna and steam shower after for $10 extra (totally worth it.) Rico (the owner) was super nice and gave me a history if him opening the spa. Margaret was my massage therapist and she did an amazing job. It was a great day! I booked a massage for my husband upon leaving because it was so amazing!!!

40.description: This is a great place to go to have a relaxing afternoon.  It is local, clean and the service is fantastic.  My massage was great and the environment is clean, friendly and just top notch.  Thanks so much- I will be back!

53.description: I went to Be Well after reading some great Yelp reviews, and I wasn't disappointed.  I've done a couples massage a few times now, and both my boyfriend and I have enjoyed it immensely.  The massage therapists are really top of the line, and the heat box treatment, tea and cookies before the massage are a lovely touch.

30.description: Be Well is a great place! Margaret, my massage therapist, was so amazing. I haven't felt this good in years! I have a chronic right shoulder problem and Margaret removed all the kinks. This was my first time ever getting a massage and now I'm set on the fact that I need these on a regular basis. The atmosphere was lovely, place was very  clean, and the staff was more than friendly. I was so relaxed during my massage that I drooled a little bit... yeah, I drooled. Be Well is definitely worth the money (massages usually run $100 anywhere you go) and I WILL BE BACK!

46.description: So I haven't written a review in a WHILE, but this was worth it. I came here looking for flaws since the other reviews were so glowing, and I'm a skeptic. Well, Be Well was everything it had promised to be. The Place:It's somewhere between clinical and spa (massage/facial, but no aromatherapy or body wraps). The shower was nice, but in a hall where I felt like everyone could hear me. The changing/locker area was also bizarrely small and led via a curtain to an awkward couples massage room that was not for me, but I got a robe and clean flip flops so it was just fine.The Massage: Chisato rocked my rocky bod. She was great about asking about pressure and trouble areas, but not too chatty. It was 90 amazing minutes of pure kneading heaven, worth every penny. I liked that it combined even pressure over-the-sheets massage and traditional swedish massage with a lotion. I think the table in there could use a skoot though, as she kicked the metal trash can a couple times, not so relaxing, but I had almost fallen asleep (for the first time every during a massage!) so it was probably good.The owner is fantastic about setting things up, no pressure to upgrade on anything and he's eager to please in a non-confrontational way. It was my birthday and he fit me in right away. I REALLY hope this place stays open, I can see an expensively good habit forming, though prices here are very fair.

1.description: My husband and I booked a couples massage. We took a chance on this business based on the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint! My therapist was Chisato and my massage was perfect because she listened to my needs and preferences before starting. Cory was an excellent choice for my husband. He gave an excellent deep tissue massage. Highlights were the sauna prior to the session. Be sure to come early so you can partake. I also loved the steam shower afterwards. All the products you need are available so there's no need to bring anything with you. An added plus was how clean the spa was and how professional the team was. I will be back when I visit Chicago again.

55.description: This is a fantastic little spa escape!  I returned recently with my boyfriend for our second visit and it was (again) fabulous.  During our first visit we received a couples massage; this time we scheduled too late to arrange that again.  Instead, for this visit, we took turns enjoying the amenities - hot box, steam shower, tea and candies - while switching off with the massage.Why you should go: * top notch massage professionals who always deliver* conveniently located in the 'hood* willing to work with you on scheduling* relatively fair pricing* fantastic positive vibes from the gracious and positive owner - he's always there with a smile for you and that really sets the tone for your whole experienceThe only downsides:* small space which is very intimate (you sometimes hear people talking in lobby or outside your room* no shared steam shower (only available in private bathrooms)We'll be back!

9.description: Relaxing time. Enjoyed the couples massage with my lady.

26.description: Okay place.  The owner, Rico, was very welcoming and my massage therapist, Eva, was good.  Based on the 4 and 5 star reviews on Yelp - I thought the place would be much nicer, so I was willing to pay $98 for a 60 minute massage.  Actually I used the Yelp deal - so the massage was $88.  While it is not a calming beautiful environment,  it is nice and clean.  It'd expect to pay $50 for a massage like this.  And they are plenty of places in Chicago to do so.   I guess for $98 and the reviews I thought I'd be stepping into an environment like Nordstroms Spa- where a 60 minute massage is $100 - but the amenities are amazing.  While the massage table was warm the air in the room was cold and so were Eva's hand - even after she rubbed them together to try to warm them.  That was not great.  Maybe this location is convenient for a lot of people.  Rico hugged me on the way out - which was unnecessary.  I wish them luck - they seem to be doing well.  I wouldn't go back.  It was just okay, and for me not worth the price.

25.description: Scheduled a couples massage here. The facility is clean and very serene. My only complaint is that we showed up for our massage, the first clients of the day and their mini-sauna wasn't warm yet. So we sat in a semi-warm box for 10 minutes. Granted, it was a cold, cold day, but still - I would have just as well skipped that part.Massage was lovely. Very relaxing and excellent service. Would definitely go back again.

12.description: It's a little more than I would normally pay, but boy was it worth it! Pre-massage sauna? Check! Tension relieving and relaxing massage? Check! Post massage steam/rain shower? Check! I will definitely go back...again and again.

59.description: I went in for the 70 minute signature massage last night.  It definitely cost a bit more than what I usually aim to spend on a massage (I'm an admitted cheapskate when it comes to taking care of myself), but I left feeling like it was definitely worth spending a little extra.  I paid an extra $10, which covers dry sauna before (I got about 25-30 minutes in there and caught up on some old time out chicago's), and wet sauna after (only lasted about 5 minutes in here).  Those were REALLY nice ways to relax before and re-adjust to life after.Marc was my massage therapist, and he was really wonderful.  We talked for a bit before about what was bringing me in, and he made a number of connections between my symptoms that I was too exhausted and stressed out to notice.  I felt like I was working with someone who really knew what they were doing, and understood how the body works (vs. some 20 year old who just got out of massage therapy school....not that I'm knocking them, just saying...).  So although this was a little out of my price range, it was definitely worth it. I slept like a baby last night and have not been clenching my jaw/grinding my teeth like a psycho today.  Which is a really really nice change.  I plan on paying them another visit in the future.  You can tell Rico takes alot of pride in his business.

21.description: Great place, all staff is super friendly and pays attention to detail. Extremely clean! Will be back in a few days. Eva is the best

17.description: Dwanna gave a wonderful massage..definitely  recommend to anyone needing a relaxing and thorough massage

10.description: i had a wonderful massage at the Irving Street location. Julie, the Be Well owner is so helpful, patient and thorough when booking. Dwana does terrific massage work -- she is thorough and the outcome of a massage with her is positive and long lasting. i have finally found the place where I will always get a massage in Chicago.

5.description: Love this place. I've paid double for half the benefit. My gal and I both had a great experience. The sauna and steam shower were awesome afterward and our massage therapists were using really interesting, unique Hawaiian techniques. Drop in for a tune up, I highly recommend.

3.description: What can I say? Be Well was a total treat! From the second you arrive everyone is nice and courteous as can be. I went for a couples massage and the whole experience was awesome. First they take you in a changing room where you get into your robe and flip flops. From there you get to spend 20 minutes in a small sauna with tea, champagne, and water. Once they're ready you go you move into their massage room. My girlfriend and I were both raving about our masseuse. I wanted extra attention on my lower back as this is a problem area and my masseuse packed a punch despite being so small. Once we were finished we got to take a shower in a steam shower. They provide premium bath products and after I got out I felt like a million bucks. They're definitely a little on the pricier end but it's definitely worth it for the sauna session and post massage shower. 5/5. Simply great.

35.description: Bravo, Be Well.  Thank you for being 5 minutes away from my house and employing the highly skilled Chisato, who is a master at her craft.  My bf and I did a Couple's Massage and I have to mention, that it is very difficult to find a place that does this in the same room.  When we made the appointment, we chose the option of the dry sauna for which you have to arrive about 30 minutes earlier to enjoy, which is great because it doesn't take away from the table time.  The place is quaint, clean, and private.  I saw that there were 2 other lockers that were occupied and I was afraid I'd bump into another guest in the hallway in my short robe, but no such scenario occurred.It was a great therapeutic massage. My trouble area has always been my upper back and prior to coming here, no one other massage therapist has given it the (not-so-tender) love and care it needs.  My pressure preference I filled out on my form was "firm".  I'm glad there weren't cameras on the ground pointing to my facial expressions as she worked on all the knots in my upper back.  She asked if I was okay and I lied through my teeth.  This woman is my size (about 5 feet and small frame) but I'm sure she can take me on in a fight.  I trusted she knew what she was doing and boy was I right.   My back was sore for 2 days (but the GOOD kind of sore).  And, it's been great thereafter.  My back feels brand new, I didn't even realize how many knots I had and how tense I was.  My posture is so much better now.I will definitely be coming back here on a regular basis.  I was here last week and I think I've recommended this place to at least 10 people.

19.description: Worth every penny. Julie at the front desk is very friendly. They've clearly worked hard to create a comfortable, clean, organized space. Cory (or Corey, not sure) was very attentive and thorough. I generally deal with a lot of pain, and he did a wonderful job of addressing my problem areas without working me too hard. Maybe he's new, but I'm surprised I haven't seen him mentioned in other reviews. I got my full 90 minutes, and probably would have stayed longer if I could. Rain shower was divine. 10/10, will be returning.

28.description: This is a beautiful and intimate spa. I had a massage by Jocelyn back in June for my birthday. The owner, Rico, is very nice and very genuine. I sat in the dry sauna for a little while before my appointment, which was lovely and relaxing. Jocelyn took time to focus on some of my problem areas and gave me some tips to keep those areas from forming nasty knots again. I felt very attended to and happy after leaving!

45.description: I was looking for a last minute/emergency massage on a Saturday night and Be Well was one of the few options that was open until 8.  It's a little pricey but the massage was great.  As others have mentioned this is not your luxury spa experience but the massage was better than most of the fancy spas I've been too (exception = the Bliss spa at the W on Lakeshore and the Borinquen in Costa Rica).  Marjorie was wonderful and really reduced my pain tremendously.  I don't need a fancy environment but the light wasn't dim enough, there was the annoying sound of an iPhone syncing to a computer every fifteen minutes and a loud clock ticking.  I would have been much more relaxed without these distractions.  If I go back I'm bringing earphones!  Would have been 4 stars if it wasn't for these annoyances.

33.description: I AM well now. Thanks, Be Well.Did you read my last review? Because you totally corrected the small issues I had during my last visit (thanks Joselyn! (Jocelyn maybe? Sorry!).No more scratchy robe. Perfect concentration on my problem areas. Rico was a warm and welcoming host, and my visit was fantastic.This small, intimate, appointment only spa was an oasis and a perfect treat from my wonderful husband before returning to work after maternity leave. Loved the dry sauna and while I was in a rush to get to another appointment so I didn't get to use the steam shower, I did get to check out the facility which was immaculate. I look forward to using it next time!

43.description: I just had my first experience at Be Well and it was great! I was able to get an appointment with just a day's notice. The person who took the appointment, as well as the owner, were super nice and very accommodating. They were running a bit behind, so I did have to wait, so fortunately I was not in a hurry. The place is clean, calming, and very nice. The robe/slippers is a nice perk, as well as the steam shower afterward. I was thoroughly impressed with the massage as well, though the therapist did rush a bit at the end and it was obvious. I was even given a coupon and bath salts on my way out. I really hope this place stays in business as I'd love to continue coming - even though it's totally out of my way!

2.description: My husband and I booked a couples massage here with some Christmas money. We went the day before I went back to work after maternity leave. It was great! the lobby is a little drab, but we loved the cozy sauna and the steam showers after the massage. My masseuse was particularly great and I felt very refreshed after the whole experience. Would definitely go again :)

18.description: Took mom here for a special birthday treat and I have to admit it was AMAZING! Yes it's true there are plenty of massage places in Chicago but I believe this one truly stands out in customer service. We were offered the grand tour and given the option to relax any way that we wanted before the massage. The ladies that gave the wonderful massages were very friendly and professional. They even laughed at all moms wacky jokes lol. Rico really made sure that our experience was great and offered to correct anything we didn't like. However we loved everything... Including the hug! How could you not; I felt like an old friend and not just a random customer. I will definitely go back again.

41.description: Lovely, lovely, lovely.  First time there and I called to make an appt., left a message and they answered back quickly.  Lucky for me they had an appt the same day.  Street parking readily available, the place was clean, and we started on time.  But the best, really the best massage EVER by Chisado (hope I am spelling it right) , Heaven.   Will tell everyone I know in addition to the Yelpers!!   I will be back.

52.description: I feel so blessed to have this place right around the corner from me.  My husband and I both felt like we had amazing massages - some of the best ever!  I've gone back several times and will continue to utilize their wonderful services.

50.description: I have a standing job so i here about acupuncture it will help with my back pain, i went to several places and didn't see any different  ,then i was passing by Be Well wanna to try with them i had a very friendly and helpful staff, ,and trust me i have no pain if i ever have i am going back to Be Well,i still get massages and facials love the spa its very rejuvenating,i wont change this place for no were else ever ........

4.description: Chisato is an amazing massage therapist. She is a master at her craft and is one of the few therapists I've ever had who can skillfully deliver enough pressure, finding and working out tense areas and knots. She knows what she's doing.

6.description: Have come here for two couples massages. The customer  service is great and very accommodating. You start off with a dry sauna, then massage, and finish with a steam and shower. Marek was my masseuse and he was fantastic. I really felt taken care of and relaxed. In general, it seems that the massage therapists change their techniques to cater to your body and needs. Highly recommend.

22.description: perfect place to go! really enjoyed the massage and my boyfriend love it too, it was a perfect B-Day gift !

15.description: I AM well now. Thanks, Be Well.Did you read my last review? Because you totally corrected the small issues I had during my last visit (thanks Joselyn! (Jocelyn maybe? Sorry!).No more scratchy robe. Perfect concentration on my problem areas. Rico was a warm and welcoming host, and my visit was fantastic.This small, intimate, appointment only spa was an oasis and a perfect treat from my wonderful husband before returning to work after maternity leave. Loved the dry sauna and while I was in a rush to get to another appointment so I didn't get to use the steam shower, I did get to check out the facility which was immaculate. I look forward to using it next time!

57.description: I had the best massage here - better then Kohler Spa, MarioTricocci or Urban Oasis!!! I was suffering from back pain (chronic), I called Be Well because of the rave reviews on this site.  I was able to get in the next day, Mark was not available - but the woman who treated me was top notch (sorry, I can not spell her name right - Chisuto?).  I had a 90 minute massage, but it felt like it was three hours long.  She had just the right pressure, and the scalp/head massage was amazing!!!  I felt like a new woman after and have not had any back pain since - it has been three weeks.   The place is clean, the steam shower is tremendous and the service is excellent.  Highly recommend!

20.description: Had a couples massage here with my fiance- his first experience.  We spent several minutes in the sauna then into a nice room with side-by-side tables.  We were both asked our pressure preferences and they checked in with us regularly about how it was going.  Overall, it was a good massage for me.  We then were given ample time to shower in private bathrooms which were nice and stocked with hair and body washes.  Overall, it was a good experience and I would definitely go back.  The inside is a bit small but that also gives it a cozy feeling.  The pricing is pretty standard although we got a pretty good deal with a Groupon package we used.

36.description: Hands down/on the best massage I've ever had!  From a sports (injury prone) background, the woman that worked on me was very knowledgeable as far as running muscles and seemed to know exactly where I was tight and how much pressure to use.  It was MAGICAL!I haven't had many professional massages but I was on a collegiate track and field team and have had my fair share of deep tissue massages to work out knots and trouble areas.  Comparatively this was just as professional with less pain and much more relaxing.After flying back from Thanksgiving break I decided to treat myself since over the weekend I had run a 15k and played 5+ hours of flag football and ultimate frisbeeI had a layover at O'Hare and I figured I could catch a cab and squeeze in an hour massage.  I had scheduled ahead of time and they were very understanding and willing to work with my tight schedule.  I had to ask that the massage be cut short (around 45 minutes instead of an hour).  That was probably the hardest decision of my life but I had a flight to catch!While I was there I was thinking ahead to Christmas to figure out how to work in a longer layover so I can come back for the 90 minute version.  The masseuse and I both expressed regret that I had to go early which tells me she really enjoyed her work!

14.description: Excellent attention to detail and extremely knowledgeable & thorough from both my acupuncturist and massage therapist. I was visiting here from Houston and have Bell's palsy (temporary facial paralysis on one side) and both specialist asked me a number of questions before they began to make sure that they were approaching treatment correctly. I really appreciated that in both of them. Beautiful facility and I'm glad that I opted to upgrade to the dry sauna beforehand and the wet sauna (steam shower and rain shower) afterwards. Worth every penny and the perfect compliment to my trip!

3.description: Finally another Colombian bakery in the city...I love pandeponos and prior to this one opening there was only one other bakery on Lincoln Ave albeit with dismal customer service....when I came to Antojitos Colombianos the server was very pleasant and everything looks very neat and tidy...their empanadas were good and my kids enjoyed the papa rellena...  prices are reasonable and the food is freshly made.. good quality Colombian food and pastries..but again..the fact that they show manners and are eager to please customers..has made me a fan...and I cant wait to satisfy my Colombian cravings at this cute little new place..

1.description: Had a craving for Colombian food and stopped by. The empanadas were yummy and the coffee tasted like home! The staff was very friendly and attentive. I will be back.

0.description: Hubby and Rosa J. are heading back to Columbia, SC for a week to visit the in-laws, so how about having some pre-flight "Colombian" food.  Yes, I love playing on words, as many of you have noticed.  I reside in west-end of Portage Park neighborhood, but I haven't taken my time to explore the Six Corners on the east end recently.  I found "Antojitos Colombianos" on Yelp a couple of weeks ago.  It's located near Berteau and Milwaukee, so CTA #56 (Milwaukee) bus is readily accessible.  All stars seemed to be perfectly aligned for our Sunday breakfast.  I never thought this place would be this busy.  After we placed our orders with the cute, friendly young lady, there was a flock of people came in next thirty (30) minutes.  Seating isn't ample, but they didn't seem to mind.  This place is extremely welcoming because those delicious pastries were smiling at me and wanting to come into my "dungeon," or stomach rather.  I saw "desayunos" on their check board behind the counter.  I spotted "changua" and felt immediately connected to him/her/it.  By the way, food to me has an inner soul and I can certainly read it. Ok, I better stop my creepiness and start sticking to the gist of this review.  "Changua" is a milk-based soup with toasted bread and soft-boiled eggs.  I found this very similar to the Taiwanese-style warm soy milk I used to have often during my childhood.  Everything in this dish screams "BREAKFAST" to me.  If this doesn't, you better "wake up" and pay attention.  Hubby was curious about the "cheese ball" pastry.  The young lady offered us a complementary sample.  OMG!  What a delicious "ball!"  I will totally go back for this.  With two (2) medium Colombian coffee, one (1) order of huevo con arroz, and one (1) order of changua, the total was about $21.  It squeezed into the "affordable, economical" meal category in Rosa J.'s book.

2.description: It's always a treat to go on a Sunday to get some Colombian goodies. Today we decided to try this spot for the first time. Let me just start off by saying that the Calentado (a dish with beans, rice, eggs, and arepa) brought me back to my wonderful Medellin! It tastes just as good, if not better (don't tell my mom), than my mothers calentado. Another thing that is superb is their "aji" (a spicy sauce we use for empanadas and anything else you can add it to, like the calentado). It literally is the best aji I have had in any Colombian restaurant here in Chicago. And it also reminds me of my mothers aji, but it might be better than hers (definitely don't tell her I said that). The bunuelos are nice and fresh, the pastries as well, and the empanadas are full of meat and are delicious. The coffee is also delicious, I mean it is Colombian ;)We also ordered some arepas rellenas with beef and they were delicious. The only thing we noticed was that they may have been microwaved at some point either to melt the cheese that is on top or to warm up the meat, we wish they hadn't! And if there's one thing we would recommend its that they refrain from warming stuff up in a microwave. It just takes away from how delicious the food is. The service is great, everyone was really nice and attentive when we were there. The place is also nice and big and very clean which is a major plus!We will probably make this one of our go to Sunday breakfast spots for sure!

5.description: This could have easily been 4 stars but they got my order wrong...My cousin and I decided to go to Antojitos this past Sunday. The place is relatively small but it has it's good share of clientele which I believe might be too much for one person to handle on his own. I ordered:1 Choclo Arepa10 Colombian Empanadas4 buñuelos6 pan de bonos2 chorizos1 pan de yucaWhen I got home I realized the gentleman did not pack my pan de yuca and only packed one chorizo (when I placed an order for 2). That is upsetting because I live in Edison Park and I wasn't about to drive all the way back down past Jefferson park toward Portage Park to get a piece of bread and a chorizo. I'm sure it was an honest mistake but he might want to get some help up front. The food I did get was delicious and I must say, those Colombian empanadas are massive! I'll give them another try, but there goes to show you have to check your order before you leave. That was MY bad...

6.description: Saw this place while driving and stopped to sample some of their baked goods. I was excited to see a new Colombian bakery open. I ordered a few bread rolls, two roscones and one pineapple bread. The bread rolls were as expected and good, the roscone was stale and hard as a rock. The Pineapple bread was tasty, but a little stale as well. While I did not go during breakfast I was expecting better quality. I was expecting better, might give them another chance to see if they are better earlier in the day.

7.description: I would punch my great grand mother in the throat for these chicken empanadas. They are served piping hot and completely stuffed full of rice, chicken and the most perfect mix of seasoning and spices I've ever tasted. I'm not a violent person. If you ever heard that I went on some sort of crazy drug binge, you can assume it's bull. But, if you ever hear about an empanada heist... I should probably be considered a prime suspect.

8.description: The place is really nice, the empanadas and the arepas rellenas are awesome, the stuff is very friendly, but i think they can do better with the kumis, it didn't taste like kumis. I'm glad there's another Colombian bakery in Chicago and it's closed to my house. :) ..

9.description: This place is amazing!! When I got there I wanted to buy the whole bakery, it smell so good!!! The buñuelos, pandequesos and arepa de choclo are my favorites!!! I will be going again since the day I went was so busy but it was worth the wait!!!

10.description: Ah-mazing! Hands down best Colombian bread outside of Colombia. The service is superb, and everything absolutely everything they sell is incredible.

4.description: A small restaurant and bakery (4 tables, 7 seats at the window bar) with amazingly good food. The green plantain with beef ($5.50) had a fresh taste.  The aborrajado ($3.50, plantain, guava, cheese) was the other highlight  the chicken empanadas $1.50 and the chicken arepa $5.50 were also tasty. Mom is the cook and dad is the baker. Their son runs the front and is knowledgeable and efficient. Service is fast and their son's advice is to be followed. We were stuffed with that order and bought bakery goods to take home. There was a steady stream of customers all of whom appeared to be regulars. A friendly, safe, and clean place. The restrooms were clean and modern.

12.description: Went there recently with some friends. We're all polish so we felt at ease, the place is cute inside and has a small area to sit in outside as well, which closes at 11pm because they don't have a licence for it (?). They made us move our drinks and food and get seated inside. Although the place is nice and cute - they play dance hits and the lounge area is pretty... everything else is not up to par. The waitstaff was terrible, we had two waiters serving us, both of which seemed very confused and disoriented. The girl seemed like she had no idea what was going on, she did a terrible job of serving us and she just kept looking at us like she didn't know what to do with anything. Maybe she was new.. I don't know. And then when she asked if we were done  and we confirmed she wouldn't bring us our check although we already told her how we'd be paying and everything. We had to go up to HER to say we're done. She didn't ask if we wanted to split the bill or how much eat item was so we could figure it out ourselves... she didn't even show us the bill. She told us the total and stood there waiting for us to all try to figure out how much to give her. We had to ask her how much each food item was ourselves. The whole thing was very very disorganized. Another thing was that the A/C was on blast. It was blowing right on our area and we were freezing! We asked them multiple times to turn it down or off, each time they said they would but they never did. We were very dissatisfied with that.The experience overall was not pleasant and they really need to work on their management and organization in that place. I doubt if I'll come back. Maybe once I hear something about improvement, I'll make a visit back there.

3.description: Great time at martini! We were so surprise on the superb option of drinks at the bar. The banquet full 5 star service, speaking on my behalf. I am fascinated with all the detailed decorations. Everything I requested was covered to their best ability and the extra mile. I am extremely pleased with this establishment.

1.description: Stay away from this place! The fact that there's no one here during the week or even on the weekend says a lot! I can't believe we ignored the obvious signs. First and foremost, there's a reason why the lights are always off and why they illuminate the place with black lights....it's so you can't see how they rip you off. If you are brave enough to check this place out, order bottled beers only!!! (And good luck)Thankfully my friends are bartenders and when they ordered Grand Marnier they noticed that the liquor came out clear as it was poured. Literally looked clear as vodka. For those that don't know, Grand Marnier is a cognac and is supposed to be brownish in color. When my friends called out the man behind the bar he immediately denied the fact that the liquor was swapped out and/or altered and then pretended to not speak any English after we called him out. (May have been a manager or owner because the only bartender there was a woman) The bottle was not removed from the shelf and the bartender ignored that we even addressed this issue.Unbelievable - I highly recommend someone inspect this place and all the liquor they have on their shelves. I'm a firm believer of supporting local businesses but not when they scam!

2.description: Tonight was my first time trying this bar and it would definitely be my last time. The drinks were horrible , I could not even taste the alcohol. I would not recommend this to anyone.

9.description: I didn't come here to party. I remember driving by it so me and my friend decided to stop o n in after dinner.They had a nice selection of martinis.  I had probably 2 or 3 and a shot and wasn't feeling so buzzed as the usual 2 martinis would do.  So that struck me as odd, maybe I just drink to much =)  I had a French martini which was made really well. I don't remember the other one and I had a Dracula's Kiss shot which was really good and should be a martini.I didn't walk around so I didn't check out the place, like I said I came here to drink.  One thing though our server was a little too attentive. Every time I turned around to look at the tv she would rush over and ask if i needed anything.  I mean EVERY TIME. So we stopped turning around! They were blasting Techo pretty loud, had a girl walking around in a hula skirt serving.  The place was jammed packed with men and very few ladies.

10.description: Apparently I'm a sucker for punishment. After having a terrible time at the Martini Club on Milwaukee next to the train station, I convinced myself this second location, also right by my house, would be better. What a colossal mistake. Again, no one in the bar spoke English. Clientle, fine, but when your waitresses don't have enough of a grasp on the language to take a beer order, there are problems. It was also pretty insulting how the bartender made sure to take care of every single Polish speaking customer before he got to me, regardless of how long I'd been there comparatively. I can't think of any reason to return to this place. Then again, there is always the chance I'll get hit by a bus and wake up with a love for loud EuroTrash "music".  Yikes.

4.description: Had a great time the other night at this little neighborhood joint. Stopped by after dinner and was surprised with some good craft beer and a nice bartender. The music was eclectic but great. The end was a little hazy (try the melon martini) but it was a good night!

6.description: Pretty place.Nice big, high-backed velvety booths.Romantic draped backroom with couches, tables and chairs.Large frou-frou martini menu.Prices not too crazy, considering. Service was good, it was pretty busy on a Thursday night.Open front windows. Nice small outside, sidewalk patio.The waitress made us chuckle when she carded my step-mom and when she told the waitress she didn't have her I.D., the waitress had to ask the manager if it was okay. It was.

0.description: Lovely little place on Irving Park. There is a big Polish following but that doesn't matter when every body's nice and sociable. Drinks are pretty good and the staff is willing to cooperate if you're not satisfied. What more can you ask for?I came here Friday night and it wasn't that full so I sat the bar. The manager eneded up buying me 4 shots, champagne, and a drink just because he needed me to move over two bar stools. How nice??? I definitely recommend visiting this place when you're in good spirits. They're not open ultra late but they do have outdoor seating.

5.description: Very nice bar buy drinks are very expensive and the place is always empty. Bartenders never smile

13.description: I'd give them a zero if I could.  Jerks have been sending me text messages advertising their crapp specials for MONTHS even though I have NEVER been there.  Several messages a week, and I've even called to ask them to stop.  This place sucks.

11.description: I have never felt so out of place.  A friend of a friend was celebrating her birthday there, and I tagged along, not having an idea of what I was getting myself into.  It was like I was at a party that I was purposely not invited to.  Everyone is Polish.  The bartenders don't even bother with English there, but at least they did make my drinks nice and strong.  This place might actually be decent if you're into the whole European club thing.  It is huge with multiple rooms and private areas with dancing everywhere.  People were all dressed pretty well.  I guess if I didn't feel so awkward being there, I might have actually enjoyed dancing to the music I have never heard.  But the only thought I had at the time was to get out of there as soon as possible.

8.description: that's a lovely little place in Polish neighborhood, however food and service was just horrible. i went there with my boyfriend to enjoy a drink and some appetizers at late evening. we sat outside. i ordered a martini and a zapiekanka (a bun with mushrooms and cheese served hot). the server spilled the drink all over the table. well, that happens, not a big deal. but then i got zapiekanka.which was disgusting, cold and gluey. I'm always nice to the servers and I never complain, but that was really too much. I decided to return this thing, but the server didn't appear for close to 15 minutes. I decided to take my plate inside by myself and ask for a check. The server was busy  chatting with the only customer by the bar. when she heard that food was disgusting, she was not only surprise and rude, but She said that there was no cook in the restaurant and she made it in the microwave and why I have a problem. absolutely rediculous. then, she fought with us, because she didn't want to take this dish from our check. finally, we paid for the drinks and left promising to each other not to come back again. what a shame.

14.description: I give it a star because I have to give it something.  We just moved to the neighborhood and decided to give this place a try.  The service was terrible.  I asked the waitress for an opinion on Chicken Wings or Chicken Fingers.  Her response was "wings are wings, fingers are fingers"  Alrighty then.  When I asked what kind of meat was in the meat OR cheese pierogi(sp) she said "Meat."  the hair in our Chocolate Martini was the bonus for the evening.  Lucky for us, she couldn't add either.

7.description: Martini Club is an alright place.  Very popular with the Polish crowd, lots of laser lights inside. The interior has a chic style and very dark.  Martini Club tries to pride itself on its huge martini menu with very fruity concoctions.  From tons of berry liquors, to sours, to the simple manhattan, Martini Club offers variety... but that comes at a pretty steep price (for the area that is...).  There's a "Downtown" price, for a Non-downtown area. On Monday nights, they have KARAOKE!  The place was scarcely filled when I was there, but that meant that I could sing with little notice that anyone was paying attention.  Thumbs up hehe.   But seriously,  its cool to have a new karaoke joint on mondays in the portage park area.

58.description: I would like to give 2.5 stars but yelp isn't that advanced yet!  I came here last night with my husband and a friend of his who drove in from Cleveland. Great job,Mariel! The place was extremely loud and there was a live band playing as if we were at a street festival. I asked the hostess if this would be going on all night and when she said yes I should have darted out. I asked for a seat in the corner furthest from the band and we were tended to right away. The first of our the waiters brought us water. The second suggested their caipirinha cocktail which I'm very familiar with. A simple cocktail that calls for lime and sugar. However ours came out with a strong taste of artificial sweeteners. Our third waiter helped with selecting our food. Really..three waiters??The Chicken Empanada was amazing. There were pinto beans inside which surprised me. Queso Arepa which was extremely dry. For my entree I chose Skirt Steak with a salad and White rice w beans. Half of my steak was a perfect medium and the other half was bone dry. My salad was a bit limp the tomatoes had that mushy texture. Gross!The rice was great, beans a bit under seasoned but the tough, salty steak made up for that. My husband's food was great but I'll leave him to do his review on his Catfish entree.

56.description: The steak was good. The staff was welcoming and helpful. Place gets pretty busy after 7 on a Saturday.Overall not bad.. It is a bit pricey.  Early dinner is better.

29.description: Love their food! I always get the vegetarian platter and my husband gets a steak. Their beans and rice are awesome. Family friendly, too!

42.description: I'm continuing my plan for a new and improved me by doing a lot more walking....it's a great way to get reacquainted with my neighborhood. During my walk this evening, I stopped in at Las Tablas​ restaurant. I had been there earlier in the week for a meeting about a neighborhood development project. After the meeting they served some empanadas that were awesome. I had gone to this restaurant a couple of times, but found that it was often too noisy to enjoy a good meal. When I walked in this evening only 3 other people were there. I was seated promptly and given a menu. The waiter did not mention any information about specials. The music playing was appropriate for a Columbian steak house...but just a bit on the loud side.I ordered a spinach salad with lots of other "stuff" with cilantro balsamic vinaigrette and some chicken and cheese empanadas. What I wanted was one of each...and the waiter either did not understand what I wanted or just wasn't paying much attention.The salad and empanadas were very good. The service, not so much. I had to ask for water and coffee...the waiter never did check to see if I needed anything. I also had to ask for a second cup of coffee. I asked for "half a cup" of coffee...but once again, the waiter either did not understand or couldn't be bothered to take the time to accurately hear what I requested. (He poured and then ran!)Bottom line....great food, poor service...too loud.  Maybe it's better on a weekend?

23.description: Love this place!! When you want thee most tasty steak and chicken go eat the Combination plate, we never leave here disappointed, Thanks Oscar for the great service The ride is worth it now open one in and around mount prospect lol even the salad is awesome

47.description: This place is highly unorganized. The only positive is their skirt steak.You may make a reservation, but it is possible they will give your table toa friend. I would recommend, you to go on lunch time.

8.description: GREAT food and EXCELLENT service.Love the live entertainment. Empanadas are LIFE and made to order. Chimichurra(I hope I spelled right) sauce is the best I've ever had.The pork chops are as well. Seasoned to PERFECTION.Every steak I've had from there should be served to me in Heaven when I go. I love this place. My whole family does. 5 year customer!!! Will see A LOT more of us.

31.description: LOVE this place!!! I've eaten there and done delivery and I must say, OUTSTANDING! The service is great and if you do encounter a problem, they will make sure to rectify it to your satisfaction. We are very picky about the places we go to and this spot is now one of my favorites. I rarely write reviews, but this place has definitely earned it!!!

34.description: Service is slow, servers uncordial, and this is just getting our drink order .... Keep you updated for the food.... Let's be hopeful ... Music is the two stars completely

16.description: I would like to give 2.5 stars but yelp isn't that advanced yet!  I came here last night with my husband and a friend of his who drove in from Cleveland. Great job,Mariel! The place was extremely loud and there was a live band playing as if we were at a street festival. I asked the hostess if this would be going on all night and when she said yes I should have darted out. I asked for a seat in the corner furthest from the band and we were tended to right away. The first of our the waiters brought us water. The second suggested their caipirinha cocktail which I'm very familiar with. A simple cocktail that calls for lime and sugar. However ours came out with a strong taste of artificial sweeteners. Our third waiter helped with selecting our food. Really..three waiters??The Chicken Empanada was amazing. There were pinto beans inside which surprised me. Queso Arepa which was extremely dry. For my entree I chose Skirt Steak with a salad and White rice w beans. Half of my steak was a perfect medium and the other half was bone dry. My salad was a bit limp the tomatoes had that mushy texture. Gross!The rice was great, beans a bit under seasoned but the tough, salty steak made up for that. My husband's food was great but I'll leave him to do his review on his Catfish entree.

13.description: Oh wait, have I not reviewed this place yet???2 words: SKIRT. STEAK.They seriously have the BEST skirt steak there is in Chicago! For reals tho. It's really hard to make awesome skirt steak because it tends to get a little chewy if you don't cook it right, but it's super tender, juicy and flavorful here. I can't wait to come back again and eat it! Definitely recommend that you come here to try it.And another great thing is that it's BYOB! I guess it's Mon-Thur only, but hey. Better than nothing.

11.description: Love this place!! When you want thee most tasty steak and chicken go eat the Combination plate, we never leave here disappointed, Thanks Oscar for the great service The ride is worth it now open one in and around mount prospect lol even the salad is awesome

39.description: I came in on a Monday recently for the first time. There were only 2 other tables when I went in. Ordered the empanada sampler to share. I wasn't too impressed with them. You got 2 of each; cheese, chicken and beef. It was tough for me to tell the difference except for the cheese. For my entrée, I ordered their Bandeja Paisa which comes with rib-eye steak served with fried pork belly, chorizo, rice, beans, fried egg, sweet plantain and avocado. I love a good steak and this one didn't disappoint. I always feel that a steak done right doesn't need any sauce. This one surely could be had without the two sauces they put on the table. The pork belly was good as was the chorizo. The sweet plantain was overdone; a little dried out and hard. The portion size for the money was great. You won't leave hungry.The food didn't take long to come out. The waiter stopped by the right amount of times so I wasn't looking around for him. These are things I look for service-wise. I've been to hundreds of restaurant and know how service should be. Given, this was a slow night, there shouldn't have been any excuses. Not sure how they hold up on a Friday or Saturday night.I would recommend this location and I would try them again, although I'm not dying to go back just yet. I just wasn't wowed.

37.description: Dear las tablas,Why have you disappointed me? Here I was bragging about how awesome your food was to people, then I come in and realize you have changed everything from the food to the decorations!!Empanadas have become anorexic. And cold. How could you do this to me? After all those wonderful times? How could you?Food portions have gotten smaller. Food is not the same quality. I'm having difficulty defending your honor from people. Even the decorations! I walked in, to see that the walls are mostly naked, with the occasional portrait of a morbidly obese woman (or man), that looks like it belongs on Queen Elizabeths living room. I thought I walked into the wrong place!!And the pop music playing in the background. Really? What happened to the hot Latin music I used to listen to?So disappointed. Heartbroken. When you decide to be the restaurant that you used to be, let me know. But as of right now, it's over between us. Sincerely, Your ex gf

0.description: I thought this place was pretty good. Our friend is from Colombia and loves this place, so that must be saying something. In my opinion, I was not as impressed by a lot of the stuff bc I just didn't think the steaks were that great, but the empanadas were quite good and the portions were plentiful. In addition, be sure to try many of the Colombian drinks they have (non-alcoholic in this case).

38.description: Horrible service, time and time again i gave this place a chance because i live in the neighborhood. Slow service OMG! I went when it wasn't busy thinking the service would be better, still bad. Thank God the food was good but I won't be back. I took several friends they to show them how good the food is. They were disappointed by the service and so was I.

51.description: The Good: The Salmon, The grilled Shrimp, the Asparagus, Friendly waiter.The Mediocre: Grilled Baby Octopus - It tasted more like the gas from the gas grill than anything else, plus, one was undercooked and almost raw, the Prices were about average for this type of food.The Bad: Constantly had to ask for water - when a customer drinks a lot of water, just LEAVE THE DAMN PITCHER ON THE TABLE IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE BOTHERED! The place only had 12 patrons total......the manager or owner was sitting at a table in the back effing around on his laptop. Typical of an uninterested manager or owner. Good management checks on tables while the wait and bus staff do their jobs - if you don't want to interact, then watch your porn in the back office!Empanadas Combo appetizer - Greasy as hell - minimal cheese - suggestion?  Use a different batter and different oil, and DRAIN THEM ON A PAPER TOWEL OR SOMETHING. Add a little more cheese than a teaspoon while you're at it.Table was sticky and dirty - if you don't want to wash the tables, then put down table clothes so our arms don't stick to the table top.Time between ordering food and arrival at the table - took FOREVER! Again, there were only 12 other people in the entire restaurant.After ordering 3 drinks,  the waiter asked at the end of the meal; "would you like anything else, another drink perhaps?" You would think the waiter would have offered a free one after ordering 3.....Took forever to get the check because the waiter was talking on the phone...and the place only had 12 diners total, but I already said that 2 times.My chances of returning to this location? Highly unlikely.Maybe the Lincoln Ave. location is better, but this place? Hell to the no!

27.description: We come at this place a lot, and always i try not to rate it, looking forward that it will change its atmosphere but its just going the down the hill. This place used to be so romantic with candles lit up and nice staff waiting to serve you. Last time we were here for dinner it was friday night, after 9pm people came at our table and charged us for door cover even tough we didnt want to stay. Than the dj started around 10pm. Night got ruined. Than we come in today just for a casual dinner on Wednesday night,  and eventually there is some soccer game going on on tv. They brought 80 inch TV inside the restaurant, people seating on the floor and yelling. We sat at the table ordered our dinner and had it. While having a dinner tvs were so loud and people rude and yelling that it was not even real. Food is great as always, but this place wont see us due to so poor ambiance and profesionalism. You just dont know what to expect when you get here.

32.description: I am literally only giving it one star because the empanadas were good. Besides that where do I begin. The service was horrible. The waitress completely forgot about us and had to ask 2 different servers to help us out. Second the skirt steak I ordered, I asked for Medium Rare. When I got the steak, I swear the whole plate was cold and the steak was completely raw on the inside and COLD! That is inexcusable. I would like to add the $23 steak came with no sides like rise or beans, just a piece of yuca and a small piece of platain.  Lastly my mother ordered a Margarita and it didnt taste like anything. I will definitely not be stepping foot in here again.

54.description: Oh wait, have I not reviewed this place yet???2 words: SKIRT. STEAK.They seriously have the BEST skirt steak there is in Chicago! For reals tho. It's really hard to make awesome skirt steak because it tends to get a little chewy if you don't cook it right, but it's super tender, juicy and flavorful here. I can't wait to come back again and eat it! Definitely recommend that you come here to try it.And another great thing is that it's BYOB! I guess it's Mon-Thur only, but hey. Better than nothing.

48.description: If you want great food, Las Tablas is the place.  However, we never experienced the type of condescending treatment we received from the manager at LasTablas during our recent dining experience.   We went to Las Tablas to celebrate a birthday.  The reservations were made two weeks in advance and we were told we would be seated with a view of the band so we could dine and dance.  We went to Las Tablas to hear live music for the birthday celebration.  When we arrived,  we were taken to a back room separated from the restaurant and were seated at a high table with high stools.  We tried to be reasonable and explain to the manager that we had friends with us to celebrate a birthday.  The manager literally mocked us in his tone and was extremely condescending and rude.  Only after one of the men in our party spoke with him, did he find a table far in the corner of the main restaurant, behind the serving station, where we could not see the band.  After our drinks and appetizers were ordered, the manager approached one of the men in our party, and offered to move us to another area of the restaurant.  At that point, we were too frustrated to move.  We would not even have stayed at Las Tablas but it was too late to go to another restaurant.  To add to the ridiculousness, they ran out of the two cabernets listed on the menu. How does a restaurant that serves such delicious steak dishes, run out of cabernet?? In fairness, they did bring a sample of a pretty bad cab not listed on the menu.  We passed.  Too bad this happened, the food is great and the live band was fantastic, but we would never return.  The owners should think about who they have managing their business.

44.description: This Columbian steakhouse is a hidden gem in the neighborhood. The food is delicious with a full menu to choose from. I had the combination plate with steak and calamari. The steak is their specialty and it can go head-to-head against any other steakhouse in Chicago. They have a bar to sit at too with plenty of drink specials to choose from. Save room for desserts because they are a huge portion. The ambiance is very welcoming, and the service is super nice and friendly. Highly recommend a visit.

24.description: We went tonight for dinner, with my friend from borgata, Colombia.  I live one block away and never went there.  First , they said the cook was sick so we waited for 11/2 hour for our food.  Several people left without eating.  The manager apologized for the wait and said he would give us a discount if we stayed.  So we thought we would stay expecting great food.  The food was terrible, the meat was dry, the yuca was raw inside.  We told the waiter and again apologies.  After all that only a 20% Discount.  We did not finish our food.  The presentation of the food was terrible.  I will. not go back, very disappointed.

7.description: I love Las Tablas but over time the quality of the service and food has gone down, especially at this location. Our family loved coming here for New Years Eve as it was a special event that many people from the community came to. There is always a flat fee for the evening, which included a three course meal, drinks and a glass of NYE champagne. Unfortunately, the last two years here have been a bust. The champagne is getting cheaper/distasteful, and the portions and options for the three course dinner are almost non-existent.I thought this might have been just for the particular night, but I've noticed over time that the portions in general have gotten smaller, and the service continues to lack. I will say, the abborajada here is off the chain.

49.description: The food isn't bad but the waiter had a bad attitude.  He wouldn't let me exchange my side for rice!  Really?  Also I had to wait 15 minutes for the waiter to refill my water.  And the steak was not well done as I ordered.

40.description: Great food but i noticed a can pop is $3.00s and a drink can be $10.00. Which can really start to increase the bill to take a family. Overall services are great , steaks are great and live music on weekends

53.description: I really love the food and service at las tablas.  The only thing that annoys me, is the live music on the weekends.  You can't even have a conversation because its so loud.

30.description: GREAT food and EXCELLENT service.Love the live entertainment. Empanadas are LIFE and made to order. Chimichurra(I hope I spelled right) sauce is the best I've ever had.The pork chops are as well. Seasoned to PERFECTION.Every steak I've had from there should be served to me in Heaven when I go. I love this place. My whole family does. 5 year customer!!! Will see A LOT more of us.

46.description: I love Las Tablas but over time the quality of the service and food has gone down, especially at this location. Our family loved coming here for New Years Eve as it was a special event that many people from the community came to. There is always a flat fee for the evening, which included a three course meal, drinks and a glass of NYE champagne. Unfortunately, the last two years here have been a bust. The champagne is getting cheaper/distasteful, and the portions and options for the three course dinner are almost non-existent.I thought this might have been just for the particular night, but I've noticed over time that the portions in general have gotten smaller, and the service continues to lack. I will say, the abborajada here is off the chain.

1.description: Came on a Saturday evening very busy. (7pm-10pm)Price:$$$RSVP needed if a large party is gathering.Food: was ok. Party of 6. Didn't wait long for the food. Or the appetizers. Drinks were great. Wait afterwards was bad. We had to wait for some drinks for 10 minutes. I ordered the octopus. Super salty. Others ordered the steak. Great Service: decent. Besides the wait. Live music: excellent. Live band this Saturday. Cumbias and salsa. Very nice. Place: amicableAtmosphere: ok  Parking: paid. On street. They play happy birthday for you. If its tor birthdate.

55.description: I took my two daughters on their16 birthday my daughters and wife are tapas people I'm not but I have to say their steak is very juicy drinks were a little expensive but overall we had a great time

9.description: The best authentic Colombian steak house in portage park,Illinois . Plenty of parking,great seating and great food .they have awesome lunch specials. Friday night they have live bands with great music. You must put them on your bucket list you won't regret it. So Good.

26.description: We ordered: Drink- A bottle of mMalbec - delish / alcohol was reasonably priced Appetizers - Empenada Sampler - they were rubbery and over cooked- Chicken Rellano Arepa - best (non chocolo) arepa I've ever had and my friend agreed, very fresh to order, savory, and moist - Grilled Octopus - it was the baby verison of octopus, beyond rubbery and no flavor besides the grill taste

25.description: My teller at Chase down the street recommended this place when i mentioned I was hungry. I have never had Columbian food before, and so the menu was a bit intimidating. The staff was very nice once they realized I had sat down for lunch. I had the steak lunch special. The steak was perfect- well seasoned, rare to medium rare (the way I like it), juicy and delicious. The salad was a bit lack luster, and I would have had on a different plate so it didn't mingle with the hot food. The fried plantains were excellent. It was a belly filling lunch for $10.I recommend this place for ethnic food, and their commitment to airing all the soccer matches.

12.description: We ordered: Drink- A bottle of mMalbec - delish / alcohol was reasonably priced Appetizers - Empenada Sampler - they were rubbery and over cooked- Chicken Rellano Arepa - best (non chocolo) arepa I've ever had and my friend agreed, very fresh to order, savory, and moist - Grilled Octopus - it was the baby verison of octopus, beyond rubbery and no flavor besides the grill taste

59.description: What is there to say other than my wife and I frequent this establishment A LOT! Love the food, drinks and the service is always spot on!

21.description: Good came out literally room temp. Which means it was sitting or reheated. Either is unacceptable

17.description: The Good: The Salmon, The grilled Shrimp, the Asparagus, Friendly waiter.The Mediocre: Grilled Baby Octopus - It tasted more like the gas from the gas grill than anything else, plus, one was undercooked and almost raw, the Prices were about average for this type of food.The Bad: Constantly had to ask for water - when a customer drinks a lot of water, just LEAVE THE DAMN PITCHER ON THE TABLE IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE BOTHERED! The place only had 12 patrons total......the manager or owner was sitting at a table in the back effing around on his laptop. Typical of an uninterested manager or owner. Good management checks on tables while the wait and bus staff do their jobs - if you don't want to interact, then watch your porn in the back office!Empanadas Combo appetizer - Greasy as hell - minimal cheese - suggestion?  Use a different batter and different oil, and DRAIN THEM ON A PAPER TOWEL OR SOMETHING. Add a little more cheese than a teaspoon while you're at it.Table was sticky and dirty - if you don't want to wash the tables, then put down table clothes so our arms don't stick to the table top.Time between ordering food and arrival at the table - took FOREVER! Again, there were only 12 other people in the entire restaurant.After ordering 3 drinks,  the waiter asked at the end of the meal; "would you like anything else, another drink perhaps?" You would think the waiter would have offered a free one after ordering 3.....Took forever to get the check because the waiter was talking on the phone...and the place only had 12 diners total, but I already said that 2 times.My chances of returning to this location? Highly unlikely.Maybe the Lincoln Ave. location is better, but this place? Hell to the no!

10.description: I love this place!!! Who doesn't?? My husband and I have gone back here for anniversaries and every time we eat here its always an amazing time and delicious food! Love the Groupon deals but we wouldn't mind going back paying full price for the food.

5.description: Came here for my husbands birthday and was disappointed with the food and the customer serviceThey were Over priced The empanadas were a joke if that's what you want to call empanadas . We had to get up and serve ourselves more water as the waiter failed to come back around and fill our glasses Not coming back here unless somebody pay's for  my meal lol

3.description: We went to this restaurant not expecting very great steak according to a certain review. But we just wanted steak that night so we gave it a try. It started out with empanadas at a restaurant. Was yummy and then the steak came and we were so impressed. The steak was incredibly juicy and tender - no need for A1! We also got some mojitos were so good. I love it, frendly environment. Awesome custumer service, I was to say thanks to Alex our server for the great recomentations. I recommend this restaurant for everyone who appreciates the fine taste of

35.description: After going to the wrong Las Tablas (in diversy), we drove here and were seated right away. The food is similar to the diversy location, but here they had a band playing in the restaurant. We were trying to talk to our friends but the music was so loud we could barely hear each other. Food is pretty filling and the empanadas and fried seafood (which they always recommend in both locations) were okay. I would liked it more if it was not so loud or if we could have danced with the music..

19.description: Not what I expected at all. Restaurant holds a classy and elegant esteem with an atmosphere to match. Service was spectacular and the food was delicious. I had the Matrimoño; a steak and chicken combo served with potatoes and yuca. It was absolutely delicious! Will definately be back again soon.

28.description: Just went here today with my gf. Haven't been here in awhile. Service was good food was good as always. Just a tad salty on the steak and potatoes. I get the same thing every time which is a skirt steak and calamari served with potato and yuca and plantain. Highly recommend it. Sangria isn't that bad either. Will def be coming back here

45.description: I've lived around the corner from here for several years before actually trying it. I was hesitant with the mixed reviews but I will say it's not the best tapas place I have been to. It's just okay. I don't think you get for what you pay for considering their menu is on the higher side. We got the beef empanadas and the skirt steak which were both not horrible but definitely did not stand out. The waiter was really nice and seemed to be serving us just fine until the end. We must have waited over 45 min for the check and he kept coming by our table but just didn't seem to notice every time we tried to gesture that we were ready. Overall I would save yourself the trip but if you're desperate for a mediocre meal then go for it. OH and note the original location is BYOB(on lincoln) the portage park location is NOT. Boo! :(Also, you'll have to pay for parking. If you don't mind a good walk try down Milwaukee BEFORE the portage theatre by family dollar.

33.description: The hubby and I always come here when it's just the two of us, and we've always had meh service, decent drinks, and good food. So for Mother's Day we decided to bring my mother along with my mother in law so we can stop bragging about how good it is and they can try for themselves. We had a reservation for a table of 12.We waited 10 minutes when our table was right in front of us, unoccupied for those ten minutes. We were told to sit, we waited another 5 minutes for menus, and another 8 or so for just water.Drinks were taken, I ordered their Lemonade and vodka, it was brought to me with no vodka and no ice, it was warm. Had to return that. Our appetizers, combination empanadas (they usually come out with salsas) nothing was ever brought out so we had to say something by that time our empanadas were cold. If you go there a lot like we do you know that those empanadas are to die for with that salsa its like you have to have it TOGETHER! Our food order was taken, three of our steaks were undercooked and had to be returned. This is the first time I ordered the Picada Colombiana, which is  Entrana skirt steak (house specialty), rib-eye steak, pork loin, and chicken breast all grilled and sliced to perfection. Also comes with homemade chorizo, pork ribs, arepa, crunchy green plantain, sweet plantain, yuca and potato, Ok so one whatever steak we did get was pure fat, the pork ribs were hard as rock, the loin was over cooked. Overall was unhappy with what I was served.Our waitress had to be told several times on many different occasions for items we had ordered, for her only to forget so we had to remind her again. the worst part is we had to give $50.00 for a tip as it was automatically counted into the bill, which she did not deserve at all.For it being a Mother's Day celebration, I was very upset at the overall experience and quality of food. I probably will not be returning.

43.description: I have eaten here with my family 2 times.  I think what I like the most is the entertainment that can be seen there.  Both times we ate there musicians were playing and service was excellent. As for the food, the first experience was excellent, especially the empanadas and ceviche.  For dinner we ate the Churrasco and the Carna Asada.  We really enjoyed it.  Our second experience was not as good as the first but I think it had more to do with us than their food.  We had the Chorizo o Chicharron con Arepa and it wasn't what we expected.  Not something I would get again.  The rest of the meal was good but not as good as the first time.  Must of been an off day.

2.description: My teller at Chase down the street recommended this place when i mentioned I was hungry. I have never had Columbian food before, and so the menu was a bit intimidating. The staff was very nice once they realized I had sat down for lunch. I had the steak lunch special. The steak was perfect- well seasoned, rare to medium rare (the way I like it), juicy and delicious. The salad was a bit lack luster, and I would have had on a different plate so it didn't mingle with the hot food. The fried plantains were excellent. It was a belly filling lunch for $10.I recommend this place for ethnic food, and their commitment to airing all the soccer matches.

18.description: I've lived around the corner from here for several years before actually trying it. I was hesitant with the mixed reviews but I will say it's not the best tapas place I have been to. It's just okay. I don't think you get for what you pay for considering their menu is on the higher side. We got the beef empanadas and the skirt steak which were both not horrible but definitely did not stand out. The waiter was really nice and seemed to be serving us just fine until the end. We must have waited over 45 min for the check and he kept coming by our table but just didn't seem to notice every time we tried to gesture that we were ready. Overall I would save yourself the trip but if you're desperate for a mediocre meal then go for it. OH and note the original location is BYOB(on lincoln) the portage park location is NOT. Boo! :(Also, you'll have to pay for parking. If you don't mind a good walk try down Milwaukee BEFORE the portage theatre by family dollar.

41.description: I always love unwinding here with great Colombian food and service and sangria! On weekend nights, there's great live music and dancing. I can't say enough about the place. You can't choose a wrong meal here! Love it!

52.description: Great atmosphere. Service was ok when we were able to get the waitress attention. I had the combination of skirt steak & baby octopus. The meat was very well done & seasoned except for the ball of fat on it. The yuca & potato had absolutely no flavor whatsoever, SUPER Dry and hard the yuca looked like a hard cake, some ajo sauce to dip would probably help.

50.description: Dinner on Valentine's  Day without a reservation and we were seated almost immediatley. Granted, we arrived at 6pm. The combination empanadas were just the right size,  not too filling. My wife and I both ordered the Columbian lemonade with vodka. I couldn't taste the vodka in my first round but definitely found it on my second drink. Very refreshing drink.Both my wife and I ordered the Carne asada, well done doe her and medium for myself. The steak came on a hot plate and the sides on a separate plate. The portions were large and the food was great.  My steak was cooked perfectly with all the juices of a medium steak. We skipped out in dessert as we were very full from our entre. I definitely recommend this restaurant and will come back a second time.

4.description: Party of 7 celebrating my parents anniversary. We had no reservations, walked in and was seated right away since not busy on a Saturday afternoon. The food was great but I have to say the service sucked. The waiter took very long on everything, I had to get up and grab plates and silverware from another table.  he automatically charged his tip of 18-20%  bringing our total bill to $262.13. Overall, the food was good but It is over priced and the customer service is not the greatest! You can find a better restaurant with decent pricing and excellent customer service somewhere else.

6.description: I haven't been at this place for 10 years but the taste of the food is still the same.  Sooooooo yummy.  We order the combination for 2 which has the steak, chicken, sausage, pork.  the meat are so juicy esp. the steak.  The 3 sauces on the side which are all good but my favorite is the spicy green salsa. The sides are good too like the bananas, yuca, potatoes.  For our appetite, this combination could be shared by 3 to 4 people depending on how hungry you are.  We also ordered the empanada sampler which has 2 cheese, 2 chicken and 2 beef empanadas.  All three kinds of empanada are really good and tasty. Pricewise it's kinda pricy, about $27 per person without drinks.  It is soooo worth it though. Customer service? The waitress is a little bit uptight. The place wasn't that busy though since we went lunch time.

22.description: Service and food is fabulous! I recommend the combination plater, but everything is extremely yummy! From the drinks, food and service it is so enjoyable. Oscar was an awesome server, I will definitely be back for more. I just can't get enough lol
