15.description: This place is excellent for a date night if you are somewhat price sensitive but looking to impress your lady friend or partner. They play live music on Friday & Saturday, they have candles on every table.... and the food is amazing. Most stuff is priced between $10-20 for a dinner, I would recommend a Steak dinner called the "Entrana." It comes with Yucca, potatoes and the steak is hanging off the plate. It looked very good, tastes great and our meal came out to $52.00. I gave him $60 and called it a night. Keep in mind my lady friend had a mojito, I had a coke and we ordered the empenada appetizer. Great value for a nice place....... Great volume and space so I can have an intimate conversation.

57.description: Food here was really very good, but was very pricey - not consistent with the atmosphere.

20.description: Has great food, the empanadas are great! Some staff take a little long bit the place is great and very nice

36.description: Epinadas Tasty, Meatballs amazing. Needs more sides. Skirt steak good. More slices of potato would be nice. Fresh deco, fresh food and a good staff.

14.description: This place has gone drastically down hill. I used to eat here all the time, and then it kinda just fell off my radar.But I saw they were on grubhub now and got excited and ordered that night.The steak was terrible. Flavor was still great but, without any exaggeration, it was the worst cut of steak I have ever been served. The bulk of it was fat or cartilage. Through out the whole thing there were think lines of inedible fat.The potato was not flavored. At all. Period.... Yeah yummy (not).Plantain had something wrong with it. Had a funky flavor to it, not sure if it was cooked after something else or was just bad.Coconut flan, one of my favorites here usually, while still tasted amazing, was not set. When it arrived the whole bottom part was like pudding. It did not even hold its shape. Like, seriously? Just say you're out of it.I mean one mistake fine, but there was something wrong with every single thing on my plate. Should have just kept it off my radar!

28.description: We really loved this restaurant. The food was excellent and the service was very good.I had the duck. It was meaty, moist and flavorful, though I think it might have benefited from a light sauce. Mom had the stuffed cabbage. She is still raving about it. It came with roasted red potatoes and sides of pickled beets and slaw. Christopher had the pork chops. He too, really enjoyed his meal.We plan on returning soon and I am sure if the food is as good as our last experience, I will kick this up to 5 stars. If you like good Polish food, this is a good place to try!

1.description: We met some friends here for lunch today and really enjoyed ourselves. I felt a bit like a "loud American" with most of the tables being filled with quiet families speaking Polish (or some similar-sounding language to my ears) but the waitress and the regulars didn't do anything to make us feel like we didn't belong. It was a nice atmosphere.It's small in the front bar area. Homey, even. The tables and decor are understated and beautiful.The food was fantastic. We tried the sampler platter and enjoyed everything on it. It was as good as anything I've ever had at any polish restaurant and better in some respects.I'll probably stick to the stuffed cabbage and pierogi next time. The roast beef wasn't exactly what expected and my wife found the stroganoff to be not to her liking but we know we loved the other foods we had and we'll gladly eat there again.

39.description: It's kind of like eating lunch in your grandma's basement... if your grandma serves Polish food often in a wood paneled environment while you and your friends watch the strongman competition in Polish. All joking aside, it really did have a cozy sort of feel to it. Tried the pierogis and I thought those were pretty good though I also think the Kasia's frozen ones are good to so maybe you shouldn't trust my pierogi skills huh? I have had tons of potato pancakes in my life and while these things are ultra filling (I'm still full two days later) they were just OK. Potato pancakes often have a bit more flavor (at least the ones I really like ) and these required people to actually salt them. Overall, worth checking out but it won't be your favorite Polish restaurant.

9.description: My friend and I ended up here kind of randomly because the place we intended to visit was closed. I'm glad we tried it! I had borscht with croquette and the Smakosz pierogi. I especially liked the pierogi - it was a flavor I hadn't tried before. I'd definitely go here again.

29.description: My new favorite Polish restaurant! I don't know about other people, but I feel like it is hard to find a good Polish restaurant these days. Well look no more people! This place is amazing! The food is amazing & so is the price! I always get the polish assortment platter because I like a little bit of everything & simply cannot just pick one  thing. Everything is always delicious. The place is very clean & the staff is friendly. Again, if you're looking for awesome Polish food, this is it!

23.description: we have passed by smakosz restaurant for many years and have not stepped in to eat here until today. i am super happy and grateful we finally did.  we (chris, george and i) arrived for a late lunch around 2pm. the place is nice and cozy with paneling, nice b&w framed photos on the wall, booths and tables. our waitress, ula is very sweet and attentive.  we each ordered the polish assortment entree. we just loved the salad trio of beets and cole slaws. with each time i tried an item on my  assortment platter, the next was better than the last.  they were all so good so i don't have a favorite which will make it a little more difficult for me to decide which one i want to order next time. but since this is our new fave find, i know we'll be back here often to try each entree. come here with a good appetite and you will leave with a feeling of human fulfillment.

5.description: 6pm Sunday place was jam packed! We wanted to get in and out quickly and we thought we'll not going to happen tonight. Surprise, surprise, waitress took the entire order first visit, drinks then bread and butter arrived. Pierogi appetizer came out quickly and was delicious meat then potato and cheese as close to homemade as you can get.  Pork cutlet with mashed potatoes, chicken cutlet with cheese and mushrooms simply amazing. The side salad of beets, coleslaw and cucumber salad all served very cold and fresh. Loved it!

31.description: I come here with a group of very hungry hikers and Polish assortment  dish is everybody's favorite.I like Russian pierogi (potatoes and cheese)and dried fruit drink as well as all the soups which are prize winning.Visit  Smakosz and be amazed-enjoy Polish hospitality and hearty food that sticks to you ribs.

25.description: After coming here once I have fallen in love with their food. Their food is all comfort Polish food and is absolutely delicious. It has a homey feel and you will be greeted when you walk in with a dzien dobry. The service is extremely friendly and they treat their customers like family. There are great Polish beer options too! I had the pork hamburger which was smothered in gravy with mashed potatoes. They also give you lots of food. It was amazing! I will definitely be returning

12.description: Delicious, tasty and fresh food for great value. Very nice and friendly staff. Best Polish restaurant in the neighborhood.

37.description: Had the best trout dinner imaginable on what I now call "Fresh Fish Friday".  So much food at really fair pricing. A pint of Okocim, one of the 3 really good Polish beers available hit the spot. Smakosz may not be trendy now, but it's where I will be eating. Very relaxed atmosphere! They really spiffed the place up too.

21.description: This is one of the few places both of us can agree on, so we went in for dinner on Saturday night when nothing else sounded good.  They were having a wedding party in the back and a lot of the tables were filled in the main room, which we were glad to see.  I got the yummy chicken noodle soup and the stuffed cabbage.  Husband had the sampler plate and a side of their addictive mushrooms.  I ended up having to take half of the cabbage home - such large portions, but it was delicious even as a reheat!

16.description: After coming here once I have fallen in love with their food. Their food is all comfort Polish food and is absolutely delicious. It has a homey feel and you will be greeted when you walk in with a dzien dobry. The service is extremely friendly and they treat their customers like family. There are great Polish beer options too! I had the pork hamburger which was smothered in gravy with mashed potatoes. They also give you lots of food. It was amazing! I will definitely be returning

17.description: I have a lunch there sometimes. Very nice place, delicious food and friendly staff. Highly recommended.

10.description: I love love love the duck. My husband, daughter and I have eaten here a few times. I was hesitant, because I've never been a fan of polish food in general. But the prices are amazing and the quality of food is phenomenal. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is because of the atmosphere. It's dark and needs some serious updating. But with some simple renovations, they could easily double the business with how good their food and service is. We will definitely be back!

11.description: There is no question that the food is worth the trip to this Northwest Side restaurant. But the service has much to be desired.   I guess the question could be: Should you patronize this restaurant when it is crowded or when there are only a few patrons in the restaurant?   A friend and I went there for lunch midweek.  We were the 2nd and 3rd patrons at a table.  The waitress (there was only one staff person), was busy with a phone order for approximately 10 minutes that she completely forgotten that we were there.   I finally had to ask her to take our order.  Food was good, but service faulting.

26.description: Went today for first time,server spoke English and very nice.Had chicken cutlet with mushrooms excellent,side salads were very good. food very fresh,Me and two other peeps at lunch kind of surprised.Only gripe is the carpet was old and had a little stench to it,and outdated.But again food was awesome hope people will know about this place and get a great meal for a reasonable price.

27.description: Great waitresses, the food was yummy, hearty food, great deals.  I had the Smakosz pierogi's and my partner had the polish sample platter. Go! , it's a hidden gem.  Found it because of the stupid Gale street inn wouldnt take reservations for 4 and then they wanted us to wait 45 mins to an hour.  We searched yelp and found Smakosz.  Excellent :-)

35.description: Warm, cozy and meticulously clean restaurant with  a retro woodsy feel. Great quiet older crowd of Portage Park locals dining quietly here. The food is 'stick to your ribs delicious,' and refreshingly affordable. May I be so bold as to say...bordering on a ma and pa version of elegance.  Had the Hungarian goulash sandwiched between potato pancakes, topped with mozarella. Huge portions come with tasty slaw and beet salad. Nice, fresh balance of elements. Pair it with some smoky white borscht and Okocim beer and you're in a state of Eastern European bliss. We sat around peacefully in such a state, cared for by our adorable, unobtrusive server.Of the average reviews by a small pack of yelp wolves, the most amusing is the complaint about the lacking *wegetarianin* selection. It's Polish food for the love of God. Polish is meat, meat, and more meat. And by the way, Smakosz means "gourmet" in Polish.  Other cultures exist. Appreciate them. Meat is In.You will not regret the short trip to another, lovlier world. Far west on Lawrence, where Lawrence is more like a country road.  I will be coming here as often as possible.

8.description: FOOD: Arriving at 8pm on a Saturday night, I slipped in to the last available booth. My sweet waitress brought me water and a menu. When she returned a couple minutes later I ordered my meal of Tripe Soup, the Roasted Duck, and the Apple Strudel. Minutes later she served my soup and a small plate of three kinds of cold cabbage salads. The creamy slaw had just a light touch of dairy. The vinegar and carrot had a slight sour flavor, while the beet salad has a slight sweet flavor. None of the three had a strong flavor of any spices. They were different from each other in a very quiet way. The Tripe Soup was a delight! A hearty beefy broth contained several vegetables and nice long thin strips of soft tripe. I could have a whole meal if they served a larger dinner-sized portion, but this appetizer size was just perfect. Next she brought the Roasted Duck which came with a scoop of mashed potatoes and a small portion of cranberry sauce. The duck skin was vey crispy and, again, very light on spices. The meat near the skin was drier than the meat closer to the bone. Adding a bit of the wonderful cranberry sauce to the meat added the necessary moisture and complimentary flavor. The apple stuffing was very soft and moist and was a great addition. The mashed potatoes were hot but needed butter and salt that was on the table to make them more pleasing. Finally I was served the lightest strudel I've ever eaten. Normally I get my knife and fork ready to tear into my strudel, but this was different. It was more like a crumb cake than a layered pastry dessert. Only a fork was needed to cut thru the light cake and apple filling. Again, this dish was made with a light hand. The apples weren't chewy or sugary sweet, they were just right. The chocolate sauce is mainly there for show. It's really not necessary to add anything to this already uniquely executed dessert. Whip cream, yes. Caramel sauce, maybe. Chocolate sauce, no. This was a great way to end a comforting and hearty meal. INSIDE: More than a dozen booths surround the walls, while the tables and chairs(for larger parties) were in the middle of the space. Modern black & white framed photos are hung on wood paneled walls. Mauve and orange vinyl cover the booth seats. The décor is dated but everything is clean and well-kept. The Men's bathroom and was clean and the sink had HOT water for washing hands. The bar was stocked with the normal brands of liquor but there are no top-shelf spirits or modern cocktail choices. OUTSIDE: The building façade is dated but clean and has a homey feeling to it. There is plenty of free main street parking on Lawrence. The neighborhood is quiet and family-friendly. OVERALL: Smakosz is a good choice for those who want to eat authentic Poilsh food. A warm family feeling is all around you and it shows in the food as well. If you're not a fan of overly spiced food, then the dishes here are very accessible to you. The flavor comes from the basic ingredients and the rich Polish tradition which can put a smile on anyone's face.

0.description: This place is amazing! It was recommended to me by my Aunt and Uncle and I am so glad I went. I come from a Polish family and so I have very high expectations when it comes to Polish food and Smakosz exceeded them. I ordered the Polish plate which came with a golabek (stuffed cabbage), kielbasa, baked pork in a mushroom gravy, a porkchop, 2 potato pierogi, and mashed potatoes. It was way too much for me to finish and had plenty leftover. The food is so fresh and authentic. I've gone to many Polish restaurants and this one is definitely at the top of my list. I highly recommend giving it a try. I also brought home some blueberry pierogi which were phenomenal. I feel like it is such a hidden gem!

38.description: This was our lunch stop on the neighborhood tour.  A small, wood-paneled wall lounge with a few tables by the bar and more tables in the back.  Something about it was a bit uncomfortable to me due to the set up and vibe.  I did, however, love the lazy susan in the middle of our table.Johnny and I split two dishes: 1) the potato pancakes, which were quite bland and the huge size did not make up for the lack of flavor.  I know great latkes, and these were not in that category.  2) Russian Pierogis (potato and cheese) with bacon.  These were quite tasty.  The waitress also gave us complimentary samplers of side salads--sauerkraut, cabbage slaw, and beets with horseradish, all were pretty good.  Prices were pretty reasonable.I am not a connoisseur of Polish food, but this was only okay on my scale.  Some of the other dishes sounded interesting, so if I were in the 'hood maybe I would try it again, but I definitely would not go out of my way to return.

20.description: This place may be the CLEANEST restaurant that I have ever been in.  The decor is a little old but VERY well maintained.  I was very impressed.  The food quality was excellent and the prices were very fair.  I'll definitely go back.  The Polish platter was great and the pirogi was as good as it gets.  I loved the stuffed cabbage too.

19.description: This place may be the CLEANEST restaurant that I have ever been in.  The decor is a little old but VERY well maintained.  I was very impressed.  The food quality was excellent and the prices were very fair.  I'll definitely go back.  The Polish platter was great and the pirogi was as good as it gets.  I loved the stuffed cabbage too.

33.description: Came here right at closing. Thank goodness I brought my Polish interpreter with me. She pleaded with the waitress and , of course, we were seated. Deijuke!!!Smakosz is in Jefferson Park! Portage Park does not begin until you hit Montrose. I grew up here! There are a few comments about the layout and decor. I do not know when it became Smakosz, but it was previously a Chinese restaurant. I liked the interior. Reminded me of a Polish Lodge dining room (sans the booths color.) The Banquet room was like a Polish Lodge dining room. My guest said she came here with 25-30 people and they were seated in this room. She said the food is good. She was right again! She started with a cold soup which was a creamy dill with Uszka and a side of mashed potatoes. Mashed potatoes with soup? She said this is the way she remembers her mother serving it. I ordered the Breaded Pork Chop with mushrooms. It was substantial and done well. It came with mashed potatoes. My lady ordered the Pork Cutlet. She said it was delicious. The prices are inexpensive for the quality and quantity of food served. The complimentary saladtki is excellent. I will be back to try other options on the menu and the pierogi. Are theirs better than mine? We will see.....Loved the place!Johnny Chitown

2.description: I really enjoyed eating lunch at this restaurant for the service was good and food was delicious! We tried the Polish food assortment-stuffed cabbage, pork chop, baked pork, sausgae, pierogi, potatoes and Stroganoff, also the salad trio was good!

34.description: I like the old school decor. The food came out hot & tasted fresh. We had cabbage roll w/ mushroom sauce. It was ok. Also Russian perogie which was also ok. It's pretty standard food. I'd probably go back & try some other food. Service was excellent.Decor was dark but clean...didn't bother me.

32.description: This place is just OK for polish restaurant. I can't say anything bad about them food tastes average

18.description: We really loved this restaurant. The food was excellent and the service was very good.I had the duck. It was meaty, moist and flavorful, though I think it might have benefited from a light sauce. Mom had the stuffed cabbage. She is still raving about it. It came with roasted red potatoes and sides of pickled beets and slaw. Christopher had the pork chops. He too, really enjoyed his meal.We plan on returning soon and I am sure if the food is as good as our last experience, I will kick this up to 5 stars. If you like good Polish food, this is a good place to try!

41.description: This is our go-to place for when a bunch of my family gets together. Or when we have out-of-towners with a taste for Pollsh food.  The Polish plate has a little bit of everything you could want--pierogies, breaded pork cutlet, polish sausage, roast pork, golumpki and more. When I say a little bit don't confuse that with small portions, because the portions are quite generous. They bring out a plate of  salads before your entrees. Usually it is a cole slaw, some other cabbage slaw and beets. I am a huge beet fan, their beets are amazing, they have just the right amount of horseradish in them. At times the waitresses don't speak too much English, which makes it a little challenging if you have special requests. My favorite entree is  the pork cutlet with mushrooms. The cutlet is almost as big as the plate, pounded thin and breaded topped with lots of tasty mushrooms.

13.description: Smakosz has great Russian and Polish dishes. The portions are very generous and the taste is authentic. I had their salmon with spinach and potato pancake and it was served fresh and the chicken noodle soup hit home in this cold weather. Service was friendly. I would definitely come back.

4.description: Authentic Polish home cooking. Always fresh, delicious, tasteful dishes. Chicken noodle soup, pickle soup, red and white borsch and sauerkraut  soup are beyond delicious. Tripe soup (I know, I know) is the best! Breaded chicken breast is gigantic. Veal cutlets, hunter stew, Hungarian pancakes with Hungarian stew are just few that I had a chance to eat and WOW!!! Every meal comes with a side of mashed or baked potatoes or french fries and three side salads. Portions are big. Quick and very nice service. Can't wait to go back!

24.description: I love Smakosz! The food is all homemade and just delicious. All the ladies that work there couldn't be any more friendly either. I go for lunch on a regular basis, which doesn't make for a productive work day after zzzzz..... but doesn't mater.. deelish!My recommendation? Get extra mushroom gravy over EVERYTHING!!

6.description: If they had 4 and a half stars, I'd give them that. But something has to really knock my socks off for 5 stars ;)Excellent, satisfying, authentic Polish cuisine. Reasonably priced, great staff. Pork Tenderloin was great! When I'm in the area, I enjoy dropping in.

22.description: Last week, a friend of mine and I were in the area.  We were actually trying to go to a different place, but found ourselves at Smakosz Restaurant.  We arrived somewhere between a late lunch and early dinner so the place was near empty and the waitress was watching the news (in polish from what I gather).  The place was very clean, even the blinds didn't have a spot of dust on them.  (Nice attention to detail.)  The decor was relaxing with Michael Buble playing in the background.I had a combo platter since I couldn't decide.  My friend was not a fan of the cuisine so he went with a sausage platter.  He agreed though the food was really good.  I should have taken notes on what was what, but alas I only took the one picture.  I liked the cabbage stuffed roll in the red sauce the most.  However, everything on the plate was good.  If I worked in the area, this would be where I would lunch most often.  I'll have to return to sample more of Smakosz's offerings!

15.description: great. a hidden gem. Great fresh. Made to order food. If you are Paleolithic or low carb this is a great place, just bypassing  bread and potatoes. Cheap strong big drinks. Friendly staff and the cook comes out to see if you enjoyed yourself. Like mommy's but better. I am here every Mondays, join me.

40.description: Smack Ho's?! That's where we're eating? Ok, it's not pronounced like that, but close. If you told someone you were trying to find Smack Ho's they'd probably point you in the right direction. We wandered in here on the last leg of our Jefferson Park neighborhood tour. It's kind of like walking into your grandparent's basement - wood paneled walls; orange vinyl booths; round tables with lazy susans; and brown tones all over. The front room is oddly set up, there's a counter almost more fitting to a dry cleaner than a restaurant and the bar seems like something you're more likely to find in a banquet hall (one draft tap, no seats, small and no frills). When I ventured to the ladies I saw that there's another room in back that looks much more modern. Service was ok, but erred on the slow side; we had the Polish version of the strongest man competition to entertain us though. Most of us got the potato pancakes and Russian pierogis. Everyone agreed the pierogis were awesome and the potato pancakes were just ok. One Yelper opted for dessert instead, her banana split looked awesome! To drink I got a draft of Okocim (OK) beer, it's a Polish lager that I find quite tasty. We got some starter salads before our meal - a cold sauerkraut, coleslaw and beets with horseradish. The sauerkraut was my favorite, but the beets will clean out your sinuses. Bottom line: Not a lot of veggie choices, but the prices were reasonable and those pierogis were damn good.

7.description: So Gooooooooood!!!!!! I could eat here every day! So far I have had White Borsch, Smakosz Pierogis, Hungarian Pancakes, Vienna Cutlet, Grilled Sausage.. All excellent!! I love the salad that comes with dinner. I look forward to trying everything! *****

36.description: Yes, I really enjoyed my dining experience at Smakosz.  The place looks like it has not been renovated since 1972 and features comfy orange bench seats and lots of wood paneling.  I settled on some borscht to start and a polski talerz for the entree.  The beet soup arrived in a huge bowl and had 5 meat uszki.  The soup was well seasoned.  The Polski talerz had a combination of foods including a cabbage roll, sausage, pierogi,mashed potato, pork cutlet and pork slice.  In addition to this all entrees came with a relish plate of beets, cucumbers and slaw.  The food was not too greasy and left me full but not feeling like I was dying.  The prices were reasonable and you got a lot of bang for your buck...or in this case kopitky.

30.description: The roasted duck with apples is delicious, and they give you half a duck. The mashed potatoes taste very instant, so I will have to try the sautéed potatoes next time. The pork tenderloin looks dry, but is surprisingly pretty good. I will definitely check this place out again.

3.description: Had the opportunity to eat at this establishment when I was in the area for an APICS work session.  I had heard about from other committee members and finally got a chance to go.  I tried their sampler plate and it was the right choice as it did too things: 1. it confirmed the extent of the excellent variety of Polish Food they prepare and 2. it gave me enough to know that I want to return many times for larger portions of everything on the sampler plate.  The potato pancakes were outstanding and the sausages, well I have a hard time describing how great they were.  Need less to say I shall return and I hope it doesn't take me four years like it took McArthur after he uttered those words!

14.description: Last week, a friend of mine and I were in the area.  We were actually trying to go to a different place, but found ourselves at Smakosz Restaurant.  We arrived somewhere between a late lunch and early dinner so the place was near empty and the waitress was watching the news (in polish from what I gather).  The place was very clean, even the blinds didn't have a spot of dust on them.  (Nice attention to detail.)  The decor was relaxing with Michael Buble playing in the background.I had a combo platter since I couldn't decide.  My friend was not a fan of the cuisine so he went with a sausage platter.  He agreed though the food was really good.  I should have taken notes on what was what, but alas I only took the one picture.  I liked the cabbage stuffed roll in the red sauce the most.  However, everything on the plate was good.  If I worked in the area, this would be where I would lunch most often.  I'll have to return to sample more of Smakosz's offerings!

12.description: This is my new "happy".  I love-love-love this place.  It has a chic clean new look.  Great lighting and very laid back.  I had my makeup  and eye brows done by Mary.  She is amazing!  Mary was very sweet and welcoming and did a great job.   I will definitely call her for my next event.  She also did subtle makeup on my 13 year old and wand curls, for her 8th Grade Graduation.  She knew exactly what I wanted and delivered.  Most places don't know the difference between subtle and pageant makeup, Mary did.     I will definitely go back and try other services.

3.description: Decided out with the ombré and in with a lob haircut.. And I LOVE IT!! Atalie never disappoints, she's amazing at what she does, I only trust her now. Thanks a million!!

1.description: Mary is beyond amazing! She is a natural makeup artist! She makes you feel like a million bucks! She listens to her clients and gives them the best service! You can't compare her work with no one in town. She did my makeup for my bridal shower, wedding and whenever I just want to feel fabulous.  I have sent many of my friends her way and they were all so happy with her work. Besides a makeup artist, she is the Queen of eyebrows! Seriously she can make your eyebrows go from rags to riches! So ladies there is no excuse to walk around town with ugly eyebrows! Mary can fix them and help you grow them back right to get a beautiful shape!

2.description: Hm. Pretty basic. Got a, pedicure and eyebrow. I still had left over brow hair. Not like "let's let this grow hair"Like randoms.Pedicure.  Meh, that poor girl barely did abutting l anything.  Watching her paint my toe nails was horrifying.As well as watching one of the girls put curls in her clients hair.  I would have been pissed

9.description: Mary has been doing my eye brows for about 2 years now and is truly an eye brow goddess. Salon is super cute and I love that I'm able to book her online, especially because she books up pretty quickly.

10.description: This was by far the WORST Brazilian waxing experience I have ever had!!!  I was very unhappy with their service every step of the way.  When I first walked in, I was barely greeted before the employees immediately went right back to loudly gossiping.  20 minutes after my appointment time, I interrupted the gossip session to ask when they were going to be available, and was told to wait another 15 minutes.  When I was FINALLY brought back to the waxing room, 50 minutes later than my scheduled appointment, the room looked very dirty and there was no cover at all on the table you have to lay on.  No sheet, no paper covering, nothing at all.  Although I was very unhappy with the situation, I had already paid for it and already waited almost an hour, so I decided to suck it up.  Before laying down on the table, I actually had to brush someone else's hair off of it.  DISGUSTING!  When the waxing technician came in, she asked if I was okay with soft wax, and I told her I had only used hard wax before and asked her what the difference was.  Before responding she already started spreading the wax on my skin.  She did not wait for me to answer, I was in mid-objection when she slathered it on.  Not cool.  She then told me that soft wax usually hurts more, but she thinks it works better.  That was comforting...10 very rushed, painful minutes later, she told me I was all done, and "cleaned up" which consisted of her wiping the area with a damp paper towel.  She did not use any after care lotion or anything, even though there was a bottle right on the table next to us.  She told me that because I had shaved several weeks before hand, there were a few "straggler hairs" she couldn't get.  When she left the room and I examined her work, I could not believe the mess she left behind.  There were clumps of wax and tons of hair left over.  The very first wax that I ever had after years of shaving left me with a much better result, so I was not buying her excuse that the terrible results were because I had shaved weeks prior.  Overall, I left extremely unhappy, in pain, and without the results I paid for.  Not to mention I felt the immediate need to shower after laying on that disgusting table.  I bought a Groupon for 3 waxes, and there is NO WAY I will ever go back to use the other 2.  What a waste of money and time!  If I could give them 0 stars, I would.  Ugg!

4.description: My review comes a few weeks late however very necessary......Mary did a FABULOUS job on my brows!  Best brow job I've had so far.  If you have problem brows (and those that DO know who you are) give Mary a try.  You won't be disappointed.

6.description: I have been a client for 6 months, Sleek Beauty studio is amazing! Mary and her team are very professional and talented. This salon offers several services and I have tried almost all of them. From Brows, nails and hair this salon does it all. Mary personally makes sure that each visit is amazing and treats all of her clients exceptionally well. From the time you walk in and till your services are over Sleek Beauty Studio goes above and beyond for their clients. Appointments are highly recommended since the salons opening it's gain it's popularity. I love that this salon uses styleseat for it's appointments, it allows me to make my appointments pretty quickly online or from my phone without any hassle. I would highly recommend this salon.

15.description: The shop is beautiful and family owned. Mary the owner is wonderful and her team is awesome. I have seen some of the work done at this shop and they are not lacking in talent. My wife will soon be going here for her long, curly, hard to cut hair - that she only trusts one other stylist in Chicago to cut. Mary and her team can transform you into the star you want to be. Shop local, support local, visit them today!

0.description: Hands down Mary is my FAVORITE Eyebrow Specialists! That woman is a life saver lol She listens to way you want and makes suggestions. I've been to so many other places and always end up going back to Mary so she can fix my over waxed eyebrows. Her salon is super cute too! Make sure to call or book online.

5.description: Where do I begin. From the first appointment with Mary I was hooked. She made me feel so comfortable. She's attentive and she explains in detail every step. Mary is very hospitable walking in sleek beauty studio you feel like family. It's clean, cozy and so welcoming. I no longer allow anyone to touch these brows. I highly recommend Mary to everyone. I can actually say all my family and friends have eyebrows by Mary!

13.description: Everything was perfect from beginning to end. ..I live in Minnesota but travel to chicago just to visit sleek beauty. Safe and secure neighborhood,  clean and glamorous salon.  Extremely talented and down to earth staff members.  Mary did my brows and Atalie colored and cut my hair.  I was in the day before Christmas and still treated like a queen, and not rushed.  I highly recommend Sleek beauty.  Thank you Mary and Atalie. I will see you next month.

11.description: Atalie is a god send! My hair is very fine and Atalie is able to work volume into my hair that lasts. I also swear by her wand curls which last into the next day. She was avle to repair damaging Ombre job done by another salon and keep my hair long and healthy.

8.description: Considering the effort I made to get over here, Mary doesn't seem to care about her clients time. I was so worried I was getting there a little late, I had the courtesy to call her ahead to time to let her know I would be 5 to 10 minutes late. She said "no problem, I'm running about 5 to 10 minutes late as well.  So I'll be ready when you get here."  I got there 7 minutes late as expected. She had me wait 40 minutes until she acknowledged that she was running behind but wasn't really apologetic at all for wasting my time and effort. She didn't care. So I left. I'm a new client. Not a good look. She was recommended to me by a friend....yeah, I'll make sure she stops recommending her considering her lack of courtesy.Don't waste a bride's time!

14.description: Mary and her team so an excellent job. She is very professional and holds her work and that of her team to a very high standards. The entire team makes you feel welcomed in the salon and their work is amazing! You will not be disappointed!!

7.description: not the best brazilian ive had cuz not all the hair was taken off. she was really nice and friendly but not as thorough as i wouldve liked and used to.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Coloring, Kids' Hair

29.description: Their focaccia is delicious.  We've traveled to Italy many times and their focaccia pizza is quite comparable.  Their bakery items are quite tasty too!  They recently expanded so  so it seems things are still a bit in the works, but if you are looking for good good a a reasonable price, give this place a try.  We have made it a habit to pick-up their focaccia and sandwiches on the weekends.

42.description: This is my top notch - go-to bakery.  Being an ex-NYer, I love their sicilian style pizza! Finally a place in Chicago that compares to home!  Their sweets are pretty fabulous, they have deli meats, cheeses, olives, etc.  The bread is by far the best I've had - hard on the outside, but nice and moist on the inside.  It's so reasonably priced!!

23.description: On my way to Madison, I stopped by Sicilia to pick up lunch and get a break from the hours of gridlock I was enduring.  I found them by their Yelp rating, as is my normal course of action when searching for food in new surroundings.I got the spinach and ricotta pizza, which unfortunately wasn't that great (too bready), and picked up some cannoli as a present for a friend.  They claim to have the best cannoli in Chicago, though I'm not sure of their source for this or whether the rest of Chicago's cannoli are just that lackluster.  The cannolis were better than the pizza, but still left me craving some as good as the ones I ate in Rome.  Businesses shouldn't  set high expectations unless they intend to meet them...$10 credit card minimum.

8.description: I'm giving it one star for being closed on the claimed open hours three times I've been there.

31.description: My family is just thrilled with this bakery! We always went here for their bakery pizza but now it is a weekly order for great Italian dishes! I literally recommend this place to everyone in the neighborhood! Keep up the great work and delicious dishes!

34.description: Went there on a recommendation because its relatively close in proximity to my house. First time was not so bad. Enough to bring me back for 1 more try. That said, second experience was terrible. 3 people in front of me walked out because of how long they waited for a sandwich. Upwards of 30+ minutes. I order a slice of pizza (which I really do like) and a classic Italian. Pizza took about 5 minutes to heat up and usually holds me over until my sandwich arrives. I had the day off so I really wasn't in any rush, however watching the flow of things and how customers were being handled I was shocked. 1 guy was training (so he couldn't handle meats) and the other girl was taking care of everything. They looked like they were running around in all directions with no flow of things. Guy in back (might be owner) is hard to understand and is rarely seen in front. Also, bread for the sandwiches is just so-so.Anyhow, after 30 minutes, the owner comes out with what looked like meatballs and marinara...which I said that was not what I ordered. All I wanted was an Italian deli sandwich. He was apologetic and so was the girl working there so who knows...maybe it was just an off day. My only advice: Stop having high school kids run your business and an additional person working up front might be helpful too.

16.description: OMG good. Really. Nothing that we had was any less than miraculously good. Did I mention cheap? Granted we are light eaters, but 2 kids, and 2 adults ate lunch with dessert AND took home pastries for around $20. What? Yeah, that is no typo. Try the rice ball thingies. Just trust me. The spinach and cheese was divine. I almost wish I'd never had one because I crave them so much now. Come to think of it, I they have even made appearances in my dreams lately. *sigh*It is definitely not a fancy place, and the service is slooow. I don't care.  There is a free parking lot on the side, and fabulous food for a pittance. I really am in love.Closed on Mondays. I found this out the hard way, giddy from realizing I was just a few blocks away and ready to satisfy that craving.....only to be crushed, seeing the closed sign in the window.Never mind.  Sicilia, you are so good, you warrant a visit all of your own(despite the distance I must travel from my current digs), and I cannot wait to acquire more of your savory goodness followed by another one of the best cannolis I have ever had the privilege to eat. And believe me I won't stop there, I will spread out the joy with take home deli meats, cheeses and specialties, and a few more sweet treats for later. Excuse me while I wipe up this drool.

13.description: I was kind of impressed with the food. I wasn't expecting much since I had $15 Groupon for a 1 topping Sicilian pan pizza, 12 jumbo chicken wings with fries, 2 cannolis and a 2-liter of soda. I liked the pizza and my husband really liked the spicy BBQ wings (more than the Buffalo). The place has a little bit of an identity crisis b/c it's a combination of a bakery/deli/pizza parlor. There is some seating for dine-in but I choose to carry-out. Overall it was clean and parking was easy. Honestly, I would have given a higher rating but there were a couple issues with redeeming my Groupon. 1. I had tried a couple weeks ago to redeem my Groupon but they didn't have chicken wings. The staff suggested coming back in a couple hours b/c the order was supposed to arrive. Good thing I called ahead b/c the order never arraved. They were kind enough to try to substitute but my husband didn't want just fries and onion rings. 2. Also when I finally redeemed my Groupon I didn't get the fries that were supposed to come with the wings. It's not a big deal I just hate feeling like I didn't get what I was promised in my Groupon. Lame!

11.description: I've been past this place a hundred times and can't believe I've been missing out the whole time. Ordered the italian sandwich. Was the best sandwich I've had on the northwest side. Topped it off with a fresh cannoli cookie all for $8. It will definitely be a place I stop every whenever I'm in the area.

39.description: I've been coming to this bakery/deli for about 20 years now and it is still the best bakery I know of.  The pizza is sooo good, I think it is the sauce that gets you.  The roast beef is the best you'll ever have and the pastries are too addicting.  Just recently they opened up their menu to include a lot of italian cuisine...everything from pastas to paninis.  I haven't had a whole lot on the new menu but what I did have was very tasty; the bleu burger was nice, E's chicken alfredo was tasty, and the pasta al forno was also very tasty.  My goal is to try one of everything...do not miss out on this place.

37.description: They have gone CRAZY & opened expanded their business, no EXPLOADED their business.  They do delivery and their menu has tripled.  I was excited to get their menu & ordered the next day.  Well...hour 30 minutes later I got my soggy cold food!  I called & discussed with the manager and he was very apologetic so that was good.  Anyhow, I think they just bit off more than they can handle & there are going to be some long growing pains.  I'll order again in a few months when I hope the delivery and food quality has gone up.3 stars b/c I have faith!

0.description: Never go to a subway or jimmy johns again if you have access to this place.  Also, the italian cookies are a plenty, very reasonably priced, and insanely tasty.  If you need pizza, they got it.  They have these cannoli buns.  Holy cow, have them heat one up for you or take some home and zap them in the microwave.  They have about 5 tables so you can eat right in the bakery by the windows.  They close at 6pm I think

38.description: My family and I have been coming here for years for their bread and Sicilian pizza - both outstanding!  I was sooooo excited when I got a menu in my mailbox - they are now serving a full menu of paninis, pasta, chicken, ribs, etc.  I couldn't wait to try it!  I went with my husband and son just this past weekend and we ordered a grilled chicken panini and a turkey panini.  My husbands was a little overdone and when it was brought to the table, they told us they were already making a new one, but feel free to start with the one we had.  I looked at it, and it really looked perfectly ok to me!  We ended up taking the second sandwich home and they threw in a free brownie and eclair as an apology!  You can't beat the price, sandwich, chips and soda for $6.25!!  Take that Panera!  I can't wait to try more of the menu, we plan to make it a regular Saturday event for the rest of the summer.  I was told that homemade gelato is on the way as well - I may never leave the bakery!!  Whether you are in the area or not, you have to stop in.  Don't expect anything inside to be fancy or trendy, it's just awesome Sicilian food made by awesome Sicilians!  Mangia!

27.description: Be prepared to gain about 100 pounds!   Some of the best Italian food I've ever tasted.

32.description: Very interesting but no menu on walls. So I had to ask what I could get. Then I saw a paper menu on counter and was able to place my order. The sandwiches were ill and for that the favorable review. I have got to try more of their stuff will come again. It was a bit pricey but the sandwich came with chips and soda.

44.description: This place has the BEST cannoli's anywhere. They make them still by hand and are the freshest anywhere. Definitely something everyone should try. If you are a cannoli connoisseur I guarantee these will be the best you ever have.

24.description: i was going to get some carryout yesterday since i was in the area but when i looked into the case where the pumpkin slices were located, there was a roach crawling around the bottom of the case. i told a man behind the counter there was a roach running around the bottom of the case. he killed it it but it grossed me out and i left. i know that most places of business have them, i just don't want to see them. if there is a roach in the daytime in a lighted case running around, i think they must have a big problem. sorry, but i will not return.

7.description: Love this place, best cannolis and tiramisu. Staff is extremely fast, friendly and great.

40.description: I bought a couple of creme filled almond cookie/pies, creme filled green cookies and a cannoli. Mold had completely infected one of the cookie pies and the other one was so old the corn syrup had seeped through the wax paper. My girlfriend almost puked. The cannoli was old - but ok.

30.description: I wish you could rate food and sevice separately...the pizza very tasty although skimpy on the toppings and this was my 3rd and last time ordering...it's always some excuse as to why my order was wrong or incomplete...tonight 2 deliveries and still got it wrong and then no answer and no call back after leaving 2 messages...they need help...Fred was really nice but blew it by not calling me back...I'm done...I wonder how long they'll last?

1.description: I drive to this bakery from Mundelein, and have a friend who drives in from Lake Villa.  Why, you ask?  Because we've been spoiled by the quality of the goods sold by Sicilia Bakery!  I'm sorry for repeating what others have stated, but they really DO have the BEST cannoli's I've ever tasted!!!  The best cucidati cookies!  The best breads.  The best Sicilian pan pizza.  And, get this - the best prices!!  I recently went to a bakery that's in my town and picked up their cucidati cookies, and all I can say is, we had to use a magnifying glass to find the skinny little line of fig filling.  I'm not kidding about that.  We thought they were just butter cookies until we pulled them up to our eyes and squinted.  And they were quite pricey!  In addition, Sicilia Bakery has been around for decades and they seem to have a relationship with a lot of regulars.  It's a family run business and everyone hustles to get you in and out as quickly as possible.  Everything is fresh, too.  You won't find them selling cannoli's filled the day before, resulting in a limp shell, the way so many other bakeries do.  Once you've been to Sicilia Bakery, all other bakeries disappoint.  I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this place!!

9.description: On my way to Madison, I stopped by Sicilia to pick up lunch and get a break from the hours of gridlock I was enduring.  I found them by their Yelp rating, as is my normal course of action when searching for food in new surroundings.I got the spinach and ricotta pizza, which unfortunately wasn't that great (too bready), and picked up some cannoli as a present for a friend.  They claim to have the best cannoli in Chicago, though I'm not sure of their source for this or whether the rest of Chicago's cannoli are just that lackluster.  The cannolis were better than the pizza, but still left me craving some as good as the ones I ate in Rome.  Businesses shouldn't  set high expectations unless they intend to meet them...$10 credit card minimum.

26.description: Their pizza bread and cannolis were totally worth the hype!  The sauce had so much flavor and the bread had a soft pleasant texture while the cannolis were really creamy and tasty!Service was kinda iffy as I had to wait 30 minutes for my calzone when they said that would take 15 minutes and never got an apology.  It was very big, about 14 in. by 8 in.  It was made with very little sauce, cheese, sausage topping, and the dough was very thin.  I'd love to give this place 5 stars, especially from the pizza bread.  I swear that stuff is like crack!  Credit cards are accepted over $10.

25.description: If you want any good service from this place, don't order and have it delivered.  They don't know the difference between fried chicken with vesuvio mashed potatoes and vegetables and half baked chicken with french fries.WHEN YOU ORDER FRIED CHICKEN WITH MASHED POTATOES AND VEGGIES, YOU SHOULD GET FRIED CHICKEN WITH MASHED POTATOES AND VEGGIES not HALF BAKED CHICKEN WITH FRENCH FRIES.  I DON'T EAT FRENCH FRIES.Plus they said they would call back in 5 minutes and never called back.  We called back after 10 minutes and were told they would call back in 5 minutes.  They never did.  So, we called back and told them to send the right. order.  I was ready to drive it back there and dump it on their counter.  I am still waiting for the corrected order 1/2 hr later.

12.description: Soo delicious! Thick crust,  tasty sauce, yummy cheese. Nothing special inside,  but very nice people.  Great when you want something a little different than typical pizza in Chicago.

21.description: Great pizza and super affordable! I always order it and serve as appetizers for all of my family parties and have never heard a complaint.  Their baked goods are fantastic as well! The fact that they deliver is a plus, however I tried to get delivery on a Sunday and was advised they do not deliver on sundays. This didn't discourage me from ordering again, but this information would have been helpful to read on their menu ( it was not stated on the menu).

17.description: I really enjoyed the flavor of the food and how fresh it was. There was a delicious Italian sandwich I bought and the foccacia pizza was ready to go behind the counter. There were so many pastries on the other side and I will return and try those another time.

10.description: I ordered an 8 inch cannoli cake for my birthday yesterday.  I was so in the mood for a  delicious cannoli cake...boy was I disappointed.  Had a weird taste to it....Also they forgot something....THE FREAKIN CANNOLI  !!!!   Thin strip of cannoli filling...They really put a damper on my birthday...I miss my 20 bucks...

5.description: I stopped in a few weeks ago because Mom had requested that I pick up "something" for the coffee. I was in the area, saw the sign and presto, there I was.They had a nice assortment of cookies. I got Christopher some of the cherry drop cookies and then a few pastries. They had some very plain cookies I got for Mom, because she doesn't like anything overly sweet. In addition, I picked up a loaf of Italian bread which was good and actually kept quite well.The other half of the store is like a deli, so I got some Italian meatballs, some pizza and a few jars of imported spaghetti sauce. All in all, I was quite satisfied with what I got, but I do want to try more items down the road.

35.description: I am ADDICTED!!!  I discovered this gem about a year ago and I love it. It's dangerous because I live about 2 blocks away.   It's a great neighborhood spot w/lots of regulars, or should I say, dedicated followers. Their pizza is fantastic, the cheesecake is amazing and the breads and salads are always fresh!  Oh, and the pasta, perfect!  I get the lasagna, it's so good!  The prices are so fair, especially for the quality food and the amazing service.  I always go in thinking I'm just going to grab a slice and I leave w/a slice and some sort of yummy, sweet treat, and sometimes I even get myself lunch for the next day, lol.  Recently I bought a cannoli cake for a birthday at work, there was nothing left, people were fighting over it.  They also came in a bit early so I could pick up fresh in the morning w/out being late to work, now that's service.  If you've never tried it you have to go in and try something, anything!  Thanks for always providing good food and great service.

19.description: DELICIOUS cannolis! I can't wait to try their other goods, because it appears they offer so many wonderful items!

28.description: Tried this spot for the first time recently after a menu was put in our mailbox. Seems like a nice little neighborhood spot. We ordered some takeout dishes - a steak sandwich and lemon chicken - from the extended menu and both were really great! I had to wait for a few minutes when I got there so the lady at the counter threw in a cannoli for free. Will definitely be back.

3.description: Sicilia has the BEST Cannolis in THE WORLD. Really? I'm not kidding. I have been going to Sicilia Bakery for 40 years. I remember getting the great thick crust pan-style pizza by the piece when I was a boy. The quality of all of their pizzas, breads (to die for), and bakery items are great and always fresh.Highly recommended. Great prices toolOnce you go there, it will be on your radar forever. You'll find car steering itself there if you're within 3 miles. Sometimes I'll just get a few apple slices, tiramisu, eclairs, or cookies - bring them to my friends or to work - and every time people ask where I got these treats from because they want more. Don't forget the spinach/feta pizza for a great lunch!

33.description: This is a great place. The service is top notch. The slices of pizza are delicious and fresh and very cheap. They have recently expand there menu like crazy so much more than pizza. Everytime I go back there I said I;m going 2 explore new items but I stick w/ the pizza its that good. Also wonderful bread and all the girls behind the counter are very nice & helpful. They have been in business since 1969 so they are doing something right! If you are in the area worth stopping by.

43.description: This ma and pa place is so yummy.  They have gotten up at 3am every day for probably 50 years.  The pizza does rock.  They under cook it so that you can warm up the pizza in the oven at home. If you order to eat there ask to warm up in oven. In march they make the most yummy desserts for St. Joseph called ZEPPOLI.  they only make these 3 weeks out of the year so hurry up after the  19th they're gone. Zeppoli- french donut filled with custard. they fill them w /cannoli to but i like custard much better.The bread rocks ,  order the Arrangini( balls of rice filled with meat and fried) for a party , you'll be a hit.

2.description: Sicilia Bakery is my family's "go to" for excellent cannoli and cannoli cake. No celebration is complete without a cannoli cake! I've had cannoli at other places and they do not compare to the cannoli from Sicilia. All their pastries are delicious, really.They are more than just a bakery though. They have excellent pan pizza and the deli sandwiches and Italian specialties are mouth-watering delicious. They also have an assortment of imported Italian grocery items. You can eat there or take your items home. And best of all - its affordable!Overall, this is your quintessential no-frills family-owned local business. The staff is friendly and down to earth. You will not be disappointed.

18.description: pretty certain my cheese was not pecorino...missing that flavor smell and texture; itll get used but i wont purchase here again

41.description: Great pizza.  Like others have said, they have it partially cooked in the case so that if you want to eat it there they can pop it in the oven for you and it will be fresh.  I always take it home and then bake it myself as I want it.  I keep a few slices in the freezer for when I need a pizza fix.This is great Sicilian pizza, square and thick.The cannoli and cookies are great also.  I eat too many of the biscotti, my favorite are the orange which have pieces of chewy orange baked in.The people are great, very friendly.  And the prices are way better than the grocery store.They have a parking lot, so no need to pay for parking.  No credit cards.

4.description: It isn't the biggest selection you're going to find, but everything they do is absolutely wonderful. We have been a few times and not once have we been disappointed with anything. The sandwiches are tasty, the pizza is delicious, and the bread is perfect.As a bonus, this is a perfect place for people watching. The cast of neighborhood characters that come in are awesome, and the owner knows them all and has a great banter with them.The only thing we would suggest is getting more seating to eat inside.

6.description: Great little place with good prices.  We usually get takeout during the week and everything we've tried has been delicious so far--the eggplant parmesan, arancini and meatballs.

22.description: This bakery has been a neighborhood staple for a long time!  I remember my mother buying me pizza from there when I was little, and I'm now 43.  I have always loved their pizza, and their desserts, but they have a new thing there.  Not only do they offer deli meats, cheeses and Italian specialties, but they offer food!  Fresh Italian pasta dishes, that are yummy and as good if not better than some restaurants, that are supposed to specialize in Italian food.  They have fresh cut french fries that were wonderful, and their panini sandwich was refreshingly tasty. I am very happy that they are offering food, and definitely will be back to take advantage of more of their pasta dishes, and anything else I can try from there.  Go, you won't be sorry, especially if you love Italian food.

15.description: All the food here is very good, but  either they stop answering their phones after 7:00 or their hours are wrong on this listing and their takeout menu. The last three or four times I've called for pizza delivery I've reached no one. Not cool.

20.description: OMG good. Really. Nothing that we had was any less than miraculously good. Did I mention cheap? Granted we are light eaters, but 2 kids, and 2 adults ate lunch with dessert AND took home pastries for around $20. What? Yeah, that is no typo. Try the rice ball thingies. Just trust me. The spinach and cheese was divine. I almost wish I'd never had one because I crave them so much now. Come to think of it, I they have even made appearances in my dreams lately. *sigh*It is definitely not a fancy place, and the service is slooow. I don't care.  There is a free parking lot on the side, and fabulous food for a pittance. I really am in love.Closed on Mondays. I found this out the hard way, giddy from realizing I was just a few blocks away and ready to satisfy that craving.....only to be crushed, seeing the closed sign in the window.Never mind.  Sicilia, you are so good, you warrant a visit all of your own(despite the distance I must travel from my current digs), and I cannot wait to acquire more of your savory goodness followed by another one of the best cannolis I have ever had the privilege to eat. And believe me I won't stop there, I will spread out the joy with take home deli meats, cheeses and specialties, and a few more sweet treats for later. Excuse me while I wipe up this drool.

36.description: Just tried this place after passing it a bunch of times on my way home. I took home foccacia, pizza, a cannoli, and a napoleon for about $10 bucks. Good deal!  I wasn't sure how the focaccia and pizza were gonna be warming them up at home. I was a bit skeptical. They were actually wonderful! The friendly girls working there told me to put it in the oven for a few minutes on about 300 but watch it carefully. They also informed me that there are some people who come there everyday. Anyway, The focaccia was nice and crispy on the outside and doughy and soft inside just the way I like it. The pizza was pretty good. And the cannoli! WOW!! It was probably one of the best I've had! It wasn't too sweet or overpowering. I haven't had the napoleon yet but if the cannoli is a sign of what their pastries are like, I'm sure I'm in for a real treat. They had a big deli with all the Italian meats and cheeses. So I will definitely be back for lunch and dinner in the future. Or maybe just to pick up some pastries for dessert one night.Heads up:  They accept credit card with a $10 minimum purchase

14.description: Their pizza bread and cannolis were totally worth the hype!  The sauce had so much flavor and the bread had a soft pleasant texture while the cannolis were really creamy and tasty!Service was kinda iffy as I had to wait 30 minutes for my calzone when they said that would take 15 minutes and never got an apology.  It was very big, about 14 in. by 8 in.  It was made with very little sauce, cheese, sausage topping, and the dough was very thin.  I'd love to give this place 5 stars, especially from the pizza bread.  I swear that stuff is like crack!  Credit cards are accepted over $10.

3.description: The staff is very friendly they have an awesome deal Mon-Sat $30 for a mani/pedi and they do a great job! I go here about once a week and am always treated very nicely. Highly recommend this place.

1.description: This place was okay not the best but I still feel like she could of took her time....!!! But I mean if your in a hurry because your leaving town in a few hours it's does the job.

2.description: Do not come here. The person that did my nails was in a rush & it was clearly obvious. My nails are full of bubbles. It looks like I did them myself. All I wanted was a basic manicure & my nails look like my younger sister did them. Not worth the $28 for a mani/pedi. Go elsewhere

0.description: Mani pedi's are now $28! Could be cleaner but the staff is friendly.

3.description: I like this store for prescriptions and general merchandise. Everyone is helpful and cordial. Mary the cashier is a real gem and Quinn in pharmacy goes out of her way to assist the customer. Dont get why so many people hate this place.

1.description: Worst pharmacist ever! Hands down, the worst. She's slow and condescending. This place is terrible. Go down the street to CVS.

2.description: Came to this location looking for a RedBox.  The RedBox is located within the store on the east side of the building.  We were looking for Rise Against the Planet of the Apes but it was not here.  If you are ever looking for a RedBox movie and can't find a store that has it I would suggest using the website.  This will help you locate an exact location that has your movie in stock.

9.description: My husband went to pick up a prescription for me there today. It had been nearly 2 hours since the doctor called in the prescription, and when he arrived he was told it would be "a few minutes". Ok, fine. NEARLY AN HOUR AND A HALF LATER he was still there waiting for them to be done with filling the prescription. Not once did they mention it would be a longer wait, and would he like to come back? Even after numerous "check-ups" by my husband, they still made him wait-for something they didn't even have to work that hard to fill (just slap a label on it!) I'll never visit this location again!

10.description: Virginia is right on about this location. What the heck ?! Is everyone that works here brain dead ? All of the cashiers are SLOW. When I was here they asked me to move over to the next line which ran SLOWER and had more people in it. The other register with the older woman only had one customer at her register, but apparently she was taking a nap. Checkout was taking forever, so I went over to the register at the photo department. That kid acted like the items were radioactive and the register was a NASA super computer. I felt like doing it for him.  Bad service ... Go to the one on central and montrose in this area instead.

4.description: Consistently, the worst Walgreens you can go to. Always rude and always makes you wait even just to drop off a prescription. Try a CVS or another Walgreens nearby.

6.description: Decent Walgreens, what more can you say.

11.description: Sure, the staff is miserable and slow, but that keeps them from smirking or making snippy comments whenever I buy anything lame like medicinal foot powder or Preparation H (which was for my last girlfriend - she'd ask me to pick it up for her - and I did, because I'm a nice man). Otherwise, the other reviewers are right. This place frigging suxxx

5.description: The worst Walgreens ever! First couldn't found what am looking for despite it should be everywhere! Secondly was accepting just the credit cards or cash and that happens many times not only once! Third thing the guys working there are rude!

7.description: Probably a year ago I would of given this Walgreens 4 stars but because of their declining selection of food I give it 3 stars. I go here sometimes to get my coffee and coffemate but lots of times they have the coffee but no coffee-mate I have to buy the flavored coffee-mate. They used to have a great frozen food section and that has declined every time I go here. But then i say to myself. I could just walk across the street to Jewel. If I find everything I want at Walgreens I'll buy it but if they don't have one thing that goes with another like the coffee stuff I'll just walk across to Jewel. I guess it's been a while since this store has been reviewed but I don't think the staff is all that bad. Every time I have gone here I have been treated well.

8.description: this branch doesn't have anything new,there are no supplies always,out of stock all the time

0.description: Great walgreens! Always organized, plenty of great sales, friendliest of staff. It's easy to find someone for assistance. The pharmacy people are very knowledgable and willing to answer any question. I come here once a week and never a bad experience.

58.description: Dear Portage Theater,I love you so, you show me great movies like The Giant Mantis and The Abominable Dr Phibes. You amaze me with your silent films like The Battleship Potemkin and Suds. I get to meet amazing stars like The Son of Svengoolie or even Dave McKean. Yes your cold in the winter and cold in the summer but I love your 20's style and the beer you sell in the lobby. Don't ever change Portage theater I like you just the way you are.

56.description: Awesome old school theatre.  I went during horror havoc week and it was truely amazing to watch such gems on the big screen.  It is a shame that more people do not know about this place.  Go check it out now!

29.description: It's been a long time since I've been to The Portage. The Wednesday matinees are long gone, and ownership has changed hands, but the Northwest Film Society is still screening great films here, every Wednesday night, and an occasional Monday night. I took in a great old Western called "Gunman's Walk," on a frigid Chicago night. It was the perfect $5.00 escape. Big old Technicolor film on a nice wide screen.  And you can still get a beer or a glass of wine with your popcorn. I hope the new owners will keep the Portage film screenings and cinematic tradition. The ghosts of former patrons and the shadows of all the old stars who lit up the big screen would appreciate it, I'm sure.

42.description: I went here for the Midwest theatrical premiere of Tucker and Dale vs. Evil.The ticket office walk-up window is on the sidewalk/street.There is alcohol, candy, and popcorn available for purchase....credit cards accepted. I did not see an ATM.The theater itself is gigantic. A see through curtain covers the screen until it is time to view the movie....the the curtain is opened...pretty cool.This theater puts you in the mindset of the past. Many Many Many seats to choose from. Don't expect anything supper comfy...it is an old-school theater.Anyhow, I believe bike parking is on the street/street poles.Unfortunately it is very difficult to get a cab in this area.

23.description: I only give this place for stars just because of how great their entertainment once before their concerts game they were known as the SilentFilm Society in Chicago and they had great movies with an orchestra and a movie or again it was great and the whole place for to fill up now I went to a concert January 30th and the place was a complete disaster some of the seats for taking out people are doing Dr and also way too many fights there was people that were late for the concert I waited up to 5 hours for the people to come out on stage and the service was not bad but there wasn't enough people to work I feel bad because I had so many memories at the old Portage Theater now it's just another Congress Theater ruined

47.description: Fantastic, I love this place.  It's an old theater, so if you want the amenities of a megaplex, it's probably not for you.  But if you want to just watch a marathon of old movies this is a very special place.  Ever since I discovered that various groups in Chicago rent out the Portage to play horror movie marathons I have been trekking up to Jefferson park to visit this beautiful theater.  This is the perfect backdrop for horror movies and silent black & white films.  There's a nice atmosphere here, it's hard to describe, but if you like that nostalgic feeling, you'll know what I'm talking about upon entering.  It's just so worth it.

8.description: Worst Venue I've ever been to. So my friends and I go to a wrestling event there, show begins at 1 doors are supposed to open at 11:30. They open at 12:45, while we wait in below freezing weather. The wrestling company sends their champ out to cheer up the fans, and at the end of the show the wrestlers praise us. Meanwhile the venue didn't let us in due to their heat not working, which surprised me because I didn't feel any heat inside. Security was rude, the seats in the theater weren't labeled properly, and there were 2 ushers for 2200 fans.This venue stinks

31.description: Now that Eddie Carranza (the scumbag who owns Congress Theater) owns this place, I wouldn't touch it with a ten foot pole.Want to know what to expect when you come here for a concert?  Expect an overly-aggressive security team headed up by a self-important machoman who looks like he just snorted all the coke they ever confiscated.  You will be yelled at, demeaned, and pushed around for no reason other than the fact that you are an inconvenience to the staff.I understand the need for security, and I don't want them to just go away.  I'm on very good terms with security staff at other venues who are incredibly respectful, such as those who work at the House of Blues.  They are there to keep you safe.  Security at a Carranza venue is there to make sure they don't get sued because someone got raped outside their venue...AGAIN.  A casualty of that is YOU.  Expect to be treated like a felon even if you are doing nothing wrong.  You will be groped, yelled at, possibly even physically assaulted. You have been warned.Stay away from any Carranza-owned venues if you want to actually enjoy the experience of going to a show.  It's a damn shame that great independent venues are being bought out by scummy people who don't care about their patrons.

34.description: Where else can fellow geeks go to enjoy some of their favorite films? Actually -- there isn't. The Portage Theater is like a heaven to those who enjoy their films, and especially for those films you grew up watching as a kid. Whether a film that scared the poops out of you, or a film that had you using taped paper towel rolls to form a saber (to which you beat your little bratty brother up with,) you've come to the right place!Although very historic and in one of the best neighborhoods in the Chicago, the Portage theater has one of the most beautiful interiors you'll ever come across. Not to mention, they have a wonderful lobby, which is usually filled with trinkets and other odds and ends that you can't normally find at your local store. This theater is in jeopardy because some church wants to -- well take it over and build a church in it's spot. Please, this would ruin this grand building and the neighborhood surrounding it. I mean come on, where else can you go for free screenings too? I digress, as my review comes to a close. Check out their website for updates on when a movie is coming, because you will not want to miss this. Oh, and if you're ever feeling dangerous -- order alcohol from their counter.

16.description: Classic theatre, yet terrible for live music, as the acoustics are mediocre at best.It's good for small events.Plus is Revolution on tap!

13.description: What is with the security here?! I honestly don't think I've been treated that way with even with air port security. They were honestly making me nervous in the pat down lol and then they have the nerve to question my bottle of anxiety meds I brought in? That are in a legitimate prescription bottle with my name on it. I dropped my ID and then they YELLED at me to pick it up. Thanks for assuming I'm trying to do something illegal instead of just trying to enjoy my friends show.

11.description: Went here for a rap concert and almost 3 hrs of unknown artist playing. The main artist only had 30 minute set times. I basically paid to take a nap there. Def was a sleeper. Was very disappointed that unknown artists had way more time to perform then the real concert everyone came to see.. spent about half that time waiting in line for the bathroom.  This is the worst venue I've been 2. Also drinks were expensive. . $13 for a little drink. Will not ever go to this place again.

39.description: Went here for Bass Drop 2012 for NYE. Much better with their audience than the Congress. It was a good crowd, the Bands were great and sounded great, and the atompshere was perfect. Granted, i was looking for a low-budget NYE after last year, but I enjoyed this alot more than i thought i would. Good job Portage!

37.description: Amazing venue in the middle of an emerging artist community. It may be taken over by a north side church. Please fill out a petition to save this historic theatre:change.org/petitions/chi…

0.description: *******Alert ********Alert According to people on the 56 Milwaukee bus the theater is open again.  They said it reopened during the 6 Corners BBQ Fest.  ********Alert******Alert********I was able to stop in here during the 6 Corners BBQ Fest as they had it open specifically for this event.  The Portage Theater is currently not active due to some disputes with the community and ownership.  It is unfortunate and I look forward to coming here for future events hopefully when it reopens.  During the BBQ Fest it was open and I was able to go in.  Portage Theater is a old style theater with the single ticket booth and open doors on each side.  They have a concession stand and entrance to the theater to the side of this area.  The theater has a large amount of seats to accommodate a significant crowd.  This is a truly iconic location and it would be in the best interest for the involved parties to try and come to a resolution sooner than later.  Bring back Portage Theater!

38.description: When I was a kid the 6corners area is where my mom took us shopping. There was a lot of business and activity but in the last ..15 yrs?..Whenever I drive thru i see lots of vacant storefronts. I found out the Portage Theater was showing STARWARS  a New Hope for free- How great is that!?The Portage is finding innovative and creative ways to draw people back into the area I think thats great! They sell snacks, food and BEER! You cant lose with a deal like that. Follow them on your social networking sites for more cool stuff going on at the Portage Theater!

51.description: Forget the Music Box! It's all about the Portage Theatre! They have amazing movies always playing. Portage is one of the oldest movie houses in Chicago so it's no wonder I find it amazing and timeless. Definitely old and delicate and I loved it plus they shot Public Enemies here why wouldn't you want to go some place Johnny Depp's beautiful feet have graced.

27.description: Since my first visit to the Portage Theater, I've loved this place.  I hear the place is indefinitely closed, that's so disappointing.  These guys had fantastic programming and were friends to indie film buffs everywhere.BROWN SOUP THING, an acclaimed Filipino American film, had its world premiere in this place.  So many great films over the years, gotta love Portage Theater.

32.description: this place is classic theatre, and it's huge! Huge! Maybe 1300 seater. But fun to be at. Hopefully it gets saved. Food and Drink a bit expensive. Also, right after Devil In My Ride, at least 1 homeless guy came in and was taking a nap in an open seat in the theatre...for well over an hour. But good place, ample street parking, cool location.

54.description: OMG FIX YOUR HEAT, PORTAGE!! Trying to watch movies in the winter is ridiculous. You shouldn't have to bring blankets to a movie theater. I would much rather stay home and warm on my couch than go to the Portage when it's cold out.Sorry, Portage, but you gotta keep people comfortable if you want them to stay.

48.description: I am absolutely in love with this place. I came here for a show new years eve, and had the best time. The staff was incredibly friendly and respectful, the place had a cool small vibe, there was lots of room and the crowd was fun and well behaved. They gave out free water and drink prices were very reasonable. It's a little hard to get to by public transportation, but it was well worth going out of the way to find this gem.
