44.description: When you first walk into this theater, you think, 'oh its nothing special' but once you get to the auditorium, you realize just how big it is and how high the ceilings are.  This is one of those historic theaters that has a red curtain and a stage reminiscent of an old Opera building.  Also it has an organ in front of the stage where, if you're lucky, you'll get to hear it being played by expert organ player, Jay Warren.  First time I came here was to see Ghostbusters a few weeks ago.  It was an interactive movie, people cheering and jeering.  Real ghostbusters on the scene, beer, the audience was all ages and all genres.  And now I've just discovered matinee Wednesdays.  For $5 every wednesday evening you can catch a old film, from the 50's, 40's or 20's, etc including really old westerns and silent films.  And you can purchase popcorn, candy, or a captain and coke.   Perfection!

24.description: I purchased tickets to see '80's icon Lisa Lisa tonight. When I arrived the place seemed decent, however my friend & I noticed how cold it was.  U could see your breath.  We were sitting for over 40 mins before I decided to ask someone about the heat.  I asked a bartender who was more interested in talking to the trashy patrons about the heat; he said that it'll come on.  Another 30 mins passed and by that time our noses were running & knees were numb from the coldness.  My friend & I decided we would ask someone regarding the heat.  We saw two guys who looked homeless, but worked there about the heat & they told us the building was old & had radiator heat & the heat should be on within an hour.  I asked why the heat wasn't put on before the doors open.  They repeated it's an older building then said that they are still waiting for more people to arrive.  I will never patronage this disrespectful place.  They set up multiple bars to get people drunk so they could ignore the heat issue.  Luckily I only spent $30 for the tixs(Groupon special).  The security told us we couldn't come back in.  We didn't care, we were going to our WARM car....

7.description: This place needs a MAJOR renovation. The ladies bathroom reminds me of world war 2 barracks, and yes all the reviews about the theatre being cold are true. I found myself quite annoyed with the lack of organization & tardiness of Big Z's production.  A 10pm start yet Rob Base did not perform until midnight & I got tired of waiting & wasting my time so I left and didn't care to see Fat Joe.  The theatre is old and it really is cold in there. I will not come back not even if they paid me to.

49.description: Let's just say I got to see The Thing in theaters because of the Portage Theater. My bro and I went during the Halloween movie marathon and it was awesome! There were vendors set up selling horror movie merchandise. The theater itself is beautiful! It is huge and the ceilings are amazing. I can't wait to go back!

40.description: We were a group of 10 to see a great comedy show called MADE IN PUERTO RICO, it was a great show !  The only major problem was we order great 5th row seats ONLINE! for all 10 of us and for some reason another group was allowed to take our seats. after us showing up an hour early. Unfortunately we had to sit in the back row, were at times it was hard to hear. due to there lack of organization the night was not as enjoyable as it could of been Very disappointed.

53.description: It's a toss-up of which theater is enjoyed more, this place or the Music Box, I love them both. The Portage is WAY out of the way, which is a pro and a con. Con being it takes a bit to get there, pro being that only people who want to be there, are there. They have hunted out the best place to see weird and wacky sci-fi and horror films, and Portage accepts them with open arms. You can tell the staff really love working there, and whether 5 people or 500 people enjoy a movie, it doesn't matter, we're all there to support this small theater showing films that we love.

30.description: Hope we can keep this old theater running. Don't know what the new owners have planned. Silent film festival and the organ is great.

46.description: I'm glad to see portage doing more fests and screenings. It is such a huge venue and I really love the low key atmosphere. I like to imagine I have walked into some theater in the loop during the 70's when it wasn't the safest thing to go see a movie. I might be getting silly here but when you think of how sterile and corporate theaters have become in the country I cherish every visit I have. The horror fests are outstanding and I really do appreciate the hard work rusty nail and friends have put out to keep the DYI aesthetic alive in this city. kudos.

1.description: If I didn't have to give at least 1 star, I would give this place 0! Not only did I wait outside (in the cold) for an hour before anyone came out to address the crowd and line, they didn't turn on the heat once I entered the theater. I, amongst other patrons moved from the outside to wait inside for 40 more minutes like herding cattle. They made us wait in anxiousness ... as if when we walked in, we'd embrace the presence of a nice establishment or a concert ! But nope we just sat and waited for another 45 minutes. To make matters more unbearavle, it was just as cold as it was outside! How is this place still open? The staff was unprofessional (except for the happy man shouting "get your drinks here!" At the bar (I didn't buy one), but he made the wait less horrible. Yet, despite the entry no one came out to address the concert goers for the delay and wait time (someone on Tamia's staff is to blame for that!- extremely disappointed.) To make matters worse, my sister sat in POP! THEY didn't clean the seats and sections...such a shame.An hour and 37 min later and STILL NO CONCERT!

55.description: I went to go see a free movie here and that was nice of them to have free movie but, I'm not sure if I would pay to see a movie here. The theater was pretty cold inside. Huge, sprawling ceilings are nice to look at but, I'm guessing they are expensive to heat. When I excused myself to the ladies room I noticed much of the tile in the bathroom was cracked and that the hand dryer was barely working. A sign was posted that they were in the process of remodeling the bathroom so we'll see how that goes. Concession stand guy was awesome. Have you ever gone into a movie theater being a cheap-ass (that's me!) and not wanting to buy their bottled water so you ask for a cup instead? At other theaters I have gotten glares, eye rolls and cone-shaped cups (who invented those pieces of crap?) this guy instead gave me a huge cup and a smile. Thanks concession guy!P.S Providing water shouldn't be such a hard task so you other theaters are a bunch of assholes.

9.description: Got here at 7:15pm. According to the groupon tickets, the doors were to be open at 7pm. Instead paid customers are waiting outside for an hour ....and it's not 80 degrees out here....no explanation of what is going on by management . As a business professional, I cannot open my doors an hour late. I will not return to any concert held at portage theater again!

26.description: *******Alert ********Alert According to people on the 56 Milwaukee bus the theater is open again.  They said it reopened during the 6 Corners BBQ Fest.  ********Alert******Alert********I was able to stop in here during the 6 Corners BBQ Fest as they had it open specifically for this event.  The Portage Theater is currently not active due to some disputes with the community and ownership.  It is unfortunate and I look forward to coming here for future events hopefully when it reopens.  During the BBQ Fest it was open and I was able to go in.  Portage Theater is a old style theater with the single ticket booth and open doors on each side.  They have a concession stand and entrance to the theater to the side of this area.  The theater has a large amount of seats to accommodate a significant crowd.  This is a truly iconic location and it would be in the best interest for the involved parties to try and come to a resolution sooner than later.  Bring back Portage Theater!

25.description: First time at the venue, this place is located on the oddest shaped block, don't believe me, try walking around the block once, there are more turns then expected, thus six corners moniker? (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Si…) Nice enough neighborhood, got lucky with street meter parking opposite side of block. Went here to see the minimalists book tour and learned during the presentation that the Portage offered to host the event, very cool, so kudos to them for doing so. The theater itself is straightforward to navigate; you walk in, standard lobby type space, next bathrooms on either side of interim lobby with drink/snack bar. Draft beer $6/ mixed drinks $7 / popcorn $3. The theater itself is good sized, not massive but big enough to get the job done, as one of the oldest movie houses in Chicago, it is a 1,300-plus-seat theater. It seemed to the naked eye to be in decent enough shape. Worth noting - the area has been slated for redevelopment as an urban pedestrian shopping district with the recent reopening of the theater, the upcoming construction of several retail-condo buildings and a street beautification project.The only downside I experienced the entire evening was that the boys room air dryers did not work and there were no paper towels available either - eeewww. So hopefully they resolve that before the health department does ;)

12.description: Where is the no star when you need it ? In a nutshell this place has really gone down the drain. I was emailed free tickets and I remembered enjoying the venue a few years back so I figured why not? Big mistake. Ended up leaving immediately due to the sour taste from the, pretty much, full body cavity search upon entering. Either your staff assumes everyones a doper muling drugs in through chapstick containers or they themselves are druggies looking for it to keep for later. Either way I was disgusted and left as soon as I "passed" your harassing security check. Get your staff in check. There is keeping a safe venue and then there is harassing and making customers feel violated. No way would I ever return to or speak good words of this venue again. Which is unfortunate because you have offered some cool/unique events.

59.description: Went to see Dave McKean (of Mirrormask and Harry Potter fame) last night, very underwhelmed by the amount of art that was there but very impressed by the theater itself.  It truly is like stepping through a time machine, the theater is beautiful and has an actual stage in front of the projection screen.  A lot of societies are starting to use this place which is awesome.  I wish people would start reviving this area of town, because it is scary how few shops are open there at 6PM.

21.description: Went to the Freestyle Forever concert and dance party on Feb 14, 2015. Everything outside the arena is quite filthy but inside its huge!! The sound system was not bad. My only big issue was the location of the VIP section which is practically pushed to the side of the stage! You can spend spend less to get standing and have a better view. Overall Stevie B is still the freestyle king!

17.description: THIS VENUE IS ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIC!!! Doors open at 8 and the 1st act doesn't come on until 11pm??? Really?? Ridiculously over priced drinks. But you have to purchase something BECAUSE THERE'S NO AIR CONDITIONING in the building and over 500 people in one room. Then when trying to use the ladies room your told to go out a back door and walk up 2 flights of a FIRE ESCAPE to another bathroom?? Oh and with wet stairs. The management and every employee in this place were a disrespectful disgrace. They will never see a penny more of our money! Jagged edge concert 8.22.15.

10.description: Time Takes Us All.The Portage, once a beautiful throwback to the days of the movie palace, is now a depressing wreck. The new management ripped out a bunch of seats and all the carpeting down the aisles between the seating sections, so now the auditorium looks more like a rock quarry with seats than a movie theater. The projection and sound for movies are just flat-out terrible. Everything that was great about the Portage even just a few years ago is gone after it changed hands to its new owners/managers. This used to be such an incredible place, and now it's a disaster.

5.description: I hate to give 1 star ratings but this theater definitely deserved it. I had bought 13 total tickets for the Magic Men Live show for Saturday July 11th. My girls and I were so excited, as we had no idea what to expect.Initially, we were all confused as to what time the doors opened and what time the show started. Your website said doors open at 630, show at 8. The tickets said doors at 8, show at 9. I called and spoke to someone who confirmed that it was indeed doors at 630. This was about 2 weeks ago. We then noticed that the website had changed from doors at 630 to 8. I wanted to talk to someone to make sure 100%. I never received a response to my email and the phone number to the theater was temporarily disconnected. The number is still disconnected today. How can you run a business and not respond to calls or emails?We decided to take our chances and hope the doors really opened at 8. We showed up around 730 and they had already begun letting people in, really?! We entered the theater and the entire theater was full besides the last 4 or so rows. Seeing that we had 13 people, it took some creativeness to find seating near each other. At about 830, there was absolutely no seating left with about 100 people left without seats. I felt terrible for these girls as they were forced to stand the entire show. How do you oversell a show like this by this many seats? Seems like a total fire hazard, with ladies crowding all in the back and down the aisles. Bathroom lines were long but as to be expected with that many people of the same gender. Drinks were SO OVERPRICED! I paid $13 for an 8 ounce solo cup mixed drink. That is outrageous. Also, it seemed like there was no air conditioning within the entire place. Everyone was a sweaty mess. I'm surprised I did not see anyone faint due to the heat. I wouldn't go back to this theater if I was paid.

3.description: This place is BEGGING!! For new OCCUPANTS!!! New Manager!!! You can over look the No Heat, No Floor....the list is tooooo LONG!!! I've never been in a theatre that is this RAGGGDDYY

35.description: Going here is a "movies+" experience. It felt as if the movie had spilled over into real life and covered the entire lobby of the theater.  I'll give an example.  We visited the Portage couple Fridays ago and they were hosting a Ghostbusters Night.   There were Ghostbuster fan clubs dressed in movie costumes and posing for pictures, real life ghost hunters promoting their tours of haunted Chicago sites, figurine toy vendors, and various other groups that were probably rehearsing for the upcoming comic-con.The actual theater is in decent shape, definitely not as shiny as it used to be, but still impressive.  Most of these big, old theaters, part of the ancient and luxurious network of first-run movie venues that were scattered throughout the city, have been chopped up internally so that they can show multiple movies simultaneously.  Somehow, the Portage has managed to keep itself limited to one giant screening room.  I bet nearly 1000 people could fit in there.  That sort of size is rare in a movie theater.  Another compliment due: the sound system was pretty good, with plenty of volume without sacrifice dialogue clarity.  A lot of times the sound effects in older theaters swamp out what the people onscreen are saying, but not here.Finally, I liked that they ran a locally created short film made by some high school students prior to the main feature.  It's great to see some kids get their work on the big screen and the crowd was really supportive of their efforts. Oh yeah, and the entire event was free.  They had a promotion where you could score tickets if you stopped in at nearby businesses that had Ghostbuster posters in their windows.  They're doing similar events soon with Back to the Future and E.T., and I'll definitely try to make it back.

19.description: First time at the venue, this place is located on the oddest shaped block, don't believe me, try walking around the block once, there are more turns then expected, thus six corners moniker? (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Si…) Nice enough neighborhood, got lucky with street meter parking opposite side of block. Went here to see the minimalists book tour and learned during the presentation that the Portage offered to host the event, very cool, so kudos to them for doing so. The theater itself is straightforward to navigate; you walk in, standard lobby type space, next bathrooms on either side of interim lobby with drink/snack bar. Draft beer $6/ mixed drinks $7 / popcorn $3. The theater itself is good sized, not massive but big enough to get the job done, as one of the oldest movie houses in Chicago, it is a 1,300-plus-seat theater. It seemed to the naked eye to be in decent enough shape. Worth noting - the area has been slated for redevelopment as an urban pedestrian shopping district with the recent reopening of the theater, the upcoming construction of several retail-condo buildings and a street beautification project.The only downside I experienced the entire evening was that the boys room air dryers did not work and there were no paper towels available either - eeewww. So hopefully they resolve that before the health department does ;)

28.description: Great theater. Threw some awesome events here, cya guys next st patricks ;) Hope Dennis stays in charge of the place forever !!! The theater really is a true historical Chicago land mark.

45.description: I have never  been here for any movies and only for concerts, but let me just say that every time I come here it's an awesome and unique experience.

33.description: I first went to the Portage in 2007 to watch Beirut perform. As I rode the Milwaukee bus, I could tell, without error, which of my fellow passengers were also heading to the show. I was attending alone with the misguided hope that I would run into a recent ex there. We were embroiled in a misguided attempt to "be friends" at the time, and while he never appeared (thankfully, in retrospect) from the ashes of that love came a new one: my love for the Portage theater. The relationship was sadly dormant for a few years until two very good friends of mine bought a house in the neighborhood. After visiting them, I would drive by the theater and take note of its offerings, thinking I needed to go see absolutely everything. My most recent visits include seeing a Santa Sangre/The Last Circus Double Feature, and spending more than a day at the Sci-fi Spectacular (sorry, Music Box, I loved seeing the Sci-fi Spectacular change venues, if only for the easier parking). There is a very real threat that the Portage might get turned into a mega-church. If you oppose this, please go see some movies right now to help them in their fight to remain a truly lovely film, theatre, and live performance space. And if you need a movie buddy, let me know--I'm usually free.

43.description: Honestly I LOVE this place. I don't live nearby at all. That sucks because most of the shows end at 2am. There are no busses or trains running at that hour within a 1 mile radius. That does suck. Its takes 2 hours to get home on those nights. But that's not Portage Theater's fault. What is their fault is that there is at least 1 issue with the projector every time I go. I know theaters like this are cold so I always bring a sweater/jacket. The tickets are sooo cheap and the drinks, popcorn, and booze(yes booze) are cheap too. I come here for all the horror shows and I definitely be back. The theater itself is beautiful and yes the bathroom could use some work, but then if they made the theater out to look like the ICON on Roosevelt, we would be paying $20 a movie. give me the old fashioned movie houses ANYDAY!!!

2.description: Supposed to be a non smoking theater, so my husband and I thought it would be okay for me to go to a show ( 30 weeks pregnant ) definitely not non smoking. I kind of expected weed smoke due to the performer, but cigarette smoking too... Wonder how that would look to the state? A pregnant woman in what's supposed to be non smoking theater and a theater full of smoke.... Now I know obviously what to expect and not to ever come here again. The only benefit was the really nice security and promoter who accommodated me with a place to sit since they over booked the "VIP" section.

18.description: I love  the Portage and wish I could give it more stars.  I've been there a couple times this winter and there is no heat.  It's February in chicago.  Heat is not optional.  I'd like to see more bands and movies here if they  fix the heat problem.

41.description: Place is a chicago gem give it a try

52.description: This is one of my favorite spots in Portage Park.  I do wish that they were open later on the week days.

50.description: I love this theatre so much - it's a gorgeous space and I just love any opportunity to perform there!  It's got plenty of dressing room space, a huge vaulted ceiling, and a really awesome lobby.I always love seeing events there!

4.description: it may be a historical theatre in the area, but what a dump, looks like a crumbling abandoned building inside despite being apparently upkept. They still owe a some associates some money from a movie gig they helped promote. Roaches in the popcorn. locked fire exits, so on so forth, really should be condemned and torn down, especially with the managements attitude.

6.description: Total dump. Went to a show and folks were stuck outside in the freezing cold for a few hours because of some issues. Once the doors opened, nobody around to assist with assigned seats.  The seats were jumbled all over the place so people just sat wherever.

22.description: I love  the Portage and wish I could give it more stars.  I've been there a couple times this winter and there is no heat.  It's February in chicago.  Heat is not optional.  I'd like to see more bands and movies here if they  fix the heat problem.

15.description: I've been to this theatre twice and I can honestly say I had a great time, however I highly recommend that you guys limit the amount of unknown artist. I understand and believe in exposure and showcasing other ppl but 2.5 hrs of listening to unknown artist is ridiculous. I paid to see certain individuals and would appreciate it if I didn't have to wait 2.5 hrs to see them perform..Last but not least it's really sad when the artist can't perform because the stage is full of ppl..why does it have to be so many ppl on stage while the artist perform?? It truly takes away from the main attraction. I hope you guys get it together or I may take my business elsewhere.

57.description: About the only thing missing from this stretch of Milwaukee Avenue - and therefore the only thing to separate the vista from the Main Street in a western ghost town - is blowing tumbleweeds.  There's a deserted steak restaurants (which, judging from the fashion of the shades on the windows has been closed since the 1980s) and hollow shells of the other businesses that once made up "downtown" Portage Park.But much like the abandoned small town it resembles, there's a movie marquee bearing the name of the once thriving little hamlet - Portage Theatre (though I think most small towns prefer the "er" spelling to the "re" because it's more 'merican).  Unlike these places (or even the Uptown), this theater survives.  Reopened a few years ago, the Portage is one of Chicago's few remaining historic movie palaces.One of Chicago's historic movie palaces that, sadly, no one except those into niche genres even knows exist.In the traditional sense, this isn't still a movie theater as such.  You can't open the paper and see which movie is gracing its screen.  But film is still its stock and trade.  From a weekly classic movie matinee on Wednesdays to the Horror Movie Fest that goes on each October, if there's a society hosting filmic events, the Portage throws open its doors.The Portage is also a welcoming place (of course it has to be rented out, it's not free) to Chicago and the the United States' independent film makers who want to screen their films.  Last year about this time, I saw the shocking "Food, Inc." here and a friend recently screened his short film here as part of a contest.And what a treat it must be to screen here.  The movie screen is gigantic.  The seats are not exactly the plushest in Chicago but they are wide and somewhat ornate.  There's an organ in the front for use with silent films.  There's even an elevated stage to field Q&A from.  In short, the high ceiling theater is a thing of beauty like they just don't make anymore. The amateur and semi-professional film maker must feel like a star producer or director for a night.But should a film be terrible, this is one of the few theaters in Chicago with a liquor license to numb the pain.  They only have one kind of beer but they do have the hard stuff.  It's movie theater prices for it ($6.75 if memory serves) but what can you do?  They have to stay in business somehow.  The prices for the movies range depending on who is presenting them, but they're usually less than you'd pay at the similar Music Box.If the Portage Theater were in the Music Box's location, there'd be no worry for its future.  As it is, you have to seek it out.  But it's a future worth preserving as the Portage is an important piece of Chicago (and the United States') past.  And, hey, it's just a great place to see a movie to boot.

20.description: This place needs a MAJOR renovation. The ladies bathroom reminds me of world war 2 barracks, and yes all the reviews about the theatre being cold are true. I found myself quite annoyed with the lack of organization & tardiness of Big Z's production.  A 10pm start yet Rob Base did not perform until midnight & I got tired of waiting & wasting my time so I left and didn't care to see Fat Joe.  The theatre is old and it really is cold in there. I will not come back not even if they paid me to.

36.description: I thought I had reviewed the Portage Theater long ago but apparently I never did.  Well, here's my chance!  The Portage Theater is amazing.  It is not a cineplex. It does not show the latest blockbuster hits.  It doesn't have the best air conditioning or heating, and the concession stand is modest at best.  What it does have, is one huge, beautiful screen flanked by a classic red curtain.  It shows classic movies from the 20s-present, including but not limited to silent films (with live organ accompaniment), film noir, creature features, and independent films.  It serves popcorn, Raisinets, and soda, and that's all that matters to me.  It is a 1920 movie palace, a gem of the community and a meeting place for all who love and appreciate alternative cinema.  I used to come here as a kid, and it hasn't changed one bit (though the center divider has come down).  In fact, it hasn't changed much at all in nearly 100 years.  This theater is in trouble and there is a chance that it may no longer be a movie house.  Currently, the Chicago Tabernacle is attempting to purchase the building the theater is in to convert it to a church.  As concerned citizens, we are asking that everyone help to do their part to ensure that the Portage theater remains a theater.  Please see facebook.com/#!/SaveTheP…I only hope that by the time this review is seen by at least 50 people, it will still be a valid review.

14.description: If i could give this place zero stars I would. I spent some crazy amount of money buying NXT tickets off stubub (because the Portage theater website was a joke) only to have to argue with someone over our seats. None of the 'security' would do anything to get these people out of the seats we paid for, and it was only perchance that we found one usher who took initiative. We only managed to get 1 of the 2 seats back (the other guy refused to move because 'someone was sitting in his seat). So I had to sit on my boyfriends lap for the entire show while the jerk that stole our seat tried to make small talk with us. This event was beyond unorganized. I hope NXT never does another show there again. Just horrible.

0.description: I've been meaning to try this place out since late summer when they first opened.  There's not much of a choice of salons on Cicero Ave.  Sure, there are a few, but nothing that sparks the interest of a snooty 20-something like me.  Maybe not so snooty: I DID get my hair cut at Supercuts a few times because it was close by and cheap.  But a few weeks ago I checked this place out and was so glad I did! The decor is modern and cute. It was a Friday afternoon and I think I was the only client.  I wasn't really sure what I wanted, so I opted for some layers and a longer bang.  The stylist did a great job.  I've gotten the same simple cut at other places and it ended up being real choppy.  Not so in this case. I can't wait to go back for something more adventurous and maybe some color. If you live in the neighborhood or are driving past and realize you need to get your hair did, you should definitely stop in!

3.description: Great customer service, very friendly. super fast delivery- although I'm fairly close. Happy it opened in Portage Park/Old Irving area. So much better than subway imo!

1.description: Absolutely horrible business at this location. Staff is rude. They failed to delivery items paid for and continued to tell us they would send it with the next order. Rudely over the phone they advised us they failed to note the account and refused to give us what has been owed to us. Not even a refund. We have proof of every order with notes attached. Best believe corporate will be hearing from us with the proof attached.

2.description: I heard great things about this place, but my experience was HORRIBLE!!  When I first walked in the store, it smelled like  reefer!  I haven't smoked pot in awhile but I have friends who do and I know how it smells when someone smokes it! But not only that,... the short Caucasian manager with the glasses, messed up two of my sandwiches! And then had the audacity to say I was the one who failed to specify when clearly he did because he looked HIGH and the store smelled like weed!  I will NEVER!! EVER, go there again!  Shame on that individual!

0.description: I ordered a #16 Club Lulu! It was fast and delicious but only one slice of turkey and ton of lettuce, thick cut tomato and plenty of bacon, which makes up for the lack in turkey. & their soda machine doesn't wash out the soda with water The place is super clean! Not a pickle out of place.

12.description: Went here for a cut and my first official color.  I had never been here before, but I was heading out of town and didn't have time to get too nervous about it.  Gotta say, I was pleasantly surprised!  They got me in on a Friday at 5pm and I had just called that early afternoon.  I was a little nervous when she started cutting, but everything turned out great!  The cut was flattering, but totally easy to maintain (I pretty much just wash and go), I was so happy to get rid of all my gray hair, and the price was, in my opinion, reasonable.  I moved to this area almost 5 years ago, and I'm kind of kicking myself for not trying XOX out earlier!Oh, there was a mom who brought her 2 kids in for haircuts, and the price for a kid's cut was much less than the place I've been going to, so I might have to switch eventually...

7.description: I needed a wax before heading out of town on vacation and they were able to fit me in last minute. I had driven by 1000 times, but never been inside. I was pleasantly surprised by how well appointed the salon and the treatment rooms were. They did a great job, better than I have had downtown and much "nicer" salons and spas. They price was very reasonable, as well. I will definitely be back!

3.description: Went there once and never again. I had an awful haircut and color for an outlandish price. These people think they are on Rush Street instead of Jeff Park. There are a lot of $5 shops where im sure i could get a better cut.  Go ahead people ....waste your $$$

1.description: I had a facial here recently based off the wonderful reviews here on Yelp. While the service was VERY good and the tech was a very kind lady...I was very disappointed that I was booked for the WRONG facial. At least..I think I was?? I had requested the standard 60 minute facial (per the website is $60) when I called, but when I got to the front desk after the service (and glanced at the time and went, oh wow..a 90 minute facial! cool!) and was told the total was $90...I was shocked! Of course, the push to buy products came on pretty strong too, so I purchased a cleanser bringing my total far beyond what I had budgeted for. Ummm.....what's a girl to do?! I didn't say anything at the time as I am of thought that I didn't want to be rude or that one customer that complains especially as my first time there. So I went home and checked the website and yup, sure thing..I paid for a facial I didn't even request. I'm not sure what the breakdown in communication was, but I will contact the salon and see what they say. It's a cute place, nice spa area in back. The couches are a tad old and ratty in the seating area, and lots of merchandise everywhere. I don't think Tabitha would be here in a heart beat lol, but it could use some updating.

2.description: Magdalena is one of the best in Chicago when it comes to hair cutting! Every time I get a haircut by her I get a ton of compliments and my hair looks absolutely awesome. It keeps its shape for weeks. She's a very talented hair dresser and I highly recommend her and the salon. Thank you!

9.description: Margaret, the owner, is a great stylist. I've gone to XOX for 6 years now. I've gone through different colors and highlights and cuts and they have all looked great. It's so nice to be able to RELAX and know the stylist will give me what I want. The only drawback is the price. I have to go a bit longer between cuts in order to save up that much. But I always get so many compliments on my hair that I immediately start to save up again.

18.description: After having back to back children I needed to cover gray (first time having my hair colored) and decided to change my hairstyle drastically.  I found XOX on yelp and selected Margaret for my first appointment.  The salon is clean and full of friendly people.  I am not scared of change but most hair stylists I have been to are and in the past have tried to talk me out of changing my hair.  Margaret was enthusiastic about changing my hair color from dark blond to dark copper/brown.  I wanted to try bangs for the first time ever and change the shape of my hair overall.  I have always looked fantastic after leaving this salon and receive constant compliments on my new overall look.  Margaret understands hair texture, especially for new moms (our hair has a lot going on) and has great suggestions.  Best of all, when I get home I can easily style my own hair to look just as good as when I leave the salon.  I always go on Saturday and there is usually a little wait for my appointment unless I have an early morning appointment but it's a relaxing place to sit and read a magazine and it's worth the wait.  I can't speak for the other hair dressers personally but they all have a steady stream of regulars.  I can finally stop trying new hair stylists!

10.description: I was in a hair crisis...went to see Margaret and left super happy. I have a short "pixie" style cut. She did exactly what I wanted and it's even growing out nicely (that's hard to find!). The price is right, Margaret is wonderful, and the salon is super convenient with lots of free parking. Thanks, Margaret for taking good care of me!

13.description: I visited this salon once and was not happy with the haircut.  My hair was restyled into what the hairdresser thought was trendy and not what I wanted.  They were very overpriced for the area and quality (?) of service.  My hair finally grew out from "la style" after several months.  I'm walking distance and never considered going back.  It's great to have long hair again!

16.description: I love this place. Like the other reviews have mentioned, I think this place has a very trendy ambience. My favorite part of the decor is the front desk - very neat decor. I have to say it is one of the cleanest salons I have seen. Margaret, the owner, is very friendly and likes to get to know her customers. She even throws a holiday party for her regulars... I have had my hair cut by her and she does a great job. I have had both long and short cuts, and my short cuts are very trendy. She really listens to what I want and doesn't over or under cut/ style. I've also had my eyebrows threaded and some facial waxing. I have also had a massage and the private massage rooms are very relaxing. Overall, I think this place is great and is easy on the wallet. I recommend this place to everyone! There is parking too which is a plus.

17.description: When I first moved here and was looking for someone who knew how to cut short hair, a friend of mine suggested XOX.  That was in 1993; Margaret has been cutting my hair ever since.  She's been with me through short and long, brunette, blonde and everything in-between.  Even though I don't live anywhere near the salon, it's totally worth the trek, because, not only does my hair always look great, the cut stays in for a long time.

15.description: Went for eyebrow wax and actually learned a lot about technique.  Stocked with Aveda products and provides free parking.

0.description: Went back and same great experienceVery important to know I never get my hair cut my the same person going on 14 years now because of some random dissatisfaction.Also moat of construction gone gone gone

5.description: Living close to this salon, it was always convenient for me to go to, especially when I didn't have a car. Now that I've branched out to other places in the city (with the help of Yelp), I've realized there is much better.I'd been going here for about ten years and not once did I leave feeling happy with my hair. Satisfied, yes, happy, no. For the price, I would expect much more. Margaret is wonderful as a person and the salon is beautiful, but I wanted to have my pin-straight hair cut into layers before and the girl butchered it! They were choppy and, I have very thick hair, so the layers made it all poofy and impossible to work with.Another time I tried to go shorter like a bob, and I ended up looking like Johnny Depp in Willy Wonka! She didn't angle the hair or anything and just left it at a blunt cut and it looked terrible.My mom came here too and no matter what she would tell them to do, she always left with the same haircut she had the last time, even after asking for something different.I've also had up-dos done here and they were mediocre for the price we paid. I'm a firm believer in you get what you pay for, but this doesn't make the cut.If you are going to see someone here, see Margaret who is the manager. Any of the other girls are very below her skill level.Needless to say, we won't be coming back here. It's not worth the price.

11.description: I've been going here for 2 years now, I go every 3 months for a .5-1in trim and a blow dry. Thisoma is my hair stylist and I adore her. She's very down-to-earth. She's easy to talk to and does her work flawlessly. It's about $35 for a shampoo, trim and blow-dry. There's parking in the lot. I've never been disappointed!

8.description: Portage Park newbie, wanted to find a local plAce. I had my brows done there and they did a decent job, plus I had heard good reviews, so I went for a haircut. Big mistake.  It was unpleasant from start to finish.  Stylist was curt, got shampoo in my ears, didn't use conditioner in my long hair (really??) and ripped her comb through the tangles. Sprayed hairspray in my face, scratched me with her scissors, pretty much sucked all around. Then, of course, she gave me the worst haircut of my life. I don't even know how it's possible for my hair to look less healthy after a haircut. She took off 3 inches instead of the 1 I requested.  The ends look like the bottom of a paintbrush.  I told her what I didn't like about it but she wasn't really willing/able to attempt to fix it a little. Ill never go back there, which makes me sad because it is conveniently located and the owner is really nice. Skip it. I've gotten much better haircuts at Super Cuts.

4.description: Lived in Jefferson Park for 3 years and always came here--never got a bad cut. Magda was my stylist 99% of the time (I think it was because our schedules just happened to line up; I didn't specifically request her but was always happy to get her), and she did a great job with my fine hair. I always left the salon feeling like I had shampoo model hair. The place is affordable, too--under $40 per cut. I've never been to a super swanky salon, so I don't know if this is a 5 star "as good as it gets" type place, but I have been to other salons of comparable price range and this one is at the top of the list. Now that I've moved away and have been trying to find a new place that I actually like, I'm missing XOX.

14.description: Again, as a newbie to Jefferson Park, I was looking for a hair cut joint in the 'hood.  As a mom of 2 little ones, convenience is key and cost is important.  Walked by on Friday and set up a Sat afternoon appointment for the next day.I had heard some friend-of-a-friend notes that this place was pretty good.  Kinda trendy for the neighborhood, at least in comparison with the other $5-7-10 places out there.  Decent decor and some Erasure playing over the speakers.  (Yeah, that sadly means "trendy" to this non-hip 40 year old mom....)"Agnes" (a shortened version of her full Polish name) was my stylist and wasn't overly friendly.  I got one "So do you have plans for weekend?" comment and monosyllabic answers to my questions about the 'hood and such.  But bottom line, she gave a great cut & style.  Cuts range from $30 for short, $35 for medium and $40 for long hair.  Same great haircut in my old Lakeview salon would have been $55, so I'll happily save $20 and get a good if not better cut in a convenient locale.   Supposedly XOX also does facials, pedicures/manicures, and massages, as well, tho didn't get the deets on those services.So - not fancy, but nice, not cheap but not pricey and again, bottom line - a good cut!

6.description: I go here to have my nails done - Kasia is the best!  My pedicure will easily last 6 weeks.  The manicure lasts the longest I've ever had a manicure last (about a week for me, I chip my polish like crazy).

28.description: Nine ball in the corner pocket and I'll walk away a hero. I used to love to play pool; unfortunately I haven't had the time recently. When I was playing, consistently that is, Chris's was the place to go. Its kind of cool to know scenes from film The Color of Money were shot here. Almost makes me feel like a young Tom Cruise ... well maybe not. It it amazing the people you run into though. I remember one time I was playing on a slow night and this guy and I were talking about pool cues, so we played a few games and guy was really good. Well as it turned out he was Joe Gold as in Joe Gold - Cognoscenti pool cues. It was an amazing experience to talk to him and he even invited my buddy and I to stop by his workshop sometime. (see my other review under Cognoscenti Cues to read about that visit) As for Chris's they keep the tables well maintained and the equipment in decent shape. Overall, It's a nice place to shoot pool, the drinks are a bit pricey and sometimes it crowded, but you never know whom you might meet..Pros: Lots of equipment, Meat market mentalityCons: Meat market mentalityCost: $$$ of 5Overall Rating: 3 of 5Recommendation: Worth the visit

1.description: A classic place to hang out with friends, shoot some pool, watch others at a game of billards. Everyone is friendly and its very relaxing to come and just chill.

9.description: Great tables: CheckGreat atmosphere: CheckDecent House Sticks: CheckJukebox: CheckBYOB: CheckPool Sharks: Check, Check & CheckUnder $4 per hour (Single player): CheckOverdone references to a certain famous Hollywood motion picture filmed here: CheckIce Cream: Check!Several 3-Cushion billiard tables and a full snooker are on hand, along with the 40+ regulation tables, in this all-serious - No BS warehouse-type pool hall.  From the moment you scale the steep stairs behind the rickety front door, the stench of high-stakes/money games is apparent.  Pool sharks circle in every corner, waiting for their next meal ticket.  I wouldn't be at all surprised if a hit was ordered during a game on one of the tables in the back - the place has that type of feel.But, I assure you, Chris' Billiards is relatively safe.  Most guys/gals are very affable and easily engaged in pool-related conversations.  Tips here come cheap.  Money games can get costly.  The place is segregated into 3 parts:  front room (snooker/3-cushioned / serious money games); backroom (younger and less serious games / jukebox) and the side room (mostly serious players that would rather practice first, then gamble).  However, the loose BYOB policy makes games in any room fun and enjoyable.  Just don't approach anyone with intentions of hustling - especially the fellas sportin' the cowboy hats.  Take your girl (or guy) and/or friends, and don't forget to bring a 12-pack with you.  Tables are often readily available, with exceptions in the later hours on the weekend.  Credit cards are welcome, but like the high stake games on table 1, cash is always king.

29.description: After climbing the lengthy stairs of this Milwaukee Avenue pool hall, you can spend a couple hours in the same room where Paul Newman and Tom Cruise shot scenes from The Color of Money.  This is a classic.  If you're looking to shoot some serious stick, this is where it's at.  You break!

23.description: now, this is a real billiards hall. chris's billiards has attracted the filming of "the color of money" (starring tom cruise) among other flicks. walk up the stairs and arrive to a collage of black & white framed celebrity photos. there has to be like 50 pool tables in the place. find your favorite jams on their juke box and rock out as you shoot your games with a buddy. it has gone non-smoking, but go ahead and light-up behind one of their pillars. you'll find a buncha middle-aged fellas in the front of the facility. it's not my first choice to bring a lady to unless you arrive with her in a group. she may feel uncomfortable in the testosterone-filled room.they have a limited junk food selection at the counter, but the lady who works there on some nights is nice.

5.description: Its ok at best. There rates change throughout the day which is good and bad. Interestingly one of the few places that still lets you smoke cigarettes inside, which sucks because that smell is gross. They allow BYOB, which is good, but when some shark desides he wants to hustle you once he found out you drank 1 too many, it takes the fun out of shooting some pool with your pals. Its a hit and miss but usually a decent time out.THe big deal was The Color of Money was shot here with Evanston local pro player Keith McCready playing Grady Seasons.

25.description: Chris's Billiards is a great place for hang out but not for pool. I personally own a pool table at home and the pool tables at Chris' is not high quality. And becarefully with the hours. One time me and my friends we had 2 tables for 2 hours, and our bills was $48 altogether.

12.description: If I can give this place half a star I would.Definitely not a place to take your girlfriend, date, or any girls.If you're a guy this place is fine.  My girlfriends and I went here after a long night out and saw it on the way home.  The place looks closed from the outside, probably the first warning sign that yelled "don't come here!"Anyways you go upstairs to a quite "seedy" big room and have the regulars (bunch of guys) around and almost gawk at us females.So to cut things short of this review, an okay place to hang out with your guys for pool.  Great for people who care about the game more than their surroundings.  And if you're a female, better go somewhere else like in Lincoln Park's Southport Lanes or Seven Ten Lounge.

21.description: When I feel like playing pool, I'll usually go to Chris's.Is it the nicest pool hall? NoIs the place clean? NoIs it cheap? NoWhat Chris's does have is a feel for a real pool hall.  This is the best place to play a serious game of pool as they have a ton of tables and space in between.You can't go wrong in a pool hall where they filmed Color of Money

16.description: One of the best pool halls I have ever seen. This place is a classic. If they ever make a movie about pool this would be the place to film. It has like four diferent sections and I was surprised how late it stays open. I happened to wander over after the bars and the place was still opened. The food selection leaves questions to be answered. I would'nt let the alley rats eat anything from this place. The place has forty or more pool tables and is the best pool hall you will find in the Midwest.

17.description: When I feel like playing pool, I'll usually go to Chris's.Is it the nicest pool hall? NoIs the place clean? NoIs it cheap? NoWhat Chris's does have is a feel for a real pool hall.  This is the best place to play a serious game of pool as they have a ton of tables and space in between.You can't go wrong in a pool hall where they filmed Color of Money

10.description: I haven't been back to Chris' in the 18 months I've been gone from Chicago, but I can only second what most of the other commenters have observed.  This place is the real deal.  It does one thing and it does it better than anyplace else.First, it keeps REAL hours, so if you just want to practice alone for 2 hours, head over in the middle of the day or any time really, and you'll have time to work on your massés.  It's hugely affordable for practice time, and you don't have to worry about a group of drunk folks falling all over you.Second, it's the last of it's breed.  When I used to play seriously, there were half a dozen great halls in Chicago that we toured, including St. Paul's on Fullerton and a rickety old place with a bowling alley upstairs on Damen and Irving. Not surprisingly, it's now a Starbucks and sterile condo development.So, go here to see a real institution.  Don't expect a mixologist with a DJ to entertain you.  Entertain yourself in an amazing throw-back which is (mercifully) still amazingly well maintained.

11.description: Nothing special about this place.  It looks pretty run-down, the staff isn't too pleasant, and the crowd is pretty...well, nothing to look at but this place is HUGE so you likely won't need to deal with "the others". :) It's a pool hall, can't really expect too much.  They have sticks, balls, and tables. Score.

26.description: This place is been around for years and has remained the same. I first came here 15 years ago with my friends who tried very hard to teach me to not look so bad when it was my shot. Reasonable hourly table prices. 41 tables in three different huge rooms. The food is very limited, but that is not why people come here. They come to shoot pool, and that they do. There is still smoking allowed in this establishment.

27.description: This place is the real deal.  No drinks, the food is probably poisonous, the lights are dim except the table floodlights, nothing but serious, well-maintained pool tables and 3-cushion billiards tables!!!  Also usually some serious players, money games, and a full sized snooker table.  There is music in the back rooms where the youngsters play, but out in the front room it's so classic it's practically in black and white -- a real institution.  Prices are great, especially if you want to just play by yourself.  They have weekly tournaments and bigger tourneys play there sometimes.  And I think they're open 24 hours.

0.description: Got in a huge brawl here because Purple Steve made a ridiculous 4 rail bank shot. That dude is so good at pool, its crazy. He's going to Vegas with the Chris's APA (American Pool Associaton) team. They let you BYOB here, so we each had our own fifth of John Daniels, which made the night super affordable, or as Tito call it, "A frugal night with the fellas." Olaf was supposed to show up, but wandered into the liquor store next door at some point and we didn't hear from him again. They have a cash payout tournament here every Saturday and even Sunday's sometimes its great. They have every kind of table size and shape here, whenever the gang is in town, you will find us here on running racks and breakin backs.

20.description: This place is awesome,very roomy, never overcroweded. They don't sell alcohol anymore,but who cares? Byob is cheaper anyways. This has always been my first choice to play pool.

19.description: As has already been mentioned, part of The Color of Money was shot here, giving you some indication that this is a Serious Pool Hall.  Its not about hanging out, looking good, meeting people, eating, drinking (no liquor), music or anything else.  Its just about the game.A lot of gambling takes place at Chris' and the hustling is so hardcore its easy to loose track of who's getting hustled and who's hustling.  If you think you're good, don't go to Chris' to pick up games or you might as well be jumping into a shark tank wearing a meat suit.  My advice would be to go to one of their tournaments (I think Wednesday nights and Sunday afternoons) and scope out the competition in a controlled environment.If you don't want to get hustled, its easy... just politely decline if anyone asks you to play.  And if you see other people playing for money, keep your mouth shut - they aren't interested in your comments or questions.  Chances are they don't want spectators either, so if you want to watch, be casual about it.The felt on the tables at Chris' is worn but that just means the tables play fast and you can't be shy with the English you put on the ball.Generally, I'm much happier to have a casual night out shooting pool and having a few drinks up at Slate Street Billiards in Vernon Hills.  I only go to Chris' 2 or 3 times a year out of curiosity, hoping to spot some big-money game between two top players.

2.description: I've lived in Jefferson Park for around 18 years and let me tell you that Chris Billiards is a must see. If you blink on milwaukee you'll miss it, and i drove pass it for years and finally stopped in about 4 months ago. Its awesome, comfortable, relaxed, and classic atmosphere. Its good to see that there are still places like this striving. Me and my friends are regulars there, not that we can play pool well either! Its doesnt serve alcohol which is good for older teens looking for a place to hang out. Nice people, sox fan -Eric the owner is a very nice guy and quite personable. Its old but its nice. I love this place and it doesnt make you blow a whole paycheck. Me personally i would love to buy in to this place and fix it up a little but this place rocks!

18.description: This piece of history, having been a locale in the film Color of Money, is a trip to a working-class, cozy, friendly place.  The pool tables are pretty well maintained, considering the almost smokey haze hovering above.  And the managers are very inviting. Bring your own pool cue, though. The house cues are in mediocre to poor shape.  And though the prices are fantastic, around 6 bucks/hour in the afternoon, 55 cents for a cup of coffee. It would be nice if they served beer.All in all, a great place to hang on a cool autumn afternoon.

13.description: I use to cut h.s. and hang out here...A LOT.  12 years later, Chris's is still the same place.  NO frills type of place.  The pros hang out and play in the front room, the drinkers/smokers (BYOB) are in the back room.  Theres also another room but it always smells funky in there.  I haven't been here in ages but the bf and I decided to get nostalgic and make a trip here last Friday night.  Ron, who been here since our h.s. days, is still working behind the counter and remembered our faces.  Walking into the backroom, I smelled cigarettes.  I thought it was just a remnant smell of the past but NO, people were smoking in there.  Mgmt doesn't really walk around the place so I guess that's how people get away with smoking.  But after awhile I got lightheaded due to no circulation of fresh air and chain smokers.  The only thing that has changed is the BYOB policy and the new jukebox.  The pool tables are cared for and the cue sticks aren't all warped.

4.description: A friendly place to shoot a few games of pool. The place reeks of atmosphere, that's a good thing. It's well lit, a comfortable place to play. Some of my favorite memories are playing my father and my uncle here. A great way to kick back before your work week.

24.description: As has already been mentioned, part of The Color of Money was shot here, giving you some indication that this is a Serious Pool Hall.  Its not about hanging out, looking good, meeting people, eating, drinking (no liquor), music or anything else.  Its just about the game.A lot of gambling takes place at Chris' and the hustling is so hardcore its easy to loose track of who's getting hustled and who's hustling.  If you think you're good, don't go to Chris' to pick up games or you might as well be jumping into a shark tank wearing a meat suit.  My advice would be to go to one of their tournaments (I think Wednesday nights and Sunday afternoons) and scope out the competition in a controlled environment.If you don't want to get hustled, its easy... just politely decline if anyone asks you to play.  And if you see other people playing for money, keep your mouth shut - they aren't interested in your comments or questions.  Chances are they don't want spectators either, so if you want to watch, be casual about it.The felt on the tables at Chris' is worn but that just means the tables play fast and you can't be shy with the English you put on the ball.Generally, I'm much happier to have a casual night out shooting pool and having a few drinks up at Slate Street Billiards in Vernon Hills.  I only go to Chris' 2 or 3 times a year out of curiosity, hoping to spot some big-money game between two top players.

6.description: It's been under new management for a while now, and they've re-clothed and repaired the tables in the front room & the back tournament room.  They've started hosting more tournaments now, too.  Probably the best place to shoot in the city.

22.description: This piece of history, having been a locale in the film Color of Money, is a trip to a working-class, cozy, friendly place.  The pool tables are pretty well maintained, considering the almost smokey haze hovering above.  And the managers are very inviting. Bring your own pool cue, though. The house cues are in mediocre to poor shape.  And though the prices are fantastic, around 6 bucks/hour in the afternoon, 55 cents for a cup of coffee. It would be nice if they served beer.All in all, a great place to hang on a cool autumn afternoon.

15.description: If you're looking for glam, hot chicks, booze and atmosphere, this is definitely "NOT" your place (go to Lucky Strike or something of that sort), but if you're a downright hardcore pool player, can play pool for hours on end without having a beer or smile, and constantly try to improve your skill, then join the club. There are a ton of tables here, and I've never needed to wait. There's a jukebox, but I hardly see anyone actually pay to hear a song. There are all kinds of pool tables (although I'm extremely disappointed with their snooker table which seems to be dated back to the world fair), and awesome prices. It was too bad I didn't have a car long enough to come here more and it's pretty out of the way if you live in the city, but if you nothing better to do and have another pool friend- definitely play here!

7.description: I love this place! BYOB.TONS of tables.Really laid back staff.Cool music - affordable prices for the amount of songs played.

8.description: Okay hangout if you're going out with a group of friends. They have plenty of pool tables to go around, but it seems like the non-regulars are easily spotted. The entrance (you have to walk up the stairs) is kind of awkward for me. Overall, the place in not visually appealing, but I wouldn't expect cozy couches and plush carpets from a pool hall anyway.

3.description: First off, if you're not a pool player you shouldn't be in the front room. Chances are, you're doing whatever with your liquor and other in the back room anyway. Now, if you are a pool player, then this is the place to get schooled. They watch you shoot for a bit and then see if you're game for some action... but mind you, they're not really looking to take you for a lot... a few $20s here and there... and yes... you get schooled... meaning, they don't teach you how to shoot... they teach you not to come back looking for action.As far as ambiance, it smells crusty and stale. The food I'm afraid to try... a million things in here need to get fixed... like the roof (leaks on rainy days), the walls... lights... someone needs to repaint the place... and put some coloring on the windows or something (like yellowish tint so it doesn't screw up the play during the day. I'm an avid shot myself, but there are other places I'd rather frequent than this now. Sure - they've got history... but at least clean the place up a bit...

14.description: The draw is "They shot Color of Money here!" Once you get over that this place is a giant warehouse-like building with no frills and pool tables. Occasionally you can see some elite games going on but for the most part, this place is a diehard pool junkie kinda place. The place is definitely an upgrade from Nick's but still has many of the same elements. It is usually more crowded and has some seriously people of all makes and models coming here to compete. This place is also not so friendly but that is what you expect when coming here. Definitely has a aura upon stepping in here. You will feel like you are hustler. But really not when some punk in baggy jeans takes you for your bills.

12.description: If you pay attention you can really hit some good deals with Jewel, which is the only reason I choose to shop here. Sadly this is bar far the worst Jewel I've been too. It's always crowded and loud. The customer service is horrible and everything is a mess. They have a very selective section in products which drives me nuts. Unfortunately this is the only grocery store within walking distance for me.

3.description: The baggers SUCK. Every single time I go there, I end up having to tell them to not put bread at the bottom of the bag. They always end up squishing at least one item. Last time, I got home to find two broken eggs which were not broken when i picked them out. This time, i have squished bread because I forgot to observe the bagger. The selection at this location isn't great as well, but I keep returning just because I live a block away.

1.description: This Jewel-Osco location is not as big as other locations Ive visited regularly like the one in Evanston or Niles, but they seem to have a good variety of grocery options to choose from and the prices are not expensive. Sales occur weekly so its good to check from time to time on their sale paper. They do also offer food readily made for purchase to eat at their deli dept! parking appears adequate!

2.description: This has been one of my favorite Grocery Stores . The location and variety of products is indisputable. Customer Service is something ok , not great but ok . I really like the department of flowers and cakes area . However the fruit/vegetable area is always clean and fruits / vegetables are of very good quality. without forgetting the meat department they are also of very good quality and lots of deals. very convenient hours Mondays to saturday 6am to 11pm.

9.description: Excellent place for Beer,Wine and Spirits!! Best selection of craft beers in the Neighborhood!!

10.description: This is my go-to Jewel-Osco location. Most of the staff is extremely friendly, the store is clean, and organized. I really admired the staff's ability to stay professional and friendly even when having to work on Thanksgiving day.

4.description: Your standard Jewel, except I encountered a problem I never had before at any other. Employees are only following procedure, but it's a shame that on the 4th of July, I can't purchase beer because they wouldn't take my ID (from a U.S. territory). I was born overseas on a US territory because my dad served in the US Navy for 24 years. Happy 4th of July!

6.description: Unfortunately this is the closet grocery store to where I live. For whatever I never really shopped here often and the few times I did it was an "okay" experience. I didn't like how it was not connected to what used to be Osco and what now is CVS. Very inconvenient. But what completely changed my mind about this store and what ultimately will lead me to never to go back there was my last experience there about a month ago. My fiancé and I went in to do our weekly shopping (which we usually do at Mariano's, but I had a taste for jewels potato wedges). As I was waiting for the wedges I asked my fiancé to go pick out two steaks for us to grill. He came back with only one and said the rest of the steaks all look spoiled. So we got the one cut that I like and he ended up going to Mariano's later for the cut he likes. I bought chicken breasts and got a buy one get one free deal. I also bought hamburger buns. My fiancé wanted bagels but couldn't find a pack that weren't hard. He was so upset he smashed a package of them in anger. When I got home I immediately put one pack of the chicken in the freezer to use in the future and opened the other pack to put in the crock pot for dinner the next day. When I opened the pack to wash off the chicken, it smelled...bad. I looked at the date and it was still good and the chicken looked fine so I decided to still cook it. Next I worked on the steak that I bought for myself because we were going to grill that for dinner. Although it was the one steak at the store that didn't have grey color to it, when I took it out of the packing I discovered a large grey dis coloring that had been covered by the sticker. I had to cut a huge piece of the steak off and throw it out (should have gone to Mariano's like my fiancé did for his steak). The next day as we were going to eat then bbq pulled chicken I made in the crock pot, I opened to pack of buns I bought from here and they were stale. I couldn't believe it. We had to throw those out completely. We ate the chicken without buns but it just didn't taste right and I couldn't get over the smell it had when I first opened it. We ended up throwing it away completely as well as the other pack I had in the freezer. What a sick collection of products this store has. Never again.

0.description: Everyone has a list of their favorite grocers and why they go there. I like Mariano's for their steaks.  I like the Jewel on Cicero and Irving Park because it's more spacious, etc. This Jewel location is much smaller than any of the other Jewel's I frequent and I only come here for staples when on sale.  But I have to give them 5 stars because they treat their senior citizens with so much care and respect. Several times I have observed employees go above and beyone to help Senior Citizens. For example, unload their cart items onto the casheir conveyor belt--without being asked. Stopping to ask if someone needs help finding an item. Helping them sort through coupons to find the right one.  All with so much patience and kindness.  Really nice to witness such excellent customer service.

5.description: Unfortunately when traffic is awful on 90, this is the closest and most convenient location to my house.  I say unfortunately because most of the time when I stop by here, the selection is abysmal compared to other Jewel-Osco stores, the meat isn't the best, and the produce is incredibly lacking.  Don't be surprised if you swing in for a special and you find the store COMPLETELY out.   Also, if you're looking for a bottle of wine to go with whatever selection of meat you MANAGE to find, good luck. I've never seen such a  half-assed setup for wine from a grocery store. I honestly have no idea how they organize the varieties.  Seriously. If someone could clue me in, that'd be great. Most of the staff is nice, and the lines aren't too long. But when you're trying to pick out yogurt and two young crew members are talking about how a customer smells like "cat piss", it's a little disconcerting. It's getting to the point where I would almost rather go to a different Jewel.... or I wish Dominicks were still around.

13.description: This is the only store I've patronized since I've lived in this neighborhood with the exception of Butera (ONLY when Butera sales are so tempting that I brave the place..it smells funny). Frankly, both establishments are disappointing.  At first my only complaint was that this Jewel was small compared to others and therefore had a smaller selection of goods. Only other thing was that the lines were a little long but hey, its a grocery store at 6pm that's just the way it is. But then they got rid of a few items that were a staple of practically every shopping trip: not one, but two kinds of ice cream (Dean's Rocky Road & StoneRidge Cookie Dough). What made no sense is that these products used to literally sell out, most of the time I bought the last few. I've experienced this baffling phenomenon with several products over the years but this was senseless--why did they remove two top selling ice cream flavors right before summer? The only explanation I ever received from management was that they had to make room for other brands. Excuses excuses. Now I go to the next closest Jewel on Irving/Nagle-- don't mess with a girls ice cream or suffer the consequences.

11.description: This is the closest Jewel (not a Jewel-Osco actually) to my house, so I do go here often. It's small, but has what I need in the food department. I'm so used to the Jewel-Osco combination, and was baffled that items like contact solution are completely unavailable. (was hoping for my usual one stop shop, but had to go across the street to CVS to get contact solution). I was also disappointed when I went there to purchase some yogurt only to find that every single one I looked at had a date best by about 2 months ago. Needless to say, I did not purchase any yogurt there that day.

8.description: This is the worst Jewel store I have ever visited.  The cashier, Amber, has crayon red hair and the roots look  awful.   SHe does not show a professional appearance AT ALL and is very rude.This is not an acceptable appearance to work with the public.  I tried to write a check for $20. over and was told that I could not do that and then another individual named Kim who was standing chatting with other employees shouted across to me asking "How much money do you have in your checking account?".  My check went through after all the insults. Unbelievably rude and sarcastic individual.  I will never shop at this store again.  There is no management at the store in the evening.  I would never recommend this store to ANYONE.

14.description: Average selection and price.  Short lines.  There are better places in the area for meat and bread, however.

7.description: Not particularly my favorite Jewel. It's small and the layout is weird. Can't complain though I can get what I need there. For some reason they have every pasta but fussili. Why?! Anyhoo... It's close to home so I will be returning often.

58.description: Uck - why did I not listen to my fellow yelpers?  I am lazy, that's why.  This place is on my way home from the Y and I thought "eh, why not?".  Well let me tell you. First off $35 for mani/pedi.  Not outrageous at all, except when your manicure sucks.  The woman who took care of me was really nice and not too chatty, but enough to be cordial.  The place, clean enough, not horrible.  But the quality of the work was not up to par.  I realized, once I got home, that she didn't paint my entire nail and the clear top coat wasn't even over that entirely.  So the next day, it looked like my nails had grown an inch because the polish was SO far from the cuticle.  The pedicure wasn't much better.  I expect a manicure to last AT LEAST a week, if not longer.  It was chipped the second day and I ended taking the polish off in 4 days due to the same issue I had with my mani. 4 days is not long enough for $35, in my opinion.

56.description: Sloppy, expensive, unfriendly, and painful! I've been here a few times because it is close to my apartment, and have ultimately decided to take my business elsewhere. For my wedding, the girl who did my 'white & pink' gels did them WRONG and when I went back to get them filled the guy said he couldn't fill them because they were incorrect. He had to put on a fresh set and had the nerve to charge me again for it. The girl who did them was also 8 months pregnant and I can't imagine that was healthy for her and her unborn child! Once, I had a basic manicure there and the guy who did it went so fast that it was not only sloppy, but when I left I had nicks all around each nail with specks of blood. It's always really busy and I don't really understand why. It's a nice looking salon, perhaps, especially with their new nail bar on the second floor, but the service and quality are TERRIBLE.

29.description: Can't comment on service itself, since I never received any services, but I was interested in their "Party Room". I called to ask about the room and availability. When I initially called, the day I needed was available, but when I tried to reserve it over the phone I was told I could not do that because I had to pay in person.  I couldn't pay over the phone? OK!?!? SO a week later I called back to confirm the day was available. The girl i talked to confirmed it was available  (2 hours prior) to my arrival.When I got there the lady greeted me at the door with a smile. She asked how she could help me and I informed her that I was interested in seeing and reserving the party room. She turned and told the young girl, apparently that I wanted to make an appointment, when that was clearly NOT what I said. So I saw the room, discussed prices, and proceeded down to make the reservation. When she opened the calendar to the date, it was booked at the exact time i needed.   UNFUCKINBELIEVABLE! I drove over an hour in traffic across the city to make a deposit, which most salons don't require, but fine ...their rules, but then come to find out you wasted my time, gas, energy, patience, and I PLANNED AND SEND INVITATIONS for this day and location!THANKS A LOT LEE NAILS- YOU SUCK especially with customer service. Maybe if someone ACTUALLY checked the calendar, this mishap would not exist.

42.description: I've had manicures and pedicures done here a few times, each time by Rosa. She is fantastic!!! She is very kind and does a great job! She never rushes to get done and she is very gentle. Highly recommended!

23.description: I read the Yelp review and was a bit uncertain, but I needed a pedicure before my vacation. So this was my first time here and it will be my last. The inside  of the shop was uninviting and I could hardly understand the girl behind the counter who was supposed to be the greeter. The guy who came to do my pedi was not friendly. He just gave orders "sit here", "go there". He also was insulting my toes telling me I need to brush them more often and keep them cleaner. (I don't have dirty toes. Just tired feet & toes from shoes all day.) This was the first pedicure in my life where I was made to feel embarrassed by my feet. Then he took one of his tools and dug under the nail of my big toe. Oh the pain! My toe throbbed through the rest of the pedi. He barely did any sloughing at the bottom of my feet.  There was no pride or care in his work. I paid cash and made certain I got a receipt just in case I have any issues with my toe that I am now soaking in warm water and putting an antibiotic ointment on. My advice--DON'T VISIT THIS SHOP!!!

47.description: I've got mixed feelings about this place.On one hand, the ambience is much nicer than many of this kind of nail place.  It's clean with a somewhat cohesive decor.  As soon as I walk in, they take care of me...and the service is quite attentive.On the other hand, my manicurist was a little rough.  I realize that with the language barrier, it's standard to just slap my leg to tell me to put it back in the water, but this gal was not pulling punches.  The foot/leg massage portion was woefully short (I'm giving a jealous sideways glance at another review that complains about the massage being too long!).Also, at some point another customer tried to get my manicurist's attention, and this really seemed to bug the manicurist.  I'm not sure if she felt like I didn't understand her (I did), but she kept repeating how I was her customer, and she was focused on me.  And then proceeded to keep repeating that when I come back, I should ask for her...I mean, she literally said this at least 8 times, and I felt obligated to comfort her.She did a good job, and I may return to give her another chance, but I'm not optimistic.  It's kind of a lot of pressure, ya know?

8.description: I got a gel set while I waited for me car to get serviced. Thought I would treat myself. I told her a wanted my nail thin and natural with no polish just clear. I ended up having to get black tips painted on bc my nails were so so horrible. My nails are thick and there are bubbles in the gel. Also I have so much glue  and gel stuck under my nails. It is real uncomfortable having all that under your nails. Plus she did not even clean my nail before doing them so I have dirt now Guled / stick to the underside of me nail and around the sides. Also she did not do me cuticle she just used the motorized file and tore them up. This is one of the worst nail experiences I have ever had. Also when I asked her to fix the underside of my nails she gave me attitude.

31.description: After reading all the reviews I was hesitant to come in but so glad i did went with my baby girl and we loved it  they took their time and did an awesome job on me and my daughter

34.description: Changing my review. In my opinion, the service has drastically changed since Jenny's daughters grew up & started working at the salon. The one that answers the phone is very snotty and lies. She'll tell you the salon closes at 7 even though it's open until 8. If you ask to make an appointment with your favorite technician, she'll tell you the person is booked for the rest of the night...so you reluctantly come in to see a different tech only to find out the one you wanted was NOT booked all night & asks how come you didn't ask for her.
