This has happened more than a few times so it's not just a coincidence.Lastly, I change up the services I go in for...always a pedicure & no chip manicure but sometimes I need a nail repair, sometimes I don't. Sometimes I'll have my eyebrows & lip waxed, sometimes just my eyebrows. Sometimes French tips, sometimes one color. But no matter what I do, it always ends up costing me the same...even when I've had less work done.After many many years frequenting this salon, I got sick of the bs. Sorry to Tina...wish I could still have you do my nails, but unfortunately I now take my money elsewhere. And I'm paying less and getting beautiful manicures and FRIENDLY HONEST service.

16.description: I have been coming here for years. I am very picky and a little demanding on how my nails should look. Thank you Rosa for listening on how I like my nails.

13.description: I've been coming here for years and this is the second time I've had a bad experience. The first was w/Lou. I came in at about 630 on a Friday to get acrylic done and he was the only tech available. He was so rude and in such a rush that he hurt me several times. Now today I came in to get a pedicure and got a lady (not sure her name) and I'm repeatedly telling her that as she's cleaning my nails something's bothering me. Her response is, "Oh I already did and cleaned it". Then when she finally goes back she realizes she wasn't thorough and instead of properly cleaning it she pushes everything back in. There's only one person whose work I truly like and from now on I will stick to them. I'm a  paying customer and don't try to give anyone a hard time but if the customer is telling you something's wrong it's not for you to get upset. Seriously this is just ridiculous.

11.description: The service is excellent and the nail tech I hard was great!  I have never seen my nails look so good.  The major issue I saw was it wasn't very clean.  I noticed nail dust all over the table I was at.  The tubs for the pedicures I don't think were cleaned adequately either.  They are super busy there and customers never have to wait for service long but I think customers would be willing to wait to clean properly.

39.description: The only reason why i'm going to this place is becauase I don't have a lot of time today and I really need my nails done, otherwise I'd make the journey to somewhere else. And that Sunday Nails place a few more blocks down East, they suck ass too.-Rude assholes...Anyway, Lee Nails. They pull my cuticle on my big toe and the lady said, "Beauty is pain" and I almost kicked her in the fucking face. Then me and my boyfriend went. I thought I'd surprise him with getting his toes manicured. (yea, some guys like that. My bf loves being pampered) anyway, She said, Clear nail polish or buffer? and i said "Buffer" and she said, "buffer?" and I said no clear polish, two totally different words, right? and she said, "Buffer?" and I said, what the hell, yea buffer. And turns out she charged us EXTRA $5 for that damn buffer. Like I said, I don't wanna go, but have to due to time constraint.

37.description: This place has the worst customer service.  Their nail techniques are questionable polish rarely lasts unless you get the no chip. But the reason I am posting today is because of the semipermanent eyelash extension service they promise the lashes will last between two to six weeks.  My daughters lashes were falling off the very next day.  There was black glue on her eye lid and the lady put noticably more lashes on her right eye than her left.  It was like she got tired and rushed through the second eye.  The process took one hour and 50 minutes that alone should have indicated a problem.  REALLY not happy and would not return again. One more thing when I called and requested to speak with a manager I was told she did not speak english so could not take my complaint.  I want a refund and will never return there even though I live in the neighborhood.  I cannot reccommend for anyone to go there their service is awful.  Clearly they cannot handle problems and exaggerate the quality of their services.

0.description: Gah! Where to start and where to finish. Well, let me start off by saying I grew up in this area and have been coming here for over 15 years on and off. So that in itself should say something. Overall, it's very very decent and really a hit or miss. Back back in the day, Jenny's business was just nearly starting to flourish. Her salon was nice but somewhat still dinky. She had very nice employees who did a good job on nails and feet. Throughout the years when her business started to grow she started doing massive changes to the salon. She added a top floor for spa parties, massage and facial services, redid her entire first floor as far as the sinks, chairs, nail stations, etc. She has come a long way and has really built a successful business.I'm not sure if that change has anything to do with the new tude of the place but the service has gone down hill. There was a girl I use to go to for my nails also named Jenny who left a few years ago. From the way it seemed she left on bad terms. This was a shame cause she was so good. Still, I came back a lot. Her daughters started working there and every time I have been in they are really just the rudest. They clearly do not want to be there and always have a stank face on. Since then, I haven't been back in the last 8 years or so. I just recently came back since I was in the area for a full set. They close at 8 and it was around 730 so I knew I was pushing it. There was no one in sight but the workers and the doors were closed. Jenny was nice enough to let me in and recognized me right away. Charlie was still there who has been doing nails there for several years now. He is not the friendliest with me but I have seen him be overly friendly with a few other clients. I tried to make convo but it wasn't happening. I was nervous because way back when when he first started he sucked but he did get better over the years. We finished at 8 and it was standard pricing 35.00 for gel full set.Overall, it came out OKAY. Other than the fact he cut my skin towards the end with the nail machine. Didn't even use anything as far as healing liquid (like they normally do) just let it chill there like it was whatever.I don't know if I'll be back here anytime soon. If you're in need and in the area just be warned it could be good okay or really bad. Customer service is not their forte. Jenny is a nice lady though so that always has me coming back at the end of the day.

38.description: I tried this place because a friend told me they do a no-chip manicure for $25. I found out when I got there that the cost is without trimming your cuticles. This place does a TERRIBLE job! The way they remove the no-chip manicure is all wrong and it weakens your already weak nails. They soak your nails over and over until your fingertips turn white and each time they take your hands out of the polish remover, they keep sanding down your nails to remove the polish. They are literally sanding down your natural nail as well!  My nails are breaking and the polish chipping within a week of having them done! Now my nails are so weak and thin from the sand-down that I have to go to my regular place and have them redone the correct way and fixed! The correct way is to put a cotton ball soaked in polish remover on each fingernail and wrap in a piece of aluminum foil. Let it sit for a few minutes and then use an orange stick to gently scrape off the polish, NOT THE NATURAL NAIL! Save yourself the trouble and DO NOT go here!

51.description: I went today looking to get a no-chip French mani, regular French pedi.  It turns out, they don't do no-chip, I stayed for the pedi and that was ok.  They're very friendly and do a great job there, but what's the point of going when I can get everything done at another salon.

27.description: My first visit here was great. I got my nails done and eyebrows waxed by the young tattooed lady. She was very detail-oriented and even got the little spots on the side of my nails that most nail techs don't bother to do. She was quick and efficient with the eyebrow wax, and made no mistakes. Both my nails and my 'brows looked great!The second time I came back here I got my legs waxed. They seemed to be very busy, but I had set an appointment for 3:00pm. I wasn't seen until about 3:30, and with an older woman with an apron (I have no idea of their names since they don't introduce themselves...). It was very rushed and very painful. She did huge sections at once and didn't even talk to me. I was ushered upstairs where I had to wait for her to guide me where to go. Minutes later, she just walked past me and into the room as I followed, not saying a word. She could've at least been a little friendlier...Overall, I was pleased with the results from both visits. There is just a varying degree of customer service and if you go with certain people you will be pleased with their customer service...others, not so much. They do a good job, they just need to be friendlier. And as for the leg waxing, I probably wouldn't come back here just because she was so brutal about it. But for nails and eyebrow waxing, I'll be back!

32.description: I have been coming here for years and am always satisfied with my service. The staff is always polite and goes out of their way to make sure you're okay. Charlie, Tina and Jenny are the best! They do not allow tips on cards, so bring cash.

54.description: THE WORST!!!!!! I call in at like 2pm to set an appointment for a pedi because I am going to Cali next week and my feet are hurting from the Winter. So long story short a young girl picked up the phone @ Lee's and told me no worries walk right in we are open until 7. My car is in the sop so I walked about 2 miles to get there only to see 15 people who look like they are working there tell me they close at 6 (which btw it was only 5:40) and that all the nail tech's are gone. Which again 15 asians sitting around so nice lie there... I see the old lady in the back yell rudely "COME BACK MUUNNNDAAAAAAY". I think she said "Monday" so I walked out pissed off and wasted time I could have used going to a real salon that can communicate VIA phone and in person!

48.description: AWFUL! Went in for a 'no chip' manicure and I will never go back. Ever. I travel often for work so even though it's twice as much for the 'no chip' it's worth the time saved ('guaranteed' to last 2 weeks) and the professional appearance ('guaranteed' to not chip). Well folks, mine chipped. After 2 days. And 5 days later is destroyed. When I went into the salon, they informed me they were not going to fix it and said they never guaranteed me it would last 2 weeks. They refused to do anything for me which is unfortunate because I go for a mani/pedi every two weeks like clock work... and tip very well. I'll be taking my nails elsewhere and I suggest you do the same!

44.description: Ive been a random patron of this place over  the years, and consistently was disappointed in the quality of the work.  My whole family goes here, so I thought maybe one day I would actually get a good mani-pedi.  I don't like anything too fancy, and usually just like my hands cleaned up and cut very short and painted clear.  They always give me a hard time and always are insisting that I get tips or gels.  I always decline, and they rush through my mani, and my nails are always chipped by the next day.  Now onto the real disaster... I went to Lee for a party where we all got our mani-pedi's.  We had a blast by ourselves, and then the nail technicians came up.  My sisters nail tech kept yelling at her about her cuticles.   My other sisters nail tech kept being very rude to her and made everyone feel uncomfortable.  My nail tech was quiet, but cut my cuticle on my hand and made me bleed once. My sister noticed that when they go crazy with the skin razor on your heels that they pull a tray out from under the pedicure station where they catch the skin.  She said it was disgusting and they don't empty it, and they just push it back under the chair when they are done.  Piles of skin sitting under a pedi station is just not sanitary.  On top of that, the tools they use do not seem so sanitary.  I left my party and a few days later I saw a strange white spot under my finger nail.  Then my whole nail from that spot started to fall off!!! I finally went to a higher end nail salon where I was told that I had either had a nail fungus from Lee or that they had damaged my nail bed. Needless to say- this was my last trip to Lee nails ever again.

24.description: I took my daughter for a manicure and pedicure. She's only six years old n she was super excited. I was getting my manicure done while she was getting her pedicure. I was sitting on the other side of the salon so I wasn't able to see what was going on. They charged me $20 for my lil girl. As soon as we left my daughter told me they didn't even wash her feet. Nothing. They basically charged me $20 for painting her nails. To be honest I could have done better job painting her nails. Don't get scammed. The lady that was doing her nails was the owner of the place. Go figure.

7.description: Love! Rosa and Charlie are my two favorites but I'm sure they're all wonderful. I try other place in the area but always end up here to fix the mess other salons make. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

49.description: So this is a not so bad place, however it is very easy to get the wrong girl!I always ask for Hannah for either manicures or eyebrow waxing, Sandra, if she is still there also does a wonderful job!Cheap place, great color selection, sometimes there is a really long wait, even if you have an appointment. So when its finally my turn, I do feel sometimes that the speed through just to get to the next person, except for Hannah and her girlfriend, they take their time, do it right and not to mention they are just really wonderful people :)

40.description: I just moved into the neighborhood and I was looking for a place to get a decent mani/pedi.  Don't go here!  Their nail polish colors are awful.  They have a minimum selection of Essie and OPI colors to choose from.  They have a majority of no name nail polishes that I have never heard of.  The worst part is the rude customer service.  My technician cut my cuticle so deep that it was bleeding and she didn't even apologize!  Also, while I was getting my pedi, my foot slip and I nicked some of the polish off my toes.  I apologized and she rolled her eyes at me as if  I did it on purpose.  I will never go back here again and I recommend that no one goes here.

53.description: I usually go to T-Top Nails in Evanston and they are great but since this place is so close to my house I gave them a try.  The first time I went was last year and the pedicure was ok, however i wanted to get my arcylic nails done and asked for them to be short because i type all day.  The guy who did my nails seemed quite annoyed that I wanted them round and short.  I vovew not to go there again.  However today i decided to try them it is nice out and i wanted to wear summer shoes.  The pedicure was fine although i would like them to massage my feet and calfs more.  The same guy from last year did my nails again I told him I wanted them short and round again he seemed annoyed with this.  He also seemed annoyed that i did not put my fingers in front of the drying fan properly he was rude. My nails are too long they do not look professional.  I am paying you so do what I ask for and be friendly but not overly friendly.  I may go there for a pedicure if I am in a hurry but I will never go there for my nails again.  They are too long and my thumb hurts from the nail or something. It has also been very har to type can't wait to see how work goes on Monday

30.description: I really do not understand how this place can get so many bad reviews. I've been going to Lee Nails here and there since I was a senior in high school. When I moved to Lakeview I had my own local shop I frequented but when I moved back to Old Irving I had to go back here. I've never had a rushed service, rude employee, or complication. Everyone there seems professional and generally happy. I mean its their place of employment...are YOU happy at your job 24/7?What I love about Lee is that 90% of the service providers understand and speak very good English. They have two younger girls who work there who speak perfect English. There's never a misunderstanding. Thier pedis last for weeks (had mine for about 3 weeks before it started to chip...and this is with regular polish!), manis are great. Mine lasts about a week before I need a polish change, which is about normal. Also they do a fantastic job with gel nails. I got my gel fill here after a botched job from a place in schaumburg and they did miracles to my nails! Also they can do some fantastic nail art and nail shapes. $25 for spa pedi, $12 for full mani, $5 for polish change, $20+ for gel fill in, $8 for nail art. Very reasonable and affordable! If i had to give any negative feedback it would be that the space can seem a bit outdated. A little new decor and the place would be perfect! Also, they could use some new polish. It seems like they don't have as many colors as any other nail salon would. Lastly, I've never seen more than about a 10 min wait on any given Friday or Saturday, but they take appointments if you're worried about that! TIPS: they do not accept tips on credit cards, so bring cash!

46.description: Got fake nails done the other day. They have all popped off at this point. I had them done Thursday, it's now Monday..ugh! $50 bucks down the drain.They still do great work for mani/pedis and last forvever w/o getting the "no-chip"I will go somewhere else for fakes next time. sigh.

1.description: I had a wonderful experience.  They have a very big supply of colors and they have special chairs for kids pedicures. They are very good with kids!y daughters nails came out incredible as did mine! I will definitely be going back!

55.description: This is conveniently located in my neighborhood so forgive me for trying them more than once. besides I thought they were reasonably priced. Been there in the past and they were good. the last 3 times they weren't. the last one (yesterday) was absolutely the worst. The technician used the diamond rotary implement to file down my cuticles after "nipping and cutting" them leaving it rough and really sloppy. I'll never go back. I think I will read reviews next time.

9.description: I have been going here for years but I only go to Anna for my pedicure, I have ingrown toenails and she is the only one that knows how to cut them without all the pain! My feet look pretty for weeks and she takes her time and does it right, if she ever leaves I will cry!!

26.description: It is very difficult to find a nail salon open before 10 AM! Thank goodness I came across Lee Nails. Open at 9 and conveniently located in Portage Park with easily accessible parking, I hit the jackpot! The inside of the salon was very clean, and all the staff was friendly. I was there right after it opened so there was only 1 other customer besides me, and I got in and sat down super quick. My nail tech was friendly, and did a great job on my nails. I sat next to a very large TV which is always nice. The prices were reasonable, and I was very impressed with the job that was done. They are also located directly across from a Bank of America which was great considering they do not accept tips on a credit card and I did not happen to have cash on me. Glad to have found a place open so early in such a great location, I will definitely be back!

25.description: Just went there a couple days ago for a no chip manicure and am so disappointed. First let me start out with the fact that they DO NOT sanitize their tools, he pulled his tools out of a plastic box that looked like a pencil box and after he used the tools on me he put them right back in the box and closed it.. WHAT?!?!? I chose my color and I could tell by his look something was wrong, but instead of speaking to me about the issue he just continued painting my nails. The nail polish was old and was not going on smoothly, but by the time I noticed he had already done my entire right hand and half my left. I have gotten multiple no chip manicures before and they take quite awhile, and have many layers of polish and coatings. He finished mine so quickly which is not normal for a no-chip. The nail polish was not smooth and perfect like normal manicures, it was rigid and bumpy. It looked like I had painted my own nails. Its only been 2 days and there is a chip, when a no chip is supposed to last 2 weeks. I am just so disappointed. Never going back!

12.description: I've been coming here for years. I love their service, prices and location. Thanks for all great service.

59.description: This place isn't too far from my condo, so I thought I'd stop in. I went there on a Friday and it was packed with waiting people. I wanted to turn around but stayed, because the wait was about 30 min's long. I got my eyebrows waxed and they kept asking if I wanted anything else. I managed to get out of there without getting suckered into any specials of the day. It's been about 6 months and I keep going back. I got my nails done there once.  I would never do it again. I told the guy that I was a chef and that my nails needed to be very short.  All I wanted was acrylic fullest.  I walked out of there with long $50 nails. The people that work there are nice but they could work a little more on their people skills. It's a nice place to go check out and see if it works for you!

21.description: what a horrible experience...did not even get a chance to even breathe before the young lady asked (on a Saturday @ around 4 temps in upper 50s) what do you want? uh excuse me...I ignored and stated eye brows mani pedi...he answer was well...it's going to be a while...did mention wait time just said or would would you like to go else where...I walked out very...VERY rude

17.description: Went in for a manicure and I Had my nails done on a Sunday by a very young man. He botched the nail polish application (I was almost embarrassed for him) I went directly to his supervisor once my nails were done and Told her I was not at all happy with my nails. She offered to have me come back for a polish change, THANK GOD. Except when I came back, an older man worked on my nails. He had the worse attitude towards me, did a crap job on my polish change, I had to ask him repeatedly to fix my nails where the polish was running onto my finger. His attitude was uncalled for considering he was fixing his coworkers crappy job. Once he was done he dismissed me so rudely and asked me to move to the front. Unbelievable. Never been treated so poorly for a service I was PAYING for. This is my neighborhood salon but never again will I go here. For God's sake don't let either of the young me here work on your nails, you will regret it! However if you're in a bind and this is the only crap nail salon open, ask for Linda. She is pleasant and a perfectionist. Two things you definitely want in a manicurist. Otherwise AVOID THIS DUMP LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!!!!Oh and another con: they only take cash tips. NOT WORTH the hassle. Go to the next salon, trust me

10.description: I have a regular nail place that I love. I only went here because my daughter's friend invited us and said really good things about it. The service was abysmal. We had asked for them to seat us all together when we made the appointment. It would be one thing if it just weren't possible. In our case, it felt like they went out of their way to keep us apart. Miraculously, just as all of our pedicures began, a spot opened up that would have brought us all together. Instead of moving one of us, they put a stranger there. They shaped my toenails in the oddest manner possible. How hard is it to just cut straight across? They gave me a hard time when I requested that they just cut them straight across and keep them short. That cannot be a strange request. They charged me full price for a mani/pedi for a 5 year old - even though all they did was apply polish. She had a fingernail that needed to be trimmed. They painted it even though it was scraggly. There was polish all over her cuticles. They missed a major spot on my chin wax and refused to fix it then - or the next day when I spoke to the owner. They were happy to do the wax the next day - for full price. We weren't there at a terribly busy time, yet they rushed us out the door. I asked if we could wait until our toes were dry. They shoved plastic bags on our feet and insisted we were fine. Not the case. We all have smudged nails - even the kids. I would go to a beginner beauty school before setting foot here ever again.

5.description: Love love love! It is def my go to place, they always do a great job and the girls there are always very talkative and politeI got a no chip for 35$ , which is what a no chip regularly is. Many colors to choose from for your no chip. Excellent place!

3.description: Best pedi EVER! Daniel took his time and even got that deep ingrown nail out of my big toe! Oh what a relief! Very polite. The no chip mani looks great too! But the pedi I received was the frigging BOMB!  By the way to the lady making a big deal outta no tips on a credit card needs to get with the program! Credit card tips are taxed, not by the owners choice, to the employee who was tipped. Then the credit card processing company charges 3% or more to the merchant (owner) to process that charge. The owner charges that 3% back to the employee. Then the government taxes the owner for that tip in the form of withholding tax. By the time everyone pays the fees and taxes on a credit card tip there's barely a tip left!! NEVER tip anyone on a credit card! CASH ONLY when tipping anywhere is the rule! It's not being sneaky as that lady eluded to, it's small business survival 101!

35.description: I feel like they rushed through my pedicure. Once they saw more people coming in they hurried to finish. I only come here when I'm having a nail emergency , other then that I think there's better places in the city .

19.description: Just moved to the area and have been looking for a regular spot. I found it! They have tons of colors and did a great job with my no chip pedi and mani!

28.description: Came across this place randomly and was VERY impressed! Great space, equipment, services.So many places charge for a pedicure when all you're really getting is a polish change with some foot soaking and half-hearted leg rub.This was real nail care, real pressure point massage, and expertly applied polish!

45.description: The place looks clean, 5 STARS!!But... the manicure I received was absolutely wretched. It's like they completely skipped the buffing step and I am staring at the ridges on my nails as I type. Mind you, I did point out the annoying ridges on my nails and how I'd like to see them disappear!! Oh and I had the pleasure of watching in horror as they poured accetone in my brand new $8 bottle of Essie polish (I always bring my own in case the salon doesn't have a shade I want). Their polish selection was used up, dried out and out of date. You will not find the current line of Essie and OPI polishes here.

33.description: Love this place! The ladies there are super nice and do a great job with my nails! Their pedicures are to die for and super relaxing. Not to mention, they are extremely affordable.

43.description: I have mixed feelings about this place.  In general, I always get in and get done what I need. I wish they'd keep it cleaner and there are a few manicurists that are a little rough around the edges on many accounts. This really convenient and I haven't had any mishaps, so I keep going back.

2.description: I've been going here for years because it's convenient. I always say to myself, "do not ever go back". It's always hit-or-miss as to their service, but pretty consistently they are rude. I went last week because my preferred place, Sunday Nails was closed (Wednesday). I think it was the manager who waxed my eye brows and she did a careless job. I now have one eye brow that looks stubby and weird and the other one just looks bad. I know this is a discount place, but it's not worth it.

18.description: Hey, you get what you pay for-this is a busy place where I have had terrific service and horrible service.  It all depends.  Be prepared to be bossed around and treated like cattle.  But they are fast, efficient, and clean (I hope)  Not my first choice (No Chip Queen is!), but if you need a quickie, they do the job.

41.description: I have been a patron of this nail salon since 2008 and the quality of a mani/pedi has consistently deteriorated.  I actually have to bring my own nail polish because their bottles are old, the nail polish is separated and they never refresh their supply.  I love their waxing services, my brows always look great when I leave.  Sunday Nails opened just down the street, I will be taking my business there...(you should too!)

52.description: Nice place but bit expensive for nails! I asked for airbrush design and I didn't get it although they have on a price board. Five stars to the lady that is doing eyelashes! Great job! I love it!

50.description: Went there for a mani and pedi affordable but they do a horrible job. Went on a Sunday afternoon it was fairly empty but for some reason the lady was in a rush to hurry up and get it over with. I think the pedicure was 10 minutes and the manicure was 10 minutes. It took longer for my nails to dry. Won't ever got back there!

4.description: Went for my 1st time ever pedi. After many races I just  needed one. It was well worth it and I LOVED it!! Went a 2nd time to have the same experience. Couldn't say I did  The lady(different from 1st time) was ok, but became annoying after giggling & speaking her language to someone else then looking at me. Very rude ,I must say. Who knows what they were talking about? My toes? It's their specialty. Though it was my first time, I did keep up with my toes.Anyways, I decided to get a full set of nails too cause the Blackhawks had me at the edge of my seat and... my nails. Ughh! Just thinking about it upsets me again. My Acrylic nails were not cleaned underneath, buffed for a smooth finish, they were polished beforehand & the result of them were not great. Got home & cleaned them up. Noticed they looked scratched (of course, they were filed but not buffed). After 3days I noticed the top part near the cuticle was already coming out, as if needing a "fill in"  I just got these!!! Not going there for a fill in that's for sure. ...new search!

6.description: I came here for the first time since I'm in need of a new nail place. Service was not as great as other places I've been too. I got a pedi and it was fine. Also did a nail color change where they buff and shape your nails which I thought was great since other places don't offer it I just wished once they finished painting my nails that they would clean up any imperfections.

22.description: Just moved to the area and have been looking for a regular spot. I found it! They have tons of colors and did a great job with my no chip pedi and mani!

15.description: Changing my review. In my opinion, the service has drastically changed since Jenny's daughters grew up & started working at the salon. The one that answers the phone is very snotty and lies. She'll tell you the salon closes at 7 even though it's open until 8. If you ask to make an appointment with your favorite technician, she'll tell you the person is booked for the rest of the night...so you reluctantly come in to see a different tech only to find out the one you wanted was NOT booked all night & asks how come you didn't ask for her. This has happened more than a few times so it's not just a coincidence.Lastly, I change up the services I go in for...always a pedicure & no chip manicure but sometimes I need a nail repair, sometimes I don't. Sometimes I'll have my eyebrows & lip waxed, sometimes just my eyebrows. Sometimes French tips, sometimes one color. But no matter what I do, it always ends up costing me the same...even when I've had less work done.After many many years frequenting this salon, I got sick of the bs. Sorry to Tina...wish I could still have you do my nails, but unfortunately I now take my money elsewhere. And I'm paying less and getting beautiful manicures and FRIENDLY HONEST service.

57.description: i was one of those girls.  yknow, THOSE girls that had (reasonably) long nails (real ones, mind you) that delighted in DIY multi-colored, bright, look-at-my-awesome-nails-or-i-will-cut-you nails.  good for confrontations at my all girls high school.good for storing food remnants for an afternoon snack.  (NO, i'm not serious, silly.)ah, but that was high school, and now, i can't even bear to have 1mm of length.  as a result, nail salons are a foreign concept to me.my sister took me out for a pedicure (thanks sister!) after a full day of getting things in order for my niece's first birthday celebration.  even though we accidentally arrived after business hours, we were still able to get our pedicures done.ooh, hot whirlpool action.ahhhhhh, massage chair.OUCH, the tops of my feet are being scrubbed off!  ...now, i have a pretty high threshold for pain, but sheesh.  ...and i couldn't understand why that step was necessary either.as our pedi technicians spoke to each other in a different language, i noticed that my tech began to cry.  ...no break to go to the bathroom or a moment to even wipe her tears away.  for that, i can excuse the two air bubbles that she left in the top coat.  i asked her if she was okay, but she didn't want to talk about it.  ...miss, if you happen to read this, i hope that things have gotten better for you.  : )

20.description: I stopped in today for a mani pedi. I live very close and had high hopes that this place would be great. I was fairly disappointed. The pedicure was pretty standard - nothing horrible, nothing fabulous. My manicure is uneven in a lot of spots. You dry your nails by holding them up to a fan instead of comfortably placing them under the drying lights that most places have. I probably won't be going back.

36.description: I have mix feelings about this place. The lady who does my toes she's amazing. Takes her time and the massage is fantastic. I decided to finally get the NO CHIP service. I have heard so many people have positive reviews about it, so why not? Well, my regular lady got started on with my pedi and was done, but someone else had asked for her. I'm guessing the owner kept rushing her to hurry up. So she asked this guy sitting next to her if he could do the service. He was not gentle at all and didn't even give me a massage or moisturized my hands. He looked so upset. Every time I would ask him a question he either ignore me and would tell me to just relax and not worry about it. (Hello! ) Finally, he was done. I have chubby short fingers, give me a bad French Mani and it will look worse. (That's what I have) Needless to say, I will come back only for my pedi's, but nothing more.

14.description: My first visit here was great. I got my nails done and eyebrows waxed by the young tattooed lady. She was very detail-oriented and even got the little spots on the side of my nails that most nail techs don't bother to do. She was quick and efficient with the eyebrow wax, and made no mistakes. Both my nails and my 'brows looked great!The second time I came back here I got my legs waxed. They seemed to be very busy, but I had set an appointment for 3:00pm. I wasn't seen until about 3:30, and with an older woman with an apron (I have no idea of their names since they don't introduce themselves...). It was very rushed and very painful. She did huge sections at once and didn't even talk to me. I was ushered upstairs where I had to wait for her to guide me where to go. Minutes later, she just walked past me and into the room as I followed, not saying a word. She could've at least been a little friendlier...Overall, I was pleased with the results from both visits. There is just a varying degree of customer service and if you go with certain people you will be pleased with their customer service...others, not so much. They do a good job, they just need to be friendlier. And as for the leg waxing, I probably wouldn't come back here just because she was so brutal about it. But for nails and eyebrow waxing, I'll be back!

1.description: The place you go to when you want to have leftovers the next 2 days The tampiquena is a must .The steak is so good that if you order you will be good with just that it comes with quesadillas & gucamaole . The Torta Cubana looks like something out of the Flintstones and you can split with a friend or 2

0.description: The portions sizes are huge!!!! You should a bring a friend to share a plate and still have leftovers . The price is affordable and food is good. You won't get over the size portions. Only issue is that you have to pay a small price ok to go boxes. Uh that's a first? Maybe bring your own Tupperware lol

12.description: I bought my daughter a snow suit here and it was perfect. For $8! Thanks to the lady working I got the right size. My daughter couldn't have been happier this morning to go sledding wearing her new "suit"! I just called ahead to make sure they had what I was looking for. Very clean and well organized store. Some consignment stores can feel stuffy, this doesn't. Parking is easy too which is great.

3.description: What a cool, unique fun store. The prices were so amazing and the owner was so super nice. Maternity clothes are expensive but I found a great top in dress. She has lots of sizes. What a great find. I will be back soon.

1.description: Have purchased great items here- clothing, toys, and Halloween costumes. I rarely leave empty handed- In the past I consigned here, but - deducting one star because I cannot consign items here anymore.  Now the only person who can accept consignment does not work on the weekends and I am not available to consign during the week (I have a 9-5 job). There is no option to drop things off on the weekend and have them evaluated during the week- not even for people who have consigned before. All of my consignments go to Moxie Jean or Second Child now.Also, another star deducted because there is no changing table or diaper genie - at a children and baby store!- on a recent trip we needed to change our daughter and the bathroom was filthy with no changing table and we were told to take our daughter's diaper outside to throw away. A store focusing on kid stuff should at a minimum have a clean bathroom, a changing table and a place to throw away a diaper.  Seriously, a changing table could be purchased for $70 and a diaper genie for $25.

2.description: This store has some of the worst customer service I have ever seen. I went in for the first time with my toddler and newborn baby six months ago. It was freezing cold outside and the store owner insisted I change my 4 week old baby's diaper in the blizzard cold.  I couldn't really argue with her and went out to struggle changing my poor baby and toddler running around a freezing car. I came back in recently hoping she wouldn't be there or that maybe my memory was wrong. Nope. Same mean woman followed me around the entire store insisting that I was trying to steal her vest from the store because I was trying it on my son.  I finally spoke up and told her she should be careful not to be so rude to customers because our business keeps her employed. She started yelling and snapping at me telling me that my children were awful and that I was "clearly overwhelmed"...um yea you think? I have two small children. Thanks but no thanks, that was my final visit to a kids store that is so not kid friendly. I get along with everyone, this woman has lost it.

9.description: I checked out this strip mall consignment shop when deciding where to take my child's gently worn & well cared for upscale clothing. So glad that I  chose The Second Child over Kangaroo Kids. For the most part, the shop had very low end clothing: Gymboree; Children's Place & Osh Kosh to name a few. The  few J Crew, Hannah & Gap pieces I saw were quite old and looked like had been worn by several children. The maternity section carried Target clothing.  So if you are a consigner like me and are taking in clothing from upscale  children's  boutiques (Little Threads, LMNOP, Red Balloon), J Crew,  Mini Boden, The Gap, along with Nordstrom & Bloomies, or if you're a shopper who wants to buy these lines, Kangaroo Kids is NOT the place to go. Some items also had "as is" tags & the clothing was ripped.

10.description: Never know about this place until I walked by to go get a wax. Found paige denim maternity jeans for $48!! Found some other cute little baby things (haven't even had the little guy yet) and a dvd of happiest baby on the block which I've heard is good. Will be back once I'm officially a mom!

4.description: Great place to get overpriced, stained kids clothes with rude salespeople!!!I gave it two stars because I've found a few things there in the past. But now they accept very non-upscale items, yet still charge way too much. Oh, and lest we forget the stains! I think I'd rather my kids stain their own new clothes from Target than pay more for pre-stained, pilly clothes from Kangaroo Kids. Last time I patronize this spot!

6.description: I got a skip hop playmat here for a good deal but I have to say, every time I've been in, nobody has greeted me. It's really strange. But they have good stuff and prices are pretty good.

15.description: Things to love about Kangaroo Kids...unbelievably organized, room to move around the store, easy parking, good prices and a nice selection.  Why only four stars?  Although I always leave with a few items, I never walk away with a haul.  Still, it's a go-to place for good quality, great prices, and friendly service.

0.description: This is the best children's & maternity consignment store in Chicago.  I especially like the kids brands they carry (I've bought stuff from Gap, Tea, Hanna Andersson, Mini Boden, Patagonia).  Maternity: Because there's less of it and it rotates based on what people bring in to sell, the maternity selection is more hit & miss with sizes and offerings, but it's still the best place I've found in the city (a low bar for secondhand maternity options).The competition: I used to shop here and The Second Child in Lincoln Park, but I've stopped going to The Second Child because there's much more stock to chose from at Kangaroo Kids, the prices are more reasonable for buying, there's free parking, and it's stroller accessible.   Downsides: As others have noted (some with praise and some with anger), the owner has a strong personality and interacts with the customers a lot, but if you want cute reasonably priced kids or maternity clothes, it's worth it.

5.description: Great selection, prices, and a really nice caring staff.

13.description: I just love love love this place!  I stop in once a month and never leave without some great barely used clothing items for my toddler.  The store is well organized and never crowded. The lady working today was super friendly. The store also runs great discounts on top of their already low prices.  I'm thankful there are places like this around for kids clothing and toys.

11.description: This is not your average consignment store for multiple reasons:1. It is strictly upscale brands- you only see brands like mini boden, jack and jill, baby lulu, baby nay- no carters or things from walmart. I think the owner only takes gap or better2. It is clean! All the toys and clothes are super clean3. It is not over crowded- all the consignment stores I've shopped in are so overcrowded it is just not enjoyable to shop4. The owner is friendly, talkative and almost always there 5. The stock does not get old- the owner only allows it to be on the shelves for a certain amount of time so you see new things everytime you go not the same things sitting around forever (like at second child) I have stopped in kangaroo kids on a consistent basis for the past year and a half and have never left empty handed. It is a consignment store so it is hit or miss but I always find something. I have found awesome toys and gorgeous outfits for my daughter for so cheap! They also have books, random other baby necessities, maternity clothes and kids clothes up to I think size 14. I cannot say enough great things for this place- my daughter is dressed very fashionable mostly because of this place. I have never consigned there so I can't speak to that aspect of the store. Check it out you will be impressed- if you aren't the first time don't give up check back because its different everytime I go.

8.description: I went in today to look for some maternity clothes! I hit the jackpot!!!!! They have a small selection but good quality stuff. I will be coming back to see what other goodies I can find. They also have a parking lot which is so nice!

14.description: I don't trust this place! They claim they sold a barely used $100 dollar baby bag for $1. The owner is not very friendly and perhaps shopping there is good, especially if they are selling designer items for a dollar. But do not consign! I've switched to The Second Child on Armitage.

7.description: Have bought Mini-Boden rain boots and coats, Gap Jeans, North Face, Hanna Andersson, Gymboree, tights, sleep sacks, dress shoes, Bogs, and haloween costumes, all in great condition and much cheaper than I would have paid retail.  Great business.  Also have a good selection of maternity clothes. Parking lot is nice too.

56.description: I drive past this place all of the time so when a friend of mine that lives in the area suggested it, I couldn't pass up the opportunity to try it. There aren't many restaurants in Portage Park so I was excited to try something new. When you walk in, there is this huge bar. It might be a little to big for the space. Don't get me wrong a bar is always a good sign. The service was very good but the place wasn't very busy when we were there at 8pm on a Friday.There are all sorts of meat on the menu, after all it is a Char house. it was hard to choose a cut. I loved the prime rib kabob I ordered. It was tender, well seasoned and perfectly medium rare. The Verandatini I had was very nice as were the Pomegranate martinis at my table. My local friend ordered the steak and shrimp. The shrimp tasted a little fishy to her. The table split the peach Melba. The dessert list was a little lackluster. I'd go back if I were determined to stay in a fabulous parking spot but I wouldn't go out of my way to go. It's definitely not Gibson's but they had a table for us at 8 pm on a Friday. Have a couple of drinks and a steak!

29.description: Food was delicious. Service was friendly and attentive. Lamb chops hit the spot and so did the saganaki. I think that's how u spell it. Sat upstairs on the rooftop very pleased with the whole overall experience. Planning on going back soon.

42.description: After four years of passing the Veranda Inn Restaurant almost everyday, we decided try it. We had a chance to meet the owner and his daughter who was visiting from Greece. The food and the atmosphere was excellent.Items we tried:* Grilled Octopus Cold served with olive oil, vinegar and chef's garnish* Saganaki Flaming cheese* Fried Zucchini Lightly breaded and fried* Spicy Mediterranean Shrimp* Broiled Prime Rib Eye SteakEach of the above items would come highly recommended by us. So, if your in the neighborhood stop it is worth stopping.Hours: Mon-Fri: 11am-2am Sat: 11am-3am Sun: 12pm-2amServes: Lunch, Dinner

23.description: One of the few terraced restaurant options in Chicago. This little gem features a beautiful rooftop terrace with comfortable plush couches and green vegetation for a bit of that "Dinner in the garden" feel. Its great for get together's with groups of friends, with a healthy menu that offers delicious mediterranean cuisine and Greek beverages. I personally would not recommend the Greek beers - although the wines are excellent. The appetizers are delicious. I'm giving it five stars for the wonderful customer service that I've always received every time I came here, the waitresses have always been courteous, friendly and attentive. Its a beautiful place, and a great summer/spring/fall option.

47.description: Average greek food in a clean establishment.

8.description: Beautiful roof top garden and restaurant. Nice late night food menu. Great service and nice mixed drinks. I really feel like I left the northwestern side of Chicago and went somewhere special.

31.description: I really like going to this place. Food and drinks are really good, prices are also good. Strongly recommended!

34.description: The drink specials are great. I had a five dollar martini tonight. Also, they have a really nice outdoor roof deck. My chicken wrap was delish...its not fancy food by any means, but a good lil' night out. Plus they were attentive:)

16.description: One of the few terraced restaurant options in Chicago. This little gem features a beautiful rooftop terrace with comfortable plush couches and green vegetation for a bit of that "Dinner in the garden" feel. Its great for get together's with groups of friends, with a healthy menu that offers delicious mediterranean cuisine and Greek beverages. I personally would not recommend the Greek beers - although the wines are excellent. The appetizers are delicious. I'm giving it five stars for the wonderful customer service that I've always received every time I came here, the waitresses have always been courteous, friendly and attentive. Its a beautiful place, and a great summer/spring/fall option.

13.description: We have lived in the area and driven past Veranda countless times, but hadn't tried it until now. Of course, we had to eat on the roof top and weren't disappointed by the atmosphere and decor. The service was good and I liked that they had a Greek beer, but my entree was really lacking. The saganaki was really good and so were the Greek fries appetizer, but the lamb chops not only lacked flavor, but looked bizarre. Each chop was a different size and the portions really varied.  I'll assume the bad lamb chops were an isolated issue, and come back to try something else on the menu.

11.description: This is a charming, little Greek restaurant with lots of potential.  I came in with a party of 5 at 2pm and we caught the swing shift.  This means that there was only one waitress so service was slightly slow.  Also we were disappointed that the rooftop patio was not open, but with one waitress, what can you do.  Even with the rooftop bar closed, the windows open up to give the seating by the windows a very alfresca feeling.  The drinks there are reasonably priced, and the mojito's were excellent.  They were served in a mason jar and had a nice flavor, not too sweet, and not weak either.  I then had a chicken cheese steak wrap which was very tasty.  I also sampled some of the shrimp from another dish and they were also very good.  The Kabob looked excellent, it was make up of very large cuts of meats and veggies, they pre took the skewer out for you as well.

39.description: I have never been here and not had a wonderful meal! The steaks are huge and very reasonably priced and not once, not once have I been there and not had a free dessert! They are welcoming and very attentive and the patio is the best in the city. This place is a hidden gem! One of the best places in the city but very "neighborhood". If you don't like "neighborfood" then don't bother. The more for me! The first time I went there, the owner gave me a plant clipping straight off of a plant on the patio! How awesome is that! And then when we left, they told us to go out back through the kitchen so we would not get wet. I love love love this place!

37.description: Crappy service, food wrong. I wanted to go to this restaurant because we like greek food, it looks great on the outside, and has a rooftop seating area. So we went, but were told no rooftop seating because of a private party. Oh well, sat inside, then were promptly ignored by the wait staff for 15 minutes - no menu, water, etc. Ordered eventually - ordered flaming saganaki - they flamed it by the wrong table, brought to us 2 minutes later! No silverware (had to ask), no salads that were supposed to come with the meal, no soft drink refills for me (woman) but yes for my husband... Food was average, took ages to come, cold. Not only will I not go back, but I will badmouth this place to anyone who asks. They made an evening out an exercise in rage.

0.description: Cozy, friendly environment, good food.  First time here on eve of new year since most restaurants have reservations, hubby and I went to La Pena first but we were turned down only accepts with reservations anyways we drove around our hood portage/Jefferson area and decided to check out Veranda.  We were both glad we ended up here not only no reservations needed but the hostess was very nice and friendly.  Got seated right away the server came right away took out order and our food came out pretty fast.  The server was very attentive and made sure we got everything we needed.  Great service! And the food wow me and my hubby enjoyed it!  I had the bbq ribs and he had lamb chops.  The grilled octopus appetizer it was really really good - cooked to perfection!!! Will definitely coming back soon to try the other food in the menu :)

38.description: The food is mediocre, service incredibly slow and pricing is off considering the menu and location. The upstairs patio is beautiful and has a comfortable layout although it was spoiled by other patrons smoking cigars (pretty sure that violates the CIAA 2005).

51.description: Cupcakes. That's right. Cupcakes.  I came to Veranda for the cupcakes.Confused? Don't be!Veranda was the host of the first Iron:Cupcake Chicago challenge, and if you know me; well, you know why I was there!Let's talk about how great this place is!  A little further west than what I normally travel, however parking is a breeze with both a small lot for customers and plenty of non-zoned street parking.  It's quite spacious inside (and apparently they have rooftop dining, which I missed) and the staff is incredibly gracious.While waiting around for the judges to eat their cupcakes I sat at the bar and had one of their specialty martinis - the Black Martini. Oh my. So good.  Very very cherry.  Not too sweet, not too strong. Ugh. Now I want one.  I also ordered gyros because as weird as it sounds, I don't really eat cake and I was so hungry.  It came with soup of the day which was okay, but the plate itself was stacked high with the meat.  I like my meat.  Only downside? Not enough pita or tzatziki.My plan is to go back again and again. My next trip? July 6th.  Around 6pm. So if you're in the area, stop in; eat some Greek and chow on some cupcakes.  The whole thing is kinda awesome.

27.description: The service here is terrible. The waitress took forever to take our order and she kept forgetting to bring us our drinks. We probably waited over an hour before our food came and she had the order wrong. We had to wait another ten minutes for her to bring silverware for my husband. I would be more understanding and wouldn't have written a bad review if the place had been busy but it was really quiet when we were there. I couldn't really understand the bad service. The menu looked pretty good but the food was just okay. It wasn't really seasoned at all and didn't have much of a taste. The bar looks like it might be nice though....

32.description: After sooo many years of passing by this place I finally had it and what's funny is I thought it was Italian and to my surprise it was GREEK! lol Well I came here the other night with a very dear friend of mine as she treated me for my Birthday and we sat upstairs in the patio the weather was perfect for it too!! Came around 830ish and it was a bit slow but none the less the place is beautifully set up!!. For our appetizers we orderded  Saganacki and it was Pretty good a lil on the burnt side but it was actually really good and I enjoyed it and so did she as we both finished it! lol They had some kind of martini specials going so of course we had to have one or 3 lol The Watermelon Martini is tooooo DIEEEE for!! once you finish it the pieces of watermelon are still in the glass and boy do those suckers soak up all the liquor pure bliss I tell you!! Now for our main dish I ordered a Greek Chicken breast Plate that had 3 large pieces of chicken, rice, a roasted potatoe and some veggies. I wasn't completely WOW'd but it was pretty good the rice needed to be cooked a lil longer and the Chicken was a little dry but still had some good flavor to it. And I think the potatoe was by far my favorite and that's only me being biased cuz I love POTATOES!!! lol...My friend had a vegeterian pasta with shrimp and boy those shrimp were nice and big and she seemed to love every bit of it!! Our waitress was extremely friendly and was also being shadowed by a girl who was training who was also really nice.  The General manager constantly floated around to ensure everything was good.  So overall for my first time here I really enjoyed myself food was great and drinks and ambiance are wonderful!

54.description: My friend's been talking about this place.  He likes this restaurant mainly because they're open late and it's never crowded (that's probably a bad thing for the restaurant).  I finally went and had the best burger I've had in a long time (that, or I was just really hungry).  I recommend the Signature burger and the pineapple yacht w/ ice cream and chunks of pineapple.  This restaurant is a little out of the way from the Chicago nightlife, but residents in the area can enjoy the great food and live music.

48.description: Very nice friendly service...Good Gyros....Very Classy looking & clean.... not too crowded..the bartender was nice

44.description: On an average, non-crowded night, we watched, from our rooftop table, as other tables got served around us. Wait for food: 1 hour, 35 minutes. Waitress forgot silverware and took an inordinate amount of time to get around to us as other tables came and went. Food is good and locale is great but Holy Moses, folks. We were there for a birthday, so it wasn't in the best interest to blow up; the woman who was managing walked around asking how things were, well good for everybody else.Got a1 out of 4 drinks wrong. Waited over 45 minutes for bread and to order. Had to flag waitress down for silverware and plates for the bread. Wasn't offered the special (waiter at another table offered it to HIS diners who were promptly served... three tables around ours. I was asked "You didn't want a salad or anything, right?" but wasn't asked that when I ordered, so if it came with it, who knows. The elements that ARE right are the decor, parking, and food is good. Careful on the rooftop dining: wind was too strong for comfort. Great location, canned Greek music. All of the elements of success are there and I'm told, if we'd have dined inside downstairs it would have been faster.

24.description: Last Saturday we celebrate my husband's birthday at Veranda...the best party ever: exceptional fresh food: fried calamari, dolmades, stuffed chicken, beets with garlic sauce, Atlantic salmon, pork kebab, etc.; right away service ( they had another party going downstairs, but we didn't evem feel that, because everything was so organized and on time). We feel like the party was organized by our family: super nice and friendly atmosphere. We had our own party room, own music...we dance and had a lot of fun..all our guest are super contented and promise that they gonna celebrate their Bdays with you guys. The speciality of the night was the roasted pork..never in my life we eat such a good cooked pork..it was melting in the mouth...thank you very much for all that..now all our weekend are reserved for a meal at Veranda...Efharisto guy and i'll see you very soon

7.description: My bud and I had dinner at Veranda Inn last Friday.  I have a feeling he has passed this place many a time, and was drawn by the possibility of al fresco dining on their rooftop garden.  I've never heard of this place anywhere other than having heard about it from my friend, but what the heck I went along with it.  Veranda Inn has a small parking lot behind the restaurant, though my bud chose not to park there but on the adjacent side street.  We walked into the main dining room and it looked pretty quiet, so we decided to climb the long stairway to the rooftop garden which was reasonably busy though not full.  It was a perfect summer evening, not too hot or cool, not rainy nor buggy.  The garden atmosphere of the rooftop was very pleasant and took your mind away from the traffic zooming down Irving Park Road.  We have dined on rooftop patios in Athens in the past, so we remarked that all this place needs is a view of the Acropolis. I opened the menu and was underwhelmed at the listing of diner style specialties.  However since I thought this was a Greek establishment, I was looking for Greek specialties.  Indeed many of the Greek dishes were not on the regular menu other than the flaming saganaki ordered by folks at an adjacent table - OPAA!  Our cheery and charming server read to us the day's Greek specialties (some were also posted on a chalkboard), and described them when she was unable to pronounce the long Greek names of the dishes.  The beer list was actually a cutesy handwritten list, and I went Greek and ordered a Mythos.  The slices of bread were decent with some olive oil.  We each ordered the soutzoukakia (Greek meatballs) as the main course.  The dish came with either spaghetti or rice, a side of veggies, and soup of the day.  I went with the egg lemon soup, which was thicker and chunkier than any version I have ever had, and my bud's navy bean had a stew-like quality to it as well.  The meatballs and rice in tomato sauce were fine with a small cup of parmesan cheese.  The Greek potato wedges added to the heartiness of my dish, while my bud went with baked potato.  Probably the highlight was the Greek dessert specials, as we again passed on the "regular" dessert menu selections such as cheesecake.  Although I imagine the baklava was good, my ekmek and my bud's galaktoboureko were both lavishly rich dessert choices.  Both were large servings with generous amounts of whipped cream and drizzled with caramel sauce.  I have had galaktoboureko before (sort of a custard pie with phyllo dough), but I have never heard of ekmek.  This was an impressive pile with a bed of sweet and stringy kataifi dough (I think that is what this stuff is) topped by custard and then whipped cream.  What a delicious way to end a very satisfying meal atop the Veranda Inn.  The final tab was very reasonable as well considering all that we ate.  I'd say "go Greek" with your menu choices and you should do well here.

49.description: BLAH, not horrible, not really good.  Went here for lunch today.  I must preface this by saying that I am of greek desent so I have had all kinds of greek food, homemade and out at almost any local restaurant.  The food here was just, well, bland.  The egg lemon soup was not lemony.  The spanakopita was just ok.  My friends souvlaki was SO small.  I have not seen shish kabob this small at a restaurant.  I probably would only go back to have some drinks and appetizers on their outdoor veranda.

40.description: I went there for party and the upstairs room in divided with an inside/outside area. There is the bar on the inside with refrigerators and an outside patio area that was really nice to enjoy in the summer time. I have not eaten in the downstairs main part of the restaurant yet but from what  I saw it's the typical Greek decorations.

53.description: I've been here once , within the first six months of their opening. From the outside , it looks like a really nice what I thought to be Italian restaurant. The restaurant was more of a Greek diner , a little of everything from steaks to fish and chicken , along with a few pastas. I barely rember what we ordered , all I really remember is that nobody liked this place. I thought it was ok , nothing was spit your food out aweful , but nobody felt really good about their meal. I know we got baked clams , which was a special of the day , they were ok. My mother got some sort of pasta with a pale tomato sauce , she wasn't a fan , and I gave one bites worth of a try before I knew I wasn't a fan. My wife got some sort of a pasta dish with chicken , she barely ate it , I declined a taste. My son ordered a steak , I'm not sure which cut , he liked it just fine , I hade to agree it was ok. I know I got a fish dish , which kind I don't remember , but I ate it all and liked it just fine. I wish I had more details but the visit was in my pre yelping days. All I really know is I probably wouldn't go back here, although if somebody really wanted to go here , I wouldn't have too much to protest about.

30.description: My boyfriend and I LOVE this place. We've been here many times.Their drink specials are awesome, and their food is good, too! They have a nice rooftop to sit outside on a beautiful day!! My boyfriend, and I came once and it was packed on the rooftop, and the owner asked my boyfriend to help him set us a table and then he treated us with lemon drop shots, which we were pretty happy about. Overall, price is reasonable, food is good- it's def our go-to place!!! We recommended this place to all of our friends!

46.description: Place was recommended by a co-worker of mine.  After going there for a Friday night dinner, I am never going to trust that co-worker ever again.  The waitress was inattentive, even though there were only 3 tables with people at them in the entire place.  Waitress walked away before we were finished placing our order.  Waitress also could not get the saganaki to light on fire, and the saganaki was average tasting at best.  Me and my friend ordered Mediterranian Chicken and Talapia, both of which tasted ok. Outdoor area is small, but has a huge mosquito problem.  When we requested the check at the end of the meal, waitress took 25 minutes to come back.  I would not recommend this place to ANYONE.

1.description: The Veranda seems to have a lot going for it at first. The restaurant has great decor and the rooftop is beautiful. Unfortunately, the food is just decent, and the service is not good. I've been here twice hoping the service the first time was not typical. Both times we arrived there was no one in the restaurant, including staff members. The first time, we needed to seek out someone just to sit down. Our first visit was over two hours. The waitress was very apologetic, saying they were short staffed. The second visit was improved, but as soon as other people came in to eat, we had to wait 15 minutes each time we asked the waitress for something (a drink to arrive, ordering food, boxes/check). The food was decent. I had the chicken kabobs, and the chicken and vegetables were good, the rice was oily. The other people I was with got tilapia and the stuffed chicken, and they both enjoyed the food. We also went once just to get a drink on the rooftop, and although the service was also not great, it was much faster and the drink prices are very reasonable. I would only go in the future to grab a drink on the rooftop. If the Veranda improved their service it would be a much better restaurant.

55.description: This place is never really busy, which is one of it's more charming characteristics. The owners have put a lot of effort to create a really pleasant atmosphere, and it shows. Unfortunately the menu doesn't meet the same level of quality. There aren't too many different options as dinners go, so if you don't like meat this might not be an ideal spot. That being said, everything I've had here has been slightly above average. It just hasn't been good enough to justify it's price. There isn't much in the way of deserts and drinks are kind of pricey, but they make a damn good cup of coffee. I'd go back, but I'm in no hurry.

9.description: I always wanted to try this place because I pass it all the time. So finally less then a month ago I went with my friend. I must say I absolutely love their patio but I wasn't too impressed with their service. Our server was really nice but there were constant mess ups the entire night which I don't think was completely her fault, it was also the kitchens fault. I ordered a chicken wrap sandwich and I asked if i could get it with no tomatoes, add cheese and avocado. I also ordered saganaki.  Well first off our drinks took so long to come to our table, our server didn't even routinely check to see if we needed refills. My friend and I ordered saganaki, it never arrived, when our entrees came out we were wondering what happened to our appetizer (which was meant to eat prior to our meal to hold us off) our server completely forgot, said she put it in with the kitchen and blamed them....even though I do think its her responsibility to make sure we get what we ordered since we were her table and she did take the order. Next our entree took about 40 minutes to arrive, mind you we ordered a wrap and my other friend ordered the chicken Philly sandwich. All the things i asked for on my sandwich (add cheese and avocado, and no tomato) which prior she said she would have to ask the kitchen if it were possible (i don't know why she would need permission...considering its only a slight adjustment to the wrap), she then told me the kitchen would do it for me. After waiting 40 minutes for a wrap, it still had tomatoes, there was no avocado and there was no cheese. Our server then blamed the kitchen again and went to go get me a side of avocados. Our server was apologetic but she really didn't double check on us, she didn't notice when things were not right with our order, or when things were taking way to long to arrive, she was a very nice lady but her server abilities were really not up to par. This place has decent food but the price is really not worth it, its a bit overpriced for the lack of service you receive.

26.description: I have had dinner a few times at the Veranda Inn in the last few months. By the name or the look outside, you have no idea this is a Greek restaurant. The place is almost always empty. The waitresses are kind and prompt, but they should dress more professionally when they greet the public. I had a chicken dinner and it was somewhat dry. I imagine it came from the freezer which is why. The breaded chicken pieces were all uniform indicating they were made by a machine. However, I have had different chicken and steak dinners and they were pretty good. They are a nice group of people, but they need to put some zap into that place and get a crowd. Perhaps a Greek theme, a new name like Veranda Greek Island or something. Perhaps they can convert to a Greek sports bar and restaurant. But the place is dead.

25.description: I live in the neighborhood and love to support businesses around here but although the place is nice and people are nice.  The food is not good at all.   Overpriced and nothing to write good about.  Used to be Greek and now trying to cater to more an American fare it needs a lot of work.  It's too bad but I can't say anything good about their food

12.description: My husband and I have passed this place a few times already and we decided to come here for our belated Valentine's Day dinner. We went on a Monday (our schedules are very different) and I was surprised by the interior and the customer service. It's a Greek restaurant, it's bigger on the inside (Dr. Who joke!), with beautiful paintings of Greece on the walls. There is plenty of parking (it's not a busy area but they do have street parking and also a lot in the back). I ordered a gyro plate, my husband ordered the mediterranean plate, with a glass of Greek white wine for myself and a cuba libre for my husband. The wine was not to sweet; it had a slight mint aftertaste (which was lovely!) and my husband's cuba libre didn't have Coke; instead, they used a soda water which made it less sweet, which was a nice touch to it (so it wasn't overwhelming). Both the entrees were delicious - fresh and tasty. They were pretty big portions too; we brought home leftovers. The ambience was quiet; there was only one other patron there, and the tv was on the news/sports, but it wasn't too terribly loud. It's nice for a date night. They also have a rooftop, and it's probably busier in the summers. The only drawback was that their credit card machine wasn't working but they don't have an ATM, which didn't make sense because they should have told us before we sat down. Regardless, they ended up being able to run the card afterward. Just be weary of that! Otherwise, overall, the customer service, food, the pricing was reasonable, and ambience was quiet but not so quiet where it was awkward. We're definitely coming back!

21.description: Can't even rate the food because we left.  It's an 80 degree day and they have a rooftop patio that doesn't open until 5pm.  Ridiculous.....

17.description: Bad news,food so so.Service very bad.place is very dirty especially the bathroom.Over priced and a very small menu.The on line menu is not correct.$ 8.00 cocktails ,Did not have many greek dishes more like taco bowls and wrap.No gyro on the menu.No wine list.Menu said flaming cheese ,we received melted bitter cheese that was obviously put in the broiler,so why do thy put opa on the menu?

10.description: They have big drinks

5.description: nice comfy atmosphere,  great ambience.Great food n cold beers.Please try for yourself,  then judge.

3.description: Great rooftop joint in the area. Feel like you're somewhere else and not in the city. Drinks are also good up there. Try the Mojitos which are tasty and freshly made. Service is also good...friendly and attentive. Food however was hit or miss. Pita bread, pork and chicken on a skewer, Greek fries with feta where a huge hit. We should of just ordered that. Then we had the lovers plate with steak, chicken, and veggies. Just ok and meat was honestly too dry. Really wanted to love it. But we also had the Greek salad and that was better. They have a ton of drink options and fun space to hang for a while. If it's nice outside, I'm racing over here.

35.description: love the souvlakia here and the octopus...these are the only thing im ordering in these place and are always great and better than any other greek or not restaurant in the chicago land area

19.description: The service here is terrible. The waitress took forever to take our order and she kept forgetting to bring us our drinks. We probably waited over an hour before our food came and she had the order wrong. We had to wait another ten minutes for her to bring silverware for my husband. I would be more understanding and wouldn't have written a bad review if the place had been busy but it was really quiet when we were there. I couldn't really understand the bad service. The menu looked pretty good but the food was just okay. It wasn't really seasoned at all and didn't have much of a taste. The bar looks like it might be nice though....

28.description: The upstairs deck is great. Except the waitress forgot we ordered and there was a wedding going on. We never got our drinks or food.... They should have closed the upstairs!

45.description: OMG, Awful. This one falls into the don't walk, run away as fast as you can category.4 of us went there today. Ordered a salad, the taziki, feta cheese plate and a salad. The salad came out first 35 minutes later. It was the wrong salad, which was interesting because when I saw the check the waitress wrote down the wrong salad even though she point out the correct salad on the menu twice. The taziki tasted off and the pita was cold. Food was bad, service was worse. The 2 wait staff were arguing. Oh by the way, the place was virtually empty but I guess there is a reason for that.

33.description: Just as many previous customers I found myself driving past this location as a local.Decided to give it a try.Went there on my own to check it out first, chatted with Chef Angelo for a bit then made a reservation.Invited our bf's to join my wife and I for a very pleasant dinner.Food was great and fresh as they do promote local vendors.Mojotos were great......get em by the pitcher.Dined on the rooftop.....a bit chilly but still great.

43.description: I went here during the week with a friend.  We sat at the bar.  She had the gyros plate which was delicious and I had the Athenian pork chops which were good but not great.  I probably should have gone for the bbq.  Our bartender/server was great.  After dinner, we went upstairs to the Veranda.  This veranda is breathtaking...rose bushes, lemon and apple trees, basil plants....We saw it at night so their were also little lights strewn across the ivy.  It would definitely fun to throw an event there.

2.description: The atmosphere was decent was happy to see a rooftop restaurant in my neighborhood. Unfortunately that's the only thing this place has going for it. My husband ordered the gyro wrap special, being at a Greek restaurant we had high expectations. The gyro meat totally tasted frozen. I got the tricolor pasta with tomato basil sauce and chicken for $13. And a $2 pork kabob. The pasta sauce had to come from a jar. The chicken was okay. My pork kabob didn't come out with the rest of my food and when I flagged my server down to inform him he told me it's on it's way and pork takes 25-30 minutes to cook. When it finally came out it was burnt and way to chewy to swallow I spit it in my napkin. Save your time and your money.

18.description: After sooo many years of passing by this place I finally had it and what's funny is I thought it was Italian and to my surprise it was GREEK! lol Well I came here the other night with a very dear friend of mine as she treated me for my Birthday and we sat upstairs in the patio the weather was perfect for it too!! Came around 830ish and it was a bit slow but none the less the place is beautifully set up!!. For our appetizers we orderded  Saganacki and it was Pretty good a lil on the burnt side but it was actually really good and I enjoyed it and so did she as we both finished it! lol They had some kind of martini specials going so of course we had to have one or 3 lol The Watermelon Martini is tooooo DIEEEE for!! once you finish it the pieces of watermelon are still in the glass and boy do those suckers soak up all the liquor pure bliss I tell you!! Now for our main dish I ordered a Greek Chicken breast Plate that had 3 large pieces of chicken, rice, a roasted potatoe and some veggies. I wasn't completely WOW'd but it was pretty good the rice needed to be cooked a lil longer and the Chicken was a little dry but still had some good flavor to it. And I think the potatoe was by far my favorite and that's only me being biased cuz I love POTATOES!!! lol...My friend had a vegeterian pasta with shrimp and boy those shrimp were nice and big and she seemed to love every bit of it!!
