Our waitress was extremely friendly and was also being shadowed by a girl who was training who was also really nice.  The General manager constantly floated around to ensure everything was good.  So overall for my first time here I really enjoyed myself food was great and drinks and ambiance are wonderful!

41.description: ab fab...can't wait to go back.  my friend and i went on a monday night. the place was dead, except for about a dozen officers of the law enjoying what was probably a highly discounted meal.  but with the price of a meal at this place, who needs a discount? i don't think i saw anything over $20.  i ordered a chicken kabob. wow. cooked to perfection on the most delicious bed of buttery rice i've ever had, with a little potato on the side and some broccoli and carrots i didn't touch (only because i'm not a fan of cooked veggies...but they were steamed nicely). dinner included a salad with yummy dressing and some soft, fresh bread. oh, and $2 miller lites? HOLLA! it's a pretty big space, and it was a shame it was so empty. my friend ordered the gyro and loved it. the tzatziki sauce was extra garlic-y, the way it should be. service was friendly and fast enough. strange that had polish newspaper spread out on the table by the front door...not something i expected in a greek joint but hey...they cater to the neighborhood?  lots of options on the menu...if you're in the 'hood, give it a try!

52.description: Probably one of the nicer restaurants in Portage Park.  The inside looks great and the staff and service is top notch.  The food is consistently good, but the prices are a little over the top, especially in this neighborhood.  And although the ribs may not be as good as at Gale St. Inn, they are still excellent and you never have to wait for seating on a Friday or Saturday night.

50.description: This is just an ordinarily nice place.  It's not spectacularly good or spectacularly bad, and it strikes me as one of those very reliable neighborhood places where you go when you don't want to schlep all over the city looking for a decent meal.  The staff is very friendly, and the place wasn't crowded, so we got a table right away.None of the food was exceptional, but it was good.  The tamarosalata (on the house) was very good.  Saganaki was crisp and tasty.  Egg-lemon soup wasn't lemony enough but it was still good.  I was a little disappointed on two counts, though.  First, the codfish with skordalia that I ordered wasn't available, and then when I ordered pastitsio, mine was the only entree that didn't come with veggies.  I have no idea why.  I did end up eating a friend's broccoli and some of her carrots because she isn't real big on vegetables, but the broccoli was kind of over done (Though it was a lovely, bright green, which I didn't think was possible at that stage of cooked-ness.)  Carrots were properly cooked, though.The bread was good, not great, ditto the chicken and pork chops.  Dessert was baklava, and I'm pleased to note that it was a big piece (I just now finished it up while writing this review.) and not over sweet.The waitress was helpful and friendly, the portions were generous, the service very good, but not pushy or intrusive.  It is just a nice, basic place, and I plan to go back.  I don't expect to get anything outstanding, but I do expect consistency, and that's not at all a bad thing to expect from a restaurant.  Not a destination restaurant (except for the cupcake competition, I guess) but if you're in the 'hood, you might want to check it out.

4.description: For a wedding reception (my only time here), I was a little upset. Service was not great. For the entire cocktail hour, no water was placed on the tables. Water, in fact did not come until dinner was served...maybe an hour and 30 into the reception. I was really confused by this. Then, the staff did not care to help the wedding party move the wedding cakes or cupcakes. The food was ok. No real taste to anything other than the roast beef. Standard catering overall. It was good space if you are looking to have a small reception here. I would recommend a food tasting of the catering serving.

6.description: The reviews were so mixed I had to find out for myself. Well I wasted 2 hours and $40. 1. The service was incredibly slow. -appetizer came at the same time as my sisters food. -My food came about 10 minutes later. -put down food that wasn't ours. We told her and she picked it up and took it to the correct table. -waited for ketchup for about 10 minutes. 2. Food sucked- sisters fries were cold. Mine were well cooked. -asked for my burger well and it was so pink. -gave us a cup of ice and warm soda so that was nice and flat. There was also a lady smoking. It's outside but don't think it should be allowed. It kept blowing right at me. Thankfully the food took so long she was gone by the time I ate. The only way I'd recommend this place is if you have plenty of time to waste and aren't hungry. We didn't try any alcoholic beverages so can't comment on how those are. The most annoying thing is that roof is awesome but there is nothing else to match. Went on 7/23/15

22.description: Its my birthday and my cousin and I decided to eat out close to home. We came to Veranda.  Angelo was our waiter. He was amazing. We got great food and history on Greece. The food was delicious and was a great way to end my birthday! :-)

15.description: The place was almost empty when I went there. The lamb chops were pretty average and actually lacked in flavor! More effort needs to be made with the preparation of lamb and its seasoning.

20.description: Came here on a whim for date night with my wife, the place is really nice, big and clean ans the rooftop patio is beautiful.  That's about all I have good to say, I'm not a picky person, but the menu didn't have much that interested me, a bunch of burgers/wraps and haphazard mixture of entrees.  The server was nice, but lacked much server sense, she didn't really know what beers they had and didn't take my order, when she brought out my wife's food neither of us were sure I had actually ordered, we just decided to share her food and get out.  We had the chicken philly wrap with fries, fries were good the wrap was ok but I wouldn't reorder. I think I'd only go here again for drinks on the rooftop.

36.description: I regularly go to this comfortable and quaint restaurant with one to three people for a late lunch or for dinner. They have a friendly, attentive staff. I enjoy their flaming fresh saganaki (which they prepare "well done" per my request). We usually order their delicious steaks, pork chops and/or lamb chops (Greek style, never tried their Cajun style). I've mostly been in the main dining room area. I have been to the rooftop terrace but be aware that there are many stairs to climb and there's no elevators. I've never been to the small outside spots. There is a small parking lot but you can park in the neighboring streets.

14.description: The patio on this place is great-- only downside is that it isn't open earlier in the day. When the weather is this great, people want to get out and enjoy the sunshine with their meals, not sit in a stuffy restaurant when there is a beautiful patio waiting.Food was decent . Nothing spectacular. Just basic home-cooked food.Service was a little slow, given how few people were there, but it's a home style neighborhood joint, so impeccable service is not to be expected.Willing to give it another chance simply to enjoy the patio.

3.description: I would've given a better rating because the chicken is good, however ordered through Grub Hub the delivery driver refused to climb the stairs to my apartment. Gave a lame excuse that he can't climb stairs after the fact the tip was prepaid. So I had to go down and get my food. Don't order delivery they suck!Go and pick it up, biscuits are good, red beans and rice not as good as Popeyes...

1.description: Will never order from this establishment again.  Ordered on a friday night and although I give people a little leeway when it comes to delivery times on peak times , this was ridiculous.  Waited 2 hours then called and was told they are one delivery person short and it should arrive any minute. half hour goes by and still no food and called back again to cancel my order. no attempt by the person on the phone to make things right except giving a tongue in cheek apology.  I have picked up from here before and the food was decent so I can't gripe on that but its definitely not worth waiting half your day for.  very displeased.

2.description: Surprisingly good! This was a quick takeout choice to satisfy my need for fried poultry. I pass by the gas station location on elston without second thought as it reminds me of downhome broaster chicken you can find in Centralia or something. However, I figured I give it a shot and I was not disappointed.The chicken is totally krispy and krunchy with a little kick of spice. I'm thinking it's somewhere between the flavor and texture of Jewel chicken (one of my favs) and Popeyes (another fave). It is a tad spicy for weaklings (black pepper spicy) and nicely seasoned. Biscuit was a bummer with its doughy inside and the red beans with rice fell flat for me. Families rejoice, they have a Vienna all beef corn dog for the kiddies. Super option for couch potatoes as they offer delivery and are on grub hub.

5.description: The food is good but i feel they need new staff. Deep fried corn is the best. Tried it here for the 1st time. Ordered a corn dog but it was burned the top was literally black like 1/4 of the top corndog was indeible. Idk how they could still send something out like that!?? The chicken was good. red beans was good but could use a bit more flavor. The girl delivery driver was VERY lazy. Didnt call. Knocked upstairs when i said basement and forgot my soda on top of it all. I called the place and told them she forgot my soda. . delivery girl came bak and rolled her eyes when i asked if there was a straw (it was a fountain drink!!!). Bottom line is. Do not tip the delivery drivers until u recieve all of your food with no attitude from the delivery person.. the food is good. Very good. But the staff is making this restaurant plummet downards into a point of no return

0.description: Krispy Krunchy Chicken is inside Bub's place. I love the catfish, they use a very mild fish. The chicken bites are my favorite, they are very spicy and filled with rice, chicken, and herbs of some sort,  and the deep fried corn is delicious as well and also spicy. The French fries are usually good, as is the sweet biscuit.

4.description: If you like Popeye's you'll love Krispy Krunchy. It's affordable, greasy, comfort food. Tastes pretty good and they even deliver! I will warn that if you get delivery don't be put off by the greasiness of the bag. You are consuming fried chicken after all.I found their biscuits to be especially tasty. They rival those of Popeye's because they're already sweet without adding honey. Though of course Popeye's are great as well and will always have a place in my heart.

58.description: I've been here only a couple of times but have been very pleased.  The coffee is really good, the place is nice and clean.  A good place to have a good cup of coffee with some pastries while relaxing.   It's also one of the few places to go in the Portage neighborhood.

56.description: Hmmm, it is really hard to rate a local place with a bad rating but the service I experienced there this morning forces my hand.  The coffee and pastry were great, but the service was HORRIBLE.  It was as if I interrupted the staff from their busy tasks of talking to one another.  I am sorry I came into your coffee shop and ordered a coffee and a pastry, really I am!  I promise  next time, not leave a tip, if that would provide me with better service. Just a simple smile would go a long way from either the cashier or the barista.  I am going to have to stick with driving all the way to Bang! Bang! Pie for my morning coffee.

29.description: Expensive for no reason ($17 for a seasonal latte & reg. Cup of coffe) & the experience was so uncomfortable! I went with my dad & the guy behind the counter looked at us like "what are you doing in here?" My family has lived in the neighborhood for 29 years, and this is the 1st time I've felt out of place at a local business. I think wicker park or Logan square is a better venue for a pretentious place such as Portage Grounds. I think majority of patrons are passers-by, not neighborhood residents.

42.description: I stopped in one morning to get work done, and the coffee was phenomenal! Definitely beats out Starbucks & Dunkin, which is all you seem to find around here.

23.description: I used to come here very often to work. Love the tea selection and the atmosphere is cozy! Great place to hang out for a while and chill or work.

47.description: I popped in there for the first time over the weekend, and I loved it! I have no idea what took me so long to come to Portage Grounds, but I know it won't take me long to go back. Cozy, clean, & comfortable. Delicious coffee. Very nice employees. Reasonably priced. They are involved with neighborhood events and they participate in a run club. LOVE THAT! p.s. They have almond milk. Swoon!

8.description: Ive been going to the xsport next door for over a year, and i always tell myself to stop by for coffee but i always forget and hit up dunkin on my way to work. Today i decided to stop in because i have been wanting to try this drink they advertise called The Lumberjack and man was it good! But the best part is the barista asked me if this was my first time coming and i said yes and he was like i hope you like it if you don't i will gladly  make you something else. Thats good customer service and that got me thinking we should support our local business more instead of giving these big box companies our hard earned money. They got a returning customer In me and im going to spread the word!

31.description: This place is an absolute gem. I consider it one of the strongest assets of the neighborhood.  Their quality is consistently good- the coffee never tastes too acidic or burnt- and their specialty drinks are creative and delicious. They also have a solid selection of pastries you'd actually want to eat, including doughnuts from Glazed on the weekends. I come here almost daily with my dog (I tie her up outside and they have dog treats and a water bowl!) and have never been disappointed. The atmosphere is friendly, but also very appropriate for studying. They also have a small room if you needed to have a group meeting.It's awesome having such an ideal coffee shop so close to the park. Keep on killing it, Portage Grounds!

34.description: I stumbled across this coffee shop while waiting on service at a car dealership nearby and was pleasantly surprised. It has a definite hipster vibe but that's not a dig in this case.The coffee was awesome and their apple fritters were huge and delicious. I don't find myself in the area often but I will definitely go back sometime.

16.description: Very cool spot. They have the coolest looking tea cups!! They also have a free meeting room which you can rent for no cost at all! Haven't tried to coffee yet but I will return since it is close to my house. It was about time someone opened up a cool coffee spot in Portage Park!

13.description: Very nice place with an outdoor patio facing Portage Park, but the coffee isn't very good. I've been here twice and both times the coffee was not good at all. I'll give them one more shot eventually, but if the coffee is as bad as before I wont return.

11.description: I liked their pumpkin lattes and the variety of teas they offer. It's a cute and fun place to hang out and work. I also like the free meeting room they offer. It's very small inside so when the patio is not open you really have to rush to get a seat. Other than that is very comfy and homey.

39.description: I love this place! Great coffee, people & atmosphere! They have a cozy fire place and alternative milks! Love. Love. Love.

37.description: I really enjoy this place.  I go there a lot with my family on our way to the park or walking home from the park.  The coffee is good and the baked treats are even better.  I really like the cinnamon rolls.  Last week they had a maple bacon long john that my husband gobbled up.  The only thing it is missing is more seating.  We can never get a seat!

0.description: This is one of my go-to coffee spots in Portage Park.  One of my favorite drinks from there is the iced chai latte.  I also like their caffeinated choices, such as latte and seasonal latte/mocha with flavor shots (pumpkin spice, lumberjack, and peppermint).  Their coffee is strong and super on-point.  Currently they feature pastries from "Fannie's," on the corner of Montrose and Milwaukee.  It's great to see a local business that partners with another one in the neighborhood.  They offer the frequent visit punch card, so you can work toward getting a free drink if you patronize here often enough.  During warm weather seasons, their patio facing the Portage Park is absolutely gorgeous and spacious.  Their business hours will also be extended until 9pm.  Otherwise, they are open until 7pm during winter.

38.description: I love Portage Grounds!  The ambiance is perfect for this little cafe across from Portage Park. There are plenty of windows and natural light, and the seating is very comfortable.  I love their conference room and free wifi.  The baristas are all so nice and friendly.  Plus, Portage Grounds makes excellent coffee!

51.description: Such a cute and cozy environment. The lady at the front desk handed out free donuts shortly before closing time. Noise level is great for studying. Tea is delicious. Definitely will be back.

27.description: Love this place! Friendly helpful staff. Also has a nice patio with plenty of seating. I'm a huge tea drinker and love their variety of flavored teas. They were also kind enough to donate to my block's block party. We like local and want to support local!

32.description: The donuts they sell on the weekends (from Glazed and Confused) are tasty. We try to patronize our neighborhood businesses often. BUT.... Service is meh, and I have had "meh" service SEVERAL times now. Quality of coffee and chai's not worth the price. We have used the conference room multiple times for group meetings but were recently scolded for only half the group ordering something. They are considering charging a fee to use the room "if it continues." We just needed a meeting place to snack and discuss private, business matters for an hour or so. No less than $15 is spent by our small group. We don't use your wifi and surely you have other customers who spend 1+ hours holding up a chair while sipping a single drink. By the way, "Robert Q", your previous reply (on Yelp) to someone about purchasing a Starbucks card and leaving it for them behind the counter so they can go back to their comfort zone is very unprofessional!

54.description: This place is amazing!  I frequent this coffee shop because the staff is wonderfully welcoming, the drinks are fantastic, the music is pleasant and not too loud.  I love it and will continue to be a patron for as long as you are around!! :)

48.description: Great chill local coffee shop, good atmosphere, good pastries, but sometimes a longish wait.

44.description: I visit friends in a Chicago often. They recently moved into the area where Portage Grounds is located. While they were at work one day during my visit I decided, as I usually do, to adventure around town in hopes of discovering new things. PG came by recommendation so I tried it out. Really friendly staff and perfectly steamed lattes - ready to drink the moment they reach your palm. The shop looks across to the park - which made for a delightful reading spot.

24.description: Great alternative to chains such as starbucks. Way more flavorful and better value. I will be coming many more times!

7.description: Updating my review! This place is fantastic. The speed of orders has also improved. Definitely check it out!

49.description: Friendly and cozy place. The best!

40.description: Love this place!!!! It's a perfect cute, quaint coffee shop! Though there's not a ton of seating, they do have a meeting room if need be. Their coffee is great! I'm a photographer and I love getting work done or meeting clients here. Definitely worth giving this place a try!

53.description: I passed up Starbucks and decided to try local. The coffee was so bitter I did not even drink it half way... Which is particularly upsetting, considering I paid $3 for that cup of coffee!!!!!!!!!!!!  The coffee was horrible, and the price was equally as such.

30.description: I'm so, not a fan...... Sidestepped Starbucks to patronize a "neighborhood" joint and that was a mistake. If I wait almost 20 minutes for two drinks, they had better be some killer drinks, and no, they weren't. And btw, you're not doing me a HUGE favor by getting me a water, and telling me you have to make a bunch of drinks before you get it, unprofessional, I was up to bat, make patrons feel like you appreciate them!

46.description: Very cool spot. They have the coolest looking tea cups!! They also have a free meeting room which you can rent for no cost at all! Haven't tried to coffee yet but I will return since it is close to my house. It was about time someone opened up a cool coffee spot in Portage Park!

1.description: This place is very unique. It looks more interesting from the outside than it does on the inside but it is still a neat place. Very homey, with a kitchen like checkout counter where drinks are prepared and served. They have bar stool seating around the border of the shop and some lounge chairs, couches, and small tables for a few. There is a meeting space that is available for reservation as well.

55.description: Great coffee, nice space right across from the park, spacious bathrooms, friendly staff. I wish it were less glass-house and a bit more cozy and dim, but it really is very pleasant. Recommend!

9.description: I'm definitely a fan of Portage Grounds. They have great coffee and the folks who work there are super nice. The location is also nice--right across from one of the nicest parks in Chicago! Recommendation: definitely try the scones!

26.description: I visited with a group of friends last night, and we all really enjoyed it. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The drinks were delicious! (: Would definitely visit again.

25.description: Love this coffee shop! Most of their flavorings (to my knowledge) are all natural and contain less sugar than others, which is a plus. Their private study room is a great place to go if you are group studying!

12.description: Came across this place because it's right next to my gym (xsport). They have good coffee and really good donuts on the weekends I recommend the vanilla bean donut & an AmericanoCoffee is strong, lattes are a little overpriced at 3.25 but it's a good treat.I think they would benefit from offering blended protein smoothies to draw in customers from the gym (but maybe that's just not their thing). The decor is cute & there is a good amount of seating indoor and out for guests. Also, free wifi!

59.description: Starbucks where? Intelligentia what? Caribou Coffee who?I never would have thought that a nice, independent coffeehouse would exist so far away from downtown and Portage Grounds indeed proved me wrong. Having had the latte and cappuccino, the coffee is definitely good: quality bean and clean coffee machine. I have had doughnuts two of the n times (n being greater than 15) I have been and wasn't disappointed. Then again, the doughnuts were from Glazed and Infused.I hope that Portage Grounds sticks around for a long time. I can always go for some of their coffee as opposed to the stock coffeehouses.

21.description: People are nice, building is cool but the coffee is no good.  Sorry dudes, but everyone in my group had a bad cup- one espresso, one black coffee and one au lait.  Lacking flavor in a real way.

17.description: I popped in there for the first time over the weekend, and I loved it! I have no idea what took me so long to come to Portage Grounds, but I know it won't take me long to go back. Cozy, clean, & comfortable. Delicious coffee. Very nice employees. Reasonably priced. They are involved with neighborhood events and they participate in a run club. LOVE THAT! p.s. They have almond milk. Swoon!

10.description: I used to come here very often to work. Love the tea selection and the atmosphere is cozy! Great place to hang out for a while and chill or work.

5.description: Came here on a Friday to grab a coffee & a pastry. Unfortunately, they were out of everything & it was only 11am! There were signs for bagels and pastries, but they were nowhere to be found. So disappointing! I ordered an iced caramel latte, that was solid flavor-wise, but a little pricey - over $5 for a fairly small large. The outdoor patio space at Portage is nice - lots of tables and flower boxes make it an inviting place to stick around for a relaxed chat with a friend or stay to get some work done. I'd stop by again, but hopefully I could get some breakfast to accompany my coffee next time!

3.description: My step daughter use to live in the neighborhood and we would come by every now and then for a drink or to chat. I love the location. The shop is clean and cute. There's a conference room which would be nice for private meetings and what now. The outdoor area is where we would spend most of our time. I love the outdoor area, but if you're wearing shorts the chair leaves these marks on the back of legs.

35.description: Came across this place because it's right next to my gym (xsport). They have good coffee and really good donuts on the weekends I recommend the vanilla bean donut & an AmericanoCoffee is strong, lattes are a little overpriced at 3.25 but it's a good treat.I think they would benefit from offering blended protein smoothies to draw in customers from the gym (but maybe that's just not their thing). The decor is cute & there is a good amount of seating indoor and out for guests. Also, free wifi!

19.description: Great alternative to chains such as starbucks. Way more flavorful and better value. I will be coming many more times!

28.description: Customer experience is cool...neighborhood local feel. Coffee is average as expected. My issue is apple Cinnamon muffin was dry and tasted old...like from last night. Disappointing.

45.description: Great little coffee shop right across the street from Portage Park! Good coffee & tea, and fantastic atmosphere. Unfortunately the last two times I went in, I had some really terrible americanos- overly acidic & bitter. So I won't be ordering those for a bit. Nice meeting room and Glazed & Infused doughnuts on weekends!

33.description: I am OBSESSED with Portage Grounds! I go about twice a week to study and the coffee is delicious and the atmosphere is so inviting and calm. The coffee is terrific and the baristas really know what they're doing. I'd also recommend a scone or a glazed and infused doughnut on the weekend!

43.description: Coffee is nothing extra, regular. They have really small space inside. You are packed like a sardines in can. No privacy - there are the bar chairs for the counter at the glass wall sides and right next to them are the tables with chairs. So it's weird to be sitting at the table and somebody is sitting right around you on the bar chairs. Seeing and hearing everything.

2.description: Great coffee! We had an Americano w/ sugar free caramel & a drip coffee. For two larges, a little under $7 (half the price of Starbucks...)! Cheap-o for this quality of coffee. Came in around 2pm so we didn't try any breakfast sandwiches or treats. They have Glazed & Infused donuts on the weekends (DELISH & a must try). Nice atmosphere and could definitely bring a laptop to work in here. There is also a small conference room with a dry erase board for meetings.So happy to see this kind of business in Portage Park! Keep it up!

18.description: The coffee and warm scones are so good! Unfortunately, the staff isn't that friendly which is why I had to rate them 4 stars. Do give them a try!

41.description: Cute little coffee shop, just what the area needed. I like to swing by the shop for a snack and strong cup of coffee before taking my dog to portage park. I use to go there to study but the music isn't exactly soothing, and sometimes a little loud. Other than that, no complaints. Yummy pastries, delicious coffee I especially like that they use all natural sweeteners) and friendly staff :)

52.description: I came. I saw. I drank. I liked! Came after work one day, starving for a panini and crazy latte drink. Sadly, there is no such thing as a panini here. Or any other sandwiches for the most part. So I had their hot-pocket looking pastry filled with ham and cheese. Not bad. Then again, I was so hungry I would've been content with a PB&J cracker. To drink, I got this hot green tea mocha. It reminded me of bubble green tea, without the tapioca pearls. It was so freakishly good. Service was good. There was only 1 other patron in the place (must've been a slow nite), which was perfect for me. Can't wait to go back ;)

50.description: I am thrilled this place is open in my neighborhood!  I love that they change their coffee/tea menu with the seasons and offer the best thing ever, which is chai cider.  (I will be sad when that one is out of season.)  The place is in a perfect location: the park is right across the street, plenty of free street parking and a bus stop right out front.  The staff working there has always been very friendly and the place has a room for rental (not sure if it's free or has a cost).  A wonderful alternative to the standard coffee chains like Starbucks.  I hope this place sticks around for a very, very long time.

4.description: I like local business so I was generous here BUT there are things to be desired. My chai was pretty average to poor, there are only about 3 or 4 tables, and the servers/baristas have personality to be desired. lastly everyone was studying and the music was pretty loud so it just seemed like they gauged their patrons poorly. glad to see something like this in the neighborhood though so i had to give it a decent amount of stars

6.description: Portage Grounds pulls one of the best espressos I have had in quite a while! Location wise.. could be better. The decor and outside tables are really cute and inviting, but the area itself (surrounding stores, busy intersection) is not as attractive. The barista are all extremely friendly, and the inside couches and tables are very comfortable and inviting. There is even a meeting room for large groups!I ordered a small latte, but wish I would I have tried one of their specialty drinks (coconut latte!) If I am in the area again I will definitely come here again.

22.description: Stopped in here on a whim while waiting on a oil change & what a great decision it was! Friendly employees, great drip coffee & outstanding muffins! Sat outside on the beautiful patio which has sunshine & shaded options with lovely flowers. I chose sun with a gorgeous view of Portage Park right across the street. All in all, I cannot wait to go back to this awesome lil spot!

15.description: What's not to love about this place. Both times I've been, every one behind the counter has been super friendly. First time we went in we changed our minds several times and the guy behind the counter was super patient. Sorry dude, didn't know what we wanted! We went with the Iced Coconut Latte & a white chocolate chip raspberry scone. The scone was absolutely delicious. Coconut Latte has now become my favorite and I dream about it daily! Love the outdoor seating area. Definitely becoming a regular here!

57.description: The coffee and pastries are very good here, and the space is attractive, with lots of wood and natural light. But I definitely got a vibe from the staff that didn't make me feel welcome. The woman at the cash register was friendly enough, but the woman making the drinks had a sour attitude toward me for some reason even though I thanked her after I got my drink and again before I left and asked if there was a specific place for me to put my dirty cup and plate. I paid with a debit card, but I left a good tip and was polite, so I'm not sure why this barista was friendly to some of the other customers and not to me. I can understand if someone is having a bad day or doesn't want to be at work, but this woman was super friendly with everyone else. It kind of killed any positive feelings I had about this coffee shop when I first walked in.I was in the area for an appointment and needed to kill some time, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back. I liked the ambiance and especially the apple cider donut, but the off-putting attitude and slow service I got makes this place a miss.

20.description: I'm definitely a fan of Portage Grounds. They have great coffee and the folks who work there are super nice. The location is also nice--right across from one of the nicest parks in Chicago! Recommendation: definitely try the scones!

36.description: This was an unintended stop today, because the place I was going to wasn't open yet.  However, this turned out to be way better than my original destination. I ordered a latte that was served in a nice oversized coffee cup with a petite spoon.  As I sat down at my table I couldn't help but be impressed not only with the cleanliness of the place but how cozy it was.  I felt like I was in a room designed by Crate & Barrel! It had a good vibe to it.  No one had an attitude, there wasn't any loud music playing in the background, it was just a good place to chill out on a somewhat chilly day...no pun intended.Wish this place was closer to me.

14.description: I love this coffee shop, their coffee is good quality and they also have pastries that are real tasty and fresh. Service is good, they have a lot of space and the patio area in the summer is beautiful

0.description: One of the most largest selection of craft and imported beers I've seen around...

58.description: Summer House succeeds in creating the experience of being in a beach restaurant on the coast. From the great seafood (I recommend the Trout) to the delicious wine (Malbec please), Summer House was everything I was looking for on a brisk cold Chicago night. Plus, you'll want to save a little space for desert because their cookies are everything.

56.description: Never been to this place before, so it was a bit iffy on a first impression. Our waiter wasn't terribly attentive, some other waiters actually delivered our food. This simply could have been because it was a busy night (make a reservation btw, no matter what time of day you plan on dining.) The food was decent. I would definitely go back however to try a different entré. Their baking is very good. The cookies were delicious. You can get it on your way out :)

29.description: Such a nice brunch place. Great service, nice crowd and good food. We made reservations, so there was no wait which is really nice since we saw a few people waiting. The food was so good and our waiter was super helpful and very attentive. The interior décor of the restaurant was so nice and even though it was freezing outside the interior design really set that summer mindset. I would definitely recommend.

42.description: I adore Summer House. The food, atmosphere, dessert.... I love it all. Let's start with the atmosphere. Summer House somehow maintains a light and airy ambiance that truly gives you a summery feel all year long, which in the long, cold, dreary Chicago winters is a real feat. Going to Summer House in the winter is always a bit of a respite from the elements for me. It's always crowded and noisy, but I like that. I love the bustling feel that you get at SH. Food wise I have never been disappointed. The guacamole is divine. The drinks are delicious. Every entree I've had has been delicious. Several of my visits have been with large groups of friends, and I think the fact that we continue to go back says volumes about how all of us felt about our meals. In fact I have a group of girlfriends that try to go out 6-8 times a year, and Summer House is the only restaurant in Chicago that we've gone to more than once. I've saved the best for last. Dessert. First of all I love that they have the bakery section up front. In theory I could drop in and grab a cookie to go, even if I didn't dine at SH. I haven't done this yet, but I'm not entirely sure why b/c their cookies are sort of the highlight of my life. I can't decide which I like more; the chocolate chip cookies topped with bacon or the chocolate chip cookies topped with rice krispy treats. Deciding is a challenge I'm willing to take one. I'll just probably need to try each one several more times before I can make a decision ;)

23.description: My absolute favorite restaurant in the entire city. Hands down! The fish tacos are amazing and if sushi is on the menu as the special... GET IT! I dream about the Palm Fizz drink basically ever day.

47.description: Get the english muffins. you will not be disappointed!

8.description: A few words...1. Love the decor. Really transports me to California in the dead of winter in Chicago. Very trendy looking place.2. Check in so you can get a free gauc and chips for an appetizer! The gauc was great :)3. Order the English muffin burger with pico de gallo and avocado. The muffin adds such a nice crisp to the burger! 4. The cookies are amazing!!!!! GET THEM.

31.description: I was a little disappointed in the food at Summerhouse. It's a little overpriced for what you get. I was excited to try the roasted cauliflower and it was really salty :( The desserts are great, we had some of their cookies and I definitely recommend them. I also had the Cobb salad which was really small and didn't have much to it 1. Ambiance = 5 stars, very cute and would be great for grabbing a drink and a few apps2. Service = 5 stars, friendly staff3. Food = 3 stars

34.description: Like other reviewers mentioned, the service here is lackluster and leaves a lot to be desired.  We came on a Saturday night as a group at about 6 p.m. and the place was packed (on both sides of the restaurant).  We were able to seat ourselves in sort of a lounge-y waiting area and receive service from either side, so we opted to do that.  It as definitely not the most comfortable arrangement, but it beat waiting over an hour for a table just to eat some pizza or whatever.  Lots of people say the service is slow, so maybe it's not just because we sat at this weird lounge table.  We were able to get drinks and the full menus from either side, but there were a lot of people passing by and it just felt crowded because of our location in the restaurant.Food was good but a bit overpriced.  The quality was fine but it wasn't like the greatest thing I've ever eaten before.  The gluten-free selection was great, which was awesome for one of the people we were eating with, and the appetizers were delicious.  All in all, I can say for sure that I don't care much for Lincoln Park and this place just exemplifies the restaurants that are trying to be "high-end" for the rich clientele of the neighborhood and end up serving normal, mediocre food like a billion other restaurants in Chicago.

16.description: I've been attempting to get reservations at Summer House for ages and when my mom finalized her plans to come to Chicago, this was the first place to hit on our list. She was more than excited to go as well.Major downside is the parking in this area is just horrendous. It's Lincoln Park though, so that was probably a given. The restaurant does offer valet but I'd rather spend my hard earned money on dessert and walk my lazy butt to the restaurant! HA. We arrived early and had a drink at the bar next door, apparently they are owned by the same as Summer House. I finished up my spicy margarita quickly when it was announced our table was ready (early, by the way. Thanks Summer House - you rock)We lucked out and got a table right near the opening of the restaurant so we had an amazing view with a fall breeze but without freezing completely in the bi-polar weather of Chicago. Summer House definitely has an LA vibe (obviously, since it's titled with Santa Monica) which is a nice change in Chicago. The place was completely packed and I have no idea how servers get around, I'd be knocking things over right and left. My mom ordered the mahi mahi tacos which she loved. They came with a lot of sides and salsas. I attempted the english muffin burger but they were out of some ingredient (can't remember since I'm writing this 3 months later) so I ordered the chicken tacos instead. I honestly wasn't disappointed because my meal was delicious. My partner ordered the double decker turkey burger which was huge. I tried this too and it also had a great flavor. I'd love to come back but this place always seems to be booked, rightfully so. If you are a yelper like me, you should check in when you arrive because we scored a free order of guacamole. We also ordered a cookie to go and had it later in the evening. These are a must!

13.description: Loved this place overall! The atmosphere was upscale yet cozy. It was the perfect spot for a girls' night out during Chicago Restaurant Week. There were preset selections for the special week and they were all tasty. The food was really good but the dessert was the best. We had one of their fresh chocolate chip cookies with ice cream - delicious!

11.description: This restaurant is absolutely adorable. Let me start by saying the service that they provide is outstanding.  The reason they're missing one star is due to seating arrangements. I had made reservation in advance for 8:30 on a Wednesday. We arrive 25 mins early, and did not get seated until closer to 8:30. Also, they were aware that I needed to set up the balloons for the birthday dinner. That's my only concern not being able to repair the table. Now on to the food, I had a turkey burger with a side of salad. Some of my friends had the pastas and tacos. Everyone's food looked amazing. The server she was the most accommodating and patient person. She allowed us to split the check between six people and we stayed until they started cleaning no one was rushing us to leave. Over all, great atmosphere and food I will return again.

39.description: Food and service is always great! Love the atmosphere! Went for brunch for the first time today, but must say that I much more enjoy the dinner. The brunch food seemed average, whereas the dinner has always been great!

37.description: I recently took my step daughter and her roommate to Summer house and absolutely loved the vibe.  Long ago I stopped going out in Lincoln Park due to its staid offerings, but, at their request, I couldn't say no to their choice.  The California beach vibe is very well done.  The food was mostly good (the tuna appetizer while tasty was one of the skimpiest offerings I've seen on a menu in a long time). Service only 'good enough'. The wine, the SoCal beach ambiance/ vibe and the cookies in the foyer are your reason to go.

0.description: This is a great example of a place where I feel like I would have to really nitpick not to give it five stars. On a recommendation from a friend who lives in the city, my wife and I ate lunch here a few weeks ago, and we were absolutely pleased. Not just with the food, but also by the atmosphere they have cultivated. It was bitter cold outside the day we came, but we felt right away like we were in southern California.All of that with awesome food and a great beer selection, and I didn't even feel bad about not eating at my usual Lincoln Park lunch spot.

38.description: When we arrived at Summer House the hostess told us it would be about a 45 minute wait, so we left, grabbed a drink and came back. We again asked about how long it would be and we were told another 20-30 minutes so we went next door to Stella Barra. We waited approximately 45 minutes before checking again. The hostess we had previously spoken to was no longer there and the man in her place asked for our first and last name (we hadn't been asked for our last name when we put our name down), after likely realizing they had forgotten us, he quickly sat us. Our server came right over, asked how we were doing, to which we very briefly mentioned the seating situation. He was genuinely apologetic and immediately took initiative to make the rest of our experience a positive one. Later his manager came over to apologize and offered to comp our wine. Our server fast-tracked our food order and also gave us an appetizer and dessert on the house. While I appreciate the free items we received, what impressed me the most was their genuine desire to rectify the situation and ensure we left with a positive impression. Thank you for all you did to make us feel like valued guests, I'd happily brunch at Summer House again.

51.description: Fun, trendy "Summer Like" restaurant & nice waitstaff. Sat at the bar & our bartender served perfect drinks & we ordered food too.  Good presentation for our dishes  & quite tasty! The Ahi Tuna appetizer just melted in your mouth.

27.description: I loved the whole atmosphere at this place, it is such a cute place with a bar area on the side, a little bakery area in the middle, and a dining area all in one. Our waiter and all the staff was absolutly awesome and he was very attentive, and was giving us ideas on what to get because it was our first time. The food was delicious and we accompanied our food with a couple awesome brunch drinks. I'm not a huge Bloody Mary fan but I did taste it and it was probably one of the best I have ever tried. I loved this place, and will definantly be going back!

32.description: I can't even begin to tell you how much I love Summer House. It's bright, airy, full of vibrance, and even in the dead of winter you feel like it's a spring day. The food is amazing, California fresh. I was there with a friend and we both had smoked salmon toasts and they were delicious. Even their side dishes can stand on their own.  Another thing I like about it is their selection of non-achololic drinks. Finally, an alternative to iced tea. I can't wait to get back during the summer when they roll up the window and the whole place is al fresco. All in all a great experience.

54.description: The food was truly spectacular, but the service is what sold it for me. I came this morning for brunch and our server was Dawn and she could not have been sweeter nor more welcoming. Excellent recommendations.

48.description: The atmosphere is so great and their food is always really fresh! I love this place for so many reasons...they have some food gluten free options and are really willing to accommodate allergies! (Their cookies are awesome too!)

44.description: Love going to Summer House. It feels like you are in south Hampton on a beautiful summer day. The whole restaurant feels like a beach house. The burger at Summer House is great. In particular because you can get it on an English muffin (if that is your thing). They have a great wine list as well.

24.description: That setting is much like if Hollister stopped selling clothes -- Became an upscale restaurant for adults and began serving American contemporary (with drops of sushi), California-themed delicious foods!! Food: Don't forget to check-in on Yelp for the free guac and chips! I almost forgot. I personally recommend that for small groups. Had the Spicy Tuna hand roll sushi which you can taste the fresh tasting tuna through the roll. For my entree, I had the prime rib French dip with poblano peppers. It's the dip that makes this sandwich! French dip might be a bit strong at first, it definitely made he sandwich great. Dessert cookie (chocolate chip with bits of rice crispy) topped with ice cream was a thumbs up! Go on and splurge on this with your date :) Service: Obviously, it was stellar. Cheers! I'll be returning hopefully soon again.

7.description: I visited Summer House for restaurant week with a friend for dinner.  It's a really beautiful restaurant - I imagine in the summer, it's perfect!We were warmly greeted and seated quickly with our reservation (not sure if it's always packed, but it was really busy during the week for dinner when we visited).  Unfortunately, they were out of the wine that was included in the restaurant week menu...but they thankfully subbed something else that was equally delicious.  I tried the chicken tacos, salad and a cookie with ice cream.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  The salad was perfectly dressed and really flavorful - bright and cheery.  The chicken tacos were a large portion with nice sides - guacamole, salsa, rice, beans, etc.  I had enough for lunch the next day and it was equally delicious warmed up.The cookie...wow...chocolate chip with rice krispie treats in them!? Yum.  Very rich but very good.  Our server told us that sometimes the cookies go so fast that by the time they go to pick up the order, some flavors are already sold out!  I think you can buy these separately if you walk in to the restaurant, which is a nice touch.Service wasn't rushing us though we were chatting a lot and they were really really nice.  I thought price-wise, it could definitely get expensive depending on how you order, but it wasn't over the top.  Also, the quantity and quality of food was also excellent.Definitely worth a visit (but make a reservation!).Food - 5Service - 5Value - 4Atmosphere - 4 (beautiful but LOUD)

49.description: I'd love to rate this restaurant five stars, as I loved the ambiance and most of the food, but it doesn't make up for rude waitstaff. Need I remind them that they are waitstaff which while I typically respect waitstaff, it is no excuse for a pretentious attitude. Cold food, acting like you're being bothered when customers ask questions about the menu and changing your customers chairs during their meal are all inexcusable. The management clearly needs to be pickier about who they hire, train their staff properly and remind them that they are being paid to service the customer. They might also remind them that they never know who that customer is and the contacts they have that could be influential to the success of the restaurant and their paycheck.

40.description: Although we had some problems with getting a table, our waiter and the GM worked very hard to make the situation right. After comping both a glass of wine and delicious vegetables, we enjoyed a very tasty brunch.  The shaved salad was very good.  I enjoyed the variety of vegetables, and my tuna was prepared just how I asked!   They worked to make the situation right and provided great service!

53.description: Not the best experience, I normally never write these. The moment we walked in, there was no one to greet us at the host stand. Mainly because there was no host. When we were seated we were given the brunch menu, 6 mins later we were greeted at the table by our server. She was indifferent about the brunch menu because she didn't know if brunch was still being sereved. I was worried about this because I specifically made a brunch reservation. The brunch menu was the only menus that were given to read. She confirmed, after the 10 min mark is when we were finally given water. Generally within 1 minute or 2 of being seated water should be brought to the table. Disappointing introduction. It got worse from there. I felt as though we were being rushed because the server made it seem like they were making an exception for the brunch menu order because at this point it was after 3 pm. I asked before we ordered, is there anything on the menu that you're out of? The answer was no. We should have everything. So we placed our drink or and Carrot Cheese Cake Muffin. I was very excited about this, heard great things about from other people. Our drinks took a long while to come finally when they did the server said sorry we are out of the carrot muffins, so we ordered the cinnamon roll. The same mistake happened again as it did with the muffin. The server put the order in to realize, since it never came to the table, you were out of the Cinnamon rolls as well. Getting irritated. Also the server came back to the table after the fact, food order already went in to ask my girlfriend if she wanted a side salad with her dish and then when my girlfriend ordered her cocktail, it was after the drink was ordered, the server came back a second time to the table to ask what kind of vodka. All these questions should be asked in the moment as the order from the table is being placed. A sad experience had from a place that has exceptional food. The service training needs to be at the same level. Also I emailed this review to Leye, I got no response back. Double disappointment.

30.description: My husband and I came here for brunch on Sunday (yesterday) and there was a small line to be seated, but we managed to get a couple of places at the bar.The atmosphere is absolutely fantastic, and so is the decor. The music is perfect and the bartenders very friendly, attentive, and professional. Their coffee is great, which is difficult to find at other breakfast places... We had the chicken tostadas... YUMMY!We took a peak at the dinner menu and we will definitely be back. Their other restaurant Stella Barra is also on our list to go next!

46.description: Great little Chicago find... It's far from little but this place rocks! We got a recommendation to try this place a few months back and we really liked it. The service was great, the food was fresh and light, and the over all atmosphere was very pleasant. It is a bit loud but we enjoy that kind of atmosphere. The decor is fresh, bright an it made us feel like we where in California instead of dreary Chicago. Great dinner date spot!

1.description: Nothing has really changed from my previous review just an update. We did sign up for their text messaging which you can get a couple of deals when you present the text. I'm assuming they do this to get more regular customers through the door. Their customer service is average &  it almost seems like the people working there don't want to be there. You really are Kind of a nuisance if you're there to be seated and you don't have a reservation.But it also might be like that if you have a reservation so I wouldn't know.We ordered a pizza again and it was pretty average a little bit skimpy on the ingredients. The ingredients that seem to be fresh just a lack of on the pizza. The appetizers are also all pretty average. The desserts are not at all appetizing. We did have a cookie which was average. The bottom line is there are so many better places to eat in the area. But if the wait here is not as long or as bad then go for it.

55.description: the food at summer house was quite good, which at the price point, it should be.  came for brunch with three friends, and we all got breakfast items.  thirteen dollars for an omelette with no sides seems a bit insane to me, but it was very good.  the ambiance is a bit pretentious, but it is located in lincoln park.  the value just wasn't there for me, because i think you can get a really good omelette for much cheaper in the city.  the food was a 5, but the value a 3.  if you want a pretentious, over-priced but good meal, this is the place.

9.description: This is a long overdue updated review. Per my previous review, one of their business partners and manager had reached out to me, invited me back to dine with them again. I went back mid Jun of 2015 for brunch once again. The food and drinks were great! The waitress Alex was very attentive and she checked in with us for a couple times. The speed and service had definitely improved since the last two times I dined there. *Definitely suggest you make a reservation ahead of time!

26.description: I visited Summer House for restaurant week with a friend for dinner.  It's a really beautiful restaurant - I imagine in the summer, it's perfect!We were warmly greeted and seated quickly with our reservation (not sure if it's always packed, but it was really busy during the week for dinner when we visited).  Unfortunately, they were out of the wine that was included in the restaurant week menu...but they thankfully subbed something else that was equally delicious.  I tried the chicken tacos, salad and a cookie with ice cream.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  The salad was perfectly dressed and really flavorful - bright and cheery.  The chicken tacos were a large portion with nice sides - guacamole, salsa, rice, beans, etc.  I had enough for lunch the next day and it was equally delicious warmed up.The cookie...wow...chocolate chip with rice krispie treats in them!? Yum.  Very rich but very good.  Our server told us that sometimes the cookies go so fast that by the time they go to pick up the order, some flavors are already sold out!  I think you can buy these separately if you walk in to the restaurant, which is a nice touch.Service wasn't rushing us though we were chatting a lot and they were really really nice.  I thought price-wise, it could definitely get expensive depending on how you order, but it wasn't over the top.  Also, the quantity and quality of food was also excellent.Definitely worth a visit (but make a reservation!).Food - 5Service - 5Value - 4Atmosphere - 4 (beautiful but LOUD)

25.description: Hair in mashed potatoes. Raw chicken. Sushi was great though. Will I go back? Most likely not. For a place boasting their service and food, their service was sub par. Call to order take away, placed on hold immediately for 5 minutes. Come back and then told to hold while they transfer me to take away line. And then come home to find raw chicken, hair in potatoes and kale. Appetite ruined. One star is for the sushi. That was great.

12.description: That setting is much like if Hollister stopped selling clothes -- Became an upscale restaurant for adults and began serving American contemporary (with drops of sushi), California-themed delicious foods!! Food: Don't forget to check-in on Yelp for the free guac and chips! I almost forgot. I personally recommend that for small groups. Had the Spicy Tuna hand roll sushi which you can taste the fresh tasting tuna through the roll. For my entree, I had the prime rib French dip with poblano peppers. It's the dip that makes this sandwich! French dip might be a bit strong at first, it definitely made he sandwich great. Dessert cookie (chocolate chip with bits of rice crispy) topped with ice cream was a thumbs up! Go on and splurge on this with your date :) Service: Obviously, it was stellar. Cheers! I'll be returning hopefully soon again.

59.description: Flavor profile and creativity: 5 stars. Food quality when served: 3 starsService: 2 stars.  Can't say enough about the interesting menu.  Very creative.  We had calamari, spinach pasta, prime rib French dip, and other dishes in our small party.  I do not now how in the world fresh pasta can be dried out when served.  It must have been sitting for some time after being cooked.  The pancetta in the pasta was quite overwhelming, leaving an after taste of nothing else.  Poor execution of the menu.  Service was spotty. Our waitress had not tried any dishes we asked about, and could not provide any recommendations.  She disappeared for a good amount of time twice.  I would NOT recommend summer house, given the expectation in the neighborhood.

21.description: I have been to Summer House on a couple of occasions for brunch and loved their menu. The chips and guacamole is delicious and just enough of a portion to share as an appetizer. The cocktails and freshly squeezed orange juice are also very refreshing and tasty! Their scrambled egg sandwich with avocado never disappoints. Almost forgot to mention how inviting and soothing their atmosphere is.. I feel like I am truly sitting in a restaurant in Santa Monica, CA. Can't wait to try more on their lunch and dinner menus. :)

17.description: I've been to Summer House a couple other times and have enjoyed each visit (both dinner and brunch). Definitely a great place to bring visitors/guests. They're always impressed! The cocktails are delicious! I had The Bonfire, a grapefruit tequila concoction, at dinner and it was quickly followed by a second. The Bloody Mary and Palm Fizz (wine, prosecco, roemary, apple & lemon) are the perfect addition to a brunch. I couldn't resist the ever popular Avocado Toast, this second brunch visit: poached eggs on top of avocado, scallion mascarpone and their homemade bread.. is your mouth watering yet? The servers are attentive to replenishing drink orders, and refilling waters, without hovering or rushing your experience. They're friendly and have great recommendations for first time visitors. Oh and it's winter, so definitely request a seat in their vitamin D room where the sunshine and hanging green plants make you forget the sub zero Chicago temperatures and snow on the ground and for a moment, let you believe that you're soaking in the California sunshine!

10.description: Awesome brunch spot - loved the drink options here, atmosphere is nice and summery as you'd expect. Food was delicious (my favorite was the burrata, we had to get to get two).

5.description: Hair in mashed potatoes. Raw chicken. Sushi was great though. Will I go back? Most likely not. For a place boasting their service and food, their service was sub par. Call to order take away, placed on hold immediately for 5 minutes. Come back and then told to hold while they transfer me to take away line. And then come home to find raw chicken, hair in potatoes and kale. Appetite ruined. One star is for the sushi. That was great.

3.description: I hyped this place up way too much in my head, so much so that I could have easily been disappointed. The best part?? I wasn't!! It was everything I thought it would be! Atmosphere was wonderful, food was delicious, cocktails were great, and service was on point. It was that night we were all told there would be a blizzard out. Although there was no blizzard, it was snowing and dreary and when we walked into summer house, we were instantly transported to somewhere warm in Santa Monica! The decor, lighting, and environment did that with ease! When we walked in, there was a display case full of fresh goodies. I wandered back before they closed that portion of the restaurant at 9 and picked three delicious cookies to take to the next bars and loved them all! Next to the display case, there was complimentary infused water, yum!We had 7:30 reservations, but weren't seated for a good 35 minutes, but thank goodness that was the worst part of our experience! I wish we would have been seated in the main dining area, but being close to the bar also has its advantages ;) we ordered a ton of food and just split it all:+ Homemade chips and guac: a Yelp check in gets you this on the house. The chips were delicious, perfectly seasoned and the guac just the same!+ Burrata: this is always a favorite of mine and it game on a bed of tomato jam, which was also tasty!+ Caramelized Brussels sprouts- one of my favorite items we ordered! Delicious! The vinegar or balsamic drizzled all over tasted amazing!+ Tempura main lobster: I was nervous it would be too fishy for me as I just started diving into seafood and sushi, but it tasted great! Enough pieces to share!+ Wild mushroom enchiladas: so tasty! Perfectly seasoned mushrooms on the inside, tangy and delicious sauce on the outside, topped with cheese and some cabbage!+ Ancho-marinated Amish chicken tacos- this was still delicious but likely my least favorite item we ordered- the chicken was too dry for my liking, but again- everything on the plate was seasoned well!For drinks, I had a beer at the bar and then switched to the bonfire cocktail. Loved it and enjoyed a few of them. My friends enjoyed the cocktails they had, as well!Service was wonderful! Our waiter was attentive, friendly, and very knowledgable of the menu! He overhead my friend mentioning it was my birthday the next day and took my first drink off the check. Overall, absolutely great experience and I can't wait to keep coming back! Next up- I want to try their brunch!!--Update 3 days later, we made it in for brunch! The wait was 1.5 hours, but it was a beautiful day so we wandered around the area. The wait was worth it. Service was just as wonderful and nothing beats this atmosphere! This is now easily my favorite place in the city and I can't wait to continue coming back (I've already made my next reservation to try more items on the menu)!! For brunch, I had the breakfast tostadas. The pulled chicken was seasoned very well and the entire tostada was delicious. The salsa isn't spicy so I did add my own hot sauce. I also split the Mexican hash browns with my friend and loved it.

35.description: I've come here several times over the years I've lived in Chicago with friends. Love the beachy vibe of the atmosphere and especially love to go during the day to enjoy the sunshine pouring in through the skylights. The food has always been good - not great, not bad (except for 1 time long ago) and the service is also good (had a few great and a few mediocre and 1 bad) but overall good experiences. Go with some pals for Brunch, enjoy the atmosphere and some fruity cocktails.

19.description: Maybe I think this because my family sat next to a bachelorette party during our brunch, but this is a perfect place to have a bachelorette party brunch. Penis straws and pink sashes aside, the food totally rules and it's lively atmosphere makes for a great experience regardless of your reason for going. It's trendy, has a delicious California inspired menu, and the light and fruity cocktail menu would make the cast of Sex And The City cream their panties. I highly recommend the beet salad and the breakfast tostadas both of which I tried on Sunday. The service was very attentive all around, and even more impressive considering it was such a zoo of hungry brunch goers. Price point is a little up there, but you're getting some pretty quality light fare for the most part. I'll definitely be back. Especially if I get invited to sip out of a penis straw.

28.description: I took my 18 year old on a College visit to DePaul University.  After much researching for THE hip, trendy restaurant for dinner all roads led to The Summer House.  Food was amazing! I had the curry Quinoa bowl with Chicken and my daughter had the burger.  David our waiter couldn't have been more accommodating.  If you are going to be in Lincoln Park - eat here!

45.description: I love this place! Food is so good. Atmosphere feels like your sitting outside in California. Waiters are very helpful. I would recommend the mushroom enchiladas.

33.description: A few words...1. Love the decor. Really transports me to California in the dead of winter in Chicago. Very trendy looking place.2. Check in so you can get a free gauc and chips for an appetizer! The gauc was great :)3. Order the English muffin burger with pico de gallo and avocado. The muffin adds such a nice crisp to the burger! 4. The cookies are amazing!!!!! GET THEM.

43.description: What an awesome atmosphere- literally felt like I was on vacation. The food was excellent as well, so worth the wait! !!

2.description: Absolute number one in Chicago! From the Décor to the food, I haven't seen a flaw yet. You are greeted by a dessert bar before you notice the hostess. And "YES." dessert before your meal is totally acceptable. Summerhouse is attached to it's sister restaurant, Stella Bar, which I've used  plenty of times to keep me occupied while waiting for a table. The menu and atmosphere are multi-dimensional. The menu gives you enough options to mix and match and they welcome all attire.I recently relocated to Cali, but felt the need to yelp and say ... SHSM, I think about you every time I dine.

18.description: It's not always about the food. The experience is really what makes it or breaks it for me. We were invited here for brunch on 9/6/15 at 1130am. We were a part of 6. We were supposed to be party of 8 but two people tapped out last minute but the restaurant was fine with that. We arrived and happily discovered their valet parking. That was the first smile on our face on this beautiful Sunday afternoon.You enter and find yourself in a setting that reminds you when you're on vacation near a beach. It's beautiful. There is a small bakery right when you walk in. Variety of goodies to choose from. We were seated promptly. Our table was large, spacious and marble! I think the only marble table in the whole restaurant. Our waitress was Danielle. She was awesome and looked& talked like Miley Cyrus. That's not relevant, I know but that's how I remember people. She was very attentive and did everything with a genuine smile. The nonalcoholic cocktails were great. My mom had the pineapple paradise which had pineapple, mint and a hint of cucumber. I had some of it and it's totally refreshing. I liked it more than my kale lemonade. All the food was great. My dad said his food and experience were "six stars!" He had the eggs and turkey bacon. (See my pics) The cookie and ice cream were awesome. The cookie is fresh and hot. Holy smokes delicious. My lobster roll had too much bread but toasted to perfection. It was decent. My sister liked her burger. Everyone else really loved their food. Everything tastes fresh and ingredients were great. Service is top notch. Decor and ambiance are beautiful. I wish I had my sunglasses! They recommend you wear them too! It's a totally  California feel inside. In summary:1. Valet parking for $132. Great location in Lincoln park 3. Excellent service. Thanks Danielle!4. Clean and beautiful restaurant 5. Great food6. Unique drinksOverall wonderful Sunday brunch experience!!

41.description: Had a wonderful brunch at Santa Monica Summer house... The beef short rib hash was delicious, accompanied by fresh OJ and country bread (i.e. Amazing toast with sweet butter and homemade jam). Pricey for a mid-day deal but well worth it given the amazing ambiance and beautiful restaurant. Friendly staff as well... Can't wait to go back for dinner!

52.description: I would like to give Summer House 3.5 stars. I am glad I went but I don't think I'll be coming back. I was told by 2 friends to come here. My boyfriend and I came on a Monday afternoon; the restaurant was pretty crowded with a great décor. The design and space really made it seem as if you were outside in California, very bright and open atmosphere. We ordered the tartar-very small portion. My boyfriend ordered 2 beers and the fish tacos; nothing to write home about. I ordered the avocado toast-very good but I feel like I could have made it at home. I thought the food was a little better than average for the price. I felt as if $80+ was overpriced for just an A-OK meal. After, I went to the dessert counter and got the rice krispy cookie which was excellent.

50.description: We ate here for the first time yesterday and we were pleasantly surprised. We went with a small group and ordered more food than we could eat. Everything from the appetizers and soup, to the entrees and dessert were delicious. On top of that the service was amazing. We were fortunate to have Shelby as our server and she was great. From the start she was friendly and energetic. As we asked questions about the wine list and menus Shelby was very knowledgable and made great recommendations. We would definitely come back because of Shelby (oh and because of the food too).

4.description: Love love love this place. You enter this place and greeted by a sweets stand. This also served as the waiting area for both summer house and the pizza spot next door. The first time I came here, the wait for a Sunday at 2pm was still an hour and a half. The second time was on a Saturday at 4pm, 15 minute wait. I didn't mind the second time around for the wait. The only down side, aside from the wait times, is that the server I had and the hostess were both kinda cold and not attentive. Had to ask the hostess twice about my status, apparently she didn't put my name down the first time around...Good was delicious though, I had the Amish chicken tacos! And the house Malbec

6.description: Like other reviewers mentioned, the service here is lackluster and leaves a lot to be desired.  We came on a Saturday night as a group at about 6 p.m. and the place was packed (on both sides of the restaurant).  We were able to seat ourselves in sort of a lounge-y waiting area and receive service from either side, so we opted to do that.  It as definitely not the most comfortable arrangement, but it beat waiting over an hour for a table just to eat some pizza or whatever.  Lots of people say the service is slow, so maybe it's not just because we sat at this weird lounge table.  We were able to get drinks and the full menus from either side, but there were a lot of people passing by and it just felt crowded because of our location in the restaurant.Food was good but a bit overpriced.  The quality was fine but it wasn't like the greatest thing I've ever eaten before.  The gluten-free selection was great, which was awesome for one of the people we were eating with, and the appetizers were delicious.  All in all, I can say for sure that I don't care much for Lincoln Park and this place just exemplifies the restaurants that are trying to be "high-end" for the rich clientele of the neighborhood and end up serving normal, mediocre food like a billion other restaurants in Chicago.

22.description: Super cute atmosphere! Feels like summer even in the middle of a Chicago winter. However, everything is overpriced for the quality of food. Fries were rock. solid. seriously they were terrible. They messed up my friends order, and my steak was very undercooked. Drinks are super overpriced I've never seen anything like it.Literally oven made pizza would have been a better meal.

15.description: Took my daughter here for her 18th birthday special dinner. Had a great time! Loud but good energy. Restaurant has been open about two years now. This was my first visit. Nowhere to park in the tight neighborhood so you pretty much have to use valet if you drive. $14 valet fee which basically means 20 bucks because you gotta tip them. The service was quick courteous and friendly. No gripes on that but just be aware.Food was wonderfully tasty! My one and only complaint was food temperature. My steak was lukewarm. Sure, I could've sent it back but I was hungry. And I don't like sending food back. It should be right the first time. I felt all of our plates and they were all cold. Not the food, the plates. The plates coming from the kitchen, from ANY kitchen, must must be heated. You put a $27 steak on a cold plate and it's going to sap the heat right out of that food, and fast. Sure, I'm being picky but that's how I like it.The waiter and the service was fantastic. Fix the small glitch and it's a five star joint! Do go and visit because the food was tasty and the service was great.

57.description: First off, it's super adorable! You totally feel like you can be right in Santa Monica at the time. The food is pretty damn good, both brunch and dinner. Make a reservation!!!

20.description: Took my daughter here for her 18th birthday special dinner. Had a great time! Loud but good energy. Restaurant has been open about two years now. This was my first visit. Nowhere to park in the tight neighborhood so you pretty much have to use valet if you drive. $14 valet fee which basically means 20 bucks because you gotta tip them. The service was quick courteous and friendly. No gripes on that but just be aware.Food was wonderfully tasty! My one and only complaint was food temperature. My steak was lukewarm. Sure, I could've sent it back but I was hungry. And I don't like sending food back. It should be right the first time. I felt all of our plates and they were all cold. Not the food, the plates. The plates coming from the kitchen, from ANY kitchen, must must be heated. You put a $27 steak on a cold plate and it's going to sap the heat right out of that food, and fast. Sure, I'm being picky but that's how I like it.The waiter and the service was fantastic. Fix the small glitch and it's a five star joint! Do go and visit because the food was tasty and the service was great.

36.description: Summer House is always a great time!  Went there for my birthday brunch one year... this year went with a group of girls for a surprise bridal shower.   We were sat in the Vitamin D room.  This is room is gorgeous and very bright!   Some of the girls brought flowers for the bride-to-be.   Our server was so sweet and brought us a mason jar vase to put the flowers in to help us decorate the table a bit more.     We all ordered an array of dishes which we all loved completely! Chips & Guac - we got this item free because I checked in on Yelp.   This was your basic chips and guac.   The chips, however, were a bit different and really good.  Full of grains and yumminess. Short Rib Hash - super yummy!!! The potatoes in this hash were diced so small and were so crisp. Our Very Nice Carmelized French Toast - um.... just that.... very very very nice indeed! one of the best french toasts I've had in the city. The portion size of this item is pretty large.... we got it for the table to share. Chicken & Waffles - Honestly I've had better.  These are a bit on the dry side. Avocado Toast - definitely a must!  Super yummmmmmmy. I've tried making something similar at home, but it definitely did not turn out as good as this one! All in all our experience was very flavourful.   I would definitely recommend Summer House to anyone.  Oh! When you walk in you can buy their as-huge-as-your-face cookies! (they are all very delicious!)

14.description: Super cute atmosphere! Feels like summer even in the middle of a Chicago winter. However, everything is overpriced for the quality of food. Fries were rock. solid. seriously they were terrible. They messed up my friends order, and my steak was very undercooked. Drinks are super overpriced I've never seen anything like it.Literally oven made pizza would have been a better meal.

0.description: Best massage I've gotten.  She is very knowledgeable about the body and knows what to do to help you feel better.  I work behind a computer most of the day and she helps all the way from my wrist pain to my shoulder pain.  I've become a regular and it's done wonders to my well being and stress level too.  I highly recommend her!

1.description: Went there and the whole crowd spoke Polish. I only give it a average rating because the bartender was like the hottest chick I have ever seen. Just a small neighborhood bar of better quality than some of the other ones within walking distance I will rate next.

0.description: Well, Casual Tap closed early, and such was the beginning of a weird Wednesday night. I couldn't get into the idea of skulking into the Six Penny, so my friends and I opted for trying the Twilight Lounge, a place we'd passed on the street but never given the time of day. Or night. Whatever.It was pretty bright, pretty clean, and pretty cheap. They didn't have video game bowling, but they did have video game bags.
