I don't know how I feel about the fact that, not only did I play, but I got into it. The regulars seemed all right, not loud, not friendly, just minding their own business, chilling. You know, Wednesday night type stuff. I pumped some cash into the juke box and downloaded a little Jane's Addiction, a little Musical Youth. The bummer with this place came from two sources. One, the men's bathroom. It looked clean, like the rest of the place, but the stink of piss from 1986 sledgehammered my face when I opened the door. I almost yakked. Yikes. The other, only mild bummer, was the lurker who didn't get the hint. I was out with a couple lady friends, none of whom seemed interested into the Shins playing, keyboard smacking long haired hippie who kept talking to them. He started off innocently enough, making a flower out of a napkin for one of the girls. She thanked him, put it on the table, and went back to bags. He didn't get it. From that point on, he would give up, sit quietly and watch us, and then convince himself that coming back over and interrupting our conversation was a good idea. Are you for serious? Yeah. I was a lot of people's boyfriends last night, if you catch my meaning.

3.description: Just a good neighborhood bar quiet during the day. .busier at night bar tender is friendly.  Just a good place to sit drop some cash on the bar have a few cold ones and see where the juke box takes you.

1.description: What a great little neighborhood bar..Eileen the bartender is very funny and very friendly ....makes you feel right at home in this cozy little shot and a beer joint. The beer is the coldest in town and its very reasonably priced.....  got a pool table , and the bathrooms are clean..... everything you want in the neighborhood bar.

2.description: Ted's Place seems like the kind of bar you'd need to visit once a week for a decade in order to truly appreciate. It's a likeable enough place that I'd do that myself, if it weren't for hundreds of other Old Style neighborhood taps with names following the [Somebody's] [Something] pattern... most of which probably also feature an electronic jukebox, pool table, darts, a dozen or so mass-produced beers, a Facebook page, and a Molson Golden whiteboard listing upcoming birthdays of regulars. The front bar was completely occupied (even on a school night), so a friend and I each took down bottle of Stroh's from a back table and let the Beatles accompany our wait for the next day to arrive.

0.description: Ted's Place is total Portage Park dive bar, and that's exactly what we were looking for! Cold beers, friendly bartender, pool table, a Touch Tunes jukebox, and surprisingly clean bathrooms...that checks just about all my dive bar boxes! Also surprising was that the music didn't screech to a halt when a group of non-regulars walked through the door - divey and welcoming, it's a cozy corner bar I'll definitely return to.

1.description: Had to stop by here last night - we were walking past & my daughter was insistent that we stop in based upon the delicious smells alone.  We picked up some sausage along with some goat cheese & pasta.  The sausage was absolutely delicious - I'm not certain what types of spices they use, but it is extremely unique.  The woman behind the counter was sweet as can be and extremely helpful.   The selection is limited, however well worth a stop by for a weekend bbq.

2.description: Saravale's is a Romanian meat market and deli owned by some of the nicest people you can imagine.  I stopped in here in hope of finding a quart of milk and I walked out with three tins of pate and six sausages.  How did that happen?  Well there wasn't any milk, but I'm the sort of person who likes to look around a bit once I'm in, and I was intrigued by all the sausages in the case.  I was told that they were all made on the premises, which is frequently a very good sign.  Unfortunately I had no idea what any of them were, and wasn't too keen on just taking a wild stab at buying, oh, a pound of this or half a pound of that, and finding that I HATED all of it.  But I did find some little tins of pate on one of the counters, and they were inexpensive and looked like something I might enjoy, so I bought one each of the chicken, pork and tuna.  (So far I can say the chicken was a disappointment, but not a huge one.)While I was paying for them, one of the owners said "Do you have a grill?"  "Yes," I said.  "I want you to try something," she said, and proceeded to bring out a package of sausages which she GAVE me.  Seriously, just put them into my bag and said "I think you'll like these."  This never happens, right?Then another customer said  "Oh those are great, you'll love them."  So that night we grilled them up and I have to say that they were really good.  I don't know what they're called but they were garlicky and spicy, and not greasy.  I'm seriously thinking about walking back up there and getting more for this weekend.  Or maybe trying something else.  Whatever.  The point here is that the quality is high, the people are lovely and the prices are very reasonable even when they're not giving away samples.Yet another small, local, ethnic food store that really should be better known.

0.description: I spent two years in the Peace Corps in Romania and I got back a few months ago.  I was missing Romania so I decided to do a search for shops here in Chicago with Romanian produce.  As soon as we walked in, we were greeted in Romanian which about made us cry because of how much we missed that hospitality.  I purchased some smoked Transylvanian sausages, goat's cheese, catabosi, zacusca, and slanina, all for right around 20 dollars.  We were also given a package of mici which we promptly went home and grilled up later that night.  They were also willing to point us in the direction to where we could buy some Romanian beer and wine.  So far, everything I have eaten from there has been great, and a taste of my second home in Romania.

3.description: Great coffee and tea. Have not been able to find in any grocery store in Chicagoland area. Tried to order a $3.00 box of tea online direct but canceled order when shipping/handling to a suburb of Chicago was $12.90 alone.  Sad.

1.description: Just about to order my must have favorite coffee, which I do every month. Online ordering, reasonable prices, always smooth, never bitter flavor, family business since 1913. Estate grown Arabica beans for ultimate premium coffee blends. Highest levels of freshness and richness. Wish it was a little more convenient and they offered in grocery stores here like up North, but ordering online is easy and the product comes pretty fast.I am always so devastated when I run out and have to wait for my order.Starbucks is so hyped up, expensive, and just not my style of a good cup of coffee.Stewarts, thanks for making my mornings much nicer with a fresh brewed cup of coffee, ha well several.....Customer for life, you are the best!

2.description: The coffee is wonderful; I've been drinking Stewart's for about 20 years. The problem I have with them is that the weight you THINK you're buying, you're NOT getting. The typical can states that its net weight is 23 ounces. The ACTUAL amount of coffee you're BUYING  is 1 oz LESS, 22 ounces. It's NOT an isolated incident.  I continued to weigh my coffee for months and EVERY CAN came up 1 oz SHORT. I think that Stewarts knows dam* well that they are shorting their customers. Since the cost for a can has skyrocketed over the years from a little over $6 a can to over $9, I think that they owe their customers an honest weight and measure.I'm taking this issue to a consumer bureau.

5.description: This is wonderful coffee.  It has been passed down in our family for several generations.  My parents wouldn't think of drinking anything other than Stewarts, and I feel the same.

0.description: We have been drinking Stewarts Columbian brew for years and years. My brother buys it is case quantities he's so afraid of not being able to find or run out! Jewel sells it but I just saw online that supposedly Walmart does too? My specialty grocery store in St Charles can't seem to get this any longer even though their customers are requesting it in the 23 oz cans....I hope they receive it because I can only find it at Jewel in St Charles and don't want to switch to another brand. Joan

4.description: Stewarts has long been my favorite coffee, I even went so far as to have my family ship it to me when I lived in New York (days before internet ordering).  To this day, I will go into stores to do my shopping, and inform the manager if they do not have Stewarts that they will lose my custom.  I only wish Stewarts would open some Chicago themed coffee shops as an alternative to Starbucks.

58.description: I love this place and come here often, but the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I had a bad experience here today. We ordered our appetizers then our dinner. After we ate our appetizers we got our soup or salad then after we were done with that we were expecting our dinner to come, but instead the waitress comes up to me and said that the pasta I ordered they were out of. You are an Italian restaurant, how do you run out of pasta?! Also, why did it take so long for them to tell me they ran out of pasta and asked if I wanted a different type instead. If i wanted a different type dont you think i would've  ordered it??  Needless to say I won't be back for quite some time...

56.description: Bar food, sandy clams, slow service. Overpriced. Lame. Not coming back.

29.description: What a great pizza place!  My boyfriend and I have to travel a bit to get there, but it is so worth the drive.  We only have the thin crust, but it is delicious.  I highly recommend Poretta's pizza.

42.description: Decided to make it a pizza night and ordered at this place. It was delicious and recommend it to anyone who lives around the area that likes good pizza plus fast delivery. Other pizza places around here are not as good as this place. I had a sausage which was good, aside was tasty,  and crust just right !

23.description: Great pizza! I used to always get take-out, but then I took my wife to eat in around Christmas time, and it was decorated so nice and there was live music, such a wonderful time!  Can't wait to go back!

47.description: Best stuffed and pan pizza ever! I've had the sausage and pepperoni regular crust, I don't think it was thin crust. It was good, but the sausage stuffed is the best and the sausage and pepperoni pan. We always get a medium, but I think it must really be a large. I've never seen a medium pizza that huge.Gooey and hot and flavorful! Seasoned well.

8.description: We like this place, they always have good bread, fresh and hot. We go there for their pizza! Nice environment and you don't have to drive so much to get there

31.description: Finally a great pizza in this neighborhood. We have tried every spot around here and have been very disappointed... We are pizza snobs... a tasty crust with good flavored sauce, and fresh ingredients IS A MUST!'  This place hit the mark. We did take out....

34.description: We frequent this establishment quite often, although it's been awhile since last visit.  Went last nite on a Friday night. Was in the area and went to celebrate  birthday.  Appetizer was fried Calamari, still tasty but definitely smaller portion than past and more expensive.  1 Butterfly shrimp dinner , ok.  1 chicken vesuvio not as good as past and way smaller portion. 1 cheese ravioli with meat sauce just ok and not to many ravioli about 6 hidden in the sauce.  1 more ravioli with meat & meat sauce same, just ok.  Glass of wine a couple cokes. Bill with tip about $110.  Had a tiramisu to go, upon opening  it, looked like soup.  The worse part was the service, very unprofessional service and waited extremely long for meals.  Understandable if crowded, but was nearly empty.  Not sure if will return, but I always like to give local places a 2nd or 3rd try.

16.description: Best thin crust pizza in Portage Park, bar none.

13.description: I have been ordering from this place for about two years and all I can say is delicious!!! We always get there pizza family pack which is a steal, and just recently I ordered the spaghetti and it was to die for. Will keep ordering from here because of the fantastic pizza and wonderful service!!! :)

11.description: Fantasic food and unbelievable pizza! And don't forget the catering great for parties.

39.description: Great place  and food keep coming here a  lot the only thing is that the wait is always long even when they are not busy..

37.description: Good pizza and Italian food. Moderately priced. If you're in the neighborhood I would recommend but otherwise there are plenty of other options throughout the city for good Italian food.

0.description: Do your self a favor and please try their chicken Caesar salad. Best $12 I spent. It's amazing and full of flavor.

38.description: So the pickup entrance is on the northwest side of the building. Waveland is a one-way going east so if you're coming from Central... you'd have to make a circle to get to it. It's a bland grey door and when you open it, you see the washroom immediately to your right. Had it not been for another yelper, I would have thought I was in the wrong place but when I looked left, there was a small counter with a nice lady who got my pickup order. Looks like this area is where the drivers wait.My bf loves sauces of all kinds so he wasn't happy that this pizza was very subtle on the sauce. I thought it was very yummy but next time I'll order with extra sauce and see if that will make a difference. I still thought the pizza was delicious.*edit*I was doing a pizza "test" around my area for a party and this place won. I ordered two extra large pizzas (one with extra sauce so I could test it). Unfortunately, I wasn't able to try it out for myself because I was running around doing stuff but multiple people asked where this pizza was from so I'm taking that as a success.

51.description: The restaurant is a great local treasure.  I've probably eaten one of everything off the menu and its all good.  Good fresh pasta dishes, fresh bread, great thin as well as stuffed pizzas, the creamy garlic dressing is also a must try.    I've had parties for 25 guests at the restaurant,  I've had catering, take out as well as pizza delivery from them and its always been a great experience.

27.description: Outstanding Italian food.  This is not your fancy downtown cuisine.. This is the type of Italian food your grandmother used to make. The chicken risotto, chicken Marsala and penne arribiata with sausage are my favorite dishes. I love starting with a pizza as an appetizer as well bc it's so incredibly delicious I can't make a trip to Poretta's without with.I've brought dozens of friends and family members here and it's become an instant favorite. If you want fancy and overpriced go to RPM Italian downtown. If you want incredibly delicious, huge portions and affordable this is your place. This is my favorite Italian restaurant of all time.

32.description: My family and I have been ordering our pizza from Porrettas since we moved into the neighborhood in 2003. I have bragged countless times to many people in this pizza-loving city that we are lucky to have the best thin crust pizza in our pocket of the NW side. In addition to their perfect sausage pizza, sometimes we splurge and have their bruschetta too which is garlic-y and smothered in tomatoes, which happens to be exactly how I like it.  Definitely do yourself a favor and give it a try.

54.description: Local neighborhood Italian Trattoria  been going here forever! Its nice when you've moved away for three years, walk in and they remember your name and ask where have you been. The service was excellent as usual.The Seafood appetizer is my favorite item on the menu, perfectly cooked, grilled and dressed!The Bolognese with Sausage is incredible, I cannot stop eating the bread! I'm happy to know that I live close enough that they will deliver!

48.description: the food and service here is great. definitely coming back again.

44.description: I had porretta's catering yesterday for a baby shower. It was great and my guests were very pleased. The chicken Vesuvius was the best I ever ate. I would never hesitate to recommend them.

24.description: Jane is the best at Porettas! She always greets us with a smile! This restaurant has wonderful food and we love coming back as a family.

7.description: Best pizza in the NW side and best authentic Italian food. All sauces made from scratch, and you can taste it. Excellent service. Definitely one of the most underrated restaurants in Chicago.

49.description: Amazing place. Welcoming atmosphere and a nice staff. Don't even ask bout the pizza because its amazing. Seriously a very good place and an ideal spot for a date. Even casual dates are good here. Visit this place.

40.description: John & his staff  our on point.Great food and specials.Nice cozy bar in the back area which we just found out about with a nice bartender. Will be a go to spot now.Always order and now we go in.

53.description: Very nice service.  I called ahead to be sure that we would get seated.  Good food, good ambiance.  Try the lasagne and raspberry tartufo. yum.

30.description: This place is wonderful! I went with my family and we loved our food. We ordered a seafood appetizer that have everything included (muscles, shrimp, squid, octopus), we only wished there were more shrimps. We had 2 pizza's a Veggie from their menu which was delicious (even great warmed up the next day or cold) and a hand tossed (deep dish) spinach and shrimp (baby shrimp). For dessert we got a coffee which was made fresh for us, a tea (huge and wonderfully tasty selection), and a cannoli. All was wonderful and served cooked fresh and timely.

46.description: If you want GOOD PASTA this is your place, this is real Italian food!! Pricey but if your hungry and not in the mood to cook but want GOOD food!  You won't regret this place! I had my food delivered, pasta with vodka sauce and chicken and chicken alfredo and it was fresh as can be, nicely packaged with breads and soup.  I can't wait to try the pizza I read so much about! The portions are nice and big, I had leftovers for lunch and it was still good!

1.description: Rosa J. has officially become a new resident in Portage Park.  "Foodie on Foot" has instinctively detected the presence of the closest restaurant to our house: Porretta's Trattoria.  While Porretta's Trattoria certainly has an more upscale and intimate dine-in option, the steel side door on Waveland serves as the carry-out center.  By the way, parking is more than sufficient on Central and on Waveland behind the restaurant.  Hubby called in four-five (45) minutes for an order of large, 14-inch stuffed pizza ($25.24 after tax, as of 10/26/2015) with these three (3) ingredients: spinach, green olives, and zucchini.  What I could tell was that this stuffed pizza will have a plenty of leftovers for at least two (2) more meals.  For a neighborhood standard, their stuffed pizza was excellent!  The pizza was nearly perfect except I preferred a slightly softer crust.  Porretta's was a bit "stiff" to me.  I rendered a full score for their abundance of cheese and all the main ingredients we requested.  They obviously didn't skimp on the "stuffed" portion.  I will definitely strive to be a regular at Porretta's.  Their carry-out menu is surprisingly extensive.  I'm very glad a quality family-friendly restaurant and take-out joint is some feet away from us!

55.description: This place is the absolute best for traditional, authentic Italian food. The owner, Johnny, will personally make sure you enjoy your meal. The atmostphere is fantastic. The location, Portage Park, means you don't have to go downtown for really good food. It's very affordable as well. I will be back!!!!!

9.description: Amazing pizza. This has become our goto spot for ordering thin crust pizza.

26.description: This is THEE best Italian place around this area, maybe even beyond this neighborhood! Delivery is fast. Highly recommend their pizza. I've ordered alot of diff't food from there, all of it has always been great. With my work schedule I order from them 2-3 times a week. I HIGHLY recommend this place to my guests & to anybody that reads this.

25.description: Canned mushrooms, bad sauce, undercooked sausage.  Horrible service on the phone, resulting in a salad that was the size of a cupcake... and forgot soda. Driver blamed phone gal; phone gal blammed driver.  Offered "credit in the mail for next time". Pizza dinner without paid-for soda and salad... WHAT next time ??!##!Offered a $3 credit for soda... that was never delivered!!  And the mgr. "John" conveniently "just stepped out". So as not to gave to talk to me.

12.description: Best pizza in Chicago.Great Italian food.I have been going there for 15 years.Delicious.

59.description: Went to this restaurant as a last-minute dinner date with old friends. I loved it! I only had the Caprese salad, due to the fact that I was full from an earlier dinner- but my friends liked their pasta and seafood dishes. The restaurant was very accommodating, and considering we walked in around 8PM (with no reservation), the service was pretty good. Our waitress was friendly, and she often checked up on us. The restaurant has a very cozy feel to it, and I will definitely go there again and try an actual dish.

21.description: I live dangerously close to this place and they have some of the best thin cracker crust pizza I've had. I've had their stuffed gnocchi as well, also good!

17.description: Canned mushrooms, bad sauce, undercooked sausage.  Horrible service on the phone, resulting in a salad that was the size of a cupcake... and forgot soda. Driver blamed phone gal; phone gal blammed driver.  Offered "credit in the mail for next time". Pizza dinner without paid-for soda and salad... WHAT next time ??!##!Offered a $3 credit for soda... that was never delivered!!  And the mgr. "John" conveniently "just stepped out". So as not to gave to talk to me.

10.description: We usually hang out at the restaurant. They always know what we want. Just ordered pizza delivery and it was as fresh as we get it at the restaurant. The owner is also always there to make sure you have a good time. One of my favorite places. Great food every time.

5.description: This restaurant has been one of my families favorites since I was a child!  Every Friday was Pizza from Poretta's!  John and his staff are wonderful. The Lasagna,  Chicken Parmesan & the Giambotta is to die for!  :)

3.description: I grew up across the street from this place so it was our go to pizza place. The pizza is delicious and always fresh and crisp. I also love the oyster Rockefeller which is oysters stuffed with creamy spinach. Delicious! If you haven't already give this place a try.

35.description: Well they have changed EVERYTHING about their pizza! Totally disgusting and 1 star is to much. The cheese and sauce are just atrocious and I will NOT be ordering from them again! It will be LaVillas from now on.

19.description: I live dangerously close to this place and they have some of the best thin cracker crust pizza I've had. I've had their stuffed gnocchi as well, also good!

28.description: Looooooove this place so much! Everything on the menu is delicious.

45.description: just have the best ribs of my life!!!!

33.description: Just came in for a pizza. It's that herby thin crust that we just love but can't find anywhere outside the Chicagoland area. Pizza is the same as we remember. Service was mediocre at best and the restaurant is definitely dated, with a couple random canvas photos of babies amidst the other framed prints. Odd. Good pizza, but I would just get it to go.

43.description: This is a place that's been in the Portage Park area for years, but mostly known for being a pizza place and a banquet hall. The Trattoria across the street is pretty damn good too. The Filleto Tornado is awesome! And they have the best tiramisu I've ever had. The pasta and pizza are always excellent, and it's perfect for a quiet relaxing dinner . The staff is always attentive, and you are always greeted with a smile. The prices are very reasonable, and the portions are huge. This is real Italian food. If your in the area and looking for a solid food, this is a never miss place to go for great Italian.

2.description: i came to this restaurant mistaking it for another Italian restaurant i had bookmarked and wanted to try, but i was very happy me and my cousin decided to have dinner here! Phenomenal service from our waitress Elizabeth who made a very delicious pasta recommendation-Rigatoni boscaiola! We liked their thin crust pizza-Medium thin crust pizza with Pepperoni and Canadian bacon! The price is reasonable for the huge portions they provide! The place was casual and abit classy(the area we were seated at had some wall-mounted TV's so nice to watch the Bulls game; lighting was not too dark and not too bright; candlelight at table and music give it that touch of class...Im looking forward to my next time so i can try more delicious food options!

18.description: So the pickup entrance is on the northwest side of the building. Waveland is a one-way going east so if you're coming from Central... you'd have to make a circle to get to it. It's a bland grey door and when you open it, you see the washroom immediately to your right. Had it not been for another yelper, I would have thought I was in the wrong place but when I looked left, there was a small counter with a nice lady who got my pickup order. Looks like this area is where the drivers wait.My bf loves sauces of all kinds so he wasn't happy that this pizza was very subtle on the sauce. I thought it was very yummy but next time I'll order with extra sauce and see if that will make a difference. I still thought the pizza was delicious.*edit*I was doing a pizza "test" around my area for a party and this place won. I ordered two extra large pizzas (one with extra sauce so I could test it). Unfortunately, I wasn't able to try it out for myself because I was running around doing stuff but multiple people asked where this pizza was from so I'm taking that as a success.

41.description: I visited this place on Father's Day weekend and I am glad I did. The service was great and the food superb! Huge portions are served, the appetizers are great, and all authentic. We had appetizers, meals and dessert for a very low price and still had more than half our meals to take home. The owner is always around to help and make sure every table gets only the best service. Definitely going back!

52.description: Amazing thin crust pizza!  I lived across the street from the family who owns Porettas and they are wonderful people.  I grew up having this pizza every friday for at least 20 years.  The pasta is amazing too!

50.description: Hooray for gluten free pizza.  About 3-4 months ago I had a conversation with the owner about how I used to go a lot before my wife was diagnosed with a gluten intolerance.  I found out a few days ago that they now offer gluten free crust.  I tried it out on Sunday and think it's the best of the limited gf choices we have in the hood.

4.description: I went here for Valentine's Day this year with my girlfriend. We had made reservations for 5pm and got in and were seated right away. I ordered the fried calamari as an appetizer and it was phenomenal. Then when we got to ordering our main dishes my girlfriend asked about one and our waitress had no knowledge of the menu or how to help when we asked for recommendations. Also we ordered our meals at 5:20 and did not end up getting our food until 6:35 I kept telling the waitress we had a movie to catch at 7:30 and she kept telling us that it was coming right out but it kept taking longer and longer. Then the waitress was acting kind of rude the rest of the evening. The food at this place is very good but the service is terrible, well at least the waitress we had. Wouldn't come back here to dine in.

6.description: The food and service here is outstanding !  Pastas are fresh sauces are delicious I want to try the pizza next time the table next to me was serve a pizza and it looked deliciously tempting .  When we left we were issued a coupon for 15% off our next visit... Now that is great marketing and yes so worth a return visit !

22.description: I have not tried anything but the pizza, and the thin crust is really good. Best option for delivery in the neighborhood. Typical "chicago style" thin crust pizza. Not at all like NY style thin crust, but really tasty. The sauce is homemade and I recommend ordering extra. Toppings are plentiful and the sausage is incredible. Mushrooms are canned, but I prefer them anyway. Almost too much cheese. If you like extra cheese this is the pizza for you. I have ordered pizza several times and it is always consistent and delicious. Way better than La Villa down the street.

15.description: Just came in for a pizza. It's that herby thin crust that we just love but can't find anywhere outside the Chicagoland area. Pizza is the same as we remember. Service was mediocre at best and the restaurant is definitely dated, with a couple random canvas photos of babies amidst the other framed prints. Odd. Good pizza, but I would just get it to go.

57.description: Growing up in Jefferson Park meant that our pizza options were confined to the hit-or-miss Rosatis, a Paternos which graced its paper thin crust with heaps of grease, and a Papa Joe's that draws nothing exceptional to a memory except that of outstanding mediocrity.These were, for the most part, the options from which our  Chicago beating hearts, pumping mozzarella and sausage through the veins, were suffered to choose between. However, all of this changed when my father, by some fantastical grace, brought home Porretta's. You may think I'm being over dramatic, but I assure you that this pizza is so good that it justifies whatever manner you use to describe the joy which is Porretta's pizza. I mean, how can you really put into words the feeling you get when you bite into a crust which is crisped, but not flaky, a layering of mozzarella that builds a bridge of taste between you and the Old country, and a sauce that punches through its foundation roots to beget wonder between your teeth. Cheers for Porretta's! And cheers to those who will go on to try this great pie!

20.description: The best pizza in town in my opinion. Great bar service.. They have plenty of parking in the back re can park your car on the street.. Also recommend seafood there.

36.description: Solid Italian place. Old school atmosphere and service. Good Italian food. Pizza is really good and specials are always reliable. We had the grilled salmon with veggies when we were there. I also had the risotto de pesce but I will admit it was good but not the best. All else was good.

14.description: I used this place to have my son's graduation party catered I had the chicken Vesuvio , vesuviopotatoes Italian sausage baked mostaccioli green beans  The food was phenomenal I had more than enough for the 20 people. the delivery driver Mark was incredible he told us exactly what to do as far as keeping the food fresh and hot I have been to the restaurant couple times and I'm enjoyed the food and the catering is just as wonderful I highly recommend this place for catering almanaque doubt and the owner John really went out of his way to take care of me and I appreciate that. For catering needs or just a romantic night out or even a night with friends this is the place to go

58.description: Really nice place!   The food and service were great!  I will be back!

56.description: Really disappointed by the menu descriptions. I ordered rigatoni with spicy Italian sausage and there was no heat at all to the dish.  Spicy was the only reason I was ordering it.The only other drawback was we sat in the bar and the bartender seemed to be the only person that could accomplish anything. Well that may seem like a good thing, that meant that she was absent from the bar often. She had to run her own food, find chairs for the bar, restock the bar when items are in low, etc., this caused a little wait time for refills on drinks.  The drinks were delicious though, the food was cooked properly, the ambience and decor is modern and fun.

29.description: Best place in the neighborhood. I love what supporosa did with the place. If your looking for a great date night or want to experience great beers on tap this is a great spot to go. Ask for Robbie the bartender if your at the bar and enjoy. PS. The food is amazing.

42.description: Hubby and I went here on a Wed for date night at 6:30pmDecor is ansolutely stunningI got the lobster mac, great!Hubby got the 12oz black angus rib eye pizzaiola he liked as wellGreat drinks menuOne star deducted, because although attentive and sweet, out server was EXTREMELY busy. She did the best she could. But, she was assigned tables inside AND outside! Poor thing. I still would definitely come back!

23.description: I've never tasted worse pizza in my life. Overpriced and a complete piece of junk. Consumers beware! To add insult to injury the pizza was not even CUT! Are you serious? What a joke!

47.description: We really enjoyed our dinner.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The food was delicious.  We will be back.

8.description: Came by for a late night dinner. First time in there it was pretty great Wild duck ravioli kinda tasted like it came out of a microwave. Experience was lovely though and the staff was really nice.

31.description: Legno used to be known as Suparossa before it was rehabbed and upscaled. We have been loyal customers of this place for years but no more. No doubt, the physical redo was first class - the place looks great and the environment is nice - BUT the food now is just awful.  Mind you, it looks pretty on the plate but that is all.  The pizza we ordered came burnt - literally black around edges but it was pretty.  The chicken dish, likewise, was pretty but wholly uncooked and the portion was small.  When they upscaled, it appears that they also decided to change their food - make it more upscale looking by making it pretty.  Bad decision. In Jefferson Park, the people don't want pretty, they want good and they want it done right.  Unfortunately, the management  now appears to think they are located in the Lakeview or Lincoln Park areas - where pretty rules. Also, I am guessing that to recoup that cost of rehabbing, the management decided also to upscale the prices and downscale the portions. Another Bad Decision.   There is a single saving grace - as far as I still know - the old Suparossa kitchen and its staff still exists to handle orders on a delivery or carry out basis.  There are separate menus. My advice right now is stick with the old.  In nutshell, If you want to dine in and want first class food with decent portions at decent prices, avoid Legno. With so many other Italian places in the Jefferson Park area, finding better for less is very easy.

34.description: Super fresh, amazing flavors and fast delivery. Can't wait to try dine in!

16.description: I wasn't sure what to expect when meeting some friends for a Legno dinner. I only knew this place as Supparosa so seeing this modern dining room was a breath of fresh air for the neighborhood. The menu keeps to the Italian roots of Supparosa but just like the decor there were some modern takes and classics. The prosciutto wrapped dates were hit with everyone and the beef carpaccio was an unexpected surprise. Who knew raw beef could be that good?. Everything else I tried seemed like care went into creating it. I'll say this. If you're thinking about going somewhere like olive garden to get "italian" food. Give Legno a try instead. The prices are pretty reasonable and you'll get quality. Plus if you live on the northwest side you won't even need to go into the city. Along with The Portage there seems to be a culinary revival going on in Portage Park.

13.description: Hubby and I went here on a Wed for date night at 6:30pmDecor is ansolutely stunningI got the lobster mac, great!Hubby got the 12oz black angus rib eye pizzaiola he liked as wellGreat drinks menuOne star deducted, because although attentive and sweet, out server was EXTREMELY busy. She did the best she could. But, she was assigned tables inside AND outside! Poor thing. I still would definitely come back!

11.description: I have had a rough weekend and was trying to make life a little easier by having dinner delivered. I heard good things about Legno and decided to order a thin crust pizza from them through GrubHub, since I had a promo code about to expire. Maybe the Legno experience is different in the restaurant versus delivery, but this is the worst pizza I've ever had. Not trying to be dramatic-- just giving you a warning in case you were thinking about ordering from them down the road. Maybe it's just that it's a Sunday evening, but I cannot get over how terrible this pizza truly was. It was not cut into slices before it was delivered, arrived pretty much cold (maybe "lukewarm," to be nice), and was missing one of the major ingredients listed in its description. It was supposed to be a Margarita thin crust pizza (fresh tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella). There were no tomatoes on the pizza AT ALL. There seemed to be a little bit of sauce around the edges but none actually between the cheese and crust of the rest of the pizza. The cheese was pure rubber consistency-- I was able to pick the entire layer of cheese off the pizza with one finger. Lastly, there were 4 pieces of basil that tasted like they had gone bad. Not wanting the purchase to be a complete waste, I shoved two "slices" down my throat. The consistency of it in my mouth was one of the grossest textures ever. Not worth the money. I wouldn't even had accepted it if it were free. If you decide to order from here, beware!!! (And good luck!)

39.description: The first visit was yummy. Subsequent visits, including tonight, were very disappointing. In a nutshell food (other than pizza) is bland and not worth the price, however low it is compared to other area gastropubs. One pro, the service is always stellar. Never again unfortunately.

37.description: I wasn't sure what to expect when meeting some friends for a Legno dinner. I only knew this place as Supparosa so seeing this modern dining room was a breath of fresh air for the neighborhood. The menu keeps to the Italian roots of Supparosa but just like the decor there were some modern takes and classics. The prosciutto wrapped dates were hit with everyone and the beef carpaccio was an unexpected surprise. Who knew raw beef could be that good?. Everything else I tried seemed like care went into creating it. I'll say this. If you're thinking about going somewhere like olive garden to get "italian" food. Give Legno a try instead. The prices are pretty reasonable and you'll get quality. Plus if you live on the northwest side you won't even need to go into the city. Along with The Portage there seems to be a culinary revival going on in Portage Park.

0.description: First time visitor.  Let's start out with the service.  Outstanding.  Edgar took the time to ask and memorize our names and he was very personable.  They had a nice drink menu but I stuck with the classic Vodka martini.  Edgar wasn't sure on the premium vodkas in stock but he promised to tell me if they didn't have Ketel One or Belvedere.  Now we had a couple starters.  These were hit or miss.  The Grilled Octopus was a definite hit!  My goodness, flavorful and seasoned well.  The Zucchini Blossoms on the other hand were a big miss.  I don't get why anyone would take beautiful blossoms and turn them into what looked like donut fritters.  The blossom might have been in this deep fried mess, but I would never have known.  For dinner, had the lobster diavolo.  They did well with the seafood here - not a fishy taste in the bunch (clams, muscles and lobster) on top of a bed of fresh tasting linguini. Dessert was the gelato with chocolate cake (they called it something else but that's what it tasted like).  This was a plus as well.  Overall, a decent experience and I definitely will go back and request Edgar again.

38.description: Legno is one of mine and my husbands favorite places to go in the Portage Park neighborhood.  The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  One waitress in particular shines and her name is Nancy, I know she works Wednesday evenings.  The food is perfection and the ambiance is perfect!  The beer and wine list changes constantly, it's the perfect place for fun with family or friends!  I always recommend Legno!

51.description: The ambiance of Legno is wonderful. The decor and space are very appealing. The service has also been overall very good both times we've gone. Unfortunately, my thoughts on the food are mixed. We had mussels for an appetizer, which were very flavorful. The cauliflower and brussel sprouts side was absolutely delicious. The lobster risotto was good, but not great. My biggest issue was with the margharita pizza. It came out and immediately looked soggy. When we brought it up, the waiter told us that when you use fresh mozzarella cheese, it is going to be watery. It was so watery that the sauce was diluted to a pink color and the bottom of all the crust was soaked through and soggy. I've had plenty of pizzas with fresh mozzarella that do not have these issues. I will be back because I really want to give this place a chance. Will update the review if the food is more consistent.

27.description: Amazing dinner at Legno! My wife and I just purchased a house in Portage Park. We been looking for great places to eat and we are so thankful that we found this restaurant! George was our server, he was laid back and explained multiple dishes for us. Couldn't have asked for a nicer midweek meal on the patio. Lobster Mac and cheese is delicious. If you are in the neighborhood, make sure to check Legno out.

32.description: This little place is a gem. Authentic Mexican food. Fresh and delicious. The owners are great people. I come here all the time for pozole and tacos.

54.description: I can't speak to the quality of the food here-- because we have been sitting at our table for 90 minutes and do not yet have our food. And no explanation as to why.

48.description: I went here last night for the first time. I've been wanting to try this place since it opened, but never got around to it. I must say, so far, so good! I went with 2 other people, who too had not tried this place before & we were all very pleased. Eddie T. was our server. He was wonderful. He could tell that we were in no hurry & didn't rush us at all. He was good at explaining different dishes & giving us some recommendations. I had the Risotto Contadina & it was very flavorful. If you really like a strong mushroom taste, I would highly recommend this dish. One of my neighbors ordered the Rainbow Trout & the other ordered a pork chop dinner that was a special. We all enjoyed our dishes. Unfortunately, we did not make it to dessert because we were too full from dinner, so I will have to comment on that another time. I think this is a great addition to the neighborhood. It's different & more trendy than most places in the neighborhood. I wish there was more places like this in the area.

44.description: First time there since the remodel, it was ok. The food was good, our waiter was a nice guy, but the overall service was lacking. They brought us the wrong appetizer and forgot to bring my husbands soup. For dessert we were told they were out of one item on the menu, but everything else was fair game. Ordered the tiramisu(which was not the item we were told was sold out) only to be served chocolate cake because they ran out of tiramisu. My dinner was good though and the ambience was nice, so I'll give it another try.

24.description: My family and I religiously went to Legno's previous incarnation as Suparossa and we still order pizza from their take out business. The updated restaurant is still fantastic. I think they've made a lot of changes since they first opened to the menu which should not be missed. They also have happy hour specials and daily specials from half price appetizers to half price Neapolitan style pizzas. We also attended a party celebration there where the food and service were also great. The standouts at my last dining experience were the meatballs, croquettes, burrata and any of their pizzas. I can't wait to try the rest of the menu. The live music on Friday and Saturday nights is also a nice touch!

7.description: I found this place A-OK as yelp describes it. The decor is very cute and the service was friendly.We started with the fried calamari. Lightly breaded and very meaty. Definitely very yummy.I got the Crisp Pork Shoulder. It wasn't bad but I don't know why it's called Crisp. Some edges felt rough and hard but it wasn't what I call "crisp". The flavor was pretty good but there was celery in the pasta which ruined it for me. I find celery overpowering but that is personal preference.My husband got the risotto contadina and we liked it although the sausage felt a little out of place.All in all. It was ok but I am willing to come back and try more!

49.description: Came here for brunch. A friend recommended it and it did not disappoint. Everything was delicious. The portions are very generous and the service was on point.

40.description: Came here on a quiet Thursday night and had a very enjoyable time. The server was attentive and helpful. We tried a delicious burrata appetizer for a cold one as well as the wood roasted octopus. I'm not a fan of fishy things but I tried the octopus and even I was a little impressed by it. I had a great short rib entree that I was a very big fan of.The beer list wasn't expansive, but the variety and options they had were all great options. That's great in my book!Overally, Legno was a great spot. We enjoyed the outdoor patio, the vibe was relaxing and calm, and the food and drink were very good. Would definitely go back if I was in the area again.

53.description: Great food and great service! Very nice decor/ambience. Lobster Mac and Cheese was amazing!

30.description: Great food and great service. Thank you Megan! Fantastic happy hour specials... grilled seafood over baby greens, homemade meatballs, and sirloin carpaccio... to name a few..

46.description: Amazing. Every time I visit I am blown away. Pizza and pasta like you would taste in Napoli. Creative fish, meat and seafood dishes. I think the chef is brilliant. Don't go changing Legno, you are perfect as is. .

1.description: Slow service, nonexistent water refills and fairly flavorless seafood will keep us from returning.Valentines day weekend and not super busy.   Walked right in at 6pm.  Hostess looked like she was on her way to a 70's party complete with leg warmers.  Quickly seated but waited forever before our waiter showed up.  And when he did, he had zero personality.  The Grilled Calamari was flavorless and my Pasta con Peche was as well.  Decent red sauce but seafood not so much.Free valentines day heart shaped little cake tasted just like a Ding Dong.  Remember them?  It was the best part of the meal.This place should have stayed Suparossa.  I loved their stuffed pizza.

55.description: I have had many good experience s here.  Today stunk. The food was salty the service slow and the music some weird 99s mix.

9.description: I've only ever ordered delivery from this place - but there is one thing that is better than anything else I've had in Chicago to date....And that is their Tartufo Mushroom Pizza. Oh my heavenly mushroom gods. If you even remotely have a love of mushrooms - order this pizza. I can't order here anymore without getting one.... EVERY TIME. Their other stuff is great too - consistent quality!

26.description: My family and I have been coming here since I was a kid. We have been through all sorts of owner changes from:  Nancy's pizza, Nancy's Suparosa, to Suparosa, and now Legno. All of the other previous owner swaps have kept true to the pizza recipes not Legno. I have tried Legno's stuffed pizza at least on six different occasions. The first one was very wet and soupy. The others were progressively better in appearance however all equally horrible tasting. Unfortunately the pizza we have loved for 30+ years is gone. It's been around three months since we've been back -too many horrible meals. Not too sure what they were thinking when they changed the pizza recipe but it went horribly horribly wrong. We were hoping they would get their recipes together but it never happened. If you've never tasted the old stuff pizza recipe perhaps this place is OK however if you're seeking that true Suparosa stuffed pizza don't even bother.

25.description: My wife and I held our rehearsal dinner here for our wedding! We live in the neighborhood and wanted a nice local spot who would take care of us! Cameron (Camy), the manager was so personable, welcoming and did everything to accommodate us! He worked with us and gave great recommendations on our night would be so special! We were very satisfied! He definitely knows what customer service is all about ! Robby the bartender is also amazing! He knows everything there is to know about beer, as well as hard alcohol! This is one of our favorite  local joints! Great food , great staff and an amazing atmosphere that makes you feel right at home! Definitely first class service - thanks guys for making our experience awesome.  Everyone is still talking about your pizza!

12.description: We've been to Legno a few times before, always trying to go earlier as we had a baby (now toddler).  This weekend we had some relatives visiting from out of town, so we ended up going during the dinner rush-- not realizing they have another section that they have for parents with children.  As a parent, this restaurant is a dream.  They have an AWESOME menu for adults, high-end, delicious and not your typical kid-friendly place.  BUT they also have a kids menu, waiters who understand when your child's bed-time might be nearing, and music that's loud enough to cover most children's meltdowns while still quiet enough to have conversation.  This place allows you to have good food with your children.  Will be going here much more often and would HIGHLY recommend to anyone--with or without children.

59.description: So I ordered delivery and can't speak the the ambiance, but the food was lousy. I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately I won't be ordering again. Ordered a prosciutto mushroom pizza. Um, thin ham is not prosciutto. The cheese was unevenly distributed, crust soggy. No flavor. A bust. Well, in case of failure, I had ordered prosciutto wrapped dates. Bust there as well. First of all they were cold, prosciutto was too thick and the whole thing just wasn't good. Not inedible, but not good. Then the tiramisu. Soggy. Flavorless. Honestly disgusting. I don't turn my nose up at very many desserts, but this went into the trash with one bite taken out of it. Delivery was relatively quick, but otherwise I don't have anything positive to say.

21.description: I've only ever ordered delivery from this place - but there is one thing that is better than anything else I've had in Chicago to date....And that is their Tartufo Mushroom Pizza. Oh my heavenly mushroom gods. If you even remotely have a love of mushrooms - order this pizza. I can't order here anymore without getting one.... EVERY TIME. Their other stuff is great too - consistent quality!

17.description: Too expensive and service was bad just like the food,but coffee was good. so if your looking for a good cup of coffee that is expensive this is the place to go.

10.description: I wanted to like this place- close to home, nicely decorated, a parking lot! However the food was bland, tasteless, overly fried/greasy and just not good. My husband got the pizza, which was bland and soggy. He also got the tomato soup which was the worst ever. Campbell's would have been a huge step up. I got a variety of apps which were just tasteless and greasy (the trio). We felt like we wasted money. Maybe just go for a drink.

5.description: Went here for the first thine on a Saturday night. Place does a good business so it's good to have reservations thru open table (yay points). We ordered the arancini, creamy French onion soup, pumpkin risotto, and neopolitan pizza pie. The soup was amazing, the risotto was very good but needed salt, and the pizza pie was the love child of a calzone and chicken pot pie. The waiter forgot the arancini which was just as well since that probably would have been too much rice given the risotto. For dessert we split the chocolate cake which was super good. And the waiter felt so bad about forgetting an appetizer that he gave us a complimentary tiramisu, which was unnecessary but a nice gesture. We will be back.

3.description: Very disappointed in the direction in which this place is heading. I loved coming to this place and getting quality food. Now it seems that most of the food is prepped with no care. On several occasions we have gotten pizza which was falling apart from the excess of liquid. The potatoes are and undercooked. Bread which is offered at the start seems to be getting harder and harder. The drinks are still good, that about it.

35.description: Loved the food, drinks & craft beer!!  Best server ever Jimmy!! Great place must try!

19.description: My wife and I held our rehearsal dinner here for our wedding! We live in the neighborhood and wanted a nice local spot who would take care of us! Cameron (Camy), the manager was so personable, welcoming and did everything to accommodate us! He worked with us and gave great recommendations on our night would be so special! We were very satisfied! He definitely knows what customer service is all about ! Robby the bartender is also amazing! He knows everything there is to know about beer, as well as hard alcohol! This is one of our favorite  local joints! Great food , great staff and an amazing atmosphere that makes you feel right at home! Definitely first class service - thanks guys for making our experience awesome.  Everyone is still talking about your pizza!

28.description: My husband and I like to go on special dates for our birthday's and this was my birthday choice. We don't go upscale often but when we do, we want to feel special. Here I felt like I was at a neighborhood bar.That said, the decor is very and well done. The lighting where we sat was way to bright but they eventually turned it down and that helped. My immediate reaction, once seated (which was awkward), was trying to kill fruit flies that were attacking our table. We spent most of the night swatting bugs, not very romantic. As for the awkward start to the night, my husband was a little turned around and instead of going in through the front door, he brought us around to the side, we walked in and the hostess was rude and then rolled her eyes when I asked if we could sit at the 4 top, rather than the 2 top right next to the bar. Mainly I didn't want to be in the bar, I also wanted more space, as I knew we would be getting more than 2 plates. The place was nearly empty at the time and there were a ton of 4 tops available. I was thrown off by her attitude but seeing her throughout the night, I think that's just who she is. Outside of her, everyone was very friendly and helpful. We ordered the trio appetizers with the zucchini flower, arancini and hand rolled croquette, as well as an order of the prosciutto wrapped dates. The dates were amazing, even my husband who doesn't usually like dates, enjoyed them. The arancini was very good, the zucchini flower was delicious, the croquette was slightly cool when we got to it and was a little mushy - all of the sauces were very tasty.For dinner we ordered the crispy pork shoulder and the brick chicken vesuvio - both were good but not good enough that I would go back for them. The pork was crispy and moist on the inside but the polenta was crunchy and that confused me. The chicken was really well cooked with amazing flavor but the fingerling potatoes were actually small slices of potato and not what we expected, they also serve it with arugula (our favorite) and cherry tomatoes on the side - my husband said, if they provided some dressing or something with the arugula it would be a great dish, instead he was confused.The wine menu is pretty small, although my husband found beer that he liked.The location for us is great and with the HUGE parking lot across the street I'm sure we'll try it again, maybe for a pizza and beer night with friends. Maybe even try out the outside seating. I wanted to really like this place but in a city of this size, with all of the incredible places we can go to dinner, it just wasn't special for my birthday dinner - I agree with another reviewer, if you want Olive Garden, go here instead as the prices are probably about the same, but if you want amazing Italian food there are SO many better options.

45.description: Portage Park is definitely trying to up the scene! We ordered the beef carpaccio, duck ravioli and the chicken vesuvio, with a gin cocktail, an IPA, and a cannoli (which we took home). My favorite was the carpaccio, with fresh arugula, cherry tomatoes, and Parmesan. Delicious! Of course the chicken and duck ravioli were phenomenal. The Chicken had a yummy white wine sauce that the tomatoes soaked in, and the duck ravioli was just the right amount, but a little more on the chicken sauce - it had pistachios in it but I think it would have been better as a purée. Regardless, it was yummy. The gin cocktail was great - but used the wrong ice so it melted too fast and watered down the drink. Cannoli was awesome as well - can't really go wrong in that area. All around, great prices and just the right portions. My husband took half his chicken home too. They have live music Friday and Saturday too! Great service, great location for locals but might be hard to get to for people who live more downtown. Otherwise, they have an amazing but drink list and great service. I would definitely come again to this lovely neighborhood gem!

33.description: The best Italian Restaurant in Chicago.  The fish, the steak the appetisers.  Wow,  this place is amazing.  I will be back and ask for Jimmy.

43.description: Decent delivery, but they didn't cut the pizza and it was sorta cold... Bright side the cappuccino is amazing

2.description: Our first visit, loved the cozy lighting and decor as soon as we walked in. I'm giving them three stars because a lot of what we ate was truly delicious, and our server George was very personable and attentive. There were some missteps though. We had fried calamari, and the batter was light and crispy and delicious, but the marinara was bland. Needed a little kick. My husband had the frisée salad with pears which he said was delicious. So here's where things get a bit tricky... They sat a large number of tables at once, which led to our calamari taking 20 minutes to come out. ( We sat down at about 6:20pm on a Friday night.) My husband actually got his salad before the appetizer came out, which was a little odd. No big deal though. When the food came out, about 20 minutes after the calamari, my lobster roll looked great- and it was. It was buttery, filled with huge chunks of lobster claw, with a delicious garlic aioli and fresh arugula. Yum. The tomato bisque that came with it was fine, but nothing to write home about. My husband ordered an evening special, which included a yellowtail filet, gnocchi and some kind of red sauce stew with capers...it wasn't good. Before that came out, however, he looked down at what was set in front of him and realized that it was not what he ordered. Within 5 minutes, the manager (we think) brought out the correct dish, but offered waaaaay to much info on what had gone wrong in the kitchen. The apology was definitely appreciated but we didn't need that much info. Sadly, he was unable to finish his meal. The fish was dry and the rest of the dish could not make up for it. We were prepared to leave feeling disappointed this time, but then George brought out a complimentary dessert: quite possibly the best tiramisu I've ever had. It was perfect and delicious. And my husband's dinner was comped because he didn't enjoy it. So overall, we felt positive when we left, and we will go back- this was our first visit, and I think we will try going back on a less busy night to avoid some of the inevitable goofs that can happen when a kitchen gets overwhelmed with too many tables at once. George assured us that we should give Legno another shot soon, and I think we will. One other note- this just made me laugh...in the bathroom, which was very nice with pretty Kohler sinks and nice soaps, there was a basket on the sink containing what I thought were hand towels for drying your hands- those nice ones that are kind of like paper towels but feel a bit more like cloth. They turned out to be regular dinner napkins, and I actually burst out laughing when the one I grabbed dissolved in my wet hands. Anyway, we'll be back, hopefully with less surprises next time around.

18.description: Amazing place! Came here for Valentines and had a great experience. They did not over book reservations. We were sat immediately when we arrived. My wife had the surf and turf and I had the veal shank. The staff is friendly and attentive. The food is outstanding. Great background music playing and excellent lighting. Couldn't recommend Legno more.

41.description: So it's our first visit here and NOT out last. First let me say the ambience was great. We sat outside in the little patio they had. We walked in and saw everything but picked the patio since it was beautiful outside. The bar area looked like a great meeting place to enjoy quality time with friends. I'm going to have to take advantage of that one day. We were seated promptly by our server and can only say that customer service def is a priority with her. After suggesting some wine for half price Tuesday (I should have gone with her suggestions) she gave a taste test which was perfect. We ordered our food, which arrived quickly. My chicken vesuvio was amazing. The other employees took our dirty plates in timely manner and our waitress Meghan kept checking in on us to see if we needed anything. Again I must admit she was great and on par. They are lucky to have an employee that  goes above and beyond on a servers salary.    Keep up the great job guys. Food amazing! Customer service on par. Can't wait to try something new on my next visit .

52.description: I've been here a few times now. The decor/interior design is well done. It's a great addition to our neighborhood. The food is good-but I prefer the pasta dishes over the pizza (just ok). I went there for dinner with friends one Saturday night & they had live music. The live music was played through the speakers in the dining part of the restaurant. I found that really nice, because we still experienced it even though we were removed having dinner & talking with one another. They also have awesome specials. Those driving-there's a parking lot across the street. This is a great date night, couples night out, or a drink/app spot with a friend. Check it out!

50.description: This is review based on my delivery through Grubhub.Delivery was quick, and overall great.The food on the other hand was just simply bad. We ate at Legno, and ordered delivery from Legno on numerous occasions. This time though the food was simply terrible. Let me start off by saying none of the pizzas were cut into slices. We ordered Prosciutto Pizza, Gustosa Pizza, and Wings.The Prosciutto Pizza was really greasy, and made with something that not even looked like Prosciutto or even tasted like one. The Gustosa Pizza was also greasy, and really salty, it had none of that Legno flavor from the wood fired oven that they have. Wings were dry, as if they were reheated. The sauce for the wings was good, I guess that was the only good thing about the entire order.

4.description: Great revamp of Suparossa! Appreciated the gluten free menu for my husband and the fresh and healthy choices available. The grilled octopus was fabulous. The dates and prosciutto were mouth watering. Great wine selection too! We will come back again for sure.

6.description: This restaurant is a nice Italian restaurant i am sure i will be going back to on a regular basis for the service was good and the place has a classy look even with a bar! I ordered the Caesar salad added grilled chicken, and Legno burger with tomato basil soup -All of which were amazing!

22.description: My favorite thing to order is the mussel starter in pesto sauce and a side of veggies. The table bread is hit or miss sometimes, but it is delicious when mopping up that pesto sauce. This place also has a great craft beer selection.

15.description: Food is great and typically the service is as well. Instead of sitting in the bar area (which is where I prefer) I sat in the dining area and Eddie T was our server.. He was nice but not personable at all and didn't really speak all. Maybe today wasn't a good day but whenever he came by the table he would ask a question and before we could finish a response he already left the table. I had to stop him several times and almost yell across the restaurant to get his attention whenever I needed something. It was pretty slow for a Tuesday night ( not sure why the service wasn't up to standard ) however they have a great deal on half priced bottle wine for Tuesday nights. I will definitely return I will just make sure to sit at the bar as I usually would do. Only giving this place four stars based off of the food and previous service.

57.description: I found this place A-OK as yelp describes it. The decor is very cute and the service was friendly.We started with the fried calamari. Lightly breaded and very meaty. Definitely very yummy.I got the Crisp Pork Shoulder. It wasn't bad but I don't know why it's called Crisp. Some edges felt rough and hard but it wasn't what I call "crisp". The flavor was pretty good but there was celery in the pasta which ruined it for me. I find celery overpowering but that is personal preference.My husband got the risotto contadina and we liked it although the sausage felt a little out of place.All in all. It was ok but I am willing to come back and try more!

20.description: This restaurant is a nice Italian restaurant i am sure i will be going back to on a regular basis for the service was good and the place has a classy look even with a bar! I ordered the Caesar salad added grilled chicken, and Legno burger with tomato basil soup -All of which were amazing!

36.description: Awesome place! Setup of inside and outside is very classy. Everything I ever ordered on the menu tasted great! Staff is very friendly and the service is the best I have ever experienced. Margarita pizza is really good too! I have been going there for over a year and will continue to keep going!

14.description: Best place in the neighborhood. I love what supporosa did with the place. If your looking for a great date night or want to experience great beers on tap this is a great spot to go. Ask for Robbie the bartender if your at the bar and enjoy. PS. The food is amazing.

29.description: Havent had a chance to stop here since this summer until today.By far, a GREAT steak burrito! Good amount of steak...very tender. Toasted the burrito after as well, and the green and red sauces are amazing!Definitely have to make this place a regular stop from now on.Impressed!!!!

42.description: Didnt know this place existed even though I live fairly close to it. Went there for lunch and the food was good! Their agua de horchata (rice water) was even better!! I ordered a burrito and a taco (tried the happy taco) and there was a plenty meat and veggies and all of the ingredients seemed/tasted fresh. The owners are just super friendly and very accommodating to any request if you want to try any of their flavored waters or will make good suggestions on food items. Will for sure be back in the future to try other menu items.

23.description: I went here at the suggestion of a coworker and I was not disappointed.  Best tacos and sauce in the city!  They make everything from scratch with quality ingredients...tortillas, meat, vegetables!  They even make their sauces from scratch which I have not found anywhere else EVER from either jalapeños or chile de arbol.  Absolutely the best in Chicago!

47.description: I am lucky to live next door to this "Mexicano Heaven", at this point I think my husband and I sampled almost everything on the menu and each time we eat from El Taco Feliz we are AMAZED, it is a party for your senses, anyday of the week!!!Super affordable, great service, and what a treat for your taste buds!!! I am lucky to have them so close but let me tell you I would travel to eat this food anyday!Give it a try, no regrets, I promise!!!Thank you Estella and Carlos!!!!

8.description: I went here at the suggestion of a coworker and I was not disappointed.  Best tacos and sauce in the city!  They make everything from scratch with quality ingredients...tortillas, meat, vegetables!  They even make their sauces from scratch which I have not found anywhere else EVER from either jalapeños or chile de arbol.  Absolutely the best in Chicago!

31.description: Love this spot. Fresh ingredients. Everything made to order, so you have to wait a few minutes, maybe up to 10-15 if there are other customers but it's worth it. You can bypass the wait by calling your order in. So happy to have this taqueria in Portage Park.

34.description: Great tortas. I always have a a great positive experience with service as well.  Such a delight to come back to...never changed.

16.description: Family owned, great tacos with homemade hot sauce and guacamole. Strak, pork always fresh and ready to eat. Come here atleast twice a week. Very cheap for the dinners great value

13.description: These are places I enjoyed some fantastic tacos:El Patron,Big Star,Los Comales,Atotonilco,Antique taco, Cemitas Puebla, Tacos TequilaBut today I found almost the best. I rated 4 of 5 because if this place made their tortillas fresh and improved their red sauce...look out. The owner would immediately have to relocate because the space is not large enough. Great tacos made from arrachera well cooked not burned or undercooked enough spices to complement their green sauce. Must stop by try just one guarantee you will come back for more!

11.description: Literally the best taco I've ever had in my life! The place is sort of small and you would never expect it to be as delicious as it is, but trust me, if you take the trip here you won't regret it.

39.description: Went to try this place out based on the reviews. HOLY CRAP!! Fresh ingredients, very friendly people, amazing coconut water, and the steak burrito/and steak tacos were outstanding!!! Can't wait to go back...breakfast burrito?!?

37.description: The steak tacos were great, good quality meat, no fat and not greasy. Everything was made fresh. The staff was very nice. I also recommend the coconut water, it's really good. Definitely will be back.

0.description: Great Family run taco joint. Been here a handful of times and tried The chicken, steak, pastor and still not sure which one I like better. Don't forget to wash it down with coconut water. Don't even bother with the small or medium because you'll wish you had ordered the large.Oh yeah, almost forgot the vegetarian tacos are delicious.

38.description: This place is great! The food and the service is excellent and friendly. I ordered steak tacos, steak burritos and guacamole. The steak was tasty and a good portion. The guacamole was amazing and freshly prepared for my order.  I will be back for more!!! Highly recommended!

51.description: Great little taco joint! The lady was super nice and their coconut water is fantastic! I got the 3 steak taco dinner and it was delicious... The rice and beans were perfect! A must go if your in the portage park area.

27.description: Great place for takeout Mexican. They have excellent guacamole, their chicken burrito is amazing and I love their coconut drink.

32.description: Everything in the taqueria is freshly cooked right in front of you. These people are extremely welcoming and friendly. Try the coconut water, it's not overly sweetened, it's perfect. Cash only!!! Bar stools only, no tables.

54.description: Awesome cecina and asada tacos!!!! Great authentic taste.  Fresh ingredients and cooked fresh. Horchata is horrible and taste almost like water but they have other drinks. Tortas could have more meat so I always ask for no lettuce otherwise you'll receive a generous helping.  This place will definitely be known for its tacos.

48.description: This place really deserves 5 Stars!The Guacamole is made from scratch right in front of you and it deserves 5 stars on its own!The tacos, steak torta, steak burrito were all amazing!The lady who runs the place is super friendly and very accommodating!Great little spot that you must GO TO!

44.description: Amazing customer service and great food! You can tell the owners take pride in their restaurant by the way they speak about their food and salsas. The owner is very friendly she welcome people from l around and encourages you to try different foods they offer. I will definitely be returning.

24.description: Literally the best taco I've ever had in my life! The place is sort of small and you would never expect it to be as delicious as it is, but trust me, if you take the trip here you won't regret it.

7.description: Good tacos, not great because they were pretty greasy. Shady business practices. Walked over from the hospital with my mom to get some dinner. Found the place on yelp and the reviews were great so figured we'd give it a try. Sign on the sidewalk in front reads "pastor tacos $2". My mom asked what that was, I explain, she says she'll take 3. 3 tacos pastor = $6Inside I pick up a printed menu postcard size and decide I'll order a 3 taco plate. 3 taco plate = $7.99I add cheese to my tacos. My mom adds cheese and sour cream to hers. I'm assuming but can't be sure because it's not posted anywhere that this should cost no more than $2. My total comes to $20.75, at which point I ask why because my estimate in my head is lower. (16 plus tax)The cashier starts to mumble something when the other woman there jumps in and points to a handwritten sign above her head on a wall. She tells me that they have to raise prices temporarily because of the prices of meat but does not say what the new prices are. I just sort of shook my head and said whatever because I didn't want to make a scene of any kind.  Their prices are on the wall, printed on cards and they even had a sign for the pastor tacos for $2 on the sidewalk!!! Where are the new prices posted for customers?!Then, not 1 but 3 men that arrived after us were given their food first. Only 1 could i tell had ordered ahead. So we waited almost 20 mins for some tacos. She apologized at the end of it all but it might've helped if she gave an explanation. I was disappointed. I like supporting the little guys but they usually give better customer service than that.

49.description: I went here based on the 5 star reviews that were posted. This place is pretty good. Everything is made fresh, even the guac is made to order. The coconut drink is awesome, jumbo size for $4.00 but worth it. I had to ask for chilaquiles but they gladly made them for me. The sauce was made from scratch in one of the professional style blenders you see Rick Bayless use (class act). I had them with the thin cut steak. I also ordered 3 tacos (steak and pastor) which were tender and juicy. The pastor had bits of pineapple which compliments the pork with sweetness. The rice was done fine with bits of carrot which also gives it a natural sweetness. All in all a good experience. I'll have to try the chicken next time based on the good reviews. The woman who runs the place was very nice and talkative for a nice little chat while I waited. Total bill was $24.00 to go.

40.description: This place caught us by surprise.  We have lived in the area for a while and this is the best Mexican food we have come across.  The steak was a very good quality, and the sauces were fantastic.  Very friendly service, and we plan on patronizing their establishment whenever we have a craving for some damn good tacos, etc..

53.description: Our first time here. Have been searching for a decent Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood... And I think we've found it.Burrito was excellent, my wife had the enchiladas - a bit spicy for her, but otherwise excellent.Home made beans and all fresh ingredients.Their coconut water is unbelievable. And I don't like coconut ordinarily.It's a small hole in the wall place - so dine in isn't really an option, although there is a small table. But a definite 5 stars !!CASH ONLYWe will be back !!!

30.description: Terrific but somewhat of a hidden place for tacos. Have eaten here a few times and was surprised how well the food came out. Despite the wait, it is worth the trip. Fresh ingredients used and cooked just right. The meat is flavored and not of poor quality. Great service, sauces made in-house. Definitely better than TBK if you're in the neighborhood and looking for grub.

46.description: Based on other reviews I decided to try the place and everything was very good.  I had the steak burrito which was cooked to order.   The steak was good quality with no gristle.   The vegetables are fresh, not bagged, so they tasted great.  Excellent ratio of meat to veggies and condiments.  The burrito was served with two salsas that were a slightly thicker consistency.  The mild red and green hot were both very good.  I kept alternating because I couldn't decide which I liked better.  Another plus was that the burrito was rolled correctly and held together to the last delicious bite.     The lady at the counter offered me a taste of the coconut water before purchasing, which was very thoughtful and considerate.  The coconut water reminded me of condensed coconut milk, though the consistency wasn't as thick.  It was a sweet drink and so good that I purchased a second one before leaving.  There is a small counter inside and 3 shaded picnic tables on the side of the building.   The owner brought out my food and checked back to make sure everything was okay.  Very good customer service.  Tasty food, nice people and reasonable prices.  I'll definitely be back here again.

1.description: I came here in the recommendation of friend, who promised me it wouldn't be a disappointment......she was right.  When I looked at the menu the prices were slightly more expensive  than other Mexican restaurants in the area. The owner informed me that she uses only the best quality meat, so her menu may seem pricey but she ensured me I would like it.  So I decided to try the steak burrito with all trimmings ($7.50), I had enough for dinner and my lunch the next day and it was really good.  I liked that the steak was seasoned prefect and there was no fat because there's nothing worst than that. I also ordered the hochata that has a coconut milk twist, omg it's amazing!
