If you come here you have to try it and they will give you sample before you purchase it.  On my recent visit we ordered a chicken taco, steak taco, and a pork taco, they were just perfect!  They marinate the chicken and it tastes amazing.  I also loved the steak taco. My son loved his tacos also. Both the salsas are also really good also.  Of course I had to get the hochata.  Now this isn't a date spot or a place to really dine in. It's a tiny restaurant with seating for about 4 people the most, there may be room for 2 people to stand and order. What it doesn't have in space,  it makes up in flavor.  The Feliz taco has a new feliz customer.

55.description: eat here!! the lil hut taco (my name for it) is AWESOME!! the torta will one of the beat in your life!! be sure to get pastor not straight pork. you'll kick yourself in the ass if you do order straight pork.call early & leave time!! you're going to need itthe guac - be warned the wife we try and convenience ya to order the hot...your gut's funeral!! there side sauce's are enough spicethe tacos are very good. the husbands chicken recipe is familiar but also very new give 'em a chance. but the beans are damn good.and the cost...for me family...VERY reasonable! you can order from here and not bust the bank doing itany questions? now go!

9.description: The best burrito I've ever had! Flavor and texture were perfect. I also bought the coconut milk which was delicious

26.description: Best little taco place in the area.  Their green sauce and red sauce are the BOMB!   I think if they bottled up their sauces and sold them they would make a fortune.  They have coconut milk instead of horchata.  It is delicious.  It is owned by the sweetest little lady and her husband.  The beans are homemade.  The tacos are reasonably priced and fresh and tasty.

25.description: I must say oh my god what a diamond in the ruff . You must come and give this mexican restaurant one try everything is made with love.Great flavors,fresh ingredients,made to order meals !!! Prices are very very affordable !!But you must bring cash only no big deal because your not gonna spend alot but your gonna get a lot. Inside is small but who cares if you get great cheap fresh eats period!! Give them a try they deserve it. One word wow

12.description: So yes this is a cash only establishment so you have to plan ahead but to me it's well worth it! They are a mom-and-pop run restaurant and it's definitely a to go kind of location but their food is a very high-quality and everything is very flavorful. The rice is awesome the beans are just OK the el pastor is amazing! The coconut water is pretty amazing and I'm not even a big fan of the flavor of coconut this is definitely a go to location for my family!

21.description: Wow!....best Mexican food I have had in a very long time!...so fresh and delicious!!...thank you for your beautiful smile when walking in the door!

17.description: Wife and I LOVE this place.  We found it shortly after moving to the neighborhood and has become our go-to when we need a burrito fix.  Unfortunately, we've only had the burritos so far.  Portions are good size, they don't skimp on the meat.  I always get the streak burrito.  Steak is cooked perfectly.  The people that run the place are husband and wife, husband runs the kitchen, wife handles the ordering.  They are both super friendly when you walk in.

10.description: Best little taco place in the area.  Their green sauce and red sauce are the BOMB!   I think if they bottled up their sauces and sold them they would make a fortune.  They have coconut milk instead of horchata.  It is delicious.  It is owned by the sweetest little lady and her husband.  The beans are homemade.  The tacos are reasonably priced and fresh and tasty.

5.description: It all depends on your personal taste.Everything is fresh.Love my tacos, but surprisingly the chicken tacos ARE THE BOMB!!! you need to really really taste it.The rice is well season and the beans, OMG THE BEANS!!! ARE REALLY REALLY HOMEMADE, most Mexican restaurants give you canned frijoles, but not this one, you can taste it right away.The lady gave me a taste of the coconut water (i normally don't like coconut anything ) but this water was AMAZING!!! better than Horchata hands down!The Salsas a full of flavor and spicy enough for my taste.P.s my husband didn't really enjoy his tacos, but then again, he burned his tongue with something else (not in the restaurant )

3.description: Approximately quarter to 1200 hour, Rosa J. and hubby were on the way to "happiness," or El Taco Feliz Taqueria, from our new home in Portage Park.  However, they weren't open so we kept on wondering back and forth on Addison. When it was time to open for business at 1200 hour, the lady owner informed us that the grill was just turned on and would be ready in twenty (20) minutes.  She was super nice and set up the side patio for us since the weather was beyond pleasant.  She was worried that we would leave and head somewhere else for lunch, but we determined to have Mexican in our new hood.  We ordered lady owner's recommendation: torta de pollo.  For extra two (2) bucks, you can upgrade the entree to dinner.  Every dinner comes with rice and beans.  Hubby liked what he saw on the menu.  Chile relleno is available on taco, torta, and burrito.  He went with chile relleno burrito and fully enjoyed it!  The dinner was portioned appropriately for our hungry appetites so definitely there were no complaints from either one of us.  Oh, what about my chicken torta?  Chicken isn't my favorite meat, but their chicken is marinated before sending to the grill.  There were so many pieces of chicken on the torta!  There were certainly grilled to perfection.  By the way, they don't offer horchata like other taquerias, but sweetened coconut water is available.  We sampled and tasted delicious.  For two (2) dinners and one (1) bottle of mock sangria, our total was $24.  Thanks for the pocket money from Mama J.  That covered the cost of our lunch.  El Taco Feliz Taqueria is going to be our staple for take-out Mexican.  They now have new regulars.  It's located close to the hospital and accessible via CTA #152 (Addison) bus.

35.description: So good! My boyfriend and I have become regulars and we tried it for the first time about 2 weeks ago! Friendly staff. The asada is seasoned very well. Very great food.

19.description: I must say oh my god what a diamond in the ruff . You must come and give this mexican restaurant one try everything is made with love.Great flavors,fresh ingredients,made to order meals !!! Prices are very very affordable !!But you must bring cash only no big deal because your not gonna spend alot but your gonna get a lot. Inside is small but who cares if you get great cheap fresh eats period!! Give them a try they deserve it. One word wow

28.description: Horrible & that's ashame bc we live right down the block. Horchata was sour. Yes sour. We returned it and the owner said it is not and blamed it on the rice. Who does that??? My bf ordered a burrito dinner and didn't receive any rice or beans but were charged for a burrito dinner. Needless to say after the sour horchata we had, we got our money back and have never gave a good recommendation for this place.

45.description: Excellent and fresh food! Awesome customer service!!! The owners were very friendly and accommodating. She makes the  best green hot sauce and the guacamole is fabulous!!!

33.description: Wife and I LOVE this place.  We found it shortly after moving to the neighborhood and has become our go-to when we need a burrito fix.  Unfortunately, we've only had the burritos so far.  Portions are good size, they don't skimp on the meat.  I always get the streak burrito.  Steak is cooked perfectly.  The people that run the place are husband and wife, husband runs the kitchen, wife handles the ordering.  They are both super friendly when you walk in.

43.description: Very friendly staff! Delicious food for cheap! What more do you want? ;) I am definitely going back. They only take cash, also a very small place.

2.description: So, I found this place on Yelp looking at a review of another taco joint nearby that was recommended to me. I saw 4.5 stars so figured it must be doing something right, right?  And, it's closer to where I live so decided to give it a shot. I'll cut to the chase.  DAMN TASTY TACOS!!  In a city filled with taco joints these are much better than most and I've tried a bunch of them. Put it this way, they are better than L'Patron. Don't pass on the chicken tacos if u give them a try. They are BY FAR the best chicken tacos in the city. They marinate the chicken and you can taste the difference. The carne and pastor are super solid and they just added a Pork Belly that is super tasty as well. I've been 5 times in the last two weeks and Estella and Carlos who own the place are incredibly nice.  Unfortunate that they are on such a remote stretch on west Addison cause they would certainly do much more business in a better location.  In the meantime, make the trip out there and support this awesome place and have some of the best tacos in the city. Agradecemelo luego!

18.description: I've gotten carry out from Feliz many times over the last year. It's a tiny, family-run storefront, with only a few stools at the bar inside and a couple of tables outside in the summer. The wife answers the phone to take your order, never more than 15 minutes until the food's ready. The husband works the small, but effective kitchen to cook the food behind the counter. My husband always orders the 3 steak taco dinner, yum, while my favorite has been the steak sopes. The salsas are homemade, spicy, and truly delicious. They should bottle and sell them! Sadly, we moved out of the area, so the struggle to find authentic, high-quality, reasonably-priced Mexican food begins again!

41.description: This place has delicious food!!! I get the chicken tacos. The chicken is so well seasoned and cooked to perfection. My friends had the steak tacos and burrito which they loved. Fyi, there meat seasoning is on the spicy side.

52.description: AMAZING!  My boyfriend and I are taco freaks (we have them at least once a week) Once thing we hate about the area we live in is we can never find a decent taco and usually travel downtown to our favorite spots to grab some tacos.  We even make some of the best tacos we know but sometimes we are lazy or on a time crunch and just want a quick, healthy bite. I started noticing this little taco hut on my drive home and seemed like it was fairly new.  After telling my boyfriend about it and finally taking the time to go (we've been disappointed many times in the area; so we were skeptic's) They ONLY TAKE CASH and we only had a $20.  We looked at the menu and decided what we wanted; it added to $18.  As we go in a lady and man were present.  The ladies energy was amazing and allowed us to have a friendly conversation.  While we ordered she asked if we wanted a drink.  We refused but gave us a sample of Coconut Agua Fresca; we were sold.  We only asked for 1 and a size small as our money was almost gone.  When the total came it was $21.50.  We looked at each other and laughed and said we only had a $20.  She told us it was no problem and she knew we would be back to repay her.  It was so nice!  We waited outside, as there isn't much room in the place.  We smelt the dishes being prepared and they smelt amazing; we couldn't wait to try them.  It took awhile; but we ordered a lot and we knew everything was being made fresh - so we didn't mind.  She came out with a large bag and said that her rice was ready for us to try. (When we ordered she told us if we didn't mind having two sides of beans, as the rice wasn't quite done)  As we thanked her and went on our way she mentioned that she would be serving elotes and ice cream on the sidewalk daily during the summer months.  When we got home and opened our boxes we just looked at one another and smiled!  We knew we were going to enjoy these dishes!  And let me tell you; wait for the rice!  I am not a rice eater but I would eat her rice any day!  I can't wait to go back and enjoy other dishes on the menu.  I mentioned to her she needs a website; maybe she will get one soon.

50.description: Awesome little place and its only 2 blocks away from my house. Tacos and burritos are very good just just pure meat!! , no fat pieces and gristle in the meat like a lot of taco places. The Coconut Water is amazing!! and so refreshing!

4.description: Must say I was pretty impressed. Very small place but it has that authentic Ma and Pa Mexican cooking and feel. I had the steak tacos and my husband had the Burrito. The steak meat was well seasoned and tender. The only thing that I noticed that maybe an issue for some people is the tacos and the burrito were a bit greasy.Other than that, the food was very tasty. The man and young man (maybe father and son) that were at the counter were very friendly. They gave me a taste test of the Coconut Water and it was surprisingly very good.

6.description: Food was fresh, delicious and gorgeous. The people behind the counter were super nice and made my order quickly. I had the steak and pastor tacos --- OH MY GOD! Sooooo good. Highly recommend!!

22.description: These are places I enjoyed some fantastic tacos:El Patron,Big Star,Los Comales,Atotonilco,Antique taco, Cemitas Puebla, Tacos TequilaBut today I found almost the best. I rated 4 of 5 because if this place made their tortillas fresh and improved their red sauce...look out. The owner would immediately have to relocate because the space is not large enough. Great tacos made from arrachera well cooked not burned or undercooked enough spices to complement their green sauce. Must stop by try just one guarantee you will come back for more!

15.description: By far the best tacos I have ever had and I am a Mexican food lover. This place is amazing. Very limited seating and cash only is the down side but with food this good, you will over look anything.

20.description: These are the best tacos I have eaten in years. My husband and I drove by the restaurant and stopped in for take-out. It is a cozy, little place with a few outdoor seating spaces. I was greeted by the friendly owner. The menus are printed on a postcard, and I was pleasantly surprised that they made authentic tacos - simple without all the extra garbage that other places fill up with. It is also a veggie-friendly menu. I watched the cook prepare the food while the friendly lady chatted with me. Everything was fresh from the veggies he chopped up to the chicken. She gave me a sample of the coconut drink, which was similar in flavor to horchata but much creamier consistency...sold, one medium please. The tacos were generously filled with the veggies for me and chicken for my husband, along with the onion and cilantro garnish. There is a choice of other garnishes such as lettuce and tomatoes. The best part was eating them at home with the green and red salsa. I wonder if the salsa is homemade. I will have the chance to ask because I will return.

36.description: I went to this place in July this past Summer and LOVED it.  Every taco we had was delicious and the lady working there was super nice. For whatever reason, I hadnt been back until today and whoa have things changed.  We got 4 different tacos and they were all anywhere from Ok- awful. The pastor was inedible, the happy taco was gross and the chicken was just "ok".  Im not sure what happened to this place but I wont be back anytime soon.  Pity!

14.description: Havent had a chance to stop here since this summer until today.By far, a GREAT steak burrito! Good amount of steak...very tender. Toasted the burrito after as well, and the green and red sauces are amazing!Definitely have to make this place a regular stop from now on.Impressed!!!!

58.description: This is our second time here and the popcorn and banana fudge gelato is was quite a treat to have. Completely no disappointment.

56.description: Great little gem in the neighborhood!  Just steps from the corner of Portage Park.   Nicely designed interior.  They had seating both indoors and outdoors.  Seems like the type of place you may in the Gold Coast or Lincoln Park.   Staff was very friendly.  The cafe was very clean inside.  Gelato was very tasty.   Kids loved it.

29.description: Friendly staff.. Adorable store! I loved the mango smoothie and I sampled some of their gelato flavors.. The spumoni and strawberry chip were delicious! If I'm ever in the neighborhood.. I will return!

42.description: Fantastic addition to the neighborhood! The gelato is amazing and they have little doggie treats to boot for my little guy. So I can take him for a walk and we can both get a treat along the way! Oh, I also had the chicken pesto focaccia, really good! Plenty of outdoor seating, right across the street from the park - perfect!

23.description: Food is what to go for, and that's if YOU'RE WILLING TO WAIT.  The service there has just never picked up speed, not since they opened. I go sometimes on my lunch break, and have had to carry my food out because I've waited so long for it that I have no time to actually eat. Frustrating. Such a cute spot. Slow service.

47.description: I say the place is awesome and everything looks appealing to my palate.The only wrong thing was the girl behind the counter who looks Gothic and couldn't even afford to smile when serving ice cream or doesn't even care to explain to a first time customer how ice creams are served by cup or by scoop. A happy place like this deserves to have employees who smile and greet customers as they come in.

8.description: This is a cute little sweets shop. The construction on Central cannot be helping business. It was a bit tricky to get to this shop, and I would imagine business has been suffering. We walked in on a weekend around 8pm and where the only ones there.My husband had the gelato, and I'll admit, it was tasty. I really liked the espresso flavor. I was craving some frozen yogurt, which the website said they had. Big disappointment! There were only 4 flavors to choose from (two of them variations on vanilla), and the toppings left much to be desired. They did do everything else well though. There is a huge candy wall that reminds me of what a kid in a candy shop's dream might be. Weridly, this place also serves sandwiches and pizza/focaccia bread.We took our sweet treats outside to a big patio area with pretty lights and a ton of picnic tables. Very cute, and it's on the other side of the building (not on the busy road).I'd give this place another try and encourage people to come for the gelato, but not the frozen yogurt.

31.description: Great atmosphere and really fresh food. Ordered the buffalo chicken salad and pesto sandwich. Both had a lot of flavorful. There's a ample seating and the whole place is windows. On a sunny day it is very enjoyable. Take the food to go and sit across the street in Portage park. Would highly recommend this place

34.description: It's 8:18pm and it say's on Yelp that the establishment is open while the locked doors say otherwise. If you're going to close early, please modify the hours displayed on here.

16.description: Based on some of the other reviews I was expecting poor customer service, but as soon as we walked in the door we were greeted with a smile and offer to get us samples. Service was great throughout!This review is just for gelato, which was excellent. The salted caramel, coconut, and strawberry chip were all delicious. We will definitely be back to try the focaccia and other food!

13.description: The salted caramel gelato is to die for. There is absolutely amazing flavor packed into every bite. You need to come here if you're in the area. They make popcorn gelato taste delicious!! My girlfriend loved the ice coffee and you can't beat the prices! Also, the fresh bread looks delicious--I definitely need to return to this.

11.description: Went during my lunch break today, it's a Nice little location with great service and good food. I got the chicken pesto caprese sandwich that was so good and it was very fresh!  The gelato was also good. I would defiantly be coming back!

39.description: What a cute place! I LOVE the decor! Very clean! We had a little of everything...candy, gelato, froyo, pizza and coffee. Everything we ordered tasted delicious! Just wish the people working behind the counter were a little bit friendlier. A simple smile, hello and thank you goes a long way!

37.description: This place is as cute as it gets, and the cafe as good as it gets, too. This is a cool storefront for the neighborhood, it's fairly new to the Portage Park area and it already has families and friends following everything they do. I've been here several times and I have to say that although it is not my style, this place makes me a little happier inside.Food & Drink: So far so good. I am a fan of the Buffalo salad, TRY IT. I like grabbing a latte or two here on occasion. A standard cup of coffee seems a bit pricey for the who-knows-what kinda beans they use, but it gets the job done. This place is kitty-corner to the park which makes it prime real estate for all of the fun and family moments that can happen at Portage, stop in, it's very inviting.

0.description: Delicious treats for a warm day. The location is very convenient to the park. You can take a nice stroll in the park while enjoying your frozen treat. They also have a good selection of sandwiches and pizza.

38.description: Super cute new place in portage park.  We had salads, sandwiches and gelato and loved all.  Only one request would be to have more outdoor seating as we go after walking the park.  This place is just what the neighborhood needs.

51.description: My husband, the kids, and I visited this new neighborhood hot spot the other day.  I am so glad there are new businesses like this opening up in Portage Park.  I base this review on solely the gelato.The decor is super cute.  The employees can be more friendly.So let's get on to the gelato.I wouldn't exactly call it gelato.  It has a lighter fluffier texture exactly like Breyer's ice cream.  If I can recall, gelato is supposed to be thick, dense, and rich texture and flavor.The flavor is mild.You can find really flavorful gelato at Paciugo's.  Or you can find really flavorful and thick gelato from Talenti at your local supermarket.Overall,  I don't think we will come back for the Gelato here, although we live a few blocks away.  It's too pricey and not enough flavor/texture.  I would rather spend my calories and cash driving to Paciugo's or getting Talenti.

27.description: Love this place. Really puts the neighborhood in the spotlight for all the right reasons. Staff is very friendly and attentive. The gelato is delicious and they have a wide variety of flavors. They also offer sandwiches and hearty homemade soups. The decor inside is gorgeous, classy and all in all a very pleasant environment. Family friendly and perfectly situated. 2thumbs up.

32.description: It's a very cute, wonderland-like place located in the Portage Park neighborhood off Irving Park Rd., directly across from the actual Portage Park.  I've been having an eye on this cafe for some time.  I'm occasionally on the CTA 85 (Central) bus and couldn't help but peek at this lovely piece of real estate every time I pass by.  This place serves gelato, coffee, focaccia/sandwiches, and frozen yogurt ($0.49/ounce).  You can also get candy by the ounce ($0.49/ounce).  Since hubby and I didn't see lots of froyo flavors and toppings offered at the froyo station, we went with the gelato, for we just had dinner at Jay's beef in Harwood Heights.  We came at the very peak time because kids were out and about, and people were curious about gelato flavors and continued asking for samples.  The young man and young lady were patient and experienced at dealing with the crowd.  The line, very soon, was dissipated.  Hubby and I were never "samplers;" we always make up our minds by visualizing the food and go with our choices with no regrets (well, there are regrets and dismay sometimes).  Tonight's choices were right on the money.  Hubby had the pistachio and spumoni; I had red velvet and lemon ice.  There are two (2) choices of size: four (4) oz. and eight (8) oz.  The four (4) oz. cup was enough portion-wise.  My favorite out of the four (4) was the lemon ice; it was light and had just the right amount of sweetness.  The bar table in the dining room features the USB outlets, so you can charge the i-pad directly with the USB cord without having to carrying the bulky outlet converter.  How thoughtful!  The location, to me, is great because I can have an access to Mia's by three (3) different busses: 78 (Montrose), 80 (Irving Park), and 85 (Central).  Coming from Montrose is a five (5)-minute walking distance, and coming from Irving Park is less than two (2)-minute walking distance.

54.description: Very cute space located right next to Portage Park which should give it decent traffic. There is more than just gelato at Mia's and my husband and I were pleasantly surprised about that. The gelato was pretty good. There is a wide counter showcasing the gelato on one side. The longer side has the focaccia type options and also has a mini froyo section. The wall also showcases some grab and go candy options. Their location and wide variety of food options should serve them well.

48.description: What a great addition to our neighborhood! We have lunched there twice since they've opened and loved our sandwiches both times. Went with the pesto chicken salad/caprese and roast beef.  Also tried the coconut gelato and although I loved it, my 15 month old gobbled most of it down.  My kid knows delicious too.

44.description: The decor is really cute. Pretty spacious with outdoor seating. Very close to the park which is all nice.They were a bit confused when we ordered food but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt since I'm sure the employees are still training.The gelato was whatever in my opinion. I taste-tested the lemon and it tasted like vanilla. The oreo gelato was surprisingly bland and I got no flavor from the gelato itself (although I can taste the oreo cookies).It's pretty pricey in there.

24.description: Went during my lunch break today, it's a Nice little location with great service and good food. I got the chicken pesto caprese sandwich that was so good and it was very fresh!  The gelato was also good. I would defiantly be coming back!

7.description: Slow service and dirty dining room. Let's see how the food tastes. It took them forever to make.

49.description: I was here yesterday and am impressed! and we are totally going back next time were at the park.This place is A LEGIT Gelateria! just as good or better than those snobby places in Wicker park or the hipster infested joint in Logan Square.Very roomy and ample sitting plus you can sit outside with great view of the park and or traffick...HA!We had some Gelato which was great! delishhhhand the coffee to go was well...coffee balck just like its supposed to be.They have a selection of FOCCACIA BREAD!!! need I say more??!?!!!SHake and bake seal of approval!Hipster infestation level: ZERO!!!!!come on man this is Portage Park! much too real for those urban explorers/starvin crappy artists to wander around in.

40.description: I parked in the adjoining lot and was chased down by an overzealous parking attendant  from Legno's.  Entering the cafe, the decor is cute and presentations of the items are nice.  The counter help leaves a lot to be desired though.  If I want two scoops of ice cream, that doesn't mean I want two scoops of the same flavor particularly when I'm still looking at the other selections.  I found the place to be pretentious and overpriced.  The gelato is okay, but not exceptional.  They are in a good location being across the street from Portage Park.  Nice place to visit on occasion.

53.description: sandwiches are mostly onion flavored, the ice cream taste like ice box, and the service needs another 3 weeks of training. if they hang around for a while, it'll all get better.

30.description: Fantastic food, Amazing Gelato!  Juan was very helpful telling us about all of his great foods.  Loved it.

46.description: This place is pretty good. Their focaccia is amazing and the whole idea of having the old school candy wall is pretty cool. Their gelato I'm afraid doesn't do much for me. It's more like ice cream. Way to thick and creamy. I've had gelato at many places here in the states as well as in Italy. This honestly was in no way gelato. I knew before I even tried based off of the flavors. They do not have general gelato flavors, they have everyone's favorite ice cream flavors such as Oreo and cookie dough. Still like this place and will frequent.

1.description: I really wish Mia's stuck with gelato and left the other stuff at the door. Their sandwiches, flatbreads and salads are ok, at best. Their gelato is good though, and so close to the park, come on - that's a win! The real reason for my "eh" review is the service is kinda terrible. It's always some apathetic person who doesn't care at all. I can get checking out at a job, man, we've all been there... but this is pretty consistent terrible service. Also TURN DOWN YOUR STUPID MUSIC Mia's! This place could be good. If the owners made some changes, this place could be very good.

55.description: Tasty gelato (Animal cracker and red velvet were spot on). Will have to try the shakes and pizza focaccia next time. Cute dessert place, take someone with you. FYI, the single dollar sign rating is misleading...this is on the higher end in terms of desserts.

9.description: What a cute place! I LOVE the decor! Very clean! We had a little of everything...candy, gelato, froyo, pizza and coffee. Everything we ordered tasted delicious! Just wish the people working behind the counter were a little bit friendlier. A simple smile, hello and thank you goes a long way!

26.description: As a resident of portage park I can say the neighborhood needed a place like this, a nice cozy cafe. Mia's has a variety of offerings from coffees and espressos to gelato and Italian meals, this place rocks. The best part of it is the gelato which is smoothly churned and is really creamy!

25.description: Gelato - as compared to what I have had in Italy their gelato is just ok at best. Actually, I come in often and not for the gelato. I have been there over 10 times and I have only had the gelato twice. What is amazing here is the sandwiches and the salads. The italian sandwich, turkey, and chicken pesto are phenomenal! Along with the puled buffalo chicken salad! I am very lucky to live a couple blocks away so this is definitely where we go for lunch on the weekends and maybe for dinner during the week when I don't feel like cooking. I would hands down recommend the food and supporting this local business.

12.description: Friendly staff.. Adorable store! I loved the mango smoothie and I sampled some of their gelato flavors.. The spumoni and strawberry chip were delicious! If I'm ever in the neighborhood.. I will return!

59.description: I think that Mia's is a great place to be for lunch or just for a quick bit to eat they have almost everything u can have to eat and most of the food is very creative including the Sicilian pizza there and the workers there r amazing and they have a lot of candy options too for both adults and kids I rate this cafe 5 stars and it was my first time there today and it's great and I recommend this place to lots of people

21.description: I've only tried the gelato here which was amazing. Please keep the Cookie Dough gelato on the menu all year! It's absolutely amazing!

17.description: The decor is really cute. Pretty spacious with outdoor seating. Very close to the park which is all nice.They were a bit confused when we ordered food but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt since I'm sure the employees are still training.The gelato was whatever in my opinion. I taste-tested the lemon and it tasted like vanilla. The oreo gelato was surprisingly bland and I got no flavor from the gelato itself (although I can taste the oreo cookies).It's pretty pricey in there.

10.description: Very good sandwiches for lunch, carrot cake is delicious. Gelato is amazing. I recommend this place

5.description: It's a very cute, wonderland-like place located in the Portage Park neighborhood off Irving Park Rd., directly across from the actual Portage Park.  I've been having an eye on this cafe for some time.  I'm occasionally on the CTA 85 (Central) bus and couldn't help but peek at this lovely piece of real estate every time I pass by.  This place serves gelato, coffee, focaccia/sandwiches, and frozen yogurt ($0.49/ounce).  You can also get candy by the ounce ($0.49/ounce).  Since hubby and I didn't see lots of froyo flavors and toppings offered at the froyo station, we went with the gelato, for we just had dinner at Jay's beef in Harwood Heights.  We came at the very peak time because kids were out and about, and people were curious about gelato flavors and continued asking for samples.  The young man and young lady were patient and experienced at dealing with the crowd.  The line, very soon, was dissipated.  Hubby and I were never "samplers;" we always make up our minds by visualizing the food and go with our choices with no regrets (well, there are regrets and dismay sometimes).  Tonight's choices were right on the money.  Hubby had the pistachio and spumoni; I had red velvet and lemon ice.  There are two (2) choices of size: four (4) oz. and eight (8) oz.  The four (4) oz. cup was enough portion-wise.  My favorite out of the four (4) was the lemon ice; it was light and had just the right amount of sweetness.  The bar table in the dining room features the USB outlets, so you can charge the i-pad directly with the USB cord without having to carrying the bulky outlet converter.  How thoughtful!  The location, to me, is great because I can have an access to Mia's by three (3) different busses: 78 (Montrose), 80 (Irving Park), and 85 (Central).  Coming from Montrose is a five (5)-minute walking distance, and coming from Irving Park is less than two (2)-minute walking distance.

3.description: I love that this cute and quaint concoction found its way into Portage Park.  This spot is "Willy Wonka innocence" meets the upscale, ooh-aah of Sugar Factory.  This is a whimsical, but classy little sweet-toothed affair.You've got gelato versus yogurt options. A decorated wall of candied jars, that you can fill a bag as you please. Small plated foods, such as soups and pizza slices, or sandwiches. Coffees and lattes. Bakery goods.This is the definition of "let's meet over a small dessert, or small bite." I think it's great for a family treat, or for a cozy occasion for any two-some. (Ex. meetup with a girlfriend, or meetup with a significant other.) I love the interior. Love the interesting flavors.You can stick with comfortable and familiar staples, like iced lemon sorbets, and spumonis, or dive into a flavor mystery, like popcorn and lavendar.  I'm definitely coming back for more, and this is a spot I'm sharing with others.

35.description: Everything food wise here is good. I was just really disappointed in their pastries for being a cafe they should have a good selection of pastries don't you think? Gelato is spot on! Coming back for that in the summer. Decor and ambience is really nice and peaceful good for a date night or just hanging out with friends.

19.description: What a TREAT to have in the neighborhood. Great space, friendly staff and lots of sweet choices! Had some fro to and sampled gelato. Was stuffed from the self serve frozen yogurt so didn't have any room to eat any thing else. Will definitely come back. The best part is there is zero guilt because I can walk there and walk home and walk off my indulgence. The owners are the same owners of Legno just north up the block. Go and check them out. You'll be glad you did.

28.description: I hope this was just an "off day" at Mia's for this usually AMAZING sandwich.  I pretty much drool at the thought of this sandwich and often wish I could have another after I eat it! Today, not so much.It had maybe two slices of turkey, was missing the fennel apple slaw, and the dijonaise was regular mayo.  I will for sure give it another try, but pretty disappointed all the same.

45.description: We all look for different things in an establishment. Me? I want to walk in, have unique, delicious, easy options and a place to sit. I have a 3 year old son and a husband who is happy with FOOD ON A PLATE. when I first suggested we walk to a gelateria after a long morning at the park, I was met with the most epic eye roll. Later, as we drove home in a food coma, I was avenged by the fact that I had a light caprese pesto sandwich on chibatta, husband had a roast beef on focaccia that he hasn't stopped talking about since, and I was easily able to find a kid friendly option (NY focaccia slice that we cut into "pizza fingers").  I am very very very excited to have this option in the neighborhood. So much so, that we'll overlook the indifference of the kids behind the counter... Although, I have to say that if our servers were people we could relate to/commiserate with, it would be an A++ experience. We will be back. Probably at least once a week. Thanks, Mia's!

33.description: Mia's is definitely a good addition to the neighborhood. The gelato is good, but that's not the reason to go there. Go for the sandwiches. The Al Italian is one of the tastiest sandwiches around. Meat, fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, arugula, pesto mayo, giardiniera, fresh bread...yessssss! My only complaint, and I know I run the risk of sounding like a cranky old person even bringing it up, is that it's always too damn loud in there. The music they play is just fine, but the volume makes it impossible to have a conversation without shouting. It makes for an unpleasant environment. I've given up on eating in there and have taken my (shouted) order to go the last few times I've been.

43.description: Best turkey sandwich ever.  Gelato and frozen yogurt rocked my socks too.  Great location across from portage park.

2.description: Stopped in today for a quick lunch and was pleasantly surprised at the menu, because they have a lot more that just gelato and frozen desserts! I got a mista salad, and it was very simple and very fresh. Nice quick lunch. I also got a scoop of Spumoni gelato. I've had their gelato a few times, and it's okay. Nothing special, in fact, it tastes a little artificial. Service was alright, the girl working the counter wasn't polite, she was clearly bored and uninterested in being there l, which is fair. Overall, it's a fine place to drop in every once in a while for a treat or a quick lunch!

18.description: My recent favorite stop. Discovered this little gem while taking my dogs to the dog park across the street. Best iced lattes and coffee ever!!! I wish I wasn't low carb dieting so I can actually try the food and gelato. Everything always looks fresh and delicious.

41.description: I really was excited to see this cute little place in our neighborhood.  Took the kids there for a treat on a hot summer day after the beach.  Was surprised (and thankful) that I brought enough $.  For as cute as it is, it's also pricey!  My son's soft serve frozen yogurt was over $7 (it was .49/lb at the time)!!  Yes, he had some extra fixins but...I don't think a large Blizzard is even that much.  Would love to try out some of their pastries and coffee as those items seemed a little more reasonably priced.  However, make sure you hit the bank before you go here for FroYo!

52.description: I went to Mia's yesterday, after there was a power outage at my place. I was tired, hungry, and my phone had less than 5% battery left. So I ran to Mia for salvation.Soups? None. Bummer. Sandwiches? Yes. Not the worst, or the best. Subway has a better selection. And better prices. I got the chicken pesto. I assumed it was a hot sandwich when it was more of a cold chicken pesto salad on toasted bread. Salads? Yes. Not a big selection. Or the tastiest. I got the Mediterranean one. Shoulda gotten the Caesar one instead. Drinks? They do have my favorite bottled old fashioned drinks. Overall, I think their prices were a little steep, esp when I expected more in taste. Pros: I did enjoy the ambiance and interior. It almost felt like I was walking into Wonka's candy store. I would definitely go back to try some gelato and focaccia bread

50.description: I want to give Mia's a five star review just by how awesome place is and how much is compliment the Portage area! However, I only had a latte when I went in. The caramel latte was actually much better then I thought it was going to be. Full of flavor but not to sweet which is just how I like it. Next time, I will give the gelato a try. My friend really enjoyed the gelato shake and said because of the service and taste that it was definitely worth the price!! Which I must agree with. The service was really good. The place was clean, big, and comfortable. They have outdoor seating too which is great for families and people that might have their dogs or bikes! Check it out the next time you're in the area.

4.description: We live in the neighborhood and have been coming to Mias since it opened and have always enjoyed it, today was a different story. The women taking our order was rude and did not take our order correctly even after asking us "what" multiple times because she was also conversing with another employee while taking our order. After waiting 24 minutes for a sandwich and salad we realized the salad was made incorrectly and by the looks of the barely there lettuce it looks like it was left over from days ago.  Despite Mias being in our neighborhood, next time we will venture out of the area for sandwiches and salads.

6.description: Perfect addition to the hood. Gelato, sandwich, pizza, and expression shop all in one. And all good too. We came after a baseball game at portage park and tried most things here. We had a chai latte, turkey sandwich, the chicken pesto sandwich, Mia salad, and a variety of gelato flavors (shout out to the sea salt caramel flavor). Sandwiches and salads are big and filling. Plus, have wifi for this that work from home or parents wanting to get out of the house. Will come here all summer.

22.description: Perfect addition to the hood. Gelato, sandwich, pizza, and expression shop all in one. And all good too. We came after a baseball game at portage park and tried most things here. We had a chai latte, turkey sandwich, the chicken pesto sandwich, Mia salad, and a variety of gelato flavors (shout out to the sea salt caramel flavor). Sandwiches and salads are big and filling. Plus, have wifi for this that work from home or parents wanting to get out of the house. Will come here all summer.

15.description: When I see cute little restaurants and cafes open in my neighborhood, it makes me happy. On the other hand, when walking into this cafe, I was presented with a warm home feeling, until I spoke to your cashier.No "hellos" or "how are you", just a cold blank stare until I was ready to order. It was very off putting, but I thought, maybe their food is good. But, I was wrong.  I ordered the tomato focaccia (and yes I've had this many times and have made it before and it's pretty simple a.k.a. hard to mess up).  When I finally got it the top was burnt almost all black. This is NOT how it is supposed to look/taste and also I paid $5 for this crap.  Get it together, this is all simple work, stop making people over pay for shit quality.

57.description: What a TREAT to have in the neighborhood. Great space, friendly staff and lots of sweet choices! Had some fro to and sampled gelato. Was stuffed from the self serve frozen yogurt so didn't have any room to eat any thing else. Will definitely come back. The best part is there is zero guilt because I can walk there and walk home and walk off my indulgence. The owners are the same owners of Legno just north up the block. Go and check them out. You'll be glad you did.

20.description: Horrible customer service! I was not greeted when I walked in and when I ordered strawberry chocolate chip gelato the girl with the long blonde pony tail served me strawberry and chocolate chip. I did not mind because I understood her confusion it wasn't until she corrected me and said its called strawberry chip and rolled her eyes at me because she had to redo my gelato. Then when I was sitting with my sisters,  I remind you she tried to be discrete, she tells her coworker that "some girl ordered one thing and changed it on me". I did not appreciate her service or that fact that I did not recieve a single smile instead she was on her phone. This is not the friendly customer service Mia's use to have!

36.description: Cute place. Pretty good gelato. Not much to say about the staff not horrible but not great. The guy seemed to care about his job more than the girl. The prices are a little high but isn't everything these days?

14.description: What a truly beautiful and tasty spot for gelato. My favorite is the lavender-light and airy it makes me feel like I'm consuming flowers which is an excellent thing for me! Reasonable pricing and the extra coffee drinks and treats make it a super fun shoot.

3.description: Love Criss!!! I've been going to him for many years and only he is allowed to touch my hair. You can tell him what you want, but he makes it better!!! He definitely has that magic touch!!!

1.description: I have been coming to criss for so many years i cant even remember how long!. Hes so good at what he does we got recommended to him by our aunt and cousins and we have passed on the recommendation to friends that go see him now as well. i can always ask him will this color look nice and he tells you what he feels about it and makes suggestions as well. i have no complaints i also bring my son to him as well and he does an amazing job. anything you want just tell criss and he will make it happened you cant go wrong going here!

2.description: Been coming to get my haircut with Criss for many years. He's very experienced, takes his time, and does an awesome job. My hair is not very easy to style but he always gives recommendations and gets the job done. Great haircuts for men, kids, and anyone that wants a good haircut!

5.description: I've been getting my hair done by Ines (who works here at Criss Hair Design).  Not only is she kind and friendly, but she also does an outstanding job.  I live about 45minutes from here and come all the way to get my hair done here.  I highly recommend her.

0.description: Been going here for years and NEVER disappointed. Always able to get appointment when needed. Recommend to all my friends and family. Very pleasant stylists. Great thing also is always parking available.

4.description: I was recommended to Criss Hair Design a year ago, and he does an amazing job! I am very picky on how I like my blonde highlights!  He really takes the time to listen to what you want.  When I was in last, I had my highlights done by Ines.  She did a great job!! I highly recommend this salon to anyone!  I will definitely keep coming back!

3.description: A month or 2 ago I'd give this place a 10. Helpful employees and great hours. Recently their hours have changed making id difficult to shop there or take in any equipment for repair.  Most people work 8-4 and that is the hours they are open during the week and only  a half say on Saturday. That is so disappointing. I mentioned this and was basically blown off.  I was told by one employee "well we are not really a hardware store and our hours are the same as our other locations"  The employees I dealt with when I took my snow thrower in for a repair were snotty and rude.  Sad when such a neighborhood gem goes down hill like this.

1.description: When I moved in with the fiancé a year or so ago, we made several trips to Russo's to furnish things, paint, and replace a few household items. I knew that he and his family had been using this place for general hardware needs for years and years (an uncle being a general contractor, his dad owning a lawn-maintenance company, and his brother being a very handy repairman). But I have been truly impressed with the level of service, knowledgeability of the employees, and the pleasant experience we had at every visit. Every time I go, If I don't know myself where to look, I'm always shown to it immediately. Ladies, they don't talk down to you here. I wish every neighborhood in the city had a Russo's!

2.description: We've been using Russo's for materials and equipment for our business for 15 years. Super helpful about anything you need and have everything you might under their roof!

9.description: Best local hardware store. Ever. I'll always try Russo before heading to one of the big box stores. A couple of times I needed parts to repair older items or to do a modification of something. They've been able to either find exactly what I need or fashion a piece to get the job done.They do everything your neighborhood hardware store should be able to do: fix/tune up small motors (lawnmowers, snowblowers, etc), sharpen mower blades, repair window screens and so much more. Need something fixed but don't know either what part you need or how to go about it? Just ask them. They'll either know what you need or will be able to point you in the right direction.Later hours on the weekends would be great, but I've been able to work with their hours well enough for years. If I had a big box store right out my front door and needed something on a Sunday afternoon I'd still wait until Monday to check out Russo first.

10.description: Great place and great customer service! I just moved a block away and needed to make several trips to get parts and things to replace our toilet and paint rollers. Everyone is really nice and helpful! I am glad to have them close by!

4.description: It's been a long time coming, I suppose. But the new façade and interior is an improvement. Though part of me misses that haphazard arrangement and organized confusion of the past.This is still the place to go in the neighborhood if you want expert advice, great customer service, hard-to-find unique parts, be in and out in 10 minutes, without having to drive 10 miles, fight crowds and traffic to some big-box store.

6.description: Love the help when I go in the door!

12.description: Russo Ace belongs on the Wild Chicago show. When you walk in the door, the kids who work here race to get to you & ask how they can help you find whatever you came there for. That's necessary b/c the place is packed floor to 15' (+/-) ceiling w/ 'stuff'. Few other hardware stores that I know of have the variety of things that they carry. They can also tune up your snow blower or lawn mower.

5.description: These people are great.  Always helpful and friendly and have what you need.  And good to tune up the snow blower or lawn mower every season

13.description: I love this place. As soon as you walk in the door, there is someone asking you if you need help. They will then walk you to the item you asked about and carry it to the register for you. When our sinks clogged up, one of the guys told us about this great stuff (black crystals in a white bottle) that works better than anything i have tried before. I much prefer shopping here to Home Depot, where I can never find anyone to help and when I do finally find someone, they don't know the answer to my question.

11.description: We live close to this place, and although they are sometimes a little more expensive, we will pay the difference every time!  Customer service is outstanding, feels very family run and old school in the way they do many things.  (buy your grass seed by the pound on your way out the door!)

8.description: Its great to still have the option of going to the local hardware store. While you will sometimes pay a little more than the big box stores, you get a personal touch that home depot can't beat. They recently repaired our window screens and did an excellent job.

0.description: Great store when you need something quickly and don't feel like dealing with a gigantic store like Home Depot or Menards.  Their service is amazing, employees are friendly, and prices are great. They are super helpful when you don't know what you need!  I've never had less than 3 people help me when I walk in.  Recently we were doing some electrical work at my house and my dad sent me here with some sort of gizmo and some info written on a piece of drywall.  I walked in, handed the employee my stuff, and he said NO PROBLEM!  Within 2 minutes I was out of there with the items I needed, even though I had no clue what they were.   :-)

7.description: This has been my " go-to" hardware store for 25 years.  They have great customer service and pride themselves on being well stocked.  If they don't have something, they will order it.  They hunt uncommon items down effortlessly, and tell you to come back in a couple of days.  It is liberating to know you can go somewhere, explain what purpose the item needs to serve and just have someone order it, if they don't already have it.  They will also fix windows, replace broken mirrors on specific items, etc.   The store is very neat and well organized.  They are great.  Thanks Russo's.

1.description: The shop has good artist, is clean, and the previous owner Scott was not only an artist but a true proffesional when dealing with cancelations etc. He is no longer there. Currently, Kris Thomas, one of the artist, is really bringing the place down. The guy doesnt show up on time and cancels appointments set two weeks in advance, WITH A CONFIRMATION THE DAY BEFORE, 30 MIN BEFORE THE APPT. He always has some sort of excuse, "my alarm didnt go off, im sick, I have a fever." He has to be woken up by his co-workers meanwhile his appts are waiting in the shop. While I understand people get sick, cancel atleast an hour before the appt. I took off work, lost money, wasted time, and didnt get anything done because of this. Kris wants clients who are there when he wants them too, he makes it very clear he doesnt like to be canceled on but cancels without sufficient notice. While he may do great work, someone who is not resposible enough to be there on time and keep up with appts is just as good as no artist. The way he dealt with the situation...he mother fd me, said his work is too good, etc etc. No one should deal with this guy. No profesionalism at all. I do not want to bash the shop, because I have gotten most of my work done there since it opened but Kris is not a person anyone should deal with. He even bashed the work performed by the previous owner....very unprofessional. If you go to Mortal, skip Kris. He's a waste of a chair in that place.

0.description: I love pizza! His tattoos are awesome and he is the sweetest guy ever!

28.description: I sometimes think I'm the kiss of death to my favorite Chinese restaurants.  Both Wok Inn and Little Hunan are now closed, leaving me to scramble to find a local restaurant which pleases me as much as they did.  Mr. Ging's is not that restaurant, however it does offer good food and a lot of bang for the buck, which I appreciate.Right  from the start I was impressed with the speed of the delivery and the sheer amount of food that was sent.  It all arrived hot, a state that is all-too-rare these days it seems.  The crab rangoon was not only a big order, but the pieces were huge.  Unfortunately they did not include any hot mustard, an odd omission.  The pot stickers were good, but the sauce, though good, was not the kind I like with my pot stickers.  It was slightly sweet and gingery, like the grown-up sister of the sweet-sour sauce sent with the crab rangoon.  Nice, but not what I wanted.  The hot and sour soup was good, but more peppery and less vinegary than I like it.  Still, it had a good flavor and was a good deal.I ordered the twice-cooked pork since that's difficult to impossible to find at most places I've been.  Again, it was good, but not great.  The pork was lean, but not as tender as I like, and the sauce was spicy, but not the almost barbeque-y type sauce I'm used to.   My dinner companion had another house special, which name I forget right now.  Shanghai something, and it was very good.I've awarded four stars here because most of my objections are that the dishes were not entirely what I expected.  It'd hardly be fair to take away points because of that.  For what we got, I'd say we did well, and I'll be ordering from there again in the future.  But I'm also going to keep looking for a local Chinese restaurant which more suits my needs.

1.description: There's a few things to consider when rating neighborhood restaurants. In no particular order-First is the nostalgia factor: does a reviewer claim to have patronized it for years? Second, what is the neighborhood like? Are there a ton of other options? Third, do they stay true to who they are? Keeping this in mind, Mr. Ging is in a small strip mall shared with a JJ Peppers. I live down the block but typically, quick service Chinese food isn't my first choice for dinner. I have several options for Asian foods with places like Ruk, LiHing, and Jess Cafe all delivering to my place. I chose Mr. Ging because I really had a taste for chicken and string beans but I didn't want to pay the $10 for a family size portion from Jess Cafe. It's just a $10 minimum for delivery, they're on Grub Hub, and being so close, it was delivered in 20 minutes.While some Yelpers had issues with their egg rolls, I loved mine. It was super crispy, had plenty of pork, and you could actually taste the five spice seasoning. I was looking forward to my sting bean chicken after my appetizer, yet I was let down. The chicken was obviously soaked in sherry (but really tender) and the green beans tasted old. Not sitting in the fridge old, but like they were sitting on the vine too long - making them dry, starchy, and lacking any sweetness. I've done this a few times after leaving my own string beans in the garden past their prime.Of course because I'm a glutton, I also ordered beef Kung pao and Singapore noodles. I was disappointed by the kung pao vegetables: celery, green pepper, water chestnuts, and bok choy. None of them are particularly flavorful, but they were fresh. Singapore noodles were good and had a nice amount of meat, but there was no curry. Whatever they seasoned it with was tasty, just not what I was looking for.All in all, for what it is it was a decent, inexpensive pick, just won't be a go-to for me.

9.description: The Best Chinese take out place in Chicago hands down!I've been going to Chop Suey for years and literally have them on speed dial.Although I do not live far from them at all. They always serve quick and fresh food. And the amount is perfect, I used to work in the area and would go to them everyday for lunch and it was always worth my 6 bucks. No other place I know is as friendly as they are and they have the best fried rice. At first glance you wouldn't think this place is too busy because it is a small place located on a strip mall but don't let that fool you the food speaks for itself. GO! GO! GO! And you'll never eat Chinese food the same again!

29.description: I'm picky when it comes to Chinese Take out.  Unfortunately no one place can fulfill my needs.  Some serve excellent food, but crappy egg rolls, others miss it when it comes to good hot and sour soup.Mr.Ging is my place to go to when I have very specific Chinese cravings.Their Lobster Egg Foo Young has huge chunks of lobster, not flecks, and I love love their Beef Mai Fun!  I haven't tried the hot and sour soup here, but their egg rolls are pretty good.

23.description: Good Chinese food on the NW Side, lightning fast delivery,in the Crab Rangoon you'll actually find some crab and not the overwhelming taste of cream cheese, good egg rolls, not great though, very good mongolian chicken and fried rice, good meat and no fishy taste to the shrimp. Solid local option.

5.description: Good food. No complaints. I just wished they added more than one sweet and sour packet when I ask for extra.

25.description: I like that you can see where the food is being prepared.  The restaurant is clean.  Service is OK and their food is fresh. I'm glad they are so close to me and that I don't have to go far to get good food.LOVE their Crab Rangoon!

12.description: Curry Shrimp so yummy.. Not my usual, happy I got something different. Going on wed are the best so fresh.  And they make it without msg

21.description: Your typical Chinese menu, here. Chicago has a plethora of Chinese places to choose from, and this place seems to be one we keep returning to. Food tastes fresh, and the portions are huge! My husband and I usually order the Dinner for 2 for $16.95 (egg rolls, chicken/wonton fried appetizer, egg drop soup, pork fried rice, sweet & sour pork, and beef & broccoli!). I also really like their Chicken Cashew. The egg rolls are good, but I'm not a fan of their Crab Ragoon filling. Delivery time is lightning fast!! They are closed Tuesdays. We have never dined in here, always delivery or take out.

16.description: Always used to order from here before I discovered a better option, Jess Cafe, just down Central..This place is not as fresh. They give you a pretty standard meal. It's not outstanding, but it's not terrible, either. They give you big portions for your buck, though. I like Jess Cafe better 'cause their food tastes a whole lot fresher, and they have bubble tea as well. Not a bad place, though. But not worth more than 3 stars.

17.description: Average service,Average food. Not terrible but not great either.

10.description: I had high expectations for this little restaurant based on the sign in the window claiming to have the best Chinese food in Chicago.  Yeah, I know it's normal for businesses to really talk up their product higher than what others might, but trust me the sign in the window was totally wrong.The only reason I'm giving this place a 2 star rating is the serving size was large on their lunch menu.  However, some of the sweet and sour pork was burnt, the rest of it had a mushy tasteless coating on it, the fried rice was not just fried but fried just barely short of burnt, the egg roll was also just barely not burnt and was very over cooked.  The one positive taste in the meal was the canned Coke which was cold and good tasting.I really hate giving a low rating to a small restaurant since I'm very much in favor of supporting small businesses whenever possible.  However, in this case I feel I am being pretty generous to even give this restaurant 2 stars.  The service was friendly and the dining area clean so at least they have that going for them.Next time I'm in the area I will just eat next door at the Subway sandwich shop where I know I will get served good tasting food.  Sorry Mr. Ging's I just really can't give you any higher rating without feeling I'd be doing other Yelpers a disservice.         :-(

11.description: When I was in high school I could eat chinese food atleast once a week and not worry about gaining weight. It's a little bit different now. I don't really crave chinese food, but if I do I order take out from here. My favorite is the sesame chicken with beef fried rice. The chicken is not like most chinese places. It's all white meat chicken with a little bit of breading. I've also tried the singapore chow mei. The lunch portions are huge and include a drink. They accept Visa/MC, but the min. is $10.

26.description: Pretty standard Chinese fare here.  I ordered some egg rolls, crab rangoon and shrimp chow fun.  I never tried chow fun, so I googled up pictures and it sounded good to me.  The crab rangoon came in a set of 8 for $5.25, so there was certainly value there, as the carton for food did not close.  The egg roll was standard as well, probably should have gotten a shrimp roll.Shrimp Chow Fun?  I am down with this dish since the shrimp is big and plentiful and as I dug around my food, there was always more shrimp to be found.  Delivery time beat the Grubhub estimate, but I must say they did not include napkins, utensils or free pop with my order.  Also they put a small carton filled with sweet and sout sauce that didn't make sense to me.  Decent value and I will have food for the next few days at least!!!

27.description: I ordered from this place and the driver was late and rude and expected a tip.  Having worked for tips, I didn't appreciate it so I told him his tip was to be on time and lose the attitude.I ordered Egg Foo Young and it was cold.  My chicken fried rice was overcooked and flavorless.  I mean how do you screw up Chinese food?

0.description: This is our favorite place to order Chinese food from. I like everything that I've had from Mr. Ging's. The food is always fresh, hot and plentiful. My favorite dishes include Chicken Egg Foo Young, Beef Fried Rice, Sesame Chicken and the Egg Drop Soup.Delivery is very fast too.

20.description: I love this place! It is made fresh to order which you can taste. None of the food is greasy which is a plus. I love the shrimp fried rice and highly recommend the egg foo young I have only ordered for delivery so I can't tell you what the place looks like ;)

19.description: Best Chinese around my area,  It use to be gross but They changed it up. The rice is delicious, orange chicken/mongolian beef/pot stickers/ crab ragoons/ egg rolls, are all tasty. They deliver fast, but they still use the carbon paper thing when you pay with a debit card (only when they deliver, inside they use the little machine), but the food is good, so you should try it.

2.description: got REALLY sick from this place. my family ate shared dishes of shrimp and chicken and all of us became VIOLENTLY ill vomiting, fever and diarrhea. SKIP MR GING if you wish to keep your family healthy, we had to go to ER for food poisoning.

18.description: I like that you can see where the food is being prepared.  The restaurant is clean.  Service is OK and their food is fresh. I'm glad they are so close to me and that I don't have to go far to get good food.LOVE their Crab Rangoon!

13.description: Found mold on my shrimp, after calling the manager and telling him about it, he didn't know what mold was so he didn't find anything wrong with it.

4.description: First time ordering off of Grub-Hub because I didn't have cash for my usual Chinese place and Mr.  Ging accepts credit cards.  First impression was not all that favorable, but not horrible either.  Egg rolls were included with a coupon, but I've had better and the delivery guy forgot the orange sauce.  I ordered three dishes and I'll list them in the order liked:  Tomato Pepper Beef Chop Suey, BBQ Pork Fried Rice, and Chicken Subgum Chop Suey.   I may give them another shot when I need a place that accepts plastic.

24.description: This was the first restaurant that I ordered from since I moved to Chicago from the suburbs. The food was hot and delivered before the confirmed delivery time, but it wasn't anything spectacular. I ordered Sesame Chicken, Pot Stickers, Egg Drop Soup, and Teriyaki Beef.

6.description: The orange chicken is the best around.  I have eaten in several places in the area and for orange chicken- hands down winner.  The chicken pieces are large and all lean white meat - delicious.

22.description: Not a fan of this place. The wings were nasty, orange chicken wasn't all that and the crab rangoon sucked as well, the sweet n sour sauce had more going on for it then the food itself. I think it's the oil they use for the food that makes it taste so bad. I'll never go back to this place. Leung's chop suey is way better and not too far from this place.

15.description: the food is great and well prepared! the place is small fit for more like take out food/pick up.. they speak broken english but just enough to understand your order lol

7.description: Their orange chicken and fired rice are the best of the area. If you are looking for good Chinese, then this is the perfect place to go. Also, the liquor store next door makes one step trip for food and drink.

8.description: Totally deliciousnous (not sure if that is a word!).  Totally made my birthday!   SOOO GOOODDD!  Highly recommend this place...!!!!

3.description: I totally luv lunch specials here, there's no need for me to ask to  Supersize. Yummmm .mm!! Next to Orange Garden Restaurant, this comes in very close to number 1! .

14.description: I just picked up my order and it was  not the same!The fried rice was overcooked,the general Ts  chicken was Blah and not to mention ,this was a very small portion,,not like it use to be,,,and my husband who NEVER complains thought  I went somewhere different!!!Very disapointed,$30.00 down the drain!!!! I wont go back not to mention that place needs its windows washed,and a good cleaning!!!

58.description: Few of us guys went there for the 1st time and after a $200 bar bill , not one drink on the house!   We wont be going back here anymore,  we'll choose other neighborhood bars that know how to take care of their customers that spend money.  They just lost our business!

56.description: This place is great. Really good food. Good prices. Really good staff. Decent crowd. They always have good specials as well. I have not had anything that disappointed me on the menu.

29.description: I live close to Sutherlands and every time i come across this place its always packed. I tried their Mini burgers and it was the perfect portion and tasted good. My sister got the mushroom stuffers but i was not a big fan of those. She also got a Mai Tai and that was delicious. Its the best I have had in awhile. I would definitely reccomend this restaurant.

42.description: It was an excellent lunch. A party of 6 and we had the Ruben (on special) and the classic burger. Not 1 complaint about quality not service. Our bartender/ server Jenni was very attentive. Brought crayons and paper for the toddler in tow. Loved the Structural Ironworker theme and the ambiance of the place. Highly recommend going there. Very good selection of craft beers.  The only complaint to muster is that the music was a tad bit too loud and unable to hold a good conversation ( difficult to hear one another at the table) or we would have certainly stayed longer.

23.description: Good neighborhood hangout with good food, but not kid friendly and they let me know it. I was eager to try Sutherland's and thought we'd get in for a quick meal last minute on a Saturday night. They did not disappoint in that regard because we were seated right away.  However, two of the servers indicated it wasn't kid friendly when I walked in with a baby and stroller. I wasn't expecting them to cater to us or the baby at all, but in the first five minutes of being there I started to get the sense they were trying to deter us with their comments. And I get it, but I was really hungry and just wanted a bite to eat nearby. Once we got over that hurdle the food and drink was solid and the convenience of staying in the neighborhood was worth it. Service was moderately slow when they weren't very busy. All in all, a great neighborhood hangout for adults but not families.

47.description: Came back for the usual good food and beer selection, and while both were still good, the old men bar flies were a sight to see and kind of annoying. The loudest kept bragging about working for the city and all of the pull he had. And when he  wasn't suggestively harassing the female bartenders (who seem used to his behavior) or preaching to his loyal subjects, he could be found smoking in the stairwell leading up to the apartments above the bar. When I first walked in I could smell cigarettes, but just assumed someone was smoking very close to the door. It was dark, so I can only imagine how many cigarette buts are littering the floor.

8.description: I would say this place has your typical bar food menu, but above average quality. Tot fan? You Vann chose them over chips or fries with your sandwich. The turkey burger is great, toppings are border line inventive, and it's on a pretzel bun. The decor inside is beautiful! Their bar fridges look like old school ice box boxes, and they just might be since this location had been a bar ever since I could walk. The high table tops and faux tin ceiling complements the new/old feel. Honestly, this place it's cheers in Portage Park, minus the warm staff. I can see the desire to have a friendly waitress, but if I'm eating, I don't want you to chat with me. Bar staff on the other hand...need to step up the game. They have an excellent beer selection with craft, imports, and domestics, but not the greatest liquor and spirit options. This is a beer and burger joint all the way. Also, this isn't Lincoln Square or Noeth Center. Leave the kids at home.

31.description: The best neighborhood sports bar. Great staff owners and food. Portage fries and chicken wings to die for. The burgers salads and daily specials are always consistently delicious.

34.description: Burgers are outstandingAppetizers were 1/2 price about 2 on sat.Service was top shelf.Music was a touch loud for my taste, but I'm reasonably sure it's normal for a tavern... I don't do a lot of bars I would be back if we lived in the area!

16.description: The food is decent but the wait staff is cold and unfriendly, wow!  Every one of them seems like they don't want to be there.  The steak sandwich is $12 and it's NOT worth it.  The meat is thin and very fatty.  Good fries, good craft beers, and good wings, but again, that whole wait staff is unfriendly, show no interest in being there, and don't seem happy.  Lots of nice TV's.

13.description: Excellent service and food. I've been here a couple of times, I highly recommend. The drinks are cold and stiff and the food has always been very very delishious!  Family friendly. Check it out.

11.description: Great place to enjoy a drink and food. I enjoyed a Delicious Sutherland burger. Sutherlands has a great friendly and welcoming atmosphere. It is a great neighborhood pub and grill to meet up with old friends. The staff is friendly and cordial. They are always on their game with service and speed. I would recommend Sutherlands to anyone who wants to grab a drink and a good meal for a great price

39.description: One Sunday, we ventured to Portage Park to grab a burger at Leadbelly's. We'd never been and didn't realize just how TINY that location is. I was getting really claustrophobic, so we left and had seen Sutherland's on the drive over. I yelped the neighborhood options and Sutherland's seemed to have a decent amount of good reviews that we went for it. I was so happy to see that the interior was spacious. They have a nice long bar and lots of other seating options. It was St. Patty's weekend and thank the gods, it wasn't a shitshow. Drinks...standard beer selection. Nothing too out there, but a few decent craft brews. Food...I had a turkey burger that was  miraculously moist. Turkey burgers tend to be super dry, so that was a pleasant surprise.  Even better was the pretzel bun. Their tator tots were SO DAMN GOOD. Super crispy and delicious. I plan to return.

37.description: I came to Sutherlands to meet a group of friends on a Saturday for the bulls game. The place is on the smaller size for a sports bar, but the ambiance was pleasant, HOWEVER the service from the waitstaff was horrendous!! The waitresses were rude and the bar back was just as bad!! I will not be back and will not recommend.

0.description: Been here a few times....Amazing food, great drinks and great service!  Definitely will be back and this is now one of my favorite bars in the area.

38.description: Great local spot! We were in there last night (not thinking about the Hawks and Bulls games being on) it was crowded but we were able to get a table. For as crowded as it was, the service did not reflect it one bit! The waitress and support staff were on top of everything. I wanted a mushroom/swiss burger which isn't on the menu but they made it happen no problem!  We really enjoying coming here for a bite to eat and a drink. Highly recommended!

51.description: The pros:Drink selectionsLegit sports bar vibeCute waitresses/bartendersThe cons:Food is just okTheir "homemade chili" tastes just like it came from a can...The burgers are so so, I've gotten some that were a bit undercooked in the middleThe fried mac and cheese is tasty but it's $7??I do really like their tater tots

27.description: Great atmosphere and great food!I had the turkey burger, and unlike many bars that serve frozen/ready made turkey burgers, this place has a turkey burger made from scratch. On top of that, you also get to pick from three different buns - great options! It was super thick and densely packed - delicious!The beer selection was also very vast, and the outdoor patio is very inviting.Definitely will be coming back!

32.description: Worse service ever. Been here with a group a few times and their service is horrendous. Bar food takes 40 minutes sometimes or sometimes just never comes out. Twice this has happened. Servers never come ask if we are doing ok, had they asked they would have seen that I had no food and the rest of the table did.

54.description: Food was EXCELENT the bartenders were fun. I had a great night, will be back soon!

48.description: Always a nice, laid back and friendly environment. Great to know solid bars and grills in the Portage Park neighborhood!

44.description: So this place is ALWAYS packed. If you ever want to get a few drinks with a few girlfriends or friends I definitely recommend it!

24.description: Have been here a few times and overall had good experiences. The food is good, the service has been good but the food comes out very slow when they're busy so if you're starving- get an app!The pretzels and cheese are good. Sliders are good. The burgers are good but a bit sloppy and hard to eat. They have a good beer selection and even got the goose island limited release blue line beer on draft. They offered us free tastings too!We live in the area so we will definitely be back

7.description: Sutherland's had been bookmarked for a while and was in my general neighborhood so a visit was inevitable.  My original thoughts were that this was a Martini Bar of sorts with some typical bar fare and small plates. However upon entering I quickly realized this is a sports bar. Ok no problem. But the windows were open and it was a warm humid day that day so that made seating a little uncomfortable.  Maybe windows should be closed on hot days. If you want to sit outside just sit on the patio. My pre-work feastconsisted of the Pulled Pork Sandwich special ( that's what the sign says) but it really came out as three small Sliders. Ok fine whatever! My preference would have been one large sandwich but the sliders were quite good. Very tender and just the right amount of sauce. They came with Tater Tots which were also very good but they would crumble to the touch making them difficult to pick up. My fingers are now full of ketchup, not cool not cool!To wash it down I had an Oldie but Goodie (Old Fashioned) which was very dissapointing. It was way too sweet and watered down. An Old Fashioned is a sipping drink and it should be strong so you need ice cubes that can last for a while without diluting the product.
