In this case I was hardly half-way through my drink and no cubes to be found. Definetly a sports bar and not a serious place to drink. Big waste of money!Overall the food was good and service was pleasant. The place was clean and agreeable.  However several missteps including an overly humid experience, crumbly Tater Tots,  and a major issue the poorly made Old Fashioned rendered this joint a bit dissapointing. 3 stars I might be back I might not!

49.description: Good place to watch a game.  I also enjoy their menu and beer selection.  Parking isn't great on the weekends, but overall experience is very positive.

40.description: A great go to during the week for tasty bites and inexpensive Martinis. Lots of tv's for watching a game and it's usually pretty easy to find a spot to sit and hang. Service is great with friendly waiters. It gets busy during game days though, so sometimes it's hard to track down your server, but the food gets there pretty quickly. Not many things to look at as far as decor, but it's as pub-ish as it can get. I always get one of the wraps with tator tots, which you can never go wrong with, but it's not really anything to be wowed with. They do have nice daily specials though, and the food is always fresh. Any of the appetizers are great. Parking is pretty easy to find. This is definitely a place for hanging out with friends and your significant other but not necessarily for a date. Overall, we've been coming here often so it's a fun neighborhood gem.

53.description: I came here today for lunch and met a friend.This place is a good bar, the food is high quality and the drinks are nice. I can't really give it a higher rating because it is a bar and there's nothing explicitly special about the place.The burgers are always good, nice buns, nothing soggy, the fries and tots are also top notch.The wings are good quality wings.Being a local neighborhood bar, I couldn't, give it five stars unless they upgrade more stuff.  Problem is, there's nothing wrong with the place, I really like it, but it's not a sexy bar per se. That said, during the summer, sitting outside across from Portage Park, really nice!

30.description: Nicely decorated bar which maintains a nice, new-looking appearance.  I love that their bar is long, like 16 seats deep kinda long.  The chairs are high chairs with a step for my lazy dogs and a hook by your knees for the ol'lady's bag or some other crap we might be shlepping. My first visit was based solely on looks.  In the past week whilst driving past, the place was crowded with smiles.  I made a mental note to check it out on some random evening.  On my first visit out my date mentioned rave reviews from her gal pal.  I guess this is where she'll grab a tasty bite, some good drinks and (maybe) a make out session with a random patron.On a recent occasion I wanted to bar trip down Irving Park road and this was our first stop.  We enjoyed a couple seasonal brews, light appetizers and then jetted onto our next bar stop.  Regarding service, our waiter could have been more inviting and checked on us more often.  The place was bustling with Blackhawk's fans hooting and hollering.  I would bet that many were "regulars" and our waiter was merely "shooting the shit" a little too long with her regulars.

46.description: Good Bar here folks, all the right moves!  Hot chicks behind the bar/ great beers on draft/ good food/ fair prices.  Lots of TV's & they actually clean the lines which makes for a great tasting beer! Three Floyd's on tap as well as some Chicago Breweries...Usually pretty crowded.. get dat did

1.description: Friendly people and comfortable atmosphere.I would like to express my appreciation to the bartender who paid my tab. Your gesture was so kind and generous. Merry Christmas to you and to your family!

55.description: Great neighborhood bar! Yummy mini burgers .. great beer selection ... the vibe is super chilled not too crowded ..

9.description: I usually come here for either a birthday celebration or to catch a game with someone. I would give them a 4 because the service can be crappy on the really busy weekends, but I like coming here. its really cool. the jukebox has really good songs. the service and food overall is good. I would recommend this spot cause they are very friendly also.

26.description: Sutherland's has your typical bar food. (wraps, burgers, salads...) I have never had a bad experience here. The one thing that I would complain about is the seating. You have to make sure you get there early (especially if there is a sports event) in order to get good seats. But other than that, I would recommend this place!

25.description: Sutherland's had been bookmarked for a while and was in my general neighborhood so a visit was inevitable.  My original thoughts were that this was a Martini Bar of sorts with some typical bar fare and small plates. However upon entering I quickly realized this is a sports bar. Ok no problem. But the windows were open and it was a warm humid day that day so that made seating a little uncomfortable.  Maybe windows should be closed on hot days. If you want to sit outside just sit on the patio. My pre-work feastconsisted of the Pulled Pork Sandwich special ( that's what the sign says) but it really came out as three small Sliders. Ok fine whatever! My preference would have been one large sandwich but the sliders were quite good. Very tender and just the right amount of sauce. They came with Tater Tots which were also very good but they would crumble to the touch making them difficult to pick up. My fingers are now full of ketchup, not cool not cool!To wash it down I had an Oldie but Goodie (Old Fashioned) which was very dissapointing. It was way too sweet and watered down. An Old Fashioned is a sipping drink and it should be strong so you need ice cubes that can last for a while without diluting the product. In this case I was hardly half-way through my drink and no cubes to be found. Definetly a sports bar and not a serious place to drink. Big waste of money!Overall the food was good and service was pleasant. The place was clean and agreeable.  However several missteps including an overly humid experience, crumbly Tater Tots,  and a major issue the poorly made Old Fashioned rendered this joint a bit dissapointing. 3 stars I might be back I might not!

12.description: Have been here a few times and overall had good experiences. The food is good, the service has been good but the food comes out very slow when they're busy so if you're starving- get an app!The pretzels and cheese are good. Sliders are good. The burgers are good but a bit sloppy and hard to eat. They have a good beer selection and even got the goose island limited release blue line beer on draft. They offered us free tastings too!We live in the area so we will definitely be back

59.description: Great neighborhood bar.  Food is good.  Everyone that works there is friendly and quick to serve.

21.description: I would say this place has your typical bar food menu, but above average quality. Tot fan? You Vann chose them over chips or fries with your sandwich. The turkey burger is great, toppings are border line inventive, and it's on a pretzel bun. The decor inside is beautiful! Their bar fridges look like old school ice box boxes, and they just might be since this location had been a bar ever since I could walk. The high table tops and faux tin ceiling complements the new/old feel. Honestly, this place it's cheers in Portage Park, minus the warm staff. I can see the desire to have a friendly waitress, but if I'm eating, I don't want you to chat with me. Bar staff on the other hand...need to step up the game. They have an excellent beer selection with craft, imports, and domestics, but not the greatest liquor and spirit options. This is a beer and burger joint all the way. Also, this isn't Lincoln Square or Noeth Center. Leave the kids at home.

17.description: Very pleasantly surprised.  Was planning on meeting a friend for lunch at Leadbelly down the street only to find out they were closed for lunch so jumped on Yelp to find the nearest decent place.  Ended up happy Leadbelly was closed.I had a patty melt and tater tots.  The patty melt was great, and what really set it apart was the onion jam.  I love places that serve tater tots and these were done perfectly.I had to go back to work so did not try the beers but my friend did and was impressed with the selection.

10.description: One Sunday, we ventured to Portage Park to grab a burger at Leadbelly's. We'd never been and didn't realize just how TINY that location is. I was getting really claustrophobic, so we left and had seen Sutherland's on the drive over. I yelped the neighborhood options and Sutherland's seemed to have a decent amount of good reviews that we went for it. I was so happy to see that the interior was spacious. They have a nice long bar and lots of other seating options. It was St. Patty's weekend and thank the gods, it wasn't a shitshow. Drinks...standard beer selection. Nothing too out there, but a few decent craft brews. Food...I had a turkey burger that was  miraculously moist. Turkey burgers tend to be super dry, so that was a pleasant surprise.  Even better was the pretzel bun. Their tator tots were SO DAMN GOOD. Super crispy and delicious. I plan to return.

5.description: Great place to take in a game.  They have a terrific selection of micro brews.  My son  and I enjoyed some great burgers and tasty appetizers.

3.description: Nicely decorated bar which maintains a nice, new-looking appearance.  I love that their bar is long, like 16 seats deep kinda long.  The chairs are high chairs with a step for my lazy dogs and a hook by your knees for the ol'lady's bag or some other crap we might be shlepping. My first visit was based solely on looks.  In the past week whilst driving past, the place was crowded with smiles.  I made a mental note to check it out on some random evening.  On my first visit out my date mentioned rave reviews from her gal pal.  I guess this is where she'll grab a tasty bite, some good drinks and (maybe) a make out session with a random patron.On a recent occasion I wanted to bar trip down Irving Park road and this was our first stop.  We enjoyed a couple seasonal brews, light appetizers and then jetted onto our next bar stop.  Regarding service, our waiter could have been more inviting and checked on us more often.  The place was bustling with Blackhawk's fans hooting and hollering.  I would bet that many were "regulars" and our waiter was merely "shooting the shit" a little too long with her regulars.

35.description: I live a couple of block away , ended up going and My first time was amazing ! Margaritas were perfect ! Great service and environment ! Definitely coming again !

19.description: Needed to meet a friend for a drink on Friday after work and basically found this place on Yelp. I wanted to stay between both of our routes home -me and Rogers Park and him in Bensenville. I figured was "in the middle" and he could jump on 90 afterwards or take Irving home.I'm glad I chose this place. Our whole tab was only $34 for the "first round" which was one meal for me (3 mini burgers with tater tots) and about 4 beers between the two of us. If I'm not mistaken, the beers were only $5 each, which for craft brews, I thought was a really great deal. I had the Lagunitas Little Suthin' Suthin', a new favorite, and another with hibiscus which I cannot remember. They had a pretty decent beer list and I really enjoyed my burger and tots.The inside was a little loud -playing Top 40 hits. It is a typical Chicago bar -long and narrow, front to back. The crowd was diverse -seemed like neighborhood folks. We sat on the patio with a nice breeze and it offered a little more quiet to have a conversation without having to yell over the music.All in all, a great experience. Glad I found it on Yelp and will definitely go back for an after work drink!

28.description: I stopped in with my cousin on a busy afternoon he recommended that I try the steak sandwich. The steak sandwich was very very good also the service was fast and friendly, the bar is clean and I definitely would recommend it.

45.description: Great neighbor spot. Loud, especially when the Blackhawks play. Foods is decent. Fries and tater tots aee great. Our favorite is the Thursday night special,  sliders! Good beer selection. Friendly staff. We come here once a week, as we only live 1 block away.

33.description: Great neighboor bar with a large selection of drinks and good bar food.  I had the Turkey Burger and tots and ate the entire thing. There are also a ton of TVs so it's a great spot to catch a game.  I've seen the outdoor patio open but have not had a chance to stop in when the weather has been nice, I will definitely get there this summer though!Food specials are great too...$3 beers? I'll take it.

43.description: Great selection and great service. I highly recommend this place if you haven't been here yet. Very clean and well ran with an awesome staff.  Perfect selection of food and the best Beer list around. Prices are very good considering everything is top shelf. Stop in and see for yourself!

2.description: Great food, service and drink!We are regulars that keep coming back because of the great food and service. The staff is always very attentive and the food comes out of the kitchen quick and hot. Sutherland's is a real model for how to run a successful sports bar. Excellent craft beers and daily specials. I especially love the pub burgers and coconut shrimp.We like to go for lunch or an early dinner as it gets very crowded and loud later (after 9). Too bad the acoustics cannot be toned down a bit (subtracted 1 star for this reason) as it is sometimes deafening.

18.description: Sports bar with a young spirit. The chips and guacamole are really good along with the wings. The place has a jukebox and well drinks are $4 (at least when I came here on Friday). They got outside seating, but it's right by Irving Park Road and cars pass by constantly. Overall, for the area it's in, it's a pretty decent place.

41.description: I really enjoy this place especially since it is in walking distance from my house.  The beer selection is good.  Their chicken sandwiches and burgers are really good and I have heard the steak sandwich is good too.  I might try it the next time I am there.

52.description: Sutherland is just the place the neighborhood, and surrounding neighborhoods needed. Their Burgers and tater tots are great, and i'm a fan of the macaroni and cheese bites. They have enough TV's and they play decent music, it's a nice place for a night out if you're not looking to go very far, but it's also great for just drinks and getting a bite.

50.description: Sutherlands is the best for me & my children. They have the best fried mushrooms & turkey burger ever. Great atmosphere.

4.description: I came in to eat with a friend here because they had heard of it. Right off the bat going in you can tell it's never empty. It's a nice atmosphere, the waitress was friendly. There were not many vegetarian options to choose from on the menu besides a black bean burger and a wrap and some appetizers but we decided to give it a try anyways. We both ordered the black bean burger and fried mushrooms. The mushrooms came out nice and hot and crispy, they tasted good, not a lot of flavor but they were the best out of everything. Then our black bean burgers came out and they looked delicious! We couldn't wait to try it! As soon as we both took our first bites however we were a little disappointed. The burger was loaded with avocado though which was a HUGE plus because many places are stingy with the avocado,  we loved that but the flavor just wasn't there. I'm not sure if it was the corn that threw it off but something was missing. We've had many vegetarian burgers and this wasn't our favorite, it was good but not a favorite. The drinks however do look tasty and we will be coming back to try them out! But the food just was not for us. Their tater tots were nice hot and crispy though! I do recommend those along with the fried mushrooms.

6.description: Great spot to watch games, lunch or just a drink. The Owners are always helpful and friendly along with the staff. They are also always attentive to what games are on and when they end.

22.description: This place has the best Turkey Burgers. All the food I've tried here have been really good. The service is good, nice beer selection. But if your going to come to Sutherlands try the Turkey Burger, you won't regret it.

15.description: Burgers are outstandingAppetizers were 1/2 price about 2 on sat.Service was top shelf.Music was a touch loud for my taste, but I'm reasonably sure it's normal for a tavern... I don't do a lot of bars I would be back if we lived in the area!

57.description: Great sport bar great costumer service love the hot wings and  they brought my beer back Newcastle

20.description: I live in the neighborhood been there a couple of times. Bar, ambiance is nice. Pretty mixed crowd as well which I appreciated. Food has not been that good the two times I've been there, was very disappointed. I ordered chili and it was cold. I believe I ordered Mac and cheese nuggets or something of that nature, not that good either. Some good drink specials. On both occasions one of their  waitress, same one I had both times,  was rude to me and pretty much ignored me; however the second time I was there , I was with my boyfriend and she seemed to be much more attentive to him. Hmmmm. (First time I was with a girlfriend). Bummed because if you live in this neighborhood you probably know we don't have many cool kind of places  in neighborhood to hang out in (I'm a young professional in my 30's). I'm forced to go back. 2 stars cause of bad food and service by waitress.  :/

36.description: Perfect for blackhawks games (with game sound!). Comfortable full, chill demographic, good beer, good food, fast & accurate service. A++

14.description: I came to Sutherlands to meet a group of friends on a Saturday for the bulls game. The place is on the smaller size for a sports bar, but the ambiance was pleasant, HOWEVER the service from the waitstaff was horrendous!! The waitresses were rude and the bar back was just as bad!! I will not be back and will not recommend.

3.description: I'm a sucker for some really good, hot and fresh chicken fried rice. What can I say I'm a simple man who loves simple dishes sometimes. Just throw a little soy on that and you're all ready to go. The prices here are really good for the amount of food you get, I haven't had a variety of things there but I definitely recommend the fried rice. :)

1.description: First off - This place is no longer called Wong's, it has changed ownership. The sign outside now says PaquinoSecond - Horrible customer service. The person who answered the phone didn't understand English. Took over 15 minutes to complete the order as we spelled out Everything. Ordered by numbers. Then it took over an hour for it to be delivered. It's two blocks away! When it did arrive, it was the wrong food. Driver had already left, so we called the store. No answer for 1/2 and hour. Driver had called to get directions, so we called him back. He also did not answer. Drove to the store to return food and get money back. When I walked in, the two people at the front... Just. Walked. Away. When neither of them responded to me when I repeatedly said "Excuse me?", someone came out of the kitchen, who spoke perfect English (facepalm). Returned the food and explained how it was the worst delivery experience I had ever had. He was apologetic, but when I suggested that he should be the front of house guy since they couldn't speak English, he just sighed and told me that the owners (the man and woman who walked off on me) wouldn't let him answer the phone. He's just the cook.So they can't answer the phone but won't let someone who can do it for them? Just stupid.Stupid, horrible, worst customer service. They will not receive one dime from me or anyone I speak to about this.Oh, and as I was leaving the store, I was almost run down by a car that zipped into the on-street parking in front of my car. Of course it was the delivery driver.

0.description: I wish I could give this place a better rating, but in all honesty I was unimpressed by my meal.  The hot and sour soup was neither particularly hot nor particularly spicy.  I ended up adding some white vinegar and some hot sauce to bring it up to the way I like it.  My potstickers were huge, and fairly tasty, and they were done the way I like them with a good, dark crust on one side, but the egg foo yung was really disappointing.The price wasn't disappointing, though.  It's close to home and the food was very fresh and cheap so it remains a possible alternative when times are a bit tough.

2.description: The restaurant is now called Paquino as was previously mentioned.  I happened to be in the area and stopped in.  The restaurant is bigger than it appears from the outside, with a lot more seating than I expected.  The place was cleaner than I would have thought, as well.The only person there was a Hispanic fellow.  I almost turned around and left, then asked myself why.  Most asian restaurants are almost all Hispanics in the kitchen anyway.  Why would seeing one interacting with customers bother me?  It shouldn't, so I stayed and ordered.I ordered a lunch special of shrimp egg foo yung, which came with chicken fried rice, a choice of egg roll or 2 crab rangoon, and a can of soda for $5.95.  That's a really good deal.The presentation was surprising.  Instead of the usual cheap plating, the meal came on a rectangular dish.  Not expensive or anything, but a refreshing change of pace.  The egg roll was mostly cabbage, but I didn't expect anything more.  It was good for what it was.The fried rice was exactly like you'd expect from this kind of place.  I like that style, so it suited me well.  I was expecting a serving the size of a small ice cream scoop, but I got a good sized ramekin's worth inverted on the plate, a pleasant surprise.The egg foo yung (two patties) was nicely fried, and featured larger shrimp than I expected.  (If there were a suitable synonym for expect that fit, I would have used it.  Sorry!)  They were still small, but they weren't the microscopic version I usually get at places like this.  The only problem I had with my meal was the gravy.  I don't know how, but it smelled salty, and definitely tasted that way.  Cut the salt content by at least half, and you've got a pretty good dish.This isn't food you go out of your way to get, but it's an excellent choice if you're in the area.  To sum it up, this place exceeded my expectations.  (What did you think I was going to say?!)

5.description: Used to be a great place for an authentic Chinese dinner when Johnny and Sunshine owned it.  Now it SUCKS.  The egg rolls are never cooked all the way and the food is terribly bland.

6.description: This is my local Chinese take-out place and fortunately, I love it.  The food is consistently delicious and the portions are large and the egg rolls are fantastic!  Like Mark S. has already mentioned, they're really not breaking any new ground here.  But who cares?  When I'm in the mood for beef with broccoli or sweet and sour chicken, this place really hits the spot.  It should also be noted that everyone who works here is super-friendly and delivery is really fast.  Also, the last time I ordered, they gave me a deluxe 2007 calendar with their menu printed on the back.  How convenient is that?9/27/07 EDIT ----------I am knocking this down to a 3 star review.  Why, you may ask?The last time I ordered from here (a couple weeks ago), I had a couple cans of diet Pepsi thrown in with my order.  (Because what goes better with all that MSG than diet Pepsi?)  So anyway, my food and soda arrives........ I crack open the can of soda, take a huge swig, and spit it out in disgust because it tasted HORRIBLE.  I hold the can up, only to find an expiration date of 2/2007 printed on the bottom.  Do you know how long soda is good for?  Like, three years.  The fact that I was drinking a can that was 7 months past its 'drink by' date kind of grossed me out.  Ugh.

7.description: Call this place up to order yummy Chinese food that's fresh and hot and you know what you've done? That's right- you called the Wong number!So no new culinary frontiers are being conquered here, but for normal basic Chinese carry-out this place is really good.  I live super close bye and they always get me my food fast and hot- no excuses ever.  Just make sure they put the mustard sauce in the bag if you want it- the tend to leave it out.

8.description: The place went downhill after the new owners took over, the food was undercooked, and when i called to add more food on my order the guy that answered hung up on me TWICE....I do not recommend this place and THEY DONT SPEAK ENGLISH!!!

9.description: There food is good I keep going back at least once a week. Prices arr reasonable.

10.description: We love Wong's. It is the only Chinese place I will eat at in the neighborhood. People rave about Guey Lon but they must have delivery because if you walk in the place it smells odd. Musty, old, funk - ick! I could never sit down and eat in there. This place is clean and smells clean. Has small seating area but enough to accomodate those who do eat there. About 8-10 booths. The staff is friendly as well. I give it 4 stars only because they are a little heavy handed on the heat. I order Kung Poa Chicken and I ask them for mild and not to make it to spicy. Well mild is still very spicey. We also have ordered several chicken dishes such as chicken/broccoli  or pea pods  and Chow Mein dishes. All very good.  The crab ragoon, pot stickers and egg rolls are all delicious. I have never had something here I did not like.  We are difficult customers too! I ask for low fat version, no MSG and no onions/scallions (allergic) they are always happy to accomodate my request. The portions are large and the prices are good. I am surprised that their are not more views.

4.description: 3.5 stars is much more accurate.When I first moved into this neighborhood I was delighted to see Wong's just a mere block away. The first two or three times we tried Wong's I was impressed. They say they can make everything with no MSG, lower fat or sodium, etc. The prices were reasonable, and the staff friendly, and more importantly the food was good.I'm not so sure about Wong's anymore.... The last time we ordered our food was dry, under sauced and overcooked. They raised their prices. They started being closed on Mondays (but only sometimes)....I might give them another chance here soon, but now that they've raised their prices-it's almost worth it to go get really GOOD traditional Chinese food, even if it is farther away.

3.description: I went here for a late lunch. It was pretty quiet, there was only a couple of other people in the place.The meal started with chips and salsa. The chips were warm and crispy. The salsa was good. It was warm. I go more for the type of salsa with cool fresh cut ingredients, but still found this tasted good.The steak tacos were really good. The steak was tender and full of flavor. The toppings were fresh.The beans were good. They had the right texture and flavor.The rice had good flavor and was cooked just right.It was clean and the people were friendly.I would return again!

1.description: Straight from work to take my daughter to her basketball game, and this is what I can find rushing down Cicero to feed the fam before the game. I'm a Mexican food fanatic. I know Mexican food. I cook it well since my mother-in-law, who is a beast in the kitchen, taught me to cook the real deal.I have no problem eating at "hole in the wall" places. Sometimes they serve up the best foods, but this place is not one of them. The food is really off on flavor, especially the seasoning. It was not good at all. I was beyond disappointed and was hoping to redeem it by making the excuse that people just cook differently. The excuse still doesn't change the fact that the food is not really that good.To top it off, I bought 3 different types of meals with 3 refreshments and it totaled $30! It wasn't even worth it.I'm reviewing the food specifically, as I was content with the service received. The women working and running this place are the sweetest and very attentive. Service itself is great, but the food leaves much to be desired. Overall, it has potential if the cook just lightens his hands on the seasonings.(PS- There's a possibility that the other reviews on this place are from friends and family members.)

2.description: I cannot believe the reviews for this place. It has been one of the worst places I've visited since moving to the hood. Jeff's might have better Mex food than this place.Our first experience wasn't great but that doesn't deter me, we went around 5pm on a Sunday. As we were walking up, a woman on the inside, who worked there walked up and locked the door..... So.... we had no other option BUT to find something else. Next visit, I get the flautas, I was stunned, not only were they harder than my phone, they were dry and unseasoned almost whole pieces of really fatty chicken, fell apart like sand it was so dry and hard, it was the most bizarre crap I ever did see. Maybe they thought....? Who knows why they would serve that to me but it was awful. I really couldn't take more than a few bites.  The last time was just a mess, we order two waters &one horchata to start plus one order of guac. We get two horchatas  & no waters & some really tasty guac.... On to the entrees, I order.... in English first- then the guy taking the order just continues to look at me, so I order in Spanish & he writes it down, comes back w/ our food in a pretty quick amount of time. IDK what it is w/ their seasonings or if all the food here is just old due to no customers & they just keep the meat/ingredients but its bland & awful textured. I haven't even gotten to the part where I'm sweating balls cuz the AC is either nonexistent/ they didn't turn it on, the woman's room was like a furnace & really gross, lets leave it at that. Also it would have been a nicer experience if this little child who was somewhere (I couldn't actually see him) wasn't screeching for what seemed like no apparent reason somewhere.

5.description: Is Portage Park the new Logan Square?  As the square turns into condos will there be a great exodus northwest up the main thoroughfare?  Those two questions may never be answered; but here's one that might be: where is the best Mexican place in the Milwaukee Avenue corridor?The answer might be found in a little storefront place just off the corner of Milwaukee and Cicero in the form of Playa Escondida.Living further down Milwaukee, I thought I had seen it all in the way of taquerias.  And from the outside, this place looks like every burrito joint in Logan Square.  But where this place is different than its southern counterparts is the quality of the food.This was no day old refried beans scooped on a plate place.  If the Logan Square Mexican joints are Taco Bell, this place is at least Qdoba (though the food tasted healthy like Burrito Beach).  The ingredients were fresh, tasty, and light; and the presentation was sort of, and this is odd for this kind of restaurant, classy.  The kitchen even sliced the lime on my side salad into a beautiful approximation of a flower.And surprisingly even that bit of artwork didn't take that long.  Being as Samantha E. and I were cutting it close for a movie (as we usually do), the speed of the service here was amazing and I thank them (though the remnants of Hurricane Ike that were drenching Chicago did make the place empty).It's a bit pricier than their southern competition (about $13.95 for a full dinner as opposed to the $9.95 in a typical Logan Square place).  But they do have $6.99 combos (I got a burrito combo with rice and beans) that are more than filling.  And when the competition all moves in to this up and coming neighborhood, I'm sure even that will drop.

6.description: In what seems to be a bit of a restaurant desert, this place was a good find. Nothing veggie on the menu, but upon request, they whipped up a decent veggie burrito. And the chips & salsa were delicious!

7.description: Great place for some good Mexican food. The chips are good and the salsa is always fresh, homemade and delicious. Very calm environment. Shy one star for the outdated decor, but everything else is great.

8.description: Tried it last Saturday. As I went in I realized it is bigger than I expected. Chips and salsa were good, I tried a lomo en chile de arbol and it was good, portions were large. beans, rice and fresh salad and I must mention the handmade tortillas you don't get this in many places, I would go back just for the tortillas. all for about $13.00 + tip.

9.description: My friend Michael G. and I came in here before seeing a film screening at Portage Theater.  It was very clean, and we were served quickly.  The food cost a bit more than we expected, but it ended up being totally worth it.  I mean, it wasn't expensive, just a little more than a typical Mexican diner.The food was very fresh, and had nice presentation.  I got the chicken enchiladas with verde sauce, which was excellent.  The sauce was only a little spicy, but very tangy and light; it tasted of limes, and I love limes.Overall very cute, and nicer food than you'd expect from it's outward appearance.

0.description: Maybe it's because I have been living in Seattle for the past 7 years, but I am surprised this place is listed as $$. It's super cheap! I ordered two entrees and made it out for less than $17.00. In Seattle, entrees usually start at $10.Anyhow, while the inner decor is nothing spectacular, the food is really good. Being from Southern CA, I am a die-hard Mexican food fan. They have an ample menu and the food was quite tasty.I just moved to the area so I have not yet had the chance to try any of the other nearby Mexican restaurants, but for the quality of the food, the location and the price, definitely a place to try if you are at 6 Corners.

4.description: It's been a few years since anyone reviewed this storefront and I get the impression that while the name is the same the ownership is not. No big money gringo combos anymore... I think I was the only one who didn't habla. That being said the service was great. The waitress spoke some English and we Charlie Chaplin-ed the rest. I really should invest in Rosetta Stone. Anyway, I stopped to have lunch and do a crossword after going to that amazing museum of old time banking and excess across the street. I used Yelp to find something close. When I walked in I could tell this place does more Spanish than English business. And they had a larger crowd than I expected- a large group of animated laborers, a weathered older couple staring, a young man being manly for a younger woman. I found myself forced to go with a simple steak torta dinner ($6.50) because I wasn't sure what else to order. Besides I was more interested in my paper than expanding my horizons. The food was good, the fresh lime was still there, and the horchata was fantastic. The salsa had some kick. I like that since the space used to serve eggs and hash browns there's counter seating. Sitting at a counter while eating alone and reading a paper just feels right. I also like a place that pays no attention to the crooked, mismatched wall hangings.  I'm all about the cake, not the frosting.  I'm there to eat and wouldn't feel under dressed in a bathrobe. A large part of their menu is devoted to seafood and I saw a bunch of it coming out of the back... a large bowl of reddish broth with a full fishtail coming out of it, an intact (head and tail) and lightly breaded fried fish on a huge platter, etc. Maybe I'll do some research and try not to go all Taco Bell when I stop in after the next time I do my banking across the street.

29.description: Very friendly people and helpful.  It's my local shop, though it is not the closest.   highly recommended.

42.description: Good ServiceHelpful StaffQuality Products priced fairlyFree safety checks when they have a booth @ an event.An establishment that gives back to the community in the form of - support for events the 16 th district Police Station bike show for example.- Donations to the neighborhood association for their Children's benefit parade.

23.description: They fixed what Smart Bike Parts messed up. Their nice staff did a wonderful job getting my bike back in working order, and for a decent price!

47.description: Just bought my bike here yesterday -  a Schwinn Cruiser SS in Coppertone.  Salesman Dennis was really helpful on the phone and when I went in -- helped me pick out the right basket, light, etc. and didn't pressure me into always buying the most expensive thing.  They also register your bike with the Chicago Police which is a nice addition because I'd never get around to doing it.

8.description: It turns out I bought my last skateboard(ever) from the Lincolnwood location  in 1990. 22yrs later and I bought my 1st bike in over 20yrs there! Great kids working there. Went with my wife to buy a $300-400 bike and thats exactly what we left with! SUPPORT LOCAL SHOPS!!! BUY LOCAL!!!

31.description: I have gone here for repairs and new bike seat, they are very friendly and knowledgeable. I went back for an adjustment on the seat 1 year after I bought it- they took care of me immediately and I was in and out within 5 minutes (at no charge!)

34.description: I bought a bike at a garage sale for $10. At some point between when my oldest child and my middle child learned to ride a two-wheeler, the tire went flat. It was only when I went to examine the tire that I saw the bright yellow "Rudy's Schwinn" sticker on the frame. After reading lots of positive reviews about the place on Yelp, I took it in for a tune-up and tire fix. The staff was really pleasant and helpful, answered my questions, and even let my newly potty-trained child use the (staff) restroom.

16.description: Most awesome service!  Rudy the owner personally came over and explained everything I wanted to know about purchasing a bike and he was honest and not just there to sell the high end bikes.  Rudy is extremely courteous and professional.  The service team is also fast and well trained.  I would definitely buy my next bike here.

13.description: Great shop for getting your bike serviced.  Not one of those extorsionist Lakeview/Lincoln Park/Wicker Park shops, they are reasonably priced and actually know what they are doing.  I worked at one of those afore mentioned shops for years...

11.description: My first purchase at Rudys was such a wonderful experience I had to make it my first Yelp review. Let me start of by saying the staff is so delightful! Very friendly,  knowledge and charismatic. I bought two pure fix bicycles ( The papa and the bravo) The moment i saw laid my four eyes on them i knew it was meant to be. Rudy was so helpful.  We ordered them, and he even gave me a ring the moment they were at the shop. I picked them up and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  Thank you to everyone at Rudys,  I will be back soon!

39.description: This place is GREAT!  Rudy is GREAT!  I went there with my heart set on a Dehon folding bike since an internet search showed him as having the lowest price.  When I got there (which was a haul from downtown), and even after my persistence regarding th Dehon, he talked me into another model, a Giant.  In many ways it is a better bike, and since the Dehon didn't come with any accessories, it cost a good $500 less!  He actually talked his price down getting me to another bike!  It is no accident that he is the third generation to own this bike store.  PS:  I love my new little expressway!  I'm on my way back today to get my main bike tuned up and again he is substantially less expensive then say someplace "cozy".

37.description: Went back to have an adjustment on my wife's bike. I had no appointment and just stopped in, I was amazed that they took her bike in the back immediately. We were in and out in about twenty minutes. Just a great shop to do business with, definitely recommend them.

0.description: I'm not the brightest guy when it comes to bikes. My kid was saying it was so hard to pedal his bike and one of his brakes didn't work. Bike was nothing too crazy, a target special or something of the sort. The kid likes the bike. I looked at it for a couple seconds and told myself to go to the experts. I figured it's worth the look before dropping another hundo on a new one.Enter Rudy's. Place has been around, and they know their stuff! Friendly staff, very knowledgeable. Simple fix for them took them 5 minutes. Couple adjustments, tighten a couple screws and reattach the brake line.  Cost me a whopping 4 bucks. I would recommend this place to anybody! I was very thankful I took it in to have them check it out. Brought it home and the boy said it rides awesome now. Thanks Rudy's you guys are fantastic!

38.description: So like a lot of the fellow Yelpers, I too was a bike virgin.  My last bike was when I was in elementary/middle school.  My wife and I recently moved to Chicago and getting bikes was now a top priority of mine.  On my way home on the train, I Yelped a number of bike shops and after reviewing them all, Rudy's was #1 on my prospect list.  So the next day, we drove there and was initially greeted by either one of Rudy's sons or another young adult he has working there.  He was super nice but his level of knowledge was not convincing me.  After a few minutes, Rudy came over and just provided the most amazing service.  He took the time out to discuss the pros, cons, etc. with everything.  We both wanted comfortable cruisers and ended up finding the perfect bikes.  I got a Giant Cypress and the wife a Schwinn Voyager.  I will admit I originally wasn't planning on spending more than $500-600 for our first bikes but I didn't really have the knowledge as to what bikes really cost for what we wanted.  We ended up spending just under $1,000 for two bikes, locks, water bottle holders and a back storage mount for the wife.  We picked out 2-3 bikes each and test drove them in the back road behind the shop which was pretty nice.  After we made our selections, Rudy double and triple checked to ensure we were good to go.  Even though he was closed (since we came towards the end of the day), he stayed and went over everything with us -  he did a gear test presentation to help us understood how the bike actually works, showed us how to take off the front tire, etc.  He was everything I had read and was expecting.  I will continue to give Rudy my business as he well deserves it!Thanks Rudy!!!!!!

27.description: The owner was helpful on the phone but when I got to the store his employee was less than eager to sell me a bike for my kid.  The guy could really careless to help me and wasn't too interested in making a sale. I bought it but I had to push on the questions, see other models etc.  He was better priced than the location in Park Ridge.Not sure I"ll be back to purchase again

32.description: It's a little pricey. The selection is alright but there is definitely better in Chicago.  If you're in that neighborhood...check it out but call around since there many local options.

48.description: They've been here so long. Always good service and friendly clerks.

44.description: I bought my daughter's bike here and couldn't be happier with their service and products.  They are all very knowledgeable here and take there time in making sure you get the right bike.I will probably be back soon to get myself a new bike.

24.description: I have bought every bike I had here.  I just noticed my bike is 25 years old.  What lasts that long now.  Rudy Jr is great to deal with and he always hires the best people.  Great neighborhood bike shop I would recommend to anyone.  Great prices.

7.description: This place is awesome, the staff is extremely polite, helpful, and friendly. The prices are not too bad! Definitely my favorite bike shop!

40.description: YAHOO! Sorry Rudy :) I didn't write this sooner. Last year in - May 2009 - just like so many warm weather-first time riders, I wanted to take up cycling.  I went to a lot of bicycle shops in lincoln park, lakeview, logan square, edgewater, yadda-yadda. Some places were nice, some were rude just cause i'm not cool enough to be a hipster bike rider, but most were extremely expensive! Finally I went all the way to the northwest side and found this gem -Rudy's! The manager was great and took the time to explain to me about frame fit, different types of bikes etc. Rudy's is a great first time bicycle shop. Because of his great attitude I've gone back to purchase accessories and will continue my relationship with Rudy's for a long, long time! The bike i ended purchasing was on sale and ran about 350. I rode my bike everywhere (including to work!) and finally stuck in in the garage in November - I'm keeping my fingers crossed and hope to be cycling soon! I'm a bit scared of the weather, so I'll wait till it's a bit warmer out! I can't say enough positive things - so I'll just say what's easiest - THANK YOU.

30.description: Do Rudy and his crew ever tire (no pun intended) of being awesome? I was fortunate enough to break my rear axle a mere two blocks from Rudy's. They had me in and out in about 30 minutes, and I finished my ride home. From now on, all my bike breakdowns will happen within walking distance of Rudy's. lol

46.description: I bought  a low-end recumbent from Rudy's. When I had some initial pedal problems, the owner fixed it AND upgraded the solid bushing in the bottom bracket with roller bearings - no extra charge.

1.description: Friendliest business I've ever been to!I'm a bike noob, and when I went in to buy a fixie the owner Rudy was the complete opposite of condescending. He was very knowledgable and super polite.Customer service is also excellent- had to bring back my bike a few times due to some manufacturers' problems- they fixed everything for no charge and with no bad attitudes.

9.description: Came in to get a flat fixed and ended up picking up rain gear that I had installed as well. The staff is very friendly and the prices are decent. It took them a while to finish it but the wait wasn't too bad.

26.description: We decided to take advantage of summer's last hurrah and the long Columbus day weekend with a bike ride.  Only problem was our bikes had been in storage for waaay too long and needed some TLC. We live not too far away and took a chance that Rudy's could get our sorry looking bikes into riding shape. The Bonus: they were running a special for 1/2 price on a tune up - nice!  We called and got Rudy himself, and he said he might be able to get it done by the next day. Imagine our surprise when we got the call (4 hours later!) that our bikes were done. Now that's what I call amazing service!  Rudy's Rocks!

25.description: Purchasing a new bicycle can be an overwhelming and intimidating process. The gentlemen that assisted me at Rudy's was extremely helpful and answered all of my questions clearly and patiently. If someone were to ask me where to buy a bicycle I would definitely recommend coming to Rudy's.

12.description: Prices are.....pretty high.

21.description: Its usually one of the more recommended places to get service done on your bike without waiting too long for it to be done. Owners kick of a jerk, but hes got some really nice people working for him, SOMETIMES. Price is fair at best, leaning more towards expensive more so than other times.

17.description: Everyone at Rudy's is a cyclist, but not the strange, zombie-type where if you so much as hint you own a vehicle or (gasp) take the bus, ever, you experience a blast of cold shoulder followed by a 15% mark up. The guys at Rudy's love bikes, love riding bikes, and gently encourage their patrons to keep riding their bikes without making it seem .... cultish.... to do so. So, go to Rudy's if you need anything cycling-related. You will not be sorry.

10.description: So super helpful. I can't believe I haven't reviewed Rudy's yet.I've been in a few times for repairs or to have them give the once-over for a new-to-me bike. They've always been beyond fair with their prices, and have done minor tweaks for free. I can't say enough about the awesomeness of this shop and the people that run it.

5.description: I went to rudy's because they had great reviews, but I would not recommend going there, they told my back wheel would be 50 dollars and they charged me $20 "extra for some piece I needed." They didnt even call me to let me know, I found out when I went to pick up my bike. And my bike is still making noise. I am very disappointed with this bick shop! I will never go back.

3.description: Of the three bike shops close to me, Rudy's is right in the middle, but it's my #1 choice. Polite service and a wide variety of accessories make the experience pleasant. I'll be going there soon to purchase my Topeak Road Morph G Mini Pump.

35.description: Recently I had a bike problem and I had no doubts where I should go to fix it. It's Rudy's Schwinn cycle shop. I really like this guys!! Every time when I go there with my bike, they are very helpful, knowledgable and proffesional. They are bike wizards and they fix bike really fast if something is minor. This was always my case- usally flat tire. I'm sure they are fast too with something more complicated. They have great prices for great service. I really recommend this shop!

19.description: I went there to have them fix my flat tire and tighten up my front brakes. The service was prompt, courteous, and customer focused. So happy I went here. They made my business feel important to them.

28.description: Everyone at Rudy's is a cyclist, but not the strange, zombie-type where if you so much as hint you own a vehicle or (gasp) take the bus, ever, you experience a blast of cold shoulder followed by a 15% mark up. The guys at Rudy's love bikes, love riding bikes, and gently encourage their patrons to keep riding their bikes without making it seem .... cultish.... to do so. So, go to Rudy's if you need anything cycling-related. You will not be sorry.

45.description: I stoped in here today to get some accessories. I didn't get anything installed here, but the clerk was very helpful. When I wanted to buy a front basket, he asked what kind of bike I had and let me know that the kind I wanted wouldn't work with my quick release wheels.He was very helpful and helped me to pick out a new rear-rack for my bike. He also answered some questions that I had about a trailer-cycle which I purchased.Bike supplies never seem to be inexpensive, but I didn't find this place to be too bad.The employees are very kind and polite...they even filled up the tires of some kids for free. Nice guys these.

33.description: The Mrs. is the kind of gal who gets back on her bike mere days after the wires were cut from her double-fractured jaw. Yeah, boneheads: don't make a left turn in front of cyclists!That said, she is not a master of all things mechanical, so she needs a bike shop that:-Has what she needs-Can install it and show you how-Doesn't give any douchey attitudeRudy's is her ace in the hole.Sez her, "They are patient, knowledgeable, and they have a great sense of humor. When they rebuilt my bike after my accident, Bill noticed that my handlebars weren't the right width for my body. He went ahead and replaced them with the correct size. Few cycle shops would even notice, let alone make the appropriate adjustment.  They are all so nice, letting me hang out in back as they make adjustments, and only rib me a little bit for not being able to switch my own pedals. But it took Aaron all his might to do it himself, so NYAAA! Plus, they don't slather your chain in gloopy lube like the lesser shops do."

43.description: We bought my husband's bike at Rudy's.  It was a terrific experience.  My husband, who is a skeptical shopper at best, had complete confidence in the very knowledgeable sales person.  An excellent, local experience overall.

2.description: It kind of breaks my heart to have to review this place poorly, because I had high hopes for this family owned very successful shop and the staff is VERY nice, especially Rudy. But TWICE now they have put me in danger with faulty "repairs" and accessory installations. I ended up at Rudy's bc they had the bike I wanted ready to go. Along with the bike purchase came all kinds of perks such as free tune ups. Well, this is the last place I would get tuned up after these two experiences.Experience 1: I buy my bike and a bunch of accessories. I ask the VERY nice and friendly burnout looking young kid to install my accessories, including a basket. He does. On the way home, my third time riding a bike in 20 years, the handlebars just drop an inch or more while I am riding. Apparently he forgot to tighten it when he installed my basket. I went to the shop on Lawrence at Western and they fixed it, free of charge. Experience 2: I overload my basket and it snaps, just a couple of weeks later. I bring it back to Rudys for repair. I get helped by the young burnout kid again. I tell him I snapped my basket and it wont stay up and told him I actually find it kind of cumbersome for everyday use and that I want a bike rack on the back for more options, since the basket is removable. He "fixes" the basket and puts on the bike rack. On my way home, my pedals start clicking like I am changing gears when I am not. Also, the minute I put something VERY light in my newly" fixed" basket, it falls down again. I take my bike the next day to the much closer to my home 5 star rated Turin's shop in Lincoln Square...The very professional associate there fixes my basket with extra reinforcements and tells me it looks like my gears are grinding bc one of my back wheels was put on a little crooked. Fixes it all for $15. Rudys charged me $12 in labor and didnt use a brake wire to reinforce my basket like Turins did. He said that was $5 of the $15, which makes their labor charge even cheaper than Rudy's faulty one. Bike runs great now and basket seems very sturdy in its place.Rudys put me in danger, and I cannot stand for that. I am a brand new cyclist and spent a lot of money on a brand new bike so I knew I would be safe. I will not be returning, even for my free tunes ups. I am, however, in love with my bike and grateful that they had the one I wanted in stock and ready to go for me when I needed it.

18.description: We decided to take advantage of summer's last hurrah and the long Columbus day weekend with a bike ride.  Only problem was our bikes had been in storage for waaay too long and needed some TLC. We live not too far away and took a chance that Rudy's could get our sorry looking bikes into riding shape. The Bonus: they were running a special for 1/2 price on a tune up - nice!  We called and got Rudy himself, and he said he might be able to get it done by the next day. Imagine our surprise when we got the call (4 hours later!) that our bikes were done. Now that's what I call amazing service!  Rudy's Rocks!

41.description: Buying a bike as a novice is no easy task. By pure luck/chance/me getting lost my first week in Chicago, I found Rudy's. I stumbled in and asked about getting a bike. The manager there was BEYOND helpful in answering every single one of my questions. I mean, I was annoying. I asked the differences in kick stands, lights, horns/bells, helmets... everything. He was so complete with his customer service that I literally got every accessory for my bike from custom tires, to a custom seat, bell, basket, headlight and back flashing lights. Because so much crap was being installed, he told me it would take a while. I had to get going so they allowed me to come back a few days later. Sadly, the manager was not there, just his assistants. They, too, were gems and went over all the features of my new bike. It's nothing too special, but I love it. They ensured the seat was fitted properly for my specifications and even helped me adjust my helmet. I was such a geek riding my bike home, ringing my bike bell.The service Rudy's offers is unlike anything I've experienced. I have been to multiple bike shops since moving away from Chi-town and no one has even come close to how amazing these guys are.

4.description: I bought a bike a few months ago and needed some gear. There's a place within walking distance of my house but becuase all of the terrible reviews, I skipped it (plus, I've been in there before and the owner is a jerk). The empolyees are Rudy's are super friendly and helpful...that's enough to keep me coming back time after time.

6.description: Went to rudy's for the first time. The owner was very friendly and extremely helpful,but I'm kinda disappointed on the service I got. I had a new spoke installed on my hybrid bike and I was impressed bout the speed of the service it only took  bout 10 mins ,but when I was riding the bike home . The new spoke I had installed broke already . I didn't have time to come back to get It worked on because I had to be at work. Gunna try to come back tomorrow and see what the y can do bout my bike.

22.description: It turns out I bought my last skateboard(ever) from the Lincolnwood location  in 1990. 22yrs later and I bought my 1st bike in over 20yrs there! Great kids working there. Went with my wife to buy a $300-400 bike and thats exactly what we left with! SUPPORT LOCAL SHOPS!!! BUY LOCAL!!!

15.description: My very first and only new bike (that I still ride, BTW) was purchased here in 1993. Now that I'm back in the neighborhood and in the market for a new bike, I thought I'd give them a shot. The crew here were nice back then and I was delighted to find that they are still nice. I stopped in this week after work and despite it being close to closing time, Rudy talked me through my options. We got it narrowed down and he told me to come back a little earlier the next night and he'd have them ready for me to test ride. Sure enough, I called when on the way and they set me up with the bikes I had been eyeing. The tech who helped me was friendly and accommodating. He adjusted things for me, listened to my concerns and adjusted again. He also didn't try to up sell me, push accessories or anything else annoying. I paid for the bike and came back the next day to pick it up with the manufacturer's pedals on it and ready to roll. Before I left, they talked me through my need-to-know stuff about my new road bike (vs my old mountain/hybrid), set me up with a presta valve adapter, wished me safe riding and sent me happily on my way. It is a smaller shop, so not for the extreme cyclist, but anything you may lose in selection, the service is well worth it. The pricing is competitive and they really couldn't have been nicer or more patient.

20.description: I've never purchased a bike from here, but they have a good selection of bikes for a beginner to intermediate cyclist. You'll find a decent selection of Schwinns, GTs, and Giant bikes.  I mainly go here for their maintenance services and they are very affordable, finish in a timely manner, and the employees are knowledgeable and friendly.  Anytime I have something that I can't figure out myself I bring it to them.  These guys are awesome!!  I highly recommend them for servicing.

36.description: I had not bought a bike since I was a kid, and I didn't want to spend too much money until I was sure that I was going to ride a bike regularly.  I made a list of about 20 bike shops in the city and near north burbs.  I am 6-4 and need a large frame bike, so after many phone calls, I narrowed my actual "visit" list down to 12 shops.Rudy's Schwinn Cycle & Fitness impressed even over the phone.  I did not know that I was actually speaking to Rudy.  All I knew was that I was getting treated respectfully and all my questions were getting answered with care.When I visited the store, I was given the same care.  On top of that, Rudy's has lower prices and a larger selection than most other bike stores. I bought a Giant 2010 XL Cypress model that was 20% off, plus they offer 2 years of regular bike service at no charge.Buying a bike is a highly personal experience.  I could not be happier with my choice.

14.description: I can't believe that they're not 5 full stars, they are some of the nicest people on earth, SUPER friendly, and they know what they're doing. I got my back tube fixed and bike inspected for less than 20 bucks!

12.description: It is good good! The portions are big, (but so are every other Chinese restaurant's I suppose), but if you are not used to eating Chinese food its something to note. We had the dinner sized portions, and no other ethnic restaurant has as big portions as Chinese, plus their meat is not ground, it is solid pieces of delicious meat!They have free food for different size orders (10, 25, and 45 I believe). They have very cheap sushi that is the best for the price. I enjoyed eating there, and the lady was very friendly, seemed to know a lot of the customers that came in, so there are regulars. I had Salmon sushi (only 3.50) and beef and broccoli. It is not as greasy as other restaurants that I recently went to, and I enjoyed every bite!I would definitely eat here again.

7.description: Right across the street from us.... We had high hopes as we ordered for delivery. It took about a half an hour for the food to get to us and the second time we had to go pick it up and it took over 45 minutes. 1st off, the food is mediocre at best, very tasteless and the last time we ate from there my wife and I both got very sick. She ordered a soup that tasted like old dirty tofu and garbage. Never again.

3.description: Every time I have ordered, they say it will take less than an hour and it always takes over an hour. It took over 2 hours this time and I had to then go pick it up myself. ABSOLUTE WORST FOR DELIVERY!!!!

1.description: No thank you. This place used to be good back in the day but now serves small dishes with no meat. I ordered a Mongolian beef lunch box and received 4 pieces of beef... Ordered a shrimp dish and got a few shrimps. The flavor isn't that good either. Sorry but this place has gone to waste.

2.description: First time I ordered and im sure the last.  The orange chicken was like mush.  The fried rice tasted terrible and the eggroll had a rock hard piece of something in it. Ugh. Big waste of money.

9.description: My work ordered their food for our New year celebration...it was very very good. I've never been to the actual place but it was amazing. I will deff have to go into the restaurant to eat

18.description: The lady on the phone couldn't understand what I was saying and it was hard to understand her. I have no accent but her was very bad. But once I CONFIRMED my order with her it was all good. Until it was delievered. Once it was delivered it was wrong. So I called up there to ask them about it, the lady was mean and told me she wouldn't refund it and I'd have to pay for another delievery charge unless I came and picked it up.In short, I paid for something I didn't want and for them to fix it, they would not refund it, and they were going to charge me for the correct item and the delievery charge.

10.description: Still delivery only!Still fast delivery times!Best Egg rolls around the area, you have to try the Spicy Salt Shrimp the best! Every time we order we get free stuff, Egg Rolls, Free Delivery or free Crab Rangoon, what a deal!Someone else needs to review this place, come on yelpers you can do it........

13.description: A Chineese takeout place in a Polish neighborhood with Spanish translations for the menu items.  Their lunch specials are a good value, assuming you find the food edible.  The General Tso's "Chicken" had a pretty bland sauce and very little with it in the way of vegetables.  If it is indeed made with chicken, it is the darkest chicken meat I have ever seen, and regardless, it tasted wrong.  The fried rice is fine, and the shrimp in it is larger than you'd expect, but the shrimp also tasted a little rancid.  I'm not a big egg roll person, but the one that came with this lunch special was especially not special.The lady at the counter was friendly, although stingy with things like sauce and napkins.  If all Chineese food tastes the same to you, this might be a good deal.  It was more food than you could eat (even assuming you could stomach it all) plus a can of pop for $5.50.  If your taste is even a little discerning, try ordering from nearby Chineese Kitchen instead.

16.description: It was alright. Alright describes the food very well I think. Fried Rice Express closed down apparently and I needed a Chinese fix so I yelped Chinese and went with this one.Delivery was fast, food was hot and the order was correct, so points for that. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are big.We ordered, wonton soup, general tso's chicken, veggie eggrolls, veggie fried rice and veggie lo mein.Eggrolls were not good. They were super salty and had a very weird taste to them- almost like a cinnamon taste. Just not good. My lo mein was ok- lots of veggies but just lacked a lot of flavor. The fried rice was the best part- but not the best fried rice I've had. No compliants on the chicken or soup, but no one was raving. My family and I have been looking for a Chinese place we can call our own so we have been trying some out lately.I guess we will keep on trying.

17.description: First off China Star is located in Jefferson Park not Portage Park. I always go to China Star. I love Chinese food. I live a few blocks away from China Star. The service kinda sucks. Their cheap with the napkins and soy sauce. Their delivery service rocked though. The food wasn't bad but they don't give enough for what they charge.

15.description: Typical Chinese fare. Pretty good values can be had, though that's generally the case at most neighborhood Chinese restaurants. Most of the items run on the greasy side, though once again, that's fairly typical. I get the impression that very few of the menu items are homemade or fresh, and that they use the same wholesale distributor as 80% of the Chinese restaurants in the area. Strictly carry-out or dine-in; they have a couple of tables but I certainly wouldn't recommend sticking around. OK in a pinch but you can probably do better if you have the time to read reviews on Yelp about where to go.

0.description: Cheap, cheap lunch specials with huge servings! For less than six bucks, you get an entree, chicken fried rice and egg roll. I wanted vegetable fried rice but they charge a dollar extra if you want anything other than chicken! The owner gave us our Cokes for free though which was nice of him. Pepper steak and eggroll were okay, but my rice was so bland! This place is mostly for carryout, as there are only 3 tables. We dined in since we were just passing through the area. I liked how the owner brought us the food instead of just calling out the order. I also got a kiwi smoothie to go which was awesome, especially with the kiwi chunks. They don't skimp on the boba, either!

5.description: Love this place!  Food is always fresh and hot and full of flavor.  The owner's are always nice and remember me all the time. One of jefferson Parks best places to eat.

11.description: Love their food, good size portions and the food is always fresh.. Love their Sushi., especially spicy tuna roll w/ avocado, the tuna is so very fresh and 8 prices for  3.50 to 5.00 is moderately priced.. The Mongolian beef is fabulous made old world style with scallions.. I would highly recommend this place.. The owners are so friendly and delivery is fast..

8.description: This place is known for take-outs and delivery. However, if you want to sit down and eat, there are always tables available despite having few tables. I can go on and on how the food taste delicious like the Kung Pao Chicken, the Orange Chicken, and the General Tso Chicken. Friendly service, good food, and definitely affordable.

4.description: The most rude lady ever. The food is alright but it's not worth coming here for people like her !!!!!!!!! Save your money

14.description: China Star is ok.  We've ordered a couple times from here, and the food is decent.  One thing to note is I believe they use MSG in their cooking, so for those looking to avoid that keep this in mind.  We've tried their fried rice, wonton soup, shrimp egg foo young, fried salt pepper shrimp...all were ok.  The salt pepper shrimp was, well, a little too salty.  I know it's supposed to be a little salty, but when your mouth tends to pucker and you feel very thirsty, that's a little too "salt" than pepper on the shrimp!  Otherwise, nothing special, but ok food.Overall, okay food, okay service/delivery, okay prices.

6.description: Yeah, it is a great place. The lady taking an order is always nice, even after not having gone there for several months she still remembered by favorite order. Good food, nice service.

28.description: I used to live in the neighborhood and got delivery.  Egg foo young, orange chicken, mongolian beef all quite tasty...excellent pot stickers. You can't go wrong with the dinner specials (or lunch specials) which include pop, egg roll and an overabundance of rice.Yum!!

1.description: So I have an affinity for hole-in-the-wall Chinese right.  And ever since my go-to for Chinese and  Asian fusion takeout closed, I'm at a loss. Left to wander the streets of Chicagoland in search of a new, easily attainable location. And until such a time, will suffer the consequences of both the good and the bad of searching.The place is old and dusty looking inside, much like their dirty, decor-free fish tank. Although properly fed, their goldfish live apathetic lives because of it. Much could be associated in how we digest their food. It's a Mom and Pop kind of place operating on a shoestring budget, so one cannot expect too much. If dining in, they offer three tables that seat 4 and street parking is free for an hour till 6 pm.The take-out joint could use some "TLC" and the fresh smell of Mr Clean! I feel as though some cleanliness would liven up the atmosphere for all. And for goodness sakes a heater as well.  I walked in seeing the counter lady donning a sleeveless vest and wondered whether she wears that while cooking? (and she does) I stopped in about 24 hours ago and on that day it was about 60 F outside in Feb, no less. However, inside the place was ice cold and looked dismal. At the time, the cook was in the middle of having his lunch and reading the paper. So, I waited for the counter lady to finish her phone call, placed an order and took a seat. I ordered a lunch special with orange chicken which comes with chicken fried rice and your choice of an egg roll or 2 crab rangoon and a can of soda. I asked for an egg roll but for whatever reason the ol' lady gave me 2 pcs of crab rangoon. It was decent, nicely fried and filled with a lightly sweet cream cheese. I also ordered shrimp chow fun. (Per reviews and photos online, this sounded good.) Jumbo shrimp pieces with bean sprouts, carrots, water chestnuts and flat, wide rice noodle. It's a "dry" entree that is stir fried. (For a little difference, you could request they make  1/2 of the noodles well done. This would add a crunch to them.)  They went too heavy with the fish sauce, because that was kicking up a stink in my car (also the following day when reheating, the stink was everywhere. I cook with fish sauce sometimes but try to use it sparingly. The smell can be offputting for some.) I requested that they make the fried rice spicy as well as the noodle dish and they obliged. Both were tasty when prepared. I'm not for certain whether the rice was made fresh at the time. I saw a very large rice cooker in the back and am aware that fried rice is prepared in advance, then steamed to life when ordered. In any case, it was steamed just right and if I'd had that alone, it was good. The shrimp was fresh, meat soft.  The orange chicken was stringy and rubbery, when I heard it dropped into the fryer I knew immediately it was prepared from frozen. The food is about a 3 to 3.5 star.  They use MSG fo'sho and I was lax when ordering, so I was left in a haze of funky, headache-inducing nausea. I felt gross after.  So, for those of you that dislike MSG as I do, it's a good reminder. Request, Request, Request-it removed. Don't let the appearance of their entry door fool you, they aren't going out of business. They just haven't had a chance to repair that glass door. So for now, the masking tape will have to hold it all together. Judging from their interior, I would bet many inefficiencies go uncared for.

9.description: This restaurant is run by people who care about their customers.  It's not fancy, but it's clean, the food is good, freshly made and reasonably priced.  The owner really wants you to enjoy her food;  I say that because whenever I have phoned an order for pick up, she waits for me to get there before she packs it up.  When I get home, the food is piping hot & fresh.  Sometimes we have the food delivered, and again, it' all good:). My family likes everything we have ordered in the past. Good, prompt service & nearby.  YUM!

23.description: BEST ORANGE CHICKEN I HAVE EVER EATEN.Very good TAKE-OUT, huge portions and good prices, don't recommend eating in, kind of a dive but clean and you can watch the food being made and they use fresh ingredients and have a clean kitchen.  Our favorites are:  Orange chicken, Chicken Fried Rice, good shrimp in brown sauce.  Been there twice and looking forward to trying other dishes.

5.description: I've ordered here a couple of times. Good is always hot and portions are big. The food is great, I don't think I've ever disliked anything from here!

25.description: Another lazy Sunday and we were in the mood for Chinese. I had also received several colorful flyers from this business and always wanted to try them. Glad we did. I"m in Jeff Park and this is right off Portage Park. It truly is a little hole in the wall. I don't think I'd want to eat there. Not putting it down, but this is strictly for pickup, but man the food is great. I ordered the Orange Chicken which was delicious. I also ordered the Mongolian Beef which I would rate a 7. Not that it was bad, but onion overload and I like a little more spice. Here's the thing, you get a lot for your money. They gave me a ton of food. I ordered two entrees and they gave me a huge side of white rice and 1 eggroll with my coupon and it came in under $20. I think we have leftovers for 2 days. Give it a try, but don't expect much from the decor.

12.description: All I have to say is I wasn't disappointed with what I got. It was very delicious and nothing bad about it, the rice was perfect, I totally recommend this place.

21.description: My favorite chinese place in Chicago! They know me by name I am sad to admit. Super nice owners, VERY generous portions, and you can see them making your food when you order. I get their lunch special (if after a certain time, you pay a bit more and get a bigger portion) orange chicken YUMM!! Crab ragoons also YUM! OK now I want some, go try this place out!

16.description: I have been eating at leung's since I moved to Portage Park in the 4th grade. I am now in my mid twenties and although I have moved to a different neighborhood I always come back to leung's if in craving Chinese. I love their orange chicken and crab Rangoon. Their lunch and dinner specials are large portions for affordable pricing and I have yet to find another place to match them. I haven't a lot of other items on their menu but their fried rice is delicious, sweet and sour chicken was yummy and their Mongolian beef was tasty. I will continue to frequent here to satisfy my Chinese cravings.

17.description: This place is horrible. I ordered the chicken fried rice and it was by far the worst rice ever, I have never seen chicken fried rice so dark in my life and the rice was stuck and clumped together.  I also ordered a small chicken with spicy garlic sauce the chicken was slimy and tasteless with no spice,nasty and could not eat this at all. Came with an egg roll also and would have to say by far the worst egg roll ever. Not cheap either and the lady was not friendly at all. Overall stay as far as can be from here!

10.description: This is our neighborhood go to for "cheap Chinese".  Fine dining it is not.  Destination dining it is not.  It is close to home.  It's fresh.  It's fast.  It's friendly.  Yeah, the portions are ridiculous for sure.  There is always something extra in our bag when we get home.  It's silly really.  The lo mein is one of my favorites.  I ask for extra veg.  The orange chicken isn't bad and easily above panda express or the place at the mall.  The other day it was still so hot when we got it home that I couldn't pick up a piece of orange chicken with my fingers.  Yes.  I was impatient. It's been in the neighborhood for years.  Right next to Rudy's Bike shop.  We have left overs for a few days.  And sometimes we get scolded if we haven't been in a while.

11.description: And the search continues for a good Chinese take out spot in Portage Park.We ordered mongolian beef, szechwan chicken, and crab rangoon for about $22.50.Mongolian beef - Too many onions. It was like a treasure hunt trying to find the beef.Szechwan chicken - Vegetables were cut too thick. Flavor was just okay.Crab Rangoon - A lot of filling, crispy but the taste was pretty bland.Will be continuing to look for a go to Chinese restaurant in the Six Corner neighborhood.

26.description: I love this place. For many reasons, so that's why I gave it the full five stars.  I've been hooked on this place ever since I first tried the orange chicken here and crab rangoon.     I ordered so much from here over the years, the lady who owns/works there knows my name when I call for a delivery. Haha.    So the bottom line about this place, is it's pretty affordable. On top of that they give you an abundance amount of food for what you pay for.  I don't think I've ever had any dislikings about their food.   They  even make my orange chicken more crispier when I ask for it, how awesome it that. This place rocks!  Try it out !
