27.description: I'm really impressed with this place.  We got a flyer stuck in our door, and when we saw Shanghai Noodles and Mongolian Mashup (Mongolian Trio) we figured we'd give it a try.  The prices seemed so reasonable that even if the food wasn't very good we wouldn't have lost much.  But the food was... is good.  It's very good.  In every case I'd say it's not the best _______ (Fill in the blank) I've ever eaten, but it's pretty yummy and very reasonably priced, so there's no bad here at all.I was never a fan of egg foo yung, but theirs is excellent, and the gravy really wowed me.  The patties are the size of my hand, and you get four of them for $6.00.  If you were really strapped for cash, one large order would give you four meals @ $1.50 each, and you would never feel deprived.  The potstickers are huge, and the sauce is really, really good.  The hot and sour I really like because it's very vinegary, and not over hot.  A friend of mine who tried it tonight said it was too sour for her and not hot enough.  Mongolian mashup is good; very tender and flavorful, though I prefer it at Great Beijing.  I prefer the price at Leung's though.  Plain Mongolian beef is even better.I tried the Pancit tonight, a Fillipino dish I had once, years ago, and never forgot.  Again, not great, but really good.  Definitely worth the money, especially when you consider that it comes in what must be their largest container, and is packed with shrimp and bbq pork.  The eggrolls, which come free when you purchase a certain amount, are tasty and crisp.Perhaps it's because they're only about half a mile away that the food always arrives as hot as it would be if you were eating in.  But proximity can't explain away the friendliness or excellent service.Recommended particularly if you want to save a few $$ and still eat well.

0.description: Great food, generous sizes, even gave us a pack of pancakes for the moo shoo pork we ordered. Tasty complimentary crab Rangoon.

20.description: This place is horrible. I ordered the chicken fried rice and it was by far the worst rice ever, I have never seen chicken fried rice so dark in my life and the rice was stuck and clumped together.  I also ordered a small chicken with spicy garlic sauce the chicken was slimy and tasteless with no spice,nasty and could not eat this at all. Came with an egg roll also and would have to say by far the worst egg roll ever. Not cheap either and the lady was not friendly at all. Overall stay as far as can be from here!

19.description: This is a good place for takeout. Definitely a great find on the North West side. The food is tasty and come in large portions.

2.description: Attentive staff, fast service, delicious food. You can't go wrong, at least I didn't. I came here on a weeknight for dinner.

18.description: Having recently moved to Portage Park, I was traumatized by the lack of really good Chinese food. Thank goodness for the reviews of my fellow yelpers, or I never would have tried it!They are so nice at Leung's, that for that reason alone I would continue to go, and the food is really good. They have lunch and dinner specials, which are so reasonably priced, that I always tip them when I pick up my order. The portions are so generous, that it's really 2-3 servings.I love their crab rangoon, Kung Pao chicken (which if you like it spicy, you have to tell them to make it really, really spicy, otherwise it's not), and the Orange Chicken is fabulous. They have chow fun noodles, which are really yummy. They also make filipino pancit, which is quite tasty. They use a lot of really fresh vegetables, which is great because I hate to waste the delicious sauces in the kung pao and orange chicken.

13.description: I will never go anywhere else! They have amazing lunch and dinner specials, great prices,  always fresh!  People are very nice they always remember us.

4.description: Ok....we've ordered from Leungs for years. ...I mean over 10 years. Once we moved further north the 15-20 ride seem to be a long for us. So we tried another place for the last year. We would always compare every dish to Leungs. No comparison. We should've known better. Now we travel the extra 15-20 minutes because Tracy is the best. We missed her and the cook to all our favorites. We're glad were back! Seriously the best bang for your buck....always have leftovers! We love Leungs!

24.description: So far I have tried 3 chinese take-out places in Portage Park and this is my favorite. There crab rangoons are stuffed full and have a good mixture, not just cream cheese. Best I have had in awhile. We got cashew shimp, chicken & broc, and shimp kow. The shrimp were clean and well cooked. The chicken was white and tender. Oh, saw on their dinner menu that they have dinner specials that are like $6.25 with either 2 rangoons or a egg roll and a soda. You see that at lunch but usually not dinner. You get a ton of food. Also, the lady gave us the free egg roll when you order over $10 without us having to ask, which was nice. Food took awhile but seemed like it was only the one person working in the restaurant. Tasty!

6.description: The food here is amazing but the lady is such a........

22.description: Having recently moved to Portage Park, I was traumatized by the lack of really good Chinese food. Thank goodness for the reviews of my fellow yelpers, or I never would have tried it!They are so nice at Leung's, that for that reason alone I would continue to go, and the food is really good. They have lunch and dinner specials, which are so reasonably priced, that I always tip them when I pick up my order. The portions are so generous, that it's really 2-3 servings.I love their crab rangoon, Kung Pao chicken (which if you like it spicy, you have to tell them to make it really, really spicy, otherwise it's not), and the Orange Chicken is fabulous. They have chow fun noodles, which are really yummy. They also make filipino pancit, which is quite tasty. They use a lot of really fresh vegetables, which is great because I hate to waste the delicious sauces in the kung pao and orange chicken.

15.description: This is best Chinese food in portage park. First, they deliver! If they weather sucks or I really just get get off my lazy ass, it's a great option that not all places give. The prices are very reasonable especially if you get the lunch or dinner special. You get your entree, choice of fried rice, crab Rangoon or egg roll and a pop for under  $7! And the portion is huge! Food is always good, and the crab Rangoon and sesame shrimp are awesome. Definitely worth a try.

7.description: My Favorite Chinese Food spot in the neighborhood. A 3 minute drive or 10 minute walk. I love this neighborhood hot spot . Pricing is good also..................

8.description: Okay the people that talk so highly on the orange chicken haven't tried good orange chicken. For the price it's meh. They do give you a big portion. And the lady that greeted me was very friendly and of course I had to tip her. Maybe they have better things on the menu but I got the dinner special with the 2 crab rangoon, shrimp fried rice and orange chicken and free pop....only because everyone else on yelp loved it. It was all just alright for me. I've had better I'm sorry. Chicken is dry. Sauce is okay wish there was more to maybe counter act the dry chicken. Shrimp fried rice was too oily for my taste. Crab rangoon was big and again for the price okay. I wouldn't go there again though. I just recently moved and am still trying to find a good Chinese place around me. I had to drive 15 minutes to get here. On yelp it said 4 star so that's what drew me to this place. I just wasn't completely satisfied with the food. You get what you pay for, and in all honesty with this place that's exactly it. It was cheap and tasted cheap. I'm giving it a 2 star for the friendliness I received and the price of the food for the amount you get. If you want a good Chinese place and are ever in the area in Bensenville there is a place called Hoy's. That place is absolutely phenomenal. Or in Elk Grove a place called bistro dragon. Soooooo yum! Good luck!

3.description: A lot of bang for your buck from this hole in the wallI live within walking distance so that helped in keeping the food hot enough to burn my tongue. I got the sesame chicken and it was deliciously crispy and flavorful. And unlike other places, they don't dump a bunch of broccoli on the bottom to make the chicken portion look bigger (there was only 2-3 broccoli underneath my chicken). Based on the reviews, I didn't expect much from their crab rangoon but that was the most flavorful crab rangoon I've had in a long, long time. Seriously, the best crab rangoon I've had in a long time. I don't know if it was a fluke or not but I'm definitely trying this crab rangoon again. *edit* I just got my second order of crab rangoons. Still really flavorful. REALLY HAPPY!Since I don't like having leftovers for multiple days... next time I'm sharing one entree and getting a full order of crab rangoons.*NOTE TO SELF*The last two times, they've kind of skimped on sweet and sour sauce. Two small packets for 6 crab rangoons and an egg roll?? Remember to ask for more next time.

14.description: This place is amazing!  Everything I have tried has been excellent!  Eggfooyoung, chicken and broccoli,  sesame chicken,  orange chicken,  and their beef sticks are awesome!

1.description: I decided to give this place a try, but they sure reflect their one start score from yelp. The guy who did my acrylic set made them too thick, I didn't wanna speak to soon maybe he would file them down, but he was almost done and I saw no intentions of fixing them; so I asked him if he could please file them down since they were extremely thick, he responded with a clear sign of frustration. I got up and said that's ok I'll pay for what you've done but I'm going somewhere else, another lady from the salon jumped in and said she would fix them, I agreed to it. She did an ok job, when it came to getting my color I told her I wanted French tips with a pink on the bottom, she started them but I noticed she was using a very dark shade, reluctant to speak again I asked her if she had a lighter shade, she said yes I do but its too late now. I said look if I have to pay extra it's alright but I don't want to walk out of here with something I don't like, she charged me an extra $6.00 to remove the color and apply the new shade. Which obviously I deducted from her tip. They obviously don't know the concept of good customer service, I do not recommend this place at all.

0.description: I had to delete my last unfavorable review of Sunny Nails, I gave them another shot, and I'm glad I did. They were pleasant, professional, fast, and caring. I'm happy they purchased this location from Nail Nirvana, and hope they will be here for a long time to come. Their prices are fair and they offer free parking. The only suggestion I would make to them is not to talk with each other in their native language in front of customers, I find it rude.

28.description: I'm not too impressed by Tony's. The french bread is good, chorizo and Italian sausage are decent but other than that it's nothing special. It's cheaper than Jewel, but A & G further down Belmont is much better.

1.description: Beware of sale items!  I bought smoked Polish sausage on sale for $1.99, brought it home and the next day opened it and half was covered in green mold!!  Same with produce or anything fresh, cheeses past expiration date still on display. CHECK EXPIRATION DATES ON EVERYTHING YOU BUY!  Dont trust the deli counter.  The store smells bad, nasty attitudes from employees, cashiers expect YOU to thank THEM.  ONLY GO HERE AS A LAST RESORT.

39.description: okay supermarket with a smattering of ethnic groceries. the produce is pretty fresh, and they have a decent beer selection. the real attraction here is the guy who sells tamales out front.

9.description: I always come to Tonys and get the usual experience, I get my groceries and go. Decent/poor customer service usually. I came Wednesday morning/afternoon I was near the milk section and needed help (very doubtful I would get any ) but I approached a young man cleaning In the freezer aisle, he very kindly set aside the mop to help me in the next aisle he was very knowledgable. More kind employees like him please !  This place has potential .

29.description: i've been shopping here for 13 years. that about says it all i think. sure, jewel and dominick's are more aesthetically pleasing, but you can't beat the prices. and now the store is going through a remodel so everything is being updated. i've also noticed more organic products so it's getting better for the health-nuts and such. organic milk is muuuuch cheaper than jewel (by 1 to 2 dollars?) for fruits and veggies i prefer a&g on belmont and central; but meat, bread, beverages, and everything else, including prepared foods from their deli, are great. weekends here are crazy like everywhere else. their spanish products are ABUNDANT, polish products are okay (just the staples), and they also have some interesting asian and middle eastern choices. you can pretty much find anything you need here to make some crazy food and save money.

23.description: I was in and outta here in a jiffy! You can get everything you need at a low affordable price! Fresh and great variety, keep an eye out for the sales. Staff is friendly, and the parking lot is big. CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP!

5.description: I come to this location all of the time but the reason I'm not giving it a 5 star is because the fruits and vegetable do not fresh long even though they do have some good prices!I just got a bag of onions that were were soft in the inside and a little while ago I bought some garlic that felt hard on the outside but they were translucent on the inside! I did take those back and didn't have a problem!I keep coming back because this store and location isn't all bad they do have some good sales and fresh meat!  They have a low price on eggs considering what the prices have been lately.  So, I will be back and I will continue to shop at this location but I have learned what I can buy and what I can't buy!

31.description: SAVE MONEY HERE!I don't know about you, but I don't need "help" grocery shopping.  I don't ask employees, I don't need "customer service", I just get what I need, pay for it, and leave.  No, they probably do not have organic specialty items at Tony's.  But they had 2 types of Boca burgers, and they have a good selection of everything.  Yes, they have sweets, but not really more than any other regular grocery store.  I was very tempted by the bakery section, which had delicious looking pastries and cakes, including an oreo cake for 4.99.  But they also have all your other necessities for groceries, along with items from Mexico and Poland.  I found everything I needed here.  It is a normal Certi-Saver grocery store.  I did not find anything "questionable" about anything there!Other than that, the pre-made guacamole was good, my friend recommended it to me and it was declicious.  The produce I got was great, like mangos, all varieties of apples, avacados, and varieties of greens.  They had Progresso soups for .99 a can, They had Cafe Bostelo for $2, aka "the brick of coffee", but it was nasty.  I could not drink it, it tasted like dirt.  But I also had some good cornbread from Tony's.  I got pretty much everything I needed for the week here, and I was looking at it, estimating the cost.  Wow, it was a lot cheaper than Jewel or Dominicks for sure, not to mention Treasure Island.  I love saving money on groceries!  Great Place to save money, and in most cases you get the same exact thing!

25.description: This is a great small grocery store. They don't carry everything but the prices are very reasonable. Things I love: -Cheap cheap cheap deli meats. Same brands as Jewel for half the price. -Produce. Wide variety and again, half the price of Jewel. -Dried peppers. They have a lot of Hispanic patrons so their selection of Hispanic food items, including peppers, is amazing. And cheap. -Wine department. For a smallish grocery store, they have a decent amount of wine for sale. I've only purchased cheap shit to cook with but you can definitely pick up an OK bottle to drink. -Staff. Always friendly. I was looking for leeks the other day and the first worker I asked did not speak very much English but he walked me over to another worker so that he could assist me. No leeks out in the general area but he went in the back, found the leeks and then found me in the deli. He gave me the leeks and when I said I only wanted one and not all three he said, "oh no, take all three. they are $1.50 per bunch, not per pound." Little things like that make me want to go back. Avoid on the weekends as this place can get seriously crowded.

12.description: Love the location and the fact that they have a fresh bakery.  They usually have fresh donuts, French bread, and fresh bread crumbs. Their meats have reasonable prices, and the butchers are always nice and courteous. I really love they have Oberweis milk!

37.description: 4 stars because you can get fresh produce here for super cheap and it's really some of the best in the neighborhood.Not 5 stars because you usually spend half the time trying to park or trying to check out. It's busy in there, but that's because it's where it's at!They have tons of ethnic foods, yes. But you can also find stuff here cheaper than Jewel (such as Chai drinks, POM POM, and various desserts).I didn't like the tamales that the little girl sells out front, but that's not Tony's! :)

21.description: Tony's is great in an emergency - like when I forgot a key ingredient in some recipe...or when I just gotta have some good ole-fashioned hard liquor.  This particular Tony's is my go-to place, and it has recently gone through some renovations that make it a lot nicer to be in.  Everything is super cheap, the customer service is OK, and the ambience is a lot nicer, overall.Not my favorite place to shop, but for convenience, it can't be beat!

16.description: I love this location!Spacious!Well organized!Great prices for produce!The women working the deli need to get it together...Their main concern should be customer service not how their date went the night before or what put their man in the "dog house." I promise ladies you would have less upset faces trying to burn a hole through you...Waiting 25 min for polish ham is crazy when there is 3 of you working and only 4 people trying to tell you their order...Gets really busy and finding parking becomes a pain...

17.description: A little cramped, always busy, and always has that Mexican grocery store smell, but the prices are good -- especially deli and produce prices, which blow Jewel and the like out of the fuckin' water. As an organic gardener myself I know that organic labeling is about 75% bullshit anyway, so the whole organic thing doesn't make any difference to me -- but Tony's does carry a nice selection of local produce when they can, which IS important to me. And for Italian and Mexican specialty products, they're a great place to go. When I have to shop for drugstore stuff as well as food, I'll go to Jewel, but for the weekly load-up on groceries, it's Tony's every time, and my bank account is happier for it.All that said: the parking lot is a TOTAL clusterfuck.

10.description: I use to shop here quite often. Then the employees became unpleasant & rude. So I took my business else where. I decided to give them another chance & it was worth it. First of all I enjoy a great value & use coupons as well. On this visit they had no problem with honoring the coupons. The only problem was that I was overcharged for an advertised item. I brought this to customer service's attention & a manager saw that the product was mislabeled & gave me the sale price. That is how a business should be run! Due to this I will be shopping there quite often... Well done!

11.description: Within walking distance of the place we were staying at.Apparently, this is where they go for good Italian sausage to use for their Italian dishes.This is also where I get my first Vitner's Tangy Three Cheese Potato Chips. Yummmmmmmmmyyyyyyy!!!!!!

26.description: I am confused about some of the negative reviews and comments about Tony's.  It's not Whole Foods, they have a limited selection of organic food.  If you want organic, go to Whole Foods and pay for it.  Otherwise, I think Tony's has a great produce department, deli and butcher shops.  Everything is fresh. I have never seen old fruit, vegetables or meat. They are always, always busy, so be prepared to wait in line for 5 minutes.  But the nice thing about a busy grocer is the turnover in the fresh foods.  Great prices too - $3.99/lb for Butterball Turkey, $2.99/lb for Provolone or Muenster cheese, $6.99/lb med shrimp.   Compare that to Jewel that charges and prices their deli products by the HALF pound (what a racket).  10 limes for a buck, $2.99 gallon skim milk, $1.99/lb chicken breast, etc.  You get the picture.  If you want Whole Foods, this is not the place.  If you're used to Dominicks/Jewel, etc. check out this location.

27.description: I have mixed feelings about Tony's Finer Foods.  I have gotten some awesome things in the past, like fresh tamales, steaks, and anything you could ever need to make a Mexican feast!  As for the rest of it, things are hit or miss and in my opinion, a little sketch.  Being a person without a car and limited places to shop in Logan Square (now Craigin??) I have often popped into Tony's for emergency foods, but it's not a place I would regularly shop.  Also, it gets craaazy crowded on the weekends.

35.description: As far as I can tell Tony's  is the cheapest grocery store in the city. I go there mainly for staples like canned soup, eggs, bread. And deli meat. They charge the same amount for a pound of deli meat that Jewel & Dominick's charges for half a pound. For the same exact brand name and everything.  A loaf of foccaciabread for .99 cents.I am not CRAZY about their produce section, but I will grab the basics. I also would steer clear of the sea food section. They have octopus there. I don't care for it. They just recently started carrying organic milk. A whole $1.00 cheaper than Jewel.  And probably 1/2 the price of Whole Foods. The one on Elston is nicer, but this one is easier for me to get to.

8.description: Really, really impressed. Great looking produce! This location is close to my mom's place which she's lived in for over a decade now. Which brings me to my old experience with a different Tony's, let's just say terrible, really really terrible. Therefore, I never even  bothered going in here.My mom wanted my to pick up some oranges, just oranges, I ask? Yes, that's all. Well, #!$?! I don't want to go out of my way for just one thing, so I pulled into Tony's. I left with two bags off produce for myself. It all looked so good and fresh. A well displayed produce section is so luscious and sexy, you just want it all.Kale, romaine, green beans, avocados. poblano peppers are some of the things I bought, oh yes and oranges!

0.description: I would give them 5 stars but they need to staff their cashiers and baggers better the lines are  ridiculous at times.but over all everything is organized,clean and affordable.

38.description: Wasn't too impressed with this place, but it was decently large and clean.  Recommend this place over Windy City.I came here in search of hummus to make a dish with, and I called ahead thinking they might not have it.  The manager assured me they did.  Well, when I went, the place was a mad house, tons of people everywhere.  The checkout lines were horrendous.No one knew anything about the hummus and after searching around for 20 minutes, I gave up.  Customer service is definitely lacking here, no one understood what I was talking about and didn't seem to concerned with helping me find it. The biggest problem here is lack of variety - little in the way of organic, and not much ethnic food outside of Mexican stuff.  So if your shopping list contains more than just basic essential groceries or you don't make a ton of Mexican food, save yourself the grief and go to Jewel.

20.description: I prefer to shop at other Tony's.  This location was small and very crowded. I especially didn't care for the female cashier who refused to greet me...even after I said hello to her.  The Melrose Park location is much, much better.

19.description: I went to this Tony's location for the first time last night around 8:30. It was a good experience. I was previously going to the location on Central near Fullerton and this one was much better! Perhaps it was because I went during non-peak hours but whatever the case, I was pleased at the un-crowdedness. It made my shopping experience much better. The prices are the same ones I think you will find at any location, but the store was very clean and organized. I appreciate that! My bill was around $60 but considering the amounts of fresh meats and fruits I purchased, it was fair. OH, and the cart pusher helped me load my groceries in my trunk! Winning! LOL! I will definitely be returning to this location.

33.description: Pretty much the same as mosts Tony's, but at least this one has a decent size lot  but not enough places to drop off your cart. Decent size but not enough aisle space. I've stopped coming here because I think the one on Elston and Pulaski is a little better. This is definitely better then the one on Central.

2.description: The produce selection is awesome, the dry goods are decent, the butcher is alright and the dairy is ok.  The long checkout lines and parking are a mega pain in the rump.  Just make sure to free up some time before you go shopping at Tony's!

34.description: If you are in search of Mexican ingredients, this is the place to go.  They have aisles upon aisles of Mexican/ Spanish foods.  This place is really really cheap.  They offer alot more variety in their produce section than Jewel...but like Chiara said, there is an overabundance of processed foods.  I go here for only two reasons.  They have Totinos pizza.  True junk food pizza.  Don't know why, but it's my husband's favorite, so I will deal with the crowd and the general disarray here.  and Mexican brick coffee/ espresso.  Don't be fooled...this coffee though cheap it is simply amazing!  No acrid bitter aftertaste..it's smooth like silk.  It usually costs only $2 a brick...which is around 10 ounces.  And for those who do like junkfood, they also have packaged of pizza puffs and hashbrown patties that taste exactly like McDonald's.  I'm not fond of their baked goods or certain prepared meats/ seafoods, but I'm overly cautious that way.  What I insist is one of the best things that they offer prepared is their home made pico de gallo and guacamole.  FUCing amazing!  We go through those in less than 2 days.  If I run out of guacamole, I will cheat and mix a few avocados with their pico de gallo.Funny story, the other day while shopping, my know it all 2 year old asked if he could have a donut.  He picked a pink frosted with sprinkles.  He had already eaten, but wanted a snack.  I wanted to get the trip over with as soon as possible so I indulged him, and I didn't want to deal with any whining.  The donut did not look very good...definitely alot of food color.  He took one bite and said, Mommy, this is yucky.  I still had to pay for it, so when we got to the counter, he insisted on telling the clerk that their donuts were yucky and that he did not like it.  I was totally mortified but found it somewhat amusing that it had stuck in his head the entire trip.  I am sure that anyone looking at my cart probably thinks that I do not feed my family well as I buy the junk food portion of our grocery list here.  I do also buy alot of fresh produce here as it is dirt cheap and the quality is very good, much better than Jewel usually.There are three things that I want to pass on about this store besides the fact that they carry the things that you shouldn't eat.  One, this is not a handicap friendly store.  The aisles are really narrow.  The checkout lane is so tight and overstocked with misc merchandise, you can barely fit your cart through.  2nd, if you know when link cards are replenished, or food stamps given out...avoid this place like the plague.  It is the worst time to shop there.  3rd, there are some real characters here, in and out of the store.  I was not pleased about being approached by a creepy vagrant while trying to unload my groceries with my son present.  He just stood there with his hand out, way too close for my comfort without speaking.  Guess what, I can't remember how to speak English or Spanish all of the sudden either.  If he wants to speak with sign language, read my middle finger.Update: 5/24/08I'm doomed.  I just found out that a Tamale guy sells his tamales outside on weekends.  I purchased 6 of these for $4.50.  The more you buy, the more you save.  Christ.  It was so FUCing good, I was speechless.  I have never had such an incredible tamale with green sauce.  The flavors, the abundance of meat, I swear that it was orgasmic.  I ate 2 of them in the car in pure silence..Couldn't say a word to my husband or child until the wave passed.  I had to close my eyes and savor it.

32.description: Yay, for the cook who needs mexican ingredients and fresh fruits, vegetables, and perhaps the best prepared in house guacamole one could fake for their own on several occasions.  It's cheap, ready to go, and some of the best made with cilantro and lots of flavor.  Other than that, this grocery store is questionable.  Their questionable freshness of meats and dairy along with some really outdated frozen foods makes me go there when I am really hankering for some mexican food and maybe some beer - they have that too - right next to the eggs.  A warning - do not go on the first of the month, unless you are one of the masses who just got their Link reloaded.  Do not.

18.description: I have mixed feelings about Tony's Finer Foods.  I have gotten some awesome things in the past, like fresh tamales, steaks, and anything you could ever need to make a Mexican feast!  As for the rest of it, things are hit or miss and in my opinion, a little sketch.  Being a person without a car and limited places to shop in Logan Square (now Craigin??) I have often popped into Tony's for emergency foods, but it's not a place I would regularly shop.  Also, it gets craaazy crowded on the weekends.

13.description: I've got mixed feelings about this Tony's location.I will spend a bazillion bucks at their North Riverside, Niles and Melrose Park locations on imported items from all over the globe. You could spend hours in those spacious and well-organized stores; they have EVERYTHING.Yet the Tony's on Belmont is the opposite of its sister locations. Yes it's smaller, but it's not as well-stocked, the variety is lacking, and it's messier inside and out. I recently was out biking one evening and decided to stop at this Tony's since it's nearby. As I was trying to lock up my bike next to the others chained to a shopping cart corral (no rack), some teenager pulled up in an SUV, almost hitting me. He got out and started to tug on the other bikes while I was there. I got back on mine and left. You'd probably find better selection (and safety) at the 6 Corners Jewel or Gene's Sausage shop by Laramie.

4.description: Your cashiers, dont say hello, doesnt say thank you, if they are in a bad mood is not your customers problem. They are been paid because of customers ok! Very upset!!

24.description: Acting manager, Joe, was very rude when I had asked him about the discrepancy in their ab for roast beef vs Italian roast beef.  Unfortunately, I will still frequent this store due to the low prices.

6.description: At first, you'll easily drive by this place without giving it a second thought.  You'll do this a few times.  Then, one day, you'll be looking for a place "off the beaten path" with good pricing and decent variety.  At that point, you realize you've missed a hidden gem.  Now, this is not a fancy-schmancy grocery store.  However, it does have all of the essentials, with a friendly staff to boot.  Sure, you walk in and say to yourself, "Hmm, looks kind of hood-ish or shady..." But, once you realize you're not in the Loop and all you want are some groceries at a good price - you'll be right at home.  So, here's how to look at it.  You go to Costco or someplace similar for your bulk goods.  You goto Aldi for your quick-hit items, and you goto Tony's to fill in the gaps.  Plus, if you live in the neighborhood and don't like the traffic near Kimball and 90, there is WAY less traffic over here.  I'm still trying to figure out what I consider "5-Stars" on Yelp, so consider this a very solid score.  Hope this helps!

22.description: I went to this Tony's location for the first time last night around 8:30. It was a good experience. I was previously going to the location on Central near Fullerton and this one was much better! Perhaps it was because I went during non-peak hours but whatever the case, I was pleased at the un-crowdedness. It made my shopping experience much better. The prices are the same ones I think you will find at any location, but the store was very clean and organized. I appreciate that! My bill was around $60 but considering the amounts of fresh meats and fruits I purchased, it was fair. OH, and the cart pusher helped me load my groceries in my trunk! Winning! LOL! I will definitely be returning to this location.

15.description: There are Tony's Finer Foods scattered across the Chicago Area and I have never had a really bad experience at any one of them. I was expecting the same from this store and I was absolutely correct in thinking that way.We just needed a few items so we were able to walk there from our home. Three cheers for a  very convenient location. The produce and deli counter all looked good and it appeared that prices were reasonable also. The store is a little old and run down and it shows and the all of the lines were moving rather on the slow side but that can only be expected on a Sunday evening.I am glad that there is a store such as this right in the neighborhood that I can take a walk to if needed.

7.description: I've experienced some pretty decent and quick shopping experiences at this location as opposed to all the other ones who have a cluster F*** for a parking lot. The shelves are always stocked and I never have a hard time getting what I want. I buy my meat here on occasion when they have a good sale, they can be a lil pricey sometimes, but the quality is good. Cashiers are Ehhh.. I've gotten a lil bit of both but I guess when you work retail no one seems to give a the BEST customer service, cuz some customers can be a hot mess! . I come here on the regular when I am in the area and sometimes i come out of my way just because of the quick parking lot!

36.description: I come to this neighborhood a lot, and I've gone to this grocery store many times.  The first few times, I walked around and wasn't that pleased with their food selection.  What I'm about to say may make you hate me, so I apologize in advance if you're an obese frequent Tony's shopper.Their food selection is awful.  Junk food is everywhere, and I believe every single thing they have is processed and jam-packed with chemicals.  I also observed that practically everyone who walks through these doors is fat, obese, or morbidly obese.  I don't think I've seen one child there who doesn't look like a mini Rosie O'Donnell.  This shouldn't be a surprise, considering they probably buy all of their groceries at Tony's.I still buy stuff there, though.  It's because there isn't any other grocery store in the neighborhood, and I buy only gum and water here.  Their employees aren't that nice.  They don't usually make eye contact with me, and they always appear very sullen.  I don't blame them; if I had to be around disgusting processed fatty foods all day, I'd be depressed too.Maybe I'm just too used to eating well.  The bottom line is: if you're anything like me, you'll find that Tony's is only good for generic drug store stuff, like chapstick, shampoo, and water.

30.description: I cannot stand this place! It always looks so dirty. I'll give t to them for being cheap but after i left there I just felt like I needed to take a shower and purell the crap out of my hands!

3.description: I'm happy to see a lot of new items especially their new foods that they have for on the go it's good because it differs from the usual drive thru I feel like there floor could be a little bit cleaner but other than that everyone seems to be more than helpful there!

14.description: Love the convenience of this store. Their meats are always reasonably priced. It is open later, and close. I dislike that the lines are somewhat long most days, and their produce is not always top shelf, but they have a great selection of Spanish food, and meat products. I wish their fruits and veggies were better quality, I would do more of my bulk food shopping here.

12.description: they let underaged kids in here all the time...not in the mood to chill and smoke with my friends while the teeny boppers all around try to start high school drama

7.description: This is an alright place for hookah. It's populated by high school kids and the atmosphere is mediocre at best. There is no music playing and the seats seemed dirty. The guy working was very nice but they seemed to be understaffed as he was working the full room and hence he was a little slow to get around to us. But if you're looking for a place to hookah and not concerned for atmosphere and can put up with annoying looking high school kids then this place is fine as the hookah was thick and nice.I've certainly experienced better.

3.description: I forgot about this place! When I was a younger lad I was in and out of this place, left and right. This lounge being owned by fellow countrymen had me coming back for different hookah mixes flavor with flavor. Years have past and I've drifted away from my hookah I'm back as of now and am excited to try the flavors!

1.description: This was not my favorite hookah bar. I haven't been to a hookah bar in like 4 or 5 years. The employees here were very nice. The place is hella smokey. The have vents, but I don't think they were working. We ended up here last night after dinner because none of us wanted to go to bar but we still wanted to hang out and talk. We tried two other hookah spots before stopping here. This one was the only one that had space for us. It was a nice chill evening. I'm not really a fan of their two people per hookah. 2 out of the 6 didn't smoke and I didn't see a bill so I'm not really sure how much the bill was.They do have a cork fee. I know the two who drank were not really pleased about that.They don't have cards which was a bummer. We would have loved to play some rummy while we sat there. The seating does not look anything at all like the photos on here. They're kind of old and dingy, but not a deal breaker. They offer French vanilla and hazelnut coffee. They have only one tea and it's not mint.

2.description: Hookah tasted like air mixed with coal. The hookah also looked tacky and looked like someone took a sharpie and drew all over them. The chairs were all stained and the place looked filthy.  You cant even lock the bathroom door. It also ended up costing $22 for one hookah with three people! Im not sure why people are saying the prices are so great. 2 stars because service was decent.

9.description: I think there are way too many teeny boppers, and the place seems kinda dirty. There are so many other hookahs in the city that are better.

18.description: i go to mr hookah at least once every week. Its a great place to smoke real traditional middle eastern hookah, and has a wonderful atmosphere. great place to take a date or just hang out with friends. the flavors are endless and they are very clean. it is very afforodable and its a perfect location right off the kennedy high way. go there i have been to at least 12 different hookah bars around chicago and this is defiantly my favoriate all different cultuers of people inside. my list goes like this #1 mr hookah, #2 koosh on dempster. #3 ambrosia on fullertin and shefield. and i can defiantly say the worst experiance i have ever had was hubble hookah on harlem, 2 thumbs down. oh also ugly hookah on bryn mawr and kimble. i really enjoyed that place.

10.description: Mr. Hookah has to be one of my favorite hookah bars I've ever been to, hands down!I've been to several other hookah bars and I always find myself going right back to Mr hookah.the prices are reasonable and the service is great! Very laid back and individual comfy couches

13.description: great place to smoke a hookah, the hookah taste great everytime and always fresh.....service is great if i could handle it i would go there every night

16.description: I went to this place a few times and I was constantly overcharged and the person who was serving me was very rude. Terrible customer service.

17.description: I'm not from Chicago but I was visiting there and I had the chance to go to Mr Hookah. One of the best Hookah bars! Awesome atmosphere, hookah and service. Go there If you want a real hookah!

15.description: If you're looking for a really nice hookah bar, this isn't the place to go.  I'm not saying it's a bad hookah bar, but at first glance, you may be put off by the loud atmosphere, young crowd, and subpar service.However, Mr. Hookah is a place of bros.  They're welcoming, the don't ask for much, and they treat you like you're supposed to be there.  After going a few times, you'll notice that even if it isn't glamourous, it feels like you can just kick it with your friends.  Put on a pair of sweats, grab a 6-back (BYOB), and chill at Mr. Hookah on a Friday night.  That's the kind of place this is.  If you don't expect much, you'll get more than you asked for.Not to mention that they only use top of the line Starbuzz shisha, and if you don't know how to maintain a hookah, they're more than willing to help you out.  Come on a Friday night and you'll always see me and my friend John.

0.description: I enjoy this hookah joint. The prices are better than the area surrounding places. Most of the chairs are comfortable and the tables are adult size, not those mini table which I wind up banging my knees on. The service is attentive and not bothersome. The owner is usually on site so there are no issues or problems they don't immediately address. I enjoy the selection of flavors; they carry my favorite and have introduce a few flavors I've never tried. I would recommend this place especially if you are a med size party. Try em and I'll see ya there :)

5.description: This is such a great environment! Great hookah with amazing flavors! The guy who makes the hookahs is always fast paced and consistently making sure you have what you need. My favorite flavor is white gummy bear/ blueberry. I've been going  here at least 3-4 times a week  for a year now and absolutely love it. The people are very friendly and the seats are so comfortable. The owners are super nice and know how to run their business correctly. Always so friendly making sure you have what you need, making you feel like your smoking a hookah at home. The tv is always playing NFL, NBA and all kinds of channels! I recommend this place to anyone looking to relax with some shisha!

11.description: My only hookah spot for the last few years. I've been to many hookah joints that's don't provide a clean hookah. Good crowd and a friendly touch by the owners. Ask for the mint flavor.

8.description: A friend recently introduced me to this hookah lounge and I loved it.  Great time for this new mom ;) She gave me the option to go here or go to a bar for drinks and I'm glad I picked hookah.  Actually reviewing this place because I was looking for directions to go again.  The place has a very friendly owner and the prices are great.  I believe $12 for each hookah.  Great time especially if you have great company.

4.description: Have even coming here for years. Great friendly environment. Comfortable seating. Great tasting hookah. Super clean which is pretty major for a hookah establishment. Honestly, this is a pretty legit chill spot with NBA, NFL and all great games are always playing on the TV. Service is pretty top notch. Charcoals are always lit. My favorite flavor is always on deck which is white gummy bear by fumari... AWESOME. Price is super low compared to other surrounding hookah bars. All that matters is that this place is affordable, clean and has great service.

14.description: I love this place, great service! and good hookah flavors! ..... the only thing that bothers me a little is that  they remodeled the place and now have tables with chairs set up like a restaurant in three rows personnally I prefer the old couches they had before ;(.

6.description: My friends and I decided that we were going to go hookah as a last hoorah sort of thing before we all went back to school... when we went on yelp, this place was cheap, nearby and had a good amount of stars so we decided to go here.  When we got here, it was pretty crowded (it was around 9pm) on a Friday night to the point where we took the last free table.  I'm not a person who hookahs regularly so its a bit harder to talk about that but let me just lay down some things about the service and ambiance...The service wasn't that attentive because he was helping regulars and favorites.   There were so many high schoolers which was so annoying.  Its not great at all when you can hear people at the next table talking about how they still need to do their college applications.  High schoolers kept walking in and hanging out with their friends at other tables for 5 minutes and then would just leave.  Maybe that's why they were so crowded - they let underage people in, I don't even know.The hookah itself was decent - clean, tasted good and the staff helped when he walked by and noticed that I did something completely wrong since no one else was there.  Honestly, Id give it a 3 on another day because it wasn't BAD but the ambiance and crowd knocked it down.

12.description: I've been here a few times, because these guys are so welcoming to the neighborhood crowd.  You can just stop by and see what they're up too.  They also do awesome tours every Saturday for $5!  Clint, Lynn and Emil and totally cool, and have just the most unbelievable passion for the beer.  They grow hops and have freaking chickens they give all the leftover grain to!  If you cant make the tour, try and find their beer somewhere around town.  You won't be disappointed.

3.description: Laker Effect is one of the best new breweries in Chicago. Located in Jeff Park in the NW side, it's become a little brewery with a big following. Starting with their staple Bitch'n Blonde Belgium style ale that you can find in most place. Then their Snow Wit beer (white wheat ale) is one if my favorites. Add in seasonal beer like the Watermelon saison which just won best beer at the inaugural Old Irving Park Beer & BBQ Challenge, and the "Blood in the Water" (brewed for Shark Week) pink grapefruit saison, and the Super Bier done in collaboration with Superdawg...all are winners.   You can find at least some of the beers at your local liquor store, bar on tap, or sign up for a tour on a nice Saturday.  Haven't had a brew I didn't like. Once u try then you'll know what I mean.

1.description: I planned a beer tour of various breweries around the area some time back, we almost left Lake Effect because it seems so sketchy when we got out of the cab.  I am SO glad we didn't leave, this place is the type of tour that makes it fun.  Not the huge tours where you see shiny huge equipment and the breweries awards, this was the real deal.And the beer was great too!

2.description: I came here over the weekend with my husband, sis-in-law, and bro-in-law, and we had a great time.First things first, this place is difficult to find. Google maps put it between Cicero and 90 on Montrose, but be warned that the front of the place is not directly on Montrose. You have to walk down an alley, past a yeast lab, past a costume shop, and eventually you will see the brewery's door at the end of the row, on the right hand side. Luckily, we ran into Clint while walking down Montrose and he showed us the way.I guess that most of the staff was out the day of our tour, doing tastings around the city. It was just the 4 of us, another couple on the tour, Clint, and another staff member applying beer bottle labels by hand. Yes, by hand.You can tell from the first minute you meet Clint that he loves what he does. This tour won't go into the "how you make beer" generic speech you get from most brewers. Instead, Clint showed us around and talked about his specific beers, the blends he makes, and his personal stories of beer-making, like when he slept in the brewery overnight, waking up every 2 hours, to check on the beer temp. That's dedication.The brewery itself is small, much smaller than I expected. All the stills are in one small-ish room, where Clint's office is in a back corner, surrounded by wine and whiskey barrels where he's aging his beer. We were taken into a connected room, which will soon house their tasting room. Our tour didn't have sampling flights (we went to Phoenix bar), because they didn't have the proper licensing. I do hope they get their tasting room up and running soon - I'd love to visit.The tour itself is free (which seems to have changed from in the past, based on other reviews), and I guarantee you'll get so much more out of it than other tours. You're basically signing on to an hour plus of having a craft beer discussion, the tour conversation going in whatever way the attendee questions take it. I enjoyed this tour way more than most other tours I've been on due to the tour's less rigid structure. That seemed to be a common sentiment, as my bro-in-law is a pretty serious home brewer, and he loved the tour as much as I, a beer novice, did.We did taste 3 beers at Phoenix, and my hands down favorite was the Mini Imperial Stout. Smooth, rich, chocolate-y and coffee-y, it was an instant hit with our group. They distribute in the city and some suburbs (Naperville and Arlington Heights were specifically mentioned), so definitely seek their beer out. I highly recommend both the tour and the beer. This brewery is a great addition to the NW side.

9.description: Jefferson park,.... Woot woot!

10.description: The guys over at Lake Effect are doing great things!  So far, the beers they have been putting out have been spectacular.  One of my first beers I tried from them was the Lake Effect Snow.  A deliciously light and crisp  wit beer.  My all-time favorite was their collaboration beer with Dry Hop Brewers, their Belgo-IPA, I Shot A Man in Simcoe.  So good!  If you had a chance to try it, you're lucky.On top of making great beer, Clint and Lynn are two great guys.  Always very friendly, and willing to strike up conversation at any time!Check out their Saturday tours!  See where the magic happens!

4.description: Is there a new microbrewery in every neighborhood in Chicago now?   Seems suiting as all of the corner entrance establishments originated as pubs so the town has a history of sustaining beer lovers.   The Wit Beir I tasted was true to style.  Think Hoegaarden (just extremely fresh as it didn't have to travel 7000+ miles).   Was hard to find but the GPS is correct.   Nice walk from the Blue Line (in my case in light snow).   Great place to warm up with some exceptionally fresh brew and a nice crew.   Fun place!

6.description: Before I went on the Lake Effect Brewing Company's tour, I knew very little about them. I had only tried their Snow beer before and in my head I always confuse them with a Milwaukee brewery with a similar name. After visiting them, I am head over heels in love with their beers, the guys who run Lake Effect are awesome and the way they run their biz is pretty cool, too!Lake Effect does their brewery tours on the weekend - usually in the afternoon. We did ours a couple weeks ago on a Saturday at 230pm. You can find out when the next tour is on their website. You also book & pay the $10 for the tour online. The tour includes samples...and the sampling amount is abundant of whatever they currently have. When you arrive, you may be confused about where to go...because we sure were. They are in 4727 Montrose but you can't see their door from the street. If you see the costume shop, you know you've hit the right building. Walk down the alley on the side of the building and you'll find the door for Lake Effect. Walk right in and soon your fun will begin!The fellas who started Lake Effect - Clint & Lynn - are both there for your tour to tell you all about the stories behind the brews and give you the brewmaster tour of things. Both guys are super nice & really knowledgeable about their craft. They walked us around the space, explaining things as we went. It was pretty cool because they were actually brewing while we were there. We sampled many of their beers and I found a bunch I really liked including Bitchin' Blonde which really should be my signature drink. ;) We also got to see artwork for their new labels of the Falcon Dive IPA which look are so adorable and funny. Half of the battle of a good craft brew is an awesome label, right? (I'm half kidding). We got to see them loading tons and tons of coffee until one brew and taste it when it wasn't even finished without carbonization. (Sidenoted Pro-Tip: If they let you try a non-carbonized beer and you then go on Untappd rating it unfairly because it had no carbonization, you're an idiot).  I can't say I've ever done that before so it was a cool experience. I think the Espresso Gone Stout we tried was just released to the market! The Lake Effect Brewing Company's tour was one of my favorite yet. I enjoyed it greatly because I really found one of my new favorite breweries. I love the fruity notes in their witbier Snow, Session Brett Ale (surprise it's a pale session ale!) and the Bitchin' Blonde (a belgian blonde), all of which will be going into my regular rotation. Lynn & Clint said they have plans to expand and add a tap room....which means danger for me since I'll be spending all my money there! Danger for them because they'll have to see my face every weekend!

0.description: I admit it, I'd never heard of Lake Effect prior to my boyfriend wanting to go on the tour/tasting for his birthday. We had a small group (6) for our tour/tasting & it was great. Clint was super friendly & knowledgeable... I liked this "tour" more than any other I've been on at bigger breweries. The location is a little tricky, but if you follow everyone's directions on Yelp it's a snap. Easy free parking on neighborhood streets, and they are right off the highway & Cicero, so it's relatively simple to get to as well. You might even be able to park down the alley back by the chicken coop if there are spots!We really enjoyed the entire experience... check it out if you're interested in local brewing & delicious beers!

5.description: The brick is original. As well as the wood beams and floors. Everything else is new and swanky. Greeted like I was her best friend as I walked in, the bartender was fantastic.  We tried many of the regular taps as well as all the seasonals. Of course I enjoyed the Judgemental Dick DIPA.  8% and bites your ass! Since this was the first stop on the tour please feed me! The Thai nachos sounded more amazing than they were. I'd still say order them just on unique factor. The whole place was lovely, interesting, spacious, and the beer? Delicious! Because, come on, that's why we are here. It's all about the beer folks!

13.description: Great people brewing great beer.

11.description: The guys at Lake Effect Brewing are true Chicagoans. They are nice, down-to-Earth guys that make some great tasting beers.

8.description: This place is hella hard to find without the tour group! My sister and I went to do one of their tours and spent a lot of time meandering through the roads/alleys trying to figure it out. Maybe some signs in the area would help?Eh, that's not really their fault though. They're up in Jefferson Park, right off the highway so it's pretty  easy to get to. The tour is very low key, and they seem to do a bunch of tours with lots of different companies trying to get their name out there. The tour is very laid back, since the place is pretty small. They can't sell you a bottle on-site because the City of Chicago's licensing laws are whack, but you can have as many samples as you'd like in the little cup they give you. They seem to have anywhere from 3-5 beers to try.You can usually try some of their stuff at local beer fests too, as well as a few bars they've partnered with. I know they're pouring at quite a few places in my 'hood (Lincoln Station, Atlas, Paddy Long's, Beer Bistro North in Lincoln Park).

14.description: Man, I almost want to write a one-star or no review so that nobody catches on to these guys, but that's not fair, is it? We've had their beer at local places (Fischmans A+, Garage A+, etc.), but that's just not fair to them. Clint and Lynn not only give one hell of a tour, but they're also just down to earth guys running a solid local business that anyone with half a brain cell should support. We can't wait to spread the word about what a great business these guys do and what a local gem this is.

7.description: What a nifty little brewery!  I would love to see Lake Effect hit the big time.  The beers we tried were all good especially the Belgian Blonde and Session Brett.One thing they shared on the tour, which I found incredibly neato, is that Omega Yeast is next door and by a happy coincidence, they happened to end up next to each other!  The yeast scientists provide Lake Effect some unique yeasts that they happily try out.All their ingredients, they try to get as local as they can and much of their hops come from Wisconsin.  The brewer also told us that each year they have a 'bring your backyard grown hops' thing and they toss what they get from various donors into a batch of beer.  KInd of like the Stone Soup book...Look for them at Binnys!

28.description: Overall this is a great place to take care of yourself at.  The dry sauna peaks at 210, and averages at 200.  In the past I've had some issues with the sauna not being at 210-220 but it appears the problem is fixed.  The average temp at one of my gym membership ranges at 180-200 so it's crucial that they keep the temp up for their saunas to make their experience more unique.  What really makes the experience good is the cold pool which is set at 35 degrees celcius that you can jump right in after a good sweat.  Showers are very clean, the food is good, staff is friendly, and the massage therapists are also very good for athletes like myself.  If you are looking for a sweedish massage, then this is not the place to go for a massage.  They will adress the injuries, and make you feel better when you leave.  I've had issues with my shoulders, back, and elbow and have never felt any better then when I get a hot & cold sauna & cold pool combined with a sports massage.

1.description: Clean and inviting facility. Definabl a great spot the spend the day to relax.facility is cleaned throughout the day and it really shows. overall a great place to forget about the outside world.Food is outstanding too. And they have a plethora of Russia tall boy beers.

39.description: If you want to render your junk useless by either extreme heat or extreme cold, this is the place you should do it.  I don't mean that in a bad way, but if you've ever been to a bath house, you know what I mean.  I think I'm just now getting my feeling back after staying too long in the cold pool.This place is classy!  Leather chairs and really cool decor.  It's a manly kind of place, but no funny business as far as I could tell.  Um, don't let that dissuade you.

9.description: I have no other banya to compare this to, but I love it hereThe fried chicken is amazing, if it was just a restaurant I would definitely go there just for the food, alone...that fried chicken is no jokeThe saunas are great, the atmosphere is very relaxed, I'm not looked at any differently bc I'm not Russian or Ukranian and I appreciate feeling welcomed.  Be sure to get a hat to protect your head, I forget the native term (Stopka?) but they help for a bald man like myself.Go and enjoy, I usually stay for a good 6 hours or so and come out like a new man every timeI can't wait to go back!Btw, they have a bunch of pictures of banya from different cultures, along with explanations of the use in each culture.  I recommend checking it out.  I'm not sure how many people pay attention to this, but I found it very interesting.If something's worth doing, its worth doing right

29.description: My body images issues have been cured!* After a spending an afternoon at the Chicago Sweatlodge, I felt young, fit and perfectly groomed. Actually, it was pretty freeing to just 'be.' To not have to worry about 6-pack abs, perfectly coifed everything and immaculate appearances was so nice. I totally get why this place exists. As funny as it is to say, it's a safe space for guys. Or, it was for me.I hadn't spent much time in this part of the city, so I inched north on Cicero looking for the lodge. I was happy to discover they had their own lot. I parked, took a deep breath and walked in. The window attendant was polite, if not talkative. I paid my money. He gave me my towels, shoes and wrap. I did my homework. I was prepared -- sorta. I opened the door to the back area and... saw a cafe? Yep. They offer food and drink at the Lodge. This isn't just a place to sweat. It's a social hang out. Granted, most of the guys socializing were near nude but what's better than playing chess than being naked while playing chess?The locker area was surprisingly nice. Wooden (like, nice... not rickety) lockers with shelving, leather over-sized chairs and abundant tvs tuned to basketball, football, soccer... and Mexican soap operas. It takes all kinds. I proceeded to drop trou and put on my wrap. I'd planned on wearing my swim trunks but as I was grunted to by the very large man in the corner, "No tuhrunks! Towel only!" Thing is, I didn't know how to wear the thing. It's a shear white wrap about the size of an oversized washcloth with a v split. I put it on like a pair of pants... and got some friendly advice from the guy at the locker next to mine: "Turn it to the side." Oh? Ohhh! Wow. I was sporting a serious wardrobe malfunction. I sort of thought that was the way I was supposed to wear it, what with so much stuff just floppin' in the breeze all around me. Properly adorned, I split my time between the wet steam and the dry sauna. Good God almighty, Eastern (and Southern) Europeans (by the languages I overheard) are hearty people. Both rooms are hot. Like, the devil is about to get you, hot. I had to wear a towel around my shoulders because my nips were getting burned. TMI (this whole review is tmi) I know, but you have to understand how hot it was. Between rooms, most guys went all Blue Lagoon and jumped in the cold pool. I wasn't 'there' so I kept my wrap on, got some water and chilled out in the chairs. I saw more than one guy knocked out in the chairs. They're comfy. They also might have been knocked out because of all the booze. Not only are these guys impervious to heat, they can drink while dehydrated. Amazing physiology! I might have been the only person drinking water (although when I requested it in Russian, I got a big smile and two bottles; what? I can speak a little Russian. I'm a renaissance man). Anywhoo, the more I drank, sat, steamed, and saunaed, I felt my stress, literally, melt away. I felt relaxed, invigorated and peaceful. I was a little apprehensive about the near-nudity thing but, trust -- no one is paying attention to you. Everyone is there to do his thing and get a relax (or business) on. By the time I showered and changed back to my street clothes, I felt like a new man. This experience is going into my rotation.$25 for as long as you want to stay. This includes locker, towel, wrap, and shoe fee. Food, drink and massage are extra. *No, they haven't.

42.description: I went here for the first time today because my back had been bothering me for a while.  I originally heard about this place on the TimeOut Chicago Blog, and liked the fact that it was not a "shi-shi" kind of place.  I went in the middle of the day and there were not very many people there.This place is Classy with a capital "C."  When you walk in you are greeted by a host at the door who gives you Two towels, a sheet and a velcro'd towel to wear.  They will also give you sandals if you did not bring your own, which I hadn't and appreciated.  Once inside, there is a rather large area for eating and drinking which is decorated with information on different cultures' ways of using sweat as a healing method.  The locker room is in the center with one side housing shower stalls.  There are very comfortable leather chairs and flat screen TVs in the center.There are two saunas, a Turkish style "wet" sauna and a Russian style "dry" sauna.  In the middle is a cold pool, and believe me when I say it is COLD!My massage was done in a separate room that housed three massage tables and two massage chairs.  It was great.  I left feeling like a new man.While I was there I talked to one of the owners who gave me a lot of information about what services they offer, and explained things to me as this was my first visit to any kind of place like this.  He was really cool and as I was leaving, gave me some two-for-one vouchers.My only qualms with the place were that it is a little pricey; $25 to get in, but the massage was a reasonable $35 for the half hour.  The other thing is that the way the locker room is laid out, it's kind of a tight squeeze to change because the chairs butt up very close to the lockers.I would recommend this place to anyone that needs to relax, or just wants some time to themselves. Now I just have to find a friend to go with me next time.

23.description: This place is a great sweat lodge and I try to go about once a month. The atmosphere is relaxed and inviting, the place is quite clean, and the massages are excellent. I will continue to go here.

5.description: This place been our first choice  to hung out for last 5 years!!! Great way to spend cold Chicago day - highly recommended

31.description: Gents,This is one of the greatest places in Chicago. I LOVE IT, I personally go at least one's every month. I enjoy every moment of it. I will drop close to $100 dollars per visited. Every penny is well worth.

25.description: I really thought that this place was the tops.  I usually go to my YMCA if I want a sauna and a massage but decided to try this place instead.  The only downside is the $25 entry fee, but they give you sandals if you need them, a linen wrap, two regular towels, and a special wrap towel with a Velcro waistband closure for when you're walking around.  I didn't even have a massage scheduled ahead of time and they still fit it in.  It was the best massage that I've ever had, and I've had a lot of them. (Guy's name was Misha.)  I cycled through the wet sauna, cold plunge pool, and dry sauna about three times over the course of an hour.  There is a lounge area if you get too hot and there is a cafe that serves beer, vodka, and good food.  They just keep a tab running for you based on your locker key number.  Everyone was very friendly and talkative, very social place for lots of Russian and Eastern European guys, but everyone was welcome including me (British/Northern European) and a few Latino guys that I chatted with as well.  As everyone else has mentioned, this is not a gay bathhouse at all.  There is even a sign on the door that says no leering is allowed or you will be kicked out.  So, no worries if you're a homophobe, this place is about as straight as the day is long.  Just for the record, you can be completely naked but about 90% of the men have a towel on at all times.  No one really cares.  When you finally leave, there are great showers and then you simply go home.  It's very relaxing.Just a word about the massage, it's not the kind where there is Native American pan-flute music playing and they leave the room while you undress.  You walk into a room where there are three tables and you drop your towel in front of the masseur and get on the table.  He puts a towel over your glutes and your front when you flip but they don't particularly care if it stays in place.  However, it was the best, deepest pressure massage ever.  He kept asking, "Pain?".  No. No pain.  It felt awesome.  He could even tell my left sciatica nerve was completely messed up even thought I hadn't told him and he relaxed my lower back and out so well, I didn't even have to take the normal Valium I do to keep my back from being in constant spasm.  I can't believe he kept up such constant, relaxing pressure for 60 minutes.  Expensive, a bit.  But I will be back.  Disregard the poor reviewers.  They obviously have xenophobia or poor body-image issues.

12.description: Best place to chill on Sunday with group of friends, family. Good food, you can play chess, cards, domino and they also have tablets. TV's on every wall, good place to relax. Never had massage there, seems pricy, I'm not big fan of guys touching me.

37.description: Sweatlodge is best experienced on a 15 degree mid January Sunday morning. Various groups of men shuffle in and out of the dry and wet saunas, representing Chicago's diverse population. Once thoroughly cooked, jump into the cold plunge pool and feel the water vapor condense in your lungs. Otherwise, just fill a bucket of cold water and toss it on yourself while in the sauna.I like an aggressive massage but my masseur was rough but in a manner which caused more tension rather than relieving it.While in the wet sauna, one of the owners gave me a scrub using sheaths of grass and birch branches. This was far more relaxing.

21.description: I returned after several places that I went, went down the hill.This time, they were better. Omgosh I couldn't believe how far better they have gotten. I had 90 minutes of massage, and it was great. The therapist who worked on me was far better than the guy who worked on me when I first came here.I will return if I'm by there.

16.description: My second visit to Chicago Sweatlodge in four years was just as outstanding as my first visit. The staff are friendly and helpful and the clientele is cheerful and relaxed. The saunas and the variety of services offered, in addition to a terrific food and drink menu, make this retreat well worth a visit.

17.description: This is an update from the previous post. Bill from Sweat Lodge called me and apologized for not addressing the issue.  He also offered to reimburse me for the unordered food (I respectfully declined). He seemed sincere in his apologies, and since we are all humans and are prone to making mistakes I believe that ultimately that was the case in my situation.

10.description: I was in many sauna places all over USA. This place Sweat Lodge  I'm highly recommending to visit for many reasons Clean place, very organized, very hot bania, cold lodge, zero gravity relaxing chairs, cold beer with many options to choose, hard liqueur available.I really enjoyed my time there. Thank you!

11.description: This is just an update to note some changes from my last review:STAFF: One of the best reasons to support the Chicago Sweatlodge is that Alex K (front desk), Serge (front desk), Jose (kitchen), Hugo (kitchen), Johnny (kitchen) and Gunther (massage therapist) are great guys.  They've all been working at CSL a good long minute and have been very consistent in their welcoming attitude toward the patrons.    FOOD AND BEVERAGES: Although my favorite CSL signature item remains the fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice, the elimination of the steak stick as an option for the borscht (beet and carrot soup) was disappointing.  It added a lot of flavor to a dish that I'd otherwise only order to feel good about choosing to laze about all day long under the pretense of "taking care of myself."  So, CSL management, please bring back the borscht with steak stick, or at least add a fresh-squeezed fruit juice option to compensate for the loss of your uniquely delicious borscht.  SAUNAS: Great heat is always promised at least for part of each day in the wet and dry saunas, though for me, it's most optimal when patrons bring garlic and eucalyptus for the furnace.  As usual, summer repairs leave the wood looking gorgeous, even though the staff must struggle to ensure the patrons won't abuse it. (Read: Patrons should be advised never to climb down from the top rung of the wet sauna simultaneously.  On one occasion, two patrons did this in the right section of the wet sauna and, as the middle right bench collapsed, they flew into me.)    I am subtracting one star partially because I've generally given CSL's Wicker Park competitor, Red Square Spa, 4/5 star reviews despite the fact that over the years, it has provided a superior experience to Chicago Sweatlodge in two respects: The quality of the menu (gelato, lamb chops, Ginger Beer, Shirley Temples) and the demonstrated appreciation of the manager, Anton, for patrons' diversity.  So if you've only found it to be relaxing, I would recommend continuing to support Chicago Sweatlodge because the front desk (both of the Alex's and Serge), kitchen (Hugo, Johnny and Jose) and massage therapist Gunther work hard to optimize the experience of CSL for all patrons rather than focusing only on the ones who the manager  thinks will look the best on the various TV shows that have filmed segments at CSL. That brings me to the main reason why I'm updating this review: I've had some recent experiences with Chicago Sweatlodge that left me questioning whether it's still fulfilling its mission of promoting relaxation, a mission that would seem to justify my choice to patronize it for nearly 7 years and spend in excess of $10,000 there.Unfortunately, I have to report that Chicago Sweatlodge is no longer a great place for me to relax, and I've probably been in denial about that for a while.  The reason why it's not relaxing is that despite the best efforts of the guys whose work I've praised in this review, the owner and the manager (at the owner's insistence) are obsessively concerned that CSL will eventually become a place where men go to have sex with one another.  The fear of sex in Russian/Turkish baths isn't unreasonable, as businesses have historically closed or been suspended over it, but there are much healthier and more commercially sound ways to channel that fear than the owner and manager do.   They spend a great deal of time trying to see what patrons are doing on their phones, trying to hear what they're talking about with one another, trying to observe how they interact with the massage therapists, and even confronting them about their perception that they have "looked" at another patron or patrons.  I have heard about several related conflicts, and on one occasion of management's paranoia at a time when I had been completely minding my own business in a room by myself, I've been drawn into such a conflict.  The accusation was that one of the other patrons believed I came to "cruise for sex" - which is mind-boggling considering that (weekly on average) I have arrived at and left CSL alone for nearly seven years and often have to be enticed just into sharing a table with anyone else there.  In the wake of the immediate conflict, the owner shared with me over the phone, by text and in voicemails some of his views on political, racial and sexual identity that don't make sense to disclose at length or in such vitriolic language with a patron, especially one who has been giving his business as much money as I have. Yet, in conclusion, he expressed that it would be a "failure" for me to stop patronizing CSL.  Although I would certainly miss the place for its virtues I've cited in this review, I know that relaxation isn't possible there with the current management strategy.  Perhaps it will be different for me in the future, and obviously it is different now for other patrons.

26.description: This place is the best place for dudes to relax in Chicago. Screw your man cave, the greens, or your gym- I have never felt as relaxed and rejuvenated as I do after spending an evening or afternoon here. I try to come once a month, but it usually ends up being once every couple months. Everyone is very helpful and friendly if it is your first time, and they will guide through getting set up. Basically, they give you sandals, some towels, and a locker. You strip down naked, tie on the mesh towel or the linen sheet and head to the saunas. I prefer hitting the wet sauna first, then the cold plunge, and then the dry sauna. The wet sauna is especially great because you can pour buckets of cold water on yourself, which is incredibly refreshing and helps you last longer in the heat.You can lie down, sit down, stand, naked or covered- and no one will care the least bit. I bravely got the venik scrub once, and while it may be intimidating to have your naked body completely scrubbed down in front of strangers, its surprisingly a good experience. My skin was soft for days afterwards and all my self image issues were thrown out the window. The cold plunge is pretty great too. I suggest taking off your sandals and towels before going in, as I have lost both in the pool and had to take extra time awkwardly finding/picking them up and drying them. After the cold plunge, you have a lightheaded feeling for a few minutes, which actually is pretty relaxing and great if your dry up and sit down on the leather couches afterwards and take it easy. Then you head into the dry sauna for a bit, and repeat the whole process until finished. I also got an hour long massage last night and it was great. They really go deep into the skin and muscles and relieve all that built up tension thats accumulated. All in all, this is the best place in Chicago to get naked, relax, and unwind. Screw the fancy spas. I've brought my buddies here too when they visit from out of town and everyone has had a great experience. They only things that are negative is the cramped changing space and the relatively high entrance fee ($25), but its still not unworthy of 5 stars. There's something great and old-world about walking into a hot sauna and hearing all sorts of languages and conversations. If you're not comfortable at all with male communal nudity, then this is not your type of place. But if you are, or can be somewhat, embrace the place, relax, and enjoy yourself. There are all sorts of guys here- old, young, white, brown, black, big, small, skinny, and large- and not once have I felt uncomfortable being here. You will not be disappointed.
