27.description: What a great place.  Clean and well appointed.  I have been going to bath houses for decades and after many years of being disappointed with the choices in Chicago I really am glad they are a traditional Eastern European/ Russian bath house.  The small restaurant inside has amazing chicken soup.  My only complaint is that the change room/ sitting area is cramped.  Changing is difficult.  They could have switched up the layout to accommodate all that is intended for this room.Satya,WLP3

35.description: I don't wanna see this place get too crowded so I won't say anything about them. But to be fair, if you wanna know what I think, 5 stars and I will definitely be back.

8.description: This is our favorite friends night out once a month. Dry and wet sauna, cold beer, pretty good food, catching up with friends: great way to spend Friday night. The place became pricey, but worth it for us. It is all about relaxation in SweatLodge.

0.description: I don't believe in God, nor do I believe in fate HOWEVER...I'm a carpenter and had a 17 hour shift on Friday. On Saturday I had to get my car serviced at a dealership and was told it would take about two hours. With nothing to do I walked around looking for a restaurant or... Something. I was already exhausted and was stumbling around like a zombie when I came across a red brick building with a sign that read Chicago sweat lodge. A bathhouse? Hmm... Ok well, let's check this out. Hopefully it's not something out of Cruising.Turns out it's a legit, old world sweat lodge. Wet sauna, dry sauna, cold dip pool, zero gravity chairs, massage.. Even an excellent little restaurant with a huge selection of foreign beers. I walked, no glided out three hours later in a delirious fog of utter relaxation. That 17 hour shift that had me feeling like an old man that just fell down a flight of stairs? Gone! I felt like a new person. Like I had a new body. And now I have to rethink my position on the existence of God and His guiding hand of fate.Cannot recommend this place highly enough. Go there, now!

38.description: I was very happy with my first visit. We came on a Saturday, and the guy behind the counter was very thorough in making sure we didn't have reservations. "Not George? Not Dave?" I think he went through 4 or 5 names. So they seem to be pretty popular. Most of my review will have comparisons to the Division Street Baths, since that used to be my hangout, but I'm not sure what's going on with them.The amenities are great. While the thin linen towels used at Division are more traditional, the velcro wrap things they have here are a nice touch. Although I had a few wardrobe malfunctions, that's to be expected. Everything is brand new, which is comforting. The lockers are good sized, but the area is a little cramped. Some ass had a 5-minute cell phone conversation right by my locker when I needed to use it. Use the cafe, dude.But, most importantly... the baths. They have Russian and Turkish, and the Russian was right up my alley. The room is a little smaller than Division, and it did get a little crowded. But I'd rather have a small room that gets damn hot than a big room that only gets pretty hot. One warning, beware of splinters on the benches. I caught one before it could do much damage, and let the staff know. The Turkish seems good if that's your thing.The cafe is nice, although a little pricey. They are not BYOB unlike the place on Division. They also don't let you bring in hookers, which the guy at Division said I could do. I'll let you weigh the pros and cons yourself.I must say the reason they only got 4 stars is the goddamn music. It went from Kenny G to Whitney Houston to - get this - Van Morrison. I'm not a huge Van Morrison fan, but he was a massive improvement. I will most certainly be back.

20.description: I love this place.  From the young man who checks you-in, to the bartenders, the masseurs, and the clientele...it's extremely friendly and welcoming.  I love the rain showers; they feel wonderful after a day at work and/or when the weather is miserable.  From there I visit the wet sauna.  Afterwards I get a massage.  My last time there I had Gunther, who was thorough and really worked on my head, neck and shoulders.  The restaurant has beer from all over the world and serves food - mostly of an eastern European theme.  High-def TVs are everywhere, allowing you to watch all kinds of sports in the restaurant, in the locker/lounge room...and even from the showers.  Everything about Chicago Sweatlodge is "escape" and "relaxation."  Oh, and it's kept immaculately clean and updated.  It's a very diverse crowd: most of the men there are eastern European; however, all are friendly and engage in conversation.  I only wish they'd add whirlpools!

19.description: I've gotta say I love this place! No nonsense, no seediness. Clientele is there for health and relaxation. I generally start in the dry heat sauna and alternate with some chilly dips into the cold pool. Finishing up in the 180 degree recliners is the best! My only complaint which in some ways can not be helped in this environment is that the chairs can have a musty smell from shirtless dudes laying in them. Thought I'd mention it to be thorough. Great experience overall.

33.description: I had never been to a sweatlodge before and went on a recommendation from my boss who has been going to them for years. Everyhting he said about the place was right on. The staff is very friendly and did a very good job of explaining the process to a first timer like myself. Don't forget to tip on your way out.....they deserve it for sure.

2.description: Good experience! Diverse clients! Manliness! Came here on a Saturday a little before noon. Welcomed and given a quick tour by the desk guy. This is a no frills place but also a place where worries can be cast aside and male bonding can begin. Good food and excellent drink options. I experienced no creepers or anyone inappropriately interested in my friend and I, other than normal conversation. Most everyone was covered unless plunging and then they were only exposed for a few seconds. Get over it. Not the best place for quiet, calm, relaxation but a great old world experience and I felt great after a few circuits in saunas and plunge.

34.description: So I must admit...This was not one of the top ten things on my bucket list of priorities, however I did enjoy the experience.That said, I am uber glad I went with an experienced sweatlodger. Otherwise I would have been lost, uncomfortable, and not have any clue on what to do.So the experience goes like:1) They give you three towels      a) one to be used for inside the wet Turkish bania      b) one to be used to wrap yourself (although mine was having some minor malfunctions)      c) one to be used when you are finishedThere are two banias     1) wet/Turkish bania    2) dry/Russian bania I preferred the wet/Turkish bania because they have buckets of water that you are constantly dipping your towel in to cool off. If that isn't working then you simply throw a bucket of really cold water all over you. It is quite the rush and very relaxing. They also have these scrubbing leaves (forgot what they are called) which are used to exfoliate. I tried them on my back and they were cool, however I was not ready nor participated in full naked exfoliation done by one of your bania peers. That seems a little "over the top" for my own taste.After sitting in the banias for a while we treated ourselves to a cold plunge, which is basically taking a dip in a small pool that is probably about 34 degrees in temperature. After taking an exhilarating dip in the cold plunge I have a new found respect for those that participate in the Polar Bear race in Lake Michigan.Once finished we sat down, watched some college football on tv (they have all kinds of flat screens throughout) and ate some cabasa and perogies which were pretty good. They also serve alcohol (have a wide variety of beer and liquor) and have cards/chess which was a huge bonus. My three complaints: (hence the 4 stars instead of 5) and the fact that I don't want some "connected" Russian showing up on my doorstep for a bad review.1) They were playing music like Brittney Spears in the back ground which was ugh. Some classic rock or similar would of made it a better experience.2) The towel with the malfunction3) Most importantly, when I am eating cabasa I do not enjoy looking at cabasa walking around naked. They provide towels for a reason...I think people should wear them in the cafe/eating area. I can't stand old guys walking around strutting their junk in an area for eating. Just my two cents!Either way, it was a cool and very relaxing experience. I will definitely go back as the weather starts to get cooler and I would/have RECOMMENDED. In addition, facilities were clean and staff was very friendly.

32.description: Had a good and relaxing time here. No need to repeat what the previous reviewers have said, but this place is definitely worth the visit. The pelmeni were pretty good. The one (minor) thing I wish this place had was some sort of jacuzzi or pool to sit in to cool off.

18.description: I've been here 4 times and can honestly say it's always been a great time. A wonderful way to spend a day with good friends, relaxing, eating awesome food, drinking interesting foreign beers and vodka, meeting new people. On my first visit I wasn't sure I'd feel welcome there among so many regulars, but those fears melted away very quickly and I started planning my next visit. Great staff, friendly crowd, unique experience. Try it with a friend!

41.description: This place is great.  Went for the first time after reading the review in Time Out Chicago, very excited about getting that true sweatlodge/bath experience and this didn't disappoint at all.  Not being a languages expert, I can't tell for sure, but based on the tiny bits I could pick out from others' conversations (namely, "da" and "nyet"), this place seems to be immensely popular with the Russian community, which is probably a quality endorsement in and of itself.So if you are not Russian, do not be surprised if you find yourself among very few native English speakers, but don't be intimidated either - there is no language barrier with the staff - extraordinarily friendly - and the facilities are top notch.  This place reminds me (heat-wise) of the Turkish and Russian Baths on Manhattan's lower east side, but at the Sweatlodge, the facilities are brand spanking new and immaculately maintained.  I've not yet been to the Division Street baths in Wicker Park, but I find it hard to imagine they could provide a better experience than this place.  I agree with the first reviewer that $25 for entry is a little steep, but you get what you pay for, including a very clean facility, towel service, occasional snacks, and very reasonably priced food and water ($1/bottle). The massage rates seem very reasonable.  Because of a bad back, I avoided a massage, but a friend that I went with did a full hour massage and said it was one of the best he'd had in years.Anyway, Portage Park may not be central to any of the more hip neighborhoods in Chicago, but it's totally worth the trip.

13.description: Really awesome place. Small, but with great hot/dry and wet saunas and for real cold pool. Had a really good deep tissue massage as well. No frills, all deep tissue, all good.Really the kicker is the little Russian (mostly) restaurant in the front. Schvitzing followed by a shot of vodka. It's a good way to winter in Chicago.

4.description: One of the most relaxing and beneficial experiences I've had. The sweat lodge is all about the polarity of the hot from cold. Something about the transition from extreme heat to extreme cold calms my mind and body. Leaving me feeling relaxed and pain free for days. Add in the zero gravity chairs and it's an awesome experience. Don't fear the cold pool, but it commands respect. Do not overdo it as it can have strange effects on your body. I did the cold plunge 10 times on my last visit after enjoying the heat for 10 to 15 minutes. I had a few muscles twitching for the next 24 hours. No big deal and it still healed many of the nagging injuries I deal with regularly so no big deal. Go and enjoy!!!!

24.description: I've been here 4 times and can honestly say it's always been a great time. A wonderful way to spend a day with good friends, relaxing, eating awesome food, drinking interesting foreign beers and vodka, meeting new people. On my first visit I wasn't sure I'd feel welcome there among so many regulars, but those fears melted away very quickly and I started planning my next visit. Great staff, friendly crowd, unique experience. Try it with a friend!

6.description: I had a great experience at Sweatlodge.  Definitely a guy's only place to visit.  Young kids with dads, teenagers, college guys and grandfathers enjoying each others company was just a neat experience.  I had a great massage and you will definitely sweat in the saunas.  I will return!Great Eastern European home made food and a nice selection of beers made this place even more special.  Excellent staff and they work hard to keep the place clean.  Definitely worth a visit men.

22.description: It is great place to relax and drink The massage guy is very friendly and professional With a nice touch too I will go. There always Thank you guys They are all friendly

15.description: Wow what a nice place. Almost on par with some of the German saunas I've been to.  Admission is $30 and includes 2 towels slippers a headcloth and a wrap. People were friendly all over.. Russians, others. I might have spotted 3 cast members of Chicago Fire. The food was excellent and cheap. Quality is outstanding. I had the Brost which came with a small skewer of beef a large round of bread and most than enough soup for a meal. I also had a large mug of carrot/celery/cucumber juice for $5. What a deal!Also got an hour massage from Gunther who was friendly and very good. I got my money's worth. I spent 4 hours there (for the $30) between the dry and wet sauanas shower by the plunge pool the bar and and the zero gravity chairs. The chairs put me to sleep. Make sure you wet the headcloth and put it on your head in the dry sauna. Some seasoned visitors wear s special wool hat. I came out feeling like a new man !

40.description: So I was playing tennis with some friends on Saturday. It was around 3pm, and we were dead tired and sweaty. So we decided to head on out to Chicago Sweatlodge. I have never been to a Turkish bath before, but I'm used to this type of styled saunas from back home.You enter the place, and they immediately give you a set of towels and a key to your locker. Go on in get changed, take a nice shower and then just chill-lax in their Turkish wet spa (douse yourself with cold water when it gets too hot), dump yourself in the ice-cold pool and then savor the Russian dry spa. After all of that, relax in their little cafe area for some drinks, food and a game of chess. We spent around an hour and a half there, but I could easily have spent more time there if I had a massage. I had a lot of fun and will definitely be back again.

7.description: Booked a pair of massages for 9pm last night.  Make the 25 min drive from the west loop to find out that there was a mix up and no masseuses are there.  Instead of just fessing up at the door so I can go home immediately and salvage my evening, they instead wait 20 min to inform me of the error so that I have enough time to change and get settled in for my massage.   Thanks for wasting even more of my time.

36.description: This place is awesome. I was very curious after reading reviews here and also visiting their website. I needed a break from a project on a Tuesday afternoon so I headed over there. This establishment is clean, classy and authentic. $25 to get in may seem a little steep, but after you spend a few hours sweating and plunging in the 34 degree pool, you'll see that it's worth it. Also I got a detoxifying scrub for $15 plus tip. I plan on going to this place regularly and hopefully convincing some friends to go with me. I didn't eat anything, but the menu looks really nice. Also, I spoke to one of the owners/managing partners after I was done and they are really nice guys. TAKE THE PLUNGE!

30.description: Men ONLY? There should definitely be a women's day.

3.description: After my first visit, I would not recommend this place at all. I should have known better when you are first greeted with a warning sign upon entering the building that reads, "No sex." Keep in mind that everyone inside the bathhouse are all men! I'm a guy and more than once I was extremely creeped out by men trying to hit on me. One guy would follow me around and persistently ask me random questions about myself. As I was showering, one guy leaned over into my stall and was watching me. He gave me a wink and quite possibly the creepiest smile I will ever see in my life. I had to yell at him to look the other way in order for him to stop. On my way out, the guy behind the desk tried to over charge another customer even though the customer pointed at the correct price for the service advertised on their wall. The guy behind the desk responded by saying, "sorry that's the old price."If you enjoy grown homosexual men sexually harassing you and having the business potentially overcharging you, then this is your place!

14.description: The best place in Chicago for a schvitz and a rubdown!!  Bill is the best, get the 90 minute massage.  Great steam room as well and dry sauna. Can be really crowded early Sunday mornings so be advised.  Some parking in back or easy neighborhood parking. Excellent food, I'm crazy about the kielbasa & pierogi combo plate.I like the ethnic diversity too  and everyone is polite and friendly, staff and patrons.Wish I could afford to gone every week, but well worth the price as an indulgence for your birthday. They supply towels and shower-shoes so jut bring your wallet and credit card, leave your worries behind and relax!!!

28.description: The entire experience with my Brazilian wax was amazing! She was easy to reach, I was able to make my appointment very quickly and easily, and the location was very easy to get to. I read in other reviews that the wax was relatively painless, and it really was. I've had many other experiences with waxing (both strip wax and hard wax) and this was the most painless wax I have ever received. I couldn't believe she waxed all the hair off! She is such a sweet woman and she does an amazing and thorough job. I will definitely be coming back!!!

1.description: Chanara is truly wonderful at what she does and she makes it quick, easy and painless.  My delicate skin doesn't love the bikini waxes I subject it to - but her process made a big difference and I will continue to drive about 15 miles from my home to continue to see her!

9.description: I can't imagine going anywhere else !!! Best service in town! Chanara truly is awesome ! Exceeded my expectations second time around ! Attentive to my needs and my comfort. A plus will keep on coming and if you're looking for the best search no more , she is the one!

29.description: I love Chanara! She made my first experience very comfortable and pleasant.  I was a little apprehensive about getting a full brazilian, but she made sure I was okay and that everything was to my liking.  I would recommend going to her, she is very friendly and knowledgeable about her craft.

23.description: This is an update!!! I still give 5 stars! I drove in from Detroit to see Chanara!! I love her! She has moved into a bigger location and the place is gorgeous even though she states they are still "working on things". I received a full face hair removal and keep looking at my face like I've never had it done and my skin feels so smooth. She also sells her own essential oil good for men and women for skin irritation and ingrown hair. Keep doing your thing and never change! I can't wait to see more big things from you!! .... I feel like Chanara is my new bff!! She is great I have had awful waxing experiences and now I know all hair removal does not have to be painful or take off a layer of my skin. She may have even convinced me to do "down there" my next visit! She did smaller sections so you aren't overwhelmed with pain. And she got every hair the bare eye could see.She has such a gentle and kindred spirit I felt like I had been coming to her for years! I plan on moving back to Michigan soon but I will be making trips back for her. She has a new client for sure!!

5.description: I have come to Chanara for the last few months for waxing. She is quick and as painless as can be. She takes smaller strips which makes the pain less.  She also uses a new stick for each dip in the wax for cleanliness.  She is also a sweet and funny gal that makes the time fly. I genuinely like to see her.Prices are also reasonable. Booking is easy.

31.description: I came to Chanara for a brazilian after buying a Youswoop deal. Because I'm allergic to certain wax ingredients/brands I called ahead of time to make sure she had wax I could tolerate. She did not. However, she ordered wax I could use the very same day. Do you guys know how amazing that is? I was super impressed because no place has ever done that for me. I ended up missing 2 appointments and she was very understanding and didn't kick me to the curb or void my voucher which was very nice of her. The day I did go, she was very friendly and talkative. It was like talking to a friend I've had for years. Most importantly she did my wax in smaller sections which was a method I've never experienced. I actually liked it. She was VERY thorough and wasn't afraid to get in there and get rid of the hair. You can't be shy in the hair removal business and she wasn't but was still really professional. I would definitely come back to her for another wax.

25.description: Chanara is wonderful! She is  very thoughtful and thorough. Frequently checking my comfort level and paying close attention to the results. Her prices are very reasonable,  her online booking system is easy to use and her location is close to CTA, Metra and the highway with easy access to parking. I highly recommend her for her down to earth personality and expert technique!

12.description: Amazing service as soon as you walk in. First time client and I felt as if I wasn't a stranger. Clean location and the bed/table you lay on is cleaned in between clients. I definitely recommend visiting her for any of your waxing needs. Currently it's only by appointment which was a downer for me at first BUT after my visit she's worth the wait!! I do have to say that I called and was able to get in the same day so it was not that bad for an appointment. Not a dull second as you get waxed conversations are exactly what we all need, great topic with humor. I feel lucky having found her

21.description: Chanara is fabs! She is just so matter of fact and sweet and genuine! I have been searching for a great place for waxing and this is definitely it. Soon we were chatting like old friends even though we had just met and I'm often reticent. The location itself is kind of a funny little place- she just rents a room- although conveniently located, but once you get over that you're in for a treat. She is just so meticulous and clean and very reasonably priced for the quality of the service. Plus she has lots of different deals and promotions which you hardly ever see.Check her out!

16.description: I just moved to the neighborhood. I needed my brows waxed and I like to support my local businesses. I called and got voice messaging, which I look at as a bad sign to begin with. I left a message about scheduling a wax appointment. No one ever called me back!

17.description: I've had two deep bikini waxes which is as close to a Brazilian without actually being a Brazilian and everything went smoothly-pun intended. The service was quick and basically painless, no numbing solution needed. Chanara is really friendly and professional. She has a cute little spot on Irving park road. And the prices are very reasonable. So glad to have this addition to the portage park area!

10.description: Chanara is AMAZBALLS!!! She is so nice and makes the experience the best. She talks to you to make sure you are comfortable with the whole process. She is the sweetest person ever! So glad I found her!

11.description: Chanara is the best! I kid you not! Her technique is unmatched. Yes waxing is painful but Chanara knows how to make a pain go from 10 to 1 really quickly! She can talk about anything under the sun she is like the bestie you go shopping with and having a good conversation is key to helping to calm you down during waxing.Ok so now to the nitty gritty:-She uses oil instead of powder to prep the skin, it helps reduce irritation -She is highly sanitary and does not double dip unless that whole waxing can is going on you for me I had a lot of services (full brazilian with buttocks, full legs, full arms, underarms, stomach) she is also very thorough and will ask before she tweezes if needed.-Her prices are quite affordable check it out on style seat if you can!-She checked with me during the service to see if I was ok and how I was holding up, and her technique was as gentle as a wax could be I felt like she was excellent in putting herself in my shoes. All I can say is experience her for yourself please! I assure you these reviews are not misleading.I look forward to making my next appt with her and you should try her out!

26.description: Chanara is the waxing queen! not only is she kind but she also is very meticulous and serious about her work. She makes you feel so comfortable about the whole situation i couldn't imagine going to anyone else.

27.description: Chanara is wonderful!  She made an otherwise extremely awkward situation quite comfortable (well not exactly comfortable-but close!).  It was so easy to make an appointment and her location is super convenient.  Her prices are incredible too!  Give her a try!  You will be very happy you did

0.description: I went there for the first time today (in what is the new space). Chanara was very sweet and professional and put me right at ease. My waxing was as near painless as it can possibly be, and I'd go back in a heartbeat.

20.description: Chanara is the best! I kid you not! Her technique is unmatched. Yes waxing is painful but Chanara knows how to make a pain go from 10 to 1 really quickly! She can talk about anything under the sun she is like the bestie you go shopping with and having a good conversation is key to helping to calm you down during waxing.Ok so now to the nitty gritty:-She uses oil instead of powder to prep the skin, it helps reduce irritation -She is highly sanitary and does not double dip unless that whole waxing can is going on you for me I had a lot of services (full brazilian with buttocks, full legs, full arms, underarms, stomach) she is also very thorough and will ask before she tweezes if needed.-Her prices are quite affordable check it out on style seat if you can!-She checked with me during the service to see if I was ok and how I was holding up, and her technique was as gentle as a wax could be I felt like she was excellent in putting herself in my shoes. All I can say is experience her for yourself please! I assure you these reviews are not misleading.I look forward to making my next appt with her and you should try her out!

19.description: Firstly, if you're worried about the pain aspect of waxing (BECAUSE OMG WHO LIKES WAXING), Chanara seems to have a magic touch. Least painful bikini wax of my life. I had a "deep bikini" wax with her a few days before my wedding/honeymoon, and my other half was very happy with his wax as well. We will definitely be back to see Chanara :)

33.description: Wow! I think it has been almost a year (maybe a little more) since I've started going to Chanara for waxing services. One would think it would be weird to have someone you know socially into your most private parts (pun intended), but she is extremely professional and knowledgeable. She's also a good resource if you are researching more holistic methods to caring for your body. I recommend her with the highest praise, I have not been disappointed by her.

2.description: COME HERE IF YOU WANT TO HAVE A GREAT WAXING EXPERIENCEI have been waxed - correction, i tried to get waxed in the past but the experience was horrible! I decided to come to Chanara because of the excellent yelp reviews! The anticipation before getting there was the worse! I honestly thought that i was going to chicken out but i stayed. Everybody knows that waxing is not a pleasant experience and that it hurts. Chanara made this experience wonderful and very pleasant. She was talking to me while i was getting my Brazilian and after 5 minutes i felt like we were best friends.  Chanara is a professional with an amazing personality! My Brazilian took about 30 - 40 minutes and i was VERY VERY VERY pleased. Chanara has definitely changed my views on waxing and honestly i can not wait to go back! Waxing at her studio was the best thing i have done in a long time.

32.description: I had my first Brazilian waxing experience with Chanara and I hope my last one is with her as well. She's super professional and very sweet. She instantly made me feel comfortable about the whole sensitive situation. As soon as it was done I knew I would never shave down there again! I recommend her to all my friends and family, (almost to the point of annoyance). I have even given up my appointment slot, just so that their first time was with Chanara. She's the perfect person to bring a friend who is unsure or timid. I would hope to never go to anyone else. :D

18.description: Chanara is the best! She's beyond friendly and made my first experience pleasantly comfortable. I will most certainly be going back. Great conversation and customer service! Very professional. She takes her time and makes it perfect, tweezers and all! :-) I highly recommend Chanara for any waxing services!!!

13.description: She's the best, simple as that! I recommend her to anyone looking for beautiful looking, near painless waxing, and great conversation! So good that I don't even need to look at my brows when she's done, the trust is just there!

4.description: She is the best! Always shapes my eyebrows perfectly and super clean work space. Also very friendly and professional. I have never gotten a Brazilian but since she is so awesome I might just be brave and do it.

24.description: Chanara is the best esthetician I have ever been to! I had so many body parts being waxed, that my session lasted for 2 hours but those 2 hours were a breeze! Chanara is super friendly and we talked about so many different things, it made me feel as if I was visiting with an old friend. I do not have a high tolerance for pain and in the past I have had people stop mid wax when getting a Brazilian because it was way too painful, but Chanara's waxing was painless! She always checked in every few minutes to make sure I was comfortable and that the wax temperature wasn't too hot. She truly knows what she is doing. I have officially found my place to go for waxes while in Chicago!

6.description: Incredible experience at a cute, quaint, classy salon in the heart of Old Irving Park! I know for a fact that I can't ever go to another place because Chanara was uhhhh-maaaazing!!!!!!! I'm definitely coming back!!I am super happy with the results, love love loved Chanara and her beautiful soul, and didn't even feel the pain because we were talking and laughing the whole time. She is extremely thorough, attentive to details, clean, efficient, and her service is priced at a super reasonable rate - you simply can't beat that! (AND she's hilarious!!) It's people and businesses like hers that make the local community thrive. I am so glad I found her and would recommend anyone to get waxed at Signature Free.

22.description: Chanara is really good! She made it a very pleasant experience! It was painful of course but she was talking to me all throughout the process and made me very comfortable. I highly recommend her and she definitely gained one client today. I am for sure coming back!

15.description: Chanara is fabs! She is just so matter of fact and sweet and genuine! I have been searching for a great place for waxing and this is definitely it. Soon we were chatting like old friends even though we had just met and I'm often reticent. The location itself is kind of a funny little place- she just rents a room- although conveniently located, but once you get over that you're in for a treat. She is just so meticulous and clean and very reasonably priced for the quality of the service. Plus she has lots of different deals and promotions which you hardly ever see.Check her out!

7.description: Can't wait to see Chanara in her new space. This will be the 4th salon I have visited to see Chanara because she is worth it - even hunted her down to continue using her services last year.So exciting to see her new venture take shape. Chanara is professional, courteous, gentle, kind and great at what she does - supporting a local, woman-owned business venture is an added bonus!!I have super sensitive skin and Chanara understands my issues and personal needs. And we love to chat about our nails, our families, and life in general, just like any great friend! Amazed it took me this long to finally write a Yelp review, but I have been a fan since my first visit.

8.description: Chanara is amazing! Not only is she great at what she does, but she is one of the sweetest and most caring lady's I have ever met. She really cares about her clients needs and wants, and has reasonable prices too! I've referred many friends to her (who have all had a flawless experience) and will continue to do so. Can't wait to check out her new storefront!Schedule an appointment! You won't regret it (:

30.description: She is the best!!! I had a full brazilian and I pretty much didn't feel a thing. She is located right off the expressway and plenty of parking. Not only that but her prices are amazing. Chanara has a client for life!!! (or until I'm eldery and don't care about my lady bits anymore) hahah

3.description: Unfortunately, my eyebrows were reduced to pencil thin, uneven lines. I actually burst into tears in the salon. See the photo posted - that's me with red eyes, after crying. Chanara apologized and didn't make me pay but lost eyebrows....really awful.

14.description: This is an update!!! I still give 5 stars! I drove in from Detroit to see Chanara!! I love her! She has moved into a bigger location and the place is gorgeous even though she states they are still "working on things". I received a full face hair removal and keep looking at my face like I've never had it done and my skin feels so smooth. She also sells her own essential oil good for men and women for skin irritation and ingrown hair. Keep doing your thing and never change! I can't wait to see more big things from you!! .... I feel like Chanara is my new bff!! She is great I have had awful waxing experiences and now I know all hair removal does not have to be painful or take off a layer of my skin. She may have even convinced me to do "down there" my next visit! She did smaller sections so you aren't overwhelmed with pain. And she got every hair the bare eye could see.She has such a gentle and kindred spirit I felt like I had been coming to her for years! I plan on moving back to Michigan soon but I will be making trips back for her. She has a new client for sure!!

1.description: I was looking for a comfy, quiet spot with wifi to get some work done when i decided to check this place out. I've driven by it many times and was Always curious. My first impression was that of a community center for young kids, but instead of young kids running around there were older folk, young at heart! The staff were very welcoming. You can sit and have access to their great WI-Fi with any small purchase from their cafe. I started out with a good old cup of coffee. It was good. It was also 75 cents and free refills! Can't beat that!For lunch I had the chicken ceaser wrap, it was very yummy! Very fresh. I didn't feel rushed out after I ate. I got a lot of work done and had a great lunch. Im definitely coming back here. Beats any starbucks!I am going to hang out here a lot when Im young at heart :)

2.description: I've been practicing for the golden years for so long now, that when I finally get to be officially old I'm truly gonna  be hip for the first time in my life. It seems like most of the times my friends trust me to call the shots, we end up (unintentionally) surrounded by seniors- listening to local history lectures at the Cultural Center, swaying to the blues on the far south side, sharing half bottles of vodka during polka night at Podlasie Club, learning how to play dominoes in the former movie palace on Pulaski.My latest adventure involved a solo visit to a lecture on the glorious and highly Polish history of my beloved neighborhood of Avondale. Of course I found myself in a roomful of seniors. This "more than a cafe" targets the 50+ crowd, but the hostess and the cashier at the cafe were super welcoming and glowing with a love of life. I picked up a 55 cent cup of coffee and some breakfast here to go with my lecture (though the burgers looked decent). Prices were super reasonable, but next time I'm going to wear a powdered wig so I can get the senior discount and save even more.In addition to the food and occasional lectures, there's a bank of computers with internet access, and you can watch seniors run on treadmills in a glass "fishbowl" room in between the cafe and the community room. Normally my favorite part about hanging with seniors is overhearing a dose of irreverent, brutal honesty from someone who no longer worries about what other people think of them (like the time at symphony hall when the seventy something shouted out, "this is awful, this is killing me!" in the middle of a classical concert)- but there didn't seem to be any of that charming crankiness here. Which means Mather is successful in their goal of creating a social center and a learning center for seniors.This may not be the place for me today, but if I was in my 50s, I'd probably be here all the time.

0.description: Great Senior Hangout!Staff is welcoming.  If you like it you can become a member - it's good for discounts on food, classes, programs, and outings.  Affordable, with or without the discount.  Your membership is good for any of the 4 locations in Chicago.Some habitués can be clique-ish.  Since I don't play well with others that turns me off.  However there is a library of donated books so reading and eating is good for me.  Nice spot for a late breakfast, lunch or afternoon snack.  Fitness equipment available.  Social worker has office hours here once a week - excellent way to access resources. Computer center with classes in English and Spanish on the basics. A bonus (?) is the pierogi outlet store cattywampus across the street.  The building and parking lot are shared with a children's center.  For seniors who use paratransit this can be a problem unless they insist on "lobby contact."  Recent event was a Polish program with dancers and singing after a luncheon of some favorite comfort foods.  I was totally impressed at how the entire staff plus some hard working volunteers kept the food coming and the tables cleared without missing a beat.  Oh yes - they also managed to provide service and space for those who didn't make a reservation in time to join in.

29.description: Tip: to cancel your membership find the manager. It's good if you find the right people to talk to. All other members might tell you it's going to take weeks.

42.description: I agree -- this is an XSport not Lifetime Fitness, but for what it is, it's perfectly fine.  I go early in the morning so I have not experienced the overcrowding, but at times, the paper towels run out, the garbage is overflowing, etc.  However, for $20/month, what do you expect?  I think the variety of classes is good though I've only gone to 1 or 2.The staff can be a bit stand offish, which is annoying.  I belonged to Zip Fitness and loved it, but it was too far and they don't have classes.  At Zip, they were constantly cleaning and the staff was very friendly.  Xsport could take a lesson from the Zip customer service philosophy.Overall, I'm glad that Xsport is in the neighborhood -- it's a good value for the money and it is not another empty building.

23.description: Joe from customer service called me and after 30 minutes were able to sort through the circus that occurred with my contracts. Anyways a check is in the mail for the discrepancy and hope to be treated better in the future.Time will tell

47.description: Things got off to a bit of a rough start when this gym opened because they were overwhelmed with the large number of members that signed up and all the remodeling they were doing (which is still in progress, but almost done). It all seems to be shaping up nicely now and I'm happy I joined.The upsides:Very cleanA large variety of equipmentNew equipmentParking lot (although it is small, street parking is available)Downsides:A little too crowded with equipment and not a lot of floor space for working out.Sometimes equipment isn't returned to correct spots. It depends on who is working and how vigilant they are on keeping things organized.Personal trainers:I highly recommend Sterling as a personal trainer. She completely changed the way I work out for the better in just a few sessions. She has a great personality and she is so knowledgeable and easy to get along with. Most importantly, she will tailor a workout to fit you. Also - she is completely responsible, shows up for training sessions and returns calls as soon as possible. I've never had any scheduling problems with her.Overall - I'm very happy with my membership and very happy I signed up for a few personal training sessions.

8.description: Newer club so everything is awesome! The equipment, the entire facility is great. The layout is smart, easy to get on and off the equipment. The staff is very helpful. Location works for my schedule.

31.description: Best xsport I say. Park across the street. Avoid peak times and you can super set your workouts. Coffee shop next door is great for pre/post coffee/tea. Free Mini massage. Cleanest bathrooms and newest equipment.

34.description: This xsport is very convenient for me and does have the machines I like to use. However, parking is an issue majority of the time. I've actually left because I couldn't find anywhere to park for 20 minutes. There's also thieves roaming to parking lot waiting to break into cars, so don't leave anything that could appear to be valuable in your car, even if you try to hide it under a seat. There's a good chance someone is watching you do that.I have mixed feelings as far as the staff goes. When I 'went in to sign up, all I really wanted was to have a place to go to use a treadmill in the winter. The up-selling aspect for personal training by making me feel awful about myself didn't sit very well with me. I realized the salesperson probably wouldn't leave me alone until I agreed to commit to some sessions with a trainer and hoped that it wasn't going to be a huge waste of money. The trainer is pretty good though, and has helped me work muscles I haven't in awhile, so I do leave the gym feeling like I've accomplished something. So I do find some value in the sessions I've purchased. However, with that being said, there have been numerous times that the trainer has cancelled the session with little or virtually no notice mostly due to scheduling conflicts. With both of our busy schedules, it's inconvenient and difficult to have to reschedule a time that works for both of us.

16.description: I don't get all the bad reviews! Maybe it's that there are no towels? The locker room is a good size for an express location and I think the gym is really nice. Yes, if you have only one machine you will use and refuse to try any others there is a chance that sometimes all of those machines will be taken. But I have never, even at peak times, had an issue with finding a machine! And sure the parking lot can get crowded but there is always street parking. I also really like that they have wi-fi, which is a rarity for an express. I feel like if they had a pool this would be my ideal Xsport!

13.description: Joe from customer service called me and after 30 minutes were able to sort through the circus that occurred with my contracts. Anyways a check is in the mail for the discrepancy and hope to be treated better in the future.Time will tell

11.description: Very clean and well designed gym.  The parking lot can get full and there is street parking available.  I have been to a couple of classes and they can use some improvement.  The Zumba class was excellent.  The kickboxing class was more like Caribbean dance...I have been to several kickboxing classes with a variety of instructors and this is not kickboxing.  I also recommend for all fitness classes that instructors provide suggestions for all fitness levels.  Not everyone can do advanced moves.  The staff is very friendly and the locker room clean and supplied.  Easy and convenient.  Look for the Yelp deals.

39.description: 2 Stars because the equipment is new. A few other reviewers summed it up fairly well. But....here's my take. It's an XSport. As in, no frills, too many useless personal trainers lingering about (not training), REALLY #$%@@#$% LOUD, staff is unmotivated, and quite frankly, all seem a little soft in the head, classes are too crowded and not the best. And, ITS LOUD (oh, did I already mention that?), Tvs blaring in every direction, and music coming from the "private" training area just blazing and vibrating the whole gym. But, what are you going to do? Nothing else is around here! And, for the super low cost, it is what it is. Best idea is to go in, grab a machine, keep your ear phones in, do your stuff and get out. At least its next store to Portage Grounds, which is awesome.

37.description: I like this xsport bec its nearby my house . Overall, its still clean bec its still new but its starting to get dirty. The crowd is good, if you're a girl and don't want to get hit on avoid rush hrs (5-9p) and early morning on weekends lol. Staff are definitely nice. I wish they have a full xsport instead of an express one here..

0.description: Not bad. Gym is small and can get over crowded at times and it is hard to find space to workout. All trainers are very friendly. Hard to find parking! I usually have to park a few block down.When I initially signed up (July) I felt I was almost being harassed to sign up for personal training. Apparently,the manager (who was a man) I was working with didn't understand the word NO. He was questioning my finances. That is personal and inappropriate. I almost walked out and left. But, I have no problems with the other staff. They are great. I can come in and get my workout done in peace.

38.description: I am EXTREMELY unsatisfied with your staff and your policies, which as evidenced by the need for me to send this letter via registered mail, are archaic. I requested that my payment method be changed from my checking account to my credit card. I phoned CS and the person I spoke with TOOK MY CREDIT CARD INFORMATION and told me it was "taken care of". Imagine my dismay when I found that an unexpected and unbudgeted $113 was withdrawn from my checking account and caused my account to be overdrawn and for my bank to charge me overdraft fees. When I phoned CS again I was basically told "there's nothing we can do about it". I was told at that point that I needed to go into my gym location and fill out a change of payment method form - 1st I heard of that! So I went to my gym and asked that all my memberships be canceled...which is when I learned that I needed to SEND A LETTER! Your manager, Josh, was very kind, however he was unable to do anything for me. What type of manager has no ability to take care of things like this? It's ridiculous. When I asked why my Xit was renewing after the initial 2 months I agreed to he said that unless I request that it be canceled, in writing, it would keep renewing and that the sessions expire each month; it's a use 'em or lose 'em situation - WHICH NOBODY EVER TOLD ME!Your business and sales tactics practices are intentionally deceptive. Your sales staff lie through omission. I will NEVER be a member of any of your gyms again and I will tell everyone I know about your deliberately unclear communications.

51.description: First off the gym is beautiful. The staff is another story, they are horrible. The staff does not care about the guests. And im sure in time this gym will fall apart in the future. The manager is a piece of work as well, I do not know why they would put someone like him incharge of their brand new gym.The gym is in a prime location, parking is ok, during peak hours it may be a little rough, but if your patient you will find one. The gym has been open for about 2 weeks and they already had a "guest appreciation day??" It was more like a Salsa Club. With food, and people dancing and even a "Hype Man." There was a guy on the microphone screaming and telling everyone to dance and kept stoping to talk to people. This gym is multicultural with alot of polish and european, why would they play only spanish music? I had my headphones on but i couldnt even hear the music from my ipod, the DJ was sooo loud. It was more of a fun house then anything. I REALLY hope they never do that again. AND they had food... people are trying to lose weight, and you put food in there face? Also, the staff had on sports jerseys so i couldnt even tell who was who! Plus they had ballons... really??The gym does not have any structure, they have no idea what they were doing and the stuff are poorly trained. Hire a new manager who can run the gym and train the staff and you will see much happier guests. i mean.. Its a gym!!! Just make sure the equipment is cleaned and the guests are happy, thats it! We dont need a DJ in the gym! Come on now....

27.description: PROS:-New facility / equipment-Excellent IT classesCONS:-Front-desk staff are useless ADVICE TO MANAGEMENTFIRE your useless staff, and HIRE people who ACTUALLY want to work. By work, this means MORE than the bare MINIMUM.

32.description: I love this Xsport and all of the classes that it has to offer. I'm am extremely satisfied with the front desk staff they are always accommodating and are very informative especially Victor Jimenez. I also cannot get enough of the group fitness classes the instructors are so motivating!

48.description: I started going to this location because before this one,the closest one to my house was still pretty far. Its a bit smaller than other ones because its express but it's pretty good in my opinion. The parking lot could be bigger though. Also,the day we had that crazy rain/flood/whatever else was falling from the sky,the ceiling was leaking in some spots o_O....overall this is a good gym and there's barely anyone there when I go early in the morning.

44.description: The gym is nice looking, new, and clean. The problems are: 1) the parking. the parking lot is tiny. the parking spots in the parking lot are way too tight. every time i park in there, i feel like someone is going to scratch or hit my car getting out. also, the other day at 7:30PM, there was absolutely no parking in there- which happens quite often. so, that means you have to look for street parking. i ended up having to park in permit parking if i wanted to work out that day. & since i had already taken the drive there- i was not about to leave without getting a workout in. of course, i got a $75 ticket. yes, i know i shouldn't have parked there & hoped i didn't get a ticket- but that's the type of decision you have to make when working out here sometimes lol. 2) it gets sooo crowded and you have to wait forever for equipment sometimes. there is also only one studio, so if you like to work out in the studio- you have to come when there is not a class. there is not really floor space outside of the studio. 3) they do not leave the key tag/checkin scanner on the desk, so you have to wait until someone is available to check you in- which can also be annoying if they are helping people & you have to wait even longer to start working out. 4) the people working at the front desk are teenagers or very young & it gives it a teeny bopper feel, which is just kind of annoying, IMO. Aside from all of that, it is a nice facility. Especially if you go when it is dead.

24.description: I've been a member of the Xsport family for over a decade.  that means ive been a paying customer for over 10 years!!  For the most part, im very pleased with the facilities that are provided for us.  However,  this Portage Park location is being neglected now that the money is pouring in.  A previous comment was made about a door flapping in the wind...lol!  It still hasn't been fixed.  The snow removal is kind of slipshod as well.   My issue, that i wanna comment on,  is that ive been formally requesting more 5lb and 2.5lb barbell weights for two months now.  Just two days ago, i was actually told, "since you are the only one requesting the equipment, corporate has not given the approval to give us more weights."  Now, i think that's ironic and not funny at all!!  What kind of weight room doesn't replenish the weights when they are lost or stolen?  It's like Taco Bell telling me that they are out of tacos...Otherwise, the location is extremely convenient for me and there is this one female employee who goes above and beyond to keep the establishment clean and enjoyable!!  If is wasn't for her,  im not sure i'd wanna continue to frequent this location.  Please order some more 5 and 2.5lb plates.Spa needs to get it together. After 20min on the phone and being placed on hold and told she couldnt hear me cause the gym is too loud...they couldnt even book me for the massage sessions they claimed were available.  Xsport DOES tend to lack in the customer service dept :(Go there, lift, and get the heck out!

7.description: I like this gym,  granted it doesn't have a pool but there are plenty of new machines and it doesn't feel like it's overloaded with machines like the other locations. I can walk without tripping on someone using that space to exercise. The customer service here has been great so far compared to the other locations.  The parking lot is small but I tend to go in the weekends and have always find parking.

49.description: As Kevin said, this gym is beautiful. Parking is pretty difficult though. The first time I came here they set me up with a free personal training session. I showed up at the scheduled time and the guy they have scheduled me with never showed up. Someone else trained me though and it was a great session. I think the person I was supposed to meet with was the personal training manager too.We scheduled another training session and again I showed up, and he didn't. This time no one else offered to train me instead and no one scheduled me for another appointment. Unfortunately, I have 4 personal training sessions left so I'm going to use them, but so far I'm pretty disappointed. It seems that no one there cares if the personal trainers are actually showing up on time.

40.description: There is only one squat rack which is always occupied with people not doing squats.  Parking is terrible.  Full of personal trainers but no helpful staff.

30.description: I love this gym! Its closer to home and an easy drive to after work. It's cleaner, it has newer machines, the staff at the front desk compared to other locations are way more friendlier and welcoming. :) They always always acknowledge you and do not give you the "cold shoulder".You can tell that the peops that work here do not just "grab your keys to swipe you in" ....they greet you each time with a smile and wish you a good workout!  :) that's awesome! Sometimes you need to hear things like that! For the few trainers I've spoken with-  They have given me nothing but great solid advice on workout tips and helping me find the right supplements for my set of goals etc.. Overall great service in my eyes. It feels good knowing that they are approachable and not just there to be there. A big plus is the motivation I get from going here. Seeing how passionate and involved some of the trainers are while working out with their clients during training sessions are awesome too! Seeing this re-inspires me to push a bit harder and to do the same! So this is what they have:*a private parking lot, but with it's growing popularity.. The lot tends to get full pretty fast. I noticed the busiest times at the gym are 4pm-9pm (Mon-Fri) and any time before there's a class. * spa, tanning & massage, child care services, complementary wallet lockers, lockers, showers, a studio (free classes) some you'll have to sign up for, an outdoor parking lot, street parking* a new coffeehouse next door*Portage park across the street, and so many conveniences nearby , some stores include a jewel osco, Walgreens, chase bank etc.. So it makes running errands on the weekends and getting  a workout in that much easier! The only thing I wish that they had more of was space.  It would be cool if they added a few more Squat racks & smith machines since it's so hard calling dibs with all the big dudes surrounding it! Lol oh and it would be great if they made their (rowing machines)  readily available to (All) xsport members instead of keeping it locked up for the private xfit training session peops. The row machine would be wonderful start hint hint!;) Anywhoo this is my fave location out of all the others I've been to. I'll definitely come back and revisit.. Cuz I want future muscles! Boom!;)

46.description: Its a new gym in the neighborhood.  Nice layout and equipment.  They advertise $9.95 with no commiment.  Which is kind of misleading.  They actually charge a $39 enrollment fee, plus a reoccuring annual fee of $49.   When you join, you need to pay the enrollment fee plus the first and last month fee.  Then the second the month you pay the second months fee plus the annual service fee.  So by the second month, you paid $117.85 (9.95+9,95+9.95+39+49).  I just wish they would be upfront in their advertising and say there is an upfront expense.

1.description: Always a friendly greeting at the front desk and an overall nice atmosphere. Everything is well kept and machines are top notch! The gym is laid out nicely with wide enough aisles and a decent amount of space in between machines. I cannot say this about the location closer to me that I pass on the way here.When I first joined, I had quite a bit of time off in between construction projects. Coming here for a workout, then crossing the street and walking a couple laps around Portage Park has been a great workout! I go home feeling great every time!Another highlight of my time here was taking my first Yoga class led by Tey P. a couple years ago. She is a great and very dedicated instructor! Still hoping to see her name come back up for something that fits into my current schedule!

9.description: This is the cleanest xsport! I normally avoid big name gyms because I can't stand the crowds and dirty feel however this gym is honestly clean. There is always someone on their cleaning staff working hard to clean the machines, floor, doors, etc! Way to go!!The gym definitely gets crowded at night and someone's the Dumbbells get a little messy but if you go in the morning like I do then you'll never have trouble using the equipment you want.The staff is nice too, they usually know my name even though I generally keep to myself. I only pay $9.99/month and definitely feel it's worth it.

26.description: The problem: parking. When we signed up, the manager stated that the parking lot will have an entrance ramp so only members will be able to park there. A year later and the parking lot is free for all and I see other people, non-members park there. Ridiculous.  Also, the parking spots are too narrow. You know that your car will get hit by some jerk who opens his door carelessly. It's inevitable.  The gym is OVERCROWDED already and they're STILL desperately advertising.  The service desk is usually overstaffed. Too many people sitting there, doing nothing but socializing. The music is always too loud. I don't mind techno, pop or whatever they play there but this is a Gym, not the club. Turn it down!!!!   The gym members are mostly alright. Some are trash who don't even bother to turn the TV off on the treadmill when they're done using it. The only saving grace is that equipment is new or maybe not so new by now.

25.description: Too small and it's almost always packed (unless you get there super early). I like the elliptical and sometimes they were all being used. Parking lot can be packed as well. I've had to park on the street.

12.description: I have enjoyed my membership at X Sport at 5515 W Irving Park, and only ran into some difficulty today, October 1, 2015, when I needed to cancel due to moving out of state. Manager Jesse Silba helped me by calling Betty at corporate. No written confirmation of cancellation yet, but when it goes through, I will be even more grateful.

21.description: I give the gym 4 stars, parking lot would get 1 star and the child care would get a 5. Lori is wonderful with my kids and I trust that she will make sure that my kids are safe and watched. The gym is a gym. The morning cleaning staff keeps the place clean and the employees at the desk are friendly.

17.description: I've been a member of the Xsport family for over a decade.  that means ive been a paying customer for over 10 years!!  For the most part, im very pleased with the facilities that are provided for us.  However,  this Portage Park location is being neglected now that the money is pouring in.  A previous comment was made about a door flapping in the wind...lol!  It still hasn't been fixed.  The snow removal is kind of slipshod as well.   My issue, that i wanna comment on,  is that ive been formally requesting more 5lb and 2.5lb barbell weights for two months now.  Just two days ago, i was actually told, "since you are the only one requesting the equipment, corporate has not given the approval to give us more weights."  Now, i think that's ironic and not funny at all!!  What kind of weight room doesn't replenish the weights when they are lost or stolen?  It's like Taco Bell telling me that they are out of tacos...Otherwise, the location is extremely convenient for me and there is this one female employee who goes above and beyond to keep the establishment clean and enjoyable!!  If is wasn't for her,  im not sure i'd wanna continue to frequent this location.  Please order some more 5 and 2.5lb plates.Spa needs to get it together. After 20min on the phone and being placed on hold and told she couldnt hear me cause the gym is too loud...they couldnt even book me for the massage sessions they claimed were available.  Xsport DOES tend to lack in the customer service dept :(Go there, lift, and get the heck out!

10.description: I've been a member of XSport for the past three years. I've frequented several of their locations, both express and full service. The company and what they have to offer is great. With that being said...DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AT THE PORTAGE PARK LOCATION. Parking is sparse, there's only one of each piece of equipment (the Barrington express has at least two of everything, as does the Elmhurst express), and the staff is incompetent.  If you go by yourself, the personal trainers see you as a potential personal training client (I already train with a trainer at the Piper's Alley location). But if you go with someone else and the other person decides that they won't be able to get their workout in because the place is so busy and would rather just keep you company instead and to help you make sure your form is right (new workout routine and they make you sign a waiver to make sure you don't sue them if you get hurt) - God forbid.Carlos, the fitness manager, is not trained enough to recognize the difference between training someone and someone checking your form. Odd, considering he's supposed to be the manager for all of the personal trainers in the location (this says a lot about the type of training that occurs at this location). But now I understand why his trainers think it's OK to bother people who are running on a treadmill by themselves.  Upon going to talk to the general manager, my fiancé was greeted with "Oh, you're the guy who's training people". That's prime customer service when you're going to explain what happened. There was no apology, only a lecture and further accusations.  What happened to the days where customer is always right?On top of all of this, the front desk staff uses no discretion when talking about you behind your back and anybody with half a brain can spot it. Moral of the story: don't waste your time at this location until management is trained to do their jobs, the trainers are taught how to not interrupt your workouts and the front desk is put through customer service training.

5.description: Although an Xpress, I do like this location!The ellipticals and treadmills have TVs with plentiful music stations, which so fits my bill. It's a pretty clean location. I have attended a class with Berto once. It was an awesome friendly vibe. I definitely feel welcomed at this location every time ago. No muss. No fuss. Just fitness.The parking is the only thing that isn't ideal, requiring a short walk across one street (which may deter people who like to workout real late at night, or if the weather is real bad). The spots are also pretty densely painted, and the parking lot isn't well lit. As a woman, and one who works out random hours, safety is kinda important.

3.description: Another terrible location. It seems this company can't stop hiring the worst types of people. The gym is in constant decay. They're are weights and bottles everywhere. The only way to get anything done here is to call corporate.

35.description: Beyond annoyed with this gym! They are so unprofessional!!!! They even left my account in overdraft, which the prior month I was charged extra. I called the same day I saw my bank statements and was promised credit for that month. Instead they charged me again. So I go and bring all my receipts and they didn't bother to give me my money back or pay overdraft fees to my account (which was their fault it happened), but promised another credit that doesn't kick in till 45 days. How is it credit, but I'm still being charged.

19.description: I love this gym! Its closer to home and an easy drive to after work. It's cleaner, it has newer machines, the staff at the front desk compared to other locations are way more friendlier and welcoming. :) They always always acknowledge you and do not give you the "cold shoulder".You can tell that the peops that work here do not just "grab your keys to swipe you in" ....they greet you each time with a smile and wish you a good workout!  :) that's awesome! Sometimes you need to hear things like that! For the few trainers I've spoken with-  They have given me nothing but great solid advice on workout tips and helping me find the right supplements for my set of goals etc.. Overall great service in my eyes. It feels good knowing that they are approachable and not just there to be there. A big plus is the motivation I get from going here. Seeing how passionate and involved some of the trainers are while working out with their clients during training sessions are awesome too! Seeing this re-inspires me to push a bit harder and to do the same! So this is what they have:*a private parking lot, but with it's growing popularity.. The lot tends to get full pretty fast. I noticed the busiest times at the gym are 4pm-9pm (Mon-Fri) and any time before there's a class. * spa, tanning & massage, child care services, complementary wallet lockers, lockers, showers, a studio (free classes) some you'll have to sign up for, an outdoor parking lot, street parking* a new coffeehouse next door*Portage park across the street, and so many conveniences nearby , some stores include a jewel osco, Walgreens, chase bank etc.. So it makes running errands on the weekends and getting  a workout in that much easier! The only thing I wish that they had more of was space.  It would be cool if they added a few more Squat racks & smith machines since it's so hard calling dibs with all the big dudes surrounding it! Lol oh and it would be great if they made their (rowing machines)  readily available to (All) xsport members instead of keeping it locked up for the private xfit training session peops. The row machine would be wonderful start hint hint!;) Anywhoo this is my fave location out of all the others I've been to. I'll definitely come back and revisit.. Cuz I want future muscles! Boom!;)

28.description: I love that the gym is close to my home but you need to be careful of parking in the lot. There is a person or group of individuals that is targeting the parking lot and they are breaking windows and stealing whatever they find. The staff wasn't that helpful when it occurred to me in October/2013. I have seen on their facebook page that it is continuing to happen to patrons. Be careful!

45.description: I'm not going to get overly excited about this particular XSport since...well......it's an XSport gym. However, I will say its a lot better than any of the "express" gyms that this franchise offers. PROS:-clean-equipment is new-treadmills are in working order-spacious-smells nice-good ventilation-nice employeesCONS:-small-not a large variety of free weights-crowded (at certain times much like every other gym, but the size of this place makes it seem more crowded than usual)-no sauna-a certain section of the gym is off limits, unless you sign-up for a fitness class-parking lot is smallSo yeah, those are my points. All in all, it's a fairly decent environment to workout in, just make sure you go to do work and not socialize (which I see often at other "globo" gyms).

33.description: Good location, ok parking(gets crowded around 5-9PM), most of the group classes are great! way too many personal trainers and selling stuff walking around! Sell people trying way to hard to sell membership! Selling point for me: Kids Area! The greatest stuff watching kids (especially Lori).

43.description: Its not close to my home, but decided to join since it was on the way to and from work. The gym is nice in there, and went as a buddy to try it out. First of all they made you sit and talk to a trainer so you get enrolled, because they won't let you do anything until you do. Which took an hour, so much for trying the gym out. So i joined. Ends up you need a mandatory orientation session with a trainer. They guy they set me up didn't even bother seeing me, which was the manager trainer and decided to attend some one else WTF?! So, someone offered to do it. He was good but the prices are to expensive. When i signed up they said i had unlimited access to any gyms. I end up going to a different Gym because of the classes. Wrong! I only have access to the Xpress ones, If I would have known I wouldn't even sign up for it. So I called the gym this gym and if you want to do the upgrade you have to come in to sign up for it and pay it. Seriously. Service is the messed up. I don't think this place is going to last. It's  always overcrowded and they are still remodeling. They should have finished it then opened it, not in between. But i must say i love the Zumba Instructor Victor. Had so much fun.

2.description: Ok gym for the price. I pay about 20 bucks for my membership and I have access to all its amenities. They have a small cardio section with stairmasters and other cardio machines. One of the stairmasters was out of order so I hope thats not a regular thing. There is also a studio for stretching and classes. I come here in the in the evening and I dont have a problem getting in a good work out.

18.description: Yeah, I don't get all of the negative reviews either.  I signed up here last year and I think it's an incredible value for the money.  I've never had an issue with getting a machine, I've always found the staff to be pleasant, and it's always been clean.  I took away one star because I think the parking lot situation could be handled a little better.

41.description: bike class lady was beyond rude...just tryna get a gym mat to do some sit-ups lady...staff here blows and there is no steam/sauna.

52.description: Wow! So happy they opened up this location finally. Everything is brand new and it is so clean. Let's keep it that way folks! The stairmasters are great-the track moves smoothly and you can hook up your IPod or phone to the machine. They also have 2 spin bikes fitted with video screens so you can either have a video instructor take you through the course or create your own. The weight machines are all great. There is one group fitness room that also houses the new spin bikes. I'm looking forward to trying out some of the classes in the next few weeks. The air circulation also seems like it's working properly unlike in some of the other locations. It wasn't too busy at the time I went (sat afternoon) so I'm not sure how busy it is during the afternoon weekday rush. The gym also has Wi-Fi and there is pretty big parking lot  and a lot of street parking available. Since it used to be a car dealership, the front of the building is all windows so you can look out onto Portage Park.I subtracted a star because I think there could be a few more cleaning stations on the West Side (free weight) side of the gym by the stairmasters-one could fit directly next to them. Let's hope the clients and the management keep this location great and clean!

50.description: My partner and I signed up several months before they opened and were told that they would open in early January. I am happy that the gym finally opened (mid-March). A couple of days ago, they had "guest appreciation day" but it felt more like a carnival. I could not wait to leave. The DJ was a horrible idea. The music was way too loud and he kept promoting himself. I understand that they are new and are trying to get new clients but having the "carnival" day will not make me go and promote the gym to friends. If I wanted a DJ blasting the music, I would go to a dance club!!!The gym itself is very nice and clean. The men locker room is very clean. I wish they had a steam room. I love the machines that they have...very modern. The staff appear somewhat rude and not very friendly and far from professional. I am not asking to be greeted at the door when I walk in but at least pretend that you care and smile. If the gym wants to appreciate their customers/guests, try retraining the staff (specially the managers) on being a little more polite. Where is the customer service component?  Perhaps the staff were not required to go through any type of training. Perhaps having bad managers/supervisors brings down the moral. But come on, the gym is brand new... shouldn't the staff show excitement and be courteous to the guests? Without guests/customers, they wouldn't have a job. Overall, I am very happy that they opened as I stated before. I hope that the staff become a little more "customer conscious", that guests keep the gym clean, and please....no more DJs.

4.description: Kelly Cartwright says she will email us to resolve the issue, however never follows through. This is such a joke. What's the point of this persons job?

6.description: I was an xsport costumer for close to 2years. Even though,there have been q number of things that I haven't been pleased with xsport. It offered the convenience and was a better option than other gyms around. I left xsport for a few months because I was out of state. So today I returned to sign for a new membership. I went in, the girl greeted me politely and gave me the form to sign. She told me to go and sit in front of another guy who would take care of me. I go greeted him,barely got a hi back. I was filling the form,while he was so busy in the computer. I was thinking what could be more important for a sales guy than taking care of the costumer who literally walked up to him ready to give his money away.I finished my form, while he continued to ignore the fact that I was there. This was sad and funny at the same time.fort the first time I was't getting bothered by a sales guy. Instead I was completely ignored. I went to the girl in the front desk and asked if there was someone else to enroll me. She called the guy, he turned told me that he will be right back with me and turned back to his computer. I told the girl that I changed my mind and walked out. That's how easy a company loses money when you hire the wrong people and don't train them properly.

22.description: I don't get all the bad reviews! Maybe it's that there are no towels? The locker room is a good size for an express location and I think the gym is really nice. Yes, if you have only one machine you will use and refuse to try any others there is a chance that sometimes all of those machines will be taken. But I have never, even at peak times, had an issue with finding a machine! And sure the parking lot can get crowded but there is always street parking. I also really like that they have wi-fi, which is a rarity for an express. I feel like if they had a pool this would be my ideal Xsport!

15.description: The front desk staff is actually really helpful and friendly, which is super surprising for an XSport. I've always been able to find a parking spot either in the small lot or on the street. The X-IT instructors are great and the locker rooms are clean. An additional plus is that they're aren't as many meatheads watching you workout!

20.description: Yeah, I don't get all of the negative reviews either.  I signed up here last year and I think it's an incredible value for the money.  I've never had an issue with getting a machine, I've always found the staff to be pleasant, and it's always been clean.  I took away one star because I think the parking lot situation could be handled a little better.

36.description: So I went to this gym today just to try it out. I can go to any Xsport with my membership and I try to work out at different Xsports.Whoa! No towels, not a biggie. Locker room the size of a studio apartment is bad. The staff here all need to be replaced. Front desk is especially bad. I bought a protein shake and they rudely asked for the change portion. Not "we are out of change,  can you help us out," I got "YOU DON'T HAVE 11 CENTS!"  I asked someone on the floor for the drinking fountain and was told "somewhere over there. "There is much competition,  take care of the people you have.

14.description: I was given a follow up about my review. Thank you for caring about your customers. I understand sometimes people have rough days. All I ask is that if a customer asks a simple question to just help them.

1.description: Came in here a couple of weeks ago. This place is dirty & sticky/dusty. I didn't have such a big problem with that but the customer service was garage. I mispronounced a craft beer name & the cashier proceeded to treat me like an idiot. That was the last time I shop there.
