2.description: I have been getting booze and smokes here since I was 12.The prices and service is good.Plus they have a friendly cat that roams around the store as you shop.

0.description: As far as I've known, my family have never willingly sold alcohol and beer to anyone under 21, don't need any more CPD sting operations than necessary here. Yes, I have somewhat of a bias because my family runs the store, but the bottom line is the store is packed with a bunch of spirits and wine, has its specialized selection in polish beer, and they run a business harder than anybody I know (then again, I don't know that many people who work 13 hours mon-thu, 14 hour fri-sat).

58.description: By far the bestest subs around!  I personally love the turkey, but my recommendation is to get them to add the dressing as they usually don't put it on the turkey for some reason. Plus they have Green River Soda from the fountain!!!  Yummm

56.description: Honestly don't know how we missed out on the wonderful meals others on the site have experienced. I like a good sub as much as the next guy, but this was not really close to the best I've had. Costello's has these guys hands down on bread and sandwich filler combinations.The service was not great. I was treated to short, curt questions and my son to sidelong looks. It wasn't until I went to pay that I was told it was cash only, and the ATM in the restaurant was a ganky affair. Why is it that I'm printing out a receipt for them to pull cash from THEIR drawer in order to withdraw money from MY account? And why would you force the customer to do that when you could have set up the key pad/card swipe right there at the checkout?In any case, I'd be able to forgive them this if A) they didn't get my order wrong and B) the meal was better than mildly adequate. If you want a sub either travel over to the Brickyard and get a Jimmy Johns or take the drive over to Lincoln Square and pick up Costello's.

29.description: bob o rinos was my grammar school joint, food is not the worst/best and the best drink they have to my liking is called, green river lol

42.description: This place is solid! I lived a bock away grew up in the neighborhood and been coming here since I was ten. The subs are excellent! I get the American or Italian and they've always Been great. They're soups are good too they have chili but its seasonal. The cheese fries are the bomb! It's definitely a neighborhood staple and I hope it stays that way.

23.description: This place is aaaaaammmmaaaazing! We use to drop in for subs weekly, but sadly we moved to the burbs.  This will probably be the only time I say this.....sitting in hair pulling traffic is completely worth it, once I'm sinking my teeth into one of these fabulous subs.We've always had a wonderful experience... staff has always been very friendly, line moves very quick, food is always very fresh and tasty. We believe they are priced pretty darn well, especially given the amount of food you receive.  Honestly, you cannot go wrong with any of their subs. Bread is always very soft, meats, and cheese is always freshly cut, including all of the veggie fixings. We are huge fans if their homemade coleslaw. Yum Yum (My mouth is watering as I sit here writing the review) A hidden gem.

47.description: Great Subs and service! I am really not a sub guy but Bob-0-Rino subs are delicious. I stop in quite a bit during dinner break at work.

8.description: I have been going here for years.  The food is good and the prices are right.  The staff is sometimes not the friendliest but they are always professional.  The family has visited Bob-O-Rinos at least 100 times over the years and our order has always been correct and our food great.

31.description: I love Bob-O-Rinos Been coming here since the 80's would love to go there for lunch when i went to school across the street as far as the food would i say its the best? no but its solid all across the board

34.description: good sub, had the American. the oil and spices make the sub.

16.description: Been coming to this place for years. Have had just about every sandwich but my all time fav is the Turkey Bacon panini with a bowl of chili.  I will post pictures soon

13.description: I've lived in the neighborhood practically all of my life and I just started going to Bob-O-Rinos about two months ago.  Not sure why... just never thought of it.  I'm glad it finally crossed my mind (mostly because I saw it on TV) because I'm tired of the Subway and Potbelly sandwiches already.  I like old school original subs.  I like the subs here.  The fries are good too.  My son likes the paninis.  I only wish they were open a little later.  Regardless, this is definitely a great option when you're in the mood for a really good sandwich.

11.description: They open at 10am! So perfect when you've got morning errands and can stop for a sammie to go for later!I loved the sandwiches I tried here. Lunch was so good, I came back another time for a dinner sandwich!  I tried the Italian Sub (small) which was probably a 9 inch sub and was so filling! Cotto salami, capicola, pepperoni, ham, provolone cheese and Italian dressing. The ingredients were fresh and it's made to order. I would have liked more Italian dressing, but that's just me. Dinner sammie was a Roast Beef on a Roll. Also a good portion size filled with lean Roast Beef, lettuce, tomato and mayo.  It was tasty and all ingredients fresh as well. Next time I'd ask them to go easy on the mayo as I felt there was just too much of it, but otherwise a solid sam.Service was nice. The digs are totally dated cafeteria style but clean. Other than subs and deli sams the menu lists paninis, other hot sams and sides like fries/chips/cole slaw. I'd probably order an extra pickle the next time I stop in too. Yum.

39.description: This place is like a Mr Submarine, its a family owned vs the other sub options.  Got the Turkey Ham sub, it was topped with American cheese and fresh veggies on good bread.  I dont think the cheese choices were advertised but I'm told you can have your choice of various cheese,They also serve RC Cola, wow cant remember when I had that last and yeah I know why now.  Overall impression was it was a good place but nothing that different to have me go out of the way to go to seeing its kind of far from my place.

37.description: Bob-O-Rino's is SO good! I have been coming here for 25 years! The people are so nice, it is clean, and ordering is easy. Let's talk about the food. These sandwiches on average are between $4-$6. The sandwich is LOADED with great FRESH toppings. You have the option to add more meat and cheese if you so desire for an additional cost. My favorite is the Ham and Cheese - Beautiful French Bread with ham, cheese, lettuce, onion, tomato, green peppers, pickles and a tangy sauce. YUM! I will recommend the fries to go with it.  I love it here! Don't miss out it is worth the trip. Buy 2 and put one in the fridge for when you crave it in the middle of the night...Bet ya will!

0.description: Best subs in Chicago hands down bar none!!!! Love the Turkey sub and a green river to drink it down with! Mmmmm... Getting hungry now thinking about it!

38.description: I went twice. Had the cheesy beef and turkey sub on second trip.  Good service, but food just not that great for Chicago standards.

51.description: This is a good sub. Not great, not wow I need another one right now, not I'm gonna write paragraphs about its glory, but good. Fresh bread, with a little crust - nice. Ingredients? Not made in house or anything too fancy, but good. Ambience? Sub shop. Its clean.I had the Italian, which is a pretty good canary in the coalmine of the subshop. If they blow that one, they're lost. They don't. The dressing is a little on the sweet side, and the tomatoes, like most sliced tomatoes in town, are lamentable in their annoying necessity, but they didn't kill the thing for me. They supply the wet, I guess.Sides are iffy. Fries? eh. Chips? Plain or BBQ? That's, well, ok. Royal Crown Cola. I ca live with that. In short, no need to drive over from Lakeview just to try this place. If you're in portage park, go fot it.

27.description: First time trying this place and well I'm highly impressed. I ordered a turkey breast deli sandwich(wheat bread) with cheese(55¢ extra) and an order of fries and let me tell you..IT WAS DELICIOUS. My sandwich was stacked with the perfect amount of turkey, lettuce, tomato, mayo, etc. and the fries were delicious with the right amount of salt(I don't like my fries too salty). The staff were also very friendly. Definitely going back.

32.description: LOVE the subs! The subs are the best around!! Just wished the people packing orders would double check to make sure everything is in there. Just picked up an order from them and they left things out. It wouldn't be such a problem if I didn't live far from them, but I do. This isn't the first time so I should've made sure but now my dinner is ruined because they don't deliver and by the time I get back there, everything would be cold. From now on, they should pay me to pack my own dinner.

54.description: Went based on word of mouth and was not supper impressed. If there were halves stars this would be a 3 1/2 for me. First it is better then subway and most other place around the area. But it does not compare to Bari and I still think Heros is better although somewhat similar. The cash only thing bother me a bit considering they have a very nice register system and they could take cards if they wanted to. Overall not bad but not worth going out of my way to get it.

48.description: good subs...but nothing out of the ordinary.  It is similar to Submarine Tender in Forest Park.  They were under construction during my visit.  So the place was a little underwhelming, but not a bad value for a large deli sandwich.

44.description: Bob-O-Rinos has the best subs. The meat is fresh & the sandwich is full of flavor. The prices are inexpensive (especially for how much you get). Much better than other sandwich chains such as Potbelly's or Jimmy John's. Try it out!

24.description: Subs are pretty good, but the customer service is not. Our lunch order is almost always missing an item, or messed up one way or another. The older man (manager or owner) is pretty rude, & I've seen him talk down to his employees- which put me off. Hate to see that happen, even if they are making some mistakes.

7.description: bob-o-rinos makes the best sub sandwiches in the city. their bread is spot on. i usually either get the turkey or the italian sub. always made well and with care. their soups are also homemade and delicious. service is always friendly and caring. thank you. try this place and you will be a lifetime fan.

49.description: Best sandwiches in Chicago! If you're looking for good sub that's not pretentious this is the place. They also have the best homemade soups and chili, but the Italian with everything is my favorite. Prices are reasonable, and the foods always good.

40.description: A large Italian with extra dressing & fries would be a candidate for my death row meal.  You can't go wrong with any of their subs.

53.description: Before Subway was making Jared skinny...before Jimmy John was giving out free smells...before Quiznos was toasting subs...there was Bob-O-Rinos!!!This place just makes a yummy sub...there is no promise of losing weight...no promise of sniffing the sandwich...no promise of making it warm...you order it and get it!!!  Isn't that what a sandwich is?Everything is really fresh here from the bread to the meat to the veggies on the sandwich.  This place is just a straight up sandwich place without all of the gimicks that all of the other sandwich places have come up with.I must mention that the staff is not very friendly here...in fact they scare me a little.  I am totally about customer service but I realize that this place must train its employees to be mean. It is kind of like vising Pat's in Phillhy for a CheeseSteak...you better know how to order it or you are banished to the back of the line. You are lucky because this place does not have a line going out the door.  You can screw up but you are not penalized for it.If you stop in you will find a yummy sandwich!!!  Trust me you will be happy you did!!!

30.description: This place has the best subs hands down! Everything is always fresh and tastes great.  Subs are large and can easily be two meals. The soups are fresh every day and the fries are great. My go to meal is the American sub with extra pickles and fries. I usually ask for easy oil because sometimes the subs get greasy if they add too much oil.

46.description: Good, but nothing to put it over the top.As a previous reviewer stated, it's good, just not great.Yea, it's better than the chains, but their prices aren't any better, and the bread I had on a Tuesday, seemed like it was delivered last Friday.Parking is decent, the place was clean with plenty of room, service was fast, but the sandwich was just average.

1.description: Rosa J. may not be a typical "all-American" girl, but she certainly likes all-American food. Bob-O-Rinos is located on Central Ave. (accessible via CTA #85 bus) in Portage Park, near the Community First Medical Center.  It has an ample parking, old-schooled comfy booths and cafeteria chairs, and simple yet delicious sandwiches and panini.  For $20.86, Rosa J., Daddy J., and Mama J. were able to get two (2) small American subs, one (1) corned beef & Swiss panini, two (2) small Green River fountain pops, and one (1) order of coffee.  You better believe that living in a blue-collar lifestyle rocks because that's what we call "great lunch!"  Did I mention that they serve RC cola?  Daddy J. told me that drinking the RC cola was a luxury in the past back in Taiwan in the 60s and 70s.  However, now it's definitely nostalgic.  It's funny to see how everything has changed over time...There's a restroom behind the kitchen through the employee entrance.  I would say BOR is clean, low-key, and relaxing place to be for a quick meal.  Lately I've been back and forth to the Portage Park area frequently to look at some properties I've been interested in, so I will keep Bob-O-Rinos in mind when "Mr. Hunger" rings my doorbell.

55.description: 1.  Decent subs but nothing spectacular.2.  They do not take credit cards.. CASH only. 3.  Typical teenagers working there with shitty attitudes who could care less about you and your sandwich. 4.  They have crazy hours and are never open at normal times. If you are at the hospital or in the hood and want a quick sammich, it's fine.  But don't go out of your way to eat here.

9.description: The cold cuts taste like cheap solylent green and my mouth is sore from working on that the rubbery bread. The bread is the most important thing! At least the place is clean. Next time, I'm heading over to Alpine Food Shop for a proper sub.

26.description: They open at 10am! So perfect when you've got morning errands and can stop for a sammie to go for later!I loved the sandwiches I tried here. Lunch was so good, I came back another time for a dinner sandwich!  I tried the Italian Sub (small) which was probably a 9 inch sub and was so filling! Cotto salami, capicola, pepperoni, ham, provolone cheese and Italian dressing. The ingredients were fresh and it's made to order. I would have liked more Italian dressing, but that's just me. Dinner sammie was a Roast Beef on a Roll. Also a good portion size filled with lean Roast Beef, lettuce, tomato and mayo.  It was tasty and all ingredients fresh as well. Next time I'd ask them to go easy on the mayo as I felt there was just too much of it, but otherwise a solid sam.Service was nice. The digs are totally dated cafeteria style but clean. Other than subs and deli sams the menu lists paninis, other hot sams and sides like fries/chips/cole slaw. I'd probably order an extra pickle the next time I stop in too. Yum.

25.description: Whenever I want something light or on the go I come here. I enjoy the sandwiches along with soup every time!

12.description: I use to go here when I was in elementary school (almost 10 years ago) i have always ordered the same thing cheese fries ...but let me say still to this day, the cheese fries....... you get a small countaner that consists of like 10 fries and a little bit if cheese for $4.00 almost. I always enjoyed them but the price for the fries is a one star

59.description: I've been eating at Bob-o-Rinos since I was a kid and THANK goodness my parents knew the good stuff. This is my favorite place in the city for a perfectly cold afforadable sub. I'm a fan of the turkey - fresh meat, fresh lettuce, green pepper, onions and pickle, mayo, cheese! And the bread--- it MAKES the sub. YES, critics, it's chewy. I dont think it demands 5 more chews than your average bread and with it's texture and freshness, are such complaints warranted?? I think not. Only thing you need here is an appetite, cash, and a seat in the booth. After, content and a smile. Thank you, Bob-o-Rinos for being reliable and tastier than them all!

21.description: Easily my favorite sub shop in the city. I've only ever gotten the Italian Sub here, but I don't need anything else. The meat and cheese are delicious and fresh, and their dressing is perfect. The bread is the perfect balance -- not too soft, with some resistance, but not too hard to chew. My friends have raved about their meatball sub, too.Do yourself a favor and get hot peppers -- they use some really good giardiniera here, as you'd expect from any respectable Chicago restaurant.

17.description: I go there from time to time. I've only had their turkey/provolone panini, LOVE IT! My friends have had their beef sandwiches, no complaints. The staff is cool, the place is clean. Not pricey either. Great lunchtime spot.

10.description: Turkey bacon cheddar pannini. Spot on good sandwich. You guys can be a little nicer to people though. Good food!

5.description: We just bought our dinner from here. We had never tried this place, but was on our way home from our friends house.  The service was exceptional and the place was very clean. The sub and pain we ordered were great. Bigger than we expected and great price. We were given suggestions on their most popular panini. It was a great one too!! The Italian sub my love ordered was big and tasty. He saved one half for his lunch tomorrow. Great crisp whole pickle cut in 4ths. Awesome sub shop. We are considering catering for an event which they do have. You can't let your taste buds miss this. We got great customer service! !

3.description: I've been going to this place for 5 years and tonight was my last straw. When the sandwiches are made correctly, they are quite good. However, tonight, for the FIFTH DAMN TIME, the sandwich that I asked for with "no pickles" came loaded with pickles. It even says on the receipt "NO PICKLES" right under my sandwich order. My wife says she asked the woman who made the sandwich twice if there were pickles on the turkey and ham and she said "no". WTF? The killer part is that it's been different employees doing this. One guy did it three times to me and now two different employees have done it once. The other times I brought the sandwich back to get it made correctly. Today I've driven over 70 miles for work and I don't want to get back in the car. I just wanted to eat my damn sandwich. It's not worth it. I'm done with Bob-o-rino's. I never want to eat another crumb from this place. So very disappointing.

35.description: The best subs and chili. The place is very clean for a fast food place.

19.description: I'm upping my stars because the guy I talked to said they have new employees so hopefully they learn how to make the sandwiches how they are supposed to.

28.description: Love this place, have been going there for Years, on 3/28/14 I ordered a few sandwiches for the family and they forgot one of them I was ready to back pick up my sandwich and yell at someone, as soon I walked in they apologized gave me free fries and retuned my money for the sandwich. Quality food and service.

45.description: Bob-O-Rinos is one of the reasons to love the food scene in Chicago: it's authentic, delicious food, without pretension or airs that it's anything other than what it is. Also, it's been around for a good minute and it's going as strong as ever. Love it. BOR is also one of the reasons to love Yelp. Without a site like Yelp, I never would have heard of BOR, much less ventured to Portage Park to partake of its sandwich-y delights... and that would have been a shame for both of us.This is old-school Chicago at it's City-of-Big-Shoulders finest. First of all, there's a parking lot -- a decent sized one. Even though you can, likely, find parking up and down this stretch of Central, the convenience of the lot (and reality that public transit in this neighborhood is a bit more difficult than others)is certainly welcome. After you've parked, walk in and take a second to peruse the menu board. You don't need that time because the options are so vast (there's a decent selection but not overwhelmingly so). You need it because it will transport you to the past: I remember coming to places like this with my dad when I was a kid... and that's a sweet memory. After taking a moment, refocus on the reason why you're here: to pig out. I went for the Italian sub with everything. For less than $6 (!), I got a yooge sub on wonderfully chewy Italian bread packed with salami, capicola, provolone cheese, pepperoni, harm, Italian dressing, lettuce, tomato, onion, green pepper, and pickles. For.less.than.$6! You can't beat that. You can't. Because the sandwich wasn't enough (it totally was), I also ordered cheese fries: crinkly fries doused in bright-yellow cheese sauce. It ain't fancy; it's just delicious. And, to top the meal off -- and I am most excited about this -- I had the option of drinking NEHI LEMONADE (NEHI!!!!! WIN!!!1!!!) but I simply could.not.resist ordering. Splice. Yes, Splice. SPLICE!!!! I FOUND AN OFF-BRAND LEMON-LIME SODA THAT'S A COMBO OF SPRITE AND SLICE! SPLICE! SPLICE!!!111!!!! Who's ever heard of this before? It's magic. I'm convinced it's magic. And the meal was magically delicious. BOR, you're alright with me!

33.description: This place is like an institution. I've been going here for years. Still, in my opinion, the best place to go for a quick, fresh sandwhich.

43.description: As a person who grew up being called Stev-a-rino, I had a great affinity for Bob-o-Rinos from the beginning.  How can you not love the name?This place has great panini and chili, and also provides a down-to-earth environment in which to enjoy those.  My favorite type of lunch spot in Chicago.  Food with 'tude (and accents).  Example: we showed up for lunch, and about 15 Streets & Sanitation workers were hanging out inside, goofing around with each other - 6 recycling trucks parked out front.  Bob-O-Rinos: a staple of the Portage Park lunch scene.  Get there and enjoy.

2.description: I love this place, so happy it's just a couple blocks from my house.  Definitely my go-to place when I just want a sandwich...a GOOD sandwich.Service - the people behind the counter are always friendly and polite.  Greet you when you get to the counter, answer questions, etc.  Food always comes out quickly.  Never had them screw up an order.Food - Great.  I would pick this place over any of the chain sandwich shops any day.  Ingredients are fresh, bread is good.  An order of fries is big and they always come out piping hot!  My favorite is the Italian.  Lot's meat, fresh veggies and I love the italian dressing they use.  I'm going to keep coming back, I'm sure I'll eat there at least once this weekend

18.description: This place is aaaaaammmmaaaazing! We use to drop in for subs weekly, but sadly we moved to the burbs.  This will probably be the only time I say this.....sitting in hair pulling traffic is completely worth it, once I'm sinking my teeth into one of these fabulous subs.We've always had a wonderful experience... staff has always been very friendly, line moves very quick, food is always very fresh and tasty. We believe they are priced pretty darn well, especially given the amount of food you receive.  Honestly, you cannot go wrong with any of their subs. Bread is always very soft, meats, and cheese is always freshly cut, including all of the veggie fixings. We are huge fans if their homemade coleslaw. Yum Yum (My mouth is watering as I sit here writing the review) A hidden gem.

41.description: Bob-o-rinos.Although the chicken salad sandwich had won the hearts of many, the cornbeef panini grabbed my heart in San Francisco and brought it back to bob-o-rinos. I think any of their paninis are pretty good - even the tuna.Everything was perfection in this cornbeef panini!Warm Toasty affordable Not super salty p e r f e c t i o n Check out bob-o-rinos! I'm sure you won't regret it.

52.description: We stopped in here on our way to the mall (The HIP) and man was I glad we did!!! See this is the story about how we stumbled upon the most awesome of Sub shops! Just as good IF not better than "Hero's"!Yes in the middle of Polski land subs are made..........With fresh crisp bread!.......Deli cut meats and cheeses!and these suckers are flavorful! Yo gotta try these bad boys! I had the "American" big boy sub!................damn!!!!  Tasty!The dinning area is big and comfy!Shake & Bake seal of Approval!Hipster infestation level: Zero!!! They are too afraid of my Cousin Dariusz Gumkowski to travel this far NW. shhhhhhhhh dont tell them what "The Hip " means otherwise next Holiday season the mall will be filled with these wannabe artists/musicians!!

50.description: Bob-O-Rinos brings my back to my childhood days. I used to go to school right across the street and I remember going to Bob-O-Rinos after school for some cheese fries. I can't eat cheese fries as much as I used to unless I want to gain 5lbs a month. I've had various sandwiches from there and they have all been great. Why go to subway down the street when you can just come to Bob-O-Rinos and get a fresh sandwich. Non of that artificial crap they put in Subway sandwiches. They have finally stepped it up and now accept Visa/MC!!

4.description: This place has the best Italian subs. THE BEST! As a bonus, the staff is always friendly and fast. I go there often and it's always a positive experience!

6.description: I absolutely loved this place until my last two visits. The subs are amazing but what's with the females they have working here? I feel like I'm in the middle of orange is the new black.I went in a few weeks ago and the girl working at the fry warmer was chewing gum like a cow... right over the food. It was disgusting. Last week I ran in and ordered a turkey and ham sub.  While waiting for my order I noticed there was a half eaten hot dog in the fry warmer... really? Right in there with all the frys. Then when I got home I wasnt given the turkey and ham I ordered but a ham and cheese drenched in some kind of dressing. These were the best subs in the area... very disappointing

22.description: I'm upping my stars because the guy I talked to said they have new employees so hopefully they learn how to make the sandwiches how they are supposed to.

15.description: Amazing soup!!!! Especially the cream of chicken. The sandwiches are also pretty good and for a good price too! Staff is super friendly as well.

57.description: My grandma used to live a few blocks away from Bob-O-Rino's, so I've been enjoying their subs for 25+ years.  After all these years, they've remained one of my favorite sandwich shops, and when I am in the area I make it my business to stop in and pick up a sub.  My favorite is the American, and my husband's favorite is the Italian. Bob-O-Rino's subs are super fresh tasting and delicious.

20.description: Seriously folks??!?!  This is the most generic sub out there. Not one thing stands out in regards to the sub. Its a good price, Ill give it that but nothing more. The bread is very chewy (I prefer crusty), no choice of mustards or sauce and generic toppings.  Staff isnt friendly and the place isnt the cleanest. Not sure how this places gets great reviews.

36.description: Gave it another try.Bread fresh,Italian sub not to good it said salami but cannot figure out that mystery meat! Fries cold waited about 7 minutes and still was cold told counter person and he said it would be another 7-8 minutes. I know it's been there forever,but maybe a little supervision or real salami.I may give it another try for the hot sandwiches that I just read about.

14.description: Mediocre subs at best due to bland taste. The deli meats are those found at your local grocery store. You can definitely make s better sandwich at home.

12.description: I've had mani/pedis (including no-chip) here and always been happy with the results. No frills for sure, but the price is right. They have winter mani/pedi specials, and run the same special during the summer on Mon-Wed. Last I checked the price was $35. I wouldn't go here for anything but nails, but for nails they're aok.Lastly, bring cash for tip, as you can't charge it.

7.description: AMAZING!! I had Sue do my nails, No Chip, and they're absolutely perfect! I'm super critical about my nails and Sue was very precise about making sure I had no polish on my fingers or cuticles. I'm definitely going back!

20.description: Only go here if you are in a jam and need a quick mani/pedi. There is not an emphasis on detail and although the place is very clean, I still think the few times I have been there as being mediocre. If you like your eyebrows and don't want them jacked up, consider going elsewhere for your waxing needs. The staff is polite but not over accommodating, they have a limited selection of OPI and no Essie nail colors, and their regular price for mani pedi is 35 dollars; although you can go Monday thru Wednesday and get a discount for 30 dollars.

19.description: While the lady was giving me a pedicure she asked me if it was my 1st time at her nail shop. I said yes.  She asked me were I normally go. I told her and she said, " I KNOW THAT PLACE, THERE ARE TOO MANY BLACK PEOPLE IN THERE'!!!    Need I say more! By the way I am a proud mulatto!!

1.description: Been coming here since they opened. Never had a problem. Good service and everything is clean.

2.description: This place is so careless and sloppy, oh and they couldn't even do a shamrock design when they said they could. They than left all kinds of green paint still on my nails n just did a French tip over it. Then for my very quick and half a$$ pedicure they painted the big toea dark with a couple of coats but yet left the rest of my toes with like one coat. Never again. Waste of money!

9.description: This is a GREAT place to go for a no chip manicure! Sure, it'll only last a week before it starts chipping and peeling (which no-chip manicures generally don't, ya know, chip...) but these guys sure don't care! And when you go back after only a week (when they said two or three), you can also expect them to charge you to remove it! What a business! After coming in to have my nails fixed (again, after just ONE week), the owner seemed like he really couldn't care less. If he had apologized, maybe even tried to offer to fix this (it was after all, his shop's mistake), I would have been happy. But no, I guess that's just not possible. I still had to pay after they filed off the polish (perhaps its defective or old?). After I got home, I had to file my nails even further, because the girl had left them jagged.Heed this (and ALL the other warnings) and find another nail salon.

6.description: Great quality nails care My toe nails last for  8 weeks. Thanks. Will definately come back again.

18.description: New to the neighborhood and wanted to try it out.....yup, all the reviews were correct.  HORRIBLE...It should be called GhettoLand Nails.

10.description: I took my 10 year old granddaughter as a "treat".   I chose the chip free and she chose the colors.  The person who took care of her was a sweet young man.  I did not ask his name.  The manicure itself came out beautifully.  I am very pleased with the whole experience and certainly will return in the future.  Give this store a chance...

13.description: Price is alright but they do an excellent job with your manicure and pedicure.  Lasts forever and looks very pretty.  No messes at all.  I always receive compliments.

16.description: I've had good and bad experiences here depending on the tech.  After not seeing me for a while, they took better care of me when I returned.  It's close to home and I've had the same experiences at other nail shops.   My nails are natural and not acrylic.  I tend to keep them shorter for my work.  The techs have done a good job polishing my shorter nails, even with darker colors.

17.description: Only go here if you are in a jam and need a quick mani/pedi. There is not an emphasis on detail and although the place is very clean, I still think the few times I have been there as being mediocre. If you like your eyebrows and don't want them jacked up, consider going elsewhere for your waxing needs. The staff is polite but not over accommodating, they have a limited selection of OPI and no Essie nail colors, and their regular price for mani pedi is 35 dollars; although you can go Monday thru Wednesday and get a discount for 30 dollars.

15.description: Beware!!!!  I recently went in to purchase a $50.00 gift card for a friend and this morning I have a 75.00 debit on my account from Fashion Nails.   I hope there is a simple explanation for this.  However, after reading other reviews this is not the first time Fashion Nails has made a "mistake." I hope they admit fault and refund my money. Luckily, I save all my receipts.

0.description: They do a good job and will go back to fix mistakes if they need to. I usually get the basic manicure and pedicure. On Monday-Wednesday, they have a special deal for mani/pedis. It's either $32 or $34 (can't remember exactly what).It's a clean, relaxing environment.

5.description: Mai is my manicurist of choice.  She does a great job and is very nice.  The location appears clean and I've never had to wait too long.  I had my first 'no-chip' two weeks ago and they still look spectacular.

11.description: They are getting better every time I go. Went last Friday to do a regular manicure. Things I've accepted: they are going to be annoyed if you change colors or take a long time to decide. Things I love: very thorough manicurists, lasts about 5-7 days, no waiting the past 6 times I've been in (3:30-4:30 on weekdays).

8.description: My toes were done perfect--I was very happy with my pedi. My no-chip mani on the other hand was done very sloppy. She didn't cut my cuticles well enough and then I had so much polish on the sides. She wasn't too pleasant so I didn't even wanna bother asking her to fix it. When I left I was really annoyed and had to pick it all off myself. I give 3 stars cuz the facility seemed nice and clean and my pedi lady was professional.

3.description: They are good. Wish they would speak English there. Got in right away no problems  worth the money

14.description: So the owner Peter sold his shop over a year ago. I still continued to come here, but lately things have not been good.A couple of months ago they over charged my card by $10. I had to show up with my bank statement. They did issue me a refund, but it was a big inconvenience. It's been a while since I've gotten my nails done. I went to get a french gel full set. Well it's been a little over a week and my nails look like crap. They don't look shiny like gel is suppose to look. I think they used acrylic and not gel. The white nail polish is starting to bubble.The salon is very inconsistent now. I need to find a new nail salon =/

4.description: I am quite disappointed in this establishment. My 25 year old daughter who is cognitively delayed and physically disabled was treated terribly here. When her personal care attendant took her to get her nails done the staff actually debated in front of them on who would take her. A business is suppose to serve no matter race, ethnic background, or disability! They should be ashamed of themselves!

1.description: I love this Chipotle branch!!! Awesome service fresh food! There's one employee I love the most. Kat has a ready smile and SUPER energy! I come in tired, and as soon as I enter I hear her energetic greeting and an infectious smile. I'll definitely keep coming back here.

9.description: Parking is no good. Its like 8 spots. This what this area needed. The parking sucks. Think the lines are never long because of this. Its clean

12.description: Just moved to the area. Love Chipotle but not this one and won't be coming back. I eat at Chipotle enough to know when the food is right or bad (sadly). But nothing here was fresh at all!!! They were so stingy with their steak meat so I asked for extra and was okay with paying for it. Extra to them was half a spoon! Their limes are horrible and dry like they have been sitting out for days. Rice is watery and the meat is toooo greasy. I have never bit into a burrito from Chipotle and had grease running down my hand YUCK!

21.description: I went in today with my three kids. It's their first day open and I'm delighted to have them nearby. The service was decent. Less confusing than opening day often is. They were out of chocolate milk but that's probably a good thing. One of the staff helped being our food to the table because I had four meals and two hands. Thanks!The food was as I expected. Textbook Chipotle. This is my new place to go when I can't face cooking. No more crappy McDonald's for the kids.

16.description: I went in today with my three kids. It's their first day open and I'm delighted to have them nearby. The service was decent. Less confusing than opening day often is. They were out of chocolate milk but that's probably a good thing. One of the staff helped being our food to the table because I had four meals and two hands. Thanks!The food was as I expected. Textbook Chipotle. This is my new place to go when I can't face cooking. No more crappy McDonald's for the kids.

17.description: Every time (6) I go in this location only 2 employees are worked mg the bar. They need to be trained by the Addison Ave. location.

10.description: Ooooo I cannot wait to order lunch here again!! I love that this area is increasing buisness and adding  new stores all the time! Chipotle  your casarito Is amazing. Maybe tomorrow I'll get a burrito bowl. Mouth is watering as I type.

5.description: While the food is tasty and is a great alternative to grabbing a bag of corn chips or a handful of chocolate almonds from my "teacher cabinet" before I leave for the trip home from school; the service is..., I'm not feeling the love, sort of. The servers are pleasant however seem to be distracted and seem to be yet feeling each other out as in awkward dance partners. I realize this is a new Chipotle's; in that it was just built, so  there's a new staff, learning how to work as a team - but they aren't in syncStill, every time I go they do jump through the various hoops that I put up with my order of three flour tacos, individually wrapped and placed in their taco smasher thingy to melt the cheese. Their hot sauce is a bit salty, which I will skip next time, but otherwise everything is good. They are busy, so this is good. They also may want to consider not having - different blaring music in the back, conflicting with the "lobby" area music going at the same time - another out of sync item, but they are young and they will learn.

11.description: This location has not impressed me. It's a new chip, recently opened. The staff are mediocre, some of them are nice, some of them look like they hate their jobs. The biggest issue is the portion control. They skimp, hard.Depending on who you get, you will more than likely get the smallest portion of chipotle you will ever receive. Which I never thought I would say because.. it's chipotle. I frequent a location downtown river north that is AWESOME. This place needs to step it up.

3.description: New location woo woo! This is a nice spot for this new chipotle. Staff was friendly and helpful. You could tell this just opened as everything looks brand new and the employees are fresh off their training.  This is a great addition to the walking friendly six corners area. Make sure you get your burrito double wrapped.

0.description: This location has the smallest parking lot you can imagine. I've been to quite a few locations of this restaurant, this location has least enthusiastic workers. They food is still good, although there are always short on the brown rice.

20.description: New location woo woo! This is a nice spot for this new chipotle. Staff was friendly and helpful. You could tell this just opened as everything looks brand new and the employees are fresh off their training.  This is a great addition to the walking friendly six corners area. Make sure you get your burrito double wrapped.

19.description: This is a fairly new chipotle in the area. I've been to this location several times and after the first visit I should've known not to return, but I kept giving the staff another chance for improvement but it seems like their customer service keeps getting worse. The service is poor & no friendly smiles, not even a "hello". Staff doesn't move fast enough and the line accumulates to the point that by the time you get your food your lunch is over. I will not be returning to this location. As far as the food goes it meets lower standards compared to the other Chipotle locations.

2.description: No brown rice. No sour cream. Chewy fatty steak. six people in line. six employees standing around.

18.description: Woohooo!! CHIPOTLE in the area! Awesome to have one so close to our home! been here almost everyday! Staff members are very cheerful and friendly! food is amazing like always very fresh! so happy to have one in our area!!! -Martha

13.description: Best Chipotle!  Staff is nice and efficient.  Food is consistent and fresh. The place itself is a bit smaller but clean. The only con is the parking lot only fits maybe 8 vehicles. Glad we can come here every week and not worry if it's a hit or miss.

4.description: SLOW SERVICE. I waited in the car while my husband went inside to get food. There were 4 people in front of him, but he was stuck in there for over 15 minutes (we ordered two bowls). According to him, there was literally only one person doing everything behind the counter the entire time. He also said employees were celebrating a birthday in the back or something. From my view from the car in the parking lot, there were 3-4 employees out by the dumpster for a fair amount of time. May have been a shift change, but due to the super slow service inside seemed really unprofessional. Also, they totally skimped on chips. Really not impressed with this location and will probably just go over to the location on Harlem next time.

6.description: I use to be a frequent Chipotle visitor, like 3 times a week! Until the experience just wasn't there anymore - the green salsa was always frozen, my rice came out different every time, and the cilantro stopped looking green. The worst part was the people, they just didn't seem to like their job anymore. Sad to say I haven't had Chipotle in almost a month, until the cilantro lime rice was calling my name (4/29) and I'm so happy I gave in. From the moment I walked in the door I felt good vibes. I was greeted immediately, which is nice but not a must. It was obviously pretty busy, but I could tell they were working as a team to get the job done. Little things I noticed in their communications and politely keeping me updated. To say the least it was the best Chipotle experience I've had since moving to Chicago 2 years ago. Kudos to Wednesday evening crew on 4/29! Another bonus, the bathrooms were very clean!!!

15.description: Really?  I am not hard of hearing and I don't usually eat out alone.  I would LOVE to have a conversation with my dining partner without saying "WHAT?" "  I CAN'T hear you"  throughout the meal.   Turn down the volume unless you only want a carry-out business.  The speakers on the street side were loud.Also staff in restaurants need to know how to make change.  If the bill is $7.18 and I give you $10.28,  a ten, a quarter, and three pennies) how hard can that be?

7.description: Update: consistency has improved!I come to this location because it's by far the closest to my home but the staff here drive me a little crazy.  It's usually something different each time.....meaning both the portions/proportions and their attitude. It ranges from checked out and just not listening (simple requests on the prep line just aren't heard most of the time) to being rude to their fellow crew (front line people barking at the others for refills while a manager stands and stares...this has happened on multiple occasions).  The place is generally clean and it's really convenient to have a parking lot, but I always go in knowing it just won't be the best customer/staff interaction.  Things can always improve...hope it does here!  :)

8.description: Omg this location is the slowest location ever! I was literally standing in line for 15 minutes to get my food. I would understand if they needed to re-up on chicken etc. but NO! nobody knew how to roll a burrito, some guys got literally 3 layers of just tortilla because it kept ripping. Train your people better before putting them our on the field.

14.description: Definitely not the best Chipotle around; but people settle for it because it's the closest to a lot of us. Service is super slow and usually you have to correct the people making your food. Don't even bother trying to order online thinking it'll be faster, you'll end up waiting even longer for them to make your food so you'd be better off standing in line. The employees will also occasionally snap at you at even the simplest request. The food is fresh, but it needs some major improvements.

3.description: Not thrilled with the pharmacy at all.  On 11/17 I needed an antivomit script filled for my 3-yr-old.  The script was for 2 tablets, which I had to wait an hour for.  Finally got home and tried giving my child the first dose which made him vomit again because they gave him pills (that need to be swallowed) instead of the dissolving tablets.I called at 9am the next morning and they told me that the doctor did not specify that it needed to be the dissolvable tabs. ???  Wouldn't an experienced pharmacist gather that a 3-yr-old (they do ask for the DOB on record) cannot swallow a pill?  The pharmacist then told me that they were going to call the pediatrician so they could send in a revised script.  By 3:30pm the pharmacy had still not called the doctor, after I was clear that my child had been vomiting for nearly four days now and should have had some relief if they had given us the correct medication.  I called the doctor immediately, they called the script in immediately and it took the pharmacy TWO hours before they even started to process the script, for only TWO tablets.  So my child did not get his antivomit medication until 7pm that night.Never going to fill another prescription here again.  CVS is so unbelievably fast, cheaper, and the pharmacists are much more proactive.

1.description: The photo lab here is horrible. To just pick up photos you feel like you're being a bother. They carelessly ruffle through the stack of photos so they have to check multiple times to find the photos. I placed 2 separate orders and they couldn't find my 2nd. After no advice on what to do I said don't worry about it I'll resend them and so she told me she'd cancel the order. My photos were also very red. I told her that and she offered no apologies nor to reprint them. I'll definitely be trying a new place to get my photos printed!

2.description: Don't order photos here unless you just want whatever comes out of the machine.  No interest in the quality of the print or customer service.

9.description: Walgreens and I have been having a torrid love affair for years. I keep spending my money there and they keep having great customer service, a clean place to shop that has almost everything, and photo processing department that does not mind processing my scandalous photographs!

10.description: This is my "default" Walgreens. They aren't too far from my house and honestly, this might be the best Walgreens I've ever been to. The staff seems to care, they never have screwed up and they are open 24hours. They are rarely out of something, the pharmacy is accurate with their quoted times and I've never had an issue and been going there 5 years now.

4.description: This is gotta be the absolute  worst pharmacy  the staff are rude they always seem like your bothering  them you wait on hold forever when you call about your rx and going thru drive thru save yourself  the headache and time go elsewhere  horrible service dont do it uggggg

6.description: What can I say its a Walgreens the staff was rather friendly! When I asked where something was they walked me to it.  that is the new standard for alot of franchises don't tell the customer where something is walk them to it. Manager was still working at 11 o'clock at night

12.description: Why am I Yelping on Walgreens?  Because this is the best Walgreens ever!  First, I love the coupons and deals.  The staff actually helps when you ask for it.  The shelves are always neat and organized.  The pharmacy is a-mazing! There was one instance when I was feeling completely craptastic and fell asleep in the chairs while waiting to get an antibiotic filled.  The pharmacist gently woke me up to see if I was ok, and made sure that my prescription was filled right way so I could get out of there.  They're also great at answering questions when you're not ill too.  Open 24 hours for anything you need...even Christmas Eve when you run out of powdered sugar making cookies!

5.description: I was at the store one day looking for some Easter cards. It took about 15 minutes for me to choose them. When I came to the register and was standing in the line, a girl (red hair to arms) picked up the phone and said "girl in the jacket? Okay". I knew that was about me. I don't know what was it about. When there was my time she was impolite. Not a nice experience.

13.description: it's walgreens. the customer service could be better. i think the register lady fell asleep while she was waiting for the receipt. I've never seen anything like it. Maybe she was just exhausted. It's has a nice lil parking lot and has everything you need. the pharmacy is not 24 hours though

11.description: This is possibly the best Walgreens I have visited. The cashiers and pharmacy techs are very friendly and helpful. I don`t have to wait for help or answer my question. In my opinion people are the most important. If they are nice and friendly you feel better.The place is aslo clean and well organised.

8.description: This has been my Walgreen's for a very long time.  The head pharmacist is great... kind of just like the commercials.  The pharmacy has a 24-hour drive-up window.The store itself is okay, but for some reason lately it seems like they're cutting down their inventory and no longer carry many things that I look for.  I find myself having to go to another Walgreen's to look for these items.  My mom has recently complained  that they have a new manager that doesn't seem to know how the coupons work and is constantly telling people that they can't use them.  I don't know what his deal is as I personally have not encountered him.  I sure hope someone comes in and salvages my Walgreen's before it's completely useless to me.

0.description: Nicole is very helpful and informative, she made my visit enjoyable. She also had patience and knowledgeable about the different brands in the cosmetics department. Keep up the good work.

7.description: Watch out for missing refills if you go to this pharmacy. I had an RX transferred there with 2 refills remaining on it, yet I had 0 refills after only filling it once.  Every employee I spoke with in the pharmacy, had a different story as to why that was, none of which turned out to be true by the way. So after being lied to, insulted, & hung up on more than once by certain employees I called Walgreen's corporate # & explained the situation. What a difference! They were polite & after taking down all my info said I would hear back from someone. I was very surprised when I got a call from the pharmacy manager Peter, who was polite, apologetic, & most importantly fixed the error. I was in a car accident so playing with my medication isn't something I want to have to worry about so despite Peter's great customer service in that situation (which I called corporate to compliment him on)I never wanted to deal with that staff again. So 1-2 months later I was having a different RX transferred but it was supposed to go to the Fullerton & Central store, not Montrose & Central but somehow that's where it ended up being sent. The RX had 3 refills on it when it was sent there yet this time it said it had 0 from the get go. So after calling the old pharmacy & the nightmare Walgreens again it was supposedly figured out that I did have 3 refills on the medication. I went to pick it up & it was ready but once again the bottle said 0 refills on it. So I go through the same song & dance again with the original pharmacy & this place (where it never should have even been transferred to!) but Walgreen's didn't replace the refills they stole this time, even Peter who had been so kind & helpful after the last incident seemed to have taken on the attitude of his staff. Perhaps because I didn't call corporate first & complain this time, he didn't feel any obligation to do the right thing or even be polite or listen. What a shame. They exhausted me to the point that they could keep the refills they stole & for that I'll simply be filing a complaint with the Illinois Dept. of Professional Regulations about that store. What angry & cruel people they must be to have to resort to stealing medication from people who need it.

3.description: Great shop and it was nice to see Terry behind the counter last time I was there...which was yesterday....The best part is the Hurly-burly 7" vinyl section...buck each,two bucks if its in a pic sleeve... Dig in!!Nice selection,friendly, and reasonably priced....

1.description: Definitely a good selection of old AND new. Not too many of the big fish as far as vinyl, but still some gems.

2.description: I found some blues records by Taj Mahal for my friend, these records aren't easy to come by so the fact that this place had it made me so happy. The guy who worked there told my boyfriend and I if we are ever looking for a record in Minneapolis (where we live) and we cant find it, he'll find it and ship it to our house, how cool is that? This place is golden I wish we had more places like this in MN, so in love.

5.description: I've been putting off reviewing this shop. It's one of my secret places. It's an uncurated haystack of vinyl that has yielded many treasures. The most I can say is, on my last visit, I picked up Iron Maiden's The Number of the Beast, a fantastic Les Paul and Mary Ford duet compilation, and a Salt N' Pepa's Very Necessary for a grand total under $10.It's a gold mine.

0.description: Cool place - not huge, but has a nice selection in a variety of genres and friendly staff. Also has my favorite (personally I think this feature is a must in any decent record shop) - under the table bargain boxes!  As always with these, you have to work through a fair number of Barbra Streisand albums to get to the good stuff, but I always find a couple of nice surprises that make it worthwhile (especially at $1 each or 5 for $6).  Certainly worth a stop if you're near the Montrose blue line / expressway, and I'd even make a special trip on a gloomy afternoon to spend an hour or so browsing.

4.description: I came here after following the first review by Katrina, and I love this place now. Their selection, classics-90's, and they are now under new management looking to expand their selection by customer suggestions.

3.description: This place is amazing! The owner is super nice and very helpful.I ordered some flowers from them over the phone the night before Valentines day and not only were they delivered promptly, but they were so much prettier then I thought they would be. For $40 including delivery I purchased the most perfect gorgeous bouquet of pink and green for my man. Funeral Lilly's, roses, fern and so many other gorgeous flowers. She understood exactly what I wanted and way beyond what I thought she would. This place ROCKS!

1.description: No review. It's a barber shop now.

2.description: Horrible! I feel like they flat out lied to me. I never give bad reviews, but Krystna and New Six Corners flower shop deserves it. I asked for a dozen pink roses  and got red ones that were already wilting. No vase, and it was $65.00. Someone could make a joke, but Jewel could have done better. Stay away from this place, especially on Valentine's Day!

5.description: Krystyna is great. She will create an arrangement for you that you won't get anywhere else, and her prices are fantastic. I just tell her want I want, and I get out of her way. My wife is always impressed. Also, I bought a jade plant from her, and it's the only plant I've been able to keep healthy in my life. She's doing something right. lol

0.description: I needed some last minute flowers for my husband fav. Aunt, that just came back from the hospital. The owner was super helpful, very nice. And all to a great price!! Got a wonderful bouquet for only$30 ;)))) will def. be back for more;))

4.description: Krystyna of Six Corners Flowers was my wedding day florist and I couldn't rave about her move. Her work was absolutely gorgeous and unique, I was thrilled! She is very professional and easy to work with; she gives great suggestions but is willing to do whatever you want/need.  She's creative and artistic and her prices were incredibly reasonable. I would recommend her to anyone!! Thank you Krystyna!

12.description: This bar is one of the best in Chicago.Great serviceGood pricesPlenty of dart boardsOh and all the regulars are friendly!!!Hats off to Lady Di

3.description: I went to the UYE here last night so now Yelp tells me my next review awaits and I'm happy to oblige.This is a neighborhood place. Its a bar with a separate dart room. The dart activities were in full swing. The local crowd is a little older.Again, just another notch in my quest to visit every bar in the city. But how our group was treated by the management, bartender and locals makes this a five star place.  Also, some trivia from Dan: Portage Park is named for the "portage" that existed along Irving Park. People used to transport their canoes across land from Lake Michigan to the Des Plaines River and onward to New Orleans. Lets see, LSD to Cumberland - thats eight miles.  They didn't have Di's Den back then to stop for a drink. I think I would have not fared well as an explorer or pioneer.

1.description: For a dive bar, this is as good as it gets.  There are two bars; one has a pool table, juke box, and a couple of video games. The other one has several dart boards (sorry I didn't count them) and a dozen tables and chairs. It's fun to watch the leagues play darts while you drink and talk.  There are bathrooms on each side and both are immaculate.  As a matter of fact, the entire place is spotless.  They do have other events besides league night.  So check out the website.  Di told us that they were having a chili cook off soon. By the way, Di is awesome.

2.description: This is the second time in a month I've been shushed or gotten strange looks for being loud with a group in a bar. Is a quiet bar some new trend I'm unaware of? I came to Di's Den for a UYE (unofficial Yelp event) organized by my Yelp pal Sandy. I wasn't expecting much from this dive bar, but I would definitely say it's more of a comfortable neighborhood bar than a "dive." It's clean, unpretentious, and the bartenders are friendly. One thing I dread about Friday nights at any bar is the potential for a lack of seating. Di's has plenty of tables, and we were never bumping into other people even though it was quite busy for a dart tournament. Di's isn't just a local watering hole. There's a pool table, a TON of dart boards, and a juke box that even lets you play music from your phone. The crowd is older - no young clubhead types or skank-a-sauruses on the prowl anywhere in sight.Well drinks were $4-5 each, there's a full bar, and of course, beer.

9.description: This place.....  This damn place!  Is freaking awesome!10 Dart boards people.  10!  and they have individual halogen lights so it's very easy to see.  You can't do "take aways?" because you got GED?  No worries!  They even have computerized scoring machine for the dummies!  (I was little inebriated so I used it)  It makes the game go lot smoother and faster.  It's same as bowling.  If you ain't drinking, you ain't having fun.  It was Friday night when a friend and I visited this place, and it's when they have some kind of dart tournament and the pot was over a grand!  I'm not much of a player so I just shot some before everyone got there and just drank my $3 16oz coors light.  Oh yeah, how cheap is that?  You don't like darts?  No worries, this bar has another room!  One for darts and booze, the other one is just for booze!  Good stuff!  If you play darts, you definitely have to come by this place.  I think this place is holy grail of darts in Chicago, I heard the old timers talking about different places they used to shoot.  A lot of regulars here, all the ones I've talked to are very cool and pleasant to talk to.  Average age is probably around 40-50.  Some are older, and they are one bad ass dart players.  Owners are awesome, she came by and talked to us for few minutes and cracking jokes.  Even gave me some tips to be a better darts player!  I will be moving to southern IL soon so I won't be able to frequent this place but damn man!  Check this place out!  THE HOLY GRAIL OF DARTS IN CHICAGO!  CHEAP BOOZE!  NICE PEOPLE!

10.description: My husband threw in the dart league and would occasionally have an away game here.  I used to accompany him because I myself like to throw darts and am friends with all the guys on the team.  Also, watching the guys play is interesting and I think it strengthens my dart strategy.  However, I stopped accompanying him when he would go to Di's because the drinks are just terrible.  They measure the shots and then charge what we think are expensive prices for a bar in Portage Park.  Unless you're a darter that doesn't mind paying Lakeview prices for drinks, it's really not that great.

4.description: The bartender is really cool. MGD bottles $2.75. The place is clean. What more you need to know?

6.description: Amazing prices, excellent service and a spectacular atmosphere. As a first-timer, I was treated like a regular and everyone was great. We'll definitely be back.

15.description: I have had a hankering to play some competitive darts since I moved from Atlanta.  After looking around on the internet, Di's Den seemed like a good bet.  They have a blind draw tournament every Friday night that apparently gets pretty good attnedance.  There were probably 30 people there last Friday and I was told that was a relatively low turn out.  The tournament was well run. My rustiness was apparent!  Most importantly, I met some nice folks that loved to play darts.  Since I also have that love for the "sport", I fit in nicely.  I wish it were a little bit closer to my place.  But, beggers can't be choosers.  The beer was pretty cheap, the place was clean, and the staff friendly and prompt.  I'll be back next time I get the itch to play!

0.description: I love a good dive and Di's Den is about as good dive as you'll ever see. Cheap drinks, good drinks, great atmosphere, great staff, free everything! Well...you know...not everything. But want to play pool? Not a penny! How about some darts? Nope, they won't take your money. Need some chips to go with your suds? Head to the table that has them sitting out with salsa & indulge for no extra fee. Jukebox music? Oh yea, it can happen...for free. They let you hook up your phone if you like and play away. Um...that's a dream.Hanging out at Di's Den feels like hanging at a friend's basement - super chilled and taken care of - just the kind of environment I'm into. There was no shortage of space. It was busy but not packed to the brims and for that it shoots straight to my list of favorite weekend spots.The bartender here was amazing. He had my back and made delicious drinks. Plus his semi-Irish accent thing he had going on...Oooooohhhh....if I wasn't a spoken for lady, I would have been straight swooning.Thanks to my lovely friend Sandra for introducing me to such an amazing bar. I've spread the word to many since going - proclaiming my love of Di's Den.

5.description: This has become my neighborhood bar.  When I am in a hang out at the bar mood, I will drive into the city from the western burbs just to hang out at Di's.  Very friendly group of regulars and the bartender on Saturday nights can not be matched.

13.description: WhayT I like about this bar is the size and how the bar is divided into two sections. So you can't see the drunk skunk on the other side as there is a wall partition and just a little area for the bartender to go back and forth. The bar is divided into two rooms and the second room is like a big dart arena. I have not seen any bar yet that devot so much of its space to the sport of throwing a dart. The televsion screens could get an update and the beer was cheap.

11.description: Made a quick pre-cinema stop here to kill some time. Big space. Real clean. Bottles and cans of beer only - no tap. Friendly. The juke had an odd mix of metal and those Stars-and-Stripes songs about the troops: Suburban and Western. Peeps at the bar knew the lyrics and sang along. Felt like I had been dropped somewhere in Kentucky. Felt a bit like a tea party. And not the Alice in Wonderland one. No Mad Hatter. No Rabbit. But it sure does look like dart central-one entire wall for your flinging pleasure.

8.description: Cheap booze, friendly fast service and DARTS!  An entire ROOM DEVOTED to steel tip DARTS (which, IMO, are the only "REAL" darts on earth....take that you pansy-plastic-tip tossing wussies!).Even the regulars were super-cool.

14.description: A bicameral establishment, with two rooms, one devoted to catering and dart tournaments, and the other, being where the "regulars" hang out, more catered to a local tavern feel.  Di and her establishment has been the prominent steel-tip dart bar in Chicago for quite a few years, and has hosted quite a few tournaments with their 13 available dart boards.  Blind draw tournaments are a staple there on Fridays, plus plenty of dart league teams play out of this mecca of Chicago darts.  One pool table, but it's free!  Good folks, fast bartenders, Golden Tee, etc.  Very low on the creepy old man/frat boy ratio - just regular people.  While the west half of the bar is devoted to darts, one certainly does not need to be a dart player to feel accepted here.  Tell 'em Sheriff Lobo sent ya!

7.description: This is the best dart bar in Chicago. It's not my favorite dart bar, but it is the unequivocal best. Countless boards, each with an oche built into the floor, scoring machines next to every board, always an abundance of pens and towels, and a Friday night blind-draw where you'll find the best shooters in the city. There is no bar in Chicago that has invested more money or effort into darts than Di's, and it shows.

3.description: Great place for a beer! Good vibe for this retro Polish bar. The ice cold mugs are perfect for the draft beers. For great service be sure to ask for Anna!

1.description: It's a solid bar. It is clean. The drinks are affordable. A game of pool is $1.00. I will probably be back.

2.description: I wish this bar were within walking distance of my home.  It is a nice, clean, casual place where I can get a good Polish beer and a light snack.

5.description: Pub is okay

6.description: When this bar was The Udder Brothers or what ever it was called it was actually decent but now it sucks. I can describe this place in 3 words RACIST..POLISH..BAR. If you are not polish don't bother coming in here you will get ignored and receive  horrible service. Me and a couple of friends came in and I swear it felt like a movie where the music cut off and everybody stopped what they were doing to stare at us because we were not polish. We sat at the bar and literally got ignored for like 15 minutes. When the bartender finally decided to serve us she was really rude to say it nicely and gave us shit tasting watered down drinks. We didn't even finish our drinks we just left. This was last summer idk if there's been any changes but I doubt it

0.description: Good place to drink a beer. One of the coolest polish pubs in Chicago.Good polish beer. Good food. Good people.

4.description: Tuesday night for Karaoke!  ladies half price! everyday is sth else. come Monday for complimentary food. darts, pool and bartenders specials. Love

1.description: Growing up eating Guatemalan pan, I can spot a winner and this place is far from one. Very disappointing! I disliked that I couldn't hand pick my own pan, maybe if I chose my own I would have avoided the small loaf that cost 3.00 that was burnt all around the edges and ended up in the garbage. All the pan that I received was not fresh, I went early for the reason of getting fresh bread and got hard stale pan. Small selection and over priced. I'll stick to any of the panaderia's up and down Lawrence.

2.description: Panaderia Guatemalteca is a great little Guatemalan bakery located next to Hops and Barley. I was in the area for that very reason so I decided to drop in and pick up some sweet treats. Happy: they take credit cardsSad: $10 minimumIn one of the more fancy bakeries spending ten bucks is very easy since things can get pretty costly but in this panaderia things cost no more than $1.50 at most. I purchased five pretty large treats and my total was $3.50!The extra large thin vanilla cookie was very good as was the flaky crusted cream filled delight of which I don't know the name. I also nibbled on the conchita a bit. It looks like a mini Mexican concha but it's a bit more dense. Everything was soft with great flavor and fresh. The lady running the place was very nice and in her limited English did a great job of helping me select some of their best items.They also have some other items from Guatemala such as coffee, sauces, etc. Great little shop, open until 9!

0.description: I love going to this place just for a quick snack while  walking my dog. It just unfortunate though that they open so early but they don't have fresh or new bread /pastry to serve.However, most of their pastry that I have tried so far is good. I like their bread stuffed with beef &cheese , and also the bread stuffed with sweet cheese.I wish they serve coffee though that would have been great for a small pastry shop like this.Overall,  I will stop by here if I'm walking by but its not something that I would crave for, specially in the morning when the guy that opens it is a lil crunky, I like the lady in the afternoon better.

1.description: I was looking for a nail salon close to home. When I arrived at there location there was no salon at the address provided

0.description: I just found this place yesterday on my way to belly dance class, at the Jasmin Jahal School on Milwaukee at Irving Park and Cicero.  So I noticed this place and decided to see what they were all about.  While I didnt get a massage I talked with the friendly girl at the desk and she went over the prices and options that they offer.  I will definitely give them a try within the next few weeks!  They offer $65 for a whole hour full body massage, that is a very reasonable price for the city! and its only $100 for 90min.  I cant wait to try it out!  I'll be back to post when Ive enjoyed an hour long full body massage.  So Ive had the massage!  It was really relaxing, I went to dance class and they stayed open for me to come in at 9:45 and they have a shower so I could rinse off.  Regina was my massage therapist and she was great.  She made sure the pressure was right and made me feel very comfortable and relaxed.  She works Tuesday-Thursday 4:30-10:00 and I would definitely recommend her to anyone who wants a great, thorough massage.  I had two knots in back and she worked on them until they were gone.  I felt so relaxed when I came home and even this morning I still feel in a nice sort of relaxed state.  I will for sure be back!  The only negative thing I can say is  that the outside of the building is not that inviting and unless you look closely its hard to notice its a massage place.

58.description: I came here with some  Brasilian friends to watch the Copa de libretadores soccer match between our team from Brasil fluminase and the Ecuadoreen team, it was very fun. The food was good, I had the churasco steak platter, and meat empanadas. The atmosphere was very fun especially every time a goal was scored by their team it was a mad house of music and cheering. At the end Brasil Fluminase lost to Ecuador on penalty kicks after Brasil was beating them in regular time 3-1 but oh well. My point is the place was fun, the people are fun too and the owner of the place is a real class act he bought use a round of beers for our teams lose and introduced himself, really nice guy.

56.description: I used to love this place so much... the lively music, crowd of regulars, drinks, and dancing was all that I could wish for - the food, for me wasn't the #1 reason for going since I'm a vegetarian and there are few options for me, but I always had so much fun, I wanted to go back time and time again ...  I would have to say, however, that the service is below par these days.   The staff also likes to jump their friends in ahead of customers waiting for a table, and it's pretty clear they really don't care if you complain.   The food was okay, but again, not very inventive I suppose, and in some cases, maybe a little too greasy.   I'll still go for the live Ecuadorian folk music... there's just something about it for me - very happy, and the tiny dance floor gets everyone forcibly intimate.    Solid like a rock, La Pena.    It's a love-hate relationship, tumultuous, drama-filled, but you just have to stick around for the end of the night.

29.description: Well walking into the place wasn't too bad until we saw the prices for food, how long we had to wait for drinks.... then to order food.... then to recieve the drinks.... then to recieve my food... Also had a live singer BUT all he sang was slow songs which messed up my mood for the night. Then he played some songs that only lasted like 3 mins to dance to. And the food i can make at home and it will taste better. I'm sorry but no go for me to this place. But you may.... IF YOU DARE!

42.description: We met up with some friends here for lunch last week. I can't say I got jazzed up over the decor, but the food, for the most part, was interesting and tasty. We were served a bowl of plantain chips that came with a small cup of some kind of uninspired sauce. What I found annoying was the chips were basically a lot of crumbs, like we got the bottom of the bag. Things began to look up after that. I had the ceviche appetizer that contained shrimp and calamari. It was absolutely delicious. I would go back for that alone. (I will pass on the roasted corn. It was rock hard and I was glad I did not break a tooth on it) I ordered their lamb dish for my entree and although the flavor was good, the lamb was tough. Christopher had a chicken and rice dish which he enjoyed, but we both felt the food was rather pricey. I will probably return, but will be a bit more careful what I order. I will probably have the ceviche and maybe one of their soups or salads and call it a day.

23.description: Worst customer service ever.

47.description: Went here with family on a weekend. A little pricey but worth the money. Great if you are in the mood for beans and rice with tasty seasoned meat or seafood.

8.description: I've been going here for a few years and the service has really gone down.They used to be super friendly and accommodating, now they are almost rude.  Had dinner here with some family recently and the waiter took our drink and food order, brought food, and never came back to check on how we were doing.  No pleasantries, nothing.  Also, they've increased their prices quite a bit, so I'm a little irritated that they couldn't also increase the quality of their service too.  Bummer, this place used to be great.

31.description: The food was great will be returning for the live band and dancing over the weekend and the drinks were strong and good. My husband and I had a combination meal for two there was enough food for three not two great place

34.description: There is an inherent drama about La Pena: Ecuadorian cuisine.  It's like a show.  There's the grilled chimichurri seafood, the pisco sours, the still-sizzling steaks singing softy like savory angels.  There's a laser light show, a fully-stocked bar, and a dance floor.  All we're missing is the ham-mot and Cabana boy refilling your coconut-Margarita.The trade off?Depressingly expensive.  Our dinner cost me my shirt (and my board shorts, much to the dismay of customers, intrigue of others)!  Even with our groupon now, the bill was sadly over budget.  Do I have to say it in Spanish!?"Que pasa, La Pena? Esta es un recesion!"Ecuador, no more.

16.description: The food and drinks here are always great. Unfortunately, they have a dance floor here that when not being danced on, seems to be the place where lazy parents let their kids run around.

13.description: Excellent Food, Service- will definitely be back! 9 of us for dinner, apps, entrees and cocktails all great with super service. Personally I had the coconut milk shrimp with rice and plantains, so flavorful! Tried another's ribeye, out of this world tender and tasty! The sweet corn tamales were worth the recommendation!

11.description: Celebrated a friends birthday here on Saturday.   We had a small party of 4, we decided to come here and did not make reservations.   As we walked in we realized there was a soccer game on.  This place was packed with fans!  We were greeted right away and despite it being packed we were seated immediately.  As for service it did take a bit long for us to get some water and have our orders taken.  This is the only reason this place will not get the 5 stars from me.   I will say that once the waitress took our orders she did check up on us often to see how we were doing and was always pretty quick at getting our drinks from the bar.  We ordered the fried plantain chips which are delicious and come with a dipping sauce that is very flavorful. These things are addictive!!!    For the main course we had the Andean platter...
