This is a great way to get a little taste of everything.  The chicken and steak were cooked perfectly but could use a bit more flavor.  There is some pork sausage and pieces of fried pork which were pretty good.    It was all very filling!  Once the soccer game was over the dj came on and started playing music and the dance floor filled up with people getting down.  I plan to come back and maybe try something else on the menu.  Overall this was a good time and they provided us with an enjoyable night.

39.description: Been coming here for years and feel like service keeps getting worse and worse!! Food is ok and way overpriced for what you get & taste-as are drinks. Been here twice in the last month and the service was horrible. Our waitress(same both times)needs an attitude adjustment. Rushing while taking our orders, rolling her eyes when we would ask questions etc...just feel that if we are going to spend a good $500+(group) for dinner, a smile wouldn't hurt! Would go back for the live band that performs over the weekend from 7-10pm.

37.description: As others have pointed out, the menu prices are high (I think for this area, but not exorbitant if they happened to be in River North), but you do get a lot of food for what you pay. Almost all of us took home leftovers. We were a group of six, later joined by a seventh. Our out-of-town guests had chosen this from our recommended South American cuisine options. The one large room accommodates about 20 some tables for two, which are easily grouped together for large parties. A colorful and fully stocked bar (there is a separate menu for drinks) is along one wall and faces the small performance stage and compact dance area.Our host/waiter was very attentive and helpful to us. Not a problem since it was a Wednesday evening and when we arrived at 7:30 PM, there was only a table of two in the place. Much later, a group of about ten arrived and were ably served by the same waiter (by this time, our table was finished). He was also an able photographer, taking snapshots for each table.Parking was a breeze here (no city meters, but you have to observe some posted restrictions), on street right in front or free at a lot on the corner just southeast. There are no close-by restaurants, so not much competitions for the limited number of spots.Here's what we six enjoyed:      - plantain chips waiting for us at the table      - calamari ceviche (marinated squid in a tangy sauce)      - fried chicken wings, French fries, hot sauce      - empanadas (one order gives 2, one each beef & chicken filled)      - humita (essentially a corn meal tamale)      - grilled lamb chops entreé      - grilled 2-pork chops entreé      - grilled pork pieces entreé      - grilled chicken entreé      - calamari with vegetables on yellow rice (a sort of paella)Of these, our favorites were the plaintain chips and the empanada appetizers. They excel in the grilled meats for entreés enjoyed by all. Some of those were accompanied by white rice and a potato pancake (yummy). Others on a bed of hominy with two fried sweet plantain slices (yummy). We passed on desserts, but our latecomer had something like a strawberry smoothy that was very tasty.Wednesday is NOT a night that live music performs on the small stage here. Fine with us since we were more interested in conversing. When we arrived, one of our party thought the volume of the recorded music being played was a tad too loud. By the time the waiter took our orders, we noticed the audio volume had been reduced to 1) allow for communicating about our orders, and 2) for the table to comfortable speak with each other. This without our having to request it. Had the room been more full of patrons, it's possible that it would have been noisier than on this night.

0.description: Love this place! Awesome food and drinks, especialy the mojitos! Always have a great time here and enjoy the music and late night dancing.

38.description: This place is a welcome addition to Portage Park.  They offer many good Ecuadorian  dishes.  The food is tasty and the portions are large. Their steak and chicken dishes are the best. They offer live music on Friday and Saturday evenings. There is a small area for dancing. The drinks are fantastic. It is worth the stop!

51.description: Great food. I enjoyed a LLapingacho mixto (chicken & steak) OMG... Delicious! The waitress was friendly and reasonable price for an exotic cuisine.

27.description: Unless you are from ECUADOR you will never receive all the attention you deserve, fuck this place it took me 45 minutes just to get a beer,  i don't sing but i came on a karaoke night and a table full of Ecuadorian fucks kept getting the go ahead while everyone else kept getting the sit your ass down and will call you when its your turn attitude... fuck this place.     the food is beyond mediocre the service is terrible and the owner was passed out in the middle of the room drunk wtf are you serious?????

32.description: excellent,excellent,,it was only 3 couples in the place,precise service,heavy drinks,great food,go. we will be back.

54.description: Walked in on Sat night and got seated right away. There was a cute family band playing including the little kids on pan flute. Lots of fun drinks to choose from. Started off with some ceviche. I reccomend sticking with the shrimp as the pescado was just OK. The wife had this great shrimp dish with an avocado salad. I had the ribeye which was really good.

48.description: Went here the past weekend for a friend of a friend's bday party. We had a large group and I don't know if the place can handle that as well.Pros: Great appetizers. The empanadas were amazing as well as their tortillas (potato pancakes) and fried plaintain chips. One of the few places where you can get adequate beer from South America. Also the free dance session late into the night is fun, even though I really don't know how to flamenco dance whatsoever.Cons: Entrees were left to be desired and were quite bland and flavorless.  I really felt that they were entirely tiny for the quite expensive price for what you were getting as well. I shared the parridilla with my date which was just charred up seafood without any seasoning. From ordering this plate we were supposed to receive a salad on the side with yellow rice, which they completely forgot to bring out to us. This really speaks volumes for the terrible service we received the rest of the night. Bad service is ok for some places, but not when they are charging you an arm and a leg for the experience.I doubt that I'd return, but if I do I'll likely just make a meal out of the appetizers while enjoying some fine cervezas and skip over the bland overpriced entrees.

44.description: The food here leaves much to be desired, as Latin American fare in Chicago goes. Edible, but nothing to write home about, really, and over-priced. Drinks are expensive too. Music to dance to used to be good. Before they had a lady DJ that played a bit of everything, emphasizing good salsa, and kept everyone jumping. Now nothing but regaton most of the time. I find it boring. Too much of the same over and over. Skip it, it is my advise.

24.description: Love this place! I have had tons of Ecuadorian food in my time, and this place is great. It is not the best Ecuadorian food I have ever had, but it is still very good and ahs definite Ecuadorian flavor. The price may seem high to some, 17.95 for Steak, Rice, Beans, and Plantains. However, this is the average price for a steak that large with a potato and veggie.... seems about right to me especially since Ecuadorian food tends to come at a higher price tag.The place also has a great atmosphere especially on a weekend night.I admit, they could step up the music to be a bit more lively, but their singers are good so I don't mind the slower music. Most of what they sing sounds like love songs. All of their servers are very nice, however they do tend to get distracted. Just be prepared to catch their eye a few times.

7.description: This place sucks!!! Horrible customer service, food and drinks are tasteless. I am asking this place to close, or at least get new employees. The wait time for food and drinks is horrendous, as well as the people who work there. PLEASE DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTURAUNT!!!

49.description: Went here a few nights ago with my husband and we were the only ones there.  We got there at around 6:30...were there for an hour and still no other customers. The place is pretty big so I felt a little weird. The prices are out of this owrld expensive for what you get. The food is ok but I think that I may have gotten bad shrimp and I could tell just by the smell when it came to the table. I think it was a bad choice since I hear they are pretty popular on the weekend, I think I may have gotten the last of this weeks shrimp.  The waiter was very nice and attentive but that may have been because there was no one else to attend to. The sad thing is that my husband and I came here a few years ago and it was an awesome neighborhood place. The music was great. They had two bars and the place was hopin'. I loved it...would have given it a five star rating had I been on yelp then, so when I moved two blocks away from La Pena I said to my hubby lets go have dinner and for the first time in my marriage I had to say to my husband "Hunny I was wrong".

40.description: Way over priced, small portions - and the flavors were not that inspiring, even the flan didn't measure up. ( yeah that is a tough one) and i was suggested another desert of a plantain with cheese vein inside it.  I don't know if it belonged on the dessert menu. I am very adventurous with food - but it was lackluster.So we got plantain chips.. so what.,.. they tasted like they came from an old bag that had been sitting in a warehouse forever. All this would not matter as much if they didn't charge such a ridiculous price for dishes for example: two small pieces of chicken on the bone leg and thigh with skin on it ( where most the sauce soaked into but i was not going to eat the skin) two large balls of rice ( cheap filler) and 5 pieces of fried plantain ( which was the highlight of the dish) too expensive for not so well made food.

53.description: This may be a good spot for live music and dancing but not for dining which is hit and miss. Pleasant staff make for a welcoming experience, and they quickly provide plantain chips and a great Ecquadorian dip filled with peppery flavors balancing the sweetness of the chips. I had seco de polo with rice. The chicken was stringy and inedible. That is, I truly could not chew it into digestible matter. Husband had pork chops which were greasy and served with microwaved frozen vegetables. Server did a check back and saw I was not eating the chicken. I told her it was too tough to swallow. She offered an alternative, but we could not wait for another entree. I had already shared my husband's chops. We were not charged for the chicken which was fair.  However, this is not on our return visit list.

30.description: I would not be returning .... First of all we waited 45 minutes JUST to order our drinks!!! And another 25 minutes to orderour food and another 30 mins for our food to arrive. The food was decent but for steak, white rice, and some beans for $17.95!!! I had to use steak sauce for my meat usually I like to eat the steak alone. The live music guy sang very well and enjoyed hIs voice however he only let me say that again ONLY sang extremely slow songs. I came to dance but only was able to dance to like four good songs that felt like it lasted a minute. The dance floor is a really good size. Overall my experience here was not memorable at all and basically wasted over $100.00 for food I can make at home and average drinks.

46.description: My friend brought me here for my birthday. Having lived in Ecuador, he'd been wanting to take me out for some of the best examples of said cuisine for a while. Turns out, I was a chump for not taking him up on it sooner!Those fried plantain chips they bring out to start you off... plant-CRACK, more like, heh heh. Damn, it was a fingers-wild shoving match over the bowl for a few minutes there, maybe we should have eaten lunch or something before we got there...First time I ever tried ceviche; apparently, the Ecuadoran version is a little different than the more common Mexican style? All I know is that I could barely restrain myself from picking up the cup it was in and guzzling that shit! Especially paired with the dried corn (or 'reverse Corn Nuts', as I like to call 'em).By the time my plate full of fried pork came out, I was both sated and slobbering. It did not disappoint. Yum, yum, YUM. In fact, everyone's plates looked pretty damn enticing, and follow-up bites confirmed this. We went on a Tuesday night, so there was no music and actually it was not particularly busy. Probably a good thing, as the service was a bit on the *leisurely* side. Lovely place all around, though.P.S. How could I forget to mention the empanadas?! Good god, people, you OWE it to yourself to order a couple of these, if you cherish all that's tasty and delicious in the world!

1.description: This place is a nice little neighborhood joint. The food was not bad and the set up for live music is good.The set up is big and open and the food is homey and has a heavy comfort factor.

55.description: Pros: GREAT food, fun atmosphere, and nice music. It kind of makes you feel like you are on a Latin American vacation. The portions were large, the food was fresh and delicious. It seemed to be a lot of regulars there, mostly speaking spanish, along with a staff that preferred to speak in spanish as well. I truly enjoyed my meal and the ambience.Parking was easy and convenient on the street in front of the restaurant. Cons: It's a bit far for a downtown girl, though worth the trekk. Service was less than stellar. While the staff was nice and helpful with suggestions, they were also a bit slow. That wouldn't keep me from going back, though!

9.description: Pleasant and quick service. Plantain chips were fresh and tasty. The platter for two seemed over priced at $39.99. Perhaps I'm not familiar enough with Ecuadorian cuisine, but I expected a bit more seasoning and the flavors to pop. One notable standout was the calamari - it was tender and delicious - not at all rubbery. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back but it's probably the best option in this neighborhood.

26.description: The food is a little pricey.....but well worth it !!!A touch of South American right in your backyard !!!The churrasco and sangria were outstanding !!!

25.description: The food was good, the environment was nice with the live music playing, and the drinks werent too bad. However the waitress we had was rude. After requesting various times for manager, we were told there was none. If the situtation couldnt be resolved between a customer and waitress, naturally there should be a manager to handle it regardless of whose fault it is. Just saying....

12.description: I would most definitely give this place a negative  number if i could. My family decided to come here in celebration for my mother's birthday. The owner or manager decided to sit us. We had also bought a cake for my mother, which they put in the fridge for us. My mother was on the way to the resturant which was going to be a surprise for her. We expected my mother to arrive shortly. She was no longer then 10 minutes away, when this man which from what understand was the owner or manager of this place started to ask us when we were going to order, we said my mom was about to be there shortly. He left with a bad attitude. Then he came back 3 minutes later angry. He screamed at us that we were holding back a line of customers, where we clearly saw that no line of customers was there (he lied). At this point my whole family was suprised at his attitude, he told us to order or leave and slammed his hands on the table. This woman came to us and asked if there was a problem, i clearly stated that he became really angry because we were just waiting for my mother, and she was a minute away. She just told us that he has a short temper, i demanded they give us our cake back because we could not tolerate this service. The owner or manager hesitated on giving our cake back and demanded on his employees to give us the cake, we were furious and shocked at such service. Can't believe this resturant is still in business. I am sure to tell everyone we know to absolutely avoid this resturant. And by the way I am ecuadorian and im sure to tell all my friends and family to never ever come here.

59.description: This is the closest decent restaurant to my house and i've gone there -probably- 12 times since it opened.  I have never had a bad meal there, but i admit the service can sometimes be dodgy and the music is too loud (don't know why they need to amplify it...at all).  I particularly like the humitas and the corn side dish with very large kernels.....

21.description: The first thing I noticed about this place was they have a NO SEPARATE CHECKS Policy. Who does that? I was with a large group but had arrived later, I ordered at the bar to specifically avoid this problem, but at the end of the night they still lumped it all together. I have no I idea who ended up paying for my food, people left at different times. They should revise the policy. The bartender was nice and friendly, but the servers not so much. The food wasn't bad, I didn't try much but what I did wasn't bad at all. The music was alright, kind of mellow until the DJ showed up. Then it got pretty good. I would go again, but now I know better.

17.description: My boyfriend"s hairdresser is Peruvian and she recommended this place.  I'm so glad we went.  Great food.  We had 2 appetizers, fried banana chips with the sauce and yuca with maple syrup.  They were so good, incredible and wanted more.  We both had the grill chicken breast, egg, rice and side of salad. It's was excellent, tender and juicy, especially with the sauce that they served the chips.  It's a hidden gem!! Try it, you're stomach will thank you.  The service was not that great but the food made up for it.  Will be back.

10.description: It was my first time there and I thought it was very delicious. I like the atmosphere and the employees were very nice. I would recommend this restaurant.

5.description: My husband and I saw a coupon for this place and decided to check them out. We went early, around 6 p.m. and there was only one other table of people. The place is set up for live music, projections, dance floor, huge speakers...It looked like a nice place to party. I was glad we got there before the disco lights were turned on. There are sports banner hanging everywhere. This place has a good bar to go to to watch soccer or hockey games.The service was friendly, fast, and careful to refill out water cups and ask what we needed without hovering. We ordered the Curry seafood soup. It was amazing. We will be coming back to try more items on the menu. I really liked the free postcards at the door with exotic animal photos on them.

3.description: I heard about this place through my boyfriend but he warned me at the beginning that the service wouldn't be great. Against his will, I decided to drag him here to have some Ecuadorian food despite the Yelp reviews that spoke about the horrible service as well. When we arrived, a man quickly seated us which made me think the reviews about horrible service were wrong. However, as we were walking towards the table a server pushed my boyfriend from behind without any warnings. He didn't excuse himself.I thought that would be the end of the bad service but it got worse. My boyfriend was really thirsty and didn't want to pay 3 dollars for a fountain drink when the food is already priced at 20 dollars a plate, so he asked for tap water. Afterwards, an older server showed up with a bottled water. My boyfriend said this was not what he wanted because he wanted free tap water. She insisted that they don't have free tap water at that time and to just buy the water. I mean, at every restaurant I have ever been too I have never been charged for water. Why are they trying to get money out of the customer in every possible way? Nobody came back afterwards to check up on us. They never came back and asked if I needed a refill on my drink. They didn't come back until an hour later with my food. Finally, we received the check and were ready to leave a tip until we say that gratuity was automatically added. This is so misleading especially to customers who are used to tipping and might mistakenly leave a lot more than they are excepting or can afford. To say the least, I am never coming back here. At least, until the service is improved because gratuity should be based on service and not be aggregated automatically. McDonald's has given me better service. At least at McDonald's I am able to get free tap water.

35.description: I was quite excited to go to my first Ecuadorian restaurant. We went in the middle of the week and had exclusive !! access to the place all by ourselves. -LocationLogan / Portage park ish and close to the 6 corners with a good amount of street parking. Definitely parked the car right outside to walk which was a good thing on that snowy night.-AmbianceIt was  huge restaurant with a lots of big group seating and a dance floor right in the middle. The word is that they have some awesome live music and dancing over the weekends.-FoodWe started with the Tortilla de papa, the Lomito Saltado (Ribeye), Encocado Marinero (Mixed seafood dishes) and fried plantains on the side. As far as the portions were concerned, they were definitely big. But the word that we both though of after the food was it is lacking certain flair or zingg !! The Ribeye tasted very much like mexican food and the Marinero tasted more of a Thai dish. Both of them lacked certain Ecuadorian authenticity. -Service.Definitely on the bad side. The bartender / host / server the all in one dude), started by recommending a dish from Uruguay !! This was after we said that it was our first time to a Ecuadorian place. Other recommendations were definitely all in the pricier side of the menuOverallI am not planning to go back :).. I hope to find other Ecuadorian places in the city to spend my money.

19.description: Worst customer service ever.

28.description: This place is cool bc it's very authentic. And they have great entertainment.

45.description: When we walked in there was no music playing just a large table which looked like a company construction outing. So we were happy when the host/waiter let us sit on the other side of the restaurant that is until they turned off the music and blasted the Hawks game. Don't get me wrong I like the Hawks but wasn't really the atmosphere I was expecting. For starters they brought out plantain chips with a spicy dip yum I could not stop munching until our mixed ceviche came. Oh the ceviche we ordered the mix calamari and talapia we got just calamari with some octopus. It was ok not as much citrus as I would like and for calamari that should not be a problem. On to the main dish. I got the mixed seafood in a coconut sauce every thing was delicious until I found a black hair in in. Mine is long and brown definitely not my hair. I didn't make a big deal of it but did mention it to the waiter. He brought us a free drink but still charged us for the uneated hairy seafood. My friend ordered the steak with sweet plantains and rice and beans I tried it and it was really good. Overall I don't think I'll be going back and am soon going to be searching my cabinets because I'm still hungry.

33.description: Disappointing. Service was slow. But there wasn't much flexibility for the vegetarian in the dinner party. And, since it was early in the evening and no band the atmosphere seemed more like an airport terminal in mid-afternoon...no people (we were the only customers), annoying music from somewhere, no one to wait on us.

43.description: This place is a great compliment to Ecuadorian's everywhere.  Really authentic food and drink in a fun environment.  You'll get your first glimpse of the food when they bring out their plantain chips.  Crunchy and flavorful chips leave you forgetting that their plantains that come with a cream sauce with a little kick.  Then try their ceviche with roasted corn - which is even better with the plantain chips, but the roasted corn happens to be an Ecuadorian staple.  I had the shrimp salad with avocado.  Nothing special but it yummy enough.  I would say their best entrees are their meat dishes - grilled beef or chicken that are simple yet have a lot of flavor. They all come with fries, white rice, and avocado (love a place that is very generous with their avocado).  For those familiar with Las Tamblas Argentinian steak house, this is very similar.  I would say La Pena offers more seafood entrees than Las Tamblas though.Drink selection is also excellent - try the micheladas with your favorite beer. For those not familiar with micheladas, it's basically a spicy bloody mary with beer.  More Mexican than Ecuadorian but i'm so happy about  - given that i am Mexican.  Aside from that, they offer other beers from Ecuador and other south american countries, wine, mixed drinks, sangria, and even liquados (spanish fruit drinks).  My wife and friends really enjoyed a drink called caipirinia - a mojito type drink with Pitu Rum, sprite and lime over ice.  Per my wife...it's the best in town.Glad that it's so close to our neighborhood.  And looking at the place from the outside, it's so unassuming yet better than most in terms of ability to find them on busy Milwaukee Ave.  Add to the fact that they have music and dancing on the weekends, it rounds out a fun night at this great neighborhood joint.  I'll warn you that it's a bit pricy, so you'll have to consider all that they have to offer that makes up for the cost.  Go Ecuador!

2.description: Good afternoon I am writing this review because yesterday we decided to celebrate my mothers birthday at this place and service was horrible. The host has a horrible attitude this is the second year we celebrate my mothers birthday the first year was bad and we figured let's give them a chance and cameTo experience the same and even worst service. Service in itself was horrible. Your host is the face of your restaurant he greets the people in and when that person is just horrible with people it doesn't work well.i don't recommend this venue to anyone.

18.description: My mom loves this place because it is family friendly and the music is always good. The services needs to be more responsive and the prices are a little more than expected but overall it is a nice place to go.

41.description: Went here a couple months ago and it was good! the fried plaintain chips at the start are pretty good and a nice touch. we ordered the surf and turf and OMG the calamari was to die for! it had the burnt edges just the way i like it. It was my first time ever having tried Ecuadorian food and i was pretty impressed. I'd come here again. The only problem was it was a bit chilly and my friend n i were the only two people in the place so it made conversing a bit awkward.

52.description: Very good food. Ecuadorian.  Quite different for those who havent tried it, yet lots of familar flavor. I have had the lamb there and the steak with chimichurri. Both are excellent. Nice appetizers as well. Good selection of wine and S. American beers. Thier Mojitos and Pisco Sours, while pricey are great and have a kick!  A littel noisy, but hey, its a S. american place.  Roll with and dance  off your meal. A lively spot in Portage PArk.

50.description: Came here for my mom's birthday to get her some real Ecuadorian food, she of course is Ecuadorian, there aren't many Ecuadorian restaurants in Chicago so this seemed like a good choice from the bunch. Nice restaurant kinda empty on a Saturday night but it does pick up later on, I believe it was karaoke night, music was played a little too loud for such a small place you couldn't really talk much but I have gone on a different nights and it hasn't been too bad so before you go check out what's going on that night. The food was perfect just as if you were in Ecuador, they also have ecuadorian sodas available, maduro was sooooo good. Only downfall of this place...its pretty expensive. The owner bought me a drink so im not complaining.

4.description: I'm giving this place one star for the live band that was great. We went for drinks and dancing and got a great seat near the dance floor. We ordered drinks upon arrival that arrived quickly and  basically never saw our waitress again. We told the bus boy that we  wanted to order food and more drinks and still no waitress. The very ignorant doorman then comes to out table and tell us that the bar is for drinks and that he is taking our table since we aren't eating. We tell him we have been waiting for the waitress and he agreed to go get her. She never came. I have never received such horrible service.  Additionally tip is already included so we paid her 20% on a  $150 tab.

6.description: Came here to celebrate my brother and sister in laws 5 yr wedding anniversary. La Pena accommodated 30 people: we had several parilladas that came with rice salad and beans. The parilladas were loaded with meat. ( chicken steak shrimp etc) the plates did come out luke warm, but over all very flavorful. The place has a dj on Saturday nights after the live band. P.S their drinks were good and have a good kick.

22.description: Don't support greedy rude business owners. Don't recommend this place it all. Expensive and food sucks as well as greedy stupid business owner.

15.description: The first thing I noticed about this place was they have a NO SEPARATE CHECKS Policy. Who does that? I was with a large group but had arrived later, I ordered at the bar to specifically avoid this problem, but at the end of the night they still lumped it all together. I have no I idea who ended up paying for my food, people left at different times. They should revise the policy. The bartender was nice and friendly, but the servers not so much. The food wasn't bad, I didn't try much but what I did wasn't bad at all. The music was alright, kind of mellow until the DJ showed up. Then it got pretty good. I would go again, but now I know better.

57.description: The service makes it a bad experience for me.  They are NOT KID FRIENDLY.  You would think they would be more polite to families in the area since it is a family neighborhood. They are not good at all with kids and if you do go with kids be prepared to be almost escorted out.  I've see other locations clean up after you as you eat but they take it to the 10th degree.  We finished eating and as we were sitting reset the table in front of us, making us move and hold things as they reset, and it wasn't event packed!Forget about telling them something is wrong with your food because you'll get dirty looks and comments made behind your back.  My kids are not wild at all, they are just rude.  We never went back after that and we have told our friends with kids as well.  We have two other families that went after us with their kids, who are older and they too had a hard time, they never went back. It's pretty much an adult, money sucking location because they only care about what you order and how much you spend.  Forget about not ordering the most expensive thing on the menu because they even say, "that's all!" But if you're there to socialize and drink then they will love you.  For singles, maybe this is the place, but that's all. And I agree, the music is blarring, even during the lunch hour.  There's just no right time to go as a family.  So we go to La Humita down the road.  Music upstairs and local to eat downstairs.  Great service and FOOD! even better priced and larger portions.

20.description: best ecuadorian food ever

36.description: La Pena moved in to this neighborhood some time ago and was originally a BYOB place. They serve Ecuadorian food and ave stayed the course through obstacle after obstacle. At one point they were premiered on Check Please and it seemed to help the business blossom quite nicely. Between a good dinner crowd and a mix on the evening crowd of Latin American dancing and some great live music on the weekends that plays Andean music and has been the same crew for a while. I have actually booked the band for parties in our neighborhood as they are very entertaining and quite a friendly bunch.The owner Jaime Castillo, is one stand up individual and I am quite proud of the fact that he is hands on. In the past couple of years they remodeled the place to feature a bar that is up front near the street and opened up the inside to accommodate many more people. BYOB has been gone for about 5 years or more.As for the food, it is all good. I have favorites of my own such as the complete line of Ceviche, Sweet Potato Pancakes with Peanut Sauce served over a bed of lettuce and their Empanada's. There is one steak dish that is delicious that is a Rib Eye served with the aforementioned Potato Pancakes, Rice, Beans and my favorite part . . . eggs over easy. Can't remember the name but it is outstanding. If that doesn't float your boat then try the Arroz Con Pollo which is a meal in itself and quite delicious.So if you go here ask for Jaime and tell him Larry sent you.

14.description: Not very good and expensive.  The Shrimp ceviche was filled with mostly onions.  The side of "tostado" (corn nuts) it comes with was a bit stale and not toasted properly.  The rice was hard, the "humita" was heavy on butter or oil (or both), same goes for the potato tortilla and the fried plantains.  It  was just bad and served cold.  These folks go very heavy on the red onions.  Not sure what the calamari dish was like, they forgot all about it or perhaps the server didn't hear it since the music was beyond loud.   Service wasn't bad but food needs much improvement.

3.description: This salon completely sucks! It is outdated. They didn't even get a credit car machine til last week when they were in business for 30 years! This place should close down. I was referred by my sister because she knew the woman stylist. It took 8 hours to do a full head of highlights?? I was over charged, She didn't even know how to mix the bleach with developer. She had the owner's son do it. I thought it was strange because he had to go in the back to do it. Also she kept complaining I have too much hair and its too long. I don't need to be criticized about my hair when i'm paying for services. The lady chopped off my bangs too short and tried to cover it up by putting a clip on it like I wouldn't notice. She insisted I did not need any toner , which I probably need. I have yellow and orange spots in my head. The back of my head has platinum blonde which looks too white. I couldn't wait to get the hell out of there. I thought she was going to give me a good deal. It's not even an upscale salon to be changing so much money. Then she kept rushing toward the end and didn't want to blow out my hair because she had a pedicure coming in..wtff??? I'm spending way more money than someone getting a dumb pedicure. like fix my hair before you do someone else's damn feet. Very unprofessional place. How the hell was this place around for 30 years?  Then when I wanted to leave the Mike guy tried to sell me some conditioner for like $10.00. I really hate when people try to sell me stuff. I already own many conditioners and  really don't think that their's is any different  than any other. I tipped her $20.00 because she was there all day, but its her fault for being too slow to apply foils. when I left I had a very choppy haircut. It looked terrible so I  put a hat on my head. I paid all that money to wear a damn hat!! I have nothing against this woman or people working there, but doing hair is not the job for her. I deserve an apology and a refund!  I WANT MY MONEY AND THE 8 HOURS OF MY LIFE BACK WASTED IN HERE !! Also as I was leaving the owner said I looked beautiful when he just lie to my face. You should not have your clients walking out your salon looking like that  with a choppy haircut and four different colors in their hair.  It's your job to make sure my hair looks nice. They only want money. Crooks! I really hate being scammed! THIS IS THE WORST SALON I HAVE EVER BEEN TO!!!

1.description: Two years ago I was a walk in to this place while my girlfriend went shopping.  Today I still go there because they offer great haircuts, right price, when you need them... rarely if ever a wait, plus they take their time to make it right.  I've never had a barber/stylist spend the time to ensure every hair is trimmed and placed properly.  Don't be put off by the decor!

2.description: Great old school barbers. These guys even speak in Italian. Yea, I wish they took credit cards but the cuts are cheap $10-15 with tip for a guy's cut. I used to do the Supercuts in-and-out special, thinking a hair cut is a hair cut. But these guys spend twice as much time for the same price and do a way better job. Time for my pre-Christmas cut.

0.description: The best haircut in Chicago, hands down.Such great quality Mike takes in each haircut. I lived in DC for a year and traveled back to Chicago a couple of times. Didn't let anyone in DC touch my hair. Every time I was in town, I'd see Mike. He was worth the wait.You will guaranteed get lined up in the back better than anyone can do it. Just tell him what you are looking for and he will work with you.

12.description: I have been eating at this Mr. Sub for quite some time, and it isssss delicious!  My favorite things to order are: Roast Beef & Turkey combo, Mr. Submarine, or the Steakburger with only Cheese and Lettuce.  The Ham and Turkey combo isn't bad either.  They have many other choices additional to these as well, and plenty of things I haven't tried yet.  I also have to mention, this place makes some of the best damn french fries I've ever had.  They are always fresh made to order, hot, and salty.  They are the PERFECT pair to any sandwich you could get here.  Hell - I would order their fries as a meal.  In addition to their food being delicious, the place is open super late and they have a drive through.  It makes for some delicious meals after a long night of drinking, or even a late night snack.  And it's great that you can drive up, get your sandwich, and go home - especially in the wintertime.  And shoot, if you're out riding your bike...just pull up in the drive through lane.  They also serve walkers and bikers as well, so no need to let your bike sit outside while you go in to order.Of course, there is a reason why I am giving them only 4 stars - and I will explain that now.  One thing that really irritates me is they never write anything down.  There have been several times when my sandwich is screwed up, even after repeating my order to them 4 times.  There have been instances where they repeat it back to me correctly, and still make the wrong damn sandwich.  And it's not like I am ordering anything complicated - king size Roast Beef & Turkey Combo with everything including mayo - and there are times when I get my sandwich and it's just Turkey with no mayo only oil, or vice versa.  Once I even got one with mustard on it - not cool.  This is the only downside to the place...and honestly, I've been eating here on a regular basis (about once every 2-4 weeks) for about 8 years, and when you eat somewhere that frequently mistakes are bound to happen.  Besides that, the place is good enough for me to continue eating there.  I love it!

7.description: i love mr. submarine!!!  eat it!

20.description: "Mr. Submarine another fine artery clogging place! They have a pretty good selection of really good and I really good fries. You can a host of subs and sammiches from the pepper and egg sub or just plain traditional turkey or meatball subs and they also have the standard meat laced ones too. Just as a not during the no school months be aware of the "gang banger fourteen year olds" hanging out like flies around... anyway, it's got decent food for the cost and I'd recommend using drive thru and getting it to go.

19.description: I used to go to lunch here all the time when I was a kid...and now that I'm pregnant I'm finding that I need to send my hubby here at least 3 times a week! I love the hot roast beef sub...it's so yummy. I don't understand the obsession, but it's really good!!

1.description: Subs, Italian beef, wings, gyros, ice cream, shakes, fries.  You name it and you can probably get it here.  I stopped by for a chocolate shake which was $2.99 for 22 oz.  It is hard to mess up a chocolate shake and that did not happen here.  The shake was great and service was friendly.  I look forward to stopping by this location that also has a drive thru to have some quick filling meals.

2.description: Best food. Always a delight eating at this Chicago Classic. Get the corn beef with cheese fries. Hot and fresh everytime! :)

9.description: This location is horrible.  Used to love their subs (not this location's per say, but the chains, back in high school).  On TWO different occasions, I walked in, walked up to counter to order, and the same unhappy looking lady was standing there counting her drawer.  No acknowledgement at all.  Not even a glance in my direction.  After 4 minutes or so and a couple of well placed throat clears, y'know in case she missed the DING when I opened the door, or the presence of someone standing 3 feet away in an otherwise empty (go figure) store.  Let out a "screw this" as I turned to leave, and even then there was NO acknowledgement.   I would give them zero stars if I could.  Will never be back again, (shame on me for giving them a second chance) and from the looks of the empty place on my two visits, I'm betting a lot of people feel the same way...

6.description: I was very disappointed with my visit to Mr. Submarine, it ruined my whole day and I was very up set. I ordered 7 Mr. Sub sandwiches, paid 50 dollars and I felt like I was ripped off and did not get what I paid for. We were going to eat inside but my wife said it was way to cold in your restaurant (heat set so low), no big deal we decided to eat in the car instead. The problem is when we were eating in the car, we noticed all of our sandwiches did not have any tomatoes on them. The menu clearly states the sandwiches come with tomatoes. I went back in the store and told the lady that none of the sandwiches had tomatoes and her response was she did not put tomatoes because tomatoes are so expansive now a days. I paid for sandwiches with tomatoes and did not get any. I told her I would never go to that restaurant again (she did not care). She look like she may have been a polish lady and spoke with a accent. I spent 50 dollars there and was not given what I paid for. Also one sandwiches was suppose to have extra meat that I paid for and I did not get that either. You would think that if someone spends 50 dollars you would get the royal treatment but instead I got crapped on. Thank you very much!

18.description: Very average.  I had the Italian Sub and was not impressed.  The meats were fine but not exctptional, and the bread was mediocre.  I'd rather have a sub from a chain restaurant - even Subway.  Service was not good or bad.  I probably won't go back unless someone I am with wants to go there.

10.description: Walked in and out..why? Because the lady working there was spraying fantastic cleaner on the microwaves directly above the meats and cheese that where uncovered letting the spray go on the food. Sorry, but as good as there subs are i dont feel like getting sick. Def not coming to this one again..

13.description: I grew up eating mr subs.  Over time the amount of meat and extras they out in have slimmed down (4 star), but they still taste the same.  I only get the king mr sub with cheese fries.  Can't go wrong with a mr. Sub, take note this isn't for those "watching" there waste line

16.description: The bread is like the wonder bread of sub rolls. meh. Without good bread, what is the point really? And the cheese? Pretty gross white stuff of ambiguous origin. The only veggies are shredded head lettuce, flavorless tomatoes and tons and tons of very thinly sliced onions. The onions might save these subs if they had anything else at all to work with, but alas, everything else is crap. It is hard to imagine that any place would make a Subway seem to be a better alternative, but Mr Submarine manages somehow to pull it off.

17.description: Love this place. We frequent this joint on basketball game nights at school or when we are loafing around the neighborhood and need to eat! I really like the fact that they have something for everyone in my family. I love the subs....(did you know the turkey sub is actually better for you than a comparable sub at Subway...look it up!!) Okay so they don't have all the weird extras on a sandwich like subway offers, but for what it has....it's great. I DIG their turano bread. It's WAY better than the "freshly made" bread at subway.  My one daughter loves the chicken sub. It's warm seasoned chicken on a sub. She orders it everytime we go there. I love the turkey or the roast beef, so does my hubby. My other two can get a hot dog or anything else that floats their boat that evening. Their fries are really good too. Nice n' Crisp, and when making it a cheese fry....whooaaa watch out waist line. BUT SO GOOD. The lady who works there is VERY FRIENDLY. She knows us and asks about the kids if I am by myself, and literally comes out from behind the counter and will hug the kids when we come in as a family. I like that they have a drive thru too...when the kids are a sleep in the car or we just need a quick bite. I dig this place for their wider variety of a menu than most sub places, and for the cleanliness, friendliness, and overall quality of food.

15.description: Wow I really like this place....I mean for what it is, a sub shop.............it's awesome!!!! The Turano Bread is the best for subs in my opinion. Its also alot better than that freshly made artifial tasting Subway bread....blahhhhhhhhh wow dude that bread is weird! Well my guy from work Tommie AKA dragon slayer (he plays dungeons & dragons) ran to the Mr Sub by work and picked us up some submarines...........My mr Sub was awesome!!!!I also got a chubby pickle on the side!! You gotta get the chubby pickle!a great meal for under 4 bucks!!!!Also Mr Subs usually are Hipster free........Shake & bake seal of approval!

0.description: The King Mr Sub is by far my FAVORITE! Of course with Extra Cheese!! If you get the Fries, make sure you ask for them Crispy!!The inside could use some remodeling lol but I never eat there anyways so I guess it doesnt matter.They are open Late!!!

5.description: I had very low expectations for this place, but was pleasantly surprised. Don't come in here expecting an artisan sandwich with gourmet toppings and you won't be disappointed. You can buy mozzarella sticks per mozzarella stick-which is pretty cool. If you're looking for a no frills place to get a sandwich, this is your place. And it's dirt cheap! I got a large turkey sub for $6.50 and it was MASSIVE. You pay about a dollar more at Potbelly for literally half the amount of sandwich.

11.description: This location needs to have its sandwich makers go to the location downtown to learn how to make sandwichs, a refresher course at minimum. I went through the drive through recently, I ordered an italian and asked for a little extra italian dressing. The guy grabbed what looked like a clear ketchup bottle with a mix of vinegar and oil but he did not shake it first. I poured me straight oil...obviously he doesnt know a thing about italian dressing, nor have a clue. I also thought the cold cuts were extremely thin and so were the overall portions of meat.

8.description: It's so sad. i think these guys used to be open real late a lot of the time. And they close so much earlier now than from when I remember. But they have AWESOME subs. Fresh. Flavorful. Good quality ingredients. Really good bread. Even the fries are pretty good too. These subs are not "empty" the way Subway subs are. (you know.... like you're eating a whole lot of NOTHING).  These subs are almost finger-lickin good.I usually get the turkey sub and or the seafood sub with a crabmeat salad. As scary as that sounds, it's really good!Really. Truly. Very affordable and very delicious. I really wish there were more of these shops all over the city and that they stayed open much later for night owls like me.

3.description: This is a cheap juice joint. Extensive menu means they are not the best at anything. You can get full for $5, but its not great food. Great for a quick cheap lunch, when you dont need to impress anyone.

14.description: Mr. Submarine has the best Italian sub sandwiches I have ever had!  This is their signature sandwich, called by the same name.  They use fresh sesame seed white bread and raw onions.  You can get a regular or King size.  The regular will fill you up just fine, but if you're a man, or very hungry, get the King.  The regular is a mere five bucks.  The consistency of the subs is right on.The restaurant is pretty old school.  There are a couple of arcade games, and a TV.  My boyfriend and I have been there three times in the past two weeks.  And we dream about going there when it's just too darn cold to walk that far.  The first time we went, a guy about 40 years old, leaped out from behind the counter and proceeded to dance and do a back flip to the beat of some mad techno they were playing in the kitchen.  We will be back, many, many times in the future.  I do hope to eventually try another sub.

4.description: I just finished one of their King Mr. Subs at my desk downtown - a few times a year, sometimes a few times a month, I stop by to get a sandwich through their drive-through window on my way from home to work in the Loop. Sometimes I call ahead and it's waiting for me at the window. Rarely, I'll walk in and eat at a table. For twenty years I've been a satisfied Mr. Sub customer. As I was just eating it, I thought to look up what Yelp reviews have to say about a place that I like.I wasn't planning to write any review until I saw some of the negative posts. I don't doubt those reviewers - every kind of business has off days and off employees - and Mr. Sub is probably no exception. But those negative comments really run against what I've personally seen and experienced at this and many other Mr. Sub locations over the years, from Mannheim Road to Lincoln Avenue to Portage Park to the Loop. What's set out in the bad posts just isn't typical.The sesame seed bread really is great - the meats and cheese are tasty and presented generously, not like the stingy sandwiches at Subway, sold by means of misleading posters that exaggerate - and most importantly, the sandwich tastes great and is filling. Good texture, crunchy onions, good, fresh tomatoes, and all the rest. And the price is a bargain.If you are an epicure and want the best Italian Sub in Chicago, go to Bari Deli on Grand or Graziano's on Washington during the business day, call ahead or stand in line, and you'll get a great sub at a very reasonable price. I support them both.But if that's not a handy option, if you want a really good, fresh, sub sandwich from many convenient locations at what's frankly a bargain price, Mr. Sub has my top rating.

3.description: Here's why you should go to this Jewel.  It's super close to the Jeff Park CTA Station (either by foot or by 85 Central Southbound bus), and it has a Redbox.  Who doesn't like movies for $1???

1.description: One of the older, smaller stores of the chain.  Selections are limited due to physical space.  Store just seems dirty and messy compared to the location on Irving/Cicero.

2.description: Dont go there.. especially if you want to be bugged by the TCF bank tellers bugging you to sign up for an account as soon as you enter the store..  i rather go to the Jewel store at Harlem an Foster Location..

9.description: This Jewel sucks. The selection is tiny, and they don't have as many vegetarian or organic selections as other Jewels in the city. I've found that trader joe's has a better price on their vegetarian/organic items than Jewel does. Avoid this dump, and grocery shop somewhere else.

10.description: This store still sucks, they deserve less than one star... went here today around 2:00... not one shopping cart available in the store, had to go outside and grab 3 cause 2 old ladies were standing there waiting too... a lot of the aisles had a bunch of pallets and misc stuff sitting around making it very difficult to get around... the lines were LONG and SLOW. I hate this store so much, but I didn't have time to go to the Jewel at 6 corners.... someone needs to close this shithole!

4.description: I am going to have to agree with the majority of my fellow yelpers who have reviewed this Jewel. This place is dirty. Really dirty. Its so dirty that I decided to roll up my pants so the bottoms wouldn't touch the bottom of my pants. The customer service is non existent because they probably cant afford to hire people for the various departments. The deli is filthy and the fresh food isn't as fresh as they claim it to be. The vegetables look like someone took them outback and beat them senselessly. The massive renovation won't fix the crappiness of this store. I would steer clear of this place to a better Jewel worthy of my business.

6.description: The reason I am giving this store such a high rating, is because I am grateful to have a full service grocery store in the neighborhood! I was glad to see Jewel invest in some capital improvements. Its in a great location with easy parking and reasonable lines. You do not have to waste time looking for parking or waiting in lines. I never met anyone rude at the store. I would agree that there is a larger selection of fresh produce at other stores. But if your just getting the basics such as bananas, lettuce, potatoes, etc. It will meet your needs. I feel that some of the other reviewers are being overly critical. I go there quite a bit, nobody from TCF bank has ever approached me, the store is not filthy, and there are always shopping carts or baskets available. But don't take my word for it, or anybody elses. Just go to the store for yourself. The grocery store has a large selection of items without the jacked up prices of convenient stores.

11.description: I used to shop here fairly regularly, despite the fact that they don't have many natural/organic foods and produce is marginal (I once bought a bag of apples and all but 3 were rotten). But the last straw was when a woman at the Deli counter actually rolled her eyes at me when I came back to place an additional order (apparently I interrupted her conversation with co-workers). I will no longer shop here. The locations on Foster and Irving Park are much nicer and have better selection anyway.

5.description: What a dump.  This place is absolutely filthy, everything in the  produce section is on the verge of rotting right in its case.  I think this is where normal Jewel stores send their produce to die.  I'm not sure if the stench I noticed as I was leaving came from the homeless man in line behind me, or the cashier, or the spilled who-knows-what that was caked all over the linoleum floor, but it was FOUL.  I'd sooner shop for groceries in a gas station.

7.description: Careful... watch what you buy...

8.description: Jewels always pricey but they're walking distance. I caught a thief of theirs out running their security guard last summer in a park across from my house. Note to ladies dont leave yr purse on the shopping cart. Staff is always awesome!

0.description: Not 5 stars cause they are still not quite there with organics, however, had I reviewed them a year ago, it would have been 1 star. They have come along way since then. Their produce is much better, their selection of discounts is great and even their floral department is 100x better! I'm glad I  no longer have to pay for pea pod.

29.description: surprise surprise when I went to Sears to look for patio furniture and sit in them. Found a sales guy who told me that it was cheaper for me to order it on the kiosk rather than for him to input it. Saved $40 and it was easy.  I expected to go home and wait the 2 hrs for it to arrive at merchandise pick up, but as I went down the escalator, i got the email saying it was ready.  Needless to say, I was loaded and ready to go home in less than an hour from start to finish.

42.description: I wish I could give this place zero stars. Our alternator died and we had to tow our car here bc it is the only place my boyfriend knew to take it. They took forever to change it, and BROKE 3 things on the way in!!!!!!! The dipstick, and also created an antifreeze leak! Also screwed up the electronics on the car, where the lights make the windows work, and locks trigger the horn, etc. FINALLY they were able to fix the electronics problem, but my baby has never been the same since. Also tried to replicate keys here, could not get it right after 2 tries. Went to home depot, no problem. Avoid at all costs.

23.description: The only good thing about this Sears is that it has an easy-to-access parking lot. Other than that, I don't get why people still shop here. The prices are horrific- why do people buy clothes at department stores anymore?! Go to the Marshall's right next door and get the SAME stuff for 40% of the price. Not exaggerating. Also, as many other reviews have noted, customer service is appalling. Not only is it difficult to find anyone to help you, but once you do, they tend to not be able to help you and direct you to someone else. Do yourself a favor and shop at Marhalls/TJ Maxx for clothes, and craigslist/amazon for appliances.

47.description: My cousin sent an e-mail that said that when a Sears employee who is in the reserves is called to active duty, Sears will pay the difference between their Sears pay, and what the service will pay them (almost always less).Way to Go Sears !!!I'll be doing my Christmas shopping @ Sears this year.

8.description: I just went to Sears in Portage Park to ask about a replacement part for the vacuum I purchased at their store less than a year ago.  The sales guy couldn't be bothered, was entirely unhelpful, and dismissive.

31.description: Where to begin.. UGH!  Purchased a dryer a little under a year ago. Last week it stopped working. I didn't buy the extended warranty, BUT it came with a manufacturers warranty of 1 year. So I am covered. Made an appointment for next day, had to take off of work. Tech stated loose wire caused problem. Ok.. That night started to do laundry again. (rewashed the clothes from the previous day). Put them in the dryer and what do you know, a new error comes up and dryer shuts down again. UGH X 2! Call for 2nd appt. came out next afternoon (Yes their reps are overseas, and hard to understand). Tech arrives, states everything looks fine, except the dryer vent was disconnected and stated that should be connected. No duh! The tech yesterday must have knocked it out. He started the dryer, I stayed and watched my towels tumble for about 10 minutes. Everything looked good.. NOT... Went to take the towels out, and what do you know..Towels are damp and error code flashing. I call back Sears for someone to come back out tonight. Nope they stop working at 5:00 p.m. Even if it is warranty and it wasn't fixed the first two times. I ask to talk to a manager, they transfer me to the "escalated dept." (yep I was raising my voice). He was not overseas. Rep proceeds to tell me they don't do after hour calls unless its medical. So I tell him, the mold from my wet clothes is making me ill. That doesn't fly, he giggles. He states I have to take off work AGAIN. Two days I already took off. I threatened with I will call another company and you will pay... That doesn't fly either, he states no matter how much I complain they will not make appointments after 5:00 p.m. they do not compensate for lost wages (Really? lol)  nor do they compensate 3rd party repair companies.  So all in all I'm screwed.. I have laundry piled up, just got back from vacation, and have kids... Sears doesn't care about the consumer or making them happy, even after 2 trips already. Think twice about purchasing your appliances through them, unless you can take off of work whenever you want at their leisure. One good thing, is that they never charged me for the service calls, but now I am still out a dryer and ticked off beyond belief...

34.description: Dryer wouldn't spin. Diagnosed as a safety latch problem. $195. Dryer still wouldn't spin. Set new appt. They cancelled without notifying me. I reset it. Turns out they misdiagnosed and want to charge me another $175 for the real problem.  GO ANYWHERE ELSE.

16.description: Sears  lost a 25 yr customer  today all week theyve been advertising a fridge on tv for $899 I go today and they tell me the commercial was a mistake they can't sell me the fridge at that price so it was  practically false advertisement to attract customer's I spoke to a manager pretty much told me take a hike ina nicer way I ended up getting the same fridge at home depot for $950  sears wanted $1300 and wouldnt even acknowledge there own sale unbelievable never going back.

13.description: I had a pleasant experience today, Monday 1/13/2015.  I went to this Sears and bypassed the one closer to me on W. Lawrence, because I find the W. Lawrence too overstuffed with inventory and needing an upgrade.  I went into the Irving Park Sears and it was clean, well lit, organized.  It didn't look like a rummage sale like the W. Lawrence store does.  I found some really good bargains - 40 to 50% off.  The bad part:  Do a price check.  Some of the prices listed did not scan the same.  For example I picked up a pair of PJs, advertised for 14.99 and they scanned for 8.99!  Somebody in inventory is not doing their job.We need department stores and I hate to see the major stores closing.  They seem to be the only places where you can buy name brand everything (from appliances to furniture to clothing) in one shop.

11.description: I wanted to write this review to let it be known that the manager in charge took care of me when I had an issue with a ring I had previously purchased. I work in retail and I know its sometimes not easy to step outside the strict rules but she took care of the situation and I am grateful and I can recommend Sears for your jewelry needs!

39.description: If you ever want family pictures taken and not have the experience end with you wanting to rip someone's head off their neck, do NOT go here for your portraits. The "portrait studio" at Sears (6 Corners) is THE FREAKING WORST. Period. Staffed with idiots, half-wits, and dopes. Their ONLY job it seems is to try and up-sale the crap out of you on dumb junk that costs too much to begin with. Nickel and dimming you the whole time. They do their best to not let you know the prices of anything until pictures are taken and you see what they look like. THEN anything and everything adds to your bill $25 at a time. We went one evening more out of fun for a fun gift for a friend and ended up waiting around for our turn (only two people ahead of us) for what seemed like 4 days but was probably just 2 days. Our kids were ready to melt down by hour two and I was ready to start whipping picture frames at their staff just to get their attention (oh, and did I mention we were there then because we called and got an appointment... not sure what good that was...). They must have all trained at the post office. Slow. Dumb. Not helpful. Not pleasant. Not good at any aspect of their job. By the end of our experience, we did go ahead and pay for a couple of 8x10 photos so the evening wasn't a total loss... then they told us we had to come back another day to pick them up unless we wanted to pay ANOTHER EXTRA CHARGE to have them print them right then and there (and by the way, printing them means pushing one more freaking button on their computer keyboard...). At that point I was ready to just walk away from the whole thing not paying a dime for any of it. If I thought they would have cared in the least, I might have. I hope Sears closes this and replaces it with an H&R BLOCK office or even just uses the space for storage... Let all these dumb, gas-huffing employees try their luck at finding real jobs where they'll actually have to DO something..I'm bummed out I have to give them even one star... they deserve none... so I squint my eyes so I don't see it as a star so much as a sore puckered anus. They get one puckered anus from me.

37.description: I ordered a service call to have a dryer repaired. Tech came late, stayed 20 minutes and said dryer was fixed. However, the dryer was not fixed.According to the receipt he left, he "cleaned chute"- a brand new chute that I installed 2 days ago, so it could not possibly have been clogged. Tech did not check heating element or any of the relay switches, which we assumed to be the problem.I tried to resolve the issue and reschedule the repair service ASAP, but I had no  luck with the overseas call center. I have been told that someone will call me in 24-48 hours to reschedule. I cannot wait by the phone for a call that may not come, just to reschedule.I have already paid $116 for service that did not resolve my problem. And now I would need to take another day off work to meet a tech, leaving me without a dryer for yet another week?This is strike 2 for SEARS. Their auto service is equally lame.

0.description: The prices at this location are very good, especially when you can find a special or sale.  But the store in general is very disorganized and sometimes it is hard to find a sales associate.

38.description: Dryer repair -- 4 days to get appointment (8am-12) finally got call at 2 that he could arrive at 2:30...  so I had to reschedule...next appointment was for following week between 1-5 pm...received a call at 7 pm that he could come by.  Forget it!!!If you like to skip work, waste time, and not get your appliance repaired, feel free to have the same experience that I did...I will find someone else to do the work -- I will keep searching until I can report a positive review --  stay tuned!

51.description: This local Sears is one of their busiest nationally and feels much more like a traditional Sears store than the new one downtown.  I am not a frequent shopper here but go occasionally for their optical shop and sometimes other things.  It has been recently remodeled though it still feels a bit old fashioned -- probably due to the large number of levels (5), with low square footage on some of the levels.  It seems to draw a heavily Hispanic clientele.  In general it is not a bad store and has a reasonably good selection.

27.description: i wish i could give them a BIG 0 this store i got a ring form here and its broke twice i sent it to get fixed again and they told me i should add more silver when which that  would cost more to ass the silver then what i paid for it.... meaning not worth it. i said to send it back to the store so i can have a refund and over a month later i didn't hear anything i called the store to hear oh we just got it today.... which i know is bull.. i'm making all my purchases else where from now on and i think you should too.

32.description: This Sears got rid of their entire Big and Tall inventory for mens. Maximum waist size is 46, average waist size is 42. You would be lucky to find a 46.

48.description: Bought a pair of Levis Shrink to Fit 501 Jeans. I'm wearing them right now!As one would say on Ebay: Prompt,excellent service. A pleasure to do business with!The bathroom is easily accessible too. Yay to that.

44.description: This place has the worst customer service i have ever experienced.  I had to look for a while to find an employee.  One girl referrred me to someone in appliances to help me with my questing regarding a vacuum cleaner.  It seems he was too busy to help me and said he had other customers waiting- no doubt he wanted to sell bigger ticket items.  The only person who could help me was on break and could not be reached.  After returning an hour later from shopping elsewhere in the strip mall I found someone to help me (I needed sears brand filters for my vacuum).  I would never ever return to this or any other Sears store.  I hope between Best Buy and Amazon this place gets put out of business.

24.description: Best store ever !!! Anyone have a problem talk to Sabrina the appliance and electronics lead she will help you ..

7.description: I joined Sears Home Warranty Service and the customer is so bad, nobody speak English and don't care about the customers or their opinions. If you are thinking about being a member you will be disappointed. I called 5-6 times and couldn't get a straight answer out of nobody. I cancelled my membership and would not recommend this nightmare to anyone

49.description: I've brought my car here several times for simple repairs, and they always caused more problems.... One good thing is they don't try to blame the problems they cause on you :-). All you have to do is wait there longer while they *try* to fix the problem. I also think they are too busy.  Maybe I just had bad luck with mechanics there. who knows.

40.description: OK, this review might out me as being one of the least cool people you've ever met but I ended up with a few shirts from this aging wreck of a retail model and (gulp) I liked them. Back story: As a bartender at a neighborhood joint I frequently wear many hats- therapist, technology adviser, concierge, referee and sometimes even lending institution. Through an ill advised transaction I ended up with a Sears gift card as collateral. I didn't want it initially but the amount was more than twice the small loan so what the heck right? Needless to say after a few months I ended up stuck with the card. I tried to find something from their online store. But I couldn't find a single item that I wanted... not even at half price. So I stick it in my wallet and forget until I find myself across the street at my bank with time to kill. I decide to go spend this thing. I'll kill two birds by freeing up space in my wallet and wasting a few minutes. Walking into this place was like walking into a time machine. I don't think I'd been in a Sears (department store that is... their auto centers are another story) since 1985 when I slept in the parking lot waiting for the "Ticketron" to open so I could score tickets for Dire Straits or some other awful show. This huge, overstaffed, poorly stocked store had the overwhelming smell of corporate bankruptcy. I mean the employee to item of merchandise ratio had to be 1 to 100. That's not good. The half full racks reminded me of grainy pictures of the pre-glastnost Russian's consumer plight. Anyway, I make my way past the embarrassingly empty shelves and chitchatting employees to the tools... nothing I need. I hit the BBQ grill area... nothing I need. After the kitchen implement section I'm 0-3. Running out of options, I end up in the men's clothing department where I find button down, short sleeved shirts on sale. $9.99? I try a few on and they fit. I'm shocked. See, I'm a little misshapen. I'm not tall enough to be a tall, not short enough to be a short. And when you wear a 50 suit jacket with my 19" neck it's hard to a shirt that works. But it's like these shirts were tailored for the averaged heighted, thick necked man. My interior monologue screams at me "Holy crap you're about to buy clothing from Sears!!!" I fight through pride and shamefully walk out with five shirts that fit better than anything hanging in my closet. While I can't believe the income can justify the real estate they occupy at Cicero and Irving and I'm certain they will go out of business soon, until they're gone (sigh) I might buy my shirts, and nothing else, here.

30.description: Sears has really been getting a bad reputation in the press and media lately. I must admit that I really do not go to Sears very often for anything. Before this past week, I can't actually remember the last time I set foot in a Sears. We needed a new window A/C unit as ours took a crap in the middle of this early 2012 heat wave. We went to the Home Depot first and they didn't have any. They said that they would not get them until June. That is not really going to do us any good now is it?We decided to go to Sears to find one and that we did. I was dreading this trip in a way because for some reason I associate major purchases with waiting, frustration and aggravation. This purchase was far from that. We found the A/C's right away and we took a few minutes to decide on the one we wanted. We found a guy to help us right away and it took a matter a minutes to ring us up. We went to the mechanistic pick up area and one again in a matter of minutes we had our A/C and we were out the door!It was a very painless experience indeed

46.description: Had a HORRIBLE washer/dryer purchase experience that ended in returning the product-twice!  Their management is downright disorganized and clueless and their phone-in customer service located on the other side of the planet and cannot resolve any issues-even after spending 20 minutes ON HOLD.

1.description: Sears as a business model is a sad thing of the past. I can see it now. It is the 90's. Sears is fighting to compete with the likes of Walmart and other large box retailers. People want to buy electronics, kitchen appliances, clothes and all at the same place. Sears is struggling to hold on, we have the Sears tower. Six Corners is the next biggest shopping district outside of the loop. Sears today. Lonely. Big. Empty. Though I may be slightly dissing Sears I can't lie that I have been here to pick up a few things on the down low. It can be affordable and convenient if you live in the Six Corners neighborhood. Paired with the Auto Shop, the dentist office, eyeglasses. I mean they have everything here. In my mind I think that this place needs to go in order to revamp the SC area completely. Maybe the Sears can stay but the building exterior needs an update really bad.

9.description: My parents bought a new refrigerator about 6 months ago. The deliver men did deliver it on time. However, they didnt hook up the ice machine and came back to do that. Also, as they were taking out the old one, they ripped the floor. My dad called and sent them pictures. They said they'd replace it, but still havent. All they do is give him a big run around. Their customer service is non existant. It used to be, Sears was a great store to purchase from

26.description: So I went to Sears to look at televisions since mine recently crapped out on me..  Having been born and raised in the neighborhood I have been to the 6 corners Sears a ton in my past....  However, I have not been there as of more recent and I was pleasantly surprised!!!!!  Upon entering the store I was greeted by the sales person, Dan, and he welcomed all the questions I was concerned with.  The store was clean and inviting, a change from what I remember in the past, perhaps under new management or the direction of someone who cares???  Either way the store was clean, and inviting to say the least...  Dan answered all my questions, was not pushy and listened to what I neede and why I was there....  TV was in stock, which he personally even went to the back to make sure, and I am now watching TV in style...  Big thanks to Dan for recommending an awesome TV within my budget, the staff at Sears for being polite and professional and to what appears new management taking pride in their store.  I will be back soon and spread the news to the neighbors that Sears is back and dare I say more improved!!!!!!!!

25.description: just try and return a TV- Ha

12.description: Customer service here only exist around the major appliances.buying a $2400 stove or a $800 tv they all over you.if you going for clothes or shoes,fagetaboutit you on your own.this place does have deals up the ying yang.every floor has a huge discount section.these are unannounced sales also.so well worth stopping in.

21.description: Clueless staff!Management needs to do a better job training and scheduling!!I came here earlier this week to pick up some tools. I find 4 of their staff just congregating near the toolbox section when they could be doing something more productive.I came in today to make to make a return. I asked the ONE lady downstairs for help and to check-out. As she was helping another patron, she said that she would be right there. I waited 10 minutes for her to come back to the register. She then tells me that she's still "working" with a customer and that she cannot do my return or checkout because someone else is logged into the register?!!!? Wtf?!!Then this lady tells me to go upstairs to an open register.Apparently she was too busy to have called someone to help me out OR tell me to go upstairs WHEN I ASKED, 10 MINUTES AGO!!

17.description: Clueless staff!Management needs to do a better job training and scheduling!!I came here earlier this week to pick up some tools. I find 4 of their staff just congregating near the toolbox section when they could be doing something more productive.I came in today to make to make a return. I asked the ONE lady downstairs for help and to check-out. As she was helping another patron, she said that she would be right there. I waited 10 minutes for her to come back to the register. She then tells me that she's still "working" with a customer and that she cannot do my return or checkout because someone else is logged into the register?!!!? Wtf?!!Then this lady tells me to go upstairs to an open register.Apparently she was too busy to have called someone to help me out OR tell me to go upstairs WHEN I ASKED, 10 MINUTES AGO!!

10.description: Getting oil change today the counter person told me it's about an hour wait even with just oil change.  There are maybe 6 customers in front of me.  The one tech happened to step up to the counter and said he will do the oil change right away.  That's what you call great customer service.  We have been coming to this location for years for oil changes there are times I had to wait for 45-60 mins or longer but today it's different shout out to tech Aaron who's doin the service now.  Hope every tech at Sears is just like Aaron thanks Aaron.  Shout out to the counter guy didn't get his name but he's friendly and helpful.  Keep up the great work guys!

5.description: My father and I went for a walk and decided to pop into Sears just to look around. We started looking at the different appliances available. The woman on the floor followed us around everywhere, on our tails, thirsty af.Please, get off my d*ck.
