3.description: I don't recommend any one buy matters from them I went and I buy matters for 1500$ and I don't want the spring box Coz my bed are high they ship me the spring box and then I called to let them pick up the spring box and they told me I will lose the warranty if I send the spring box and I will not risk 1500$ matters for that so I told them to pick the matters and and the spring box and for 5 days now ever morning wake up at 8 cancelled the appointment and call at 7 at night to reschedule I don't understand how they think Pepole don't have jobs and life to do that then when I call the manager he say we been canceled Coz the elevator and I don't have one in my building and I live in the first floor  they keep lying everyday about it I want trust what they say any more !my house is studio I can't move Coz of the matters taking all room in the house so they play games all time about I went buy matters from sleepy for the same price with 10 years warranty and they deliver it next day and they are so nice and I'm really happy with there costume Service !!

35.description: If I could leave Sears a zero star review I would. I'd even pay for it!! Never buy a big ticket item from Sears, ever. Biggest mistake of my life. I bought a $923 dishwasher and wasn't given the opportnity to choose even what part of the day it might be delivered. The next day (not the scheduled day) the sub-contractor, Galaxy something or other, says they tried to deliver at 11am, with no phone call prior. The sub then calls and leaves a message on the secondary contact number at 15min before their closing to select a time the next morning. The next morning calls were placed to the sub and no one responded. The following day after that calls were placed to both the sub (Galaxy) and to Sears. No on responded from the sub and Sears never called back as two different people promised. The next day the order was cancelled, despite customer service trying twice to reschedule and STILL wouldnt give a choice on time frames. I just got my statement today and its still on there. I called customer service and guess what? They cant help me, becuase it has to be a credit issued by the store purchased from. As soon as I get this straightened out I am cancelling my card. These people are beyond the worst, beyond pathetic, they deserve to have Best Buy, Target and Wal-Mart run them out of business!!

19.description: You know how when you go to Target looking for something specific they usually have it.  And a "good one" to boot!  This Sears usually doesn't have it.  And if they do it's some shitty model.  My errands never end here.

28.description: I found something I really needed here, but the customer service was HORRIFIC.  Not only did multiple people ignore me, but three people essentially said "ask someone else" when I needed help and I had to bog down the poor cashier who had a long line of people wishing to check out just to try to get my problem fixed.I tried to call the other Sears stores in the area to find this item, and they were absolutely not helpful.  I don't know if they have archaic computers, bad manager, or just really low expectations of their employees/customers, but this was one of the worst experiences of my retailing life.Also, the "national" customer service line is just as bad.  SO MUCH ATTITUDE!  I felt like it was 1990 when you'd call the customer service line and they'd just give you a hard time instead of helping.  The service in these stores really needs a lift!

45.description: I will never buy tires at this Sears again.  I waited and waited and waited for over an hour with a toddler only to find that they hadn't even begun on my car.  I took my car down the street (I strongly suggest you go to Majestic for your tires.), was in and out in less than 30 minutes and the tire was $30 less than at Sears .

33.description: Wow.  WOW. Wow, wow...WOW.  And NOT in the good way.I recent attempted to make a return to this store after purchasing a darling but defective Lands End coat.  After consulting with the Lands End online customer service rep (who was VERY sweet and helpful), she gave me the internal code for the purchase that would be necessary for the return, as I could not find the original receipt, and said I could make the return at the Sears on Irving.Made it to this Sears locale the day after Christmas, expecting there would be additional staff to handle returns.  UH...no.I made it to the Customer Service/Checkout/Return station, only to be greeted with ONE cashier gamely trying to handle a complicated return that invovled an old Sears credit card that no longer was in the customers possession, a MOUNTAIN of returned items scattered all over the area in heaps and humps, and other huffy people waiting to make their purchases/returns.Immediately my "WTF?!" radar went off and I braced myself for a long wait and began thinking about happy fluffy bunnies and smoosh piles of kittens to keep me sane.  After five minutes of waiting with other inmates while the ONE cashier tapped at a screen and looked confused, another gal came up and handled the next customer...and then WALKED AWAY, leaving the one gal STILL dealing with the demented return.  Ugggghhhhhhhhh!  Finally, I make it up to the lone cashier after about ten minutes in line, which is about nine minutes too many.  The cashier was calling for additional help on the reigsters via a walkie talkie without any real luck, while other Sears staff members walked around and halfheartedly put away some of the growing return mountain. I explained the situation to her and she said to me, "But I am new and don't know how to make a return without a receipt!"  DEEP YOGA BREATHS ENSUED.  I ruminated on the aforementioned fluffy bunnies and smoosh piles of kittens.I showed the gal the information as given to me by Lands End, and she finally pulled up a screen that ostentisibly would handle the LE return.  She typed in the numbers  that were given to me and..."This says there are not enough numbers," she said to me, pained and nervous.I looked at the screen as she typed in the information and, lo and behold, she was right.  Amd THIS, dear readers, is where I would expect another staffer to come over, a manager, perhaps, and HELP ME?!  You know, at customer SERVICE?! Because I was a CUSTOMER???!!!!She looked at me.  I looked at her.  i was seeing RED and starting to get really, very, and utterly LIVID.All the fluffy bunnies and smoosh piles of kittens in my head were gone, having scampered off elsewhere.After about thirty more seconds of no further conversation, I calmly gathered my belongings and walked away.As I left, I heard the cashier gal say into her walkie talkie, "I am leaving now to take my lunch."Well, today I just read that over 100 Sears stores were closing due to poor sales this holiday season.Yeah, NO SHIT.

43.description: I used to think this place did a great job! I had a few flat tires and they filled them for $20. The last two times I have been it here it was a completely different story. I don't know if they changed management but, the customer service was terrible and apparently now to fill a hole you have to buy a "whole" new tire. Very disappointing. They did say they were short handed but being honest and treating people right can be done with fewer staff...

2.description: So I go to buy a treadmill (which was not in stock at the store) and was told about the delivery and set up fee and declined it at the time.  After a long drive home I decided I would want it, I called them to add the delivery/set up fee on to the order and was told I need to cancel it and do it over.  I said okay do that, she told me sorry you need to come in and do that in person we can't cancel over the phone.  Okay I make the drive back to the store and was told that delivery would be on 10/31 (Saturday) and I paid the extra money for Saturday delivery.  Friday night comes and I get the automated recording that they will be there on 10/31 between 2-4pm great perfect for me since I am at work until 3pm.  Saturday morning comes and I get a call from the delivery driver telling me that they are now coming at 12noon.  I tell him that will not work and I specifically paid for Saturday delivery and later in the day.  He said this is the time we will be there.  After minutes of pleading with him he said let me talk to my boss and I will call you back.  He calls back in 2 minutes and tells me fine we will be there later.  I tell him great and thank you that made my day.  I get home and make sure there is room for them to work.  I sit and wait until 5pm when I finally called the delivery service (calls go to India) and she tells me that the delivery was rescheduled.  I tell her no I didn't reschedule it, the man confirmed that they were coming later like I asked for originally.  She tells me there is nothing she can do about it, and I need to be there Sunday.  I tell her I am working and that will not work, after going back and forth and her reading her cue card over and over I tell her to cancel the order.  She cancels it with no problem (not sure why I had to drive back to store to cancel and redo my order the first time when she did it with no issues).  I decided to call over to the store and speak to a manager.  The manager (Luz) was sooooooo helpful and worked it out to have them come first thing Monday morning and I requested a different driver.  The guys came and set it up with no issues and I still made sure that they were tipped well; after all it was not their fault that the other lazy drivers didn't want to come.  I drive back to the store the same day and tell the managers what happened again and they refunded me all my delivery/setup fees.I get the email about my experience with Sears delivery and fill it out like I did on here and it asks if you want someone to call you about your bad experience I put yes and guess what I am still waiting on a call back from those aholes.PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THEM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!My next bad experience (because I didn't learn from the 1st one) I ordered some earrings on 11/26 and I still have not received them.  I ask about it via on line chat and was told they can escalate it and it would be another 3-5 days, I tell the guy to forget it and cancel the order.  Well that doesn't happen and I go back on line today to the chat and another guy tells me it was escalated and would take 3-5 days I tell him to cancel the order because if it takes you 3-4 weeks to send out some small earrings than I don't need it.PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THEM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!PLEASE STEER CLEAR FROM SEARS   SHOP ANYWHERE ELSE BUT SEARS

18.description: I found something I really needed here, but the customer service was HORRIFIC.  Not only did multiple people ignore me, but three people essentially said "ask someone else" when I needed help and I had to bog down the poor cashier who had a long line of people wishing to check out just to try to get my problem fixed.I tried to call the other Sears stores in the area to find this item, and they were absolutely not helpful.  I don't know if they have archaic computers, bad manager, or just really low expectations of their employees/customers, but this was one of the worst experiences of my retailing life.Also, the "national" customer service line is just as bad.  SO MUCH ATTITUDE!  I felt like it was 1990 when you'd call the customer service line and they'd just give you a hard time instead of helping.  The service in these stores really needs a lift!

41.description: After another bad job hunting experience at this location I have now OFFICIALLY boycotted this particular location maybe I will boycott the company overall. I did another application a few weeks ago and I got the same response that I did not meet their qualifications. I wrote them a letter about my frustrations and I got a response back from them. Only it seemed like they really did not pay attention to my concerns. It seemed like I got a response from a robot or something they just cut and pasted from some handbook corporate uses. It wasn't humanly possible. So if they want to continue to hire people that look like bums off the street and people who sexually harass other workers like I have seen before then they can keep them. I have now officially boycotted them after many years of shopping with them.

52.description: This Sears has been the anchor of the Six Corners neighborhood, and still is with all of the changes going on recently. I imagine all the new homeowners in the area will need to fill up on brand new appliances and clothing here. I have purchased mundane stuff like a vacuum cleaner and a television set from here. I remember when I was a kid and there was a candy counter where you could buy Halls cough drops by the pound!

50.description: I just had one of the best customer service experiences at this store.Some background info.  I go to this Sears about once a year to fill my Levi's 501 habit.  I went yesterday, picked up a pair my size and quickly left.  I got home washed them and noticed they shrunk to clam digger proportions.  I was very unhappy.  I would have to drive back up to portage park from lincoln park.I arrived today and was told by the lil ole lady in the men's department, that I bought the particular 501's that drastically shrink and that I could not exchange them.  I was heated, but kept my cool and explained that they should have a better system of informing the customer that not all 501's are created equal.  She held her ground and said that it was store policy and that Levi's themselves were to blame.  I agreed that it was not her fault, but I also explained that my 32-30's were now 28-26's and if they are to shrink they should put the shrunken size on the label, or I should have been warned by the checkout gal.Maybe she is a sweet ole lady, maybe she was just tired of hearing my bull$hit, but she ultimately told me to grab a pair of "preshrunk" jeans.  I am pleased to announce that these have survived a wash and will be in my starting lineup for the next few months.Thanks Sears, and thank you lil ole lady!

4.description: Still hoping to find a new coat tokeep me warm this winter!According to the Archives this Sears Store location opened it's doorsto the public on October 20,1938.And, I have some fond memories of this store/location, for when I wasgrowing up back in the 60's and 70's My Mom would always take meshopping at Sears, and they were always known for the Best qualityand always had a great selection of everything, they were thriving!And before Christmas every year Sears came out with their AnnualChristmas Wish Book which was a toy catalog and I remember going throughthat book oohing and ahhing, okay, I was a Sucker for toys back then, And I went to see Santa down in the Sears Basement where all the greattoys were at and I always told him I had been a really good girl that year..For the record, I lied through my teeth to Santa about 2 times in hopesof him bringing me one of those great toys from the Wish Book!And, when I was in 6th grade Sears came out to my Grammar Schoolbecause they were offering a Charm School Course, my friend Judyactually signed up and paid for that, however, I didn't need it since I wasalready quite charming...And, this Sears location was always filled with Customers and they had3 Floors filled with Merchandise, they even had a small Cafeteria so onecould shop and have a meal/snack, pretty convenient!But, this past Saturday I re-visited this Sears Store which held suchgreat memories for me, and.. I was truly saddened by what I saw.Everything seems to have been condensed and they only have a fractionof the merchandise that they once had.Gone are the Beauty Salon and the Cafeteria, and there are very few checkout kiosks for their Customers.There are only one set of doors open now, where there used to be 3 andit truly makes me sad that this store which holds such fond memoriesfor me is just a shadow of what it once was...But, I came in on Saturday looking for a Winter Coat since I have beenfeeling so cold, and.. I actually was able to find a lovely faux wool coatby Covington at 40% off!And, for that I say Thank You to Sears, because once again, even afterall of these years they came through for me..But honestly, I have a feeling that Sears won't be around much longer,and I hope that's not the case because that would truly be a tragedy..Sears, a Chicago Institution, which I hope will never go away..Because they always have come through somehow for me..And for me, that pretty much says it all...

6.description: Ridiculous. This Sears has totally turned me off from shopping at Sears. I reserved a crock pot online and was told I had 48 hours to pick it up. When I get there a few hours later, the cashier informed me after a long wait that it had been returned to the shelves and they actually return it to the shelves after an hour. Wish I had been told of that before I made the trek over. One hour and 48 hours is a huge difference. On top of that, their employees are super rude and unhelpful. The man who works at their key center was super flippant and made rude comments to me when I was nothing but polite. They charge more than twice what you'd pay anywhere else for keys.

22.description: We purchased a washer $900, dryer $971, 2 pedestals $460 and 5yr warranty $320. the purchase when smooth and seamless - until it got to the actual delivery. NOT 1 attempt NOT even 2 attempts but 3 attempts and all epic failures. if it wasn't one thing it was another (we own an OLD house) the delivery guys acted like they live in a brand new home. I made every attempt to make the delivery as seamless as the purchase I removed doors and the door trim but STILL things were not good enough.1st attempt water valves were not in the same room as washer/dryer so I had the wall removed, 2nd attempt the water pipe is not a water pipe, it's actually a gas pipe the previous owners Jerry rigged to be a water pipe, I asked the 2nd group of delivery guys to wait 10min while I contacted the sales associate but they told me that I refused the delivery and walked out my house, by the time I got outside they drove off! . the 3rd attempt we actually decided to just have the washer/dryer delivered and we would hire a plumber to come in a install them but washer/dryer were scratched, they looked like they were on and off the truck a many times. Rich the manager said he can have guys come out there to repair them. I said NO thank you if they are damaged on the outside I could only imagine how damaged they really are. Rich the manager did give us $150 refund on the 1st attempt, and $400 refund of the 2nd attempt, but those refunds didn't help with all the aggravation. Rich said he deals with contractors every day w/ no problem, I told him I'm sorry I'm an average joe and not a contractor. By the way they offered us 10% off our next purchase LOL next purchase my foot - We REFUNDED the washer/dryer and have decided to pay full price and go somewhere else.

15.description: Great service, Bilingual, great sales, and has a bit of all one's needs. The store had a great men's department and awesome service was nice they had many sales and the app is great if you go also great appliances my whole house has their appliances. I'm a Sears shopper

20.description: You know how when you go to Target looking for something specific they usually have it.  And a "good one" to boot!  This Sears usually doesn't have it.  And if they do it's some shitty model.  My errands never end here.

36.description: Last fall when I moved into the neighborhood, I would have given this store about 2 stars.  But now, I'm not sure what happened in the last several months, but this place has improved 100%.  I don't know if a new manager came in, or if there was some kind of new over-haul, but I shop here once a week - in all the departments excepts kids (I don't have any).  I love this store - the returns are a piece of cake, the wait in line is 1/3 what it was due to the knowledge of staff and customer care - woo hoo!  The garments personnel have it together at this store.  I am impressed on how clean the fitting rooms are- they are constantly putting away items some customers are to lazy to even bring to the rack!  My hat's off to the employees at this store- it's a difficult location I'm sure, and for me a pleasure and convenience to shop at.

14.description: So for mother's day  the store was closing early so they made announcement  at 5:35pm but he said it was 5:40 pm  the time  5minutes earlier then they said do my lie to get people out of the store

28.description: Hong Kong House is a real pleasure. I have ordered and dined in on numerous occasions and it is safe to say that the staff, who are always polite and competent, will provide you with a good meal. Favorite dishes on mine start our with the pot stickers. These jumbo dumplings of delight are more than a meal on their own if you ask for two orders. Their crab rangoons are some of the best I've had. The only downside is that they don't offer the super sweet orange syrup with them.The fried rice at HKH is especially tasty. You can believe it's good when their Plain fried rice is better than most Chinese kitchens meat loaded offerings.On the downside they have a couple dishes (Orange Beef, Fried Duck) that are a little too fatty or over-fried. Therefore I recommend finding what you do like and sticking with it.Oh, and it would be nice if they threw in some fortune cookies on deliveries.

1.description: Hole in the wall is the most correct descriptor.  It was still winter in Chicago when I first checked them out and it was about 40 degrees (F) outside.  The chill of the outdoors had permeated the double door system meant to keep the weather out.  This all left a chilling feeling inside the dining room.  It was just cozy enough (with my coat on) to allow for enjoyment of my food.If you aren't sure what to get, read reviews!  I kind of went overboard.  Lunch special of General Tso's chicken, which I requested spicy as well as the fried rice.  Egg rolls were decent and I got an order of fried potstickers which were good as well.  Service was great despite the run-down look of the place.  Like a crappy tasting fortune cookie, sometimes an inspiring fortune is found within.When the restaurant boxes your dine-in food for you, I find this service fucking brilliant and tip accordingly.  Cheers.

39.description: So, I'm a BIG fan of crab rangoons.  My favorite place to get them is this little hole-in-the-wall called Darien Chop Suey in Darien, IL.  Darien is quite far away from where I live, though, and I've found all of the chinese food restaurants in my immediate neighborhood (such as Wong's and Leung's) to be sorely lacking.That is, until I found Hong Kong House.I live literally two blocks away from it, and I drive past it ALL THE TIME.  A friend of mine said it was a dump, so I never bothered to go in.  I have a hard time experimenting with chinese food because it tends to be sort of pricey, and there's a big margin for error, so if I don't like it I'm kind of screwed.  Nevertheless, I was feeling bold one day, and called up.  Not only do they deliver, but they accept credit cards as well.  +2 for HKH.  Not 20 minutes later my food was delivered by a courteous older gentleman, and 5 minutes after that I was in the middle of a food-gasm.  The beef chop suey and crab rangoons were BETTER than Darien Chop Suey!  I have since been DELIGHTED that there's such a great food find so close to my house, and have been demanding that friends and family eat there as well.  I want them to do well, so that they never leave, but I am sure most chinese food afficionados would like it, too!  Especially those of you who like Wong's - you don't know what you're missing.  Enjoy!An update, on 1-27-09: Darien Chop Suey changed owners and now their food tastes like cardboard, so forget everything I said about them.  Hong Kong is now officially the best Chinese food in the city, in my humble opinion!

9.description: Glad we went out of our way. The portions were wonderful and the price insanely reasonable. We dined in choose 2 lunch specials and a few extras and were very satisfied!  Dine in or carry out. It's worth it.

29.description: This is the only Chinese food I will order as long as I live anywhere around it. I'm sure everybody has their own Chinese food horror story but this place is great. I usually get the Beef and broccoli and egg roles and both are delicious. The egg roles are nice and hearty. They even have vegetable egg roles (NOT just spring rolls called vegetable egg rolls) for those that like them. They deliver super fast and are very friendly. I don't order from anywhere else.

23.description: This is a lovely little Chinese restaurant. I dined in today with my boyfriend and we were both completely satisfied with our experience. We spent only $20 and have leftovers for days. The food took 10 minutes to arrive at our table after ordering and the portions were very large (see photo I uploaded).  The only thing that wasn't a completely 5 star experience was the sesame chicken sauce. It was a little bland.Simple dining experience. 5 stars.

5.description: Ordered the general tso's chicken lunch special for $6.50. It came with a soda, egg roll, and large portion of chicken fried rice- very good deal! I also ordered a small hot and sour soup - very big container actually, the soup itself was bland. Solid Chinese food (I'm Asian and have had my fair share of all kinds of Asian cuisine). The chicken was battered and didn't get soggy under the sauce. A few bits of broccoli. Very large portion!  The flavor itself was ok, a bit better than average. The food was cooked fresh and packed in less than 10 minutes. Good service. I'd most likely order from here again if I'm in the mood for decent Chinese food, great that's it's walking distance!  Not the most authentic Chinese food but for a neighborhood fix it'll do fine.

31.description: I've never been here so I can't speak to the hole-in-the-wall ambiance of the place, but I can say that the food is quite good, plentiful and well priced.  We ordered from this place the week we moved in here, and were impressed, but over the last year we've tried a lot of the other Chinese restaurants which deliver to our neighborhood and so haven't had the chance to really explore the menu as much as we would have liked.  But tonight I had a taste for Chinese and we went back to the original favorite, and were not disappointed.The crab  rangoon is excellent, very crisp and tasty with a generous amount of fish mixed into the cream cheese.  (Be sure to remind them to send hot mustard sauce if you like it because they don't always pack any.)  Egg foo young from HKH doesn't disappoint either.   But for me, the star of tonight's meal was the almond pressed duck.  I haven't eaten pressed duck in ages and this was everything I'd hoped for.  It was moist, tender and flavorful, served on a bed of chopped veggies.  I'm more used to a bed of shredded lettuce and tend to prefer it that way, but this was just fine.Delivery was fast and everything was exactly as ordered.  I have no complaints.  It's not the best Chinese ever but it's darn good and they'll bring it to us.  There's no bad there.

25.description: O.k. so I am very particular about where I eat and this is one of the best! I absolutely love their crab rangoon mmm mm mmm! They literally have the CRAB filling unlike some places that simply smear the filling like it's free LOL! I always buy the chicken fried rice with vegetables extra spicy yeah buddy! Oh and no kidding the delivery is sometimes freaky fast.

12.description: This is a lovely little Chinese restaurant. I dined in today with my boyfriend and we were both completely satisfied with our experience. We spent only $20 and have leftovers for days. The food took 10 minutes to arrive at our table after ordering and the portions were very large (see photo I uploaded).  The only thing that wasn't a completely 5 star experience was the sesame chicken sauce. It was a little bland.Simple dining experience. 5 stars.

37.description: Excellent crab rangoons!  The food was traditional Chinese take-out, fresh, hot and delivered fast.

21.description: I live in Portage Park and am that restaurant about once every two weeks.  It isn't fancy at all.  The food is great.  I order orange chicken (easy sauce), egg foo yung (easy sauce).  The crab ragoon is excellent.  They make their own hot mustard.  The service is great and the food is always hot.  You can't go wrong for the amount of food at the price.  Do not judge a book by its cover.

16.description: I just loves this place!I am very picky about chinese food and the only place I liked so far in the city, is a restaurante by Belmont and Cicero!But this week, I went to the mechanic to change the oil in my car, and they were gonna take a while so I went to eat.I ordered shrimp with vegetables and fried rice and it came with a delicious roll!For just 6,50 i got a lot of food! I just loved the taste of everything!Highly recommend it!!I dont know about delivery service as everybody is complaining  because I dont live in the area! And they treat me really good! People need to know that in this country we are from different countries and they are chinese, so they are not as friendly as some other country but that doesnt mean they are rude! Is the way they are!

17.description: Maybe they're having an off day.. But I just ordered pick up. And their beef and broccoli sucks doesn't even taste like beef and broccoli the sauce is water and the beef is gray. and so does their pork fried rice. My boyfriend liked his orange chicken

10.description: I think they changed owners, or distributors. The food has taken a nose dive. Pretty sad.

11.description: I have been coming here for 18 years always good never disappointed food fresh and spicy if you ask for it that way delivery service is on point food arrives hot every time hope you enjoy

26.description: Super fast and tasty food.The service is friendly and appreciative.  Food is great, albeit salty, and the fried rice and singapore noodles a bit oily. However both are excellent! The combo fried rice has generous chunks of pork, chicken,beef, and shrimps or whatever, yum. Singapore noodles and seasame chicken are staples i always order at chinese food places, and Hong Kong's are great.I have had their smoothies also, only thing that would make them better is if they had the tapioca balls.Have dined in and picked up. Cant comment on the delivery yet.  If you like this place, Jess Cafe a bit farther West is also worth checking out.

27.description: I ate here a few times when I first moved to the area and have since found better places. The egg drop soup was good but the entrees we got were just typical and not very fresh. Nothing stood out except the soup and if I go to a chinese place it wouldn't be for egg drop soup. Unless maybe I was sick, make sure they put the green onions in there. If you want good crab rangoons go to Leung's on Irving, way better. And my mom said this place was "gross" when we ordered delivery.

35.description: This restaurant is a little hidden gem in the old Irving area.  Is it the BEST I've had? No, it's not, but for a local place that delivers, it really is surprisingly delicious!  Their mushu pork is delicious every single time.  Also, their take out menu has some coupons for free appetizers.  If you order $20 or more, you can get free 6 pc. chicken wings. The chicken is AWESOME!  It is one of the best chickens.. it's battered and deep fried, so it's not a buffalo wing style, it's a straight fried chicken style.  It is tasty with the perfect crunch.  It's amazing that one of the best fried chickens come from a chinese restaurant! If you live in the area or walk in the area, give this place a try. I order my food without the MSG or extra salt and they are very accommodating.

8.description: Though I finally figured under-cooked Chinese beef does not get along well with my stomach, I must say that1. The place looks good2. The service was blazing fast3. No customer friendly bullshit, like constantly asking if I need anything else4. Boxed my leftovers for me5. The check arrived promptlyI was the only customer when I came, nevertheless I think the service was great.

0.description: Ordered egg drop soup, shrimp fried rice and beef & broccoli to go last night. I arrived about 15 mins after I placed my order and the food was hot & fresh when I got home. The fried rice and soup were awesome - but I wasn't given any broccoli with my broccoli & beef (I looked on the receipt and it said 'broccoli gravy', so I think it was a matter of the guy hitting the wrong button). Not the end of the world but I was a little bummed. Overall the price and the taste were right and I will definitely return.

38.description: I was really surprised that we liked this place. We've lived in PP for about a year and never really reconciled ourselves to chop suey instead of Thai food. However, we tried this hole in the wall and found it to be very good! The chicken broccoli was better than I have had from the local competitors, the crab rangoons were good, and the egg roll was fine.All in all, this place seems to be some of the better Chinese in PP. We still miss good Thai though . . .

20.description: The delivery was fast, the prices weren't bad but the food wasn't that good.Actually, the crab rangoon was delicious! I'm so picky about it and was impressed with it. We also ordered the egg drop soup (it was okay), the orange chicken (mediocre), chicken fried rice (okay, very salty), egg roll (not very good) and mongolian beef (SWIMMING in wayyyyy too many onions. WHERE'S THE BEEF???).

19.description: I'm doing take out but I usually dine-in, they have the friendliest service here and the best orange chicken you'll ever eat! Super underrated and their delivery service is always super prompt! They have great lunch specials too!

33.description: This place was a total surprise for me. Its one of those "dont' judge a book by its cover" type of places. It looks old and dingy but their food is sooo good. My fav is their fried calamari...oh its so delicious, and their crab rangoon is the shiet! So far everything I've tried from this place is good, the portions are generous and the price is not bad either. Overall a great neighborhood spot to get some chinese food. Check it out for yourself!

2.description: I went out with my girlfriend and her sister because we wanted Chinese food! The place is nice and the lady is very friendly. The portions are abundant and the price is very affordable. The flavor won't let you down either.

34.description: The food here is delicious and very quick to get served.  The establishment is not the best, but not the worst in the world either.  The fried rice and sweet and sour chicken are some of the best I've ever eaten.

32.description: HKH is a great little dingy spot for carry out or delivery. There obviously are so many better Chinese food places to dine which provide the commotion and hustle one would expect at a Chinese restaurant. HKH is the antithesis of that experience. It is slow and empty and makes you wonder whether you should check out another place as soon as you walk in. The owners are often sitting in the dining room and talking or watching tv while prepping vegetables for their dishes. I still don't understand how they turn a profit, of the dozens of times I have carried out from HKH this place has never had customers. Getting the food is another story. After ordering (we have tried pretty much the entire menu), you can hear the wok getting going and food being prepared fresh (a good thing about a slow/quiet restaurant). The food is ready incredibly fast and the prices are dirt cheap. If you spend over a certain amount they toss in chicken wings as well. Quantities are plentiful but go for the extra dish so they you can get the free chicken wings. They are better than most fried chicken joints that specialize in it. My fav 3 are the mushoo pork with a side of plum sauce (solid dish, definitely has been a mainstay in our tifecta orders), mapo tofu (classic taste with a generous portion of tofu), and any chicken dish (we like the sesame or the general). Add on the 6 fried chickens and you have a feast. Great little discovery in my hood. Awesome speed in delivery service as well. If lethargic and wanting to veg by the tv. Order in from HKH and eat like a king in your underwear. No one will judge you.

18.description: I'm not from the neighborhood at all. When a friend of mine told me she had to go to Six Corners to meet a coworker to pick up things for her job and asked me to tag along. I jumped at the chance to get out of the house and do something that day. We planned on walking around the Six Corners shopping district and we did. We also paid our sincere respects to the magnificent "Portage Theater" which we previously visited many times. Getting hungry and me wanting some Chinese, we decided to eat here. The place looks....like it has seen better days. However, I don't care about decor at all. I actually like places like this because it allows you to realize what really is important is the food and the service. Both were excellent. I ordered a General Tso's chicken combo with a strawberry smoothie and my friend got a banana smoothie. My plate was huge and I was given a good amount of food for what I paid. They even have options to take it easy on the sauce or not use MSG. The lady who served me was also incredibly friendly and nice. She took my order quickly and my food came in 5-7minutes. I found it funny because I could of sworn she was arguing with other workers in Mandarin or Cantonese, but I've heard that depending on how you say a word it has a different force. Maybe that was it. even then I was chuckling while eating my food.Anyway it was everything I expected and if I'm ever in the neighborhood again(Portage please come back!), I'll definitely eat here again.

13.description: Was kinda scared at first, but this place is surprisingly clean and the staff is friendly  and easy to understand on the phone.  They have a classic huge Chinese menu and the style is classic "american Chinese" food.  Loved the fried chicken and egg foo young.  Over all pretty standard.  Might need to add a little salt, but I look forward to trying the peking duck!

4.description: I didn't expect much from this place and that's what I got!  The Bok choy in garlic sauce was probably the best dish I had that night. The Mongolian beef was pretty good too but all the other dishes were not worth me going to the Chinese place. The prices are cheap but I'd rather pay more for so I can enjoy my food. With so many Chinese places to eat in Chicago, I would not put this on my list to go back to.

24.description: I'm only reviewing the take out service.We've been hunting for a local chinese joint since moving to Old Irving last year.  We tried a few places and sometimes just went to the old hood.But the review for Hong Kong House were promising.  We ordered the eggrolls, chicken fried rice and sweet and sour chicken.The service was fast (15 minutes!) and the food was really good.  The chicken was from tender moist piece of chicken breast.  Very good quality.  I'm not a huge fried rice guy - but I would highly recommend you get at least one order of this from them..Also - they respected our request for no MSG - always a plus.From the look of it, I wouldn't recommend eating there - it's very greasy spoon in there.  I saw a sign for parking in back, but given the cross streets, I literally have no idea how I would get to it..

6.description: I chose this place because of the reviews here on Yelp,  but I was quite disappointed. The food was just okay, not great. I ordered the General Tso's chicken, and it came with chicken fried rice. I travel a lot and I eat Chinese food in every state that I go to. This place would have to be at the bottom of the list. The meat was not white meat from a chicken breast, as stated in an earlier review, but dark meat. The rice had way too much pepper, and just wasn't right. However,  the service was impeccable. I ordered as delivery and received the food really fast, and the delivery driver was very nice. I wish I could write more nice things about this place, but I cannot.

22.description: So my quick tip said "I'll let you know" and now I will. I went here because of all of the very good reviews and I have to say it was just okay. The food was relatively bland and uneventful. I guess for a quick bite it would be fine if you stuck to something like fried rice but other than that . . . The good news is that the portions were huge and the prices inexpensive and the woman who waited on us was very friendly. However, being a bit spoiled on places like Ben Pao puts me in a bad spot as that is/was the best Chinese food in the world.

15.description: Crab ragoons are good. Their food is not bad actually, but if you decide to stay there, be prepared for the worst service ever. They prefer that you do not stay there and give you dirty looks till you leave.

7.description: My favorite for fast, tasty, and convenience. There rice is always on point, I usually get a veggie fried rice which is always made fresh and is nice and soft. The eggrolls are the best. The Lo-mein is great, u get some free eggrolls or chicken wings with orders of over 25 dollars I believe and I usually get the chicken wings which I love but my wife ain't crazy about.  The delivery is very fast, I never had a problem with my order. The dining area is not so inviting so I always carryout or get delivery. I ordered almost 50 dollars worth of food once and I asked for 2 little things of hot sauce he charged me 25 cents for one and gave me one free. REALLY!  So not so costumer friendly but really enjoy the food.

36.description: My favorite Chinese food in the world can be found in this hole-in-the-wall restaurant in Portage Park. The pot stickers are incredible, the vegetable lo mein always hits the spot and the sesame chicken is divine.

30.description: Continues to impress as a reliable neighborhood Amero-Chinese joint.

3.description: This family joint is becoming a weekly pilgrimage for lunch. This small spot, is quiet, and the staff is super friendly. They are always on top of refilling your beverage. They have a great selection of lunch specials- that are fresh, hot, filling, and run about $8 all in. You get a big plate of food, egg roll, and a coke for that.I like my food as spicy as you can make it- they never get to where I like, but they always bring me some fresh chilli peppers to put on as much as I want. Stop by for lunch, and if you leave hungry- you did something wrong!

14.description: The delivery was fast, the prices weren't bad but the food wasn't that good.Actually, the crab rangoon was delicious! I'm so picky about it and was impressed with it. We also ordered the egg drop soup (it was okay), the orange chicken (mediocre), chicken fried rice (okay, very salty), egg roll (not very good) and mongolian beef (SWIMMING in wayyyyy too many onions. WHERE'S THE BEEF???).

3.description: My favorite local joint in the portage/jefferson park area

1.description: Great old school joint in Jeff Park!   It doesn't look to have been updated in quite awhile but that's what makes it good.  Inside is pretty dark, strewn with locals seated at a very long bar.  The bartender Krissy was awesome and we did a few rounds of Malort with her on a quiet Friday Afternoon!  Just don't sit next to "Nut Job"... get dat did

2.description: This place has a very clean men's bathroom. It beats most places by a mile.

5.description: Great place to party on the weekends! They have a good crowd here along with delicious food and good music. This is really a great place to come with friends and just have a great night.

0.description: Great neighborhood bar, and it doesn't break your bank account either. There's usually food on Sunday for football season. There's a small sitting area out back for smokers or for those wanting fresh air.

4.description: A good bar that has a crowd that doesn't try to be pretentious. I good dive bar around Milwaukee and Montross. Cheap beer and cheap women make this a memorable place.

1.description: Well, since it seems the other review on here comes from the mouth of someone associated with the place, let's get a little real up in here.I won't lie, I was really looking forward to trying this place out. I live only a few blocks away, and used to frequent Sun Cafe. I'm always looking for some new places to spice up bland little Portage Park. Sadly, all Cafe Refreshed made me want to do was kick something.My girlfriend and I were looking for a lunch slightly healthier than the Italian beefs or gyros we usually find in the area (in hindsight, a mistake) and so we decided we'd try the new cafe on Montrose.Upon walking in we discovered three strangely arranged tables in a large space. Empty walls. A faint suggestion of music drifting from a radio behind the counter somewhere. Ok, I thought, this place is new, and hell, at least it's quiet...I ordered the chicken pita "delight" and an iced Snicker's latte. My girlfriend ordered a turkey wrap and an iced coffee.Here we go.I get my pita. I try to pick it up. The entire thing crumbles in my hands. This has to have been the cheapest pita bread ever made. I go to get a fork to eat my mush with. Oh, there's no forks. Great. I'll just eat it with my hands, like an animal. My drink comes. It's a small. Ordered a medium. Oh, they're out of milk? And ice? So I have a half a lukewarm latte. Marvelous.My girlfriend's drink- room temperature iced coffee, black, with not a single ice cube. Her wrap, mysteriously missing lettuce.(Warning, language use gets a little ugly from here on out.)Seriously, how the fuck do you run a coffee and sandwich place and not have any fucking milk, ice, silverware or fucking lettuce. Really? Are people in this neighborhood stupid enough to put up with this shit? We can't be the first people to walk in here. I mean, as an owner of a fucking coffee shop, you think you might have been inside a couple before, you know, see how they're fucking run. No ice? What year is this? Oh, 2008. My drinks should be floating on fucking hover trays, not coming lukewarm because your dumb ass ran out of ICE! Walk down the street to the fucking gas station and buy a bag. And while you're there, buy some fucking plastic forks, some milk and some goddam lettuce.Never. Never ever will I come back here.(And for all you waitresses and baristas, no I don't hold the woman behind the counter solely responsible. She did nothing to fix the problem, but I know someone else probably was in charge of ordering. Fuck 'em both.)

0.description: NOW CLOSED... best of luck Nef...Formerly the Sun Cafe in portage Park...this newly renovated space, Cafe Refreshed....has much more to offer in organic options such as Coffee, espresso, Cappuccino, and Teas...not to mention Great Salads, Sandwich Delights and Wraps as well...Pastries, bagels, and cookies...all in a delightfully clean, and contemporary setting...I can't wait for the outdoor seating to be approved...just in time for summer!

28.description: My sister's closet is great little shop. I've found high end designer clothing, brand new at great prices. The last time I shopped I got Seven jeans for under $20 and some great cashmere sweaters Judy, the owner is super friendly and always willing to lend a hand or get you something from the back that she has been saving for loyal customers. Also a great place to get vintage and unique jewelery. My Sister's Closet has always been a go to place for great clothes at an affordable price.

1.description: I love this store, but they do an annual Super Bowl Sunday Sale where they slash prices, but their systems are so bad, I waited 3 hours to pay for clothes.  They only had one register open. They could have used card scanners on smart phones and saved tons of time.  And they kept telling customers to be patient, that we should know it would be busy.  Please don't disregard technology, just because you are busier than usual.  Great clothes, a poor attitude, and poor communication. There was a wait for a dressing room and to check out and if that was explained when walking in the door, it would have made a big difference.

9.description: I love this place!I agree that some items are overpriced but that can be the case at any resale shop, sign up for their emails and you will get notices for their sales, which can be phenomenal!Also, I guarantee you that most of the people that complained about the prices did not notice that they have color tag discounts like they do at Village. Big difference is the quality of items, My Sister's Closet is meticulous about the items they take. You will not get any stained, ripped, broken products like you can get at some resale shops. I have been here many times and always get great deals and service, most clothes have been like new that I have purchased. I feel they are well organized and you can find many cute, unique items!

29.description: I really like this store.  I try to get in there at least every couple of months. Yesterday I bought three items-all designer-with the tags still on.  I also bought a new hat and two pairs of pants for my kids.  All of this was only 50 bucks.  I never leave empty handed.  The people who work there are all friendly and helpful.  Last year I got a 100 dollar coat for 12 dollars at the superbowl sale.  Most items are current and everything is clean and in good condition.

23.description: Forget what I've said before were my favorite stores, this is the best resale shop I have ever been to.  For years I've admired my girlfriend's Anthropologie-like boho chic finds from here but never made it over.  I often find consignment shops overpriced, dated and disorganized.  This one is none of that.  The clothes are all practically new and, for the most part, up to date.  I especially like the Chico's rack.  It has more selection than the clearance rack at an actual Chico's.  I bought 8 blouses and jackets for casual Fridays at work and spent  $90.  The most expensive item was a like-new $14 Chico Jacket that originally sold for about $100.  I am not sure the younger 20 somethings are going to like this place.  The neighborhood and the store are for a bit older crowd.Also, the two staff working didn't seem to like each other at all and were kind of rude to each other which was wierd.

5.description: The women who work in this store are extremely rude. They make it very difficult for consigners to bring in their items because they change the drop-off days and times frequently; many times it seems just because they don't feel like being bothered. They say that they only accept between 10-4, 3 days per week which also makes it difficult for people who work to consign. You are not "allowed" to bring in items in boxes or bags. You MUST bring items in a plastic bin with your name written on the inside. They also tend to take items that I'm actually on the fence about brining but leave the $800 pristine 1 year old jacket in the bin to take back home. I'm really not sure how hey stay in business.

31.description: One of the better resale shops I've been to.  If you're a fashionista, or aspiring to be one, this is a cheap way to acquire some decent pieces.Some of the brands I saw here: Three Dots, Marc Jacobs, Cynthia Rowley, Prada, J. Lo, Sweet Pea, Laundry by Shelli Segal, Diesel, Chico's, Express, by Joseph, DKNY, Karen Kane, Sutton by Bloomingdale and Betsey Johnson. Everything I saw was in good condition - nothing ripped or stained. Womens clothing is sorted by size and color (all the mediums in the reddish tone are grouped together, for instance).  They have maternity clothes, baby/kids clothes, shoes, purses, toys and housewares. There are some treasures to be found here. If you sign up on their mailing list, you'll get notice of sales and sample sales (a sales woman told me their biggest sale, on Super Bowl Sunday - 50% off the lowest price of everything - is not advertised).

25.description: Over-priced junk.I really don't get the positive reviews. This is a resale shop for old ladies.I drove out here because I heard they have maternity clothes. They have a few, but most of it is hideous. I didn't find a thing I could wear.My friend and I browsed the rest of the selection as well. They may have designer labels on some of their clothes, but everything is overpriced and butt ugly. They were charging $20 for a shrug sweater from Anthropologie. Are you kidding me? I was thoroughly unimpressed and would prefer sifting through the piles of crap at Village Thrift than trying to find something cute at this place.If you want high quality second-hand clothing, just shop on eBay instead. This place really isn't worth the drive out to the NW side.

12.description: I always leave here with a few neat things!

21.description: Found few good things here :)

16.description: Over-priced junk.I really don't get the positive reviews. This is a resale shop for old ladies.I drove out here because I heard they have maternity clothes. They have a few, but most of it is hideous. I didn't find a thing I could wear.My friend and I browsed the rest of the selection as well. They may have designer labels on some of their clothes, but everything is overpriced and butt ugly. They were charging $20 for a shrug sweater from Anthropologie. Are you kidding me? I was thoroughly unimpressed and would prefer sifting through the piles of crap at Village Thrift than trying to find something cute at this place.If you want high quality second-hand clothing, just shop on eBay instead. This place really isn't worth the drive out to the NW side.

17.description: Any business that is going strong after 30 years, with many of its original customers and consignors, must be doing something right. The range of merchandise, from toddler to misses clothing, high-end to economical, new samples to vintage, accessories and everything in-between makes this a true resale "boutique". Merchandise arrives daily; there's always something to tempt the savvy shopper. And, if, by chance, your experience is less than "5-star", the owner would want to know; she'll make it right. In this day of chain stores, it's refreshing to shop this local (the owner is Chicago born-and-raised) one-woman-owned store. Nomi R.

10.description: I love this shop!  They buy things from my closet (and we all have brand new items never worn or worn once, right?) and I have never not found a bargain while I am shopping there.  They are expanding their shop, so plenty of dressing rooms.  There is always a sale, you just hunt for the sale colors (clothing tag colors indicate 10%, 20%, 30% discounts, etc.).  I have gotten cocktail dresses, great jeans, jewelry and many trendy tops there.  From sidewalk sales to academy award parties, it's a fun place to shop.  They have a sharp eye for current trends and great clothes and the owner and staff work hard to keep it organized. Found a great piece of silver jewelry there the other day (missed the Mother's Day weekend jewelry sale but it was still a bargain).Have fun!  PS there is FREE parking in the lot behind the store and pay meters in front.

11.description: I've shopped here throughout the years and I rarely ever leave empty handed-- I've found some very cute things for myself as well as for others. (You can find some unique gifts and accessories here). I have yet to visit them since they expanded, but I look forward to doing so soon. As far as the ladies: very pleasant. I recently consigned some clothes with them for the first time, and they took many of my items. The transaction was smooth, and they complimented me on much of my clothes. Further, I just received my 1st check from them--some nice extra cash, just in time to do some holiday shopping with it--yippie!

26.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this store. I had read some of the reviews, which weren't super positive so I wasn't really that excited about this place. After years of driving by this place, I finally stopped in. I really, really liked it! Granted, it's a little more "pricey" than the resale shops I'm used to. However, I'm used to those bargain basement crazy warehouse places where things are messy and under $5. This place had a variety of items from $7-$50 but, I have to say, it was clean, quiet and organized. Plus, they did a great job selecting more quality / brand name merchandise so you are paying for the benefit of not having to search through a bunch of ugly stuff. I got a really nice pair of New York and Co. dressy / work capri pants, a Rue 21 blouse and a George (Walmart's career separates line) all for $25. Really not bad. That's averaging $8 a piece -a small "higher" price to pay for quality clothing. I would definitely revisit this store. They have some really nice stuff!

27.description: for being in the suburbs, i guess this place is okay. the people that work their are quite a bit older, so it only makes sense that the selection is going to run more along the lines of chicos and coldwater creek. the maternity section is about 3' long and consists mostly of XL-XXL sizing.i had a serious allergy attack while in there, so i was anxious to get out but that does say something about the cleanliness of the clothes and/or the store itself. i did appreciate how everything is grouped according to color and then size. looked like they had a lot of cool jewelry, but with all the crap they have strewn over the top of the counter, it's impossible to take a good look without bothering the help and the help made it perfectly clear they weren't in the mood to help.after all is said and done, i walked out with one maternity dress for $5, two liz clairborn "dressy" sweaters for $9 each and, my big purchase,  one super cool 100% cashmere, black, bat-wing, cowl-neck sweater for $58.(for trendier clothes and a huge selection of designer jeans, i rock buffalo exchange on milwaukee in wicker park.)

0.description: I can't even think of words to express how much I love this store. Usually, I'm not really a consignment kind of girl and I prefer to go to the Burberry/Chanel/whatever store to purchase my items brand new, but I've found a new love for this store.I came here searching for a costume for my character in the play I'm in, because I'm playing Susan in the production of Don't Drink the Water (by Woody Allen). I needed some '60s-looking or authentic '60s clothing and had no idea where to start. The owner Joanne was extremely helpful, considering she lived through the '60s and knew what all the fashion trends were. I'm planning to go back next Sunday for their 50% off everything Super Bowl Sunday sale, because I saw the cutest Givenchy blazer for only $40!! Needless to say I'm definitely buying it if it's still there ;)

20.description: Excellent resale shop. I decided to check it out today and I was pleasantly surprised. Tons of great brands like Diane Von Furstenberg and Marc Jacobs. They even provide dressing rooms. Reasonable prices and lots of cute jewelry. The super nice ladies helped me check out and I will definitely be back. Great shop.

19.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this store. I had read some of the reviews, which weren't super positive so I wasn't really that excited about this place. After years of driving by this place, I finally stopped in. I really, really liked it! Granted, it's a little more "pricey" than the resale shops I'm used to. However, I'm used to those bargain basement crazy warehouse places where things are messy and under $5. This place had a variety of items from $7-$50 but, I have to say, it was clean, quiet and organized. Plus, they did a great job selecting more quality / brand name merchandise so you are paying for the benefit of not having to search through a bunch of ugly stuff. I got a really nice pair of New York and Co. dressy / work capri pants, a Rue 21 blouse and a George (Walmart's career separates line) all for $25. Really not bad. That's averaging $8 a piece -a small "higher" price to pay for quality clothing. I would definitely revisit this store. They have some really nice stuff!

33.description: You never know what treasure you'll find in a resale shop!My Sister's Closet carries clothes, housewares and gift items.Hours:Monday - Friday  10AM - 6PMSaturday              10AM - 5PMSunday                 11AM - 4PM

2.description: This place is awful.  If you look close at the jewelry it is damaged.  The tarnish of the metal is coming off and discolored.  The Druzes were fake.  A lot of stones are plastic or glass.  It has also been there for months.  They do not even change the inventory.The clothing IS damaged.  Again, you have to look closely.  There are tears and threads coming loose.  I cannot believe this store has been around with the fake crap and damaged goods they sell.The owner is rude and the old hags that work there are mean as hell.  This place is also shady.  Be very careful because when you drop stuff off you then find out consistently that things are always missing. Not trustworthy at all.  This is not a place I would shop.  You get better quality at Walmart.

32.description: My Grandma's sister is always talking about shopping her. Now my Grandma is obsessed with going. It's funny, becuase my Grandma would slit her wrists before she EVER went into any of the MANY thrift stores that surround her own house. Ha.

18.description: I never shop here-I only consign-I used to bring in my baby itmes but found that they were selling them for so little it wasn't worth the time to bring them there. The woman who look through the clothing act like they are bothered to be looking through your items and claim to be very familiar with brands-They will take anything that has a designer name on it even if it looks like it is falling apart and pass on newer items without the brand name. Don't bother trying to sell them your shoes-they are great for selling dresses and purses to. Don't bring your kids there is no room!!! It is packed to the brim so make sure you have time to look if you are going to shop. Don't bother selling them your baby items-take them to once upon a child.

13.description: It's good and I like it but it's a bit expensive. The owners are a bit strange. Their clothes are varied.

4.description: I just found out about this place today. Paid a visit and fell in love with the store! Not sure how I have lived in Chicago for nearly 20 years and I had never been to this fine establishment. The clothing,  jewelry,  shoes, and other items are all in great condition. The prices are perfect and I benefitted from a major sale today! Woohoo! Joanne is the owner and she is very friendly and passionate about her store and it's operations. Designer clothing for a mere fraction of big department stores. I will hit this place up at least once a month now. If you park on the street, throw at least an hour of change in meter. They do have parking in the back lot but that can fill up quickly. Such a great place! Oh and they also gave me a little goodir bag today for my first visit. Sweet! Thanks for this gift of a store!!

24.description: This is a pretty good consignment shop. I don't get what some of the other reviewers are saying about the prices; they seem reasonable to me. For instance, a Banana Republic wrap dress, with tags still on it, was $28. They have a wide range of styles, so yes, there may be some "old lady" clothes, but everything is in great condition. No stretched-out Target Mossimo tees for $18 here. If it's a Gap tee, it's in perfect condition and priced  - at the most - at $8. They have plus sizes, kids clothes, and household items, as well. And a good shoe selection.  Lots of handbags.

6.description: You will not find a better consignment store! Joanne, the owner, takes pride in her store and it shows! Love her and love everything about the store. A don't miss if you're in the Chicago area.

22.description: I've been going to My Sisters Closet since it opened (about 28 years ago!)   One of the best resale shops around, and they are always having sales, so you walk out spending under $100 and get bags full of great things.  Yes, its true, you do have to get past the piles on top of the counter- but the clothes are organized by color and size.  I'm under 40 and think i'm pretty trendy, and I always find things that are cute, and also professional.  I don't look at any of the brick-a-brack since thats not my thing, but there is something for everyone.  The owner, Joanne is one of the sweetest people -she loves what she does and loves her customers.

15.description: I love this place, the people whom shop there are nice. Thus the people who work there! A nice overall experience!

7.description: Update: I take back my comment on the ease of  the consignment policy. And they really need to get their shit organized elsewhere, not on the retail floor. If it isn't for sale, don't put it on a fucking rack and then harp at me for not knowing it wasn't for sale. I'm surprised they haven't been shut down for fire code violations, with all the disorganized mess clogging the aisles. These old biddys can go to hell. In fact, I'm so pissed, I'm not sure I'll shop there anymore.I've shopped consignment and thrift and all sorts of resale all over the country since I was a kid. This is by far the best I've ever been to. I spend an average of $12 an item, which is kinda pricey for used, but the names, current styles, and super organization of styles, colors, sizes make it worth it. Their consignment policy seems very user friendly too. There is free parking in the back.And they are open til 8 on Fridays.

8.description: I have been here a few times and the only thing I ever buy is something new!  It  is in my EDGEBROOK neighborhood, not Lincolnwood.  I keep thinking it will be better.   Good, not great, selection of jewelry.  But, pricey and I'm not cheap!I have brought items here and I have no idea what their criteria is because I shop at Nordstrom, Ann Taylor, Chicos and what I consider good stores and it seems want my Target finds more.  I end up leaving with most of my items not wanted.  It's crowded and messy.  I keep wondering why they don't expand into the empty space next to them.

30.description: This store it great!  They have nice clothes in good condition.  They don't have any mens clothes, but they have women's, children's, and maternity clothes.  There is a small selection of shoes, lots of jewelry, and some cosmetics.  It's great to catch them during a sale.

3.description: You'd think if a store takes an ad out in the local paper to celebrate their 3rd Anniversary in their expanded space and said ad mentions refreshments and music, that when I arrive an hour after opening, I'd be met with a cheery hello and an offer of refreshments. You would be wrong. They didn't even have the radio on. I spent over half an hour browsing and not once did anyone smile at me, make me feel welcome or bother to unwrap the cookies and other foodstuffs sitting on a counter. I even mentioned to the elderly cashier how nice it would be to have a cookie since lunch time was approaching. Clueless. Also, my friend and I stumbled over containers placed along the aisles up front. Really?! Why risk a law suit? Jut put your bins in back! I found only 3 things somewhat reasonably priced (compared to ebay) and it was nice to try them on in the ample well-lit dressing stalls (can't do that online). All we got was 10% off. Big whoop. Will I return? All signs point to "NO."

14.description: Forget what I've said before were my favorite stores, this is the best resale shop I have ever been to.  For years I've admired my girlfriend's Anthropologie-like boho chic finds from here but never made it over.  I often find consignment shops overpriced, dated and disorganized.  This one is none of that.  The clothes are all practically new and, for the most part, up to date.  I especially like the Chico's rack.  It has more selection than the clearance rack at an actual Chico's.  I bought 8 blouses and jackets for casual Fridays at work and spent  $90.  The most expensive item was a like-new $14 Chico Jacket that originally sold for about $100.  I am not sure the younger 20 somethings are going to like this place.  The neighborhood and the store are for a bit older crowd.Also, the two staff working didn't seem to like each other at all and were kind of rude to each other which was wierd.

29.description: If you are thinking of going to Jewel for meat or produce stop! Instead go across the street to Family Fruit Market. Great prices. Great quality. But, if you need *all* the other things like paper products, cleaning supplies, pet food, organic items, a ton of frozen food choices Jewel is the place. I rarely have any luck finding someone to tell me what aisle something is that I'm looking for, so my shopping trips take way too long. (I can't help but think that is intentional. If I have to go down every dang aisle to find something Jewel might hope I pick up a bunch of other stuff that wasn't on my list.)

42.description: This is one of the best Jewels I've ever been to, and I HATE Jewel.Decent organic/ethnic food aisle.Large Osco with everything you need.Cashiers are very friendly.Pretty good prices, especially with that hoosifudge card.

23.description: They are getting a little better.sales are getting a little better.they are still a big chain which brings bigger overhead.very nice staff in front though.

47.description: After moving away from the 6 corners area. I tend to miss this jewel. It was a walking distance from home and a great place to get something after work just by getting off the Irving park bus. But I don't miss the high prices. Jewel has really jacked their prices up over the years and our 200 dollar link card went quicker every month with less to show for. I now shop at Butera. Better all around but not as big as jewel. Better produce. Far better produce I should say. Are they sure they aren't making a mistake. A green pepper for a buck? You can go just about anywhere else and get em for at least 69 cents a pound. I would of figured a big chain store could give you better deals then smaller chains like Butera but just ain't the case. But I still miss the comfort of having a supermarket close to my house.

8.description: So tired of Jewel.  I cannot tell you how many times I have gotten my groceries home and found that seals had been broken, or removed completely.  It's not like you can walk around removing vitamin, sour cream and hummus lids to see if the seals underneath are in tact.  Plus, I bought their jewel brand "taco dip".  I got it home, opened it that night, and it had mold all across the top of it.  Vitamins - seals missing under the cap, yogurt that is not expired, but curdled anyways, hummus that has half the seal open.  So many times I have found open seals on their dairy products. I found a piece of hard plastic in my potato salad that I bought at the deli.  The ice cream is always super mooshy, and not frozen at all.  Sadly, this is the best Jewel in the area.  The other jewel on Elston and Addison has lost my business, after I called them and someone answered, said "You B*tch" and hung up on me, before I could even say one word.   I need to find other options.  People say Marianos is more expensive, but how can that be true when I am always throwing out previously opened products.  Waste of my money.

31.description: Boo! took my cart  full of foods... I hate it when Jewels' do this...

34.description: Unlike my local Jewel, this one doesnt stop selling alcohol at midnight.  Besides your average domestic fair..they also have several cases of specialty brews.  And even those fancy one off pint bottles of craft beers.  I didnt really explore the wine and liquors since it was more of an in and out endeavor.   But as far as I know their beer selection is....at least above average.  I would say its better than above average.  But the actual chilled selection is limited.  So you have fewer choices if youre in for a quick stop off to a house gathering.

16.description: This jewel is always fairly busy and they seam to have the slowest cashiers ever. I've never been to a store besides this one where a person is buying 8-10 items and it takes 15 minutes to check out. Really poor cashiers.

13.description: Tonight the service and employees were lame so slow and nobody knew where anything was located! Terrible

11.description: Average at best... Cashiers weren't happy or even spoke to me after I greeted them... Glad this isn't my usual place

39.description: I pretty much live between this Jewel and the one on Pulaski & Foster now, and after having this Jewel be my local grocery for over 5 years, I gladly go over to the one at Foster & Pulaski.Compared to most Jewels in the city though, I'd say this one is by far one of the better ones. They've recently renovated the place (to look exactly like Dominick's!) so it's all nice and sparkly now. I just find this one to be slightly more crowded and slightly more aggravating to get around in than the one at Foster/Pulaski. Not a huge difference, though.

37.description: A decent Jewel but their produce is always questionable.

0.description: I was in the area to meet with a client and I wanted to pick up a plant, wasn't sure what kind or even if they had any that would last for awhile.  Jennifer was in Floral and she was just as helpful as could be.  Ended up getting a beautiful orchid for under $20.00 (very surprising because normally they run $30+) .  She was extremely polite and just wanted me to be happy with what I got.  I would definitely come back if she was going to be there.Thanks Jennifer, she loved loved loved them!!!

38.description: This is my neighborhood grocery store.  Goood Ole Jewel Osco!  One thing that I must get used to is just how busy every place is in Chicago.  Everyone is in a rush and nothing requires rushing more than going to the grocery store.  With that said I like this store.  They have a great selection and tons of checkout lanes.  They even have my most favorite do it yourself lanes.  Jewel, as natives like to refer to it, had an really good wine selection and you get great discounts when you use your trusty Jewel Osco card.Thumbs up!

27.description: This is my neighborhood grocery store of choice- when Family Fruit Market doesn't have what I need. It's a clean, well-stocked location. Have always dealt with helpful employees when I had questions. They have an organic foods aisle that I wish was a bit bigger. They have sales often and it's easy to punch in your customer number if you forget your loyalty card. The parking lot is big because there are several other stores in the plaza. Good location.

32.description: It's not my neighborhood jewel - osco so I don't have much to say about it, it's clean, it's organized, no good or bad impressions at first sight.

44.description: I like the locaton of this store a lot. Couple blocks from home with a fabric store, sewing machine oulet, and Sears all within a few feet. I haven't had a problem here, accept for overpriced lemons, but that's just Chicago.

24.description: Everytime I come in here and I go to the deli counter I always end up leaving without getting anything I understand they have things to do but how long is it going to take to turn around and wait on a costumer . I will just take my business to Maraion's they have enough clerks behind the counter to wIt on costumes

7.description: At this point I should be able to make a list dedicated to my Jewel reviews.  Jewel has always been my store growing up.  I was never a Dominick's person and when my mom started shopping at WalMart I frowned upon it.  Some people will say Jewel is expensive and especially in the city.  To me groceries are groceries and I usually try and go to the most convenient one in terms of distance and what they have to offer.  Since I grew up on Jewel this one does it for me.  All the same familiar brands and the same store set up so I know where to get things.  Like I said there is not much to write about as this store isn't much different than any other Jewel.  There is a TCF bank inside and they do have 6 self checkout lanes.  I don't like checking myself out as I'm not narcissistic.

40.description: Ok, it's just a Jewel-Osco. I still usually go to Dominicks for produce.... Or I go to Stanley's, Jerry's or the Family Fruit Market.BUT-for most of my grocery shopping, I stick with Jewel, and this one is the best in my area. I'd much rather go here than the Jewel at Lawrence and Central OR the Jewel at Narragansett and Irving Park.

30.description: shop at A &G at Belmont and Cdentral   same general area, good food, quality fresh fruit and a senior discount on Tuesday.forget Jewel!.

46.description: I just moved into the area... and so far, so good.

1.description: This place needs new management. I usually come here daily and sometimes not sure why. The lines are always long, shortage of cashiers, long check-out times and a bit dirty.Not the best place to come for fresh fruit/ vegetables either. The only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because there are some decent employees here. I have to come here because it's so close and the prices are reasonable. But there are things I prefer to buy elsewhere for better quality.

9.description: It's not a bad place to shop. They've made some improvements since I was last here. Soup and salad island for the quick bite to eat which is nice. I used to work in a grocery store and appreciate how clean and faced the shelves are. Customer service is also good. I'm sure Jewel is feeling the heat and double downed with good customer service and attractive store layout with Mariano's popping up all over the place

26.description: This particular jewel is always clean and fully stock. I usually go an order special orders on birthday cakes, which they do a great job decorating them. Their deli is always nice and clean, their chicken caesar salad is great.

25.description: It's not a bad place to shop. They've made some improvements since I was last here. Soup and salad island for the quick bite to eat which is nice. I used to work in a grocery store and appreciate how clean and faced the shelves are. Customer service is also good. I'm sure Jewel is feeling the heat and double downed with good customer service and attractive store layout with Mariano's popping up all over the place

12.description: This used to be my neighborhood Jewel.  The last time I was here, they had a socially awkward employee at the front door giving out free samples of their squishy, crappy French bread. Sorry, Jewel; I know you really want to compete with the likes of Mariano's, Tony's, and the smaller, independently owned markets in the 'hood, but you've got a lot of work to do.  Here are three things you should probably work on if you want to stay in business:1) Fix the self checkouts.  Not only is it rare for all of them to actually be open and working, but you have the rudest, most incompetent people running them.  What's up with the bald, African-American man that refuses to speak or smile?
