I want to run up and pinch him, just to see if he's an actual human being and not an automaton. 2) You might want to take better care of your produce department.  In early August 2014, I visited your produce department and the lettuce was frozen.  The romaine, red and green leaf, and endive were literally frozen to the touch.  I returned the next evening and the same lettuce was on display, only some had thawed out and was wilted.  It's not uncommon to see packaged spring mix or fruit cups on displays that don't stay cold.3) How does a store run out of BAGS? I guess it's for the same reason you can't manage to keep the sale items stocked, either.Farewell, Six Corners Jewel-Osco!

21.description: They wonder why they are going out of buisness.This place is large...semi clean.The customers are ...well. if you like running into tatted thugs...this is the place for you.While I also feel for the plight of those less fortunate.  I am sorry. But if you are stinking to high heaven...I dont think you should be in a store touching produce.The cashiers have awful attitudes.My favorite is the black bald headed guy who stands watching the self check out area...and does not speak to you....at all.If something is not working and you raise your hand. He begrudgingly comes over...looking annoyed...fixes whatever it is without saying a word.Even when you leave..no goodbye...nada. ...really dude ? You work at jewel... check the attitude. Marianos has far superior customer service and better food.Screw this place.

17.description: CONGRATULATIONS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Dirtiest supermarket bathroom ever.  Pretty fierce who's filthiest competition between the toilet, floor and sink though.

10.description: Ugghhh. Why have the managers at this location realized that they NEED to open more checkout lanes? Instead of having 3 people behind the customer service desk, good customer service would be to have at least one person step out and relieve the cashiers a bit by opening another register. Avoid the self check out-they never work. The cashiers that I have seen on a consistent basis always make me smile especially Tom, Kamil, and Dennis, and the younger guy at the meat department always goes out of his way to help me when I have questions. The pharmacy is much better than the actual store service. All of the on staff pharmacists have been tremendously helpful throughout the years, and the female pharmacist always follows up and follows through with her promises.

5.description: I went shopping for some beer and they refused my FOID Card as a form of identification. Almost everywhere I go it's a form of ID. I do carry my drivers license but it's a hassle to take it out of my cover slip. Screw this place. The only reason this place gets a 1 star is because of Lorena in the meat department, super sweet.

3.description: Why are the cashiers at this Jewel store so very unfriendly?  They never say hello or Thankyou. They act like their doing you a favor, by you spending your money at this store. They don't even smile, especially that bald African American guy who stands by the self service check outs. He shouldn't be working there. He has No personality  !I stopped shopping at this Jewel because very poor customer service.

35.description: This Jewel is usually very clean.  Aisles are kept neat.  Never really had to speak to staff, but they are always stocking the aisles.They can be busy in the evenings and pretty swamped Friday and Saturday nights, and late only have one or two registers open if you are lucky.  Just need to stand behind the line of wifebeater wearing, Corona box toting patrons.All in all, nice store.  I am glad it's so close, but they are still expensive on meat/produce.  For that I go to Jerry's.

19.description: They wonder why they are going out of buisness.This place is large...semi clean.The customers are ...well. if you like running into tatted thugs...this is the place for you.While I also feel for the plight of those less fortunate.  I am sorry. But if you are stinking to high heaven...I dont think you should be in a store touching produce.The cashiers have awful attitudes.My favorite is the black bald headed guy who stands watching the self check out area...and does not speak to you....at all.If something is not working and you raise your hand. He begrudgingly comes over...looking annoyed...fixes whatever it is without saying a word.Even when you leave..no goodbye...nada. ...really dude ? You work at jewel... check the attitude. Marianos has far superior customer service and better food.Screw this place.

28.description: I live right next door to this store and I didn't realize how unwelcoming it is until I stopped by Meijer over in Arlington Heights this afternoon.This Jewel never does not have baskets for hand shopping.I've never been greeted when walking in the doors, ever. Sometimes it's the little things that make you drive across town for groceries.

45.description: Very nice.One thing that caught my eye about this Jewel was their outrageously cheap beer selection.  I got a case (12 bottles) of Berghoff for $8.  What the F?  Seriously!I like supporting independent stores (like the Valu Most on Milwaukee) but these booze deals are too much to beat.

33.description: I don't usually use this store - I prefer Whole Foods...or even Tony's...but sometimes when I'm in a bind.  Or just want those brownie cookies that only Jewel carries.Ok.  Yum.Clean, pleasant service, pretty good selection.  Like the stars say, "A-Ok."

43.description: Yeah probally the nicest jewel I have been to.

2.description: I always doing my shopping in JO, but near my house. Today i visited on my way this store. Same atmosphere, this what i like. Fast and no lines in the cash counter. My husband got for me a nice flowers there. Thank you

18.description: I don't usually do my grocery shopping here but it's a great place to go to if you're heading over to a friends house and need something to bring. Surprisingly the bakery is pretty good. Why have gotten some things like their apple pie and cookies that are not good most of the stuff will go good with that cup of coffee or tea. Some personal recommendations would be the vanilla poundcake the cinnamon rolls and strawberry rhubarb pie. The strawberry rhubarb pie was in especially well received treat last time I was by my buddies house. The stuff isn't that expensive either. No don't give me wrong it's not gonna taste is greatest something your mother would make and it's not going to be the most gourmet big good you've ever had but it will hit the spot. Another thing that is nice about Jewel is there deli department. while I do not shop in this area often there are times where I feel like some chicken tenders with their Dijon honey mustard sauce not a bad five dollar meal if you're not on a diet and able to cheat a little bit. The sides that are offered are also great things to get if you're headed to a barbecue and need something to bring. Also the banana pudding is a nice dessert if you're in the mood. Service and assistance is on par with any similar type a grocery store.

41.description: This is a really great Jewel.  I love their Ethnic and organic sections, and it's also a bit more up to date than most.  The reason it loses 2 stars from me is the fact that they have alot, and I mean alot of creepy vagrants walking about.  I was extrermly freaked out when I was stared and followed through out my 45 minute trip there by a creepy guy with an empty cart.  I was so freaked out that I brought it up to their customer service department who really didn't seem that interested.  I had to ask for security to help me in the parking lot because I was convinced that I was going to be mugged or killed.  The second and last time that I shopped at this Jewel, the same vagrant was there with an empty shopping cart.  I am convinced that he lives there. I told a friend about it who also had the same experience.  And for that, they have lost my business.

4.description: Poor service and long wait times. Unfriendly people at pharmacy who also managed to screw up my simple order.  Only have gone to this location since I've moved to the neighborhood but will be going to another store further away since this one is so poor...

6.description: This store is awful.  2-3 lanes open with lines.  Then staff stands around talking while you bag your own groceries! I'll stick with Mariano's.

22.description: At this point I should be able to make a list dedicated to my Jewel reviews.  Jewel has always been my store growing up.  I was never a Dominick's person and when my mom started shopping at WalMart I frowned upon it.  Some people will say Jewel is expensive and especially in the city.  To me groceries are groceries and I usually try and go to the most convenient one in terms of distance and what they have to offer.  Since I grew up on Jewel this one does it for me.  All the same familiar brands and the same store set up so I know where to get things.  Like I said there is not much to write about as this store isn't much different than any other Jewel.  There is a TCF bank inside and they do have 6 self checkout lanes.  I don't like checking myself out as I'm not narcissistic.

15.description: Sometimes I really like this place and other times I get a bit frustrated.  Most times of the day it is fairly busy except if you go first thing in the morning.  The produce is hit or miss.  When it is good it is really good.  When it is bad it is really bad.  I wish there was more of selection on many of the items.  Also, it seems like the shelves are always being restocked which can be a good things except when you want something that a stocker is blocking.  Customer service is usually ok.  I have been shopping at this store for several months now and I have to admit I have seen some changes for the better since my first experience there.  So, I can only hope it will continue to improve.

20.description: Typical Jewel: high prices, poor customer service, poor quality.This place always looks ransacked.  I understand that this is a high traffic location, but you would think they would use past sales to predict what they need, but they always run out of items.  The shelves are often bare and if you go in to buy an item based on the sales paper, you'll never find it.When I stopped in on July 4th, they actually ran out of full-size grocery bags.  What grocery store runs out of bags! They were using these tiny bags that held no more than two items.  I left the store with about ten bags and half of the items were spilling out.

36.description: This Jewel is by far one of the betters ones in the city. It is clean, the staff is great and most of them long term employees. They remember you and always ask how you are etc. They have an awesome selection and they have by far the largest natural foods section with lots of Organic foods and as well as organic produce. I know people who take the metra home and on their way home will get off here and walk over to the jewel for groceries and then hop back on the train. If you are driving parking is easy. Pricing is reasonable and probably one of the better (lower) priced stores. The managers are always interested in hearing about new foods you would like for them to bring in. If they keep this up I may have to stop going to Whole Foods as they are now carrying most of the staples I get from WF here and they are cheaper!

14.description: This Jewel is very convenient for me at my new residence.  I am glad they have organic choices in produce and packaged goods.  I would like to see a little more even if it is in the frozen food section.They keep it clean and pretty looking.  Their wine selection is amazing!  They have my organic/ eco friendly mascara!  Good for them.  I can also find safe cleaning products and toiletries. At certain times of the day, the lines are very long but the cashiers do their best to move them along quickly.

3.description: I needed some milk, super quick, and having just moved to the 'hood, wasn't sure where to go. Randee's is right on the corner. Since Mike's Pantry seems to keep banker's hours, I headed over and got my gallon of milk along with a nice smile from the guy behind the counter.

1.description: R.I.P coyote.

2.description: Hours are great! This store has booze at prices that rival Jewel. If that isn't enough, it's clean, well lit, and has a friendly staff.

0.description: Solid little mom and pop corner store in an up and coming section of Chicago. Portage Park used to be called Polack Park when I lived in Rogers Park, but then again we called Rogers Park Robbers Park, cuz I got mugged 3 times in one summer! Jokes on them, I only had my sunglasses! HA! What was I saying?Yes, they have the staples that make this a legit corner store, 25c oatmeal raisin, jerky, but they also have a ton of craft beers and other goods that I can't even tell you about, you just need to see them. There seems to be a trend, when a company updates its inside and outside look, it seems to get better. I swear I was here about 4 weeks ago, and the sign wasn't working, and the place looked kind of dingy, but now? Man! Looks awesome! I think its all the new lighting inside, looks real clean now. Plus they're open 20 hrs a day for whenever you feel like getting some convenience items late night. I also like their address, 4321 Milwaukee? Sounds like the lyrics of a song from the 30's that you would listen to and do the Charleston.

3.description: Service was pretty rude and our party wasn't even served. They lost our almost $200 business and the place isn't really kept up with either. Bathrooms are a mess with an obnoxious crowd.

1.description: A few friends and myself came to this place to shoot some pool and visit with each other since we only see each other around the holidays. We used to be regular customers until we showed up last night. Terrible mistake. We tried to order several orders of nachos and the manager claimed he couldn't sell any to us. Whatever. So we ordered pizza from the Giordano's next door only for the manager to very rudely tell us we couldn't have outside food at this establishment and that I needed to learn to "read the posted sign" about outside food, which did not exist. There was no such sign. Ended up having to leave early and ate our pizza in the car. We will never be back after this incident as this completely ruined the entire evening. Hope your satisfied with your awful customer service and poorly kept pool hall (place is absolutely filthy) because we nor our money will be back.

2.description: If I could live here,  I would! My boyfriend and I are really into billiards and were supposed to go to Nick's. But because they were under construction,  we looked elsewhere. So when we found this place, we were greeted and everyone was very friendly.  They charge $5 an hour I believe. Not too expensive.  But parking is pretty easy, getting a table was pretty easy...  The food isnt five star  but you don't go to eat.  Lol.  I would recomend this place to people who shoot. My boyfriend and I are always here when he's home from school.  It's very laid back. I love it. Oh and ladies shoot free some days:)

9.description: There are not too many decent pool halls on this side of town. This is definately the top of the line. Always a friendly face at the counter, great food, great rates, and always a spot to play. Never had a bad time and always looking to come again soon.

10.description: This place is pretty much my preferred pool hall. Despite some of the younger, looking-for-a-fight crowd, most of the people that drop in are just looking for a low key night of pool.The cues and tables are all in pretty good condition, and they have enough tables to keep the wait to play at a minimum. The TVs are usually showing whatever sports are on, and there's an internet jukebox if you feel like shooting to some tunes. The rates are hourly, and pretty reasonable. I can't remember which night if their lady's night, I think either Tuesday or Wednesday, but anyway, on that night ladies play free. Good deal.They do offer some bar type food behind the counter, most of which isn't bad, and very affordable. They also are BYOB, and don't charge. There's a liquor store right across the street. Convenient.

4.description: DO NOT GO here if your not white.  The last guy that served us at the counter was a complete moron and totally rude.  From the moment we walked in he was an asshole with a mission to not serve us.  Never have I been that disappointed or upset with someone's service.  Totally unprofessional and disrespectful.  Don't waste your money here there are many other places much better than this.  The staff is a joke.  Enough said.  Never ever again.

6.description: Last night we went there and service was very rude from the moment we walked in. From the way the worker on duty spoke with us, to his refusal to accommodate our party of 10 people, even with two tables available. And for a party our size who would have easily stayed 2-3 hours they lost out on an easy $200-300. Any intelligent person who runs a business would know you should always be out to convenience your customers not inconvenience them. You lose out on good business, and for a pool hall that is mainly packed only on the weekends and makes the bulk of it's money then, it is not a smart move to turn away a group of customers. The owner should fire that worker for very poor employee etiquette and managing skills. We've brought large groups on a number of occasions and other workers there have been smart enough to accommodated us, but because of the ignorance of that one employee we will not be returning. Never leave a bad taste of customer service in a Customer's mouth. And as I finish this review, I quote a customer playing at a table nearby, staring at us and shaking his head as we were leaving....."All that money just walking out the door."

11.description: This place is the closest pool hall to my house. I used to frequent it from time to time, but I haven't been going there as much. I bring my own cue stick, but the house cues are fairly good, as are the tables, and there are at least 14 or 15 of them. They also have a second floor that you can apparently rent out, but I've never seen anyone up there. The jukebox that they have is great. The patrons are really easy going, and on occasion offer to shoot a game or two. From time to time, you get an annoying high schooler or two, but most people keep to themselves. The staff's friendly, and they usually have whatever is on ESPN on the TVs at all times. The food's decent. What I like most about this place are their rates. From what I can remember it's about $7 or so for 3 or 4 hours at most on the weekdays. And I shoot a LOT of pool. With that being said, I'm going to plan on heading here soon.

5.description: Solid pool hall, great rates, $11 from 9-6? And its BYOB? Nice man. I am a fan. I will return. They have $5 burgers and fries also.

7.description: Good place to hang with friends. The cue sticks where ok but what more to say with public cues. Crowd was nice BYOB so we all were there for entertainment. Didn't try the food but plan to NEXT time hopefully with a few more friends.

8.description: Ravi,Thanks for the feedback. Good to hear that you are keeping an eye on food trash left around. That will definitely help.Since I was knowledgable about those tables, otherwise how could I have known to ask about them, it was still curious as to why we weren't allowed to play up there? I was told that I would have to wait for the place to be full. This doesn't seem like a good reasoning really. What difference would that make? Probably easier to supervise if everyone is downstairs, but even harder to supervise the upstairs if the downstairs is all full! Anyway, if I knew about them, then I probably would not want to go up there just to trash the place or shoot up or whatever. Two beautiful pool tables going to waste up there while gathering only dust.regards,patrick

0.description: This place was pretty cool. Went on a random night sometime in the middle of the week. Other players seemed friendly enough. Good neighborhood vibe and easy parking. Byob. They have two rooms which makes the place feel more closed off. They don't have much for seating, other than two high chairs, which didn't make it the most comfy. I also didn't like that half the tables in the main room easily get disrupted by newcomers walking in. the setup and flow of the space is just not ideal---- registers are at the back of this double store-front spot. But it was pretty cheap. Byob. And cool vibe.  I'd come back

3.description: A completely unpretentious, old school Chicago neighborhood bar - friendly (wound up chatting it up with various locals) and cheap (2 Lite bottles and 2 shots of Beam for $10).  Enjoy it for what it is.

1.description: If sitting next to the Hero of Canton (the Man they call Jayne) while drinking $1 Miller Genuine Drafts and watching a fishtankful of frogs is your thing, the Cabaret Lounge is your place. Many of the customers here have hit andropause but the frogs most certainly have not. There's also a bookshelf full of harlequins, a beautiful and massive world map, and adjacent statuettes of Mark Twain and Ronald Reagan in the back room in case you get bored.

2.description: This place is a dive.But it's a good dive.Friendly bartenders, a full jukebox.Too many Rock n rye shots had my friend and I waddling into the December snow. In one word: friendly.

0.description: The best damn neighborhood bar in the world...It might be a dive..... But it's a good Dive....nobody bothers you .......Even women can come here and not be bothered.... Because the regulars don't let women to be treated like that around here.... come have a shot here ....and a beer..... You will be very pleased with the place ...tell em' Feats sent ya'.....( no... I don't  own the bar... I just been drinking here for 40 years....l)

3.description: this place has a wide selection of alcohol/smokes, last time i was there they had this cute cake faced chick getting guys to try honey JD... fair prices

1.description: I went here because it is very local to me. We stopped in to get a couple of items. Shelves and bottles are very dusty. As we were checking out, their credit card system errored out yet still charged my card twice. This concerned me as the manager, Daniel, stated that the charges will fall off in a couple days. Then he recommended I go to an atm. He wasn't concerned at all about the charges on my card but yet I'm out $93 with out anything to show for it. I will not be back!

0.description: I am almost hesitant to yelp this, as I know there are some hardcore bourbon collectors following, but I believe on passing it forward...I have  found many rare bottles (Booker's 25th Anniversary, Elmer T. Lee *commemorative* edition, George T. Stagg Jr., Sazerac rye, Elijah Craig Barrel Proof - just to name a few) on their shelves... not to mention an impressive collection of hard-to-find tequila, rum and scotch. this place is an absolute hidden gem and worth a trip for any serious whiskey collector, even if it is a little out of the way. prices average about $5 higher than local retail on items like Blanton's and some mid-tier favorites, but it's hard to beat the selection! I just blew my bourbon budget for the next couple months, but I'm definitely gonna make this store a new weekly stop.

2.description: This place has always been a liquor store to me!!!  I grew up coming here with my Dad to stock up our house for parties.  We use to load two carts full...when I was a kid I had no idea this was a lot of alcohol but now when I look back it totally was...all I can say is that my parents threw some great events!!!This place has everything you could ever want from Vodkas to Craft Brews.  I really like this place because all they do is sell alcohol.  Yeah for Cardonal Liquors!!!  That is what they are dedicated too!  If you want Coors Light then go to Jewel, please do not hold up the line from the serious drinker! Do not come here to do your grocery shopping, unless you are buying for Nicholas Cage's character in "Leaving Las Vegas"!Liquor Liquor and more Liquor...that is what you will find here!  Be careful on holidays becaue the store can become quite crowded.  They also have a pariking lot too unless you want to pay the parking meter!!!

5.description: I probably wouldn't go to this location to shop, just because I don't live in the area, but the employees were friendly. I had the opportunity to see what the employees were really like, because I was holding a liquor event here. I was at this location for a few hours, and what I observed was a vast knowledge of products, as well as a friendly customer friendly atmosphere.If I'm in the area, and need something I will go back.

6.description: Awesome place. 1) Their prices beat all the other neighboring liquor stores by a lot. Jewel has cheaper beer, but that's because they're jewel. You should buy liquor from a liquor store, not a grocery store =)2) Their have a large selection AND they keep a good stock of their selection. I know what they sell, and when i want it, they have it. They don't run out of what i go there for - ever.3) Staff is super helpful. Not only are they willing to help a large guy like me take a few boxes of packaged goods our to my vehicle, they also have a knowledge of what they're selling.There is always a middle aged white man helping people out. It's clear he's the "boss" around there, but he may also be the owner...? not sure on that, but he's been a HUGE help in the past w/ my questions/inquires into wines and other spirits. Basically, if you have a question, SOME ONE in the store will be able to help you. I've personally been helped w/ wine, exotic beer, bourbon and even absinthe selections.Great place. If you live within 5 miles, definitely make the drive here.Oh yea, also they have a private lot - so parking is easy...but there is usually street parking, which is even closer, readily available.

7.description: Great selection of liquor and spirits. They have a decent selection of beer and wine but it pales in comparison to their liquor selection. They have EVERYTHING, in multiple sizes and at good prices. They have ample parking and are close to home. I've found my new favorite liquor store!

8.description: It's good for around here but not 5 stars.

9.description: Cardinal.  Fast, cheap, and orders esoteric liquor when necessary.  Kwok specifically for my husband.  Prices cannot be beat.

10.description: This place is wonderful, just wonderful.  It's a haven for alcoholics and casual drinkers alike.  Plenty of wine - all at excellent prices and lots of help if you need it since I don't drink it.  Lots of liquor and then my favorite section in the back in the last row - ah yes, beer.  They have our favorites from Unibrou, Bell's, New Holland, and so on - not just dusty and on the shelf, but cooling in the fridge right behind it.  They still have a few Kalamazoo's left - the Wheat kind in case anyone who knows about the Bell's Kalamazoo branding debacle and wants to get it before it is totally gone.  The prices are great and the people who work there are interesting.  You'd think after looking up Woodchuck Amber for the past 6 months, they'd put it in the system with a barcode scan.  Nope, I'm stuck in a world here where I'm looked at seriously holding a green and red container with woodchucks on it being asked about my "woodbridge" wine.  Also, it's only happened once, but one time the lady asked me how much it was and I told her $5.99 and she believed me.  Going to hell, maybe - but I love that.  One star missing because I went to the Cardinal on MIlwaukee up in Niles and the people who work there are helpful and want your business - the manager actually offers for you to call him, tell him what you want beer-wise, and not only will he order it, but he'll put it in the cooler for you.  Now that's a true friend.

4.description: Wow!  Best deals on liquor I've seen anywhere in the Chicago area.  Extensive beer selection too.  I saw customers stacking cases in their carts their prices are so low.  A bit out of the way for me, but when in Rome... stock up!I now have 4 bottles of vodka in my freezer :)

3.description: It saddens me to revise my review of this place. Simply because the staff is so friendly. I got a full set,and two fill ins done by a really nice guy here,and a great pedicure by the young lady. But the last time I visited,I was serviced by a guy who reeked of alcohol,and did not do a good job at all. He took his time doing my nails,but somehow it still came out bad. I went in with one of my nails cracked,and when he was done,my nail was still cracked..instead of putting on a new nail,he just filled over it..he also used cheap nail glue to stick down the sides of my nails..why? I have no idea...endless to say,my nails did not last longer than a week...so I'll give them one more chance,because it was one bad experience with one guy...ill just go to the other guy next time,if I return.

1.description: This is the 2nd time I've been here. This time for a mani/pedi. I went back because I liked their color choices and it's close to my house. The Asian woman was my manicurist and she's really rough. When she was painting my nails she grabbed each finger very aggressively same when cleaning my nails and cuticles. It was unpleasant being grabbed that way. The other reason why I won't go back is when I was finishing up drying my nails I asked for the dry oil because I was wearing gym shoes and the man acted like he could not be bothered to help me. He kept saying they should be dry already. But I insisted since my polish has often smudged in the past when I had to put my gym shoes on. Won't be giving them my business again.

2.description: A girlfriend and I wanted a decently priced pedicure at a clean salon with good reviews. Swayed by a free parking lot and two appointment openings, we decided to try this place, which is actually called Sunny Nails. The place seems popular, as it was pretty crowded. Because we had appointments, we didn't have to wait (I hate it when places accommodate walk-ins before appointments!). I've never had such a lengthy, thorough pedicure before -- with a surprise hot stone massage to boot! They did a great job removing my rough heel skin, exfoliating my legs, and perfectly painting my toenails. The bottle of polish looked like new. My feet turned out great. I'll definitely go back to this place. And I love the punch card -- after five services, you receive $10 off your sixth visit. They accept credit cards, too.

0.description: IDK why no one has reviewed this place yet. Perks: Cheap, good, relaxing mani/pedi's2 blocks off of Grayland Metra stop (booyay)Shares lot w/Jeff's Red Hots (can you say oreo shake & cheese fries)Parking lot & street (easy non permit parking) Pedicure chairs are new & oh so relaxingCustomer Service, some of the friendliest people!!TV set to Dateline when I was there ;-)ConsMay have to wait, call aheadSmallish, only 4 pedi chairs, but enough mani stationsMust try it out! Def worth the cons....

4.description: I never had a bad visit in the 4+ years I have been going there! The prices are the best around, the staff is friendly and personable. And they even have their own little parking lot! The only thing I would change is the TV channel; many times it's on a foreign station that I don't understand or relate to. They should choose a channel that is more geared for the customers and not themselves.UPDATE: 8-7-2014= There are new owners that took over and changed the TV channel to something I can understand and concentrate on while they are working on me :) The prices are still very reasonable and the service is still good. On my latest visit however, they talked between them selves (3 employees) in their Asian language and didn't seem to have any interest in talking with their customers or learning their names or any kind of small talk to put the customers more at ease. I guess that was the only thing I didn't like, hopefully they will feel more comfortable in the future to better communicate with their clients. Other than that, I would go back again and recommend this business to friends and family members.

3.description: We had a wonderful birthday experience for our 4 year old son at the Inside Out Studio.  After some warm up art activities, we got right down to mask masking and kids had a blast (the parents, too)!  This isn't your typical, rent a room party.  The owner Jeff Semmerling is a master mask maker and is there to help the kids along the whole way.  For younger kids, parental help was essential for tracing and cutting, but older kids could mostly create their masterpieces all on their own.  They each left with a beautiful mask of their own making and it was wonderful to see them all flying around the mask shop in their personalized bird masks.  Jeff even made a special dragon mask for my son because he loves dragons so much but was a little young to piece together the more complicated project.   Highly recommend this for a birthday party for kids of any age, especially if you are looking for something a little different.

1.description: My 8 and 5.5 year old just finished a camp session at the studio.  My 8 year old left very upset ... Why?  Because it was over.  They loved every minute and want to recreate more of the crafts at home.  We look forward to returning for more camp days on CPS days off.   Thank you Jeff et al.

2.description: This place is awesome.  The owners are wonderful with the kids and very talented.  My kids both attended the 4-hour 'camp' days during this winter break.  They were the youngest kids there and were still totally engaged.  My goal was for them to have art class, not for me to have 4 hours alone, and I'm so glad I sent them because this is a legit studio.  The kids worked in almost every medium possible over the course of 4 days and had multiple impressive projects to bring home every day.  They learned about famous artists, they made elaborate sketches on subjects given each day, suncatchers, 3D art using scissors, glue, paint, drawing tools, they made paper mache/clay animals, 3D trees adorned with hand-drawn wildlife,  holiday trees using curled paper as the color for a textured effect, and of course masks. My child who shows no interest in art at school loved this class and begged to go back every day.  Their time was much better spent here than at a sports camp.Thanks to Jeff and Donna - support this local business!  I'm so glad I did!

0.description: The Inside Out Art Studio is not quite what you may expect. Master artist and mask maker Jeff Semmerling  is incredibly talented and shares this talent with many. He brings in kids for parties and they learn how to make masks. He brings in individuals with special needs and delights them with his artistry. Jeff makes masks and puppets for Chicago theater and beyond....and his creations are always a big hit in Naw'lins during Mardi Gras. I was honored to wear one of his creations during the Mystick Krewe of Laffs Bash at the Chicago Cultural Center and I had numerous invitations from folks who wanted to take their selfie with me!  The Inside Out Art Studio is a wonderful place to explore the mysteries of art and self. A mask...especially a mask of Jeff's creation can make you a totally new person or help you discover just who you really are. It's fun......be there.insideoutarts.us

1.description: I came here on a weekend evening and you would of thought there was a clothing shortage. The line here looped around for days. I didn't notice this when I first came in so I spent 10-15 minutes finding a pair of jeans and trying them on only to put them back as I did not plan on standing in an hour long line. Marshalls is a discount clothing store providing a decent selection of items. Nothing special but it is cool seeing the original price tag and how far it has been marked down. Pretty standard and nothing special. I am not sure if it always this busy but long lines are never something I look forward to.

9.description: The store  has great bargains in the clothes department,the shoes are nice,and love the household items there.

23.description: From all the Marshall's in Chicago, this is my favorite.  Not that I've been to all that are in Chicago, but I've been to few and this one stands out.  It is organized much better.  It is hit or miss whether you find something cool, but chances seem better here than at other locations.  They have a large women's clothing selection, actually all the departments have large selections.  My favorite here is the home section.  I found a great quilt here for under $40 and lots of bedding, a rug, kitchen supplies, and lots of other stuff.  Once in a while they have good shoes.

12.description: I never really liked Marshall's and would literally go the opposite direction when asked to accompany someone.  I was not a fan of clothes thrown every where and the store being extremely unorganized.  Well, I have noticed since moving to Chicago that Marshall's has a lot to offer.  This is my neighborhood location and I have spent quite a few Saturday afternoons looking and finding great deals. Now it is still Marshall's so you will have to search quite often for quality pieces but once you find them they really are a lot cheaper than the department stores.

21.description: I lived close by this location for a year and it is sad to say that it is my least favourite store. Maybe its due to the size in addition to the prices. It seems to me that they never re-list their items for sale, they just keep on pricing them till somebody gets it off the shelf.

16.description: Why I love Marshalls:Because I just bought a pair of Oscar De La Renta sunglasses for $10.

17.description: This is the Marshall's where clothes souls go to die. It was the most depressing, dirty, unorganized Marshall's I have ever been to. Don't even try to look for shoes because if you find a display of some you like the shoes won't be beneath them. I was so aggravated by the shoe search I didn't even try to look around the rest of the store.

10.description: This is thee worst Marshalls of them all. Always a mess, disorganized & not stocked on anything. Smh Marshalls! Get it together! Every time I go there I remind myself that the last time I went was supposed to be my last!

5.description: Decent for the prices, but you have got to spend a lot of time looking for non damaged goods. Nothing worse than finding something you like, them having only one and its messed up. Other locations are more organized and you can actually find gift quality goods.

11.description: I'm surprised by some of the "meh" reviews. I found a lot of cute stuff here -but admittedly I was looking mainly at sportswear. I do understand that these stores can be kind of hit or miss. -It really depends on how the merchandise turns over. -But I find, with a little patience and a good eye, you can quickly scan over the crap to eye that one item that sticks out. I found a bunch of cute Nike shorts for the gym here. All the locations are pretty much the same for me. I didn't really find this one any different. I'm a pretty seasoned clearance rack shopper so these stores don't put me off. I am able to get in, scan the racks and pick up a few gems!

22.description: This store is okay but -- opposite of Urszula -- I have never been able to find anything I want here -- and I don't usually come away from Marshall's or TJ's empty handed.  No particular complaints, just that they never seem to fill my shopping needs.

0.description: Marshall's, or the shebang of T.J. Maxx sister stores, are probably some of the busiest retailers during the holiday season.  Don't even attempt to head there on the weekends in December because you will be stuck in line forever and ever!  I have written several reviews on Marshall's and T.J. Maxx.  Here are the "do's" and "don'ts" based on my experience in shopping at various locations throughout the city:DO- keep an open mind, because you won't necessarily find the exact items you want.  In other words, this kind of retailer isn't suitable for "point-and-shoot" style of shopping.  Please allow yourself to have a plenty of time to browse through each aisle.  - check out their home department, especially when you are thinking about hosting a tea party at your place.  There is usually a massive selection of mugs, kitchen gadgets, organic tea, and random Danish cookies.  However, ensure that expiration dates are carefully inspected before purchasing any food or beverage items. - pay attention on the " add-on" as you are making through the check-out line.  I found "panettone," a traditional Italian Christmas cake that hubby requested this year.  I honestly didn't spot this anywhere else in the store.  DON'T- even think about finding bargains on their beauty clearance shelves.  Most bottles have been opened, pumps have been activated, and packages have been either tempered or destroyed by mankind.  I was contemplating on picking up some of the clearance beauty products as my associates' stocking stuffers, but I quickly scratched that idea when I witnessed this catastrophe.  - expect merchandise to be impeccably organized and sorted according to the standard.  You will find non-clearance items on the clearance racks and vice versa.  It is what it is.  That's all I need to say.  I typically convert my credit card reward points into T.J. Maxx gift cards so that I can stock up some of the beauty products that normally cost twice as much in a department store.  For example, I find the Shiseido foamy or deep-cleaning facial cleansers for under $13.  This particular Marshall's location is part of the Six Corner shopping district, on the corner of Kilpatrick and Irving Park in east end of the Portage Park neighborhood, accessible via CTA #80 (Irving Park) bus.

20.description: Why I love Marshalls:Because I just bought a pair of Oscar De La Renta sunglasses for $10.

19.description: This store is a complete mess. Like, a disaster area. I get that it's Marshall's, so you're going to have to look through their clothing to find anything you may like, but this? I've made multiple attempts to have a good shopping experience here, but everything I feel like I should turn on my phone's GPS so friends & family can find me amongst the mess. This place looks as if the staff just stands idly by while customers just throw things anywhere and everywhere. I don't care how inexpensive it is, I don't have the energy to dig through.

2.description: Came here at 9:30pm to grab a pair of gloves for the kids since it just snowed. Got dropped off at the entrance and the asshole rent-a-cop yells, "we're closed"... Door says they close at 10pm. That's more than enough time to literally choose a pair of gloves and pay. Stood by the store hours sign and read the sign, and the asshole and one of the workers see me doing that, and I can tell that they know that I know that this was bullshit. Marshalls sets the hours, not you guys.

18.description: Methinks not is right! Every time I prepare to write my witty over dramatized reviews I remember how important it is to give 100% in customer service. I enjoy Marshall's prices and ability to have Home Decor, Clothes and Work out equipment. I was on a mission to find aesthetically appeasing wine glasses for a price that wouldn't involve giving my first child. On my journey to find these perfect display glasses for my new bar, I stumbled across the perfect set which with my luck only one left, I needed two. I asked customer service to find out if they were available at any other Marshall's and I'm given one phone call (I felt like I was in prison, who do I call my lawyer or my best friend, my family!? AHHHHH!) Well I choose a store that refuses to take our call and I say forget it I'll go to the store in person and give a piece or 5 of my mind, long behold I didn't buy the glasses at the first store due to the fact of possibly not finding another match, I come to find the store we tried to contact had them and lets just say I schooled everyone on how to get off their fat ass and cell phones and help customers because we sign your checks. With that I received a discount and much better service. Along with the whole time before the dramatics of their poor performance, I had to sit inline listening to the employees and managers talk about their hangovers & highs. Not smart, nor does the whole store need to know who's pregnant or stoned. I'm sure MTV & VH1 will give them a show and all of America can learn about it then. Marshall's you have no class or etiquette at any store I've been too. Therefore you get a start for your none broken products. Thank you and goodnight.

13.description: I love Marshalls, but this one can be really messy and disorganized.  I'd love to see what would happen if they got friendlier employees & a manager who could tackle making this place a little nicer for customers.Good deals on cute stuff, though!

4.description: Clothes selection was great... Floor staff was ok... Cashiers were horrible and of course that's what I remember the most... Didn't say a word to me... Even when I spoke to herI see why this place has 2 stars

24.description: This store is in the Marketplace at Six Corners just east of the Sears that has been there forever. There is a decent selection of apparel here with good prices, but sometimes the frenzied crowds can cause some of the clothing to be strewn about and you have to dig for what you are looking for.

6.description: This Marshalls has a very limited selection. I often can never find what I am looking for when I visit. Don't get me wrong-they have some cute stuff, but they don't have much merchandise to chose from.

15.description: Not Really the best experience but not the worst - Pros: Cheap PricesAlot to Choose From Close to My CASA!Cons:ClutteredUnorganizedCustomer ServiceI love that i can get everything like Nicollete M. stated Oscar De La Renta Sunglasses for cheap, and i love being able to find almost every type of clothes, but it would be nice if they were organized better and not so cluttered. Plus the Service Behind the Counter Rude. More occupied by her own thoughts,than to do her job ring me up. I'm not difficult but that was un called for - Like i said not the best, but its not the worst either -

7.description: Customer service here is just awful.They really need to have workers who care even a little...Great prices but ugh... almost not worth sorting through a mess and having rude employees treat you like garbage.

8.description: Waited until I visited a few times before righting my review so I could try not to make a snap judgement, but now that I have let me say that this is the messiest store front I have ever seen.This Marshalls is about as organized as a bad yard sale, but most yard sales at least have friendly people. Like a yard sale good deals can be had, but all things considered I would say avoid this one...

3.description: More often than not, I can rely on Marshalls for nice home decor at budget prices.  At this location, I purchased a silver picture frame with a birds and branches design for $8, and a photo album with a nautical design.However, the clothing and handbags aren't much to look at.  There's a new label by Cristian LaCroix on the handbags racks, but other than that, I breezed through this area pretty quickly.  I would head down the street to TJ Maxx instead.

14.description: I had the WORST customer service her ever. A blonde woman working the front counter was rude, not helpful or accomodating. You already know going in is going to be a disorganized mess but you may find that needle in the haystack gem. I was just very disappointed. Born and raised in this neighborhood and have to have such a bad taste in my mouth. You guys should have hire standards when hiring.

28.description: Another 6 corners legend. I as a kid purchased my first starter cap from them it was an Orlando Magic hat fitted cap. They do have a great selection of hats but I don't think they are overpriced. I bought a nice Kangol hat from them for about 15 dollars. Thats not bad for a Kangol hat thats first quality or you can go to Marshalls and purchase the same hat for less but second quality meaning the size is wrong on the hat or it's blemished in some way.

1.description: Hats Plus is a great store, and I would say reasonably priced.  I'm not saying it's a bargain, but I wouldn't say they're overpriced.  Here's why!There are very few hatters out there.  This industry has shrunk considerably.  The places that do sell hats, usually only sell "small, medium, large and extra large" with no proper hat sizes.  They are sold as a side item, so there's no real selection.  Hats Plus sells it all.  They have a lot of inventory too!  Remember, while they don't have a "sexy location" they carrying a lot of overhead with all those hats!  I've had a had blocked and cleaned, and purchased a couple berets.  Now, as far I know, no one sells a beret anymore.  I purchased a Hoquy authentic French beret, and those are less scarce than any other hat out there.  I also had my old authentic, felt, Brooks Brothers fedora cleaned and reblocked.  For 20 minutes worth of work, they charged me $60 which I think is a lot.  But I felt it was a contribution to the cause.If your serious about buying a good hat that fits properly, and realize the subtle and differences between a fedora, hamburg, and a tribley and how these subtleties can make a difference in your appearance, then this is the only place to shop.Very few cities have a hatter of this magnitude.  Before moving to Chicago 13 years ago, I purchased from this company though the Internet.  We're fortunate to have them here in Chicago.

9.description: "Everything in Headwear" says their business card. I heard an employer tell a customer they have 35,000 hats in their inventory, which I believe.Hats Plus is by far the most no gimmick, straightforward, interesting retail store I have been in here in Chicago in a long while.The "top shelf" here is really the side display cases, where the more expensive hats live...priced from approximately $60 - $130 each. And there is a hat for everyone. Wow, what a cultural learning experience. Just read the names of the hats and as you do you can imagine a person you know or knew wearing each hat.There are hats for every personality and season. Perhaps I was unduly optimistic yesterday browsing for a summer hat .... something Panama or Plantation style to keep the sun off my face. Yes, the sun. It comes out once a month here. I think; if I remember correctly.There are not only styles upon styles, here but there are hats for function, including many that are packable.Average price seemed to be about $50 for hats not in the "top shelf" side wall display cases.Customer service: excellent. There was a blind man buying a handful of hats, and I saw him work with the patient sales clerk to wrap each hat in materials that feel differently, so he would know each hat by its wrapping paper. Something for everyone. West on Irving Park on the south side of the street just east of Milwaukee Ave., and you can park free at that point on Irving Park...no meters here!So go in and browse!!!

29.description: Plenty of hats. It almost makes you dizzy.

23.description: I love this store.  I am blessed to have such a cool store close to me.  They have a wonderful selection of fedoras, cabbies, and some decent winter hats also.

5.description: It's nice to see a storefront business that is not in a mall or boarded up. Hats Plus fits the bill. (Oh crap, the first hat pun).  This is a great place to find and purchase a hat! No frills, no push to hurry, nobody constantly hovering.Nice.If you have questions the staff really knows their ample inventory and I found the prices quite reasonable, well worth the transit ride from the loop.Three years back we were in Chicago and went to Sids on the south side and picked out a relatively pricey cap, and being tourists had no knowledge of other stores but next time: straight to Irving Park.Thanks, Hats Plus!

25.description: Very helpful staff who will show you a lot of product even if it is not what you are looking for. Affordable prices such as a Kangol runs you $35-45. Not a lot of variety in styles and colors though.

12.description: Absolutely one of my fave stores of any  kind. I've been coming here for maybe 20 years and each visit has been a pleasure. Just stopped by this afternoon and picked up a beige short brim fedora. I know these hats can be pricey but think about the pleasure they bring for years of use. Very knowledgeable staff unlike other hip-looking stores run by newbies. I actually like the dated feel of this place.  Reminds me of a generation when hats were widely considered cool.

21.description: The hats here range from the typical, to some what popular among young men, to the more expensive kind. I've gotten a few hats there, one of which was a black cap, almost like a sailors, that I have never seen anywhere before. It also didn't cost much. Got a hipster hat too that was the same price as every place else I've been to, and actually cheaper than places in Wicker Park. When you get to the more expensive hats though, you start to see some really nice ones. A good variety of fedoras, bowler caps, newsboy caps, etc. The thing you have to take into consideration is that when you get to these types of hats they're of course going to be more expensive. They're made better and with a style.The guys who work there have been helpful every time I've gone. Helped me find a straw hat that my grandfather might like, which he did. And a gave my friend suggestions of where to look for a certain type of hat they didn't have.If you like to check out men's hats then check out this place.

16.description: Been here several times and the selections of hats are amazing! We had Shawn help my bf get a derby hat and took his time with finding him the right one and taught him proper ways to take care of the hat . We will keep conming back to buy more hats in the future!

17.description: Well, the name of the store sums it up pretty well.  If you want a hat, this is the place for you.  It should be mentioned right out, however, that this store sells primarily men's hats.  The selection is also mostly traditional hats (fedoras, bowlers, ivy caps, 8/4 hats, etc...)The prices will seems a lil' steep, but the hats are quality names...  Dobbs, Borsalino, etc...

10.description: I really can't say enough good things about my visit to this rather unassuming store earlier today. I've been to dedicated hat stores in Cleveland and New York City, but none have had the selection that Hats Plus has. I saw more flat caps today than I've ever seen in my decade or so of wearing them. And the prices were very, very reasonable. They've got some absolutely outstanding imported caps of very fine wool, as well as some lesser-priced hats ranging down to the $15 Stetson flat cap I picked up on sale. They also have some very nice scarves in fine wools and cashmeres. The clerk I worked with was very knowledgeable and just the right amount of friendly (I hate it when clerks try to be too friendly; that's just weird). The store may not look like much, and it's a little off the beaten track, but every well-dressed gentleman should visit.

11.description: One of the coolest places on earth.  Whether you know exactly what you are looking for, or have no clue what will work for you, the friendly staff will put it in your hands and on your head.  It reminds me of shopping on Saville Row in London.  They stock EVERYTHING!  They sell bowler hats from England, wool berets from France, and greek shipping caps from Greece: in every possible size and color.  You live in Chicago, you need a hat.  I know of no better place for men's hats on earth.I paid $20 for a greek shipping cap, but you can buy a luxury Homburg for $500.

26.description: The sign boasts "30,000 hats!", but that actually means 10 hats, with 3,000 examples of each kind.If you want a fedora, it's great. There are nice ones!If you want a cabby/newsboy cap, fantastic. They have a million!All permutations on those two, with only a small smattering of baseball caps, fisherman's hats, and berets. No women's hats at all. I considered going retro and buying a beret, but they were $48, youch.

27.description: Hats plus a few gloves and scarves, but they've got some dope lids.My 74-year-old beatnicky dad wanted a french-style beret, but the closest thing they had were the Kangol hats, which I thought were way cooler.  Couldn't convince the old man though.Get your Stetson on (literally)...

0.description: I was looking to get a new hat after doing a little searching, I found Hats Plus. It was a bit of a drive to get there but there are very few hat stores around so it is worth the trip. They have a huge selection of hats! There are lots of varieties and sizes to try on so you can be sure to get a perfect fitting hat. You will be able to browse the hats on your own, but they also have people there to help point you in in the right direction and give advice on the fit and style. For parking, I believe you can park out front on the street, but I found a near by lot to park.I would go back again next time I am looking to get a new hat. If you are looking for a nice hat at a reasonable price I highly recommend Hats Plus!

20.description: I'd been meaning to get a new hat for some time now. My Cubs hat is getting ratty and tired, not to mention no matter how much I wear it they never seem to get any better. Looking around at different styles of hats, the cadet style had struck a deep interest. It was just a matter of time to find the place to get the right one. Luckily I came across reviews of this hat store which sparked an interest. I didn't wait, I was eager to see what they had. The same day I picked up two hats. This is a Men's hat store, all kinds of interesting hats and none of them are sports themed. Goorin, Cowboy, dress, Christy's, Fedora's, tweeds hats and more. They have the space of two shops side by side with plenty of hat specialists to help you, if you need sizing, etc. Most hats are regularly priced $24 or more, more upwards of hundreds of dollars. If you trek to the northwest corner of the store you'll find their clearance area, with hats priced as low as ten bucks. WoOt! Returns are thirty days; standard. It's located on that busy corner where Irving Park road and Cicero meet; still there is ample street parking and public transit nearby.

19.description: I've been to plenty of hats stores in the city but this place is here to stay.  I have purchased hats from them before and decided to take my grandfather there.I ended up buying him a tweed fedora and it was very reasonably priced.  They carry "XS" which you don't find in many places.  It appears that there are many of them on sale so I will be back there soon.

2.description: Great place. I buy almost all my hats here. Fantastic selections and helpful, friendly staffGo here and support this local business.

18.description: The store obviously lacks the appeal or historyy of JJ Hat Center in Manhattan, New York. That being said, the selection is exceptional. They have quite a few styles and options of fedoras and flat caps. When in doubt, go with a Biltmore. The staff aren't great but you can get a cool hat at a reasonable price.

13.description: A throwback to the haberdashery. I love this place and always spend money here. The staff are knowledgable and eager to help.

4.description: From one hat lover (specifically Kangol and Wigens) to another, who knew?  Well, I didn't.  I was driving in the area a few days ago and happened to lay eyes on Hats Plus.  WHAT?  A hat store that I knew nothing about.  Sids on Roosevelt Rd., scoot over.Hats Plus has a lot of the *uncommon* colors (Kangol 507) I had been admiring online, but had been hesitant to purchase, eye--sight un--seen.Today:  20% off my fav style bamboo Kangol, for summer!  Salesperson informed me that Kangol is discontinuing the 507.  Hmph, they need to be d/c'ing the frickin' 504.I will return in the near future, as I had to activate my $elf control by NOT walking thru the entire store.  Thank goodness the K's were situated at the front of the store :D

24.description: Large selection of hats, less than stellar service.

6.description: I bought a beret for my husband online from this store.  I figured that if there was a problem with it I was better off buying from a place in Chicago .  It turned out that they were out of the size I ordered.  It is generally annoying when an item is listed as in stock on the webpage, and isn't.  However, they got in touch with me immediately and made every effort to be available for consultation.  The salesperson I talked to was knowledgeable, patient, and good humored.  He didn't mind checking on things for me or giving full explanations.  The hat I ended up ordering arrived the next day and my husband was very happy with it.  From the descriptions here I wish that we had the time to go to the store.  It sounds like alot of fun.

22.description: Needed a hat for a Halloween costume and remembered driving past this place before. I don't know about the "Plus" but they sure do have hats. Never before have I seen so many hats in one location. If you need a fedora, beret, bowler, stocking cap, whatever - this is your place. Uncanny.

15.description: The hats here range from the typical, to some what popular among young men, to the more expensive kind. I've gotten a few hats there, one of which was a black cap, almost like a sailors, that I have never seen anywhere before. It also didn't cost much. Got a hipster hat too that was the same price as every place else I've been to, and actually cheaper than places in Wicker Park. When you get to the more expensive hats though, you start to see some really nice ones. A good variety of fedoras, bowler caps, newsboy caps, etc. The thing you have to take into consideration is that when you get to these types of hats they're of course going to be more expensive. They're made better and with a style.The guys who work there have been helpful every time I've gone. Helped me find a straw hat that my grandfather might like, which he did. And a gave my friend suggestions of where to look for a certain type of hat they didn't have.If you like to check out men's hats then check out this place.

7.description: Guys, if you are a hat whore, get to this store! It could take you hours to go through all the hats and caps in this place. The array of stingy-brims, porkpies, Ivy caps, Ascot hats, and newsboys here is crazy, and even stuff like derbys, mad hatter style, top hats, old-fashioned boy scout/Mountie, and furry "pimp hats" are represented. Bigger sizes (7-1/2 to 8) seemed harder to find, but one of the clerks was very helpful, and also explained what type of hats flatter certain people (i.e. if you're tall, short-brimmed hats or brims that turn up can look funny because they look like a little kid, etc.) My bf found a flattering summer hat and deliberated but couldn't commit, so maybe we'll be visiting again. Meanwhile I grabbed their business card for my brother, who deserves a better hat than the grungy thing he perpetually wears! Overall, why wear a crappy baseball cap when you could have a fabulous fedora, a stylin' Stetson, or a bad-ass bowler! Find your crowning glory at Hats Plus!

8.description: Hats are average at best. Hat box is more style. This store looks like something out of the 60's on one 1/2 and something from the west side on the other. Didn't buy anything in the end but they were friendly

30.description: I don't know why they call it hats plus, I don't remember anything in this store except hats. They have the largest selection of every kind of hat that you could think of and the quality is high.  The problem is the prices. In my opinion most of them are overpriced. Yes, they are a speciality store, but come on, do the the prices have to be this high?

3.description: selection has slipped as prices have headed north, but the main problem, and why Iwon't be back is simple. after spending at least $1k there over the last15 years, Ido not need to have them treat me like they think I am there to steal from them, following me around , looking around corners like I am a thief.screw it.

14.description: I'd been meaning to get a new hat for some time now. My Cubs hat is getting ratty and tired, not to mention no matter how much I wear it they never seem to get any better. Looking around at different styles of hats, the cadet style had struck a deep interest. It was just a matter of time to find the place to get the right one. Luckily I came across reviews of this hat store which sparked an interest. I didn't wait, I was eager to see what they had. The same day I picked up two hats. This is a Men's hat store, all kinds of interesting hats and none of them are sports themed. Goorin, Cowboy, dress, Christy's, Fedora's, tweeds hats and more. They have the space of two shops side by side with plenty of hat specialists to help you, if you need sizing, etc. Most hats are regularly priced $24 or more, more upwards of hundreds of dollars. If you trek to the northwest corner of the store you'll find their clearance area, with hats priced as low as ten bucks. WoOt! Returns are thirty days; standard. It's located on that busy corner where Irving Park road and Cicero meet; still there is ample street parking and public transit nearby.

3.description: I think this place is ok. A bit pricy but it's seafood so w.e. Rice and beans are good. Shrimp are ok... I also got a milkshake and it was gross... Very watery and barely any taste to it and paid almost $4 for it smh. But the food wasn't all that bad.

1.description: I was also looking for tacos when I came in here. I didn't see them on the menu though. I don't speak much Spanish and the menu looked pretty foreign to me. It was all fish and super expensive.  Clearly they are a speciality restaurant which is fine but the ambience didn't match the prices.  I settled on one of the only familiar items I saw on the menu.  Fajitas! I chose steak. They were really good.  The meat was tender, the portion matched the price.  I left really full!  I really liked the creamy green salsa.  I swear im tasting canned ortega green chillies in it.  That being said, if you are looking for mainstream american/mexican, you won't find it here.  This was nothing like I have tasted so I would imagine it's truly family recipes.   The restaurant smelled wonderful when I walked in, I just couldn't afford most of the fish items.My suggestion for the restaurant... expand your menu just a bit beyond fish and cater a few things on the menu to us gringos,  lol.  I seriously Googled like 10 items on the menu before I gave up. Asada and lengua tacos please!

2.description: Wow wow woooow 140 dollars  for three people and a child they are expensive the ceviche was garbage,  tacos where mediocre.  I really don't  write review but this place i cant even explain it.  I suggest other places than this one.  I even order a torta for my husband to go, all the sauces where spoiled, so he was a bit hesitant  to 3at the torta so he threw it away.  And the receipt doesnt show what you got so I'm  curious if there adding on what ever they want.  Even doh  we pay. They have our money.  I will never come here again.  Enough said you been warned.

5.description: The place looks nice and descent, it looks colorful and I like the way they decorate it.The service and food are TERRIBLE!  They never gave us a menu. Being a first time costumer I was hoping to find out what variety of food they had. When the waitress came back to us she asked us if we were ready. I am used to eat "asada tacos" well when she asked me I told her I wanted 2 asada tacos and she told me "we don't have any asada, we only have chicken and pastor"  REALLY? Being a Mexican restaurant they are supposed to have asada. The first thing that came to my mind since it was a bit late was they were probably busy and ran out?  Ok. So we placed our order. After 5 minutes she came back. The tortillas were way too small (no biggy) the tacos we kind of OK but the ones my brother in law order did not taste like chicken!! The salsa had an awful taste. It taste old and so the chips. The waitress didn't even come back and ask us to see if everything was OK or I offer something else. I will definitely NOT come back again to this place!!!

0.description: Okay, I ordered meat from a place that clearly wants to focus on their seafood options. I'm good at finding weakness...that probably helps explain why I'm divorced. Anyways, I ordered on GrubHub and was pretty disappointed. While I was pleasantly surprised that the quesadilla was made with a house tortilla, the carne asada tasted a bit...off. Likewise, the pastor meat on my grossly overdressed huarache wasn't great and it was half fat. My boyfriend liked his flautas (special price on Tuesdays) but his tastes are questionable. Remember what I said about weaknesses? To top it off, they were out of thres leches cake and I had flan instead. Except I didn't because it never made it in the bag.They have daily specials and a really large selection of family and party sized plates. Maybe if I had gone with the seafood I'd have a more positive review. Help me out Yelpers and get me to change my mind?

4.description: The food wasn't good and Damm is it pricy for food that isn't worth it. $3 for a soda and the fish ceviche looks like they used the cans of tuna instead. Never again!

1.description: One of the better shrimp houses...Great Chicago style fried shrimp. Tasty hush puppies. Great classic Chicago style batter (not a babies batter). Original sauces. Should have fresh cut fries. Should have jumbo scallops. (If so than 5 Stars)Would be great if a horseradish sauce was an option also.*Frank's (towards ownership), It is worth getting rid of the frozen fries... Get those fresh cut fries in motion at all locations. It will generate more profits vs. the frozen fries and it would also add further reputability to your business. Be one of the first to do this, not the last.

9.description: Great job guys! I usually don't eat like this but my wife and I decided it was time for a treat!Great Shrimp, the batter was light enough that you still taste the shrimp. Fried Oysters with a perfect Briney Flavor to them were awesome! Hush Puppies were delicious! We also had Clam Strips, they were OK, but wouldn't get them again! This is a place you have to try!Heads up, really a To-Go place, but they do have a bench and ledge to eat from if you want(that's what we did!)Next time; Fried Scallops, Cat Fish, & Frog Legs for sure!!!

23.description: The Chicago shrimp was sooooooo good! Prices were pretty decent and service was fast. So glad they're in Portage Park!

5.description: Was good and fast. I liked the fact that they remove the tail from the shrimp versus some other places. Also the place was very clean and basic. The scallops were good too. There is a little garlic seasoning that they put on. Price is a little high, but then again I don't know what the market value for seafood is either.All in all, a positive and pleasant experience. The staff was cool. If I am ever back in this area and crave some shrimp, I will stop by.

25.description: Shrimp were fresh battered, great hushpuppies too!

12.description: Good shrimp, good sauces, good cole slaw, good fries. Hush puppies. Are tasty. I have been buying the dinners, fish and shrimp since they opened never a problem always good. Have a tough time finding enough room for the hush puppies. Want to try something else on menu but I am stuck on the shrimp.

21.description: I've been going to this place since I was a teenager, and for the last twelve years I have lived out of state and try to manage a stop to Frank's at least once or once every other trip. I have never found shrimp as good as Frank's nor as big. Trust me they're huge!! It's a small place, and if you're from Chicago you know great food comes from restaurants without seating that require you and your friends to eat in your car. Stop reading and go!!

16.description: The food was awesome. This place was spotless, and they were cleaning my entire time I waited for my order.  I have been to places that had a fishy smell. Not here at Franks. They were quick to get my order out. The fried oyster were great. I will be back and my only reason for the 4 stars is that I did not get offered any sauces. I had two sauces in the bottom of my bag. One was a spicy ketchup the other I think was a cocktail sauce. I am a tatar person.

17.description: I sometimes go to Frank's Archer Ave location. Good food, but prices are very high. I remember 1 lb of fish chips were $ 1.50 compared to $ 9.50 today. Soon they will be $ 10.00.

10.description: OK, so I grew up on the fish & chips from a nearby shop probably less than a mile away. I truly believe it is what you grow up that influences your tastes. I ended up here because I did not want to deal with traffic on Montrose because it still looks messed up from construction, I was craving fish chips and this was a fairly easy detour down Irving.  I ordered  1/2lb of fish and hush puppies. Wish I would have noticed the fried cauliflower. The prices are comparable to "the other" fish place. Frank's chips are much larger and crispier than the other place. Because they are larger it gives you the mental picture of not getting as much - but  1/2 a lb is  1/2 a lb, it's the same amount. The hush puppies were a bit more BUT you get quite a bit more and they are larger and they are also very good. The only complaint is that I did not like the cocktail sauce at all, it was more like BBQ sauce than a cocktail sauce. I. made my own when I got home. I am not sure if it is just a lot of Worcestershire sauce (which I do love) or what, but it it very dark in color and just tastes like BBQ sauce.  I would go here again to check out the Chicago style fried shrimp and fried cauliflower. This is strictly a chippy shop and not a fish shop like the other shop that also sells fresh fish by the lb and frozen fish and has a small grocery store supply of fish related things. It's strictly for eating pleasure.

11.description: One more hidden gem in portage/irving park! I'm from the south burbs originally and the shrimp here remind me of the famous Hiene McCarthy's in Orland. Frank's prices are on the low end, especially for the quality - a new favorite.

26.description: I just moved to the area so I was hoping to compare this to Lawrence's Fisheries in the city. They definitely don't have the selection of Lawrences but they do everything well.The Chicago Style shrimp was beyond delicious. It didn't taste like garlic but I haven't had the plain before so I can't compare. Big, juicy pieces of shrimp that were fried to perfection. And that cocktail sauce was just kick*ss. Seriously delicious.Everything was fried perfectly. Luckily we live close so it was still hot when we got home. Lawrence's has a leg up on the hot sauce but Frank's shrimp and cocktail sauce is the winner. I will be back many times over.

22.description: We have been here several times and the food is always great. I grew up in the neighborhood so my parents used to frequent their old location quite a bit and I was sad when I heard they were selling the other property. Very happy to see that they are still in business and on a busier street. I also have to say that I have been to the new location when it has been both packed (lent, especially) and quieter and they always get our food to us within 5-10 minutes. Another thing I'd like to add is the customer service - the woman behind the counter with the glasses especially is always really nice to us. You can tell she takes her job seriously, gets everything done efficiently but also makes time to talk with customers.

0.description: Very pleasant staff and amazing shrimp.  Great batter, clean oil, crispy.  Some of the best fried seafood I've had in Chicago.

20.description: Great job guys! I usually don't eat like this but my wife and I decided it was time for a treat!Great Shrimp, the batter was light enough that you still taste the shrimp. Fried Oysters with a perfect Briney Flavor to them were awesome! Hush Puppies were delicious! We also had Clam Strips, they were OK, but wouldn't get them again! This is a place you have to try!Heads up, really a To-Go place, but they do have a bench and ledge to eat from if you want(that's what we did!)Next time; Fried Scallops, Cat Fish, & Frog Legs for sure!!!

19.description: I love you guys.  Happy you moved the place looks great... the last two times have been in I like ot get the dinner asked for crispy fries and they were soggy and pail not even golden brown.. I give up again back to ording by the lb..

2.description: If you're ever craving seafood deep fried, this is the place to go. Some friends and I came here to pick up some fried food to go down with some beers that we were planning on having. Let's just say we ordered way more than we could handle. The two staff members, who I think we're owner and son were super helpful. Being that it was our first time there, they made valuable suggestion but we decided to bite off more than we could chew. We orders shrimp, scallops, some fish and hush puppies. The short wait inside didn't make our clothes smell like I had imagined. The food was fried and packaged quickly and efficiently. Upon getting home and plating everything did we realize we ordered too much. Nonetheless everything was seasoned and fried perfectly. A light batter that wasn't dense or soggy. Hot fresh seafood centers and nice tangy and spicy dipping sauces. Awesome food joint!

18.description: The best shrimp in all of Chicago.  The lady that waited on me was most pleasant, friendly and helpful.  Service was great, food was super, I will be back whenever I am in the area.  Place was clean.

13.description: Extremely over priced for both the quantity and quality of food served here. Its unfortunate,  that this is the only place in our neighborhood to purchase a fried fish sandwich. Not impressed.

4.description: The best shrimp on the north side of Chicago we were looking for them at the old place but thanks to yelp we found our new location it's even closer to us now yes sir the best

24.description: Best fried shrimp and catfish in the city. Its fried but not greasy. Delicious and fastttt.

6.description: Fast, fresh, reasonably priced seafood. What else would you need?  It is clean, the staff is pleasant & the seafoid is hand-breaded so you don't end up with so much breading that you cannot even taste the seafood, which is endemic at other places. Go for the Chicago style Shrimp, which is seasoned with garlic and other spices, you can't beat it, it is yummy beyond compare!

15.description: 3/4 pound is what I usually order....I might have to UPgrade to a lb. though, 'cause I is greedy and I loves the shrimps!

7.description: The shrimp was cooked fast & to perfection. The price was high for 1/2 pound of shrimp but I was pleased with the taste of the shrimp. I will definitely be back soon

8.description: I just moved to the area so I was hoping to compare this to Lawrence's Fisheries in the city. They definitely don't have the selection of Lawrences but they do everything well.The Chicago Style shrimp was beyond delicious.
