It didn't taste like garlic but I haven't had the plain before so I can't compare. Big, juicy pieces of shrimp that were fried to perfection. And that cocktail sauce was just kick*ss. Seriously delicious.Everything was fried perfectly. Luckily we live close so it was still hot when we got home. Lawrence's has a leg up on the hot sauce but Frank's shrimp and cocktail sauce is the winner. I will be back many times over.

3.description: I've been coming here since it was originally down addison by Linder right where I grew up. They have always been super friendly and it's definitely a childhood memory going here in the summer with the pops. They recently moved down irving not too long ago so it's still in the neighborhood and I can't complain. The shrimp is just amazing. Jumbo sized lightly but perfectly battered and super flavorful. You can either get the Chicago style (breaded with garlic) or the regular (breaded no garlic) I like both but I'd recommend the original as a first timer. I've tried their ocean perch which is good but I just love love their shrimp and don't want to order anything else, lol. People complain about the prices but they're pretty decent given its seafood and seafood isn't cheap when it's good. Crinkle fries, hush puppies, jalapeño poppers and fried pickles are all amazing sides-fries are always a must no matter what! Their sauce is just to die, perfectly tangy! Personally I LOVE their hot sauce-ask for a tub and you won't be disappointed.If you're a shrimp person this is a must try!

14.description: I normally don't give a review so high for a business, but I personally like this little raggedy place! The food is really good and always fresh and the employees are nice and very efficient with your order.  AND!! They have amazing Hush Puppies!!

3.description: This is my FAVORITE dollar tree. The fact it wasn't even registered on Yelp (and the fact it isn't next to a Target) likely has a lot to do with why it is so well stocked. True, it has a few less things then the one over by the Target but it's still a cool little store. They turn over their inventory a lot too and the place is most always clean. I only wish, as I have said on all my city Dollar Tree reviews, that they carried mops. The place is convenient from the bus and is on my way home and the staff is actually really nice here.

1.description: One of the good Dollar Tree's. Fully stocked on everything you're looking for & big. Who doesn't love it when everything... YES everything, is $1. Minus one star for opening late. M-SA they're supposed to open at 8am. Waited 10 minutes after 8 for them to open. 6 people were waiting along with me. Let's get that together!

2.description: They had just what I was looking for and the cashier was friendly, which is a major plus! I'm glad this store is in the neighborhood.

0.description: Out of all the Dollar Trees I've been too. This one has to be one of the cleanest and one of the better stocked ones. I find what I need about 90 percent of the time.  But I wish these stores could do their freight overnight and not during the middle of the day. It's gets annoying when you have boxes in the way.

Baltika, meaning things (Amber, woodcrafts, ceramics, toys, glass, spa items, and more amber) from countries (Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, Finland, Poland, Germany...) around the Baltic Sea. Excellent shop, amazing selection of all top quality handmade items, friendly and helpful staff, you just can't go wrong here. A never-miss place to grab a quick gift or stock your china cabinet for an upcoming party. My birthday is in June.Baltika is now closed.  :( There is some slim possibility they might re-open after the building re-models. Here's hoping.

58.description: This place is great. I love when you go into family owned places and you can see the pride they take in presentation. So unlike Jewel and Dominicks where produce is a mess (and many time, already gone south), the oranges and lemons were in neat little rows, the cheese was stacked by category, the vegetables were shiny and so fresh...parking kind of was cramped (i got the last spot) but there's a lot across the street that I noticed when I was leaving. I'll be back there for sure.

56.description: I love this place. The price is right, always way cheaper than other places we might go. Great produce and great specialty items. We got a huge jar of dill pickles from Wisconsin here one time for $2. They were so good, I had to return for two more jars 3 days later. Tasty and fresh Polish, Mexican and Italian items. Great cheeses for really good prices. Nice salad dressings. Some fruit can be hit and miss, but some is amazing! And OMG try that coffee cake. I dare you. We always buy a ton of stuff and always get out of here for 20-30 bucks. Highly recommended.

29.description: I'm super selective about my produce, and like visiting Family, but it's a bit spotty.  But when they're running a special, it's usually a great deal.I often cannot buy all that I might like to due to condition -- like rot or wrinkling (zucchini, avocados, garlic, spanish onions, apples, blueberries, strawberries, cherries, cucumbers, romaine, carrots, celery, grapes, plums, etc...), it seems I can always find something to make it worth the stop since it's on my way home whenever I'm near six corners.  I've found the avocados at ALDI seem to ripen and keep better than those I've gotten from Family.  Also the celery at Family seems deformed, with a massive inedible stem and hardly any full length stalks; so I'm getting celery at ALDI or Meijer instead of Family.If I'm desperate enough for something that isn't in prime condition at Family, I can always trek over to the nearby Jewel and pay twice as much -- and there's no guarantee of better quality at Jewel.

42.description: Hoffman Super Sharp cheddar....50% less than Jewel! Same exact product. Support this local business.

23.description: I truly feel like family when I walk into Family Fruit Market. I'm always welcomed by the staff who are easy to find throughout the store and can help with any reasonable request. It's a quaint store with plenty of selection. Speaking of which, you find only the freshest produce. The deli is super quick and also has great selection. It's easy to fill up your cart here, but the price you pay certainly doesn't reflect that. You can't beat the deals!

47.description: produce quality has declined a bit lately, but still a favorite.  I have refused to shop at Jewel since discovering this place, but lately have ventured out to A & G on Belmont for wider selection and similar prices.

8.description: Prices were great. Only bad thing was my fault but also the stores fault. The milk i purchased on December 26th expired on December 24th. This should be something the store should be checking. I obviously take part of the blame but im use to going into a grocery store and grabbing milk that doesnt expire for another week or 2.

31.description: I shop at several fruit markets all within a mile of my house.  Family fruit market is by far the best and my favorite.  Great quality but not perfect.  They seem to buy the slightly flawed fruits and veggies that are still good, just not perfect, in order to have really low prices.  Doesn't bother me a bit as I clean, chop and check things as I use them anyway.  I appreciate a lower price.Their prices are very good and they have great sales that let you stock up on staples like pasta, pasta sauce, juices and canned meats as well as fresh meats, deli counter items and of course fruits & vegetables.They have an excellent selection of fruits and vegetables.  I tend to try new things and unusual recipes and they usually tend to have what I need.  There have been a few times when I had so go elsewhere for stranger more unusual items (purple potatoes, kurrat, salsify...).They have a nice deli section that carries nearly everything you could want for.  They run the gamut from typical American fare to Polish and Mexican traditional foods.  Buy ready made guacamole or fresh salsa, homemade sausages or fresh mozzarella boules. They have a fresh bread area that includes items from several bakeries in the area.  You can find submarine rolls, bolillos, kaiser rolls, fresh focaccia, regular French bread, Italian bread and an assortment of those fancy French rolls.They also have regular groceries in aisles. They have a lot of specialized Spanish and Polish items that you can't find across the street at Jewel.  I love getting the Polish soup bases.  I only wish that they carried a few more Asian items.They make feeding your family easier and more affordable.  I'm glad to have them in my neighborhood.

34.description: Produce is not always very fresh, and not fully stocked either. Really hard to maneuver your cart around because the aisles are really narrow and this place is always packed.

16.description: This is a great little grocery store. They have a great produce section and it is never crowded. I used to go here a lot more often and then I stopped. I have no idea why. Every time I go, I think, "This place is so great, I should come more often." So, that is my plan. I need to eat more fresh fruits and veggies and will make it a mission to stop by here more often after work!

13.description: We used to live in Rodgers Park and loved the Morse Market and have been trying to find a replacement for that since moving to Portage Park. Family Fruit Market is great! I have only been twice to get produce. Much better than what jewel offers because Jewel never seems to keep ripe fruits which is what you need for things like mango and plantain and I want to eat it today, not a week from now! I bought all the ingredients for a Beef Stew there (not including the meat bc I already had it) for $9 so the prices are pretty sweet. Like any market, if you are looking for a specific brand they may not have it in stock but they always have the basics. Lots of ethnic food, which is good for us since we mostly cook Dominican dishes.

11.description: I love this store so much! Produce is way better than Jewel and appreciate the gluten free and ethnic sections

39.description: I've been doing my groceries here for years.  They always have a large and fresh selection of produce.  I love their deli.  I'm always amazed at what $30 can buy me here.  Beats Wal-Mart prices (and you don't feel guilty for giving your money to the devil that is Wal-Mart).

37.description: Excellent prices and selection.  The staff is really great as well.  After having been checked out today, my cashier realized that she had charged me the non-sale price for the milk, and while she could have easily just blew it off and I would have been none-the-wiser, she took the time to void the milk and ring up the correct price in order to refund me the difference.  How freaking awesome.Props to you Norma!

0.description: Excellent alternative to chain grocery (Jewel).  They really upgraded their store nicely.  Have almost everything you need.  While they may not have 5 types of one item like a big box they will have it.  The organic section is much improved and prices are competitive.  Very clean and organized.  Produce is awesome!Place is a perfect way to support local businesses in the community!

38.description: Got things straightened out ,,,, he greets me and get the items i want without any further issues

51.description: It was nice to see so many fruits that I haven't seen in a while. Though it seemed peaceful from the outside, the inside was chaos. People were all over the place but it was nice seeing imported food from all over the world. I recommend coming here for nice quality produce and some weird European foods! Didn't find what I was looking for but I came out with a bag of peanut puffs from Croatia for just 59 cents! :)

27.description: If you're looking for a one stop shop, organics, or higher-end products, this fruit market isn't for you.  For bargain hunters and anyone that loves to cook with fresh ingredients, Family Fruit Market is worth adding to your grocery shopping rotation.I'm here ~twice weekly (I have an 18 lb rabbit that eats 6 cups of lettuce each day), and the selection varies from one visit to the next (minus one star for this). Sometimes the fruit is pretty beaten up, and the greens are starting to get mushy or wilted.  Other times, everything is fine.  The prices are excellent: giant, gorgeous heads of romaine for 39 cents per lb, 2 large bunches of cilantro for .89, English cucumbers for $1 or less, and enormous bags of spring mix for 3.99 are examples of the deals to be had.  They have Boar's Head deli meats and cheeses at fair prices, and I highly recommend their fresh pico de gallo.  They are the only place I've been able to find fresh oregano and basil this winter for just 1.29 per container (they package it in round, plastic deli containers).The parking lot adjacent to the market can be a nightmare to get in and out of, but there is easy metered parking along the side street, and a large lot across the street (crossing Cicero on a cold day with two hands full of groceries sucks).I'm so happy they're in my neighborhood!

32.description: I don't have much to say, and just wanted to add to the chorus of five star ratings. Since Yelp makes me write something in order to rate, here is my review: This is the best grocery store ever with an awesome selection, and pants-peeingly-awesome prices.

54.description: Hard to add much to the great reviews.  Have been shopping here for almost 10 years.  The prices are still terrific but have actually gone up a bit (they had to subsidize the physical plan facelift somehow).   Now, however, they they carry a much wider selection than before - some organic produce, soy & rice milks, and a separate freezer for ice cream & popsicles to name a few examples.  Still a bargain both in terms of price and quality compared to Jewel.  Killer, killer guacamole - to be consumed ONLY with El Ranchero tortilla chips - the finest chips on the planet.Plus, it's absolutely true what people are saying about the music - it's hilarious.  I've heard Talking Heads '77 (Psycho Killer), Devo (both Whip It and Working in a Coal Mine), Elvis Costello, and many other Nouveau Wavo gems.  Oh yeah, Gary Numan's Cars as well.  Let's see...Saved by Zero?  I could go on, but you get the idea.

48.description: My favorite thing at the Family Fruit Market is not, in fact, the fruit, although it is quite fresh and affordably priced. No, the reason I come back to the FFM week after week is the deli. I've stopped shopping at Jewel, Trader Joe's, even Costco, because the deli prices were beyond insane compared to the goodies one can find at the deli counter of the Family Fruit Market. Our family favorite is the imported Italian ham with rosemary, although the genoa salami and fresh ricotta, mozzarella and feta cheeses are high on the hit list as well. Even my parents, who live in the home state of Whole Foods *and* the Central Market, make a trip to the FFM part of their visit to Chicago, and have been known to pack a couple of pounds of the ham with an ice pack in their carry-on bags. My daughter refers to the FFM as the ham store.My 4-year-old son, on the other hand, refers to the FFM as the chocolate store. We're all fans of the chocolates imported from Poland and Germany, and the cookies from France and Poland. I like that I can always get organic or rBST-free local milk here, and every time I go, the FFM's selection of organic produce has expanded. The housemade salsa and guacamole are great, and the local bakery bread is fantastic as well. Other highlights of the store are cheap pasta, canned tomatoes, imported teas, free-range eggs and organic yogurt. The only things that are more expensive here than elsewhere are cereal, cleaning products and packaged bacon. Otherwise, it's a great destination for perishables and shelf-stable goods alike.

44.description: Just moved into the neighborhood, and I am a HUGE fan.  Quality produce and deli meats for dirt cheap.  I walked out of there yesterday with what easily would have been $100.00 or more worth of groceries across the street at Jewel for $45.00!!!  This will be my grocery store going forward.  Thanks fellow Yelpers, for helping me discover this little gem and all it has to offer!

24.description: It's a great small grocery store, great quality of fruits. They Aldo have some organic produce. Their deli had quite a selection, hams, cheese, and different curs of meats. Place is a little small, but kept pretty clean.

7.description: Their quality has gone down since their "remodel". It's not the first time I've gone in to see old produce and food in the fridge or on the shelf. The assortment is limited as well. Sad, I hope they bounce back.

49.description: This place is excellent for produce.  We love their prepared salsa and guacamole.  Would be a 5 star, but they've been a wee bit careless with the produce lately - getting bruised/wilted more than it used to.

40.description: This place is great for produce! Very cheap with a wide assortment of items you can't normally find.Go here instead of Jewel for their over-priced produce. You will save a bundle!

53.description: This is a great place! The deli and meat section always has great quality food thats very fresh and the inventory of other foods is always well stocked, organized and always tastes great.  The produce is fresh and its quality is always at a high level.  Overall, its a great place to get groceries without breaking the bank.

30.description: A great local market with reasonable prices and a nice selection.

46.description: Favorite fruit market. Prices are incredibly reasonable, and they have everything I need and very little that I don't need, like yucko super-processed foods. Produce is usually excellent, always at least pretty good, and is always well-priced. Compared to the disaster of a chain grocery across the street, it's heaven.Price of a non-rotting lime at Jewel: 79 cents.Price of a good lime at Family Fruit Market: 5 cents.Also, never have to wait more than two minutes to check out, no matter when.

1.description: Rosa J. may not be an excellent cook, but she enjoys grocery-shopping.  Family Fruit Market is located on the northeast side of Portage Park, part of the Six Corner shopping center.  Parking is more then plenty; excess spots can be found across Cicero.It's much smaller than I expected to see.  Fresh produce was merchandised with a visually-pleasant organization.  Many organic veggies were on sale, so Mama J. and I picked out a few.  I would skip the meat department next time.  If you need a place to shop for USDA poultry, meat, or processed meat, my recommendation will be A&G Market near Belmont and Central.  Otherwise, Joseph's Finest Meats on Addison in Dunning have an extensive selection of top-notch, premium USDA Prime products.  Family Fruit Market has a little bit of everything, like Mexican, Polish, and Eastern European items.  However, Montrose Deli on Montrose or Irving Park is literally an one-stop store for anything Polish, while other neighborhood grocery stores will be sufficient enough for fresh produce.  Unless you live very close to FFM or are running errands nearby, no travel is necessary.  I rendered 3.5 stars for FFM, based on their venue size, uniqueness and prices of their products, and freshness of their agricultural produce.

55.description: I love this place. The fruit and vegetables are great quality and really cheap, staff are very nice, deli is excellent, nice selection of fresh bread and meats. I would always choose this over Jewel.Its sometimes a little hard to park on a weekend in the main lot, but you can park in the lot across the street which is a short walk and has lots of spaces.Its a GEM of a place.

9.description: I've been going here for a few months now and really like the way they have remodeled their store.  They now have lots of good organic and gluten-free items.  The store also has lots of fruits and vegetables and bulk nuts.  They also have items from around the world: even cheese from Denmark!  Their prices are excellent.  The only complaint I would have is that sometimes some of the produce is a bit wilted and should probably be removed sooner.

26.description: Their catty cashiers can be overlooked by the great selection of fresh fruits and vegetables they carry. You can even find tropical fruits like tamarind, young coconut, Pomelo and so on without any difficulty. They have an additional meat section in the back. The bread and cake are all delicious. You will be surprised at the variety of things Family Fruit Market carries.

25.description: Your average small grocery store. Good selection of fruits and vegetables. Deli and meats were ok. The place is pretty clean. However the prices here are all over the place.

12.description: Family Fruit Market is a simple little grocery with friendly family service.  When you come here you can expect lower prices than your neighborhood chain grocery store.  The produce section is where you will witness this the most.  They have a wide selection of fresh fruits and vegetables.  This store also has enough of the other essentials to fulfill your weekly grocery shopping needs.  They have a deli and a butcher but I didn't notice many fresh fish options.  They have all of the regular branded middle aisles items as well as other culturally friendly branded products.  Family Fruit Market is a good representation of what is so good about a local family owned grocery.  You won't be pushed around by rude shoppers and the service is always with a smile.

59.description: Know what's fun to do?1)  Go to Family Fruit Market - load up your cart with as much badass produce as you can, until the thing is literally brimming with potatoes and squash and apples and leeks and spices - and then GUESS how much it will cost. Just...throw a ballpark amount out there for what you'd expect to pay for a fucking cart full of produce at any other store. Lowball it if you're feeling adventurous.2)  Then, go to check out and pay and be REALLY pleasantly surprised at how wrong your guess was, and how you paid like, $30 less than you would have at Jewel or $50 less than you would have at Whole Foods for the same amount.3)  Then, do a happy dance and hug your wallet.4)  Repeat every few weeks.

21.description: What a find!I love that I have a huge fruit market in walking distance from my place.  But if I have to drive, they do have a parking lot adjacent to the shop as well as across the street. I mainly shop here for the fruits and veggies. The prices are reasonable and the quality is good. Sometimes the produce is super fresh, meaning you have to use it soon or else it will go bad. But most of the time, the freshness is reasonable so you don't have to do a complete clean out/use up of the fridge contents. There is a good selection of dry goods--but some are pretty over-priced (cereal!). But if you catch a sale then you've got yourself some great deals. The deli looks promising but I have yet to get any of their fresh meats. It's an older store so not so sleek and shiny. The service is OK. I love the pop music they play overhead--makes shopping fun. My best find so far...tons of fresh pickle cucumbers that were used to make pickles.

17.description: Family Fruit Market has a great selection of fresh and diverse produce, as well as specialty foods that you can't find at many places nearby. It's worth a special stop here and the prices are great, too. So happy they've committed to the new, organic and local sections.

10.description: What a find!I love that I have a huge fruit market in walking distance from my place.  But if I have to drive, they do have a parking lot adjacent to the shop as well as across the street. I mainly shop here for the fruits and veggies. The prices are reasonable and the quality is good. Sometimes the produce is super fresh, meaning you have to use it soon or else it will go bad. But most of the time, the freshness is reasonable so you don't have to do a complete clean out/use up of the fridge contents. There is a good selection of dry goods--but some are pretty over-priced (cereal!). But if you catch a sale then you've got yourself some great deals. The deli looks promising but I have yet to get any of their fresh meats. It's an older store so not so sleek and shiny. The service is OK. I love the pop music they play overhead--makes shopping fun. My best find so far...tons of fresh pickle cucumbers that were used to make pickles.

5.description: Ermagawd the Italian beef!!! Go to the deli section, ask for Italian beef and don't forget to ask for the gravy along with it. It's so unbelievably gooooddddddd! Throw it in a crockpot and you'll have yourself the most impressive Italian beef ever prepared in your kitchen. Grab a fresh baguette to accompany it and you won't regret it!

3.description: FRESH FRUITY OR VEGGIE MEI can not believe I've never written a review for this place. I grew up in Portage Park and even owned a house in the area. This was my go to place for most of my shopping. Yeah there's a Jewel across the street but their produce prices will literally cost you an arm & a leg. I never understood why people constantly shop there paying those high produce prices. I walked in here recently and walked out with 6 heavy bags of fresh food for only $20. I was most impressed with the giant bunch of fresh parsley I picked up. It is the freshest parsley I've had since growing my own garden this past summer. But my love didn't stop there as I loaded up on even more veggies. With prices this low it makes it hard to not buy the entire store. The store also has many essentials, so you could get away with all of your shopping here. The two basic ethnicities that are covered here include Mexican and Italian. Everything you need to whip up tacos is at your finger tips. And if your feeling saucy then why not make a giant pot of Sunday Gravy. They even have dried pasta if you like cooking out of a bag. What really impresses me is the great prices on lunch meats and cheeses for the last 20 years. It is almost worth the drive from downtown to stock up. We picked up a giant container of shaved Parmesan for only $3. At a big grocery store this would cost over $5. I must admit that this cheese I bought literally melts in your mouth. I should have bought two containers. If you're looking for deli meats then this is the place because the prices are fantastic. Again the larger grocery stores mark up their lunch meats so high. The deli counter also has pre made items. So if you're looking to take out the part of assembling your food, then you can just take & bake them at home. The staff behind the meat counters are really good and fast at completing your orders. They even have a small butcher here who can cut your meat or grind up anything you want. There are some pre marinated meats and again you just need to take them home to cook them up. I really miss this place and I wish I still lived closer. I am going to make more attempts to shop here when I am driving through my old neighborhood. If you find yourself in the 6 corners area, then by pass the big Jewel and visit this smaller store that will treat you right. They even have a small organic section that has great prices. And don't worry they have two parking lots. One next to the store and the other is across the street. So what are you waiting for because it's time to get healthy and cook up some fresh food.

35.description: This place is very convenient for me as it is right by my house so I stop here weekly to get my fruits, vegetables; sometimes some bottled watered, chips, etc. I think this supermarket is great in that the fruits and vegetables are always fresh. I also love the prices!!!! The deals in the store always save me so much money it is incredible. When buying the same products in Jewel or Dominic's I would spend around $10-$15 more than in here.  The staff is also very helpful, whenever I have a problem finding an item they are more than willing to help me.  I also love that the lines are super short because the managers make sure there is enough people on cash registers which is super convenient for us Chicagoans!

19.description: Good produce selection (obviously)Cheaper than jewel (what isnt?)Parking is rather annoying unless you live close enough to not have to drive. They do have that second lot but then you have to cross busy as hell cicero pushing a shopping cart like a homeless person.

28.description: I have shopped at Family Fruit for years.  They have begun running an ad on Groupon with a photo display that must be from the 50's.  There has never been that kind of produce display in my memory of 15 years.  Recently the variety has diminished, sometimes fruits and vegetables are visibly old, and the prices have increased. Even the deli selection has fewer choices of cheeses/lunchmeats and prices are higher.  I had a difficult time trying to find $20 worth of produce to use my Groupons.This is not the store it was even a few months ago.

45.description: This is place great. I go to A & G when I need tons of stuff and lots of brands. But for day to day shopping this is THE place. I wouldn't buy paper goods there, or cleaning supplies, or baked goods because they are cheaper at A & G. Milk is also cheaper. But for anything else this is the place. Very inexpensive produce. And very fresh. Good prices on meat. When I compare the meat on sale with what's on sale at Jewel it is an extra 30-40% less. Great sales in the deli. Once in a while when I'm stopping at the Blockbuster across the street I like to go to the Jewel next door to compare prices for what I just bought at Family Fruit Market. Then I just smile and pat myself on the back for saving so much money. I don't understand why people still shop at Jewel.The parking lot is too small, but there is another lot just north on the corner of Cicero and Bertau.There is never a line of more than two people per checker. Good luck seeing that at chain grocery stores!My pet peeve with this place, they use way too many plastic bags. They put like five things in a bag. I got tired of asking them to stop it and micromanaging the bagging, so I just bring my own canvas bags.

33.description: Great place to get your fruit shopping done at. They get pretty busy over the weekend, so it's probably the best to go during the week. I get all my fruits and vegetables here and they are always fresh and not had a bad experience yet. They could keep the place a little bit more clean, other than that it's a good place to get your shopping done.

43.description: Favorite place to grocery shop in the Chicago area. I'm a stickler for cash and getting the most for my dollar, so the hour and half bus ride to get here doesn't seem to bother me that much. The fruit always seems to be fresh. I usually stock up on cartons of raspberries and blackberries (usually 2 for $3), a few pineapples ($1.99 ea), and kiwis (5 for $1) to make fruit salad that a freeze in individual containers for snacks at work..The veggies are reasonably priced and fresh as well. I remember getting a 5lb bag of potatoes for $1.99 a few weeks ago or cabbage for $0.19 a pound. The lunch meat and cheeses are priced extremely less than other grocery stores in Chicago. I have gotten pastrami for $3.99 a pound, honey roasted turkey for $4.99 a pound, and American cheese for as little as $1.99 a pound. Meats are priced well, but I rarely buy them so I wouldn't know the industry norm. Groceries are a little closer to the norm, but still great to complete a full grocery store shopping trip in the Chicago area.

2.description: I'm a bit of a produce market snob, and this one is just ok.   I do think the actual produce was fresh and well priced (case in point, some spinach lasted well over 10 days), so no complaints there but...There is a distinctly lacking selection of good breads (ethnic markets are usually good for these, but this was primarily pre packaged preserved products and a few local but not great rye selections.  I think I do remember decent tortillas?)The dry goods are also lacking and high in price.  You'll find the staples, but even then selection is limited and no better than Jewel (again, something I usually love about small markets)There IS a decent organic selection of dry goods, but again for the price, I don't see the point.I'd stop in for produce needs, and it's still probably better than frequenting the Jewel, community wise, but it's not among the best.

18.description: Quality of their produce has changed for the worse, I stopped going here completely about 3 years ago.

41.description: Great prices on produce - usually considerably cheaper than Jewel, and a lot bigger selection including unusual fruits and veggies. The deli is extensive and is often half the price of Jewel, too!  This market also stocks bakery bread from local bakeries, so you can get favorites easily. AND (drum roll) they always have many checkout lanes open so you rarely have to wait! Small enough to do your shopping in 15 - 20 minutes. I generally use Jewel now just for dry goods, toilet paper and cat food!  The small parking lot next to the building is sometimes full - there is a bigger lot kitty-corner across the street which always has space, and you can push your cart there, if need be.

52.description: I love, love, love this place. I've been going here on a regular basis for months since moving to the neighborhood. Last night I paid just under $20 for delicious fruits, vegetables and nuts. I bring my own bag and by the time they packed it all in, I could barely carry it. The butternut squash is absolutely amazing and my co-worker was admiring it when I brought it for lunch today.Family Fruit Market is a shining beacon in a city dominated by chain grocery stores (we know who they are). And yes - you will be humming and singing along while you stroll the aisles because the music is awesome. It's weird to be in this store singing with fellow shoppers, but you just can't help it.

50.description: I love love love this place and have been coming here for years. I moved a few miles away, and still trek up the Milwaukee bus line for it whenever I can.Fruit and produce are hit or miss (usually miss) if you buy them out of season. Everything else is GREAT. Fresh and cheap and good: fruits, veggies, nuts, bread. A great deli with all the usual meats and cheeses, but more affordable. Fresh herbs are A DOLLAR in the summer, usually under $2 in winter. These are farmer's market prices and quality.Plus, a great selection of Mexican and Polish items. The housemade guac is fantastic, and the European cheeses and snacks are perfect for fancy dinner parties that don't kill your bank account. Spices, nuts, and some processed/packaged goods round out the selection (to be fair, most packaged goods are cheaper at Jewel across the street). I wish they had a little better selection of eggs and yogurt-- organic please? Because then I really would never need to go anywhere else.

4.description: Great service, new organic section, more stuff at the frozen section.Very clean, and organize.

6.description: I've been coming to ffm  now for over 10 yrs and I have to say it has taken a turn for the worst. You can tell since the remodeling and removal of great products they once carried, their clientele has declined drastically. Every time I stop by I get more and more disappointed about the selection of products and the quality of produce. Today a lot of the veggies were old, cucumbers, squash, and cilantro needed to be thrown out! The organic products are over priced, he should have left that to the bigger grocery stores. Sad, this use to be a treasure in the neighborhood.

22.description: Family Fruit Market is a simple little grocery with friendly family service.  When you come here you can expect lower prices than your neighborhood chain grocery store.  The produce section is where you will witness this the most.  They have a wide selection of fresh fruits and vegetables.  This store also has enough of the other essentials to fulfill your weekly grocery shopping needs.  They have a deli and a butcher but I didn't notice many fresh fish options.  They have all of the regular branded middle aisles items as well as other culturally friendly branded products.  Family Fruit Market is a good representation of what is so good about a local family owned grocery.  You won't be pushed around by rude shoppers and the service is always with a smile.

15.description: My husband and I have had what seems to be only bad experiences with FFM. We live very close and were excited to have a fruit market that is walking distance from our home. 1. In the European Specialty aisle-my husband purchased a jar of an ethnic food that we were happy to see. When he opened it, it was rotten and obviously old. 2. The self service roll area is disgusting. I have seen, and had to ask for a customer (as I am a customer myself)  to not do this.A man  took rolls out with his bare hands and his nails were obviously unkempt. He would take one out and examine it, and put it back and so forth. It was disturbing to see as before this incident I actually liked getting the rolls because they seemed fresh. I have not gone back since this incident. I want to know where the actual staff of the store was, since this is probably not the first time something like this has occurred. At LEAST put a sign up. 3. Some of the cashiers are rude.4. They sell expired candy after the holidays.A lot of people are sad to see this place go but we wont miss it. Great potential, but they need to re evaluate some basic standards of running a grocery store.

57.description: I hesitate to write a review for fear that I'll never be able to get in on weekends.  This place is right by my house, and I always make the extra trip here from Jewel.  Definitely worth it for the cheap and fresh produce, but a must for the deli.  Meats are half the price of Jewel and a better selection of imports.  Get the Italian beef and they'll include gravy gratis if you ask.  French bread and tortillas are always fresh.  Don't forget the Mexican Coca-Cola with real sugar; it's waiting for you at the door when you walk in.One warning: Beware of the stone fruit.  It's really hit or miss with the peaches and nectarines out of season.

20.description: This is a great little grocery store. They have a great produce section and it is never crowded. I used to go here a lot more often and then I stopped. I have no idea why. Every time I go, I think, "This place is so great, I should come more often." So, that is my plan. I need to eat more fresh fruits and veggies and will make it a mission to stop by here more often after work!

36.description: They should call this the Mexico fruit market, they have it labeled from USA but the apples are from Chile, really they have bad water and used outdated pesticides which cause nerve damage, and the Mexican avocados I understand that; but come on the grapes are from Mexico the tomatoes, the peaches, the oranges, the carmalita bananas made in Mexico. Come on this is that's is why its so cheap!! killing off one nervous system at a time. The meat is high priced the fish is old, and the milk doors smell spoiled when you open them, check it out for yourself. City has been out many times to look into false allegations of mis-labeling. I will find my picture of how they take out foreign fruit and label it product of USA.False folks, I will walk across to Jewel and pay a lot more for real fruit from real farmers and they are union... its worth the extra money to know my food is safe for my kid. No one is pulling the wool over my eyes... nothing is that cheap all the time and good for you.. I have learned farmers markets are cheap and organic. Fresh over the year great stuff!!!!Love your health. protect it fight against immigrant fake fruit markets.

14.description: This is an update... I have to change my review of this place. It goes from 5 stars down to 2 stars. It used to be so much better. But, when the old owners sold it the store changed what is carried. Now it is just some huge bins of fruits and vegetables that take up most of the store. And a lot of unused space. There are just a couple of small rows of non-produce items I used to be able to do all my shopping there. Now I can't. I'm not going to bother making two trips, one to this produce store and another trip to get everything else (good bread, condiments, salad dressings, boxed foods, canned goods, snack foods, etc.)They used to have a great selection of all the other things plus very good produce. Not anymore.

58.description: Galvins has a typical Irish pub feel.  I recommend the fish and chips and the sumo fries.

56.description: BLAAAAAHHHH! As Irish pubs go, this is pretty common. I've eaten here on a couple of occasions, and have not been impressed. It is a local joint that gets very packed, and it's difficult to find standing room sometimes. The good thing about this place, besides being close to my house, is that they have live bands on the weekends. Usually Irish bands, but they have other stuff sometimes too. The parking lot is small, for the number of people that are jammed in there on the weekends, but there is street parking available near by.  I'd go again, but only if I was going to see a specific band.

29.description: $2 burgers on Tuesdays?  Sold.

42.description: Normally, I don't care for bars/ pubs. That being said, I really enjoyed the lunch we had at Galvin's a few weeks back. Kudos to the bartender / waitress who seemed to be a one woman dynamo, while remaining cordial and efficient. I had the bangers and mash. It was really very good. I brought home some for mom and she loved it as well. Christopher took advantage of their $2 Tuesday burger. It wasn't any little dinky slider. It really was a good deal all around. We will be back for sure. I just need to remember t bring a flashlight to read the menu. It is kind of dark in there and these old eyes of mine.....

23.description: I stinkin' love this place.  Friendly folks behind (and in front of) the bar.  I had to wait a while for a friend who was running late and got into a great conversation with a couple of the folks along the bar rail.  Great mix of older and younger patrons.  Always friendly folks here which is something I can't always say for some of the NW side "local" bars in the 'hood.Just enough TVs without being too many, the occasional band, and a FIREPLACE. And oh geez, THE FOOD.  Two words:  Irish Nachos.  But good food from apps through some traditional Irish fare, as well. Currently, they are running a "kids eat free" promotion on Mondays.  They always seem to have specials, including a $2 burger night.  Family owned by good people (who are actually (gasp) Irish!) who give back to the community.

47.description: I give this place five stars because the food is AWESOME and the drinks are cheap AND I can go with my dog in the summer. I don't think I need to elaborate, but I'll do you the favor and explain. The have great daily specials, everything that I've tried is exceeding my expectation. Although they are a bar, their food goes could really carry this place on its own. I highly recommend the Irish nachos (Homemade potato chips with bacon, scallions, cheese, and sour cream) as well as their wings (if you like sweet go for the Irish ones, if not, the classes hot wings are good). And, although my husband might kill me for letting out our secret, I'm doing it anyway. They have this INSANE gravy that they serve with some of their dishes. My husband liked it so much he tried it with fries. Let's just say we've been hooked ever since. It's not on the menu, but the staff is ultra friendly so I'm sure they'll oblige. You can thank me later.

8.description: We had a Pub Quiz to raise money for our school this past Sunday afternoon at Galvin's.  We were anticipating about 75 people, but 90 turned up.  Susan and her staff were very accommodating to  our group as we were setting up.  The appetizers were great.  Most important, there was enough staff to handle the large crowd.  Our guests received very friendly service.  Galvin's professionalism helped make our event a success.

31.description: I don't know what I was expecting but I was a little disappointed.  My dude and I bought a house a block away and had been meaning to check out our closest watering hole for a long time but, you know, we've got some kids and stuff and they don't go well with bars.  So we finally had a night alone and went in to check it out.  The bartender was a big meh.  She spent the night chatting up some guy and left us hanging often.  She was not at all friendly to us.  No big deal, she's just there to serve up the drinks.  I think the most disappointing thing for us was the dart set up.  We throw in a dart league and when we heard this place had darts we were excited.  But the dart set up is terrible, in order to play we would have had to hover over a couple having drinks at a table.  That wasn't happening.  So we had to skip that.  There was a guy on guitar and while I don't normally like live music in bars (I feel it's usually too loud and I don't go to bars to shout over my friends), this guy wasn't too bad and he wasn't screaming so I could still sit and chat with my dude.  Like I said, it's the closest bar to us so we'll probably be back eventually, I'm not scrambling to find a sitter to come so we can go.

34.description: Not impressed.  Very slow service and the food was just okay.  The staff were like zombies and nobody seemed very enthused to be working there.  The meatloaf was pretty good though.

16.description: I don't know what I was expecting but I was a little disappointed.  My dude and I bought a house a block away and had been meaning to check out our closest watering hole for a long time but, you know, we've got some kids and stuff and they don't go well with bars.  So we finally had a night alone and went in to check it out.  The bartender was a big meh.  She spent the night chatting up some guy and left us hanging often.  She was not at all friendly to us.  No big deal, she's just there to serve up the drinks.  I think the most disappointing thing for us was the dart set up.  We throw in a dart league and when we heard this place had darts we were excited.  But the dart set up is terrible, in order to play we would have had to hover over a couple having drinks at a table.  That wasn't happening.  So we had to skip that.  There was a guy on guitar and while I don't normally like live music in bars (I feel it's usually too loud and I don't go to bars to shout over my friends), this guy wasn't too bad and he wasn't screaming so I could still sit and chat with my dude.  Like I said, it's the closest bar to us so we'll probably be back eventually, I'm not scrambling to find a sitter to come so we can go.

13.description: We had dinner here last night for Valentine's Day.Service: 5/5Food: 4/5 - very good. Tried the bangers and mash and fish and chipsAmbiance: 5/5 - nice Irish pub with a great fireplaceDrinks: 5/5Price: 5/5 - had a couple good beers and good pub food right next to a fireplace with good Celtic music in the background, for $35... going back soon

11.description: I've always really enjoyed going to this bar, but even more so with the new management. The new owners have made a few very noticeable improvements especially when it comes to the revamped food menu. Additionally, they have a bags league on Wednesdays and during Bears games it is $30 wristband deal for all you can drink domestic beer and well drinks with a buffet that is first come first serve. All in all I really enjoy this place.

39.description: Okay. Love, love, love Galvin's! Just wish it was all the way up in Jeff Park so we could get there easier.Let's start with transpo...the Lawrence bus goes right by there but you have to catch it at the Jeff Park Blue Line station because if your try from Kedzie on the Brown, you will need to change over to the Lawrence west bus from the Lawrence east. Trust me, slow as hell so just catch a cab.They have parking but it is a very small lot, so unless you are planning to come for lunch or you get here very early (6-ish) evening, you will have to settle for finding street parking. Logistics handled, let's talk atmosphere. Singles, families, little children about, this is the community spirit of the Irish pub. Throw in live music on weekends and sometimes other time as well, and you have a winning combination already without getting to the food. I have been to this place on St. Paddy's and after a live Celtic FC versus Flyers exhibition match and it rocks!And, the food! Wow! Something changed in the last few years because when were started going there 5 years ago, the food was ehhh. Not sucky but not good, just bland. But not anymore.For bar food picking, they have good Onion Straws, Cheese Curds and Bacon Wrapped Shrimp. For a bigger meal, they have excellent Fish and Chips, which I usually order. Hubby likes their Irish Breakfast and their Bangers and Mash. Good stuff.

37.description: Delicious fish sandwich and chips. Chips are amazing! We went there on their Tuesday "Half off Burger Days". I'm a vegetarian and I wish they had one that was half priced or at least allow us vegetarians to get the fish for half priced too. :-)

0.description: Went to Galvin's last night to meet up with some friends.  I understand that since my last visit, they are under new ownership.  I would say they've done something right, as the place was packed all night.  First - it was packed full of families having dinner out.  It seemed like they were a little short staffed for the crowd, but did a pretty solid job all things considered.  I had the fish and chips, which was a fine dinner.  I would definitely have it again.  Everybody else seemed pretty happy with their food as well.  Drink prices seemed fine by me as well - $5 pints of Guinness work for me.After food and whatnot, I hung around for the band that was playing, and the place was again (still) packed, but now with the more usual Saturday night out crowd.  It's a tight space for a live band, but it seemed to work out well enough.At the end of the day, good food, good drinks, at a good place.  I would definitely come back.

38.description: A black and tan is Guinness and Blue Moon!!! never again, will I go. waitress was horrible and tried to inflate our bill with more drinks than we ordered. then when we confronted her, she attempted to not correct the issue anyway.

51.description: This place is worth a trip just for the Irish Nachos...SO good!  Great service and friendly staff

27.description: So sad to say this authentic pub so reminiscent of the European original really disappointed me . Service ABYSMALLY SLOW ....and we were only ones dining. Two old guys at the bar......and the two servers behind the bar couldn't burn the calorie and be bothered with giving us ketchup and napkins. Used to be a cool and quaint place to grab a Weiss beer and some authentic comfort food, but so not worth it.

32.description: Saturday night June 10, I went with friends to Galvin's to hear a great bluegrass trio called Sunnyside Up, scheduled to play at 10 PM.  They had played there before, been booked again for this date by the owners even though it was the night of a Blackhawks game, but we were excited to hear this group.  The game ran quit a bit overtime, so we all just enjoyed the event and hung out 'til the game was over (Blackhawks won! Yay!) at about 11 PM.  Then Colby Maddox and his band Sunnyside Up finally went up on stage and played  two great numbers, after which the owner came out and asked them to cease playing,  (Was everyone there only interested in the TV after-game coverage? Did nobody else wish to hear live music? or what?)   We had been there from 9:30 PM - had come from quite a distance, specifically to hear this band, waited an hour and a half - not to mention the band being booked for 10, bringing in and setting up all their sound equipment, instruments etc., much earlier,  not being allowed to play until 11 PM, because of the game, and then being stopped almost immediately!  We were furious.  No explanation. Not even a kind apology.  Simply a rude brush-off to us who had waited so patiently just to hear this great music, and a rude,  unethical, and unprofessional  brush-off to the band,  not even wanting to pay them their full pay after such an error in their own planning.  An appalling lack of courtesy and professionalism to their customers and to the band they had booked.    Judith

54.description: Where do I start? Well, Galvin's is an awesome little Irish Pub that's very authentic. The decor is welcoming and cozy and there's even a small outside patio in case you want to get away from it all. The music can range from rock to pop and I've even been there when they've had a live band. The bartenders are chatty and they've always been cool and super fast. Oh, and the Guinness girls ;) have been known to drop in every once in a while... what's better than free pints of Guinness and the Guinness Girls?I've only been there to drink, but the last time I was in the food look delicious and if it wasn't so late I would have ordered some. For a true Irish experience in Chicago, I definitely recommend Galvin's!

48.description: Galvin's is a nice neighborhood Irish pub with good food and good beer.  Galvin's was the first place where the REAL Irish bartender poured me a Guinness and crafted a shamrock in the foam.  I rewarded him with a nice tip.We've never been there for music and usually go for an early dinner and a couple of pints.  They pour a good Guinness in a town where so many bartenders don't know what the heck they're doing.I wish we still lived near Galvin's...

44.description: Thank you to all of you who recommended this restaurant. We had a lovely evening. Good food, good prices, great beer. Kathy, our waitress, was working alone and she did a great job! We had an Irishman in our party and he had Shepard's pie and said it was very good. My husband had fish and chips and the rest of us had corned beef..delicious.The only thing I would say against this pub is their desserts are just ok. Chocolate cake...don't bother. Apple crisp...just ok. Brownie sundae...very good. We will surely be back.

24.description: Every man (and his wife) needs a bar like Galvin's.  This place has good food, especially if you have a hankering for Irish fare, good daily specials and always a friendly face behind the bar.

7.description: I have to say, the new menu is AWESOME! I can't wait to try all the new things. One thing I did have the pleasure of encountering is the handmade/homemade mozzarella sticks. Woot! I included a pic but it's only if a 1/4 order cause I hoovered them down before I had a chance to yelp 'em.

49.description: Local, laid back and what you would expect from the lads and lassies in jeff park. Bringing kids here is encouraged by the wonderful woman who owns the place, and in the spring you can enjoy the outside beer garden. We even bring our dog - outside of course. It's just "that" kind of place. Wednesdays pub quiz is fun and Sean the bartender takes care of his people well. Props to Sean and Nick-  they can tend a bar like David Blaine can work a crowd ... Magic ! I really like this place.

40.description: The waiter we fell in love with just left this place.  The reason we come back is because he suggested what we had and we loved every bite. Fish and CHips are amazing, so are the burgers.  French onion soup always spot on. Good amount of tables, and a few booths/benches around a would be dance floor/mingle area.

53.description: This is a nice neighborhood place to go have a few beers when you're not at work on a Thursday afternoon.  Good bar food and irish fare on the menu and the staff is always nice.

30.description: Food is really good. Service absolutely sucks. Unless you are a regular, plan to be there a while. We go occasionally - fish n chips is excellent, all you can eat fish on Friday - but their wait staff is too busy chatting with the barflys and regulars to actually offer good service.Go - just not if you are on the clock !!

46.description: I went here to watch my friend's cover band play. This place is not ideal for holding music events. It's not laid out properly to really hear a live band, and the makeshift stage is like forcing the band to play inside a phone booth. Since you can't hold a conversation and you can't hear the band, the only option you have is to watch whatever movie is muted on the various televisions and pretend you can follow the plot. To be fair, you can tell that they try to make it a good place to see a free show, but they can't quite fit the live music aspect in. It's like a forty year old man going to a wedding in the tuxedo from his high school prom. As far as the pub itself, it was very nice. To be honest, I expected a sort of dive atmosphere due to the neighborhood it was in. It's very clean and comfortable, and it resembles a traditional pub you'd see in Ireland. Even the staff is Irish. I didn't have any food, but my friends said it was fantastic. The beer selection was decent, and I can assume that they know how to pour a proper Guinness. I only ordered two beers the night I was there and both times the bartender misheard me and poured me a beer I didn't order. Of course, he was cool about correcting his mistake. Since I live in the outskirts of the city where the only places to get a drink are dank and dingy VD factories with glass block windows that proudly advertise having "Old Style on tap", it's kind of nice to know a place like this is in close proximity. I definitely wouldn't mind going back to hang out and have a few pints. But if there's a live band that night, I'm afraid I'll have to pass.

1.description: Fiona was very nice and made my experience a pleasant one.  Prior to purchase, she allowed me to sample the craft beer on tap, even with a Group On.  Her consideration was most appreciated.  The pub burger was solid, properly cooked and arrived with the condiments I requested.  When I heard they had tater tots, that was my selected side.  Crisp to perfection with just the right amount of salt. I stayed for a couple or three more after the Groupon too.  Thumbs up to the busy barkeeps who kept things humming along.

55.description: Why is everyone complaining about the prices and portion?  Ummm, Hello!  Almost all of the businesses are cutting back and/or increasing their prices.  They are hurting just as much as everyone else!

9.description: This has recently become my go to pub/bar even though it's not right in my neighborhood.  What I'm saying is that it's well worth the trip to get over there.  Food is consistently good from: shepard's pie to fish & chips, even the chicken quesadilla is solid.  Which is somewhat surprisning for an Irish bar. Other positives include the parking in their lot just to the west of where you enter the bar, the nice fireplace, free popcorn, and super friendly and attentive bartenders and staff every time I've been in here. The crowd is a healthy mix of local barflies as well as business lunchers or after work cocktail seekers that pass through depending on the time of day you visit. I've never really seen the place crowded which is a plus in my book as well.  If you find yourself on the NW Side, it's definitely worth stopping in.

26.description: Great quite pub to enjoy a drink and not have to yell. They have specials everyday of the week. Televisions for sports. I enjoy this bar a lot

25.description: The food and drinks are good, but if you sit at a table, the service is always terrible. If you order soup or water, good luck getting it in under 20 minutes.  The only way I will go back is to have a drink at the bar.  The service has cost Galvins a lot of business from the neighborhood.  My neighbors don't go there because of the bad service.

12.description: Chip Laszlo here.We were looking for a place to go to for St. Pattys and based on the reviews we decided on Galvin's. The guinness was $5 for a pint and tasted great. The look of the place was great. Fireplace and live music added for a great atmosphere. The place was busy and I mean packed! We figured as much being a Irish pub on St. Pat's. The only problem I had with the place was the food. I was surprised because so many people spoke highly of it. Maybe they were rushing because of how bust they were and the quality suffered. I had the fish and chips. I never knew fish could be chewy, they must of left it in the frier to long because the cod was very dark in color and tasted like oil. The chips though were excellent! My fiance had the corn beef and cabbage, The corn beef was tough, very tough. Our jaws got tired of chewing kinda  tough, The cabbage was bland.... just bland. Chances are we will try this place again and hope the food is much better.Chip Laszlo signing out.

59.description: I stopped going here after an incident where the bartender actually spilled my shot of jager that I just payed for,she refused to give me another.I do miss the ambience and the beer garden is ok.

21.description: What a pleasant surprise! Found this place through Yelp, and right in my own neighborhood.  Cute outdoor patio.  Great food!! Started with the Jameson wings-WOW! Crispy, juicy, and flavorful. I had the Ruben Sandwich.  Cornbeef was tasty and fresh.  My partner had the Philly Steak.  Also delish!  And best part was the fries! Thin, crispy and tasty!  I will become a regular here!

17.description: Megan was super nice and friendly..great service. Amazing food and low key atmosphere!

10.description: My husband and I have been having lunch here since we started dating 4 years ago, and while their food is delish, I wish the wait wasn't so long. I love the staff and I always leave feeling like a had a great meal overall.

5.description: Wish I could actually review the food.  We went on a Friday night and it was crowded but not overwhelmingly so.  We waited five minutes for someone to acknowledge us and offer a table to us.  Five more minutes and my friend hunted down a waitress to get menus.  Ten minutes later with no one even glancing our way and we were out the door.

3.description: Very average and the strangest bean soup that I ever had...like baked beans but very liquid.

35.description: SLOW!I went on Sunday afternoon (12/9) with some friends. It was after the Bears game, and the place was less than half full. There was one guy working the bar, and one girl working the floor.We all had drinks and appetizers, but it took forever to get anything to come to the table. We arrived at 4:30 and didn't get out until 6pm. It shouldn't take 90 minutes for beers and wings.

19.description: So sad to say this authentic pub so reminiscent of the European original really disappointed me . Service ABYSMALLY SLOW ....and we were only ones dining. Two old guys at the bar......and the two servers behind the bar couldn't burn the calorie and be bothered with giving us ketchup and napkins. Used to be a cool and quaint place to grab a Weiss beer and some authentic comfort food, but so not worth it.

28.description: Pretty good food, great service, friendly and clean. Wonderful neighborhood bar in an area where there aren't a whole lot of those.

45.description: This place is pretty much perfect for me.  Their food is great, and as people have mentioned, you have to try the Irish Nachos.  I've enjoyed everything that I've eaten there which includes some of their sandwiches, curry chicken, and different appetizers.  The wait staff is very friendly and always willing to chat with you if you've got something to say.The only two knocks that I have on this place is their TV situation and the live music.  I'd like to see a few better televisions in there so watching games is easier.  The only nice television is in a corner and some of the things on the wall get in the way of seeing that tv if in the wrong spot.  As far as the live music, I don't mind the bands that play there but as others have mentioned, its just too small and is very loud.  It ends up being an ok atmosphere since people are jammin but you really can't hear anything once the band starts playing other than the loud music.We've brought a few people with to this place and everyone else has enjoyed their time so hopefully you will give it a try too!

33.description: I love this place! Great food, reasonably priced drinks, and outdoor seating! They always have beer and food specials too!

43.description: Pub close to my home.Good meals, plenty of space.Best to get a drink or 2 and sit by the fire enjoying one of their great specials.  Friendly.They also have a patio space, can't wait for the weather to improve!

2.description: I really wanted to like this place. Neighborhood pubs are my favorite and the outside looked so cute. The service was average - nothing notably bad or good. The food was well below average. The Irish Nachos were lacking cheese and weren't cooked all the way. Instead of scallions, there were cut up yellow onions and we weren't told ahead of time. The shepard's pie was fresh. You could tell it had been microwaved. The inside was steaming hot but outside was cold.We were watching the Hawks game and the screens froze in the middle of the third period right after the opposing team scored. Nobody on the staff seemed concerned or bothered to fix it. Disappointing!

18.description: Well nice fireplace, but lets make sure you don't leave ur beer half way or 3/4 full and go out for a smoke at a table due to they will clean the table and give you an attitude when u tell them someone cleared your beer.... n when the bartender tells u "dont leave your beer anymore"  I understand clean the table of the empty bottles but not the ones almost full....

41.description: Favorite neighborhood bar! Great for a fun night and/or a relaxing night! The staff is hard working and polite. $ stars because sometimes I wish the food was better.

52.description: I went to Galvin's a few weekends ago for a birthday party. Even though I was mostly in the back room where the party was (rockin' the karaoke mike with Sonic Lizard Karaoke!), I did get to pass through the main room to get to the back room, as well as pass through to get to the restroom. It is a pretty laid back, friendly place. There were several groups of locals in their late twenties and early thirties. My friend and I walked in all glammed out (as we regularly do when going to a karaoke party) so I was a little nervous people would be like, "Who the heck are these divas?" Nope. Everyone was accepting and cool. I would like to revisit this place for a pint and get to know the vibe in the main room.

50.description: Great neighborhood place to have drinks and even listen to some live music. If you ever get a chance to see Fast Eddie play there, I definitely recommend it.

4.description: One thing about this place is that they know how to fill a glass of wine. A nearly 3/4 full glass of wine is something to be noted and praised. The food I'm not so sure about.I ordered fresh made chips. I got them back in less than five minutes. They were delicious but they were also room temperature? Why weren't they hot?? The Gordon Ramsay in me became suspicious. No way were these made a few minutes before.I didn't make a stink. Too tired and too late. I will be back for the drinks.

6.description: My boyfriend and I came here last weekend for the fish fry. Holy cow. We had a blast, the food was delish, and our server ( i wish i could remember her name!!! Cute little blonde woman) was the sweetest thing in the world. They have gold tee, jukebox, and occasional live music. We're coming back!!!

22.description: I have been going there for years. Always a good laugh with the ever-present regulars at the bar.. I love the bartender Maggie-so sweet and fast! Love their curry sauce-I put thats.. on everything :) Try their fish and chips ( I sub for mash potatoes) and bloody marys. Always a good time!

15.description: I stinkin' love this place.  Friendly folks behind (and in front of) the bar.  I had to wait a while for a friend who was running late and got into a great conversation with a couple of the folks along the bar rail.  Great mix of older and younger patrons.  Always friendly folks here which is something I can't always say for some of the NW side "local" bars in the 'hood.Just enough TVs without being too many, the occasional band, and a FIREPLACE. And oh geez, THE FOOD.  Two words:  Irish Nachos.  But good food from apps through some traditional Irish fare, as well. Currently, they are running a "kids eat free" promotion on Mondays.  They always seem to have specials, including a $2 burger night.  Family owned by good people (who are actually (gasp) Irish!) who give back to the community.

57.description: low key, high energy pub...this is a semi-local irish pub in the jefferson park area serving all the usual irish pub fare.  i need to commend their vegi burger!  when ordering vegi burgers, i normally ask the server if they are boca or gardenburger -- a) hate boca b) can't get myself to spend 7 bucks on boca/gardenburger when i can walk down the street and buy 2 BOXES of the stuff from jewel.  our server assured me that it was neither but that it was not made on the premises, either.  i gave it a shot and it was pretty good - MUCH better than boca.  it was the perfect spot to catch up with friends and when our server overheard it was my friend's bday, insisted that she take a bday shot on the house!  our server was very attentive and super-friendly.

20.description: Really lovely little neighborhood place. Warm and cozy fireplace in the winter, nice side street patio in the summer with pretty flowers. They make an effort to have good seasonal beers on tap. They have pared down their menu, which allows them to make everything better.  Good burgers and delicious fish and chips.

36.description: Yeah, their fish and chips were great! Batter just nice, not at all greasy, mild cod, big portions and delish chips. Good drink specials and cozy atmosphere. We got a table in front of the blazing stone fireplace. Not a lot of tables, though, so make a reservation if you a weekend if you can. I would give this a 5-star cuz we were very pleased, but I reserve that for someplace really unique and innovative.

14.description: We had stopped going under the old management and decided to try it again. We were pleasantly surprised by the new management, the new menu and the new plan for the restaurant. Plans are to redo the floors, paint the walls and rename the pub. For all of those who left, go back! Great neighborhood pub again!

3.description: old style tap room / liquor store i go here because they carry three different brands of imported cider (magners, woodpecker and strong bow).  Also the painted glass storefront is a hoot cuz it is kinda out of date 'cold beer - in a glass!".....the tap room is a dive to be sure.....

1.description: The woman at the counter has a terrible attitude. Left without spending a dollar, and will not return. One star for being open when the liquor store around the corner from my apartment was closed.

2.description: Can't beat the attached liquor store.

0.description: I have only been to the store portion and not the attached bar area.  If you ask me, Miska Liquors is pretty much what you would expect for a neighborhood liquor store.  Decent selection, a few sales, nothing fancy about the place, friendly  staff.  Since Ruk is BYOB, this place is also very conveniently located.And just in case you were wondering, yes, they do accept credit cards.

1.description: This place is a riot.  Not actually a FUN riot, but a riot.  I used to go on these pilgrimages every Christmas down to northern Indiana to buy pierogi for Christmas Eve dinner - exchanging goods for cash in White Castle parking lots, etc.  Really.But the guy working on our hours last year (ah, Wally) said "NO!! You spend too much!  You have to go to Alexandra!"  So this year we did.First of all, know what to expect.  You walk in.  There's nothing but a counter with a huge row of freezers behind the workers and someone shoves a little clipboard in your hand.  While you wait, you check off how many of everything you want.  So, BE PREPARED or at least know you'll have to step to the side.Got to the counter.  Everyone tried speaking to me in Polish.  I was flattered, but am Ukrainian-Russian and had to just look bewildered and helpless till they figured it out.  Got my Pierogi and was out of there.  I have never seen such efficiency in my life. My head was spinning.Reviews:  the cheddar in the potato and cheddar is NOT american (thank god, it's a pet peeve of mine and common).  People who love mushrooms loved the mushroom ones.  The sweet cheese are perfect.  Sweet cheese and potato are perfect. I have yet to try to try the blintzes.  They aren't QUITE my grandmas but very very very good, and I'll definitely be back...and prepared!

9.description: I heard about this place from my water aerobics ladies at the gym and just HAD to check it out since I am a true Polack at heart!!  And I LOVEEEE me some pierogi!There was really no quick way to get here from VP but it was totally worth the drive out!  It is a warehouse-y storefront that sells refrigerated and frozen pierogi, dumplings and blintzes.  And the prices are AMAZING!  The more you buy, the cheaper they are!  So, of course, I had to get the best deal and get 10 packages which made each package only $2.50/dozen!  Yes!  That cheap!!  I was just as stunned as you are!  HA!I went with the kraut and mushroom, kraut, potato and cheddar and sweet cheese.  So far I have tried the kraut and mushroom and potato and cheddar and both were fabulous!  The best Polish style pierogi we've ever had!  They tasted so fresh despite being previously frozen and the dough was perfectly chewy and crisped up nicely when fried in a bit of butter and oil.  I cannot wait to try the other flavors because I know they are going to be just as good!If you are on the lookout for great Polish style pierogi, head over to Alexandra and grab a dozen or 10 (and save more money).  It is so worth it!  See you soon Alex!

23.description: Forget Kasia's, if you want the real pierogi experience, you have to try Alexandra's.  I don't know why that is, even the package looks just like Kasia's pierogi.  But the way that these cook and taste is a world of difference.  My favorites are potato & cheese and kraut & mushroom.  Grab a bunch of your friends, buy a whole bunch of packs and have yourself a big ol pierogi party.  To make them extra delicious fry them up in bacon or onions as a finishing touch.  I stopped in at the meat counter at the A&G grocery store around the corner and picked up some potato pancakes for a complete Polish carbtastic meal.  Don't forget the sour cream!

5.description: I can't describe in words how good Alexandra's pierogis are. My husband is 100% polish, and these are better than anything his grandmother, mother, and aunts have ever made. The mushroom pierogi are phenomenal and my favorite on the menu. The farmer cheese and potato are also wonderful. I'm not usually a sauerkraut/cabbage fan (aka kapusta), but these were great. The way we cooked them at home is by boiling until they float and puff up. Then saute with a little butter and serve with sour cream, apple sauce and caramelized onions. ::cue stomach growling::.  I highly recommend Alexandra's for non-polish people who want to try authentic polish food, and for polish people who want pierogis better than grandma used to make!

25.description: Without a doubt, Alexandra has the best pierogies in town. This place is a pierogi factory with a tiny storefront outlet along Central, but it seems all the Polish people know about it. I stopped in here to stock up for Christmas. In case you didn't know, Christmas Eve is a major pierogi-eating holiday in both Polish and Ukrainian tradition.  I usually come in December to get Uszka, which translates into "ears" (little mushroom-kraut pierogies). The line was to the door but the 4 ladies working the counter kept things moving quickly and I was out in under 10 minutes. Seems everyone buys at least $20-$50 worth of frozen pierogies, often by the case-ful. Bulk discounts allow you to get a lower price if you buy more packs. The language spoken by the employees and customers is almost exclusively Polish, though the price list is in English too. To the uninitiated, it can be a scary cultural immersion. Behind me in line was a stereotypical, older Polish woman complete with a babushka, fine moustache on her face, and a bulky handbag. I suspect that she was sizing me up as an all-American boy having no business being here. I was expecting a dirty look from her if I should stumble in placing my order. The moment of truth came. In the best Polish I could muster, I ordered uszka, potato & cheese(Ruskie) pierogies, kraut & mushroom pierogies, and some Sloske kluski for my mom. Bam! I paid and they filled my order on the spot.The fruit-filled pierogies are really an individual preference as I'm not into fruity ones. I like sauerkraut & mushroom or potato & cheese  much better. They are always fresh indeed as Kasia M. says.Cultural differences aside, warm some up at home for dinner with lots of butter on top and freeze the rest for next time. You can also find Alexandra pierogies at other Polish stores, including Jerry's Fruit Market in Niles.Alexandra is in the process of expanding all the way to the corner of School St., opening a storefront twice the size in 2008.

12.description: My parents are both from Poland, so naturally we eat plenty of pierogi, nalesniki (crêpes filled with sweet cheese), and uszka (mini pierogi filled with mushrooms that are traditionally eaten with borsch). We always get them here; they take too long to make by hand, and I really don't like Kasia's (even though they're sold all over the place).My family has been coming to Alexandra's since it opened, and I am consistently impressed by the store's cleanliness, customer service, and of course, its selection.I judge stores that aren't clean, and like myself, Alexandra's is clean, neat, and organized. When you walk into the store, you simply walk up to the counter and let the Polish ladies know what you'd like to order. The ladies pull your pierogi out of the freezer for you, and you're ready to go! There's no digging through freezers to find your favorite flavors and, for all the germaphobes, there are no random people touching your pierogi packages.Although most customers who come in are Polish, all of the items available for purchase are translated into English. Still, if you don't speak Polish you may face a bit of a language barrier, but don't let that stop you from trying this place out! Everything I've tried from Alexandra's is delicious, but here are some of my favorite picks:Pierogi ruskie--- "Russian pierogi," which are stuffed with potato and cheese. The filling is super smooth and savory.Uszka--- The little tiny pierogi with mushrooms.Pierogi z kapusta i grzybami--- Pierogi with sauerkraut and mushrooms. They're a little bit bitter, but great as an entree.Pierogi z jagodami--- Blueberry pierogi... they're great topped with blueberry yogurt. ;)Nalesniki--- Crepes stuffed with sweet cheese that are more dessert-ey and on the sweeter side.
