I think the place is under new management, and the young guy that manages the joint is a jerk. There are many places to drink in the city that appreciate your business. This place isn't one of them. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this joint. You'll thank me for it.       Can you believe it? After I posted this review, I received the following e-mail, I'm guessing it came from the jerk that manages the place:"Nice review!! We don't have to give you a "free" drink!! Just a FYI it's illegal to give out "free Drinks"!!!"Can you believe his response? It's now against the law for the house to buy you a drink. That's a new one on me. I guess all the other bars in the city are breaking the law then. Hey everybody, make sure the next time you're in a bar, and the bartender buys you a drink, you call the police and turn him/her in. Unbelievable! Even more reason to stay away from this place.And by the way, if you're such a law-abiding citizen, how come the city shut down your expansion plan next door? Could it be you're not so law-abiding after all, just greedy? Sorry pal, you're just a poor excuse for a businessman.

40.description: My favorite bar in the neighborhood!Super chill, variety of craft beers, sports on t.v., friendly crowd.

53.description: great neighborhood bar with an amazing beer selection

30.description: This place is going to be trouble. Let me set the scene. I just moved in to my new apartment in Jefferson Park, which is walking distance from this lovely establishment, and needed some beers for backyard drinking. My friend and I stopped in to the liquor store and picked up several 6 packs ranging from fancy Japanese cider to tecate (because that's how we roll motherf*@ker) to enjoy while sitting out of doors. The liqour store opens right in to the bar, and it turns out she knows one of the bartenders next door. He informs us that we are early. "Early for what?" we ask. Oh, as it happens they are having a Cinco de Mayo celebration. After some internal debate we decided to take a pass on that and headed back to my place with drinks in hand. Fast forward several hours (and drinks) later and we decide to go back to Fischman's to enjoy the sights. We stumble and swerve down these fine city streets and manage to arrive uninjured. We find some seats at the giant bar and get settled in for some more imbibing. Turns out these bartenders really know their stuff. They even take classes about it and stuff. All I know is I slurred a general idea of what I like and was brought a very tasty libation. I'm not even sure what it was to be honest, but I know I had a few. They had a DJ who was kind enough to play my request for some britpop (Romeo Void - Never say Never) which sparked a whole conversation and more music requests, and basically a really fine evening of tasty alcohol and amusing conversation. All in all I can seem myself back at this bar very soon. Only next time, I'm going to call it a night when this place closes. The 5am bar down the street nearly killed me.

46.description: Went here with a few friends and had a great time. I'm looking to go back on a Thursday night.

1.description: Surprising, but I really liked this place.It's a liquor store/bar, but it's nice that the spaces are totally separated, so you don't feel like you're actually sitting in a store.  I don't really understand the corkage fee if you're drinking something you bought at the attached store (which isn't done at other, similar spots).  If you stick to what's on tap, there are a ton of good options.  They have very unique beers/ciders and you can get flights and smaller taste sizes if you want to try a few or don't want an entire beer.The staff was pretty friendly and prices were really reasonable.The liquor store next door had a really interesting selection of beers/wines/etc and some rare finds.Worth a visit if you're in the area.  If you're not from the area, parking might be somewhat difficult on a weekend....

55.description: Fun dive-ish bar with a nice beer selection, both on tap and in bottles. Not crowded at all and fun to see some of the same people here on a Monday evening that were here on a Saturday night. As for the craft beer, good variety of local taps, Belgians and other American craft beer (Three Floyds, New Holland, Lagunitas, Tripel Karmeliet, Kwak, etc.).

9.description: Fischmanns is a great place to meet up with friends and family to drink for a good price. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. It is a place where people from the neighborhood can get together and become friends. Not to mention there is the liquor store next door after last call for a night cap. ;)

26.description: Great craft beer selection, awesome events, always a good time. And the staff is knowledgeable and friendly.

25.description: We live a few blocks away and I couldn't be happier to have such a great neighborhood bar right around the corner.  The beer selection is impressive and balanced across so many genres! In my experiences here the bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable without any sort of pretentious beer snobbery to be found. The wagyu wagon is awesome, and there's pretty much always something going on there. The only thing I would even consider changing is that it does get crowded, so it would be great if they could expand into the space next door. If you're in the northwest side or you have easy access to the blue line, this bar is an absolute must-visit!

12.description: Good beer.  Hit or miss service. Some bartenders give terrible  beer snob service. Others are cool.  Overall a place for beer people.   if you  are  not able to talk beer you will be ignored.

59.description: Ok, so, after much resistance because of my generalizations about this kind of dodgy-half-liquor-store setup, I officially like this place. Yes, yes, the beer inventory is great and the staff is helpful and it is clean and the prices are totally reasonable, but beyond that this place is really making an effort to get in the mix with the community and just do some fun stuff to try to breathe some much-needed liveliness into Jefferson Park. The events I have been to have been really solid, other people/neighbors in attendance with whom I have chatted have been really friendly and pleasant and overall this place just has some really good mojo. I hope it doesn't get too crowded or crazy popular so it will still be nice to go here, but I do want to see them succeed so they can just keep doing what they are doing! Keep it up Fischman's!One wish-list item: I wish the bar did flights or shorts of some of the stuff on tap. I love beer, but am not a huge boozer and like to be able to try a bunch of different stuff, so that would be fantasmo in the future!

21.description: It's a dive bar with a great atmosphere and an even better beer selection.  They take cash or card and they have a liquor store connected so you can't go wrong. Nice crowd and reasonable prices for their selection.  Don't expect any dancing, just beards and beer, but they do have a jukebox.

17.description: Great spot. My new local bar and store. Thankfully under appreciated.

10.description: Love this place! We've been coming here since we bought our home in the neighborhood 4 years ago. This bar is our saving grace, as there isn't much else going on in the area. The entire room is the bar. It's a huge beautiful wood oval bar with a few scattered tables around it. Attached on one side of the room is the liquor store. This is not a Budweiser bar. I mean, you could come here and order a Bud, but you'd be missing out on all the amazing craft beers they have. Every time we come here, we always get to try something new. Each and every single bartender we've had has always been really friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. You never sit at the bar with an empty glass. We often ask for suggestions, and they always get it right. Sometimes we stay long enough where we get hungry. They have no problem if you bring in outside food to nom and they even have frozen pizzas they'll cook up for you if you ask. They always play the games on TV and the UFC fights. We come here often to watch those but Thursdays are the nights to be here. It's their "Tap this" night where they have a bunch of specialty beers and food trucks are parked outside.Also, I got to drink out of the last known Goose Island Marisol keg here. We love this bar so much, we even bought their shirts. Represent!

5.description: Fischman has been around for a while, but whoever's running it now has really stepped up their game.  The bar is crowded and a bit cramped, but the service is good, the atmosphere is nicely old-school, and the selection -- of both craft cocktails and craft beers -- is outstanding.  It's not cheap, but you're definitely getting quality for your dollars.  The liquor store is also terrific, with an amazing selection of beer and a very good liquor lineup.  It's easy to get to from our Logan Square pad, so I'm hoping to make it a regular stop.

3.description: Cool local pub.Fischman is located off of Milwaukee and Lawrence. It is half liquor store and half bar. The bar on the south part of the establishment has bar stool seating around the bar which is centered in the middle. Televisions line the outer walls of the bar so you can watch whatever sporting event across the bar. Locals and regulars seemed to hold this place down. It was pretty busy on a Friday night. Drinks are affordable and shots are cheap too. We ordered a few "specialty" shots that the bartenders didn't know but they got the hang of it pretty quickly. The bathroom in here is pretty dingy and not very clean. It is certainly an experience and any description I list here wouldn't do it justice. Check it out, it's interesting.

35.description: Fast forward 2 years...This review is for the Tavern section of the Fischman's business and is based on two years of visiting on nearly a monthly basis. Attending last night's (2/20/2014) Tap This! event featuring Three Floyds is what pushed me to write this update. I was very disappointed with the way the bar tenders were pouring the beer. The head on the beer was too big which significantly took away from the 12oz of liquid delight in the glass. This has to get better, because others will take notice. I guess the situation was a little overwhelming for the staff, because of the massive crowd that night, but no need to rush a good thing.My previous review of the bottle shop remains unchanged. They still have a great selection and continue to keep Beermenus (spelled it correctly this time) updated daily. The prices are fair, relative to other stores around the north side of Chicago. I just picked up La Boheme, Another One and Vanilla Buffalo Sweat.

19.description: So just had a nice experience celebrating my wife's bday at Fischman's. It's the next morning and I take a look at the bill.  They sure have expensive ice $3 up charge if you get $4 whiskey on the rocks.  Now I will admit I didn't notice last night but I did have 5 whiskeys and was being a social butterfly. But come on, MAN!  The menu does state some whiskeys are 1 or 2 oz pours.  Which is kinda peculiar.  But I didn't see anything saying $3 for ice. It's not even the artisanal hand made stuff in a perfect sphere or cube! I don't think it was flown in from Antarctica or the North Pole it's just ice! If you look outside right now there is tons.  Anyhow I feel a bit cheated I thought ohh they have decent prices but after the on the rocks charge this place could be in any of the trendy neighborhoods.  Also, an FYI the menu on the website does break it down a bit but it's not the same menu that's at the bar. The whole menu I guess is just shot prices and misleading.  I just want a shot poured into a glass sprinkled with some frozen water. Hey man it's a bar we shouldn't have to read fine print! Did the owner used to work for a bank or credit card company?Now onto the service. The bartender was a nice guy,  I asked him which whiskey I should have next and he kinda looked blankly at me.  I then asked about a certain one and he said we sell a lot of that in the store. The place is attached to a liquor store.  For $7 jack daniels on the rocks I would expect the bartender to know something about whiskey.  Dissapointing....   In the end I guess they don't want to serve spirits, just drink beer.  Hopefully they don't charge more if it's cold.

28.description: Just an old working class bar that's been cleaned up!  I really liked it, HUGE Square bar that circles the whole room..don't see those much anymore!  Great, great Beer List.. gdd

45.description: I finally got the chance to sit down at the bar, we came here for my bfs bday ( a stop before we took the train to the loop) Dawn was the bartender that afternoon and she is great! She gave us little glasses to taste some different beers and helped me find a beer that i would like. This is definitely a place to come and enjoy each others company and a few glasses of good beer.Definitely come check this place out on Thursdays because they have food trucks come!

33.description: One of my biggest pet peeves in Chicago is when bars or restaurants don't offer free refills on fountain drinks. I'm further annoyed with a waitress or bartender doesn't inform you that the refill you ask for is not free. $4.00 for two small sodas that cost you pennies? Give me a break. It could be on your menu (I don't know, I didn't need to look at the menu to order a coke), but your staff should give customers a heads up. I'd also think you'd being encouraging designated drivers from not drinking. Guess not

43.description: Thanks to Laura at the Map Room for tipping me off to this place, which I certainly would never have found on my own.  Fischman's epitomizes the revolution in the beer industry:  a long-time old-guy bar which in recent years has transformed itself into a serious craft beer venue.  Oh, the atmosphere is still divey, and they still move a lot of PBR to the remaining loyal AKs, but their craft-beer selection is first-rate, and the server appeared to be enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the stock.  I tried two things:  The Bruery's excellent, winey Barrel-Aged Smoking Wood, and the relatively new Spiteful Brewing Company's Damn Pigeon Porter.  Many more new-to-me brews will keep me coming back during my Chicago visits.  Also a fine package selection.Good public transit access; a couple of blocks from the Jefferson Park stations of the CTA Blue Line and the METRA UP-Northwest Line.  Also at the outer end of the 56-Milwaukee bus line, and convenient to a number of crosstown routes serving Jefferson Park station.  Pub crawlers can use either the Blue Line or the 56 bus for access to Revolution, the Map Room, and Piece, though none of these is really close.

2.description: Great bar with good prices. One of those awesome bars that has a liquor store attached to it. Great drink prices, and a Touch Tunes jukebox that you can control with your phone.Friendly bartenders, all around a great joint.

18.description: I lived within walking distance for years and had no idea this gem was here.   I'm not a beer drinker but my cohorts were pleased with the available selection.  My cocktail was yummy and consistently prepared (I had two of the same) which I appreciate because I don't like to guess at what I might get.   I'll be back!

41.description: I don't know what happened with this place.I can give one extra star for beer selection and Thursday events.  This place got expensive.  There is only one beer on tap for$5. Other bets are for $6-$9.Thursday event- $3-$5 for flight glass 5oz. Quick math- the cheapest beer (pinr) cost 9$. More expensive - $15. Whoaaaa. Are you guys out of mind????This bar looks exactly the same like 3 years ago.  I would understand some price increases  but they went way too far.   I think they lost returning customers.

52.description: The Portage Park/Jefferson Park area is where the city takes its last gasps of life before turning into weird yellow 1960s apartments buildings and eventually surrendering to the desert of the prairie that is the suburbs. Go any further and you will be out of the Algren's wilderness forged out of steel and blood-red neon. You will be exposed and scared: don't go past here!Since you can't pass, you may as well enter before you start the long walk back down Milwaukee avenue. You may not be surprised by the working class crowd and the abundance of television machines found in Fischman's, but when you gaze upon the beer list you may wonder when Hopleaf moved west and became Fischman's Last Chance Saloon.  They have an excellent selection including St Bernardus on tap (a rare find indeed) and many other draughts that are not typical of the neighborhood or nearly anywhere.  I'm still not clear on the policy, either because it's confusing or I'm simple, but beer can be purchased at the adjoining liquor store and brought here to pound down.  There is a $5 cork fee that comes with the scheme (used in the American way, not the British one) and this will somehow save you $1 dollar.  I will not attempt to do this as it will most assuredly get me yelled at.

50.description: Best Craft beer selection in the Northwest side of Chicago. Great daily deals and good staff, that know what kind of beer they have.

4.description: Great selection of craft brews!  I like the beer menu idea with descriptions and ABV's listed.I guess we weren't cool enough to elicit more than monosyllabic responses from the Friday bartender when asking a couple of questions.  Too bad that the guy was so unfriendly.

6.description: This place has a massive selection of craft beer.

22.description: Great selection of craft brews!  I like the beer menu idea with descriptions and ABV's listed.I guess we weren't cool enough to elicit more than monosyllabic responses from the Friday bartender when asking a couple of questions.  Too bad that the guy was so unfriendly.

15.description: I can spout reasons for a lower ranking BUT the selection and location are factors for success.  Solo or with 4 dozen friends you can get some drinking done and grab a roadie.   The package selection is high priced but well picked.  The back porch is surprisingly relaxing albeit as plain as the whole establishment. A block from the Jefferson Park transit station puts this place as an easy to get to destination.

57.description: I love this place. It's a two for one. Buy your craft beer at the liquor store and take it home or have a pint at the bar next door. They have the absolute best craft beer selection not only in the NW side of Chicago but rival any of the big box liquor stores in town. They're prices are awesome too. I've done a quick spot check and they are always at least a $1 to $3 less a six pack then Whole Foods plus drafts at the bar somethimes go for as little as $2! Lastly, great service. The owners are awesome and have done a tremendous job with the place. They hold bi-weekly events called "Tap This" where they invite food trucks to cater and have awesome rare beers on tap. I can't wait for their kitchen to be built out. I'm sure the food they'll serve will be top notch. I hope this places inspires more folks to take a look at the area and open up shop in a sleepy part of town that needs and deserves more options.

20.description: So just had a nice experience celebrating my wife's bday at Fischman's. It's the next morning and I take a look at the bill.  They sure have expensive ice $3 up charge if you get $4 whiskey on the rocks.  Now I will admit I didn't notice last night but I did have 5 whiskeys and was being a social butterfly. But come on, MAN!  The menu does state some whiskeys are 1 or 2 oz pours.  Which is kinda peculiar.  But I didn't see anything saying $3 for ice. It's not even the artisanal hand made stuff in a perfect sphere or cube! I don't think it was flown in from Antarctica or the North Pole it's just ice! If you look outside right now there is tons.  Anyhow I feel a bit cheated I thought ohh they have decent prices but after the on the rocks charge this place could be in any of the trendy neighborhoods.  Also, an FYI the menu on the website does break it down a bit but it's not the same menu that's at the bar. The whole menu I guess is just shot prices and misleading.  I just want a shot poured into a glass sprinkled with some frozen water. Hey man it's a bar we shouldn't have to read fine print! Did the owner used to work for a bank or credit card company?Now onto the service. The bartender was a nice guy,  I asked him which whiskey I should have next and he kinda looked blankly at me.  I then asked about a certain one and he said we sell a lot of that in the store. The place is attached to a liquor store.  For $7 jack daniels on the rocks I would expect the bartender to know something about whiskey.  Dissapointing....   In the end I guess they don't want to serve spirits, just drink beer.  Hopefully they don't charge more if it's cold.

36.description: Living in Jefferson park I can really appreciate having the store and the bar with such a huge selection of craft beers. Their list of micro brews on tab is very impressive and changes all the time. I also love that they bring live music to the place during their "Tab This" event. I can only complain about the prices. They became a bit expensive since they started "Tab This" event. Don't get me wrong, good beer is worth the money but we are not in Lincoln Park so I think prices should be a bit lower (I loved their Friday's $3 Lagunitas / Half Acre special).

14.description: Nice local craft beer. Cover band in the side room. Interesting crowd.  Business happy houred still worried working men, hipster, grannies, etc.

3.description: So they ended up calling us and said they would refund us the difference for the thinner board. Happy ending right? Nope, they canceled the delivery on Friday( delivery was Sunday) and said they couldn't find a single one in stock(yet the manager at the store we went to was willing to exchange us the one he had with no refund, just store credit).  Said they'll give us a full refund and we can go buy a board at a non Sleepy's Store, so I gotta coordinate when to have one delivered so I don't go a day without it once Sleepy's takes the one we had. one star for the half hearted effort, don't bother calling or reaching out to us again Sleepy's literally gave you three shots

1.description: My wife and I just went into the store as we needed a new bed for our new home. Couldn't be more impressed with the service and attention and overall service we received. Dell took care of us, it was quick and he had more enthusiasm than almost any other sales person I have dealt with. His happiness was contagious. This is my first review for a retail place - well worth it.

2.description: Excellent service! Took my husband and I through a whole mattress comfort process. We felt super comfortable. This is an excellent place I highly recommend to come here to purchase your mattressBest sales person: DELL

5.description: Amazing service, very helpful! Even got a call after my bed was delivered to see how I was sleeping. Wouldn't shop anywhere else for a bed

6.description: The worst customer service ever. I was buying a tempurpedic mattress which was around 3800 dollars the sales person Amadour did not know any of the policies regarding the bed, he would tell me one thing and I would find out when we were applying for financing everything he told me was wrong. He told me the bed had a 120 day return policy which was only 90 days, we also purchased some tempurpedic pillows and mattress cover which was about 220 and he never told me I had to pay up front for the pillows, after sitting for about an hr and a half applying for  financing which he couldn't figure out how to do he  had to call his boss about 3 to 4 times. Finally the price of the bed was not matching the monthly payments and he couldn't explain why and didn't know who we were going to pay for financing. I also explained to him the box spring  was probably not gonna be able to fit up my narrow stairs to my upstair bedroom but he said we have professional movers that are not subcontractors and we can get the box spring upstairs which I knew was B.S. and sure enough subcontractors came and couldn't  take the box spring upstairs so I just left it in a room downstairs. Worst experience buying a bed ever.

7.description: This was one of the best experiences ever. I suffer from chronic back pain, so it was very important that My husband & I find the best mattress. Vince was very knowledgable & very informative. He never rushed us & made us feel so comfortable to take our time looking for the right mattress. His coworker Steve was also very helpful.  Great customer service!!! Since we walked in & were greeted, we knew we were at the right place. Very happy with the mattress we picked & would recommend everyone to go to this particular store because of Vince & Steve.

8.description: This was one of the best experiences of all time. Steve, the Sleep'y employee, who helped us was insightful, informative, and all around great. He let us try various beds for over an hour. He never hurried us and answered every question we asked. One of the most personable person in sales I have worked with. Mattresses are great. Delivery - Rafael and Melvin were great. Polite and concerned about making sure they did not inconvenience us. What service. When in need of a mattress, stop here first. You will not have to go anywhere else.

9.description: I just moved to a new apartment and was looking for a mattress.  I was very happy with the service at Sleepy's and I found a great mattress in my price range.  They were very knowledgeable and I actually learned quite a bit about mattresses.  I would recommend this store to anyone in search of a mattress.

0.description: I went in with every intention of buying and found a mattress to fit my needs and budget (desperate and good quality for a low price) in no time at all. I'm young and wasn't exactly looking to make a huge investment in a mattress at this point in my life (I can sleep on anything, really). Joe was friendly, had a no-pressure sales approach and didn't give me any flack for any of my odd questions--he was quick to find the answers, even if it meant calling someone to figure it out! My order was a bit different (split box spring on a queen to fit a narrow stairwell) and I was initially told it would take about ten days to deliver, which I was totally fine with and understood. However, Joe called later that same day to let me know they had new dates available--the next day! I was thrilled to be off the air mattress and onto a new bed so quickly. They showed up right in the middle of the delivery window (a little more notice than five minutes would have been nice, but the house was ready the night before),and everything was in place and done within fifteen minutes. Signed on the dotted line and that was all! Overall, totally satisfied with my experience. I'll recommend Joe at Sleepy's to anyone I know in need of a new mattress--and I'll go back next time around!

4.description: Dell was extremely helpful and gave us excellent service. I would absolutely recommend this store to other people.

58.description: I lo-lo-loooove tea, but can anyone explain the sucktastic attitude of the woman who assisted us yesterday?Ms. Deadtooth, as we will refer to her from here on out, was rude and unfriendly and did everything in her power to make us feel incompetent and as though we were wasting her time.  Ms. Deadtooth rolled her eyes when we asked where the clean sample cups were when we pointed out the huge stack of used cups sitting next to one of the sampling stations. Ms. Deadtooth then took the time to point to the clean sample cup dispenser, tucked away from plain site behind some displays.  Oh, silly me!  Why didn't I think to move everything and find it myself???  You are, after all, a very important tea maker Ms. Deadtooth!The piece de resistance?  She stopped, mid order, to guzzle some tea while my friend was in the midst of explaining what she wanted.Yeah, I'll be downstairs at the Starbucks Ms. Deadtooth.  I've never had anyone pause while taking my order to slurp down a mocha while I'm trying to order.I shudder thinking about this experience.

56.description: It's an amazing place in a middle of a busy, tourist filled retina burning eyes lights water tower place.I bought some tea with jasmine pearls and have been a fan ever since. And I usually don't drink tea. I prefer shots of espresso any day. The people there were super friendly and nice. Still can't afford the hunder dollar tea pots but the jasmine perls rocked my world!

29.description: DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT....purchase their stuff online.  Absolutely garbage.  Worst customer service because they outsource their customer service and they are a waste of time...repeat...do not order online you will waste your money.After I received the product...it was old and did not taste good...good luck trying to return it...

42.description: I decided to stop in for a free sample of tea, and then decided I might as well look around.  I had a very nice girl come in and help me out and tell me a bit about things.  And after that I decided to get two tea cup/pot things.  And then I wanted to get some tea.  At this point the other girl started to help me and she was being very snotty to her co-worker on how to make tea.  She started off nice to me, then just went nuts.  She kept trying to sell me the more expensive teas, since I was buying it as a gift and didn't even know how much it would be dranken I just wanted the cheaper one and once I had my mind made up she was like "Oh how about this one?"  Which was of course more.  After that, she was trying to sell me tins to keep the tea fresh, I told her I'd pass. She then asked if I had a dark, air tight container to keep the tea in.  I said I'd find something.  And she then went "ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE SOMETHING?  IT IS NOT GOING TO BE FRESH BY CHRISTMAS."  I was then like "Um, yeah."Last wonderful thing she did was ask how much I wanted, I just said the 2oz because again, wasn't sure how much it'd be dranken.  And she goes in a very snotty, condescending tone "Well, don't you want to get more than just a weeks worth of tea?"  I was pretty much fed up with her by that point so I just told her "NOPE."  I'm sure the tea will be great and the first girl I spoke with was very nice, which is why it's getting 3 stars...but if it weren't for her, you better believe 1 star would be all they got!

23.description: I needed a final small yet thoughtful gift for my mother for her birthday, and in my wanderings around Water Tower I spotted Teavana. My mother loves tea, but tends to stick to the grocery store bagged variety, so I thought it would be nice to make her a custom blend.I can't remember the name of the associate I met, but she was very attentive and helpful. She was willing to work within my meager budget and create something special, though she did push me on additional accessories or a tea kit. When I explained that my mother lives 700 miles away, she did back off a bit before it became too uncomfortable. Admittedly, I was close to walking away without purchasing anything, but we came back around and I left with two small bags of beautiful loose tea. I would certainly consider returning.

47.description: Do yourself a favor and come in here for a post-meal tea. They brew teas in the store and they are DELICIOUS. My favorite is the liquid gold (a blend of 3 of their finest tea leaves) over ice. If you like your tea sweetened, ask for a little hint of honey - the flavors really pop. Or, just have it unsweetened like I do. This place is a tea lover's dream. So many different varieties of loose tea, tea accessories (pots, cups, you name it), and friendly knowledgeable staff (they are soooo helpful). There are also multiple samples to be had. Oh, and also make sure to pick up some green tea mints. Vegan, sugar AND caffeine free... eat 3 of these little guys and it's like you've had a cup of green tea. AMAZING! (You'll end up eating more than 3, trust me). There's a reason they put these by the cash register... I picked up all three varieties while I was here last week. The lemongrass one is a dream. Pear and lychee flavors are good too.

8.description: I have a lot of mixed feelings about Teavana. Some of their teas are bad, some of their teas are amazing, but only a handful are worth the money.My biggest quibble with Teavana is that most of their flavored tea blends are about 95% frou-frou and 5% actual tea leaves. Not only does that make the price of most teas inexcusable, but it means you wind up drinking a cup of hot fruit juice instead of a cup of tea. (These options taste better iced but why not just save your money at that point and buy juice?) The worst offender I've tried so far was the blackberry mojito green tea, whereas the better-balanced blends have been the strawberry slender pu-erh and the anjou pear-adise oolong. You can partially counteract this problem by buying one of their lower or medium-grade pure teas and blending it with the flavored selection. I like the peachberry jasmine sutra blended with additional jasmine pearls or with plain sencha jade reserve.That said, some of the pure and scented tea varietals are fantastic. The gyokuro imperial, green jasmine pearls, monkey-picked oolong, and body+mind white are exquisite. Capital of heaven keemun and the now-discontinued nine dragon golden needle are also very good. Are they worth paying up to $10/oz in some cases, though?! That I'm not so sure about, but I'm inclined to say most of the markups are excessive. So far the most comparable quality tea I've found was from Rishi Tea and I think their prices are a little bit more reasonable.Another drawback here is that the minimum quantity they sell of a given tea is 2 oz, which is a lot to commit to, especially for the pricier teas or blends of multiple teas. They offer samples of a few teas, though, and I recently discovered that they brew and sell individual cups of tea at the counter, so I recommend trying a new tea before buying to make sure you like it. Tip: the cha yen thai black tea, while decent in its own right, tastes absolutely nothing like thai tea.Finally, the employees in every Teavana store I've ever visited try to upsell and cross-sell you like CRAZY. Some of their tea accessories are worth it and some are overpriced, but the pushy salespeople will try to get you to take home everything in the store. I might have given them 3 stars otherwise but the sales experience knocks it down a peg for me.My overall impression is that a few Teavana options are worth the cost, but most are not. I'll keep sampling cups to pick out the gems, but for my "fancy" tea I'll mostly stick to Rishi and for my medium-grade tea I'll mostly stick to Argo Tea and Tealuxe.

31.description: I really liked this place. It is a bit pricey but they have great stuff. The staff is incredibly friendly. Good quality & tasty teas.

34.description: Their products are awesome.  IF you're a tea fan, I'm sure you can find something good and healthy.  Even if you don't like tea, their free samples could get you hooked fast.   It's a little pricey, and I was a little dissappointed when they didn't think it was a big deal to go a little over the amount we asked for which ended up increasing our purchase by 30%

16.description: This place should be renamed Cheatavana because from the moment you enter all they are trying to do is scam you and mark you as a target for trying to get you to spend as much as possible.  They wouldn't tell me the prices of the teas when I was buying them and the next day I found out there was a 30% sale going on that I was not given.  When I spoke to corporate they informed me to go back and they will credit me the difference.  Of course when I get there the manager is not there and they need corporate to call them to confirm this discount with them, however it was late so obviously corporate was closed.  Very convenient for them.  Anyway if you want to be ripped off, Teavana is the place for you.

13.description: AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS! Like a bad relationship that is just not good for you, I had to finally cut ties with Teavana after many many months of being together. I used to spend hundreds a month on their teas, and I even had a great system at home of tasty hot and iced teas that I drank regularly, but it was time to go. It was difficult to do, and sometimes I will miss certain teas of theirs, but it was the best thing for me. Plus, I am MUCH happier in my relationship with Adagio Teas now. In the case of Teavana though, it wasn't me, it was them, and a lot of the problem had to do with this store.As everyone has already mentioned, one of the biggest problems with Teavana comes down to their pushy and downright rude sales tactics. Never in my life have I come across this kind of aggressiveness, not even on a used car lot. They sell their teas in 2oz portions, which is the smallest amount you can buy, and they offer a 10% discount if you purchase 16oz. They must be required to make sure everyone leaves with 16oz of tea, because they will push that discount on you over and over again, even if you are just walking it for 2oz of tea. When you say no to them, they will say things like "you'd have to be stupid to not take the 10% discount." I finally told one employee one day, "well clearly I must be stupid. Thanks!" Also, they are very sneaky. You'll ask for 2oz of a tea, and they will put like 3.5oz in your bag and seal it up. I finally caught someone doing it one day, and called her out on it. She said she 'didn't think I would mind,' even though it was almost double what I asked for. When I told her to take it out, and only give me the 2oz I asked for, she gave me a snarky "fine," and then told me not to blame her when my tea tasted terrible, because she was going to have to take out all the 'good stuff' to get my tea down to 2oz. My jaw hit the floor.As I said, I am MUCH happier with my experiences at Adagio Teas now. The employees are never pushy, and seem to be there just to help. Most importantly, the teas are as good if not better, and much cheaper. I can walk out of the door with 16oz of tea for $25, where at Teavana it would cost me $75 or more. Go to Adagio, you'll thank me later.***On a side note, I have to point out a ridiculous and lazy policy Teavana has. As many already know, you can go into Teavana and order tea 'by the cup' to go. It's nice when you need a cup of tea on the go, plus you get to sample tea that you will likely come back and buy to brew at home. Well, during the holidays Teavana tries to get rid of that, because it's 'too busy' to brew people tea. This store takes it to the next level though. Two weeks before Halloween, when there was literally no one in the mall, this store had already started the policy and told me they wouldn't be brewing tea by the cup again until January 1st. When I questioned them, because the holidays weren't even close yet and there was no one in the mall, I was told to just go to the food court because the tea is 'just as good' there. What?! When I walked out of the store, they went back to gossiping since they had no work to do. I ended up contacting corporate about my experience, and was told the employees are supposed to only say no if it is 'very busy' in the store. Clearly, they can also say no if they just don't feel like it. I guess I shouldn't be too surprised, I had the same thing happen in this store around 4:30pm on a Sunday one day. I walked in and asked for a cup of tea, and the employee said they don't brew tea by the cup for the last hour they are open, so they have time to clean. When I explained to him it was 4:30pm, and they close in an hour and a half at 6:00pm, he said it was 'too bad' because he already had started cleaning. Again, clearly it's this store, because I visited the Orland Park and Skokie stores just a week or so before Christmas, with their stores packed with shoppers, and they were more than happy to brew me a cup of tea by the cup no questions asked. Seriously though, this should be basic customer service. The more people can sample, the more they will buy when they like it, especially during the holidays.

11.description: Pay attention to the prices!! My husband ended up spending $57 on 8 ounces of tea. One of the teas was $10 an ounce! The staff definitely tries to sell you the more expensive teas. The sales people were knowledgable - and there were 8 of them in the small shop.

39.description: 5 Stars for really great tea, 1 star for service...The samples around the store are worth the visit, and the 2 oz. minimum will still get you enough to satisfy any fancy tea cravings. The sales staff? Really frustrating. Not unlike the experiences so many of you had, upon checkout our salesgirl became a pushy bitch. "Do you need a tin?... No? No tin? Well what do you plan to store it in?... Tea needs a tin, or it will go bad. What sort of a tin do you have at home?"... Lay off. I am certain that the tea will stay alive for the next 30 minutes, until I can get home and put it in a pillow-lined tin. Then she started in on how we planned to make the tea, and did we have the proper water boiling tools. I told her we planned to dump the entire 4 oz. of tea into a pot of hot water, soak it, and pick out the pieces... because that's how you make tea, right? The sarcasm was lost on her.At any rate, the tea of course was delicious, but we haven't been back to the store for more. The whole place is gimmicky, and it's clear they are more interested in sales than tea (at least Starbucks pretends to prefer the coffee). Still, if you want to spoil yourself with some nice tea, this is a good option.

37.description: I have shopped here twice.  Both times the sales staff was very knowledgeable and patient.  I enjoyed the teas I purchased immensely.  It was a bit pricey, but I understand I am at the water tower buying tea.  If I am out near the area, I would certainly go back and get some more.

0.description: To quote one of the shows, I watched as a kid "Damn, Damn, Damn!" Walking into Teavana, I felt a little out of place. I don't consider myself rich, but I felt like this is where the rich would come to have their tea, not Starbucks. I've tried to stay clear of Lipton for the last few years. So, I thought it was time to upgrade to something with stronger flavor profiles. This was my first visit to Teavana. I needed more Matcha powder for my green tea latte, and google lead me to them. Antionet S, I hope that's her name, was a huge help. She was very engaging and friendly. One of the reasons I spent more than I planned. Thank you Antionet.I read the reviews before I went in so I knew it could get expensive. I did not plan to get much. The smell of the tea's and amazing customer service are what got me. The plus side about this tea's, which was shared with me is, they can be steeped more than once. I have put that theory to test this morning and sure enough you can. I was told between 3 to 5x depending on the tea. I have used the same leaves twice so far with amazing flavor each time. Try doing that with you everyday grocery brand. I think the amount of times you can steep the leaves makes up for the price. I am a fan!!!!I got 3 very delicious flavors Strawberry Paraiso, Limeade twist, and Sakura Allure. All very good and aromatic. Just try not to go overboard or you too will be saying Damn, Damn, Damn! when you see the price. Lol! worth it though.Great smells products, customer service, and location. Great as a gift or for yourself.

38.description: This review pertains to the Water Tower location where I have been a very loyal shopper.   I drink a lot of tea, like variety,  and buy a lot of tea to give to friends.  This translates to a lot of money in their register! While I like the product very much, my problem with the store has always been the hard sell.  To be fair, I must say that most of the employees are very pleasant and helpful.  However, I had a particularly offensive experience the last time I was in the store and in the future will only shop there when this particular gentleman is not present or spend my money at the North Bridge location.  A final word of warning would be watch the scale.  They tend to measure out more than you've asked for and by more than a few ounces.  Beware!

51.description: I like this place but I don't love it.  I go here primarily because it is geographically accessible without a car.  I really like tea.  I grew up in a family where tea was prepared for me by people one generation removed from Ireland so, for me, tea has always been something string that you put cream in.  I will occasionally drink herbal tea but not often.  They have a good selection of black teas here and a couple of really good white teas too.  The green tea selection is good (I HATE green tea).  Not only can you buy it loose (which I have for gifts), you can buy the macha green tea powder which is ideal for baking things like green tea cookies.  I have also used their loose leaf teas in baking as well and they stood up pretty well too (earl grey cookies, anyone?).I agree with another reviewer on the hard sell at checkout.  I don't want the special tea steeper and their specific kind of sugar and overpriced tins and all of the other stuff.  But the few times I have been here, it has all been pushed on me despite my polite but firm protestations.  I find it really annoying.If I have a ride down to Chinatown (or the energy to bus it down there), I much prefer shopping at Ten Ren.  They are just as knowledgable and not nearly as pushy.

27.description: Wow, unbelievable.  I had thought it was just one bad store but this one was also packed with car salesmen trying to get me to spend my kids school tuition for the next year on tea.  I cant think of an experience when I have been so annoyed with the salespeople.  The peach tea I tried there was soooo good though.  Please teavana- do something about your salespeople, I want to come back to you!!!

32.description: I love this place and I vvish there as one in NYC!Excellent quality tea and that day they had 6 samples of different flavored teas- hot and cold.  It's pricey and I think their descriptions of the health benefits each tea vvill give you is a bit over-done (vvould be nice if true).Beautiful, high quality tea kettles.  Very expensive.Sure the staff there can be a bit pushy/annoying.  I think they have to bother people because of all of the people in the store vvho are there just for the free samples of tea they keep taking multiple cups of.  (no, I'm not speaking from personal experience, oh no... not at all.  ;)

54.description: Tevana......ah the tea connoisseurs dream come true. Being an ODD American, I have always loved hot tea(and no, not that Lipton stuff) so I was so excited to discover this place. With everything from Earl Grey Creme, to Jasmine Dragon to herbal fruity blends every tea lover will find something they adore. They also sell beautiful tea services, both British and Asian inspired as well as any other "tea accessory" you can think of.Now the downside- EXPENSIVE! If you are a person who drinks tea everyday, you will find yourself going to the poor house to keep yourself stocked in Tevana tea. If Chinese tea blends are your thing, many shops in Chinatown sell the exact same quality for 1/4th of the price.(the only reason I didn't give this place 5stars)

48.description: I love, love, LOVE Teavana... their blends are by far the BEST I've ever had. If you love tea, I would highly recommend trying them the next time you're at Water Tower place.

44.description: I love Teavana and their free tea samples. They are kind of overpriced, but their tea is so good, sometimes it's worth buying. They trick you though by making really good mixes as samples, and the mixes are typically more expensive! They have a great selection of tea-related gifts, such as strainers, mugs, teapots, etc. The store is small and overcrowded if there are more 4 customers though.

24.description: I first wandered into Teavana at Old Orchard and I really liked the place. So I dragged my tea loving hubby down to this location because it's closer to home. Upon walking in we were immediately greeted by a very friendly employee. We sampled several teas and decided to buy some iced teas to go. The employee Pablo seemed very knowledgeable and passionate about the tea. He was very courteous and willing to teach us about anything we wanted. We left very happy and will definitely come back for more.

7.description: I love the selection and the customer service. If you are new to loose tea this is the best place to start. The employees are well educated on the subject and the products. The prices are actually pretty good. And overall the service is excellent. Don't know what to get there are samples everywhere!

49.description: Teavana, While the tea is great, and the accessories are cute and cool, the approach to customers may need to be revamped. Every time they try to unload these everlasting freshness bins on you, and they are not quite clear about the pricing of these bins. Before you know it, you've spent over thirty dollars on tea and these magic bins. haha

40.description: I like my Tea Ren's and other Chinese tea shops. This western tea shop? I don't understand it! AND they're expensive!! But I go here on days when I have work and I'm feeling just awfully sick. I ask for whatever type of tea that would help make me feel better. It usually does the trick, but still, it's awfully expensive and I don't know what it is that they give me...  Hence the three stars.

53.description: Teavana has a great selection of teas and a few brewed up for you to try.  And tons of cute tea pots.  And a staff that loves tea and will follow you around the store talking about how much they love tea.   The bad:  the hard sell at checkout  Me:  I'd like some of the oolong I just tried!Teavana:  Would you like it in a large $6 tin or a larger $7 tin?  This first tin will hold about $56 of the tea you selected.Me:  No thanks, I don't need a tin.  And I just want 2 oz.T:  Did you bring your own tin to take it home in?Me:  No.T:  Tea has to be stored in a tin.Me:  I've got pleanty of tins.pause for 30 second staring contestT:  what kind of tin do you have?Me:  A TEA Tin  pause for 30 second staring contestT:  well...  I can put it in a bag if you're going to take it right home and put it in a tin.It was really just a bizaar experience.  Good tea, high prices, crazy service

30.description: Let me start off by saying I want to blame the slow elevators @ Water Tower for being dragged into this store.I was asked if I wanted to sample some tea.  I love tea.  I need to cut back on the caffeine, so tea is a great option.  I had been meaning to check out the store and wow.  What a lot of tea.The sample was really good.  I was shown a lot of the teas and got to smell them.  All of them were pretty pricey.  When I asked to smell the cheap tea, I got a "look".  When the sales person was showing me the store and various tea pots...I was so overwhelmed. I should have known right then.  The rest is a blur.I just wanted to taste some tea.  The next thing you know I'm walking out of there with a tea set, expensive tea and I'm still confused how it happened.  But I am looking at my receipt and am embarrassed by what I spent. It's just farking tea!However, I am sitting here drinking my tea and admiring my new tea pot. I really wish I didn't have this overwhelming sense of guilt associated with it.  The pressure of the sales staff was completely overwhelming.  Do not go in there alone, like I did.

46.description: This review is pretty much for the customer service. You see as a tea newbie I really have nothing to compare their tea  too. Um, it's good though. (?)I idiotically braved the memorial day weekend tourist crowd strictly to go to Teavana at water tower. My roomate has been drinking their detox tea for the past few weeks  to much success.  Unfortunately I cannot have caffeine (darned acid reflux) so I was relying on the staff to be able to provide me with alternate options.  So  after 2 packed buses, and a lot of walking I made it to teavana red faced and irritated.  I sweatily explained my needs to the two girls at the counter, and they patiently and expertly set me up with a great white tea/green tea blend (ok I can have  a little caffeiene) and a tea infuser perfect for making iced tea. Yeah I kinda got the hard sell, but it didn't bother me as I knew nothing about what I needed.   The one salesgirl even spent a good five minutes explaining to my mathematically inept ass how the tea is priced per ounce. A potentially overwhelming experience made simple. Thanks for your help ladies.  I will for sure be back (just never..never..ever on a holiday weekend again!)

1.description: Absolutely obsessed. As soon as I went to the front of the store, I was greeted by this wonderful guy, Nathan. He was SO helpful. He walked around the entire store with me in order to pick out the perfect gift for my mom. Due to black friday, he even gave me 40% off. This was easily the most enjoyable experience at any tea shop that I have ever been to. Their samples were perfectly made and every employee seemed to really enjoy being there. As I was leaving, I asked if there was a number that I could call into because I was so thrilled. Nathan told me that there was no survey, and that he was actually the manager. I was delighted to see such a wonderful and cheerful person be in this position.What a delightful experience.

55.description: Besides Lipton Ice Tea (you know what I'm talking about "Thats Brisk Baby"), I was never a tea drinker and to be honest never even gave it a chance.  That is until one fateful Christmas shopping season. After a very friendly sales associate helped picked out a gift, she offered me a free sample.  She assured me it wouldnt taste like my grandpas tea. And boy was she right.  That day I walked out with 1/4 lb of Rooibos Tropica and Tranquil Dream, and have been hooked ever since.I am looking forward to trying the ginger bread cookie tea

9.description: A word of caution: PAY ATTENTION TO THE PRICES!I enjoy a good cuppa - usually black teas, but of late white teas have taken my fancy as well. The staff at Teavana were knowledgeable; talk to them about your tastes and you're sure to find something you like - white, green or black. Or a mix, if you prefer it.I bought a mix of white and black tea BUT I did feel cheated of my money because the associate did not tell me how many ounces a packet would hold (a minimum purchase of 2oz is required) and I ended up spending more than I would have liked. I know it is specialty tea but I think there are other places in the city where you wouldn't feel that way and still get very good quality (if not better) tea!

26.description: Wow, after reading some of these really negative reviews, I was wondering if I had visited the same store.  My wife and I stopped in Teavana for the first time today and were quite happy with our experience.  Xavier was the sales person who waited on us and he was very knowledgable about the different teas they sold.  He was super nice and not pushy at all.  He even gave us two free cups of tea since it was my wife's birthday.  Now that's customer service!  Since my wife and I are big tea drinkers, we will definitely be back...as long as Xavier waits on us!   By the way, we happily purchased about $40 worth of tea and can't wait to try it!

25.description: I been disappointed with tea many times, but here I was awed, not only by their vast array of tea choices, but the way they prepare their teas, and their mixtures. I couldn't decide on what tea to try, so I asked the barista to recommend something. Well worth it!

12.description: Ok so this is way more than I want to spend on tea, but I wanted to treat myself after a long day of Christmas shopping.  The sales person was nice in helping me figure out exactly what flavor I was looking for.  I ended up purchasing 2 oz loose leaf white peach tea which cost me close to $30!! However, if you bring the container back with you to refill, I guess it'll be slightly cheaper for tea next time around - or so she says.  We'll have to see... nonetheless I'm a fan of Teavana.  I can't see myself purchasing tea here regularly, but they make great gifts!

59.description: Wonderful selection at a resonable Price!As soon as you get "into" tea, you will realize that they range in price.In Korea and Japan... you can easily spend over $500 on a few onces!However, thats not me.Teavana has an EXCELLENT selection of teas. They are geared more for the "american" market, that do not know much about tea (in general). This is one of the reasons they "sweeten" the tea, and mix different teas together. They are big on education, and believe it or not... there is no such thing as a "stupid" question.. especially when talking about tea. I believe the "owners" are an American (white) guy and his Chinese wife. Great pair!The selection is very wide and my favorite is the Geisha. I promise you, smell it, drink it, you will be FALL IN LOVE.My wife LOVES the Peach Tranquility.We have never been disappointed! However, if you live nearby, just buy a few onces.If you are SUPER thirsty, then buy a cup or two!Love you guys!

21.description: Watch out - these are salespeople!I walked in hoping to find something a Christmas gift. After looking online, I was pretty sure of what I wanted. I left spending way more than I intended to because they employ really good salespeople that will fast talk you into things before you know what happened. Obviously they get paid commission. I walked out feeling like I got swindled. Next time I will just order online or find some other place to avoid their crazy sales tactics.

17.description: I love this place and I vvish there as one in NYC!Excellent quality tea and that day they had 6 samples of different flavored teas- hot and cold.  It's pricey and I think their descriptions of the health benefits each tea vvill give you is a bit over-done (vvould be nice if true).Beautiful, high quality tea kettles.  Very expensive.Sure the staff there can be a bit pushy/annoying.  I think they have to bother people because of all of the people in the store vvho are there just for the free samples of tea they keep taking multiple cups of.  (no, I'm not speaking from personal experience, oh no... not at all.  ;)

10.description: Pricey but I love the quality of the teas.

5.description: I don't want to even put any star, I went there in the middle of employee conversation the alught so laud and if I ask for a sample they showed the attitude, besides the location in watertower Chicago whetre I was yesterday was so dirty and mess I was so excited toc heck this please because im actually socialmedia advertisement specializing with tea industry..........and its horrible, people if you tired with the job do what you want but don't mess up with someone business I spend by meself aroun 200$ for the tea a month.......so thanks for a welcome time im glad you and this store is not worth it.I don't remember the names of associate but there was a skinny girl with short hair and black woman that sarcastically laught at me anytime I ask question.Besides the tea was cold and the way the emoployee gave it to me made me totally out of store.Can I try more free samples...I ve got an answer " you can only sniff for free out teas or watch our accessories" Seriusly??????????????????????????Teavana! sorry- goodbye.

3.description: Nice place and their ice teas are great!!!!!And you can use your starbucks app to pay which is cool

35.description: The salesgirl at this Teavana would get more bees with honey!It was my first time ever in this place, and I know as much about tea as I know about quantum physics (which is nothing). I was interested in some green tea, and she immediately pulls out the most expensive one. I had her show me different teas cause I wanted to know what was so dang special about the $20 tea. Then she tried to sell me a cast iron tea kettle even though I told her I had one, and she tried pushing this "air tight" container claiming my tea would go stale in a week without it. It'll be gone by then. Not once did she make eye contact with me. I felt totally out of place in this store. She missed out on a sale, because they have really cute stuff. Most people buy things from people they like. Can't say I liked her attitude. The tea is good, but I will not go back.

19.description: Let me start off by saying I want to blame the slow elevators @ Water Tower for being dragged into this store.I was asked if I wanted to sample some tea.  I love tea.  I need to cut back on the caffeine, so tea is a great option.  I had been meaning to check out the store and wow.  What a lot of tea.The sample was really good.  I was shown a lot of the teas and got to smell them.  All of them were pretty pricey.  When I asked to smell the cheap tea, I got a "look".  When the sales person was showing me the store and various tea pots...I was so overwhelmed. I should have known right then.  The rest is a blur.I just wanted to taste some tea.  The next thing you know I'm walking out of there with a tea set, expensive tea and I'm still confused how it happened.  But I am looking at my receipt and am embarrassed by what I spent. It's just farking tea!However, I am sitting here drinking my tea and admiring my new tea pot. I really wish I didn't have this overwhelming sense of guilt associated with it.  The pressure of the sales staff was completely overwhelming.  Do not go in there alone, like I did.

28.description: I'm reading some of the other reviews and I'm stunned at the people who had a bad experience.  I've went here twice now with different people and the experience has led both people I've taken here to spend over a hundred dollars.  They nor I knew anything about tea.  However we don't have the buyer remorse that some do.  The passion, excitement, and certainty of the employees is amazing.  They know what they're talking about and the product is amazing.  I'm really impressed with this place.  Big fan.

45.description: I used to buy my tea from Teavana in Boston, and am relieved there is one in Chicago.  This is one of the best places in the US to find quality tea.  If you like to simply reach for a big of Lipton and call it tea, you will not know what hit you when you sip real tea.  Typically I get my tea in the Netherlands or France, but the Rooibos and white tea selections available at Teavana are fantastic.  I highly suggest investing in one of their "Perfect Tea" makers.  It is what they use to make tea for customers, and is also what I swear by (outside of the cast iron pot).Also, if you are not sure you want to invest in a few ounces of tea, you are able to order a beverage to try it out (about $2.99 for a regular selection).

33.description: I love Teavana and their high quality products. It may be intimidating as a first time visitor not being familiar with tea and you may feel a bit overwhelmed. You will know that some associates are honest and others are too damn pushy. (some locations are better than others too) Been there..done that... They are pricey, I do admit. However, they have a great product. Once you get your necessities (Perfect Tea Maker & Cup, Scooper, Honey/Rock Sugar). You're return visit for a refill or a new flavor should be easy. In general, this location has friendly people and give great suggestions.

43.description: If you're the type to never turn down free samples at Costco, then Teavana is the place for you.Kidding aside, the free samples here are really rich and good. My favorites are the peach and apple pomegranate. It's a nice boost, especially if you've been shopping in the Water Tower all day.This place is great for gifts, and if you want to try any of their delicious flavors, you purchase a cup to sample without the guilt of buying a whole bag. P.S. The employee with the blue short hair -- amazing. Thanks for all the suggestions!

2.description: There is this tea place by my folks' place.  You walk in and its like a legit tea museum.  They have three types of piping tea available for you to sample -- in big cups, for you to sip casually as you smell the samples of each of the probably-over-200 teas as you shop. Popping in there is always a really enjoyable experience. Juxtapose:  Teavana.  Pretentious and pushy and the opposite of enjoyable.  Oh, thank you, Teavana, for 3 milliliters of lukewarm Earl Gray served in the same type of plastic cup that used to come out of a container in my grandmother's bathroom next to the bottle of mouthwash.  Please, push me around a little bit more and don't bother stopping your Oolong-rant so that we can just collect our thoughts and make our purchase decision.  Oh, no, by all means when we finally choose the teapot and cups to purchase for our friend's birthday tell us "Well, I'm going to be honest, I wouldn't like it."  Oh and if you wouldn't mind, could you be a little bit more dramatic, flamboyant, and condescending when showing us your extensive inventory of green tea that, if we only knew what we were talking about, would know whether we preferred green tea for its "health benefits" or "just for taste."Anyway, overall we got a great gift and a very fair price, and Teavana saved the day.  But the pretty pushy environment and the over-the-top sales associate (Nathan M) left us running out.

18.description: As far as the tea goes this place deserves 5 stars. But when I was there I was treated very rudely. I tried to use my Starbucks rewards for tea, and it didn't go through. I felt that they owed me an explanation at the very least, since they work there after all and considering I took the time out of my day to get this tea. Out of pocket, this teavana is very expensive, so maybe you can understand my disappointment. The response I got was "we can't just give away free tea."  This was said very rudely, when the fact was that I did not ask for "free tea."  My Starbucks rewards states that I can collect one ounce of loose leaf tea per reward. I had collected 2 for a minimum 2oz. purchase. I was offended and felt very insulted having this said to me in front if other customers.  Will I go back? Yes. The tea like I said is very worthy. I just hope to be served by other associates. During my experience I asked the lady working there if I could just smell some of the teas (they have a large selection I know), and she was getting frustrated after I asked to smell the third one. Usually I get my 2oz for free and pay for a different 2 oz. Therefore I wanted to know what I was getting. In the end, it's their job. It's what they get paid to do. I felt as if I was asking more out of her when asked to smell the teas. It sucks because my first few times there I got a really good impression and enjoyed going often. I am a frequent Starbucks customer and my rewards rack up pretty quickly.

41.description: I liked it.  I've been wanting to try some good teas (first time getting beyond grocery store tea bags) and some friends recommended this place.  I stopped on my way home from work.I told the sales person (college age girl with short hair) that I know absolutely nothing about tea.  However, I didn't tell her that I am a well educated salesman.  I was impressed by both her knowledge of the products as well as grasp of the selling process.  She walked me through the differences between the different categories as well as the different benefits and flavor profiles.  This was great.  She asked nice leading questions to figure out what I would like best based off of some basic cues.  I like full flavored and things that aren't overly flowery or herbal tasting.   I am a former/taking a break pipe smoker and always favored strong tasting varieties.  I had a goal price range of about $80 out the door with everything I needed...with at least 3 different kinds of tea ( 1 each of green, oolong, and black).  I ended up with 4 kinds (those 3 plus a mate), 1 tin, and a strainer for just under that amount.  My when in doubt was to go for the most expensive one.  Good for their sales and this shows off the top what they consider their "best" teas to me.  Sales process-very good.  She did a great job of add-on selling without being pushy or coming off as trying to earn a commission, pushed value over price, and picked up on cues from me with ease.  E.g. when she saw that I perked up when she mentioned a higher caffeine content, a few moments later recommended a mate.  From a sales perspective I give her 5 stars.  I am VERY pleased with what I ended up with.  I'm looking into a teapot so that I can brew more than 1 cup at a time.  I will be going back or using the online site.  I'm sticking with 4 stars for the shop because it seemed a little under staffed. I'm going to check out a few other tea shops for comparison.

52.description: Ok I totally promote shopping local and I know this happens to be a store that is national -however!  I love their tea!  In fact, I am sitting here writing this review drinking their Jasmine tea.  What I love - the quality.  The Jasmine for example is the full bud.  I also like their selection of Japanese cast iron tea kettles.  This is one of the few places that I have actually found the iron warmer (used with tea light candle) to keep the tea warm.    The only reason I gave it a 4 star is that fact that its national - I just don't want to see this larger style chain sell out and get too big.  I think the concept is great.  I appreciate how they store the product - in canisters instead of leaving it open so that the tea dries out and is not as flavorful.  I also like that they allow you to buy a canister that you can use over again which I do.

50.description: 5 stars for having the tea I like but can't find anywhere else. 1 star for not asking me if I wanted my teas in canisters and just putting them in, ringing them up and surprising me with a $20+ for very little tea. That would come to 3 stars but I deduct another star for that really shady tactic.I just wanted some yerba. And then I agreed to try some of what you're telling me to sample. You were very nice and into the tea and the professional-like wafting. Lovely. Now I was new to this tea enterprise so I didn't know what you were doing with the shiny tins. But then you told me (well you didn't, the register did), you were selling them to me out of the blue. And you could've fit my small amount of tea in a small tin I later learned existed, but you put it in a larger tin because, why the hell not? It's busy and I'm very unlikely to ask questions, request you tear the stickers off the can, and dump the tea into bags. If I was pushy enough I'd get my way but I look nice and you weren't making eye contact to invite me to ream you. Luckily I am nice in public and I actually trust people in stores for some odd reason.All this time I shrugged it off as your way of doing things, just a business I won't buy from again because those are your rules..and then I come here and read that it's actually optional. Some sense! And that most people complain about the tin pushing..which I wasn't lucky enough to get the opportunity to fight. What business does this? If you have to make a little extra cheat on the scales so most of us don't notice. Don't blatantly add the TruCoat without even verbally acknowledging you're about to screw me. Egh.

4.description: I love Teavana.  In fact, I drink their tea multiple times a day. Teavana as a store with a wide variety of quality loose leaf tea gets 5 stars. The 3 stars reflected here take this location into consideration. I've been to this store on many, many occasions. The staff ranges from super friendly and extremely helpful to rude, pushy, and downright snobby.

6.description: I love the tea selection here.  It's very pricey and I would second the other reviews in telling you to watch out for the pricing.  One of the teas I just purchased is $12.00 per two ounces.  Think about that for a minute.  I almost left with $87.00 worth of tea!  When I said "holy s**%^" the awesome manager was more than accomodating to take back a lot of what I'd asked for.  Judging by how kind she was about doing this (didn't seem irritated by me at all) I'm guessing this sort of thing happens a lot here.  :-/Great teas, great customer serivce, and nice tea accessories.  I bought a pretty tumbler mug which was worth the $33.00 it cost so far... keeps my beverages nice and toasty hours after brewing.  I will continue to shop here for all of my tea needs.

22.description: Yikes, these guys' commission must be AWESOME for how voraciously they jump on you. I mean, everyone was nice and helpful, yes, but the associates helping me would only show me their top shelf ($22/oz) teas, I had to really talk them down to show me some of the more moderately priced ones.  Every time I hesitated/said no to something they would whip out another tea and start fanning it at me, and this would happen until I finally said 'yes.' My two 2-oz bags of herbal teas racked up to $26, which feels a little ridiculous compared to my normal tea sources (Whole Foods and Coffee & Tea Exchange), but to their credit the tea is really, really good, and the associates gave me some good tips on how to make my tea go farther with multiple steepings. I would return, but with a solid plan of what I wanted and how much I was prepared to spend.

15.description: I needed a final small yet thoughtful gift for my mother for her birthday, and in my wanderings around Water Tower I spotted Teavana. My mother loves tea, but tends to stick to the grocery store bagged variety, so I thought it would be nice to make her a custom blend.I can't remember the name of the associate I met, but she was very attentive and helpful. She was willing to work within my meager budget and create something special, though she did push me on additional accessories or a tea kit. When I explained that my mother lives 700 miles away, she did back off a bit before it became too uncomfortable. Admittedly, I was close to walking away without purchasing anything, but we came back around and I left with two small bags of beautiful loose tea. I would certainly consider returning.

57.description: I could not get enough tea into my system even if I had an IV going straight to my veins. I drink it all day long and so does my best friend. Now, I'm not saying that they don't have good, quality teas here because they do. I just feel that it is a little overpriced. You can get similarly quality loose leaf at The Coffee & Tea Exchange in Lakeview for a much more reasonable price. I love that because it means I can buy more, more, more!Additionally, I feel like I am always being PRESSURED to buy anything additional that they can shove in my face. No, I don't want to buy the tin. I have a ton at home. No, I don't want to buy the tea maker/holder/brewer or anything else. Just give me what I ask for. I do enjoy their teas and the generous samples they provide, but I am taking away two stars for the two reasons listed above.

20.description: Ok so this is way more than I want to spend on tea, but I wanted to treat myself after a long day of Christmas shopping.  The sales person was nice in helping me figure out exactly what flavor I was looking for.  I ended up purchasing 2 oz loose leaf white peach tea which cost me close to $30!! However, if you bring the container back with you to refill, I guess it'll be slightly cheaper for tea next time around - or so she says.  We'll have to see... nonetheless I'm a fan of Teavana.  I can't see myself purchasing tea here regularly, but they make great gifts!

36.description: I love tea - but not pushy salesmen and not this place!I seriously went in here to buy a little tea and came out with $34 dollars worth. It was all because of a ridiculous salesmen (name might be Mark/Matt) who turned me off from the entire store. I'll never be back because of way I was pushed into buying my tea. Granted it's good tea, not life changing, but it's definitely not worth what I paid for it. He was a little condescending which really turned me off. I don't know a lot about tea, but I definitely don't want to feel stupid about it after visiting a tea shop. He kept making a strong argument for buying the large sealed container because it was only a dollar more than the smaller container. I repeatedly had to say I did not have the space for a gigantic tin barely filled with tea. This is the problem with America in general...they think bigger is better but it's not always the right way to go. I hate having to defend why I want something when really I just need assistance in getting what I originally came in for. This was a battle that left me annoyed in the end and with $34 dollars worth of jasmine tea balls that will probably last me for the rest of the year. Avoid this place and look for a more mom and pop store that doesn't need to pay high Watertower rent.

14.description: The staff is usually pleasant here(Hey Ashley) but I was very pleased with the service I received tonight. Special shout out to Chris and the young lady who worked with him tonight (sorry I didn't get your name)

29.description: My friend had fond memories of a place called Toots, which was basically a hot dog shack with ice cream too. We were looking for some ice cream, so we thought we would give Scoops a shot. He was impressed by how large Scoops looked in comparison to Toots, which was formerly at this location. The menu looked like one of those at a Greek diner where you can get about anything. However we were focused on dessert, so we each ordered a sundae. He did not say anything, but personally I was very disappointed with my chocolate sundae (though I did eat every drop of course). The sundae was some vanilla soft serve topped by a blob of whipped cream (and the two tasted the same) and also tipped with some chocolate drizzle. That's it - no cherry, no nuts, and frankly no flavor. I should have stuck with my initial thought of getting just a soft-serve cone. My friend had a strawberry sundae and I thought that looked even less appealing, with a meager drizzle of pinkish-red sauce atop his white blob. No hint of a strawberry anywhere. I don't think I will be back to Scoops.

42.description: Scoops is borderline decent, but nothing spectacular.  I guess it depends on what you're looking for or what you're craving.  So far, I've tried the following:Burger - was just OK... the burger is large but very thin.Chicken sandwich - pretty tasty... I'd probably have it again.Gyros - strange... almost seemed undercooked... it was wet... I've never had wet gyros... it would've probably been good had they thrown it on the grill for a few minutes.Fries - just OK... nothing memorable.Shakes - pretty good... as long as they're thick.Ice Cream - they have soft serve cones... good for when you have that craving.Floats - They don't make them!  Now does this make sense?  They have soft serve and they have soda, but they don't make floats.  Why?  Who knows!  I think I was told "because we don't have a price for it".  Makes no sense!Again, Scoops is OK, but nothing spectacular.  It's open late... so if you have late night munchies, maybe this will be the place to go.Scoops aside... I miss Toots!!  Why couldn't they just re-open in the new spot??  That would've been perfect!
