23.description: Its a bit pricey for the portions. Fries were cold. I could have gotten a bigger burger from one and a half slider, It had absolutly no taste but at least it was edible thats the only reason why it got 2 stars. Definately not a place to go back to

47.description: When it first opened it seemed disorganized but they are getting the hang of it.  I like the idea of "scoop"-ing burgers, which is very innovative and different.  I enjoyed the appetizers, and the ambience.  It is definitely a vast improvement over what was there before.  I am glad to have a clean, new neighborhood place in the area.  The staff is friendly and gives good advice.  Try it sometime.

8.description: Large portions? HA! I just had the smallest gyros sandwich ever. Very little meat, gone in 4 bites. Ripoff. All food made to order? No! The pre-made Greek salad had mealy tomatoes and wilted cukes. This place is a ripoff and should be avoided. And Mr Slick behind the counter should work on his attitude...(unless you're a pretty girl).

31.description: Toot's may not have been the best, cleanest or nicest place but dammit they had variety! This joint that replaced it is a sad reminder of how good deep fried everything tasted. Greek food? Yeah and Taco Bell is real Mexican too. If you want some real artery clogging fare, head east to Susie's. That's where I'll be...

34.description: Okay in a pinch.  Keebobs are good.  Burgers need a little work.

16.description: Just a little bit of advice. Don't judge a book by it's cover. Don't assume that Scoop's is an ice cream place because it's name is "Scoop" as a previous reviewer complained about. Besides, ice cream isn't the only food substance that is scooped. You got sloppy joe. That stuff is sometimes scooped. Tang. You have the option of scooping that into a glass of water to make a drink. Ground coffee is another item that may be scooped to make a different type of drink. Sour cream... you get the picture.The food is pretty good, however I am sometimes at a loss as to whether I'm getting too little for my buck, or if I'm getting just the right amount, and Scoop's doesn't believe in over-consumption. The gyro sandwich has about half the meat I would get at another place for just about the same price. You get one hotdog in a hotdog special for the same price you would get two in many other establishments. This could also very well be a result of our economy. But until someone can answer the question as to why I'm paying  so much for half of what I get at other places for the same price, I will have to round this down to three stars.

13.description: I remember Toot's well.  It was a nonstop party during the summer.  Even if you never ate there, all you had to do was drive by to realize that this was THE place for the youth of the neighborhood to stand around, yell and scream at each other and passing cars, and sometimes even eat.  Toot's legacy will not die anytime soon.  Toot's food was standard greasy food, and so is Scoops'...the main differences are that Scoop's doesn't have quite the variety of ice creams, and that this new place isn't very conducive to hanging out.  Where Toot's had a larger outdoor "patio" area with more tables, Scoops is more of an indoor dive.  Anyway, I came here once since it became Scoops and didn't care too much for it.  Places like this are a dime a dozen in Chicago, and there are plenty others like it or better that i can go to that are within walking distance (or a shorter drive) of my home.

11.description: Do not step into Scoops. I am serious. Don't. Not only is the place filthy, but in the neighborhood news, it was said that they almost failed a health inspection on  May 25, 2012. They received only a citation. This place makes you want Toot's back - desperately. Scoops isn't the best of anything, really. . . So just hold in your hunger a bit longer and head over toward another restaurant in the neighborhood that actually tastes good. There isn't much I can really say about this place.

39.description: I went there today for lunch around 12:15. As we were waiting for our food. This heavy set old man, wearing what appeared to be slippers, walked inside the restaurant and to the kitchen. He started picking out french fries with his grubby fingers right over the spot where they are dumped out of the deep frier. He then wiped his mouth and made two cups of soft serve ice scream and and gave to somebody he knew in the dining area. He then went back and scooped up a handful of fries, out of the exact same area where the customers get their fries and just stood their eating. That has to be a violation of a health code. It was totally disgusting. Yelp should have a way to notify health inspectors of unsanitary conditions.

37.description: This place makes the true locals around there mad. I want my TOOTS!  Anyone that used to go to toots will tell you that this place is nothing compared to what food place used to be there. Only thing that this place has going for them is that the place is clean, but that's because the place is pretty new, so it's expected.  Think they are owned by same people that own Mr. Zees.    Don't eat here, maybe they'll go out of business and open up something better.

0.description: Grilled chicken sandwich is just like any quick deli--But.....I ordered a grilled chicken meal & got a small sized beverage, it totaled 8 something and I tipped 1 dollar. I noticed the owner didn't particularly show any hospitality with me. He didn't show me where the ketchup was at, I asked for hot sauce and he dropped bbq on the counter like I was an alien. Then when it came to getting a Togo container, I approached him friendly and smiled -- he dropped the styrofoam away from where I was standing at and walked back to reading his newspaper. This will be the last time I eat here. I didn't feel welcome.

38.description: The kebabs are really good, both beef and chicken, the rest is decent but nothing special, so moral of the story is get the kebabs which are cooked to order.  For all those moaning about the disappearance of Toots, good riddance!

51.description: After seemingly taking MONTHS for the "finishing touches" to go on this place, it finally opened.  The banner outside announced "Scopie-Burgers" but alas, only "Scoopie Burgers" were on the menu...a typo on permanent signage was a sign of things to come.I took a friend on a late Saturday afternoon.  A couple of people ahead of us in line but several standing around waiting.  That should have been another sign.  My friend ordered a burger (standard fare, one would think) and I ordered a Gyro, which I'd think would be pretty easy to prepare since, well... it's already cooked.  Service was slllllooooowwwww.  It took about 15-20 min to get our food - not really acceptable in a "fast food" joint.  Quality of food - pretty good but nothing outstanding.  Fries - pretty standard, gyro - good, fairly fresh-tasting.  Overall, fast food with a bit of a greek flair.  I'd think with the name "Scoops" they's have some sort of special ice cream section, but that wasn't the case, at least when I visited.  Our visit was a couple of weeks after they opened, so I may try it again sometime, to see if they have gotten more organized and efficient.We moved to the area JUST after they tore Toots down.  Sorry I missed it.

27.description: I'm giving this place a four-star review because everyone who gave it a review less than three stars is only comparing it to Toots. Scoops is not a replacement for Toots, they are not responsible for the tearing down of Toots, and they do not specialize in ice cream.Scoops has pretty decent food. Chicken Kabob Pita is quite tasty and the Greek style dinners are as well. Everything else is okay. Overall, it's a good place to have in the neighborhood.

32.description: Scoops is pretty standard Greek fast food.  Nothing I would go completely out of the way for, but when my wife wants a salad I can usually find something on the menu that is satisfying.  I had been to Toots, and even the place it was before Toots in the 70's.  I hate to tell you Toots fans this, but I think Toots was a nostalgic place for many and therefore most people have a hard time judging it objectively, but it really wasn't that good.

48.description: scoops was OK.  I only went for apps this time and they were pretty standard.  Motz sticks, cheese fri, chicken tenders.  I won't be craving scoops but it was clean and they have a good selection of food beyond standard fast food (kabobs, chicken, rice sides).

44.description: Can I give this place 0 stars? Visit #1: My friends and I went to Scoops on their grand opening this past summer to get an old Toots' staple: soft serve ice cream. It's summer, we're a few blocks from Portage Park, why not check Scoops out and get some ice cream to-go? I realize Scoops is not Toots, but what we all thought was misleading was the joints name. What kind of place calls themselves "Scoops" but doesn't have an ice cream selection? My friend and I held a table outside while the rest of our party ordered the ice cream. Scoops was packed and were jazzed for some ice cream! The tables outside were FILTHY!!! This was the grand opening. They were absolutely disgusting. And I don't mean a little ketchup either. I mean pieces of food, DIRT, salad dressing! There's no way this furniture was new either. It was gross. I was pretty disappointed when the rest of our party joined us to tell us the bad news, Scoops only has vanilla ice cream and 2 toppings options: strawberry or chocolate sauce for a sundae. I requested a strawberry sundae. 10 minutes later the rest of our party comes back outside to tell us we're leaving. Scoops didn't have strawberry topping on their grand opening. Okaaaaay. We left very annoyed. No ice cream and nasty tables. Visit #2: Let's try the food! My husband and I got some greasy staples. He had a hot dog with cheese fries and I had cheese sticks. The food was ok. Nothing to get excited about. What didn't make me happy was finding a piece of chicken (nugget?) in my bag of cheese sticks or finding a chunk of ground beef in my husband's cheese dip for his fries. I'm a vegetarian - both "surprises" disgusted me. And again, FILTHY tables inside. Napkins, food and general crap all over the tables and floors. Nobody was in there except one other party. There should be no excuse for how dirty it was. Scoops needs to invest in a few bus boys who can get this place looking a little better.

24.description: I remember Toot's well.  It was a nonstop party during the summer.  Even if you never ate there, all you had to do was drive by to realize that this was THE place for the youth of the neighborhood to stand around, yell and scream at each other and passing cars, and sometimes even eat.  Toot's legacy will not die anytime soon.  Toot's food was standard greasy food, and so is Scoops'...the main differences are that Scoop's doesn't have quite the variety of ice creams, and that this new place isn't very conducive to hanging out.  Where Toot's had a larger outdoor "patio" area with more tables, Scoops is more of an indoor dive.  Anyway, I came here once since it became Scoops and didn't care too much for it.  Places like this are a dime a dozen in Chicago, and there are plenty others like it or better that i can go to that are within walking distance (or a shorter drive) of my home.

7.description: This place is operating under a different name now. Mr. Zee's II

49.description: What a big improvement over Toots.  Great gyros, chicken/rib dinners, and burgers.  Was showing the family the old neighborhood and decided to check this place out. Our order took about 15 minutes to come up but was well worth the wait.  The kids loved the gyros and cheese fries.  I thought the chicken was very tasty and the ribs awesome. Would definitely recommend to friends and we will be back soon

40.description: Really, it's like 3.5 stars...but I didn't have that option.Been here twice.  Yes it takes a long time to get your food, but that's because it isn't BK or McD's; they don't have the food waiting for you when you come in, they cook it when you get there. So waiting 10 - 15 minutes is worth it.The chicken plate is delicious - tender, flavorful chicken, yummy rice and potatoes.  The chicken on their chicken breast salad is a little dry.  The gyros salad was yummy, even though I would prefer any lettuce over iceberg (that seems to be the standard everywhere though).The bathrooms were nice. It looks like they have taken the suggestions of people from earlier reviews and added busboys because it looked pretty clean when we were there.  Overall, the ambiance looks nicer than typical fast food places in the area.They now have an ice cream selection, but hopefully they will expand it soon.  For everyone bitchin about Toots, it was a piece of crap anyway, so this place is a nice upgrade.

30.description: Ok, so I've seen the reviews that people are complaining about the wait. All food is made to order.  Translation:  it's not sitting under heat lamps all day--IT'S FRESH!! I enjoy the egg lemon soup that they have on Sundays.  It's clean and  the people who work there are really nice.  It's what you'd expect, a good, cheep neighborhood grill. Also, it's open late--definitely a plus.On a personal note (if the owner actually reads the yelp reviews) could you please add a veggie burger to your menu?  I'd happily help you find a decent one!!  Hell, I'd even add a star to my rating!

46.description: yes, its a typical Greek snack shop, but try the chicken kabobs, they have a unbelievably good smoked, char-ed flavor.

1.description: Gyro plate is good here and not super expensive like other places around here. Service is good with the usual staff. The name just changed to Mr Zees II however the menu seems to be the same. Looks like they are upgrading their outdoor seating by the summer.

9.description: Gyros was ok. But can't believe how small it is. Wow is all I had to say. Very disappointed.

26.description: The food is pretty good for the price and that's a 3 star The complaint i have is for the manager that works there!  He acts as if he owns the place,very rude and i even heard when he went off on a customer screming at her sayng that his the owner! and that the customer is wrong!Now that's not how you run a business! i hope the REAL OWNER will read this and put him in place! but i will stop by also and find the owner to mention few other issues i had with this place.I BEEN A CUSTOMER AT THEIR OTHER LOCATION SINCE THEY FIRST OPEN:MR'Zs on irving park and never had a issue there everyone is nice and never had a problem with my food or attitude there! But scoops is a diffrent story,and i hate that because of the little guy (that thinks is the owner) i don't want to return! oh well to bad

25.description: This is a Greek fast food restaurant. This place is great for soup, oven brown potatoes, Greek chicken, and basic quick eat items. In my opinion the potatoes and the soup are there best items on the menu. this is one of my favorite places to go when I go to my sisters house because its right around the corner. No delivery which kinda sucks.

12.description: Lots of people mention toots in their review, well that place is long gone so I'll review Scoops. Service is decent, one employee kind of rubs me the wrong way, but whatever I might rub him the wrong way. They got a big money and I normally get the chicken breast dinner. It might not be gourmet food, but you get a lot of it with a variety. I like the lemon egg soup a lot. The inside is nice and has a lot of tables and waiting area if you ordered take out. A few complaints are sometimes the parking lot is packed and the spoons they give you will slice the inside of my mouth.

21.description: Got a gyro plate from there. I got VERY little meat. Almost got as much onions as meat. I was VERY disappointed. I will NEVER go there again.

17.description: I'm giving this place a four-star review because everyone who gave it a review less than three stars is only comparing it to Toots. Scoops is not a replacement for Toots, they are not responsible for the tearing down of Toots, and they do not specialize in ice cream.Scoops has pretty decent food. Chicken Kabob Pita is quite tasty and the Greek style dinners are as well. Everything else is okay. Overall, it's a good place to have in the neighborhood.

10.description: Went in this place tonite with my boyfriend.  First, it is always a bad sign when you say hello to the girl behind the counter and she says nothing back.  Then there was a guy behind the counter who never even acknowledged us...just kept playing around with his cell phone...Talk about a super unfriendly staff...Anyway we were very hungry and ordered the hot dogs and fries...i took one bite and was disgusted...it tasted like it had been swimming in water since the early hours of the day...i looked at the other end and it was a grayish color...then the few fries i ate were just awful...they were half cooked...we threw away the food and headed out for somewhere decent to eat...what a waste of $10...i live in this area but i will NEVER set foot in this place again...if i could give this place zero stars i sure as heck would...

5.description: I think the management change here since they changed from Scoops to Mr. Zee's II. I go here all of the time but ever since their staff changed, I have has nothing but bad experiences here. The service counter is nothing but rude and forget to put items in your bag for a take out order. Be sure to double check your bags and expect an attitude when you ask the service counter if everything is in your bagged order. Rudeness is not on the menu but they are very generous in giving it to you for free. I will not be going back to this ever, I had enough.

3.description: the food stays in you're stomach for days. little portions and too much money. The people need to wear gloves and hairnets. I went into there and as I was waiting for my order the cook was eating and drinking behind the counter where you can see them. I complained and they were snotty and rude. never again.

35.description: i thought this place was good.  i had a gyro and i got 2 hot dog n fry meals. my family and i 100% enjoyed it.  i miss Toots too but this place is good too.  give it a try. thanks.

19.description: Evrytime i would go there i would wait 40+ plus minutes even if theres barely people. People cooking take their silly time playing around and still not make good food. Food just isnt good and the employees arent very kind. There are way way way better restaurants better around there.

28.description: Decent fast food greek food. The portions are HUGE & the prices are cheap! So I'm a fan. Oh and the owner is very friendly and it doesn't hurt that he is good looking.

45.description: Toots was way better. Toots might have been a greasy spoon but this Scoops place is terrible. Bad service to go with bad food . I wont be eating there again....

33.description: Scoops may be classified as "fast food", but they're definitely a step up and offer some home-style cooked meals. One of my favorites is their chicken dinner with rice and potatoes - very yummy and lots of food for the money. Greek salad and feta = delicious! Keep in mind that everything is made to order, so you may wait a few minutes but well worth it!!

43.description: Are you kidding me?!  They knocked down Toot's for THIS?!!  What a pile of crap.  OK, the big room looks nice.  But hell, I'd rather stand at the counter and eat Toot's food than the garbage they served here.  This is the kind of restaurant (if you can call it that) that you would find in a mall in California.  There is NOTHING Chicago about this place.  The fries were tasteless, hamburger generic and nasty.  For supposedely "Freshly" cooked food, why was everything cold when we got it?  This place is an abomination.  Never going there again.

2.description: Ok food, good for a quick bite. Nothing special. Does need to be cleaned better.

18.description: This place is starting to make progress. I noticed a lot of improvements in the last year. The staff seems much friendlier. They have a Greek dressing that is out of this world. They have a couple of the locations East of Eden is west of Eden and Mr. Z's but the salad dressings taste different at all of them. You gotta be consistent. I'm not sure what the theory was a naming them differently. Instead of keeping all the names the same. Because when you walk in the menus all look the same that's how I put 2&2 together.

41.description: Ate here twice. I was suprised to find out that there was only one type of ice cream you could get. WTF is it called "Scoops"? And why did Toots have to be torn down and this take the spot? :(Sadness. Their sign also says to try the "Scopie" wtf is that? Is it supposed to be a Scoopie? I had it and it's a burger with grilled onions. All I could taste were the onions. It was blah.OH, they put lettuce and tomato on the chili dog. The heck???? LOL

52.description: So this is what took over Toot's, eh? I don't know. I'll say this, it's bigger, and I haven't seen any employees slinging vulgarity at 13-year old girls, but...Well dammit, I miss my mac & cheese nuggets.Ok, Scoops... Decent italian beefs and gyros, but nothing to rave about. The place seemed disorganized- I dropped in Sunday for a sandwich and they had people trying to order from all over the counter, it looked like a mob or a trading floor or something. I'll chalk this up to being new. On the plus side, they have a lot of seating a couple outdoor tables, and lordy, it's infinitely cleaner than Toot's ever was.

50.description: Decided to walk in this place and give it a shot................Not worth the trip.This is a very sad example of the former Toot's.

4.description: Ok food , they had a recent remodel I can't really tell what they changed , it wasn't a lot , but there's definitely room for improvement and opportunity for it but it's not my place so i don't care. For a quick bite it's ok , depends what you get also if you get a plate you get ok portions of food. Not high quality definitely can tell when it's a little old like salad and potatoes. Could be cleaned more often the lobby needs more attention. People a times seem not to be doing to much they could clean the lobby or the tables.

6.description: First off, this place is not closed. I currently hold an order ticket from there in my hand which I received yesterday, so those reporting this place to be closed are inaccurate.  I will most likely avoid this place in the future, however, because of the following experience.               I got to the counter to place my order. I asked for a grilled chicken breast sandwich, and that part of the order process went fine. Things derailed, however, when I attempted to order rice pilaf, as identified on the menu.  The woman taking my order looked puzzled, and said, "I don't think we have that". It was then my turn to be puzzled, as it was clearly there on the far left menu, in the middle of the right column under the category of "Sides", allegedly  at the price of $2.something.  There are also pictures of orderable assemblages of  varieties of food, defined as Plates, some of which were clearly visibly incorporating rice pilaf, playing a seemingly pivotal role in the definition of a certain plates, one example of which would be the Half Greek Chicken Dinner.               Seeing all of this, I said,"Pardon?" The young woman taking my order looked at me blankly. Pointing,  I said,"But it's right there on the menu."  She then lackadaisically swiveled her head in a fruitless effort to peer at the menu at which I was pointing, and arrived at the conclusion that she couldn't actually read the menu from her vantage point, which was to her the only investigation this situation required. She then resumed her blank stare, although this time seemingly with a slight aspect of mystification.                I was stumped. Uncertain as how to proceed from there, or what the rationalization was for running out of what seemed to be a core menu item, I then pitched the only scenario for which I could conceive logically arriving at this conclusion: "So, you're out of it, today?" The young woman latched on to this with a visible look of relief and, nodding her head, said,"Yes, we're out of it today." Not really satisfied with this answer, I concluded my order and paid, after which I sat down on one of the convenient chairs placed neatly in a row opposite the counter.               A few moments later she called an order number and a man came up to the counter to get his order (the aforementioned Half Greek Chicken Plate), in the middle of which was a steaming mound of rice pilaf. An older woman appeared at the counter beside the younger one, and I caught her attention. I said, "Excuse me, what was with the chicken on that man's plate?" She curiously replied,"Rice Pilaf." I asked,"So you have Rice Pilaf?" She confirmed that they did. I then asked,"Then why was I just told that you don't have any?"                The older woman looked at the younger woman and they hastily exchanged words. The only snippet I caught was from the younger woman:"He already ordered". A  telephone rang and the older woman produced and answered a cordless handset, disappearing through  a door somewhere towards the back left, leaving me alone with the young woman. Twenty minutes had now passed from the time of my initial order. I briefly started to entertain a scenario that would allow me to order some rice pilaf when the young woman called out my order, extending her hand with a bag that contained among other things a foil wrapped chicken breast sandwich. As I took the bag from her hand, she said,"Ooooh, you wanted rice. You threw me off with 'Rice Pilaf'."  She spread her hands as if to communicate that  she was perfectly justified in her puzzlement. Such was my stunned disbelief in that incredulous moment that I don't quite remember the response I tendered as I then exited.Needless to say, most likely not again. The chicken sandwich was ok, decent Greek spices, but way too much mayo and vinegar for my taste.

22.description: Actually, the restaurant is exactly what it should be.  The food was prepared per order, they have great malts, and everyone was friendly.  No complaints at all, and we are picky.

15.description: The food is pretty good for the price and that's a 3 star The complaint i have is for the manager that works there!  He acts as if he owns the place,very rude and i even heard when he went off on a customer screming at her sayng that his the owner! and that the customer is wrong!Now that's not how you run a business! i hope the REAL OWNER will read this and put him in place! but i will stop by also and find the owner to mention few other issues i had with this place.I BEEN A CUSTOMER AT THEIR OTHER LOCATION SINCE THEY FIRST OPEN:MR'Zs on irving park and never had a issue there everyone is nice and never had a problem with my food or attitude there! But scoops is a diffrent story,and i hate that because of the little guy (that thinks is the owner) i don't want to return! oh well to bad

20.description: Just a little bit of advice. Don't judge a book by it's cover. Don't assume that Scoop's is an ice cream place because it's name is "Scoop" as a previous reviewer complained about. Besides, ice cream isn't the only food substance that is scooped. You got sloppy joe. That stuff is sometimes scooped. Tang. You have the option of scooping that into a glass of water to make a drink. Ground coffee is another item that may be scooped to make a different type of drink. Sour cream... you get the picture.The food is pretty good, however I am sometimes at a loss as to whether I'm getting too little for my buck, or if I'm getting just the right amount, and Scoop's doesn't believe in over-consumption. The gyro sandwich has about half the meat I would get at another place for just about the same price. You get one hotdog in a hotdog special for the same price you would get two in many other establishments. This could also very well be a result of our economy. But until someone can answer the question as to why I'm paying  so much for half of what I get at other places for the same price, I will have to round this down to three stars.

36.description: I miss Toots. Went here a couple times for lunch long after this place replaced Toots.  I figured I'd wait a few months until this new establishment got its' act together and found its' style.  Fail.The gyros here were too greasy and cut weird.  Fries nothing to rave about.  Food took 10-15 minutes to prepare while I was basically the only person inside, really?Only reason I give it 2 stars is because of the neat interior and large LCD TV to watch while waiting.

14.description: This place is nasty overpriced and the owner is a dick . If u get a burger u will need to use the toilet 30 minutes after eating it . As for the the gyros plate I don't how you can get that wrong , it's always rdy the fries are horrible and the veggies taste old and oily . I don't know how this place stays in bizz.

58.description: Great food, ambience and service all add up to a fantastic experience at Hops and Barleys.  A new menu includes some great additions, with healthy choices, as well as all the old favorites.  Servers and management are attentive, efficient and friendly.  Good for anything from an afternoon meal to big night out with the gang.  Can't recommend enough!

56.description: This place is great.  Very good food.  Great Sunday specials and not too crowded.  Patio seating out front.  Just be prepared to be there awhile, the service is a little slow.

29.description: very good food good place to grab a beer and a bite...went before a concert down the street....also a good place to catch a game

42.description: I love this place! It's a nice, friendly neighborhood pub with great food and friendly service. Always has a  nice, diverse crowd, great specials and trivia night on Tuesdays is way fun. I feel lucky to have it in my neighborhood.

23.description: 4 stars for the decent food/drink specials and TVs to watch sports. 3 stars for the average tasting bar food, ok beer menu and ambivalent servers.

47.description: Great local business. Nice to have a decent place to grab a beer and some dinner. Wings are fantastic. Only took one star off for the sides. Not my favorite.

8.description: Hops and Barley is one of my favorite places to go! My boyfriend lives in Jefferson Park and we frequent this place a lot.First of all, the waitresses are ALWAYS so wonderful! Literally every single time we go, their great. Tonight in particular we had an absolute doll of a waitress named Danielle. She was so quick, sweet and creative specifically with her suggestion of putting different fruit in my plain water to jazz it up :) She was also dressed so cute and so pretty and friendly. Second, the food is so delicious and they always have great drink and food specials. My favorite is the shrimp appetizer. It includes 10 lightly fried shrimp with fries. It just has the right amount of spice too. The shrimp and fries were piping hot and fresh. They also have drink or food specials that are always something so good. Last, the atmosphere here is always great and it's never too loud or noisy.After all the times we have gone here, I had to make sure that I gave them a great review; they deserve one!

31.description: I love this place I wish they would bring back karaoke!!!  but I love Wednesdays they are awesome with dj risky business. Plus 3 dollar you call it's. Its only cash$$$ on Wednesday but it's worth it.  Laurie is the bomb and  the rest of the girls are awesome too!! This place has a great neighborhood atmosphere and I love that plus it's not a dive and you don't have to dress to impress it's just come as you are kinda like cheers  If your in or around portage park stop in!! You'll come back.

34.description: Always treated me well in this place.  Good beer selection and prices.  I'm only in the area infrequently but if I lived in the hood this would be my go to place

16.description: The rating this place gets is too low.  The food is excellent for bar food.  Prices are more than reasonable.  Maybe the best turkey burger and portabella sandwich in the city.  The bartenders are friendly.  Always has interesting beers.  Decent inexpensive wine.  The only thing that keeps it from being a 5 is the decor.  The bar area seems like a great hipster beer and drink place. But the dining area feels more like a dark, little bit sleazy Northwest Side pickup place.  It isn't, but just feels that way.  They should lighten the place up a little and it would be about the most comfortable bars in the city.

13.description: Happy birthday, bartender! Spend some time serving the bar instead of drinking it. That's cool, I don't mind waiting 10 minutes for another customer to call u over so I can get a drink, better make it 3 cause I won't see you again. I mean ever, cause I won't be back. Whip that.

11.description: I came here on a date.  Our drinks were okay but I wouldn't come here just for their cocktails.  I also ordered some nachos.  I was very hungry and ate them but the cold, liquidy yellow cheese spread that topped the nachos was far from delicious.  On a positive note, the food is very reasonably priced.It took a while my server to come to the table.  After we got our nachos the server disappeared again.  We had wait awhile to get napkins and silverware, this time from a different server.  It took some time before our anyone came by again, and the restaurant was not busy at all.

39.description: This place always seems crowded, so I figured I'd try it! Its an upscale neighborhood sports bar. But the prices aren't upscale, just the atmosphere and the food. I took my grandparents here, and we enjoyed the food a lot. The TVs were set on MAX VOLUME that day though which none of us enjoyed much.

37.description: Unfortunately this place was not good for me. I can only review what I experienced, but this was one of the worst places I've ever been to. The waitress was super nice, but new nothing about her job. It seemed like her first day, but also as though she received no training. I honestly tried to order three different drinks before I finally gave up and asked for a bud light. They thought I was crazy when I asked for a guiness and cider mix, they offered me 3 bourbons and ended up being out of 2, I asked for an lit and the waitress told be they didn't serve tea. I didn't want to touch that so I ordered a domestic. The food. We tried the calamari. Twice. The first time it was under cooked. The next time was better, but it still wasn't very good. My friend had the blackened tilapia, which was actually very tasty, but her tots were bland and cool. I tried the pizza burger. The pepperoni cheese and bun was great and it covered the taste of the burger for a while. Once the good stuff was gone and I had only meat left it was awful. My home cut fries were pretty good though. Overall. This place was horrible and I don't think I could even give this place a second chance.

0.description: This is a great find in the neighborhood, a bar with craft beers on tap and a full food menu with TVs all around the area. We came on a Sunday afternoon to catch the game and could not have had a better experience. Bartenders knew their food and drinks and service was great. Food came out hot, fast, and under budget. Their drink specials cannot be beat in the neighborhood, getting the downtown drinks or the latest craft beer for a fraction of the drink. Highly recommend!

38.description: Great food, great service. Definitely worth stopping in to enjoy all they have to offer. Dave is the man.

51.description: I love the beer selection at this place.  They've really expanded the beer menu by leaps and bounds in the past 6-8 months.  They have also refined their food menu to concentrate on fewer menu items to make them all great.  My personal favorite is the Friday night fish and chips.  Lightly battered and never over fried or greasy.The wait staff is pleasant and attentive but not overbearing.One of our favorite places in the neighborhood and one that keeps us coming back.

27.description: This place is my go to bar if I feel like having a few drinks when i want to get out of the house.. I love love the staff here!!! The manager, the awesome mustache guy!!! Ronnie I think???? Sorry if I got that wrong.... but my ABSOLUTE FAVE is my girl Jen!!!!! I'm soooo happy that you're back girl!!!!!! :D they have killer deals everyday!!!! My favorite is 3 dollar burgers with fries???? (On Mondays ya'll) Omgosh dirt cheap and awesomely gooood!!! :P and what I also get every time I go is TATERTOTS!!!!! People!!!! Go go gooo to this place and support your local bar!!!! Hahahaa!!!! :D

32.description: This place has been my local bar for a long time. It's a great place to watch the game, has good food with big portions, and has a growing craft beer list. The staff is super nice and the crowd is pretty fun to hang out with. I'd recommend the chicken sandwich and the tater toys, as they've always been a favorite. Can't wait to come back!

54.description: good food, GREAT drink specials, good service.  Why did it take me so long to find this place?  After one visit, we instantly became regulars.  : )

48.description: Friday night 6/21/2013 a little past midnight:I will NEVER walk into this establishment again.  It started when I ordered a drink from the Bartender. I asked for a tall glass and my response was "We don't do that here".  She sat the little glass down in front of me with no napkin or coaster.  When I went to pick up the drink the glass, it was stuck to the bar. As I sat trying to talk to my date, who was an out of town guest, I became even more disturbed.  There was a man (clearly over served) sitting at the end of the bar and randomly screaming obscenities.  The classless bartender just laughed at him.  He was so loud that I was unable to hear my friend sitting next to me talking.  The bartender then joined in screaming and encouraging the drunk and disorderly man.  She poured him more beer and screamed her own filthy language right along with him.  At this point I turned to leave and noticed she was no longer behind the bar.  When I walked out she was rubbing her over sized half exposed breasts on the obnoxious drunk!

44.description: Average service, beer is good with a good selection but the food is horrible. I used to come to this place a lot but I'm done now. On my last visit I ordered a burger but what I got was a mistake. They're serving burgers from Costco or Sam's club. Absolutely horrible!!! Time to find another bar in my neighborhood.

24.description: If you're looking for a mediocre time, this place is for you! Not awful but definitely not special.

7.description: go here occasionally as a neighborhood spot is convenient. waitress laughed at me and told me it was a classy place when i asked for malort, which is not the case lol, also no malort in a chicago tavern is a travesty. also got food poisoning from a burger there and called and they said theyd call back and hook me up with something but that never happened. still an ok place for a few drinks

49.description: Super chill bar.I really enjoyed their grilled calamari better than any restaurant I've been to.And their blue something martini - is a creeper!  Sweet but so strong!They also serve gumballhead beer here seasonally, which is one of my faves.

40.description: Good neighborhood bar. They have a great beer selection and the mixed drinks are pretty good. The food is just okay. It's decent enough but nothing outstanding. They do have outdoor seating in the summer which is nice. Overall, it's a solid late-night drinks and appetizer place.

53.description: Rude staff, mediocre food, decent drink prices. (when they have specials)Management is careless. Complained about the bartenders attitude and demeanor to management, and got no apology. It amazes me that some people work in the "service" industry. Its not for everyone.

30.description: Now that this place is under new management, I've become a regular!  Great craft beer selection, and really good bar food!  Tuesday nights are $5 pizzas and $3 lake effect pints.  Thats a steal!

46.description: I live in Mayfair and this place is my neighborhood go-to.  Great burger, great music, great crowd, great specials, great service.  The GM is a really cool guy and you can tell that they appreciate their customers.  5 stars.

1.description: The food was great. Build your own bloody mary is a good idea. Came here for a Bears game and a server called off which left with only 1 wait staff. I have to say she (Cheery) did a great job. Not just with my table, but with the bar. I'd come back just for that good of a service. I had the smoke house, popper, and wings; i give it a 8 out of a 10. I'm glad to say I'll be back.

55.description: I've tried this several times now since I've moved here (3 blocks from my house) and have withheld my review to really give this place plenty of chances.  However, after about four visits, all consistently sub-par, i have to finally give it what it deserves.  Believe me, I wanted and still want this place to be good, or even remotely consistent enough to make it a decent watering hole since it's so close, but I'm at the point where it's convenience isn't enough to trump the rest and warrant even a short stop. First off, the food is very inconsistent, the first time I went, it was okay, the 2nd time, pretty bad, 3rd time okay, last time bad.  The "okay" food could pass if they hadn't screwed up our order every single time we've come, not joking, every single time, they've brought something wrong to our table or left something out etc.  Also, I'm not expecting fast-food service at a bar-n-grill, but come on, I've never seen any more than one other table (and know I understand why) when we've gone and yet we sit there with or without menus, waiting to order for sometimes up to 20minutes.  Meanwhile, the server wanders around, talks to friends at the bar, or just disappears for long stretches at a time.Finally, the beer... for a place called Hops & Barely, I'd expect more from their beer selection.  I wish this place would pull it together.  It's really not that difficult, it's bar food,  booze and atmosphere, you don't need much to make this business thrive.  It's a good spot where there's not a lot of competition, but a lot of potential customers.  You should be making a killing at this spot!

9.description: Hops & Barley's is a nice bar in the Portage Park area.  I would say this is a hipster like bar with old black and white photos lining the brick wall on the north.  It has its menu and drink specials written on chalk boards above the kitchen and behind the bar.  The first thing you will notice about Hops & Barley is their outdoor seating as there are not that many places that offer this in the area.  Again, I note that this is a hipster kind of place with the fancy beers and a good kitchen menu.  But it also caters to other crowds.  It turned slightly into a sports bar on a Sunday when the World Cup was taking place.  They originally had on some music but turned the audio on for the game once it began.  They had a dozen or so perfectly place large screens for great viewing.  Not only did they do a great job on the sports viewing but it seems like this bar restaurant has plenty of weekly deals.  They have trivia Tuesdays, cheap burger days, cheap pizza days, and many other deals that are written out on the chalkboard.  On the Sunday that I was present for they had $12 domestic buckets which is a steal.  The also had Stoli specials and 40 cent wings.  Hops & Barley's look like it had a space for some type of open mic area as well as a downstairs area.  I would like to come back and check out what the night life is like here.  There were a few regulars that were having a Sunday Funday.  If you have some regular party people then you know that this place has to be a good time.  Two thumbs up for H&B.

26.description: I came here on a date.  Our drinks were okay but I wouldn't come here just for their cocktails.  I also ordered some nachos.  I was very hungry and ate them but the cold, liquidy yellow cheese spread that topped the nachos was far from delicious.  On a positive note, the food is very reasonably priced.It took a while my server to come to the table.  After we got our nachos the server disappeared again.  We had wait awhile to get napkins and silverware, this time from a different server.  It took some time before our anyone came by again, and the restaurant was not busy at all.

25.description: Good food, good beer, excellent service. All around a nice place to meet up with friends.

12.description: A good go to place for drinks and all around fun. Awesome beer selection and specials during the week. There are tv's all around, so we've gone here a few times just to watch Blackhawks games. The food is the run of the mill pub food, but hey, it's inexpensive and the customer service is on top of everything. I love ordering the Purple Haze beer and tator tots. They've also got trivia nights! It's maybe a good place for a first date but highly recommended for just a group of buddies getting together to watch a game or just hang out. Parking is on the street and paid, but easy to find, and there's also a lounge or club of some sort downstairs.

59.description: I love this place, its a great neighborhood bar with great food. When we go we usually order wings, tots, and a blue moon, the perfect combo.

21.description: This is a great place to meet up with friends. I beer was pretty good too.

17.description: Love the atmosphere. Great food specials and the drinks are cheap.The owner is awesome! He would tell the most hilarious stories and made it a great time.

10.description: Good place to drink but the food leaves a lot to be desired!  Ordered some food to go.. wings were on special but they said you had to pay $9 if you ordered to go..ok, I get it.  Paired it up with a "Smokehouse Burger".. total cost with tip about $25!  Problem #1: They use those cheap aluminum to go containers where you just crimp the lid and it SEALS.. Newsflash: ALL the food was soggy mush and inedible even 10 minutes after I got the order!  Burger:  A GFS pattie cooked to MW with 3 totally undercooked pieces of bacon.  Wings: Total SOGGY mush, terrible "Buffalo Sauce" and even worse "Blue Cheese"/  cheap and tasteless!  Fries in the third container were undercooked by about 2 minutes and wilted to nothing in the lovely container/ garbage can!  Sad thing is the place does a ton of business and whoever was cooking last night should have worked their last shift..get dat did

5.description: I like the feel of the place. The staff is awesome and the bathrooms are clean. If I was coming here just to drink I'd give it 5 stars, but the food menu could use some variety. Don't get me wrong the food is good, it just needs to accommodate people who don't want typical bar food.

3.description: Great sports bar with lots of TVS and a great beer selection.  Surprisingly the mixed drinks are good to!  The wings are smashing.  Cheers!

35.description: I had an awful experience here. I honestly have nothing good to say. The name of this place is hops and barley,  but their beer selection is mediocre at best. Not only that but they were out of my first two choices. The waitress also knew nothing about beer and kept insisting that she could bring me a Miller lite. Took forever for her to come back with drinks too. When she took our order she seemed confident enough to not write down our orders. When we got our food 40 minutes later.... Every single order was wrong. She offered to have the kitchen redo it,  but we didn't want to wait anymore. Again took a while to get the check and we didn't get any sort of discount for all of her mistakes. They even charged us for the food she brought and not what we ordered. When I asked about it... She said,  "well you did eat it." Absolutely shocked... I had nothing to said. We paid and left and will not be back.

19.description: Great beer whether it be craft or domestic. The wait staff is friendly and excellent at their jobs. The bartenders are experienced and can make a hell of a drink and are friendly and great at their job. The music is also a plus since its not top 40 radio crap. Highly recommend this bar to anyone looking for fair priced drinks and a good time.

28.description: Hops & Barley's is a nice bar in the Portage Park area.  I would say this is a hipster like bar with old black and white photos lining the brick wall on the north.  It has its menu and drink specials written on chalk boards above the kitchen and behind the bar.  The first thing you will notice about Hops & Barley is their outdoor seating as there are not that many places that offer this in the area.  Again, I note that this is a hipster kind of place with the fancy beers and a good kitchen menu.  But it also caters to other crowds.  It turned slightly into a sports bar on a Sunday when the World Cup was taking place.  They originally had on some music but turned the audio on for the game once it began.  They had a dozen or so perfectly place large screens for great viewing.  Not only did they do a great job on the sports viewing but it seems like this bar restaurant has plenty of weekly deals.  They have trivia Tuesdays, cheap burger days, cheap pizza days, and many other deals that are written out on the chalkboard.  On the Sunday that I was present for they had $12 domestic buckets which is a steal.  The also had Stoli specials and 40 cent wings.  Hops & Barley's look like it had a space for some type of open mic area as well as a downstairs area.  I would like to come back and check out what the night life is like here.  There were a few regulars that were having a Sunday Funday.  If you have some regular party people then you know that this place has to be a good time.  Two thumbs up for H&B.

45.description: This place is OK. Nothing more.  It can be very hit or miss.  I have been disappointed by the food here it just does not seem fresh - I made a terrible mistake in ordering mussels here.  Never do that in a random Portage Park bar, it just doesn't make sense.The bartenders here are good - generally they just don't seem as friendly as other neighborhood bars.  Some are ok and they all make sure you have a drink, but they are not chatty at all beyond that.  It is what it is. If you want a slightly nicer bar within a 1/2 mile of your house, come here, but definitely do not make a special trip.  If you have gas or cab money, there are better options within a couple miles.

33.description: This place has pretty good bar food.They always have good specials..Sundays are the best.40 cent wings and 3 dollar Build your own bloody Mary's. 3 dollar stoli drinks. U can't beat that.  Kasia is a real cool Bartender.  Not rude and will spark up a conversation with ya.  Good bar for a pretty boring neighborhood.

43.description: Great food, decent beer selection and a 5 min walk from my place, what more can I ask for? Their wings are delicious and the other appetizers are just as good. Great place to meet up with people and catch up. Their party room also is a big plus!

2.description: Excellent wings! And on Sunday's they're 40 cents....score! Dave, the owner, and his wait staff are super friendly too. Neat neighborhood bar with good drinks and many drink specials. Their homemade French fries are delicious, as is their mac and cheese. My grind had the grilled cheese sandwich which came with poblano peppers, she loved it. Will definitely come back :)

18.description: New-ish neighborhood bar.  They play all the Chicago team sports. Great selection of craft beer and drafts. A bit small but that's ok. Decent prices. Will try the food next time.

41.description: ehhh. good-ish. I guess? food was good, not great. Server was nice, not overly attentive, but...nice. Beer arrived flat. Didn't have the second choice, settled for 3rd choice. Noticed a huge dust-ball/hair ball thing hanging from one of the light fixtures, which, obviously, made me a little grossed out. Didn't really have the vibe of being well cleaned, but, again....ok. Close to my place, and will probably stop by in the future for a beer, but only because......where in the world else are we supposed to go around here? there doesn't seem to be many decent, non-hole-in-the-wall bar options.

52.description: I took all reviews 3stars or less as a grain of salt because Hops & Barley is a real nice place. During the summer we take the dog with us. They always bring her a bowl of water and a treat. Love this place!!

50.description: Great food, loved the small menu, makes you know they want the food to be perfect. Nice place to enjoy a game or just sit outside in the summer. We were greeted by the manager with a smile and a hang shake and the staff was very friendly. Look forward to coming back and making this a regular place.

4.description: Got here shortly after they opened around 3 p.m. today. Sat at the bar. The bartender clearly saw us come in & sit while he set up some tables. Took him a bit to ask us what we wanted to drink. He wasn't the most pleasant person when shooting down the first 5 drink orders my buddy asked for,claiming they were out & not offering any suggestions. Also, right after I asked for another round, he decided to talk to a table, do their drinks then ours.. um hello, we are sitting right in front of you & ordered before the other ppl.. Food is mediocre.. burgers & skewers cooked well but no seasoning or taste.

6.description: Great beer, friendly service and owners, yummy grub.Servers and owners have always been nothing but amazing.  They have great food and drink recommendations and are truly interested in making their customers happy.  The food here is really good, not your typical bar food.  While they do have the staples (buffalo wings, burgers, and fries), they also have unique house made items like crab cakes, custom mac and cheese, and fish tacos.  I'm happy to walk into a place and feel like the owners care enough to talk to you and serve you great food.  Love this place!PS - outdoor patio is dog-friendly :)

22.description: Monday special is $3 burger & fries! Great drink specials.  And cool neighborhood place to watch some football :-)

15.description: There are some good musicians and vocalists that perform at their open mic on Sunday nights.

57.description: Chill, low key bar with a nice deco, especially for the Portage Park neighborhood. Last night was my first time there and I happened to catch their $5 pizza special. It was a thin pizza but it was very good. It was also filling, good for 1-2 people. The drinks were pretty cheap which is a positive and the staff was friendly.I couldn't rank it higher than 3 stars as I can't give much more of a review beyond this as I wasn't there too long. But it was nice.

20.description: The food is average and people say it's kid friendly but the whole bar is tall stools which let me tell you is not kid friendly.

36.description: The sliders were good.  Wings were not.  Fajitas smelled really good.  Made me sad I got the wings.  Decent drink selection.

14.description: Nice bar but not impressed with the bland food and watery drinks. The service was ok until our waitress informed us that she leaving so we paid out bill in hopes of getting another drink but the second waitress just passed by us a few times with no acknowledgment.  Pretty lame!

3.description: The cake was dry and that really disappointed me so not gonna be back anymore. The cake looks cool but not perfect. The taste isn't very good as well. I just had high expectations coz of the first 3 reviews here. But oh well, we had a blast during my cousin's birthday party so I'm just gonna forget and move on. Lol

1.description: This review is long overdue but I have not forgotten the Baby shower cake I had last summer. She checked in with me several times before making the cake, asking about guest numbers and the preferences of the Mommy to be. She matched my Cute as a Button theme and colors. I'd post a picture of the cake but we forgot to take one before we ate it. It was soft and delicious and not too much frosting per the Mom to be's request. She even stayed to serve the guests (which is great because i am terrible at cutting cakes). All around great service!

2.description: My mouth is salavating writing this review.  My girlfriend threw me a surprise birthday party and Cake'n It, provided the cake and deserts.  The cake was FANTABULOUS.  It's probally one of the first times I didn't want to share (is that bad?).  She also made cookie deserts that did something to my soul, they were definitely the talk of the party, for weeks after the party.  I would highly recommend her in the future!!!!

5.description: I was throwing a surprise birthday party for my mom.  Fairly last minute (about a week or so before the party), I remembered seeing cakes and cupcakes and such made my Cake'n It. I immediately reached out to see if she could make a cake and some cupcakes for the party. She was very professional and asked questioned I hadn't even thought about. She offered to come up with design plans or said I could send her any ideas I may have. I decided to look some ideas up, sent them over to her, discussed the size of the party and she recommended the size of the cake and the number of cupcakes. She executed the order better than I could have ever expected AND SHE DELIVERED!!!  She showed up to the party (AND IT WAS SNOWING!)  with the cake and cupcakes beautifully put together. She did an amazing job! I'll definitely be using Cake'n It for all of my future cake, cupcake, etc needs and will be telling ALL of my family and friends to do so as well!! Thank you Cake'n It for an awesome experience!

6.description: Vionka provided a cake for my Bridal shower that was delicious. The ingredients were fresh and the flavors were exactly what I wanted. In addition to the cake she brought delicious little cup cakes. I would high recommend these cakes.

7.description: These desserts are delicious! To the point where you really don't want to share! I love her cakes and cake pops. Not only are they up to par in taste, they look amazing too. She does a great job in working with your party theme and creating a custom dessert that will enhance your tables appearance and serve perfectly as the center piece! You definitely need to try Cake'n It!!!!

0.description: It was amazingly good! We received a chocolate donut. cake and would definitely order again

4.description: I had order my daughter 4th birthday with cake'n it and we loved it. We had a rapunzel theme n not only was it delicious, but it looked amazing as well. It was absolutely made creative, very presentable, and she is very professional. All of the guest asked about cake'n it and will also be ordering from here. Thanks and will be using cake'n it for future events.

0.description: Ninos always has my haircut and lineup on point. I refuse to go elsewhere.

12.description: My fiance' went in Thursday to buy her father a gift. The sales man went above and beyond in helping her. He spent the time helping her pick out the perfect gift. Very knowlagble, and informed on the types of cigars they offer, flavor, history etc..... I have been to a few cigar stores before, but this one is the only one I will return to or send her to. Highly reccommend

7.description: I wanted to give an update to my previous review. Just when I thought Utopia couldn't get any better they surprise me with even more great hospitality, atmosphere, products and service. Utopia often has "Cigar Parties" that they host in their shop. It is a chance to meet the reps for the different cigar brands, learn about cigars coming out and other things, but most of all, you get to spend some time with great people and get some great deals on products. They even have raffles and food and drinks. Last week, my buddies and I went in to hang out and we each walked out with a box of cigars and a bunch of products. We bought two boxes of cigars, one was an above average box. We also bought lighters, raffle tickets, where we one an ashtray, and my buddy bought his first high quality humidor. We were given great deals on everything and I am convinced that you can not get a better deal anywhere else. Every time I buy something here I walk away with no regrets and I feel confident that I received the best price and the best products. Kevin has even helped me find products that I could not find anywhere else, and for cheaper prices than I had expected.   We can't stop coming back to Utopia. We are there every week now. The more I go, the more I am impressed. The regulars that frequent the place are a great group of guys. Something that I really noticed the other day is that no matter what time of day or night, there are all kinds of people that come in there. Int he few hours that we were there, I seen all kinds of men and women coming in of all ages. There were regular blue collar workers, white collar workers, college students, retired men, cops and all kinds of people. there is a very diverse group of customers and regulars and everybody loves this place! My friends and i have come a long way on cigars and knowledge of them and we owe it all to Utopia Cigars and their owner Kevin. We get weekly e-mails telling us about specials and new products and we have very high quality stuff. the knowledge and help that Kevin has always given us is priceless. He is our go-to cigar man. So stop in and see Kevin and all the other great people here. I promise you, if you are a cigar fan, you will feel right at home at Utopia.

3.description: This is hands down, the best cigar lounge ever. The prices are fair, the quality is superb, everybody is friendly.If you have any questions about what to smoke, they have the answer. Great place to buy one, a box, and even sit down and enjoy. they even let you BYOB.

1.description: Awesome Cigar shop!!!!!!!!!!I was in town on business from Dallas.  Kevin and the guys treated me like a regular.  This shop has a great selection and great prices.  Wish you guys were in Dallas.

2.description: Nothing could have prepared me for this hole in the wall. MAN ... talk about phony. I pick up a vsg enchantment, went to pay... $25 dollars. "For this little guy?" "Yea its a ESG". Funny, because the cigars arent priced in the humidor, and Ashton doesnt make a perfecto ESG. Its an 10 dollar cigar. But hey, what does this kid know, charge him whatever I want. "Have any Aging Room?" "No." "I mean why would you its just a  number 1 cigar on aficionado " Wowowowow... now thats some phony shit, would never and have never come back.

9.description: Great Place people welcome you in large variety of cigars very knowledgeable able to help bought my first cigar there. variety of people cops,bikers, all sorts very friendly. Special functions from the suppliers, parties  and rolling demo's very cool smoking fresh rolled cigars Prices are great small parking lot but worth the wait or walk if you have to                                                                              Wolfman

10.description: Went to utopia about a week ago to pick up some cigars for my boyfriends birthday. I was a little nervous about going in since I had absolutely no idea what I was looking for but the guy working was extremely helpful and went the extra mile to make my experience easy and painless. I will definitely be recommending Utopia to all my girlfriends that are in need of cigars but are too scared to go into a cigar shop

13.description: I ran a tobacco shop in Lakeview for a number of years. It is hard for me to like other tobacco shops because of this.  I have certain expectations in regards to product knowledge, variety, display, ventilation, cleanliness, humidor temps, and the overall vibe that I get off of the store clerks.  Many places are snobby, and being a woman I have been treated the same way that I do when buying a car in both nice and divey establishments.I have been to Utopia few  times now.  My first experience wasn't a great one  The smoking area was jam packed with Bikers and it was hard to breathe.  (I say Bikers, so that you know it's laid back, not pretentious. I personally have no issue with them...I actually like them.)   I did not expect the clerk to be the guy sprawled on the couch with crutches, I felt bad asking him to get up.  He was friendly, but I did not browse around and got out fast. I went back there tonight to purchase filtered tubes for RYO's.  I felt like I was in a completely different store.  I had total deja vu.  It reminded me off the small tobacco shops in Greenwich Village.  It made me feel like a kid again.First off, kudos for being open late. 10pm!!!!  Woohoo!!   I was also pleasantly surprised to see that the ventilation issue was fixed.  Store was clean, and the woman behind the counter was friendly as well.  I could not believe how inexpensive they are.  Their prices were great.   As a side note, they do not carry cigarettes.  If you are a RYO smoker, they only carry Drum and a packet of generic brand tobacco.  No Peter Stokkeby.   I am definitely going to return and check out their humidor next.

16.description: I came to Chicago for work, did a local search for cigar lounges and found this great place if you want a great selection of cigars and even better prices then look no more. Kevin the owner will treat you like a guest, I drove around to other cigar lounges but service makes this lounge #1.

17.description: I love this place!  Great people, great service and the best cigar selection and prices around.  Stop in for a Utopia Blue, their very tasty house brand.  Sure it can get alittle smoky inside... it's a cigar shop.  If you want, ask for a chair to sit outside and they will gladly set one up for you.  If you need help picking a cigar, they will be more than happy to find the right cigar for your taste and price.

15.description: This place is fantastic and the Utopia house blend is a great value.

0.description: I went in looking for cigars to buy for my upcoming wedding. The staff was super helpful in explaining my options and setting me up with some high quality cigars.I was impressed with the place, and it definitely seemed like a good place to come hang out.

5.description: I have been going to Utopia Cigars for probably 10 years now. They always have a great selection and the staff is always very helpful. The prices are reasonable too.   Although I moved farther away I stop in every time I am in the area. They have cigar parties every now and again and they are a great time. The Utopia Blue is a great cigar.

11.description: The people in the Utopia Cigar lounge remind of the characters from the television show, Cheers. Every time I stop in, I see the same people, sitting in the same place and they are usually slinging good natured insults at each other. In other words, It's my kind of place.  Utopia offers a wide variety of high end cigars at a reasonable price. If you can't find you are looking for, ask Kevin about the good stuff he keeps in back. He stashes the limited edition Cigars away to make sure all of his customers have the opportunity to buy at least one. They also have a wonderful house brand of hand rolled cigars. The wrapper may look generic, but they offer a delicious smoke that won't dent your wallet.  My favorite aspect of Utopia is the smoking area. It's not fancy or pretty, but it's a wonderful place to light one up and relax. Utopia is the perfect place to enjoy a ballgame while puffing away on your favorite Cigar. The lounge has a wonderful vibe. I really enjoy winding down with a good smoke after a hard day of work and Utopia is the perfect place to do it.  The bottom line on Utopia Cigar: Good people, a top notch selection of Cigars and reasonable pricing makes Utopia a great destination for Cigars lovers. The lounge at Utopia is one of my favorite places to enjoy a good cigar. If you are looking for a gift for the smoker in your life, or just to relax after a hard day, head on down to Utopia. You will be glad you stopped in.

8.description: Don't miss an opportunity to smoke one at one the great NWside hangouts. The owner, the staff, and the regulars, well they may all be a little peculiar but they incredibly nice, knowledgeable, and friendly. I say that knowing I am spending more time there with every passing day and beginning to resemble one of the regulars.If your looking find a great cigar and to be able to smoke it, this one of the last places in Chicago you can smoke in the shop. Pick a comfortable couch, watch some television or hit the WIFI.Recommended with a smile on my face and a cloud of smoke over my  head.

4.description: Great Place for any type of cigar your looking for and very friendly people

14.description: Great place.  Been coming here since I was 21.  I am 29 now.  Always worried about being treated differently because of my age, but I never felt that way.  The owner is great and now the son runs the place.  It is still a great place to check out. Open late which is nice.  They have great parties!  There is a parking lot!  It is a bit small and tight because it is shared with other places.  Nice couches to sit and relax and watch TV.  What else is there to say?  Stop by and see it yourself!

6.description: My favorite Cigar shop in the city. This place is great for everyone if you are an aficionado or just like to have a cigar once in a while like I do. When I do go in I never know what I really want and the owner is more than happy to lead me in the right direction, my wife has even stopped in here and came back with a great selection for our anniversary one year. It's more than a cigar shop, they frequently have events for customer appreciation in addition to their "Cigar Parties" when you sign up for their email list. They have a few couches and tvs for you to relax and have a smoke with a couple friends. Great shop that I highly recommend. The parking lot is a little small as it is shared with multiple businesses, but there are usually spots available. If anything there is always street parking available.

58.description: This place is just awesome!! Went there for the second time ever just today and had a great experience. The first time I went, I had some fried oysters...not on the menu...but I asked the lady behind the counter who told me she could fry up some of the shucked oysters from the case. A bit more than I wanted to spend or eat, but it was well worth it and I finished every last single delicious oyster. I have had many fried oysters in my lifetime and these were just awesome!! Unlike some places that give you the huge oysters that have all those extra, tasteless parts, Hagens gives you small, but delicious bite-sized bits of heaven! I ate the whole bag in the car!!! I'm sure I looked like an idiot as I scarfed my food down, but at least I was a smiling idiot :-)This time I had a fish sandwich, which was delicious and very worth the price, some fried shrimp, and some fried mushrooms. The shrimp was awesome as well. I had some in the car before heading back off to the office and nearly finished it all before arriving back lol. The mushrooms were good, as far as mushrooms go, but I should have ordered the hushpuppies instead. I completely forgot that I had planned to...until I was on my way back to work. I can't wait to go back...what to try next....for sure, those hush puppies are gonna be on my list :-)

56.description: Everything is good.  Go.

29.description: Best fried shrimp! Always come here when I crave sea food. Love the smoked salmon especially the garlic and pepper one.

42.description: We have been customers at Hagen's for about 30 years, maybe even longer. We typically get the fish chips, clam strips, fried shrimp, homemade shrimp salad and fish sandwiches to name a few items. Why? Because it's usually good. We have had a few disappointments along the way - breading seemed different on occasion, fish deep-fried a little too long, fries over-salted, not anything that would have kept us away. But, sadly, it seems that day has come. Not on account of the food though but due to the PRICES! They have become CRAZY EXPENSIVE! Enough food for a family of four will cost you about $50 - $60! We are simply not willing to pay these high prices anymore for take-out fish! Yes, you will probably enjoy your meal but be prepared to pay plenty! Thanks Hagen's- it was nice while it lasted.  :(

23.description: This place is amazing!   I kept hearing about this place and when I had the opportunity to go, I jumped on it!  Everything we had was amazing!  From the fish sandwiches, to the friend clams, to the smoked salmon!  Everything was absolutely delicious!  The staff was super friendly and HELPFUL!  I can't wait to go back. I recommend this place to everyone near and far!  Thanks Hagen's for the amazing experience, I can't wait to visit again!

47.description: If you're a seafood lover, then Hagen's is a great place to play "I Spy".  I spy shrimp, I spy crab legs, I spy smoked salmon, I spy fresh mussels. Hagen's has been around for over 50 years. It's family-owned and operated and provides a great selection of fresh seafood for it's customers. Or if you want something ready to eat--they have a nice menu of fried to order snacks and you can never go wrong with their smoked fish. As a new resident of the Portage Park neighborhood, you bet your scallops I'm so excited to have Hagen's in my 'hood. Service is very friendly and helpful. Even kind of giving me a tour of their store the first time I visited. They always have a steady stream of customers when I visit, which is a great sign, but the wait is never very bad. In addition to the seafood, you can purchase anything you need to make a seafood meal at home--sauces and spices to complement your fresh purchases. Their home made Mustard Dill sauce is divine--it's great on their smoked salmon, or even just dipping pretzels in it. Look for it in their cooler. Thank me later. My favorites so far have been the smoked salmon, fried clams (great fresh briny flavor) and the fried jumbo shrimp. Once my kitchen is settled, I have my eye on fresh fish and crab legs for dinner soon. Their cooler case is also stocked with cold drinks, rounding out what you need for snack or mealtime. Excellent quality at affordable prices. Hagen's is a win.

8.description: I've been having some unexplainable crave for fried seafood.  I even randomly expressed my desire to make it here today to my boss (she lives in the far southwest suburb; of course, she just ignored me because she really has no clue knowing how big of a foodie I am). I convinced my hubby to come along so that we can tackle this copious amount of fried goodness.  Hagen's, here we are!  It really looked obsolete from the outside, but they were born in 1946, so they are old as they should be.  They have free parking for customers, which is always a plus for Chicagoans who love their vehicles and bad-driving.  Make sure take a number, because it's how they determine the order of who needs to be helped.  The menu is straight forward: decide what fish you want and you will get one (1) pound for it.  The principle works the same for the sides, such as the potato salad and other items.  As soon as the order was taken, whoever served you at the counter does the frying, but they are plentiful attractions in the store that will keep you busy.  It's just like a mini fish market, which also sells condiments, frozen seafood, smoked fish made in the house, seafood-frying essentials, and other miscellany that I might have failed to notice.  Now, it's time to talk about the taste.  I'm glad there's no surprises, in a positive way.  We knew what fried seafood should taste like, and they surely delivered the taste we were craving for.  By the way, we ordered one (1) pound of shrimp and one (1) pound of catfish strips, along with one (1) serving of cocktail sauce and one (1) serving of tarter sauce.  The total was about $29.  Yeah, it's not the cheapest option in the city, but it's what fried seafood usually costs.  The shrimps were pretty huge to be considered as "regular-sized" shrimps.  There's also the "jumbo shrimp" option available.  I didn't see anyone else order it so couldn't tell how large one of these bad boys was.  Anyways, I'm truly impressed!!If you like old-fashion fried fish and want it done with quality, come to Hagen's.  I think I deserve a nap...so full...

31.description: Hagen's fish chips are by far the best fish chips in Chicago! It's been my favorite since I was a kid

34.description: The sea food choices and over all selection is incredible.  There are so many choices that you can pick from as well as ingredients you can add. They also have a list of selections for you in case you're making any recipes. The staff is super friendly and so helpful. I love seafood but I don't know much detail about everything and what peers with what drinks or other foods. So the fact that they are very knowledgeable was important to me. I'm definitely planning to come down to make more recipes and pick up their good meals.

16.description: People probably pass this daily never stopping in. I used to live in the neighborhood and never even gave it a second glance. My girlfriend told me about it and boy am I glad that she did. If you like fresh seafood you need to check this place out. Whether you want variety of fresh fish to cook yourself, or smoked fish ready to go. Lots of fresh frozen options for seafood as well. But my personal favorite is dine in or carryout. Deep fried fresh seafood to order. Their batter is great and they make amazing clam strips, shrimp, scallops, catfish, and even fries. Only regret is I can't eat everything at once. Go there.

13.description: Fish chips cooked golden brown and tender to boot. Great neighborhood spot. Highly recommend practically everything

11.description: Had lunch here the other day.  Got fried fish chips and the wife got baked clams.  I'd have recommended the shrimp to her over the clams, but it was outstanding overall.  There is a reason they've been in business so long.

39.description: FIND THE FISH...Well, if you're looking for good fish, fresh fish, fish to bring home to your parents, THIS  is the place to go. It's been here for years. It's probably generational. A fixture in the community. The only place my parents trusted. I'm just a cocktail shrimp guy. Always get looks when ordering five, cleaned and cooked (not fried) shrimp. Anyway, it's convenient, plenty of parking and a great quality product regardless of what you buy."Ooooh, fishy, fishy, fishy fish!"

37.description: Hagen's is a neighborhood favorite. They smoked fish is tremendous and all of their fried fish is outstanding. Plus it is run by 3rd or 4th generation family.

0.description: The best smoked fish in the city. Fast and friendly servicePopcorn shrimp is great too

38.description: Highly recommend the spicy popcorn shrimp, they are my favorite! I really dig their cheese curds too...I know it's a fish market, but I can't help myself!!! Definitely one of my regular stops.

51.description: As someone that loves fried food and was a fan of this place I am sad to say things have changed.  There lack of trying to keep consumers happy is sad.
