Shrimp has gone down in size tremendously, pollock for fish chips yuck. And don't even go there on the calamari. Taste like rubberized mozzarella sticks. The one think I still like are the jumbo shrimp which are not that jumbo but breading is good and the clam strips. Hence the two stars otherwise they'd be down to one.

27.description: How fun is it that a fish smoke house still exists?!!It's frozen in time. I remember visiting this place more years ago than I care to admit to smoke a perfect salmon my dad caught in Lake Michigan. Fast forward many years, this place is still open and awesome. A true "institution" on the NW side. They smoke fish or fowl, and serve up some super good stuff to order. Late on a Sunday night a steady stream of happy customers with a fish craving; no one left disappointed. Enjoy!

32.description: Hagen 's is great for fried fish : you love the fried shrimp. You can also buy frozen crab legs and lots of other things to make fish. I love the smoked chubs. Staff there are great!

54.description: Love this place! Everything is fresh, fresh, fresh! Employees are really nice and very knowledgeable. $14.95 per pound for king crab legs to take home and cook. Not bad considering they go for $19.99+ per pound at the grocery store.Went in with my mom and enjoyed a pound of their fried jumbo shrimp. Fresher than fresh. They were absolutely delicious. Cocktail sauce complimented it well too. Wasn't a fan of the cole slaw. It wasn't bad, but I prefer the creamy mayonnaisey kind over the vinegary kind. My mom dogged it.We enjoyed sitting outside and eating. Can't wait to go back and try some more items!

48.description: Random craving for crab legs! So i searched for a few places around my area. I was going to drive to the nearest Pete Fresh Market but I was too lazy.  The 7 minute drive to Hagan's was well worth it.I paid about $22 for 4 pounds of snow crab legs. I was a bit worried to purchase because i don't know what a "good deal" is when it comes to purchasing seafood. The friendly guy at the counter assured me that the snow crab legs are delicious and even gave me great instructions on how to prepare them (I'm terrible in the kitchen). My $22 went a long way and the crab legs were delicious. The only down side to my legs; they were kinda thin. Everybody was friendly and very helpful!I will be going back for more crabs!

44.description: There food is Sooooo good.. I haven't tasted something from here that I haven't liked yet.. My Favorite is the Shrimp and the fish Sandwich..

24.description: I always end up getting more than I need but it's well worth it. Everything is great! Remember to grab a number!

7.description: How fun is it that a fish smoke house still exists?!!It's frozen in time. I remember visiting this place more years ago than I care to admit to smoke a perfect salmon my dad caught in Lake Michigan. Fast forward many years, this place is still open and awesome. A true "institution" on the NW side. They smoke fish or fowl, and serve up some super good stuff to order. Late on a Sunday night a steady stream of happy customers with a fish craving; no one left disappointed. Enjoy!

49.description: Candy salmon was excellent, so was the smoked salmon.  I want to come back and try the fried shrimp I keep hearing great things.

40.description: No complaints here. Ordered fried fish, ate it, enjoyed it.

53.description: Went last night to pick up $14.99/lb crablegs and got about 4.5lbs. It was as fresh as it gets in the midwest and I'll definitely be back.  They also have a variety of oysters but were out of my favorite kind.They've been around over 50 years and it isn't hard to see why. I like giving my business to small local businesses instead of self-admitted overpriced places like Whole Foods, so I've definitely found my new seafood market!

30.description: What can I say other than AWESOME! I grew up in the neighborhood & one of my fav memories is of how heavenly it smells of smoked fish inside. Honestly, this is a store that I will travel to as I am now downtown. The owners have customer service down and the selection of fish is incredible from fresh to their prepared fish. Also please note that they will smoke your catch for you.... yum!!!!!!!!!!!!

46.description: I ordered a pound of calimari and paid for it but I only got a half. Luckily I looked inside and asked for another 1/2. I had to wait for another 1/2.  They fixed me another portion within a couple of minutes and it was almost raw and like rubber. When someone does a mistake like that unintentionally - I would expect they give you something free to show it. But they did not. I would think they just tried to steal from me.

1.description: 3.5 actually, couldn't leave a 3 though. 4.5 ten years ago.Been going to Hagen's easily 40+ years now.Easily the best shrimp outside of the Gulf coast. Period. Going to turn into Bubba from Forrest Gump.Best fried shrimp, boiled shrimp, smoked shrimp, peel and eat shrimp and cocktail shrimp.Best fried Lake perch.Smoked salmon is very good, but you have to ask how long it's been in the case. Too long and it can be a bit drier than liked.Best fish chips.Fantastic hush puppies.Recently moved to Des Plaines and have tried a couple of their fish places (which are excellent) but pertaining to the items above those establishments can't compare to Hagen's.Admittingly their cold salads suck badly and always have. Why keep them with the smoked fish. I want my smoked fish to taste like smoked fish and I want my salads not to taste like smoked fish. Their fries, for me the only reason to order them is to insulate your order.Not a vast selection of fresh fish to choose from but they will de-bone, skin and filet them.Their fried scallops have taken a huge dive over the last several years. They used to be about the size of a quarter and 8-12 per pound, light and succulent. Then they changed over to ones the size of a dime and they are not very good at all, frozen and rubbery. I guess they think if customer see more it's a better bargain ... it's not.I will go other places for my lobster rolls, my soft-shell crabs and my fried scallops.But I will keep coming back to Hagen's for my shrimps.

55.description: fried shrimp and cheese curds are amazing!

9.description: I highly recommend this place.  Seriously top notch.It has been an institution in my family since the 70's and is THE go to place for top quality seafood.  The staff always has great recipe ideas too if you are at a loss for how to prepare any fish or what to serve it with.It's a relatively small and cozy place so during the holidays, like Christmas, New Years and Lent, it is packed with people.  Pick a number, don't cut and just enjoy the smell of smoked chubs, salmon and other fish in season.  The smells and anticipation make your pallet water.For those special occasions. this is the ONLY place I will go to get lobster tails and frankly one of the few places you can get a lobster tail over 2 pounds.  The market prices for lobster aren't cheap and at those prices I can't gamble on quality.  At Hagen's I can always guarantee that it is handled and refrigerated proper and is always of the highest quality.  I have never been disappointed.  I can't say the same for other fish markets, supermarkets and bulk seafood purveyors who are a "crap-shoot" at best.Fresh is always best but if you are in the mood for something special, like crabs, clams, oysters, squid octopus or fish from a particular region call ahead and they will procure it for you.  They are the best.

26.description: They have excellent, large spicy popcorn shrimp that is prodigious! If you like fish n chips, try their Alaskan Pollock. These items are under $10! Also, their cheese curds are outstanding as well as their hush puppies. The exterior is a crispy crust with a tender interior bursting with ubiquitous flavor. Five-stars for these nuggets.  Everything here is made to order, so you know that you are getting super fresh food. This is a non-pretentious fish market. It is NOT a restaurant. You walk in, order, pay and leave. We have also tried their catfish strips and clam chowder soup. Wow, it is the best clam chowder soup we have ever had (and we have had tons of clam chowder soup all over the USA and Europe), but this is definitely "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" For this reason, I am rating the clam chowder soup with 5-stars. Their crispy fish-filet sandwich at $4 is a major bargain! It is also a good size sandwich served on a fresh bun with their home made tartar sauce. 4-stars for this $4 sandwich. Service is hospitable, kind and the owners (at least one of them) will always be at the business/store. They truly care about their products as well as the customer. They have a parking lot, so you don't have to worry about "Pay to Park" when you come here. You can always eat your food in your car or take it to go and enjoy at your home. Either way, you are in for a feast of a treat. This place is a Chicago institution and I highly recommend it for their variety of fresh, quality fish and other seafood delicacies. If you enjoy scallops you definitely have to try their scallops. At $16 (unheard of at any fine seafood Chicago restaurant) you will be amazed at how huge and tender these scallops are and, best of all, they do not have a fishy taste. The scallops here are ethereal.  TIP: They don't just smoke fish here. Bring your Thanksgiving turkey here and they will smoke it for you. Pure awesomeness!This is a very clean joint started decades ago. You can almost visualize the nostalgia from the "old" days the moment you walk inside. It is now owned by the grandchildren of the man who started Hagen's Fish Market in 1946. It is a mom and pop operation with friendly service. For the most part, their price-point is reasonable and your experience here will be a positive one. They also added some delicious new recipes which have become long-standing staples for their customers. For example, Charlene's Crab Dip is outstanding and a "must" try! Some of their fresh fish is delivered weekly from the east coast as well as from Hawaii and Florida. I also like that they create party trays with high quality morsels of fresh seafood. Last Summer, we ordered their shrimp party tray and it was a huge hit with our guests.This fish market is in the Jefferson Park neighborhood of Chicago. It is a stand-alone business in the middle of a residential neighborhood. A very strange location for this place, but it works for the owners. They appreciate their customers and it shows. I appreciate that they appreciate their customers, so my final rating is 4-stars. The only negative is that you cannot eat inside this place (a disappointment if you live a distance away from here). However, you can enjoy your fresh, delicious food inside your vehicle or at home.

25.description: Wow - I cannot believe I forgot to do a review for this place! I have had fish from here since I was a little girl. My grandpa used to bring us fish from here or corned beef from Elliott's (sadly gone like 6 years ago) when he came to the suburbs to visit. I almost moved into an apartment 1 block away from here when I moved into the city. Good thing I didn't or fish chips every week probably would not have been a good diet! I moved close enough that it was easy to get to but not too easy. Mom said when she was little the fish was haddock, it has been pollock for a LONG time - still great. I have had the scallops and shrimp as well, but I tend to stick with the fish for some reason - maybe just missing grandpa! I have bought the catfish for various BFs and they all liked it. Now it is Lent, so I popped in on a Monday when it was not crowded. I had been craving fish for some time. I like this place better than Lawrence Fishieries near Chinatown - but this is what I grew up on. Batter seems lighter.

12.description: I'll start off with the good by saying the hushpuppies were great, even though some of them were raw in the middle but VERY brown on the outside.The spicy shrimp were OK, but they were not even slightly spicy. When someone says spicy, I'm expecting some sizzle, but I got fizzle. My biggest problem with the shrimp were the fact that they were not deveined. When I pay $9 for shrimp from a fish market, I think the shrimp should not have the gross veins filled with shrimp doodie! I loathe all places that do not devein all shrimp prior to cooking.The catfish was heinous. Almost all the pieces were the brown slimy kind that if you know catfish, you know you are in for a bad meal. It was really wild tasting. I thought a fish market would have better catfish then some other places, but obviously not. The fish was not seasoned at all, I'm talking not even a hint of salt and spices to be found. I might have been eating cardboard. No flavor, unless wild is considered a flavor.

59.description: The pepper and garlic smoked salmon is pretty decent. The main complaint I have with it is it is inconsistent. Sometimes I get it and it is way too peppery. Other times I get it it is way to garlicy.

21.description: I have been going to Hagen's for years.  I currently live about 40 miles away but whenever I am even remotely in the area I will take some extra time and go there....Their smoked Sturgeon and Fried Shrimp is to die for.....

17.description: Something Fishy is going on:)So, this past Saturday, I was out and about seeing what type of trouble Icould get into when I found myself out Hagen's way, actually, right at thedoor of Hagen's..Now, I must admit I have not been to Hagen's since my 2 sons were small,and they are now 28 and 33 so it's been quite a while.And, yes, I have great memories of Hagen's Fish Market for they had/havethe freshest looking/tasting Fish/Seafood around, and I thought it was abouttime for me to re-visit this place and see what they had to offer and if thingsstill looked the same.So, I stepped into this place once again and the memories all came back,Hagen's still has the great quality they had all those years ago, granted theprices/market value of items has gone up/increased but, hey, that's the wayof the world anyway and I did'nt expect this aspect not to change.I saw my very favorite Smoked Sable for $21.99 a pound and I couldn't seeforking that out on Saturday so I took a pass..But, Orange Roughy which is a very light, delicate tasting white fish was$11.99 a pound so I definitely bought some of that.Hagen's will smoke any fish for you that you bring in to them as well, good toknow if I ever decide to add fishing to my bucket list....And, they fry shrimp/seafood by the pound for you as well, Jumbo shrimpsare $19.99 a pound, regular shrimps are like $15.99 a pound!Salads and Soups and Hushpuppies are available too!So, in conclusion, Hagen's is a family run and operated business since 1946,And, from everything I saw the standard of quality is still there, it has notlessened in all these years, which says a heck of a lot.This place was packed with customers on Saturday, and I believe that's becauseHagen's has built quite a nice little reputation for themselves..Well Deserved Indeed Hagen's, You have worked hard for it and it shows..:)If you haven't been to Hagen's and are craving/wanting Seafood you shouldcheck them out..Definitely worth the trip..:)

10.description: I had a dream about piles of smoked fish, stacked neatly in a showcase, heads pointing forward, staring straight at me. Frightening? No, delicious!! Just the aftermath of my last visit to Hagen's Fish Market.They don't make fish stores like this anymore. 70 years in the business, and the same family runs it for 3 generations. Aside from smoked fish, there's fresh fish, salads, fried fish, house made herring, and assorted groceries and sauces that go well with the above.But still it's about the smoking. They smoke their own here. (They'll smoke yours too, for a fee.) I tried the smoked mackerel. I don't mean "tried"--I mean ate, devoured it.  The fish is meaty, mild in taste, lightly smoked, and not at all greasy--in short, perfect. You lift up the skin, pull off some flesh, and enjoy every morsel, scraping the bones for flesh until you strip them clean. Gross?  "Oh, I hate bones! A whole fish--with the head and eyes?? I can't do that."   Good!!  More for me.The small chubs are also delicious. Smoked fish lovers, head to this place. There are a dozen varieties. You won't be disappointed.

5.description: The lobster and crab are so good. I like making this for the family on occasions. I can't find another place that sells good lobster like they have here.

3.description: Simply the best. Small, family owned fish market where I can grab some fish chips or some shrimp for lunch. Always fresh, always delicious and they have 12 oz bottles of Topo Chico. Be still my beating heart.

35.description: I've been having some unexplainable crave for fried seafood.  I even randomly expressed my desire to make it here today to my boss (she lives in the far southwest suburb; of course, she just ignored me because she really has no clue knowing how big of a foodie I am). I convinced my hubby to come along so that we can tackle this copious amount of fried goodness.  Hagen's, here we are!  It really looked obsolete from the outside, but they were born in 1946, so they are old as they should be.  They have free parking for customers, which is always a plus for Chicagoans who love their vehicles and bad-driving.  Make sure take a number, because it's how they determine the order of who needs to be helped.  The menu is straight forward: decide what fish you want and you will get one (1) pound for it.  The principle works the same for the sides, such as the potato salad and other items.  As soon as the order was taken, whoever served you at the counter does the frying, but they are plentiful attractions in the store that will keep you busy.  It's just like a mini fish market, which also sells condiments, frozen seafood, smoked fish made in the house, seafood-frying essentials, and other miscellany that I might have failed to notice.  Now, it's time to talk about the taste.  I'm glad there's no surprises, in a positive way.  We knew what fried seafood should taste like, and they surely delivered the taste we were craving for.  By the way, we ordered one (1) pound of shrimp and one (1) pound of catfish strips, along with one (1) serving of cocktail sauce and one (1) serving of tarter sauce.  The total was about $29.  Yeah, it's not the cheapest option in the city, but it's what fried seafood usually costs.  The shrimps were pretty huge to be considered as "regular-sized" shrimps.  There's also the "jumbo shrimp" option available.  I didn't see anyone else order it so couldn't tell how large one of these bad boys was.  Anyways, I'm truly impressed!!If you like old-fashion fried fish and want it done with quality, come to Hagen's.  I think I deserve a nap...so full...

19.description: Random craving for crab legs! So i searched for a few places around my area. I was going to drive to the nearest Pete Fresh Market but I was too lazy.  The 7 minute drive to Hagan's was well worth it.I paid about $22 for 4 pounds of snow crab legs. I was a bit worried to purchase because i don't know what a "good deal" is when it comes to purchasing seafood. The friendly guy at the counter assured me that the snow crab legs are delicious and even gave me great instructions on how to prepare them (I'm terrible in the kitchen). My $22 went a long way and the crab legs were delicious. The only down side to my legs; they were kinda thin. Everybody was friendly and very helpful!I will be going back for more crabs!

28.description: Awesome service, fresh fish. More fish than bread for the breaded jumbo fish.  Be ready to spend some cash for the jumbo shrimp but it was a splurge for me.

45.description: Hagen's is a unique place. They have some cool stuff to offer that isn't easy to find in the area.Main focus is their fresh seafood selection. Lots of nice fish to choose from and my favorite. ... They always have two different types of oysters to choose from. Anything raw that I've bought and taken home has been quality.I've tried some of their fried food. It's better than the other fry house that's near by. I've tried some of their Italian seafood salad... Not bad. One issue I have is their smoked shrimp. Would be excellent but the shrimp are left whole, in shell, and I don't know about you but I feel strongly about shrimp being deveined. Customer service can be hit or miss. Come here for the fresh seafood! In the Portage Park area that might as well be gold.

33.description: I had a dream about piles of smoked fish, stacked neatly in a showcase, heads pointing forward, staring straight at me. Frightening? No, delicious!! Just the aftermath of my last visit to Hagen's Fish Market.They don't make fish stores like this anymore. 70 years in the business, and the same family runs it for 3 generations. Aside from smoked fish, there's fresh fish, salads, fried fish, house made herring, and assorted groceries and sauces that go well with the above.But still it's about the smoking. They smoke their own here. (They'll smoke yours too, for a fee.) I tried the smoked mackerel. I don't mean "tried"--I mean ate, devoured it.  The fish is meaty, mild in taste, lightly smoked, and not at all greasy--in short, perfect. You lift up the skin, pull off some flesh, and enjoy every morsel, scraping the bones for flesh until you strip them clean. Gross?  "Oh, I hate bones! A whole fish--with the head and eyes?? I can't do that."   Good!!  More for me.The small chubs are also delicious. Smoked fish lovers, head to this place. There are a dozen varieties. You won't be disappointed.

43.description: The only gripe is that they can't shuck oysters for you (and therefore you can't eat raw oysters without taking them home and doing it yourself). Otherwise we had 1/2 pint of fried oysters and 1/2 pound of their delicious smoked shrimp. Their seafood all tasted very fresh and prices are very reasonable.One strange thing is that while they will fry anything in the service case for free, they won't do it for the shrimp which is 9.99 raw but 17 something fried because it's on their menu... strange.Still, highly recommended. They have a few small plastic tables outside where you can sit down and munch on the food.

2.description: I always stop at Hagen's when I am in the neighborhood and today happened to be one of those days. The fish is smoked on premises and they have a nice selection. If various fishes -- salmon, sturgeon, sable, trout and if you're lucky, chubs!  We bought a nice selection and it made a wonderful meal.  Prices are reasonable and the quality is top notch. In addition to the smoked fish, they also have a variety of fried foods (fish, chicken, fries, cheese curds, etc.) and dries goods as well.  There's a small parking lot just east of the restaurant, which makes for a convenient experience.Highly recommended should you be close by.

18.description: FIND THE FISH...Well, if you're looking for good fish, fresh fish, fish to bring home to your parents, THIS  is the place to go. It's been here for years. It's probably generational. A fixture in the community. The only place my parents trusted. I'm just a cocktail shrimp guy. Always get looks when ordering five, cleaned and cooked (not fried) shrimp. Anyway, it's convenient, plenty of parking and a great quality product regardless of what you buy."Ooooh, fishy, fishy, fishy fish!"

41.description: Been coming here since I was a little girl with my parents. They loved it so much, they moved across the street. :)  My favs are the fried shrimp and fish chips. Love Hagens!

52.description: Live this place.  They know Thier fish and smoke.  Great place to pick up a quick bite too.

50.description: Something Fishy is going on:)So, this past Saturday, I was out and about seeing what type of trouble Icould get into when I found myself out Hagen's way, actually, right at thedoor of Hagen's..Now, I must admit I have not been to Hagen's since my 2 sons were small,and they are now 28 and 33 so it's been quite a while.And, yes, I have great memories of Hagen's Fish Market for they had/havethe freshest looking/tasting Fish/Seafood around, and I thought it was abouttime for me to re-visit this place and see what they had to offer and if thingsstill looked the same.So, I stepped into this place once again and the memories all came back,Hagen's still has the great quality they had all those years ago, granted theprices/market value of items has gone up/increased but, hey, that's the wayof the world anyway and I did'nt expect this aspect not to change.I saw my very favorite Smoked Sable for $21.99 a pound and I couldn't seeforking that out on Saturday so I took a pass..But, Orange Roughy which is a very light, delicate tasting white fish was$11.99 a pound so I definitely bought some of that.Hagen's will smoke any fish for you that you bring in to them as well, good toknow if I ever decide to add fishing to my bucket list....And, they fry shrimp/seafood by the pound for you as well, Jumbo shrimpsare $19.99 a pound, regular shrimps are like $15.99 a pound!Salads and Soups and Hushpuppies are available too!So, in conclusion, Hagen's is a family run and operated business since 1946,And, from everything I saw the standard of quality is still there, it has notlessened in all these years, which says a heck of a lot.This place was packed with customers on Saturday, and I believe that's becauseHagen's has built quite a nice little reputation for themselves..Well Deserved Indeed Hagen's, You have worked hard for it and it shows..:)If you haven't been to Hagen's and are craving/wanting Seafood you shouldcheck them out..Definitely worth the trip..:)

4.description: Always delicious can't say anything bad about this place. Since yelp feels I didn't write enough for this to be a review, I'm adding this non sense.

6.description: Great place to get fresh fish,but they are a very small place and suggesting on large orders call ahead.....

22.description: Went a few weeks ago with my boyfriend, we got the calamari, two orders of hush puppies and the Atlantic cod. All of it was great! The breading on the calamari was my favorite, will definitely be going back

15.description: This place is totally awesome and I'm a little embarrassed I never knew it existed since learning it's been family owned and operated since 1946! Didn't know what to expect as a first timer but the guys behind the counter were so cool and walked me through the many options to choose from. I ordered the fish chips and paired it with a side of tarter sauce. DELICIOUS! It took only a few minutes to fry up too! I'll be back here again soon!

57.description: If you're a seafood lover, then treat yourself and stop by this local institution; family-owned and operated for over 50 years.Hagen's sells fresh, smoked, and fried fish. They'll even smoke your own catch, so if you're an angler, you might want to consider bringing in a whole fish and letting Hagen's work their magic. The variety here is plentiful; fish is flown in daily from the Great Lakes and both coasts, and is fresh as all get out (which hopefully goes without saying). I picked up some sea scallops and halibut for the same price as a grocery store and it was infinitely superior in quality. Other prepared items include soups, salads by the pound, various condiments, and of course, all their fried goodies.In addition, they sell Scandinavian delicacies like lutefisk, lingonberries, pickled herring, and potato sausage. Hours are great too; open Sundays, and during the week until 10pm. Free parking lot next door.

20.description: This place is so closed from work , my first experience was incredible . We order jumbo shrimp , regular shrimp , calamari, hush puppies , it all tasted fresh !! Love it

36.description: Fried fish, fried clam strips, and fried shrimps were all okay.  They should've seasoned the seafood meat before breading and frying it.  I wish the shrimps were larger shrimps and not the little baby shrimps.  It was difficult to taste the clams or shrimp with the excess breading on it.  It was not worth an 1.3 hour bus ride over here.

14.description: I've been going to Hagen's at this same location since 1963. I grew up, moved away & turned my husband onto it...as a Catholic girl I had smoked chubs for dinner on Fridays; as a Jewish boy he had smoked chubs for breakfast with cream cheese, muenster & bagels! What a great combination of two cultures. He was astounded by the quality of their fish as I knew he would be...and 26 years of marriage later, we still come here. My only sadness about Hagen's? That Lake Michigan chubs aren't as plentiful as they were when I was a kid; Hagen's had the best smoked ones. Not their fault; what they offer is always excellent. Keep doing what you're doing!

3.description: Ahmed has been cutting my hair for past 11 years and it isn't changing - #1.

1.description: This place is amazing. I come all the way from Hanover Park for Ahmed. He's the best ever never rushes me and always takes me even if he is super busy.  He knows what he is doing. This place is a place everyone should go too. They not know yet, but they should be very soon. Top knoch for the buck.

2.description: Came in for a trim and line and Amanda did an awesome job. Quick in and out ! Will be back again. "First Asian with a beard" ;)

0.description: Came here around 3 months ago and have kept coming ever since. This is the best place for Urban hairstyles with the best barbers in Chicago and for a good price not over the top expensive just 10 dollars for a haircut plus a tip of 5 as always. I recommend coming here and every barber is good. Hit up naidr or Jose will leave you looking fresh to death.

3.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS STORE!! It is a little family owned business, which gives it a very warm and welcoming feeling once you enter. All the employees are very polite and friendly which makes every visit a pleasant one. I have never encountered such good butchers like Fernando and Jasper. Not only are their prices good but the butchers always put you first even when they don't have the meat you came for in the first place they never have a problem actually ordering it specially for you.  Going regularly to this store really builds a family feel to it not only because its a family own business so everyone helps each other but the fact that they actually ask you how your day is and mean it and the next time you stop by they remember you is really a good feeling. Kathy is a wonderful person who owns the business and I have never met anyone as involved with her customers as she is. Will not stop coming in for my Krak

1.description: Excellent produce, friendly staff, great prices, and a cool deli section. It has a variety of international food items from Poland and Latin America.

2.description: Not the best place for fresh produce, even in a pinch.  I'd rather go without.  I do get my deli meats and cheeses.  Great prices on both.  Why? Why? Why? is there only ONE register open when there's a line all the way back to the meat counter?  I spent over 10 minutes waiting in line.  Definitely not cool.  :(

5.description: Great place to buy cheap groceries. I hope this place doesn't go out of business.

0.description: Normally Rosa J. doesn't mind fulfilling the responsibility for grocery shopping, but she prefers to be carefree and wants to forget that she's also a wife who needs to feed her husband!  Luckily, Sun Fresh Market & Deli is around the corner from her house.  SFMD is rather tiny.  Prices for agricultural products are reasonable; qualities of fresh veggies, fruit, poultry, and seafood are average.  However, the convenience factor alone is four (4)-star worthy, in lazy Rosa J.'s opinion.  SFMD has a good variety of Polish and Mexican ethnic products, in which reflects the demographics of the Portage Park/Belmont Central neighborhoods.  Bakery goods from a local panaderia is also available.  Certainly SFMD isn't a grocery store you travel ten (10) miles to get there, yet it's awesome for those who live within a walking distance or happening to pass through.  Customer parking is available on Central.

4.description: It's definitely gotten better... I still don't buy deli meat there, but that's just me. I have not had another experience with out of date products, and the produce selection, while small, it is of good quality

3.description: Ok so I was scared trying a new stylist, I always am. But I think it was time after 3 years of going to Salon Blonde I needed a change and it was getting too expensive.  So I read Stella's review and thought why not.  So far so good, I am yet to actually wash my hair and style it myself. That is my ultimate test cause with 2 kids I have no time to stand in front of a mirror with a whole bunch of hair tools.  The salon itself is ok , nothing fab. But Goca is very nice, and she seems to know hair. She is helpful when it comes to your cut.   After about 2 minutes I felt like she was one of my friends as we talked about everything, it was a comfortable experience. So kudos to Goca, and thanks Stella!   I might have to change this to 5stars in the future.

1.description: I also went to Goca based on Yelp reviews and also because she is in my neighborhood. I needed and emergency bang trim as my normal hair girl was not available and she took me even though I didn't have an appointment. I just have to say that it took her maybe 5-10 minutes to trim my bangs and she did an amazing job since I am so picky about my bangs and she even understood how my bangs work..so as I was leaving I went to pay and she didn't even charge me but I still gave her money for her trouble and taking me on such a short notice. I thought that was really nice of her! Now that she is in my neighborhood and she did a great job I may be tempted to switch stylists....

2.description: Goca is amazing!she is the best hair stylist in Chicago.She does amazing work with hair!

5.description: I'd been going to Mario Tricoci for years and I had lost faith on stylists in chicago area since I thought if at Marios are stuck in the same old ways even though they try to catch up with areas like Cali or New York. But no matter what they did my hair was either too brassy or too green when they'd try to steer away from gold. On top of it my hair was always damaged. Someone introduced me to goca and she did on my hair whatever I'd been asking for years and never got in other places. My hair is not damaged and is the perfect natural shade with highlights that have no brass whatsoever. The reason why i went to her is cuz my friend gets highlights done by her and she goes really light and her base is dark which i was told it causes for your hair to pull a lot of gold, but my friend has amazing creamy color and she has long hair which is  something i couldnt have at that shade since my hair would break as a result of other places using cheap products. I am glad i found her. I cant wait to try her haircuts

6.description: I went to Goca's after seeing Stella's review. Her salon is right in my neighborhood, and I am so happy to have found a hip hair stylist like Goca in Jefferson Park!  She was very attentive as to what I wanted in a haircut, but also made helpful suggestions.  I felt like a million bucks when I walked out... After first going to Goca for a haircut, I am definetely going to her with cut and color next.  She also got me in for a haircut within the week of calling which was a plus for me. I found a new hair stylist!!!

7.description: I went to Goca based on Yelp reviews and am very happy with her.  She did a very nice job on my hair, but after I played with it a bit, I wanted the back a bit different.  I called her and she took care of it immediately - and gratis!  She is very personable and I felt comfortable immediately.  It's so nice she is in my neighborhood and I intend to help keep her there!

8.description: I went to "the goca" after seeing a girls hair that comes into the bar I work at. OMG! Her hair was so cute so I went to see "the goca" as a friend of mine fondly referred to her. First of all, can I just say that "the goca" is too cute?!! She is. This is important to me when finding a new stylist, they have to be cute and have good style which she definately does. The salon is cute, has hip decor, and it's yellow! She uses Matrix and Rusk products so my hair smells purty now, I need to get this shampoo for real. She brightened up my color and took the bulk out of my hair - and gave me some cute bangs as well. Also, she's far more reasonable pricewise then the salons I've been frequenting lately. At least I won't have to sell my first born to get a highlight and cut anymore...and the price I was quoted was the price I was charged - which is refreshing. For real. Love "the goca".  You will too.

0.description: My mom and I get our hair cuts and color here!  Goca is fabulous ! She is friendly and fun and most important great stylist !!! Also few of my friends come to her salon and they are very happy with her !

4.description: I picked Goca based on the reviews here and also because she is in my neighborhood. She did a great job with my picky hair! I am very happy with my cut and the price is very nice too.

0.description: No alcohol sales which sucks.  However they do have Lotto.The only reason I stop here is because they have those Mega size freezee bars.  You know, the colored ice, blue, green, red, purple.  Its priced under a dollar.I've seen in there once or twice, dvd's on sale.. its the "recorded in movie theaters kind."  Also bargain bin porn.. who still buys porn? and from a quickie mart?

58.description: D'Absolute provided the catering for my wedding. Chris was great to work with for the most part and the day of the event him and his staff were very professional and on top of things. Some of the reviews here say that Chris is pushy, and he can be. But then again, he runs this business by himself and he tries to secure business when he can, and his way of doing that is being a little pushy. Nothing wrong with that. He was pretty accesable most of the time and knows what he is doing.The food was great. Everyone at the wedding was complimenting the dinner. We did a buffet style with a stuffed chicken breast, vodka pasta, green beans, salad and potatoes. They provided the bartenders and they all did a great job as well. No complaints there either.There is really only one main thing to complain about. We had originally thought we would have about 250 guests at our wedding and we set our minimum with Chris at 200. Two weeks before the wedding we realize that our guest amount will be more around 175 (guess people don't like us). So we go to Chris and ask him if there is something we can work out as we are 25 people short of our minimum. I wasn't asking for him to give up all the money he would be missing out on, I was thinking more of maybe adding a few trays extra of appetizers, or something to offset the costs. This is something almost any caterer will do in this situation. Chris flat out said he couldn't. He gave us the run around saying that if his costs went up that he wouldn't charge us extra money and theres alot of extra things involved in adding in an appetizer other than just the food costs and blah blah blah. We were really asking him to make less of the expensive food (the chicken) and just throw in a few cheap appetizers.. (Meat balls or chicken skewers or something). But he wouldn't but he did say he would throw in some kids dinners for free (something he had said previously that he would include anyways). So, I didn't complain too much because he had every right to do what he did and stick to the contract we had signed, but still kinda annoyed me that we wouldn't budge at all on it. Other than that everything was great. And despite that, I would still highly recommend hiring them. Just make sure you give a lower minimum than you think you will need.

56.description: Chris catered our wedding in April of this year and absolutely knocked it out of the park.  We wanted to do something tapas-style and he couldn't have done it better -- paella, bacon-wrapped dates, potatas bravas, the whole shot.  The guests raved about the food and deservedly so; it was great.  Chris was really flexible in menu choices and working with us on what we wanted.  We didn't feel limited at all in our choices.  In addition, the wait staff was fantastic.  They were friendly and fun and gave great service.  When the father of the bride remarks on how great the servers were, you KNOW they were good.I'd never have a doubt hiring Chris and his folks again.  Fantastic job.

29.description: We can't recommend D'absolute Catering enough! Their food and service are AMAZING! We worked with Chris and Nathalie on and off for the past year planning our wedding and the entire experience was truly remarkable. Chris and Nathalie make the process so comfortable and fun. The personal tasting was exceptionally unique, thorough and delicious. Halfway through the tasting we knew we found our caterer. Their professionalism, attention to detail and sincerity were so greatly appreciated. They also helped us create a festive drink menu. A few weeks before the wedding we sat down with them again to go through all of the details of the event. Nathalie insisted that we tell them exactly how we wanted all of the tables setup and promised they would be set just as we wanted the day of the reception - and they were! She and her staff did a marvelous job!! Another testament to their reputation was the truly remarkable review the event planner at the South Loop Binny's gave D'absolute. A few weeks before the wedding while ordering all of the alcohol, the planner at Binny's (with some 20 years of experience) assured me that D'Absolute is by far the best caterer in Chicago (and one of the best in the U.S. in his opinion). He was so happy we were working with D'absolute. We were already excited about the food before that review, but for some reason the completely unsolicited review from the Binny's event planner made us even more excited. After seeing how they made our event come together and eating the food they prepared, I couldn't agree more! Truly remarkable Chris and Nathalie. We are so glad you are part of the story of the most special day in our lives. Thank you!

42.description: Called Chris' catering service, D'absolute Catering, for a last minute company event - and he pulled through beautifully. The event was a breakfast meeting, and the muffins, bagels, and danishes served were huge in size and super, duper fresh - like they came straight from the oven! i'm using D'absolute for future company events.

23.description: Chris, Nathalie and D'Absolute did an amazing job catering our Dec. 20, 2013 wedding at the Newberry Library.  They are a husband and wife team whose care and concern for doing an exceptional job is evident from the start.  From designing a distinct and seasonally appropriate menu to ensuring our guests were well-served with food and drink to acting as a day-of coordinator, D'Absolute is a full service caterer who will make your wedding day truly memorable.  We loved that they are a smaller company who add personal touches throughout the whole experience.  A few specific comments:Food.  It was important to us that the food was not typical wedding day chicken with white sauce and green beans.  You will see none of that with D'Absolute.  Chris and Nathalie designed a delicious menu and per our request offered three different entrees (filet, salmon and vegetarian) to make sure our guests had several choices.  The appetizers they prepared were delicious and creative and seasonally appropriate--not easy for winter in Chicago!  There were both healthy and more hearty options (including late night snacks) which made all of our guests happy.  We received so many compliments on how delicious the food was.Drinks.  Chris gave us some ideas for signature drinks and helped us choose the appropriate amount and mixture of drinks.  One of the reasons we chose the Newberry is they allow you to purchase your own alcohol (at least in 2013), so making sure our guests had the right mixture of booze was very important to us.  Chris helped make sure we purchased the appropriate amount and mix, and he provided all of the glassware for each of our cocktail options.  When we told him we liked bourbon, he offered to provide a "bourbon barrel" where we could offer tastings to our like-minded friends.  This was a fun and different touch.  Service.  The service was elegant, efficient and very professional.  All of the staff were very friendly and seemed enthusiastic about their work.  D'Absolute provided beautiful linens and glassware -- everything you need for the evening.Day of Coordination.  We designed a timeline for the night and presented it to Nathalie during the walk through and she made sure each and every detail was taken care of.  For the cocktails and reception, you really do not need a day of coordinator if you have D'Absolute on your side.  They will take care of everything, from place cards to menus to seating to linens and glassware, as long as you give them everything in advance.  We did not have to worry about any of this.Pricing and Contract.  For people who are busy, Chris made it very easy to see exactly what we would be charged.  Navigating through catering pricing can be tricky and stressful, and Chris cut through all of that by indicating exactly what we would be charged per person, and whether there were any "extras" or gratuity.  If he says you will not be charged extra for mixers or garnishes or what not, you will not be.  And for what you receive, the price is definitely reasonable.  Special Touches.  We will never forget this special touch--after the ceremony we retired upstairs to take a breather before the night began, and Nathalie found us and offered us a plate of appetizers and a drink.  I cannot emphasize how meaningful this was for us, as even after all of the planning, you as the bride and groom will have very little time to eat or drink too much until well into the night.  It was just the moment we needed to remember the meaning of all of the planning and to take in the quiet excitement we felt.  This special touch differentiated D'Absolute from other experiences.For those who are planning for an elegant, unforgettable event at an unconventional space, I highly recommend Chris, Nathalie and the D'Absolute team!

47.description: I've heard good things about the food but Chris's service SUCKS BALLS I called about a wedding reception that I wanted D'Absolute to cater and immediately I felt like I had to get every word and detail out in 5.2 seconds he completely rushed me off the phone and told me he didn't want to waste his time or mines by coming up with a proposed estimate on how much everything would cost. O_o Wait isn't that his job cost means everything sometimes and in my case EVERYTHING! COME ON SON!!!!

8.description: D'absolute did a fantastic job with our wedding last week!  My then-fiancé and I are pretty easygoing when it comes to working with vendors and pretty much trusted them to do their thing, which made me a little nervous, because we do have high standards!  I wondered if I had given them enough direction, but I needn't have worried.  These guys are serious pros and executed the day perfectly.  The food was absolutely delicious (once Chris mentioned truffle fries, I was sold) and our guests raved about it - some said it was the best wedding food they had.  We worked with Chris for the menu setup and tasting, Nathalie for the details, and then Mena was the day-of manager.  Their staff was extremely friendly and professional as well.  Oh, and they really take care of everything, down to boxing up all the stuff we brought to the wedding and carrying it out to the car at the end of the night.One minor quibble - as a couple others have mentioned, the scheduling for the tasting is challenging since it's typically just during normal business hours (at least this was the case in July when we were choosing a caterer), and Chris insists all decision-makers (i.e. both members of the couple) be there.  We almost didn't use them at all because of this since my fiancé had a new job at the time and couldn't really take off work, but ultimately we were able to compromise.  We're so glad we did, because their food was leaps and bounds better than the other company we were considering, and the process was smooth sailing after that.

31.description: D'Absolute catered our wedding at the Newberry Library this past week and did nothing short of an amazing job. I received several comments that the food was "the best we've ever had" at a wedding. Chris (the owner) doesn't provide the same old chicken and carrots, he has quite an interesting menu with any number of choices for different audiences. From the appetizers through dinner, literally everything was great.Also Chris as a caterer goes above and beyond when managing an event to ensure that everything goes well on site - he quite literally was running the entire show. He knows how to work with locations and other vendors (ie, DJs, etc) to ensure everything runs smoothly. I cannot say enough good things about D'Absolute. Chris is fantastic to work with and provides delicious and interesting food, and top notch service.

34.description: D'Absolute catered our wedding on Sept 14 at the Newberry Library.  He did a spectacular job, from start to finish.  Having been to many weddings where the food has been lackluster, we were so pleasantly surprised that our guests were all raving about both the filet mignon and the salmon dish that Chris designed for us.  I have never seen so many empty plates at a wedding!  I also heard the appetizers were a hit, although I was unfortunately too busy to try most of them.  His prices were extremely competitive and I really liked how his packages included linens, setup, etc.  I didn't have to worry about hidden costs.  He also encouraged us to buy our own alcohol, which he served for us.  I worked with him (and Jeff from Binny's) to come up with a list of alcohol to order, and Binny's delivered it right to Chris on the day of our wedding so there was nothing I needed to worry about.  Also, we did not have wedding planners or event coordinators and fully relied on Chris and his wife Natalie to manage the event set-up and break-down.  He did a spectacular job.  Everything was perfect and I was so happy with the end result.  I highly recommend D'Absolute!

16.description: I cannot say enough good things about D'absolute. This is a very long overdue review. D'absolute catered our wedding in January 2014 at the Skyline Loft at Bridgeport Art Center. They were an absolute pleasure to work with from day one. Chris and his wife Nathalie have so much experience in this field and we welcomed and appreciated any feedback they had to offer. Chris had some wonderful advice that would help make our day run more smoothly and he was open to any new ideas that we had to share. Their food is delicious and the tasting was an experience in and of itself. We got so many wonderful compliments on the food and service from our guests who attended the wedding. Chris and his team went above and beyond their call of duty and also acted as our day of wedding coordinators, from setting up our entire cocktail and dinner reception rooms, to breaking down, cleaning and packing up our supplies at the end of the night. We would have been absolutely lost without their service.Since our wedding we have recommended them to many of our friends who have also had nothing but wonderful things to say about their service!

exceptional job is evident from the start.  From designing a distinct and seasonally appropriate menu to ensuring our guests were well-served with food and drink to acting as a day-of coordinator, the bride and groom will have very little time to eat or drink too much until well into the night.  It was just the moment we needed to remember the meaning of all of the planning and to take in the quiet excitement we felt.  This special touch differentiated D'Absolute from other experiences.For those who are planning for an elegant, unforgettable event at an unconventional space, I highly recommend Chris, Nathalie and the D'Absolute team!

11.description: Chris and Nathalie catered our wedding on August 1st, 2014. They were absolutely wonderful to work with! From the beginning of the planning process to the day of the event their communication and attention to detail was perfect. They listened to exactly what we wanted and completely exceeded our expectations. The food was amazing and our guests kept mentioning how kind and attentive their staff was. They also were willing to work with our budget and our vision of the day.Thank you again for making our day so special! I would recommend D'Absolute to anyone planning a wedding in the Chicagoland area!!

39.description: I am using D'absolute for my wedding.  Not only are they catering a fabulous meal, they are also running the rest of the show.  I love Natalie, she's really great at her job and Chris has been really helpful too.  My wedding is coming up soon, but I doubt my opinion will change.

37.description: Chris does an amazing job with his food and service!  I will have to keep trying everything, so this is really a 4 and a half star review, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  We had a small party (which is something they do) and we got Chicken Marsala, Chicken Fraincaise (a Lemon Butter White Wine sauce), Beef Stroganoff, and Dessert Bars.  Anyway, it was really nice to have food so well prepared for a small Bridal Shower.  It's nice to do something different, and D'Absolute was a wonderful place to go.  On time. Excellent food and service!

0.description: Our wedding reception was at Room 1520 in August of 2015.  D'Absolute was on their preferred list along with about 16 others.  Through a "Value Based Analytical Hierarchy Process" (a term my Project Manager Groomzilla used when planning for the wedding), we narrowed it down to just three for a tasting.  D'Absolute was the first one we on our list so we had no expectations.  The 'tasting room' was a small restaurant-like room with a bar.  Nothing fancy at all.  Chris was the one to great us, offer us a drink, and served us the food.  The food was delicious - appetizers, short ribs, the chicken, and even the ravioli.  In terms of food, this first tasting set the bar.  Although we were already impressed  with D'Absolute we still attended the tastings with the other caterers.  Their tastings included a decorated table, servers, cute menus, and other extras to try and impress us but their food was just as good as D'Absolute.  Our final decision was based on the cost and D'Absolute beat the rest by several thousand dollars. About a month before our wedding we met with Natalie to discuss the final count, the menu, the signature drinks, the table cloth colors, and other important details.  She was just as down to earth as Chris and very easy to talk to.  On the day of the wedding the place looked amazing; the foyer, the table settings in the main room, and the bar area.  Our signature drinks, sangria & mojito, were a hit.  More importantly, every one raved about the food.  A friend of mine said that she was already full but she couldn't stop eating because it was so good.  Statements like that confirmed to us that we made the right choice with D'Absolute. Thank you, Chris & Natalie, for providing us with exceptional service & food!

38.description: My wedding planner (Anthony with Liven It Up Events), recommended Chris and his D'Absolute team for my wedding last month.  Chris is such a professional!  He is very organized and knows catering so well!  He had great suggestions on how we can make our reception go more smoothly as well as have great input on every aspect of our event.  Everyone commented on the professionalism of his staff on the night as well.  We did drop off catering (we wanted Chinese food from a specific restaurant) so I can't say much about the food, but he managed my reception so well and his staff was amazing!  I highly recommend Chris for anyone planning an event, big or small.

51.description: I called Chris to get a proposal and he responded very quickly and was on par with my budget.  He offered us a special cash only incentive if we signed with him within 2 weeks for a discount.  I didn't think it was quiet worth it because we were still waiting to hear back from others and based on a previous discussion it seems his "flexibility" may come off sketchy... Say what?  When we talked about deposits to secure the date and stuff he basically said that there is no deposit and the payment plans are flexible....um...are you going to show up on my wedding day?!?!?!?!  Although this may work for some people, I wasn't comfortable going forward.  One cool thing I really liked about Chris was talking to him about the cake- he really encouraged me to bring in pictures of cakes I liked and wanted and would try his best to make something similar. I will have to say that he was very easy to talk to and work with.  He went to my venue website and took a look around as he talked to me, but he hadn't work there before so I opted to go with someone familiar with the venue.

27.description: I don't think I will ever be able to thank Chris, Natalie and the D'Absolute team enough for making sure that I had the wedding of my dreams this past weekend. Not only was the D'Absolute team incredibly professional, but the food was spectacular! The appetizers were artfully executed and the main dishes were super tasty. I honestly felt like I was eating at a restaurant (not having "wedding" food).  In fact, I can't tell you how many positive reviews we got from guests regarding the food specifically (this is saying a lot considering many of our guests are in the restaurant/wine industry). I would hire D'Asbolute again in a heartbeat and will recommend them to all of my friends who are planning to get married in Chicago.

32.description: This is not a review of the food that Chris provides, rather his catering business. Since the wedding was cancelled, I never got to eat the food, although I am sure it would have been great. This also is not written with any bitterness because the wedding was called off, so please don't misinterpret my comments that way.I am giving a one star based on my experience, which again, did not include trying the food. Initially, I signed a contract with Chris last May and since the second deposit was due in early June, I wrote the check for both the initial deposit and deposit two. Deposit two was $2,500. My name was on the contract and the checks.We called off the wedding about 5 days before the second deposit was due, and I let Chris know immediately that we would be cancelling our contract. Since we had five days to go before the second deposit was due, I thought I would be entitled to a refund of the $2,500 deposit, since it would not be due for another several days. I explained this in an email and Chris replied he would get back to me.Over the next month or two, I emailed Chris twice more asking for a refund and explaining my thoughts on the matter, with no response until the final email where I voiced extreme displeasure with not only not getting a refund, but with his lack of regard for business ethics or common decency.Chris finally responded to me and told me he would not be issuing a refund and that he had discussed the issue with my former fiance, and he was under the impression that it had all been settled. I don't blame her for not knowing the situation, since we were no longer talking.Chris, on the other hand, had received 3 emails from me, all of them explaining my views on the matter. My name was also on the contract and the checks. It is unethical to ignore a former clients emails and discuss my money behind my back with someone whose name was not on the checks and contract.This is the reason for the one star (I wish it could be zero) review. Not only was I not issued a refund for my deposit, I was never explained why this never happened. Chris also ignored my emails for months and discussed the issue with someone else.I am sure he puts on a great party and his food tastes great, and I hope no one has to cancel a contract with him, but this was based on my experience with him, and I have nothing but bad things to say about my experience. I would highly highly recommend going to a true professional instead of Chris.

54.description: Delicious food, excellent price and thoughtful service!D'Absolute catered a small private party for us on the Northwest Side, and did a terrific job. We had to make all the arrangements from out of town, and because we were coming in at a very busy time, had a hard time finding a caterer in the area who could take our business.Chris was very accommodating and responsive as we settled on the menu. He and his driver delivered the food, as planned. But they also insisted on setting everything out on the serving tables, which was a great help.Everyone raved about the food. The sandwiches were excellent, the salads had everyone going back for seconds (and how often does that happen with salad?), and the mini-pastries and mousse cake were to-die-for. I would go back to D'Absolute again for

48.description: Chris is amazing. I challenge you to try to find a caterer who knows more about throwing an awesome event than Chris. With him, it's not just about food (even though his food is awesome and we've had numerous people say it's the best wedding food they've had all year) but about making the right decisions to make your event go as smoothly as possible. Chris told us at one point that if we hired him, we wouldn't need a wedding planner, and he was right. He advised us on everything from our booze selection to our table layout to the timing of our reception--he even talked us out of ordering late-night food and extra dessert because he didn't think we needed it. That would have been money in his pocket, but he didn't care. He was just being real. He met with us several times, including at our venue to talk us through where to put tables.The presentation of his food and his staff was also fantastic, and my husband and I are total food snobs. We looked at some caterers that promised hyper-local, sustainable eats that sounded fancier than Chris' food, and it took forever to get quotes and they charged way more for rentals and staff. And when it comes down to it, I bet Chris' food is just as good. It's food everyone recognizes but done well. It's a fabulous value for what you get. In some way, we're sad our wedding is over, because now we don't have an excuse to see Chris. He's the kind of person we'd be proud to be friends with. I really can't say enough good things about  him.

44.description: Chris is absolutely amazing.  We hired him as a suggestion from the Stan Mansion for our 11/11/11 wedding at the Stan Mansion.  I read the reviews on Yelp about him & was a little skeptical but decided to give him a shot.  I am SO glad I did bc I have nothing but great things to say about him.  He gave us a great deal.  The food was absolutely amazing, tasted as good at the tasting as it did at the wedding.  I got so many compliments on the food.  Usually wedding food is just blah but this was far from it.  He even designed our cake with basically no direction from me & it was gorgeous.  My husband & I didn't have many ideas and Chris is such an expert that he was able to work with little direction.  On the flipside if you do have a direction he can go with it and make exactly what you want!  His servers & bartenders were fabulous.  I didn't have to worry about one thing the day of my wedding bc Chris handled everything.  He was there from beginning to the very end of the night, well past when I left.  My husband & I are still raving about what an amazing job he did.  You always hear brides saying something goes wrong at your wedding but not ONE thing went wrong bc of him.  He is so professional and on top of his game that I would recommend him to anyone.  You will not be disappointed.  Should we ever need a caterer again for anything we will be contacting Chris.    I can't thank him enough for the amazing job he did.  He allowed me to relax & just enjoy my day rather than worrying.  Thanks so much Chris!!!!!!

24.description: As part of our wedding planning, we worked with Chris at D'absolute Catering to develop a tasting menu. My fiancé and mother attended with me and we had a terrific experience. Chris was very easy to work with, knowledgeable, and went above and beyond to make the tasting enjoyable. Not to mention the food was spectacular. I would highly recommend Chris and team.

7.description: Chris, Natalie & Mena were an absolute all-star team.  From the first correspondence and the tasting, Chris had us completely at ease.  Natalie was a dream to work with, she was present at any and all meetings at our venue, detail-oriented, prepared, quick to reply, thoughtful of any and everything and such a gem overall!  Mena was incredible on the day of!  We had mostly corresponded with Natalie so we were nervous when she told us she wouldn't be there, but Mena was as incredible as we could've asked for!  The food and service were amazing and she was friendly and so attentive to everything throughout the night!  All of the staff and especially the bartenders were a delight and our guests were so well-taken care of!  BOOK TODAY!!  You won't regret it!!

49.description: Chris catered our wedding on 10/1/2011 at A New Leaf, and it was absolutely fantastic. Our goals for the reception menu included a couple curve balls: 1) we wanted everything vegetarian, and 2) we wanted tapas to go along with the cocktail party-style of the reception and to honor our honeymoon destination. He took these in stride and developed a delicious menu for us that included risotto, eggplant and goat cheese lasagna, patatas bravas, and a series of passed hor'doevres that were simply heavenly. The dinner menu was great but it was really the hor'doevres that made the meal fantastic. Mini quiche, stuffed dates, goat cheese croquettes, mini baked brie, and more....they were all amazing. Plus, Chris developed a signature sangria drink for the cocktail hour which servers passed around. We signed with Chris after our first tasting and before we had a chance to meet with any other caterers because he offered us a discount if we would sign within a week. We had no problem doing so because we thought he the quality of food for the price point was a great value. We were able to meet with Chris in person a few times in the month or two leading up to the wedding to finalize the menu, walk through the venue, and go over details. All in all we found him to be accessible and accommodating, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend him to anyone else looking for a wedding caterer.

40.description: Over promised, under delivered. It was like they never listened to our requests, requirement or concerns. Be sure to really hammer out the contract before working with this vendor as they pulled a fast one less than a week before the wedding requiring additional payment.

53.description: Our guests couldn't stop raving about the food served at our wedding reception, thanks to D'absolute catering.  We only had to do one tasting with this company, and we knew we wouldn't find anything better for the price!  Chris was very accommodating, he allowed us to pick up the table linens a day ahead of the wedding so we can set up our own centerpieces.  The servers were polite and Natalie, the supervisor, was so thoughtful.  She had saved some hors d'ouevres for my husband and I  and even served us separately on our buffet-style reception.  They carved/served the whole roast pig which we ordered elsewhere for no extra charge.  Very highly recommended!

30.description: My first and only regret with this review is that we did not write it earlier! Chris Constantine from D'Absolute Catering was the caterer for our wedding day in December. We worked very closely with Chris and his wife Natalie. They are an amazing team!  We sat down with approximately 8 different caterers and D'Absolute was without a doubt, our first choice. Not only because they were reasonably priced but we felt as though they were the easiest to work with and understood the business. The other caterers we spoke with continually tried to change the view of the wedding we wanted. D'Absolute took our vision and ran wild- adding in what they thought would work for our December time frame.  Leading up to the big day proved to be hassle free and actually quite relaxing. D'Absolute took care of EVERYTHING for us (linens, food, liquor, bar, waitstaff, timing, and more!) They made everything seamless and easy. The food from D'Absolute was amazing!  They have a very extensive menu to choose from. Chris knew what worked for the season and what would work best for the type of group we were entertaining.  We did not want a formal sit down dinner, but instead wanted a party atmosphere. With that said I was adamantly against a "buffet style" wedding.  D'Absolute conquered our day with perfection!  I still have guests speaking about how great the set up and flow was, how wonderful everything looked and most importantly how EXCELLENT the food was. We went with a few different items that were tailored for the season- passed appetizers:  spaghetti squash mini cakes, ahi tuna tacos, cheese and red grape lollipops; dinner stations: grilled beef tenderloin skewers (amazing!), ravioli, fresh vegetables, grilled flatbread, French style Coq Au Vin (amazing!) red smashed potatoes and  seasonal salad. Late night they brought out mini gourmet grill cheese and pulled pork sliders! The food was absolutely to die for!  I've had a number of people who have inquired about the caterer and raved about their food! Our guests were very happy and left feeling very satisfied.  Chris was very honest and up front with us on what he thought would work and not work. Chris and Natalie also went to great lengths to help us with our sweet table and set up for the sweet table as we brought in mini cupcakes, small individual cakes, etc.  I had concerns that the wait staff wouldn't  clear the tables and plates as quickly as I heard others discuss however, this was never a problem. Their waitstaff was efficient, professional and I barely noticed them!  Just when you think the wedding is over.... they collected the few sweets that were left over, the left over liquor, and packaged up the top of our cake for us-allowing us to pick this up from them at our convenience.   I cannot compliment this amazing team enough!  If you are looking for personal attention, amazing service, excellent food and a professional team of caterers- Chris and Natalie Constantine from D'Absolute Catering are hands down, the best!

46.description: D'absolute catered our wedding in September of this year. My husband and I couldn't be happier. We shopped for months for a caterer that would provide great food, flip the room from ceremony to reception, pass appetizers & drinks during cocktail hour, clean up completely, work professionally and stay within our budget... to much to ask for? Well, a lot of other caterers in Chicago had a problem with that. The minute we met Chris we knew we found our guy. Not only was he completely on board with everything we needed, but he had so many great suggestions. The day of, Natalie (part of the team) acted as our day of coordinator. She was fantastic! Our dinner was buffet style and I was worried about 220 guests getting fed within 45 minutes. The D'absolute crew, had it down and all my guests were eating within half an hour.. no long crazy lines. I was amazed. Food was great too, not the typical flavorless buffet food, our guests were very satisfied. Chris even helped us put a liquor list together and had his bartenders serve it. If I go over every single detail this will be the longest yelp review ever.  Basically, our wedding was a dream come true, from beginning to end. We really didn't have to worry about a thing.Thank you D'absolute!

1.description: There are so many catering companies in Chicago, sometimes it's hard to decide on which one to use. D'absolute Catering had so many rave reviews on Yelp that I wanted to give them a try.On the contract, I specifically said that the food had to be set up by 5:00 PM for a 5:30 corporate meeting start. By 4:30 the food had already not arrived and I was worried. Bottom line is the food was not completely ready to go until 5:45. The guys setting up were busting their asses to get it set up though, which I appreciated.Being MLK Day, the building's dock closed early and held up the guys for about half an hour, but if the owner had dispatched the crew to set up the food at the appropriate time with time to spare instead of waiting until the last minute because of the "cold temperatures that would make the food cold," then we would have had time to work around the building closing the dock unexpectedly. I think the owner or the crew should have done more to get around the dock being closed, or should have gone to the front to talk to security instead of waiting downstairs for 30 minutes for something to happen. While I'm setting up for my event, I don't have the time to worry about whether or not the dock is open or how the food will get up--- that's the responsibility of the catering company. What I expect from catering companies that I use is the foresight to overcome unexpected obstacles so that everything is set up on time, as specified on the contract.If you're looking for a reliable catering company, best to go with another company. Blue Plate has never failed me.

55.description: We had our wedding about a month ago and it was perfect. I got so many compliments about the food and cake and decorations and staffs. Usually, wedding food is not so great, cold, but the food from D'absolute was delicious and warm! At the beginning of the planning, I was just looking for a caterer that has the lowest price to save money. As you know, wedding could be very expensive and I wanted to save every dime. However, after many calls and tastings with different caterers, I realized that the most important thing was that I had to be able to trust the vendor. I wanted someone who can trust that they can do the job and I don't have to worry about it at the wedding day since I had thousand things going on wedding day. Chris from D'absolute was that person. Chris is very much experienced and knows what he's doing. He was flexible on the menu and guest counts as well. He also got us a beautiful wedding cake as we requested except the cake did not have all the flavors we asked. We asked each cake layer to have different flavors but the final cake only had two flavors.I felt like I was well taken care of during the wedding and reception. He appointed a wait staff to the bride and groom so that we are not left out during the cocktail hour and reception and etc. Usually, the bride and groom do not even get to taste much food and drinks since they are too busy greeting the guests and taking pictures, but we had our dedicated person to make sure we have our food between the formal picture and reception and cocktail hour, etc..Now I know that the caterer is a big part of the wedding. It's more than just food.  :)

9.description: Out of six caterers approved by The Newberry Library, this is the only one that would require my fiancé to take off a half day of work because they do not conduct tastings any later than 4 pm. Since my schedule is more flexible, I could attend the tasting alone but that is not ok with Chris because he wants "all of the decision-makers" there. His associate Mena never conveyed this issue to me in our correspondence so I was prepared to come to a tasting alone and it seemed as though they had availability during the day on weekdays. Yesterday Chris told that we would have to wait until October.I have now spoken to Chris twice over the phone and he keeps emphasizing the point that these tastings cost him $300-$400 so he does not like to do them unless there is a likelihood of a good outcome. This last time I spoke to him he conveyed the message that he basically does not want to work with me because he thinks I have already found the caterer that I want. Chris, if that were true, I would not be wasting my time talking to you and corresponding with your associates. I was interested in you because your work seems to be really good and I wanted to see if your food was the best of the companies from which we have to choose. I can't make that decision from looking at descriptions and pictures. I was looking forward to experiencing what the positive reviews are saying. But I have come to understand that I am not welcome at your house. Perhaps it is all a misunderstanding, perhaps I am just not your kind of client. I never realized I would have to face caterer rejection as part of the wedding planning process. Isn't the hunt for the dress stressful enough? Ah well, c'est la vie.

26.description: We were married on 10/26 and had our catering done by Chris and Nathalie at D'absolute.  The service, food and professionalism were all top notch!  We received so many compliments on the quality of the food served (short ribs, chicken and butternut squash ravioli).  I would highly recommend D'absolute for any event catering!

25.description: When I was planning for my August 2013 wedding with the Glessner House museum, I learned that D'absolute Catering is the exclusive caterer for the location, due to their knowledge of the space and respect for the somewhat regimented guidelines of the museum space. My fiance and I were originally a bit concerned to not have a choice in the matter, but after reviewing the menu, chatting with Chris and Nathalie, and enjoying the most comprehensive "tasting" ever, we were hooked!Chris and Nathalie not only deliver on exquisite food, they will work with you on your menu personally and help identify the best options for your budget. Plus, they are lovely to work with! They try to help make the process as easy as possible - one example was when my sister was shipping some alcohol for the wedding (Glessner museum allows you to bring in your own, a real cost saver!), but it needed to be shipped somewhere with a liquor license. Chris helped take care of that, which took another worry off of our plates.At the reception itself, Nathalie was very hands on with her staff to ensure the service - and their brand - lived up to what we expected. A lovely touch was her putting aside some appetizers for me, since the bride is running around a lot! We were wholly pleased with the service and the food, and would highly recommend D'absolute for any and all of your special occasions.

12.description: Can't say enough great things about Chris and his team. They delivered exceptional food, service and fun to our wedding 12/31/14. He worked tirelessly throughout the year, going above and beyond what is expected of a caterer to ensure we had the absolute best night. We went table to table saying hello to people that night and every plate was empty and all our guests could do was rave about their meals! Thank you again Chris and Natalie!!

59.description: We used D'Absolute Catering for our wedding at the Newberry Library in Sept 09- and I must say, this was the BEST vendor decision I made for the wedding!!!
