Chris is very friendly and was always quick to respond to my e-mails/phone calls. Chris was also very flexible and patient with me, even thought I changed so many things last minute. My husband and I had a very tight budget for the wedding, but we were able to have a beautiful wedding at the Newberry Library only because of D'Absolute Catering- it was by far the best deal we got!! Although we got an incredible deal through him, we didn't have to sacrifice quality. The food was absolutely fantastic- all of our guests told us it was the best wedding food they had. The service was impeccable- I didn't have to worry about a thing all day/night long. The staffs were very friendly and kind- they always asked if we needed anything and attended to all our needs. I highly highly recommend D'Absolute Catering.

21.description: This is a long overdue review. Our wedding was June 2013 at the Zhou B Art Center.  Venue only provided the space (no chairs, tables, etc.).  Other than the flowers and ordering of the chairs and tables, D'Absolute took care of everything else.  Nathalie and Chris at D'Absolute did an amazing job.  We reviewed 10+ caters and DAbsolute showed the most expertise and capability in providing the level of service, menu selections, and price we were looking for.  Many caterers we reviewed had pre-set menus and if you asked questions outside of their menu's, they would start getting tongue tied. Chris did the best in coming up with ideas based on my input.  Chris was very professional.  Different from other caterers was his emphasis in making sure you were happy and the solution best addressed what you were looking for instead of just making a deal. Minor changes to the menu were made with no charges.  As the final head count came a few days before, the total price was adjusted.  I was a little concerned about hidden costs based on another review.  I asked Chris about the review. He provided justification and assured me this would not happen with us. We had to rent additional tables used for catering services (e.g. bar, serving tables), however, there were no unexpected costs in food or service.    From a process perspective, Chris handles the front end (e.g. sales and tastings). Natalie handles 'everything else'.  Nathalie becomes your point of contact after the contract is signed.  I came to the realization of this myself.  It was a little confusing at first as I thought we would continue to work with Chris throughout the process. Nathalie is super easy to work with, organized, and flexible.   In the beginning, I was skeptical as emails from her were short and I sometimes had to repeat what I had already noted in prior emails. I took that as lack of detail, but later on realized she is always on the go and is not in the office as often as Chris is.  She is a workhorse. It is amazing how she keeps everything all together.  She handled the ordering, planning for the day of, walk through, etc. On the day of, she managed all the activities including service, setting up tables/chairs, food, execution of the day of timeline, and break down clean up.  Our friend that had helped with coordinating day of activities and was a wedding coordinator for her church for many years complimented at how well she had things organized. For example, at a snap of her fingers, rose petals were positioned correctly. There were a few things we forgot to give her (like the seating chart).  Even with the many things that came up or things that were missing, she did a really GREAT job. On top of the great service and execution, the food was AMAZING :). We received many compliments from our guests on the food.  We would recommend D'Absolute for any occasion!

17.description: If I could rate Chris and D'Absolute with more stars I absolutely would!  My husband and I were married in May of this year at Prairie Production, and I cannot say enough about how amazing it was to work with Chris!Not only was Chris always available, he was extremely flexible and willing to work with us in regards to our budget.  We brought him our ideas, and he worked closely with us to make them a reality for the most wonderful day.The FOOD!   It is a few months after the wedding, and I still have guests talking about the food and how much they ate at our reception.  That was our number one goal, and D'Absolute made it happen!  Chris handled the day of coordination, working with my other vendors and making sure the entire reception ran smoothly!  Thanks to Chris and D'Absolute, we had a blast and so did our guests!

10.description: D'Absolute catered my Oct. 3 wedding at Ignite Glass Studios.  Chris and Natalie were so fantastic and we couldn't be happier with how the food turned out!! I don't remember how I found D'Absolute while researching caterers but from the minute we contacted them for an intial proposal, to the tasting, to the menu adjustments, and final wedding day - they were so easy to work with an very communicative.  They were mindful of our budget and we ended up coming in under our catering budget. On the wedding day there was a minor hiccup with uncooperative weather.  We were supposed to have our ceremony on the roof top.  All 200 chairs were set on the roof and then high winds and uncharacteristically cold temps that day made us want to bring the ceremony inside.  About an hour and a half before the ceremony was meant to start my sweet hubby told Chris we wanted it brought inside...I'm sure not an ideal circumstance for the caterer! They made it happen though and pushed all reception tables to the sides of the space so we could fit 200 chairs in there for our ceremony.  It was top notch service and we truly appreciated them working with our last minute change so efficiently.  Everyone had only good things to say about the food! We had the yummiest passed apps: goat cheese crositini, baby lamps chops, bacon wrapped dates, and ahi tuna tacos.  Dinner was beef tenderloin, chicken, or grilled veggies and tofu...all with potato and green bean sides.  The bar service was great too! They were able to manage a wedding of heavy drinkers and keep the drinks flowing!! I would definitely recommend D'Absolute to anyone.

5.description: We couldn't have asked for a better caterer for our wedding!! Chris and his team went above and beyond to make sure our wedding reception went smoothly. My fiancee and I planned our wedding from out of town, and Chris was so responsive whenever we had any questions. They are probably the best caterer for an affordable price and they even allowed us to bring in outside food since my fiancee and I wanted to make sure our Korean and Chinese backgrounds were also reflected in the food. On the day of the wedding, during cocktail hour and dinner, they were always bringing out food and drinks promptly, and Chris himself made sure we were comfortable throughout the reception. Chris was so open to our vision of what we wanted our signature cocktails and food to be, and so easy to work with. D'absolute was one of the best decisions of our wedding!!

3.description: Chris and Natalie catered our wedding on 6/21/2014.I can't even begin to express the gratitude I have to Chris and Natalie for all they did to make our wedding day happen. They went so, so far beyond just being our 'caterer.' First of all, we initially chose D'absolute based on their food and their hospitality. We had visited several other caterers, including some who would be considered more high-end, but after a few cold main courses and one bout of sudden illness, we stepped into D'absolute's tasting room and knew instantly they were the best choice for our wedding. The food was delicious, Chris was professional but still down to earth, and it was an overall great experience. ( Chris also got along swimmingly with my Mom, which may have had something to do with it :)I'm STILL thanking my lucky stars that we made the D'absolute decision, because I'm not sure I would have been able to handle all of the problems that we encountered later, without them:After 14 months of planning, we found out that our venue had closed it's doors and we had nowhere to host our wedding. Chris instantly jumped in to help, being my main source for info on where to look and who to contact, and maybe even acting as a therapist during the tougher times...He contacted people for us, negotiated for us, and changed the ENTIRE plan around just a mere 5 weeks before the wedding. He took meetings and phone calls at all hours of the day (and night). He was brutally honest when he needed to be, and saved me from making an epically terrible venue decision based on pure exhaustion. And, he did all of this while dealing with a bunch of other brides who were going through the exact same thing. (In fact if I recall, he found one couple a new venue in 3 days, because that's how much notice they got)The day of ended up being absolutely beautiful. Again, because of the last-minute wedding planning chaos, D'absolute stepped in to help with things that I don't think a typical caterer would even consider. I honestly think it turned out better than it would have if our original venue had just stayed open. Oh and the food? Guests were telling us it was the best wedding food they'd ever had. So, to sum it all up... D'absolute is a company run by good people, who are in the business because they love what they do, care about the people they do it for, and wouldn't do it for any other reason. The result is exceptional food and exceptional service, that your guests will remember for years (and you'll remember forever).

35.description: Chris from D'absolute is a must-hire for your wedding or special event!  He was a recommended caterer for my wedding venue, and at first I wasn't so keen on being told who to hire.  But after emailing with Chris and deciding on a menu for a tasting, and then actually meeting him in his space, I knew it was the right choice.  The food was delicious, particularly the appetizers (on the day of, everyone RAVED about them).  But beyond the food, Chris and his team just take care of all the little details that you don't even think about!  We ended up renting or bringing our own linens, but they are the ones to set it all up.  Natalie was amazing with helping my mom to set up the place cards at every seat.  We wanted to tie a little ribbon around the mason jars Chris provided for our signature cocktail, so he made sure we got them a few days before the wedding to do so.  Also at the end of the night, they were the ones who really cleaned up, boxed up all the decor, etc.  It's just so important to get a good caterer to keep the party moving smoothly so that the bridal party doesn't have to worry about a thing.  And the last comment I have is just that Chris is SO reasonably priced!!  I mean, I did get a quote from one other caterer and I can safely say it would have been double what D'absolute charged.  One great contributing factor is that Chris lets you get your own liquor, but he also helps you by recommending how much to purchase (and he is not an upseller, not at all), and also getting you into contact with the special events manager at Binny's.  All in all, we were so happy with D'absolute Catering, and would definitely recommend Chris to anyone for their event!

19.description: D'absolute catered my daughter's wedding at Newberry Library a few weeks ago. Everything was amazing.  People raved about the food!   Chris and Natalie are wonderful to work with and were able to accommodate many special menu requests.Their staff is top notch and very professional.  Do not hesitate to hire D'Absolute Catering...a class act!!

28.description: There are no words that come to mind that I can use to accurately describe how fantastic Chris with D'Absolute is. He catered our wedding over Labor Day weekend and it was perfect! The entire menu was delicious, the service was impeccable, the staff was friendly and attentive. And he helped assure that everything flowed seamlessly.

45.description: D'Absolute was absolutely the right choice of caterer for our wedding on October 29th. My husband and I were planning everything from New York City. Chris was incredibly responsive, which is very important to me. He answered emails quickly and offered great suggestions throughout the process. Most importantly, the wedding day went completely smoothly. He was there early. His staff was efficient. The tables looked beautiful. The food, of course, was delicious - we received a ton of compliments on it! They arranged to have appetizers brought to us and our wedding party during our photos so that we didn't miss out (that's an extra nice touch)! And clean up was uber-fast.  We don't have any complaints and neither will you! We could not have been happier.

33.description: I need to confess - at first I was indifferent with our food vendor and what type of food that was going to be served at our wedding because I wanted to save money with our caterer. What a fool I am! The food and alcohol can make or break your entire wedding experience. My wife and I started off tasting at various vendors in Chicago and the suburbs. And we were only partially satisfied with food, menu, and price options (at the beginning). That all changed when we had our food tasting at D'Ab. Chris's food tasting was the highest quality food of any other food vendor we visited. I thought for sure pricing would be through the roof for such high quality and delicious food. I was mistaken when he gave me his estimate and it was significantly less than all the other vendors. AND we had more menu items and food options.Chris and his wife have it down to a science. They have been in the industry for such a long period of time and know how to do it the right way. And they tailor their service to your needs. D'Ab is a full service caterer that provides food, plate ware, glasses, linens, staff, cooks, bartenders and bar service, and different dining options such as pass service, plated dinners, food stations, and buffets. That's about 4 vendors wrapped up into one full service company. Chris was one of the only vendors who would NOT charge us for bringing our own deserts or cake cutting. Our guests were raving at how great the food was and the beef tenderloin is magic; you truly cannot go wrong with the food options as they are endless and all taste magnificent. I also went with a late night food option through Chris and it was a HUGE hit to sober up everyone at the end of the night. The custom signature drinks were a winner too! The last win/win relates to how dialed-in and involved Chris is in your wedding planning. He makes things so simple by taking the lead role to coordinate the timeline for the day and working closely with all the vendors. We were able to skip on hiring a wedding planner since Chris coordinated almost everything on our behalf.You honestly owe it to yourself to take 1 hour to do a tasting and meet with Chris. He will seriously blow your mind and your mouth will drop when you see how his pricing will beat the other big corporate vendors. I rate the service and experience with 5 stars. I highly recommend Chris to ANYONE who is looking to work with one of the most professional and best people in the business. Thanks D'Ab and keep up the great work!

43.description: Chris and his team catered the most amazing food for our wedding (which our friends and family are still raving about!). The entire process of working with Chris was very smooth and seamless. Email correspondence was very good and all invoices were sent electronically (which I really liked so I could keep better track of everything). The tasting was amazing and the very minute things we asked to be changed for the wedding day turned out great! Thanks Chris & D'Absolute Catering!

2.description: We got appetizers and desserts dropped off at our reception space and were so happy with both.  They were on time, priced VERY FAIRLY, and the food was delicious.  The assorted dessert bars were absolutely perfect.  I only wish I had saved some to take home with me.  So Good!

18.description: This is a long overdue review. Our wedding was June 2013 at the Zhou B Art Center.  Venue only provided the space (no chairs, tables, etc.).  Other than the flowers and ordering of the chairs and tables, D'Absolute took care of everything else.  Nathalie and Chris at D'Absolute did an amazing job.  We reviewed 10+ caters and DAbsolute showed the most expertise and capability in providing the level of service, menu selections, and price we were looking for.  Many caterers we reviewed had pre-set menus and if you asked questions outside of their menu's, they would start getting tongue tied. Chris did the best in coming up with ideas based on my input.  Chris was very professional.  Different from other caterers was his emphasis in making sure you were happy and the solution best addressed what you were looking for instead of just making a deal. Minor changes to the menu were made with no charges.  As the final head count came a few days before, the total price was adjusted.  I was a little concerned about hidden costs based on another review.  I asked Chris about the review. He provided justification and assured me this would not happen with us. We had to rent additional tables used for catering services (e.g. bar, serving tables), however, there were no unexpected costs in food or service.    From a process perspective, Chris handles the front end (e.g. sales and tastings). Natalie handles 'everything else'.  Nathalie becomes your point of contact after the contract is signed.  I came to the realization of this myself.  It was a little confusing at first as I thought we would continue to work with Chris throughout the process. Nathalie is super easy to work with, organized, and flexible.   In the beginning, I was skeptical as emails from her were short and I sometimes had to repeat what I had already noted in prior emails. I took that as lack of detail, but later on realized she is always on the go and is not in the office as often as Chris is.  She is a workhorse. It is amazing how she keeps everything all together.  She handled the ordering, planning for the day of, walk through, etc. On the day of, she managed all the activities including service, setting up tables/chairs, food, execution of the day of timeline, and break down clean up.  Our friend that had helped with coordinating day of activities and was a wedding coordinator for her church for many years complimented at how well she had things organized. For example, at a snap of her fingers, rose petals were positioned correctly. There were a few things we forgot to give her (like the seating chart).  Even with the many things that came up or things that were missing, she did a really GREAT job. On top of the great service and execution, the food was AMAZING :). We received many compliments from our guests on the food.  We would recommend D'Absolute for any occasion!

41.description: I own Prairie Production with my wife Kristin.Chris and Natalie are here quite often working for my clients,sometimes thre events a week. They are always producing high quality dining and service. I f every caterer took the personal care that D'Absolute does my life would be a cake walk.The one thing that strikes me is that a wedding is actually a very simple thing to pull off with style and grace.Iknow that and so do people that do weddings the trick is to help the bride and family feel that they can expect everything they have in mind. doing something for the first and only time can be a scarey thing.Chris and Natalie take personal ownertship of everything they touch.Anyone that gives a one star review to a business is probably not a rational person or has no ability to communicate.that sort of thing bears itself out when you look at the comments as a whole collection.Anyone can feel free to contact me if they have questions

52.description: D'Absolute catered my wedding shower in April '10 and my wedding in July '10.  Chris and his team were great!  The food was very tasty.  For my shower we had a brunch buffet...I highly recommend the french toast.  For our wedding we had passed hors d'oeuvres and fruit/veggie/cheese stations.  They customized their packages for my needs.  I most appreciated being able to provide my own alcohol and have them serve it (had to pay additional fee, but worth it!).  I look forward to hiring them again in the future.

50.description: The apple salad with Pecans, spinach and berries was delicious as were the grilled veggies.Great ending with Chocolate covered strawberries.All in all, a very yummy lunch!

4.description: LOVED this caterer! I can't recommend them more highly.Chris and Natalie were so easy to work with and helped us plan our day. Not only did they help us with the food, which was delicious, but they gave us suggestions about what would work and what wouldn't work in other aspects of the wedding. We didn't have a wedding planner but you wouldn't have known that based on how they kept the day organized. Mena was the coordinator from D'Absolute on the day of the wedding and she was fantastic. Overall, they were very receptive to any changes or additions that we needed to make. The food really was delicious and our guests told us later it was some of the best wedding food they ever had.

6.description: D'Absolute catered our wedding in August of 2014 and they were just hands down incredible. Chris and Natalie (dynamic duo) had everything covered. The first time we met with Chris, he said that he would be able to take care of everything and that we did not have to worry. In our heads, we were thinking that of course you would say that because you are trying to sell your services. BUT, everything that he promised came true. Chris and Natalie are more than just caterers. They understand the logistics and the wedding business so they know how to work with other vendors and get things done. I almost want to say that they were like our other wedding planner because they went above and beyond. That is just how good they are! As for the food, the one dish that sold us was the ahi tuna mini tacos. My goodness, those things are worth every penny. Our guests had the options of Filet Mignon, Salmon or a Squash Pasta. Everything looked and tasted incredible. We had multiple guests come up to us asking who catered the food because it was that amazing. I personally had the Filet Mignon and it was cooked perfectly.Chris and Natalie are truly some of the best in the business. They are both very professional but also very personable. Two great people doing great work and serving great food. Hands down, one of the best caterers in Chicago.

22.description: D'Absolute catered our wedding in July 2013, per the recommendation of a close friend.  They did a fantastic job with the food and we got numerous compliments in the days after our wedding.  The price was comparable to most of the other caterers we considered, but the quality of the food was by far the highest.  Chris did an excellent job suggesting a menu that would be a good fit for the season and our guests.  He also helped us coordinate our alcohol menu and gave us very helpful suggestions.  The bar and wait staff during the wedding were friendly and prompt.  Chris was quick to respond to phone calls and emails and made us feel comfortable every step of the way.  I am whole heartedly giving them five stars.  We felt confident that they gave us impeccable service and amazing food at a competitive price.

15.description: D'Absolute catered my wedding this past June and did an outstanding job! I've got several years of corporate event experience in my background and was pretty picky about who would be handling this portion of our wedding. We decided not to use a wedding planner so we knew the caterer was going to be responsible for more than just food, it would be the fine tuning the decor, layout, the flow, set up and tear down, etc. Chris was excellent about welcoming us in for a tasting (which far exceeded my expectations!) and answering all of my questions. He listened and understood our vision, helped us refine it when necessary, and wasn't afraid to tell us when we were heading down a path that wouldn't work.Once we signed the contract we worked directly with Nathalie who was amazing! Just like Chris she helped us mold our vision into a really cool experience for us and our guests including a beer tasting during cocktails and some late night Chicago dogs and mini grilled cheese sandwiches. She was easy to work with and each time my husband and I met with her we'd walk away talking about how happy we were that we picked D'Absolute and Nathalie would be doing this with us. While I had done a number of corporate events, I'd never done a wedding. And Nathalie did a great job guiding us when necessary. When it came to the actual wedding, D'Absolute and Nathalie nailed it! Set up was done ahead of time, the food was excellent, they made sure we had drinks and food at all times, worked with all the vendors to make sure it was seamless and went with the flow when the schedule changed on the fly. They went beyond "food and drink" and really helped us orchestrate the experience we wanted. It exceeded our expectations, I HIGHLY recommend D'Absolute!!!

57.description: I think I posted this on the wrong D'absolute. Sorry. I meant the one on Irving Park

20.description: D'absolute catered our wedding at The Newberry Library on 5/24/14 and did an absolutely AMAZING job. We first met we Chris early on who took our food vision and created an absolutely delicious menu! We had many comments from our guests about how great our food was. The whole team was a breeze to work with - Chris, Natalie and Mena especially.  Natalie specifically was present for the entire event and made sure everything went off without a hitch. I also really liked how she always made sure my husband and I were eating and drinking.  The staff in general was fantastic and even loaded up our car with the things we needed to take home at the end of the night.We couldn't have asked for a more perfect day and D'absolute is in large part to thank for that! We recommend them to everyone!!

36.description: we used chris and D'absolute for our June 2012 wedding at the Newberry Library.  We had originially booked another caterer, but 3 months before the wedding we started looking for a new vendor to work with.  We contacted everyone on the preferred list at our venue, plus some others...Chris was by far the easiest and most pleasant to work with!He worked with our budget and helped us plan the event of our dreams.  When we saw the reception hall on our wedding day, it was just as we had pictured.  Plus, we got so many rave reviews on the quality of his food!  He was easy to work with, quick to respond to emails/calls, and priced just right!  I would recommend him to anyone I know that is planning an event!

14.description: When I was planning for my August 2013 wedding with the Glessner House museum, I learned that D'absolute Catering is the exclusive caterer for the location, due to their knowledge of the space and respect for the somewhat regimented guidelines of the museum space. My fiance and I were originally a bit concerned to not have a choice in the matter, but after reviewing the menu, chatting with Chris and Nathalie, and enjoying the most comprehensive "tasting" ever, we were hooked!Chris and Nathalie not only deliver on exquisite food, they will work with you on your menu personally and help identify the best options for your budget. Plus, they are lovely to work with! They try to help make the process as easy as possible - one example was when my sister was shipping some alcohol for the wedding (Glessner museum allows you to bring in your own, a real cost saver!), but it needed to be shipped somewhere with a liquor license. Chris helped take care of that, which took another worry off of our plates.At the reception itself, Nathalie was very hands on with her staff to ensure the service - and their brand - lived up to what we expected. A lovely touch was her putting aside some appetizers for me, since the bride is running around a lot! We were wholly pleased with the service and the food, and would highly recommend D'absolute for any and all of your special occasions.

12.description: GOOD BEEF.   Didn't try anything else, Caveat Emptor....but I will be back for the BEEF

3.description: The gyros is good, but sometimes they cut the meat a little too chunky. The mozzarella sticks are battered instead of breaded like most, and they were quite tasty, but you only get 5.I've had the polish sausage before, and it tasted like good quality beef. I would advise yelpers to stay away from the corned beef melt and the vanilla shake. The corned beef melt was dry and skimpy, and the meat had a strange smell. The milkshake was the worst I've ever had in my life. My shake was very icy and severely lacking in sugar and good flavor.

1.description: The food is good, service it good although sometimes rude. Their gyros are the best! Nice little place to have a quick lunch.

2.description: This is my go to place for roasted chicken!  The chicken is tender, well marinated, and juicy.  They are also very generous with the rice and potatoes which are included with the meal.

9.description: My wife and I stopped here last nite to pick up a quick bite after our camping trip.  I got the chicken souflaki  pita.  It was the tiniest thing ever!3 nuggets of chicken, one was 80% gristle too.  2 slices of grilled red onion the size of a nickel, and a few thin tomato slices.   Luckily I got the large fries to fill me up. Not worth it otherwise!My wife had the patty melt.  The bread was barely buttered when grilled, more akin to eating a cheeseburger on wonder bread!Oh well.

10.description: I've been driving past this place for a couple of years and am glad to have finally decided t stop in. The chicken special is a good deal. The chicken is prepared well with skin just beginning to turn crispy. Rice was in a lemony kind of gravy. Garlic bread was OK but tasted as if it had been prepared to long ago.

4.description: The chicken kabob was ok but not made from scratch thats for sure.  There was one other person there which made me wonder. The booths were hard wnd uncomfortable and the owner wasnt very friendly. I will go somewhere else next time. The owner is a very unpleasant unhappy man. If youd be nicer to people they might patronize you more often. Jay at jays beef and his group are super  nice and friendly.  Guess i will go there next time. You Mr Flip make me feel unhappy and i shouldnt have to be because of u.

6.description: Decent food. Service was terrible. Got the order wrong and then got rude when I questioned him about it. Then a few guys who worked or owned the place came in and gave me the evil eye until I left. It was definitely not special enough to go back after that act. Plenty of other places for a gyro or burger in the area.

15.description: I feel the food is so so,yet I keep going back.Nothing special but if you just get off the montrose or Austin bus and are hungry it will do.

0.description: I've had their chicken souvlaki (kabob) dinner multiple times, it's always very good.  Can also recommend their half chicken dinner.  Both are competively priced and in my opinion more tasteful than other restaurants I've been to locally.

5.description: Gross!!!!! I had a pork kabob and the pork was still red on the inside not pink but red! It was not cooked all the way. They put the meat right on the pita and the pita bread gets nasty. This place is a joke.

13.description: Had the Gyro Plate and it was not bad .  Maybe next time i will get the Greek Chicken special.

11.description: It's right in the neighborhood so I've experienced it a few times. Probably won't go again though, chicken dinners are cheaper than other places for a reason, potaoes weren't very good and neither was the garlic bread. No salad with the dinner either. Wasn't the worst but not the best either

8.description: LOVE LOVE the 1/2 chicken dinner!! I have eaten this so many times its unreal!! Greek salad is also very good! This is a must try !!!

14.description: I had not such a great experience at Broilers. The food was so-so at best. Places like this are literally a dime a dozen in this city, so since the hamburgers suck here, I'll just go elsewhere.

7.description: Some of the best french fries that you'll find on the northwest side of Chicago.  The shrimp basket & gyro sandwich are also tremendous.  The Italian beef sandwich is subpar, unfortunately.

1.description: Tom is great and so is his wife! When Tom is slammed with customers his wife takes care of my son and leaves him looking great! His wife actually cut my hair today and did an amazing job!

2.description: Tom's a great dude.  Will stay late to get that last minute haircut in.  Pleasant environment.  Men's basic haircut is $5! Can't beat that!

0.description: I still drive to Tom's even after moving out of the neighborhood. He and his wife know how to give a great men's haircut. I never got compliments on my haircuts before I found this place. They will use a straight razor to get the edges and your neck.  It is worth the drive. Cash only.Edit: I just learned that they have free parking in the back of their building. This is a big plus since parking on Montrose can be a pain around rush hour.

3.description: This the "Hot n ready" pizza place that NEVER has anything hot n ready when I come in!  Always a 10-15 min wait. Complete bs.

1.description: I'm still scratching my head trying hard to write this review because I know how hard it is today to find a decent job for anyone but I put the blame on my visit today on management because you should train your front of house employees on when to dispose of dry,tasteless pizza its simple a freaken timer people hello. I don't care if it's $5.00 pizza or a$35.00 pizza their is a thing called FIFO first in,first out. Don't ever serve crap. This manager should be retrained or fired their is no excuse especially when your business is $5.00 items. I will never return here what a shame. I hope they get it together for the kids job security sake.

2.description: Worst pizza ever! Hot n ready not! We waited over 20 minutes for a burned piece of bread. Check my pictures.

5.description: It seems like the pizza is never hot and or ready here.  $5 gets a you a pizza...not the best pizza but a pizza but you can get ample amounts for entertaining guests at a garage party.  ALWAYS ask for the free cookies with the pizza, why not! Say you have 10 kids.  Only reason why two stars was because of my last visit.  I tried to get two pepperoni pizzas...of course they weren't ready.  A couple minutes later I see the hot box freshly stacked.  I'm still patiently waiting for my order. So another customer comes in, an impatient one.  Orders, guy tells him 15 minute wait.  Go walks around for two minutes...asks for his order and gets my pizza...meanwhile why the clerk forgot about my order! while staring at me the whole time.  My hot and ready wait was about 30 minutes.  I was pizza treated.

6.description: This place smells like my childhood.When I was a kid and the Ninja Turtles owned my soul, all I wanted to eat was pizza, and the only place I wanted it from was Little Caesars, probably due in large part to the legendary playland on Harlem and Foster.But I'm older now, and my taste buds have matured. That's what I wish I can say. Alas, I cannot.  I know Little Caesars is to pizza what Nickelback is to rock and roll. I know that. So while I felt ashamed as a Chicagoan to walk out of and home from Little Caesars with a large pizza in hand, especially in the tall shadows of Giordano's and Pete's #2, that shame isn't enough to deter me from going back again. And again and again.Sometimes I'm in the mood for good bad pizza. Five bucks and my dignity for a large pepperoni that's ready the moment I walk through the door. What a steal! #pizzapizza

7.description: The manager at this location is a complete ASS!!! I went in there last night to get two pizzas. While I was waiting I was bending my credit card in my palm of my hand. The card snaps in half but isn't completely broken. So It's my turn in line and I order what I needed to get and I hand the cashier (very nice kid) my card and said "be careful when you slide it, I just snapped it and it's about to break into two pieces" the cashier said "no problem I'll be as careful as ever". He slid my card 3 times and it wasn't working and the cashier said "don't worry I can fix this let me grab some tape and fix it for you". He comes back with the tape and before he can even tape it his asshole manager says "no give me the tape it's not our job to fix what he broke, let him do that on his own time". He grabs the tape and walks away. I have NEVER felt so disrespected in my life. What kind of manager does that to its customers??? The cashier offered and the manager acted like I asked and demanded it. The manager is so unprofessional and a big douche bag. If I ever see him again I'll ask for his name and I'll call and report him to the little Cesar's company and get his ass fired.

8.description: The best, hottest & cheap pizza. This location is by far one of the best in the city.

0.description: Not too many around that I know of, but I go here when i need a crazy bread fix.  On the corner so the intersection can be busy, and it does have a lot that gets cramped as there is another couple of businesses here.People inside are nice.  Inside is clean.  But the manager here was a pretty cool guy.

4.description: The pizza here is always hot & gooey, I usually have to flip a coin when I decide to go to little Caesars for pizza for a quick lunch or dinner option because sometimes I get it hot and other times just warm but not here, it's been perfect every time I go here. That's a rarity at other places.

1.description: My mom went there about 3 times to get a perm from Eva.  She liked her until the last time in January 2015.  Eva was talking NONSTOP to a guy and was not paying attention. My mom said her neck was burning yet Eva said it was fine and did nothing.  It's 4 months later and my mom still has the scars on her neck from that perm.NOW TODAY, I decided to go get a perm from there, just not from Eva.  I talked to the owner, Maritza and she told me she could do it at 2:30.As soon as I walked in, a woman asked what I wanted and I told her I was there for Maritza.  She said she could give me a perm but I said I wanted the owner to do it.  The lady said she would wash my hair and I said fine.  As she was washing it she said she gives great perms and I told her if Maritza said she was good at it she could give me one.That's when things got REALLY uncomfortable.  The owner and the worker started fighting about what size rollers to use on my hair....right in front of me!  The worker kept asking me which rollers I wanted and i said I had no idea, I haven't had a perm in 25 years!So that settled, she was just about to start rolling my hair when another customer came in with an appointment.  She started muttering under her breath about Maritza saying that appointment had been canceled.  I told her Maritza could just do my perm.So Maritza comes over and is about to start my perm when ANOTHER customer comes in, 5 seconds later she leaves me and goes behind a curtain.  I asked the worker where Maritza went and she said to thread the ladies eyebrows!!  REALLY!!  I had been in that Salon for over 30 minutes and only got my hair washed.  Needless to say, I got up and said I'm outta here!!  The owner, Maritza said it will only take me 5 minutes to take care of this customer, she has 2 kids and doesn't have time to wait,  Really again, my time apparently wasn't as valuable as this other customer.  I got up and left!!I WILL NEVER GO BACK to that Salon.  WHAT A WASTE OF MY TIME!!

2.description: First review!!!! Have been cutting my hair here for almost 2 years with Rosely she does an anazing job everyone always compliments my hair cuts :)

0.description: So, I took a gamble and went to Shear Art Hair Studio because its conveniently a few blocks away from my home and I'm so happy I did! Maritza was super nice and she gave me a great cut and style. I just walked in and showed her some pics of what I wanted and that's exactly what I got. I was hesitant, because going from long to short is always a scary thing, but I'm so excited! My hair looks great, and the price was more than reasonable. This place is a hidden gem than I'm so glad I found! A+

58.description: Thank goodness Josi's finally opened!!! Just made it before the 9pm closing time, love, love, love, the orange sorbet and cream!!! Will have to come back to try different flavors, I do like that they have flavor dividers. It is super cute, come check it out!

56.description: This new shop is literally three doors down from where I work so I checked it out in the middle of the day on a Wednesday. It's definitely very kid-oriented with a play area and plenty of candy toppings for the yogurt, but I'm not complaining! I got the French vanilla and Valencia orange "josie twist," which tasted like a dreamsicle. It's self-serve and you can put as many toppings on as you'd like! At $0.46 per ounce, your cup can add up fast, but I will definitely be coming back for a sweet indulgence every now and again this summer!

29.description: Been here TWO times this week and love it!!! Gram's fav is chocolate strawberry and mine is the Josie's pull: salted caramel pretzel mixed with California tart. YUM!!!

42.description: I thought the shop was just darling and I did enjoy the frozen yogurt but after buying just two small deserts my bill was over $10.  I loved the experience, but my budget won't let me come back as often as I would like.  I especially like the fact you can make it yourself.The staff was also wonderful.  Thank you!

23.description: Josi's is cute and clean but the topping selection and flavor variety is a bit limited compared to other self serve places in the city. It seems it will serve its purpose in the area since there aren't a ton of other options nearby, but this isn't anything exceptional. And some of the toppings were a completely stale. Yes, it's open self serve and this will happen from time to time but graham crackers shouldn't be hard and smell of cardboard. Just my two cents...

47.description: What an excellent addition to the neighborhood! The space is bright and cheery--the perfect place to enjoy your yogurt/topping creation. The yogurt is high quality and healthy so I feel (slightly) less guilty when I pile on the candy. Love the constantly changing flavors--gives me even more reason to keep coming back.

8.description: 5 stars for this cute little neighborhood sweets spot.I walked in around 8 on a Wednesday and was surprised to see the place was pretty full. I headed toward the back of the store, where all the frozen yogurt was. I was disappointed to see there were no taster cups. My friend told me she was sure they had them (she had been there before), but there was such a long line to wait in that I just decided to pick some flavors I thought I'd like for my cup. The selection isn't as huge as at the chain fro yo shops, but with about 10 choices, that was more than enough for me. I ended up with the strawberry and berry tart flavors.Next came the toppings. I was impressed with the wide variety of options, again, because this isn't a chain store. I went on the light end with toppings, choosing only peach boba, mochi, and my absolute favorite - marshmallow fluff topping. Not even all the big shops have marshmallow topping, so Josi's gets an extra star from  me for that. Really, the only topping I usually get that they didn't have was Captain Crunch cereal. I know, it's weird, but it's so good.We didn't wait in line to pay for too long. Even though the line was long, it went by quickly. At the end, my yogurt ended up costing just north of $2! What a deal!We ended up staying there to eat our treat. That's when I really had a chance to look around the place. First of all, there's a dressed skeleton at one of the front tables by the window. He was wearing Blackhawks garb. Cute. There were board games and a ton of items for kids to play with. There was even a bunch of paper pieces set out that customers were encouraged to "write an idea" on. Then, hundreds were hung on the wall. The ideas I saw ranged from "I love ice cream" to "I hate pink" to "Go Hawks!" very cute idea. There was a machine that let you purchase $0.50 poems from a local poet, and there was even a container set out that collected food to donate. Needless to say, the place had a great vibe.As we left, the woman working who I assume was the owner thanked us for coming in and told us to have a great day. It was the cherry on a lovely experience at Josi's. I'm so glad my friend (who lives nearby) took me here. I'm sure I'll head back every time I'm in the area.

31.description: I really like this place. It's cute, it's really kid friendly, and we come here a lot. Our daughter likes to play in the play area, and my husband and I can just hang out and chat. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that they haven't changed their flavors since we've started going there (about 2 months), and although I like a few of them, it would be nice to get a little variation. Also, I'm a little concerned about it once the weather gets cold, because they don't have much at all besides frozen yogurt. You can get a regular coffee or iced tea, but that's it. I think this place would be better for fall/winter if they expanded their coffee selection or got an espresso machine. In any case, this place is a great addition to the neighborhood, and we'll keep going there!

34.description: This place is great. It's clean inside, the employees are friendly, and the yogurt is fantastic. I've seen a few other reviews that say this place is expensive - it's not. It's cheap. The first time I visited I spent under $2.50, and the second time I spent just over $3 because I got a little fancy with the toppings. The great thing about this place is that it's self-serve, which allows you to make it as big (expensive) or small (cheap) as you like. I'm not a skinny dude, but even I can't fill up a large and pile toppings on it and finish without going into a sugar coma. I've seen people do it while I've been in there, so of course they're going to pay a lot. The bottom line though, is that these same people wouldn't want a heeping serving if it wasn't fantastic. It is, so check it out.

16.description: Okay so after having dinner I decided to stop by for dessert and this place is amazing!!! Love their topping selection and best part someone pay it forward and my frozen yogurt was free. Now I have to go back and do the same for someone else.

13.description: Creamiest froyo I've ever had at the best price I've paid. The flavors are inventive such as salted caramel pretzel. The toppings are abundant. I love the gummy frogs and hot fudge. There is a lot of indoor seating; no outdoor. There is street parking. This will be me and my girlfriends dessert spot this summer!!

11.description: Really good frozen yogurt place in the hood. Best tasting yogurt that comes from a small farm in Aurora. Try up 10 your flavors and all of the toppings that you can think of.  My son tried the dark chocolate and pink lemonade flavors. Kids loved it and stuck around to play in their small play area. Ask the owner Barbara about all of the cultures and proteins that are in her delicious yogurt.  If she stays open for the winter, ask about the soup and chili she also serves. A must try in this area.

39.description: They offer a variety of yogurt flavors with delicious toppings, hot and cold beverages and have plenty of seating. Another added bonus is  their men's and women's bathrooms. The employees are friendly and helpful.

37.description: I love that the Portage Park/Six Corners area now has Self-serve Frozen Yogurt place.Josi's is a cute shop--cool color layouts. I love that there is a toy corner so little ones have something fun to play with if they need a little diversion. Josi's has 8 flavors to choose from, plenty of toppings (candy, fruit, mochi, chocolate) and probably what some people would totally dig--little cup dividers so if you hate mixing your flavors, you can keep it all divided. The flavors are good--I had strawberry, rice crispy and coconut.  A little on the sweet side for me. But the consistency is smooth and creamy; refreshing. I wish the toppings bar was kept a little tidier--the counter was kind of messy.  But that might attest to how busy they are? My favorite is still Yogurtland but Josi's is nice to have in the neighborhood.

0.description: This place is great! The yogurt flavors are really tasty and the selection of toppings can't be beat. The shop is very cute with lots of little activities (play area, board games, chess, etc)I like it better than the major chains and the prices are better too! And I always feel better supporting a great local businesses.

38.description: We came in for froyo and couldn't help but be completely enchanted. There is just enough selection of flavors and the toppings are extensive, I love that they had so many! It's the perfect local spot and I'm so happy to have the option now in our neighborhood. We will be returning soon for sure!

51.description: Their frozen yogurt is creamy, delicious, and inexpensive. They have varieties that are low fat, dairy-free, and I'm pretty sure I saw a sugar-free option.The inside is bright, colorful, and clean. The staff is attentive and friendly, and they even give out tiny cups for tasting their different flavors before you decide what you want to purchase. There's also a small play area for kids in the back.I'm not sure why it's marked here as "moderate" for price. My husband and I both got a small cup and loaded them with toppings for $5 and change.

27.description: Im loving the jeff park area lately with all these new additions! My favorite being Josi's yogurt. Such great service. Great flavors and interesting toppings! Higher quality that Forever yogurt and Red Mango. Great prices, friendly people awesome yogurt. Not to mention very close to me. My only qualm.... Im moving to skokie. DAMMIT!

32.description: Josi's is my new fav place!! Very nice and clean frozen yogurt spot. Their flavor selection was great and they actually had strawberry. The taste is amazing, doesn't taste watery like all the other frozen yogurt places.

54.description: Been going to Josi's since Day 1. The make-your-own experience is fun for the kids. Enough but not too many fro-yo favors to choose from and then so many toppings to have some fun and variety. The price is pretty cheap. A small cup comes to about $2.50. The staff is very friendly. They also have juice and coffee. For parents looking for a quick treat, this place is way better than McDonald's. I hope they start having kid events on weekends or something like balloon twisters, storytellers or magicians. That would be cool.

48.description: Found this place through google. Was looking for the nearest frozen yogurt place and found this Josi's. Walked in and the owner was very nice and polite. Love the variety of flavors. Also love the decor of the establishment. Very cute and chic. Will definitely come back!!

44.description: My kids LOVE this place.  Seriously, they beg for it regularly.  It's like kiddie-crack.  It's self-serve fro-yo, with several fro-yo choices, and they even offer little dividers for your cup, if you want multiple flavors from different spouts.  There are a lot of no-fat and low-fat options, and TONS of toppings.  Lots, and lots of toppings.  IMO, the cereal toppings rock!  I see they have added a sugar-free option, which I think is good.  I am concerned that there is a ton of sugar in these (as evidence by my kids completely bouncing off the walls after we go there--which they do NOT do with ice cream).  They have a small play area with toys for kids--probably best for kids under 5.  I'm so glad to see more small businesses (with food, my favorite kind of business) popping up at 6 Corners.  This place is great!

24.description: Really good frozen yogurt place in the hood. Best tasting yogurt that comes from a small farm in Aurora. Try up 10 your flavors and all of the toppings that you can think of.  My son tried the dark chocolate and pink lemonade flavors. Kids loved it and stuck around to play in their small play area. Ask the owner Barbara about all of the cultures and proteins that are in her delicious yogurt.  If she stays open for the winter, ask about the soup and chili she also serves. A must try in this area.

7.description: Recommended!  On par with other places like Forever Yogurt.  It is much more of a local place than a chain.  Very nice selection of quality yogurt with many toppings.  The place is totally kid friendly with toys and games.  My personal favorite is Tahiti Vanilla with peanut butter sauce and fudge.  Bring your kids!

49.description: I was excited when I heard Josi's was opening locally. With summer just around the corner May was a great time to open. I finally came in with my 5 year old this afternoon. You can choose from eight different flavors of yogurt. Strawberry, chocolate and vanilla are always there and the other five vary. There are a ridiculous amount of toppings. Over thirty. It's self-serve and you pay by weight. I had Dreamy Dark Chocolate and Sea Salt Caramel Pretzel. I chose Kit-Kat pieces and chocolate caramel chocolate mini cups for my toppings. Yummy. It was less than $8 for the two of us and we did not have small helpings. Jodi's is so cute inside. I love the decor. The yogurt is good and reasonably priced compared to most yogurt places. It's a great addition to the neighborhood. I hope it has much success.

40.description: So yummy! Great place for a summer night! My daughter and I went for a late night FROYO run and we were not disappointed.  Flavors are great! And you can sample before you commit.  The rice crispy treat flavor and the coconut were sooo good.  Atmosphere is inviting--books and games so you can come hang and stay a while.

53.description: I just stopped into Josi's with my 2 kids. This place is wonderfulThe price can't be beat. Under $10 for 3 ice creams. And the bottled water is $0.75!!!The decor is simple and cuteThe owner is very nice. She sat down near us and chattedAnd most importantly... The frozen yogurt is delicious. Lots of variety to choose from. Too many toppings to decide. I highly recommend Josi's

30.description: Very cute shop. I've been here twice and have enjoyed the no sugar added vanilla, strawberry and dark chocolate flavours. My boyfriend is a huge fan of the rice crispy treat flavour as well. This is his favourite spot for fro-yo because the location is so close to home and there really aren't any other places that serve fro-yo as close. Great location, great fro-yo and great service.

46.description: Great new fro-yo place! Super cute and friendly! Need to add a couple seats outside so can bring dogs. Delicious choices though!

1.description: If you're in the area and want a quick, "customized" frozen treat...try Josi's.  I like to use the paper divider to separate my flavors. The flavors taste fresh, natural and creamy...they have a consistent frozen treat formula. The value is not bad and decided by weight. The shop is clean and accommodating.Why only 3 stars? The selection has varied and unfortunately there's no notice or any rhyme or reason to it. You go back a week or two later and it's like the yogurt guessing game. The staff is nice enough to give you samples but don't know what flavors they're going to keep or change out.

55.description: We've been here with the kids a couple of times since they opened, it's a very nice little place with good seating and a little play corner for the kids.  The frozen yogurt is good, inexpensive and there are lots of great flavors and toppings.  We can walk there so I'm not sure if there is anything but street parking, which is easy enough around here.

9.description: Always a joy for all - service with a big smile. We love how they cater to our kids! They have toys in the back with a big play area for all ages. They have multiple choices of flavor a and toppings - all for a great price. We got two for $7.

26.description: As someone who lives far from any food related places, I was surprised to find out that this cute little froyo shop is just around my neighborhood.I love that there's a variety of flavors and toppings. This is a perfect hang out place for people who just want to chill for an hour or two. They even have board games and cards that customers can use. The place is child-friendly too because there's a spot where kids can read or play while moms or babysitters enjoy their froyos.Did I mention there are waffle cones available?! Yum!!!

25.description: One of the best frozen yogurt places I have ever been to. Their flavors are always real good. Even though they always change, you will always find a flavor that you will love. Some of my favorites have been salted pretzel, apple pie, strawberry and watermelon. There are several more that are just as good as well. Good selection of toppings and very friendly staff. Definitely a great place to get frozen yogurt. It's also the savior for the neighborhood seeing as there is a lack (essentially non-existent) frozen yogurt places in the neighborhood. Is you are in the area definitely check it out.

12.description: Fantastic place!  Friendly staff and delicious frozen yogurt with a bounty of toppings.  The prices are extremely reasonable so you'll probably get more froyo then you can eat!They currently have a cinnamon bun flavored frozen yogurt.  Get it.  It is one of the most amazing flavored I have ever had!

21.description: I love Josies.They are very friendly and I always feel very welcomed! and the flavors are amazing I just love them. I honestly have to come at least twice a week. So happy to have something like this in the neighborhood and very modern place.

17.description: I love that the Portage Park/Six Corners area now has Self-serve Frozen Yogurt place.Josi's is a cute shop--cool color layouts. I love that there is a toy corner so little ones have something fun to play with if they need a little diversion. Josi's has 8 flavors to choose from, plenty of toppings (candy, fruit, mochi, chocolate) and probably what some people would totally dig--little cup dividers so if you hate mixing your flavors, you can keep it all divided. The flavors are good--I had strawberry, rice crispy and coconut.  A little on the sweet side for me. But the consistency is smooth and creamy; refreshing. I wish the toppings bar was kept a little tidier--the counter was kind of messy.  But that might attest to how busy they are? My favorite is still Yogurtland but Josi's is nice to have in the neighborhood.

10.description: Josi's is yet another frozen yogurt establishment.  With a great location on six corners I look for this location to thrive.  Josi's FroYo is self serve, like many other froyo places, but you also add your own toppings.  They have a large selection of toppings.  From cereal to sweets and syrups.  Josi's seems to target families as a lot of parents and children were here or on there way to this location.  They have a small play area with toys and games for families to partake in.The wife loves froyo so I'm sure I will be back to this location sooner than later.

5.description: Cute yogurt place with a sweet owner! Stopped in after dinner at Community Tavern. Great yogurt with low fat options. The yogurt is natural and has probiotics (without the usual sour taste these tend to leave in yogurt). Great toppings too.

3.description: Family friendly and the owner is active in the community, always doing toy, clothes, canned food drives. That's a business that I want to support!

35.description: Our entire family loves Josi's frozen yogurt!  The shop is just darling.  It is so exciting to see places of this caliber appear in Portage Park.  Keep up the great work and we will keep up with the great appetite!

19.description: Everyone is so friendly here. The place is so creative and fun for all ages. There are always new flavor and they taste good too! I love the "gormet" combinations you can make. Definitely worth a try.

28.description: After coming here many time, I'm finally writing a review.First, the actual froyo. Their flavors are hit or miss for me (obviously some will love what I hate), but the original tart froyo is amazing. Reminds me of berry chill, which went out of business. Some flavors are super rich (tahitian vanilla) and some taste like candy instead of fruit (watermelon). Good flavor spread and there should be something to appeal to anyone.Toppings: they have plenty of toppings in a do-it-yourself style buffet bar. My only complaint is that they use frozen fruit instead of fresh even when the fruit is in season. Service: Can be hit or miss. Sometimes people there are super friendly and helpful and other times I don't get acknowledged until I come to pay. Only time this is a problem is when I would like a sample cup and have to wait for one. Overall: Definitely a place I go to frequently and will continue to do so. Some small problems with the place, but I'm sure they will iron out the kinks soon.

45.description: Josi's is yet another frozen yogurt establishment.  With a great location on six corners I look for this location to thrive.  Josi's FroYo is self serve, like many other froyo places, but you also add your own toppings.  They have a large selection of toppings.  From cereal to sweets and syrups.  Josi's seems to target families as a lot of parents and children were here or on there way to this location.  They have a small play area with toys and games for families to partake in.The wife loves froyo so I'm sure I will be back to this location sooner than later.

33.description: What a sweet little shop! I stopped in because I saw the sign for iced coffee - didn't know there was delightful frozen yogurt. Please note that, while I still bought iced coffee, I sampled some of the yogurt flavors. The Rice Krispie treat flavor was spot on, and the Dark Chocolate was THE BEST I have ever tasted. Now, the iced coffee - made with locally roasted beans, and I chose Chocolate Milano syrup. Given the choice of 2%, skim, or cream, but the best surprise was when she offered coffee ice cubes! Really added a nice coffee undertone to the drink AND it did not get watered down during the remainder of the afternoon. Nice touch!

43.description: Rice Crispy frozen yogurt + sea salt caramel chocolates = It's delicious and really cute inside.

2.description: Did not know about Josi's! Right in the neighborhood! Came here for a fundraiser for Saint Robert Bellarmine! I think I'm addicted! Tahitian vanilla with sprinkles and fudge! Yep! I'm never going to lose weight!

18.description: I love Josies.They are very friendly and I always feel very welcomed! and the flavors are amazing I just love them. I honestly have to come at least twice a week. So happy to have something like this in the neighborhood and very modern place.

41.description: While it is a nice place, the yogurt is okay, and  the prices gorged me.  Twelve dollars for a small and large cups of froyo.  Prices are way too high to be a place that I visit often.  The prices made Josi's a "once in a while" place.

52.description: First place to open in this neighborhood that gives me hope for its future. Well decorated, affordable, and delicious. A great place to get your fro-yo fix.

50.description: Josi's Frozen Yogurt is an incredible place to sit , relax, and eat some of the creamiest frozen yogurt in a wide variety of flavors that periodically change....so just when you think you found the best flavor EVER they add a new flavor that becomes your best flavor EVER #2!! Service was excellent....lots of smile. Family friendly. Go here. Enjoy frozen yogurt here..... did I mention the 5,487 toppings? (Actually they have a few less than the 5,487 toppings that I mentioned....but only slightly less!)

4.description: I would render Josi's, overall, a 3.5 star.  However, it's a great place to hang out if you have young children with you.  As a married woman yet with no kids, I have to say I don't have a propensity for liking Josi's that much.  The yogurt varieties at Josi's cannot really compare to other franchised yogurt establishments, but the young lady at the register was more than happy to offer each and every patron free samples.  Hubby and I respectfully declined and went straight to the yogurt machines.  I had the orange chocolate truffle.  I had to say that I will pass next time because the orange flavor tasted odd, and the chocolate portion of the yogurt tasted weak and diluted.  Hubby's pistachio/vanilla combo was a better choice.  While Josi's yogurt didn't impress us much, the cost per ounce was on a lower side for the city standard: $0.47/ounce.  In average, most competitors in Chicago would charge $0.49/ounce, as of August 2015.  The sitting skeleton earned my half-star freebie.  I'm a huge fan for anything that associates with skulls or skeletons.  Thank for your warm greetings, Miss Josi, the skeleton.

6.description: I finally took a peek.  A friendly worker asked if I wanted "taster cups." Before I replied that I did I checked out the flavors, labels and cleanliness. I was pleased with all three categories so I asked for three cups.  While I was getting my frozen yogurt (original tart and a berry flavor right next to it but I can't recall the name) I was thinking about topping it with whipped cream and how yummy that would be. So I walked over to the toppings; not too interested because it was mostly candy. But right before the cash register I see whipped cream and other yummy stuff. I was so happy.It was very reasonable. I sat at a very cute table in a very clean environment.  Josi's really made my night.

22.description: My wife and I are regulars here and love this place but there have been recent changes we aren't too thrilled about......please bring back the fresh blueberries and strawberries please!

15.description: This place made my kid stop hounding me for Yogurt Square in Lincoln square...... She eloquently expressed to me "Mom, I like this place better than Yogurt Square, I can't wait to come back!!" And I agree! We sure will be back, the flavor selection was awesome, the toppings were delightful, and the woman behind the counter was super pleasant. And it's so very conveniently located near our home.

57.description: Was in last night for the first time. Wanted to come here since I first stalked their FB page. My daughter has the same name, so it was basically in the universe that we make a trip as its also located  in my hood.  Got two types of swirl for hubs baby and I and it was standard froyo, not as many choices as other places but really, that's over whelming when you have 10 diff flavors 20 if you count the swirl. I also bought a blueberry scone I'll try tonight. Tons of toppings. The place is just adorable. And really reasonably priced.I would imagine they get a lot of foot traffic, but would benefit from a big sign outside.Will def be back.

20.description: Really Good Froyo Like the vibe. You can see a lot of neighborhood folks and catch up on local happenings. Typical Froyo setup. Josie herself is often around.

36.description: I love, love, love Josi's. Great flavors, and an even greater atmosphere. My favorite so far has been the blueberry tart, but every flavor so far has been delicious. She has a lot of different toppings to choose from. It's a great spot, go soon!

14.description: As someone who lives far from any food related places, I was surprised to find out that this cute little froyo shop is just around my neighborhood.I love that there's a variety of flavors and toppings. This is a perfect hang out place for people who just want to chill for an hour or two. They even have board games and cards that customers can use. The place is child-friendly too because there's a spot where kids can read or play while moms or babysitters enjoy their froyos.Did I mention there are waffle cones available?! Yum!!!

28.description: Great slim & fit spinach & mushroom omelet- very fresh, great service and very clean

1.description: IHOP in my understanding is a mediocre business with mediocre service and food and that's okay. What's not okay is that you have to pay $$ for.. lets just say a breakfast you could've easily made at home for half the price. More irritating is that you can't make your breakfast a little more interesting by adding roasted tomatoes, or cucumbers on the side. Very very limited options.I rated this place two stars because of my experience today.- Hi, I made my order on the phone- What your order?- Four eggs- What your order?- I said four eggs- Four eggs and that's it? (He didn't even try to look up orders before that dumb repeating question, when he did it pulled up right away)- Four eggs, hash browns, blah blah blahHe leaves for a couple of minutes and comes back with my order. As you can see, not a hi, not a thank you, nothing, pure business and I would be okay with that if I had to pay %20 less.All that being said, I have to disclose that it was a hard test, what can be more challenging than taking orders on a busy Thanksgiving morning. I didn't expect this IHOP to be that busy.

39.description: Unfortunately International House of Pancakes (IHOP) has been around a long time and many of their locations are dated, including this one. The food is decent and the service quick, but the dcor is frighteningly out dated. I have yet to be unhappy with the selections or the quality of my food. It a nice place to dine when everything else is closed.Pros: Decent food, Cheap Price, ParkingCons: Decor is a bit datedOverall Rating: 3 of 5Recommendation: Tolerable (decor)

9.description: The reason for three is because of the effort I see that they put into customer service. The food just isn't up to IHOP standards in my opinion. It's not as fresh. The staff however is nice.

29.description: I called to order for pick up for a nice late night snack this evening.  The phone rang for about 90 seconds and I hung up.  Undeterred, I rechecked the number on the company website, and others, and redialed.  Again, nothing.  This time I let it ring a solid two minutes.  So, since the website reads that this location is open 24/7, I sent my husband out in the freezing cold with our food order in writing.  It is about 3 miles from my house.Upon his arrival, he informed me that they are OUT OF TO-GO CONTAINERS and therefore could not provide us with to-go food!  WHAT?!  How does something so basic get overlooked?  And why don't they have a back-up plan?  Go to another IHOP and borrow some, go to Jewel and get some dang paper plates!  Anything!I was especially angry since I had called the location twice, before sending him out in the cold, and no one answered.  At least then I would have known.  So, I called them a third time.  This time I got the manager, Dan.  He was short with me and condescending, "This is a 24 hour restaurant, we run out of things, just like any other place."  Not apologetic, whatsoever.  I asked, "Don't you guys have a back-up plan?"  His response was, "Well, all we have is what we get when the truck gets here."  That was it.  No apology for the inconvenience, no idea of how to remedy the situation.  Just some attitude.  Needless to say, I will be calling later this week to speak with Dan's boss about this encounter and also ask them to address their lack of preparedness for running a restaurant.  I have worked at restaurants, and never did we let something so basic get overlooked.  If we needed something "on the fly", we went to the store and purchased it.  We even borrowed from competitors if necessary.  Anything to keep the customers happy.  This is not the case with this IHOP.  I am sincerely disappointed and very, very annoyed.

23.description: I've been to countless chain breakfast joints (in various states of intoxication) and this one manages to be one of the worst ever.  Not as good as the worst cliche.

5.description: I went to this IHOP just to have some coffee with my friend late at night last week and the service was fine.  It is helpful that they have bilingual staff.  The other times I've been here, the food has been ok and the prices have been reasonable.

31.description: It looks as if this place has been able to fix all of it's health department violations. Thank you god and baby Jesus that they have them all taken care of. This place is very close to my home and it is a solid place to go to grab a reliable meal.Every time I have went here it has (to quote the illustrious Ellen M) filled the void quite nicely. I have never had a bad experience here and I khave never had a knock my socks off experience either. The service has always been good and the food has been satisfactory!

25.description: Ok for starters there bathrooms are disgusting! Second i ordered a pepsi the first time it was fine. I got a refill and i had red dried up food inside my glass i didnt notice it til half my drink was done. I called the waitor over and told him i wanted a new drink and new glass. Ok no big deal i understand mistakes happen.Well it was my 2yr old my husband and myself. My husbands pancakes where ordered plain not even butter we he got them there was more red stuff cooked om them like they didnt clean there grill in there down timeMy 2yr old can live off pancakes and sausage she ate half a pancake and half of a sausage n looked at me with this disgusting face and flat out said "momma im not gonna eat that" well by the time i finished my food i started getting cramps in my stomCh. Let me make this clear i have a stomach of steel i can drink a cup of warm milk on a summers day then have catfish n be fine! Before my husband was done with his last pancake the waitor asked do need anything else or just the check? Ummm how about you let us finish first. So i went and paid for the check and my stomach cramps got worse and the mngr asked how was ur food? I cut em off and i told em it has nothing to do with not wanting to pay a bill or leave a tip(i left the waitor a $6.50tip) but as im signing the reciept im hvin horrible stomach cramps ur food was awful. And alm he could say is well im sorry. Sprry doesnt cut it for the pain in. I ate there almost 5 hours ago and i still feel like shit. I will be calling the health dept in the morning!

12.description: I went to this iHop location with two friends. Both ordered the bacon burger while I ordered the Split decision. When the food came, I noticed how small the portions were especially with the burgers! There were barely enough fries. My split decision was just okay because of the fact that the sausage and bacon did not look fresh at all. This location is also super dirty! There were flys and dead ones too by the windows. They should clean this up! The syrups handles were super sticky. They should look into cleaning that too. There was also a bad smell which made this experience less pleasant. The waitress was alright but she brought the check without even asking if we wanted something else. Overall not satisfied and never coming back here again. There are far better locations that actually try to make the place look decently clean and give bigger portions.

37.description: Good Food. Great service. A bit pricey. Overall a nice place to have breakfast, lunch and dinner.

21.description: Ihop was the only place open at the time of night. I've  never been to this exact location. I usually go to the one on Halsted (Boystown Area). But I've never had a bad experience at any ihop, so this one was a first.. On the particular day we went, it was snowing pretty bad.. The contracters that were shoveling the snow instructed us to parallel park the car instead of pulling into a park because they needed the parking lot open.. When we entered the restaurant, the older lady fussed at us about the car being paralleled parked. We told her what they told us, but she continued to fuss all the way to the table she seated us at.. She asked us what we wanted to drink, she promptly brought the drinks back. Came back to take our order. She took our order, brought our food. Then she asked in the middle of our meal if we wanted to move the car and park it right. (I wondered Why does it matter?) There are Only two other people in this ihop. The parking lot was big enough for our little Kia not to interfere with other people parking. But honestly how many more people were coming? So we tell her we'll move it when we leave (being a smart ass, I admit. It was rude but she was being rude). However, for the rest of  our entire meal she Never came back. By this time, our small glass of water was completely gone. We could hear her holding an extensively long conversation with one of her fellow coworkers. After another 15 minutes of her not coming to our table, we simply got to  just pay our bill and leave. As we got up to put our coats on, she rushed over with the check as she seen us getting ready to leave as if we didn't intend on paying. Because of this bad experience I will Never visit this ihop again.. She was beyond inconsiderate and simply not a good waitress. The little things matter..

16.description: First time being at IHOP & it was pretty good. I had country fried steak & eggs and it did not disappoint. It was a little packed when I went with my family so we had to wait a while, but I guess a full house is to be expected during a Sunday morning breakfast.

17.description: Based on all the reviews you would have thought this place was an actual dump site. To be honest, the food was ok, and so was the place. It does need some upkeep and investment,  but not as bad as people make it out to be.

10.description: been coming here for years. service and food isnt bad. But.. their bathroom and overall look is outdated therefore it looks nasty. i really dont like coming here anymore even though the food n service isnt bad. i hope ihop renovates this place it needs it bad!!!

11.description: I came in with my sister for a late lunch and the place wasn't too crowded so I figured we'd be in and out fairly quickly.  We were in and out but not for the reason I thought...Our waitress was pleasant so that's always a plus...wish I could say the same for the food.  I ordered the breakfast sampler and requested no butter on pancakes or anything if possible.  Well good came out quickly but there was a scoop of butter on the pancakes...she took it back in and brought it back out and said she thinks he only switched the top...well, they scraped the butter off and just switched places with the bottom cake so I wouldn't know...what if I had crazy allergies??  Then to top it off, my $9 platter tasted awful...the eggs were cold as well as all the meats...I had a couple bites of the (probably made hours ago) bacon and sausage and the eggs.  I ate most of the hash browns since I was able to drown it in ketchup. Overall a very disappointing meal.I won't be back to this location...they made me waste food and I HATE wasting food!

26.description: This place is ok if you have a craving for mediocre pancakes and service. I personally do not like using syrups on my pancakes or waffles. However, I needed to drown my food in syrup to get a somewhat enjoyable flavor.
