The pancakes were bland and unsatisfactory.The ambiance leans toward depressing and the service was... there.Next time I come here will be most likely never. Sorry guys.

27.description: This place was a little crowded but our waiter was cool. My boyfriend and I ate 2 plates and my only complaint is that they wanted us out of there so other customers could get a seat. I can understand that but they should let people rest their stomachs for a couple minutes instead of bringing the check when we take the last bite out of our pancakes. Food was good.

35.description: It was cold, ugly, the women's toilet was overflowed and the emergency exit was blocked by a stack of highchairs and booster seats piled on top of that - most likely due to people skipping out on the bill. I shudder at what the nooks and cranny's in the kitchen might look like. The food was blah, the wait staff was fine.This place is in serious need of an overhaul. They should change the name to The Rat Hole. I'll skip this place for sure next time.

8.description: Have been here a few times.  Keeps getting worse.  IHOP on Forest Preserve Drive by the H.I.P. much better.  Service was fine here.   Food was sub par.  Got me when I asked for one more salsa cup (2oz cup) which they only give u one for Chicken Fajita omelet to begin with (prob 4x that on omelet on Forest Preserve for free).  99 cents for 2 more ounces of salsa.  No thanks.

0.description: Our server was sweet, polite, and attentive. Can't quite put my finger on it, but the place just seems a little run down- maybe it's the lighting. Food is what you would expect from any IHOP. Minus two stars because: the bathrooms are always gross; as I was trying to have a conversation with my dad, I could overhear the loud employees complaining about work and personal issues; upon leaving, my clothes and jacket smells as if I was the one behind the grill cooking; and overall there's just nothing amazing to write about. Like I said though, it's IHOP- my expectations aren't too high, although in this recession, spending hard earned dollars, expectations should probably be high! ;) But seriously, I've been coming to this location for a number of years every other blue moon usually only because it's what's convenient at the time. Nothing amazing, but nothing too bad. I don't ever wake up on a cute, sunny Saturday morning and think of having breakfast here though.

38.description: Fills the void, doesn't offend.  It's small enough that they could probably put it on a lift and take it somewhere else, like those old photomats.

20.description: This Ihop had the worst customer service ever! I had to pour my own coffee and call the server when I needed something. Since the server never showed up on her own! Never again!

19.description: This place is terrible, probably the worst BLT ever made on the planet, soggy lettuce, old tomatoes, consistently bad service and food preparation at this location. Please avoid at all costs. When you pay at counter they take your receipt and give you one without the free coupon when you fill out the tellihop survey. Moldy booths, staff is brutally disinterested. A dump.

33.description: Went here once and the place was swarming with house and fruit flies, all the tables were riddled with what looked liked the nights before's food, stay far far away from this hell hole.

2.description: Yes, this is a 2 star report. I went out to breakfast with my two kids. My daughter ordered a turkey Benny breakfast with avocado and the avocado was brown. I ordered the same thing and the bread that came with this meal taste quite different. I will not be ordering this option again. My son ordered chicken fingers and fries and there was more chicken fingers and fries in his meal. Can we say golden nugget?

34.description: Okay so I came here before and thought, Oh well I will give them another shot to see if I was wrong the first time. Well, such a disappointment. The water was awful , the raspberry iced tea was awful, the omelette was really bad, the lettuce on salad was wilted. It was just a mess. Three of us all said the same thing. Although it wasn't the waitresses fault, the food here for me is definitely bad tasting. I give up, will not be going back nor do I want people to go there, its just a real mess.

32.description: My son and I visited this location on valentines day. It was his pick as he has in the past really enjoyed going here and did I as the food was good. Let me say that I was first apprehensive when we walked in and smell the stench something not pleasant. The front entry ways smells somewhat like a dirty bathroom. Upon stepping in the dining area I did not smell it anymore so I reconsidered. Normally when I smell that I walk right back out and leave. The service was horrible. We ordered foods that was pretty basic; a breakfast combo $7.99 (for dinner) and I ordered a turkey club sandwich.$7.99.  It was not busy. There were 2 servers and 6 tables. Our food took 45 mins to arrive. When it did my son's scrambled eggs were brown, his slices of ham had black burnt spots on them, the sausage was dried and shriveled. The bacon had a funny taste to it. The only thing good  and fresh on his plate were the pancakes. My sandwich had wilted lettuce,  stale bread and tomatoes that were not ripe, they were not even pink in color and the cheese was old. It tasted like a refrigerator. The edges of the cheese were dry showing their age. The french fries were also grainy which tells me they were froze and not cooked enough. Needless to say I did not eat my sandwich. It was buy one get one meal free so. It was not really a loss to me except of my time. I asked my server Angie how she would feel good about serving this food and she explained there was only one cook in the kitchen when it really needed 4. Well yes, when you have a valentines special of buy one get one you should properly staff your kitchen. When I spoke to her about anything she would look down very nervously to the extend I was afraid she was going to burst in tears. Today I come to find out today she is the acting manager of this hot mess. The place needs an over haul. The current owners have let this place fall apart. You walk in and see a counter full of "stuff" when you walk in and honestly it just looks bad and questionable. Go else where this place is horrible. I would not be surprised if it had several health code violations as well. Also I agree with the above poster the water tasted really off. They must have very, very old and rusted pipes. It was gross.

18.description: Give me a DGive me a UGive me an MGive me a PWhat does that spell?  Dump.  That is kind of what this place is.  It is never really the cleanest or very appealing to the eyes.  The last few times I have been here the food tasted like it was thrown against the kitchen wall & then put onto a plate.  I have been here over the course of many years & many different times.  I would say that the last few times here have gotten worse & worse.  The service here has never been awesome.  I understand that sometimes this place can be busy later at night & that there are only usually one to two waiters or waitresses but the service here is still not that great.  It takes a long time for them to come back to the table & check if you need anything.  Overall the food wasn't that good & neither was the service.  However the convenience of being open late is nice.  I don't know if I would eat here again.

13.description: My group of 5 friends arrived here to get some pancakes as a brunch type of thing. There weren't too many tables, and we were seated quickly. However, our waitress took forever, and she was quiet and hard to understand. She took our orders and it felt like an eternity as we waited for our pancakes. We did not get to eat for a whole 35 minutes as we waited. We grew more and more agitated because there were not that many people inside, although it was noon. Our waitress forgot an extra water and two sets of silverware, and it took her awhile to get back to us. When we paid, we realized that our waitress was also at the cash register, so I think they are understaffed. I ordered the Buttermilk Pancakes, and my friends ordered the French Toast, the Chocolate Chocolate Pancakes, and the Strawberry Banana Pancakes. My friend and I switched off two pancakes from our stacks and I tasted the Chocolate Chocolate pancake. The batter tasted off, not chocolately. My other friends would barely finish their stack because the chocolate was TOO overwhelming after two pancakes. My order was perfect for me. As for the friend who ordered the strawberry banana pancakes, they didn't give her the bananas until she was almost practically done, which makes no sense since they just have to chop them in. The strawberries were fake tasting and extremely syrupy. The French toast, my friend said, was alright. The food is not cheap at all either, ranging from easily $6-9 on pancakes. I usually never ever eat breakfast out, or brunch, since to me it is not worth spending money on breakfast unless I am on vacation. It was alright, I would stick with the pancakes, there really isn't a way to mess them up, which is why I avoided the eggs and other such items.

4.description: This is probably the worst service I've ever gotten anywhere. My son and I went for a late breakfast today and the wait time wasn't too bad. As soon as we sat down the waitress came over and began to rush us. We placed our order and the food was out very quickly. Good? Nope. Bad! The food was cold. The hash browns tasted like they'd been sitting out for a while. And since they seemed to be having a busy morning, maybe they pre-cook and then just serve? My coffee was cold too. There was no sugar. Our waitress never showed up to ask if we were okay or if we needed anything. And boy did we need everything! Food is mediocre. Service was bad. And the restaurant looks DIRTY. I will not be coming here again. I hope everyone saves their money!

24.description: Hola como estas! Let me segregate you in this corner because i think you can relate with our waiter. HUH i dont speak spanish?! what just happened? that was experience number 1..... Experience #2 Just as awkward... i should attempt to speak to their waiter in spanish and assume he cant speak english. well i walked in 4/27/2013 and wasnt greeted so i understood and stood there and stood there and stood there. Staff did not apoplgize for not seeing me or attempted to understand. HORRIBLE SERVICE! WE DROVE 10 MINUTES TO THE IHOP ON 9500 SKOKIE BLVD! AMAZING please save yourself the trouble and just drive a little further for a way better experience! the waiter made a mistake apologized and was curteous! Like night and day!

6.description: Service is very polite and courteous. However, I in the last three visits I asked for citrus chicken salad, which I love from there, but they did not have the dressing that goes with the salad. Restrooms need a lot of attention and rugs need to be changed. Management should take care of this if they want to improved their business.

22.description: The place is DIRTY... Me and the family went there after my sons football game. The place was super busy and usually that is a good sign that they have good food. Not at all, at one point we wanted to leave but we were all hungry. Table was sticky, iced coffee was gross asked multiple times for missing items from our order. The mens bathroom was so dirty I'd rather have used a portable potty.

15.description: Service was ok.Gave us the check all early and one of us wasn't done eating. Cup was dirty, food no flavor! First time their won't go back!

7.description: What can you say about a chain and a diner chain at that. Known for its breakfast they continue to vamp up their breakfast offerings to keep things new and fresh. There is nothing earth shattering or mind blowing that I can recommend. I just happen to like the one that is in my neighborhood. I know that it's close and that they are 24 hrs (should the need arise to visit at odd hours). They can get busy on the weekends, but they are pretty quick and efficient so they turn tables around fairly quickly. The staff is also pretty friendly which helps. So if you ever need a chain place in a pinch. This location should do the trick.

36.description: Food is uuuh.... ok I suppose, I have had better!   I like that they give you a carafe of coffee so you don't have to threaten to kill your waitressfor more coffee..   in my opinion, if you want a better breakfast or better type of diner food... go to either the Golden Nugget on Irving park or Lucky Grill on Milwaukee and Sunnyside.

30.description: The day that I went here it was super busy. My friend ordered coffee and the waitress brings a cup and pours coffee in it. As she sets it down my friend, boyfriend, and I noticed a stain on the edge of the cup. Who knows what it could have been. Lipstick stain? Previous coffee drinker? then the food comes and and it tasted okay. I had to wait a long time to get my water refilled. She messed up our receipt total and charged us for 2 coffees instead of 1 and an extra hot cocoa. Probably won't come to this location again.

3.description: ate there often and usually ordered the crepes.  Mother age 94 loved the crepes.  last time we had crepes the ordered contained one gummy and thick crepes under the others that were good.  seems to me a deliberate cover up considering two of us got the same thick crepe under others that were good.mentioned this to the cashier who's response was to have the waitress replace the order.really after we ate three quarters of the meal? and on our way out.  a so sorry would have been better.

14.description: It's an IHOP.  It does a good job doing that.  Service was friendly and the food was decent and it was comfortable. Pleasantly surprised based on other reviews.

56.description: I've only had the breakfast from this restaurant and it is very good. Small diner with low prices and good service.

29.description: So I feel like most of those stars are what my family would give this place. We go here often on the weekends just cause it's one of those friendly places with a simple menu and you know what to expect. I personally am not excited about the food, never really have been, which my mom and I debate about, so to each his own. But recently we went and enjoyed lunch. We stayed a while chatting over coffee (good coffee) and it dawned on me that the service here is on point, absolutely on point every time. Even when they are busy everyone is attentive, quick and friendly. And I want to end this review by giving a HUGE shout out to the one bus boy that's been working here for years. He is running around that place, getting the job done! I mean I am impressed by his intensity and amazed watching him. You go boy!

42.description: always drove by this place, finally stopped in. good service,  friendly waiters, cheap and good breakfast. the orange juice is AMAZING! will return

23.description: Came here with my family for lunch. It's an old spot. First the tables were leaning a little. Really to update the bathrooms really cheap soap and 30yrs old dryer. My food came and I thought it had a hair in it and Cheap bacon. I guess we got the last of the coke in the fountain so the lady said she was going to bring the other 10minutes went by so yes she forgot. Then took her forever to bring the check. Food was ok .

47.description: Great food and great prices at the burgundy!  It's a good neighborhood place for breakfast, lunch or dinner! The breakfast is delicious because everything is fresh! Fresh squeezed orange juice, homemade ham off the bone,  turkey, hashbrowns and corned beef hash, need I say more?I enjoy going back again and again...

8.description: We haven't been here in years but the service and the food are still great we love their breakfast

31.description: This place has really good burgers one of the best in my opinion also the waitresses are really nice not snobby like other restaurants. They have great prices too much cheaper then other restaurants. Only complaint is lack of parking you have to drive around for awhile and this is a little thing but everybody was given a bread basket when they sat down except for us.

34.description: Diner.  Quality food and excellent service.  Decent prices.  Would definitely recommend for breakfast or lunch "regular food".

16.description: Solid neighborhood diner. Reasonably priced, friendly staff, good food served in a timely manner. The owners often on site and friendly and courteous. Seems to be a perennial favorite with CPD, perhaps because of the neighboring uniform store! definitely one of our favorite "go out to breakfast" places.

13.description: When will this dump close down? The Greek owner is a cheap stingy jerk and the waitresses are all recovering alcoholics with nasty attitudes. The owner also owns some apartment buildings down the block and I've heard about their rodent/roach infestation. Just plain nasty

11.description: The Burgandy is one of my frequent breakfast stops. Quality, hot, fresh items you would expect, all reasonably priced. Solid go to. My comment relates to the honesty of the owner and I hope speaks volumes about the place. Had breakfast last week, paid with a crisp one hundred dollar bill. (Or so I thought). Before I could get out the door he caught up with me and handed me the second hundred that was stuck to the first. I never would have noticed or figured it out. Jimmy is as good as they get.

39.description: Over the last month have been there 4 or 5 times as travel allowed. A good early morning spot, at least for me. Freshly prepared breakfast and good service.  Got in and then was able to get on with my day.

37.description: A nice cozy spot to go with your family or friends. I absolutely love their coffee & their service is great. I ate their chicken kabob and it was very juicy and cooked very well. Definitely a place to check out.

0.description: Burgundy Restaurant is located on the southeast corner of Austin and Irving Park.  I feel that almost every neighborhood needs a family-friendly, affordable diner place like this.  Fortunately, Burgundy offers "breakfast-all-day" option and it's open until 10pm from Mondays to Saturdays, and 9pm on Sundays.  Breakfast is Rosa's favorite meal because it may be the only meal she can have in a peaceful, non-hectic setting.  However, hubby and I wanted to grab a quick bite before heading to a friend's Halloween party.  We ordered these following dishes:- tuna melt: it came with soup (navy bean soup was his choice) and fries, unless you ask for a special accommodation.  Hubby munched it quickly before I had a chance to talk to him.  I guess I was caught up with the soccer game playing on TV.  - steak skillet: it came with a choice of toast (wheat in my case).  Poached eggs were done impeccably!  Those were really the highlights.  Otherwise, the steak and hash browns were passable.  Hubby also requested coffee, so the grand total came to $24 after tax.  Credit cards are accepted, yet unsure about the minimum purchase.  Like I have mentioned in the first paragraph, a diner like Burgundy is essential for a neighborhood.  It's within walking distance and I know I will be back for certain.

38.description: Sunday Brunch. How I love thee!My boyfriend and his family love coming here to have brunch and he was talking about it all week. I was starting to get a bit jealous because I wanted to try this place out too. Luckily we all decided to go there for a quick brunch. WIN!Cute little place. Lots of seating. It's def an older diner and nothing too fancy. We parked on the street and my boyfriend's mom told me that there are some free spots but mostly metered parking. The staff at The Burgundy informed us that you can actually park across the street at the bank on the weekends. DOUBLE WIN! We were sat promptly and we placed our orders. I ordered the HOMEMADE corned beef hash with 2 eggs. My boyfriend had the scrambled eggs with bacon and sausage. Both of our meals came with fluffy pancakes. Both of our meals went off without a hitch! Both of them were absolutely delicious. My BF also ordered some orange juice. This ain't from concentrate either, fresh squeezed, baby! It was a nice added touch to a fantastic brunch. I believe that this place would be best for breakfast and lunch. I am looking forward to my next visit to The Burgundy.

51.description: For better or worse, joints like this are my cultural heritage. I can imagine myself eating at the Burgundy when I'm an old lady. I will do the crossword puzzle and drink decaf with equal. I will pay my bill with exact change, counting out even the pennies, but I will still leave a good tip.There's nothing to say about a place like this. Either you love it or you don't get it. It's usually empty. The food is predictable and greasy. Old guys sit at the counter; the waitresses know them by name. One can eat alone comfortably. Bring a newspaper. The Burgundy made me feel normal. I like that.

27.description: Nice option for a diner in portage/Irvin park. Easy to get a table and fast service. Get the eggs any style and toast - nothing special outside is that. Free wifi is a bonus.

32.description: Good breakfast. I ordered the Spaghetti with Meatballs for 8.99 and I am very disappointed.

54.description: A typical neighborhood family restaurant. Been here a hand full of times , left feeling alright about it every time. The standouts for me here are the grilled sandwiches , cheesy , grilled meaty and good. The soup is good , the BLT was standard and good. Can't sing the praises too much but  it's good , cheap and they have a decent menu selection.

48.description: We used to go here for dinner while we were working a lot.  Clean, good food and great service.  Honestly, I never had anything bad here.  Great neighborhood place.

44.description: Have been here for breakfast and lunch. Nothing special about this diner. Average, bland, and greasy. Golden Nugget isn't great, but it's better than Burgundy.

24.description: Great family restaurant just like the olden days. Waitress use order tickets to take orders and a old fashion cash register. There is a variety of food like a patty melt and turkey club.

7.description: Pretty average diner. We like it because it's close and they always give my son whipped creme for his pancakes.  It's not the best breakfast food I've ever had but I will say they serve the most perfect poached eggs I've ever seen. They are cooked to such perfection that they almost look fake. Perfect oval shape, smooth texture. Someone in the kitchen knows what they're doing. The rest, meh. But I love those poached eggs.

49.description: I started writing this review right after I first went...but the experience was so lackluster that I couldn't bring myself to post it.  It reminded in my "Unfinished" reviews list for months and months.  Today I got a "Write More" compliment and decided to post it...so here it is....A while back, I led a friend on a wild goose chase around the Northwest side of the city.  I claimed I wanted to go to Super Cup diner.  Well, Super Cup Diner was out of business, so then we kept driving.  After making a stop at Eli's Cheese Cake world, we were starving.   We drove down Harlem and made it to some little Italian conclave.  We tried stopping at Capones for pizza and pasta, but they were closed for a private party.On to drive some more, we finally spied Burgundy Restaurant and went in.Meh...the food was boring, The waitress was very slow to get to us to take our order and very fast to complete it, so I ended up forgetting to ask for cheese on my veggie omelet.  The rye toast ended up as white and everything was just palatable.It's standard diner food, and at least it's not closed like everything else in the vacinity.

40.description: i love this place. my boyfriend and i go here at least twice a month for breakfast/brunch.  it is 10 times better than golden nugget and the service is exceptional.  the food is delicious and the portions are huge.  give it a try you wont regret it!

53.description: My friends tease me about the way I order and eat breakfast out at restaurants.  I am kind of high maintenance when it comes to ordering, because I like everything a certain way, i.e. bacon crispy, omelette well-done, spinach fresh, not canned.  I just like what I like.  Anyway, I have three words about the Burgundy: HOMEMADE CORN BEEF HASH, okay four really.  I am not southern, but I love homemade corn beef hash.  I have not found it anywhere in Chicago, and believe me, I always ask.  It is delicious.  Along with the corn beef hash, they have great coffee, fresh OJ, great omelettes, pancakes excellent.  I have not had a bad meal or bad service there. I even take out-of-towners here, and they love it.   As far as breakfast goes in Chicago, this place is worth the drive west.

30.description: What can I say? The Burgundy was my Mom and sister's best kept secret from me until my sis moved to a northern suburb. I move into the area and my Mom takes me here. Perfect day for a burger, fries...chili...ordered the Burgundy burger and it was unbelievable! Grilled green peppers, onions, crispy fries...nice 1/2 lb tasty meat on frickn' rye bread! Good coffee and a waitress that was almost too friendly( I can only take being called 'Honey' three times in a day).Will definitely be back for the chicken kabob! Now if I can only get them to offer Half Acre beer!

46.description: Looking at the place from the outside you would think that this is a cozy restaurant that boasts good homemade food. Inside is you will find depressing decor with OK food that you can find anywhere.

1.description: A great find with clean comfy booths, nice waitstaff and support, and dang good food ! Impromptu coffee and breakfast gathering randomly wound up at Burgundy. Insert gag about keeping it classy, I don't mind, Ron. Burgundy can handle a joke, a curveball, or, in our case, a boisterous five-top that was grateful to be here.It was only afterwards outside that I noticed one of their signs trumpeting the Ham off the Bone. Well, it caught my eye when it mattered - on the menu. Trust that the sign if you must, but they are signing the Truth. Cause, y'know? It was tasty. An unapologetic border of fat, that you could do with what you please, but most important: It was meaty and not too salty. It appeared in my Pancake Sandwich. Two eggs, Two pancakes and between the cakes rested the ham. I opted for poached, separately, and they were cooked just right -- without me specifically even asking. And yes, they came on the side. Always a good sign from the kitchen and the Staff.The meat scramble that someone else had looked awesome: full of meat and veggies. It was huge, so he had a lil somethin' somethin' for later. Another asked for fries ,if they were available at breakfast (this was before 10am). Again, no problem. I wish I knew of Burgundy Restaurant when I lived in Chicago. It's not my typical neighborhood, and that's what makes it that much cooler. You can come home again - and still find 'new' places.

55.description: This place is sick. the soup tasted like old granny socks and diluted chlorine. AND the fries tasted like soap. I should not have ordered a burger at this place. Maybe pancakes woulda been better. Never coming here again.

9.description: I am updating this neighborhood diner to five stars, based on two particular things. Obvious improvements, whatever they may be, in the kitchen and the server that identified herself as Misty.Both of these have contributed to making this provider of simple, honest food, in the tradition of the Chicago diner, upgraded from 4 to 5 stars.My major complaint in the past was breakfast was great but lunch/dinner sporadically good. Problem solved. AND Misty and her near telepathic bus-person have upgraded the service from good to great.Way to improve. Kudos to this decent, honest, wholesome restaurant.

26.description: Decent food, decent service. Nothing majorly wrong with this place, but nothing amazing either. Classic old fashioned diner that's nice to go to every now and then.

25.description: Service is always friendly and breakfast food is always good! Love my neighborhood breakfast place ;-)

12.description: I love this place. Very good food and served not and ready very quickly. The cream of chicken soup is amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone.

21.description: This place sucks the chicken is raw, the eggs are over cooked and oily the waitress is a bitch. And they really need to clean up and update.

17.description: Came here with my family for lunch. It's an old spot. First the tables were leaning a little. Really to update the bathrooms really cheap soap and 30yrs old dryer. My food came and I thought it had a hair in it and Cheap bacon. I guess we got the last of the coke in the fountain so the lady said she was going to bring the other 10minutes went by so yes she forgot. Then took her forever to bring the check. Food was ok .

10.description: Came here with my girlfriend. Our waitress' section was not at all busy but it took nearly 20 minutes for her to take our order (with attitude). After serving our food she ignored us while tending to every table around us.My meal came with soup but was never given. When we asked for it we were again ignored. I had the country fried steak and it was bland and soggy. And I was thirsty. I still remember that thirst. Why won't she refill our drinks?The only thing The Burgundy is serving is disappointment.Stay away.

5.description: Husband and I were in the neighborhood and thought we would give this spot  a chance . The Husband ordered the Reuben sandwich which wasn't good , their cream of chicken soup wasn't that good either . I had the chicken panini and from a 1 - 5 I would say  2.5 not pleased with our visit here probably won't ever be back .

3.description: Ordinary diner.  A better menu than my movie theater food option.  No trek necessary.CORN BEEF HASH SKILLET ($8.99) -- skip it.  Impossible to taste Corn Beef Hash as it is hidden by Potatoes.  Nicely chopped green pepper and onions.  Perfectly cooked over easy eggs.STEAK SKILLET ($10) -- may be a better option.CUP OF CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP ($2) -- a bit skimpy and scarce on ingredients.  Good flavor.  You may get a bone.BOTTOMLESS COFFEE ($2) -- tinted, light, typical diner coffee.  White Sugar is the only option. ALCOHOLIC DRINK -- available.  Stick to basics.  Beer.  On the rocks.Additional 1-star because:- Chicago PD hangs out here- one of two restaurants near Patio Theater- open- VENUE -- Clean.  Organized.  Blast from the past niche.- SERVICE -- "Ms K" has a good heart and a sincere concern citizen.  Staff works as a team with quick clean-up.

35.description: I don't know....disappointed here. I guess the mayor started it with paying 3.50 at the meter but...even taking that out of it was still very disappointing.  I sat down into a seat sticky like a chair at the admiral theater at closing time.  Then the coffee tasted burnt and never got better with refill. My wifes diet coke came to the table with a disgusting unrecognizable object floating in it. It was apologetically replaced but should have never made it to the table. The biscuits and gravy were completely tasteless. I guess with the Median age of the patrons safe flavorless bland food comes with age? I hope not. The toast was dark and not buttered. Please note if i am ordering the country fried steak and biscuits and gravy please do not try to save my life by sparing the butter on my burnt toast. The wife's turkey club looked good but how do you mess up a club sandwich. She said the vegetable soup was good. Service was adequate at best. Prolly wont go back. There are better in the area. I miss johnny's uncle Jim's.

19.description: I love this place. We have been coming here for years and I've always had good food. My favorite dishes are the omelette's and the burgers. The waitresses could be faster and nicer but the bus boy is absolutely the best! He takes care of the customers extremely well. Thank you for doing such a good job!

28.description: they have a cheesburger club sandwich...wrap ur minds around that...now i havent had it yet but it sure sounds deliciouscorned beef is yummy but the bread sucks

45.description: Standard diner fare and prices, but a notable lack of taste. Everything was just bland. The chicken noodle soup almost certainly came from one of those bags where you add water, and the corned beef  on the Reuben sandwich was substantially lacking in flavor. Nice atmosphere, prices, and service, but the food was just bland in every way.

33.description: Very good place for breakfast

43.description: If your looking for that diner experience or the "greasy spoon" stop in.  I'm not giving 5 stars because I'm still not sure I been to a diner in the city that deserves 100% on score but that's just me.  To date though, it is my favorite diner in the city. Food is consistent. You get exactly what expect after reading and ordering an item off the menu. It's family owned and operated and everyone is as nice a can be. I keep going back when I have the hunger for a skillet with ham off the bone. I always have a wonderful experience and I'm betting you will too.

2.description: Cozy old school diner feel! The people were friendly and the food was good. We got their gyro plate which was fantastic, it came with homemade fries (amazing) and a cup of soup that was ok, typical chicken noodle soup. Overall good place to go for a home cooked meal.

18.description: Service and food is always great. Staff is always attentive to my two toddlers and they know how to make their patrons feel right at home.

41.description: We've eaten here several times for breakfast. It really is pretty good! The orange juice is actually fresh-squeezed, pancakes and french toast are better than average, eggs seem larger than usual, and they give you plenty of ham. The servers are friendly, and the owner sometimes stops by to ask if everything's ok. Though the decor has seen better days, it's clean. This is a great, friendly neighborhood spot with home-made food. There's only street parking, so bring some quarters.

52.description: Not horrible by any means, but not the greatest diner either. The menu is overwhelming and has near everything you can think of, which to me, usually means that the food is "just okay."My friend and I stopped there for a light bite to eat while taking a walk through my neighborhood. It was a Saturday night and the place was DEAD. I think there was one other party there, which is okay, and typically doesn't alert me, except that half the lights were off in the restaurant. That made us feel rushed. My friend had breakfast: eggs, bacon, pancakes. The pancakes rocked. I had spinach pie that the waitress recommended. It was really good and not greasy like some of them can be. It came with a fruit plate. I wish the fruit was fresh. You can't really get a fruit plate wrong unless you serve old, mushy fruit which is what I got. Old watermelon and mushy grapes. Lastly, there was a bug on our table when we sat down. Ewww!

50.description: I have to start by saying I love breakfast places! I have been to this one twice before and it was always "nice", never stood out. I had a veggie omelet with feta, substituted hash browns for mashed potatoes since they didn't have grits. The veggie omelet was fairly good. Not mind blowing amazing, but not dry, well cooked on the inside, lots of veggies, and the feta was not too chunky. Yum. The gravy that came with the potato was unexpectedly flavorful (where did yoooou come from?)Now this is where the true stars are earned and I felt compelled to jump on Yelp. The waitress was attentive and very nice. My mother asked if they had cheese blintzes (God, mom, aren't you full?! I'll have to help you eat that, obviously, help you from yourself.) Apparently they didn't since she went back and checked...BUT then came back and said they could try to make them. They used cottage cheese in the middle and they were...AWESOME. My mother being a huge fan of them declared them the best she has ever had and I concur. SO, points to them for accommodating our craving and fulfilling it so nicely. Burgundy you have exceeded my expectations.

4.description: WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE HERE!!! Just went in here with my girlfriend for breakfast I got a skillet and said no cheese I have a dairy allergy please make sure there is no cheese. When they bring out my my food I start eating and then realize that it was very stringy and what looked to be mozzarella cheese in the skillet. The waitress came over and I said are you sure there is no cheese in this I have a dairy allergy and I will get very sick. She continued to say listen that is the egg there is no cheese. Me being stupid decided to take a couple more bites and realized there was 100% cheese in it. The waitress was avoiding my table checking every other table while I proceeded to get pretty sick. When we finally got her attention I said listen there is cheese in this and I'm going to get very ill. She took the food and came back with another skillet. This one was not stringy at all and had no cheese. I continued to ask are you sure there was no cheese in the other one because I will get very sick. She said there wasn't and I had to explain to her how the other dish had cheese and was stringy when I lifted it with my fork while the one she brought out was not stringy at all. She did not understand. She was foreign and had no idea what I was talking about I made her get my check for me so I can get out of there because I was getting sick. I rushed out and the minute I got outside I started throwing up. This place is literally a mess the waitress I had was absolutely terrible rude and had no care for the fact that I was getting ill from the food she kept saying had no cheese in it which it 100% did especially when my girlfriend tried it and knew there was definitely cheese. I don't even know what else to say about this place I'm disturbed that they showed so little care or understanding for people with food allergies. I would really recommend do not go here if you have any sort of food allergy because they will ignore your request and put it in the food anyways. Absolutely worst experience of my entire life at a restaurant I wish I could give negative stars.

6.description: Wouldn't recommend going out of your way for here. If it wasn't for the fact my last few visits I took my chances and ordered some traditional Greek items that surprised me, I think I would give this place one star. This is the rare diner where for whatever reason, I have no idea why they can't get breakfast items right. Heck, it makes the mediocre pancake dish I got at Elly's Jeff Park almost good in comparison.If it wasn't for the fact my friends infrequently come here and that I sometimes go along to give them company, I'd never come back. Honestly if you're don't know the diners out on this part of town well, I'd suggest going to Lucky Grill instead. Heck, I have an odd feeling you might have a better experience going to Big Top(open 24/7 IIRC, and at least is open just as late if they now only do 24 hours on weekends by some chance), or A's instead(northeast corner of Irving/Naragansett, and too bad it doesn't stay open past 5pm). I badly need to bookmark the latter, for a future visit.

22.description: I love this place. We have been coming here for years and I've always had good food. My favorite dishes are the omelette's and the burgers. The waitresses could be faster and nicer but the bus boy is absolutely the best! He takes care of the customers extremely well. Thank you for doing such a good job!

15.description: Usually I only review restaurants poorly that give me digestive issues. Thankfully, I survived here.I walked in and saw a Wait to be Seated sign. Waited several minutes, started thinking I was invisible as the regular customers engaged in conversation with staff all around me. A very friendly waitress working the East room asked me if I was waiting for someone. I said just a big booth or a table. She said sit anywhere.I ordered Eggs with Ham off the bone from a different waitress. I remembered it being awesome in the past.This time, very thin and dry. The toast was undercooked. The potatoes were terrible. The waitress didn't stop by once to check if I was ok.I waited several minutes after I finished and walked to the cashier. On the way, my waitress asked if I was ready for the check. She totaled me out, and I told her I'm giving her a tip, handing out $2."But I'll be honest with you, I really didn't feel like it"

57.description: You can get anything from eggs and toast to full chicken dinners here.  This Americana diner has been here as long as I can remember. One of my favorites to get here is the chopped steak. It comes with Greek bread and sides. Their coffee is excellent and it is a favorite stop for Chgo. Policemen also.

20.description: ...for breakfast or coffee break. They have some challenges for dinner. The morning staff is excellent. They will make your experience one you want to repeat. Food is comfort food. Don't look for fancy. I go there on average one a week on weekends for breakfast. Almost never a botched order, and Tony is always at your elbow with fresh coffee. The rare oopses are quickly and courteously corrected by the owner, always with an apology and a promise to improve. I like these people, and I like going there for breakfast.Free wifi is nice for coffee breaks, too.

36.description: This is my favorite family restaurant.  The owners and Lori manage it well.  The food is always like a nice home cooked meal.  Their CORN BEEF HASH is freshly made from scratch, by one of the owners.  They have good CREAM OF CHICKEN RICE SOUP on Sundays.  The place is clean, casual, and an honest business in a quiet community.

14.description: We still give this place 5 stars especially for this area. Atmosphere is always friendly and inviting. Food quality is continuously good. Portions are pretty decent. Wait staff - there is a high turnover rate but they are all friendly. Owners are almost always there and talk with everyone. If there is a true problem with the food - not a case of you just not liking it - they remedy it rapidly. They always have 3 different homemade soups on hand. Not the best I've had but not bad either. And pretty much any meal except for breakfast comes with a bowl - not a cup- of soup. This is a diner type place. It's not a steakhouse so don't expect that quality of steak but you aren't paying that kind of price either. This is an all American diner type fare.

28.description: Decided to walk in on a Friday afternoon around 3pm. Waited only a few minutes for Rhett. It's nice they have someone just for those if us who are reservation deficient. Haircut took 30 minutes. Excellent atmosphere in the shop. Small talk and bantering between barbers as well as customers. Next time I want to try a shave in addition to my haircut.

1.description: Jessie is an amazing barber I cannot speak highly enough about his ability to paying attention to fine details.

39.description: I was a customer of Jesses back when he was at Belmont Barbershop and have made the switch to his shop since he is the man.  This place is the real deal.  This is a real barber shop .  Great hair cuts, no frills, and authentic.   Warning I would not recommend Jesse to Hot Yoga enthusiasts, this place is for real dudes.

9.description: I have found my barber.From the checkered floor to the older barber chairs everything about this place is awesome.I can honestly say, without hesitation that I just received the best hair cut I've ever had.I will be a regular.

29.description: Jesse is not a stylist or a hairdresser; he is a barber. Jesse knows how men's (and boys') hair should be cut. There might be hair on the floor when you walk in, just as there may be sawdust or welding fumes when you walk into any other workshop. Jesse is a skilled tradesman, and his trade is to make sure your mug is framed and groomed in the best way possible (or, I guess, however you ask him to). Anyone who's seen a terrible tattoo knows the difference between cheap and a good deal. Sure, you could go to the $5 chop shops all over the city. You could just as easily go get inked by some scratcher needling you in his mom's basement. But those who care want quality work, and to get the professional quality work that Jesse does (for only ten bucks more) is a great deal. Plus, he's a local guy running a small business in the community. Call ahead. Bring cash. You'll be glad to have found your new barber.

42.description: I've gotten my hair cut by Jesse for a couple years when he had a chair at the Belmont Barbershop, but now that he's opened his own place I had to try it out.  It's a beautiful shop with an old-school, 1940's look and feel.  Excellent (free) coffee, the same amazing haircut I've come to expect from Jesse over the years.  Prices are better than at Belmont, which is a nice bonus.  He does straight-razor shaves too, which is a really cool experience if you've never had one.Lots easier to park too...  there are some metered spots but if you park on a side street it's easy to park for free.  Really excited to see Jesse with his own barbershop.  It's an excellent addition to the *real* 6 Corners neighborhood (Irving Park and Cicero Ave).

23.description: Best barber shop in Chicago.  Jesse cuts my hair as well as my three boys.   Every haircut is done with pride.  He doesn't rush and makes sure it's perfect every time.

5.description: Excellent first cut at Jessie's from the man himself. I'm new to the area and had heard good things about this shop. They did not disappoint. I had a business trip come up on short notice and needed some serious work done. I made a same day 9:20 AM reservation online for either barber, scheduled it at 7 AM, and was done by 9:40 AM. No muss, no fuss. Just a great, affordable cut, on short notice. I will be telling all of my friends about this place.

31.description: Like many of the reviewers, I first started getting my haircut from Jesse at Belmont Barbershop.  When I first started going to Belmont, I got my haircut by practically every person, just to see who I liked the best.  That person ended up being Jesse.  This is not to say that Jesse is "better" than everyone there, I always got a very good haircut from each person.  I think that finding the right barber is more of a "I know it when I see it" approach.  That's how I feel about my haircuts from Jesse.  I have a high and tight with a side part, and it's exactly how I like it.Here are some pluses about the new shop:-Appointments are easier to get.  At Belmont, I feel like you need about a week of lead time for Friday or Saturday appointments, so if you forget, you will be stuck with a ragged cut for an extra week.  At Jesse's, I don't think I've ever had an issue calling a couple days in advance.-Appointments are a half hour.  At Belmont, appointments are 20 minutes.  Big difference.  Plus Belmont was very busy.  And if someone is late (which happens all the time, make it to appointments on time fellas), the whole system is thrown off, which is frustrating for barbers and customers alike.  At Jesse's, the process is more relaxed, and Jesse has plenty of time to get all of the details right.-$15 for a haircut, great deal.I will end with a story about what a good guy Jesse is.  He was cutting my hair one day at Belmont, and a guy walked in with a long beard.  The guy said that he was going on his first job interview in a long while, and he asked if he could get a beard trim.  The issue was that the guy only had a couple bucks; the guy wasn't unhygenic, he just was strapped for cash.  The person who was working the walk in chair said no (which was completely his prerogative, and I would have probably done the same).  Jesse told the guy to hang tight for ten minutes, he would trim his beard on his break.So support a solid guy who gives a great haircut.

25.description: I rarely ever write reviews but I had to after this visit. I've heard about Jesse from a few friends and I really needed a new barber after my last haircut. TIP: DO NOT EVER GO TO A $5 Barber. There is a reason why they only charge $5. That's my warning. But I got lucky, I called a few hours before and got an spot for a haircut later that day. I walk in a little early and Jesse was more than happy to see me early since he had no one before me. I explain what I wanted and he knew right away that someone messed up my hair bad last time I got a haircut, but he did his magic and I walked out with an amazing haircut. Simple as that. Both barbers were awesome to talk to and price was completely reasonable. Hard to find a great barber like this for only $15. So bottom line is that these guys know what they are doing and both seem like they love their profession so you get this sense of security that they aren't going to mess up your hair haha. But thanks again Jesse. Also Cash only.

12.description: Decided to walk in on a Friday afternoon around 3pm. Waited only a few minutes for Rhett. It's nice they have someone just for those if us who are reservation deficient. Haircut took 30 minutes. Excellent atmosphere in the shop. Small talk and bantering between barbers as well as customers. Next time I want to try a shave in addition to my haircut.

37.description: Jesse is the man; I have been getting my hair cut by him for the last few years and I followed him to his new shop.  His shop is what a barbershop should be; it's clean, welcoming, and it has a retro feel.  I've had cuts and shaves by Jesse and I swear by him.  Check this place out!

21.description: First time in the shop and before I had to say anything about my cow-lick and double crown, Jesse brings it up right off the bat. I was immediately impressed, as my hair can be very tough to cut. If not done correctly I will look like Alfalfa from the little rascals or a porcupine. Been back in Chicago since 2006 and before I met Jesse and Rhett, there was only one person I would let cut my hair. If you only want to spend 5 dollars for a cut, then I say to you in response, you get what you pay for. In my line of work a 5 dollar cut is not going to make the grade! Many, many thanks to Jesse and Rhett and much success!

16.description: I rarely ever write reviews but I had to after this visit. I've heard about Jesse from a few friends and I really needed a new barber after my last haircut. TIP: DO NOT EVER GO TO A $5 Barber. There is a reason why they only charge $5. That's my warning. But I got lucky, I called a few hours before and got an spot for a haircut later that day. I walk in a little early and Jesse was more than happy to see me early since he had no one before me. I explain what I wanted and he knew right away that someone messed up my hair bad last time I got a haircut, but he did his magic and I walked out with an amazing haircut. Simple as that. Both barbers were awesome to talk to and price was completely reasonable. Hard to find a great barber like this for only $15. So bottom line is that these guys know what they are doing and both seem like they love their profession so you get this sense of security that they aren't going to mess up your hair haha. But thanks again Jesse. Also Cash only.

17.description: Like many of the reviewers, I first started getting my haircut from Jesse at Belmont Barbershop.  When I first started going to Belmont, I got my haircut by practically every person, just to see who I liked the best.  That person ended up being Jesse.  This is not to say that Jesse is "better" than everyone there, I always got a very good haircut from each person.  I think that finding the right barber is more of a "I know it when I see it" approach.  That's how I feel about my haircuts from Jesse.  I have a high and tight with a side part, and it's exactly how I like it.Here are some pluses about the new shop:-Appointments are easier to get.  At Belmont, I feel like you need about a week of lead time for Friday or Saturday appointments, so if you forget, you will be stuck with a ragged cut for an extra week.  At Jesse's, I don't think I've ever had an issue calling a couple days in advance.-Appointments are a half hour.  At Belmont, appointments are 20 minutes.  Big difference.  Plus Belmont was very busy.  And if someone is late (which happens all the time, make it to appointments on time fellas), the whole system is thrown off, which is frustrating for barbers and customers alike.  At Jesse's, the process is more relaxed, and Jesse has plenty of time to get all of the details right.-$15 for a haircut, great deal.I will end with a story about what a good guy Jesse is.  He was cutting my hair one day at Belmont, and a guy walked in with a long beard.  The guy said that he was going on his first job interview in a long while, and he asked if he could get a beard trim.  The issue was that the guy only had a couple bucks; the guy wasn't unhygenic, he just was strapped for cash.  The person who was working the walk in chair said no (which was completely his prerogative, and I would have probably done the same).  Jesse told the guy to hang tight for ten minutes, he would trim his beard on his break.So support a solid guy who gives a great haircut.

10.description: Jesse was my barber while living in Chicago for a few years. He knows what he's doing and will take care of you. I'll definitely be stopping by for a cut whenever I head back.

11.description: Jesse is one of the best guys I know. I met him a couple years back when I randomly chose him as my barber for my first appointment at The Belmont Barbershop. Best decision ever. Now that he has his own shop, he's running it the way he feels he should which is great customer service and quality haircuts as his top priorities. Aside from Jesse, I don't trust anyone with my hair. He really knows how to cut hair, especially the classic gentleman's cut that has blown up as of lately. The shop is very clean with an awesome vintage feel. It's what a true barbershop should be. Call in and set up an appointment for a cut. You will not be disappointed.

26.description: I first found out about Jesse's Barbershop through Facebook updates from our alderman and others.  Enjoying articles by Brett McKay, about men returning to old fashioned barbershops, I decided to do just that.I am so pleased to call myself a loyal customer from the first visit!  Jesse and Rhett are welcoming and friendly to all, and they know how to give great haircuts for men!  I have had each of them cut my hair, and both do a fantastic job!I also have witnessed them giving haircuts to small boys, and I have to say, they are just as great with them!  Some barbers and stylists out there don't have the patience or skill to work with little kids, but these guys are great!One of these days, I'm going to get one of their classic, hot towel, straight razor shaves, too!Haircuts are $20.  Shaves are $30.Appointments taken on Resurva.com

27.description: I've gotten a couple of great haircuts here.  Super clean shop, very friendly owner, consistent service. Leave time, though - this is an experience in socializing and friendly service, and it will take a little bit longer than your stack 'em deep and chop 'em cheap barbers.. The price is reasonable, and I think they do take appointments (but I take my chances and just drop in).  Thanks for the great haircut, Rhet (or however it is you spell that).Tip - on the weekend, try the loading zone a couple of yards east of the front door - it's free on the weekends - if it's available, it'll save you a meter.

35.description: I'll make this short. I don't take the time to write reviews. I bounce around a lot from barbershops and hair salons. All I cared for was a simple hair cut. For the first time I walked away with not only a great cut but also with a pleasurable experience. The shop is tranquil, simple, and comfortable. The guys are genuine and professional. I found MY barbershop. Looking forward to be a long-time customer.

8.description: Jesse's Barbershop is a great addition to the Portage Park/Old Irving Park area. I have to admit that I am not very loyal historically to those entrusted. I don't know why either.I'm 100% sold on Jesse's Barbershop. 1. It's a very well run business. Call and make an appointment or sit your butt down and wait your turn. 2. Simple & Cool. It's a pure barber shop where there's no gimmick. Want a cut? Come on in. Also, Jesse & Rhett are chill barbers. There's no obligation for small talk but they're both pretty cool guys so don't be a chump and talk. Once before, when at the Lyric Opera House Barbershop, did I get a similar experience. Advantage Jesse's as the best cut so far for me in the city.Schedule an appointment and say goodbye to having to listen to some mom bicker with her seven year old at Great Clips.

0.description: I never write Yelp reviews, but this time I just had to!So I go in nervous as hell about getting a new haircut since I haven't it the top of my head in over a year. I needed a haircut because I'm starting a new job and they require I have a more traditional look. So I step in and sit and talk to Jesse about what kind of haircut I'm going for, while showing him a picture to illustrate my point. He tells me my hair is too short for the idea and I just say that's fine. He starts cutting my hair with the chair tired away from the mirror, and thank god because if I had to watch my hair cut I think I would've cried. I'm pretty sure he notices my tension so he talks to get me distracted. Nice guy to talk to and good conversation nonetheless. One of his other patrons came in for their appointment we all talked to. Finally, it was the big reveal and I was blown away! I couldn't even recognize myself! Both Jesse and the other guy were complimenting me and I felt great! Overall, great atmosphere, great quality at an affordable price, would highly recommend anybody looking for a great quality haircut to come here!

38.description: Jesse is a fantastic Barber.  He is cutting my hair for a few years now and I was happy to go to his new location.  The barber shop is looking great, old time feel with great prices and a good atmosphere.  I'll be back!

20.description: I would give more starts but the Yelp rating system does not go to 11. Jesse's Barbershop is a no-frills, no b/s, classic barbershop. There are two barbers, Jesse and Rhett, both of whom are masters of their craft. I would not go to any other shop in the city.I have not had to wait very long if I show up as a walk-in, but I've found it is better to call ahead in case they're booked.Wash the gunk out of your hair before going in; it is not super cuts. Don't forget to bring cash. Tip well.

19.description: I passed this place up a couple of times while driving and I always liked how the old skool barber shops looked so I made it a point to check it out.  When it was time for some grooming I went and made a visit and was greeted right away and there was an open chair.  Rhett (the barber who attended me) took me right away.  Everything was going ok until his appointment came in (which I had no prior knowledge of) and he told them he would be right with them.  I felt right away that I was going to get cheated of a good hair cut and beard trim/ shave.  Basically, he tells me that he wont be able to fully take care of me and unapologeticly.  But, I needed to finish my beard so I was willing to make it work with him and come back later, gave him a $20 (thinking that I was paid in full) and left.      2 hours later I came back told him that I would like my hair line to be tightened up  in the front.  He said he can't do it and wasn't trained on it.  Im thinking like really??  So "im like alright, ED Debevics of hair here."  So, I'm trying to talk him into it but no budging so I stopped asking and just wanted it to be over with.  Finally done, I gave him another $5 bucks and he said was it was $25 bucks more!  I only brought 25 bucks because I figured that covered the cut and the tip! So he immediately goes off, saying "I don't go to your job and expect it to be free!!"  I tell him I can comeback tomorrow to pay the rest and he's still upset so finally he was like "ok" assuming I would I never come back, and I left.   I'n my car now, like damn that was an expensive cut.  But i'm not a dead beat so I'm gonna come back and pay what I owe.  Then I had remorse about doing that because of how rude he was and called the barbershop and told Jesse the owner I won't pay the rest because I was treated rudely by Rhett.  He was apologetic for the misunderstanding and listened to my complaints so I figured Ill comeback and payup because he was being respectful and I just don't like owing people money.  I came back the next day and Jesse said it was ok on the rest and gave me his card if I ever want to comeback to make an appointment.      Moral of the story don't assume anything! 1. First time customer YOU the barber need to go over the prices before you perform a cut to protect yourself for something like this to happen, not everybody is like me and will comeback to pay. 2. Don't kick somebody out of a chair while your still cutting their hair. 3. Don't jump to crazy conclusions about people.So after all this you would think I would give a negative 5 if I could right? I'm not like that. Despite all that I did get a decent hair cut.  I like the way their clippers make my hair feel.  The place looks awesome and It provides of a more adult like atmosphere.  If you don't mind paying the extra bucks to avoid the rap tunes and the famous hair charts in most barbershop, this is the place for you.  They do more when it comes to shaves like  I guess what a lot barber shops did back in the day that was standard but now it's like "extra. "  To be honest I've gotten the same type of  cut at other barbershop considerably cheaper but like I said, Jesse's, in my opinion is considered more of an upscale shop to what most people are use to paying.  I would also recommend to go see Jesse unless you like cocky jerks go see Rhett

33.description: Ever since I've come to Chicago I've been getting my hair cut by Jesse. From the belmont barbershop to his current place he's the man to go to for your cut. Very knowledgable and really takes care of his customers.

2.description: Feeling fortunate to find this close to home jewel now that I'm growing out my beard.

34.description: I've been going to Jesse for a while.  Glad to see he started up his own business.  He's the best barber I've ever had.  Very skilled work the razor and always makes me look good.

32.description: Best barbershop in the city.  Jessie has been my barber for many years.  His shop is awesome!   Doesn't hurt that Jessie is a great guy with a big heart.  Highly recommend.  Once you visit you'll never want to go anywhere else.

18.description: I met Jesse when he was working under the name "Frankie Blades" or something like that, over at Belmont Barber Shop. It's always a pleasure to see young barbers expand onto there own journey and write the next chapter in there life but without losing there roots of where they been or what they've seen. Anyhow, moving forward. Jesse's barbershop is a diamond among the upcoming Portage / Jefferson Park neighborhood. It's a barber shop guys, so whatever Floyd's chain Salon told you what a barber is and what a barber ain't - screw that. Jesse and his young grass hoppers are 3 licensed barbers, not hair dressers. They cut hair like a barber which means tapers and the traditional classic cuts such as a slick backs, push forwards, pompadours, pomp, hard and messy side parts and whatever floats your boat. Come with a thick skin well... because you're hanging with the big boys now, not some soft spoken salon gals. Jesse works on appointment only and his grass hoppers work the walk ins. The cut is always solid so bring your waiting shoes because a good cut in chicago is hard to find. There is a reason you are in and out at these salons! The haircut price is way too cheaper so it's another reason the wait can be long sometimes. Jesse's offers some fine water base products for your grooming. To many years, Jesse's barber shop! :::thumbs up.

41.description: Jesse is one of the best guys I know. I met him a couple years back when I randomly chose him as my barber for my first appointment at The Belmont Barbershop. Best decision ever. Now that he has his own shop, he's running it the way he feels he should which is great customer service and quality haircuts as his top priorities. Aside from Jesse, I don't trust anyone with my hair. He really knows how to cut hair, especially the classic gentleman's cut that has blown up as of lately. The shop is very clean with an awesome vintage feel. It's what a true barbershop should be. Call in and set up an appointment for a cut. You will not be disappointed.

13.description: Jesse is not a stylist or a hairdresser; he is a barber. Jesse knows how men's (and boys') hair should be cut. There might be hair on the floor when you walk in, just as there may be sawdust or welding fumes when you walk into any other workshop. Jesse is a skilled tradesman, and his trade is to make sure your mug is framed and groomed in the best way possible (or, I guess, however you ask him to). Anyone who's seen a terrible tattoo knows the difference between cheap and a good deal. Sure, you could go to the $5 chop shops all over the city. You could just as easily go get inked by some scratcher needling you in his mom's basement. But those who care want quality work, and to get the professional quality work that Jesse does (for only ten bucks more) is a great deal. Plus, he's a local guy running a small business in the community. Call ahead. Bring cash. You'll be glad to have found your new barber.

4.description: It doesn't matter whether Jesse or Rhett cuts your hair -- you're going to walk out looking better than you did walking in.  Best hair cuts from the best dudes.

24.description: I have found my barber.From the checkered floor to the older barber chairs everything about this place is awesome.I can honestly say, without hesitation that I just received the best hair cut I've ever had.I will be a regular.

6.description: A tried and true barbershop.  Jesse puts a lot of work and detail into keeping the shop a traditional and old school style barber shop.  Everything from the rotary phone, to the work stations, to the plain old "barber shop" answer, it feels like my favorite of old time barber shops and is.  I used to live in the neighborhood, but continue to come here even though I've moved.  Rhett is my usual barber and he does an exceptional job and I always end up leaving feeling more than satisfied with the cut.    As with any traditional barber, the place is cash only and appointments are recommended.  I plan on coming here until I no longer have hair.  Thanks guys.

22.description: This is the only place that my 4 year old son will happily go to get his hair cut.  We always walk out of there with a great cut.  I love that the shop isn't glossy, just a great laid back spot with a cool vibe.  I'm so happy Jesse chose 6 Corners to open his business.

15.description: Jesse's the best barber in the city. The shop has a great retro look and a friendly atmosphere. If you're looking for a barber, I highly recommend Jesse.

40.description: Great haircut, great shave.  Couldn't be happier with the service.  Love the style, and old school feel!  Will definitely be back, and recommend to friends.

7.description: One of the most beautiful barbershops I've been to. Definitely a retro cool environment and a relaxed atmosphere. Jesse and Rhett are both great barbers! But be sure to make an appointment ahead of time.

36.description: In the land of fades, blowouts, graphics and line ups (portage park, six corners area), Jesse's Barbershop is a breath of fresh air for those who are just looking for an honest and authentic haircut.  No longer do we west chicago folk have to travel far east for a great haircut.  Jesse cuts hair by appointment which is great because I know I will get my haircut right at 4:30pm instead of putting my name on a board and twiddling my thumbs for hours at locations that do first come first serve only.

30.description: Great, traditional shop - personable barber. Great cut. Recommended. *Cash only*. Best to make appointments.

3.description: Jesse's great plus a great feeling baberbershop

14.description: I would give more starts but the Yelp rating system does not go to 11. Jesse's Barbershop is a no-frills, no b/s, classic barbershop. There are two barbers, Jesse and Rhett, both of whom are masters of their craft. I would not go to any other shop in the city.I have not had to wait very long if I show up as a walk-in, but I've found it is better to call ahead in case they're booked.Wash the gunk out of your hair before going in; it is not super cuts. Don't forget to bring cash. Tip well.

29.description: Amazing. Driving around on Sunday, looking for something different and caught the other reviews. Stopped in an hour before close, nobody there but me and the owners (?). Don't let that stop ya. This place is legit and I can't wait to go back. Owners couldn't have been nicer. Periogis we're made fresh as I ordered (pretty sure) and so so good. Cabbage rolls top notch! It's not fancy, but it is good.

42.description: In my attempts not to look weird, I occasionally end up doing weird things.  See, I had waited for 20 minutes to catch the CTA Holiday Train on the Blue Line, so I wasn't going to just ride it for one stop to Belmont (where the errands I needed to run were).  Plus, I thought it would look weird for a grown man with no children to take the Santa Train on purpose (but it shouldn't, by the way, because it's AWESOME!).  Anyhow, I decided to take it to Jefferson Park because it seemed like a reasonable, uncreepy, distance. But once there, I couldn't just wait on the platform and take another train back.  I had told total strangers that I was running errands in Jefferson Park.  So I had to follow through.  Right?  Unlike me, Teresa has nothing to prove to anyone.  She is old school and authentic Polish (just like her restaurant which looks straight out of the 1960s).  And there was no Polish or Eastern European techno music either.  Nothing was needed to add to the authenticity (she was playing 94.7 on the overhead speakers when I was there).  There are a few Polish places that could be described as "being like in your grandmother's living room" but this takes it to another level.  After you order - a process made somewhat complicated by needing to translate Polglish (i.e. "not filing" does not mean that the portion isn't large, it means "not filled") - the server goes right back into the kitchen and makes your food in full view of about half of the diner's tables.The actual quality of the food, however, shatters the illusion a little.  My pierogis, while plentiful, were lightly breaded.  This was just confusing and subtracted from the taste.  My "clear" beet soup, while it warmed me up from being outside, was actually clear (only sort of reddish) and void of vegetables.  And it had a sour kick to it that I wasn't particularly fond of.  Extra points, however, were awarded in my mind when I tried to order "borscht" and was told quickly in response, "beet soup."  How proudly Polish is that?  Screw the Russkies (even if borscht is Ukrainian) and their recipe!Such hospitality was shown to me, however, that I can't help but think fondly of it.  I was given a free potato pancake while waiting and a free dessert.  While it didn't warm my heart as much as the Holiday train, to know a little, family-style, Polish dive like this still exists in Chicago was pretty heartwarming.

23.description: Really solid food for a wonderful price! A friend and I came here on a Monday for lunch and we were the only patrons. We were able to chat a bit with the wonderful older ladies who were working here. I had 12 pierogis (I asked for a mix of flavors) for $4, and they were all delicious -- particularly loved the cheese and potato one!

47.description: So yes, it's like Grandma is cooking for you, but what the hell is wrong with that?  I fell in love with this place.  Not sure what Bialynia C. saw while eating, but that place was so freaking clean, you could watch Teresa cooking your food from the reflection off of the 60 year old tile work in the kitchen.I will say, it's not for everyone. The service is slow and the cooking time is even longer. But you feel like you are at the home of a good friend or something.I could see a scene from a David Linch movie being shot there, no question. SO GO, have a cocktail, order the best potato pancakes, order the meat, and sweet cheese perogies (I got half and half), and if they have the Dill Pickle soup (I know, it sound bad, but it's NOT) order it. You will not be disappointed. Also, I saw the Parisian Schnitchel come of of the kitchen.It looked amazing.Check it out and support a piece of history.This place isn't going to be around forever, sadly.

8.description: Theresa II is like going into Babci's kitchen. The Barszcz (beet soup) with the small mushroom dumplings was to die for!  The Polish plate had the best potato pierogi's I've had since I was at my Mom's. The potato pancakes and blintzes were amazing. Come hungry!  The owner is a sweet older lady and her husband. They did all the cooking and serving. (So it was good that there was only one other table in the restaurant). It was like a little piece of home.

31.description: I came into Teresa II for a vegan Polish Dinner and it did not disappoint! There was a huge variety of food from mushroom barley soup, cucumber salad, stuffed cabbage, and potato pancakes and pierogis.  I was expecting the food to be good but had no idea it would be this outstanding! If you are ever in the mood for Polish food, head over to Teresa II for friendly service and flavorful dishes!

34.description: I confess that, a while ago, when I first entered this restaurant, I gave my friend a dirty look for having suggested this place.  While the restaurant is clean, the decor is shabby and a little tacky.  However, once they began to serve the food, my reservations about the place started to fade away.  The food is simply amazing.  I ordered the assorted pierogis plate, consisting of potato, cheese, and meat pierogis, but before my entree even arrived I was treated to a bowl of delicious mushroom soup, a beet salad, and bread.  The portion on my plate of pierogis was huge, and they were, by far, the best pierogis I have ever had.  What is most amazing about this place are the surprisingly reasonable prices for such good food.  The service is friendly and you are really made to feel at home.  Teresa II serves excellent traditional Polish home-cooked food.  Disregard the decor and give it a try.

16.description: This is one of those hole in the wall joints that people aren't aware of but would have people lining up out the door if they knew about it.  Come soon because most of the staff looks near retirement age and even if it survives them it won't be the same.  Great home style cooking.

13.description: If you feel the urge for real, lovingly prepared Polish food, look no further than this bright little spot on North Milwaukee Avenue.  My husband and I both had navy bean soup (so good) and pierogis.  He opted for the mixed plate (meat, cheese and potato and cabbage); I went for the all-kapusta (cabbage) one.  Teresa is a gem, the food is prepared for you alone (no heat lamps) and, if you're interested in relaxing further, Manhattans and martinis are $4.50 each.  Worth the trip and parking is free in the back lot.  Hint:  Dill pickle soup is available on Mondays (always) and Tuesdays (sometimes).  Fridays its potato soup.

11.description: One of the most charming places I have been to for a long time. In fact, time stands still there, in a good way. Reminds me of my Eastern European grandma. Hard to put a finger on it, but it's a special place. I paid extra (and you should too) because she deserves more than what she is asking for this cooking in Chicago today.

39.description: Alright alright, until my Babcia opens up her own restaurant, no Polish restuarant is going to get 5 stars. The decor- lacking. However, Ms. Teresa makes you feel right at home. Her food was very good, and definitely had the homemade element. We all thought the entrees and side salads were very good. If I had one complaint about the food, I thought the soups were a little watery for my taste. I prefer a soup with some texture- but that is just a preference thing. Give it a try, I think you'll like it and its reasonably priced.Oh- while we ate, she had Christian music playing. I'm not the biggest fan of it for my dining experience......

37.description: I have lived right down the block from Teresa two all 29 years of my life and remember my grandma taking me there when I was a child. The place has not changed a bit since then. The mushroom soup is the absolute best. Homemade pierogis, potato pancakes or cheese blintzes, you can't go wrong.

0.description: Amazing!  Everything was homemade and tasted like my mother-in-law's cooking. The barszcz was fabulous!  I just moved to Chicagoland and will be a regular at this cozy restaurant where the server makes you feel like family.

38.description: I just finally went today.  It was delicious, basically your polish grandmother that you never had comes and takes your order then goes and cooks it in the back.  Good prices too.  The only drawback is that it takes a kind of a long time if you are need to have a quick lunch.  I ordered the polish samper plate which was just enough for lunch at 7.95

27.description: I have been there before and the food was good. Was there yesterday and the service was some of the worst I ever had. Got some old wine that was rotten and expired, they overcharged us by 11 bucks and it took almost an hour for the food to arrive. There were 3 other tables, so it was not crowded. One of the tables was trying to get its bill for 45 minutes. After 50 minutes I had to beg to be served and was hoping to be properly waited on, but I guess it was my lack of Polish ethnicity I had that made them think they could ignore me. My boyfriend was addressing them in Polish, so not sure what the deal was. The people who came in 40 minutes after us got served first and doted on and even go comped some food, but not us.I won't go back. I just can't.

32.description: I went here last Thursday night as a part of a 60 person or so vegan meetup group.  We were seated in the banquet section.  Now by no means is this a fancy restaurant; it's more like your neighborhood restaurant, which you may remember as a child.  Our group was treated to a vegan buffet of pierogis, potato pancakes, stuffed cabbage, and on and on and on.  I felt like it was hugely generous for what we got and the price per person and the people there (who worked at the restaurant) were extremely nice.  I'm really glad they hosted us!  Thank you!

48.description: I love Polish food. I practically grew up on it since I'd often go to my friend's house after school and her grandma would make us all sorts of yummy things. Fast forward to a few months ago-- I went to Teresa II with a different friend who also likes Polish food. We were really excited.
