Upon entering, we felt like we had just stepped into a Polish grandma's home. Everything looks old and outdated, the light filters in through the filmy windows, and you can pretty much see "grandma" bustling around the kitchen. My friend and I decided to share the Polish plate (which has all the popular dishes one plate). We had started off with some interesting salads-- so by the time we had taken a few bites off the Polish plate, we were completely full. Unfortunately, our server (a.k.a. grandma) would not have that. She told us to keep eating, gave us a complimentary plate of sweets, and walked away several times when she saw that our plates were not yet clean.  A part of me felt like a trapped animal while another part of me felt like an overly loved and spoiled grandchild. :\Somehow . . . we got our plates to an acceptable level and she finally brought us our check with the words, "Now you are finished." Ha. She was certainly something else. Anyway, the food was definitely homemade and good-- but I wasn't blown away by most of it and I almost feel like I've had better. I probably would go back if the craving for some really good bigos (or hunter's stew) hits me in the future, though. That was good stuff. All in all, I'm glad I tried Teresa II-- and the experience was wonderful . . . in a twisted sort of way. ;)

44.description: Sure, if my babcia cooked at all remotely this good, we'd likely have had a better relationship. Offering me hard-boiled eggs and beer, or cantaloupe and beer, was never an exciting dining option for an 8 year old boy, but might I digress.During a casual stroll through Jefferson Park, I decided to finally try this place that I had long been meaning to visit. It was alright. Alright. There were two children running around the front of the house while they're Polish mother yelled things at them in Polish. I went to the restroom and then they vanished. Perfect start. I stared at the hilariously classic menus that have been updated year after year with a pen and white out. I ordered a side of bigos and a side of potato pancakes.Delicious bigos. It was one of the most colorful forms of this dish that I have ever seen. The potato cancakes, though, were so oily that I had asked for more bread so that I could use them as a blotting tool. After that event was completed, they were more my style.Even still, the mistake I had made was ordering two sides. Both of which rang in at $4.75 were more than enough to be an entire meal. After feeling as stole Teresa had held me hostile while she was tooling around in the back for about 20 unattended minutes, I didn't know what to do. The layout is setup so that there's no good way for you to politely yell back without being invisible. And mind you, I am patient, I'm not joking about the twenty minutes. Thankfully, my phone is loaded with apps that keep me entertained. I assumed that she might have been giving me that time to enter a coma.As for Polish food, I'll put this place down as pretty good. There are quite a few other places that I like more than this one, but my cause for bumping the rating up a notch was that when I got my bill, I was confident that she thought I had wanted two full dinners and I just didn't realize how big Teresa considers a side dish to be.Next time: Kiszka!

24.description: We live in the neighborhood and decided to give the place a shot. We left very satisfied with the food and service. Teresa is very nice and made delicious food. Such a nice a personable lady, and makes sure her customers leave happy. Highly recommend!

7.description: So pleased we found this little Polish gem.  Although the vegan choice was limited they were very flexible to our needs and what arrived was delicious. Such great flavor from simple dishes. Teresa's place was original, cozy and with a friendly ambiance, definitely worth a visit..

49.description: Hmm, how would I describe this place?  How about: I'm afraid to eat the food here because the cleanliness of the dining room leaves much to be desired.  Also, the waitress seemed to also be the cook, and I never heard or saw water running in the kitchen after she left our table...  I'm a big fan of Polish food, but even though Chicago is chock full of Poles, a real good Polish restaurant is still really hard to find.  Teresa's might very well have good food, but even though I'm never afraid to try raw fish or some steak tartar, I was definitely questioning whether I should be eating the fully cooked meat pierogi.

40.description: Food was great! Real comfort food. Had the Polish Plate which is a little of all the Polish classics and it was fantastic. All 4 of us left nothing behind. Worth going to.

30.description: This is a nice, low-key Polish Restaurant with great, reasonably priced Polish food. I usually have the "Bigos" (hunter's stew).

46.description: Excellent, hearty polish food in an empty room that looks like its been unvisited since the 60s.

1.description: Delightful! We were the sole diners there on a Saturday night which meant we got the chance to chat with Marisha, the waitress/cook/and maitre d'. Her made-from-scratch dill pickle soup, potato pancakes, and pierogis were excellent, but it was the stuffed cabbage that sent us over the moon! Our check total was shockingly low, made more so because we couldn't finish everything that Marisha put in front of us!

9.description: Sorry to repeat everyone else's words, but this is the food of my polish grandmother.I would say this is the best restaurant I've ever eaten in. It might not look like much when you walk in, but I got huge portions of cabbage, beet soup, two chicken breasts, 12 pierogis, 3 blinzes and 2 free potato pancackes for $20. Downtown that would cost me $100. The owner everyone speaks of, Maria, was there to greet us after the meal.This is an amazing and inexpensive place that everyone with a sense in their mind would prefer to any fine restaurant like Alinea. I'd even send Grand Ashatz to intern with Maria!

26.description: Real good home made food. Soup was good and perogis were definitely not store bought.

25.description: Now here is some food!  YES!!!!  This quaint and comfortable place is the best food I have had in a long time.  The people who work here are the tops!  This is truly a family run establishment.  You are served by people that are very courteous.  Did I say the food is absolutely fabulous?  Ho there and enjoy wonderfully well prepared food presented to with care.

12.description: This was actually incredible. I cannot stress how much my family and I enjoyed this place. We got a bunch of plates of stuff to enjoy it as much as possible. Having been to Poland and living with a strong Polish heritage, we figure that we know what we're talking about when it comes to ethnically Polish dinners. She was an absolute pleasure to talk to even though she is not a primary English speaker. We had one of the most wonderful meals in our time in Chicago visiting my family and will be eating here again as soon as possible. This lady made her food fresh and fantastic with almost upsettingly low prices.

21.description: As vegetarians we were treated to a whole custom menu decided by the lovely chef (Teresa?)! The food was great (a little simpler than what I've had at Staropolska, but still flavorful and well done) and the atmosphere is homey! I look forward to going back!

17.description: I've been going to Teresa II for years . They've never disappointed me.Your "Polish Grandmother" and mine , who prepares and serves all these great home - cooked meals  ,actually goes by the name of Mary. As I understand it , Teresa was the Owner , Bruno's ,  late wife (There's a very cool photo of them , ca. 1970's , on the back of each menu.). This cafe was preceded by a restaurant just called "Teresa".What I like about Bruno , is he's old school , but friendly . He's around pretty often , and he always greets customers , even if he's busy , and asks how they're enjoying the food. A lot of restaurant and club owners in Chicago could'nt care less....... I've not disliked anything I've had , here , though I prefer the Polish plate , because it contains just about everything you were considering on the menu. The chicken is very good , too . I love the borscht , though they don't always have it. The standard beet broth is filled with potato and carrot slices . Don't be surprised , though , if Mary decides you have'nt been eating enough , and brings you some potato pancakes , or something else you did'nt order , but , realize you should have. It's far from a fancy atmosphere , but , that's the beauty part of it. It's like one of these little places my Mom would have taken me to in the early 70's ,  unravaged by the hands of time. It's an ideal dinner spot for the young and old , and it's really cool to see elderly people enjoying themselves , so...Recently , three haus fraus were cutting  somebody up , good , in German , laughing hysterically , just feeling at home , and that's what Teresa II is all about , feeling at home.

10.description: I was going to get carry out but I'm glad I didn't. You feel like you took a trip into another country when you dine in. The good was great, and Teresa was a real sweetheart. She fed me like I was her kids coming home from college. It is also very inexpensive. Chicago needs more places like this.

5.description: Um....anyone there?Walked in with my girlfriend on a Saturday afternoon and there was not a soul in the restaurant. Looked around for about 5 minutes and before deciding to leave, I took a peek into the kitchen and finally see a person in there working quietly to the radio. So I asked my girlfriend to just open the door and then come back in so the door chime would ring.A very friendly elderly woman came to greet us and sat us down. Again, my girlfriend and I were the only customers in the place so it got very awkward. We only ordered the vegan pierogis for my girlfriend because this was a spot she picked out. The woman came back with free potato pancakes and I thought that was very kind of her.The pierogis themselves were good. Though my girlfriend said she's had better....this is my first pierogi experience, so I cannot say. Though I'm used to my dumplings being fried.The food itself was pretty good and the price was extremely inexpensive. But being the only customers inside the restaurant was awkward and its the reason why I'm only giving this place two stars....no, three...because I feel bad for talking bad about a kind elderly woman.

3.description: Just perfect.  1st time trying polish food and was awesome. Great service the lady polish, she was lovely. That goulash and the mushroms soup. I went to the polish heaven and came back.

35.description: We went there later in the evening around 9. There was nobody there. An old BABUSHKA took our order.She was so nice and attentive and very authentic. She totally reminded me of my grandma (R.I.P.), whom I would visit every once in a while for some Ukrainian meals (she was Ukrainian). Anyway, I ordered pierogi and instead of 12 she brought me about 16 -- with no extra cost. She was SUPER nice! I'm going there again! SOON!

19.description: 'Teresa 2 - Fine Polish Food', the awning above the door reads. You idly wonder about the whereabouts of Teresa 1 as you walk in, shaking the rain from your umbrella. The time-yellowed wallpaper strikes you first, working in concert with the amber resin of the equally aged tables and the dim lighting to make you wonder briefly if what you thought was a restaurant is in fact an antique photograph. It's not quite dinner time, and the room is empty save for a single diner seated alone at a table near the door. She does not look up as you enter. No one stands behind the counter, so you warily find a seat at a table in the corner.  You look at your watch - 5:28, and no where to be until 8:00. Just as you are about to reconsider your choice a woman toddles from the back room. She is as aged as the decor, and has an unconcerned, grandmotherly demeanor. She does not speak to you, merely glancing in your direction as she delivers a plate of some unidentifiable stew to the other patron. You open your mouth to alert her to your presence, but no sound escapes. Several minutes pass in silence, and a menu appears in front of you. There is a photograph on the front, perhaps the same photograph you stepped into when you entered the restaurant. The woman in the photograph might well be the waitress some 30 or 40 years before, and might well be named Teresa. All the same, she might well not be. You have ample time to consider this as you wait for who you have decided to now call Teresa to return to take your order. You read the menu aloud, your tongue stumbling over familiar letters arranged in unfamiliar patterns and combinations. The Polish items have English translations, but you have no basis to judge their validity. The other patron hears your struggles and offers advice. "The cheek meat from a roasted pig's head is tender and delicious", she says. You thank her for her input and decide on the beef with horseradish. You look at your watch. Time must be passing, surely. Teresa ambles over to your table, stopping on the way to snatch a napkin from a stack nearby. It is on this that she writes your order. "Oh, we no have," she tells you upon hearing your decision, "I give you goulash instead." Too taken aback to argue, you inquire about the side options, asking if you can have mashed as your Choice of Potato. "Boiled," she replies, before moving back into the kitchen.  You look at your watch again. Is it still working? Why didn't you spring for the model with a second hand? You try to calm yourself by looking around at the decor you had not yet had time to let your eyes settle on. The liquor cabinet has no door, and the bottles within are obscured by dust and written in a language you do not comprehend. There is a soda fountain in one corner. 'UpTown'? That's not a real brand. You decide not to order any drinks beyond the pitcher of water placed on your table. The meal arrives, and your fears and concerns are wiped away in a fog of savoury smells punctuated by simple spices. A salt shaker stands alone on your table, but you do not even consider it. You've eaten traditional Polish cuisine before many times, and this was as good or better. There is even an unexpected gift of a potato pancake which Teresa delivers in silence. You finish your meal quickly, famished not only from the journey you've undertaken to arrive here but also from the time since you sat down. You look at your watch, and then remove it and put it in your pocket in disgust.  You catch Teresa's eye as she is replacing your water pitcher and ask for your cheque. There is neither recognition nor acknowledgement of your request, but in due time it arrives nevertheless. In the time between you asking and it returning, other patrons have stumbled in from the rain. You do not look up as they enter. As Teresa drops off the bill, she delivers menus to the newcomers. Their mouths roll over the syllables haltingly. You smile. Leaving cash on the table to cover your due, both to avoid having to summon Teresa once more and because you are uncertain Visa is accepted in the foreign country this restaurant seems to occupy, you stand and put on your coat. Steeling your nerves, you stride toward the door, fighting through clouds of unnatural urges to sit and eat some more and to simply never leave. You break through, cross the threshold, and a flash of sunlight tells you that the rain has finally ended. You look at your wrist. It does not inform you of the time, and you sheepishly fish out your watch from your pocket. 7:02. You head down the street to your show. As you reach the corner, you look back at Teresa 2 and are shocked to find that there is no restaurant behind you. Only a vacant lot, containing charred timbers and a slagged plastic awning reading "Teresa - Fine Polish Food". You blink, and look around you at the city skyline. It is unfamiliar. You see a newspaper in the gutter and scramble to pick it up. Your eyes flash to the date - May 8th. 1983.

28.description: Just like eating at your grandmas house.  The little old lady is sweet as can be.  Makes you feel like you need to eat everything on your plate even though you're so full.  Everything we ate was good.

45.description: I absolutely love this restaurant, and I believe I love Teresa, too.  My mom used to hang out at this restaurant with her friends, as well as me, in tow.  I was really happy the restaurant still looked the same, and I was really happy to see Teresa's pictures on the wall - that made it easier for me to remember her.  We moved away when I was about five or six. Teresa's serves up food in the style of my mom and grand mother's cooking.  It's hearty, traditional, and does not skimp on ingredients.  I had a variety of different foods, some what of a sampler, if you will, and I absolutely loved it!  Everything was seasoned well, cooked to perfect texture, and the assortment of flavor from the fresh cabbage to the black tea took me back to my grand mother's kitchen in Zakopane, Poland.Yes, the appearance of the restaurant is some what dated, but the food is amazing.  I find it unfortunate that some people need the modern sterility of a McDonald's (and by the way, as a food service manager with ten years under my belt - I have seen way more disgusting things in nice, new modern restaurants - things I have called not only their corporate office about, but the health department) to enjoy food. Teresa's made me feel as if I was visiting my Great Aunt's house, with the lace curtains and formal china for tea and soups. I liked the flowers at the table, and I thought the place was charming.  I absolutely love this restaurant.  We have quite a few Polish restaurants back here in Arizona, and I was sadly disappointed when I tried them.  Next to my mom's pierogis and Bigos, Teresa's is my favourite.

33.description: When my date and I entered Teresa II, the restaurant was totally empty of patrons or staff, and we hesitated for a minute.  But then a little Polish grandmother toddled out of the kitchen and told us to sit anywhere, so we did.  The soup of the day was dill pickle soup, and we were commanded by the very same Polish grandmother to order it.  "Is very good," she assured us.  "Is very homemade."So we did order it, and indeed it was both very good and very homemade.  The potato and cheese pierogi were likewise very good, as was the complimentary potato pancake that came out halfway through our soup course ("You finish soup!" I was told, as I was visibly distracted by the beautifully brown and delicious-looking potato pancake that had just appeared before me).   I was a little less enamored of the meat pierogi, but they were fine.At the end of the meal, two lovely little pieces of pastry appeared, unexpected but welcome, just like the potato pancakes.  The total bill?  Nine freakin' dollars.  Needless to say, we tipped big, and will certainly be back.

43.description: This place was interesting! It is definitly like grandma just cooked me a meal. The polish plate was delicious and I thought everything was cooked perfectly. I would give it 5 stars for food, but it lacks some ambiance and our waitress asked us AFTER our main course came out, "what would you like to drink?", but we got a good laugh out of that. She was old and cute like my grandma. The place is old retro cool(we took a video of the place), but dark and closed off with curtains over the windows. So that is why I gave it a 4 total rating. I would suggest going with a group of friends for authentic Polish food they deserve more business.

2.description: Now that I am vegan, I thought that I could never set foot in a Polish restaurant again. Or, if I did, I'd be stuck with kapusta, rye bread and beets. Not so at Teresa II! They actually know what vegan means and will make you vegan versions of Polish food.Ignore the menu, though. Just ask what vegan stuff they have and Maria will tell you whatever is in the kitchen. It's very down home, just like busia used to make. Maria remembered me the second time I went and told me right away what vegan options were available. They even made me vegan dessert pierogi. DESSERT PIEROGI! With fresh strawberries! Never thought I'd find that in a Polish restaurant.Quick story: I brought a friend of mine who was a complete newbie to Polish cuisine. Even though I told him that powdered sugar goes on top of dessert pierogi, he still asked for ice cream or whipped cream. Oh the glare our server gave him! She then offered him sugar. They are the real deal.Besides strawberry pierogi, they also have made me potato pancakes, cabbage rolls, potato pierogi, blueberry pierogi and cabbage soup.They also don't skimp on the liquor. My mother ordered vodka and Coke. She received about 4 oz of vodka and a can of coke. Our server kept giving her more vodka. You must stop here if you are vegan (or not) and craving Polish food.

18.description: Really solid food for a wonderful price! A friend and I came here on a Monday for lunch and we were the only patrons. We were able to chat a bit with the wonderful older ladies who were working here. I had 12 pierogis (I asked for a mix of flavors) for $4, and they were all delicious -- particularly loved the cheese and potato one!

41.description: There's so much more to a dining experience than simply the inane details of the physical decor.  Here it is:  We love this place - - the entire family, including my teenagers because it's real.  Enjoy grandma and her quirkiness.  If you need something, go back to the kitchen and get her.  If you want to try something, ask her.  Share the food.  Enjoy the homemade nature of everything.  We're certain everything there is made by her (except the bread - from bakery next door), straight from a trip to the vegetable market, butcher or bakery (3 doors away). The plain potatoes with a few carrots even taste weirdly really good.  Yes, it's old. It's crusty. it's dingy light blue with printed garage sale paintings crookedly hung about.  But it's all about what Chicago is about, and places like this won't be around long as long as it's deemed even remotely noteworthy if a place like this has Wi-fi.  (C'mon, Yelp.)  How about asking if the perogis were made by hand to order?

50.description: I can't give this place enough stars!! The service is the best I've had in Chicago (the owners are usually there and take great pride in serving you). The atmosphere is kinda Eastern European/ Diner...kinda cute, kinda not... but not the reason I go. The food is really different and great (very fresh...you can hear them cutting in the kitchen after you order), and you get tons of it...The polish plate is under $10 and you get more than enough food for 2 people...and it comes with at least 8 different things (did I mention it includes, soup, salad and drink in the price). I love going to locally owned places like this b/c you feel like you're supporting people from the neighborhood. The only Polish place I've ever been, but really good. GO!

4.description: Delicious little Polish restaurant. I had diner there on a Saturday evening, went there early with my friend and we were the only ones. Nevertheless the waitress was really nice to us, smiling and polite. Food was served quickly and was very good. We ordered the mixed plate - a plate made of various Polish dishes, all very tasty. I also like the atmosphere there, and the little paintings/pictures on the wall, it reminds me Poland...

6.description: The owner and chef is the cutest older woman / grandma. I'm not overly familiar with polish food so can't judge it versus other restaurants but it wasn't my favorite dinner. Plus it was chilly inside. On the upside the beer was less than $4 and the service was good, if you like adorable grandmas.

22.description: I can't remember how I found about a Polish restaurant with vegan options, but I'm glad I did. Just like many said before this place feels like your Polish grandma is cooking for you (not that I know what that's like, really) but vegan or no this is probably my favorite Polish food I've ever had. The stuffed cabbage was the highlight but the perogi, veggies, potatoes and salad were all great.Also, the woman (not Teresa, apparently she was in the kitchen) who took care of us did that awesome thing where she pretty much decided what we would eat. Leaving a meal in someone else's hands is often risky but everything she brought out for us was great and in great portions for my friend and I. The check was also a bit less than I estimated, which was a nice treat! We left a pretty bigass tip. I will definitely be back.

15.description: I couldn't believe how much fun i had visiting this cozy, retro restaurant.  The food was delicious.  The customer service was very entertaining.  To top it all off, there were vegan options for my girlfriend.  We tried both the regular and vegan stuffed cabbage. The vegan potato pancakes and the vegan pierogis.  YUM!  Even for being a 'meat eater', they were both delicious.  I found it so generous that the server kept bringing more and more side dishes out to us.  I felt like we should have paid twice as much as we actually did on the bill.  Hope to see you there the next time i visit.

20.description: Not for the tourist, this place is old world and amazing. Get the home-made vegan perogies.

36.description: I come here for the experience, not the food. The food is good, and the pierogi and borscht are really good. However, I love the atmosphere of this place, its like you stepped back into 1965. Teresa reminds me of my own Polish grandmother so it could be said that I have a favorable bias towards the place. This is such a local and casual place; you can even see them making the food in the kitchen. Teresa would not take my plate until I cleaned everything from it. Some diners will hate that, but for me there is something awesome and comforting about finding your grandma's kitchen in the middle of Chicago :)

14.description: I can't remember how I found about a Polish restaurant with vegan options, but I'm glad I did. Just like many said before this place feels like your Polish grandma is cooking for you (not that I know what that's like, really) but vegan or no this is probably my favorite Polish food I've ever had. The stuffed cabbage was the highlight but the perogi, veggies, potatoes and salad were all great.Also, the woman (not Teresa, apparently she was in the kitchen) who took care of us did that awesome thing where she pretty much decided what we would eat. Leaving a meal in someone else's hands is often risky but everything she brought out for us was great and in great portions for my friend and I. The check was also a bit less than I estimated, which was a nice treat! We left a pretty bigass tip. I will definitely be back.

58.description: Affordable luxury with Acupuncture and Massage...all in one place!MASSAGE:  Kingston Reflexology is pretty new in the neighborhood, so I decided to treat myself to an affordable massage.  I made an appointment for a Swedish massage and I was very pleased!  It is a full Swedish massage (clothes off, modesty preserved with a sheet.)  Meg was awesome!  She treated my shoulder muscles (where I carry all my stress) as if she had a personal vendetta against them.  Again, it was awesome.  I went back several times and plan to be a regular.ACUPUNCTURE:  After one of my massages, I noticed the announcement that they now offer Acupuncture.  I've never had it, but I'm having some issues with stress, diet, weight so I thought I'd give it a go.  I talked to the acupuncturist, Eliana,  and made an appointment.  She spent time taking my history, then talked me through how the acupuncture would go.  The treatment was lovely!  It was not painful and it relaxed me so much that I couldn't even hold a cup of water!  The cravings I had been having decreased.  I've had three treatments so far, and I plan to continue.In all, I highly recommend this place.  I just want to point out, as other reviewers had, that any noise carries, so speak softly when you enter and tune out the noises during your treatment.

56.description: Here is another 5 star foot massage place. Again furniture is new and the place very clean with well kept restroom area.I had gone to the place three times. First two times chinese women had given me a foot massage and they knew how to do it.Third time was done by an  american girl starting out as a trainer. She was  very well gentle on giving a good rub on the calfs and the feet area. So I feel there may have been a miscommunication between the girl and I.I should have mentioned the type of massage to be soft, medium or hard. Her massage was ok but the chinese women knew the location of the pressure points. For a beginner, she had done ok but she has great potential. I prefer the chinese women but if you want s softer, gentler massage then go with the american girl.I prefer the hard range  on my numb ankle area. My radiologist told me my blood circulation as slow around the ankle / foot area.

29.description: I had a Swedish massage with Cindy, I believe. From start to finish, it was a great massage. I went in with some stuffiness in my sinuses and it was all cleared up afterwards. I will definitely be back. It was a quality massage at a great price.

42.description: This was one of the greatest experiences that I have had at a massage place. I have even referred this spot to a few friends and they have enjoyed it as well.-Very clean-Reasonably priced - Great customer service

23.description: I went here earlier today with my girlfriend and had a couple's massage. I had a Swedish massage and it felt AMAZING!!! I feel like a new man now. The masseuse got rid of quite a few knots in my back and now I feel really good!!!

47.description: 5+ stars!!! Exceptional customer service!! Let me first tell you that this was my first time as a massage place. I did about 2 weeks of research via groupon and other discount sites. I've seen a deal for this location however wasn't a couples massage. I looked at their pricing and it was cheapest among all. I thought by paying less I would loose out on a great massage. That was NOT the case at all. I can't tell you how happy my fiance and I are. This was her first time as well and we will be going back for sure! The lady whom worked on me "Mae" was very professional and skillful. Magical hands! She put every second into my massage and that's important. The rooms are super clean and quiet. The music is great! I love them! Please visit them if you would like an hour or more of true relaxation!

8.description: Always very good and professional. Most important you can communicate.Keep up the nice work....

31.description: A friend recommended this place and they're a short walk from my place, so I thought I'd try out one of their foot massage packages to give them a shot. I got the 60 minute foot massage, which was listed as including a 15-minute neck and shoulders massage too, plus a foot soak. I thought it would be a step above a standard pedicure massage with a quick shoulder rub. Halfway through I thought the massage therapist clearly must have misunderstood the package I had signed up for because she was giving me the works and as all my stress melted away I thought, whatever, I'll gladly pay whatever this ends up being. I was a little shocked when I went to pay and THAT WAS the foot massage! For the price of a bad pedicure at some places I got the second best massage of my life! The shop is spare, but comfortable and immaculate. The staff were all super nice but unobtrusive. And the prices are simply unbeatable. Instead of massage as a treat, it seems they want to make it an available part of a normal healthcare routine. So wonderful to have them in the area! Street parking is available (meters) and bus service is convenient to the location. After the massage, stop in next door at Josi's for frozen yogurt or go across the street to the art museum.One small word to the wise: you can pay with cards but they prefer cash for tips. You can put the tip on the card, but there's a small surcharge. It didn't phase me, but I'll be sure to bring cash for tip next time.

34.description: This place was amazing! Great service and nice prices! Definitely going back. Keep up the good work!

16.description: A friend recommended this place and they're a short walk from my place, so I thought I'd try out one of their foot massage packages to give them a shot. I got the 60 minute foot massage, which was listed as including a 15-minute neck and shoulders massage too, plus a foot soak. I thought it would be a step above a standard pedicure massage with a quick shoulder rub. Halfway through I thought the massage therapist clearly must have misunderstood the package I had signed up for because she was giving me the works and as all my stress melted away I thought, whatever, I'll gladly pay whatever this ends up being. I was a little shocked when I went to pay and THAT WAS the foot massage! For the price of a bad pedicure at some places I got the second best massage of my life! The shop is spare, but comfortable and immaculate. The staff were all super nice but unobtrusive. And the prices are simply unbeatable. Instead of massage as a treat, it seems they want to make it an available part of a normal healthcare routine. So wonderful to have them in the area! Street parking is available (meters) and bus service is convenient to the location. After the massage, stop in next door at Josi's for frozen yogurt or go across the street to the art museum.One small word to the wise: you can pay with cards but they prefer cash for tips. You can put the tip on the card, but there's a small surcharge. It didn't phase me, but I'll be sure to bring cash for tip next time.

13.description: Clearly I got the lemon "masseuse" (if you can even call him that) because my experience is the absolute opposite of everyone else. If they ever offer you a young guy say no.I wanted to give him a lesson in anatomy because he clearly never learned it and although I'm a gynecologist I still remember enough to be shocked. The massage I went in for was the 60 minute deep tissue plus 30 minute foot massage. My husband did one as well and we shared a room, he liked his female masseuse significantly better but what received what he describes as a typical massage. We both just ran a half marathon and explained that our hips, glutes, quads and shoulders were very sore. Onto the young buck without a clue. He spent a good twenty minutes just running his palms up and down the same track on my paraspinals which was as far from "deep tissue" as you can get. He then proceeded to run his elbow deep up and down the track of the paraspinals and ending by plucking the same sore spot on my trapezius. Never actually massaged that shoulder, on either side, nor did he address my very sore muscles around my scapula- didn't even touch them. I got a two second pat up my neck, my arms got a quick pat and that's it. Onto the legs- same story, gentle up and down for twenty minutes accomplishing nothing, and then with his elbow attacked the same poor hamstring and dug into my right piriformis, but not my left. Newsflash sir, my hip also has a gluteus Maximus that is dominant in this area and really hurts. Didn't touch my quads- the ones I torture daily running. He did give me a 15 minute head scratch which I really didn't care for. And the foot massage- you mean toe massage. Awful. Awful. I wish I was told his name so I could put it in here.I actually feel worse than I did once the soreness from the race kicked it which is terrible.

11.description: I visited Kingston today and Linda did an amazing job.   Similar to the other reviews regarding Kingston,  it was a great experience.

39.description: My best massage ever!  -  Ive had a lot of massages too.  I have had stress back pain for weeks - Tried every at home step then went to Kingston on a whim.  I worked with Cindy - 90 Min combo Foot and Upper body massage.   She hit all the pressure points.  and when she worked on my back she literally jumped on me and used her knees to work out my knots. I am pain free - Amazing.  Also, cant beat the price I will be back next week.

37.description: This place was great.  They took me as a walk in on a Saturday afternoon and the masseuse knocked that knot right off my back.  I highly recommend this place.

0.description: Julie has Ben very kind to me.  I love coming here for last minute appointments, because it seems like she is always able to accommodate me. The location is great since I live up the street in Jefferson Park.  Prices are perfect and are fair for the community that it is in.If you are picky with massages, all you need to do is make sure you let Julie know exactly what you want.Whether it is a two-hour deep tissue, full body massage, it just a quick 30 minute foot massage, Kingston Reflexology is a great place to unwind and improve your health without paying a fortune.

38.description: If you can live without the frills that come with a regular spa, and really just want a great and affordable massage, this place is for you.  I've had several and all have been great!

51.description: It's my first time getting a real massage. The reflexology on my feet was great! My feet felt like I was walking on clouds afterwards. Definitely recommended. Julie have nice strong hands. But she is never too rough unless you like her to be. She a complete sweetheart. They all very nice and friendly.

27.description: This place is great I have gone now a few times and have seen Candy each time. I ride a motorcycle and generally sit weird when I sleep or write this review for instance haha. I tell her where it hurts and I don't know what she does but I feel amazing afterwards.  Very soft yet very strong hands. I have been to many places for a massage, including many high-end spas and nobody has quite the touch she does.  The place is super clean, and parking is a breeze.  Just request Candy you wont be disappointed!!!

32.description: Omg, my experience at this place was AMAZING!!! I called on a Friday night and asked if they had any availability for that same day. The woman on the phone told me she could accommodate me right away. I got the 90 minute Swedish massage. I asked specifically for a female masseuse and they immediately moved some things around to make it happen. The massage itself was like no other- the masseuse was on top of me at various points throughout the massage and used her legs, arms and hands to hit every pressure point on my body. The place itself was new and very clean. They had calming music playing throughout, and she kept making sure the pressure was okay. I can't wait to go back to this place.

54.description: I'd been experiencing some moderate pain in my neck and lower back for a few weeks thought it was just poor sleep and stress.   Perhaps I slept in a bad position and wasn't stretching enough in the morning.  I was referred to Kingston Reflexology I and emailed them late at night and I had an email back the following morning.  I'd never considered massage therapy or acupuncture as relief/treatment of minor neck or back pain (for myself).  In my opinion, it was for the release of stress/relaxation (but not for pain) and I had little knowledge of its origin (other than it involved very small needles) and Eliana was very patient and explained how it worked.  She explained what I can expect, as well as the possible minor side effects (none of which I experienced), and asked several routine medical questions you would be asked during an intake visit with your physician.  As I have never experienced acupuncture, her voice was calm and reassuring as she explained everything she did and I relaxed easily.  I was so relaxed I fell asleep (literally, I was out cold within 10 minutes).  Being the skeptic, I didn't schedule a next visit after the treatment as I wanted to be sure I felt fine the following day (I FELT FINE).  I will be scheduling another appointment.  I HIGHLY recommend them, especially if you haven' t experienced acupuncture before.  Thank you Eliana

48.description: This place is killer. Went today for a birthday massage, got one hour couples deep-tissue massage and one hour foot massage. It was heaven. The foot massage was truly stellar. I can't believe it's only $28 for one hour!!! They were very accommodating, we had to push our appointment time back an hour at short notice and it was no problem. The place is clean and the music is very relaxing. The neighbors upstairs got a bit noisy and could be heard walking around but overall, no complaints. I intend to make this place a habit!!!

44.description: After an unfortunate first experience, the owner Julie contacted me & offered me a free prenatal massage with their massage therapist. She apologized for my first experience & I decided to give them another try. I was honestly impressed by her efforts to contact me & make it right. I just had my prenatal massage & Meg was amazing! Julie remembered me & greeted me before and after my appointment with Meg. Meg used a regular massage table but made it work. She was very knowledgeable & could tell I have issues with headaches so she worked to release my tension. I will definitely come back. Thank you Julie & Meg!

24.description: I came here on a total whim and was blown away. Linda was amazing. This place is a great value but don't expect "spa" treatment. You are in a large room with an open ceiling, multiple people in your room, you are clothed and towels are placed over you, but goodness...was this an amazing massage.

7.description: Overall I suppose I will give 4 stars but I wish I could give 5. The reason is because the actual 60 min deep tissue massage I got at Kingston was a very complete and satisfying one. At 65 an hour, that price point can't be beat. That great price point unfortunately comes at a price, the irony! So the layout of the business is such that there's open ceilings throughout the massage room floor. That means you can hear everything going on in other rooms and even the front desk area which is rather active, at least when I was there. It probably didn't help I was in the room closest to the front door/desk but still. It was also a bit brisk inside which can make getting undressed during winter months a bit of a nuisance. Because I'm not spoiled or entitled I really don't need all the other stuff other than the massage itself which was great and priced well....I just can't say it wasn't a factor. If you are a massage purist maybe you will take issue with this but for me, the value is definitely there plus they almost always meet your schedule. 4 stars solid

49.description: Checked out Kingston after reading the great reviews. I agree! Had a great time with my hubby. We got the combination massage and I feel so relaxed. We will be going back to try out the Swedish or deep tissue. The 2 asian ladies were very nice. The room was nice and clean, cozy.

40.description: I looked at the services online and chose this place because solely based on yelp reviews + being near my home + having another massage appointment canceled (err.? run away business?) & needed some cold weather relief... I was a walk in customer, greeted by a young friendly female. I chose the 90 minute combo & she asked if I minded a male masseuse, and I said no.  I was led to a room with two massage tables. Normal massage policies/draping. Middle aged asian man & very typical reflexology massage.  Deep massage of the feet and shoulders. I'm surprised they weren't busier!  Was a great experience & i'll definitely be back!

53.description: I was able to book an appointment the same day I got the massage. I had made an appointment for a combo massage and it was amazing! I already had some knowledge of reflexology (nerve endings and how upward motions is used to promote blood blow to the heart) and I have to say the masseuse really knew what she was doing. She was able to work out all the knots and kinks caused by chronic stress. Not to mention, the price is very reasonable.

30.description: I love it here and it's quickly becoming a monthly ritual for me to come to Kingston. They are so kind and so good at what they do. I've done the 45 and 60 minute combos and the 60 minute Swedish. They're all amazing but I slightly prefer the combo because it focuses so much on feet and legs, an area where I'm prone to have pain.Like others, I would like to point out to other customers to please (please please) be respectful of others when you're in this place. You can hear literally everything above a whisper.

46.description: Amazing! My two girlfriends, my husband and I went there for my birthday. I am 7 mo pregnant and being pampered is what I really wanted. We all left feeling refreshed and Happy. It was a great birthday and not overly expensive. Clean, nice, serene and the ambiance was wonderful. So happy! :)

1.description: I generally don't leave reviews on Yelp, but I cannot understand why this place has a misleading high rating. My fiancee and I came here hoping for a relaxing massage, and we did not get anything close to that. For me, the massage was extremely painful, even after I asked repeatedly for lighter touch. I am currently sore from the massage, and not in any kind of good way. For my fiancee, her massage therapist was touching far too close to inappropriate areas on her body. This was an incredibly uncomfortable experience for us both.The room was very cold, the place was very loud - we could hear everything going on outside our massage room, from people entering to conversation happening in the other rooms. For this kind of price, you can get a much better and more relaxing experience elsewhere.

55.description: I mean, look at all those 5 star reviews. What more do you really need?Ok. My two cents...It cost 28 bucks for a 1 hour "foot massage" which is really a 65 minutes foot, leg, neck, shoulders, and full body massage! I honestly kept thinking it was over, but the masseuse kept massaging!No groupon needed. That is their actual price.And I called and got an appointment for the same day. They are extraordinarily friendly. The owner giggles a lot, which I think is super endearing. And they have a nice awards program. Honestly, with the Six Corners resurgence of late, this place is next to Josie's, I expect that they will either raise their prices or get super busy soon. So jump on this place now.

9.description: So happy. I had been suffering with back pain (being a nail tech and constantly hunched over), my back had all but seized-up. I called Kingston and they were able to get me in when i needed. I showed up about 20 minutes early and they took me right away. I was asked if I wanted water or to use the restroom first, which was very much appreciated. I was shown to my room and asked some questions, we discussed my issues, and she understood very well what I needed.My therapist was thorough and incredible. There was a bit of a language barrier, but all I had to do was point and she knew what I meant! She dug out all of my awful knots and god knows what from my back, my legs, my arms, my shoulders! These people are GOOD. the massage comes complete with hot towels. I loved it. And the price cannot be beat.This place is very clean, the sheets and towels smell really good, and they layer everything with disposable (but comfortable) paper as well. I will most definitely be back. I am looking forward to going back, I even hugged the therapist before I left!

26.description: I really love the acupuncture here! She is amazing and always hits all my trouble spots, takes her time and doesn't rush the session. I always feel great after. I've gone there three times now, and I will definitely be a regular client.

25.description: This place deserves a 6!!!! I was absolutely blown away by the massage I got here...I expected good for $28 but I got OUTSTANDING !!! I actually felt like i underpaid and they over delivered...lets face it ..how any times does that happen these days!!I will most definitely be a regular here ... I have paid ten times more for a massage and none of them were this good! total professionals who are extremely competent at what they do!!

12.description: This place is amazing. I've gotten both the deep issue and Swedish massage here and both experiences have been great. I am hooked on this place and try to come at least once a week now. Tina is awesome! She is so sweet and knows exactly how to get all the bad knots out. I always feel so much better after coming here!!!

59.description: I've had a great number of deep tissue massages over the years, and this one quite possibly topped them all. I tipped $20 if that at all speaks to how impressed I was.

21.description: This place was extreamly nice and I have no complaints, I'll definitely be back. It has a very nice atmosphere and decor, with a receptionist who was pleasnt and helpful. I called ahead and came a little early and was taken right in to a room after being helped with deciding what service I wanted. I was accommodated with sort of customized service and really enjoyed my massage..

17.description: Excellent quality massages at an affordable price!  Very comfortable atmosphere, appointments not necessary!Not much more needs to be said!

10.description: Jason is awesome! I got a 90 minute deep tissue and I feel amazing! He really worked everywhere I needed help. And he is super strong -which I love.  I am a massage therapist, so I know a good massage, and this guy killed it! I can't wait to come back.

5.description: I give 4 stars for the quality of the massage. It was pretty good - though I think my husband's masseuse (Tina) has a lot more experience than mine (didn't catch her name). There were moments when my masseuse put pressure on my spine or when she stretched my leg too quickly that caused unnecessary pain.I give 2 stars for service though. It would have been nice if they would ask us where our trouble areas were. I actually told my masseuse that I would like more work on my shoulders and head, but she proceeded with the standard progression and spent half of the time on my legs. It was good but I still have my tension headache.Moreover, our masseuse asked for $40 tip for the couple massage, which was $120 for 60 minutes. Really, are we tipping 33% now? I understand that the price is lower than most places, but I'm not sure if it's ethical to make up the difference by demanding a larger tip.Speaking of amenities, the receptionist leads you to the room where you'll have your massage and that's where you and your partner change. No robes, just towels. There weren't hangers or a place to put your clothes, just pile it up on the sofa.

3.description: For the price this place is a hell of a deal. Period. My massage was hard and I loved it. Harder the better. If it is too hard you can always say back off, if the touch is weak you are screwed for an hour.

35.description: Having been to a few other foot reflexology places in Chicago, I appreciated that Kingston Reflexology was just a step above the others. Instead of one large room, there are smaller rooms. The towels and lotion are higher quality, the reflexologists took a little more time with us, and I felt like it was overall a more enjoyable experience. Street parking was easy (although not free), and we made an appointment about an hour beforehand and they fit us right in.

19.description: Having a pretty intense, stressful job...I wanted to check this place out to get some much needed help on my neck/shoulders. And this place delivered. I will admit I don't think many speak English here, so it was a bit frustrating communicating what I was there for, but the level of work that they do can't be compared to anywhere else I've been! I don't know the name of the person that worked on me, she just walked in, did her thing and walked out. But I feel so much better today! They accomodated my ever changing work schedule and even took me an hour earlier when I called letting them know I could come in sooner than my appointment. Nice place, great decor, very clean and for sure will be back! Oh, and be sure to ask to keep your cover when you're asked to flip over. Mine was pulled off...AWKWARD!

28.description: Great Customer Service! Absolutely the best massage! I'm going to become a regular after this.

45.description: What a great experience! You won't be disappointed here. I treated my mother-in-law (and myself) to a 60 minute birthday massage. The decor and ambiance is spot on...modern and super clean. Staff is very professional. They are really focused and attentive. Let's just say I've accumulated massive amounts of brownie points with my mother-in-law. Thanks Julie and Kingston Reflexology. We'll definitely be back.

33.description: Nice and clean-and what great prices!

43.description: I keep meaning to make another appointment, as this place was AMAZING. I went on a weeknight and did 2 hours -one hour foot massage and a one hour body massage. I had been suffering from plantar fasciitis and, I swear, the foot massage was definitely a factor in my healing, loosing up the tight muscles on the bottom of my foot. This was super relaxing and I left feeling like a new woman. Good thing for Yelp -this is my reminder to call today and go back this week. Worth every penny to walk out a new person!

2.description: Not the relaxing experience that I was hoping for.The first problem: I booked a couple's Swedish massage online.  The website said that I would get a confirmation e-mail.  That didn't happen, so I had to call ahead just to make sure that we were booked.Unlike at other massage places, I was not asked to fill out a form describing problem areas, areas to work on, or what type of experience I was looking for.  Nor did the massage therapists ask us what we wanted.  This was the most painful massage that I ever received.  I know some people like a rougher touch, but I like slow and pampering.  I could not relax, because it was so intense.  Plus, the ceilings are open from room to room, so I could hear everything.  Conversations up front and in the other rooms, footsteps, etc.  I also heard stomping from the floors above me.  These issues really took away from the relaxing experience.

18.description: I looked at the services online and chose this place because solely based on yelp reviews + being near my home + having another massage appointment canceled (err.? run away business?) & needed some cold weather relief... I was a walk in customer, greeted by a young friendly female. I chose the 90 minute combo & she asked if I minded a male masseuse, and I said no.  I was led to a room with two massage tables. Normal massage policies/draping. Middle aged asian man & very typical reflexology massage.  Deep massage of the feet and shoulders. I'm surprised they weren't busier!  Was a great experience & i'll definitely be back!

41.description: Best deep tissue massage by Sophia and for the first time I had acupuncture by Julia and it was worth it, so relieved and relaxed!  Will highly recommend this place.

52.description: So I'm writing this review on Yelp to let everyone know that this is the place to come and get the best foot and body massage ever.. I was completely satisfied with the service I was provided with at Kingston Reflexology.. Tina was my masseuse both times I visited and can say from my personal experience that she is just Great and will continue seeing her ...            The establishment itself is clean and very comfortable to be in ... Front desk and staff were very nice and friendly (lots of smiles) and just made me feel welcomed.. Hope this helps for all you YELPERS out there! !!

50.description: Oh my Godness, a Chinese woman named Tina did the foot massage for me, she is so wonderful. This is the first time I am here and I have not had a lot of massages before but I definitely come back and have a 65 $ massage therapy. Thank you so much Tina. You are amazing

4.description: This place is great!  It's very clean and spacious with easy street parking.  The front desk woman was very friendly.  I had an hour long Swedish massage with Jason.  He was awesome - strong but not so much that I am in pain right now.  I feel so relaxed! He hit all the right spots and really knew what he was doing.  I took one star off because he did not massage my arms or my feet, which I thought was strange.  Also the rooms are set up loft-style so they are not totally private, and it was quite loud - you could hear other rooms and also the employees filling buckets and doing other things - it was distracting. It's not a fancy spa if that's what you are looking for, but at $45 for an hour (with coupon) it was a great deal.   Overall I recommend it and would go back.

6.description: The Swedish massage was Amazinggggg.. And Affordable. Prompt. Completed the whole 60min. Clean  Such a peaceful environment.. Definitely will be coming back! Thank you Kingston and staff!

22.description: Excellent quality massages at an affordable price!  Very comfortable atmosphere, appointments not necessary!Not much more needs to be said!

15.description: I love it here and it's quickly becoming a monthly ritual for me to come to Kingston. They are so kind and so good at what they do. I've done the 45 and 60 minute combos and the 60 minute Swedish. They're all amazing but I slightly prefer the combo because it focuses so much on feet and legs, an area where I'm prone to have pain.Like others, I would like to point out to other customers to please (please please) be respectful of others when you're in this place. You can hear literally everything above a whisper.

57.description: I've never had reflexology before and it was great. Sam (the only male therapist) was very professional and attentive. I could feel the difference as he applied pressure to the different parts of my feet. And then there was the massage. A nice mix of Swiss and Deep Tissue and he really addressed the tight knot of nerves under my shoulder blades. Great location in Six Corners, very, VERY reasonable prices, and a nice staff.

20.description: Having a pretty intense, stressful job...I wanted to check this place out to get some much needed help on my neck/shoulders. And this place delivered. I will admit I don't think many speak English here, so it was a bit frustrating communicating what I was there for, but the level of work that they do can't be compared to anywhere else I've been! I don't know the name of the person that worked on me, she just walked in, did her thing and walked out. But I feel so much better today! They accomodated my ever changing work schedule and even took me an hour earlier when I called letting them know I could come in sooner than my appointment. Nice place, great decor, very clean and for sure will be back! Oh, and be sure to ask to keep your cover when you're asked to flip over. Mine was pulled off...AWKWARD!

36.description: The last time I got a massage was last year in October. My job is stressful and I am planning my wedding for September. Did I mention my 5 year old and my husband lol. I was having the worst back and neck pain that you wouldn't believe tossing and turning nights in bed. I tried icy hot to relax my muscles cold packs nothing seemed to work until I yelped this place saw nothing but good reviews place was very clean neat very friendly employees made me feel comfortable. The 45 min deep tissue massage was amazing! My back feels good! Deff will be coming back and it's so close to my house.

14.description: 5+ stars!!! Exceptional customer service!! Let me first tell you that this was my first time as a massage place. I did about 2 weeks of research via groupon and other discount sites. I've seen a deal for this location however wasn't a couples massage. I looked at their pricing and it was cheapest among all. I thought by paying less I would loose out on a great massage. That was NOT the case at all. I can't tell you how happy my fiance and I are. This was her first time as well and we will be going back for sure! The lady whom worked on me "Mae" was very professional and skillful. Magical hands! She put every second into my massage and that's important. The rooms are super clean and quiet. The music is great! I love them! Please visit them if you would like an hour or more of true relaxation!

3.description: A friend recommended I go there since they had such great stuff.  Glad I did!  Deborah the owner is super friendly and everything in there was very clean.  It's obvious that she takes great care in putting only quality items in her store.  I will definitely be back!

1.description: I love this shop. Debbie is a doll, and keeps the shop clean, well-organized and seasonally stocked all the time.She also buys back at fair prices if she can use the merchandise. Just like any other buy-back business it's probably not a good idea to bring in 5 garbage bags of old stained clothes, but newer toys, clothes and equipment are usually always bought. She will also call you if she gets in anything that matches a specific request of yours. Great shop to buy new/gently-used kids clothes, toys and accessories.

2.description: It's become a pastime  of mine to haunt resale/thrift shops to seek out clothes for my daughter.  This is one of the best I've yet found!  Lots of merchandise, and good brands to be found....Hanna Andersson, Gap Kids, Little Boden, Columbia, Justice, Children's Place, etc.  The clothes I looked through were in very good condition, and the prices are great!   For $50, I walked away with 8-9 items including several that were brand new with tags...it's the best deal for the best quality that I've found in quite awhile.  The store also has toys, books, games, stuffed animals and such.  The owner, Debra, was very nice and friendly.  I commented on her merchandise, and she told me that bags and bags of clothes come in every day.  I'll be back!

5.description: Used to come here alot when I lived down the block, but I still make the occasional trip if I see something cute in the window. Prices are great, and the toys are superclean - the last few things I've bought have been brand new in the box!The lady that runs it is super sweet and will help you if you have any questions.

6.description: Loved this shop. Great kids stuff. Clean. Good selection. Came in on a whim and caught a 50% off summer sale. Got 3 bathing suits (gap kids & childrens place) and 2 toys (Lamaze & Melissa & Doug) for less than $20.  I will definitely be back.

0.description: The proprietor is an absolute angel! The selection of new and barely used items was amazing, definitely a neighborhood gem. They didn't have an item I was looking for, but they took my contact info and followed up with me the next week when they had it in stock. Felt like I was robbing the place for the price I paid for brand NEW children's clothing and toys, just don't tell everyone about it!

4.description: What a great find! I'm expecting my first baby in December and was looking to round out what I received at my baby shower. I bought 10 gender neutral onesies in the sizes I wanted. Each one was $3 or less. The store was very well organized and it was easy to find what I wanted. I also found a lovely bouncer for $25. Everything looked like new. I'll definitely be back!

1.description: The gym is really small. It gets super packed in here, especially on mondays. The locker room is always packed, restrooms are out of order frequently. Not a lot of machines. Benches are always occupied, you have to come in early in the morning, or late after 8 pm. The price is really cheap, thats the only good thing about this gym.

9.description: I used to frequent this location all the time. So far, my experience with XSport is that the smaller gyms are better taken care of than the larger ones. For whatever reason, the lighting in this location is really good. I always see the workers cleaning the machines or vacuuming. The weight area is usually a mess, but they also have the group fitness room where I would use to do my own weight workout sessions. The parking isn't the greatest, but I never had any trouble finding street parking as the lot there is a joke. It is an older location, but I really liked this one compared to the Brick Yard Location. I was disappointed in one of the spin instructors. Although she was very friendly and introduced herself to me after one of the classes since I was new to the class, she did spend about half of the class, not on a spin bike, but checking herself out in the mirror while SCREAMING instructions at us. I did not find it encouraging at all and this was the first time I ever had a spin instructor at XSport behave in this manner. Needless to say, I did not return to the class again, but this location is otherwise great!

23.description: I still have 6 months remaining on my membership to this location, however have decided to go elsewhere.    This gym is dirty and outdated.  The staff isn't always professional.  While working out on the elliptical there are staff members sitting right in front of everyone eating junk food.  The smell of grease looms in the area making it easy to get off the machines and just go home.   They don't monitor the tanning closely - I have had several instances where my minutes were low and not due to my use.  The music is usually way too loud as are the t.v.'s  Some mornings the staff is watching t.v. while sitting at the desks & have them so loud it is a distraction.I have been in the gym when someone that knew a staff member was there with their pit bull.  The dog was not on a lease and was roaming around the gym while not being watched by the owner.The personal trainers are required to be there even when not with a client.  They are sales people looking for business and have no qualms about interrupting your workout to try and get you to sign up.The gym is not clean and the woman's locker area usually has an unpleasant smell.Parking is usually difficult.  The weight area is overly crowded on the weekends.  The equipment is outdated. I don't need a fancy gym- can bring my own towel & skip the fancy lockerrooms - however this is not an atmosphere I am comfortable in.   There are other gyms in the area, one less expensive and also opened 24/7.  If you're serious about getting in a good workout in a comfortable, clean gym  I suggest going elsewhere.

12.description: A year ago this gym was completely horrible and I'd only visit to get some quick cardio in my life. I took a few months off of the gym but came back recently and was pleasantly surprised. A bunch of the machines were updated. The elliptical and bikes now have their personal TVs. WIN! And the paper towels are finally stocked.Sadly, it still has its flaws. The locker room is a nightmare. It's pretty scummy in there and its too crowded. The weight area is in need of new equipment and lastly the workers don't really look like they're qualified to be giving health tips.All in all, there are better gyms in the city but for a quick workout, this works.

21.description: A year ago this gym was completely horrible and I'd only visit to get some quick cardio in my life. I took a few months off of the gym but came back recently and was pleasantly surprised. A bunch of the machines were updated. The elliptical and bikes now have their personal TVs. WIN! And the paper towels are finally stocked.Sadly, it still has its flaws. The locker room is a nightmare. It's pretty scummy in there and its too crowded. The weight area is in need of new equipment and lastly the workers don't really look like they're qualified to be giving health tips.All in all, there are better gyms in the city but for a quick workout, this works.

16.description: If you're looking to get your GTL on for cheap, go here. The Belmont location doesn't offer all of the amenities other X-Sports do (pool, basketball court, rock climbing), etc., but they do have all of the essentials: weights, cardio machines, a group fitness studio, and tanning. EQUIPMENT: I've been a member for about three years now, and they've made many upgrades during that time. New treadmills and ellipticals, new FreeMotion strength training machines, flat screen TVs, and, most recently, TVs on every cardio machine. Totally satisfied. Except for the fact that there's often a wait for benches and machines during peak hours.STAFF: The staff is usually nice and makes an effort to say whattup when you enter, but they're not annoying.ATMOSPHERE: Lots and lots of juiceheads. Tanned juiceheads. Although some may find this intimidating, I look at it as a motivator (because if I spend enough time there I may one day bench 200 and have a bangin' physique just like they do). The music selection, though, was better before the playlist became one of the TV music channels.TANNING: As a guy it's a lot less awkward going tanning at the gym than walking into a tanning salon, which is probably why many of the juiceheads jump into the tanning beds right after their workout. Beds are good. Definitely get the job done.

17.description: I joined this gym back in 2008. Since then I have moved to the Elston location, but relocated and started frequenting this location again. Xsport in general is a pretty good gym. When I first joined, I lost 40lbs with the assistance of my personal trainer, who is no longer there. But, I did gain a wealth of knowledge from him a lots of motivation. As previous posters have stated, this is a pretty bare-minimum gym, but for the price, what can you expect. If you are strictly into working out, and lifting, this is a good little location. I would avoid going during peak hours after work, or later in the evening, but if you can go in the morning or late at night, it is usually pretty empty. The locker rooms have improved over the 3 years since I first joined. While they are messy at times, for the most part they are clean and stocked. The staff is sometimes aloof and will not greet you, even though you may have spent (in my case) tons of money there, but again, it is to be expected at a gym of this sort. Overall, an okay gym for the price. No frills and definitely not for the faint of heart.

10.description: I is hard for me to feel sorry for those going to a gym, but wont walk a block or two to park.  I just joined and have always found a spot in one of their 2 lots.   Got a free personal training session.  It was wonderful!  have to say the sales pressure was a bit strong.  But come on that's how they make their living. Listened lots to the trainer.  He was knowledgeable and I took the opportunity to learn.  Believe he helped me look to what I should be doing.  Wish they offered a once a month trainer evaluation.  Just can't afford to do the full trainer sessions.  Only issue is wanted to do all the exercises the trainer showed me on my second trip but floor mats were hard to find.  Hope you will all be as friendly now that you have my money but not much more to give!

5.description: I have joined Xsport fitness recently and this location is one of the worst. It is extremely crowded around 7-9 pm in weekdays and it is full of weird looking older guys doing nothing but staring at all the women around them while occupying machines just to sit and stare. On top of that you have to wait in line for everything.I had a personal trainer who was extremely bored and not very enthusiastic about being a trainer. He looks like he was just there to get his monthly payment without doing much work. If teaching people annoys/bores you so much why are you working there?? He kept talking on and on about some stuff that i dont even remember a word of it. He just supposed to listen what I need/want, then figure out what we should do, show me what we should do and then make a weekly plan. Listening and figuring out part was okay. Then he suppose to make a plan for me so i keep doing it until i meet him again and he only gave me 4 exercises to do over a week, freaking 4 exercises. He seems like he is trying to take things slow on purpose so i can purchase personal trainer for another month. I cannot find any other reasonable explanation about how he treated me.So i have decided to change my location to another Xsport which seems to have much kinder employees and cleaner space.

11.description: Disappointingly hard to do business with.My wife loved the first couple months, but when her schedule didn't work out, she tried to cancel this after not using it for three months. They want the card and contract mailed back. Odd, but fair enough. Then they refused to take those documents IN PERSON, demanding them via certified mail.#Unprofessional #xsportfitness

22.description: I was briefly a member of this xsport about 2 years ago and it was horrible.  It's dirty, it's messy, the staff when not ignoring you is very pushy with sales of supplements and personal training sessions.  Worse, many - and I do mean many - of the members are filthy themselves.  I mean they smell.....BAD.  So bad, in fact that one man alone was capable of keeping me out of the entire back half of the gym.  But wait, there's more - my iPod was stolen from my locked locker by an xsport employee.  Couple days later I canceled my membership.

0.description: I come here about 3 times a week. I'm sold because of the daycare included in my price. I get two free hours and can even see him on a TV at a machine if I want. The staff are nice and friendly. Everyone speaks to you when you come in. The downer is that parking is tight in the evenings.

20.description: "Tis what it 'tis.  This gym has seen better days, but the cardio equipment has been upgraded, as has the personal tvs.  You have to ask yourself what you want out of a gym.  If it is to get into shape or stay fit - no frills, then this is your place.  There are a couple excellent trainers there - Fiona being one. I go because it is close - rain, snow or shine - and eliminates one more excuse why I shouldn't be in shape.Know it is basic.  Know it is no frlils.  Know that if your goal is to get fit without the fancy - then this is your place.

19.description: "Tis what it 'tis.  This gym has seen better days, but the cardio equipment has been upgraded, as has the personal tvs.  You have to ask yourself what you want out of a gym.  If it is to get into shape or stay fit - no frills, then this is your place.  There are a couple excellent trainers there - Fiona being one. I go because it is close - rain, snow or shine - and eliminates one more excuse why I shouldn't be in shape.Know it is basic.  Know it is no frlils.  Know that if your goal is to get fit without the fancy - then this is your place.

2.description: If you like cockroaches in the sauna & mexicans pourng water on an electric heater while they are wearing gym shes, socks, swea at tpants, throwing garbage, spiting, go to xport on belmont &central..the filthyest place I ever went..Iv'e been in cook county jail andbthis place is 10 times worse e! !!!! The staff dont have any class....

18.description: This place is ok... But if you're going to offer child care make sure you staff appropriately..

13.description: A good gym, not the best. Has some equipment, it is an express. I would not recommend going on a weekday mon-Thursday in the morning or late evening, this place will be packed. The staff is just there, stand around, dont give any trouble. The tanning is cheap here as well, decent.

4.description: I 've read a few previous reviews about the front desk staff needing to learn basic customer service skills. I absolutely agree. It's as though they are encouraged not to smile, say "welcome" or "hello," or even give you eye contact. I've made this observation on the company's website too (along with a couple of others, like a lack of water fountains). Don't expect any changes based on a Yelp review.All this to say, read all the low-star reviews on this place. They seem pretty accurate in my experience there. You may want to spend your time and money elsewhere.

24.description: Not Xsport's best effort.PRO: I went on a Monday @ 7:30P.  It wasn't crowded. The facility was clean. Tons of weightlifting equipment. CON: NO TOWELS.  Bring your own. Temperature in the facility was appropriately cool (for summer) but there are no ceiling fans and the air circulation could be better. 18 Treadmills (with no TV's on the machines).  10 TV's in the treadmill area. One was off. One had a blurry screen. Only one water fountain.Women's locker room was clean, but it is small and the carpet and lockers look old. There's is no pool, jacuzzi or sauna. There is tanning.The fitness classes room is big and looks very nice.Parking: 16 spaces in the lot (was full, some illegally parked) and plenty of street parking (metered).I'm a member at Xport's new Logan Square facility. It's often crowded but it is a very nice facility compared to this one.  But if you just want a bare bones Xsport that isn't crowded at night, this might work.

6.description: I went in with my friend to check out xsport before I got a membership as my membership at charter fitness had just expired. I hadn't been there for 1 minute before the BS started. Some salesdude comes over a put such ridiculous pressure on me it was pathetic. I explained first: I've never been here before and would like to see what machines they had and what the experience was like; second I wouldn't make a decision without my husband as he would've been signing up as well. Fat boi just wouldn't let it go. 10 minutes in my gurl was livid as this dude just wouldn't give up. Why would I start membership somewhere I hadn't even checked out. Are they desperate? Because of this I decided to yelp the location in skokie closest to my house and saw all the negative reviews and that sealed the deal. No xsport for us. In thus location the love drinking fountain was in the middle of free weight section. Awkward. Also there were no towels or spray bottles of sanitizer to take with you to actually wipe down machines. Filthy! And to me the machines compared to charter sucked. Add all of that with the fat boi that put so much pressure to buy before you look. You guys suck. I expected so much more. I'm going my happy butt back to charter,where they're friendly,clean,and machines are simple. I'm sooooo glad she took me in here as I would've walked into skokie location which is premium,paid a guap,and been to naive to check out before I bought with the lure of having pool and sauna,and been absolutely pissed. I never once had problem at charter,and I feel super guilty for leaving thinking the grass was greener........

15.description: Let me start by saying that the pictures on this yelp page are not pictures of the actual gym aside from the storefront picture. the gym looks nothing like those pictures, those are from a newer xsport, not this one.
