This is definitely my least favorite xsport, but also the closest- needless to say, i still stop in here sometimes because of the convenience.1) parking is awful: the parking lot has about 10 spaces. i have not been able to park in the parking lot once. they say they valet but there is never a valet guy out there. also, as much as i go to the gym, it would suck to have to tip someone every time on top of the membership price. then, all of the street parking is either permit parking or pay for parking. it's best to just walk there if you are close enough.2) it is super outdated: everything about this place is old. very old lockers. bathroom is old. equipment is old. definitely does not look like the other xsports.3) tiny: it is a very small gym. i get that it is express, but it is still tiny and gets VERY crowded. 4) always have to wait for equipment: the equipment is very limited and i usually have to wait for equipment. especially treadmills, there is almost always a wait for a treadmill. 5) get's VERY hot and smells bad: yes, you come to the gym to sweat. but since it is so small & so crowded, with poor ventilation- it gets extremely hot to the point that it is very uncomfortable and it smells like sweat & other things.6) locker room is terrible: half of the lockers do not even close!! they are worse than my high school lockers. the bathroom stalls are tiny and impossible to change in. they are also very dirty. 7) there are a lot of young kids in here: i have never been to a gym that has so many high school kids and even younger "working out" here. they sit on equipment texting the whole time or just talking, which can be annoying when you are trying to get your workout in & leave right away.Overall, it's not the greatest gym and can use a ton of updating and more parking. but, you can get  your work out done here.

7.description: Great staff. Clean. But very busy. It's hard to find parking especially between the hours of 5-8pm.

8.description: This Xsport. though small and crowded seems to be managed very well lately. Friendly staff and has enough equipment, cardio, weights etc. I tried a trainer there and he was great and knew what he was doing.  I had an excellent workout with him. It is busy sometimes but they are working hard at keeping it cleaned and maintained.

3.description: Oh where to start with this review.  I heard that they offer basic plans starting at $5, I signed up elsewhere and paid a lot more. Well this is an express location so you won't find a pool.  It's also one of the original locations so it's been remodeled but it's not as fancy as the newer locations,  which doesn't bother me because the machines are in good conditions and that's what I'm there for. The staff has been friendly so far. I've been to 2 aerobic classes and that's what keeps this location on my schedule.  The Zumba with Raquel is awesome!  She is so intense and you leave feeling like you got exactly what you came for.  The cardio kickboxing with Tory is also a class worth taking.  My only cons so far for this location is the aerobic class is really small (really, really small).  The other issue is the parking as with all the locations  is difficult.

14.description: Parking is a pain unless you go down the street to the garage, sometimes it's messy super early in the morning (weights everywhere, paper towels on the floor), and definitely do not come here during peak hours.BUT - it's inexpensive, close to home, and the workout room they have is great. I can see small upgrades/replacements to equipment lately, which is nice.I've heard the men's sauna is broken a lot, but I've never had a problem with the women's. Having protein and granola bars there - that you can charge to your account instead of bringing in a wallet - is convenient. Despite some of it's downfalls, I'll be sticking with this gym.

58.description: I went there today with my kids ordered two slices and ended up paying more money then usual they raised the price 550 a slice with no warning to the customers that have been going for years . Very disappointing

56.description: This last New Year's Eve, my friends and I were on our way to Sidekicks (god bless) and needed to carb up before we started pounding shots into our already-brimming bloodstreams. I suggested pizza and hopped on Yelp to find the nearest place. Two were listed as the high-rating in the area. Bacci's and some place across the street--the name of which escapes me. For all of you that remember, NYE 2012 was a bleak, frigid night. My friends were wasting zero time on the street, looking for a place to go. We originally opted for the place across the street from Bacci's and I swear to god, it had one light on. The menu light. The soft amber glow of neglect illuminated a scene of plastic lawn furniture and a single frightening man sitting in the shadows playing, I don't know... Doodle Jump on his phone. I immediately turned around and yelled, "Bacci's it is!" Yes, this place may be slightly ratchet. The pizza may be just-missing-the-mark NYC style. But the slices are Teri Hatcher-thin, ample in size AND it comes with a free soda--awesome for dining in, crappy for a to-go order... it's practically a styrofoam thimble with a straw--so who can really get that upset with this place? They let us stay, without argument or grumble, past the closing time so we could finish. All of the employees wished us a Happy New Year and told us to come back when we had more time. Everyone was pleasant, the tables were clean, and there were no odd smells or textures coming from the pizza. I'll be returning, but sober and with a skeptical eye. Your move, Bacci.

29.description: What a great gimmick - jumbo slice.  But the problem is their pizza is terrible. Little Cesar might even be better. This place reminded me of a pizza place from the early 90s. Not the cleanest place. Skip this place, not worth your time.

42.description: I love this pizza I am not going to lie, but why is it that I always get BAD customer service?Yesterday I had the worst experience in there. I came back from school and it's super convenient for me because it's my way home. So I stopped here to grab a couple of slices for home, as soon as I pull the door (which was stuck and it made a huge noise) I didn't notice anybody at the counter. It took around 5 minutes for anybody to show up. It was a young girl around 16-17 yrs. and of coarse she is not properly dress to work with food, she had her hair down and NO gloves. This girl is named "Brianaz N" I attempted to say Hi, because she didn't greet me. I ask for my order and she gave me the worst attitude (what can you expect from a spoiled little girl) as if she was doing ME a favor. lol really? Whatever happened to customer service skills? Any who, she asked me if I wanted one cup for my soda or two separate, I told her that I needed two and she literally tossed me the cups at the counter, wait to go brat! lol Time passed I received my pizza and I left! As I pulled that noisy door to go out, I realized that I kept blaming that little girl for my anger but in reality I should blame myself for going to places like these. No more money from me Bacci's that is for sure!

23.description: Its same quality as little Creaser's pizza or worst. They told me it was going to be 30 minutes till it was going to be ready which is no problem. But when I got there about forty minutes later i had to wait on my pizza for about 10 more minutes. They weren't to busy, but the real kicker is that instead of the sausage pizza I ordered I got pepperoni. I wasn't about to wait another hour for a pizza.

47.description: A slice of pizza I have trouble finishing and all you can drink pop for $5? Yes please! The wings are excellent. I've had buffalo and barbeque and now have the problem of not being able to decide between the two whenever I'm in the mood for wings (which is basically all the time.)

8.description: Great service, great food. The Bacci slice is a go to food choice. I love the giant slices of pizza. I love bacci!

31.description: Seriously, if I want to make flat bread with the tiniest hint of cheese and tomato sauce, I would've made my own!! Bacci's what happened to your awesome pizza??? Sooo disappointed!!!

34.description: Waited an hour and a half on a Sunday night. Pizza was cold on arrival. Not worth the 25 bucks we paid.

16.description: Yes the pizza is big for one slice.....but that's the only thing good about it. The pizza was lacking of flavor and sauce. It's not those type of pizza where u bite into and hot melted cheese stretches out. Not worth it. Better go somewhere else!!!

13.description: My friends told me the food here never sat right with them. Ignoring them and seeing some good reviews, my girlfriend and I went to try it at night. The following morning, the both of us woke up sick and vomiting. I myself had to be treated for food poisoning. It may have been two slices that may have been left out too long, but in my opinion no slices at all should be causing people to vomit uncontrollably the next morning. I advise no one to eat here.

11.description: baccies is a great place to have a quick bite to eat and enjoy a big slice that will fill you up. dont expect a top notch pizza for this is a "working men" pizza joint. the service is great and everyone is so nice. prizes are fair and quantity is good. good job bacci's i shall go back for more soon.

39.description: Their pizza is ok at best.

37.description: I use this location for delivery only. It's always on time! I absolutely love their Chilli Soup!

0.description: Chicago has its fair share of great pizza but I've been on the hunt for the very best and oh my gosh did I find it. This is the perfect combo of perfect sauce, perfect bread and perfect toppings. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. They are quick and the prices are great. Not to mention - the desserts Joel their weight as well. They also have great soda - that might be weird to say but it has good carbonation and crushed ice. So that is probably a personal preference but all in all - this is my #1 spot!And when I looked them up to do a Yelp review - I saw they deliver! Best news ever!!!!!!!And PS - jumbo doesn't even begin to describe the size of these slices!

38.description: Go to place to split a piece of pizza when everything else is closed. Not the greatest but good enough to fulfill that pizza craving. They have it sitting out and they reheat the pieces for you, They bake the pizzas and throw toppings on top afterwards. Kinda weird but again, good late night spot to kill a pizza craving.

51.description: It's good ass pizza for cheap. HUGE slice of pizza and a cup for soda free refills only 5.50 it's a deal like no other.

27.description: I've been a patron of Bacci's for a long long time. Ever since high school I've been coming and ordering Bacci's and loving it. I live just blocks from this location and always find myself coming back to Bacci's even after other pizza places open up around it. Never had a bad experience here, from ordering to going here and eating in. Delivery has always been about normal, never an issue. The pizza itself is the stuff drunks dream of. Crispy crust, tasty sauce and lots of cheese. It's the most perfect food to soak up last night's vodka and to just take a slice home when you're feeling like it. This isn't a place that the pizza only tastes good when you're drunk though. It's not a very thin crust, almost a middle between thin and pan. The $5 jumbo slice & pop is perfection, you can't get a better deal! The establishment itself isn't the prettiest but then again it's usually the best, hole-in-the-wall places that serve the best food! Sure they may employ neighborhood teens who hate thier lives (but who didn't go through that "phase"?), but as long as the product is good and the service isn't horrid, I'll keep coming back!

32.description: I've always loved Bacci the pizza is great however this is the second time they have messed up my order and forgotten my drink. I ordered a sprite and a coke. He handed me a sprite with my pizza and said he would come back with my COKE and he came back with a sprite. Mind you he had just delivered one sprite with my order. So again here i sit eating my pizza without my favorite thing to quench my thirst.... :/

54.description: Today was my first time ordering Bacci's pizza and it was okay. It is a little greasy but I blotted the pizza with a paper towel. The delivery arrived on time, but the delivery guy was not very pleasant. He gave me my change and ran off. I was planning to give him a tip but he seemed so irritated I just let him go. I counted my change and he kept my coin what like $0.50. Why not be nice and get a decent tip? The food was not so great I cannot live without it. So, I do not think I will be ordering for Bacci's again.

48.description: Hungry and only have $5.00 to your name? Pizza and pop will get you $5. The pizza slices are always filling with the jumbo slice.

44.description: This place is aweful especially when you order online or over the phone. They don't have a lot of the items on the menu and when you have a choice of type of bread or grilled or crispy chicken, they just put whatever they want.

24.description: I didn't even want to give this place one star but no stars was not an option.I ordered  a family size cheese and sausage pizza last week and after telling the guy yes I wanted sausage on the whole pizza ,when my husband picked it up there was only cheese no sausage .I called back and spoke with a young lady that asked me to come pick up another pizza I explained to her I was over 30 miles away but they could deliver one to my address  because me being inconvenienced is not an option especially when they are the ones that screwed it up.she offered to put 25.00 back on my credit card and I agreed and now here it is 3 days later and no credit ! I am not a picky eater but cardboard is an acquired taste I couldn't even eat one slice of the pizza so it was thrown away and I ordered from Luigis

7.description: I used to love the parmasen chicken its cost 7.95 plus tax and you would get a good size sandwich but not anymore.  I order three parmasen  chicken sandwiches and was infuriated by the size of the sandwich, its about half the size of what they used to be. They are Not worth it anymore, same price for half the sandwich! This is the only thing that made me want to eat here. The amount of cursing I did driving home was above average. So mad I had to download a stupid app to write a review!

49.description: Large slices, huge pizzas are great for a crowd. Reasonably good pasta dishes. A good spot for quick delivery.

40.description: Seriously horrible experience tonight. Have been ordering from here lately because I live in a area where we don't get many deliveries. Tonight I ordered a spinach and mushroom pizza and had no idea they throw canned mushrooms and raw spinach on top of a old slice of cheese that has proably sat there all day. I called to ask the employee if this was a typical thing they do and before my sentence was finished she insisted the spinach was not raw. I was getting nowhere quick with the rude employee on the other end of the phone call so I asked for a manager and what do you know there was no manager there. I then asked when would a manager be in and what was their name she then told me she could not give out this kind of information. So what I have gathered is a bunch of 16-17 year olds are running this place and that maybe the health department needs a call before someone is sick in the hospital because of this children running a food establishment. I will never EVER order or think of ordering from here again.

53.description: I give this place four stars, but not for the quality or uniqueness of the pizza. Sure the slices are huge, and it's decent for a late night drunken pizza binge. Maybe it's because the pizza is cooked, left out, and the re-cooked. I mean it's no different from me eating leftover pizza. It's edible. Tastes alright. It's only $5 and it comes with a small drink. But that's not all they have. I have to give them props for their other items. Their Italian beef sandwiches and chicken wings are actually better than the pizza. This particular location in Portage Park also delivers.

30.description: I got FOOD Poisoning from the pizza! This is completely unacceptable. I was sick for a few days which was dissapointing. I will never set foot in there again.

46.description: Pizza slices bigger than your face! It's spectacular for the size and the price. Not the best, but definitely better than those corporate places. Almost everyone has five dollars. Plus they make their own soda pop, which is zero deneros if you buy a slice.

1.description: Ordered a jumbo for the super bowl party I was having at my house. I ordered my pizza at 2:30pm so I could pick it up at 5:30pm. I got here at exactly 5:25pm to pick up and I still waited another 30min. The staff is nice but my pizza was undercooked. I know they are jammed with orders not at least cook the pizza right even if I have to wait an hour. I had to cook it some more in my oven. That sucked since my guests were already over. The pizza has gone downhill for me. Not sure if I'll ever order again.

55.description: Let's begin by stating the obvious...THE PIZZA IS HUGE!!!! I've gotten both the jumbo slices, and actual "normal" pizza from this place. Now, I know some people eat things like pasta and what not from a pizza joint, I'm not one of those people, that's weird to me. Anyways, Is this the BEST pizza I've EVER had in my entire life? No. However, I do like it a lot a lot a lot. I've had carry out, delivery, and eat in and I think the food is pretty consistent. If you join their club you can get great promotions in the past 2 months alone I've gotten 50% off a large and a free yes FREE no purchase needed large pizza delivered to my house. I think the service is a little "meh", but if you have $5.50 you can come here and get a drink and a pretty good pizza. I'm a fan and I continue to go back.

9.description: Just terrible! Paid our money for a slice and waited over 20 minutes and still no food. Will never go back there!!!!

26.description: Just had a slice from here tonight... Got a slice of pepperoni and it was HUGE and a really great value. I got a pop and a slice for $5. That's a great deal when you're broke and you're hungry. Ive had slices from other places in the neighborhood and this one is probably the better of them all. Will be going back, just hope they have more than just pepperoni and cheese.

25.description: Gave it another try last night.   Pizza had no flavor at all, crust was very gummy, totally under cooked.   soft drink machine, coke came out clear, it was carbonated water.  Cannot believe after all these years they still can't fix that machine!My little guy likes the hot wings,  5 wings for 2.50 is a great deal.  other than that... yuck!

12.description: Not a huge fan of the pizza, but rest of the food is pretty good.  Really need better customer service.  When the younger kids are working with no manager they really don't care about having happy customers or making their mistakes right by the customer.

59.description: HA. This place is a straight up joke. I hope they fired that one girl with the Jordan's and dark hair at the register or the manager taught her a thing or two about customer service. Came here last summer with my boyfriend and he got a slice to go. I would've gotten a slice as well, but I didn't feel like indulging in pizza which is essentially bread, bigger than the size of my head that day. So I decided I'd settle for a salad. Yep, they offer a variety of salad. I specifically asked the girl if their chopped salad comes with bacon (cause most do). I wanted to make sure I got it without it if they did since I didn't eat red meat at the time. She said it doesn't and that it came with lettuce, tomato, cucumbers, and dressing. Hmm, never had cucumber in a chopped salad...but sounds alll good to me!And whaddaya know, i get a big 'ol pile of bacon on top of a bed of lettuce. -_- I figured she was new and just made a mistake which I'd understand (I've worked at a restaurant for years) so I was patient with her...up until she started being unbelievably rude to me for no reason at all. When I told her again I didn't want meat, she was completely unapologetic, rolled her eyes, and after she literally yanked the box of salad out of my hand, the girl rudely goes, "Ok, so what do you want? A new one?"  She acted as if I was trying to be a bothersome to her. All I said was No and asked for a refund. I can tell she was getting even more annoyed. But wait a minute, YOU'RE the one that clearly messed up my order. Grab some scissors and cut that shitty attitude of yours or learn your menu so you don't misinform customers with certain diet restrictions. If you did that, you wouldn't have to go through that oh so time consuming dreaded process of opening a fucking register. She went to the register then proceeded to tell me she can't give me a refund because I didn't have a receipt. Are you kidding me? Who the hell hired this girl? My boyfriend tells her how she just handed me the receipt a minute ago when I paid for it, and I left it on the counter (cause I didn't think that I'd be needing it) and he saw her throw it out. She says, "I still can't give you your money back without a receipt or my register will be short." What? How is your register being short my problem at all?  What do you possibly want me to say to this? Go find my receipt in the garbage you threw it out in or look up the last order/receipt through the computer like any person with common sense would?? She then magically figured out what buttons to tap, gave me my money back, and stormed off.Hahaha, long story short, just go to Pizza by Alex across the street. Better vibes, and I believe they actually practice a little something called good customer service. Plus, their pizza isn't like chewing into a 3 inch thick cardboard box with cheese on top.

21.description: 5$ jumbo slice with a pop. It's not a bad deal. However they've literally forgot my pizza in the oven almost every time I go there. I will repeat though...If I'm not in a rush. Wings are okay, haven't tried anything else there. Neighborhood joint, been around awhile but losing its charm. Try it out for yourself, you will probably like it if you are looking for something quick filling and cheap.

17.description: You can't beat it for the price I guess, kind of NY style big chewy crust I prefer thinner and a little more  crisp style guess I'm just a Chicago style person

10.description: The pizza is good! Always good, but when I. Order other things for delivery its not the best, i wish they would take in more quality with their other foods,just like they do their pizza. But Thr Last time I ordered I. Was very disappointed with the food and the pizza,they didn't put enough cheese it was more sauce and bread and the girl that took my order had a hearing problem,I had to repeat myself because she couldn't hear what I was saying!! Change your or train them better!

5.description: I have to say this place is my to-go-to pizza place when I'm craving pizza. It's never been a disappointment and it's ready in couple minutes. My boyfriend and I usually get the jumbo slices and they are my fave

3.description: Probably the pizza its not the best on quality but its so yummy lol. maybe 1 or 2 time stop by this location and get slice to home, don't trust this place to stay around and enjoy my food. the slice is to huge and maybe good to share with another person..

35.description: I remember when this place first opened up! I was in high school! Which was quite some time ago. Though I do love me some Bacci's pizza, it certainly has changed over the years. Their pizza is still good, but now I think they premake all of them and leave them out and wait for people to order them then heat them up. So it doesn't have that 'fresh' taste. The pricing has gone up. I remember when it was $2.50 for a slice with free pop (now that was a flippen deal!!!!) Then it went up and up each year, and now I think it's $5.50. I've been to other locations around the city but I fee like this is the cleanest and has more friendly employees.

19.description: "OMG! IT'S SO BIG!" Yeah a big slice of crap.

28.description: This place sucks. We got a thin crust to go. After a couple horrible slices I realized that the taste of the pizza resembled oyster crackers. This is the first time my fiancé and I didn't even want to save the left over pizza, we tossed it in the garbage where it belonged.

45.description: I am obviously a huge Pizza fan I grew up in NYC. That being said I do love Bacci Pizza. However, not from this location. The past three times that I have ordered in food from them they have forgotten parts of my order. And this last time that I ordered and they forgot something they yelled at me, claimed to not understand me. When I called back they got upset and said that I did not pay for it. When I told them it was from their coupon that I entered and it said it took online they were even more rude. They have forgotten the cardinal rule of customer service "the customer is always right." In addition, who yells at a customer and hangs up. I respect how hard people in this industry work I have many friends who are in the indsutry and I am in customer care myself. But to yell, hang up the phone and not follow through on your coupons! Its just ridiculous. All in all yes, Bacci pizza is great! But go to another location where you can get your moneys's worth, good food and good customer service!

33.description: Pizza slice is around $5.50 now with free pop. Burgers here are okay. Also ordering pizza for large parties isn't ideal for some reason it ends up tasting shitty order somewhere else.

43.description: Came here around 2:30 AM with a group a friends craving pizza. I ordered sausage and started to wait. Took almost ten minutes to get my slice ... But it was cheese. I went by the counter hearing a guy and the cashier talk about her shifts. Instead the cashier gave my slice of sausage to someone that she knew that came in a minute ago. I was shocked when they told me they had no sausage left. Started to eat my cheese slice at 2:50 but was kicked out before this Baccis was suppose to close.

2.description: One of the worst pizza places I've ever encountered. I don't know why we wanted to try this place out, but two large pizzas costed us $57 including delivery fees and tip, which is why overpriced for this garbage.We ordered a supreme thin crust pizza which was soggy and had terrible taste. Then we ordered a stuffed pizza which was delivered wrong and instead we got a pan crust pizza. So for $57 we could've gone to Little Caesar's and got 10 pizzas which would've been better than this place.Avoid at all costs.

18.description: Gave it another try last night.   Pizza had no flavor at all, crust was very gummy, totally under cooked.   soft drink machine, coke came out clear, it was carbonated water.  Cannot believe after all these years they still can't fix that machine!My little guy likes the hot wings,  5 wings for 2.50 is a great deal.  other than that... yuck!

41.description: The pizza slices are definitely big and you can get a decently priced meal but taste wise -- the pizza is just average.

52.description: worst expierence ever!!!!!!!!! they don't even desrve 1 star. i placed my delivery order through grubhub at approx. 8 p.m. and my approx. delivery time was 9:05-9:15. 9:05 came and gone then 9:15 then 9:30. i called grubhub to see where my food is at. grubhub says approx delivery time 9:45 so 9:45 still no pizza. i waited til 10 p.m. still no pizza. i called grubhub back and they said they were on their way. i asked that i get a substantial discount because i have waited about 2 hrs. all they were going to offer was a free cheesecake and a free soda. when the food finally comes at 10:45 they give me 2 pieces of stale looking cheesecake and no soda. my husband refused to sign the cc receipt because it din't have the correct discounted price on their so when we went upstairs and opened the pizza the flippin pizza was cold! my husband straight told them forget about sending him an updated receipt because he isn't going to pay for it. my guests were so hungry they were heating the pizza up in my microwave!! i used to like bacci's but after this fiasco never again!!

50.description: I have been to this place once before the pizza was decent and so was the price but after I went again to the one on montrose and Milwaukee and ordered from there I will say never again in my life am I gonna eat from there!!!! I honestly don't know what goes thru their head on serving molded pepperoni on my pizza as soon as I saw that I threw all the pizza I had bought for a party if they honestly serve food like that I wonder what else they keep for long periods of time and actually serve molded garbage to people

4.description: I've had the pizza and beef combo here. Both were really good. Especially the beef... was very consistent with the rest of Chicago. They advertise the biggest slice in town. And I would have to agree that it so far has been the biggest slice in town. Minus one star for the not so great customer service.

6.description: Their pizza is ok. The slices are huge but not that good. We ordered delivery tonight and the pizza literally stuck to the cardboard. All the cheese fell off, not worth ordering again. There is much better places than this one.

22.description: Huge pizza slices, good food/dessert, but terrible terrible terrible service.  You'd think they could hire someone with a brain.  You can literally stand in front of them, after walking into the door, and the cook will help you before anyone else will.

15.description: BOOOOO! The pizza is all right, cheap enough; but we ordered delivery of sandwiches, and the buffalo chicken sandwich had no dressing - they just threw a plastic factory-sealed packet of Kraft "bleu cheese" [-flavored] salad dressing in the bag! To their credit the driver gave me 2 free slice-of-pizza coupons since the delivery took 1-1/2 hours (the person on the phone had prepared us for that time span). If you're desperate, want to spend not much money and get not much for it, this might hit for you. "No thanks" for my part!

57.description: Slice is big but it's not the best. They do give you a drink which is good if you plan on dining in. If you are dining out the drink is worthless because I need about 10 of them. The meatlovers is alright. If I'm hungry and just want something quick and cheap and I'm in the area ill get Bacci's. If I want a better pizza I'll order out from some place else.

20.description: "OMG! IT'S SO BIG!" Yeah a big slice of crap.

36.description: The pizza isn't that bad but as the rest of the reviews point out the service here is terrible. Last night we ordered a pizza and the driver left after one missed call to my phone (we were working) and he never bothered to even ring the door bell. Once I called to ask about my order he was sent back with a cold pizza and had NO  change! His only option was a muted "I can go back to the store".I gave him the money and sent him on his way. There are better places to order from in the area.

14.description: Over-rated. Slices to expensive for the taste. Sauce flavor decent. Crust sucks. Maybe because it sits for ever and then re-heated before giving it to you. The old place used to be good. Expanding sometimes costs. In this case it has. Massively. 15 years ago at another location you would be happy. Now? No. I will add one other thing to this. Service. guy ringing people up was nice enough. The tiny chick throwing around boxes of pizza and slices like they were cardboard gives you a idea of the personality of the joint. Shitty! Ask yourself this. How many pizzas can you throw around without the tops sliding and doing all kinds of crazy in the box? Well Baccis cardboard pie is like a tank, impervious to damage. That's cause it's like cardboard. Try Dante's at Milwaukee and Diversey. It's destructive and fresh. See my other review.

0.description: Wow. Unbelievable selection of dvds. All pretty cheap as well.Some interesting toys and . I loved it. My girlfriend did to.

3.description: I live on the other side of the city now but it is worth the trip. Sandro is the best and I've been seeing him for years. The best!

1.description: I've been to all of the popular barbershops around the city of Chicago, and Sandro is by far the best! It's obvious he's extremely passionate about his craft, and his skills definitely reflect that. If you're looking for a great place to get a top notch cut from a friendly and professional barber, Sandro's is the spot.

2.description: Sandro is the best. The best haircut  I ever got. Nice and friendly.

0.description: Sandro is the MAN! He gave me a new hairstyle & I love it! Dropped my old barber for Sandro with no regrets! Does an awesome fade & side part. The atmosphere of his shop is laid back & not "street" like other fade shops. I love it there!

4.description: Moving here to Chicago just about 2 years ago i was in need of a good barber and im glad i met Sandro! His skills are on point and he takes his craft to another level.

28.description: The food was OK. I got the steak and cheese and there was absolutely nothing special about it. I would have given them two stars, but the guy working was pretty nice. I would not go out of my way for this place and I likely wouldn't even stop by if they were parked right outside my work... If it was about 2am and I was just leaving the bar though, I'd consider it.

1.description: Not only is the food great, Gino's saved my ass!After the previously scheduled food truck canceled two hours prior to the event start, I called Gino's and they saved the day!  Gino's showed up on a moment's noticed, and we had a great event with great food!

9.description: I have ordered from the truck 3-4 times in the past 2 months in the south Loop.  One of those visits I didn't get what I ordered; however when I mentioned it next time, they made up for their goof.The sandwiches are LARGE and I would say worth the $9.  Fries are $3 but easily two servings.  They aren't Philly's Best, but hey, I am not near Belmont!I ordered beef with provolone- will try cheddar next.

29.description: I've tried this truck a couple of times.  The steak and cheese fries are great and addictive.  However, the steak sandwiches are rather big and $9, they should offer a smaller portion.  Beware if you eat here it will run you $10 at the minimum.  Food is good but costly.

23.description: Fantastic cheese steak sandwich. Anytime I see these guys I have to grab one! Quality steak on the perfect roll.

5.description: Every time I ask for no onions... there they are... onions. Not to mention that they are pretty overpriced.. you can get a better cheesesteak from Philly's Best for less.

31.description: I ordered food here from the food truck event held in Schaumburg. Although the lines were long I decided that I would wait because I really wanted a cheesesteak. So I waited in line 30 mins and placed my order.... An hour later (that's right, an hour, from a food truck!) I received my food. They even mocked me when I told them I'd been waiting an hour. How rude is that?! It tasted fine but it wasn't prepared Chicago Style (which is $1 extra) like I asked. I'll be sure to skip this truck next time around and I suggest you do too.

25.description: Best philly cheese steak on this side of Philly. They put Philly's Best to shame. It is kind of expensive at 10 bucks a sandwich but trust me, you will be going back. These sandwiches truly are addictive. Havn't gotten the fries yet but the sandwiches are on point! The truck is hard to find sometimes and also the wait can be long at times.

12.description: This truck is not a respectful neighbor when parked in the loop.  The people who work the truck holler at the passersby all day long.  It is incredibly disruptive and rude to the many people who work in this area.  For that reason, I will not even consider patronizing this truck.

21.description: Bug in my fries. Bought the chicken cheese fries got back to the office and saw a little bug wandering around my lunch . waste of $10.

16.description: 2 o'clock in the morning I was on my way home and I saw this truck and decided to check it out. I am from the east coast originally and thought I'd give it a shot because I'm a pretty rough critic when it comes to steak and cheese. The owner seems like a really cool guy and he recommended his homemade doritos which I thought "hmm interesting concept philly steak with homemade doritos I'll give it a try". I will tell you I was shocked at how they both were so tasty. I don't think it could have made my night better getting a juicy philly steak at 2am that was definitely on par with the ones in Philadelphia.

17.description: The truck was located in the Daley Plaza today so I decided to try it. I ordered the chicken/steak fries with lettuce and tomatoes. The cook put peppers on my food even though I said no peppers.  There was a dead bug on my lettuce and it was just plain disgusting. The meat was so bland didn't taste well at all. Went right in the garbage! Waste of money.  I will never try them again!

10.description: $10 down the drain for a completely flavorless cheesesteak. I considered rating 1 star, but the toppings were all very fresh. Great Steak, Philly's Best. ..even Baba's (for my hood folks) are all far superior. Spend your sawbuck at one of the other food trucks.

11.description: Had these guys while at a local brewery (Imperial Oak) and ordered a cheese steak and fries.  Cheese steak was really tasty, with fresh lettuce, tomato, and cucumbers on it, which was a nice twist, but the portion was super small, not much cheese or beef.The portion was more like a kids sized menu item, and that is why I only gave them 3 stars, if taste was the only criteria, they would be 4 stars.Ordered some fries which tasted fresh cut, but a bit too greasy for my tastes.If I'm having a drink at the brewery and they are there, I will pry get another sandwich, but I would not seek them out.

26.description: I have ordered from the truck 3-4 times in the past 2 months in the south Loop.  One of those visits I didn't get what I ordered; however when I mentioned it next time, they made up for their goof.The sandwiches are LARGE and I would say worth the $9.  Fries are $3 but easily two servings.  They aren't Philly's Best, but hey, I am not near Belmont!I ordered beef with provolone- will try cheddar next.

27.description: Wow!!! Hands down... Best Steak sandwich I ever had. We had a steak sandwich, cheese fries & chicken salad. Our food was delicious!!! The staff are nice friendly and truck was nice and clean. Thank you Mr. Steak man.

0.description: I stopped up to Gino's Steak Truck for lunch today and was pleasantly surprised at the tasty sandwich I had.Décor: It's a big, yellow food truck, you can't miss it. The menu is proudly displayed on the side of the truck, it's easy to read and not complicated. The order window is nice and large and there is nothing about the truck itself that feels sketchy.Bathroom: I'd hope not...Staff: It had to be Gino himself inside (he looked just like the caricature painted on the side of the truck) and he has a relatively quick service. From ordering to making the turnaround is fast - it seems that he only takes one order at a time, prepares it, you pay. Then, and only then, does he service the next customer. Also, he does take credit card!Food: The sandwich itself is a good size and has plenty of meat and cheese on it. Not only that, it was still nice and warm when I got back to my desk (double-wrapped in foil). I had a chickensteak sandwich with melted cheddar and it was DELICIOUS! Certainly on par with some of the best cheesesteaks I've had. On top of that, it filled me up (plus a bag of chips I already had). Normally I shy away from food trucks b/c their serving sizes are small for what you pay and I end up having to get double - Gino's did not leave me hungry.Value: The price is right for the service and the FOOD! Like I said, normally portions from food trucks are small but this is a good-sized sandwich for what you pay.I'm a new, BIG fan of Gino's and already cannot wait to try him again. Only next time I'm going to go steak and try the fries!

20.description: Overpriced and underserved.  Got the Steak sandwich for $10.  What a disappointment.  The sandwich was very average, definitely not worth $10.  The serving size was like something off of a kids menu, about 4 bites of sandwich.  Definitely will avoid this truck at all costs

19.description: Okay *munch*...OMG *munch*...this is AMAZING!  Screw Philly, the Chicago style is THE BIZ!! And the cheese fry?!  Look.  All I'm saying is, if you're going to have a cheat day, THIS is what you get!  They also sell this OKF Aloe drink.  It's like grape Kool-Aid, but au naturale!  Lol

33.description: We ate there today @ the Food Truck event.  Not only was the order incorrect (and we were unwilling to face those ridiculous lines to get it corrected) the food was bland.  In a city like Chicago, there is no room for bland food.  Maybe the truck was unprepared for the sheer volume of people but it wasn't great at all.

2.description: The food is very good ! I'd recommend White american cheese because it has the most flavor.The bread was fresh and the steak was chopped small. Fries were fresh and crispy serving sizes fit the prices.If you see the truck give them a try

32.description: I've eaten here twice, tried for a third time this past week but after waiting in line in the rain for almost 5 minutes they informed me they only had chicken that day.  Dear Gino, being a cheesesteak truck, maybe you should stay home if you're out of steak.  Now the two times I have eaten their food, they've been one for two. My first time, I asked for Chicago style and didn't get any of the added toppings (but still paid for them). The second time everything was good and the order was actually correct. The main problem with them is consistency. If they have the food and they get the order right, your experience can be awesome. The other problem is their unwillingness to post a weekly schedule. Either you walk outside and hope they're there or check Twitter, because they'll mention something an hour before they show up.

18.description: Hanging out with the Gino's truck guys at Copper Fiddle. The cheesesteak was great and they come to you!

13.description: Bug in my fries. Bought the chicken cheese fries got back to the office and saw a little bug wandering around my lunch . waste of $10.

4.description: We should have taken a clue that we were in for a bad time when we were ordering and noticed that the woman at the grill was in pajama pants.My sister and I went to see a performance in Chicago, and had some time to kill before we got on our train. We stumbled across a food truck near Millennium Park, and we couldn't resist. It smelled amazing, and who can say no to a food truck?We paid $9 for a standard steak and cheese to share, and paid an extra buck (I think?) for it to be "Chicago style". That is, adding mayo, pickles, lettuce and tomato. It was served up pretty quick, and we continued on our way, then sat to eat.The bread-to-meat ratio was horrible. It pretty much seemed like they gave us a side order of meat to go with our loaf of bread. The meat was warm, but absolutely tasteless. If you had blindfolded me and asked me to say what kind of sandwich it was, I could have only identified provolone and pickles. That's all it tasted like: a basic Subway cheese sub. For less than the $10 I paid here, I could have gotten a footlong, drink, and some cookies at Subway or Jimmy John's. At least then it would have had flavor. Thankfully, we only bought one to split, because if we would have spent $20 on two bad sandwiches, we would have been even less happy.

24.description: Okay *munch*...OMG *munch*...this is AMAZING!  Screw Philly, the Chicago style is THE BIZ!! And the cheese fry?!  Look.  All I'm saying is, if you're going to have a cheat day, THIS is what you get!  They also sell this OKF Aloe drink.  It's like grape Kool-Aid, but au naturale!  Lol

6.description: My boyfriend and I decided to get dinner here while sipping some summer beer at Imperial Oak brewery.  I was a little put off because they were running late and I get getting hungry.  My boyfriend on the other hand was getting hangry.  I ordered a cheese steak while he had the chicken thing with cheese and we shared a cheese fry.  I saw when I checked in on yelp that you could get a free fry if you ordered "a fatty."  I however could never order such a sandwich no matter how amazing it sounds because I could never bring myself to order something called "fatty."  I think it might be because I'm an overly self conscious girl.  But whatever.  I thought the food was good.  It was a little pricey for what you got but good enough.  If you happen to run into them at Imperial Oak you should give them a try.

22.description: Love this damn truck.Awesome food, really cool staff, and the owner Sal has gotta be one of the coolest guys to chat with.Apparently he studied under the Big and Little's masterminds so you know he does it right!

15.description: Love this damn truck.Awesome food, really cool staff, and the owner Sal has gotta be one of the coolest guys to chat with.Apparently he studied under the Big and Little's masterminds so you know he does it right!

7.description: Loved it.  The steak sandwich is philly style, but the ingredients are way better than anything you'd get in philly. The bread was fresh and it absorbed all of the delicious flavors of the steak and provolone cheese.  I had mine "Chicago style" with tomatoes, sliced pickles, and lettuce.  I would highly recommend this option.  Great sandwich.  The cheese fries were exactly what you would hope for, made from fresh potatoes, I requested mine "extra crispy."  Next time I'm going to order the chicken sandwich, and by the looks on the faces of the patrons eating those, I won't be disappointed.

8.description: We ordered sammiches here when they were at a local brewery. There weren't a lot of other customers around but the service was quick and seemed friendly. I'm not sure if they called our names when our order was ready and maybe we didn't hear them, but they brought our food over to where we were sitting, which was nice. My veggie sandwich was not bad. It had a lot of mushrooms on it, which I'm not a huge fan of but that's my issue. It had some pickles and cheese and various other things on it. (I should mention that I do appreciate a steak truck even offering a veg sandwich!) My husband had a chicken sandwich, which he thought was good. We split an order of fries, which were tasty. All in all, it was decent. We probably wouldn't hunt them down, but if they were going to be at the brewery again, we'd  place another order.

30.description: I'm a loyal customer of Gino's Steaks Truck and sometimes go to such great lengths to eat there that I track down their yellow food truck's lunch-time location via my twitter account. (@ginossteaks) You can often find Gino's Steaks Truck at Clark & Monroe but I've had to venture to 57th & Ellis to get my fix. But no matter where you see the Yellow Gino's Steaks Truck...I assure you, it'll hands down be one of the best sandwiches you've ever had.The Steak and Cheese with onions and peppers with white american chicago style is my go-to order but I've never been disappointed, regardless of what I've tried. My only warning: Just don't get addicted to the fresh cut cheese fries, like I did.

3.description: We passed by their truck on the way to millennium park as we walked north on Michigan avenue in my beautiful hometown Chicago. We asked if they were open and they said yes. Unfortunately yelp said I was too far away to check in so sucks for me but didn't stop me from taking pictures of the experience. Pros and cons list begin!Pros:1. Takes cash and credit2. Free fry with the fatty sandwich as per yelp! 3. Delicious food for any occasion4. You can share a fatty 5. They also sell bottled water6. They were generous with napkins and forks 7. Fries, sauce and toppings were good. Cons:1. Large sandwich that you can't hold in your hands without making a mess2. $12 sandwich. Well $13 something with tax3. The girl inside the truck wasn't wearing a hair net to my naked eye 4. Heavy!The fatty comes with cheese sauce, fries, steak, peppers, lettuce , tomatoes and onions. It was actually very good. I liked it a lot and think it's worth a visit or two!

14.description: Got food with my husband on 7/21 and I have to say that this was so poorly executed. The hubby ordered a steak sandwich and I got steak and cheese fries. I really wish I had gone to one of the other food trucks but its hard for me to resist something like steak and cheese fries. So how did they screw up? Well the orders were wrong. My fries should have had the steak, peppers, onions, and tomatoes. There was only steak and a sparse amount of onions( big chunk cut pieces) on my fries. They also got my husband's sandwich wrong. He asked for steak cheese and onions. Well there was only lettuce and cheese on it. How they got lettuce from onions, you tell me. This truck wasn't even busy so I don't know what the cook was thinking.Here is the real gripe, this steak had to be the most flavorless steak ever. I don't know it anyone is familiar but It is similar to a steak-umm. I don't consider that steak at all. It didn't taste like anything but bland, greasy, fake steak. The fries were also lacking any seasoning. The only thing with taste was the grease and cheese. These fries are $9 dollars so I expect real steak meat. Even at greasy spoon restaurants the steak meat is steak. It might be fatty but its steak. My stomach felt like there was a brick resting in it for at least 3 hours after eating. The only thing that made this worth nine dollars was the amount of nasty food they give you. It was definitely a good portion. Any other place is better then this. Just keep walking because this truck will only bring disappointment.

3.description: This deli is always super busy. Parking sucks but it's worth finding when you want a sandwich from here. They make it super fresh with your choose if meat and cheese. $3!! You can't go wrong. They also have delicious soups that they make from scratch and pierogies that you can throw in the microwave or something. Really nice people that work there too.

1.description: only been once but i'll be back for homemade pierogi that are very cheap (why make them yourself).sausage is good, not sure if they make/smoke them theirself though.don't worry if you don't speak the language of everyone else in there, you can find a translator

2.description: Good deli items, selection of Polish foods including Polish beauty items which were fascinating me- I don't even know what most of the stuff is as I'm not Polish.  But they make $3 sandwiches!  Go here for a sandwich at a low price.  Everything is decent priced.  The smoked salmon spread is awesome, so are the potato/cheese perogies aka Russian perogies.  They have a huge meat selection, I don't eat meat but I see people like it, but there is no corned beef.The only thing I didn't like was how some of the food was stored.  There were cooked foods completely out in the open, which is not safe.  Food either has to be kept hot or cold, not just sitting there where anyone can cough on it.  The store does not look very clean or modern overall, maybe needs some updating, too.

5.description: Excellent products...deplorable service!!!Reasonably priced homemade slaws, soups and salads to go--absolutely delicious.  Produce and grocery items are of high quality, but at deli prices.  Wonderful freshly baked breads and pastries.  Wide variety of meats and cheeses which look to be fresh.However, you will experience interminably long lines on weekends.  Plus, I never really get the feeling that they truly want Americans in there.  Is it possible that they don't like us?  Maybe they just want to keep it Polish.  Either way, any adult from any culture can easily tell when someone is talking about them--right in from of them--in a foreign language.  C'mon now!  To do so is not only unprofessional and downright rude, but is also a low class way of insulting someone.

0.description: This is another awesome Polish deli where amazingly, you will spend a lot less on deli items as opposed to your local national chain grocery store.I love this store!

4.description: I came here today after eating some polish sausage at a friend's bbq over the weekend.  I have never really been to any grocery stores in Portage Park, but I plan to come here often. I got some kielbasa wiejska (country sausage) and it is so great for bbq's!  Seriously, if you have never had any, you better get some!!!  It is $2.49/lb and are long sausages.  They have a great selection of polish sausage and the prices are reasonable.  I am going to try some other sausages the next time I go there.  In addition to their deli, they also have a good selection of polish food.  This is a small grocery store and they all speak Polish.

0.description: Back when I was a little punk twit in high school I got all my hair supplies at Sally's. When spiking your hair, please, don't use Elmer's. I know you might lose a little cred walking into Sally's, but as I described my ideal hair concoction to the skeptical and motherly lady behind the counter she was more than willing to open up a little and help be build the perfect disaster. They have really great deals on bleach and coloring products, and the staff is infinitely knowledgeable. They know all the tricks to fix you up, even if your idea of fixed up is kinda the opposite of fixed up.

3.description: Abdul is one of the best barbers I have ever gone to. That man can cut some mean hair. I've tried a lot of places, this guy is the best.

1.description: Probably would have never noticed this place had a guy in the bar across the street not mentioned it. The owner is a really nice guy who does a great, fast, mens haircut. His cute little kids are sometimes around, you can tell that he's a very loving parent. The price is right, 15 bucks. So, you get a good cut, cheap price, and you get to give your money to a decent guy. What more could you want?

2.description: Sport Cuts is kinda hidden on the corner of Milwaukee and Montrose. I have yet to get my hair cut there but he has a lot of clients. Sports are always playing on the tube or golf he even has an indoor golf thingie to play. I go there because Elena has been doing my eyebrows for over 2 years now and she got them to the shape that best suits my round face =) She does wax and thread and yes under 10 bucks. You see I always give her $20 because she does other areas of my face that I don't want to mention hee hee. So bring your man along for a cut with a great barber and lady's ask for Elena to wax or thread away that unwanted facial hair.

5.description: Sport Cuts is the best place to get a haircut. I have never been disappointed in my haircut. They listen to what you want and make sure that you get the style that you asked for. The owner is easy to talk to as well and is very nice to all the customers. Would highly recommend.

0.description: Still the best place to take my sons for haircuts. Tried two places near my neighborhood. Both stylist and barber gave sons bad haircuts. Both cuts did not grow out well.Hormoz now charges $12 for boys. Still worth the drive and paying for city street parking.

4.description: Best eyebrow threading ever.  I live in the neighborhood and can walk to the location, so I stopped in as I saw the 'threading' sign in the window. So by chance I found Elena, who is the first gal to do my brows justice. I highly recommend her services. I also found out my neighbor gets his haircuts there, as well as his Father who lives in Glenview, yes he comes all the way down Milwaukee Avenue just to visit this salon. 5 stars, at least.

12.description: Consistently delicious and very inexpensive Mexican food. It always seems to be the same woman behind the counter/waitress and perhaps cook? hard to say. This is a pretty small operation.The veggie burrito ($4) is not one of those Big as Your Head frat-boy burrito, but for $4 it is plenty large. It has all the stuff you want, but nothing in excess. The burritos here seem excessively healthy as opposed to the situation at a lot of places where grease makes up for otherwise missing flavor.And while we are speaking of flavor, the Quesodilla con Rajas (poblano peppers) ($1.60) is brilliant and includes bonus grilled onions. I had coffee today which had that kind of weird but not exactly delicious Mexican flavor. I'm guessing that it is intended to be sugared and creamed up or something. The atmosphere is what you might expect for a tiny rustic Mexican joint - a step above your typical taqueria, but only a tiny step. The service is great and personal.

7.description: So you've worked up a hunger playing dress-up at Fantasy Costume, now what? A few doors down sits Lomas Verdes, a sleepy little Mexican restaurant. I got the impression they don't get a lot of foot traffic, let alone 9 people all at once on a Sunday afternoon. There was only a woman (maybe the owner) running the front and one guy in back doing all of the cooking.Food was just ok, I've had much better and the misfortune of having much worse. Service was aloof, I don't know if there was potentially a language barrier or what, but the woman running the front was very hands off, if not slightly disinterested in us. Prices are reasonable, even when you aren't grossly undercharged. Unfortunately, we didn't figure this out until after we left, but our first clue should have been having enough money to leave a 70% tip. If only we were high rollers who could afford to drop insane tips like that!Bottom line: On a fairly barren stretch of Milwaukee, conveniently located near Fantasy Costume and Portage Theater, it's a decent spot for a reasonably priced bite.WARNING: The bathroom is sketchy. It was out of soap and the lock was jerry rigged by something resembling a paper clip. The exhaust fan was so loud I felt like I was underneath a hotel ice machine with the deafeningly loud rumblings; I worried that at any moment a pile of ice might crash through the ceiling.

3.description: I stopped by here since I was going to a concert at The Portage Theater, across the street.  I love Mexican food and who can mess up Mexican food....well these Mexicans did.  The place smelled like old furniture, which should have been an indication to leave and go to Subway across the street.  The host was an elderly lady who moved very slowly.  She took my order plus my friend's.  She brought out these tasteless, unsalted chips with 2 cups of cold tasteless, watered down salsa.  U could drink the salsa.  Gross.  I ordered the chicken enchiladas with mole, a fav.  Not any more.  This place could make u hate Mexican food for life.  Again tasteless, bland, no frills.  My friend ordered the ground beef taco dinner & said it tasted like imitation beef.  We ate part of it and paid for the food.  I didn't want to cause a scene but decided pay & leave.  We used the restroom before we left and it smelled like mildew plus it had a thunder sounding vent when u turned the light on.  I wonder when this place was last visited by the Dept. Of Health.  Please help them Chef Ramsey!!!!!

1.description: No, no and no..... My friend and I came here to eat before a concert at the portage theater. They did not have enough staff to accommodate the extra people coming to the show. They had one lady taking orders for everyone here. I ordered the garlic shrimp that had no flavor, my friend had the chicken taco dinner, he said they were dry. I tried them and I would never order them. Overall, I would go to subway across the street next time.

2.description: Like most people that visit here.... We got opposite of what we ordered. I ordered no cheese and no crema on my sope and gordita and got extra of both. My bf ordered chicken breast with avocado and got a chicken leg and drumstick with no avocado. This would be a fun place to go of you want a surprise food experience. Good luck!!

9.description: The ONLY reason I came here was because I was going to the Portage Theater and they were directly across the street and I didn't want Subway. I ordered a steak burrito because they don't serve barbacoa ;-( I only get rice, beans, cheese, and meat in my burritos. She said rice was $1 extra. Get the fuck outta here!!! Ofcourse I declined the rice. I then asked her how much for just a bag of chips(no salsa) she looked like she was just thinking up a number for me to pay. She said $1.50. Even though that price was ridiculous, and I saw her taking the chips out of a plastic storage bin, and not a heating table, I still bought them. My friend asked her how much for bottled waters and she looked again as if she was just making up prices. She said $1.25. She rang up our order and when I told her the price she quoted was too high she started to argue. She finally took out her calculator and after adding everything up she realized that we were right and she had miscalculated. She gave us a shit eating grin and said she wouldn't charge taxes on the meal. How about giving me the rice that I asked for? That would have made me much happier. The meal wasn't bad, the flavors were OK. But not worth the arguing, crazy prices, or the waitstaff 101. If it wasn't for the fact that it was right across the street from my destination and I wasn't in the mood for subway, I would have never come in, and after what I experienced I will never come back.

10.description: The food was good it just wasn't THAT good. They are very accommodating as far as bringing out fixins...sadly that is all I have to offer about Lomas Verdes. Mediocre Mexican just doesn't excite me these days (that's what she said).

13.description: PLEASE visit this restaurant! I know there are plenty of great Mexican places across Chicago, but I'm glad I got to try Lomas Verdes yesterday. The veggie burrito had rice, beans, avocado, cheese, sour cream, and corn, if I am remembering correctly. Incredibly cheap and delicious at $4.25. I also got a banana shake and that thing was GOOD! The hostess was a genuinely nice person. I will get to the Portage Theater early for any future shows I attend so I can eat here again.

16.description: This is the best mexican joint in the eastern part of Portage Park (Mucho Gusto at Irving and Central is the best in the western part).  Its good, but not great, but i have not suffered from eating here the way that la palapita (further north on milwaukee) hurt me!

17.description: I live nearby and was very pleasantly surprised the first time I went in for a burrito. The guacamole is great, and everything else I've tried is great too. A nice friendly woman seems to run the joint. I took my Dad there to grab a quick lunch and she jokingly taught us both some spanish while we were there. Definitely give this place a try and support a great local small business that has quality food and friendly staff.

15.description: A great little Mexican restaurant. I always go there when I go to the Portage theater across the street. A small place, BYOB. Very good food and quite cheap. Tacos for 1.50  burritos which are a good size for abotu 4.50.  well worth it. I get stuff pretty simple, just onions  and cilantro, but they will add cheese, sour cream etc if you want it. I had the Huachinago(snapper ) there too and it was good.  I hope this place stays open, that neighbourhood is spotty and  in that area this is  the best place next to La Pena to eat.

0.description: The main attribute is that this place is directly across from the illustrious Portage theater and is literally the only restaurant in a two-block radius. That neighborhood is depressed and I don't know how they stay open, unless they get major turnover from The Portage.The decor is Mexican taqueria dive-retro. Oh sombrero-wearing man leading a donkey poster, 1984 called to say hello and I've missed you.The waitress/counter lady is all smiles and genuinely friendly, like an aunty who wants to fill you with food!The food is simple, fresh and tasty. All the ingredients look like they walked in from the farm just this morning.The guacamole is AMAZING and ultra-fresh, like mi abuela used to make.The service is fast and your water glass will be refilled like clockwork.The orchata tasted authentically homemade, not powdered.Dinner for 2 with drinks was under $15. It's BYOB too, so bring your fancy or slummy drinkies as you like.I want more!

5.description: Went once, never came back. There is a severe lack of quality Mexican food in the Portage Park area, and sadly this place is just one more in a long chain of disappointments.

11.description: As someone else mentioned, this is the only restaurant close to Portage theatre, so I guess they have location going for them for people attending things there. The fajitas were pretty good (although they seemed a bit generous with the black pepper), but there were several other problems we had when dining here that means I'm not going to be coming here again and won't recommend it to anyone.The service was a bit slow - there was us and one other table in the restaurant, so it shouldn't have taken that long for her to come take our order. When she got there, she didn't seem all that friendly, either. We both ordered chicken fajitas, one with no tomato or cheese. When she brought out one order, we figured that just meant the other was being cooked separately to accommodate the request... finally, after 5-10 minutes waiting for the second one to come out, we asked her how much longer it would be (since we were going to the Silent Film Society's presentation of Phantom of the Opera, and didn't want to be late). She was surprised that we had two orders. Was she not listening when we ordered the first time?... it was very specific! If we had ordered just the one without tomato and cheese, it would have been wrong anyway since mine came that way. One other thing to note, which probably isn't a big deal to many people but should be mentioned, is that they don't have flour tortillas. She brought out corn ones and since I don't like the corn ones, I asked for flour. No dice.I ordered a cheese quesadilla as an appetizer since it was so cheap. I didn't expect it to come out with the fajitas instead of before, but no big deal. What was a little more bothersome was that the cheese in the center wasn't fully melted (you could still see shredded cheese in the center, instead of the gooey mess of cheesy goodness it should be), and honestly it was cold. I guess that's why it's an appetizer, to be brought out before the rest of the food is cooked.When the second entree was brought out, we asked for the check since we noticed it was taking several minutes for the other table (still only the two parties) to get theirs. Ten minutes or so later, when she was busing the other table... we asked again, since she hadn't brought it to us. I guess it was a good thing we didn't just leave our cash, because she overcharged us. She brought us a check that had what we ordered on it, but no prices; I had figured out the total in my head based upon what we ordered (two orders of fajitas, a cheese quesadilla and a can of pop that I wouldn't have ordered if I'd known it was in a can), and according to what the prices were on their menu, it should have been about $20. She charged us about $23.Needless to say, if I really *have* to eat something before going to another Silent Film Society event, I'll either bring a sandwich or stop at the Burger King down the street.

8.description: Across from the Portage Theater on Milwaukee Ave sits the fairly inconspicuous Lomas Verdes.  I am sure I would have walked right past this restaurant had it not been for my guide. There's not much to the décor in the place. It's a typical Mexican hole in the wall with a few tables, cheap artwork and a corner fridge stocked with authentic Mexican drinks. The lady behind the counter seemed a little confused and overwhelmed when our party walked in. It took her a few minutes to be galvanized into action.  In all fairness, I too might have been confused and overwhelmed if a party of 9 walked in for lunch at 4 PM.  The menu had a variety of different choices.  I opted for an enchiladas poblanas platter with spicy pork.  The delivery of the plates was staggered and some of my dining companions got their meals before me.   I experienced burrito envy when I saw the gigantic wraps placed before them.  The envy disappeared as soon as my enchiladas arrived.  Doused with a traditional mole sauce and melted cheese, my platter looked very appetizing and emitted a very pleasant aroma.  I could have done without the refried beans and rice, but the spicy pork enchiladas were delicious.  I suspect the burritos weren't as good since one of my lunch companions needed to spice hers up with a lot of extra jalapenos.  In terms of value for money, Lomas Verdes is a real steal.  The massive burritos were under 5 bucks each.  The incredibly low total bill surprised us all.  I intend on going back if for nothing else than to determine whether I made the right choice in picking spicy pork enchiladas over the steak burrito.

4.description: I came here with my husband and 2 year old daughter, and a friend of ours with her 2 year old. First of all, it's deathly quiet, which is always weird. No one else in the restaurant, no music. The waitress was really unfriendly and I immediately wanted to leave, but we decided to stay because the kids were hungry and we didn't feel like looking for a new place. While we were there, my daughter spilled some water and the waitress acted really put out by it. I ordered chicken fajitas and they were pretty dry and bland. That night I woke up feeling nauseous (I'm not sure that it was connected, but thought I'd throw that in). I am usually pretty lenient in my judgement on restaurants (I'm usually willing to give a place a second chance), but I wouldn't come here again. The only good thing about this place: you don't have to worry about filling up on chips & salsa, because they only bring you a tiny bowl of chips, and no refills.

14.description: I got a lunch special which included a taco, sopa, and a quesidilla with beans and rice for only 5.85.  I also got a Mexican Coca-Cola (made with sugar and not corn syrup!).  As far as authenticity goes, I cannot vouch.  But everything I had on my plate was superb.  The sopa had little bits of chopped cilantro, crispy fresh iceberg lettuce, mexican cheese, sauteed yummy onions, delicious chicken meat (no gristles or dark meat), and a bit of sour cream all on a very interesting thicker shell (she described it to be like a gordita).  Great texture.  The taco was 2 corn tortillas and chicken meat with lettuce on top - also good.  The refried beans were delicious.  And I usually don't like spanish rice, but I really liked the rice here.  The service was awesome and friendly.  My only complaint is the chips that come out at the beginning.  They were a bit greasy and stale.  Oh yeah, and the restaurant itself smelled a little funny.Other than that, I highly recommend this place!  I will definitely bring my friends/family here.  It was really refreshing.

6.description: Noce little run of the mill family run Mexican place. Food is reliable and the owner is a very nice lady. Can't give it higher than 3 stars which is still A-OK. We only go there for lunch during the weeks and I will normally get the ground beef tacos which are good but not great. Next time I think I will try the chicken ones.

1.description: I got my hair cut by Christina and I'm incredibly pleased!  They are all very nice here and she did exactly what I was asking for and more.    I walked in feeling very down on my hair.  She took her time looking at my locks to get an idea of what I had and what could be done considering my requests.  After she washed my hair, she again took her time to make sure my hair was just right, and even "fine-tuned" it after she had blow dried.    My hair looks so much better now!I am so excited that such a great place is just down the street for me!Just goes to show that you don't need to go downtown and pay downtown prices for a great haircut.They don't take credit cards, so be sure to bring cash.

0.description: This hair studio is excellent. I've been coming here for years and every time, my hair cut is perfect and exactly what I asked for.

29.description: OK...so people in Chicago say, Giordano's is the place to get great pizza........and that the food is good......Alright...awesome let me give this place a try....Let me just jump into the juicy scoop.... are u ready? are u? So i ordered the Calamarie Appetizer..... **mmmm Calamari who doesnt love ordering that weird looking but tasty crunchy goodness of Squid!! HELLLOOO!!!Boyyyyy oh booooooooooy, When I received my platter i was like what the hail is this im seeing, it looked like a science experiment or cut up cadavers just placed on my plate... you gave like 8 pieces of Fried Calamarie....with fried green beans that I may add were hard as hail..and here is the funny part.............FRIED LEMON SLICES!! WHAAAAAAAT THE HAAAAAAAAAAAAILLLLL is that? How are you going to charge expensive price for me to receive FRIED LEMON SLICES?You can't turn a fruit into an unhealthy item... who Fries Lemon Slices and decides to put them on a plate....really? It's unedible....I would know cuz i TRIED to eat this Fried Lemon Slice..........!! I know i learned my lesson and i will read the fine print on the menu's LOL..... disappointment...eeeeck.I can't look at a Lemon the same, i'll think of it as a greasy hot mess of an attempt by a drunken inventor to decide to fry Lemon slices because he had NOTHING else to fry. two words... EPIC FAIL! So they had this New Item for entree.... it was a Shrimp Piccatta Linguine for 12.95 or so.....it sounded good from what I read...... until it arrived on my table..... the pasta itself was bland, doesn't have much of a sauce, i counted the shrimp and they only placed 5 small shrimps...now there was alot of pasta, but I cant sit there and eat a bland, tasteless linguine? would u? even with parmesan cheese it gave this pasta no justice, maybe a lil heavy cream, with the white wine and oregano and lemon juice wouldve been a better option to give this dish what it needs....FLAVOR!I told my waitress I didnt like this at ALL, i am not going to sit there and force myself to eat something i simply dont like...thats like ur mom forcing you to eat beets because that's all they had.She then said thats fine and asked if i wanted something else..i say pizza...u cant mess up pizzaShe brought me a kid's pizza, which is fine..the Pizza is good, not AMAZING like New York Pizza [***oooooo, that would make Chicago Native blood boil.....i can hear it now....LOL] Other than that I probably wont return, I wasn't impressed. EHHHH....Giordano's your not all that with a big bag of Fried Lemon Slices....! grrrrrrrrr

42.description: Just tried again after several years. The deep dish pepperoni was at best mediocre.Bland crust, sparse pepperoni ,so so sauce. Won't come back.

23.description: Pizza is ok.i,ve had better (itailian fiesta)...(beggars)..etc.the pizza is better than most indepedent places but only the thin crust.i dont to much care for deep dish pizza.

47.description: Not the best pizza in town but a regular standby, that's for sure. I always enjoy the pizza. I usually get the spinach pizza. I haven't tried any meat pizzas, don't eat it. I have gotten delivery and eaten there a couple times. The service is good.....though apparently waitress don't pre-bus here cause I notice this at many places.....well, the nicer places do of course. We also enjoy the Greek Salad which is good to split between several people (dinner sized). The cheese on it could be better but there are lots of red onions and big carrot slices, couple olives. Once I got the fettechini alfredo and wasn't too impressed. But I never get that dish anywhere and I was getting sick so maybe it was me (though I don't think so). The bread is good too, would be great warmed, and it comes with real, cold butter. When I have visitors and we order pizza i usually get it from here. Definitely not a bad pizza.

8.description: If you want to wait for 2 salads for 1hour then this place is what you need. And plus staff is unfriendly and unprofessional. Manager couldn't even say hi. I don't suggest this place.

31.description: On the brink of bankruptcy, you would think all Giordano's restaurants would try to step up their game.  Not here...why? the wait staff.  We had been craving pizza all day - we could have gone ANYWHERE, we chose Giordano's - first one we hit - parking lot was full - so we left.  We decided to go somewhere else, then we stumbled on this location, we decided to go in - got great parking, and the place was pretty empty at about 9:30p on Saturday.  We get seated - that was our experience at this location - our ass got to sit in their booth....no one ever came back to check on us - no water, no nothing.  One of the wait staff literally looked right at me (us), walked right by, went to the other tables to see how they were doing then she disappeared.  We walked the hell out of there and as we are walking out - no one even noticed, even as we passed by 3 wait staff who were sitting there just gossiping.  We went to DANTE'S PIZZA ON ARMITAGE AVE for some great pizza.  Good luck to you Giordano's - you will need it to remain open with this type of horrible service.

34.description: Very good pizza with thick crust.  A single slice'll do ya!

16.description: This location USED to be consistent. It's a chain, it should be! It was my go to deep dish for out of town guests. However, two out of the last three times we've placed an order, it has been screwed up. Perhaps the person taking the order needs to work on their listening skills. The first time, we ordered the baked ravioli appetizer, only to receive the regular ravioli entree.  We just ate the incorrect item. It wasn't worth the wait for it to be fixed. The second time, we ordered specifically chicken sausage (due to a dietary restriction for no pork) and we received chicken AND sausage. When we called to complain, after being placed on hold for quite some time, they offered to refund our money, but that left us without an edible pizza. The man on the phone didn't seem to see that eating pork might be a problem for some. Unfortunately, the replacement pizza would take 45 minutes. In the same order, we asked for a Skinny Margarita Pizza. I can see why it's considered "skinny", there was hardly any cheese on it.  I actually added cheese to the pizza from my fridge just to make it seem less like tomato spread on a cracker. The skinny pizza was placed in the oven to warm, because it's rude to eat in front of someone not eating. It was dry and old instead of hot and fresh, after all, it was 2 hours old upon consumption. Big sad face for our orders.  I'm sure my husband will stubbornly order pizza from Giordano's again, but honestly, I'm not sure why.
