13.description: Had a really good experience at this giordanos location. The restaurant was very clean, the staff was friendly and they waited on us very well. We stopped in on a Sunday evening with a party of 15 people and ordered a few deep dish spinach pizzas which were delicious. We also brought our own beer and wine which made the experience even better. I would definitely recommend this giordanos location to anyone looking to have a family dinner and enjoy good food. My hats off to management and the staff for the great hospitality. Hope to return soon!!!

11.description: On the brink of bankruptcy, you would think all Giordano's restaurants would try to step up their game.  Not here...why? the wait staff.  We had been craving pizza all day - we could have gone ANYWHERE, we chose Giordano's - first one we hit - parking lot was full - so we left.  We decided to go somewhere else, then we stumbled on this location, we decided to go in - got great parking, and the place was pretty empty at about 9:30p on Saturday.  We get seated - that was our experience at this location - our ass got to sit in their booth....no one ever came back to check on us - no water, no nothing.  One of the wait staff literally looked right at me (us), walked right by, went to the other tables to see how they were doing then she disappeared.  We walked the hell out of there and as we are walking out - no one even noticed, even as we passed by 3 wait staff who were sitting there just gossiping.  We went to DANTE'S PIZZA ON ARMITAGE AVE for some great pizza.  Good luck to you Giordano's - you will need it to remain open with this type of horrible service.

39.description: This Giordano's has been revamped and refurbished (the photo given is now outdated) and has become a nice place to dine-in for an evening with friends and family. The staff are very nice. The pizza does not disappoint, no matter if you get the deep dish or the thin crust.I personally like their thin crust pineapple and pepperoni. I would eat it everyday if I could...If you are dining in, try the french fries or the brushetta. Both taste yummy. The chicken caesar salad is also quite good as well.

37.description: This place is soooooo expensive!   We ordered 2 thin crust pizzas and the total was $60!!!!  That absurd!

0.description: Love This place. The waiting is always very nice and the best minestrone I had in Chicago (not including pizza Of course)

38.description: So I came to Chicago for work and a little play.  Of course I had t o have some deep dish pizza.  I was told to check out this place by family and friends.  I checked online and there were numerous locations to check out.  I wanted to see if it made a difference, but the reality was my course was literally down the block from this location.  We got out of class early on my Sunday evening so I ran over hear and ordered a Medium Stuffed Pizza with Mushrooms, Pepperoni and Sausage.  It was a 40 minute wait.  Wow.  OK, so I sat and waited and watched TV ("Once Upon a Time" was on and I like the show so I was pleasantly occupied).  The 40 minutes came by fast and my pizza looked GORGEOUS, smelled great and was just to die for! I took off a piece and took a bite.  Luscious! YUM. E! Perfection squared! It was just that good! And since I was by myself and wisely ordered a medium, I would have plenty to spare.  It was delicious hot and cold as I could eat it the next day for breakfast before my next class.  I even had thirds and fourths as it was just SO huge and it resided in my refrigerator in my room.  The pizza was so good that I even came back for another one during my week stay in Chicago.  I wisely called ahead this time and just ordered the individual sized.  Smaller, less sauce, but still good.  I'm in love! And thankfully they deliver out of state so I'm sure once I get another craving, I'll be making my order...

51.description: The best Pizza in chicagostuffed means giordanosI love giordanos

27.description: Usually a Great pizza. Everything else is utter garbage.This location does occasionally have an off night with their pizza - but 9 out of 10 times great. Tasty crust on deep dish. Thin crust is more like a pan - but is really good too. Generous on toppings and cheese, a little skimpy on sauce.Avoid all the appetizers. Unless it's pizza, they ruin it.

32.description: I'd give them NO STARS or less if possible!  There were none but 3 tables busy. They sat us and never took our order!  The waitress walked by, never greeted or said "be right back"! Ten or more minutes later we got up and saw the same waitress behind the bar and 3 other waitresses chatting at a booth by the entrance...no class here!

54.description: The last time I went past this place it was closed for remodeling.  In the restaurant business that is very often a euphemism for "out of business."  If so I can only assume that the shortcomings in the kitchen took their toll on business.

48.description: The best pizza and service in the Chicago area.

44.description: I used to live a couple miles from this location and ordered delivery at least once a month. The deep dish pizza is the best I've ever had. We also ate at the restaurant occasionally and they also have the best calamari we've ever eaten. I can't emphasize enough how good Giordano's is. Best pizza on Earth.

24.description: Great service and great food! Loved the thin crust cheese pizza. The best are the garlic parmasan fries! Wasnt too thrilled with the margharita pizza but overall the place is good.

7.description: If you go here for carryout be prepared to wait when you get there.  Every time I order from here I am quoted a time it will be ready only to arrive at the restaurant and wait. If they asked me to wait 5 mins that would be fine, but 20 mins is just not acceptable!  At least give me a courtesy call if you are running behind! After complaining to the incompetent employees I was given a half ass apology.

49.description: The pizza is great but they are WAY too expensive.  The last time we ordered from there, we ordered two pizzas and we got one wrong pizza.  It was very obvious, being the wrong size, wrong toppings, and having the wrong order number written right on the box.  I called there and the guy was a raging asshole, arguing with me that there was no way possible they could have made such a mistake, and basically I was wrong and crazy.  They finally brought the correct pizza back after a huge fight over the phone.  I was so pissed off with the service and the way that dickhead treated me... We will never order from there again.  There are plenty of other places that have just as good pizza and aren't such a ripoff.

40.description: after another waitress dropped off our order that was the last we saw of her, until 10minutes of waiting for our bill.  She was at the liquor store across the street.!! Do wha!! So we have no service while she is partying!!! Ok time to get management involved.... So the manager just boxes up our food and a check. With a half apology.  Im shocked at the lack of care or concern for customers in such a well established business.  If it was not for great pizza I would never come back

53.description: Wow I am impressed! THis place used to be like the dirtiest dingiest Giordanos in all of CHicago!!! Kinda like the hipster of Giordanos.BUT now its been redone.................New carpet, new furniture,its bigger, hell even new silverware!!!Itsgrown from Hipster dive to Yuppie Lounge! I like it!!!!Pizza is awesome! and for you fellow alkies..........BYOB!!!YES AND THERES A LIQUOR STORE ACROSS THE STREEET! :)sHAKE & BAKE SEAL OF APPROVAL.

30.description: Ordinarily I would have given it 5 stars but was very disappointed w the BBQ chicken deep dish. It's a skip. I regret not sticking to the regular stuff which btw it's awesome. Garlic parmesian fries were ok. A little on the dry side.

46.description: Let's face it, Giordano's is NOT anywhere near the best pizza in Chicago. However, in the Jefferson Park area it's about as good as you're going to get. We've had some absolutely filthy tasting hot circles of garbage delivered in this area, trust me. Sarpino's anyone? Vomit in a box.I've found the secret to ordering from Giordano's though! My biggest complaint with their thin crust is that they always put entirely too much cheese on it. By the time it gets to your door step it's this coagulated weird sheet. HOWEVER, you can avoid this by telling them to go "easy on the cheese." This is a valid order option and they will happily oblige the request.Always tell them you have the $3 off $20 or more coupon on the phone. The driver never asks for the coupon.I'd avoid dining in this location. I took some friends from out-of-town over to this location and all we could do was laugh at the experience. It's apparently ran by some pretty hardcore Christians (which should have been obvious by the fact they don't open until something like 4:00PM on Sundays). There is no alcohol served here. I myself don't drink for health reasons, but I was pretty embarrassed I took my buds to a place for pizza that doesn't serve beer. They also BLAST Delilah on the radio at night during dinner service.

1.description: No plans to patronize ever again. This location must not realize the pizza competition in Chicago! Lou Malnati's will be opening soon (Irving/Keeler). The delivery service has been terrible each time. It is SLOW (1 hour) regardless of what you order, which lastnight was a thin crust pizza and 1 order of wings. The food is nearly room temperature when you get it, and we have also had sauce and cheese that was clearly days old. Lastnight, the driver brought the pizza, forgot the wings. Admitted he forgot, then still asked for the FULL cash payment with no promise of delivery time of the wings. We refused the pizza. NO CALL FROM THE MANAGER/OWNER....? NO APOLOGIES. I wasn't expecting free food. I was hoping for a quick remake of the pizza and the wings. But no one ever called, and that was the final straw. You've been officially briefed. Keep your expectations low.

9.description: Really great pizza! A little on the pricey side..but completely worth it. The waiter was also extremely friendly, and it didn't take long for our food to arrive. Overall a nice experience.

26.description: Ordered a stuffed pizza today and a thin pizza also. I ended up getting 2 burnt thin crust pizzas and thats aside the fact that the lady was rude on the phone and, asked me to repeat everything, and the driver took a personal call at my door. Very dissatisfied..

25.description: This location USED to be consistent. It's a chain, it should be! It was my go to deep dish for out of town guests. However, two out of the last three times we've placed an order, it has been screwed up. Perhaps the person taking the order needs to work on their listening skills. The first time, we ordered the baked ravioli appetizer, only to receive the regular ravioli entree.  We just ate the incorrect item. It wasn't worth the wait for it to be fixed. The second time, we ordered specifically chicken sausage (due to a dietary restriction for no pork) and we received chicken AND sausage. When we called to complain, after being placed on hold for quite some time, they offered to refund our money, but that left us without an edible pizza. The man on the phone didn't seem to see that eating pork might be a problem for some. Unfortunately, the replacement pizza would take 45 minutes. In the same order, we asked for a Skinny Margarita Pizza. I can see why it's considered "skinny", there was hardly any cheese on it.  I actually added cheese to the pizza from my fridge just to make it seem less like tomato spread on a cracker. The skinny pizza was placed in the oven to warm, because it's rude to eat in front of someone not eating. It was dry and old instead of hot and fresh, after all, it was 2 hours old upon consumption. Big sad face for our orders.  I'm sure my husband will stubbornly order pizza from Giordano's again, but honestly, I'm not sure why.

12.description: I get here 11:58 pm and they have the open neon sign on and doors locked. I call and speak to the manager he says sorry we are closed we close at 12am. In a ver snotty way. Very rude and un professional. If you close early then state it on the door as to why. Also turn off the big neon sign that says open. As a small business owner myself I can't understand why they would have management team like that.

21.description: if it was possible I'd give them 0 stars.. I ordered 2 deep dish pizzas with 2 toppings each.. after waiting for an hour for the pizza to be ready I went to pick it up and they gave me 1 pizza with all the toppings in it.. I didn't think 2 and 1 sound similar in any way

17.description: Not impressed at all. We ordered a thin crust pizza with two toppings (nothing out of the ordinary); but it didn't compare to some other brands, even frozen. Thick bread-like crust with thin cheese and toppings.  Definitely not a fan.

10.description: Staff was great, waitress was attentive, pizza was amazing, and the price was fair! It was my first time at a Giordano's, and I will definitely be back if I'm in the area again!

5.description: I love this place. I've been eating here since I was a kid, and it's always had the best deep dish pizza around!I usually get cheese and spinach deep dish which is absolutely delicious. The tomato sauce is perfect and the cheese is amazing. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I occasionally get a thin crust to, which is also cooked to perfection with just the right amount of cheese. I will probably order from here for the rest of my life!

3.description: I love this place. I always come here for all my celebrations. The atmosphere is quiet and the serves cater to your needs. For my sons birthday, the server offered chocolate cake with ice cream. She even brought all the employees to sing. You can't find restaurants that do this any more.

35.description: This is a great Chicago pizzeria to take out-of-town guests.  It is away from the "hustle--and bustle" areas of the city (downtown, Near North, Magnificent Mile and Near North) yet not sacrifice the "deep dish pizza experience".  Yes, the cheese topping the deep dish pizza is delicious with whatever ingredient you choose on the menu.  I've enjoyed their appetizers and various pizzas (thin crust too).  The staff is friendly and most of the time attentive.  The only drawback is finding a place to park, it can be difficult but if you don't mind walking, park in the neighboring streets.

19.description: What is going on at this location, the last three times I've ordered a pizza I've experienced nothing but problems. Prior to Super Bowl they were short handed so they couldn't deliver pizza, during Super Bowl they were too busy, and today there is an hour and a half wait for pizza.Is this how you should treat a client that has purchased from you for over 20 years? I asked for corporate number and they refused to give it to me. This is not the way to to do business I'll get my pizza somewhere else.

28.description: Giordano's Chicago's best pizza?  Nah.Never really cared for this place but my friend likes it.He had good taste picking me, bad taste picking Giordano's.Place is clean, decor okay, wait staff okay.  It is the pizza I have a problem with.  I do not like the crust.  The cheese is okay.  It does not make my taste buds dance. On top of that I think the place has gotten pricier.  I do have to say that the Greek salad does have a large piece of feta on it.No off street parking is a problem.  I could not find parking and had to pay the meter $2.50 for a little over an hour.  Then I come out, it was snowing (again).  Getting across Irving to get to my car tested my patience.  Street quite slick and busy.  Pizza was not worth taking my life in my hands.

45.description: I went couple of times to this location... I also order for delivery... I call on saturday, after waiting almost one hour for my delivery... Manager Bill called and said that my pizza was made wrong. We have to wait almost another hour. The manager Bill told my husband that we going to have 7 dollars off only for the mistake and some free soda, which I already have a coupon for 2 dollars, we also asked for parm and spices. My surprise was when the pizza arrive we only have 5 dollars off and the 2 for the coupon, the driver was a really nice person, but we didn't have our parm and spices, I called the place again and I told the manager Bill that we were not sitisfied and we were really upset of their service! He told me that if I didn't like the service to don't ever call again and he hang up the Phone on me. I will never call and get any from this people. Manager was very rude and ass hole. He can go and Fuck himself. I was paying for my service and they didn't care. FOR THIS KIND OF SERVICE GIORDANOS IS FILING BANKRUPTCY!!!! ja!

33.description: Seriously, if you're choosing to be BYOB then please post a sign outside telling your customers. Instead of bringing beer I had already purchased/made sitting at home, I had to walk across the street and pay the inflated random liquor store price. I like BYOB places, and even prefer it...as long as I know it's BYOB. The apps were average, and the the pizza was your typical tasting Giordano's pizza, which is a good thing.  The service was good, but the lack of any notice of the location being BYOB really got everything started on a bad note.

43.description: After getting a full remodel, this location is quite nice and big.  The pizza is great and the service is pretty good.  The hardest part is finding parking at times.

2.description: This use to be my go to spot for pizza. Me and my family would look forward to friday and order a stuff pizza and a thin one for the kids and fries and any other appetizers we could think of, we would spend about 60 to 80 dollars weekly on this place and the food was delicious.  Well that came all to an end over the last few years due to horrible service  delivery and dining in.We always put up with the bad service but after a while enough was enough. The delivery drivers would come drunk sometimes, banging on our door and saying why were we taking so long.  The girls on the phone would be busy and rush you thru your order over the phone and ofcourse you would get the wrong order. I would call back to tell them and it would be nothing but bad attitudes. You dine in and they would be all bunched up at table having lunch or something and would take forever to attend you.This is all a product of the owner or manager there. He has a bad attitude and does not care about his costumers because this has been goin on for years and you can read other reviews and go see for yourself.I really did enjoy the food there and I refuse to give this place another dime until they get new management.

18.description: Pizza is ok.i,ve had better (itailian fiesta)...(beggars)..etc.the pizza is better than most indepedent places but only the thin crust.i dont to much care for deep dish pizza.

41.description: Some of the best Chicago-style pizza I've ever had. It's one of those two-layered kinds, where they have the cheese sandwiched between the bread, and then they just load it on top with all the meats and spices and whatnot. It was a while ago so I don't remember what kind we had specifically, but I do remember it was pretty good.

52.description: I just stopped in this place the other night, and all I can say is WOW.  Seriously, I didn't even think I was in the same restaurant. They're completely redone the whole space - they even moved the kitchen!  It's spotlessly clean and super cheerful and a 1000% improvement over the way it used to look.  I'm way impressed.Oh - and the pizza is still amazingly delicious.  I'll be dining in again for sure.

50.description: OK, Let me start of by saying the 3 stars is based on food and parking. Let me explain: Parking: 1 star It is very hard to find parking. It seems they have about 5 spaces in front that say "No Parking - Tow Zone". I don't get this. It should be a 15 minute parking area for carryouts. I really don't understand this no parking area. The rest of the spots on Irving and the nearby streets are the expensive meter parking. They really need to strike a deal with one of the area businesses to use an unused parking lot during the evening hours. OK, On to the good part. Pizza: 4 stars I thought the stuffed pizza was very good. There were just the right amount of toppings and it was very filling. They don't skimp on their stuffed pizza. The sausage had a good flavor and the sauce was just right. Inside:I also remember the old place and this is much nicer. The people were so nice and friendly, that I feel bad talking about the parking issue. I would really like to return here again, but the parking thing needs to be fixed.Giordano's, please find a parking lot you can share in the area.

4.description: They must be trying to cut costs at this location. $27.00 for a large stuffed spinach and it was all dough. Very disappointed.

6.description: Well the only reason it did not get 5 stars was cause of the unfriendly woman over phone telling me I can not place a order 1 hr before closing cause they were planning to go home early with so I had to take thin crust.... Like really I'm going to call the best deep dish pizza company and order thin crust.... agh no!!!! I insisted and spoke to a very friendly man called Dino He placed the order for me and had it ready in 45 minutes Both my cousin and brother must agree with me that it was one hella of a pizza it was perfect Crust was warm and just perfect The cheese was melting to perfection By far one of the best deep dish I have had from giordanos

22.description: Bland pizza. Looks good, lacks flavor. If you want tasty Chicago deep dish pizza you won't fail with Lou Malnatis. I wish Giordanos would revamp their recipe for deep dish and add FLAVOR.

15.description: I want to go back!!! Amazing pizza!

20.description: Waited almost a whole hour for service. Not one staff member bothered to come to our table even when we asked they said they will send someone, never did. A lady was worried about her phone dying and they helped her look everywhere for an outlet, I just left and didn't bother going back. Love the pizza, just not this place. Terrible service.

36.description: Disappointed! After waiting for an hour and 10 minutes when I was told my pizza would be out in 35 minutes I decided to ask the waitress she said there was a problem with the computer. Funny thing is that her friends who she sat next to arrived about 30 minutes after we did and received their pizza before we did. I asked to speak to a manager . I thinks I was complaining to get a free pizza. Boy did she miss the point that we chose her restaurant to celebrate my twin 6 years b-day. Not for free pizza that apparently takes an hour and half to make. She really missed the point that my four kids left that restaurant hungry. Not one did the waitress ever mention they were having a problem. I declined the free pizza not everyone the complaints wants something for free. You staff needs better customer service. Keeping me informed would have made me happy. I promise you this I will never return to your restaurant.

14.description: The line wait was 30-45mins. We (boyfriend and I )went on valentines day and when we were finally seated the people who got seated after us got waited on first. Then we ordered a large pepperoni pizza, garlic Parmesan fries, and wings 5 buffalo and 5 barbeque. The pizza, let's face it if you do actually live in Chicago then you know that this ISN'T Chicago's best at all but it is eatable but those fires are a must have when you go there and there wings are super crispy and drenched in sauce mmmm finger-licking good for sure!  But on there on-line menu they have something called the leaning tower that I was so egger to order when I got there but then they told me that it wasn't available! Which I didn't understand because there online menu was updated specifically for 2015 for that specific Giordano's! Overall okay.

1.description: I bought a couch from Windy CIty Second hand. After our HUGE winter storm we had they still delivered. Now my apartment is small and the couch was too big to get in the front door. They went above and beyond and went in the alley back way to bring it in walking through the snow and making sure my couch wasn't getting ruined. Best customer service. The quality of the furniture was wayyyyy beyond what i expected. Very sweet and the owners are like your instant friends. Def recommend this company to anyone I know moving. Thank you guys again for all your help!

0.description: My daughter and I stopped here on a whim to see if they had any kids books. They didn't have a large selection, but the lady behind the counter told us we could have any that we wanted for free! My daughter found a book she'd been  asking for for months that I've been meaning to buy her. The store is not big, but the people who own it are so nice it is definitely worth stopping in.

12.description: I've played at the Nite Cap with bands several times.  It's an interesting place.  Not a top venue, but definitely a step-up from places like The Mutiny and The Big Horse (RIP).  They expanded the stage a few years ago, and it's kind of an odd shape, but ultimately servicable.  Acoustics are just okay.  Drink prices are not too high.  All-in-all, a good place to see an up-and-coming or beginning band.  The only unpleasant experience I ever had at the Nite Cap came from the management's demeanor.  They sometimes have an Eastern-European stentorian gruffness that is offputting.  And it's like, maybe that's what everybody did back in "the old country," okay, but this is America, and I'm not going to try to rip you off or perceive you as weak if you're polite and you smile occasionally.  I'm just a dude in a band hoping to get my $2 a head at the door or whatever.  That's no reason to be stern and gruff.

7.description: Excellent times at the Wednesday night open mic. Good times, indeed.

19.description: like mentioned above good place for shows. i went here in 2006 when my boy played one with his band. sound was okay though. it's funny no one's written a review later than 2007 til now. makes me wonder if this spot were a faded hollywood star they'd be on vh1's "where are they now?". can anybody actually answer that question?

1.description: If there is a band, there is a modest cover charge.  Do not, under ANY circumstances, make the same mistake I did and enter when the doorman/bouncer/money-collector-guy is in the men's room or otherwise occupied.  Halfway through the night, the guy found me in the music room enjoying the show and made a federal case out of me somehow being there without having paid the cover.  Sorry, man, honest mistake but if you're serious about collecting from each and every person you can't be wandering off and letting people in unawares.

2.description: I was actually the bass player for the first ever band to jam at Nite Cap. I would go there with my  buddy Russ (he was the guitarist in my band, as well) because all of our Foreman High School friends were there. One night we convinced the (then) owner Frank to let us use the raised dance floor he installed in the adjoining room and play a couple of sets (he was looking to make it a Euro-style dance club, that never worked out). I moved on, but I was amused when I drove by the place several years ago and saw that they had regular live music.Good times... I may have to check it out to see what it's like these days.

9.description: A cool looking rock club. I like that this place is away from everything else and the bs of downtown clubs. The staff is really friendly and this bar has a nice neighborhood fel to it. They have open jam nights and two cool looking bars in a small place.

6.description: Nite Cap is decent. It's quite a distance (even for my near-west-ish self), but ya know.I've only been here a few times to see a friend's cover band play (plug for them - Boom Shakalaka. They're fun, I promise). It's one of those places. Ya know, just a place unless there's something cool going on.I wouldn't come here without a purpose. Just sayin.

18.description: Decent room for a band , smallish stage , decent sound . Bars in front room and stage room. Fearless waitresses , some of the ballsiest I've seen working through a packed crowd during a show , props. Price of booze , average , decent cross section of bands that play here weekly. Solid bartenders.Good room overall. Saw a Sabbath coverband (Dio era) nuff said.

10.description: If you are in a band this is not the place where you will play the best show of your life. Seriously... this is not a fun place. I could have fun in a hole in the ground but I couldn't here.

13.description: This place is great. Drinks are cheap, people are cool and the music rocks. Come by for their wednesday night open mic, it was a good time

16.description: There have been some GREAT shows here.   But I remember thinking, "I wouldn't come here at all except for a show."  And I haven't.   It kind of seems to be in a gray area between bar and venue. That'd be a compliment if it were just a venue, but since I guess it's a bar, hmmm....make sense?  Anyhoo, yeah, great place for shows, not much else to it.

17.description: Meh. This place is a local neighborhood watering hole where the softball team comes after a game, but is trying very hard to be a reputable music venue.  They do get some decent bands through there on occasion, but I swear to god this is the smokiest bar I have ever been to.  That's not even an exaggeration.  The sound varies widely, and the bands tend to be metal, loud rock, punk/hardcore, and the odd cover act here and there.  Blue collar all the way, and you may very well have your ironic ass kicked if you are a wiseass hipster, so at least it's got that going for it.

15.description: i didnt really care for the set up.its a big bar but its divided strangely. I cant comment on prices being reasonable,seein that ive only been here once and my boyfriend at the time took care of that. I'd go back only if a friend was playing or to grab a couple beers.

0.description: Very reasonable! A $7 cover charge to see 2 rock bands. Both heavy metal.  They do have different genres but that was the type for this evening.  They have a full sound system.  So you might want to bring ear plugs (if you are like me and don't want to damage your hearing). The crowd was diverse and laid back.  Clientele would talk, sing and joke around with you. We got a $3 MHL and a $5 Hendricks gin drink. My date from Lincoln Square couldn't believe it.

5.description: I attended a local hip hop show here the other night. Most of the acts were appropriately awful but the reasonably priced drinks and friendly staff mitigated the pain. Notably the jovial manager(?) Dave who imparted a couple of hilarious stories.

11.description: Saturday night. Craving a beer and some jams. Don't really feel like rolling all the way out to friggin Chicago Heights (where the crew is this fine evening) What's a girl to do? Oh right! My boys band is playin Nite Cap tonight. It's a jillion times closer and I'm always down for some skull thrashing metal. Might as well go check this joint out. Got there around 10:30. Nabbed parking pretty easily. There's a slew of black clothed, long haired, big booted folks out front. Yep, this is the place. Payed my $12 cover (apparently the "I'm with the band" don't fly around here) and strolled on in. This side is narrow with a small bar on the right and a wall on the left. As you venture in, a room on the right appears with a large oval bar in the center and the stage up front. It was quite a small stage. So small, in fact, that it just so happened to be a good thing that Veneficum (buddys band) just canned the drummer for his divatude. More room for the singer, 3 guitars, and keyboard. There were two other bands that followed, both with 4 members each. They had a bit more room to groove. Over all the sound was pretty good. Nice and loud, just the way I like it. The levels were pretty spot on too. Biggest problem is the lack of space between the front of the bar and the stage. I'm not big on the mosh pit deal, but for those who were, they kept falling onto the stage and jostling around the mics and whatnot. But hey - that's metal right? Service was quick. I never waited more than a minute for a beer. $5 for Heinekens, $3 for PBR. Worst part of the night is spent waiting for the ladies room. Only one and it was consistently out of toilet paper. Thank God for bar napkins! I don't think I'll be hitting this place up on a Tuesday or anything, but as long as they keep the shows comin - I'll be back.

8.description: Oh I really acted a fool at this place.  They had old school house music and the drinks flowed one too many.  Next thing you know I'm dancing in a shirtless male sandwich, sweating, trying to wave up others to the dance floor. (Oh GOD am I a dork.)  There was some weird metal pipe or bar sticking out of the floor near the dance floor which I wiped out on twice, the second time it happened I tore a perfect circle out of the top of my leather boot.  Granted I had no business drinking that much or wearing those boots but overall I like the place.  I'm glad they didn't' give me the boot.

3.description: I use to go there back in the day when it was a night club and wow it has changed lol they updated one of the rooms and hope they do the other room bc its a great place for local musicians. Last night i went there for an acoustic show and had a great time. The owner is a real nice guy too!

14.description: Surprising amount and variety of good local rock bands, especially for a divey neighborhood bar. Great service, and awesome, laid back crowd.

4.description: Great place.  The owner, Dave, is a great guy.  Every 1st Mon of the month, they have a burlesque fetish show with hooks and bdsm acts for NO COVER.   Beer selections is pretty weak, as I mainly dig craft beers, but the bartenders are quite skilled at choosing alternatives for you.  The people there are somewhat the older biker crowd, but they're still good people that know how to ROCK!!! \m/

1.description: As many newspapers and magazines have gone digital, why is a place like this still in business?  Well, behind the closed doors, if you have an addiction involved with some kind of "graphics,"you will start pulling your wallet out of your packet.  Well, make sure that you're "just getting" the wallet out of pocket.  After such motion is completed, please don't let your hand linger around your "pants area."  I don't know if you Yelpers understand any of that in the first paragraph.  I purposefully refrain to delve in detail, but I know the "adult-only" section constitutes the majority of their sales on this "newsstand."  Well, I briefly peeked around "that" area and was quickly restrained by hubby behind me.  Anyways, that wasn't in my interest at all.  As a libertarian, you have the right to pursue your own happiness, even if your happiness entails some women's body parts.  I guess that's alright with me.  I was fond of the runway fashion magazine section.  The prices were somewhat steep, around $60 to $70 per copy.  I told hubby to pick up one of these for my birthday coming up in September.  There were many atypical books that you wouldn't be able to find at a Bo*k-A-mil*ion or a Bar*es & No*le.  I found many potential purchases, yet we decided to hold off and not to use the $5 credit from the groupon I purchased recently.  I know I'm a healthy individual, and I will be back for the front sections of the shop.  Loving fashion is my addiction because I like to put clothes on.

9.description: They just created a coffee shop, which the coffee is FANTASTIC.  Unfortunately, the service is sub-par.  I went the first time, and there was one man working both counters, which clogged up the line.The second time a very unpleasant young man working the coffee bar did not even acknowledge my existence and went on talking to a man who he knew who had just ordered coffee.  Very rude, and I will not be going back.

23.description: If you need a magazine that is hard to find, this is the place to go. Highly recommended.

5.description: They hyped up the release of Charlie Hebdo but only had 6 copies available for sale. They are taking pre-orders for the second shipment coming the following week. Waste of time. Why not wait one week for the full sale?

25.description: The other day I wandered into City News for the first time since I was a teenager, aside from Sears it is one of the only stores that seems to have survived from the era when the Six Corners area of Portage Park was a lively, bustling shopping & dining district.  They carry many out-of-town newspapers and just about every magazine under the sun, including stange fare catering to audiences such as militia men & Barbie Doll enthusiasts.  And, of course, porn-a-plenty towards the back of the store.

12.description: The best stand in Chicagoland. Hands down. If they dont have it Its not printed. Nice job on the remodel.

21.description: I stopped here to get some mags for a friend in the hospital. This place has the best selection of magazines, literary journals, etc. I've seen outside of the larger bookstores downtown. Probably a good place to stock up before you are heading out of town, or if you're looking for something obscure.

16.description: Love magazines?  Tired of going to traditional bookstores and not finding magazines that cover your particular tastes, interests, and hobbies?  Then this is the store for you.  No frills, just racks of all kinds of magazines from the USA and around the world.  The counter people are friendly and love to engage customers in conversations.  They are also helpful with giving information about various magazines, if you can't find your favorites on the racks.  Check it out!  I always manage to find new, interesting magazines to pick up along the ones I usually buy.

17.description: A neighborhood treasure. City Newsstand is the only place for miles around - or as far as I know, within the city - where in one visit I can pick up fancy British music magazines (you know, the ones that come with mix CDs), higher-brow political journals, and B-movie mags. While I'm sure that some of the magazines are available at Borders, City Newsstand carries a greater number of esoteric and foreign publications than any chain. Plus, it's nice to spend local.Uh. One little gripe though - The gay porn magazines are way too close to the political science section. Every time I go looking for an issue of Harpers I end up getting an eyeful of "Hung Studs" and the like. What gives? Put the gay stuff over near the bodybuilding magazines, where it belongs.

10.description: Great selection of magazines; I've found just about everything I've been looking for here, including magazines you can't usually find at a Barnes and Noble or... well, I guess Borders doesn't exist anymore. The also sell the Daily Racing Form, which is a rarity, unfortunately.Do mind your step, however. The entire back of the magazine is nudie magazines, and they aren't separated by a tasteful curtain or velvet rope, either, so it's pretty easy to come in, walk back and BOOM: porno. I'm a big boy and can handle it but maybe you or, more likely, the little tyke you're bringing along for his Sports Illustrated for Kids can't. Since this doesn't effect my use of the place one iota I won't dock them a star for that, but your experiences might dictate otherwise.

11.description: This is an excellent little tucked away neighborhood newstand. It's located in a small store front on Cicero near Irving Park/Milwaukee and you almost miss it because on either side are large empty stores sadly.... but once you walk in you are in magazine heaven. They have every magazine you could think of, even newspapers and magazines in different languages.Must warn though the "adult magazines" aren't in a special section or tastefully covered up like at chain stores.... so might want to keep an eye on little Johnny if you don't want him picking up his first issue of Playboy too soon.

26.description: No reviews?Another neighborhood legend of 6 corners. They have the greatest selection of magazines and out of state newspapers. I can't believe no one has written a review of this incredible store. I have been shopping with them for over 14 years. I would play hooky from Portage Park day camp as a kid to go there and read magazines because at times camp would get boring and back then they sold Garfield comic books. So come to City News and purchase a newspaper from Pittsburgh.

22.description: If you like to bring a 'different' magazine with you for a vacation, or plane ride, this is the place to find it. If you're going to a city for the first time, you can get one of their local newspapers here, & have an idea of what the locals do as well as what a guide book would suggest. The Chicago Public Library may have more magazines, but City News is great place to find good reading material. They were also the only place around for a long time that had a copy of the Reader. Parking on Cicero Ave. is tight, but the Sears lot across the street is only full near Christmas.

0.description: This place features an extensive selection of magazines, newspapers, and books, sometimes in different languages. They proudly brew Uncommon coffee. The place is quaint, ceramic mugs are provided for people who drink in, and the selection of coffees and flavors is extensive and quite delicious. They also make their own truffle, which are absolutely tasty! The lady that served us was modest and kind.The hours are also very nice, 7am to 11pm, 7 days a week.I will be back, and I recommend this place to anyone who wants to grab a morning cup of coffee, study, or escape the busy life in Portage Park for a little while.

20.description: A neighborhood treasure. City Newsstand is the only place for miles around - or as far as I know, within the city - where in one visit I can pick up fancy British music magazines (you know, the ones that come with mix CDs), higher-brow political journals, and B-movie mags. While I'm sure that some of the magazines are available at Borders, City Newsstand carries a greater number of esoteric and foreign publications than any chain. Plus, it's nice to spend local.Uh. One little gripe though - The gay porn magazines are way too close to the political science section. Every time I go looking for an issue of Harpers I end up getting an eyeful of "Hung Studs" and the like. What gives? Put the gay stuff over near the bodybuilding magazines, where it belongs.

19.description: No reviews?Another neighborhood legend of 6 corners. They have the greatest selection of magazines and out of state newspapers. I can't believe no one has written a review of this incredible store. I have been shopping with them for over 14 years. I would play hooky from Portage Park day camp as a kid to go there and read magazines because at times camp would get boring and back then they sold Garfield comic books. So come to City News and purchase a newspaper from Pittsburgh.

2.description: I've got to hand it to this place -they really have cleaned up, reorganized / remodeled it and made it the "go to" place to find unique magazines. I love the newer (last two years or so..?) cafe that attracts a nice neighborhood crowd -it adds a nice vibe to the place. I get a lot of magazines directly to my home via subscription, but I was looking for some particular teen music ones for my nieces for Xmas. I planned to gift them the magazine and then put a note that I bought them a subscription. These are harder to find in, say, a Jewel or Walgreens. But, I found them here! (Alternative Press and Karrang! both music magazines for the more rock / emo bands.)Great place -super excited to find some cool stuff that I suspect will make a nice Xmas gift (or at least I hope!).

18.description: This is one of those unique kinds of places in the city that you only find by accident or if someone tells you about it... so I'm telling you about it! City Newsstand is probably the biggest storefront magazine shop you will ever find. They have two locations, Evanston and a Chicago location just north of Irving on Cicero. The Chicago location is kind of mind blowing. This is one of those places that people with ADD shouldn't go unless they want to be sucked in. I say this because it holds 60 Newspapers and 6,000 different Magazines. The place is always renewing and or changing/ adding to the already vast selection on display. They have so many different rare magazines foreign and domestic that you won't find anywhere else. A friend of mine back in the day wrote for La Coda, a French magazine which I never thought that I would be able to find until I stumbled upon City Newsstand. Though I could only make out a word or three, lucky for me I had another friend read it to me. The staff has always been extremely friendly and will help you through the overload of the visual senses to find what you need. So if you're going on a long flight or just appreciate a good article this is the place for you!

13.description: Looking for that rare magazine?  How about a better selection of architecture and design magazines? Or wonder what mags are read in other countries?  Still trying to find that newspaper from the other side of the country/continent/world?!Well my friends, Look No More!   City Newsstand is a wonderful gem in Chicago.  This place has a _____ (insert curse word here) huge selection of magazines and papers.  I've been coming here for years and simply love perusing the small store and seeing the different covers. The owner is super cool too. With a friendly smile, a warm hello, the staff are super helpful.Come over to Six Corners, pop some quarters into the parking meter, and enjoy a nice afternoon of magazine hunting.

4.description: I love this place. Have been here a couple times now and it's such a unique place to have in the neighborhood. What's so special about a newstand? Well I believe they have just about anything and everything and more than your run of the mill Barnes & Noble section. Like antiquing...there is a magazine for you. Music fans....there are loads of mags for you. My husband bought a rare music magazine as a Christmas gift! Not only that they have this cute little cafe in the front of the store with the sweetest lady that runs it. If you are not looking for fast coffee and a place to chill this is the best spot. The coffee is pretty good and the lady at the counter will talk about how they make their own truffles and even give you some to sample. The first time my hubby and I went there they had NY bagels that she said would go great with their coffee. I believe we just bought coffee and we got the bagels for free. Now that the weather is nicer I'm sure my husband and I will be spending some of lazy Sundays perusing the stacks and enjoying our coffee.

24.description: This is the place to come to find magazines you wouldn't ever dream up- if it's hard to find and this place doesn't have it, nobody will.  Know that while it's called "City Newsstand," it's not a stand- it's a store, with a front door, racks for the magazines and everything.  The porn section's pretty big, and mixed right into the shop, so if you make a lap around to browse all the magazines expect to rub elbows with the pervs who apparently lack internet access hanging out in the back.

6.description: A visit to the City Newsstand is one of my favorite treats.  The selection of magazines is unparalleled in Chicago.  I gravitate towards the expensive art and photography periodicals, the food and travel ones, and political commentary.  When I was a kid my aunt would take me to the book store and tell me I could have anything I wanted: I get in this frame of mind when I visit the City Newsstand.  This past Sunday I was paying for my stack of reading material and the owner spontaneously told me this great story of a pre-9/11 all-expense-paid trip, on CBS' dime, for he and his wife to be in the audience for the Late Show with David Letterman.  Letterman used to bring his show to other cities, until he realized it was cheaper to bring other cities to New York.  The main guest was Jerry Springer, and the musical guest was Al Green.

15.description: Amazing selection of magazines, best in the city! Don't forget to get a cup of coffee at the cafe and a homemade pastry.

7.description: This place sucks. Granted they have plenty of magazines. But really the coffee shop is a ghost town,and the coffee ....ummmm. no.But they do have plenty of porn which has brought quite the cluster of Pervy guys into the place,so while this used to be an ok place to kill time maybe pick up a paper. Now you get to enjoy odd leering strangers!So boo to upping the creep factor. There are places for that. So if u have kids and they are with you.....think real hard before you venture in.

8.description: Recently remodeled, this shop now includes a coffee bar that features coffee from Uncommon Grounds Saugatuck, which is our favorite coffee in the universe. We have bags shipped to us every couple of months so we're not fooling here. They even feature an exclusive "City News" blend, which is delicious.The selection of magazines is extraordinary. I spotted magazines covering just about every subject conceivable. If you provide firefighters with equipment, there's a trade magazine available here for you. Beekeeper? There's a couple of magazines here for you. Love it. We will come back many times.

3.description: The magazine selection is insanely good, and IMO this is a neighborhood gem store that's often overlooked by those who hadn't heard of it, or don't make it out to Portage Park often and might've missed it while passing through the area. Just about every obscure magazine or newspaper you're trying to find, including even some foreign language ones, are stocked here. Like others said, they have a sister store in Evanston, on the corner of Main/Chicago. Though that one has somewhat less selection, vs. this location.The porn thing doesn't bother me(in the middle of non-porn magazines) since I ignore that, but I see how it could bother others. Keep that in mind, if say you know someone who might be offended by that, and it's their first time here. I'll have to revisit, and see how the cafe addition to City Newstand is going. Gosh, reading that in a newer review reminds me how many years it's unfortunately been, since my last visit here.

14.description: City Newsstand always stocked porno mags. It's a moneymaker, I know.  But on a recent visit, I was surprised at just how much (paper and digital) porn  the store had for sale. Boobs and butts and sticker covered nether regions seemed to be everywhere. I know it's hard to be connected to print media these days, but I didn't know it was this hard, heh heh. As I checked out, the salesman noticed the ring on my finger and remarked that engaged women spend a lot of time in the Wedding section. He was surprised I didn't follow their lead. I wished I told him that  I couldn't find it in the middle of all that porn.I want to patronize this store more often, but the porn factor isn't going to make that happen. If you want a wide variety of magazines with fewer guys drooling over Penthouse, visit the Chicago-Main Newsstand in Evanston.

0.description: I needed a couple of chairs for my apartment. Not only does this place have clothing, but it has some furniture and a small amount of electronics. I was really happy finding what I needed and at a great price. I will go back sometime.

1.description: Forget the other review!!! 4get Me Not Flowers is a gem. It's one of those well kept secrets that is only heard of by mouth.I first heard about this place from my cousin when she had her wedding and then best friend decided to have her flowers also from here for her wedding as well. Both of them were delighted with the end result. Grace, the owner, works with your color scheme, taste, and budget. Naturally, when it came time to my wedding, I absolutely had to head to 4get Me Not. I could not be more happy with how everything turned out. Unlike some other things that did not go so smoothly on my special day, the fresh flowers arranged perfectly on each table of the 30+ tables way before the guests arrived. My husband gets flowers from here on the special occasions. Sometime he gets them delivered. I just got some yesterday :) Sometimes he even asks for same day delivery and they are quick to accommodate (in a reasonable time frame of course). They truly value their customers.Prices are average. There is a huge variety of flowers in different price ranges so you are sure to find something in your budget. There are pretty budget bouquets (under $20) and several absolutely gorgeous flowers for those with larger budgets. Bottom line: If you are looking to make anyone's day special, this place will put a huge smile on their face.

2.description: Should be named 4GETABOUTIT! They are horrible. IF you ever order through an online florist (1-800 flowers) make sure they're not coming from this place if you want your flowers to be delivered by someone competent. My elderly mother with COPD had to lug the gianormous flower arrangement I ordered up to her condo all by herself because the lady delivering them couldn't figure out the simple self-explanatory intercom system and called me 5 times! 2 of those calls were from someone back at the florist that was trying to help her over the phone and they hung up on my when I tried to explain the intercom. "You find the name and you punch in that number....hello?" I guess it didn't help that the delivery woman sounded ancient herself and didn't speak or read english. I was so angry and upset because what was supposed to be this huge happy surprise was ruined and my mother had to carry her flowers all the way up to the 3rd floor by herself. I'm sure her rescue inhaler got a work out that day. So much for happy birthday!

0.description: We hired this shop to provide for our daughters wedding.The owner Grace was highly accommodating and very professional. The flowers on the grand day were fresh, beautiful and abundant! They were delivered on time and even seemed more than what we paid for!They lasted for two weeks after the wedding on top of it! So while our little girl was cruzin the Caribbean on her honeymoon, we had a beautiful, fragrant reminder of a beautiful wedding and the bountiful life ahead for her and our *newly welcomed* son in law!I decided that I would like some fresh flowers to brighten up our home and the thought of Jewel or Mariano's came to mind...one stop shopping ya know? But then I remembered This lil flower shop and the independent lil guy. So even tho it was a step out of my way,I went.I was so glad I did! A dozen roses were 12,99!! Fresh,beautifu, fragrant, affordable!So much so that I also purchased a mixed bouquet for the same price!They lasted for over a week and the roses opened so beautifully! Unlike the flowers my hubby brought for me from the chain stores,which never opened and although the prices were comfortable the quality was not.I not only am over the top happy but ny home is beautified as well as my conscience in knowing that I helped support the local independent shop owner. And it didn't cost me anything more than a decision in action,I am so glad I did!

3.description: Don't go here. I stopped by here because it wasn't busy and my husband needed a quick shave and it was cheap. The ladies seem nice?? but the guy doing men's haircut was not very nice, didn't have good technique and was so rude to my husband. Not only did he not do a good job, the area was dirty and the wire of the razor kept smacking hubby in the face. My husband, the bigger man that he is, even gave him 10 bucks for a 5 dollar easy job and still the guy didn't say thank you....my hubby said "I hope you have a good day" the guy responds "I'm already having a good day". Rude rude rude and condescending to my husband. Ladies who work here--do you really want this guy representing you? Never ever again...first and last time. I believe this is an Albanian establishment--don't quote me on that. I guess as the old saying goes "you get what you paid for".

1.description: I guess you get what you pay for.  If you are girl with a high expectations in hair style and you think this place can do it for you, then you are simply naive and/or.........  I've been using this place for 10+ years and i only get military hair cut, I love it and I think  $5 is reasonable.  I don't even want to those girls to talk to me (or any other barber)so I simply take a little nap.

0.description: Auroras is great.  I've been getting my hair cut there for years, so have my two boys.  Everyone is friendly and are all usually busy with a customer.  I walk in... someone greets me... sometimes i wait 5 or 10 mins.  I sit down and get my hair cut.  $5 plus tip.

2.description: They ruined my hair.  So much so that I literally had to call the police.  Going here was a mistake that I will not make again.

5.description: I went last year to get my hair cut in layers. The woman working there kept hounding  me to get my eyebrows waxed which I don't let anyone touch my brows since I do them myself and receive many compliments and people ask me to do theirs as well. Well she cut my hair and it was a disaster, I kept telling her it wasn't a layer cut and she began getting frustrated and talking to the other workers in another language. I decided to leave. When I got back to my moms house she asked me what did they do to my hair, she said it looked worse than when I went in. I went back and told the girl I wanted my hair fixed she turned to another worker and started talking another language and she flat out refused to fix my hair and even starting yelling at the other worker and turned around angrily to do something else. I got the hint that she didn't want to deal with me when the other woman told me she doesn't want to fix your hair but I'll fix it for you. The woman did a decent cut and did fix it but it wasn't exactly what I wanted.

6.description: If you are a man who doesn't mind getting your hair cut with an electric razor, then this place is for you. If you are anyone else who prefers friendly, qualified service then stay away from this place. Customer service has no meaning to the people who work here. I am not even sure they are certified to cut or color hair. I once saw a boy try and explain how he wanted his hair cut but considering how limited the employee's English was, I don't think she understood him and I don't think she cared what he wanted.As another reviewer mentioned, this place is rather dirty. The people who work here just sit around doing nothing when they could be tidying up.

7.description: I'm a firm believer in supporting local indy owned business. So I stopped in Aurora's on a late Fri afternoon. Even tho they looked busy they took me in right away, cleaned up my hair style, that had grown out and waxed my facial hair for a very reasonable price. I think the lady's name was Tina...very sweet & efficient . I'm not familiar with their color work but am willing to give them a try.

8.description: Disgusting. This "salon" doesn't properly dispose of their garbage and leaves hair all over the alley. The employees are rude and disrespectful to their neighbors, constantly shouting and smoking outside the building that houses the salon. The customers and employees park on the sidewalk and block the residential diagonal parking. There is lovely graffiti on the front door that alludes their customers are not happy with their work.  This place is a nightmare. I would NEVER step foot inside!

9.description: Dirtiest bathroom I have ever been in.  Try the place at Menard and Addison.  Same kind of place price-wise, nice people and clean.

10.description: This place is really close to where I live and on a last minute whim decided to walk in to get my eyebrows threaded for the advertised $5. There were a LOT of employees there, almost too many. I was taken in right away, but the girl doing the threading did it too slow and consequently I did not have a comfortable experience. Slow, painful pulling. I get my eyebrows threaded regularly, so I know the difference in experiences and appreciate the faster technique. I won't return.

4.description: they suck. I went in for layers and the lady ended up giving me a mullet. she seriously cut my hair in like 5 minutes & it took me 1 whole year to grow out. what do you expect to get with a $5 hair cut, though? boo. don't go here. for real.

29.description: I have been going to Felicia ever since March and I am still very satisfied with her service.  I feel as though people do not understand that she is the only one running this business and is the only nail technician.  Her work says it all and I have never had an issue.  I recommend all my friends to go see her because the products she uses (Biosculpture)  that all those other salons wont purchase due to the cost.  But its well worth it because my nails are healthy and strong and my no chip last for more than 2 weeks.

42.description: My no-chip toes are gorgeous!  Felicia is AWESOME!She is one of the most thorough & hygiene-oriented nail techs I've come across.  I found the No Chip Queen on Yelp & these reviews had me confident I would come out happy.  Fellow Yelpers, thank you for your reviews -- Felicia is so nice & welcoming, she wants to make sure you have a great experience & that you leave happy with her services.  Her prices fit my budget nicely too.She gets after your cuticles too!  My toenails look super clean & the polish is flawless.Now that it's getting cold I typically get no-chip pedicures so I don't have to worry about my feet looking too jacked.  She explained about how I often I should no-chip my nails & how best to care for them.She's available 7 days a week, which fits my schedule perfectly. Felicia is customer-oriented & uses Biosculpture, the best no chip product.  But she's also very sanitary & knowledgable.  She's got a great array of colors... looking forward to trying Cast Iron next month!

23.description: After almost a year and a half I am still going to Felicia and loving it!I look forward to 'nail day'  not only for the nail refresh but also for the fun company. Felicia is the kind of person you just can't help but be friends with. She genuinely cares about her clients and takes her time with you! I'm so grateful to have found this place and look forward to booking my next appointment in the upcoming week.

47.description: I've been going to Goca's Salon for my hair (Goca is fabulous) for a few years now, and recently when I was there I noticed a new nail station in the salon.  I was in desperate need of a pedicure and Felicia was able to take me for both a no chip manicure (my first ever) and regular pedicure.  She was amazing and I left feeling so taken care of and pampered.That said, if you're expecting a "spa" of sorts, then this isn't for you.  If you're coming to Felicia, you appreciate an extremely well-done (and reasonably priced) manicure or pedicure by someone who truly takes pride in her work and wants you to be 100% satisfied.  I have never experienced a pedicure where someone really spent several minutes (for lack of a better term) "detailing" my feet and toes prior to polishing them.  Felicia also uses great-smelling products and spends the extra time to give you a lovely massage with a salt or sugar scrub.I really have to say it sounds like Chu b.'s review below is from an entirely different experience.  Felicia is easily the most fastidious, professional, lovely, detail-focused nail professional I have ever had the pleasure of having do my nails.  The no chip will last for at least two weeks, if not longer.  My regular pedicure lasted about three weeks, looking GREAT, and in the fourth week it still looked okay.  She worked really hard on making sure both were done impeccably, and clearly takes pride in her work.  Also, Felicia recently got a new chair and has beautifully redecorated the nail area of the salon.  She is such a sweetheart and I have already been back once.Go see Felicia--you will not be disappointed.

8.description: Hello all!  So this was my first no-chip manicure experience, and I chose this place because it had the best price. She is extremely friendly and attentive! Strong recommend!

31.description: Had my first no-chip with Felicia a few weeks ago and am very satisfied with the result. I had a hard time deciding on a color as there are so many and she was very helpful- I ended up choosing one of her suggestions. As a nail tech, Felicia is an artist. She is very detail oriented and takes pride in her work. As a person, she's the sweetest lady. I text her to make an appointment and she is responsive and accommodating, despite being so busy! I look forward to my next positive experience with the No Chip Queen and highly recommend her.

34.description: Felicia is the best :). She makes you feel so at ease the best manicure and pedicure. My swoop coupon was expiring and she said since she was so busy but she would still honor it after 4 days. Love this place and will definetly be recommending this place to my friends

16.description: I have been getting mani/pedis with Felicia at NCQ religiously for months now, but simply have not had the time to write a review.  Upon reviewing Felicia's reviews, I was really upset to see the 3 star review Felicia was given by Sam K, certainly not deserved!  But instead of attempting to counteract every negative thing posted about Felicia, I will simply rave about her stellar services and let that speak for itself. First and foremost, I live in the South Loop and drive a good 20-30 minutes for Felicia's services.  Felicia ALWAYS makes an attempt to fit me into her schedule.  In fact, Felicia has taken me at late as 7:30-8:00ish before due to my hectic schedule.  That is just one example of how dedicated Felicia is to her work and her clients.Secondly, Felicia's work speaks for itself and she stands behind it.  That is hard to find these days and that is what I really appreciate about her services.  I have never felt rushed and that is definitely something I experienced frequently before finding NCQ.  Felicia takes her time and pays attention to the small details, that is why I always leave looking and feeling like a million bucks. Third, Felicia is the epitome of a professional.  She usually books her appointments via text which is nice because she isn't constantly interrupting my services to book clients.  Another thing I really appreciate is that Felicia goes above and beyond by making sure everything is sanitized and that her clients are comfortable.  I've never observed Felicia wearing a coat, and in fact, she has always checked in with me in regards to my comfort level of the temperature in the salon.  She has only explained her rationale behind using new buffers and files for each client and introduced the concept of the pedicure chair she uses at my first appointment.  After that, I never heard about why she does things the way she does, but I continue to observe her pull out a new liner for my pedicure every two weeks in addition to pull out a fresh file and buffer for my services.  While to some, this consideration may be overlooked, it is greatly appreciated by me.  I pride myself on having beautiful nails and toes and I am glad Felicia keeps me looking beautiful and healthy at the same time. Bottom line is Felicia is amazing at what she does.  You can tell she really loves to make people look and feel beautiful.  I always leave my appointment with beautiful hands and feet and a smile on my face.

13.description: I started coming to No Chip Queen a couple years ago after being referred by another client (thanks Bella!) and love this spot in the neighborhood!  Nothing else compares and its especially nice to have a GOOD local business to support (I live in Norwood Park).  I've lived in Lincoln Park, West Loop and all throughout the city and have never found a no chip that looks as great and lasts as long as hers.  Felicia really takes her time and is careful so you know you're going to have a great looking and long-lasting manicure.  I rarely review a spot unless I think they're exceptional and I've been very happy with all of my services here.  Not sure what these other couple negative reviews are about...I've always had excellent service, find it very easy to schedule (and to park here!) and have referred many family & friends.Highly recommend...check out No Chip Queen!

11.description: I've been back to visit the No Chip Queen Felicia several times over the past months. She's really the best.  When she boasts, the proof is in the manicure or pedicure.  Felicia is flexible on timing and really takes her time and care about what she does and how she does it.  Do yourself a favor and book an appointment today.

39.description: I love my nails! Felicia is very thorough and knowledgeable which is important for me.  She doesn't rush her clients and is very precise.  My manicure lasted for 3 weeks and I am VERY pleased with my current manicure.  This has become my new treat, I cant wait to get a pedicure.  If you want great service and excellent quality, then call Felicia for your no chip manicure!

37.description: I've seen Felicia twice for no Chip manicures. She did a fantastic job both times. She really takes her time to make sure every nail is perfect which is a nice change from feeling rushed and pushed out the door with a not so great manicure at other salons. My first visit, she went into great detail about the product that she uses which made it obvious she takes pride in what she does. She is very friendly and easy to talk to which makes the experience that much better. Her prices are extremely reasonable for the fantastic work that she does.

0.description: My favorite no chip manicure ever without a doubt... from the nail color, quality of the products, and the hospitality Felicia provided. Such a sweet woman with lots of talent. She didn't  hurt my nails, was very gentle, knowledgable, and really fun to talk to! Felicia is my  favorite nail tech thus far, hands down!

38.description: I've come to fall in love with no chip manicures because of Felicia. I've had 4 there so far and have loved every one. She has a wide variety of colors and has been extremely helpful and nice. None of mine have chipped, as I've heard some other no-chips have. She takes her time and gets to know you, which makes coming back even more enjoyable. Her affordable pricing, attention to detail, and hygiene-friendly practices have made No Chip Queen my number 1 choice.

51.description: I had an online coupon for here and it turned out amazing! I have had my nails done for two weeks and still no chips! At first I couldn't find the place, and it's more hair salon than nails. But she knows what she's doing. Super happy I found her!

27.description: I had my first no chip manicure done somewhere else. But after learning that if the wrong person removes your polish, that it would involve scraping, leaving your nail damaged and weak. So I decided to search for a nail tech that knows what she is doing. I found No Chip Queen through Yelp and trusted all the great reviews she had. She removed my polish gently with no damage to my nails. Whew!Felicia gave me a no chip manicure and pedicure right before I left for my vacation to Italy. It withstood 10 days of sandal wearing, non-stop walking on cobblestone roads and rocky trails, several stubbed toes, countless times of packing and unpacking, and rummaging through my bag every other minute to find and assemble my camera gear. In fact, it lasted 4 weeks (work got the best of me after my vacation and a part of me wanted to see how long this would really last). The nail polish looked as smooth and shiny as it did the first day it was applied. If it wasn't for nail growth, this manicure would have lasted quite a long time. I've gotten a regular mani+pedi from Felicia, too. She really is detail oriented. A perfectionist, even. My cuticles are neat, my nail bed is smooth, the shape is perfectly round, and the polish is shiny!Most importantly, she offers something no one else does - a very sanitary experience. Ever wonder how many times that pumice stone at your local nail salon has been used. Who it was used on before you? If it has ever been cleaned. Or if they ever clean the water jets in the foot bath? Doubt it. Felicia uses a new tub liner for each session. And uses a one time use foot scrubber. Nail files and nail buffers are all new and just for you.Felicia is a sweet girl. She is a one woman show and she runs a great business. I always look forward to seeing her!

32.description: I had stopped getting no-chip manicures because they were destroying my nails and I couldn't convince myself that soaking your hands in acetone is okay for your body.  It's actually pretty horrible for you.  I was going on vacation and needed my nails done.  With a little research I found the No Chip Queen.  I am so glad I did.  I had a no-chip done using Bio Sculpt which is a much more natural product and does not require a chemical bath to remove.  She was so attentive, professional and great to talk to.  The files and foot bath liner were all disposable which I so appreciated.  There are no other nail technicians in this neighborhood that provide such a meticulous and sanitary service.  Felicia is truly concerned about her clients natural nail health and goes above and beyond to make sure you have a wonderful experience.  I will definitely be back!

48.description: Felicia is awesome, as is her work. She's a lovely young woman, and really a pleasure to talk to, but she doesn't bother you if you just feel like sitting and reading a magazine while you're having your work done. I like that balance.My no chip mani and pedi are amazing, and the prices are super reasonable. She uses Biosculpture brand no chip polish. If you know about no-chip polishes, you know that this is the absolute best, and usually costs a lot more than the other no chip manicures, but Felicia does not pass that cost along to her customers.  She also doesn't file the first layer of your nails off before applying the polish, which I appreciate. This way the nails look fab when the polish comes off.Pedicures are above average. Felicia works hard to get any dry or dead skin cells off of your footsies without hurting you or being too rough like a lot of salons will. She gives a nice scrub and massage with each pedi, and really takes the time to give your feet the attention that they deserve.I also have to comment on the cleanliness of Felicia's stations. She is super hygenic. She even told me that she ordered a new pedi chair with a new "removable lining" system. Apparently she'll be the only person in Chicago with this chair, and I can't WAIT to use it! Summary: Awesome Manicure and PedicureFantastic company, if you want to talkTruly cares about her client's well beingClean, clean, cleanLatest technology for your conveniencePlenty of street parkingAffordable------UPDATE---------7/14/12WOW! I can't believe that I have been going to No Chip Queen for over a year already! I still think that Felicia is the best in town! She is always super clean, professional, and does the very best no chip mani this side of the Mississippi. As for the lady who reviewed her below, I already contacted Yelp letting them know that she has written a false review. I happened to be at the salon the day that this all happened, and her entire review is pretty much a lie. The truth is that Felicia is one of the most professional people that I have ever met, and I only wish that every business was run the way that hers is. With all of the competition out there, it says something that I've stuck with NCQ for over a year, and the service has never been an ounce less than stellar. NCQ is the only place to go for a no chip service if you want meticulous work done for a (STILL!) great price! If only Felicia knew what a commodity she is, she could charge twice what she does and get it easily, but if you don't tell her, neither will I!

44.description: Felicia the No Chip Queen is FABULOUS!  I've been getting no chip manicures for over a year and I needed to find somewhere closer to home to get my nails done.  I found No Chip Queen and am so happy with the great quality of the products and the personalized service!She offers a great price for a no chip manicure and it lasts for at least two weeks!

24.description: A bit shout out to Felicia for what was easily the best no-chip ever! 4 weeks after her having done my nails with no-chip, the polish was still intact; she even has pictures of it on facebook if you need proof. Except for the growth of the nails, no one could tell that I needed a fresh application of polish. And 4 weeks is a loooooong time in the nail world. Add to that the fact that I cook a lot and do quite a bit work around the house, so that says a lot about how 'sturdy' the application is.When I went back, I got a regular pedi as well and Felicia was just as good with it. It's so wonderful to see a woman run a business efficiently, with the intention of providing the best service. She so is the Queen of No Chip! Good going Felicia!!!! :)

7.description: I moved to Jefferson Park in April 2014 in desperate need of a good manicurist. I found Felicia on Yelp and was definitely not disappointed. She lives up to her 5 star rating. I have had no chip manicures in the city and vowed to never do it again. They chipped and did not allow my nails to grow. Felicia assured me that the products she used were the best and they are! I took a 3 1/2 wk trip to Italy and all I saw was nail growth, no chipping. Not only are you getting an amazing nail technician but you are also making a friend. I recommend Felicia hands down!!! Don't be intimidated by the cash only/appt. by text or phone. She is worth it!

49.description: Just went to see Felicia, the No Chip Queen today, and my experience was exquisite!  Even though I arrived about 30 minutes early, Felicia was able to take me right away.  There is a cafe next door, and she had a cute waiter bring me a complementary cappuccino, which was delicious!Felicia and I chatted throughout my entire no chip pedicure, and I must say, she is an absolute delight!  She is extremely nice and took the time to make sure my pedicure looked perfect.So, to sum it up: Felicia is a sweetheart, she does amazing work, and to top it all off, the no chip pedicure was only $35!!!!!!  This is by far the best deal in town.  I used to go to a competing no chip salon and paid $65, but never again.  I've found my new salon, and I'll be here every month.  Thanks Felicia!
