40.description: Felicia does an amazing job!  At first I was hesitant to try no chip manicures, I've heard they can ruin your nails almost to the same extent that acrylics do.  However, that is not the case with Felicia and her Biosculpt products.  I had a manicure last 3 weeks with only one nail peeling a little because I broke it first.  When she took off the manicure, my nails didn't look any worse than before I got the no chip manicure.  She has a huge selection of colors and takes her time.  I definitely agree with DB - she is very hygiene oriented, which is a nice change from other nail places I've been.  She is also easy to talk to and makes you feel very welcome.  This last time I got my original no chip manicure removed, another no chip manicure, and a regular pedicure.  She did an amazing job on both my hands and feet and her prices are very reasonable.  I look forward to seeing her again in a few weeks!Make sure you call or text her 1-2 weeks out for an appointment, now that spring is coming, she is starting to book up quickly!

53.description: I did my first no chip manicure and my nails looks so beautiful!!! Got many complements on it . She has a great knowledge about the product, explain every step she was doing. Her station looks very clean and organize, definitely coming back! Thank you so much!!

30.description: I have been getting my nails done at various places since the beginning of February of this year.  I've been doing a lot of shopping around, as I want to find the best, as well as the most affordable.  I recently have switched from gel nails to no chip and this was my third no chip manicure and my first visit here.  I really liked Felicia's personality- she is very warm and friendly.  She really took her time and educated me on my nails, the products she was using and how I can care for my manicure after I leave the shop.  This is a great relief to me as I am used to people doing my nails that don't even speak english.  I like also that you can text her for an appointment (which, since I'm a nightowl, I did at 2:30AM), and she got back to me less than 8 hours later for a next day appointment.  I wouldn't be surprised if that was lucky, as she is really good at what she does.  This is a fabulous place to go and I will be returning for my next manicure and pedicure here.  I think my shopping around is going to end at this woman's door.  I've found what I was looking for!

46.description: The one thing in life I was still a virgin at....no-chip mani....jk :)Alas, I got some recommendations from yelpers on a thread and good old Bella E. suggested this place.  Me and two friends make the trek up here from downtown on a Wednesday to see Felicia.  Its easy to find and a quick ride on the expressway.  Bonus to free street parking!The salon is no frills, which is fine with me.  Felicia was there and super nice.  She did a fantastic job explaining the product, etc.  However, I know nothing about no chip manicures so she could have been selling me a used car for all I know.It looked perfect after she was done and two weeks later it was next to perfect.  After the second week, the sides started bubbling a little, but you couldnt really tell.  It was great!  It was weird having the polish on that long where my nails were growing out...haha.  There are an array of colors to chose from.  Felicia herself is totally nice, hilarious girl!  Easy to talk to, but not fake....like you know when you go to a new stylist and they talk your ear off and you dont really care....this was NOT like that.  It was perfect conversation...not too much, not too littlePlus, we got authentic Serbian coffee from the cute boys next door that made me cracked out on caffeine.  First time is $25, I dont know how much it is after that.  Like I said, its a bit of a drive, however, honestly its like 10 mins in the car, free parking, cheap and great quality!  I am glad I went to Felicia to pop my no chip cherry :)

1.description: I'm still a loyal client to the original No Chip Queen. She's a one woman show and has never let me down. Still cash only. Still appointments scheduled by text or phone. Still renting a small space in Goca's Hair Salon. Still a great conversationalist. Never a dull moment. Ultimately a hardworking mom doing what she loves. The supposed outdated salon space and lack of a jet water spa chair truly does not affect what you pay for- best quality no chips manis and pedis (even regular ones) that last long and look great. That's what you want in the end and it's guaranteed going here. Trust me! I've been to the high end nail salons, even others rated 5 stars not so high end, only for the end result to make me regret ever going anywhere else. See my other reviews. None compare to the longest lasting no chips I've received here. Today is my last visit as I relocate to another state. I doubt I will find another like the No Chip Queen. I've been going here since 2011! I will miss her greatly but best believe when I come back to see family, I will make sure to make my appointment here. PS- Summer is very busy so book ahead of time. Look past that the space is not so high end for now. (Goca will be doing a remodel soon if that really matters to you.) Regardless, you will receive a very personable service and a quality mani and pedi. Affordable.

9.description: I found this gem of a spot one day when I was super desparate in need of a pedi before going on vacay. I texted Felicia and she kindly responded that she could fit me in where a cancellation was.  My no chip was pretty, she even incorporated some type of glitter as an accent nail.  I really like the price of the services here but what is always most important to me is the type of service I receive. Felicia is so nice and genuine, which is super important in a business where you have to work with many people. When she is working with you, it's strictly your time and she works without stopping. I appreciate her flexibility.

26.description: Such a pleasant nice atmosphere-quiet, not a "nail shop" noisy feeling..plus the no chip is so fast and fun!  Love it,,

25.description: At no chip queen you get personal attention no question without the hustle and bustle of a big salon, although you do get the  same quality of work as  in high end spas and better. The thing that I like the most is her focus on sanitation since the pedi tub she has has no jets, it has disposable inserts and I am fine with that since I bet no matter how much other salons can try to keep clean those jets I am sure there is still science project going on in them. Felicia is definitely very detail oriented and a perfectionist, very friendly and profesional  as well. I want to try the no chip next time.

12.description: Felicia is a true toThe game nail technician! Still loving manicure and pedicure from yesterday!! I'll be back to see her in two weeks!!!

21.description: I find that businesses who insist on telling you why they're better than everyone else do so because they're not so sure you can figure it out yourself from the product and service.  No Chip Queen is the perfect example of that.Expect to hear about how this place is special, and how other nails salons are unsanitary and give horrible service.  Expect to hear this continuously for your entire manicure and pedicure.The manicure and pedicure I got was pretty great, and lasted through an entire vacation.  And I honestly enjoy a little bit of snobbishness when the business really is great,  but there were way too many problems with my experience to give it five stars in good conscience.1.  My appointment started half an hour late.  No apology was given  - in fact, she seemed annoyed that I came into the salon at the time of my appointment.  She brushed me aside and told me to pick out colors, and I waited while she finished up with her last customer.  She had even confirmed that morning and told me that my appointment would be lost if *I* showed up late.  I hate when businesses value their own time more than the customers.2.  She took phone calls during services.  Not emergency phone calls that were addressed quickly, but actual chit chat phonecalls she took her time with.  She did this even though my appointment started late, and I said I was getting my service for a vacation and  that my flight left later in the day. She took her time with everything.3.  The spa was freezing.  Felicia wore a heavy sweater, a jacket, and snow boots, but I of course had bare feet for my pedicure and while my polish dried.  I was uncomfortable for the entire time I was there, and my feet were freezing.  I'd imagine that if you're cold enough to wear boots and a jacket indoors, you might have the sensitivity to maybe put the heat up for people who have to have their feet bare for their service.  But there was nothing spa-like or comfortable about this experience.  As my service ended, I thought "screw it," and rushed to put on my socks and boots, and she tried to urge me to walk out in my flip flops and just turn on the heat in the car.  In December.  While it was snowing.4.  Too much nail product  got under my nails.  It's an uncomfortable feeling to have sticky product under your nails, and when I go home i had to scrape it off myself with the metal attachment on my nail clippers.Again, it was a great no chip manicure, and it lasted,  and Felicia was very thorough, so I'm giving the standard three star, above average A-OK rating.   But my experience here was not worth the price or the hype.  And mostly I just very much hate to feel like my time isn't valued.

17.description: After almost a year and a half I am still going to Felicia and loving it!I look forward to 'nail day'  not only for the nail refresh but also for the fun company. Felicia is the kind of person you just can't help but be friends with. She genuinely cares about her clients and takes her time with you! I'm so grateful to have found this place and look forward to booking my next appointment in the upcoming week.

10.description: I find that businesses who insist on telling you why they're better than everyone else do so because they're not so sure you can figure it out yourself from the product and service.  No Chip Queen is the perfect example of that.Expect to hear about how this place is special, and how other nails salons are unsanitary and give horrible service.  Expect to hear this continuously for your entire manicure and pedicure.The manicure and pedicure I got was pretty great, and lasted through an entire vacation.  And I honestly enjoy a little bit of snobbishness when the business really is great,  but there were way too many problems with my experience to give it five stars in good conscience.1.  My appointment started half an hour late.  No apology was given  - in fact, she seemed annoyed that I came into the salon at the time of my appointment.  She brushed me aside and told me to pick out colors, and I waited while she finished up with her last customer.  She had even confirmed that morning and told me that my appointment would be lost if *I* showed up late.  I hate when businesses value their own time more than the customers.2.  She took phone calls during services.  Not emergency phone calls that were addressed quickly, but actual chit chat phonecalls she took her time with.  She did this even though my appointment started late, and I said I was getting my service for a vacation and  that my flight left later in the day. She took her time with everything.3.  The spa was freezing.  Felicia wore a heavy sweater, a jacket, and snow boots, but I of course had bare feet for my pedicure and while my polish dried.  I was uncomfortable for the entire time I was there, and my feet were freezing.  I'd imagine that if you're cold enough to wear boots and a jacket indoors, you might have the sensitivity to maybe put the heat up for people who have to have their feet bare for their service.  But there was nothing spa-like or comfortable about this experience.  As my service ended, I thought "screw it," and rushed to put on my socks and boots, and she tried to urge me to walk out in my flip flops and just turn on the heat in the car.  In December.  While it was snowing.4.  Too much nail product  got under my nails.  It's an uncomfortable feeling to have sticky product under your nails, and when I go home i had to scrape it off myself with the metal attachment on my nail clippers.Again, it was a great no chip manicure, and it lasted,  and Felicia was very thorough, so I'm giving the standard three star, above average A-OK rating.   But my experience here was not worth the price or the hype.  And mostly I just very much hate to feel like my time isn't valued.

5.description: I've been to nail shops ALL OVER the city, and each and every no chip I received had peeled off by the 3rd day! It was so frustrating until I found felicia at no chip queen...she truly is "NO CHIP QUEEN"....she is a perfectionist! Her manicures are so detailed and she pays attention to each and every nail! The no-chip formula used NEVER peeled until it was due for the next mani! I am so happy to have found her and will be a life long client of hers!

3.description: I found this place through Yelp and have read the reviews. I decided to give this place a try yesterday evening. I have to say Felicia is awesome. She's a very nice person with great energy. She made me feel quite relaxed and happy. I'm also very satisfied with my No Chip Mani and Vinylux Pedi. The color I've chosen isn't a color I'd usually wear, but it's a very pretty shade. I plan to go back to her for occasions and my birthday.Thank you Felicia for great service and great nails ^_^

35.description: this place is awful, it took me 3 tries to get someone to call me back, when i finally got through, she could not get me and my daughter in for almost 3 weeks, if i did not have a you swoop i would never have come in, so she made our appts for the last day of the swoop. she never even called to confirm my appointment even though i made it so far in advance, i made an error on my calendar and put it down for monday, and she had sunday, she never called to confirm nor did she call when we did not show up, she got her money no mater what, poor business practice, and a bit of a scam artist if you ask me. just thopught you should know, and now she is having all her friends prank call me because knows who i am and what my phone # is be very careful with this non professional

19.description: Thank you Felicia for your wonderful customer service! Although I wasn't completely satisfied with my last service I really appreciate your willingness to correct the issue after reading my review. Bottom line, Felicia does fabulous no-chip manicures and unfortunately I caught her on a not-so-great day. I still highly recommend giving her a try.

28.description: Thank you Felicia for your wonderful customer service! Although I wasn't completely satisfied with my last service I really appreciate your willingness to correct the issue after reading my review. Bottom line, Felicia does fabulous no-chip manicures and unfortunately I caught her on a not-so-great day. I still highly recommend giving her a try.

45.description: The no chip queen is truly amazing.  She cares so much about her customers and is very knowledgeable about everything she does.  I am also impressed with her sanitation techniques.  She uses a disposable liner in the foot soaking tub and only uses items, such as nail files, that cannot be sanitized.  If you go here you will receive and excellent mani or pedi from a wonderful person who does a great job.  The prices are reasonable as well.  No such combination exists anywhere else in Chicago.

33.description: I have nothing but great things to say about the NO CHIP QUEEN - she is the best. I went here for my no chip manicure for my wedding and they still look perfect. I went to Jamaica so I was in the beach for ten days and they are still perfect. I can't believe what a great job she did. Some of the girls that went to my wedding had no chip manicures done at other salons within days they were chipping even the next day. I went on June 6 and today its the 20th and still perfect! I also got a pedicure and it was great, very sanitary and that is all that matters. She will be my new manicurist!

43.description: Fabulous nails from the fabulous lady who does them. First thing's first: the product. If you look it up on the Internet the Biosculpt products she uses are the best there can be: no acrylic, no junk, nothing that will turn your otherwise healthy nails into yellow dried stumps. Props on that- I love my nails and had them damaged by thoughtless technicians who hid the reality of the product they used from me before, so this is a welcome change. What I absolutely love is that she does not force you to wear the nails all year round and admits that your naturals have to breathe every now and then no matter how good the product is. Now that is honesty, and not being driven by profit at the expense of someone's health. Again, love that. She also does not file the surface of the nail before polish application and that is something I appreciate.Moving on: application takes some time but the result is as awesome and clean as possible. The color is perfectly even, you can't see any streaks (I've had this happen with a no-chip manicures at other places I've been to). Removal is also a painless process, as she puts solution-soaked pieces of cotton on your nails and wraps them up to melt the polish. No dipping your hands into acetone that's being heated from below. No dry fingers afterwards, no fumes, no headache. It may take a few minutes longer than an acetone bath, but I'd take this over the nightmare of a soak nail removal any day. The choice of colors is more than enough, and she's constantly adding new ones in. You can find a color to match any occasion (this was one of the issues with other places for me- they had maybe 10 colors, 5 of which were different shades of pink- how often do they expect me to wear the same color, I like to change it up every time I come in). So there, that's covered.The cost is as reasonable as it gets. It's actually less than any other place I've ever been to and it's twice as better here, so that's a win right there if I've ever seen one.Last but not least- the quality of the actual manicure. Adding to what I've already said about it being flawless and all, it really lasts. No peeling. None. None from the bottom, none from the sides (again, I've had this happen when I went elsewhere). I know it's supposed to last two weeks, but I can proudly show my nails to anyone at the end of week three and gloat about how awesome they are holding up all this time. If it wasn't for the grow-out, you wouldn't be able to tell.If you're going anywhere else to get your no chip manicure done, you might as well just go ahead and say it out loud: you don't care if your nails will hate you afterwards. Seriously, go visit Felicia- your nails will feel the love. P.S.I usually don't care much about what others write in their reviews but this one caught my eye. There is one clearly unhinged person, who left a review about the salon not calling her to confirm her appointment and ripping the cool nail lady a new one without ever seeing her face to face.Lady!It's not the dentist, and it's not a colonoscopy. I've had my nails done in a few different countries on two continents, and nobody, no matter how fancy the salon was, ever called me to confirm an appointment. Places wh9ch do nails and hair usually do not do that, because how hard is it to put down a date in your calendar? Dentists and doctors do that because they stand to lose hundreds or thousands from your missed visits, and nail artist and hairdressers usually do not. What you wrote is cray cray.

2.description: Felicia is the No Chip Queen indeed! I texted the number on yelp the day before Christmas eve to see if she had any openings that evening and she was gracious enough to take me in. She told me a lot about the product she was using and why it was better than the leading competitors and boy was she right! I'm almost a week in to my manicure and it looks awesome, no fading or peeling! I look forward to my next no chip mani!

18.description: I had my first no chip manicure done somewhere else. But after learning that if the wrong person removes your polish, that it would involve scraping, leaving your nail damaged and weak. So I decided to search for a nail tech that knows what she is doing. I found No Chip Queen through Yelp and trusted all the great reviews she had. She removed my polish gently with no damage to my nails. Whew!Felicia gave me a no chip manicure and pedicure right before I left for my vacation to Italy. It withstood 10 days of sandal wearing, non-stop walking on cobblestone roads and rocky trails, several stubbed toes, countless times of packing and unpacking, and rummaging through my bag every other minute to find and assemble my camera gear. In fact, it lasted 4 weeks (work got the best of me after my vacation and a part of me wanted to see how long this would really last). The nail polish looked as smooth and shiny as it did the first day it was applied. If it wasn't for nail growth, this manicure would have lasted quite a long time. I've gotten a regular mani+pedi from Felicia, too. She really is detail oriented. A perfectionist, even. My cuticles are neat, my nail bed is smooth, the shape is perfectly round, and the polish is shiny!Most importantly, she offers something no one else does - a very sanitary experience. Ever wonder how many times that pumice stone at your local nail salon has been used. Who it was used on before you? If it has ever been cleaned. Or if they ever clean the water jets in the foot bath? Doubt it. Felicia uses a new tub liner for each session. And uses a one time use foot scrubber. Nail files and nail buffers are all new and just for you.Felicia is a sweet girl. She is a one woman show and she runs a great business. I always look forward to seeing her!

41.description: Ladies - I can't rave enough about Felicia's work.  She is a QUALITY manicurist.  Not only was I amazed at the cleanliness of the place (she uses disposible liners in the foot tub, disposable files and buffers - and you even leave with the nail file, buffer, shoes and toe separators she uses on you).  I have NEVER seen that ANYWHERE.  More places should be doing this.  While she doesn't have the "jet" tub for your feet (which I didn't miss considering those things are a breeding ground for disease), she makes up for it with a comfortable massage chair AND the water is heated and the foot tub vibrates.  Felicia is a pleasure to talk to AND while this isn't a swanky salon, she provides a nice calming atmosphere in her pedicure room.  In addition, she pays attention to detail, and her hand and foot massages are the bomb.  I recommend this place to everyone looking for a great mani/pedi.  She has a regular customer out of me now!

52.description: I bought a gift certificate to your salon for my girlfriend.  She loved her manicure and pedicure.  Now I know what to buy the ladies in my family for Christmas.  Thanks for making her smile.  Steve S.

50.description: If you are looking for a high-frills salon, this is probably not the place for you.  However, if you're looking at a great, clean, fast no-chip manicure, GO HERE!!!  The location is easy to find and there is a lot of street parking on Milwaukee (no meters!).  Felicia is flexible with scheduling and I had no problem getting in to see her.  She explained the product she uses which is FDA-approved and all natural.  It doesn't have any acrylic like the OPI, shellac or gel no-chips.  She didn't file down the surface of my nails which I've heard they do for other no-chip treatments.  There is a great choice of colors available.  Manicure was great and four days later still looks like new.  As for the pedicure - AMAZING.  She really took the time to take care of my feet which hadn't had a pedicure since before the snow.  They were a disaster!!!!  I already scheduled my next appointment.  There is also a deal where after 5 no-chips, you get one free.  I am almost afraid to write a great review, because I don't want her to get totally booked and be hard to get into!!!  But seriously, look no further for your no-chip needs!

4.description: Great service.

6.description: I found Felicia through Yelp, and had to give her a try because of the great reviews. I used to get a no chip at a mall salon across the street from my work, but stopped after just 2 months because the way they scraped the polish off my nail was thinning it out!Felicia gently removes your polish using her own nail- and actually takes the time to soak it long enough. The product she uses is great, and so is the conversation. My favorite part... the salon is so quiet! Just me and her having a nice relaxing manicure. I can't wait to return!

22.description: The best non chip mani in Chicago.  I have tried many other places and they all start lifting after a week.  Felicia's mani's last almost 3 weeks and still look fabulous.  So glad to of found her.

15.description: Felicia is excellent.  I have been getting a no-chip pedicure for several years and this is the best experience I have ever had.  I say 'experience' because I not only received a great pedi, I was educated on a variety of mani/pedi spa services and equipment. She is very knowledgeable on all things mani/pedi related and I really appreciated her willingness to share the helpful tips and expertise she has honed throughout her career.Thanks, Felicia.

20.description: I have been getting mani/pedis with Felicia at NCQ religiously for months now, but simply have not had the time to write a review.  Upon reviewing Felicia's reviews, I was really upset to see the 3 star review Felicia was given by Sam K, certainly not deserved!  But instead of attempting to counteract every negative thing posted about Felicia, I will simply rave about her stellar services and let that speak for itself. First and foremost, I live in the South Loop and drive a good 20-30 minutes for Felicia's services.  Felicia ALWAYS makes an attempt to fit me into her schedule.  In fact, Felicia has taken me at late as 7:30-8:00ish before due to my hectic schedule.  That is just one example of how dedicated Felicia is to her work and her clients.Secondly, Felicia's work speaks for itself and she stands behind it.  That is hard to find these days and that is what I really appreciate about her services.  I have never felt rushed and that is definitely something I experienced frequently before finding NCQ.  Felicia takes her time and pays attention to the small details, that is why I always leave looking and feeling like a million bucks. Third, Felicia is the epitome of a professional.  She usually books her appointments via text which is nice because she isn't constantly interrupting my services to book clients.  Another thing I really appreciate is that Felicia goes above and beyond by making sure everything is sanitized and that her clients are comfortable.  I've never observed Felicia wearing a coat, and in fact, she has always checked in with me in regards to my comfort level of the temperature in the salon.  She has only explained her rationale behind using new buffers and files for each client and introduced the concept of the pedicure chair she uses at my first appointment.  After that, I never heard about why she does things the way she does, but I continue to observe her pull out a new liner for my pedicure every two weeks in addition to pull out a fresh file and buffer for my services.  While to some, this consideration may be overlooked, it is greatly appreciated by me.  I pride myself on having beautiful nails and toes and I am glad Felicia keeps me looking beautiful and healthy at the same time. Bottom line is Felicia is amazing at what she does.  You can tell she really loves to make people look and feel beautiful.  I always leave my appointment with beautiful hands and feet and a smile on my face.

36.description: I am soooo glad i found Felicia - amazing mani/pedi right in my 'hood! Thank you youswoop! My 1st visit was using the deal - I upgraded to the no-chip mani and regular pedi, and I'm sure glad i did! I've had at least 10 no-chips so far at different salons (with and without a deal) but NEVER have I seen the no-chip color selection like Felicia's! WOW, there must've been a 100 of colors, i felt like i was at the Home Depot paint department. And guess what - she always has new colors! Back to my appt - pedi was perfect - the tub liner, nail files and all other tools are disposable, no more funky things swimming with your pretty toes! Oh, make sure you turn that massage chair on - it did great things to my sore body. Mani was just as fabulous. Total appointment time as about 2 hours so please plan accordingly. My nails looked great for 2 weeks, and if it wasnt for a previously scheduled appointment, I'm sure I could've worn my no-chip for 3 weeks. My second visit was for a no-chip mani, I got the beautiful and new yellow. The appointment was just as fab and fun as the 1st one. I will definitely be back

14.description: The one thing in life I was still a virgin at....no-chip mani....jk :)Alas, I got some recommendations from yelpers on a thread and good old Bella E. suggested this place.  Me and two friends make the trek up here from downtown on a Wednesday to see Felicia.  Its easy to find and a quick ride on the expressway.  Bonus to free street parking!The salon is no frills, which is fine with me.  Felicia was there and super nice.  She did a fantastic job explaining the product, etc.  However, I know nothing about no chip manicures so she could have been selling me a used car for all I know.It looked perfect after she was done and two weeks later it was next to perfect.  After the second week, the sides started bubbling a little, but you couldnt really tell.  It was great!  It was weird having the polish on that long where my nails were growing out...haha.  There are an array of colors to chose from.  Felicia herself is totally nice, hilarious girl!  Easy to talk to, but not fake....like you know when you go to a new stylist and they talk your ear off and you dont really care....this was NOT like that.  It was perfect conversation...not too much, not too littlePlus, we got authentic Serbian coffee from the cute boys next door that made me cracked out on caffeine.  First time is $25, I dont know how much it is after that.  Like I said, its a bit of a drive, however, honestly its like 10 mins in the car, free parking, cheap and great quality!  I am glad I went to Felicia to pop my no chip cherry :)

58.description: Came in with a girlfriend for burgers and had the most amazing experience. Everyone was so incredible and the food was way too good. We ordered our burgers, obviously, and then desert. The bun was fantastic and light but tasty. The two patties were incredible and the cheese with care liked onions was perfect. They added some sauce to the bun that just made it.  Everything they were offering sounded so incredible for desert, but we chose the French Silk Pie. Amazing. So lite and delicious and the crest was perfect. Yes.

56.description: (few months delayed, but I drove by it last night and remember what an unfortunate place it was) To be fair, it's cute on the inside but that's about as good as it gets. We met friends here for drinks after a movie and it was not worth it. While we waited for our friends, we kept looking around to order drinks and when I stopped a waitress she said I'm not your server. Fair enough, but usually you could take our order or grab our waiter for us. Eventually, we were met by our actual waiter and drinks were ordered.  My boyfriend said it was one of the worst old fashions that he has had. I had something with vodka and I am easy on drinks so didn't care that much. No one else was ordering food, but I was because I was starving. I went for the beet salad and it was SO bland and then I ordered the gnocchi for my main and it literally had 4 pieces of gnocchi and the rest was potatoes. such a bummer! I can order gnocchi dishes at any Italian  restaurant for 14 dollars and it's a full plate and this was such a "try-hard" dish. Overall, this place needs to revisit their service and overhaul their menu if they want to survive. They can't be getting a lot of foot traffic based on their location, they need to create a reason to go there.

29.description: We stumbled across knife and tine on Opentable, we needed a brunch reservation for New Years Day, unfortunately we waited until NYE to find a reservation. K&T had one available so we figured we give it a shot. We were very pleasantly surprised. The food was excellent, all four of us enjoyed each item we tried. Service and decor were great as well. I'll definitely be back if I find myself in the area again.

42.description: I wanted to come back as I was eating my first meal here. The beer can chicken was so moist, the fjord sea trout was tasty and the skin was nicely crisp. The fried chicken on the other table loooooooked soooooo good that I wish we had ordered one to share! The service was very attentive. The only thing lacking is the dessert. The cookie and milkshakes we ordered looked good, but i felt like they forgot to add sugar to the dessert...

23.description: My wife was dying to try this place, and looking at the yelp photos made it look so appetizing. I have to agree with some of the other yelpers who said it tasted pretty basic and nothing mind blowing. We ordered a bit of everything from each section of the menu. I can truly say,the devil eggs is not worth your time. BUT the CRAB CAKES on the other hand was a great pallet cleanser, nice flavors and great balance of citrus and herbs. We ordered a burger which was quite good. Overall ambience was good, service was nice. But food wisr, definitely nothing that will have you craving to comeback....but than again there menu does change frequently.

47.description: Stopped in around 6 p.m. on the Wed. before Thanksgiving. It was pretty empty, probably because of the upcoming holiday. We were greeted right away, helped right away, but the place felt forgotten. We had several questions about the menu that were answered with the information already presented on the menu. I would have liked more explanation and understanding about the dishes we wanted to order. I was also sad about the lack of vegetarian options and chance to remove the meat from some of the dishes.  The lack of elimination of ingredients and substitutions disappointed me. For example, we really wanted to try the Deviled Eggs, but they cannot make them without the bacon. The items we did order were pretty good, which is why I give three stars. I think they could up their game a bit. So only A-OK.For stars we shared the Shishito Peppers. Everyone loved them with the fondue dipping sauce. You get a large portion as well. We also had the Brussels Sprouts (sans the chorizo). Not my favorite preparation but others at the table thought they were pretty good. The preparation was not as crispy or firm for my liking. The seasoning was a bit bland. Maybe the chorizo adds he missing element, and we missed out.  Two people ordered the soup of the day, lobster bisque and raved about it! We also had the Basil, Beets and Buratta. I only had the Buratta but the basil past drizzled on top was a nice touch.  For mains around the table we ordered the trout special with the raviolo. It was a very large plate and great presentation.  You received one large raviolo with a soft cooked egg in the middle with the fish next to it. We had the crab cakes as a main, but I was told they were not that great. I had the Chicken and Dumplings. It sounded so fun and warm and hearty for the holidays. Maybe my hopes were set too high, but it was bland. The chicken was most from the broth and you get four-five neatly made dumplings. I just missed the salt or seasoning or something to make all the ingredients come together. On a side note, the butter that they serve with the bread is outstanding. We had two different kinds over the course of our meal. I think the flavor changes constantly so I won't excite you with the kinds that we had.

8.description: I've been into Knife and Tine a few times to sit at the bar. They have a nice selection of craft beers and cocktails, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the food is delicious. I had the skirt steak last time I was in and loved it. I cant wait to go back soon and try the crab cakes! Great addition to the neighborhood

31.description: Food is delicious, service was great and the atmosphere is cool. I can't wait to come back here. We went for dinner and it beat my expectations. Favorites were the popcorn and shishito peppers. Definitely worth trying!

34.description: Came here for a ladies brunch in the past & really enjoyed it! Just had dinner and LOVED it! Flavored, service, and great value for the quality this place is a solid 5! We used to frequent the former restaurant in this spot, Sprout and were bummed when it closed but we are so pleased w what it is now! Ok so the food.  Snacks: popcorn & deviled eggs (2 pc in an order).  They were both good. The eggs were so exceptionally good that the hubs ordered a 2nd round! We shared the mussels.  Good portion & nice light flavor. Then we both ordered the specials.  He had the pork belly & I had the grouper.  Again, loved the flavor profile....we cleared our plates.  They were good portions but not large.  We can't wait to return as we really enjoyed every element of our experience!!!

16.description: I wanted to come back as I was eating my first meal here. The beer can chicken was so moist, the fjord sea trout was tasty and the skin was nicely crisp. The fried chicken on the other table loooooooked soooooo good that I wish we had ordered one to share! The service was very attentive. The only thing lacking is the dessert. The cookie and milkshakes we ordered looked good, but i felt like they forgot to add sugar to the dessert...

13.description: Stopped in around 6 p.m. on the Wed. before Thanksgiving. It was pretty empty, probably because of the upcoming holiday. We were greeted right away, helped right away, but the place felt forgotten. We had several questions about the menu that were answered with the information already presented on the menu. I would have liked more explanation and understanding about the dishes we wanted to order. I was also sad about the lack of vegetarian options and chance to remove the meat from some of the dishes.  The lack of elimination of ingredients and substitutions disappointed me. For example, we really wanted to try the Deviled Eggs, but they cannot make them without the bacon. The items we did order were pretty good, which is why I give three stars. I think they could up their game a bit. So only A-OK.For stars we shared the Shishito Peppers. Everyone loved them with the fondue dipping sauce. You get a large portion as well. We also had the Brussels Sprouts (sans the chorizo). Not my favorite preparation but others at the table thought they were pretty good. The preparation was not as crispy or firm for my liking. The seasoning was a bit bland. Maybe the chorizo adds he missing element, and we missed out.  Two people ordered the soup of the day, lobster bisque and raved about it! We also had the Basil, Beets and Buratta. I only had the Buratta but the basil past drizzled on top was a nice touch.  For mains around the table we ordered the trout special with the raviolo. It was a very large plate and great presentation.  You received one large raviolo with a soft cooked egg in the middle with the fish next to it. We had the crab cakes as a main, but I was told they were not that great. I had the Chicken and Dumplings. It sounded so fun and warm and hearty for the holidays. Maybe my hopes were set too high, but it was bland. The chicken was most from the broth and you get four-five neatly made dumplings. I just missed the salt or seasoning or something to make all the ingredients come together. On a side note, the butter that they serve with the bread is outstanding. We had two different kinds over the course of our meal. I think the flavor changes constantly so I won't excite you with the kinds that we had.

11.description: I'm not a fan of reservations because I never know what type of food I might want days or weeks in advance.  So - during the holidays, we love trying more popular places because we can usually get in w/o much notice.  This past Saturday night was no exception at Knife and Tine.We sat in the Atrium - which is absolutely beautiful.  I highly recommend sitting there each time - high ceilings and brick facade.  It was just a very relaxing atmosphere with good background music playing.Food-wise - we started with the shishito peppers.  The Gorgonzola maple fondue that accompanies the peppers was really good, and I liked the peppers.Since we opted not to have dessert in the beginning of the meal, we ordered the always filling shrimp and grits and honey butter fried chicken w/ biscuits.  The shrimp was overcooked, but the hush puppies and grits were the shining stars.  Both excellent - but very filling.The chicken was nicely cooked and juicy, and while the biscuits were average, they came with a pesto aioli sauce that was a star hit.  We could have kept eating the biscuits if we had more of that sauce.As I said, we ordered the big meals, so we had no room for dessert - but next time b/c several of them sounded good - something about pralines and butterscotch...!For drinks - we ordered two cocktails.  Neither were my favorite (one was like a margarita and the other was the peach drink).  I would stick with wine next time.Our waitress was really friendly and helpful on suggestions on the menu.  She always checked on us to see if we wanted anything else - which is much appreciated.While there were a few dislikes on items we ordered, Knife and Tine is a place we would try again as there were more hits than misses.

39.description: Our group tried the Shishito Peppers, Tenderloin Skewers, Mussels from the starters and Pork Belly, Honey Butter Fried Chicken, Shrimp & Grits, Cioppino, Seared Trout Brussel Salad, and Vegetable Gumbo from mains. The Knife & Tine has flavors for every palate, from creamy shrimp & grits with large shrimp and hushpuppies to the brussel salad or vegetable gumbo. If your partner is looking for 'just' a burger, the burger is excellent as well, according to some in our group who had been at the Knife & Tine before.There is a Sunday brunch that is very popular as well.The Knife & Tine is part of the renaissance of Southern Flavor sweeping through New American dining. Back home in Minneapolis, we have restaurants like Smack Shack and Freehouse that incorporate southern charm in their cooking. I try to bring some of this flavor into my own cooking, which is vegetarian, with collard greens with curry, eggs with hot sauce, etc. I was very impressed with the Knife & Tine's take on New American, inventing new flavors I had not experienced back in Minneapolis.We had a group of 8, and the Knife & Tine is perfect for large groups. While we were there, there was a group of 40 in a dining area in the front that can be separated from the main restaurant by glass and wood patio doors. There is also a private dining room in the back that can seat around 10. We were in the main dining area where the bar is.The Knife & Tine is great for conversation. There are very high, maybe 15 ft, and dining rooms are divided with wood and glass. Our large group could carry on conversations without raising voices. The music has a modern beat that adds to the energy of the experience without drowning out conversation.

37.description: I'm not a fan of reservations because I never know what type of food I might want days or weeks in advance.  So - during the holidays, we love trying more popular places because we can usually get in w/o much notice.  This past Saturday night was no exception at Knife and Tine.We sat in the Atrium - which is absolutely beautiful.  I highly recommend sitting there each time - high ceilings and brick facade.  It was just a very relaxing atmosphere with good background music playing.Food-wise - we started with the shishito peppers.  The Gorgonzola maple fondue that accompanies the peppers was really good, and I liked the peppers.Since we opted not to have dessert in the beginning of the meal, we ordered the always filling shrimp and grits and honey butter fried chicken w/ biscuits.  The shrimp was overcooked, but the hush puppies and grits were the shining stars.  Both excellent - but very filling.The chicken was nicely cooked and juicy, and while the biscuits were average, they came with a pesto aioli sauce that was a star hit.  We could have kept eating the biscuits if we had more of that sauce.As I said, we ordered the big meals, so we had no room for dessert - but next time b/c several of them sounded good - something about pralines and butterscotch...!For drinks - we ordered two cocktails.  Neither were my favorite (one was like a margarita and the other was the peach drink).  I would stick with wine next time.Our waitress was really friendly and helpful on suggestions on the menu.  She always checked on us to see if we wanted anything else - which is much appreciated.While there were a few dislikes on items we ordered, Knife and Tine is a place we would try again as there were more hits than misses.

0.description: Dined here for brunch with my girlfriend during restaurant week.  We hadn't realized it was restaurant week so we failed to make a reservation but were able to be seated at the bar.  The bar tender was actually one of the restaurants owners which made for a really great experience.  He and all the staff were super friendly and gave really great food recommendations.  The restaurant week brunch special was $22 for a drink, entree and side.  Due to the recommendation I went with the shrimp and grits with two poached eggs.  I was afraid that the plate would be over run with overly torch grits but the dish was perfectly sized and balanced.  The shrimp were fresh and delicious.I must say though that my favorite part of the meal was the Bloody Mary.  I have never had a bloody like that.  It is slightly darker then you would anticipate.  This is because it is made with Guinness which made me skeptical at first but this thing was great.  Perfectly mixed with a dash of celery salt and pepper served Ina glass with a lemon, lime, and pickle.    This place really prides itself on doing everything the right way.  While eating I saw the bar tender remake a few drinks before serving them because they were to his standard.  This is a mark of a well run restaurant. I highly recommend this place.

38.description: Butternut Squash Suffle is to die for!  Great place with a lovely atmosphere and excellent service. Perfect for a date!

51.description: Came here for brunch. Not too bad. Not my favorite brunch place in the area, but was decent. The service was pretty bad and the food was good but definitely nothing special. I'm kind of surprised that it has 5 stars on yelp--definitely a stretch. Maybe it's better for lunch/dinner? Also, it's pretty expensive. The best part were the homemade donut holes.

27.description: Finally got around to getting into Knife and Tine for lunch.  I was in the neighborhood, which by the way is very easy to get to being one mile off the highway, and had a few minutes for lunch.  As I was browsing the menu, I noticed one thing and one thing only.  THE BURGER!  It was delicious.  Perfectly cooked just the way I like it!  Also, the fries were crispy and fresh.  I know what you are thinking......"It's easy to make burgers".  I've had quite a few burgers in my days and I have to say that it's art to make a REALLY GREAT burger.  Kudos to Knife and Tine once again.  Definitely a Top 10 Restaurant in Chicago.

32.description: The atmosphere is awesome very relaxing and the atrium is a cute little spot for more light and an outdoor feel. The food was amazing. My roommate and I both got burgers and they were very good. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because our server was a little too pushy with recommending the most expensive bottles of wine and entrees on the menu.

54.description: Knife and Tine is refreshing, intimate and exactly what a gastro pub should be. The food is flavorful, comforting and made with pride. The staff was attentive and appreciative of our patronage, which is sadly lacking in so many "hot and new" establishments in Chicago. I really don't care how great your burger is if you're going to be a complete dick when you serve it to me.  Hannah was our server/bartender, and not only was she knowledgeable about the menu, she was very knowledgeable about the local beers, wines and spirits that they proudly promote and sell. I am in sales, and I eat out 6 days a week. This simple formula of great food and service is so hard to capture. All of the right components need to be in play, and it's not as easy as you think. Knife and Tine have it all right now.Here's the skinny..Apps.. The roasted mussels were amazing. We were just getting started. Hannah had mentioned chicken liver as an ingredient in a few of the dishes. We asked if the chef could give us some with some toast points as an appetizer. Not only was our wish granted, but the chef served it with some homemade chips and bacon jam he whipped up. Well done sir. It was amazing!Lunch... I had their cheeseburger. In this town you'd better be serious about putting together a burger, and Knife and Tine did not disappoint. This is not a "burger joint", but their's was no slouch. No point in getting into details. It was a delicious burger that could get in the ring with Kumas or Owen and Engine, etc...Much to our surprise, after our meal, Hannah came walking out with a pumpkin, blonde brownie with a carmel apple sauce, as a thank you for our business!! None of this seemed out of the ordinary for Knife and Tine. What a great day spent meeting new friends and enjoying a great meal.Hannah encouraged us to come back and see her.. I'm certain we will.

48.description: My wife and I were walking down Fullerton ave. looking for a place to have lunch when we happened upon Knife & Tine. It was about 11:30 the day before Thanksgiving so the restaurant as you would expect was empty. We were seated at waited on by one of the partners Mike.We were in no hurry so with the help of Mike we worked our way through the menu. We began with the crab cakes which set the tone for our lunch. The crab cakes were light and the seasoning was perfect. Next we tried the Beet and Burrata appetizer. Again we were impressed not just with the food but also the presentation. The next dish that we shared was the Shrimp and Grits. This was not my grandfather's grits. The white grits were very creamy more resembling a risotto. The Shrimp and Grits  had just the right combination of seasonings to make this simply delicious! We finished with the apple pie that was accompanied with whipped cream, caramel sauce and a cream cheese butter. All I can say is wow!We did not have any drinks although the list of wines, cocktails and beer had a nice variety.My wife and I will definitely come back and we will bring our friends with us. Our total bill including tax and tip came to $65.

44.description: Knife and Tine is such a wonderful restaurant regarding both its food and its service. I hosted my sister's bridal shower there. They had a private room that was big enough for 20-30 people. It was just the right amount of space, and we were able to play games in there too. Everything we ordered was delicious and came right on time. We were all pleasantly stuffed by the end of brunch. The staff was so kind and accommodating. They helped us carry in decorations at the beginning of our set up. They constantly checked in on us making sure we had everything we needed. They were very attentive to our guests throughout the meal. And they even helped us carry all our gifts and decorations to our car at the end of the event. I have never been to a restaurant with such excellent service to customers. I definitely recommend this place for private parties and just for an overall great dining experience!

24.description: Good food, but nothing too special. One of the more over priced restaurants I've been to in Chicago. Probably wouldn't go back again. Staff were nice though and a good date atmosphere.

7.description: Came here for a ladies brunch in the past & really enjoyed it! Just had dinner and LOVED it! Flavored, service, and great value for the quality this place is a solid 5! We used to frequent the former restaurant in this spot, Sprout and were bummed when it closed but we are so pleased w what it is now! Ok so the food.  Snacks: popcorn & deviled eggs (2 pc in an order).  They were both good. The eggs were so exceptionally good that the hubs ordered a 2nd round! We shared the mussels.  Good portion & nice light flavor. Then we both ordered the specials.  He had the pork belly & I had the grouper.  Again, loved the flavor profile....we cleared our plates.  They were good portions but not large.  We can't wait to return as we really enjoyed every element of our experience!!!

49.description: This place is super overrated. It was expensive and the food wasn't all that great. For the price, the portions aren't that large either. The only reason I didn't give it one star was because of the service, but the attentiveness soon got annoying. Overall, it was just okay and really expensive.

40.description: We had a great dinner here a few weeks ago! The ambiance in the restaurant is wonderful. Service was wonderful from the moment we were seated to when we left. We started with spoon bread which was great! I got the shrimp & grits and my husband the short ribs. Both were equally delicious! Our third guest had the mac&cheese as a side...yum! Typically not a fan but this one was tasty. A great find in the neighborhood and we will definitely be back!

53.description: My wife, daughter-in-law and I dined at K&T Sunday evening for the 1st time. My wife had a burger while my daughter-in-law and myself both opted for the salmon. Appetizers were the carpaccio of beef and the deviled eggs. All selections were prepared and served to perfection; the salmon was presented on a bed of risotto and had a wonderful firm texture and a subtle smokiness that left me wanting more!A special dessert was available Sunday; a warm apple pie with a delectable buttery crust. The pie was perfection; neither too sweet nor tart...overall, a 5 star dinner for us served in a very attractive contemporary setting. (Note the unique chandeliers in the dining room....).Suffice to say K&T was a most pleasant experience for us.....

30.description: Our favorite neighborhood brunch spot of late.  We've been a few times now and we have been impressed with the high quality and attention to detail of their dishes.  Notable dishes:  cinnamon roll pancakes and cheesy grits.  I'm craving it as I type this!  On top of that, we always get friendly and warm service.  Can't wait to go back soon.  Cheers Knife & Tine and keep up the great work!

46.description: We have had brunch here a couple times and love their beer menu and brunch items. The shrimp and grits I had were phenomenal.

1.description: Overall reason for the rating was the food. It was just meh. The service and the ambiance were nice but the reason one goes to a restaurant is for good food, especially if it is a bit pricier. Mac and cheese: the pretzel that came on top was super salty and very dry. The Mac and cheese part was very good. Fried chicken: again, the chicken part was good, but the biscuits were dry. Brussels salad: the chicken that came on the side of the salad was rubbery.In summary, the food that was "good" was nothing super special and definitely not worth the price. The stuff that was bad, was really bad.Most likely will not return. Take your money to one of the many better restaurants in the city.

55.description: My boyfriend and I have been wanting to come here since we moved into the neighborhood. I liked this place, it's a nice change from all the sports bars in the area. We'd give it. 3.5!Service: was really good! Our server, the server assistants, and the manager or hostess (not sure what her role was) were nice and attentive.Food: it's pretty good. I wasn't blown away, but I was pretty happy. We had the cheese plate for an appetizer, three types of cheese, all very good with pumpernickel bread, which I felt overpowered the cheese. For dinner I got the shrimp and grits. The dish was very flavorful, and creamy. My boyfriend got the short ribs, the portion was pretty small but the taste was really good, and the broccoli was over cooked, the parsnips were burnt on one side. Beverage menu was pretty good, nothing spectacular but not bad. He had a beer, and I had the blanc de blanc. Ambiance: loved the decor. It's very nice, swanky, dark, and intimate. The only con is it gets so incredibly loud in there. It got hard to hear each other once the place filled up.

9.description: This is my second time dining here and I enjoyed my meal. Last time I had the pulled pork and grits and it was good but too much pork and not enough grits and the fish special (their version of fish and chips) was tasty. The pies are a must!

26.description: Great service and ambiance. The servers could not be any nicer or helpful.  The food was great from start to finish. Started with shishito peppers , a Basil ,Beets and Burrata cheese salad. Both where wonderful and highly recommended. For our main courses,our  table had the Honey butter fried chicken , Bone in Pork Chop and the Shrimp and grits.All got rave reviews . We finished with mini eclairs with three different dipping sauces ( the eclairs need some redoing) and a apple dumpling with a citrus sauce which was quite good. Nice cocktail menu .Will definitely be back

25.description: Brunch was a hit!  The coffee was spot on - not bitter, nice and hot.  Hubby had pork shoulder benedict - it was to die for, seriously, the giardiniera hollandaise & tender pork was melt-in-your-mouth.  I had the K&T hash - I don't know how they prepared the brussel sprouts but just the fragrance coming off the dish was amazing.

12.description: Opted for this brunch place after seeing glorious pictures of the burgers. When my boyfriend and I arrived, the restaurant was packed and the hostess informed us they were completely booked. Although another couple was about the be seated at the bar, she hunted for some extra stools and quickly squeezed us in without a reservation. Despite my better judgement, my boyfriend and I skipped the burger in favor of shrimp and grits. This dish was surprisingly incredible. It wasn't the overly rich and heavy meal your thinking of. It was flavorful, balanced and truly delicious. We also ordered the cinnamon roll pancakes. Expectedly rich, but so tasty and worth every sweet cinnamony bite. The bartender/owner was our server at the bar. He mixed a spicy Bloody Mary with an original twist. He was a super nice guy who genuinely enjoys his job and interacting with customers. We even got a special taste of their seasonal mimosa with a cactus juice. I highly recommend this place if you are looking to branch out and find a delicious brunch place without a 2 hour wait or a line out the door. You won't be disappointed.

59.description: What a lovely find. We sat in the front room and although it was loud, not a soft surface anywhere, it was vey nice. The cheese plate was wonderful. We had the filet & roasted potatoes which was right up there with any steak house! Hannah, our waitress, was extremely upbeat & attentive as were the food runners & hostess. A great dinner restaurant for any occasion!

21.description: We decided to try this place out for Chicago Restaurant Week. The Restaurant Week menu was a joke as you actually end up paying more by selecting from the menu versus ordering a la carte. Needless to say, we didn't order from the Restaurant Week menu. Our reservation was on the early side so we were shocked that it took over 15 minutes to get our drinks. Not sure if the bartender was in training, but by the time we got our drinks they were half empty from what seemed like the entire staff taste-testing the drinks. The cocktails themselves were sub-par at best. I switched to wine after one drink, figuring they couldn't mess that up. The wine was the best part of my meal (but for the price of a glass of wine, they could be a little more generous with the pour). Onto the food. It was HORRIBLE!  All of it. Lobster bisque was okay, but no actual lobster. I ordered the beer can chicken with dumplings and my friends both got the fried chicken. All AWFUL. I ate the dumplings because I would still have to pay for the meal. The broth of the entree was one of the most horrible things I've ever tasted. My friends ate few bites of the fried chicken and were done. KFC has better fried chicken and at a fraction of the price.  My husband is a Caesar salad fanatic and was highly disappointed in the bland salad. We also ordered the Mac and cheese - how can Mac and cheese not be delicious?! They even messed this up. It was spaghetti noodles with a sauce that tasted like nothing I ever want to experience again. When my husband doesn't scarf down Mac and cheese, you know it's very bad. By the end of the meal, we didn't even want to try dessert and wanted out as soon as possible. We went next door and contemplated ordering pizza. My friends who ordered the chicken had stomach aches and were ready to call it s night. Needless to say we will never return. This was the worst meal we've ever had in Chicago.

17.description: I seriously wish burger binge week could be every week. Knife & Tine showed up strong to the elite opening event bringing their delicious burgers and those fine homemade pickles--so strong that I decided to visit them for a second go-around. Since it was my first time here, I was surprised just at how nice the restaurant is. There's large atrium style seating with great natural lighting and stone brick walls. It seems like a great spot to take a date (there were a lot of couples here). My group cut right to the chase and we all ordered the K&T burger. Just like at the elite event, the burgers were fantastic. You get two medium cooked patties, awesome sauce, and white cheddar on a soft yet sturdy bun. I think it's the first time I've been to a "nicer" restaurant and been served a double cheeseburger. It was unique, and the proportions of meat, topping, and bun were spot on. Along with the burger came a sizable portion of fries that were fresh and well seasoned.Nothing but good things to say about K&T. Our server was a nice guy, although I couldn't tell if he hated us or not since there was something a little off about his demeanor. I'm always self conscious that a waiter is judging me for using a deal, and rightfully so since people have probably been giving terrible tips all week long. But other than that K&T is a great spot and I hope to be back again!

10.description: My wife and I sat at the bar duringRestaurant week and were so surprised at the attitude and energy of the staff. We had 4-5 different workers chatting with us about food selections, beer choices, cocktails, etc.  That all well and good, but all the above must be great...and it was. The cocktails were tasty and the food recos exceptional.  Thanks K&T as we had a very nice experience at your place. Can't wait to come back!

5.description: I had this bookmarked for a while so I had some high hopes. Though they had a restaurant week menu, it didn't seem like a deal compared to the a la carte.The meal and service was slightly lackluster. the food and drinks were slow to arrive. the drinks were not memorable. when the food finally arrived, my BF's steak was cold. Within a minute, the couple sitting next to us mentioned their steak order was cold too. Long story short, the restaurant did replace the steaks. while we were waiting for fresh steaks, we shared my ciopinno (see below) and mostly finished it. we weren't too hungry for the steak but waited anyway. the good:-Lobster bisque - I usually think lobster bisque is overrated but their bisque is different...it has coconut or spice or something that made it addictive. - Ciopinno had a good flavor with a spice kick. I was just thrown off by the sun chokes.....I though the dish had raw potato as it was super crunchy. I tried to tell the waiter who corrected me that it was sunchokes. - service was friendly and checked in on us. I think they knew we were waiting for our order. Bad:- Skirt steak was cold when it finally arrived. the 2nd batch was fine but it wasn't anything to write home about. the homemade tator was cool though. - beets and burrata - fairly disappointed. the beets were thin slivers and looked like carpaccio with an arugula salad and less than substantial amount of burrata. not worth it.   - food was slow to arrive

3.description: We absolutely loved knife and tine. The atmosphere was great, the food was good and the portions reasonable. They also have great mimosa's. The only reason I can't give them 5 stars: we made a reservation, showed up on time, but then ended up waiting about 30 minutes to be seated. And then were seated only because a young man, whom I assume to have been a manager, instructed the hostess to seat us asap. He also gave us a round of drinks for the inconvenience, so #win.All in all we generally loved the place and will definitely be back!

35.description: great date night spot. foods great but not worth the price tag. great ambience though.

19.description: I'm so glad that i found a new great spot that i just discovered recently! the restaurant is sporting a great and fun atmosphere! so far , I only tried their Apple and Vanilla Bean Bourbon and it was fantastic! I will definitely return again and try their other stuffs on the menu.

28.description: So I'm not sure what happened to this place.  It used to be great, but when we went on a recent Thursday,  things were really bad.  The lobster bisque seemed watered down. The salad was old and had no dressing.  The worst part, the burger was overcooked and over salted, almost like the meat was going bad. The drinks were good though.

45.description: Stopped by knife and tine based on a recommendation for their burger, which was great, but when I saw the menu I had to try it all! I've been back many times since because it has great atmosphere and they really treat you like family! Can't get enough of their deviled eggs!

33.description: Great food. We had deviled egg appetizer, pop corn appetizer. I had the fried chicken entree it was delicious. Good drink menu overall good experience

43.description: My sister and I just went for a Dickens inspired dinner with drink pairings. We loved every course and I plan on going back to try the regular menu.

2.description: My boyfriend and I came here for a date night, and we had a lovely experience. Upon arriving we were warmly greeted and sat at a very nice table. I was a little taken back with how fancy and classy the restaurant is for being on the Fullerton strip. Our waitress was friendly and knowledgable; she answered all of our questions about the menu and gave us plenty of suggestions. I was very happy with the drink selections, specifically the draft beer options. I had an Allagash White, and Revolution's A Little Crazy. Both tasty and fresh! For an appetizer, we ordered the dates, and they were SO good!!Our dinner was delicious! I ordered their famous burger, which was fantastic. The awesome sauce was so tasty and really elevated the burger. My boyfriend ordered the fried chicken, which was good but not amazing. I did like the biscuits that came with the chicken though! We ordered the brussel sprouts side, which was pretty good but again just okay, I thought they were a tad overcooked. I wish we had gone with the mac and cheese special instead. Overall I had a wonderful experience. I enjoyed the ambiance and the fantastic service. I was impressed that the manager came over to ask us how we were doing; very classy! I would suggest that they take out those terrible blue lights on the back bar wall, it kinda throws the whole vibe off and just looks tacky.  I will be returning! I really want to check out their brunch menu.

18.description: Our group tried the Shishito Peppers, Tenderloin Skewers, Mussels from the starters and Pork Belly, Honey Butter Fried Chicken, Shrimp & Grits, Cioppino, Seared Trout Brussel Salad, and Vegetable Gumbo from mains. The Knife & Tine has flavors for every palate, from creamy shrimp & grits with large shrimp and hushpuppies to the brussel salad or vegetable gumbo. If your partner is looking for 'just' a burger, the burger is excellent as well, according to some in our group who had been at the Knife & Tine before.There is a Sunday brunch that is very popular as well.The Knife & Tine is part of the renaissance of Southern Flavor sweeping through New American dining. Back home in Minneapolis, we have restaurants like Smack Shack and Freehouse that incorporate southern charm in their cooking. I try to bring some of this flavor into my own cooking, which is vegetarian, with collard greens with curry, eggs with hot sauce, etc. I was very impressed with the Knife & Tine's take on New American, inventing new flavors I had not experienced back in Minneapolis.We had a group of 8, and the Knife & Tine is perfect for large groups. While we were there, there was a group of 40 in a dining area in the front that can be separated from the main restaurant by glass and wood patio doors. There is also a private dining room in the back that can seat around 10. We were in the main dining area where the bar is.The Knife & Tine is great for conversation. There are very high, maybe 15 ft, and dining rooms are divided with wood and glass. Our large group could carry on conversations without raising voices. The music has a modern beat that adds to the energy of the experience without drowning out conversation.

41.description: Delightful!Lovely ambiance.Attentive yet thoughtful service.Delicious food.Great wine/cocktail list.I didn't order the burger but wished I had. FYI...What more could you want out of a spot for a lovely night out with mom and grandma?

52.description: Dined last night here before heading to the DePaul theater center. A super intriguing menu and delicious food. The cocktails were a fascinating combination of favors--unique without being purposefully weird. The Mac and cheese was to die for! Joseph had the chicken and dumplings and I had the pork shop: the bed of farro was superb and the pork chop was quite delicious. I would go back in a heartbeat! Great service and fun ambience. My favorite eating experience this fall!

50.description: Phenomenal food and amazing service! Top notch!We celebrated my son's 6th birthday here and I could not have asked for a more perfect brunch! From the moment we walked into the door, the service we received was top notch! My son was looking forward to hot chocolate but it wasn't on the menu. Seeing my son a little bit bummed, our server Hannah went out of her way to get hot chocolate from a local spot near the restaurant. If you can, you have to ask for Hannah as your server ... she was amazing! I can't describe in words how delicious our brunch was. One order of the pancakes was enough to feed three kiddos! I could go on and on! Let's just say that we will definitely be going back!

4.description: I had my boyfriends surprise birthday dinner here with about 10 people. The staff was extremely nice and helpful from the beginning and it made me excited to finally try out this place. Our group was placed in a private room in the back with its own doors. Made us feel like we had the place to ourselves. The food was really good and they have a good selection of beers and cocktails. At the end of our dinner they brought out the birthday boy chocolate chip cookies with a candle inside a dessert shooter. Nice touch! Everyone enjoyed themselves and we will definitely be back!

6.description: Delightful!Lovely ambiance.Attentive yet thoughtful service.Delicious food.Great wine/cocktail list.I didn't order the burger but wished I had. FYI...What more could you want out of a spot for a lovely night out with mom and grandma?

22.description: The cocktails were well made and the staff was friendly, but that's where the highlights end for this place I'm afraid.  The food was overpriced (this is definitely not a "$$" place), our Brussels sprouts were cold, the fried chicken and deviled eggs were bland, and it took an unacceptably long time for our order to arrive. Our waiter did not check up on us often enough, either. Even receiving the bill took a long time. I do not recommend this restaurant at all.

15.description: Yelp's Burger Binge Week brought me to this fine spot. Knife and Tine, did you know the word "Tine" means prongs essentially like that on a fork. Huh! I guess I learn something everyday. Supposedly the naming of the restaurant came from one of the owner's mom or grandma and she just blurted out "Knife & Tine". The others just said "Oh Shit, I kinda like that, lets roll with it". Tired and exhausted from walking most of the day I was looking forward to devouring this dreamy burger. From the outside you would not expect to get a big juicy burger, as it is one of the few Fine Dining spots in the area but without the pretentious bullshit that you receive from them, but their burger is a winner.The K&T Beef Burger was a double patty with pickles, Cheddar Cheese, sauce, and Carmelized onions. A well-balanced burger that still allowed me to taste the actual meat. It was not the best burger I have had but it was just a small notch below. What really impressed me was they offered fries with their $5 burger special, an offer most others fail to do. The fries were also quite good, crispy with nice flavoring. They do not skimp here as they truly do care about providing a Poitier dining experience. Well done!Looking at the menu I noticed many items that I do not see very often making a future visit inevitable.  Arancini Balls, a Cheese Plate,  Butternut Souflee, Rabbit and Pork Sausage,  and a Bibb Salad. These delectable offerings along with outstanding and knowledgeable personnel will put Knife & Tine into my Lincoln Park rotation go-to-spots.

57.description: The food is still fantastic! Make sure to order the Shishito peppers! Every dish I have ordered has been wonderful and the service was great!

20.description: So many stars!!!!! Where to start.. We had 11 for brunch today and they were so accommodating. A couple of orders were wrong or forgotten so we had to wait. Minor inconvenience but no biggie. We ate and enjoyed ourselves in the adorably decorated restaurant. The bills came (separate which is amazing) and they didn't charge us for our second round of drinks! They also brought us a couple orders of cinnamon roll pancakes to make up for the delay/mistake! Not many places do this so it was such a nice gesture!! The food and drink (bloodies were amazing) were so good so will def be back. Thanks Iman!

36.description: I ate at this joint on New Year's Day 2016 (January 1st) and I must say, the food is of the gods. I had the breakfast burrito, which is the same as your traditional burrito, except it contains eggs and peppers instead of rice and beans. As I consumed the meal, I felt like a child again. Specifically, I felt purely happy, unencumbered by the worries of adulthood and in a state of pure ecstasy. If you are eating at a fast food place you are existing wrong. I don't mean to disparage fast food, but Knife & Tine is leagues ahead of such establishments. Please, do not let the opportunity slip away. Eat here tonight!

14.description: The cocktails were well made and the staff was friendly, but that's where the highlights end for this place I'm afraid.  The food was overpriced (this is definitely not a "$$" place), our Brussels sprouts were cold, the fried chicken and deviled eggs were bland, and it took an unacceptably long time for our order to arrive. Our waiter did not check up on us often enough, either. Even receiving the bill took a long time. I do not recommend this restaurant at all.

3.description: Walked here on a Sunday night from my friend's new place a few blocks away...awesome sign flashing, beckoning, got there around 7:30 p.m., the tap room closed at 8 says the sign. Wow, the pants-suited Polish bartender couldn't have been more of a jerk. Carded us (i'm 35 and look it), one of our 4-person group was black and very obviously mean-mugged by all patrons. I stepped outside for a smoke, ingesting the street scene: Mimi's Mature Bookstore across the street (with signage advertising 'marital aids'), 2 closed check cashing places, a scary diner, and when I walked back in the tvs were off, and it was time to GO. "Ve are closed," she said. At least they had Jameson. And one of the kicked-outees directed us to an ok bar a few blocks away. Oh, also, the 3 actual tables that were there probably could have had people sitting at them if there wouldn't have been 2 canes and a paper bag full of what smelled like Pepe Le Pew's gym socks on them.

1.description: This is my place when I want real tequila for mass-quantities of Margaritas.  I scored half liters of El Jimador here once for much cheaper than any place else I could find.  They actually had a pretty huge selection of tequila in general, with some good stuff.  Otherwise, the spot's pretty sketchy, paritally in a good way, partially not.

2.description: Oh a good old fashioned grimey crowded Chicago liquor storePolish beer - checkDomestics - checkLiquors - checkZubrowka - check (3 kinds of that delicious bison grass vodka!)Forget more "upscale" beer. Or microbrews. Much to my dismay.Prices are on par.Favorite: dude: "Will you accept a dollar in change"cashier: "yeah"dude comes back with a 40 of king cobra. oh yeah.

0.description: Using my standard of "perfect corner store" to be Vas Foremost on Milwaukee & California, this Foremost doesn't come close.  But it's decent, and leagues better than the ValuMost on Milwuakee.  Then again, this place has a sweet position across the street from an adult bookstore.  A 40 and a peep show... sounds like a night!

58.description: Good grub and friendly/attentive service.  I am a big fan of the this joint for breakfast - ham, eggs, and salsa.  You can't go wrong.  The burger is quite good as well with the carmalized cheddar prep.  I haven't eaten much else besides these entrees but will one day.  Could be five stars but they need to invest in some internal design as the layout is clunky.  Very welcome addition to the neighborhood.

56.description: Great place for breakfast! Lots of seating and friendly service. I had a veggie skillet that was fresh and delicious. They also make their own juices.

29.description: We were so excited about eating at this place and man were disappointed. The Two waitresses were wonderful but that was it. We waited for our food for over forty minutes and it never showed. We saw our waitress go back over to kitchen several times and could not get the cook to make our order The owner got mad at the waitress instead of the cook. The owner/manager was horrible. She had no clue what she was doing. I will never go there again
