42.description: I came here with my boyfriend for breakfast because we saw that it had good reviews. I don't know why it has such good reviews because our experience was the worse. We came in around 9:30am, there were probably 6 other people in the restaurant already. The waitress took forever to come to our table and take our order. She asked us what we wanted to drink and left. I asked for an orange juice, the other person working there (I assume the manager) then came 10 MINUTES LATER to tell me they were out of orange juice. Another 10 minutes later the waitress came back to take our order. Another 15 minutes later the guy came back with my soda (since they didn't have orange juice, I had to pick a different drink) which was hot. They then brought out our food and never checked on us to see how we were doing or if we needed anything else. Two older ladies who were sitting on the booth next to ours also complained to the waitress about her food and how they had forgot to bring them ketchup they had asked for 20 minutes ago and a side of fruit (which came with their breakfast combo). Horrible service. The food wasn't too bad, but not great enough to come back. If the service we received was better, we might maybe consider coming back. I understand that if you go out to eat you are expected to have to wait some time, but having only 6 customers, it was ridiculous.

23.description: The service here was amazing. Our sever was very kind, checked up on us frequently and brought us our food quickly. There were no more than a few other people in the restaurant, and it had a very familial feel to it.That being said, the food was not so good. The cheese on my omelette had not quite melted, and it did not taste as good as the cheddar omelettes I make at home. The hash browns were okay, the coffee was also fine. The prices were average, not quite as pricy as IHOP but also not as good. Overall, the place is fine. I would definitely give it five stars for their impeccable service, but unfortunately the food just did not do it for me.

47.description: What a great place for breakfast with reasonable pricing. For this quality of food they should be charging more.The décor is at least a few decades old but in pristine condition.  Old school diner vibe...As soon as you walk in you get the feeling that somebody cares about what they are doing. All of the food is top notch and the owner Manny, as well as his family, make you feel like you are at home.

8.description: Loved this place!!!! Stumbled on it when IHOP had an hour wait and it was WAY better. I had an omelet which was stuffed with fresh veggies! My husband had a breakfast burrito with fresh avocado. Aside from good food the prices were very economical and the service was excellent. It is family owned so obviously they care about their customers. We never had an empty drink and they made our little kids feel like they were part of the family. It's rare to find a restaurant that appreciates 2-year olds! We will be going back regularly! Give it a try!Also - the family said they had had challenges finding good servers in the past which is perhaps the reason for a few of the poor service reviews. Seems like they've gotten that taken care of now.

31.description: Food and Service was on point!I got the Egg croissant and Spanish Omelette. Very delicious!And I definitely love the customer service.Very friendly, not 'dropping off the food and go' type of place!

34.description: This place is just OK.  Nothing special.  The decor was very sparse and really could of used some sprucing up.  The service was good considering what the staff had to work with.  I think actually ran out of glass wear. I was really hoping for a good breakfast spot in my hood.  I may have to give it one more chance.

16.description: I don't know how this place is still in business. Not only have they failed multiple health inspections recently, but they have AWFUL service. A few weeks ago my boyfriend and his friends waited MORE THAN AN HOUR for their food when there was ONE OTHER TABLE THERE. That is unacceptable. A waiter actually gave them the check before they even got their food. The worst part? They didn't apologize. Their food isn't even good! Needless to say none of us will ever be back.

13.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! I moved to the city from the suburbs about a year ago and my son and I were looking for a new weekend bfast place. We came upon Shila's on Yelp and decided to check it out because of all the great reviews and affordability! Since the moment we walked in we were enamored with the place because the people running the place are so great and make you feel like you are at home. The owners of the restaurant (Reina and Manual) came over to greet us and since then we've become quite fond of Reina. Now about the food: I always get the chilaquiles, because, why not?? They are baked and made fresh each day...Reina makes the yummy green sauce :) My son likes to try different things from the menu but really loves the bfast sandwich, which comes on a croissant with a side of hash browns and mini pancakes. Reina also started making tamales and this past weekend she gave us a sample and they are perfect! I felt like I was at my mom's house. LOL. My son had the red tamales (pork and chicken) and I had the rajas tamal. I love tamales de rajas and she made them perfectly! Needless to say, we brought some home...and I just had the last one last night so I will be going back for more this week. Finally, I don't get the bad reviews on here...I've been coming here for about a year and we've never experienced anything like other reviewers have described. Anyway, check it out for yourself!

11.description: Delicious. I have never had a problem with slow service like a couple other reviews stated. The resto is always very clean, great staff, chilaquiles are out of this world delicious and their coffee is nice and strong. Love this place!

39.description: Nice place to enjoy breakfast, lunch and now dinner. I had the Tuscan Chicken sandwich and it was very good. Bread nicely crisp and toasted. Ingredients fresh especially the basil and avocado. The fries were cooked just right not soggy. Very tasty.  Coming back for sure!

37.description: Shilas is now open for dinner and you must try it.  Good food at a good value.  I had the chicken marsala and is was very tasty.  Large portion so 1/2 came home with me.  My son had the special that night, rib eye steak.  Really large portion, cooked to medium.  Fluffy baked potato was cooked perfectly.  Dinner came with special pizza bread, salad or soup and entree.  I had a glass of the Santa Julia Organic Malbec.  Very nice wine from Argentina.  Shilas has several Argentina and Chile wines that are excellent and a great value.  Service is excellent and very friendly.  Try Shilas anytime.

0.description: Hands down BEST breakfast food around! I wish I would have tried this place sooner. Combo skillet is amazing. Omelette was excellent, the spinach/tomato taste like actual fresh produce, and the feta cheese was really good, too. I would say this is some of the highest quality "diner" food Ive had, yet its several dollars cheaper than any of the other diners in the neighborhood. If you haven't tried this place yet, GIVE THEM A SHOT.

38.description: Ever since they opened, the owners Reyna & Manuel have been not only gracious, courteous and conscientious, they have their heart & soul in Shilas. They ask questions and respond in kind. Their desire to be successful is based on their customers satisfaction. Much success is my wish for this adventurous couple!

51.description: I came here with friends on the way to the airport. It got good reviews on Yelp and I can see why.I order the special which was chile quiles and it was Amazon.  I was also surprised to find it was vegetarian! The meal was the perfect bled of spice and flavor.My vegetarian friend had the breakfast burrito, and he agreed that it was also the perfect blend.The whole experience was most enjoyable. I don't know how often I'll be in the area, or if I'll ever be back, but if you're in the area and want to try a Mexican style breakfast, then try Shilas. I did!

27.description: This unassuming restaurant has some truly great food for an even better price. I have never once been disappointed with a meal at Shila's. The wait staff is friendly and accommodating, but a little on the slower side. If you want a delicious meal that won't break the bank (and don't mind spending a little more time waiting for food) this place is worth it.

32.description: First time going and our last, waited an hour only for the food never to come out. Walked out horrible service. The waiter never put in out order and never came back to check on our table instead another waitress came to ask us what we ordered :-/

54.description: Absolutely delicious and super reasonably priced! Check out the Chilaquiles on the specials- best I've ever had!

48.description: Good comfort food. Can't believe I've live in the area and am just finding this place. I will definitely be going back. Good food at a decent price. Awesome!

44.description: My skillet was supposed to have feta but had a glob of bland melted cheese.  The advocado was missing.  The hash browns were greasy.  Onions were not listed on the menu as part of the dish but there were a lot and many were just about raw.  The sausage was mediocre.  The spinach was fresh and the pancakes were okay.  It seemed homemade so has potential but fell short of what I expected from other reviews.  The price was good but this would not be my choice of places to eat breakfast.

24.description: This is a great little diner. The waiter was exceptionally friendly and personable!! They also have a delicious homemade salsa. Everything you want in a diner - definitely recommend! =)

7.description: Let's start off w the good: the employees are VERY VERY genuinely nice (our male server offered to pour my Sprite in my glass of ice for me. Who does that?! Amazing)Really good sweet potato friesDecent burgersNow, two stars deducted, because we were THE ONLY ONES dining here, we got here at exactly 1:20pm (I know exactly, bc we paid for the parking meter), and the hubby and my burgers didn't come out 'til 1:51pm!!!! Why do burgers at a completely empty restaurant take 30 mins to make?! The super long wait time made me so sad.

49.description: We tried Shilas for a Sunday Brunch.  They were full the entire hour that we were there.  We were seated quickly, but it took a bit of time to order and get our food.  My husband and I split a Skillet and it was plenty of food.  The menu is fairly small, but the food is great and the prices are right.

40.description: Shila"s is now open for dinner. Menu has an Italian flair to it. All very good. Service is still very friendly. Highly recommend.

53.description: Best breakfast I've had in a long time & amazing pancakes! Def our new breakfast place!

30.description: Horible service!!! The food was all burn also dont recommend, The african-American young lady looks lost she even forgot to bring me my tea had to ask another waiter to please bring me it. I suggest them to improve on customer service because she was just horrible ! Will never go back.

46.description: Shilahs food is delicious.  The service is pleasant and attentive. I like this place so much more than Lucky Grill.  Their selection is small which is nice. That makes their taste so much fresher.  We've only had breakfast here but we hope to soon come back for lunch or dinner.  The ambiance is throw back to an older diner restaurant and it's clean.  Come to Shilahs for great fresh food and friendly service.

1.description: My friend and I were pretty disappointed with this place. The only soft drinks they had to offer is sprite and coke, our eggs were not prepared according to what we ordered, and the hashbrowns are pretty tasteless in general. The service was very slow at the beginning but all that being said the servers were very friendly.Just kidding, as we were walking out someone else had a diet coke. They arrived after us.

55.description: Incredible find in Portage Park !Fantastic Good, Excellent Service !!Unbelievable low Prices!!!!Try this Restaurant today !You will Love it !!!!!

9.description: Great service! Food is excellent! Specially the burgers. Would definitely come back again!

26.description: Affordable, great food, quick and family-friendly... perfect place for breakfast around Portage Park!

25.description: Small place, basic breakfast and brunch.  The staff was amazingly great and attentive.  Food seemed to be prepared cook to order, which I prefer to fast.  Nice local haunt for nondescript breakfast.  Nothing fancy, just good food.  Get the tatter totts.

12.description: We tried this place for breakfast based on the reviews and they weren't lying!  The food was amazing and the service was incredible.  Our waiter Manny was so nice and attentive.  We both had different skillets that were delicious and fresh ingredients!  You must try it!

59.description: The decor here is super misleading, I must say. The staff is professional and amazingly attentful. My coffee cup was never empty, and for me that's saying a lot! The food is pretty good, although I just admit I haven't wandered too far from traditional breakfast offerings. I did try to pay attention to other diner's food and it all looked appetizing and well portioned. Heard other customers commenting on the superb service, and positive yelp reviews. Also, and importantly, the price was VERY fair. I mismatched my meal and they didn't charge me an arm and leg. Would definitely give 5 stars if it didn't feel so drab. Mismatched lighting and fake wood for miles. Over all very positive experience

21.description: Ate here for the first time this past Monday and I was really impressed. I had the Spanish Omelette and it was excellent! This diner is a must try!

17.description: My wife and I  recently from Pilsen into Portage Park and this is easily or favorite local restaurant. The staff is friendly, professional and genuinely interested in giving you a great dining experience. Usually this is are go to for breakfast but when we heard they were extending their hours for dinner we had to come support. Unlike the pretentious owner of "Community Tavern" who always acts like it's a waste of time to talk to his customers. The owner at Shila's warmly greets us like family. The mushroom soup was hearty but not over seasoned. I usually get the combo skillet with mini pancakes. Enjoy.

10.description: Ever since they opened, the owners Reyna & Manuel have been not only gracious, courteous and conscientious, they have their heart & soul in Shilas. They ask questions and respond in kind. Their desire to be successful is based on their customers satisfaction. Much success is my wish for this adventurous couple!

5.description: Skillet breakfast -oh yeah! So us Cali kids wanted a great Chicagoen breakfast. Should we spend $19 for the Marriott brunch? No way. Thanks to previous Yelpers for highlighting Shila's, a short jaunt on bus #56 bus off the Jefferson CTA blue line station.     The atmosphere in Shila's is warm and the serving staff are friendly. Even better, the food is wonderful. The Veggie Skillet was robust and soooo tasty. The Hangover Skillet was another winner. To be truthful, the serving sizes were so BIG we probably should have shared a skillet.    Bottom line - Shila's dishes up great food.

3.description: Great place and service! Delicious food! I came here with a friend earlier this week and was not disappointed. I had the veggie skillet and a fresh squeezed juice(which was amazing) and an iced tea which tasted great and not watered down like most. Hands down best breakfast I've had in awhile! The veggie skillet had so many veggies in it! And it came with two eggs, hash browns and a side of toast or mini pancakes and the pancakes were big. This place is delicious and affordable! I will definitely be coming back here soon to try out some more of their tasty foods. Can't wait to try their soup! The food tastes fresh and home made and you can't beat the prices. A new favorite spot for me!

35.description: I would like to start off by saying it's nice to see $3.50 eggs with sides on the menu.  This restaurant is has good breakfast food with that being said...the service needs a little polishing. We had 4 ppl at the table and the 2 waiters got everything wrong , might have been new. Idk.     I had the chiliquiles and they were spicy like the  menu read. My friends had other breakfast fare and I could tell they were looking at their plates saying, that's it? One said should of had the skillet. The plates did look a little bare with the food sectioned off on each plate. Maybe were just used to now a days with a pile on our plates.     Anyways all in all its not a bad place they do come back to the table to refill coffee plenty of times, maybe a bit to much. This place needs to trim the trees out front so ppl can see the name being that it's fairly new to the area. I did like the white table clothes on each table. I'm sure I'll be back for lunch being this restaurant is in the area where I work and I like to support local businesses.

19.description: Horible service!!! The food was all burn also dont recommend, The african-American young lady looks lost she even forgot to bring me my tea had to ask another waiter to please bring me it. I suggest them to improve on customer service because she was just horrible ! Will never go back.

28.description: I saw Shilas on Yelp.  It's rated 4 1/2 stars and a single $.  Based on this and the reviews I decided to give it a try.  Shilas is located on Cicero Ave just a few doors south of Irving Park.  The restaurant is a simple storefront facing east.  Inside the decor is very dated.  The first thing I noticed is that there seemed to be a disproportionately large number of people working for the number of customers.  I came in direct contact with 5 people.  One the hostess that sat me, two the waitress (very nice and friendly), the owner came by to see how everything was, a girl that refilled my water and asked me how everything was. & finally the cook that actually brought my food to me.  The service was pretty goodBased on the 4 1/2 star review I was a little disappointed by the menu items.  Nothing really jumped off the page that I was salivating to try.  Just your basic breakfast and lunch items.  Then the waitress went by with a plate for the next table.  On the way back I intercepted her and asked what the guy at the next table ordered.  He ordered quesadillas with eggs, spinach, onions, mushrooms & cheese with hash browns.  I decided that we what I wanted as I already had a hankerin git me some Mexican vittles.  They were pretty good, but lacked some seasoning.  After adding the salsa that came with the meal it was much better

45.description: Shilas is the best! And it just got even better because they are now open for dinner! We had the mussels to start (they come with an amazing red sauce that we even used to dip our bread in). Next was the soup of the day, which was cream of mushroom, also quite tasty,  and a side salad with cesar dressing (it didn't taste exactly like normal cesar dressing, but that's why I loved it! ). For the entrées, chicken vesuvio and the skirt steak. The chicken has a delicious herby sauce with potatoes, my husband's favorite! The skirt steak was so juicy and tender with a red wine and mushroom sauce that they put on the side. There was also a baked potatoe with butter sour cream and green onion! They even cooked up some beakfast for our son since this is always his favorite spot! The whole family was happy just like every time we come here! Everything was delicious! I wish we had pictures to add, but we were way to in to dinner to stop for pictures! Also on an extra note, even our 8 year old son commented that "everyone is so nice here!" And they really are!!

33.description: This was my first time coming to breakfast here. I don't regret it I saw it had good reviews so me and my fiancé decided to try something different. I am very pleased with the service and the food. They serve us coffee right away which was nice not having to wait. I most definitely recommend the breakfast sandwiches and french toast with banana's &strawberries.  We spend around 23 dollars on eggs with bacon, french toast and a breakfast sandwich. Not a bad deal for the homemade quality of the food. I will definitely come back for breakfast.

43.description: Dinner has finally arrive!!! It is absolutely delicious, light and all dishes are made from scratch! I highly recommend the chicken Vesuvio but prepare to wait 25 min. The wait is well worth it. It will not disappoint, that's not a promise, it's a guarantee. They cook the chicken with bone in like we prefer but they have it boneless upon request. Their homemade margaritas are out of this world. They have an excellent wine list. The mushroom & chicken soup was divine. The wife had Chicken Marsala and the savory sauce was covered in mushrooms. Fresh not canned. She never stops talking but last night upon getting her dinner it was silent until her last bite. Come check them out for dinner. You will be glad. Thank me later ;) ...

2.description: In my search for a local neighborhood restaurant I found this place on Yelp... unfortunately.We walked in and found a seat immediately... it wasn't busy and we were excited to find a local gem.The tables order consisted of: Eggs, Bacon, Pancakes, Hashbrowns, Chicken Noodle Soup, their fresh juice blend and Tropicana orange juice.... That's 7 ways to leave a good impression.They failed on every accord possible. Rude, cold food, missing items, and... delayed attention.  They were fully staffed, the restaurant was 75% empty and the manager sarcastically asked me to "look around" (as if they were packed) in explanation of their errors.

18.description: Food and Service was on point!I got the Egg croissant and Spanish Omelette. Very delicious!And I definitely love the customer service.Very friendly, not 'dropping off the food and go' type of place!

41.description: We have gone there for breakfast and it's great. We truly enjoy the delicious plates. However, today we experienced DINNER. Holey Moley it was excellent!!The Wine recommendation was perfect and I had the eggplant parmigiana and my husband had the best pork chops!!  Delicious and service was so good!!!

52.description: Amazing breakfast! We ate here yesterday morning while we were in the area, I only wish we lived closer to we could frequent here. Great super friendly service, something you don't see often these days. Everything was perfect, including the coffee. Hash browns done the way they should be and AMAZING pancakes. Seriously. I'm picky about my cakes, and these are good! Oh, and real butter! Yes please. And to top it off, great prices. Definitely check Shila's out if you want a good meal.!

50.description: I eat here all the time and it is just what you want in a family friendly, price friendly neighborhood restaurant. Currently they are only open from 7am to 3pm but plans are being made for a dinner menu. Just good solid food at reasonable prices! Very friendly staff. Great coffee. Good service. Go here.

4.description: I saw Shilas on Yelp.  It's rated 4 1/2 stars and a single $.  Based on this and the reviews I decided to give it a try.  Shilas is located on Cicero Ave just a few doors south of Irving Park.  The restaurant is a simple storefront facing east.  Inside the decor is very dated.  The first thing I noticed is that there seemed to be a disproportionately large number of people working for the number of customers.  I came in direct contact with 5 people.  One the hostess that sat me, two the waitress (very nice and friendly), the owner came by to see how everything was, a girl that refilled my water and asked me how everything was. & finally the cook that actually brought my food to me.  The service was pretty goodBased on the 4 1/2 star review I was a little disappointed by the menu items.  Nothing really jumped off the page that I was salivating to try.  Just your basic breakfast and lunch items.  Then the waitress went by with a plate for the next table.  On the way back I intercepted her and asked what the guy at the next table ordered.  He ordered quesadillas with eggs, spinach, onions, mushrooms & cheese with hash browns.  I decided that we what I wanted as I already had a hankerin git me some Mexican vittles.  They were pretty good, but lacked some seasoning.  After adding the salsa that came with the meal it was much better

6.description: Love this place. This is my second time here. Great customer service, and the food wait quick as well. I love their salsa. The food presentation is very nice as well.

22.description: The food is pretty darn good.  Our table had food that ranged from breakfast to lunch entrees, and everything was very good.  The coffee was very weak and could use an upgrade.  Prices were in-line for the neighborhood, perhaps trending towards a little expensive for what you get.  Portion sizes were better than similar restaurants in the neighborhood.  Décor was a little stark and dated, but hey we're here for the food.  Service was attentive.

15.description: I came here with friends on the way to the airport. It got good reviews on Yelp and I can see why.I order the special which was chile quiles and it was Amazon.  I was also surprised to find it was vegetarian! The meal was the perfect bled of spice and flavor.My vegetarian friend had the breakfast burrito, and he agreed that it was also the perfect blend.The whole experience was most enjoyable. I don't know how often I'll be in the area, or if I'll ever be back, but if you're in the area and want to try a Mexican style breakfast, then try Shilas. I did!

57.description: My hands smelled like a campfire after eating the bacon. Enough said. Epic. The grits are delicious, and everything I had made me wish I wasn't getting full. Can't wait to go back!

20.description: My wife and I  recently from Pilsen into Portage Park and this is easily or favorite local restaurant. The staff is friendly, professional and genuinely interested in giving you a great dining experience. Usually this is are go to for breakfast but when we heard they were extending their hours for dinner we had to come support. Unlike the pretentious owner of "Community Tavern" who always acts like it's a waste of time to talk to his customers. The owner at Shila's warmly greets us like family. The mushroom soup was hearty but not over seasoned. I usually get the combo skillet with mini pancakes. Enjoy.

36.description: By far the best breakfast place in portage Park and must try there dinner Great coffee and now serving wine and beer

14.description: The dishes we order had real good flavor. We got one called sierra and one with chicken and sweet peppers, service was good, they were very attentive.

3.description: This market is very good.  And there's a lot of potential for this market to hit 5 stars.There's what I consider an average selection of vendors, although the number of options is improving.First thing.  THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! to the vendor (Faith's Farm?) that sold us the hamburger brats this past weekend!  You now have a new, loyal customer.  So very delicious.Additional shout-outs to Regulus Coffee and Fannie Schmoe's Bakery!  Your products are always on my list.   The honey vendor is outstanding as well!  We buy various products from this guy, which are always amazing.  patzmapleandhoney.comI also appreciate that they have regular dog adoption events.  Finally, this market usually has very talented musicians.  My favorite regular is Kent Rose (kentrose.com).  A voice like butter.

1.description: Three stars for the Portage Park Farmers Market. Why only three? This is a nice little market to stroll around on Sunday mornings. There's usually live music, vendors with fresh baked goods, tamales, crepes, local honey, jam, cheese, knife sharpening. All that's missing is, well, farmers. While there is *some* fresh produce available, the selection is very limited. Even in late July the majority of the sellers weren't there with produce, but with prepared goods. That's all fine and well, but what I'm looking for in a farmer's market is a good selection of fresh fruit and vegetables. There's definitely a place for the prepared items and freshly cooked stuff (you will never hear me complain about a fresh, warm, crepe) at a farmer's market, but I think the majority of the market should be about produce. Even though Portage Park is only a five minute walk from my house (yay!) I make the trek to the Oak Park farmers market throughout the summer for fresh, local or nearby fruits and veggies. Early in the season there's not as much there--that's the growing season for ya--but that market is still much more produce-centered than Portage Park is. I still stop by the Portage Park market on the days it's running (keep one of their magnets on their fridge to check the dates, since it doesn't happen every week), but I've learned not to expect too much in the way of fruit and veggies.

2.description: This is a great farmers market! Lots of local support, local businesses, and best of all, IT IS LOCAL! I have been to several other farmers markets, and this is a great one. Very friendly and knowledgeable vendors with a great selection. There is always live music and it is the perfect setting to lay a blanket down with your family or dog, eat some delicious crepes and drink coffee. Highly recommended.

5.description: Portage Park Farmers Market you get another star!Ten mini pumpkins and gourds for $2.00...be still my Autumn decorating heart.Huge bag of the freshest spinach I ever bought for $2.00...recipes scrolled through the brain as I paid!Sign the petition for Portage Park to get an enclosed Doggie-Park, please!Still small. Still plenty of parking. Still not crowded.Still on every other Sunday, but the season is coming to an end...sniff-sniff, pass me a kleenex please.

6.description: This is a market - but NOT a farmers market.  I waited 2 weeks for this and it only had 1 farm participating.......and not much to offer, and not the best prices.....There were booths with nut, coffee, t-shirt, cheese, meat, bread, hot dogs, olives etc.....everything seemed overpriced and overhyped.  Not much produce at all.  Now I have to scope out where a real farmers market in the area might be.

7.description: 4 stars for Katydid's jams and jellies...the rhubarb jam is so good!

0.description: This is one of my favorite markets in the city.  It is so nice to stroll through a beautiful park on a Sunday and munch on delicious, local products and take home local produce.  And listen to music!  And adopt a dog if that's on your wish list!  The presence of Fannie Schmoe's Bakery is enough to get me out of bed and down to the park.  To the reviews complaining that there is no produce-notice the dates on those reviews.  Early June.  The growing season is barely started and they are acting like they expected to be bringing home a full summer's harvest!  These are small, local farms and they grow seasonally.  Many don't have the big greenhouses or the ability to travel from further south to get to market.  Sheesh!  Eat locally.  Eat seasonally.  And have fun doing it!

4.description: As another reviewer mentioned, this is more a MARKET versus a farmers market. There was only one tent set up with actual produce and while the prices were pretty cheap, I felt like the produce wasn't very fresh. A lot of it looked really dried out and not the best quality, especially compared to other markets in the city, which was disappointing. Hopefully it was just a bad week for them, I will check them out again next time to see if the quality looks better. Otherwise, the stands with local cheese, coffee, baked goods, etc. all looked really good. In a neighborhood where you do not always see a lot of the locals out socializing together, it was nice seeing so many people come out for this market. I think this location has a lot of potential. It is within walking distance for me, so I would really like to see this little market grow. There is obviously community interest in it, we just need the people in the area to continue supporting it so that more produce vendors will buy in!

address: Central and Berteau Ave in Portage Park

12.description: Had a great time this year. This is one of the more interesting fest I have attended. Quite a mix of entertainment...from a great kids area ...to pro wrestling for the older kids and dads...to some really great music.My only complaint is that it should last longer. Why not go over 3 or 4 days?

3.description: I am not a big fan of street fests, but figured we'd give it a shot to support our new neighborhood. We went on Saturday afternoon, somewhat between typical lunch and dinner times. Overall, the offerings seemed underwhelming compared to other fests. I did find one local spice vendor, Spice Heist, that I've purchased from previously, so that was nice. And as a wine drinker, the selection was much better than I've seen elsewhere. I was very disappointed to not find any local BBQ restaurants participating. Considering Smoque, Gale St and Pitchfork are all so close, it was unfortunate they were not part of the fest. While the food was decent, I did not recognize any of the BBQ vendors at all. I did see a couple small carnival-type rides, but was quite turned off by the sad, lonely camel and few ponies corralled for "rides" that were along Belle Plaine. I would have rather seen another carnival ride instead of some poor animals tied up for the sake of entertainment. With all that said, I really enjoy our new neighborhood and love to support it. I don't know however, that I will rush back to this fest unless there are some more local vendors participating, especially the BBQ restaurants!

1.description: I think this was the 4th year of the fest and I'd have to say the food is good and the atmosphere too but it's always the same vendors and not from the area. I should know this because I lived in the area for many years. Seriously. Robinsons #1 ribs? I don't recall them in Six Corners. I'll still go but the promoters have a year to think about putting local joints at the fest.

2.description: 6 corners BBQ Fest is located off of Irving Park road on the north portion of Milwaukee  avenue.  Located in the Portage Park neighborhood 6 Corners BBQ Fest offers a taste of some of the best BBQ in the Chicago area.This fest has the $5 suggested entry much like all other Chicago summer festivals.  It is important for the growth and foundation of these events.  Tickets are sold by cash and credit and follow the same pattern as all other bbq festivals.  Food and drink are plenty to choose from.  There are also some art tents and other promotional groups that are available.  6 corners BBQ Fest offers music and the south entrance off of Irving Park road as well as in the north side parking lot.  The parking lot area serves as a place to sit and eat as well as providing bleachers to listen to the musical entertainment.  The Portage Theater was also open during this event which was nice as it is currently not open due to some business ownership disputes.Overall, 6 Corners BBQ Fest does it right and is a nice taste of the Portage Park/Old Irving Park neighborhood.

9.description: I tried to really like this fest. I live within walking distance of it, and it seemed to gather a big crowd.That big crowd didn't stay long. Two BBQ vendors and Las Tablas. That's not a BBQ fest; that's just a small little block party. Way overpriced, too.We were encouraged to tour the old Portage Theater. It was open, and when we walked in, the big screen had an art film or some type of blue movie with close-ups of sexual organs. That was weird. More varieties of food would really help to boost this new fest. Heck, just more food in general.*Update: the immediate neighborhood has a lot of great BBQ venues: Smoque, Gale Street Inn, Sutherlands, The Portage, La Villa and even Bread and Wine. That's a great line-up of local food operations if there ever was any. Not one of these restaurants were featured at this festival; just the catering operation that took over for the former Giovanni's in Berwyn. I used to go to Giovanni's, and they were alright. But this fest was in no way a true BBQ fest, and definitely not representative of the area.

10.description: A friend and I went to the fest today and were made to feel guilty for not paying the "suggested donation" of 5 dollars each. Both of us live in the neighborhood to begin with and are super inconvenienced this weekend with the 56 Milwaukee bus being rerouted from Montrose to Irving Park for 2 days. That equates a donation to me.At 4:40 pm today all of the hand washing stations were completely out of water except for one that barely had a trickle coming out. The fest opened at noon today! If I can't wash my hands after using a port o potty how can the people that are making the food?!Another thing was there was not enough port o pottys for the size of this fest. There were a total of like 6! There was at least a thousand people at the fest.It seems like they are trying to make as much money as possible at the expense of some acceptable level of cleanliness.And as a previous reviewer noted no immediate area restaurants that have great to decent BBQ were represented here.The inclusion of Texas Thunder BBQ from Texas was a good move though.If this fest can work out the kinks next year I might attend again, but I am not going to hold my breath.

13.description: We had a great time at BBQ Fest! The entertainment was fun, the food was good and it wasn't overly crowded. Will definitely go again next year!

16.description: A couple days before moving into the neighborhood and felt like I should check it out. Not as crazy or super crowded as the likes of the one in North Center. It definitely has a more neighborhood block party feel to it. It was nice to see they made it about enjoying with your family with games for the kids and even showcasing different ethnicities in the neighborhood through cultural dance. True the actual BBQ vendors were a little lacking, but I enjoyed being able to walk around without wall to wall people or with items being sold out.

6.description: I live in a building on the block that this occurs, so I was excited. I love BBQ, and the idea of a whole BBQ Fest just outside my door sounded fantastic.  Sadly, BBQ fest was significantly lacking on the BBQ, there were three stands selling BBQ, and I am being generous by calling one of them BBQ,  It is basically carnival food.You have to buy tickets for the food just like most other festivals, which is fine, until you find out that most of the stands have sold out of BBQ before noon. So you have to settle for something you weren't really interested in because you have tickets that you have to use. I hope they improve the Fest this year, you know by actually having decent BBQ......BBQ

15.description: Entertainment was fun, kids had fun, crowds not bad but not enough BBQ vendors, lines were ridiculously long.

0.description: Every year the fest gets better and better. It's far enough from downtown where you don't get the big crowds of people. If the taste of Chicago is to much for you this is the place to be. The food was better then expected and I could try everything in one day. Overall it was a good experience. Think carnival meets backyard BBQ.Pros- -smaller crowds (less lines)-decent music-kid friendly-local sponsorsCons--little seating in shade-standard pricing (though coupons are available)

5.description: It's nice to have our own fest, but I really hope it grows over time.  I went for the first time this year and was a little disappointed in how small it was... almost seemed amateurish.  I do like that they had lots of activities for the kids.  But, it needs many more food vendors.  Hopefully, the reviving Six Corners businesses will contribute to it's growth.  Only time will tell.

11.description: 4 bbq vendors for a fest that's called BBQ fest?  yikes, better get more next time guys... and thanks for wasting a visit to the city!

8.description: I'm sure the organizers worked really hard and this idea looks good on paper, but this fest was definitely underwhelming and disappointing. It seems you have to go on Saturday, because by Sunday the few BBQ vendors that were there ran out of a lot of items.  The only local "restaurant" was a bar that doesn't specialize in BBQ. With only 4 BBQ tents serving food, the lines were long and the ones that weren't had barely average quality meat and sauce. The beer selection was actually impressive. Instead of just Miller/Bud, they also had Goose Island and Founders. But if I'm paying $6 for a beer, I'd prefer it were fresh and cold from the tap. The system they had going on had them pouring it ahead of time and the person serving just takes it off the table, leaving you with almost warm beer. Hopefully they can improve it next year with more local places and the vendors more prepared. The live music was good, and was worth the $5 the optional donation.

4.description: Another fest that felt promising but really was a bit too small. Truth be told, I got there Sunday night, having bought the Groupon deal for admission and four beers- which was a decent deal in my opinion. The weather was nice, and there was a decent selection of the same stuff at every festival- food, beer, candles, people, etc.The people at this fest were quite interesting, a lot of families. The food was way overpriced- my beef brisket sandwich was decent, medium in size, but cost $10. I'm not an expert, but I feel like it should have been slightly cheaper. Same holds true for the other stuff. I guess my thinking is I pay $$ for food, beer, entry, what does this fest have for ME? Nothing really. The only real reason is to see cool stuff people make, hang out with friends, and relax. Only stayed here like 30-40mins before I got bored... but DID hit the DOLLAR STORE down the street!

14.description: 2011 was the first year of a BBQ fest serving the 6 corners community and hosted by the Six Corners Association.  I see that someone has posted it in the Events area of Yelp so it's happening again this year (2012).  If you click the link for the website you may not find any information, yet.  I clicked it already and it's a homepage for a new blog.  Last year's site was up for some time but offered little to not enough info.  It's another year and I hope for 2012 we can see more representation of local restaurants.  There are some big names in Chicago BBQ that are nearby and if the association could get them to come out, that would be a big deal to barbecue enthusiasts like myself.  Jefferson Park has a reasonable festival that gets Gale street to theirs, it'd be a place to start?2011's fest was okay, best for families and kids.  They are operating this in the shadow of bigger BBQ festivals happening all around the city.  Ribfest Chicago being the biggest and best of, at least for the 606 zip codes.  Another local big one with big names is one which happens in Forest Park during later summer which happens to attract barbecue caterers and wannabes that aim to find out if they have the gusto to start a new business off of winning a prestigious title of, "best of".  If you attended the Windy City BBQ fest which happened in the Uptown area last year, their  festival was almost exactly like the 6 corners version.  Except less drunken, strange people.  Don't get me wrong, drunken strange people make for interesting people watching.  The six corners area is more family involved.  So, what I liked most about it was the layout and offering.  They kept one area for the stage and music which was far away from where the children and families were seated and playing.  They had a few jumpers set up for the kids but the hours of service of those areas was a detail very hard to get at their different entrances.  My first visit out there with four wee ones in tow turned angry when the entrance folks told us there was still time for the kids to play, but after paying and entering, we find out the carnies are taking the jumpers down.  The kids were heartbroken, especially after the length of time sitting in the car looking for nearby parking.  FYI, good information for a festival website =  Times of or schedule of a kids area and or shows for the kids.  They may have had a schedule of shows last year, but I don't remember a timing schedule for kids activities & jumpers.  If the kids are happy, then I can manage to get in some beer time with the parents and check out the local singles scene for myself.  As far as ribs, tips and more I found the selections to be too typical.  Some of the people they had offering food are the companies we always see at Chicago festivals.  The guys with the huge triple layered signs selling frozen lemonades, fried snickers and run of the mill BBQ and those huge turkey legs.  They had one or two Chicago barbecue names like Robinson's which I don't have the highest regard for.  If I go to a fest for barbecue I usually always come out with fingers stinking of sweet barbecue.  After leaving this one, that wasn't the case.  The fest was geared more for the likes of the neighborhood or felt like one huge block party.  I hope this year the fest has a larger offering and involves more of the community.  Maybe more stores that are located on that stretch of street have open doors and are participating in the fest.  More inclusion or involvement from area businesses or other service providers hosting tents at the fest.  Just some ideas, I hope will enliven this years.

7.description: Someone's gotta stick up for this fest. I googled when I saw the 6 Corrners bbq fest was comin back around this year and then I see mostly bad reviews. Who are these people?It's a fun neighborhood streetfest. My friends and I have gone every year and left with a full stomach and possibly a little tipsy. Last year they had Shakespeare  street theater and professional wrestling. Love that quirky mix.I'm going again this year. Five stars if nothing else to counterbalance the negativity.

58.description: Delicious, and authentic. The Pozole here is legit! Very legit! Tacos, burritos, rice, everything here is good. We just ordered the Pambaso De Asada because my girlfriend and I have never tried it. We're confident this restaurant will deliver great taste with any item! Also, this place is family owned. Giving it a very warming feel for both take-out and dine-in.

56.description: This is a regular for me in a desert of good Mexican food. Lulu is fantastic, always takes time to chat and remembers my order. I get tacos and take home pozole for dinner!

29.description: This place was defineately average Mexican food at best. I like Amigo Chino much better. They charge extra for cheese and sour cream. The ambience is terrible. The owners kid screaming and another kid running around. They give a small cup of cold soup which was anything but appetizing. The chips were dry and the dip was like ketchup. For sure i wont be rushing back.

42.description: Enchiladas suck! Salsa sucks! Guacamole sucks! (More onions, cilantro than aguacate). The waitress is super nice though

23.description: Get in my belly!!! This place was really yummy. Service was awesome, husband wife team and the hubby carried a sleeping toddler on his shoulder most of the night. Personally I dig that. I like the family run joints. Horchata was delish. I got Nachos and they were the best I've had since my move from Texas. Prices are great as is the street parking. So happy to have found this little gem.

47.description: Tasty food, nice big portions, friendly family who owns it. I really liked the pozole and they do fresh guacamole.

8.description: I've been here for the first time with my girlfriend and I loved this place! The owner is a very nice lady, always smiling and very friendly. The food is very tasty and if you decide to go you definitely have to try the posole:) I will come back for sure!

31.description: Very nicely marinated steak, and the lady who runs this place is extremely nice and friendly, you walk in and feel like an old friend.

34.description: ordered steak taco dinner, everything was amazing!!! also sampled the pozole and honestly it's the best pozole I've ever tried. my only regret was not ordering some pozole to go! the horchata is the perfect amount of sweet and the service is amazing

16.description: My boyfriend and I were looking to grab good food for cheap. I couldn't come up with anything so I took to my magic crystal ball that is Yelp. Thanks to my past bookmarking spree we decided to try Pueblo Nuevo because 1) it was in our neighborhood, 2) it had a 4.5/5 star rating, and 3) it had one $.All of the reviews rave about the Pozole, but we were starving and didn't think it would satisfy us. We even inhaled the chips and salsa (so good) before she put them on the table. We ordered a milanesa torta and a chicken pambaso and both were some of the best we've had in a looooong time. The servings were HUGE. I've never seen a torta as large as the ones they serve. I actually couldn't finish my pambaso and took it home. Lulu, our vivacious server, let us try the Pozole and now I know why everyone screams about it. It. Is. Perfect. So good! I always order an horchata at any Mexican restaurant and that was good. We finished our meal with flan, which wasn't the best I've had, but still delicious.I'd definitely come back and plan to order Pozole. Seriously, so freaking good.

13.description: I came here due to the high accolades from other yelpers who, with their thumbs up, recommend this place.  Now I finally get it!  Not only did we have some comforting, filling-the-stomach-to-the-maximum-level Mexican cooking, but also we were invited to the owners' family.  The owner lady had SO much spunk and energy.  We came in on early Saturday evening after work and intended to try their Pozole de pollo.  There were vegetarian options for hubby, and he decided on the veggie torta.  The complementary starter salsa was unique.  It resembled the marinara sauce with a nice "garlicky" kick!  I actually liked it better this way since the flavor seemed to be more "concentrated." The food was quickly brought to the table.  I didn't remember when I had Pozole last time, but I knew I had a delicious bowl this time!  Yelpers' recommendation didn't lead me erroneously.  Instead of having my usual ginseng chick soups when I'm sick, I should go with Pozole de pollo from now on.  Ok, my plan has been revised.  Hubby's torta, on the other hand, was a huge one.  For $6, I would say the veggie torta was money well-spent.  Their horchata was creamy and satisfying.  Although we were genuinely full, the young man (one of the owners' children) brought each table a slice of cake.  That really demonstrated their hospitality, and we want to thank you for that.  I thought we would be spending $25 to $30 since that's the typical range a Mexican restaurant would charge.  Nevertheless, we spent $16.38 before tips.  I kept asking hubby if the owner lady forgot to punch in one of the items we ordered because it was way less than what I initially estimated. The street parking is rather easy.  We found one without encountering much difficulty.  I don't live that far away, so I will make every excuse to come back here.

11.description: Holy guacamole Pueblo Nuevo @ 4342 N Central Ave is a small Mexican restaurant.  I bookmarked it in Yelp because it has a 4 1/2 star rating and a single $ sign, my kind of restaurant.  We were in the area tonight so we decided to stop in a check it out.  The restaurant is very small and it was filled when we got there.  They brought us a bowl of chips and an excellent red salsa that Jethro Bodine (Beverley Hillbillies) would have glad a hard time finishing, but we did.  The red salsa was excellent very good seasoning and not too spicy.  The food is very good.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge.  Add this to excellent service and you have a winning combination. Our waitresses tonight were Lulu and her 8 year old daughter Jocelyn. (Both camera shy). It was very busy Lulu was the waitress, cashier and bus woman, serving & clearing tables.  Her daughter Jocelyn was so cute she came up to the table and asked me if I was done with my dish or if I was still working on it lol.  Well neither my wife or I finished our dishes.  We could have split it and it would have been enough.  My wife being a good Catholic doesn't eat meat on Friday.  She ordered the fish taco dish which was huge & delicious.  Instead of large chunks of fried fish like other places the fish was minced and mixed with onions, cilantro with lime squeezed on it was delicious.  The dish came with the normal compliment of beans & rice (which was very nicely seasoned).  I ordered the enchilada dinner which also came with the beans, rice and salad.  I got 2 steak (which was very spicy hot) and 1 chicken enchilada which was very good.  We both brought home more then half of our meals.  Like I said huge portions.Lulu brought us a small complimentary bowl of a chicken pozole soup to taste.  She also threw in a free flan dessert which we had a hard time finishingVery hard working and excellent service.  Lulu brings her 3 kids a 15 year old, 8 year old (Jocelyn) and a small boy about 2-3 years old.  Awesome food, awesome service and my 2 favorite waitresses Lulu and Jocelyn.  Tip big Yelpers they deserve it and work hard for their money

39.description: Lulu, the owner is fantastic, anything we had from the restaurant was great, fresh, delicious. You can't help but love this family small business.

37.description: Family business with good food and very friendly service. I dined in but will probably do take out next time, the place lacked atmosphere and was noisy.

0.description: Pozole, olay, such great taste!  Pueblo Nuevo is the best Mexican restaurant in the Jefferson and Portage Park neighborhoods.  The food is fabulous, I've never had a bad dish here.  The steak burritos, my perennial favorite, are out of this world delicious.  Lulu is amazing, such an excellent memory for detail about customers preferences. The chips and salsas are delicious.  The horchata is very good and there are other soft drinks available.   Such a neighborhood gem.  Five stars all the way.

38.description: My boyfriend and I were looking to grab good food for cheap. I couldn't come up with anything so I took to my magic crystal ball that is Yelp. Thanks to my past bookmarking spree we decided to try Pueblo Nuevo because 1) it was in our neighborhood, 2) it had a 4.5/5 star rating, and 3) it had one $.All of the reviews rave about the Pozole, but we were starving and didn't think it would satisfy us. We even inhaled the chips and salsa (so good) before she put them on the table. We ordered a milanesa torta and a chicken pambaso and both were some of the best we've had in a looooong time. The servings were HUGE. I've never seen a torta as large as the ones they serve. I actually couldn't finish my pambaso and took it home. Lulu, our vivacious server, let us try the Pozole and now I know why everyone screams about it. It. Is. Perfect. So good! I always order an horchata at any Mexican restaurant and that was good. We finished our meal with flan, which wasn't the best I've had, but still delicious.I'd definitely come back and plan to order Pozole. Seriously, so freaking good.

51.description: Very friendly staff. Good food that tastes fresh. Large menu. Owner's crazy kids running all over the place. Our new go-to!

27.description: Wonderful food, great service. It's our new go-to Mexican restaurant. Clean. Highly recommend!

32.description: Oh my God this place is SERIOUSLy off the chain. My friend and I just finished a bartending class at A List Startenders so we were in serious mood for drunk food. We found this place on Yelp and it's been the best Yelp find I've had in AGES.First off, the chips and salsa were amazing. We got a free small sample of pozole as an appetizer, and then continued onto the stars of the show.The Torta Cubana was HUGE, SO flavorful and probably my favorite. Layers and layers and layers of meat that go SO well together. We also got two tacos (I forgot what we got) but the tacos were the BEST I've had in Chicago. The store owner is also a lovely woman, and her daughter Jocelyn is so incredibly mature and a joy to talk to. We also received a slice of complimentary flan to share, and I'll never forget the warm hospitality. Come support this small business! It is SO deserving, and all in all, we paid only like $20 for two sandwiches, two tacos, and complimentary pozole and flan and chips and salsa? A steal.

54.description: I went there a couple of weeks ago after reading yelp reviews. It's in my neighborhood, and I've passed by several times, but never noticed!The owner is a real charmer, makes you feel like part of the family - she brought us complimentary Pozole, which was outstanding. The portions are huge and reasonably priced. I had the steak fajitas, delicious! the salsa is kind of a chunky puree, very good! I will be making this a regular stop!

48.description: Amazing!  The guac was the tits. Really bold and complex flavor. Our new favorite gem.

44.description: I wanted to try the pozole that everyone talks about.  It was okay, I've had better.  The rice wasn't cooked and was still hard.  The place is in need of some deep cleaning and the carpet needs replacement.  Don't think I'll be going back. The owner was very nice and friendly though.

24.description: Started with the salsa and wow, such a great bite from the peppers and garlic! Managed to eat almost an entire pamboso and it was a real treat. Crispy bread and tender steak, swathed with lots of sour cream and cheese. All fresh and delicious. And the service was as warm and friendly as about any place I've been. Highly recommend this place.

7.description: Oh my God this place is SERIOUSLy off the chain. My friend and I just finished a bartending class at A List Startenders so we were in serious mood for drunk food. We found this place on Yelp and it's been the best Yelp find I've had in AGES.First off, the chips and salsa were amazing. We got a free small sample of pozole as an appetizer, and then continued onto the stars of the show.The Torta Cubana was HUGE, SO flavorful and probably my favorite. Layers and layers and layers of meat that go SO well together. We also got two tacos (I forgot what we got) but the tacos were the BEST I've had in Chicago. The store owner is also a lovely woman, and her daughter Jocelyn is so incredibly mature and a joy to talk to. We also received a slice of complimentary flan to share, and I'll never forget the warm hospitality. Come support this small business! It is SO deserving, and all in all, we paid only like $20 for two sandwiches, two tacos, and complimentary pozole and flan and chips and salsa? A steal.

49.description: Holy mother of a find. We rode our bikes up from Logan to go car shopping and searched online for something to eat. Everything in the neighborhood seemed too simple but happened upon this place on a thrillest best Mexican food in Chicago because of their Pozole. I can even explain how perfect the soup was. Rich with flavor and spice, it left nothing for the wanting. Our hipster biking selfs left with smiles on our faces and bellies full.Staff was lovely and super nice.Unfortunately not BYOB, tacos were nothing to write about here.

40.description: When will they start selling Tamales?? Please LuLuThe steak burrito is good but the steak is so tough. The chicken needs to be seasoned for the nachos

53.description: Friendly, service with a smile, excellent Pozole, salsa, everything we tried was fantastic!

30.description: My horchata, chips, and pozole were delicious! Service was friendly and speedy was too! The check was reasonable. Pozole served on weekdays as well! I'll definitely be back! Glad to have found some pozole on the north side. The area seemed safe. Street parking found in front.

46.description: Wow! This place has some really delicious poZole!! Was feeling alittle sick and after calling every taqueria in the area and they failed to have pozole! I found this place!! Ordered a pozole and a taco on the side just incase I was unsatisfied with the pozole!! The tacos was great the pozole was even better!! delicious!!

1.description: After reading all the positive reviews I made an out of the way stop to visit. Unfortunately my experience was not even close to the reviews I read. I wanted to like this place, a small family owned business w a very friendly owner. I walked in at 7:15 Friday night, no waiting and the waitress behind the counter at the back of the room indicated I could sit wherever I liked. She brought chips and a medium spicy salsa along w the menu. I asked about the pozole and she brought a sample, and I agree w the reviewers, it was delicious. After a few minutes I asked the waitress for an enchilada / chile rellenos combination plate. She said she was new & would have to ask the owner. The owner came over and very politely advised they do not create custom combinations. I then ordered the enchilada dinner and a horchata to drink. The food came in a reasonable time and was served hot. Rice, beans, & a mild homemade enchilada sauce that was very tasty. I had 1 cheese, 1 steak, & 1 ground beef (piccadillo) enchilada ($11.99). The taste was okay, not great, but the lettuce on the plate was brown all over, obviously not fresh. The enchiladas were a little tough as I cut them but they might have been on the griddle before serving & if so that made the tortillas a little hard on the underside. I tried to get my waitress' attention several times, but she was either too busy eating or just not paying enough attention to see me waving my hand for over ten minutes. The owner is sweet & friendly, the food is okay but unfortunately not exceptional, good portion size but not trip worthy. Liked it, didn't love it.

55.description: It was taco night so I decided to check this place out because I heard good things about them. I ordered my usual steak tacos and got my mom the Mexican sausage and egg torta. The tacos were very well seasoned. Nice tortillas and tender steak. Mom liked the torta.  Great place in the Portage Park area.

9.description: Fantastic neighborhood joint. The food is always good and the owner is very nice. I highly recommend their taco dinners, enchiladas with green sauce (if you like SUPER spicy food), and the pambazo.I like to order my pambazo with veggies since it usually only comes with lettuce and cheese. It's really good.

26.description: I thought the food was great. I ordered a steak burrito and thought the steak was excellent. The steak wasn't cubed like the rest of the places I've been to diffintly a plus. You could tell the Carne a sad asada was fresh and it was not that processed stuff that's bland and has no taste. The lady was super nice and I look forward to going back and trying more food.

25.description: Great food with great service.  Nice mom and pop type of place with very friendly lady (owner?) waiting tables, busing tables, answering phones and taking care of carry out orders.  great neighborhood restaurant!

12.description: Ok, the guac here is outstanding. After opening the package and seeing that there was so little avocado, I kind of sighed and felt a little bitter. But then, I tried it. Packed with delicious onions, tons of cilantro. So. Much. Flavor. It was so damn tasty. I also got a shrimp dish that was well cooked, beans were delicious and the rice was so tasty as well. I'll be back.

59.description: The best Mexican food around. I have now been back 3 times and always enjoy the food. The waitress works her but off to serve you quickly and always with a smile!

21.description: just to continue the craze...pozole was amazing!!!! lulu is sweetness and her kids are adorable.

17.description: Holy mother of a find. We rode our bikes up from Logan to go car shopping and searched online for something to eat. Everything in the neighborhood seemed too simple but happened upon this place on a thrillest best Mexican food in Chicago because of their Pozole. I can even explain how perfect the soup was. Rich with flavor and spice, it left nothing for the wanting. Our hipster biking selfs left with smiles on our faces and bellies full.Staff was lovely and super nice.Unfortunately not BYOB, tacos were nothing to write about here.

10.description: We came for a dinner date the other night. Staff was a bit sparse, so unsure of what the protocol was, we seated ourselves. The female owner (?) got to us within a few minutes. She had a lot of personality and was super funny. Win right there.We had a side of guacamole which was wayyyy overloaded with cilantro. I felt like I was eating a whole cilantro plant!  The house salsa was more of a paste/puree; unfortunately not a fan of the texture/flavor.I ordered 2 fish tacos and 1 veggie taco a la carte (about $2.50 apiece). The fish was good, though a tad on the salty side. The veggie consisted of refried beans, rice, lettuce, tomatoes, and cheese. I have to admit to being a bit let down there wasn't any avocado in there. My +1 had chicken tacos. They were shredded but sauceless, so very very dry. Ingredients for all were plentiful and fresh.It took a while for our check to come, though by that time they weren't super busy. $17 before tax: not bad!I'm torn between a 3 and 4. While the owner lady was delightful and portions were generous, the food was just Ok. I'd like to try them again: forgoing the guac this time.

5.description: We just cant stop going back here for more Mexican food! The owner is just so down-to-earth and amazing really makes you feel at home with each visit! She offered us some chips with avocado dip which was good just ran out of chips; another thing is that we forgot to request flour wrap instead of corn wrap so she gave us 4 wraps for free! The food was phenomenal again! This time i tried the Picadillo, Pollo and Infierno taco(damn is flaming spicy so be warned!)

3.description: Still an amazing place! I absolutely love the service here. The lady is so nice and sweet, really cares about her customers. The food is devious! Really happy to have this place in the neighborhood. Best tacos in town!

35.description: Excellent food! I had the chicken enchiladas. I like that everything is authentic. I had never had Pozole, and it was delicious! It came in a small bowl prior to my meal. The restaurant is is locally owned and I prefer to support the local business owners.

19.description: Went here yesterday...OMG the best Mexican food in Chicago.  We live by midway airport with lots of Mexican restaurants to choose from, but none of them come even close to Pueblo Nuevo.   First off, when you walk in, you are greeted immediately by two things...a super friendly woman and by smells soooooooo amazing you want to faint.  We had flautas, steak tacos, chicken tacos, rice, beans, pozole, chips and salsa...everything was top notch, I'm not exaggerating at all.  My only complaint is that we don't live closer to Pueblo Nuevo.   The owner and her family are fantastic. YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS AMAZING PLACE.Btw, my 15 year old daughter just ate her leftovers, she said the food tasted even better, which she said seems impossible because it was soooooooo perfect and awesome yesterday.

28.description: Really great family owned restaurant. Good portions, great flavor. Good service. The family that owns it is adorable!

45.description: All I have to say is... OMG!!! This has got to be the best neighborhood spot in Portage Park for Mexican cuisine. With a husband and wife holding down the fort, this place is a MUST GO TO for the absolute best Pozole I've ever had in my entire life!!!

33.description: I stopped for carry out on my way home from work today. I've read a few good reviews and I love Mexican food. What a find! You can feel the sense of family as soon as you walk through the door. The service was quick and friendly. When the woman (owner?) who took my order found out I have a head cold, she sat me down and brought me a piping hot bowl of pozole. I feel better already!Now I ordered Carne Tampiquena  for my husband. The steak was tender and flavorful. It came with a veggie quesadilla which he loved. I had chicken enchiladas verde. They are spicy and delicious! The rice and beans are good too. I'm a fan and Pueblo Nuevo is the place I'm going when I crave Mexican food from now on!!

43.description: The lomo encebollado tacos are my favorite, tender beef with caramelized onion. YUM. Very friendly service that has brought us back at least once a week since we first tried this place. Vegetarian options are available, the veggie burrito is the size of my thigh and their chile relleno tacos are to die for. So glad this opened up in the neighborhood!

2.description: I really want to give this place another go based on previous reviews but nothing really stood out to me for my first time. I called for a pick up order and the lady was pretty friendly kind of hard to understand but really friendly. My friend wanted tamales and I knew it was a long shot considering you can't just get those wherever whenever(not an intentional Shakira reference) so I asked anyways and she goes "I'm not the tamale lady,lady" but she said it so funny that I just laughed and she started laughing so it wasn't like a bitchy response.It was ready within 15 min. I found parking right away around the corner but it seems pretty tough if you were going to sit down and eat. When I went to pick it up the owner/lady on the phone kept calling me lady and cracking jokes so I could tell she was just a friendly person and outgoing. Their daughter is hilarious. A little independent woman I would say is the best to characterize her just really mature beyond her years. She actually rang me up and was talking to me like it was whatever. My interactions with kids are always awkward so I really didn't know how to respond but definitely thought she was a trip super extroverted.I got the steak taco dinner American style and an order of chicken tostadas for my friend. The chicken tostadas weren't all that big and I felt bad so I offered my third taco to my friend since he was still hungry. The tacos were good and the meat tasted quality. Like I said it was good just nothing really stood out to me like WOW.Next time I go back I'm hoping for more and will update my review stat. The pozole seems to be a popular hit and I like that they don't just serve only on weekends like most places. I also like that they are super affordable and not too pricey whatsoever considering the quality you get!

18.description: Ate here for the first time last night. Wasn't expecting anything special since my bf & I are pretty skeptical of any Mexican restaurants and usually stick to what we know is good. We walked in and were immediately greeted. I was nervous when I saw that their steak is grilled beef, but when my food came out the meat was actually not bad at all. The green salsa is amazing, probably one of the best I've had. It was super spicy but that's the way I like it. I think the best part was the owner - she was very welcoming and friendly, and based on her service alone is a reason why I will be back!

41.description: Holy guacamole Pueblo Nuevo @ 4342 N Central Ave is a small Mexican restaurant.  I bookmarked it in Yelp because it has a 4 1/2 star rating and a single $ sign, my kind of restaurant.  We were in the area tonight so we decided to stop in a check it out.  The restaurant is very small and it was filled when we got there.  They brought us a bowl of chips and an excellent red salsa that Jethro Bodine (Beverley Hillbillies) would have glad a hard time finishing, but we did.  The red salsa was excellent very good seasoning and not too spicy.  The food is very good.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge.  Add this to excellent service and you have a winning combination. Our waitresses tonight were Lulu and her 8 year old daughter Jocelyn. (Both camera shy). It was very busy Lulu was the waitress, cashier and bus woman, serving & clearing tables.  Her daughter Jocelyn was so cute she came up to the table and asked me if I was done with my dish or if I was still working on it lol.  Well neither my wife or I finished our dishes.  We could have split it and it would have been enough.  My wife being a good Catholic doesn't eat meat on Friday.  She ordered the fish taco dish which was huge & delicious.  Instead of large chunks of fried fish like other places the fish was minced and mixed with onions, cilantro with lime squeezed on it was delicious.  The dish came with the normal compliment of beans & rice (which was very nicely seasoned).  I ordered the enchilada dinner which also came with the beans, rice and salad.  I got 2 steak (which was very spicy hot) and 1 chicken enchilada which was very good.  We both brought home more then half of our meals.  Like I said huge portions.Lulu brought us a small complimentary bowl of a chicken pozole soup to taste.  She also threw in a free flan dessert which we had a hard time finishingVery hard working and excellent service.  Lulu brings her 3 kids a 15 year old, 8 year old (Jocelyn) and a small boy about 2-3 years old.  Awesome food, awesome service and my 2 favorite waitresses Lulu and Jocelyn.  Tip big Yelpers they deserve it and work hard for their money

52.description: omg! so good.  it's hot and has lots of flavor...The waitress was nice and the orchota had a good flavor.  Have you ever wanted a posole mid week?  I totally loved it and would recommend it to those that aren't afraid of spice and flavor because the soup has a lot of it.

50.description: So glad to have tried Pueblo Nuevo for lunch. Wonderful service. Good food. Comfortable surroundings. Love to find great places around the neighborhood. Among us we had the yummy pozole, and delicious tacos and burritos.

4.description: This place is buzzing with excellent service and a great atmosphere. The Pozole is outstanding--the best I've ever had (sorry Mom). Overall, the food is tasty and the service is great.

6.description: It's all about the pozole at this little gem...the Yelpers got it! There is one size of green, chicken pozole and it can feed two people. In fact, if you order two entrees, Lulu will bring out small bowls and extra plates for you to share. Adorable, but unnecessary. I want all my pozole and you can keep the enchiladas. My guy had the red chicken enchiladas and it was nothing to write home about. He ordered it mild since my Yelp friends say spicy is no joke. Unfortunately, there was very little chile or cumino flavor to them. However, the green salsa picante Lulu brought out more than made up for the red sauce. It was hot and flavorful.I really wish I didn't fill up on the chips and salsa. I've had better chips, but the garlicky, fire roasted red salsa was addictive! I would have enjoyed the enchilada a little more if it was covered in that stuff. Alas, a belly full of corn tortilla chips meant I couldn't finish my corn soup. #chicanaproblems I'll try harder next time.

22.description: The food is amazing and the service I as well. I'm treated like family whenever I go! Hands down easily my favorite authentic Mexican restaurant. The food is very filling. I usually order enchiladas and I walk out beyond stuffed! The pozole is definitely a must try !!

15.description: This place is amazing. The food is phenomenal and the service is even better. The Carne Asada burrito is delicious and they don't pile the lettuce on like other places. The chips and salsa are great as well. I go here at least once a week for the last two months and have not been disappointed at all. It gets better every time. The posole is great and has amazing flavor. If you want Mexican food, this is the spot.

57.description: Great service, very homely soup was excellent. Quesadilla was perfect. Waitress  was friendly and courteous.

20.description: One of my wife and I's favorite places in our neighborhood. Lulu knows us by name now and always makes us feel very welcome. One of the nicest and friendliest owners you will ever meet. The pozole, tacos, guac, and burritos are in our regular rotation, but we're always surprised with the quality of the other items as well. Start with the pozole, come back for everything else. Wish it was BYOB or at least had a margarita on the menu, but that doesn't stop us from ordering there often.

36.description: This place is great! It seemed family owned, the lady was literally running around serving, hosting and cashier. We were impressed! They were super friendly and they didn't want us to leave. We went next door to buy donuts and got their daughter one. She was so excited!! The food was great and the portions were huge. I only saw one man back there handling all the food. Kudos to him!We are from Vegas and will definitely be back when we are in the Chi area!

14.description: Get in my belly!!! This place was really yummy. Service was awesome, husband wife team and the hubby carried a sleeping toddler on his shoulder most of the night. Personally I dig that. I like the family run joints. Horchata was delish. I got Nachos and they were the best I've had since my move from Texas. Prices are great as is the street parking. So happy to have found this little gem.

12.description: The jamaica and horchata taste delicious! It's your average Mexican fast food restaurant. The guacamole was very good, my daughter pretty much ate a whole order as her meal. The food is decent and the service is good. I only give it 3 stars because although it is good I won't go out of my way to go back.

7.description: Just had lunch at this location as a take out....Been many years since I stopped in for lunch and since it right down the street from Office I wanted to try something new for Lunch and I must say I really enjoyed their Food was Great !!!...I picked up a new Menu and will add this Place to my Lunch Runs...Great Food and the Service was great as well 5 Stars for this location !!!

20.description: the area around poncitlan is pretty much devoid of dining options, but this taqueria is worth a visit. the food is quite good, although the tortilla chips are store-bought. the tacos & sopes are pretty big, and two of them (at $1.45-$2.50 each) are enough for a meal.
