19.description: I can see this place from my house and walk there if all other options of food delivery and preparation fail.  They have been pretty consistent with the food we've ordered - my husband always gets the burrito - but makes amendments to I would say f-it to - no beans, sour cream, extra meat, plus avocado.  They get it right every time.  I change it up and try their 15 types of dinners, their tasty chilaquiles, nachos (eh, not the best or worst), and whatever is on special.  My favorite thing they offer on the weekends is the shrimp cocktail -  it's more like a ceviche except for lazy cooks.  Whole shrimp, cold tomato soup, onion, avocado, cilantro, onions, and lime - comes with crackers - so good.  The question mark for this place is their chips and guacamole.  The guacamole has had some devastating results for both me and my husband on more than one occasion and lacks flavor.  The chips are cold and as mentioned - come from a bag.  No love there.  Open early and late, good local choice for take out or sit in.  Lots of Mexican families eat here at night and also, people always seem to come in for their fruit drinks.

1.description: Consistently good quality food and the prices are reasonable.I tend to order more than I should and its hard to stop eating until its all gone!Everything is good here!

2.description: Good local spot in Portage Park! Their food has pretty good taste and the service is very attentive! The prices are reasonable for the kind of food you get. I always get the "burrito mixto" with steak and al pastor. I will def keep coming back here for more awesome food!!

9.description: The food here is really good. Nice Mexican furniture, however it feels very crowded. Wish they would take out a table because it's a small restaurant and needs more space for customers to feel comfortable. Friendly staff. My fave is their tacos- specifically asada

6.description: Had a steak burrito and was disappointed. The portion size was just right but the meat was grounded and chopped down to the point that it lost its texture. A tad too greasy for me and not flavorful. Service is alright and wait was not an issue. The prices are reasonable but with better options around I will not be back.

18.description: Here is another recently-opened taqueria in the neighborhood here. This venue was _another_ Mexican take-out restaurant in its previous incarnation. I visited here one afternoon after mailing a big envelope at the post office nearby. I opted for its ground beef burrito (picadillo). For $4.60, it was solidly in the middle for its value. I excluded the tomatoes (It left them out.). Avocado is 50¢ extra [unordered]. I also received its hot sauce (red). I thought this burrito needed the hot sauce. The ground beef itself was average. The lettuce was crispy, albeit underchopped. This was a competent burrito, competently made: Not too big, not too small. I am very comfortable with assigning Poncitlan a three-star rating.I dislike having to scrawl this. This was a venue in which I perceived _I was not the desired demographic_ for it. The print menu is the only place where you will espy English words. As a primary English-speaker, I seemed to be merely tolerated, and not especially welcomed. If your Spanish speaking is better than mine, give it a go in that language and see if you are treated better. [YMMV]Transit options: You will probably wind up on the #54 Cicero bus. It runs twenty hours a day, including every hour that Poncitlan is open. 3400 N. is Roscoe, which is equidistant to both the #77 Belmont & #152 Addison routes. Also, during weekday daylight hours, the #X54 Cicero Express route stops at both of those streets [but not Roscoe]; so you would experience a two-block walk.

10.description: what happened, the steak taco meat used to be so good, now it is ground steak like ground beef, why. why. why? now i have to go somewhere else. I am sad of this. Please change back to regular steak not this kibble and bit meat sized steak....

13.description: I had a good first experience with this little Taquería. My al pastor burrito was bigger than a newborn pup and the meat was redder than the devil's dick. Just how I like it! The horchata was passable and the chips were wholesale, but they keep them under a heat lamp, so it's makes a bit of difference. The guac was very good so altogether it was a pleasant meal.The prices were decent and they DO take credit cards if the purchase is over $10. If you live within walking distance, I would recommend a visit.

16.description: Authentic mexican food at an excellent price! The service is a little slow, but worth the wait for the quality of the meal. I tried lingua (tounge) here for the first time ever; it was hands down the best burrito I've ever had! They have regular meats: steak, chicken, and chorizo, but I like the lingua best!

17.description: Run of the mill Mexican joint. The Al Pastor is average, nothing spectacular. The Pozole is on point though, the only thing is I prefer Pork in Pozole and they use Beef. But overall good Pozole is hard to find so I add a star for that.

15.description: This spot is solid, and a hidden gem, in an area where you may find plenty of Mexican restaurants, but not good Mexican restaurants.  Let's face it, most of the time, when you crave Mexican Food, you want tacos, tortas, or a nice fat burrito.  Taqueria Poncitlan has this for you, and the carne asada they use is cooked to perfection.  In other reviews, I've read about their horchata being on point.  Guess what, it is!  Delicious and refreshing to be exact.  Their mole enchiladas are amazing too, but if you choose to order this from their menu, come with an appetite, because you get plenty of it, served with rice and beans, with a side salad.  I have to admit though, that the guacamole wasn't the best I've ever had.  It lacked a bit of flavor, and at times, I've noticed their chips to be a bit stale, but don't let that stop you from stopping here if you're in the area, because their typical Mexican choices are quite satisfying.

0.description: love their food here. i typically order take out and always get their taco dinner (al pastor). their guacamole is yummy too.  my husband has had their buritto and enchiladas and thinks they were also delish. come to taqueria poncitlan. dine in or order take out. you won't be disappointed.

5.description: Awesome little place! I popped it here on a whim, I was starving and had some time to kill before a hair cut next door. I was greeted with a smile, quickly seated, and served up a bowl of awesome homemade chips/salsa. I kept it simple with a few tacos. Pollo, Lengua, El Pastor. Came out quick and hot! The tortillas were either homemade, or damn close! Great flavor in all the meats. My favorite was the El Pastor. Pollo was great too, and the Lengua was made with care. Great place I will visit again. 4 Stars for now until I try some more food there, but easily a 5 Star place. Very expansive menu with simple tacos all the way to Platillos!

11.description: Taqueria Poncitlan #5 is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have ate from. From the tacos to the chilaquiles to the caldo de pollo. Everything has always been great there I have yet to complain about one of their dishes and I been going to them for almost 5 years. I have called on Saturdays at 11am for 15 people each ordering a dish. There's times when I've ordered 60 tacos and they always have the order ready by noon, lunch time. Food is always made fresh to order and that, to me, is very important. If you are looking for real Mexican food go there. The staff is very pleasant and the new waitress they hired is hands down better than some of the other girls they've had before. I had to just throw that out there 'cause my daughter and I ate in about a week ago and she gave my 3 year old a lot of attention. Keep it up guys!!!

8.description: Worst place ever in my tacos had hair and restaurant didn't did nothing never to come back

3.description: food is great, I usual dine in but when I'm not in the mood it's just as good the enchiladas verdes (green) de pollo are amazing the sopes are amazing they do deep fry them so beware if you are not a fan. The bistec en su jugo is amazing. I've tried almost everything is a quick and fast place if tou are looking for Mexican food that will be satisfying. No issues just yet.

14.description: I was told recently to try this place. I'm glad that I did. This particular area doesn't hold very many good restaurants to pick up a decent meal from. Of course there is McDonalds and my favorite KFC but it is lacking fast establishments when in a pinch. Since I am frequently in the area around dinner time and find myself getting a quick "to tide you over" snack from McD's because of all the school functions we are involved in....I am often left in a pinch without any options. Now mind you , there are other places within a short drive, but seriously , most of the time I don't have the time to get there. Just ONE MORE block down Cicero at the corner of Roscoe is this little restaurant, I probably would not have even tried before the recommendation. Food is very flavorful, fresh and super fast. It sure beats a cheeseburger, bucket of fried chicken, or the $1.00 hot dog we sell at school at concessions. I can actually feel good about the tacos or burritos or torta that I give my kids for dinner without having the major guilts of stopping at mcd's for the upmteenth time.I really like the chips, even if it is from a bag (who cares), and the salsa is VERY good. I really like this place. Although my orders have been limited to tacos, burritos, or tortas so far, I have been super happy with everything. Price is very resonable with good portioned orders as well. I can split a burrito between two teenage kids and call it a meal. So to sum it up, I haven't had a bad experience here. I've ordered take out, and eaten in. As far as little establishments go, I think it is on the "better" side of the scale.. Here you will find a very clean, kind staffed, resonably priced, with good food establishment......that's all i could ask for.

4.description: Whenever i crave a buritto at work i go overe there. Theyre one block away: best chicken and pastor burittos i ever had. Really good honemade salsa for the chips too. TBK can not even compete with them.

3.description: Best fades in chi-town...I take my son there and I as well. The place feels like a real barber shop.  I will be back there again and get the cut...

1.description: I have been going here for years. Only barber shop I will go to in Chicago. The barber Adeeb remembers my haircut, I just call ahead of time and I sit down and he starts cutting. Best fades ever.

0.description: I get my fade by Maurice and I'm never disappointed, he is always on point. Make sure you tell him what you want and he will master your fade with no issuies. The man is very consistent on how he fades the scalp to perfection.

2.description: If you are looking for a cut that's current and cool Maurice is the place. Coming from NY it's been hard finding someone in chicago who has understood the different haircuts that's are not necessarily from chicago until I found Maurice The Cut..

5.description: The Cut is a great place for hair cuts.  I have been going to my Barber Andy for the past 8 years even before he opened his own shop.  I come in sit on the chair and dont say a word and Andy takes care of me.  When he asks me for what I want to get done I tell him whatever he thinks looks good.  Andy is VERY consistant with his haircuts. There are many times were barbers at time give a good hair cut but then the next time ruin your hair.  You know what your getting when Andy is cutting your hair.Andy is very professional and respectful to your time.  He understands that we have other responsibilities and if you call in advance gets you on the chair with a short wait.  I recomend Andy for hair cuts.I get compliments on my hair cuts by my friends and now all my friends go to Andy for their hair cuts!

6.description: pretty overrated from my experience lol went there in my high school days back when it was cheap and it never turned out the way like how i imagined it which was not good, got made fun of by degenerates @ school.. went again 10 yrs later to check out wats diff and the price was jacked up $15 for a crappy cut lol asked for a blow out and  trim the top and the blow out was crappy half ass work, dude asked me if it was ok as i looked seemed fine but when i got home ahh hell naw lol didnt even trim the top that well i told him to trim several times and i finally gave up lol social ppl tho but small place and some overrated barbers like juan lol

7.description: I get my Biweekly haircut at this place and not once have I ever been let down. Whether its the haircut or the time spent waiting for a cut. The Barbers are funny and full of energy. One of them is always singing making it entertaining for anyone waiting. Overall each Barbers takes his time to make sure the cut is fresh and perfect, this is always and my only choice of a Barber Shop.

8.description: No thugs, good cuts, good prices equals five stars! I've been looking for a great barber, there was not one in NC, none in the panhandle, and yet to find one in Boston. I was fortunate though to have been referred to Andy at The Cut. This guy is incredible, uses the clips as well as scissors. This place has a bunch of young barbers, they look like they know what there doing. Always busy. I recommend Andy though, I don't get fades, but I do get a taper fo hawk.

9.description: This place has some of the most talented barbers in Chicago.  My only gripes are that a couple of the barbers do not know how to honor an appointment and will quickly "let my boy get his cut real quick," and take your place instead.

10.description: OMG so I had this one lady, Tammy that use to do my eyebrows ALL the time for so many years at Mario's and then she left and I was sooo sad because eyebrows are a BIG deal!  I had no idea where she had gone so for the last 4 years I been going to this other lady Sara, but she moved a couple miles away and I hate the drive there. So I got word that my long lost eyebrow lady could be found at The Cut AND she was!!!!  I was so happy to see her after a couple years and you know what?  She's still GREAT!!! I recommend ANYONE who doesn't know where to go to get there eyebrows threaded to go to The Cut. O yeah the barbers there are pretty good too =)

4.description: Top shop in the city!! Get my fade done by Andy.. He does it all!!  Also Maurice is good too..

3.description: I've been going to Brother Hair Design since I moved to Chicago back in 2005.  The crew here is friendly and they know how to cut heads for a cheap price.  The average cut is $10 and an eyebrow thread or wax is $5.  You can try parking on Irving Park, but good luck with that.  I'd recommend the lot which is about a block away and the current rate to park there is about one quarter for every 14-17 minutes.  I'd recommend dropping .75 cents just to be sure.These guys get good business because they know what they're doing.  The down side to that, though, is they get real crowded on the weekends.  Try to go one night during the week.They do a real nice fade and they do a great cleanup with a razor.  In a world of $15 haircuts, these guys rock so much more for $5 less.

1.description: The eyebrow girl here is a total hidden gem! She takes her time and it's super inexpensive and she's always precise in her threading technique

2.description: I've gone here for years.  I'll tell my story about the first time.  Baker saw me walking down the street and remembered me from the barber shop he worked at previously.  He drove me to his new spot he just opened up (Brothers Hair Design) and gave me a free haircut and some free shampoo.  That dedication alone speaks on his character.  In the past couple years I've had Issac cut my hair... he has really gotten good with the clippers.  I usually get a blowout... or a fade... and its always on point.  I go during the day and the wait time in short.  The prices are reasonable, and there are many people available to cut hair.  5 stars...

5.description: I moved to a new hood.  Need a simple haircut. Block away. Open till 8:00. SOLD! Solid clipper work. Good people.   My new go-to. Support local businesses.  Period.

6.description: Just had the worst haircut ever here.I asked for a simple fade and ended up getting a lopsided fauxhawk.Barbers barely speak english.  I should have walked out when i heard the barber talk.Never again

7.description: This is a great place to get your hair cut with detail. Not like those 5 dollar joints where you go and they give you a half ass job haircut. For 12 dollar you get a great haircut and shampoo and such a great staff. The young lady that cut my hair I will definitely ask for her the next time I go there.

0.description: I've been on a 3 year search for a stylist since my stylist moved away and I had yet to find someone who understood exactly what I wanted.  Granted, I don't have a lot of hair to work with and I like my styles long so my thing was make me look like i have a lot of hair w/o cutting off my length.  Selwa nailed it!!!  My search is over!!I wasn't even going to cut my hair tonight.  I went in looking for my regular eyebrow girl who is now gone :( but wow.. so glad I met Selwa.  Eyebrows and a fab cut for $15???????  WHAAAAT.  Are you KIDDING ME???  I haven't done a happy dance about my hair in a REALLY long time.  So please please please MOB Selwa with business so she stays... I NEED HER.

4.description: I have been going here since i was in 5th grade. I'm 27 now, they went through a change in owners/location, but they still can cut like back in the day. They even have a veteran or two from the old crew, and they haven't changed their prices in years while still giving a clean haircut. Quick service before noon, I'm usually in and out in 20, making it a 2 quarter trip on the parking across the street. I hope they never go away cause I don't trust any other place for a good haircut, I like this joint.

58.description: I went on a Saturday.  The Italian beef and fresh cut fries were outstandingly delicious, and I had no issue with cleanliness or attitude from the people behind the counter that others mentioned.  Beats Superdawg by a country mile.  I'll be back.

56.description: I wish I'd liked this place better.  It's convenient to my doctor's office and has a couple of tables set up outside so it's reasonably pleasant to eat on site.  Alas, my first experience with Roma's is likely to be my last unless I start feeling more charitable.  (I feel crumby today so take all this with a big grain of salt.)I ordered a hot dog and fries and to be honest, for what I paid, I expected a lot better.  I don't really know how they managed to make a Vienna hot dog with all the trimmings so completely tasteless.  The onions, the relish, the dill pickle... nothing.  They all smelled right but were beyond bland.  And the hot peppers?  If I hadn't seen them on the dog, I wouldn't have known they were there.  No heat, no flavor.The french fries looked good; I like skin-on fries.  But again, there was virtually no flavor to them.  It took a lot of salt and ketchup to make them interesting enough to eat, and by that point I figured "Why bother?"I can't say the place was any cleaner or dirtier than any other fast food stand I've been to, and I can't say the people were unfriendly.  I can't say they were friendly either, so make of that what you will.Given that people are raving about their beef, I might be persuaded to try it someday, but I'll tell you this:  When I come out of a place wishing I'd just walked up to Mickey D's. or stopped at iHop, you know there's something missing.

29.description: Arrived at 7:45pm last night hoping for a good beef sandwich to go.  The cashier was eating and seemed irritated that I interrupted his dinner.  Ordered the beef with mild jardiniere and a fry.  Back to car and find that the jardiniere was hot, no napkins, no condiments, and the sandwich was very dry.  The fries are with skin on, so it kind of feels like you're eating dirt!  For $8.40, NEVER again!

42.description: Took the non Chicagoan girlfriend here for her first beef ever. I have been coming here since I was a kid and still think its the best beef in town. New owners, same great food-- get your beef smothered in juice and enjoy with just-right fresh cut fries.

23.description: For more than 20 years, this was THE beef place in Chicago.  A gem only known to those who happened to live in the neighborhood that had better beef than any of the proclaimed "best" places for beef in Chicago. Sadly, that's no longer the case.  Sometime in the last 2 years the original owner sold the restaurant and the new owner kept the original recipe for a while, but either because of ingredient costs or lack of interest in taking the time necessary to make the original recipe work, it's now a pitiful copy of what Roma's beef used to be.  The gravy no longer has that in-your-face punch of flavor that it used to, the beef isn't as tender as it used to be and the bread is dry compared with the Roma's of old.I've been eating Roma's Beef since I was about 6 years old having grown up in the Portage Park area, and it's always my first stop when I fly into town for a return visit.  On my last two trips (December of 2013 and June of 2014), it had steadily declined.  On the december trip something tasted "off," but not awful, on my June trip, I mourned the death of my favorite restaurant in Chicago. It's just not what it used to be.Sadly, Portillo's now seems to be the best beef in town. With Johnnie's running a close second.

47.description: Something is very different about Romas and I mean that in a good way. I ate here more than a few times. Beef and fries were good, just always seemed expensive, which you recieved with a smug attitude. The beefs and fries are taste the same but without that attitude. They also added new items to the menu witch is not a suprise since the old menu was very minimal before.

8.description: Not the best not the worst! Super quick thoughHad an Italian beef dipped and w hot peppers on the side and it was $7

31.description: The first time I went here it was pretty damn good, thought this might be my go to spot in the area. WRONG. I had some family from the burbs come out and they wanted dogs and beef. Where did my dumbass take them?  Unfortunately I took them here. I thought it would be as good as the first few times I went, nope. The fries were soggy and under cooked, the beef was gamy, the hot dog bun was stale and it wasn't cheap. Steer clear of this little house of horrors...

34.description: This review is primarily based on the Italian Beef.  Similar to some of the other reviews, I consider myself kind of an Italian Beef snob.  That being said, I grew up in the neighborhood and even worked here in 1978-1979 (I don't have any connections with the previous/current owners), so it may be the beef I grew up with and have known.  Regarding the ambiance, it is a small restaurant, so you don't have the space of a Portillo's to hide you from the "kitchen experience".I have since moved out of the Chicago area, but when I make it back to the Chicago area, I get an Italian Beef sandwich where ever I can (e.g. popsbeef.com, buona.com, alsbeef.com, portillos.com, etc.).  Out of all the restaurants, Roma's is still my favorite place to get an Italian Beef.  After reading some of the negative reviews about the "new owner" (he has been there for about 1.5 years) and the recipe changing, I almost didn't go back this trip.  However, I made it back and was pleasantly surprised to experience the same spicy Italian Beef that I had known for years. I bought two sandwiches and both had plenty of beef (maybe the other reviewer just had a bad experience with one of his sandwiches. I liked the beef enough to buy the "beef by the pound" to take home with me to last a while.On my 2nd time back to Roma's this visit, I met the current owner Fred, who confirmed he is still using the same recipe for the beef.  I am not sure when all the additional fried foods got added to the menu as the previous owner was a "French fry purist" as Ron didn't want to put anything in the fryers that would alter the taste of the fries.  It was good to see the French fries are still being made from potatoes peeled and cut by hand in the back of the restaurant.

16.description: I've been going to Roma's many years and haven't been there in a while so decided to skip all the great beefs places I go to and stopped in here. The beef was the worst I've had! The bread was stale and they dipped the bread to hide that I think, the peppers I think were from last week, the hot peppers were also stale! I know a good beef and this use to be a great place I don't know what happen but every time I try to give it a shot it's always horrible but today beef was by far the worst ever! I mean who are you trying to fool with this beef? Real Chicagoans know a good beef. I gave to stars cause the service is good otherwise it woulda got ----0. Jeez!

13.description: Great neighborhood establishment! Friendly service and good food. Will definitely be back.

11.description: For more than 20 years, this was THE beef place in Chicago.  A gem only known to those who happened to live in the neighborhood that had better beef than any of the proclaimed "best" places for beef in Chicago. Sadly, that's no longer the case.  Sometime in the last 2 years the original owner sold the restaurant and the new owner kept the original recipe for a while, but either because of ingredient costs or lack of interest in taking the time necessary to make the original recipe work, it's now a pitiful copy of what Roma's beef used to be.  The gravy no longer has that in-your-face punch of flavor that it used to, the beef isn't as tender as it used to be and the bread is dry compared with the Roma's of old.I've been eating Roma's Beef since I was about 6 years old having grown up in the Portage Park area, and it's always my first stop when I fly into town for a return visit.  On my last two trips (December of 2013 and June of 2014), it had steadily declined.  On the december trip something tasted "off," but not awful, on my June trip, I mourned the death of my favorite restaurant in Chicago. It's just not what it used to be.Sadly, Portillo's now seems to be the best beef in town. With Johnnie's running a close second.

39.description: Delicious Italian Beef sandwiches and fries.  The best sandwich I have had in a long time.  Great Chicago beef sandwich!  Sit outside in the summer or inside at the counters facing Cicero in the Winter.  Not a pretty place but I don't go here for the ambiance.

37.description: I used to stop into Roma's about once a year just to feel like the old owner was doing me a favor by selling me a sandwich.  Late last year there was a lotta traffic on EveryBlock.com about new ownership.  I gave them another chance and stopped in for a burger and the owner gave me a slice of pizza to sample.  My family has been eating about a pizza a week ever since.  Best in the area and addictive (but I would avoid the anchovies as it was like eating a saltlick).  Chicken sandwich Italiano is great too.  Haven't had the beef yet and will once I get tired of the pizza.

0.description: I must say they have excellent beef sandwiches. They are Courteous and very friendly. I will Definitely go back and also recommend them.

38.description: I have been going to Roma's for more than 35 years.  Since it is under new ownership, I decided to go back and see if it measures up...very disappointed.  Had the beef/sausage combo.  The sausage was cooked to a crisp...it was burned and no flavor other than dried out.  The beef did not taste the same savory beef I was used to having.  It was my go to place in Chicago and unfortunately, I will not go back again.  Portillo's will be my go to place in the future.

51.description: My favorite place for beef and cheese fries! Nothing else compares. Yum!

27.description: A small Italian Beef place, with just a counter and stools.  Honestly everything I have had here has just been okay, nothing particularly bad but nothing particularly good either.Pizza slices were okay.Mozzarella sticks were okay.Italian Ice was okay.Service was alright.For me, the food doesn't justify the prices (which aren't outrageous, but a little more than some of the other joints in the neighborhood).They are supposed to be known for their Italian Beef, and I haven't tried it yet, but even if it's spectacular, it can't be the only thing to justify the rest of the menu.

32.description: Absolutely the best beef joint in the area. My dad used to take me here when I was little. He had to pick me up and put me on the stool. 35 years old and they have the same stools and I still love it. New owners doing a very nice job but my wife swears the meatball sandwich changed. She might be nuts but if not please bring the old one back so she'll go with me!!  (This review is from my husband, but I definitely agree with his rating)

54.description: Not the best Italian grub, but pretty damn good for a little hole in the wall!

48.description: This place used to be good but hasn't been in a couple of years.  This is Chicago and a Chicago style hot dog has tomatoes on it.  I ordered a couple to go, got them home and guess what, no tomatoes!  I should know better as the last time I ordered to hot dogs with everything they came with NOTHING on, just a dog on a bun.  Shame on me for going back.  After today's experience I called to complain and was told that the tomatoes "were extra, and you had to pay for them."  Well, why not post that on the menu, or mention it to the customer in advance.  The help is rude and when I called back I didn't even get an apology for not getting what I ordered.  If the owner doesn't care anymore about his customers he should close the business.

44.description: Same great beef sandwiches and fries, bigger and better menu selections, a little less dingy looking, and a new owner and employees who actually seem to appreciate your business.  'Nuff said...

24.description: Great food. Low price, but excellent quality, Luke a good full scale Italian restaurant.  Quiet clean a for tmosphere eat in or take out.

7.description: I've been going to Roma's for over 10 years now. Sometimes on a weekly basis and sometimes I've gone a year without it, but recently stopped by and noticed it was under new ownership. I was hoping they hadn't changed much to one of my favorite Italian Beef sandwiches in Chicago... but they did!I should add, I've never ordered anything from Roma's other than Italian Beef, fries and Italian Ice in all these years. That alone has been so good I've never wanted anything else. This time around though, the beef was well... different. No longer as flavorful, not sure if it's the meat or the gravy, but it didn't taste as good as I remembered and they definitely skimped on the beef as well.They seem to be putting too much focus on pizza and too little on their beef. As disappointed as I am in the beef, it's still one of the better ones in that area. I won't go out of my way for their beef like I do for Jay's, Johnnie's or Boston's. It's not the same Roma's and it's definitely not a new & improved.

49.description: This is a typical neighborhood hot dog/beef place. Roma's happens to have friendly staff but a small menu.I've had mozzarella sticks, they were pretty good. I think they also have really good chili cheese fries (waaaay better than Susie's!!).Not everything is good though, I've also had the watermelon italian ice and it was way too sweet and gross, I didn't eat but a few bites.Nothing to look at, the stools have tape holding them together, etc. but in places like this there is no ambience-at least it is clean.

40.description: Food was good and delivery was quick. The lady on the phone was also awesome. I'll definitely order from again!

53.description: My family has been going to Roma's ever since I can remember. This is the first place I tried my first beef at, and I've been coming here ever since.Before I start, I'd like to mention this is a dive. It isn't a place to eat at and expect any type of service or cleanliness. You get in, shoot the sh*t with the owner, (he's actually a pretty cool dude if he gets to know you) eat your food, clean up after yourself, and eat.I'll get right down to it. The beef is delicious, and while their homemade giardiniera lacks peppers and heat, it's fresh and crunchy and definitely compliments the meat. I love the au jus at Roma's. They don't soak the beef like they do at Al's or Pop's, but they get it just juicy enough to really go with the beef. The fries are a little soggy for my taste, but you get a good amount of them. Their italian ice isn't bad either. People complain about the owner, but he's just a loud dude who treats you well if he knows you. Roma's is a great place to stop by if you're around the area, and a good place to try if you love Italian beef. I give it a 5/5 because I've been coming here ever since I was a kid.

30.description: Despite changing hands, still the best Italian beef anywhere. Having said that, the beefs are a little less generous than before the owner change. Drinks are better now.This place also used to have the best hot dogs anywhere, but this is under review, as the last one I had there seemed a bit smaller, even though the new owner denies it. Still, the best Beef. Fries are very good too, as is the Italian ice.

46.description: Our neighborhood joint. Real Chicago. Real guys/gals working here. Should get tomatoes back on the dogs, but they are way better than all the faux joints with scripted attitudes.I guess they should apologize for not having a veggie menu, but they are a HOT DOG stand.Grew up with dipped beef and sausage like theirs.Probably some just as good, but never had better.

1.description: Awesome beef and sausage sandwich with sweet peppers.  Great flavor and tender meat. Had it "wet" which is a great choice.

55.description: I have been coming here for over 30 years.  This is one of the best beefs in Chicago.  I make the trip twice a month.  They make their own beef and have fresh cut fries.  Also the giardinara is awesome.  A hot beef is what I always order and have never been disappointed.  You will become a fan once your try.

9.description: Although I moved away about a year ago, this place by far has the best Italian beef I have ever had in Chicago!  Honestly, I still drive back to Chicago just to get this once in a blue moon.

26.description: Great Italian Beef sandwiches with the best giardinera that I've ever had.  This little Italian Beef place is one of the very best in the entire City of Chicago.  It's a neighborhood treasure.  I know my beef sandwiches and have ate at nearly every good Italian Beef place in the City and surrounding suburbs.  I can't think of any off hand that are better than Roma's on Cicero Ave.  They also have good hot dogs (Vienna brand), sausage sandwiches and just added Breaded Steak to the menu.  They also sell pizza, whole or by the slice which is pretty good.  They have Italian Ice and just added soft serve ice cream.  This is a very casual beef stand, there is a counter inside with stools to eat in and picnic tables outside.  Friendly servers are pretty spot on with taking and processing orders.  I can't recall ever having an order mishandled here.  Roma's is one of my favorite "go to"  places in the neighborhood for a quick bite.

25.description: I have to agree with many of the other reviewers. I have been going here for years as I live in the neighborhood, and they had the best beefs and polish's. Ever since new management took over, the food is not the same. They added many items to the menu, which I think took away from the great food they made. They are cheap on the cheese for the beefs, and the cheese is not even melted. The fries are cooked too long. The girl taking the orders screws up and then tells you that you are wrong. I just miss the old Romas.

12.description: Great beef and now they offer the Atomic Bomb sausage. Now that's a combo Owner is usually there and is always friendly.  Stop By For The Fresh Cut Fries BUT  don't forget to drink the river.  The Green River that is

59.description: I wish I could give this place Zero stars. Start with the service maybe the worst and most miserable people I have ever seen.  Told the girl my friend said they had good beef sandwiches and she just stared at me.  Ok.... The owner didn't even aknowledge me...Jack A$s im spending money in your empty sandwich shop your old you suck.  Ordered a Combo fries and drink  $10.06 pretty expensive so I was expecting something pretty good.  When I first picked up the sandwich I thought there was nothing in it just a piece of bread.  Opened it and there was almost no beef in it.. I was immediately disapointed.  The taste was decent not bad beef but whatever.  Then I ordered a refill.  27cents she tells me.  I laughed but she was not kidding I asked her for half a refill for 13 cents she  told me no and the owner just stared at me like I was doing something wrong.Your beef stand is terrible I hope that he is debt on it and it goes belly up becuase it does not deserve to stay in business and the girl at the counter seriously smile life is to short and you are ugly enough that you shouldn't frown all day... I will never go back there and I hope no one else ever goes back there either so bad.

21.description: Awesome pizza by the slice! Fresh cut fries, good hot dogs and overall friendly staff. Definitely recommend it for a quick bite.

17.description: I have to say that this place has a great tasting beef sandwich. Great pizza slices ,great everything.outstanding neighborhood restaurant fresh,tasty,made to order food.Friendly geniune nice people Who work thier.indoor & outdoor seating. Great job guys will be back and i will spread the word

10.description: A small Italian Beef place, with just a counter and stools.  Honestly everything I have had here has just been okay, nothing particularly bad but nothing particularly good either.Pizza slices were okay.Mozzarella sticks were okay.Italian Ice was okay.Service was alright.For me, the food doesn't justify the prices (which aren't outrageous, but a little more than some of the other joints in the neighborhood).They are supposed to be known for their Italian Beef, and I haven't tried it yet, but even if it's spectacular, it can't be the only thing to justify the rest of the menu.

5.description: Great beef, the Italian beef  sandwich is a Chicago classic... It's in my top 3 favorite Italian beef places in the city. Number one being Johnnie's beef, number two being Mr Beef on Orleans... Number three being Romas. each place has their unique blend of spices that the beef marinates in the juice. At Romas the tender juicy delicate beef/bread melts  in your mouth. They're hot jardineria is delicious, ads that spicy kick to any sandwich. Bring your out of state friends and family you won't be disappointed.

3.description: I was there this morning for the first time, pretty good italian beef, fresh cut fries were incredible, steaming hot!!! The girl working the cash register was cute also

35.description: All these 5 star reviews are suspect if you ask me...I dont get it..the beef aint the same (under new ownership) and not as much..pretty much all bun and for 6 bucks its a ripoff..they added pizza slices to the menu but I'll go to bacci's if I want pizza...I used to come here alot before but not no more..when I walk home from the train around midnight I see people in there so maybe there open later now so thats cool...they added benches outside, did some painting and now have uniforms..thats all good but having said that..the prices always sucked but now the food sucks and not as much.Mark K, Carol A, Jason F..I think you and your responses are fake...it dont make sense to me..anyways,I think the name Romas will keep them going for another year or so until people realize the crap there selling and uhaul buys them out and adds an extension to there lot..just saying..lol the beef in the pic (additional tips) was is twice the size of what i got..i couldnt even see the beef until i opened the bun

19.description: Charged me $4 for an Italian ice which i thought was a little much. Then one of the workers asked me if i wanted to buy a pizza for $10 that looked like it had been sitting for a week. Dont think i will return.

28.description: Honestly, I don't know a good Italian beef from a bad one.  I ordered a pizza from here and I've stopped by for the Italian ice.  Both were quite good.  Every time I come in here, the people are so nice.

45.description: New owner and the beef isn't the same not sure why however, still good. Less greasy which is a good thing and they now serve pizza which has a great taste they also deliver.

33.description: As a long time customer I stopped in to get what I thought was the great beef and fries that had always been the norm. surprise to me. the beef was ok but the fries were limp and greasy. I told the girl behind the counter that the fries were not edible and gave them back to her. I finished my beef and assumed they would make fresh fries and give them to me. that was not the case. I asked and was told the fries were fine and there was nothing wrong. I left and voiced my complaint onto deaf ears. Anyone could have a bad day but that was the second time this has happened and the first time they made fresh fries and they were the great fresh cut fries of the past.They obviously don't want to throw away the greasy soggy fries. DONT waste your time.

43.description: Average Beef. Under New Management, Not the same! As a self proclaimed beef connoisseur, I am a bit of a snob.  Also, I grew up on the old Roma's Italian Beef & Sausage.  So, I do not have an unbiased opinion towards Italian beef. That being said, the following is a review solely on the beef.Ron the old owner had a signature recipe, which died when he sold the establishment. The building might have been worth $270,000 but that signature Au jus sauce and seasoning is priceless. Fred (who seemed like the current owner) told me: we don't plan on changing the old menu, just adding to it. I want to keep the old, old and just add new. ..This apparently is not the case because; I don't see any essence of the original sandwich in the current version.  Don't get me wrong it is an O.K. Beef. Not even close to what it once was. The pure fact that it motivated me, to write my first Yelp review, should speak volumes.  I will not be returning purely as homage to my favorite childhood restaurant.

2.description: Best beef in the area! Best gardinera! If you can, go in and order your food.  We've tried delivery twice from them and both times they have been sub par - skimpy portion, lukewarm and despite living 10 minutes from them it took over an hour to be delivered. So now I suck it up, put my pants back on and go get it myself.  The owner is a really nice guy who seems to know a lot of his customers and there's always a good conversation to be had while waiting for the NW side's greatest beef.

18.description: Now under new ownership and they have restored Roma's to it's earlier glory. I can recommend the combo wholeheartedly.

41.description: Great Beef sandwich that I now know is close to home. Very friendly people and decent fast food vibe.

52.description: The best beef in Chicago, Romas should be mentioned along with the places down town that get all the press. Nothing they do is any better than Romas,...Great Fries and  and Gardinaria. The place is an institution in that area and has been there forever, it the first place I ever had a beef and it is the sandwich that I judge all other by. Years ago we moved to Michigan and would comeback to the area and fill a cooler with beefs to freeze and eat throughout the year. Plus Dont miss the Green River  the way it was meant to be non carbonated in the drink machine! I would go just for that.

50.description: I probably keep going back for the nostalgia, although every once and a while I get a sandwich that reminds me of why I loved the place. But too often the beef is skimpy, or dry, or both. The fries have always been meh. The hot dog is probably your best bet on the menu nowadays, which is disappointing for what used to be a very solid beef place, though in fairness the hot dog is pretty good.In their defense, I've found the service/cleanliness to be exactly in line with other neighborhood grills, contra some of the other reviews, and have never had a problem with either. Your mileage may very, or course.

4.description: Pretty good food! I got a chili cheese dog (not on the menu, but I just asked for it) and fries. There was a LOT of cheese on my dog, which was great for me, but up to you to decide if you want that. The chili had a really nice spiciness to it that cut through the gooeyness of the cheese. I only wish that the hot dog was bigger- the toppings definitely took the star role - I could barely taste my dog. As for the fries, they weren't too hot (temperature wise) or salty. They were not soggy, however. Pretty okay. Not outstanding. The cashier was friendly and funny, he offered my boyfriend a special they're having (don't remember exactly... think it was Italian beef and a Polish sausage in one sandwich), which he didn't get. Overall, I'd say this place is worth stopping in if you're in the neighborhood and craving something salty. Still doesn't beat Portillo's for chili cheese dogs. Good prices, too. I paid $15 for me and my boyfriend's whole meals.

6.description: This used to be my go to Italian beef. When I was just out of high school there was no Italian Beef any better anywhere nearby and this is chicago. They are a small place with some cool little bar style seating if your looking to eat in. Get the beef extra juicy and you won't regret it.

22.description: I had heard from others that this place had change and defended Roma's to the end.  Unfortunately that end came on my last trip. Fries were still as good as ever, though not to everyone's taste, the skins are left on and they are as I call them properly burnt (deep brown & crispy).Took a bite of my combo (beef & grilled sausage) with sweet & hot peppers.  Put it down (dry, bland & and very much not the same) started to talk privately with the owner who was behind the counter and told him the reputation the one time best beef stand was receiving lately.  He assured me nothing had changed and thought my sandwich was maybe made by a employee wrong. He told me to wait and went back and returned with one he had made himself.  One bite later (couldn't finish) with same result and I felt very sad, as I now realized the truth about it's current state. Hope the changes are corrected soon or the only talk about this place will be where it use to be and not just taste wise.

15.description: Food was good and the staff is really friendly they joke around and they keep smiles on their faces really like this spot

57.description: One of the best italian beefs around! And no, the atmosphere isn't out of this world, but you come here for good quick food, not ambiance.

20.description: I've been going to Roma's for over 10 years now. Sometimes on a weekly basis and sometimes I've gone a year without it, but recently stopped by and noticed it was under new ownership. I was hoping they hadn't changed much to one of my favorite Italian Beef sandwiches in Chicago... but they did!I should add, I've never ordered anything from Roma's other than Italian Beef, fries and Italian Ice in all these years. That alone has been so good I've never wanted anything else. This time around though, the beef was well... different. No longer as flavorful, not sure if it's the meat or the gravy, but it didn't taste as good as I remembered and they definitely skimped on the beef as well.They seem to be putting too much focus on pizza and too little on their beef. As disappointed as I am in the beef, it's still one of the better ones in that area. I won't go out of my way for their beef like I do for Jay's, Johnnie's or Boston's. It's not the same Roma's and it's definitely not a new & improved.

36.description: So I don't know if ...based on previous comments...if the new management is so recent  since I visited but I don't care to go back to find out. The management is what made me not go back anyways. I came in because I was driving about and had the hankering for a simple hot dog. They're close to a Mcdonalds and lets just say..I'm not a Mcdonalds girl. I walk in and the place has an aroma of grease...EVERYWHERE. It's like they mopped the floor with it. Now don't get me wrong I love the old time smell of a good old hot dog place like Superdawg or Portillos but...this place was just gross. When I walked in there was a guy..who I assume would be the manager or the owner...stared at me when I was glancing over the menu...no "hello"..no "what can i help you with?" which for me, is a big deal. These 3 guys who were there before me were leaving as I was about to order...the same guy goes "thanks guys! see you soon!" before LEAVING me at the register. I had to wait close to ten minutes to order...with NOBODY else eating there. I finally did order when a woman came to the register. Food was mediocre. I've had so much better. When I was eating the same guy came back and leaned on the counter looking as bored as ever. He watched me leave without so much as a goodbye for me. Good thing he treats only some of his customers with respect. *snorts* What a dump. If it closes, then good riddance.

14.description: Italian beef sausage combo homemade Italian ice just amazing! Friendly fun staff. Great beef!

28.description: Simply put...No stuffy and/or  snobby tea elitist attitude, much more affordable and tastier than Teavana, friendly, knowledgeable, and approachable owners and staff possessing great personalities.It's great to have a family owned and operated tea shop in the Portage Park neighborhood, I stop in multiple times each week.  I highly recommend you try it.

1.description: I don't come to this place much ofter but every time I do I am greated with a smile. Service here is amazing, the waitress is really friendly. Tea here is one of the best teas I've ever tasted. There is plenty of flavors to pick from to your desire with an option to mix and match. I highly recommend this place to anyone craving an amazing tea beverage or just feel the amazing atmosphere inside the shoppe.

9.description: I love tea--hot or cold. It's one drink that's fun to customize--milk, lemon, sugar, etc. to make it your own.  Tea'se is a great place to shop and sip and learn about tea. Ericka A and I wandered in here and got to chat with someone I assume to be the owner. He was very knowledgeable about teas, shared the healthy properties of tea and encouraged us to browse and check out all the different teas for sale. There's probably about 70 different teas to choose from so browsing is really fun and there's something for everyone's tastes.I was hooked after I caught a whiff of the coconut chai and the orange creamsicle tea and promptly bought some of each. I have already had several cups of the teas at home and found them lovely and flavorful. The shop is cute, minimal decor, but the use of color, shelving and mason jars give it a sleek yet warm feel. If you are new to tea or want to upgrade your tea accessories, there is a nice selection of tea brewing essentials and glassware for sale as well.

29.description: Never knew tea could be sooooo REFRESHING!! Plenty of flavors to choose from. Def made me a repeat customer. Check this place out!

23.description: This tea shop is another great addition to this up and coming neighborhood. The roasted almond tea is worth the trip across the city or from the burbs! The owners are friendly and knowledgeable and give free samples of different teas daily. They even offer a discount when you buy their loose tea and bring back the empty mason jar. What could be better?

5.description: Love this small and local shop! The teas are organized on shelves according to their type; roobios, herbal, green, black, and other. In front of each jar, you have an ingredient list, description, and sample jar. Each jar is available to open and smell the tea which helps you make your decision. The selection is huge and new flavors are usually available. Mango and friends, roasted almond Chai, and vanilla chocolate chip are some of my favorites. I love to mix flavors, like roasted almond and chocolate cake. Mariola is always helpful for recommendations, plus she makes delicious tea! Pricewise, the shop is very reasonable and they offer discounts to frequent buyers. You can also see the owners talented glasswork around the shop. I definitely recommend them!

31.description: Odd story - we originally met the owner, Damian, at the local dog park just a few weeks before Tea'se was set to open.  We were immediately excited, as this is such a great and unique kind of shop for our neighborhood, and we weren't disappointed!  We came in after the grand opening and were astounded at the awesome selection of loose teas available.  Not only do they sell the tea, they'll brew it for you right then and there!!!  Hot, iced, whatever, it doesn't matter because they do it all!  They also have a ton of tea-brewing and serving accessories you can purchase.  This is a serious tea shop, people!Damian and his brother are so friendly and helpful, stop in and buy some tea, you'll enjoy every sip!

25.description: My husband and I absolutely love this place! Just what the neighborhood needed. The owners are super friendly and willing to answer any questions you have. The first time we came in to check it out we left with 4 different kinds of tea and two freshly brewed drinks. The tea smells amazing and the flavors are so intense that you don't need any kind of sweetener really.

12.description: Odd story - we originally met the owner, Damian, at the local dog park just a few weeks before Tea'se was set to open.  We were immediately excited, as this is such a great and unique kind of shop for our neighborhood, and we weren't disappointed!  We came in after the grand opening and were astounded at the awesome selection of loose teas available.  Not only do they sell the tea, they'll brew it for you right then and there!!!  Hot, iced, whatever, it doesn't matter because they do it all!  They also have a ton of tea-brewing and serving accessories you can purchase.  This is a serious tea shop, people!Damian and his brother are so friendly and helpful, stop in and buy some tea, you'll enjoy every sip!

21.description: No pressure environment and awesome teas.  Great customer service and very knowledgeable.   Great addition to the neighborhood.

16.description: Great place, the best selection of tea flavors I've seen around, Mariela is super nice!

17.description: If you like tea and you're in Chicago-land, you need to visit this place. Wonderful selection and very friendly owners. Surprised about the review saying it tasted like plastic. My experience is their tea actually tastes like tea and puts Tazo to shame.

10.description: this place rocks! if you love tea you will love this place. great prices, great staff, and you can buy your favourites in bulk. bring your jar back and get a discount. i am also now addicted to tea all thanks to this place. Definitely a destination for tea lovers

11.description: I am so happy I had time to stop here today! And it's also a ups pick up. Best ice tea I have had. So many to choose from.  I do wish they has a types of detox teas would be nice .  Check this place out!

26.description: What can I say here other than if I lived any closer, I would visit everyday of the week! The owners are great guys and the place is family owned and operated. Portage Park was long in need of an establishment like this to come along. Many thanks to them for choosing us for their location and many years of success wished upon them!

27.description: It's kind of funny how we found this place. We missed a UPS delivery and it gave us the address of this place to pick up the package. We thought it was a mistake but they actually hold missed UPS packages for pickup and you can even drop off any you are sending out to be picked up here which is really convenient! This place is great though, we really aren't tea drinkers at all but I decided to buy some since we stopped in. We've actually started drinking tea now instead of coffee. They had a huge variety of tea, by weight or they will even brew it for you there. It was reasonably priced and the owner of the store was so helpful and friendly. They even give you these mason jars if you buy a certain amount of tea that look really nice and would make great gifts. I'm really glad we discovered this place! Places like this really add to the neighborhood. Even if you don't think you like tea they might change your mind!

35.description: Great tea place!  Stop in and get a great custom iced or hot tea blend at a reasonable price!  Or, take some home like we did and brew at home!  Let's get some Stevia in the Raw in the house for a natural sweetener option and the place is damn near perfect!  Owners are super friendly!  I'm glad to support local business's such as these.  Go get some Tea'se!!!!

8.description: Super friendly staff, delicious teas (I'm so in love with the strawberry genmaicha), and very reasonable prices. It's great having such a nice tea shop so close to home. Orrr maybe not considering I already have a ton of tea yet I always leave here with another bag or two for the stash!

0.description: I love going to this Tea shoppe. They are always so friendly and welcoming. The employees know everything there is to know about tea and take their time with preparing your order. I don't usually like tea but they have this new tea lemonade that is to die for! I will always come back and recommend to othersCustomer Service: A+Quality of product/service: A+Interior Design: A+Support small businesses! This place is great!

20.description: Great place, the best selection of tea flavors I've seen around, Mariela is super nice!

19.description: I can't believe I waited this long to stop in here. I live close by and see it everyday. Finally my husband and I decided to check it out. I'm so glad we did. I had the green iced tea sorry I can't recall the exact one but it was tasty and refreshing.  I like the tea, the atmosphere, and the people here much better than teavana. The lady working there was so nice and friendly. She told me all kinds of things about the teas. I will be back..... A lot!

33.description: Very cool and chill place to stop by and have a cup of iced or hot tea! Have tried plenty of different flavors since they opened, they have so much variety that everyone will find a flavor they like  ...pastries & more sitting area would make the place perfect!

2.description: It's great neighborhood store near the corner of Irving Park and Menard.  I've been trying to check it out ever since we've moved to Portage Park.  Please let your guard down and get enticed by the free sample!  I may not be excited for a donut like 60% of the population out there, but I will be very delighted to have a cup of tea.  The lady sales associate on duty was very sweet.  After a short session of "sniffing" on a wide variety of tea leaves, we went with the "blood orange" and "raspberry rhubarb."  I was informed by the friendly young lady that a reward program is available.  For everything $15, one (1) star is earned (an email address is required for participating).  Once ten (10) stars are accumulated, I will enjoy a 40% off discount on my next purchase.  They also offer tea to-go!

34.description: This place is a great addition to the area. Such a great variety of tea and friendly, open, and knowledgable owners made me shop there twice in a week! Best tea in my opinion that I have tasted thus far is the Mango n' Friends. It is happiness in a cup!! Stop in to pick up a stash for at home or have them brew yourself something then and there!

32.description: A great variety of teas and a very informative staff. I purchased the Mango n' Friends blend and the flavor and quality of tea is amazing. The fact that it came in a cute mason jar is a huge plus. I will be going back and buying many more. I recommend stopping in. This place can change a coffee addict into a tea lover.

18.description: I have never seen so many flavors of tea in one place! I want to try a new one each time I come. Some are so unique, such as raspberry popcorn and chocolate cake. There are other ones that are super refreshing, such as lemon zing and watermelon lime. I can't wait to try them all. The shoppe is very pretty and the owner and staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. This is a great addition to the Portage Park neighborhood!

13.description: Very nice place for a delicious cup of unordinary tea. Great variety and selection. Nice and helpful staff. The price is reasonable especially comparing to chain stores serving only regular tea in the bag for similar price. I just wish they would have a nice and comfortable sofa so people could come there and meet with their friends. There is not enough sitting place. The other thing is that they could serve tea in a regular glass cups nor in a plastic/paper cups.

4.description: If you ever get the bright idea to hand pack, string, staple, and label 360 teaspoons of loose leaf tea into single serve teabags as wedding favors, please note that you only need about 1 kilo of product... not 3. I'm still not entirely sure how my now husband and the lovely girl working there decided on that amount, but there you have it. You live and you learn.I've been into Tea'se three times now and it's always been a charm. I wish I lived closer because their iced teas are tasty and their inventory is intriguing and priced appropriately. I much prefer a little local shop like this over DavidsTea or Teavana.As Aimee M stated, their setup is streamlined. It definitely gives off a "less is more" vibe, and I like that. But don't think for one second that you'll be left wanting. My problem is that I inevitably leave with a bigger bill than I had intended because there are so many things I want to try and I can actually afford them!When trying to order tea in bulk, I had called during off hours and left a voicemail maybe Tuesday or Wednesday and hadn't heard back by Friday (needs some work in this department), so we gave them another call when they were open and someone answered the phone. They gave us the hours of operation and Dalibor Z went in on Saturday to discuss discounts and measurements. The girl working there (pretty sure it was Mariola) wasn't entirely sure how much tea we'd need but she was sure that the owners could give us a good price for as much as we were looking to purchase. She suggested he return while one of them was there, which wouldn't be until the next day.We came in on Sunday and spoke with David, co-owner with his brother. He was fully on board with our vision and said he could offer us a discount pretty close to their wholesale price when purchasing. We went with it and he placed the order on Monday. The shipment arrived at their store on Wednesday and I went in and picked it up from Mariola. I also had her make me a strawberry watermelon iced tea to go!I spent Wednesday, Thursday and Friday putting together the teabags with much help from friends and family. Anyone who was around to witness this madness commented on how fantastic the tea smelled.When all was said and done, we had about 2/3 of a package left of Butterflies in the Tummy, Orchid Berry, and Tropical Escape. So, as I said, we way overdid it; however, the price was so good that I'm not even mad. I've been gifting heaping helpings of teas to those who helped, I'm sending my mom home with lots of tea, we've got enough left over to last us the rest of the year, and everyone who took home the favors and has tried them is giving it rave reviews. I'll probably be giving this as gifts for Christmas and birthdays because it's so good, and I'm so lazy.

24.description: Their tea is amazing! I had the strawberry mango ( delicious cold) and it was refreshing! I didnt need to add sugar. My mom just got me a bag of their Place de la madeline for my birthday and i was so excited!! This tea is so fragrant, i cant keep my nose out of the bag! Its like vanilla awesomeness! The tea itself is beautiful too! Strands of blue and lavendar mixed throughout. Such a treat and i look forward to every cup! I really cant wait to go into the shop to get more because im getting addicted!

6.description: Not my cup of tea. (literally) I had a Golden Star Fruit and it tasted artificial for me. I like that you get to smell the teas before you decide what you want. They have a great selection here. I went with the Golden Star Fruit because of it's enticing smell. However it tasted differently from what I would expect. I'm not sure if it's the right way to describe it but the taste was almost plasticky? Perhaps I shouldn't complain too much since my drink was free (belly bites). The shop seemed really cute though..

22.description: Love the idea and the atmosphere, I just wish they had a larger selection of vegan organic teas. Still, I'm glad to have them in the neighborhood!

15.description: Their tea is amazing! I had the strawberry mango ( delicious cold) and it was refreshing! I didnt need to add sugar. My mom just got me a bag of their Place de la madeline for my birthday and i was so excited!! This tea is so fragrant, i cant keep my nose out of the bag! Its like vanilla awesomeness! The tea itself is beautiful too! Strands of blue and lavendar mixed throughout. Such a treat and i look forward to every cup! I really cant wait to go into the shop to get more because im getting addicted!

7.description: This is were magic happens. I visited this little cute shoppe over the summer and it was heaven! I bought the KIWII SPLASH APPLE. All I gotta say is DELICIOUS DELICIOUS!! I will definitely be returning soon.Also, the girl with the tattoos is so friendly and has a lot of knowledge about tea. (Cool tattoos too)

36.description: I stopped in this week to check out this place. Very cool atmosphere. The brothers that run it are very approachable and like to talk. Their passion is definitely evident. The small tea shop offers dozens of unique tea flavors available for purchase. You can buy it by the bag (50g), the jar (100g), or have them brew you a cup on the spot. Good people, good product, good atmosphere. 4 stars.

30.description: Cute little place to relax and enjoy a cup o' Tea

3.description: I stopped in here one Sunday afternoon and needed a refreshing beverage. David and Mariola were so nice and welcoming when I entered the shop. I have been here three times and I'm always impressed with the teas that David makes me. He is very knowledgeable with the different types of teas and their benefits. I'm in the process of trying every single type of tea on the shelves and look forward to experiencing them all. P.S. I recommend getting the teas with the lemonade. They're freshly squeezed everyday.

14.description: To All My Portage Park Peeps I recommend for all to check out This hidden Gem!This Place Has The Best Variety of Amazing Teas.Hot or Cold they Taste Phanominal!!My personal Fav. So Far is Their "Apple Pineapple " I recommend Cold! =P
